Summary: Our family was so excited to take our 7yo son here for his birthday. We invited the whole family. We reserved 3 rooms total for everyone. For our room, we reserved the Wolf Den thinking it looked so fun for the kids. It was simply a tiny room inside of our room Witt a bund bed. It didn’t look anything like the picture.  There was no drinking water in our room. No microwave (even though their food is insanely overpriced). It would’ve been nice to be able to reheat our leftovers. Then again, the food was not good at all, especially the pizza. It was hardly edible. They charge a resort fee but it doesn’t include parking. They don’t refresh rooms at all, even when requested. For $500/night, having our room refreshed after a day in their filthy water park shouldn’t even be a

Summary Heading: Good add-on to a Disneyland trip.
Summary: The listing says "Has microwaves" Does not.  The listing says "Has free parking" Does not. Parking costs a minimum of $22 a day.  This is a "semi destination" resort, not just a hotel. Good option for a one day layover prior to visiting Disney.  The facility, staff and waterpark are all first rate, in fact I would say that the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff exceeds that of Disney property hotels.    Avoid as best you can busy season and times. This place cannot absorb the amount of people that "fully booked" represents. When it's packed the quality of the experience goes dawn substantially. for everybody and the price skyrockets.     Great for kids up to about 13 years, teens, not so much.
Room tip: Avoid the crowds as best you can.

Summary Heading: Come to Great Wolf Lodge If You Want to Be Disrespected and Robbed
Summary: We’ve been loyal customers of GWL Garden Grove since 2018 but this last visit has destroyed that. My mother in law gifted us a stay by purchasing the reservation and paying the full amount in advance. We confirmed with a rep over the phone she and the card did not need to be present at check-in. She said verbatim that because the balance was paid in full, we just needed to show up and put a card on file for any damages.   When we got there they claimed we couldn’t check-in, and that they needed to refund back to the original payment and charge us with a card that is physically present. Luckily, we had the money to cover it but the attendant belittled the situation as if anyone could whip out $700 out of thin air without any show of empathy or consideration.  My mother in law

I spent over $700 for a one night stay at this place. I ended up getting a view of a building wall of my room. The rooms were more mediocre. Beds were uncomfortable. The carpet in the hallways of the hotel need to be changed out. Get ready to pay inflated prices on things; 4 hot dogs with a drink and French fries + nachos run you $160. Parking is $22 and the garage is so jammed packed with cars, it takes a while to find a parking spot. There a limited amounts of chairs and lounge chairs in the water recreation area and you have to get to the entrance at the opening time to get a space. In my own experience one night is enough here and I am glad I didn’t book my entire weekend here.

Update rooms with new lamps and modern day usb chargers. We are used to this and didn’t like having to go hunt for a charger block. It’s very simple. Outdated lamps to the max. The rest of experience here was nice but this a very simple fix. Peace and love

This place was terrible, $30 for a pizza that tasted like it was a frozen oven bake style, Kids running wild up and down the hotel halls slamming into peoples doors at late hours, the water park is so small you can do everything in around 4 hours, the beds felt like we were sleeping on the wood support the were terrible, absolutely no water pressure in the shower. The system went down on Saturday and we were unable to check our towels in the staff we handed them too assured us it wouldn't be a problem and when I get my final bill today what do I see $60 pool towel fee. Did I mention you have to pay $22 a night just to park. There are at least a dozen other places I can think of in Southern California that would be more fun and a better value than this place. Do your family trip
Room tip: Chairs in the water park are scarce get one early and hold on to it. So many unattended children...

Summary: I had low expectations based on other reviews and word of mouth but Great Wolf in Garden Grove by far exceeded them.  My 6 and 9 year old kids had a fantastic time.  Our room was clean, QUIET and well appointed.  The waterpark was clean and not over crowded.  There was a good range of rides/attractions that we adults enjoyed as well.  Food was decent.   Only complaints;  the Dunkin Donut line in the lobby was ridiculously long and the last day the wrist bands stop working after checkout time even though you are able to use the waterpark all day.  No one told us this and when we went to order food they didn't work.  We didn't have money with us in the waterpark because we were counting on the bands.  This meant someone had to get dressed and go all the way to the garage across

I am not a complainer but this has to be said. So this place used to be off the hook for Halloween. Giant spider in the lobby, characters everywhere visiting kids and impeccable rooms.   This visit was underwhelming. Lobby had some 99 cent store decor and trick or treating was 4mini booths. This trip saw a barley decorated lobby and our room was dirty. Scuffs on the wall and a shower head with crusty calcium all over it. Really? $400 a night for that?  Waterpark had different attractions shut down all the time. Not once did we see all the attractions up and running. They told us Covid is  creating staff shortage. If that’s the case give a discount….if not hire people.  Also why am I paying a resort fee? No room waters, no microwave, nothing other than tattered and stained

We got moved here after our hotel was damaged in a water leak so wasn’t here by choice. The lobby is very impressive, handed wolf wars to wear. Rooms fine  no complaints. Evenings though the hotel is so noisy!!! It’s crazy kids everywhere running around out of control! There are interactive things on all floors you can buy wands  for and kids are running up and down corridors to  play with them this in turn causes the lifts to be very busy!  Pool  area great for kids but again so noisy. A very interactive hotel great if you want  this if not avoid.

I thought this would be a great place to bring my 12 year old for his birthday. He invited a friend, so I was a single adult supervising 2 children.   The first shock was that, even though I wasn't going in the water or using any attractions, I had to pay full price to get in ($100). For that, I would have expected it to be easy to find places to sit. There were not. Almost every surface was covered with people's towels and personal items, but no one was sitting there. It was hard to find places to sit where I could see both kids. There was no outside food or water allowed. For my full price admission, I would have expected either a place to sit with waitstaff available, an app to order food, or really any kind of decent service that was in line with the $100 entrance fee.

Summary Heading: Amazing! Book your trip now you won’t regret it!
Summary: We stayed here two nights. My daughter got to trick or treat, go to a dance party, play golf, bowl, play magi quest, do arts & crafts, and make a build a bear - all included with her wolf pass. She had the time of her life! She said she’d rate them 10/10. The food was great, prices reasonable for a hotel & in line with other attractions & a McDonald’s, gas station, restaurants & rite aide within a few blocks. The room was clean & comfortable. What a great time! That’s without even mentioning the water park! You won’t regret coming here but you will wish you had found this gem sooner. We stayed during the week because it was significantly cheaper than the weekend. Highly recommended!

Good: -All food experiences we had were excellent. We had dinner at the Lodge grill, breakfast buffet at the Loose Moose, and ordered lunch at Buckets. All the service staff were great and food was excellent and reasonably priced. Service was also quick, which is very appreciated with hungry toddlers. Loved the omelette station at the breakfast buffet. -Water park activities are fun- all the slides, pools, toddler areas are great. A little crowded but not unexpected.  Bad: -I understand chlorine strength and cleanliness of the pool go hand in hand. But man, that chlorine really stings your eyes! Multiple times throughout the day, various pools would be closed because of a pH chemical imbalance (poop accidents?) But it really made you think twice about the cleanliness of the

The so-called Great Wolf Lodge is an overpriced, dystopian HELL ON EARTH. Think: Chuck E. Cheese on STEROIDS with water slides, eye-burning/lung hurting airborne chlorine, day-drinking/drunk tattooed gang banger dads, trashy women with way too much silicon, endlessly long lines for everything from checking in to getting food, never ending NOISE POLLUTION, a crappy app that didn’t work, and constant upselling/price gouging. Also, the hotel rooms are ugly, bland and have filthy carpet in them, gross. And on top of all that, we found a LARVAE on my son’s bathing suit from the lazy river. This place is ‘MERICA at its best/worst. If we don’t get Covid and/or monkey pox, I’ll be amazed.

Summary Heading: Fun, inclusive set up with financial risks
Summary: It started out with us wanting to take our Grandson for his 3rd birthday on his first overnight trip. When we got there for our reservation,, we had park access form 1pm on the day we start the room reservation. We go to check in at 12:45 and there was almost no line because they had quite a few "Pack members" manning the front desk. They let me know upon check in that our room is ready. Off to a great start.  Sadly, this is where the actual problems start to occur. Unbeknownst to me, the pack member at the front desk actually put a $10,000.00 hold on my credit card instead of a $100.00 hold per night of stay. Since the facility allows for your wristband to be charged all your discretionary purchases in the facility, I wouldn't find out until I was leaving and stopped to get gas

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay at Great Wolf Lodge Anaheim
Summary: Our family of 13 stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge Anaheim from September 12th through 16th.  We had an amazing time.  We have stayed at the Great Wolf in Scottsdale in the past and the Great Wolf in Anaheim did not disappoint!  The staff at the front desk treats you like family. Sidney checked us in, and she was so friendly and helpful.  Our rooms were clean and beautifully decorated.  We love the family atmosphere at Great Wolf.  The children walk around in pj’s and slippers in the evenings, just like they are at home.  The staff in the water park are very helpful and also very safety conscious.  The young men in the surfing area were amazing with my children. They worked hard to teach them to surf and were so patient!  Ne’osha was the housekeeper most of the nights we were there

Summary Heading: NOT FRIENDLY TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS
Summary: We specifically came here for the outdoor pool and the area inside that had the basketballs that we enjoyed from a previous bday party. However when we arrived at 9 when the park opened, we were told those areas didn’t open until 11. There was NO ADVERTISEMENT anywhere stating that those areas were closed until that time and when you have a child with special needs it’s difficult to help them understand that. Birthday ruined. But that wasn’t the only issue, there seemed to be a miscommunication with the call center reservation line and the actual location. I was quoted, and I have proof of the email, stating that the premium seating I was paying for was $99 that day, got to the front desk and receptionist told me no it’s $163. I also had an add on for an additional room and was

Summary Heading: Quality continues to go down hill
Summary: We have come to this resort about six to eight times. It started out great but the quality and amenities are on a downward trend.  1- Paid Upgrade to Wolf Den was a DOWNgrade 2- Removed TVs from Wolf Den's kids area 3- Shot down areas in water park 4- Not fixing Wolf Tail slide for over a month? 5- Removed microwaves from rooms.  We booked a family suite and then upgraded to the Wolf Den which has a separate area with bunk beds for the kids. In the past there was a TV in that room. But that TV has been removed from those rooms. This caused us to be stock with the kids in our bed watching kids programs. WORTHLESS upgrade!!! Parents need their quality time and this ruined that.  Wolf tail slide has been out of order for over a month. On our second day, one of my kids favorite

We had visited in 2018 and it was amazing. We returned in 2022, and The waterpark was filthy!! Moldy walkways, dirty floors of the pools. Felt so gross. Lots of inner tubes broken so long lines. We won’t return. The rooms were just whatever. Barley acceptable.   Need a better dinner options. Dinner at one place was pricey and then the buffet was not good. Not even an ice cream machine. And just sub par food.   After such a great visit in 2018, I guess 4 years makes a difference.  Clean the place GWL!!!! Close the place for a week and clean!!!

We were so excited for this trip to celebrate our daughters birthday! We came prior to the pandemic and had an amazing time! Prior to the pandemic, the park was well maintained and CLEAN. Today, that was not our experience. I’m laying in bed right now in their hotel and unable to fall asleep, due to feeling grossed out by the condition of our room. I will disclose, I can be a bit of a clean freak. For the price, I do have an expectation that I’ll have a clean room…There were crumbs on our carpet, hairs on the bathroom floor, and the bedding didn’t look clean. We left to Target to purchase clean blankets. The water park flooring was peeling and large parts of it were covered in green slime… Some areas, black, highly likely, mold. There was smashed food on the floor throughout the

This was our second visit to Great Wolf Lodge and it was disappointing. The rooms were very run down and more like a motel room for the cost of more.  The fun and activities for the kids is plentiful but I don't think that it makes up for the cost of the room  that you want to feel comfortable in.  I think this property is in need of some love and refurbishment.

Been coming here for the last 3 years. This year the slides and pool area are extremely dirty and poorly maintained. Paid over $1800 for 2 nights and wish we went somewhere else. Place should be closed down for a good cleaning. Looks like mould on the pool floor. If your thinking of staying here, don’t bother.

We were excited to take a vacation and visit Great Wolf Lodge. Upon arriving the outside wasn't what we were expecting but that was ok. It's about the experience. We did a virtual check in and expected to have a quicker way to get your keys. Instead we were told we still had to wait in the LONG line to get our keys. What's the point of virtual check in then. We got to our room and the kids really liked their bunk beds. Rooms were nice and clean.  Water park was smaller than we imagined but seemed to be clean.  The worst part of this trip was the customer service. EVERYONE, mainly the lifeguards, seemed like they hated their job. I got maybe 2 smiles the entire 3 days.  I'm not saying they needed to jump for job or go crazy but a smile would make someone day be a little brighter.

Summary Heading: Fun, a bit pricey but worth the 4 hour stay. Made the very best of it!
Summary: The visit is as much fun as you make it. Long lines but nothin impossible. Pack an extra patience sandwich for the day or two you stay there. Take a deep breath before you walk into the water park and enjoy. Fun for the entire family. More TLC for the park itself is needed as it’s a bit beaten up but awesome opportunities await for you and your family. Great rides, just marvelous in terms of rides.

The service was incredible!   It started with your super courteous front desk.  We checked in at noon and was amazed our room was ready! The concierge staff were informative and welcoming … it began like magic!  We had a cabana for 2 days in the park and the Staff went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed.  The lifeguards are professional and focused on what we want them to focus on! Thank you for keeping our kids safe :)  The room and the park was super clean and well maintained :)  The service at the bar and grill was friendly, accurate and joyful as we celebrated my daughter’s 10th birthday.  We were a party of 10 and the food was so good! We miss our steaks! :)  Next and most importantly: my 10 year old hid her iPhone/tablet and Apple Pencil In the bed.

Summary Heading: Fun place, clean, friendly, helpful staff, price a bit steep
Summary: Rooms were clean. The suite could be bigger, but it worked. Staff went above and beyond to be helpful. The activities offered  for young children such as bingo, character experience, art, wand interaction, bowling, golf, arcade and the dance party is all great! Again, feel the price per night is a bit steep, but the pools etc.. are all included. Pretty good food options available in the hotel. Woukd recommend this hotel over some of the pricey hotels near Disneyland if making a Disney trip. It is just a short distance and ART bus can be accessible.

We visited great wolf lodge for the first time for My daughters birthday this past weekend. It was a little on the busier side with it being a holiday weekend but The staff Was still very friendly and helpful! Astrid was working some of the food outlets and she helped me and my Husband decide which is the best option of food for our family. I would recommend coming here for a family vacation 100%!

Summary Heading: made us nervous with so many poor reviews....but, SURPRISE!
Summary: From This Business Explore a world of play  Arrive as a family and leave as a pack at Great Wolf Lodge.  Explore a world of play  Arrive as a family and leave as a pack at Great Wolf Lodge.  Review Highlights “It has an arcade, amazing indoor waterpark, a wizard quest, and small dance parties for the children” in 415 reviews  “There are also activities throughout the day such as decorating their wolf ears, making pin, and dancing at night.” in 54 reviews  “The service is great, the indoor water park and the activities for the kids are fun, and the rooms are comfy.” in 120 reviews  Show more review highlights  Location & Hours Map 12681 Harbor Blvd  Garden Grove, CA 92840  Mon  Open 24 hours  Tue  Open 24 hours  Wed  Open 24 hours  Open now Thu  Open 24 hours  Fri  Open 24 hours

Too many people, long lines and both kids pools shut down frequently. Waiting 40 minutes for a 2 minute flow rider and a small wave pool that felt like I was in Rio, Brazil on New Years evening.  First and Last time.

It was dirty---through no fault of the hardworking housekeeping staff. Just run down and generally a disgusting set up. Worst of all, at 5 PM after having left the "resort" at 11 AM, I was charged $75 plus tax and fees for towels. It was my understanding that towels were complimentary. My 10 year old daughter checked them out so I wasn't aware that they needed to be checked back in. Hence the charge. I am LIVID. Spent well over $1200 for two nights at this gross place and now have to face the indignity of this bogus charge. No one in their right mind would steal their flimsy worn out towels. Of course the 5 I was charged for are still there! STAY AWAY.

My kids enjoyed our stay at the hotel, the staff was very nice and welcoming! The water park was fun and they enjoyed the pools! Art & craft was very entertaining to my kids they enjoyed the night dance party in the lobby.   The downfall was that our bathroom drain was broken so my little ones couldn’t play tub and at night our bathroom pipes made loud noise that woke up my family and it was hard going back to sleep from that loud noise! I called the front desk and they said they were going to send someone to check on the problem but the noise didn’t go away so I called again but no one answered! The noise was so bad it broke the shampoo and body wash bottles that was attached to the walls in the bathtub.

This resort is a kid’s dream place! There is an indoor water park, mini bowling, mini golf, arcade, candy and ice cream shops, and way more. For adults, it may feel a bit chaotic with all the children constantly running around; however, it was fun watching our kids buzzing with excitement the entire time. Luckily, they offer craft beers and tasty cocktails for a decent price, so that helped bring some adult fun.  We stayed in the Kid Cabin Suite, which has a mini mountain-themed cabin with bunks within the bedroom. The kids loved it! The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.   The food was generally good. The restaurant within the water park served typical fast food… nothing special but the kids were happy with it. The Lodge Grill had several delicious options for the

This place was great for a quick family getaway. The only reason I didn't give it 10 stars is because of how spread out everything was(it took forever to walk from room to everything) and the room price. The water park is included and it is an amusement park so I can under stand the expenses. We were able to check in quickly and with ease. I was a little nervous because I read when you pay with Affirm you don't get the same customer service as "paying customers". That was not the case at all. I received great customer service and our room was ready a little earlier than we expected which was awesome. Our room was pretty big. My little ones loved the separate kid area with the bunk beds. My big kids secretly liked it as well. In normal hotel we would cram everyone into a single

I have been going here since i was a kid. It was always so fun, and everything worked out so well. Not until 2020 came. After quarentine and everything, i thought it would be the same. Wrong. Food is not even average, rooms are super small, and water park is insanely different. The waterpark looks the same, but its very different. At least once a day a child decides to use the wave pool as their bathroom, and most of the tubes for the lazy river are popped. The staff is nice, but the food. For dinner, i had beef brisket and albacore. It sounds amazing at a 5 star restaurant, but at the buffet, it doesnt. Both of the meats were very dry, brisket was okay, but the albacore was just terrible. It was hard, had absolutely no flavor, and was small. The deserts were terrible too.

Celebrated our kids birthdays here. It's been 3 years since having a real birthday party due to covid-19 so we decided to splurge.   Stayed 1 night and got a cabana. Always check the price onsite. We paid $300 while online it was $500. Cabana is definitely worth it. Comes with seating for 6 to 8 people, a safe, small refrigerator with 4 water bottles, tv, and best part is the service. They bring all the foodand drinks to you including the birthday package cake and pizza. You just give them the coupons and they take care of it. Even will bring you the dipping dots ice cream.  Both the pizza and cake were tasty, especially the sheet cake.   Kiddos had a blast and it took us a week to recover from all the fun. Will definitely do it again.

Summary Heading: Not up to GWL standards! Go to a different location.
Summary: We’ve been to many GWL and this location is RUN DOWN!! Carpet is nasty, rooms are cramped and not efficient, no closets in the grizzly bear suites like most locations have, no clocks in bedrooms, all the chairs have fabric (which is gross at a water park), and we waited in line 1.5 hours to check in and our suite wasn’t ready. We were told this location doesn’t guarantee your room by 4pm check in time. Magi quest is similar to TX where it is on multiple floors which is cool… but it’s the same game so if your kids completed it at another location, they will be bored. The gift shop is sparse, and overall the hotel needs a major rehab. Surf ride was closed, and was the main reason the kids picked this location, so that was another blow to this lame GWL. There were about 5 single

So this was our return trip from pre pandemic. We thought after being closed for so long they would have made improvements,  guess not. In fact it became worse. The pricey Wolf Den Suites have removed the TV inside the kids area. Parents I don't need to tell you what an inconvenience this is! They still have no USB Chargers anywhere in the rooms. Still sub par in the room cleaning,  we found a old yogurt in the mini fridge. The check in still takes a very long time and we were promised a higher floor room when booking, almost happened. The wave machine was out of service for some time, guess spring break is not a priority to have it fixed for? The Howlin Tornado their high level attraction took 30 minutes to wait for because of 1 inner tube available. Really?? No one thought

Summary Heading: Not worth the money! Just do day pass!
Summary: Just like a lot of other people I had really high hopes. Before booking our reservation my sister tells me that the website says we can’t take our food by the pool. Ok got it. She also tells me we have to check in at 4 but we can arrive earlier and use the water park(also on website). Ok no problem. We arrive at 11 on Friday and we only take our bathing suits in. I go to the front desk and I’m told we can check in already, cool we just have to walk all the way back to our car to get our stuff now. Luckily they have little carts for your things. The water park is cool but it’s very humid inside and cold in the lobby. You have to walk through the gift shop to get into the park which I thought was weird. They have food and drinks inside the water park which is odd because the

Summary Heading: Very aggressive manager used foul language in front of my children!
Summary: The only highlight of this place is the valets, the buffet workers and the maintenance crew.  I had a manager use foul language in front of my 5 year old and my 8 year old.  A person working in an establishment made for and full of children should know better.  Not only was he using foul language, he did it in a very aggressive threatening manner, toward another guest!  When complaining to customer service, there was no sense of concern, nor did they understand why a parent would be upset that a member of the managerial staff would swear in front of my children.  It's hard enough explaining when they hear other adults use it, but when the person is wearing a Wolf's Lodge shirt, it's even more confusing.

The pipes bang in the wall all day and night. We complained and got switched to a new room that had the same issue. Kids running up and down the halls past midnight. The halls smell of pot. The dress code was never enforced (no shirt no shoes). The pool is way too busy to enjoy.

Too expensive  Too Crowded  Food sucks Staff is nice no complain about that Sofa bed horrible to sleep in Really more for little kids than older ones with the exception of the slides and since its so crowded it takes forever to finally slide down... In conclusion, not worth it for the money

We booked a 5 day stay for 3 adults and 4 kids. The smaller room's AC broke so they had to give us another room for them to stay in which made it difficult to plan activities together. The room was musty and smelled like cigarette smoke. My daughter has asthma so she ended up having to stay on a broken pull out couch in our room.We had to call maintenance twice because the locks pops shut easily and our 1yr old locked herself in the room. The staff was polite except the front desk.  The cost of activities and to eat there was insane. For 7 people our bill came to $340 and the food was subpar. For that amount I would have expected better. For 2 wands it was $100. The Waterpark was packed and the slides took forever. My eldest kids probably used the Waterpark for a day because of

Summary Heading: Best for young kids but the rooms need work
Summary: This is a place best fit for groups of kids under 10. The water park is smaller than expected but fun. The water park employees really seem to like working with kids. And the lifeguards are probably more engaged in their jobs that I ever remember seeing. But the rooms. It felt like a low level chain brand. The bathroom had mismatched fixtures. It was just economy feeling. The pillows were terribly hard.  They need to do something about the noise too. Kids screaming in the hallway woke me up several times. A door sweep would help tremendously. I was pleased that things like the ice cream shop had very reasonable pricing.

Booked a night well over 6 weeks in advance. Decided today (3 weeks out) that it would not work out. Call them and was charged a $50 hidden cancellation fee. What a rip off. If I would have known this I would never have booked. Back to hotels.com I go.

Summary Heading: Very sad that it has dropped off
Summary: I have had two previous stays at Great Wolf that were outstanding, but this time I was very disappointed. The check in process was quick and easy. Our room was ready ahead of schedule. We went to the water park shortly after check in and there was almost no one there. My kids were so excited that we would get lots of rides in, but that was where our enjoyment was replaced by dismay at the water park’s ability to plan ahead. Or maybe I should say inability to plan ahead. Their tubes had all had leaks (which apparently couldn’t be patched) and of course the replacements were on a ship waiting for delivery. Unacceptable. I complained to the staff and they were all unapologetic. For two days we waited ridiculously long for rides that otherwise had relatively short lines. The food

Besides the kids of course having fun in the water, I would NOT recommend GWL. The cost of the room does not justify the experience. For the same price you pay, you could almost stay at disneyland hotel, with a beautiful room and good food choices and things to see for entertainment for free on the grounds. Both visits we had family with us. A total of 12 one visit and 9 the next visit.  They rented their own room this time for a grand total of $1500 just for 1 weekend room.  This was our second visit within 30 days to GWL since we only live an hour away. We did mobile check in because last time the check in line was outrageous. This time, when we arrived I had to wait in line again because the mobile system was down  Rooms:  The first trip I rented 2 standard rooms. They looked

Summary Heading: Great fun @ The Great Wolf Lodge and Water park
Summary: Booked a room for two nights for two adults and three children we were able to use the park before we actually even got into our rooms and we were able to use the water park even after we checked out of our rooms at 11:00. My grandchildren had a blast there was something for them to do all day right up till 10:00 at night. Whether it was swimming listening to stories doing a Halloween trick or treat event or dance party.

Summary Heading: If you can handle the waterpark crowds it is OK
Summary: Booked 2 very large, very expensive rooms for 12 of us, each room slept 6.  Not at all a cheap deal.  A few things that are  good to know. On a Saturday the waterpark was at capacity -we had to wait for people to leave to get in and once in it was crazy packed.  Now if you are worried about Covid a crazy crowded indoor waterpark may not be right for you.  I mean its packed and indoors and  no one is in a mask,  no large open windows to the outdoors (we are in SoCal so I am not sure why that was).  I was OK with it but I am not sure everyone would be.  Also I wish they had water filing stations so you can bring your own water bottle and refill easily- I hate all the plastic waters bottles they are selling. Kids liked the Pizza and it was pretty reasonable.  I packed snacks  and

Summary Heading: This place is a blast (if you have kids)
Summary: Yes, it's overrun with kids and some adults who have no concept of personal space. Yes, the main attraction is a waterpark which in this day and age seems like it would be a giant petri dish of who-knows-what. Yes, its overpriced for a medium sized, motel level room in Garden Grove. But I have to admit we all had a blast. Our family of four (two kids 9 and 13) thoroughly enjoyed the waterpark which I have to say felt pretty clean and sanitized. There are family slides, a large water play area, wave pool, outdoor pool, lazy river and slides for the more adventurous. The food is typical theme park fare, inflated prices for very average pizza, burgers, etc. The food in the breakfast buffet may actually be worth the price with some more unique offerings outside of the typical eggs,

Summary Heading: Staff is bored and not trained to interact with guests who have Autism
Summary: - staff is not trained in how to interact with those on the spectrum. The life guard Monique tried to kick my son out of the Waterpark for standing on a lily pad, I explained he has autism and I will be sure to keep my eye on him as we were not aware that he wasn't allowed to stand, she then told me that autism is not an excuse for not following the rules and the next time he doesn't listen he will be kicked out. Really!? What kind of professionalism is that. She then walked away and proceeded to laugh about the incident with her fellow loge guard. Not cool. I saw multiple other kids standing but they were getting much more leniency due to thier age. Just because my son looks like the typical child doesn't mean his thinking process is at the same level. Autism.is the invisible

We stayed at the great wolf lodge in garden grove for my sons birthday. It was nice with how clean it was specially since Covid was still going on. We had a great experience the water park was so nice and big! I will for sure be returning again. If your going to stay there and have kids with you I highly suggest getting a wolf den suite, it's a private little sleeping area with the kids that have bunk beds and it's so fun for them! The moose kitchen was really good and had a lot of variety perfect for kids, the breakfast is the best! The bar is also really nice for the adults! I was so tired after being there two days cause there is so much to do that I didn't even get to do it all but I like that there was so much to do. The staff there is very friendly and made it a good

stayed around the 4th of July holiday, it was packed, but that's because everyone wanted to get out after COVID restrictions were removed. Paid more than $600/night but it was not worth it at all. They also overcharged me (double charged the deposit amount) and I cannot find a way to reach them, multiple phone calls, no response. I will not return for sure.

Spent $400 for a room, $100 charges for parking, resort fees, and taxes, totaling $500. Food was subpar, and couldn’t sleep all night due to a plumbing problem in the room above -zero sleep and was credited $200 lol! Two weeks later still no credit issued. Spent 30 minutes and 45 minutes on hold for customer service to ask about credit. Go to a better hotel, and a better park (indoor water park is small and crowded, arcade overpriced and crowded) Not worth it! And good luck trying to call customer service, if needed, plan on putting an entire afternoon aside to get through.

When you first walk in, it seems like this nice family resort and we we’re so excited as it was our 1st time. The water from the park is recycled so you can immediately feel how gross it is after while swimming and you can’t help but feel that salty taste it’s almost unbearable. The room seemed a-okay but when it came for us to go to sleep we noticed the sheets were just layered so many times and we seen dead bigs as we were unlayering! Disgusting! We luckily brought blankets so we we’re able to sleep. The carpet felt like it hasn’t been shampooed in over a year it had a stench! Another downfall was all these hidden fees! Towards the end we knew we had a balance for our dining voucher we purchased at the time of booking and they said we had a big purchase in the snack bar area

Had to try and Reschedule because the lodge was close until 15 June, got only nasty and unhelpful customer service, they refused to refund or to help at all . The Lodge is close not do to my fault.  Do not use !!!!!  Go to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Dishonest, Unethical and Disgusting. Do Not GIve Them Your Business
Summary: They cheated me out of $1,200.00 without providing anything. I reserved rooms for an expo. Corona struck. Even cancelled. Every other rental returned my money except for Great Wolf. "Not our problem".

My family and i had a great experience!! No problem at all..the kids had a great time!!! The rooms was clean!! There were a lot of activities for the children!! The food there is good. The water park attractions are great..ill b back soon

Water park was great.  I loved the water temperature, it was not cold like other water parks. Room was great and comfortable. Loved the mini golf. Enjoyed breakfast with characters. Loved the breakfast, food was great

I have been many times to Great Wolf Lodge.  We have stayed in the Cave themed room , Deluxe room with Grand Children & another time with Niece & Nephew.  The last two stays only Gramps & I stayed in the King room in between errands in the OC.  It was great fun for just us two also. Very clean park & every Wolf Lodge employee is so very, very kind & helpful.  Many fun crafts & adventures.  My Grand Daughters LOVE the nightly Dance party & story time.

Summary Heading: The Best Experience for our family Amazing Resort ,
Summary: Amazing place to create memories,  to feel special in a very special place , customer service Outstanding,  f&b awesome,  waterpark magnificent , room amazing , hotel staff Amazing, the attention to detail is incredible,  the way the staff put so much energy into the kids it's just awesome to see

Pretty interesting place. Lots of fun water activities, but there is an arcade, bowling, miniature golf, lots of food places, bars and shops. It is fairly expensive, but once you are there, there’s no need to leave. They even have a magic wand treasure hunt that takes you through out the place finding treasures. This place is more than just a water park.  The only problem is the water park is one price and everything else costs separately.

We took our 3 kids ages 2-7 on a quick 2 day trip. Everyone had a blast. Pretty much every single employee that we came in contact with went above and beyond for us with a smile. They are clearly trained to take great care of their customers. 4/5 of our family is gluten intolerant and follow a strict gluten-free diet. We purchased the meal package and visited Loose Moose Buffet for both breakfast and dinner. At each meal the head chef came out and showed me everything that my family would be able to eat. And anything that might be iffy because of where it was placed on the buffet (next to gluten foods) they would make us separately in the back dedicated kitchen. I can’t tell you how excited my kids were to get gluten-free chicken strips, french fries and waffles. There was so

Summary Heading: Wish they would have told me
Summary: So we planned a overnight trip for my 2 kids as a surprise we got here kids were happy excited first trip (3 and 4 year old) we checked in put our stuff in our rooms changed to go into the water park area when we got in we noticed a whole section not working the main play area right in the middle my kids and me were very sad at this this is the main play area for them to me was unacceptable should have been told when I booked at the very latest when I checked In. The later that day at around 10pm when down to go get some pizza as a late night snack to find out that the pizza place was closed I had look at time on the app and on there sign when we first checked in and it said 11pm as I was standing in front of the pizza place it said 11pm this again was not acceptable would have

The average room at this resort hovers around $300, disregarding any promos that may be running. For that, you get 4 passes to a water park that's almost as good as any other, a room, and not much else. The water park has the basics: A kids splash area with bucket, a toddler pool with slides, 3 tube slides, a racer slide, 2 raft rides, a small vertical drop slide, wave pool, and a lazy river. Only one of the rides is really unique. There are activities, such as kids yoga and story times that are free for anybody in the lobby. They have a game called MagiQuest which is a fun enough fetch quest game, but nowhere near a good value. Everything else is prohibitively expensive. The only reason to come is if you really want to go on waterslides in the winter. Otherwise, you are better

Summary Heading: Waterpark was great, but don't expect to sleep
Summary: There was trucks rearranging dumpsters or something all night long we heard them backing up beeps and then dumpsters or something banging.  We got no sleep and wound up cutting our trip short due to everyone being completely exhausted.

I stayed at great wolf with my 2 kids age 9 and 14. The initial aim of our trip was to go to Disneyland but great wolf turned out to be a highlight! The hotel is amazing. We were there just prior to Halloween so the decorations were great and they had nightly trick or treating which the kids thought was amazing. The rooms are great for families...we had 2 x double beds and a sofa bed. There’s a kitchenette is you want to make your own meals but the restaurant in house and nearby dining options meant we didn’t bother. The indoor water park attached to the hotel is insane!!! So amazing. The kids loved it and so did I. There are rides for all ages. Can’t wait to go back. My kids can’t stop talking about it!

We celebrated my twins birthday during our stay and had an amazing time. Yet, the highlight of our trip was definitely when my daughter lost her build a bear that we had just purchased. My daughter was in tears and extremely sad after loosing her Sammy the squirrel stuff animal and after asking several employees about a lost and found I came across Ed a manager that was extremely helpful and went above and beyond in getting Maile the build a bear manager to replace the lost stuff animal. She did not hesitate to replace the lost stuff animal and had an amazing attitude. Thank you for being empathetic to our situation and making our trip a memorable one. Great Staff and great services ;)

If you haven't been to the Great Wolf Lodge, you are missing out. They have an amazing indoor water park, bowling, Build A Bear, arcade and more.  The lodge was very clean and the rooms were spacious. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: The Best trip for my family
Summary: The customer service is great. Everything is always really clean. Everyone is really nice. There so many things to do and alot fun stuff like the quest with my kids,bowling,glow in the dark golf and arcade. Great food the rooms are clean. The water park is really clean and lots of fun for everyone.

We visited GW on a Sunday of a 3 day weekend. We got there at 1pm  and once we did the pre-checkin on the app, went to a pre-checkin line and were able to get our wristbands and wolf ears. We were greeted warmly and tended to in a prompt and friendly manner. We were then instructed to await a text letting us know when we could enter our room. Regular check-in time is 4pm, however, it's possible they would text you sooner based on room availability.  In the interim, we were permitted to go into the water park where there are changing rooms and shower stalls. Around 330, we received the text that our room was ready.   There are a lot of family activities to take part in and the staff is friendly and helpful. The Lodge itself is not fancy, but is definitely clean and well

Summary Heading: Body Surfing indoors on a rainy weekend
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge  was lots of fun for the whole family. Diane helped teach the grandson how to boogie board and body surf. She was a great teacher and so patient. They have slides for the cautious and slides for the daredevils. Food prices were also pretty reasonable so there was no need to leave the Lodge. We will be doing this again.

Summary Heading: Extra Fees Charged & Just Not Impressed
Summary: I got my reservation for this hotel through Priceline, and when I checked in they charged me additional "resort fees" and I was quite upset with that!  The front desk said that they would have a manager talk to me about the fees and that never happened.  I then got an email survey and requested to be contacted and that never happened either.  AND I never got a receipt for all of the extra charges that my credit card statement reflects.   If you have children and can take advantage of the water park, it might be the place for you, but I don't have small children.  Also, the room key is a wrist band that grants you access to the water park (that I didn't use) and was told that if I lost the wrist band then they'd charge me $50/band. The room also didn't have an alarm clock or any

We travelled from Australia and stayed for 6 nights as we were also staying 6 nights on property at Disneyland so thought it would be great to break up our accommodation. The hotel was beautiful, really very family orientated. I was concerned that my kids (12 & 13) would find it too childish but that wasn’t the case at all! We all loved the array of dining options and family activities located in the hotel but the superstar of the trip was the water park! Our room was immaculate and beds super comfy, hotel staff were also very friendly. Only hiccup was the credit card authorisation however that was sorted out promptly and very professionally. We’ve made some wonderful memories staying here and would stay here or at any great wolf hotel again.

Rooms were clean, food was affordable, staff was helpful and pleasant, and water park was attended to!   My only wish would be a bank of (paid) lockers OUTSIDE the waterpark so that I could have put my food that I brought with in there - would have saved me a bunch of money.   What else can you want?!

Summary Heading: Everyone is awesome except front office team
Summary: We love this hotel, kids enjoy it, we've been coming from times to times...the team from the hotel are very friendly, EXCEPT the front office team...not sure if they are overloaded, or no training...they are just cold, and not welcoming...simple greeting can make a big different, but I don't see it in Great Wolf Lodge...especially my last visit...the room was okay, the shower head is about to fall apart, but I didn't report it, I just thought the housekeeping will know better as they clean room everyday...

We've been celebrating our kids birthdays since 2018 here. Perfect place for a winter birthday. Friendly staff and clean rooms. We enjoy the restaurant and bar very much. We recommend this place to all our friends.

Summary Heading: Horrible customer service, extremely uncomfortable rooms
Summary: This place is a joke of a resort!  The room is inadequately supplied with pillows for the extra sofa bed and the beds have no blankets.  Only sheets.  4 pillows for 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.  The staff is rude, condescending and honestly should not even work in the hospitality industry.  The girl in the candy store was the most personable on the entire property.  The state that there is a Disney shuttle, but that seems to be a joke as well!  The staff has no clue what Apple Pay is when using it to book a room and cares not about listening to anything you have to say to explain.  I would not recommend this place to anyone, ever!  The carpets are old and dingy and the elevators smelled like urine!

Wonderful family atmosphere..awesome water park and fun things for the kids to do..clean rooms and friendly staff and facilities are very clean..safe place for children to wander around to play Magic Quest and all the other activities..

Summary Heading: Year End Family Trip to GWL
Summary: GWL is very expensive. In order to get more bang for your buck, arrive BEFORE check in. This is something the hotel does not advertise but something you can totally do. Arrive early, leave your bags with bell service. They can hold it until your room becomes available. Also, do NOT pay for meals ahead of time. It won't be worth it. The way that works is, "Breakfast with Characters" is paid up front. The payment includes gratuity, meals expense and taxes. You're better off paying that directly when you get to the park. Also, for lunch and dinner, if you get the meal plan, the hotel will issue you a voucher with a "Paid balance". If for any meal, you come under the balance, it will not be refunded to you (thumbs down). Any overage you will be responsible for at checkout. Also, if

Summary Heading: second trip food is a BAD
Summary: the Loose Moose restaurant (inside the hotel)  is way over priced and most food is not kid friendly. We bought the food package and thought it would be simple to use, NOT so, what they don't tell you is they give you a budget and most of the food actually cost more than what the budget allows. So you pay a flat fee for food in advance and then when you check out they add more extra costs to your room. The pool was so crowded it was difficult to enjoy and the water smelled of urine.The plumbing  made noise most of the night and when we called the front deck at 5AM we were offered a free night.. When we check out the next day NO ONE remembered anything about a free night.We actually had to shut the water off to the toilet so we could get some sleep. If we were going to do this

Summary Heading: My 4 year old autstic child found a used condom on side of bed
Summary: We took our son ther for his birthday he found a USED CONDOM on side of the bed staff really didn't seem to care when i got upset the manager threatened to call security on  me like i wasn't supposed to be upset not he has to go for all types of testing for his saftey worst experience ever

We stayed here for just one night, Jan 9-10 for my niece and nephew’s bday. Prior to checking in, Willow, one of the staff already sent me a text reminding us of our stay at Great Wolf and she was very helpful with my requests. . Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Their water park is very fun place for kids and adults. Planning already for out next stay!

We took my niece and nephew so there were 7 of us total. I did the pre-check in and my room was ready when we arrived at 12:30pm. (Normal check in is at 4:00pm). The room we stayed in had two bedrooms and had plenty of space for all of us. We stayed here for two nights.  We had access to the water park right away and had a blast the first day. We played all day on the second day. There are eight water slides not including the slides in the kiddie area. There’s a lazy river, wave pool, separate pool with basketball hoops and a water bridge, and an area for really little kids. You can stay till the park closes on the day you check out.   We chose to get the meal plan so we didn’t have to leave the park to eat our meals. It was very convenient but the food was just okay. If you

Summary Heading: Great wolf experience in winter season
Summary: I liked the lobby, decorated for the season. It was loud and hard to hear staff at check in. You have lean in to hear them which is weird how loud it is in that room.  The room needs to be a little updated.  I was looking for room service menu but I don’t think they deliver to your room. It would be nice if there was a peek window between the sleep area and kids sleep area. I have to check the kids a couple times to make sure they were on the bunk beds. The swim area seemed a little crowded and noisy. The sounds are all in one with no escape of sound. It’s so hard to hear people that are even next to you. I felt like I needed ear plugs to distant some people’s voices. The place needs a escape window of sound like a sky port or something .

Exceptional service, very clean throughout. We really appreciated the ease of the bracelets for hands free purchases. The only issues we had was the chlorine in the water park was overwhelming which limited the amount of time we could spend inside. Our eyes, nose & throats burned. Not good for those with asthma or other sensitivities. Perhaps better air ventilation? Also we were not able to find kid friendly shows/movies on the TV. I understand the GWL doesn't want you in your room but rather out spending money, but would be nice to have a family movie at bed time/breaks.

Our family of 4 [parents/2 boys 9 & 11] traveled to this local resort for an overnight trip to wrap of Christmas break.  The water park is fantastic. We experienced reasonable wait times and it was very clean.  The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable.  The only downside of the trip was the food. It was VERY overpriced and the quality was lacking.  I highly recommend bringing your own snacks to keep in the room and checking out local options-especially if you're vegetarian or have other dietary needs.  Overall it was a fantastic experience and we will definitely go back.

arrived to a nice lobby filled with friendly staff. lobby was full of kid activites. also in the lobby you have a view of the waterpark which is very nice. check in was a breeze. safe and secure hotel. we also really enjoyed the interactive wizard game within the hotel and different floors, along with an arcade downstairs. eating area was good lots to choose from also characters of the hotel visit you while dining. waterpark was super fun with the kids and husband. hope to be back soon.

Great family vacation with everyhting available in the hotel.  Quest was beyond my expectations, grandson loved it. The waterpark had a variety of options, easy to more scary rides for whichever works for your family.

Summary Heading: Fun, but I have some concerns
Summary: This was are second trip to GWL. The first time we went, it had only been open for a few months, so obviously the hotel and water park were in great condition. The pros: fun attractions, nice hotel rooms (not a fan of carpet in the dressing areas of the rooms), and friendly staff. Cons: apparently they allow people to purchase day passes which was not allowed on our first trip, making for a more crowded environment. Hair everywhere!!! They need to clean the floor in the park more often. The food is horrible and many of the food establishments didn’t open until 11am.

Summary Heading: First time at Great Wolf Lodge near Disney resort, The Good, and the not so Good.
Summary: The good:   The staff was welcoming and service at shops and restaurant was pleasant and efficient.  The Risotto in the restaurant was fabulous, all of the food tasty, but huge portions- we could have split dinners and lunches.  The room was clean and well supplied. (it was not a special kids suite, it was a mini-suite with 2 queens and a Sofa, I had heard about the mobile check-in so didn't wait at all at arrival. Used valet parking which was only 5$ more than regular parking-- well worth it.  We were quite impressed at the size and appearance of the lobby, and surprised at how much there was to do. The kids we saw were having a great time, and the last day we were there my grandson joined us, and it was terrific for him- swimming, games and the pizza! The room came with wolf

First things first, inquire about mobile check in when you book your stay. We waiting probably an hour or so to check in.   Be forwarded that if you purchase a Magic Wand it is interactive with the wolf’s den rooms just by being in the room itself. We weren’t told that and all night long the wolf den in our room lit up and was talking, we honestly thought it was a malfunction. We didn’t sleep very much because of it.   Where was no directory explaining which ride/slide was what which was confusing. Also, my younger  son is exactly 48-1/10” he went on all the rides including the 4 persons yellow tube ride many times, We decided to do that one 2 more times before being done for the day. We went down once then got back in line, waited another 20 min and the person working up there

Won't recommend this facility for Great Wolf Lodge (GWL) patrons.  Other GWL facilities seems to be better run and staff more helpful and knowledgeable.  The reception/registration process is very disorganized and procedures in place totally lack customer/patron orientation.  Facility is great just like other GWL facilities.  Staff needs in-service training and be more customer oriented!

This was our first time at the Great Wolf Lodge and it was a great stay! The lodge has many activities for my sons from arts and crafts, dancing, swimming to the magic quest adventure. My son has already asked me to come back for his birthday.

We arrived to find a 60+ minute wait to check in... during which I started reading tripadvisor reviews (too late, I realize), and I got really scared that our whole visit was going to be frustrating. But even with this negative first impression, we had a great time here! Do the before-noon mobile checkin and you can avoid this line.   The waterpark gets 5 stars as far as my family is concerned. We were here on New Years Day, when kids were out of school, and while the whole complex seemed really crowded, there are enough slides and enough variety within the waterpark that I didn't feel that any of the lines for the slides were excessive at all. We have a 6 year old and a 4 year old, and there were enough Small, Medium, and Large slides to keep everyone entertained, and we found

All the activities Great Wolf offers are awesome and kids love it. The water park is tons of fun also! The staff are very friendly and helpful. They have various activities and snow land was also a lot of fun for the kids.

It was my family and I first time here. We enjoyed the great water park and the hours were reasonable. The park is filled with friendly staff and clean restrooms. The price of the food in the park is a bit expensive in my opinion but overall the one night stay was a fun experience. We will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Family trip to Great Wolf Lodge Garden Grove Ca.
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge Garden Gove Ca. was a well worth while family trip.  when we arrived at the lodge we were greeted by a very friendly face and our check in process was quick and easy.  We were given three pairs of complimentary wolf ears for my three grand children and a Birthday badge for my grandson who was celebrating his 6th Birthday. When we arrived at our room it was very clean and ready for us.  Our room slept 6 people ( a standard suite). Our room included waterpark tickets for 5 and I purchased  three additional activity packages for $99.00 each. The activity package was the best for the price, you get one build a bear (cloths not included), one wand for magic quest game, one cup to fill with candy at candy shop, game tokens  for the arcade, one game if bowling and glow

Summary Heading: Great for families with small children
Summary: Brought my older sons (we have spent many an awesome vacation at the Williamsburg location) but they were bored.  The waterpark entertained them for a day, but their MagicQuest (which they were looking forward to) experience was lackluster at best.  The new game is not as engaging as the old and was centered around grinding out experience for your totems rather than using them in quests.  Moving around required elevator use vice stairs (thus, you are crammed with 500 barely supervised kids banging on the portals, trying to manhandle the chests open, sitting on stations... :( )   Our room was clean and well stocked; the beds were comfortable, and the service was good.  Absolutely take advantage of the mobile check in feature - mine wouldn't work and I ended up waiting in line for

Took our grandkids, loved the easy check-in, the wristband idea worked fabulously! Our room had a microwave and fridge, it was clean, had plenty of towels, could have used a bit more shampoo, but bring your own if you have long hair. Fun winter thing to do, I found one full day was enough, after that the kids (ages 14, 10, 9 & 5) felt it was repetitive. Great idea to have lots of luggage carts! You can bring in a small ice chest with food and drinks. The snack bar was reasonable, the nachos were HUGE, chicken strips were done just right you got lots of FF!

Summary Heading: Howling good time with Grandkids/Great Wold Lodge
Summary: Had a great experience with first time trip with Grandkids.  The thoroughly enjoyed the park to a point of exhaustion.  Good value for hotel and waterpark.  Add on's and food are a bit pricey and the total cost quickly escalates.  Bring your own food or go elsewhere to eat.

3rd time there to celebrate my sons birthdays, 1st & 2nd time was an amazing experience & friendly staff. Can't say the same this last time. Sofa bed was worn out or broken,no longer have birthday bears instead a pin that cant be worn in the waterpark (not safe) therefore children dont get as much acknowledgement for they birthdays

I purchased one night on Priceline. This was my first visit to this hotel. I was charged taxes and fees when I purchased. Again when I arrived I was charged taxes and fees!! Overall I was charged over 90% taxes and fees. The hotel room was dirty and disrepair. We spent about 5 hrs. In our room. We go to Anaheim about once a month but will not return here.

Great Wolf Lodge was a huge disappointment for our family. Very expensive. There was no real welcome or help navigating the place. Our room was run down & dirty. The water was cold, especially in the lazy river & we were FREEZING in long lines for the limited number of floats for the water slides. I broke down in tears because my kids had looked forward to going to this place for years & I thought it was going to be a dream come true,  not a nightmare:(

If you are reading this, it is very likely the review will make no difference.  You are on an inevitable path -- propelled solely by the desire to please your children.  We went to the GG, CA Great Wolf Lodge in October.  It was horrifying.  The customer service is terrible.  If you call the front desk, they never answer.  Ever.  There are some things you can never obtain except by calling the front desk.  But, they never pick it up. There is no room service -- except that they are somehow equipped to deliver wine at unreasonable prices to the parents' rooms. On top of that, most likely the grossest thing my husband and I have ever witnessed occurred at this location.  A mother brought her child over to the trash can near where my husband was sitting.  The child virulently

We were really unimpressed with our time at Great Wolf lodge. We could really take it or leave it and would think twice about recommending this to trip to others.  I will say that I was very glad that we had quite a deep discount for the nights we stayed.  It is definitely not worth even close to the full price.  The customer service at this establishment was really poor when trying to make a reservation for eating... after multiple calls over multiple days with assurances from staff 'everything was taken care of' it clearly wasn't--this made for a very non enjoyable time for our stay where we were to relax with our family, not play matre'd for the hotel. Also, the hotel's claim on the 'hold spiel' when I was waiting on hold for 20 + min on each of the many calls I made to get a

My family of 6 has so much fun here! So I realized once I checked in yes parking is $20 but you pay per night and they give you another special ticket to keep so you can scan at the entrance/exit to come and go as you please! I got a great deal on Groupon! We only stayed one night but I will definitely stay longer next time!!! I checked in at 12 and luckily they had my room ready YAY! :) awesome awesome awesome! My son will always remember this birthday!

Summary Heading: Great fun for the entire family
Summary: We went in November with several other families and had a great time.  I was worried about the smell of chlorine as some of the reviews state it as over powering but it didn't bother me or my family anymore than a visit to a public pool. Some have suggested bringing eye drops for after a day at the park - we didn't need that.   The facilities were clean and there are other activities to capture the kids attention when they've had enough water play.   We brought robes for the kids in case they got cold but they were not necessary. The water is on the colder side and you can get a bit cold when waiting for a ride however if you're constantly in the water, it's OK. My 4 and 6 year old were constantly in the water. As it is quite humid and warm inside the water park, you dry up and

This was my second time at GWL Garden Grove and my son loved it.  The staff were AMAZING! Smiles everywhere I went.  Staff could not have been more accommodating.  The water park was my favorite.  Definitely a "bucket list" item..lol

Great wolf lodge did not disappoint me at all. The amount of activities provided by the resort as well as the water park kept the children busy from sunrise to sunset. The water park was a hit! There were no wait times and staff were very helpful throughout the park. My daughter and nephew are both swimmers but what I loved the most about the water park are the safety guards, always very attentive to their guest walking back and forth making sure everyone was being safe. The water park was not the only best thing they also have bowling and golf and my my my the quest drove the children crazy! They were excited to get up the next morning and continue with the quest. The breakfast buffet was delicious  They had healthy yummy foods. Cant wait to go back soon!

The sinks aren't in the bathrooms, they are in the living area so if you want to wash your hands after or brush your teeth or do your hair or anything that doesn't involve the shower itself or pooping then it needs to be done in front of your family.

We decided to celebrate our son's 1st birthday here instead of Disney. That was a mistake it seems as though everything here is about money and not the experience. Customer service was rude when we asked questions. There is a resort fee of $34.99 per night along with a parking charge of $20 per night. Before you know it your bill is increased by $54.99 per night with not much to show for it. We could not connect to the Wifi and that just irritated me a little bit, but I could deal with it.   The activities are nice but the schedules do not make sense for families staying with toddlers. We wanted to attend storytime, but the nighttime activities started at 8 pm which is too late for a 1-year-old. We were hoping there would be different times for kids of different age groups. I

I am a local resident and have seen this hotel since the ground breaking day. I was skeptical to book the hotel due to an expensive rate and have read some bad reviews. Anyway our experiene was very good during Veteran weekend. The waterpark is smaller than I thought but my 7 yr old and husband had so much fun. Our room was very basic with 2 queen beds, microwave, small refrigerator and coffee maker. The room and bathroom was clean upon arrival. The foods are pricey as expected but you could go to nearby shopping center/restaurants for lunch or dinner. Be aware that they'll charge daily parking fee and resort fee plus taxes. We will return in the future if we could find a great deal/discount. 4 stars due to high resort fee, parking fee and slow-to-none wifi connection inside

This resort was amazing. My kids loved it, we celebrated his 2nd birthday there. The water park was clean and so much fun! Its a ice family getaway!!!!!!!!!!!!  Everything as very clean, the food at the park was amazing and they even have drinks!!

Brought my daughter for her bday as she's had other friends tell her about it. She was super excited and enjoyed the park. Overall, our stay was pleasant. The check in process was simple (mobile check in), the rooms open with your bracelet, which is awesome, one less thing to worry about. Towels were easy to get as well at the water park section. The water park isn't big like Raging Waters, but it has enough to entertain the young and the older people. My daughter enjoyed the smaller slides, while my son enjoyed the longer slides and options such as wipeout, which was for you to boogie board. The best part is that even on the day you check out, you can still enjoy the water park. What we did was we took our luggage back to the car, and just left the clothes they would change

Summary Heading: Exciting water park and excellent hotel for the whole family to enjoy!
Summary: My family recently spent 1 night at the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove, CA (aka Anaheim/Orange County/Southern California).  The overall experience was fantastic from start to finish.  Arrival: We parked our car in the huge self-park lot and worked our way to the hotel lobby.  Since we had used the Great Wolf Lodge app to pre-check in, we were able to bypass the front desk and go to the little kiosks to complete the check-in procedure.  The employee that helped us was very friendly and helpful.  She was very knowledgeable and was able to answer all of our questions.  She also noticed that we had been over-billed because of the way I entered the reservation and was able to deduct the over-payment from the amount we had left to pay at the counter.  The entire process took us

If you're booking through a third party website, let it be known you're going to be paying at least $35 a night in just resort fees.  They don't disclaim this when you're checking in and immediately charge it to you, along with other fees when you check out.  It does have it on their official website but most people, like I, go through third party to get the best prices.  Yes I assume my own accountability for not looking at their own website but I would also expect something like this to be told upfront and not already charged when I leave.  When talking to people about the situation, they wanted to shift blame and didn't seem to want to help at all.  Not worth it and never going back after this.

While our trip.was fine, when we received our receipt they charged $45 for 3 pool towels that we left in the room as we had in past trips. The Halloween trail had 5 stops, I think we were expecting more fanfare.

Our kids love water parks, while the waterpark is good the hotel is terrible. It was absolutely packed, lines everywhere. Rude staff and so expensive. Waterpark doesn’t open until 9am. Surely you should do a magic hour for hire guests like they do at Disney? We left feeling ripped off and disappointed.being back some old fashioned customer service  Save your money and go to Disney, no comparison.

Check your bill before leaving. we’ve stayed twice and both times were over charged. The taxes are outrageous, more expensive than Vegas. 1 night with 2 grand kids added a food package cost us over $800.00...it would be cheaper to go to Disneyland.

The place is great and stuffs are all nice and friendly. They will give you all the informations you need upon checking in. We will definitely come back with friends and relatives next time and we are so excited to share them our experience.

Left my charger in the room. I called them to report it, was transferred to security who had a message that claim needed to be filed online.  I did this.  Gave exact info on where the charger was left.  A few days later received an e-mail saying they couldn't locate it, even though it was plugged in to the wall.  Very disappointed that such and expensive hotel didn't find a charger by housekeeping.  Cheaper places I've stayed at have returned stuff left behind.  But expensive ones can't find when cleaning a room.

Staff was so rude and unwelcoming. My reservation was completely messed up. No one cares and we felt lost the entire time.  We were Charged double for our stay and no seems to care about guests. Spent most of our time complaining. never returning!!

Summary Heading: Resort is nice customer service is terrible
Summary: Room was clean and the waterpark was fun. The showers in the pool area were filthy. Pink mildew all over the curtains and walls. Definitely leaves you with a bad impression. I reserved a shuttle for my family to Disneyland. We waited for 30 minutes before it finally showed up and I had to ask 3 employees before someone finally called to see where it was. Not a good way to start you day with 3 little ones.

Summary Heading: If you get a good sale price. It's worth it. Here's some advice for first timers
Summary: We got a sale price around $120/ night for a very nice clean comfortable room with two queens and a pull out sofa.  That's similar to other hotels in the area. So essentially the resort fee paid for the water park and the free kid events for our two preschoolers.  They allow you to bring food into your room, (not the water park) so you can save money that way, but the ice cream store and other side restaurants also sell sandwiches, pizza, etc at prices that were not as bad as I thought they would be. The character breakfast buffet is not worth the price.  ADVICE - If your new to great wolf and have small children, find out themes, times, and  locations of all the free events beforehand, we were lost till we figured it out. The water park will get crowded, because they sell day

Enough rides to keep kids busy for the whole day. A lot of fun for the kids!!!! Room is great size for 6 people. Facility is clean. Story time is good. Also trick or treat is great. Only problem is we need to pay $20 a night for parking, I thought it should be included as hotel guest.

Would def recommend. Fun for all ages! Very clean resort with lots to do and very friendly and helpful staff. My kids range in ages 2 to 14 and they all had a blast. Even mom and dad enjoyed a fun, relaxing vacation.

We have gone to the Great wolf lodge several times and have never been dissatisfied. The rooms are exactly as pictured and are clean & comfortable. The waterpark has several different areas, so there's something for all age groups. We usually go during fall and  winter so the wait times for rides are virtually nothing. My girls are 11 and 3 and both had a lot of fun. There are also many lifeguards on duty and they are so vigilant and professional. The arcade is a little pricey, as most are now a days, but the kids always enjoy winning tickets and prizes. The staff is very friendly throughout the hotel and park. We have never regretted going.

We have recently stayed at Great Wolf Lodge, Garden Grove, California. This hotel was huge.  It was a little out of the way for us to get to Disneyland but only a $7 Uber ride to Disneyland Park. They do have a little shuttle to Disneyland but seeing how huge the hotel is, we think they need to do more shuttle drop offs/pick ups to and from Disneyland Park. The facilities are fabulous and the kids visiting the hotel were having the time of their lives. The Great Wolf Lodge is a holiday resort in itself with a huge indoor water park, a mini ten pin bowling, amusement park, restaurants, it even has its own Dunkin Doghnuts There are so many activities for the kids to do and the hotel has many attractions to keep the kids occupied. We were two adults visiting the hotel to check it

We arrived at the lodge with friends who checked in first and were offered and accepted a room upgrade for $50 a night, so we asked (not offered) for the same upgrade and were told $150 a night, we didn’t understand the difference except we had two more children but were not explained why the stark contrast in upgrade price. We were told the kids had various Halloween activities that they could do, but when we showed up to do the activities staff told us they would not be happening because, “those supplies ran out a long time ago.”  The elevator in the parking garage was not working for the three days we were there and the second floor door was open with no caution tape or blockage or anything to let people know to keep away from these open doors of a broken elevator. At the

My kids had a blast at the water park. I loved how after the waterpark the hotel still had kid friendly stuff like trick or treating for the kids to participate in & just in general they are such a kid friendly environment.

wonderful waterpark for all ages.  temperature was perfect and no lines.  great value for the price.  love the extra Halloween themed activities.  everything was super clean including the rooms and hotel.  food options were great.

We had been there b4 without incident but this time there were bugs in the room. Staff tried to down play it . disgusting. Looking forward to a resolve....will update with one soon I hope , contacting corprate today

Took out two daughters to Great Wolf Lodge and everyone had an amazing time. Staff was friendly and always smiling. The water park and pool has fun things to do for all ages. The whole property was clean and Halloween nighttime activities were great. Our girls really liked the Dance Party and Story Time. Close location to Disney is another added benefit.

Such a great time with the kids here. Just make sure to leave the waterpark and not stay there all day or you will get a chlorine headache and the temperature feels super hot. You can also make sure to take the kids out for fresh air, especially the little ones under 3.

Summary Heading: $20 parking fee for each vehicle is hilarious!!!!
Summary: So if your'e staying at the hotel you still have to pay $20 per vehicle and that's a joke! Not only is it overpriced to stay at this place but they want to charge you parking. Disneyland at least covers that cost when you stay at their hotel.

Our family loves this resort. Always an activity going on. The staff is always so friendly and helpful. They have trick o treat everyday for the entire month of October. We will be planning another visit soon.

We frequently stay at the GWL in Texas. In our opinion it is better. Parking is free, the water park is bigger, they have an adults only hot tub, and the towel system is better. We were stressed over the towel system and did everything right and still ended up being charged for towels. The system in Grapevine is much better. After a long day at Disneyland we were excited to soak in the hot tub and were so disappointed to discover this location does not have a hot tub. Overall the service was great, especially the first few days. By our 5th day, as they got busier, the service declined. Make sure to check your bill- we were charged for parking, but had no car. We were charged for towels that we in fact returned. And we were charged for ice cream that we did not have.

We spent a weekend here a Great Wolf Lodge, my kids had such a wonderful time that they rather stay at the hotel instead of going to Disneyland. My kids don't like walking, so they can be biased. The pool temperture was comfortable. The food in the buffet was about 20 dollar a person. 3 years old are free. Food was good. Didnt try the pizza area. The staff entertain the kids throughout the day. For the amount of money you have to pay for the room, the room should be, in my opinion,  should be more updated.
