But I guess it pays for the free entertainment throughout the hotel. The arcade is too priceing, but better prices than chuckn cheese. Staff were very nice. There are enough staff standing around ready to answer any question you may have. This is not a cheap hotel, I know that

Summary Heading: Wish it had a hot tub!
Summary: Loved everything, but a hot tub would be great to have! The bathroom in the water park had a wet urine smell to the floor.  The room doors are so heavy and have no way to prop them open while you enter with all your stuff.  Other than that, everything else was great. Kids had a blast!

If you want to find a place for the kids to have fun without breaking the bank just for a one day experience, then this is the place to be. Besides from their usual rates, great wolf offers a lot of specials throughout the year for those on a stricter budget. I usually only buy a single night, but enjoy the park use for two days. Tickets come with the room depending on how many people are in your party. So if you find a deal to stay here, it’s the perfect excuse to get away from home and relax. The indoor water park is pretty expansive. There’s no real wasted space at all. I don’t see any room for expansion so as long as the kids enjoy the rides that are currently available, then it’s always a good place to go. We went while the kids were on their fall break. We didn’t want to

Best experience!!! I celebrated my daughters 1st birthday and she had a great time. I love the fact its a kid friendly hotel, kids can run around, restaurants inside, free activities for the kids, arcade area, and super friendly staff. My kids were super happy that we were able to enjoy two days of fun in the water. Also family members who didnt stay in the hotel were able to buy the wristbands for the water park. I do recommend to buy them after check in the hotel so they can get a discount since someone is already booked in. Before booking the hotel they said $80 and after I gave them my room number they said $50.

That is how one of the bellhops described the place. He was one of the nicer staff we ran into, but more on that later.  We were in town for an impromptu Disney visit. Our two usual hotels had filled, and we tried this one as a friend had done a staycation here and said it was fun. It seemed a bit spendy for what it was, but I just assumed it was because things were filling up. In reading some of these reviews, the price seems to be the norm.  Now, as I look at some of these, I am a bit skeptical. Any indoor pool is going to smell of chlorine. (Chlorine is our friend in this context.) And it's in a kids theme park area. So... you should have reasonable expectations. Resort fees should be banished, but it is hardly unique to this hotel.  My expectations include non-lumpy beds and

It was our first time going and we had the best experience and service. Our room was available before check in time which made going to the water park a lot easier. It's a 1 stop place, it has an arcade area, food, bowling, mini golf, build a bear workshop and a scavenger hunt through out the hotel to keep the kids busy.

We bought a day pass - $90 each for our family of 4. We could only stay for around 5 hours because my littlest was too cold. It was also very crowded. For a $360 one day family adventure my standards / expectations are a lot higher than the reality. It might work if you stayed at the hotel and were able to easily take breaks or had bigger kids. My skinny 5 year old could not hang. I saw a lot of kids shivering.

Summary Heading: Quite enjoyable as a mid-week excursion with the kids
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge has plenty of attractions for elementary age kids. We had a good time. The food was good and the staff was nice. There were a few minor things that could be improved.  It would have been nice if there was another body surf ride to reduce the line wait. Overall, we had a good time.

Rude staff, Supervisors won't do anything to make your poor experience better when you share your experience with them, limited time to enjoy the park since check-in is at 4:00pm, check-out at 11:00am and park opens at 10:00am. The park is filthy and the rooms smell old and dusty, no matter how much money you spend on your room per night, plus parking and food, the hotel doesn't do anything to make your child feel special about celebrating their birthday at the park unless you spend more.

Summary Heading: Unacceptable wait time to check in
Summary: Be prepared to wait for an hour to check in. After asking what was taking so long they said it is just the way it is. It’s very very crowded, everything is super expensive and not that great food wise. The staff didn’t seem to care that we were upset about the wait at check in. Everyone looked frazzled and annoyed. Our room smells like a wet dog. I wish we would have went somewhere else. Definitely would not recommend coming here . For the price you can go to a lot nicer places where they care about customer service.

This was our first time visiting. Had been wanting to do it for a long time. Finally made the trip over... We stayed for three nights. My husband, my 5 year old son, my 2 year old daughter, and I. The property was clean, couldn’t ask for more. The staff was great, they made our trip. The food at the Lodge Grille was amazing. We dined on the half chicken and on the filet mignon, it was great! The water park has plenty of options for kids of all ages. Can’t wait to go back!

We booked this hotel a month ago and signed up for the mobile app on the phone, which allowed us personal content to be delivered through the app (Great Wolf Lodge app). With this, it allowed us to pre-check in the night before and we got to tell the hotel when we expected to arrive. This helped the check-in process to go so much smoother than expected, and we were able to secure a ready (!) room right when we got to the hotel!   The room was nice and spacious, as well as comfortable. The beds were ridiculously comfortable. The downside was that it was TOO quiet at night - not a bad thing (in fact WONDERFUL for a great night's sleep), but for us we needed some white noise to help us sleep (we used a sleep sounds app).  THE WATER PARK. Sweet baby Wiley this was an amazing water

This was the best water park I’ve ever been too!! Definitely going back . Everything was the best experience from the start. The hotels were extremely clean and comfortable. The water park was just amazing and the staff was so nice, definitely feel welcomed here and will return !

great indoor water park and friendly staff what else are you looking for?..enough parking space...near in freeway ...easy check in and easy check out ❤️❤️❤️...we have a great experience here with my family....highly recommended...

We loved our two night stay here, we live in Orange County and saw a great mid week deal for a staycation.  There is so much for kids to do and we had the best time.  The buffet is well priced and has good food, the service is excellent and my son loved the water park.  We'll probably come back at least once a year, but only on off-peak times as I would have hated to be there when it was any more crowded.   I wish our room had a balcony so we could go outside while my son was sleeping but the room was big so it wasn't too bad. It's also only 10 minutes drive from Disney so we spent one of our mornings there and came home for nap time.

Summary Heading: Fun water park but either bring food or plan to diet
Summary: The whole hotel is quite run down. The MagiQuest locations were often broken or looked to be nearly broken and were all very dingy. The water park was great fun but the flooring was nasty. Stepping on soggy, used napkins and food with bare feet is so gross. Speaking of food, do NOT plan to eat there. The food at every outlet (minus donuts from dunkin) was horrible. Even simple items like pizza, burgers, and chocolate cookies were worse than any amusement park I have been to. I’d compare it to airplane food from the 1980’s. When kids won’t eat the pizza and cookies, you have a problem. The arcade was fun and our tweens loved it. Lifeguard staff was great with all kids at all times. Hotel staff all seemed very unhappy. Camp In staff was half/half. Whoever was in charge was smiling

Our most recent trip to GWL was a blast. Everyone from the 6-year-old to the 65-year-old enjoyed themselves. Our Grand Bear Suite was plenty of space for all of us. Rooms were clean and all the staff we came across were friendly and helpful. The waterpark was hours and hours of fun. As was the MagiQuest and the arcade. Be prepared, the MagiQuest will require lots of adult assistance, but it is pretty fun and once you get started you want to finish! We ate at the buffet, the steakhouse and Dunkin Donuts, all are good options. We were disappointed there was no quick grab fruit station available. But we made do. One complaint is during our stay the outdoor area was blocked off and reserved for private functions twice.  Next time we are in the area we will consider a stay at GWL

Summary Heading: Nice little water park and beautiful place to stay with my kids
Summary: We’re having a wonderful time here. Water park look small but actually not small at all. They’re have everything you need just like raging water park. Room we’re staying is wolf den so it fit 6 people plenty places for my family. Anyway, I love it so my kids. I hope you’re all will have good time like us too.

I cannot say enough great things about this resort. They providing our family with an experience we'll never forget! They have plenty of staff, and everyone is kid friendly. The activities provided are phenomenal. My children especially loved the Jammie Jamboree Dance Party each night. The staff members were engaging and fun leading all the activities.  We loved the waterpark of course, and felt that our little ones were safe with adequate number of lifeguards on duty. The arcade was a blast, and we loved how you could save up your tickets on your card in order to turn them in on the last day for the maximum amount of tickets for prizes. Prize values are good too (much better than a Chuck-E-Cheese).  The food in all restaurants was fantastic! We loved the variety. From easy

We had the best time ever.  My family and I had so much fun.  The staff were friendly and courteous best customer service.  We enjoyed ourselves and had a blast.  We are already planning another trip and can’t stop talking about this place to our family and friends.  We will definitely be back!  My family and I loved it.

Summary Heading: Best water park I have ever visited.
Summary: Family fun awaits in Anaheim, CA. Great Wolf Lodge in southern California provides indoor water park fun and dry-land experiences for your entire family. Enjoy kid-friendly indoor activities, dining, shopping, and more all under one roof. Choose from over 600 suites, each featuring free access to all the water park's 14 slides, four pools, and more. Near Los Angeles in Garden Grove, the water park is a warm 84 degrees all-year round.

If you're looking for a nice place to spend the weekend or any 2 to 3 days in the week, with a water park experience for the whole family, then this is the place for you.  However, if your pallet craves cuisine of Asian decent, then you'll have to venture out of the park.

You wont regret it a great experience for the little ones or teens. The hotel and waterpark took care of everything we needed. The showers in the water park were pretty good with privacy, felt very comfortable using them.

If your Vegan,dont expect to have any Vegan options here for you and your family to eat... The Rep who booked our rooms told me that there were 7 restaurants on the grounds that would be able to accommodate our  diet. This was not the case upon arrival !! So to say the least,after being suckered into purchasing expensive food passes we couldn't use,we then had to leave the lodge several times a day to get food for my family and I. Very disappointing ...

Summary Heading: Great Wolf not for Special Needs families
Summary: They advertise on their website that they donate to Autism Speaks, but they are not at all accommodating to special needs children. They need to train their staff on the treatment of children with special needs. Stay clear.

Summary Heading: Watch what you eat and your towels being charged
Summary: Amazing water park time and the feel for the overall security was decent. Not enough personnel in the general area of the water park to create a safer environment. Witnessed one teenager hitting his grandma and another young man stomping on and violently throwing an ice pack on the ground roughly about 15 times with no one in sight to check on those people. Enough lifeguards in the water rides though. Biggest issues were finding bugs/worms in the raspberries in their cafe and then because their own system was down I ended up getting charged for the water park towels because apparently they didn't mark me returning the. Then trying to call multiple times to speak about the charges it would keep ringing then after waiting for 5 minutes it would just start beeping busy signal.  You

I brought my Grandson here when I picked him up from his first day of preschool.  He has been here before, and had a wonderful time, so I thought I would surprise him.  We had one of the suites with the bunk beds, and he was beyond thrilled.  I was offered a great deal on an upgrade when I checked in, and I took it.  The food was some of the best I ever had at a venue like this, water park was  lots of fun, especially since it was a weekday after kids have gone back to school.  Being able to go in the park at 1pm, and being able to stay the next day and go again was a real perk!  Will be looking for deals to plan another trip!

Summary Heading: A bit expensive, but not too bad
Summary: Have always had a great time here, especially when we're with the kids. I just wish they had a lapping pool for adults. Not everyone wants the water attractions. The rooms are nice, clean, and spacious, except for the carpeted floors - which are sometimes a bit icky. You also need to bring your own snacks if you like to snack at night, since all the stores and restaurants close at around 9pm.

We stayed for two nights just recently and over those two nights my family received over 20 bug bites while in our room. It was terrible. I would not recommend for people to stay here. Also I must of missed somewhere where you have to pay each day for self parking and also every day your there you have to pay the resort fee. I think that’s a bit much. I understand paying it once but to do it every time you are there is just a way to take your money.

This place is meh at best. Go somewhere else. Save a few hundred dollars and hit up the Knotts water park up the road. You don't need to go to an indoor water park in Southern California. It's Southern California!

Summary Heading: Lower your expectations and prepare to be disappointed.
Summary: Logistics at check-in is horrible if you self parked and forget to bring in your parking ticket to exchange for in-out pass. They make you go back to the end of a very very long line. They have no concierge / information table / no maps to guide you. No manager visible to escalate complaints to. Staff members rarely smile and greet you if at all. I witnessed a lot of inappropriate swim wear that better suited strip clubs and brothels. The place attracted a lot of questionable people.

Summary Heading: Great for kids, but beware it can be Very Crowded!
Summary: This hotel/Water Park, is entirely focused on fun for kids.  If you are looking for a relaxing getaway, this might not be your place.  I rated this hotel a 4 for the kids, they had a blast, and that is the reason we were there.  This is a fun for kids, high energy,  indoor water park & hotel.  We stayed one night at the end of the Holiday weekend.  The customer service was good at check-in, and we were lucky to get a suite on the top floor, this was perfect for us so we did not have anyone above us making noise throughout the night.  On our 1st day the water park was insanely crowded, there were no available seats and there were long lines for most slides.  There was clearly too many people for this amount of space.  As it got later in the day the crowds died down and we were

Summary Heading: Great time, but the staff needs customer service classes!! We won't be back!! Anaheim stay was  September1st-2nd 2019
Summary: My family and I were so excited to come and have fun!! We drove up to the valet and the employees were friendly and super helpful..But, once we entered the lodge there was a different story. The front desk employee Debbie was soooo so so rude. She didn't say hi, let alone welcome us. And the irritated disrespect never stopped. I asked why she didn't address my family with a friendly attitude and she said " I didn't know if you were coming or going" . But why would that matter?? So when I called her on her bad attitude it continued . The bad attitude didn't stopped there, Rachelle was the the rudest and most unhappy employee at the water park. Rachelle was rude to my children  and other children with irritated look on her face the whole entire day. Rachelle was at  the line at

This is a wonderful place for family vacations!! My family and I really enjoyed our stay at the Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim, the rooms were so clean, the water park was amazing, and the food is delicious. I will definitely came back for more.

Great place to take the kids. We've been there twice and we love it every time. The water park is big and there's alot to do. They also have an outdoors pool. My kids love the hotel and activities they have at night.

I very rarely wrote reviews, but my experience with GWL S. Cal. was horrendous.  I went with friends and families.  We booked two rooms at the front desk, same type of room, same price.  The next day, I was charged $100 more than the price given to us, while my friend had the quoted price.  I thought that this must be a mistake and a simple call to the customer service would solve the problem.  Not at all!  The staff answered my call did not solve the problem, and threatened to charge my friend extra for the price difference.  After being questioned, he hung up the phone on us.  My subsequent calls to the lodge were blocked and never went through.  I spent hours and hours listening to the waiting-in-line kind of music before the calls were dropped.  In the end, I asked my friend

I want to thank Fernando who checked us in- I had my son who has been there many times and my nephews who were new to the resort. He gave us a great check-in and a great start to our trip. The rooms are clean- the staff is just great and now they have multiple kosher foods. The Dunkin Donut has kosher food and most of the ice cream is kosher. Made everything for us so much easier. I love the refill cups in the water park- saved me money with 4 boys. We just love this place

Probably our 7th or 8th trip. Price totally worth it. Employees super dedicated to the kids. Plenty of lifeguards. Super clean. Their activity schedule keeps little ones busy. Loooove the chatacters.  Drawback: skip the buffet, food is NOT very good. try one of the many restaurants just fown the street. This has been  our regular vacation spot for 3 years......

Summary Heading: DO NOT GO HERE IF USING AFFIRM
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last two months. The first two times I paid cash and was shown the most outstanding customer service, our room was ready early, we were given a list of events and a hotel schedule. Last week I tried out the option "affirm" at check out and my experience was that of a Motel 6. I was told, after 2 hours of waiting, that the "mobile check in" option was for "paying guests only" and their policy was for affirm guests to be checked in at "4PM on the dot." Well, that didn't even happen as I had to speak to a manager 20 minutes after 4 to ask what the hell was going on. They gave me my wrist band and apologized but it wasn't sincere.   If you are paying cash, it is a great experience. If you are going to use affirm, find another resort with

A friend recommended a GWL and we found the resort clean, well maintained and great fun for the entire family  We were impressed by the number of life guards and the attention to the safety of all visitors.  We expected the water park to be busy but we still found enough empty chairs and tables.

everything was great....all employees were GREAT!!! rooms were good  water park great...Maria at check in was very very nice and explained everything in detail....at buffet Austin was also sooooooooo very very accomodating.....wonderful stay...will return but I need discount tickets...very expensive for our family...

If you want a hotel attached to an indoor water park in California, this is your only choice. You need to be prepared for an almost entirely kid-centered space where noise levels and chaos levels may not be to many adult's taste. If a decent cocktail will get you through that, then go for it.  The Good: The water park is well-maintained (though could use a few more paired inner tubes for the blue/yellow slides). The rooms are spacious and well laid-out and quiet. The lifeguards on staff are diligent.The nachos are tasty. The sangria and the mojitos are both tasty.  Just out to the left of the hotel is a bunch of restaurants with take-out options. The schwarma place was super tasty.  The Bad: The check in line at 2 on a Sunday stretched past the stairs and had to be tackled

Summary Heading: Awesome time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: I LOVED the indoor water park. I have kids in every height group amd they all had plenty to do and a great time doing it. The arcade was pretty awesome and they even had yummy dip and dots at the park. The room was very clean and comfortable to sleep in. Plenty of food options within walking distance of the park if you don't feel like buying what they have available.  Yummy dunkin donuts on site.

Received my final bill and there were several incorrect charges. Extra Packages I did not authorize that were billed And incorrect charges. This issue robbed us of the whole experience. HEED THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!! They are right!

Summary Heading: Don't eat at Wood Fire Grill Restaurant
Summary: This is a wonderful place to take your family the kids had A blast the water park was amazing the only negative was the wood fire  grill restaurant the food was not worth the price and was very tasteless I recommend going ouside the Lodge for dinner.  He had the ribs they were cold and had no flavor the corn bread was old in crunchy and the macaroni and cheese tasted like craft out of the Box.  On top of that the server was the only one in our whole section so she was super busy and quite frankly a little rude  And came off very stressed out probably because she had no help.

My family and I loved the entire Great Wolf Lodge experience. So much to do. Staff was awesome. Food was great. The rooms were comfortable. No long waits for water rides. I felt like my children were safe at all times.

Staff was friendly and helpful. Park is amazing, my kids had a blast. Very family oriented and there was no wait time for the rides. My kids can't wait to come back. From our early arrival everyone was nice. The room and the park were cleaned

Im a single dad of a 7 year old and 10 year old. They had an amazing time.  Honestly I wasn’t expecting something so great but it totally exceeded my expectations. I’ll certainly take them again in the future.

This is a good spot if you can afford it. They will nickel and dime you once you get into the resort, i.e $3 smore, $70 wand and fee to play the 'magic quest' game, $7 for a glitter tattoo, etc. My 7 and 2-year-old girls really enjoyed the waterpark though. And the outside area is a great escape from the noise and a great way to get some fresh air. I would return but need to save up at least $1200 for 2 nights and if the kids want any souvenirs.

The last 4 years my family has visited Great Wolf Lodge for my special needs sons birthday weekend.  And for the past 3 years I have booked a cabana. After being in cabana #1 each and EVERY time...I requested a different cabana through reservations AND by email.   Had I known my request would be ignored, I would have chosen an outdoors cabana...or another hotel experience elsewhere.  So, when I was again, assigned cabana #1, I requested a change and was moved to another cabana.  After settling in and enjoying the slides, my family returned to find our belongings moved, and another family in the cabana.  Inconvenienced and embarrassed, and wondering what made it OK for staff to touch all Of our things...I stayed calm and asked for a manager.  A very nice young man, Austin, I

Such a pleasant surprise!  Such a fun spot with great options for all ages.  It's a bit pricey but I felt like it was worth it.  The wave pool was my crews favorite (ages 10-11) but I died over the water slides, super fun and a little scary (in a great way)!  The service is really nice as well and the hole place seems professionally run.  The food options weren't bad either and they have beer and other beverages for adults!  We will absolutely be back.

Our 4th time here. Cannot rave enough about this place!  The food is amazing and not too expensive.  The kids always have a blast. The rooms are clean and have everything you need. There’s a fridge and microwave if you want to bring snacks/food.  The staff is super peppy,happy and accommodating.  We love the water park and find it clean and the life guards are on it!  The Magiquest game is fun for the kids (extra money), but worth it!  Don’t miss the character breakfast. The food is delicious and fresh.  We love the Great Wolf Lodge!!

I’ve been wanting to come since they opened in SoCal but it has always been $$$$.  I have all teenagers and it does seem like a kiddie place. Don’t get me wrong they do have bigger rides but it does seem more towards the younger kid.  Wish it had more activities towards the teens, there were many families that have teens and less thing for them to do. I expected the waterpark to be much bigger.  When we arrived around 2pm the water area was extremely busy. It began to die down around dinner time. The water park closed at 8:30 and in the morning opened at 9:00am. When we came at 9:am it was PERFECT, that was the time to get on the rides around 12noon when the park was busy.  It’s an automatic check out of your room, we left our rooms at 9am and went to the water park. We packed a

We decided to come for our daughter’s early 3rd birthday (she wouldn’t be three for a few more weeks) because kids 2 and younger are free. We came on a Saturday for one night and had the King Deluxe Wolf Den. The ambiance was adorable but our bed was VERY. uncomfortable. Squeaky and hard as a rock. Our daughter had no trouble sleeping in the bunk bed. If you are sensitive to light, their hair dryers have night lights attached to them so you’ll need something to cover them because they are in the main rooms. It is also really close to Disney, so if your toddler goes to bed early, just know that their fireworks start at 9:30pm and you can most definitely hear them from inside the room (and we were on the farther side of the building away from them).   We did the birthday package

Summary Heading: Great fun for family of all ages
Summary: The  rooms are not real luxurious, but they are adequate and have good  air conditioners you control.  Also the   rooms have refrigerators and microwaves. That is rare. The  place is so fun for kids...with the indoor huge water park and the clever magic wands with treasure hunts in the hotel.  Our kids lobbied to come back a second year.   Most of the water is only about 3 feet deep, including the  meandering stream, and you  can't get around in that without getting water dumped on your  head. And it is heavily treated water, chlorine I assume.  Adults enjoy the wave pool and rides more.  There is one very shallow outdoor pool. Last  year had better tables & chairs for eating outside.  The afternoons seem the busiest. We couldn't even get chairs one day. Early and late is

This hotel took $2500 from our bank account ( we paid upfront for the room )and ruined our vacation. It was returned then after we checked out they took another $836 that was held for 7 days. This is ridiculous and no compensation for wreaking our vacation that we spent over 6k on. Total disappointment

2-Star Review A not so gorgeous view of the delivery area??? Back of some building? We did not want to open the curtains due to such a dreary wall to look at. Maybe a mural could be done on the walls so at least it becomes a better view for guests.  Arcade- the games are quite expensive (just brewed).  Not many areas for parents to sit and chill.   3- Star Review Noise Level. It seems like the hallway walls are thin. There is a large gap at the bottom of the door which allows a lot of light and noise to seep in.  The Maps they can provide are somewhat useless or at the very least complicated to follow.  The Den Rooms- while the den bunk area is adorable, if you want to relax and have both the TV in the den on and the TV in the “other room” on, you will be competing for volume

I like the fact of it being indoors and the water was not freezing cold. It was a bit crowded and I found the Lazy River too shallow for an adult to enjoy. I would have liked to be able to have had a tube in the wave pool. I will go back again! Soon I hope!

I was super iffy about booking this because I have a mother whom is paralyzed on her left side so she is wheelchair bound and an disabled daughter so family trips are some what challenging. From the moment we got there ( a little after 1pm). Check in is at 4pm but you are allowed to pick up your wristbands at 1pm and go i to the waterpark. We left our luggage in our car but you can leave you luggage in the lobby if you want. They show you how and where to check you luggage and everything in. Our wristbands were also our room keys and you can add your credit card to it so that you do not have to carry it with you and I loved that option. Upon entering the staff informed us they have free towels and water wheelchairs (WHAT!!). They also measured all my girls heights and gabe my

Summary Heading: Great fun but take out a loan!!
Summary: Great fun was had by all!!  Took our grandkids for two days.  Early check in was allowed so we could enjoy the park.  Was not given our full packet or were we asked if we wanted to have our wrist bands to include charges.  Had to go back to checkin for both.    Bring your check book.  Very expensive if the kids want to do all that the park has to offer besides the water park (which was great)  Bypass the cabanas, the website says starting at $119 for mid week but was actually $299.  While nice, not worth the money when they have sufficient tables and chairs thru out the water park.  Plan on a vacation after to recoup!!  The Magi-Quest is great fun but will have you doing a weeks worth of exercise in one day.  Check in and you have no need to leave for the duration of your stay.

Summary Heading: Fun for a large family and all ages!
Summary: We had an amazing family vacation at the Anaheim location. Our Family stayed in the Wold Den and the accommodations were comfortable and facilities were clean. We purchased the Birthday Package for our Daughter and she was thrilled to walk in the room to balloons, a card, and cake. Their staff was friendly and energetic at every interaction. The schedule of activities that they offer kept our large family entertained our entire trip. We have 3 children in 3 different age groups, so this made for an easy, complain-free vacation. We highly suggest GWL for any family and we will definitely be back!

My Family had a great experience during Summer camp. I would recommend Great wolf Lodge especially for Family. Our room was ready when we got there, that's a pleasant surprise. Will be back again. Thank you GWL!

The place is great but the employees are no help at all and treat you like you didn’t just pay $2000 for a nights stay. The rooms are really nice and clean. Water park is also nice. I was kind of cold sometimes but once I moved around a bit more it was fine.

Summary Heading: Fun experience but overpriced for lodging
Summary: I found the park to be interesting setup for an indoor waterpark attached to a mountain critter themed hotel. It was super crowded but we were there July 4th weekend (the big earthquake hit us too ). We had a large room setup my brother in law booked the Bear Suite. It had 2 rooms (1 king and 2nd room w/ 2 queen beds) plus 2 bathrooms and a living room w/ pullout couch. Thank god cux we used it all up w/ 6 adults and 4 lil kids. The kids had a blast but we only got 6 bracelets so 2 adults couldn’t join us that sucked. A daily waterpark bracelet was $100 for a day that’s insane. Next time I’d only go w/ Groupon deal cuz paying $400 per nite is way high. 😔

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge Southern California - Fantastic
Summary: What a great place to take children of all ages.  I had a 12, 9 & 5 year old and everyone had a great time.  I suggest that you buy the package that comes with everything.  We spend 3 nights 4 days and had so much to do.  I loved that the food was included.  We enjoyed running the resort with our wands and participating in all the arts and crafts and late night dance party. Oh yes, yoga was terrific.

Our family was very pleased with the accommodations, the convenience of the water park, and the very friendly staff.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The kids (and adults) really enjoyed the water park and other attractions (mini golf, motion ride).

We just finished 3.5 days at Great Wolf Lodge in Southern California. There were numerous activities, which kept our 4 grandchildren excited about returning each day. We couldn't have had a better experience!

We’ve stayed at great wolf lodge many times in California and also in Niagara Falls. We always have a great time. Kids make great memories! We often go with groups of friends and split the room costs. It’s fun for the whole family

Overwhelming amounts of chlorine, burned my son's eyes for hours. Arcade was not even as good as a Chuck E Cheese, lots of standing water in the water park. Not enough life guards, all staff in water park appear to be teenagers.

DO NOT BUY THE GROUPON. They did not honor the date/price I selected through groupon. They basically told me that they were "sold out of the groupon option for the day", even though Inwas there on the date I booked on Groupon. I bought a groupon for $149, and had to pay an additional $448 to get my family in today. What a scam and what a rip off. Groupon wont refund it because it is the date of my reservation. So I thought we were getting in for $149, but all in all costed me $587. I am beyond angry. I hope you guys have fun cleaning the enormous mess we will be leaving behind everywhere we go!

Worst place ever very dirty were are the house keepers there's trash all under chairs and bathrooms toilets dont flush they had crap on the tables trash under the cushions the room was disgusting the shower had black mold on the tile and my kids got sick at hungry as a wolf the pizza is like cardboard terrible food in all outlets

After a 9 hour drive with our young children we finally arrived at the hotel only to make it for story time but we had to freshen up and change the kids into pjs but couldn’t as they lost our baggage and the room carpet and bedding was damp.We got our baggage an hour and a half later and staff were terribly rude. Got attitude from the girl at the hostess at the stand seating people(rolling eyes at us and being absolutely rude). Much more but I’ve wasted too much time and money on this place which was NOT worth it so just a heads up.

Great Wolf Lodge is a awesome place, kids had a blast , food is delicious.. will be returning soon . The employees are great water park is worm lots of fun , rooms are clean fun activities for the whole family.

We celebrated our 10 year olds birthday there and everything exceeded our expectations! As adults, we really loved having our wristband have waterpark access, room key and credit card for all transactions. It was so nice to not have to carry around a wallet and room key.

Check In was crazy.. I pulled into valet which was non existent. After waiting 15 minutes to see an employee I tried parking. That alone was a mess . Not enough parking . They do have carts to help carry your luggage which was nice .check In took about 45 minutes ,long lines.  Before we even got to water park the wave pool was shut down for 2 hours , due to poop.while in the kiddie pool we saw an employee walk in with gloves and pick something up . The pool was instantly shut down it was poop. We went to go to the outside pool. Again an employee with gloves and a bag with actual poop in it . We went back inside the wave pool was shut down again. The pool with the basketball courts was shut down 2 times due to poop. All of this between the hours of 2:30- 7:30. Rooms look like old

the staff and events were well planned and great for family fun. people and staff are excellent. down side was the food in the hotel but there are plenty of options just outside the hotel. still love the facilities and things to do in the resort were amazing. the kids loved it !

A bit pricey on food and hotel rooms. The place is starting to show wear & tear. Our room had a hole in wall in one bedroom and one bathroom. We had the biggest suite too and it was not up to standards for a deluxe two bedroom suite for the price we paid. Overall, the kids love the place.

We stayed here for two nights to celebrate my boys' 11 & 9 birthdays.  We stayed in the Wolf Den room and purchased the Wolf Passes as part of our reservation.  I had no clue the involvement of this hotel... it was amazing!!! There was something to do the entire weekend.  My boys especially enjoyed the games with the wands (which I had no idea the extent of those games!).  We almost ran out of time to check things off of the pass.  The indoor water park was fun, but honestly, I believe my boys enjoys the wand games better!!

Summary Heading: Avoid room 401 if you want a good night sleep
Summary: 401 is located next to emergency exit and stairway.  Also is the first room as soon as you exit the elevators.  You can here everyone that stay on this floor come and go.  And for the stairway, employees use it to commute between floors.  Emergency exit door started to slam as early as 7:30 am.  Wifi speed is horrible.  The speed is 1-2 Mbps.  That's is between AOL or EarthLink dialup and DSL speed.

Summary Heading: Great Family Resort in Los Angeles
Summary: The room is clean, has a fridge and a microwave.  This makes it convenient for the family.  In this time and age, and with the expensive room rate, I expect USB stations or wall adapters to charge our devices, Bluetooth to set our alarm clocks, or play music.  I would have to give points though for putting a smart TV where the kids can watch Youtube conveniently from the TV.  I only want to add to please erase the search history of the last tenant who stayed as part of routine cleaning.  Lastly, the room is environmentally friendly.  As for the water park, I wish that they put more visible clocks to help us see the time.  There were large clocks in the indoor water playground, but none in the outdoor pool and some areas.  Typically, when you swim, you don't wear a watch, and it

Food was awful.  More adults using waterpark than kids.  Arcade was ridiculous with money you have to spend.  Paw pass which was expensive, included cheap stuff...Rooms way over priced!!!!  Will not return.

Great experience from check in to check out. Room was great size and very clean. Water park was great and clean. A lot of slides/rides to do. Great family location for a trip or just to stay the night.

Summary Heading: Great experience for the entire family.
Summary: We were there for one of my children's competitions. We had such a great time! It is set up really well, you can use your bracelet to pay for anything. Room was fine, large enough for my big family. Staff was amazing. Everyone was friendly and had a big smile. The staff went out of their way to make sure everything was clean too!

Excellent facilities and great staff.  Clean and new and comfortable.  Staff was friendly.  Waterpark was clean.  Buffet restaurant selection could have been better (only a few choices of food) for the price.  Will return.

One of the most cleanest and comfortable places Ive ever stayed at. All the staff is friendly and helpful. The bedrooms have comfortable mattresses, pillows and sheets for a good night's rest.  Even with a hotel full of kids you could not hear anyone in the rooms around you. The rooms have a microwave and small refrigerator. The waterpark has something for every age and the perfect temperature inside. No need to worry about putting on sunscreen since its indoors. Park gives you towels and they have life vest jackets for kids so no needs to bring those extra items. Also you can charge everything to your room with a scan of your wrist brands so you dont have to carry around a wallet. All the food in the hotel is delicious tried the pizza and nachos. Also they sell alcohol

We have 2 daughters, ages 7 and 9. We recently visited for the 3rd time and it was our best stay yet. Here are a few tips: pack light, all you need is a bathing suit, flip-flops, and something warm to wear indoors.   If it's your first trip, I recommend getting the "pup pass" for the kiddos - for an extra fee they'll get to try the various amenities of the resort from bowling, to mini golf, arcade..etc.   My favorite thing about GWL is that it's actually fun for the parents. The water slides are a blast. There's plenty of libations to choose from and delicious food to eat. We always end up having pizza after a long day in the water. The onsite pizza restaurant is reasonably priced and delicious. You can feed a family of 4 for $20 can't beat that at an amusement park!

Germ-infested, unbearably hot & humid indoor area. My daughter got sick 3 days later. Also, the food is embarrassingly awful. Not sure how they can label the tiny slab of meat-resembling substance an actual hamburger — and charge $12 for it. It’s a joke. On top of the room fee, they charge a $30 “resort fee” — seriously? This is NOT a resort. It’s a cheap hotel. They also charge extra if you bring pool towels up to your room. Except they don’t tell you that when you check in. You get the bill a week later. Pure thievery.  Isn’t there some kind of consumer law against this?

I live in so cal and I just recently discovered This water park and wow it’s soo much fun. They have themed room hotels Jn the kids sleeping area with bunk beds and kids love it! You walk to the water park and don’t even have to worry about a thing ! Just get up and and go and enjoy. The indoor water park has some pretty cool slides for all ages. They also have bowling alley, arcade, build a bear, and lots lots more. It’s like a little city! Has everything you need my kids, my family loves this place and def planning on returning!

The experience at GWL was very good. There are plenty of things for the kids to do not just the waterpark. Things can get pricey so make sure to look at all of the food and service options before buying.

I’ve been here a couple times now and love all the amenities it has. You can go rain or shine because it does not matter. The indoor water park feature is amazing. The only con is that it smells allot like chlorine. You get used to it. I suggest taking snacks. They are allowed. Rooms are a fair size. Worth your buck.

The park was easily accessible for my first day arrival.  My kids enjoyed everything in the first few hours the following day, and continued to enjoy all the rides until well into the afternoon.  The park was clean and the staff was very helpful.

I give them a 5 star  review for the excellent service. The place was wonderful. Everything clean, staff members very friendly. We want to go back for sure. The food was delicious, the waterpark super fun for the whole family.

Something for everyone of all ages!  The water slides were fun, but there was so much else to do. Convenient that the hotel is connected to the water slides, so families can go back and forth.  Clean and fun.  We will be back next summer!

We booked a room for a Thursday evening based on recommendations from a few coworkers. We were only planning on staying the one night, and going to San Diego the next day. However, the next morning we woke up to a paper under our door that offered another nights stay for about 50% off. As soon as I asked my wife & kids (ages 11 & 16) if they wanted to stay another night. They ALL agreed we should! The resort has stuff to do for ALL ages. It was clean, and very well kept. I think the best part for me, was that every associate treated our whole family, like we were family. We can't wait to return.

No announcement or reminders to return all the towels to the water park personnel only or there will be a $15 fine per towel. Towels were probably worth less than that. Towels brought back to the room were counted as Not Returned.

We came here for a weekend to celebrate my daughter’s 9th birthday. We got the wolf’s den so the kids can have their own space in the room with a bunk bed. The check in process was easy and friendly. They passed out wolf’s ears and even bday ears. The facility was clean, orderly, and fun. They had a lot of fun activities for kids to do (some at additional cost). If you wear your wolf’s bday ears to dinner, they automatically sing you a birthday song. It’s just so easy and friendly! I cannot stress that enough. The pool can get very crowded in the afternoon. In the morning, it is a lot better. We did the meal plan there. The food was decent. Overall, it was great and prices were fair. I would return!

It was actually an amazing experience, this place is great for preteens and under. We got there on Sunday night and stayed until Wednesday afternoon. Our days were perfect because there wasn’t long lines for anything. We didn’t experience overcrowding, BUT their other  attractions, such as, arcade, bowling etc are very small. For example the bowling area is about 6 lanes only. If there were more people and if it was the weekend I’m sure those things would be impossible to do. The arcade was also very small, although their games were great, i was very impressed with the selection they had. I just wish it was more spacious. The water park was just enough not too overwhelming, but they don’t let you bring outside food, which is fine, but for us with a big family and staying there

Well, where do I start? First of all, we checked in at 1300, we didn’t get a room until after 1600, and that’s because I complained. When I did check in, some young lady with the “ I really don’t want to help you attitude” checked us in. I had let the Wolf Lodge know that I was celebrating my sons bday. They really didn’t give a rats A$$! She didn’t even give us the wolf ears, we had to ask them? Finally we got a room, we called for bellhop, he brought our stuff, I tipped him, and half of our stuff was missing! I had to waste my fun time and energy looking for our personal belongings. I forgot to mention that on the first floor, it is kind of hidden where the rooms are located. To put it simple, it was a wild goose chase to find the room. Our check in person could have at least

So I took my two kids to Great Wolf for their birthdays and all out ended up spending over $1000 with all of the hidden costs. They have resort fees and then fees for homeless people (together added up to about $200 in extra charges) and then parking and on and on. I had a discount. It didn't matter. All of this cost and that was WITHOUT food or any of the Magiquest games or anything. Next time I'll go to Hawaii for the price. I feel ripped off and upset but hope that my review saves someone else the experience!!!

what a great family fun time! food at the family kitchen is great! awesome indoor waterpark! activities like crafts and dancing and much more! bowling and arcade are great fun, staff is very friendly and helpful!

This trip wasn't that great this time vs the last ones. Staff was rude, maids didn't understand or speak English, and they put unknown charges on 2 cards linked to the room. New towel system SUCKS seeing as anyone can grab someone else towels.

this is by far the worst vacation we've ever had. I paid and planned for this reservation 3 months in advance with numerous phone calls to avoid any unnecessary charges and to save money. The moment I arrived I was getting emails and checked my bank and great wolf lodge already charged me 2 $100 for holding fee for the 2 rooms i have booked, $109 for something i don't even know and another $325 for a Cabana (when clear as a day it says on their website it is $119 per day mon-thursday and I am here Wed to Thurs) The manager on the night shift was sooooo rude and her name is Adriana. She keeps saying there is nothing she can do. The fact that we pay for all of it and do not fall short on any of the payment but they fall so short on their services is what gets me. The wrist band

I just wish they had more of a security process on exiting the water park into the hotel . I felt like someone could easily take a child into a hotel room . Maybe like a computer check in check out with a picture of who is in your party. Kids were able to just exit the park without an adult . I didn’t feel like it was a safe place to let my kids go

We’ve been here a number of times and have loved our stay every time. The water park is set a temperature where you won’t be cold even when out of the water. Life vests are provided and there’s something for everyone to enjoy. Towels are provided as well but make sure to return to avoid being charged. There are showers and changing stalls as well. No outside food, but water is permitted. Inside tons of activities for kids. The MagiQuest is fun for older kids to wander around the hotel, but I can’t imagine being one of those rooms next to all the madness of kids running up and down the elevators completing their quests. Arcade, mini golf, and bowling are all affordable. We’ve gone with and without the passes for activities, but have seen the passes are worth the price.   Overall

Trying to get a live person on the phone is one of the most frustrating experiences in recent memory. Once I got passed that issue it was a wonderful experience for my family. The water park has something for all ages. My 2 & 5 year old grandsons had areas that catered to them while my 12 year old grandson was entertained by the more adventurous rides.

Really enjoyed our trip to great wolf lodge!!! We will be returning soon! Very nice & clean resort. Loved that there wasn't long lines for any ride. My 8 year old loved the wolf tail floor dropper water slide.

We had a large sized group, and we were able to all relax and have fun. The room and waterpark temperatures were good. All the kids were safe to roam around the hotel. Also, food, amenities, and gift prices were fit for different budgets.

We stayed for 4 days at the hotel.  We ran into 2 problems.  Our hotel keys got deactivated.  Our toilet clogged in the first day.  The room is much smaller for the family of 8. I'm disappointed at the service we received.  Someone texted me and introduce himself as Willow.  He asked how was my stay.  I told him the problem I had above.  He even said "Thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention. Here at Great Wolf we strive to provide excellent service while creating joy for you and your family. I would like to extend your check out to 1pm complementary for the issues you have had."  I told him that we have to check out at 11 and refer that he gives us complimentary parking.  He never said anything afterward.  Bad following up...That is not "strive to provide

We spent one night at the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove.  Hotel The hotel is large.  Big Lobby, great front desk, valet and bellmen. Lots of eating options: Grill, buffet, pizza, Dunkin Donuts etc.  Arcade, mini bowling etc.  Each member of your family gets wristbands which not only act as your door key but also is connected to your credit card so you can charge everything to your room and do not need to walk around with money.  Convenient but easy to spend a lot when there.  Waterpark Lots of slides and well organized.  Lots of seating and is open from 9 am till 830 pm.  You can use the waterpark the day you arrive even if your room is not ready.  You can also use the park and continue with charging privileges the day you leave. Note, they have towels for each guest when you

My room didn’t get clean till I requested to get clean that’s very disappointing plus the AC PROBLEM And they offer me something and I didn’t get wat they offer me very disappointed I wish they can be in the same page cuz someone said something n the other person doesn’t know anything about it

This is the perfect family vacation spot. Worth every penny. Staff is friendly, rooms are the most comfortable in the industry, and the park is the most fun ever!. You cant get an experience like this anywhere. Just do it!

So expensive. All you get is the room and the waterpark and everything else costs more. I absolutely would not recommend this place, there is gross wads of hair all over the floor and because they allow you to eat in the park I stepped in so many mushy fries on my way to the various pools. Plus, I ended up with food poisoning from the Loose Moose restaurant which ruined mine and my kiddos time. We will not return.

Summary Heading: Great experience at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Amazing time. Staff are friendly and helpful and really care about their guests. Games and activities included in our stay made it so easy to keep my kiddo entertained. Themed rooms are more expensive than standard rooms. Resort fees and parking not included in the reservation quote.

Summary Heading: 2 Full Days of Fun... But Expensive!
Summary: Fun time with family celebrating my youngest daughter 10 year old! 🎂   This hotel is like Vegas for kids, everything revolving around making them happy 😃 arcade, mini bowling, 6D ride, scavenger hunt with dragons, elf’s, goblins and magic potions, candy store, ice cream store, Pizzaria and of course the main attraction a inside all year around water park!!  We check in around 3:30pm, had to park on 5th level (arrive early 1pm to find better parking) waited 30m for check in, lady at the counter was cordial but appeared over worked and tired... she gave us all wolf ears and a special one for the birthday girl, our bracelets (they open our rooms and are link with cc for purchases inside the hotel, só no need to have your wallet around the park 🙌🏻) don’t loose the bracelets

Summary Heading: Corporate should spend a night on the beds!!
Summary: Meant for young kids, maybe 10 and under.  Bunk beds and pullout couch bed were horrific; couldn’t imagine 2 people on the pullout couch, though the room was intended for 6 people.  I would feel really bad for the 6 people who thought they could make the sleeping conditions work. Bring plenty of your own water ($3.00 a bottle in hotel) and the Dunkin Doughnuts prices were about the same as normal.

Summary Heading: My two year old and I had a blast
Summary: There is so much to do for all age groups. I got the pup pass for my son, he is two almost three, and I reccomend doing the same if you have a lil one. He could only spend so much time in the water park as he was getting wrinkly. The pup pass kept the fun going. They even have bowling that the lil ones can enjoy as the bowling balls are the perfect size. He had a blast and so did I. As a single parent I recommend checking out the rate calendar on their website to help choose an affordable option when booking, it's very helpful.

I reserved for my birthday & I took my kids with me. We had a blast! Indoor water park was incredible, they have food everywhere.  You don't have to get out of this place, they have everything you need, coffee &donuts place, restaurant, buffet, arcade, so much fun.

Too many 10 stars. Only 5 miles to Disneyland. Great food and drinks at affordable prices. Try it once and you’ll be amazed:) Wristbands for everything, how convenient. Fast elevators, soo much room to park and only $20 a night to park and free shuttle to Disneyland but don’t forget to reserve your spot and time for shuttle.

So after reading many of the negative reviews of this place, I was honestly a bit worried about what to expect.  However, after the first day there, it was obvious that some people will always find something to complain about.   We booked a room through Groupon and went in early June for my child's birthday.  The price we paid for the room included access to the water park for 5 of us, which was an excellent deal.    We arrived around 1pm and found a long line at check-in but it moved very quickly.   Even though our room was not ready yet, we were able to check-in, get our room keys (bracelets), and head down to the water park.  Room was ready by 4pm as promised and the Wolf Den room is perfect for the kiddos.   The water park was super fun!  temperature inside was nice and

This place is amazing. Like any attractions, it is a little on the pricey side. I wish they added all the resort fees etc with the initial price they quoted me when I was booking. Also, $20 per day parking is also in addition to the resort fee and taxes and fees. Food inside is also pricey.

Summary Heading: Great Place for the Family!!   everything you need in one place!
Summary: Kids loved the food and activities....many choice for eating.   Get a Cabana and you are set while the kids are having fun.  Join them or not in the water park you'll enjoy good food and drinks.    Many things to do after the water park closes... arcade , theater and so much more

Nice size rooms for families, microwave, good countertop space to make your meal for picky eater like my kids. Sink separate from toilet and shower good for mornings with big family. Food courts around hotel weren't expensive ,water $3, fries 4 bucks and a typical burger sandwich meal was under $10. Rent as many towels as u want for water park with ease. Helpful staff and many activities and things to do around the building you'll wish you had booked more days. Many restaurants like a Chuckie E Cheese,Korean restaurants, stores and even a market to pick up and enjoy in your room. Well definitely return again. Money well spent

Summary Heading: Ridiculously overpriced and not worth it
Summary: The outdoor pool closed because some one dumper in it. The wave pool closed because someone   dumped in it. They said 40 minutes. 2 hours later, the lifeguard said well it’s kinda cold outside so our lifeguards aren’t gonna come back out. We didn’t pay HUNDREDS of dollars to be told sorry were cold. I’m so pissed. Both still closed. Pathetic.

Summary Heading: I had hoped for a funner trip
Summary: My family decided to stay at Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove for our son's 9th birthday.  We were invited by our good friends whose son was also celebrating his 9th birthday.  First, the positives- 1.  The Flow Rider was really fun.  My son and I boogey boarded and surfed. 2.  The water basketball courts were cool. Next, the negatives 1.  Over $300 per night is a lot of money even if it includes water park access. 2.  $20 per adult and $10 per child for breakfast with the characters.  The food was not that great. 3.  It was super crowded on Monday (granted it was Memorial Day) 4.  One video game was $6 per game. 5.  They shut down various pools at various times for various reasons without any explanation. 6.  They had 3 different packages you could buy.  $45, $80 and $100.  We

With this being my family's first time visiting the Great Wolf Lodge, I was excited and didn't know what to expect. Upon arrival, I was pleased with the ambiance and the overall look of the lobby. It genuinely feels like you're in a giant log cabin. The water park itself was nice. It was small but the kids (7 year old twins and 12 year old) enjoyed themselves. We swam for a couple of hours, and went up for bed.   This is where the issues started. The beds are ROCK HARD. I'm not even kidding guys, at 4a I couldn't take the tossing and turning anymore so I laid on the pull out sofabed with my son and it was LITERALLY more "comfortable" than the bed. My husband couldn't sleep at all.   Then we went down to the buffet for the character breakfast and everyone piled their plates as

Summary Heading: don't waste your money in this scam
Summary: we were raelly excited to go , ge got the meal plan witch is nothin but pay yooure meals in advance if you dont finish that credit they do not aply it to you or give it back, to many scam much expensier than Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Resort Ruined By Frigid Temperatures
Summary: Our family had previously had a wonderful experience staying at the Great Wolf Lodge in the Poconos in Pennsylvania over Memorial Day weekend in 2017. Having relocated to Southern California, and the kids still clamoring to return, we decided to repeat the experience for Memorial Day weekend in 2019, this time at the Great Wold Lodge in Anaheim. While there are some differences in the layout of the hotel itself, the two resorts are substantially the same, with the attached indoor water parks being almost identical. And yet we had a far worse experience in Anaheim than in Pennsylvania.  Why? Because in the Poconos the air and water temperatures were lovely, positively balmy, and in sunny Anaheim the air and water were kept unpleasantly cold. So cold, in fact, that we were forced

My kid and I were both duped by the endless ads and YouTube videos of this place. Unfortunately, the hotel is desperately in need of MAJOR upgrades. We stayed in a standard double queen room. Absolutely no frills. None. Inconvenient room layout with a separate sink outside of the toilet/shower section of the bathroom. Very small bathroom with no ventilation or drying clotheslines for wet swimsuits.   The beds were uncomfortable and the sheets felt thin and cheap. The bottom sheet wasn't even fitted  - it was a flat sheet just laying over the mattress. Why is this a concern? If your kid is as wild a sleeper as mine, then waking up in the morning is like waking up on a bed of rags.  We dined at the buffet for dinner. The food was unremarkable. Much of it looked as if it had been

Summary Heading: Worth it if going to water park
Summary: We stayed in a Wolf den room, which was sufficient size for a family of 5. Rooms have a fridge, microwave, and safe. Rooms and food are a bit overpriced on their own, but worth the water park included and all of the additional activities it's worth it. Can do sit down meals or buffet style, several different restaurants and Dunkin Donuts. Additional activities at extra cost, but can purchase Wolf Pass and/or Pup Pass which include a Build a Bear (clothes and accessories not included) and other activities/goodies. Would stay again, but probably in several years due to the total cost

If you are looking for something to do...for something that will be enjoyed by the entire family this is the place. Not only is it fun for everyone but it is also very clean.  Even non-swimers can enjoy it, since they have so many options in the water park. They have many restaurants, a arcade, magiquest, activities for the children and much more. Definitely recommend!

Summary Heading: Greatwolf Lodge was so much fun!
Summary: My son is very hard to please but he loved the water park, meet and greets with the characters, arcade, and kid’s bowling alley. The food was pretty good, as well...my husband likes that alcoholic drinks are served. So, basically, Greatwolf Lodge has something for everyone!

This was our first time staying here and our experience was more than what we expected.. Very family oriented and clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Great activities for the kids. Our kids did not want to leave... we will definitely be returning!

This hotel literally has everything, there’s really no reason to leave. It’s an all in one hotel. All it really needs is a daycare center so that is parents can go out and enjoy the water slides on our own 😆. We’re already planning our next trip out here!

Summary Heading: Hotel is not in good shape anymore
Summary: we have been at great wolf lodge 6 times already since they opened .. so a frequent guest .. you can see the changes everytime we go .. but this trip was the worst .. wear and tear of facilities, frontdesk checking us in was in a bad mood, basically just handed me the bands with paper with room number . room smells musky, air conditioner is really loud sounds like there is an airplane taking off everytime it turns on.. water park looks beat up too .. white stains on slides and kids play area. beds moves and squeak . on top of that a ridiculous TOWEL policy ... scan in and out to get pool towels..Look at your final receipt when you check out the one they send you a day after .. they would automatically charge you towels that you have returned . good thing i called and demanded

Summary Heading: Great place, worth the price, but had one incident
Summary: I was very hesitant to stay at the Great Wolf Lodge given all of the reviews I had read. We booked through their site for a one night stay in Late April 2019. Booked the standard room for 2 adults and 2 kids, did not purchase any of the added packages for meals, nor gaming passes. I was fairly pleased and surprised with our positive experience at the GWL Garden Grove.  The resort allows you to use the waterpark at 1pm the day you check in and up to 8pm the day you check out, so it is basically two full days of water park experience with the one night stay if you time it right. When you enter the property they have a check-in desk at the lobby by the candy store, where they provide you with the bracelets to use the facility, open room locks, and charge things to the room. The

I spent two days at great Wolf Lodge with my four year old grandson. We had a great time in the waterpark. I was surprised and pleased that he was able to take advantage of all of the waterpark activities so long as he wore a lifevest. I loved that everything we needed was on site,  so we never had to leave the premises.  Everywhere was clean. And the numerous employees were all polite and friendly.  I plan to make this a once a year special adventure with me and my grandson.

Summary Heading: Great place, poor customer service and pricing details
Summary: The lodge itself was great, kids had a blast. However, we won a gift card from our work for here, couldn’t use it to book or pay for anything over the phone, really frustrating. It’s 2019, don’t have gift cards if you can’t use them on your website or over the phone, a little ridiculous. They also over charged us with no real explanation, our itinerary shows $504 for two nights and we were charged $738 for two nights, NOT including the room taxes and resort fees, after several calls and emails with little to no response they ended up only charging us $100 of the $288 over they originally billed. Probably just gonna eat the cost and leave it at that. Very bad customer service in this regard. They also couldn’t book us separate packages for separate days either, we wanted

Nice and exciting place that you can really say you can be a kid again. Very nice and clean rooms. My children were upset that we had to leave the place. The food is very excellent did not think it was pricy think was a fair price for what you pay for.

Our stay was amazing from the front desk staff Ellery who was very friendly upon check-in and communicated to us the various times of things that would be going on during the day for our stay. To the security and housekeeping staff that assisted us in getting my son back to me when he got away from us and wandered into the elevator by himself. I am grateful to the entire staff as once we communicated through one staff member everyone was on deck to find our lost little one. As a mom I was very worried and immediately thought the absolute worst. I want to personally thank Jose from security that brought my little one back to me. The housekeeper that found my son Sonia Morales & the AGM Diana. & every employee that was dispatched to help find a lost child in a really big hotel. I

When my daughter wanted to go to a water park for her birthday, I was less than thrilled. I always think of those places as one big biohazard. So I did my research, this place seemed the cleanest place to take her, so we drive from San Francisco down to SoCal. It did not disappoint. Yes, it’s expensive, but you get what you pay for, and for us, it was worth it. We took the advice of others and got  room elsewhere the night before, we reserved a cabana the day we checked in, which meant we can get into the water park as soon as they open. The kids really enjoyed it, the bunk beds in the wolf den were super cute. We stayed two nights and had three full days of the water park, but honestly two would of been better. We are definitely coming back.

Summary Heading: I love it and my 4 year old did too!
Summary: My husband and I decided to do a Staycation at the Great Wolf Lodge and I couldn't be happier with the experience.  We got to stay there on a $99/night special, which was the motivator.  I am glad we were able to see what it was all about.  I don't know that I'd pay $400/night to stay there, but I would certainly come for the waterpark because it was fun.

We had a wonderful time. Great place to be for Mother’s Day! I even received a flower upon dining. Water tubes and attractions were so fun. My family enjoyed our stay! I just suggest shower areas around the water park so that people don’t go straight in from resort and the restrooms. I had to go to restroom barefooted. I used indoor showers to wash my feet, but the path going out is still dirty. You get that icky feeling going back into the pools.

It is always a great experience at the wolf lodge,  great food, awesome water park,  excellent food.   Fun for everyone I will be back soon!  You will get Wolf ears, sometimes even wolf tails,  great experience and fun to wear.

For the price we paid for family of 5, the room itself looked beat up and everything seemed to not work or not work well. There was sticky stains on carpet and u had to wear shoes in our room. It was probably just our experience but it seemed like one thing after another went wrong. Saturday the water park was so full when we came back from lunch we could not find a chair to put our stuff on, took us half hour to finally find one. The kids loved the rides but when it got so crowded they were waiting half hour for each slide we took a break to do quests. The kids loved the wand quests, it was a lot of fun for them to explore the hotel. Finally we went for my daughters 10th birthday and we find out today she contracted hand foot and mouth disease during hotel stay.  Hope you have

We stayed here for one night on Mother's Day. Arrived at 1:15 and our room was ready even though check-in is at 4:00.  It was packed but it was so awesome. There was a "deal" so we booked it then called back and got a AAA discount which was not available online. $46.30 off!  I booked a king suite but it had no chairs or a table??? They said it was an accessible room and those don't have tables and extra chairs. We never asked for an accessible room. They offered to move us to a double-bed room but we were only there for one night and declined. We had to ask three times for the chairs and table.  Each time each person was very nice and they finally came after about 6 hours.  Other than that.....the entire facility was sparkling clean. Very pretty camp-themed furnishings.

Great wolf Anaheim was in amazing experience for her family. Customer service was extremely friendly and always willing to help. The facility was super clean and the theme was extraordinary. They accommodated many requests that were made by our party. We are extremely excited to return.

We've been here 3 times and this last time stayed consistent. Quick check ins as always and most of the time we get called when our room is ready but after 1pm we are able to enjoy the water park while we wait for the room. Park area is kept clean, plenty of towels are provided for use. Plenty of sitting room. Food at the park is good, food at the buffet in the restaurant was not worth the cost. Super expensive and the food was not good so save your money. Not many characters to take pictures with. We got a themed room with a bunk bed and the boys loved it! Room was clean and not noisy like our first trip where we were placed behind the gym where kids where using it as their playground. This trip definitely was better than our first trip. The activities kept my kids busy and

We had a great experience at the GWL. The hotel is clean and welcoming upon arrival. There are various activities for children throughout the day. The water park is diverse enough for a variety of ages. They safeguard the younger children’s area with special gates. My husband and I had fun with our four kiddos ranging in age from 2-9. There is also an outdoor section for the warmer months. I do appreciate the indoor portion so we don’t all have to lather up with sunblock.

Awesome experience from checking into the Lodge to Checking out. Plenty of things to do with the kids. Very safe place I highly recommend it. Worth the price.  Very friendly and knowlegeable staff and helpful.

The place is nice and seems clean but is very expensive.  They should really make this a little more affordable for families.  The food was good and the room was nice and clean but nothing fancy at all just like typical Motel 6.  We will not go back again .

This will be a yearly vacation stop for this Grandma of 26. No better place to take a water loving gang! Lots of swimming and no sunburn. Family fun and lots to do even when the water park is closed. 2 more trips already planned.

We had a great time.My kids loved it, they said it was the "funnest" time they ever had. The staff is friendly, and the rooms are very comfortable. There's so much for the kids to do. I recommend getting the paw passes.

Olivia Help desk is amazingly helpful and knowledgable Anthony at the Bucket grill is superb and helped us pick our food choices Travis the bell help guy super helpful in assisting us with our luggage.

Summary Heading: Doesn't honor room request. Bad Towel Policy
Summary: Planned this trip for my son's birthday. He has autism and anxious about going down long hallway, yet the hotel put us in a room at the end of the hallway, doesn't even try to correct their mistake. Bad experience. The new towel policy is as inconvenient as well because you have to check out and check back in the towels. There's always a long line just to get towel or exchange towel. Plus I have seen other people just randomly grab other towels on the chair for checking out. It's like someone stole mine so I stole yours thing going around

My husband and I took our three kids (aged 7, 4, and 2) to the Great Wolf Lodge for two days and one night. We had a great time. The 7 yo had as much fun as the 2 year old. Aside from the indoor waterpark (only downside to it very little natural light and it is SO LOUD) there is bowling, minigolf, a kind of video game which we didn't play but which looks like fun because there are check points all over the hotel for it and it somehow involves magic wands... We also didn't partake in the after hours stuff for the parents when the kids are down (they have this wine thing, very intriguing...) but would have if we'd stayed longer. At the Grill, there was lobster bisque and adult mac & cheese with bacon, sausage, and a crunchy parmesan crust :O that I couldn't even finish but will

Summary Heading: Just hit up the Arcades and Water park
Summary: The indoor water slides are the best feature the lodge has to offer but the food quality of the restaurants and buffet are extremely poor such as why is the buffet serving the leftovers from the Lodge Wood Fire Grill? Smoked Rib's, Smoked Beef Brisket, Brussels Sprouts, Mac and Cheese, Lobster Bisque, even the Grilled Chicken?  Basically you should just go to the buffet and avoid the Lodge Wood Fire Grill.  Speaking of which there was hardly any smoke flavor at all if any.  Another reason for the medium score is because they wanted 40 dollars for a cheaply made stuffed animal and 20 dollars on top of that for a pair of clothes for it.  Same goes for the magic wands, 20 dollars for a wand and on top of that 20 more for a topper or base?  I'm gonna just recommend people hit up the

I returned my pool towels, and because they scan system down, they just wrote my return notes, after I check out, they charge me $45 for unreturned towels fee. I told them I returned, their answer is I didn’t return it.

Pros: kids had fun, indoors so don't need to worry about sunburn  Cons:  NO disability accommodations which was a major bummer for my husband!  We thought we had a great deal, $260/night but then the bill showed $100/day additional in resort fees/taxes!  If you want to do any of the non-water park activities, you have to pay more $$$.  You cannot bring in any food or coolers into the water park unless it's food from their restaurants.  I'm not sure if I would go again as we do have an indoor water park near home especially as Great Wolf was pricey.

Great for kids. Very clean and good food. Misinformed several times, perhaps the answers were misleading. When return the towels, check and double check that the attendant sees your writing scanner. Other than that it was great

This is a great place for the entire family to have fun.  They have fun activities all over the hotel from morning til night.  The aterpark has many different pools, slides for all ages.  I highly recommend it as a quick getaway or vacation.  Note that most of the activities are geared towards 10  years and under.

Perfect stay for family of all ages! Many activities to choose from, overall great experience! You'll enjoy your stay!!! The staff are friendly & access all your needs; rooms are clean & comfy to stay in as well!

Summary Heading: My girls called our trip the best spring break ever!
Summary: We are a family of 4, 2 children and Mom and Dad. I could not do a Disney trip this year due to just thinking about the long lines during spring break. I was told about The Great Wolfe Lodge and we decided to try it out. My girls aged 5 and 7 loved it!! They even slept in every morning. They were constantly entertained and by the time it was lights out, they were already sleep. I highly recommend getting the Wolf Den for a family and a Paw pass for the kids. The character breakfast was also a highlight for the girls. We will definitely return.

I am very disappointed. I booked a room for my daughter's 4th birthday. We had to cancel and could not get a refund but were told we had a year to book our next visit as credit for the $459 spent on one night's stay. Today, I called 9 months later asking to re-book a new date with my credit and they said my credit has been "forfeited" because I had 5 months to call in and let them know when I would re-book?
