They said I should have received an email notifying me of their terms, but I never received an email. The customer service representative passed me to another representative in Garden Grove. When I asked to discuss this with the manager she put me through to a voicemail and hung up. I really feel taken advantage of from this and can say that this has been the worst experience

Customer service was awesome! Very professional, staff well trained. All of them were courteous and efficient!!! First issue was with a spring-a-palloza booked by mistake, I forgot the name of the employee who helped Vicky at mobile check in! He Changed rooms and reduced my rate, saving me $150. Txt message by willow was awesome! And the best experience of all was chef  Amin Boubaddi accommodating our vegan needs! My kids loved his food!  I can’t thank him enough!!! We had the greatest experience of all! Highly recommended!  We stayed one night, enjoyed the water park both days, kids loved the arcade, we had a great dinner, and a nice breakfast! Enough as a spring break treat! Mom enjoyed the pool - outside - sun tanning + pina colada = couldn’t go wrong!!! 🙏🏽

This is the 2nd time we have been to Great Wolf Lodge. We had  a blast, everyone there was friendly and helpful, food was really good and they have so many things to do for the kids. Great Family experience. Tip, you will be tired from all the swimming but it was so worth it!!!

Enjoyed early mobile chk in. Our room was clean and ready, we immediately got changed to our swim wear excited for the water park. We hit up the lazy river, there wasn’t enough tubes so you just walked with everyone else. Next hit the out side pool only to discover it was closed due to some one pooping in the pool. So, we went inside to the toddler pool only to discover some one pooped in there as well. My son is Five so he hit the main play area and he did the kids slide there for about 15 mins we were over the water park so we went off property to eat dinner and hit up downtown Disney. Over all our trip was a very expensive sleepover. We left the next day by 7:40 and we only live an hour away. Never again.

While we love the water park, we have been there many times, this was the dirtiest we’ve seen it. Also the coldest. We ate at the buffet dinner. My kids were super hungry. None of them wanted to eat! It was terrible. I’d never want my name on the advertisement for being the chef. Yuck. These were NOT the worst things. My two year old was diagnosed with an autoimmune disease that requires her to have medical devices, certain foods and medication via syringes. We packed a small, soft sided cooler that we actually bought from great wolf lodge on one of our previous trips. It held drinks, snacks and her medication. The young woman checking bags was incredibly rude and was adamant that we were not allowed to bring it into the park. I again, let her know it was for medical purposes

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge is a game changer!
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge was a total surprise in a way that it surpassed all our expectations. The place was very well operated and absolutely caters to children. Staff customer service was exceptional. The room we stayed in was not one of the themed rooms, but it was well appointed, very clean and very roomy for a family of 6. The water park was fantastic with so many activities for all ages. Lines for the rides were the fastest I've been in because staff were very efficient. Lines for the food kiosk had the same speedy service and the 3-4 times I went to purchase food, I didn't have to wait more than 10 mins before I left with food on hand. The staff at the wipeout ride were the most patient allowing riders to try 3-4 times. I love that the staff are circulated and stationed to

We took our 3 year old son and 3 month old son to the Great Wolf Lodge and had a complete blast! They thought of pretty much everything at the water park! Some many things to do other than swimming if you want to get out of the water for a while. We spent time in the arcade and went bowling which my son loved! The rooms are perfect size where you can spend the evening hours comfortably relaxing.   I cannot wait to take the boys back again!

Summary Heading: Great time at The Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: My family and I have been vacationing here for four years. Every year has been a great experience for us! The hotel is cute, friendly staff, and most importantly clean. The water park has something for everyone. Our bigger kids enjoyed the wave pool, lazy river, and water slides while our little ones played in the kiddie area. The wands and arcade kept us busy outside of the water park. Great food options for kids and adults. The only thing I did not like is that you cannot bring your own snacks into the park. Other than that, lots of fun to be had!

I paid for a Birthday package where it stated that the room would be decorated with a poster, birthday card and balloons. When we first made our way to our room I was expecting to see the decorations up as I was seeing posters on the adjacent rooms and along the hallways. My daughter was becoming more and more anxious as we got closer to our room (745). We finally arrived to our room where my daughter was greeted by a room number instead of her Birthday Poster. We entered our room to no decorations either. This was a surprise that I planned out for my daughter and paid Great Wolf Lodge a fee to assist me in such a simple task. Had I known Great Wolf Lodge was not going to comply I would have not paid the fee for the Birthday package and decorated the room myself with much more

We shared a Cabana with our friends and they said we can leave the towel there!then after we left they charged us $60 for Towel Fee!I saw the sign next day!very small sign and only one place cant see anywhere else in the park!Like they want to charge every one for this hidden fee!This is a rip off!Never come back and we will tell all friends and family shouldn’t come back to this place

We came here with a group of 20+ adults and children and the water is not 84 degrees as advertised. It is a cool slightly warm temp. The children in our party were shivering, cold and their lips were turning blue. Management said that the water temp was “within parameters” and offered first aid to the kids if they were still cold. Definitely a condescending response. If you’re thinking of booking this place because you believe the water will be warm like we did, think again. They falsely advertise warm water and it’s not. I tested the water with my thermometer and it was well below 84 degrees so apparently their “parameters” are not 84 as they say the water temp is constantly at.

The place was wonderful and my family having so much fun, and two boys loves the place waterpark is very enjoyable, The food dinning was good We will plan again this summer for my husband birthday celeb

Summary Heading: Not for the pups in the pack
Summary: There's a ton of restaurants nearby that serve/deliver great food and bringing a few beers up to the room will pay for itself in just three cans. McDonalds is across the street, if you order through the app you can say you're at the restaurant while at the hotel so by the time you actually cross the street your order is ready and waiting. With all the money saved on food maybe one of their $500 cabana's won't seem so bad -only if you like people not touching your things and not taking your seat while with your kid.  Activities and most of the environment are best geared toward children older than 6 anything younger will turn the vacation into more work, specially considering that many people have no manners.   The parking is crazy if you're trying to unpack at check in.  I

Great place for the kids! Facility is clean inside and out, no bad smells! Water park water is clean, no green moss seen on attractions. Rooms are big! Easy to find all places. Wolf pack members are helpful and cheerful! Great place overall! Plan on returning soon!

Love love love this place... there were 6 of us 3 kids 3 adults in a grand bear room.... each kid had a wolf pass (highly recommend) the food was Great.. we were able to let the girls go freely through the hotel to do the AMAZING MAGI, QUEST.. just gave them check in times... staff was OVER THE TOP... ALWAY HAPPY TO HELP, ALWAY SMILING. Waterpark is the best!!....... tons to do!!we never get it all done!!... this was our 4th visit and it just gets better and better!

We took our 3 children ages 7,4 and 2. They all had a blast even the little one who still had about 7 water slides he could go down. You never really have to leave the hotel. My kids love the Magiquest game, goi g up and down the hotel looking for items is always fun. We cant wait to come back again. Also we cant wait until the one in Manteca opens.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge is a Howling Great Time!
Summary: We came to Great Wolf Lodge with our 9 and 10-year-old.  The water park was a blast!!! Plenty of things to do here, you never need to leave.  Lots of food options that taste great.  Waterpark is great for all ages.  Most other activities caters toward younger kids.  Overall it was amazing!

We just got back from our annual Disneyland trip where we celebrate mine and my oldest sons birthdays. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were very friendly and professional. The room was large and the beds comfortable.  The hotel isn't in the best part of town and seems to attract a lot of locals that do not monitor their children. The "lazy" river was overrun with kids racing around and shoving people in rafts to get passed. The lifeguards seem to all be young kids that try their best to keep things in order but it seems the efforts are for not. At one point my 12 year old and I went down the "Coyote Canyon" tube ride and when the slide dumps you into the pool of water a jet flipped our raft causing both of us to go under.  This would be fine but the jet then forced my son

We went to GWL for my daughter’s 8th birthday. She brought a friend and our 2-year-old was with us as well. The majority of staff was really friendly and there was plenty to do. The kids loved the water park, arcade, bowling, story time, dance party etc. The only reason why I didn’t give it a 5 is because it’s expensive, they won’t let you bring snacks in and there were some issues with other guests taking chairs and towels which is out of the control of the resort. I would definitely go back again!

The water park was a blast. Lots of other activities so you never have to leave. Most of the activities cost extra so be prepared for that.  Food was subpar. That is the only thing I would fix. Better to head offsite to eat.

I took my 12 year old son and his best friend over Spring Break and they had a blast!  The water park is great plus they have tons of activities in the resort to keep everyone busy. The food was surprisingly good.   My favorite part was the Dunkin Donuts inside the hotel with great lattes.  Would definitely recommend for families.

Its a great place to laze around with lots of fun activities for the kids. A bit pricey actually a lot expect to spend a couple grand. Theres only two lounge chairs in the water park so get there at 730 am to be first in line for the best seats. Theres a lot of competition between families so be prepared.

I was charged for resort towels. I checked out 4 towels each time inside the water park and every time I returned the towels, they didn't even count them. They just randomly charged people for not returning towels without any proofs. Be aware to review your hotel charges carefully.

Summary Heading: Family Fun at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: This water park and children's adventure resort is great fun for the family, but especially geared to entertain the kids.  With a magi quest that will entertain and challenge kids to find hidden items and challenge goblins and dragons, bowling, miniature glow in the dark golf, laser beams, arcades and so much more, will keep you entertained for days.  We had a wonderful time and look forward to visiting again in the future.

Great place to stay with family. Clean facilities, awesome staff. Kids are free to roam around. My kids are aged 11 and 14, the younger the better. Kids will surely have a blast. Food is reasonably priced. There is a Mc Donalds across the street and there are other food options available.

Summary Heading: Super FUN times at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: Everyone is smiling, courteous and having a great time! Lots of activities for the kids in addition to the water features. Wave pool, Quests and Tube water rides were my granddaughters favorites. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Top notch experience!!!!

This place is very kid-centric (as it should). There are plenty of kids activities besides water park. However, we didn't participate in any of them as the only thing my kids wanted to do was the water park. After 8+ hours, they were pooped and barely had the energy to enjoy the delicious food at the Loose Moose Buffet.  The room was clean and decent. I would like to have a Keurig coffee machine as the line at Dunkin Donuts are ridiculous in the morning.  Overall, it was a great experience.

been here many times, please beware of the slip and fall.  Must wear WATER SHOE at this resort!!!  In the begining, this resort was so clean all over the resort. But, now it isnt the same anymore.  Hotel room is clean, Staff is friendly.  But, the water park isnt the same anymore.  Water Park many of the water gun doesn't work.  Kids just pushing others, kids to use the one that works.  I wish water slide, in the middle waiting is different.  it just feel safe.   BTW, you must check in for the towl at the swim pool and return all, if not they will charge $15/towel. I am guessing many people are taking the towel?

Plumbing is terribly loud. Indoor park is uncomfortably stuffy. Arcade is outrageously expensive. The rooms are small for large families. Food was costly. Bar option is a plus. The kids loved dunkin donut store in the hotel. All activities seem geared towards smaller children.

Horrible experience.  Waterpark is not that great.  Save yourself some money, get a room close to Knotts soak city and go there.  More attractions and better service.  For the price of one nights stay here you can get season passes to knotts berry farm and soak city and rooms and the knotts hotel.  I will never go back to this place again.  You will not get your moneys worth.

Summary Heading: Great day at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Wonderful time and experience. Everything went great. Starting from check in. I really like that they allowed you to stayed at the park after checking out. You are not allow to bring food inside but they have places to buy food if you get hungry. Also there are restaurants in the property for dining in.

So off top Great wolf lodge is pricey you have to pay to park, pay for themed rooms, $100/night incidental fee (refundable upon no incidents) and pay for amenities such as bowling, arcade, XD theater, etc. with that being said I absolutely loved it. They have lots of free activities to do including waterpark admission, meet and greet with hotel mascots, dance party, story time and others. We also received a complimentary breakfast buffet for the entire family and we went back to buffet for dinner very good food. They have a dunkin donuts in the hotel, candy shop, spa, fitness center, sweet eats, pizzeria, souvenir store, glow golf, magic quest and a sit down restaurant as well. The waterpark was indoor and outdoor water was neutral which was good I have a toddler, a elementary

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge Anaheim, great time but check your bill!
Summary: We enjoyed our experience there. It is a very busy place and is expensive. We were able to get into our room early and enjoy the water park which was a nice bonus. There seems to be more taxes here than at other hotels we stayed at which dramatically increases the price of the room. We were in a hotel in Newport Beach just prior to checking in here and the taxes were not as high. Our kids enjoyed the arcade and the breakfast buffet. And of course all the waterslides! I will say that you should definitely check your bill before checking out. We had several invoices emailed to us after checking out. Some had false charges on them, the bills kept changing. We were initially charged for parking, but had no car there. I had to ask to have that removed. We were charged for not

Summary Heading: Fun but don't eat the food
Summary: The resort is beautiful and clean. Great waterpark and young children activities. Not for over 10 year olds. Go off site to eat, food and service is horrible.  If doing Disney parks, pick a different resort.

We could not be more happy with our stay at Great Wolf Lodge. We were treated superbly with above par service from all staff members. Everything was so clean and well taken care. We absolutely will be back again!

Summary Heading: I would give more stars but...
Summary: First of all this is a fantastic place to go. My family spent four days in Disneyland and this was the last celebration before we went home. Everything is clean. The check in process was smooth , I used the Mobile check in. We went up to our room, it was good sized.  The place is sensory overload. There is over 11 restaurants, a large arcade, glow-in-the-dark mini golf, some sort of XD theater.. you can “build a bear” (same concept but for GWL).. they have a dance party for the kids at night, and night time stories. Plus the waterpark. Nice area for toddlers, a pretty cool wave pool, basketball hoops, slides for every age. Some of them GO VERY FAST. The lazy river is awesome.  Only problem is..after check out we realized an extremely important bag was missing. We alerted the

My family came here for my son’s 10th birthday. We had a blast there was so much to do. Additionally, I felt the hotel provided exellent customer service and treated us with respect. The resort was very clean and safe. Great family trip.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: We are from Michigan and came to stay with our grandkids in California for a few days. We took our 10-year-old grandson and 14-year-old granddaughter to Greatt Wolf Lodge. Both ages had a lot of fun. I will say that the Magi quest  was probably more suited to our 10 year old grandson. The only negative thing that I would say is that the lines for check-in, arcade, and Magi quest were long.  As with most arcades where are you cashing your tickets for prizes it always takes a long time for the kids to decide. Other than that the experience at the waterpark was so much fun that even the grandparents enjoyed it! We arrived at 1:00 pm with a check in at 4:00pm but our room was ready so we were able to get in right away.

My nieces LOVED The Great Wolf Lodge. My family spent a couple of days her this weekend and my girls enjoyed themselves, never got bored. The Great Wolf Lodge Staff literally though of everything as for entertainment and food. The staff was incredibly friendly and help, everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant. We are already planning our next trip to come back.

You can’t check in to your room until 4pm. That is very inconvenient. They are going to get you with parking fees, locker fees, room fees/taxes that are going to surprise you. Don’t purchase the meal package. It is complicated and restrictive. A one night stay for a family of 4 is going to cost you about a grand once it is all said and done.....ONE NIGHT. Think about how much fun you could get your family with a grand doing something else, an entire weekend at a real beach, Disney Land, Las Vegas. Great Wolf Lodge just isn’t a good value. I only went back a second time because grandma gave us gift certificates, which were a pain to use.

Look, if you’re looking for cheap, this isn’t it. Having said that, I’d actually consider it to be a decent value.   We got a pretty good rate for a KidCabin suite since we went mid-week and a little off season. I think some people forget that this room comes with water park admission.   Water park was fun. The lifeguards are super attentive and not bored and disgruntled local teenagers. They pay close attention to the water and will call people out on rule breaking. Most of the negatives are based on other guests. People will claim a couple tables for the whole day, which keeps others from being able to eat. The little kid area was also closed at one point because a kid pooped in it. Also saw a kid pee on the side of the pool. There’s a restroom close by, so this was a parent

Hotel was clean friendly staff. We had 1 rude staff experience but management took car of situation and seemed to really care about our experience. Fun for the whole family even teens lol Room was clean and looked brand new.

This year for my daughter's birthday we were looking for something different to do and budget friendly. I booked a room for 1 Night on a weekday to save extra money and added a Character breakfast with our package the price was GREAT! Plus wolf ears for each guest including a birthday one .$20 parking a night.I packed my own food and decided to eat there once and an ice cream treat bought my own birthday decoration and presents to celebrate. I got an early notification about checking in early because I read that it works sometimes I was worried. I did it any ways while I was home not expecting my room to be ready and then I got a notification at 10 that my room was ready ! I kid you not lol I didn't end up getting to the hotel until 12p.m lol but yup room was ready and right off

My family and I spent 3 days at Great Wolf Lodge In Garden Grove. We experienced the best time ever. We enjoyed the water park, bowling alley, food court, arcades and the room was superb!!! The price was great for the days we stayed there. On the second day we all went to Disneyland to celebrate my birthday. We had a wonderful day at Disneyland but nothing can compare to the fun we had at Great Wolf Lodge. When I checked in they gave me special birthday ears to wear. I also told the girl we were also celebrating my daughter that passed away in October 2017 Birthday too and she gave me special birthday ears in honor of my daughter. We both cried. Great Wolf makes you feel like you are part of their family. My kids are asking every week to go back. As a mom of 3 young kids under

We had an awesome time.  Took my 5 year old granddaughter and she absolutely loved it.  I wish we we had been able to stay longer--I was worried she might get bored, and she did not!  There was lots more activities that we didn't get opportunity to try.  I highly recommend this for families with younger children.  I don't think teenagers would stay enterained long enough to stay mulitple days.

We went in October and my daughter had a blast. There were so many things to do that children can get very overstimulated. If you have anxiety and have to go then take things to help calm those nerves. The water area is decent. I wish the lazy river was a bit lazier (and longer) but really that's my only complaint. The staff and lifeguards are efficient and shutting down pools quickly when needed (you know why?!?) especially in the toddler pool. Personally, I don't like being in a bathing suit but so many different shapes were there enjoying the water with their families, so if you are in fear of that it's good to see everyone be accepting.   There are plenty of chairs and towels for everyone to sit down as well as lifejackets/vests. The only time they are NEEDED that I saw was

Summary Heading: Amazing experience for the entire family.
Summary: This was our 2nd visit to Great Wolf's Lodge.  My kids are 10 and 11 and they had a blast. From the water park to the arcade to the bowling alley, everything was amazing and geared toward children.  Great fun for the entire family.

Summary Heading: Amazing Experience... Could Have Been Better
Summary: We had so much fun at the waterpark. My lists below apply to our experience, everyone's will be different.  Pros:  - A large indoor waterpark with plenty of activities for every age range. - Fun activities outside of the waterpark area as well - Several eating options available at the resort as well as food options inside the indoor waterpark area - Included Wrist Bands for the adults that have build in chips so you can link them to your account (you don't need to carry a wallet or keys for your room, you just tap your wrist band) Just tap your band at the cash registers of shops, restaurants, and even vending machines! Very cool! - Dunk'n Donuts near the elevators for the hotel rooms. Perfect location and they serve breakfast food at a reasonable price. They very fast at moving

We had a few problems and were not satisfied that they closed the outdoor pool on a beautiful sunny day but the manager Mr Bruno went out of his way to make it up to my children. There were lots of things that went wrong but the staff and manager just exceeded our expectations and turned it all around! Great place to go and if it all ends up going south you can count on the manager to fix it!!

Great place for the whole family! The rooms, hotel and water park were extremely clean. Lifeguards on duty were extremely on point! My daughters enjoyed this more than Disneyland!! Thank you Wolf Losge for a great mini get away!

Summary Heading: Stayed 1 night w/ late ck out
Summary: Our family of 7 stayed one night(March 13-14) in Room 5514, one of the wolf den suites. This suite is 2 separate rooms with connecting doors. The doors are annoying and take up extra walking space when open but Im still glad we stayed there.  My 4, 5, and 11 year olds Loved the wolf den bunk bed area and my 15 & 17 yr olds liked the regular part of the room.  The waterpark was AWESOME! We had no time for any other activities since we were only there for 1 night in the middle of a Disney trip. I loved being able to charge my items through my wrist band and was not incorrectly billed for anything.  The on-site Dunkin Donuts was a god send for us and one of the best parts, from our adult point of view.  I loved that everyone gets free wolf ears upon check in, nice extra touch. Our

We visited Great wolf lodge for 3 nights in March (Wed-Sat) for a Disneyland trip. We stayed in a regular family suite. The room was pretty basic, 2 double beds with a pull out sofa. The room had a minifridge and a small single serving “keurig-like” coffee maker. The room was pretty basic and if you are expecting 4+star accommodations, this isn’t the hotel for you. Housekeeping didn’t show up the first night and the next day we had to call to ask them to come. Fortunately, we did not spend much time in our room. My two kids LOVED the waterpark - there is so much to do that we had trouble getting them to go to Disneyland. My oldest declared that she liked the waterpark more than Disney. I’d recommend not staying here and doing Disney — this hotel is a destination on its own. My

Summary Heading: Kids' delight, maybe not the parents'
Summary: I'm averaging the adults' reviews and the kids' to give this one an even score. My little ones are aged 3-8 and had the time of their lives at Great Wolf Lodge and still ask to go back. They ran around like crazy in the water park all day, and then when we were at the restaurant for dinner, a little PJ dance party broke out and they ran out to go dance. This place does an amazing job catering to children and there is a ton for them to do, even outside the water play. I agree with several reviewers that the food is quite decent too! The lower scores come from our adult experience: the room was comparable to a tiny Motel room and didn't have the cabin bunk bed like I thought I had booked. I had forgotten a toothbrush and was forced to go purchase one from the store where most

We took our family of 6 here for Sping Break last weekend. (March 2019) We have 15, 13, 9, and 6 year old girls.  We stayed in a king suite with a separate room for the kids with a themed bunk and a full bed and sofa. There was more than enough room for everyone and my younger girls loved the bunk beds that had their own tv. Our king bed wasn’t as comfortable as Inhad hoped, but it was sufficient.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet.  We pulled into the resort on Saturday afternoon (had we come earlier we would have been able to utilize the attractions before hotel check in) and didn’t leave until we were done at the water park four days later. They allow you to stay and play in all the days if your reservation whether you are checked in or out at that time.   we bought

Summary Heading: For an Auntie and Uncle with no kids, we had a lot of fun
Summary: At first we were worried what we got ourselves into, but the kids had an absolute blast. Online checkin made things fast and the food was reasonably priced and honestly pretty good (and yes we are DINKS with snobby tastes). Had a lot of fun with our nieces and nephew in the waterpark and the staff was friendly. Would go back!

Excellent event venue for children of all ages- water park magnificent. Wonderful people, service and facilities. Would highly recommend to families, particularly with younger children. Tons of fun for all.

Had a great experience with my son. Our only complaint was We both wished the operating hours would be open longer.   Clean rooms with good housekeeping attentiveness.   Arcade and restaurant experience was “good enough”. Does the job but nothing  to rave about.   Good staff, service and experience otherwise! Thank you GWL!

We stayed here, for one night on Sunday 3/3/19. It was 3 adults and 2 toddlers. We stayed in a family suite, which had 2 “queen” beds and 1 sleeper sofa. The queen bed is more like a full size and the mattress was on the hard side. The pillows were also very uncomfortable, which was a first for all of us.  The room is small, but clean, and has a small microwave and a mini fridge. There is no laundry service, no drying racks, and no clothes line in the room. The rooms also do not have balconies; therefore, there is nowhere to hang all the wet swim clothes.   You can access the waterpark,  effective 1:00pm on your check-in day; therefore, we decided to arrive early, which we arrived around 12:00pm. When we arrived the check-in lines were very long. It took about 30 minutes from

Our kids kept bugging us to go to Great Wolf Lodge. The idea of an indoor water park did not seem interesting. I kept thinking it's going to be loud, smell like bleach and be full of unruly kids.   I was 100% wrong. Great Wolf Lodge goes out of their way to make sure you have a great visit. The water park is clean, full of fresh air, lots of lifeguards making sure everyone is safe and respectful. We went on a Wednesday and found it wasn't very busy which was nice.   Lots of after hours fun for kids from mini bowling, mini golf, arcades and staff hosted dance parties and story time.   Our room was clean and quiet. Totally thought we would be able to hear kids running all over the place. We were on the 7th floor which does not have any of the elevator lobby scavenger hunt booths

Great Wolf is a great destination for the kids of all ages. Hotel with a Great water park, priced right.   Rooms are very nice and many fun options for comfort and unique experience for the family.  Love that are keys were in arm bands so we didn't have to carry one around, awesome addition Great Wolf!   Staff was nice and helpful when we had questions, fun activities in the great room that our kiddo enjoyed.   I didn't know about having to pay to park, but wasn't surprised by it, as everyone seems to be going that direction, especially in California.   Water park was awesome, something for pretty much any age group, a little more organized than some, for towels, etc.,  and I like that the little kids are measured so you know which water areas they can be in.  The wave pool was

Summary Heading: Not as good as i expected
Summary: I had my son's 6th birthday party there. The party went very well but the hotel experience wasn't what I excepted. Of course for the money being spent for the hotel and having a party with 45 guess at $50 a guest you would expect to be treated very courteous. And while some staff did others were not as courteous. We received smart remarks when calling down for extra blankets. We also had to carry our own drinks (10 each) down on trays from the party area to the pool area. Seems like a staff member could have assisted with that. I could go on but don't have the time.

Summary Heading: Sooooooooooo amazing. And all of the family was happy
Summary: We all had a blast and the kids are the best age. It also was a good experience. SO FUN !!!!!!!!!!!!  Water park was so fun and we enjoyed the food and the service was great. I think we should definitely go back. Thank you

I had no idea what our family was in for, other than a water park and hotel. This was so much more. It is a full Family Resort. They offer so much for the family. Dance time with the family, story time with a big stage setup, game nights. The food was really good and there are numerous restaurants to go to.

My family had a great time at great wolf lodge. Water park was great. Wait times were very short and slides are amazing. Food was good and reasonably priced. Themed wolf den suite was awsome! Kids loved their interactive wolf den bunk area. In all, it was a great time at a great value. Kids liked it more than Disney and I liked that it was less than half the price.

Summary Heading: Expect to pay for any extras.
Summary: Water park was good kids enjoyed it. Any other attractions were not included and were very expensive. Resort fees and parking were pricey as well. Ordered pizza on their app expecting to have a delivery option but had to go all the way down to lower level. Cheese pizza left a lot to be desired crust was like cardboard. Rooms and resort were clean but a lot of bait and switch with their prices.

From the moment we walked in we felt welcomed and excited to be there! Every staff we encountered was polite and accommodating. So much to do for the little ones, and so many options to eat on property you never have to leave. We thought of it as a little Las Vegas hotel for families. The kids are already talking about going back.

This was our first time at the great Wolf Lodge, we found it to be an amazing place to be with our grandchildren! The waterpark had amazing slides, that even the adults enjoyed! The restaurant was delicious with great food quality. The staff were pleasant, the rooms were clean and very accommodating.

Summary Heading: Great for grand daughter & grand parents too!
Summary: Loved Great Wolf Lodge! My husband and I loved this place as much as our 8 year old grand daughter!   Everything is immaculate with warm friendly staff, great food & wine too! wonderful indoor water park at 84 degrees in and out of the water! we will be back for sure! Very reasonably priced with room over night and all the activities!

This was so an awesome trip for the family. Everything was at our finger tips. The hotel is so kid friendly which was even better. My son played games throughout the entire hotel. We made so many great memories and cannot wait to come back.

This was our 2nd visit to Great Wolf Lodge.  Our 1st stay was fantastic and we enjoyed our time in the room and the park.  The 2nd visit was booked with the promo offered after our first stay, and our experience was troubling and in my opinion should have resulted in a refund.  We arrived early and had checked in the night before via the app.  My oldest daughter decided to join us so I visited the counter to add her on our reservation and pay the $50 fee to add her on.  I was glad to pay it since she wasn’t initially included in our reservation.  Once complete we headed straight to the water park.  We spent about an hour swimming and had a great time.  Then, we decided to grab some lunch at the in-park restaurant “Buckets”.  The portions were average and the prices were a little

Summary Heading: Really fun and great family time
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge is a really fun trip for families with kids of all ages. There are a variety of slides with varying intensity levels, a large water play structure, water play areas with basketball nets, floats and obstacle courses plus a wave pool and a lazy river. So in the water park alone there is a lot to do. You do however need to and should take breaks from the air inside and the chlorine water. It is really strong and after a while you can feel it burning your sinuses and throat and I am not all that sensitive. They do have locker rooms with showers including shampoo and conditioner inside the water park so you can shower off and also changing rooms so you can bring a dry change of clothes with you and change into at the end because the hallways can be cold. The lodge

It was our first time here but we had heard from friends and family that this place was so much fun. I booked in our stay a night before and my kids were all so excited. Upon arrival they had my room ready (an hour and a half before my time) this was more than great. The kids had a lot of fun and so did me and my husband. We can’t wsit to book our next visit here. Completely recommend The Great Wolf Lodge for your family trip.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge is a wonderful place to take the kids for a quick vacation
Summary: It's not the cheapest place in the world and I wouldn't recommend more than a couple of days but it's a great indoor waterpark with things for both the younger and older kids. There are only a couple of "thrill" water slides but there are enough none water park things to occupy their time. The rooms are so so and the neighborhood isn't that great but everything you need is right inside the resort. I'd recommend spending a little extra for a themed room for the experience.

We had a good trip here.  We typically only stay 2 days (1 night) and GWL has gotten better and better at the check-in/check out process throughout our stays, making extremely streamlined and easy.    So you ask, why only 4 stars?  This time they had a new rule in the water park that was extremely frustrating.  You had to check-out towels to your reservation, limit 1 per person and they would charge you $15 per towel if you didn't return it.    I had so many issues with this, first their towels are not horrible, but if you really want to get dry- it takes at least two of them to do that.  If this rule was in place for quality towels, probably wouldn't be an issue.   But when you are leaving the park, and want to take a shower, you simply can't get dry with 1 towel per person.

We planned a trip to Great Wolf Lodge for my daughters birthday and we had the best time. We enjoyed the indoor water park during the day and in the afternoon we had plenty of other activities to keep us entertained, such as bowling, golfing, arcade. It was nice and clean, not crowded, friendly. I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Kids loooooove this place. Great hotel (clean, comfortable, lots of food choices available). This place makes it easy for adults to relax while the kids play. It was such an excellent trip. Can’t wait to go back.

We went on a holiday weekend and experienced long Waits and a lot of crowded conditions. Also the air was humid and full of chlorine in the Water Park area. Our eyes and throats were very irritated. For what we paid I sort of expected a nicer room, although there was absolutely nothing wrong with it. The kids had a fabulous time.

Stayed here for one night as an add on to our already planned vacation. Went with our 2 year old and it was amazing -already planing a staycation with the one being built closeby. We arrived on a Thursday around 5, and although we had prechecked in, it didn't go through and we ended up waiting in line. Once checked in we had the bellhop bring our bags up -they made it to the room before we did, and turns out, it wasn't our room! They programmed my wristband to my brothers room. I had to return to the front desk and the correct room programmed. They were apologetic and all worked out. We didn't spend much time in our room before we headed downstairs for the dance party, music show and storytime. My son was having the best time. The following day we spent in the waterpark with a

I would say the best kids age group would be 3 to 10. There is a lot the explore and do while never leaving the resort. Everything is conveniently placed, clean and staff is great. It is not too big or small and hence not overwhelming. It fits the ideal family fun experience.

Summary Heading: Can get really pricey really fast.
Summary: It's a good idea and definitely a fun hotel, but the prices can get expensive really quick. Especially after taxes and fees. Some items/services are really overpriced, eg poolside lockers are $12, $20 a night parking. Take advantage of water park access on check in and check out day, kids 3 and under eat free, groupon deals, booking 60 days in advance, etc.   There are changing rooms and showers in the waterpark restrooms for when you check out of your room. Poolside chairs/tables can be hard to come by during peak hours. Can be a little daunting if you're a solo parent with a young one.

We loved the atmosphere, the staff were all super sweet and courteous! Our kids loved it: all the activities, water park, arcade - there is just so much to do and enjoy! We stayed at the Kid's Cabin Suite, it was sooo cute, the kids loved it....  It's so worth it!

Summary Heading: Amazing place for the whole family
Summary: This place is loaded with fun activities that don’t just stop at the water park! I definitely recommend upgrading the passes!! We will definitely be coming back in the near future! Best time to come is weekdays!

Our hotel room was clean & spacious but unfortunately the bathroom fan does not turn off. It was loud & when we called the front desk bc we couldn't figure out how to turn off the bathroom fan, we were told it didn't turn off & they just recommended that we close the bathroom door. It would have been nice to have been told prior to reserving the room. The lighting by the sink was also not working. Beds were comfortable.

Summary Heading: Soooo much fun for our kids (and good food)
Summary: We enjoyed it more than we expected, as adults.  We were prepared for only our kids to have fun, but the waterslides are huge and super fun for adults.  There is SO much to do.  We did 1 night plus the late checkout which was perfect because it gave us 2 days at the park.  The food is surprisingly good (and pretty affordable) and the beer is mostly local.  It was our first time and we were celebrating birthdays to they give you these adorable headbands with wolf ears at check-in.  Jose in Engineering was the only employee who went out of this way to wish us a happy birthday.  Also, Daisie at the breakfast buffet was a delight!  So friendly, so helpful, lovely lady...  I would have given it 5 stars if not for 1 thing: The Front Desk staff only gave the 2 adults wristbands; none

Summary Heading: Locals, Take Advantage of Off Season Deals
Summary: This hotel can be a bit pricey so as a local, I have been watching for off season deals.  I finally found a Groupon and took advantage of a Friday that the kids had off for President's Day Weekend.  We booked the Thursday night at a deeply discounted price.  I brought 5 13 year-old boys for the day.  Because of scheduling issues with my group of boys, we did not take advantage of the check in day water park access nor did we spend the night.  With my discounted Groupon rate,it was still worth the money to have a full day at the water park for six boys.  We had a room that included 6 water park bracelets and we were able to buy an additional bracelet for my daughter for the day (around $50).  The food in the water park was reasonable for an amusement park, around $10-12 for a

My boys 7 and 9 had an amazing time. It pretty much had all the rides a regular waterpark would have. Just compact so you dont have to walk so far. All the staff were soooooo friendly! Any questions we had we asked were answered. Nothing was overly priced. There was so much to do in location. You don't have to leave the resort

Great for families. Tons of fun for the kids. And good food. I recommend at least a two day stay to ensure that your family or friends gets to partake in all of the activities besides just doing the water park.

great time at Great Wolf Lodge, the place is nicely decorated, with a great family atmosphere, me and my wife had a great time and we are planning to return with the grand kids to enjoy the water park, food is great, and the margaritas are the best I had the blueberry margarita, simply the best,

We visited due to rain at Disney, hotel has sticky carpet, dirty rooms, deafening arcade, the cooks visibly eat out of your food baskets, while wearing gloves will rub face, scratch head, then return to cooking your food without washing hands etc. however if you bring up your concerns with management, instead of taking concern with them they will offer a 30% discount for one night to “ease the financial impact and hopefully give a bit more value for the price”   I’d rather be staying at a hotel that is concerned with food safety and cleanliness then to priced me with a financial value. Clearly this hotel is aimed at a bargain hotel consumer and has a “you get what you pay for” vibe.   I was expecting some level of shock with my feedback and concern not a discount. Clearly the

The kids love this place we have been here several times but first time since new towel policy. The new towel policy to check out and check in isn't too bad. Except we had to verify every time how many towels their system said we had out. Twice they said we had more than we originally had checked out but were able to correct it. Kids loved the waterpark and the wait times were not that long. We tried to use the mobile ordering but it was not working when we were there.  Overall a Great Time and will be back soon!

My family of 4 went and enjoyed the water park for 2 entire days. We had the best time. The water park is fun for hours upon hours and the hotel has so many things to do that you do have to leave to keep entertained for days.

Exciting indoor fun for the family. You need your bathing suit but not the sunscreen. There are always different activities and events that keep the day exciting. My kids love the pajama party and story time yoga. And of course the waterpark.

Summary Heading: My niece LOVED the Kids activities
Summary: So my niece begged me to come here,I even tryed to suggest the Disneyland Hotel she refused! So it's an elevated hotel experience. Character breakfasts, water park, arcade and mini golf! Guess what we got there and she all of a sudden turns into a turtle! Yup, a turtle! There was so much to do she got nervous and shy! So the first night was a bust! Thankfully the next morning after most people went cocoa puffs for disneyland! We stayed to try and enjoy the activities. That's when we met Corey! She was so sweet with my niece and coaxed her out of her shell, she genuinely tried to get to know her since we were doing many of the day activities! Each time we ran into Corey she said hi to my niece using her name not just a "hey". Let me tell you Corey saved the trip for us otherwise

We have gone 2 times now to great Wolf southern California, always clean, staff is friendly, great service, no lines, and most important I trust their life guards!!! Great experience!!! I highly recommend going during the week.

This place is awesome!  From the minute we were at the parking gate the attendant helped direct us to the best parking spot there was.  Check in was really fast and  easy.  The rooms are very spacious and tv has apps to where after a day of fun we were able to sign into our Hulu account and have a family movie night.  I had been missing out, we can’t wait to go again.

We just went in February to great wolf lodge after months of reservations planned and I got to say it was awesome. Very attentive staff , very clean pools and lounge areas , very clean rooms and exciting activities for the kids. Will definitely come back soon.

The BEST experience!! I highly recommend splurging on: Wolf den themed room ($50) Birthday extras ($30) Paw pass ($80) - I got 1 for 2 kids to share Character Brunch ($20 adult, $10 kid) Water Park!!!

Great place to relax, hangout and play. Enjoy! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The resort was full of adventures, games, shops and entertainment. Make sure you come prepared to leave the outside world behind and to enjoy the warm water utopia.

Summary Heading: Great for families, not for business.
Summary: My organization held a conference here for some 400 educators. Some brought their families to enjoy the water park. However, it is very much geared for the children and was unsuitable for business. The beds were particularly uncomfortable as the unfitted sheets left you swimming in linen. The $20 breakfast buffet was a bit overpriced considering that the omelet I ordered wasn’t cooked long enough to melt the cheese. Thankfully there were  other restaurants near by for those whose funds were running out.

My family go to this place once in a while maybe once in a few months. We like to stay there to enjoy indoor swimming along with slides, lazy river with my kindergartener. We noticed some change has been made from the last visit; they started checking towels in and charge for the lost/not returned ones $15 per. They accidentally charge me $30 for the final bill and I had to call to fix it. Secondly, once you checked out the room and it might completely checked you out so I had to go upstairs to reinstate for the rest of stay in the pool area. Too many people and not enough chairs to sit on for resting. So, I give 3 stars. Hopefully, they fill a gap for improvement till next visit.

The resort is spacious, clean and fun. The water park was clean and provided hours of fun for the entire family. Staff was very friendly. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet! My kids would rather come here than Disneyland... and we didn't do the arcade or bowling alley.

Summary Heading: Wolf Lodge has their claws out for every dime of your money!
Summary: From the time you walk in the door after having spent almost $660 per night for one adult and 2 kids, there is an up-charge for everything. The silly wand have multiple rates and does not include the game, there's an arcade game that's not marked that charges $10, even the lockers in the waterpark (beciuse of course you don't get your room until 6pm) charge $12!!!! I've never heard of such a thing!  I had to wait in line for 30 minutes to check in, surrounded by hundreds of people going on about what a great discount they got on Groupon.   The Water Park was ridiculously overcrowded. People reserved all the  chairs with a pair of diapers or goggles. They were short rafts and staff so lines were long.   The air in the room barely works and is one of those manual units which makes

I love this place. Just left the resort and already making plans to go back!! This is the best place to be and I love the fact that we can go anytime and any season!! I definitely recommend this place!! Best thing about it is you have a room to go back to and water park access for 2 days!!! Can’t get any better than that!!

Our kids loved this place!  The wolf den was perfect with the bunk beds and semi-private enclosure. The slides and other rides were a lot of fun.  I just have three big nits, though.  First, the sheets in the rooms were literally the roughest linens I've ever encountered in my 40 years.  Seriously, it was one notch above a burlap sack, and it was very difficult falling asleep and staying asleep.  Second, the gym needs free weights.  Third, every Purell hand sanitizer dispenser was empty the entire time we were there.

Summary Heading: First time at great wolf lodge
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge water park was alot of fun- the water park was very clean and alot of staff room help - a very strong chlorine smell was not so pleasant- rooms are just plain rooms and their are lots of upgrades available for kids to play- of course for an extra charge - overall a good time - the lack of a jacuzzi was sorely  missed -

Summary Heading: The worse experience we have had with this resort out of the 3 times we had visited.
Summary: This is was our third time staying at the resort and by far the worse experience.  We pre checked in the night before and arrived at the resort at 1pm.  Mobile check in kiosk went well and went to the water park until our room was ready.  The bell desk was so overwhelmed with guests that the carts with people belongings were being stored in the lobby.  So we decided to keep our things with us not knowing our room would not be ready until close to 6pm. That was the most disappointing. We checked with front desk at 415 since we hand not received a text message.  They told us the room was still being cleaned and it would be awhile until we were able to get our room.  I went back to the front desk at 550pm still had not received a text message with our room number.  Front desk told

We’re always looking for a fun place to take the Grandkids on Birthday Adventures! This place was great. Online checkin sure helped make things go quickly when we got there. So excited that our room was ready early. On with our bathing suits & down to the water park! The grandkids had so much fun! Enough variety of water slides & activities for all ages. The food at Buckets was great-hot, plentiful! We had a great time.

was everything and more, can't wait for the Scottsdale location to open this year....The characters being around and all for our grandsons aged 20 months and 5 3/4 years old  We upgraded to a two bedroom, was awesome....loved the breakfast with the characters

Summary Heading: Very disappointing experience, even worse customer service after we left.
Summary: It began when we got there and checked in. We felt rushed thru the process to get us our key and move on to the next customer. He gave us our room key and rushed us on our way. I had previously paid for the paw pass which he didn’t say anything about so we went back and asked about it. He said, oh yeah and gave us all the things we paid for and told us where to go to use them. Again we talked away and I thought, hey, we bought the prepaid meals. So we went back again and asked and he replied, oh yeah, gave us some meal tickets and rushed thru where we could eat and how much we got. Bewildered at the process so far, we went up to our room, 713. To our amazement, when we showed up the door was open and the room was dirty. So again we went down the elevator (there are 6 but take

I liked out time here. Lots of kids. Water park was fun. Lots of activities to keep kids busy. Location is perfect for Disneyland and even has a shuttle. Really close to a Target. Things I did not like... The indoor water park smells so strongly of chlorine (good thing I guess), but it's hard to breath in there. So many kids running around. Charging for parking. I mean it's already expensive and now you want to gouge me for having a car.

This is our second Great Wolf trip, the first was the Grand Mound, Washington location. With both trips we got a 50% off deal for booking greater than 60 days in advance. I think their full price is a little much but half off is a good value. One downside is the Anaheim location does not have a hot tub, the Washington one does. Another downside is the food. You pay a premium price for less than awesome food. However, there are several other dining choices very close to the lodge so I didn't take off for that. Also we would just make our sandwiches for lunch to save a little money. The waterpark was crowded on Saturday but not bad on Thursday or Friday. Most importantly the kids loved it, the 6yo especially.  The 11yo really enjoyed exploring the lodge as part of Magiquest. The

To start, their website descriptions are very vague. When booking our room, I picked a room based on their website description, and it was not what I had expected. While booking, they offer their "Passes" they have three levels with three different prices. I was unsure if I needed to purchase before arriving to their property, so I called, and I was 152 place in line! with a projected 48 min wait time before speaking to someone!! So I then tried their online chat, and I was 33rd in line. This made it very frustrating, as I didn't want to spend all morning on hold trying to figure it out. So, I went ahead and didn't purchase the pass while booking my room.  When we arrived, we got there at noon. I know check in time isn't until 4pm, but decided to give it a try anyway. Our room

It was a great 1st experience. My kids loved it. Everything was kid friendly. I like that they had a lot of lifeguards. I felt safe when my kids when on their own. We will be planning to return with more family.

I am not a usual fan of water parks as i find it a little "germy" but I was more than satisfied with Great Wolf Lodge Resort. Everything was satisfactorily clean for the most part, the service was beyond what I expected. They had a text concierge where if i had a any questions or requests, I can instantly text my assistant concierge. I'm not sure how i received it. It was perhaps because i left my phone number when I downloaded the app but it was great as I was able to get questions answered in an instant. They even worked around my request to have my room changed so I was next to our friend's room. The food was also surprisingly good and they give you a ton. We had enough fries to between the kids meals to last us a week. The kids enjoyed the additional pup pass we purchased

Summary Heading: Bet place to take the family
Summary: Absolutely loved this resort, the kids had a great time. We will make this a yearly trip during the winter months. Great place to go with the family, especially since water parks are a no go during the winter. this resort allows you to enjoy the water park with the water being at a warm temperature.

Great local indoor water park for the whole family. Great service, available to check in prior and no line in picking up your wristlet and wolf ears. Large room great for family and little ones to run around. Convenience of food and other items all within the hotel.

We went on a Thursday and Friday We had a great time! We prechecked via cellphone — this made everything so easy. Rooms were ready upon arrival! Rooms were clean. Our 5 year old was thrilled to be there! The paw pass is the way to go! Our daughter (5) and daddy finished the magi quest just in time! (8 hours) the knighting ceremony was very sweet! The princess experience was great! In addition to the pedi she got a cozy robe, tiara, lotion, hair sent, hair ties, nail polish, file etc...I reccomend the artichoke dip and the brisket sandwich in the grill restaurant 💗

This hotel was built with the family in mind.  From the activities to the food to the staff and even to the large trashcans in the rooms!  The water park and hotel were clean and adequately staffed.  The staff was friendly and it was not overly crowded.  We will be back for certain!

Great experience for the kids.  Do not expect a relaxafull vacation.  Be mindful of what you charge to the room because it will all add up at the end.  On full day of this place is enough.  (We stayed three).  Will not be going back.

Summary Heading: Amazing place for the whole family.
Summary: Such a fun place for kids and adults too. My son didn’t want to leave. The wolf den room is fun. The bunk beds are amazing. The facility itself is very clean and the personnel are helpful anf friendly. We can’t wait to come back.

Summary Heading: An excellent hotel for spending your time with family
Summary: During our trip to USA, the kids loved this hotel most.  The water park and other facilities in the resort are quite interesting and that is why we stayed one more day before we headed to LAX.  Definitely would recommend it to our friends with kids.

Kids love the water park even on the winter time, they love to stay there forever ;). The kid cabon at the room has it own tv and all they want at the bed! Games are awesome. Special the wave pool, my kids just want to stay in the water the whole time even we are on winter time!

Perfect for a quick getaway to spend quality time with loved ones. Our 3 and 6 year olds had a blast! The facility was clean and the staff were professional, friendly and helpful. We will definitely be returning!

I took my 17 year old daughter and 5 friends for her birthday weekend. Tge girls had a great time in the water park and the 24 hour arcade. Good clean, safe fun. 4 of the girls are vegan and there were not a lot of food options  in the hotel but we found a great Vegan pizza place a couple miles away.

Loved the fact that the outside weather doesn't affect going to a water park.  It was pouring rain outside but we were enjoying playing in the water.   Only downside is the pullout sofa was extremely loud and uncomfortable.   Woke up everyone in the room.  Employees,  cleanliness, food, were all great!

I was there on business and took my wife and grandson. He thoroughly enjoyed himself, especially the water park and Story Time.  Reasonably priced meals throughout the facility. Plenty of activities to entertain the kids. Great family hotel. Highly recommended!

Every year my wife and take our daughter and two of her friends and moms to Disneyland as a part of the Happy Hearts program.  We usually stay at the Sheraton, but thought it would be fun to try something else.  Easy parking in a big structure.  Our check in experience was  fine until we went to our room.  We got to our assigned suite just as a family entered the room we were told was ours.  They said they had been there for 3 days.  When my wife tried her wristband on the suite next door it worked for that room, which was not the number written on our key sleeve.  My wife received a text from the hotel’s personal assistant to see how we were doing.  She mentioned the issue with our rooms, and someone  from  maintenance was sent to our new room with replacement keys.  None of

We had so much fun, everything was perfect.  This is the best resort for a great family get away.   Everything is geared to the kids and they love it.  The food is good, and there are a variety of price points which is good.  The waterslides are fun and scary, and it helped us create memories that will last a lifetime.

From our smallest (2yr) to our oldest (55yr) everyone had a blast this has been added to our list of "my favorite place" according to my 2 and 5 year old. Easy to pay for items with your cc wristband which also works as your room key.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun worth the upgrades
Summary: We went for my daughters 7th birthday. We upgraded to a wolf den and she got the paw pass. Her favorite part was getting the wand for the magiquest game and interacting throughout the hotel. She loved how the parts of her room came on with a wave of the wand. We also have a 2 year old and she enjoyed all of it as well. Overall we had a great time but its very expensive. With one night though you can have two days to enjoy all of the hotel/ waterpark so I would just say make sure you get the most of it.

Both my children, husband and I took a small get away for the weekend to celebrate our children's birthday and they loved it. Atmosphere was great, everything was super convenient and accommodating. Will be back for sure. I suggest if you want to do all the activities plan before hand and organize yourself with time. Honestly I was skeptical regarding the water park and did not expected to have as much fun as my children did. I completely recommend it.

We recently heard about Great Wolf Lodge from friends. We weren’t familiar with the GWL but an indoor waterpark sounded fun! We live in So. Cal and we were looking to getaway for the weekend and GWL just happened to be only a couple hour drive for us. We started our search about 3 weeks prior to our arrival. At first, we were surprised with the cost when we looked online and considered other options such as Disneyland or Knotts. A couple of days after our search I conveniently noticed a 30% discount offer to GWL while on Instagram (funny how that happens) and we decided to book our stay. It was the best option for a few of reasons, such as, it’s February in California and the weather might not be ideal for other amusement parks and outdoor activities, GWL was somewhere we could

Summary Heading: Let’s Talk About the Ridiculous Towel Program
Summary: This is our third visit and it’s clear that Great Wolf is still working out some of the kinks.   1) The lines form at the bottom of the stairs and it’s awesome.  You now don’t feel like someone will knock you over. 2) They started making you ‘check out’ towels.  Before, you could simply grab a towel from a stack and return when finished.  Now, you need to use your wristband to checkout a towel.  Forget to turn it in?  $15 added for each towel.  THIS IS RIDICULOUS.  I wasn’t there an hour before someone took my first towel.  15 bucks down and I had 47 hours to go.  Not a good start.  Great Wolf – don’t make your towel problem into MY towel problem.  I pay enough as it is.  According to your sign, the towel program is to prevent people blocking chairs they aren’t using.  Wake up.

My son loved this place.  Staff was very friendly.  Will be coming back.  The MagiQuest is a must, recommend getting eirher the Paw Pass or Wolf Pass.  The lifeguards at the water park were very attentive and kept all children safe.

Luckily we arrived with family who had stayed before and gave us pointers on arriving early to enjoy the waterpark, the best place to dine during our waterpark adventure time (pizza and Buckets). Ordering from the app was a breeze and the text notifications were helpful. I enjoyed the ease of hotel room access and not having to carry anything around (room key cards or $$). The kids had a great time and we will be back.

Summary Heading: Kids had a blast/Parents, not so much
Summary: This park is clean, the rooms are mediocre (we stayed in the suites) and the kids had a blast.  The wands are extremely over-priced and the food options are acceptable.  The water park is amazing!  However, we have a toddler with special food needs and they refused to allow us to bring in his food.  We were required to toss the food or take it back to our room, which is a 20 min roundtrip walk from the park.  They allow food in the park, but only if purchased in the park.  Such a frustrating experience.  They have Yoga for the kids, which seemed fun, but it was disorganized and the 2 woman leading it were simply unqualified to do so.

I recently had family in town from Utah.  They wanted to stay near Disney and somewhere fun. This place was great for both! Water park inside the hotel was clean and fun for my little cousins. They had a kids activities throughout the trip to keep the kids entertained. Corey from the kids club staff was extra attentive to my neice and made sure she was having a good time even when you could tell she was having a rough day. Corey was able to get her to play with some of the other kids which can be difficult. Most of the staff around the hotel were always friendly. The hotel was so big we didn't have to leave to do much. A restaurant inside made dinner easy a few time. I'm sure i would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for something out of the norm of you'r

This is THE kids resort really. Kids run and play to exhaustion, sleep with smiles and wake just late enough. Parents really can relax and just let the children be children without being overly concerned about every little impulse their children may have. The Staff are super helpful. And if you need something in the room. They are there crazy fast. It’s like they are waiting outside your room to help make your stay super easy.

My family and I were pleased to stay at Great Wolf Lodge. We were beyond our own thoughts about our stay and will return soon. We did the Paw Pass and the Wolf Pass. Our food and beverages were purchased at the Great Wolf lodge as well. We had a blast and can't wait to celebrate birthdays again next year.

The resort was an awesome experience for my son’s birthday. This was what he asked for and was not disappointed. Even though we live locally, this place made us feel like we were on vacation. Thank you Great Wolf Lodge.

Hi,Our stay was good, the only thing was the check in process was really bad. I do understand that check in time was at 4pm, upon arrival at 8 :30 am I asked the front desk agent if we could check in a little early and I do not mind being charged extra since I was with my grandmother and we were on the road since 11 PM we came from San Francisco  and that she really needs to get some rest. Agent says that the system was down and that we can stay in the lobby while waiting for our room. I did understand that, however we were at the lobby for 7 hours! my son kept on asking about the room but still, I then asked them and they said that they don't know if there's a clean room per Housekeeping and this is at 1pm.  This is unacceptable I paid the room for $500 and I was ok to be

This place is amazing  for a family get away. We always have a wonderful time.The Hotel is clean and the staff are all very accommodating.We have been here 3 times now and will definitely plan another trip in the future

Summary Heading: Don't come with any expectations or your entire time will be ruined like my child's birthday.
Summary: Be prepared for the worst to happen because everything under the sun happened. No goggles that cover their nose. Don't waste your money on them as they aren't allowed and there's nothing posted staring that. They'll make your child cry telling them to get them off. They might bring your kids cake 2 hours late when you're already gone and out of the room because check out is at 11. You might get locked out of your room at 10:30. You might get charged over $500 on your card even though you shouldn't have been and it's even noted in your file. You might have difficulties getting the remaining balance on your gift card given back to you unless you want it MAILED. Their entire system might fail for an entire day so you can do room charge and have to carry your money around at the

Our kids, ages 7, 9 and 13 had a blast at the water park.  Tons of different attractions for all ages.  For me as a parent however, it was extremely hot and stuffy inside the park, seemed like there was no ventilation for the tons of chlorine that they used in the water.  My eyes burned and I got a headache within minutes of walking into the park.  If you are a parent of older kids and plan to not go on the attractions, good luck sitting there.  It's pretty unbearable. Also, we arrived on MLK day, when public school was out.  It was extremely packed!!  We stayed overnight and by the next day, much of the crowd had cleared out.  I would NOT recommend visiting on a national holiday!!  Way too many bodies crowded in there!

As a third time visitor, I thought I knew what to expect and was excited to bring the kids back. In just the 6 months since our last trip, the quality of the service, he cleanliness of the resort, the quality of the food and the amenities provided have all gone WAY downhill. All while the price goes up. I feel duped. The room was dirty (we had a Wolf Den Suite), the food was cold, our room wasn’t ready until we’ll after the check in time and they over charged us not once but twice. Even the costumes of the characters are old, tattered and dirty. Don’t waste your money.

We’ve been going to GFL for a while. Since it opened in 2016, we’ve been there about 4 times, but this last time left me thinking... What Happened...?We always go at times we suspect won’t be very busy, like winter, week day. With that said, I kind of know that it’s not that busy. This past weekend we went and were pretty disappointed with their new system. They seem to have a VERY limited number of tubes for the slides, and we had to wait even when it wasn’t crowded... the new system might work for over crowded days, but I wasn’t pleased with having to wait for the tubes.Add to that that now you have to keep track of your towels to avoid a $15 per towel charge...It was nice to find shampoo and conditioner in the water park showers, but they were dirty and water barely comes

All the staff were very helpful. The mobile concierge was great. The towels at the water park are not very nice (rough like sandpaper), but not a big deal. We were able to reserve 1 night at $150 (non-peak rate), which was worth it. I don't think I would go back if I had to pay more, but that's just me. Overall it was fun.

Everyone really enjoyed the water park.  Wait times were reasonable - worse on the weekends and no wait on the weekday.  Food was average but we didn't come here for the rave food reviews so that didn't surprise us or disappoint us.  My kids had a blast with the MagiQuest game too.

Very fun place to visit on for all adults and kids it’s an overall fun experience. You don’t have to leave the place everything is accommodated in there from breakfast to lunch and dinner and Bars. And The pool rides is the best place to have fun in.

Checked in expecting to use the water while having to wait til check in but room was ready.  Kids enjoyed waterpark a lot.  Ate pizza for dinner from restaurant there.  It was pretty decent pizza for the price.    Bed was slightly on the hard side and while duvet was pleasant visually with room.. not very comfortable.  Arcade had lots of fun games and tickets were gracious.  Will come again, this place is easily a 2 night stay.

Watch out booking with them! They scammed me out of $183 which left me stranded and they didn’t offer to help they said that in 2-3 business days my money should return but what was that “soft charge” then? When they already took out a deposit and the room was booked. They tried to rip me off an additional 183! They deserve really a 0 at that site not sure of the others I won’t be biast but I wouldn’t go to there again

Summary Heading: Family Fun AND great Gluten Free Dining!
Summary: Crazy that I'm posting about a hotel that pays strict attention to the needs of celiac. Our dining experience at the Grill was AMAZING!! Only drawback to the hotel is no hot tub. We had ribs calamari and beef brisket. Huge portions. No adverse reactions...and I am very very sensitive!

The prices shocked me to get what we wanted but I spent the money anyway. I'm glad I did. My daughter and I had a blast and it is officially my daughter's favorite place to go. You never need to leave the hotel...it gets busy but we've been 4 times now all at busy seasons and it is never overwhelming. Yes, it is a pricey but I personally think this is a very unique and wonderful experience...kids love this place!

Great Wolf has everything a family could dream of in one package.  We went on the perfect day so there were hardly any lines for the water park.  The thematic rooms captured the kids immediately and the staff was so attentive.  Great food, great fun, great experience.

The resort was all age friendly. Staff were professional ,check in at 4:00 but, I came early and wolf lodge accommodated me. I really liked the check out and, continue to enjoy the water park. Wood grill bar makes great drinks, the food was great. The sweet shop down stairs had stale cup cakes but promptly refunded my money. The best part of the trip was smelling the cookies bake at night. Good job Wolf Loadge!!

Summary Heading: A fun time for kids and adults.
Summary: We just spent 2 nights at GWL, Garden Grove, Ca. A fun time was had by all. This was our Christmas gift to our grandkids and their parents. It was fun for us to see their joy and to hear them say this was their best gift ever.

What a neat place everything under one roof. Great customer service! My family had a blast!!! We will be back again soon. The food was great! Had fun in the water park and the arcade. There is so much to do which is really cool. You dont have to go anywhere else it's all here.Thank you for making it so great

It is a great place for kids to have fun in the water.  The lifeguards were everywhere.  I felt the children were safe with the patrol of the life guards at the stations.  Enjoyed being able to sit at table, eat and watch the kids.

Summary Heading: Fun for the Kids, but expensive vacation spot
Summary: Great vacation place for kids (mine are 11, 9 and 4 yrs old), but parents need to really plan for the expense. Also, we all expected the waterpark to be warmer - all 5 of us were freezing outside the water and we were surprised there wasn't a hot tub/jacuzzi (I think we all expected it, so there was a huge disappointment). I think this is probably a fantastic vacation destination for families that live in a '4 seasons' location, as long as it's budgeted correctly and expectations are clear.  The breakfast buffet food was great - one of the best we have been to at a hotel. Service was great, all around.

I took my daughter and nieces family here for their birthdays and they both had a blast!! They enjoyed the pool, scoops spa, and all of the other attractions as well. The food was great!! We ate at the loose moose for buffet breakfast and buffet dinner. We had pizza for lunch honest to the scoops spa. The kids have already asked me, when r we coming back.

We have stayed at this resort 3 times now! Every time we are very satisfied with the attractions and cleanliness and will continue to come back! There are multiple dining options to choose from and compared to other resorts in the Orange County area the pricing is on the low end! The check in process can be a little longer and could be more streamlined but there are things for the kids to do in the lobby while you wait in line. The staff is very friendly and informative. Our room(s) have always been cleaned and usually ready when we arrive. I highly recommend the mobile check in process. That way you will get text messages from the resort saying when your room is available. We live about 45 minutes away and our room was ready around 12pm!!! Its nice that you are able to go to

we had a howling good time.  rooms are fun.  i would bring your own pilow, theres were not very comfy.  Food was Yummy activites are super fun.  Kids got rash from too much clorine.  hope to return soon.  thank you

Great and easy fun! Food was really good with many options. Clean rooms, waters and public areas. I was pleasantly pleased that I didn’t have to leave to find dinner. We ate at the grill and my steak was delicious and competitively priced. Bars for parents too!

This place was amazing! My kids and I had a great time. We celebrated my daughter’s 7th birthday. We had no issues the entire experience went smooth and we will definetely return! I recommend this place!

Waters way to cold for having no hot tub. Broken vending machines at night on every floor. You had to pay deposits for crappy pool towels. Definitely not worth the high price to stay there. Won’t be back

I asked my 6 year old son after our trip to Great Wolf Lodge were he would want to go for his 7th Birthday.  Disneyland, LEGOLAND or GWL...he chose Great Wolf Lodge! I want to go for my birthday. enough said!
