Summary Heading: The lodge is nice and clean. I think the lodge has so many people that come there often that they know where they're goi
Summary: I think there are so many guests are that come and go that the staff doesn't understand that when new people come that don't know where everything is they have to get a map. There has to be a way to communicate where the events are taking place in at what time we were lost the whole time we were there we were upset that the pool didn't open till 10 a.m. when we did not know that we didn't know anyting it was confusing and it ended up being more expensive than we planned

My sons birthday was a hit and one to never forget! Hes already bugging to go back. Water slides were awesome and food was delicious from buckets. Drinks are reasonable. Never a dull moment at the wolf lodge!

We stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge for one night on Christmas eve 2018.  Pro: - convenient check-in process, we completed the pre-checkin process the day before, and I got a text when my room was ready. - you can go to the indoor water park for 2 days on 1 day resort stay.   You can get your wristband at around noon on the day of your checkin, and spend the rest of the day at the park, and the same wristband is still good for the entire second day. - The waterpark is not very big, but there are a lot of things to do, my 11 year old son spend 6 hours the first day, and 5 hours the second day in the water park, and had a lot of fun. - The wait time on the different slides are pretty reasonable. - There are restaurants inside the Great Wolf Lodge, but they are fairly expensive, but

Our family had so much fun its amazing how great this resort is.  The water park, the themed romm-Wolfs Den, the food was excellent.   The service was stellar.  We were lucky to find this place...I have a 14, 11 and 4 year old.  They all had fun and want to go back.

Summary Heading: Fun and new experience for you and your kids!
Summary: GWL is a fun and new experience that even kids in SoCal can really enjoy. The entire resort caters to kids and really gives you and your family the opportunity to hang out and enjoy each other all day.

My family and I spent 3 days in the Great Wolfe Lodge on a "workation" where I met with my agency in the conference center from 8-5 and my family enjoyed the various activities until I got off of work each evening.  This was a great experience as I usually travel alone and lose valuable time away from the family.  Merging the two experiences was the perfect solution.The animal theme made for a fun environment... although my 12-year-old informed me that she was over that part of her life.  There were tons of children running around participating in different activities.  Each evening about 8 pm, the bleary-eyed youngsters would drag their tired bodies back to their hotel rooms and recharge for another day of excitement.  We retired each night to comfortable accommodations and

Summary Heading: Great trip, esp for kids ages 8 to 14
Summary: Yes, it seems pricey, but this water park is phenomenal. We went over the long MLK weekend and the lines for even the best rides were never that long, and it was not overly crowded. The water slides are fantastic -- some of the best I have ever been on. There is a LOT of chlorine in these pools! Beware!  For my kids at least, the REAL fun at Great Wolf is Magic Quest. My kids are 9 and 11 and I bought them wands and got them going, then sat in the lobby and read a book with a glass of wine for a couple of hours while the kids ran all over the hotel on the lengthy, interactive Magic Quest. They had a WONDERFUL time, were intellectually and physically stimulated, and played Magic Quest for at least four or five hours over two days. They became "Master Magi" (there was a special

My wife got the stomachache bug but the hotel provided enough for me and my 3 children to do. Would have been miserable at another hotel. The wolf wall and story time was a hit with my three year old and everyone loved the water park.

Summary Heading: Quality has dropped in recent months
Summary: This had been my 3rd stay in 6 months and I am not sure if I will be back. There is now a checkin/out process for towels in the water park and you have to trade to get a new towel and are warned it will be billed to your room for failure to return so if you have little ones keep track of their towel and don’t dare leave it unattended on a chair!

This was our 3rd trip to Great Wolf Lodge, and we already have trip number 4 scheduled.  We had our 2 and 5 year old boys, and there was plenty to keep both of them busy.  The facility is well maintained and the staff is on the ball.  The water park has a great toddler area and plenty of slides and other areas for a 5 year old.  We usually eat 1 meal at Buckets, since it's so convenient. The food is pretty good and the prices are reasonable for an amusement park.We have only visited mid-week and the lines are short if any at all.

Check out is usually at 11am my one year olds nap time is 10am to 12pm. I text our "concierge" for late check out she  said she could extend till 11:30 then from 11:30 to 2pm is $80. All moms know how important sleep schedules are mess it up 1 time you suffer for a week. I let concierge know I just need till 12pm not 2pm she still wanted to charge $80 for that extra 30 min. Then in the water park if u get a towel you need to return them or you get charged we checked out 12 towels we returned 14 and still got charged for towels in the end. Seems like they want to nickle and dime you anyway they can.

We stayed for 1 night but ended up requesting a late check out.The hotel is beautifully decorated and arranged. There are shows and story time for the kids to attend in the lobby which is amazing. The park, bowling alley, arcade room were all very clean and the staff was professional and polite. The food was delicious and fresh which was totally unexpected. The beds are extremely comfortable, so comfortable i didn't want to get up. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back soon for a longer stay.

Really crowded for January, surprising. Check in was long, even with pre-registration. Loved the texting service (free) with hotel staff person. Also purchases can be charged to room, so you don't have to carry cash. Room was very clean and comfortable. Not enough tubes for lazy liver. Wave pool closed after 10 minutes since someone threw up in the water. Another 10 minutes, and the kiddie pool area closed d/t another kid having an accident. Swim diapers people?? Hello???Not vegan friendly. I would encourage restaurants to provide more options. Chef thought vegan meant gluten free. Nice to visit once, not sure if we'd go back. Overall not a great value for price paid. Even with 30% off promotion.

Summary Heading: Great place for the kids and adults
Summary: Plenty of activities to do indoors with the kids. The restaurants inside the resort are reasonably priced and if you purchase the package for breakfast, lunch and dinner it is even a better deal. The rooms are nice and spacious, friendly staff and the water park is awesome! My 1 year old had so much fun as well as my 13 year old and my husband, grandma and I. Everyone in the family enjoyed it. I highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay-cation spot for young families.
Summary: Yes it costs to stay at a resort I did not like the price but they sent me a coupon after signing up for their newsletter. This place was my kids favorite so far, knotts, disneyland etc theme parks. The breakfast buffet is so worth it do it you have to! The next day after enjoying the water park do all the activities, they give you a list during check in, my kids did yoga, face painting, made shirt buttons at the arts and crafts session. This place literally has everything. We did pack sandwiches, fruit, water, and the kids juice boxes for lunch the room has a fridge and microwave. The price seems a lot but for all that you get, the quality it is worth it.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf is now the happiest place on earth!
Summary: It was our first time at Great Wolf and I definitely recommend Great Wolf. My family especially my kids had so much fun during the stay. The line for the slides are not that bad. Lifeguards are very nice and they will give instructions and everything for the guests safety. We will definitely going back to Great Wolf. Oh did I mention that we’re going back on February 18? We actually just went there on January 17. Thank you so much Great Wolf and crews. Now we know where to go for vacations instead of going to Vegas. 😊

Goin in you know its an indoor water park but don't expect THAT! SUPER FUN! The indoor themes had the kids on a sugar high without candy and the extremely convenient waterproof wristband/roomkey was awesome! The rooms had the fun Wolf Den theme to match the kids imagination although the lighting in some parts of the room seemed to be lacking.Staff was friendly and helpful and seemed to enjoy coming to work. Use of the waterpark even outside of check in/check out time makes the value well worth it. Looking forward to the next vacation with GWL as a top choice for destination.

We do our family annual trip to Wolf Lodge and we love it. Its a perfect way to celebrate our kids birthday in the middle of winter. We enjoy it all from kids to the parents a new little getaway from home

Our room was so gross we tried not to touch anything.  It was almost sticky on every surface.  The water park was covered in hair and bandaids.  It was truly disgusting.  The food at Lodge Wood Fire Grill was similar to Denny's although the customer service was fantastic.  At night all you hear are children running up and down the halls.  You won't sleep at all.  The service at the hotel and restaurant was great.  Go to Disneyland instead.

Kids love the place so much we have one trip in the summer and one in the winter, Hotel staff is courteous perfect vacation for the winter or the summer they are already looking forward to our next summer trip

Wow, this place is so expensive, but other than that there a couple reasons why we will not stay here again: 1.The Crowd size.  Every public area was so packed. The lines for check in were horrendous. I was extremely concerned for the safety of my children in the water park.  I was next to them the whole time, but it is complete chaos and children were not being supervised by parents.  There are definitely not enough life guards on duty. 2. Underage Drinking - I saw adults purchase alcohol and then hand off to minors (around 14yr).  The attendants saw this happen and no one did anything.  I believe this is because their staff is very young and there is limited management. 3. Unexpected Charges on Folio - Watch your final invoice.  The hotel encourages guest to use wristbands to

We spent the night on a Thursday in January, and were happily surprised to find that we could check into our room early (11:30 a.m.; we had arrived early because we came off of a cruise in Long Beach and came straight over). The room was a good size and the beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and professional. It was our first time, and our almost-12-year-old and 8-year-old both had a fabulous time with all the attractions. So did my husband and I. We didn't do any of the other additional-cost attractions, because the water park was plenty for our one-night stay. We had a pizza at the pizza place but ordered it to-go and ate it upstairs, because it was crowded and the arcade next door was very loud.Overall we had a great time!

Great customer service, very clean, great for all ages. The only thing that could be improved is the food. Their pizza was not the best, the crust was a bit dry. Almost $7 for a plain small simple hot dog (without french fries or anything). Other than the food, i would go back.

Summary Heading: Great Place for Family of All Ages
Summary: Even though this place is pricey, it is worth it. The water park is so fun! The slides are legit. There are a lot of activities for the kids. The activities are reasonably priced. I can't wait to go again. The only issue I have is with the bathrooms. They are small which isn't the best when dealing with kids.

Summary Heading: Bugs/spider bit in the hotel room. Bad attitude cashier inside water park
Summary: We purchased the drinks at inside water park with bad attitude cashier and no straws for blended drink which is already pricey. Got bugs/spider bit several spot plus rashes on my neck which I have never experienced this before. Please have company go check the room 459.

We stayed there this past Sunday to Monday to celebrate my daughters’s birthdays.  They totally enjoyed it!  The staff was extremely friendly and attentive! And there were a lot of things for our entire party of eight to do from toddlers to mature adults.  The young ones enjoyed all the different activities as well as the waterpark.  I also liked the fact that there were a lot of lifeguards.  Roxanne who took care of us on our departure day when we booked a cabana was professional and friendly.  Also, my daughter fell and the nice gentleman in the MagiQuest shop called someone over from the waterpark to check-up on her and give her ice packs.  She was okay, but I was impressed by how they handled the situation.  We will definitely come back again!  Thank you Great Wolf Lodge!

Went for my daughter's 8th birthday. Ordered birthday package to be delivered at a certain time however it was not. Had some trouble with the heat in our room which was not resolved. Waterpark was fun for my daughter. Overall experience was just ok.

Great fun place to take the kids.  Lot of water activities.  Arcade games are a little pricey.  Overall cheaper than Disneyland.  I would definitely bring my family here again, the kids had fun.  Hope they add more water activities outside the lodge and would be fun in the summer.

Great family environment. Clean rooms.. vau friendly staff. We only stayed 1 day this time but it was just as fun at the other times we've stayed longer. Kids loved it. We're going back in a couple months for our other daughters b day

I stayed at Great Wolf Lodge for my son's 7th birthday with friends and family and we had an amazing time!  The overall theme of the hotel when you walk in provides a warm and welcoming experience! The staff goes out of their way to ensure your needs are met in a timely matter. The best part is that you gain access to the water park even if your room isn't ready for check-in once you arrive. The staff will call or send you a text you once your room is ready to check-in! My son had an amazing time and I will definitely return!

the Lodge was clean and had lots of fun on the water slides.  I was disappointed with the sink in the bathroom being clogged and the iron had build up which stained my shirt.  My daughter celebrated her birthday at the Lodge she said it was the best birthday ever.  Overall great experience.

This water park and hotel was better than I expected! We came during a rainy day weekend and had a great time. My son and I spent most of our time on the lazy river and the wave pool. There was also a cute water play area with stairs, slides and buckets of falling water. There is more to Great Wolfe Lodge than just the water park. There is a great arcade with a lot of machines that I had not ever seen before, a cute mini bowling alley, mini golf, food court and the Magi Quest game that had my kid running all around the hotel trying to complete the quest. I was just expecting the water park but all the extra activities made our stay event better.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for all ages
Summary: We have now been to GWL twice. The first time our kids were a bit too young/cautious to really enjoy it. Now at 6/8yr we all had a blast. We took advantage of low crowds after Veterans Day and got to enjoy the park to its fullest! Food and drinks aren't cheap but they are delicious. I think the outside bar has the best adult food and beverages in the water park area. The bunk/cabin rooms are so fun for the kids and gave us a bit of separation at night so they would still sleep!  The staff is so nice and love that you can check your bags with the bellhops if your room isn't ready yet so you can enjoy the water park ASAP. Super close to Disneyland for those that want a longer vacation too!

We are a family of 5 our kids are 7, 4, and 2 years old. Everyone had an amazing time in the waterpark and out. The wristbands are your room key, payment method, and waterpark passes.  This place is a great way to focus on your family and forget the rest of the real world! We were not ready to leave.

We always have a wonderful time! The activities are fun... the food at The Lodge is fantastic and affordable ... the pizza is good.... refillable cups are cheap the kids love the bowling and the simulator is really exciting!

I highly recommend including everything you can in your package, the wristbands made it so easy for all of us to get in and out of the room, access our prepaid food package, purchase additional items at stores and in the Howlywood

Very kid friendly. Got accommodations at the pool for a child with autism. The room was clean and nice but the pull out couch sucks, mattress is to thin, you can feel the bars. But other than that everything was great. We got the paw pass for the kids, cheapest one and it still came with a lot. I would recommend to purchase the paw pass for your children. We went out to eat because it was cheaper. We recommend to a least try the place out once. We are planning on going back sometime soon.

Great Wolf Lodge offers fun experiences for the whole family, just like our wonderful stay there. Highly recommend it to everyone who is looking for a family getaway that offers a variety of fun things to do with your family.

Great experience. Very family friendly. Having all ameneties near made it easier. Breakfast buffet was good. My kids had endless water fun and wasn't as exhausting other parks can be. Lines were very short. Look forward panning on going again.

I have 5 children ranging in ages from 3-13. All my children were entertained and had activities that were age appropriate. The hotel and restaurants are clean and the water park was clean as well. The staff was friendly and incredibly helpful. The vibe of the hotel was family friendly and casual. There are many food choices and the meals are reasonably priced. The passes are worth the money and include enough for children to experience all the best parts of the hotel. The pup passes worked best for the younger children ages 3,4 and 7.

Summary Heading: My third time at great Wolf Lodge but he will definitely be my last
Summary: The waterpark is great that the rooms  horrible dirty my toilet bowl almost fell off because it was not connected to the floor  The workers just don’t care about your stay motel with the hotel price hard to bits

Stayed at the resort not knowing what to really expect. It was a great experience for both of my grandchildren, ages 5 and 1 and us adults.  We were amazed at the fun, safe, a little bit noise - water park. I highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge to family and friends. Lodge pricing is right.  Food at the water park was pricey, but restaurants' prices at the lodge are competitive.

Great place for all ages. Great customer service, food, fun! This was our 11th trip since opening, we will come back again and again. The kids always leave upset because they want to stay longer. Next time we will stay 2 nights.

the overall experience was good. the food is PRICEY! The water park gets crowded fast, barely anywhere to sit. The rooms are a good distance from the parking structure. The breakfast buffet was good. my room had problems with the cleanest of it. not enough towels, hair on shower wall, underneath the bunk beds not clean, sheet had a hole in it. the kids still had a good time. never got offered the free ears upon check in either.

4th time going! We'll be back. My kids 7 and 11, us parents love this place. Staff and resort have been great to us! Worth the money. Book in advance. Join their email, get discounts. Cheaper then Disneyland.

We got invited to great wolf for a bday for family. It is extremely expensive so we booked 1 night to at least be able to enjoy the weekend celebrations. I received an email from them a day before we went offering 40% off and upgrade to our room. It looked cool the price was reasonable so we did agreed. Get to great wolf it’s cool, very geared towards kids in every way. We get to our room it’s very cool with the themed kids bunk beds. We go to put our stuff in the fridge and it’s filled with the previous persons leftovers. I call down and request that they remove all the food so our trash doesn’t stink with all the old food sitting in the room. 2 hours later we came back to put our food and drinks in fridge and still full. I threw away myself and filled my fridge. Later the day

The air is extremely toxic in the water park. That is my greatest grief with the place. They need to better circulate and purify the chemical air. The park opens late at 10am and closes early at 8pm. The hours should be swapped at 8-10pm.Because they close so early, we can’t do both Disneyland/universal studios and water park, as it is closed by the time we return to the hotel.

We have a 9, 10 and 11 year old. We checked in early at 1pm and was allowed to get into a room and start in the water park early which was great. We stayed until closing only to take a quick break to eat. Then we played all day the following day and stayed for a second night. We were able to check out at 11 and put our belongings in the car to enjoy more of the water park. The rides were very fast if you hit the right times. Not worth waiting if the lines are long, just try something else. We went January 9th-11th so it is the beginning of off season which is why lines were short. I don't know how long lines are during season. Food was great and service was amazing. TIP: Use the bathrooms behind wave pool. It is so much cleaner than the one by the entrance.

Great place. Love indoor water park, so many activities to do with the kids. Probably go back when not on peak season. Little hectic, but still great customer service. Would definitely go back with my family though.

We took our son to Great Wolf Lodge for his 11th birthday. I was worried that it would be too "kiddie" for him but he had a blast! The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly the rides in the waterpark were perfect for the kids. we had a blast.

Summary Heading: Great family fun for all ages!
Summary: Great family fun and something for all ages! Everything you need under one roof and a great location if you need to explore outside of the resort. Peak season can be pretty pricey but you can find discounts and deals if you signup for emails.

Great wolf lodge is a great place to spend a few days for family and friends. The waterpark was a blast. My kids didnt want to leave. Although its a little pricey, the money spent was well worth the excitement and fun my family had. The rooms were comfortable and the amenities were pretty great.

Had an amazing time with my three girls ages 14, 13 and 10. We never got bored, there was always something to do. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the water park was fantastic and the rooms were clean, comfortable and fun!!! We will definitely be visiting again and again!!!

Summary Heading: Use the check out as your main water park day
Summary: Check in at 4pm and water park closing at 8pm is pretty weak. I feel like they want to get you out of he main attraction (water park) that requires more staff as soon as possible and get you into the eating and arcade which just sucks money out of your wallet. I would recommend using the checkout day as your main water park day since you can stay from 10am to 8pm, and then get a hotel somewhere else that night.

We stayed in the Great Bear Suite. We showed up about 2pm so we were able to enjoy the water park till our room was ready at 3:45pm. Then we took our stuff to the room and went back to the water park! After it closed at 8pm my kids and I enjoyed a fun game of Magiquest where you travel all over the resort looking for items scattered on different floors. It is time consuming, but it kept us busy! The game turns off at 10pm but by then we were so tired! We picked up where we left off at 8:30 the next morning and finished just in time to go back to the water park! I opted for the late check out, put our stuff in the car and after we had checked out of our room we still stayed at the water park for a good 2 - 3 hours before heading home!

We stayed one night Dec26-27 2018. We got the cheapest room, however we took late checkout and dining package for $140. Overall, we spent almost $900 for one night stay in the cheapest room. Very overpriced. Our room smelled. The water park has so much chlorine in the air, that my eyes were hurt. My daughter scratched her knee in the lazy river, then she started running fever at night, but the convenience store at the lobby was already closed. So, we did not have good experience, unfortunately. Do not buy this dining package, it is not worth it at all

Made an emproptu trip over winter break with the family. Everybody loved the hotel/resort experience. Hotel was clean and staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The check in and check out process was effortless. We will be returning for sure!!!

Summary Heading: Very clean, family oriented, not much waiting time for the rides. Friendly staff.
Summary: Very clean, family oriented, not much waiting time for the rides. Friendly staff. Great price for water park and a suite. Many choices of places to eat. The beds are comfortable. My would definitely go again!

This was grandma and grandpa’s Christmas gift to their  children and grandchildren. We all had an amazing time. We all went together as a family and our rooms were very close to each other.   It warmed our hearts to see our family having such a great time.  The grandchildren are from 2 to 6. They all had great things to do.  What a great weekend we had.   We will go back again

We spent two nights at Great Wolf Lodge with our grandsons and their parents.  The boys were 4 and 6 years old.  We stayed in a Wolf Den Suite and the boys loved their wolf den with bunk beds and their own TV.  There were plenty of water park activities to keep them busy, though it was sometimes difficult to find places to sit.  Evenings were least crowded times, we discovered.  Temperatures in the water park area were very comfortable.  When the the boys had had enough splashing, sliding, and wave jumping, there were plenty of other activities also.  The buffet dining was fine, but the steakhouse food was delicious.  There were plenty of kid-friendly options on every menu.  The bowling alley was fun for the whole family, even the littlest one.  The mini-golf course really was

We celebrated my daughter’s 8th birthday and she had a great time experiencing water activities in the middle of the winter. We all enjoyed ourself and can’t wait to return. The rooms could be cleaner.

Summary Heading: Over all pretty great place for kids!
Summary: Pro: friendly stuff great service, nice and clean hotel many things to do and good buffet!! Cons: dirty showers, no hot water, shower head is bad, pretty chilli at the indoor park and not many attractions. 2 days are more then enough!!

Everything about GWL is exceptionally GREAT! the name says it all. My children are 14 and 12 and they had a great time. down to my grandchildren 6 and 1! even my husband had a great time at 49! Fun for all ages.

Overpriced for what  they really offer, Simply too much. Still need to learn a lot about customer service.  The stores have limited sizes and don’t have everything in stock. The food was good and is the only thing with a right price.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge day of fun
Summary: Waterpark area is full of fun. Lines are a bit confusing at first of what tubes/matt you need and start of lines. Meal pkg is not inclusive but credits applied to meal with exception to brkfst voucher

The water park was great for all ages but the kid's cabin suite left me needing earplugs all night. Between the bathroom door squeaking and the bunk bed squeaking, I was miserable.If you want to take advantage of more than the water park, you'll need more than 1 day. There is just so much to do other than the water. We celebrated with a birthday package and my little guy enjoyed the extras.

I cannot begin to express how much we loved our stay,last weekend.  The little touches are endless, the decor, and Loved the Christmas decorations, these were the nicest we saw at any park.  We had set up mobile checkin and it worked flawlessly,  One tip I had not seen on Tripadvisor is when you arrive the parking structure will give you a entry ticket, not to worry, we had prepaid our parking so just used our wristband to exit, were not charged again separately.  The wristbands are great, no room key to keep track of, no credit card to keep handy- our bill was there in my email when I got home and absolutely accurate.  We just texted 'out' when we left our room, didn't even have to stop at the desk.. Another great feature- there are free luggage carts Everywhere, you can get

Rooms were not clean, blankets and towels scratchy and hard, no luggage racks in rooms, refrigerator did not work, housekeeping did not refill coffee daily and did not leave extra toilet tissue in bathroom

It was great fun with lots of activities for the kids. I’m giving it a 3 because the bathrooms in the waterpark were disgusting. Not clean, toilets were not flushed! Floors were dirty with toilet paper everywhere. Also, the buffet breakfast at Loose Moose is not worth the price. The hot food items are not hot. Example, the “cream” gravy was cold and watery....so gross, eggs were cold, eggs Benedict was cold, coffee was horrible! I could go on and on. Also we had dinner at the Lodge Wood Fire Grill and it was not good either! You guys really need to step up your food game. As for activities, they are great but when doing magic quest with our registered wands-half of the magic boxes were broken and would not open. Several people were commenting on how disappointed they were that

Summary Heading: A little pricey, but totally worth it
Summary: We stayed from 31-Dec-19 to 04-Jan-19. I was worried it would be cold, but they keep it nice and warm! The rooms are clean and well furnished. The water park itself is amazing! Our 3 boys (11, 8, and 2) had a blast…there’s something for kids of all ages. We also enjoyed the arcade, miniature glow golf, bowling, and the treasure hunt/quest. We didn’t get around to doing the theater. The staff was amazing everywhere we went. Our little one threw up and 2 of them rushed to help without any trouble. The food was ok, not great, but not bad. It would be nice if they offered room service other than the pizza (the pizza wasn’t that good). We’re definitely looking forward to booking another trip!

I had'nt heard of this waterpark or hotel and I did not no what to expect.  It passed my expectations.  I have to say that I will definately go back with more of my family and I have told everyone about the Great Wolf Lodge and the waterpark.  Everything was so clean.  Check in was so fast.  We received wristbands that let us into our rooms, parking, food, towels and whatever else we needed.  The waterpark was wonderful.  It had everything and more that the outdoor parks have.  Don't miss it.

We had a lot of fun. We only stayed a night but you definitely need at least 2 nights. I had a 4, 15, and 18 year old with us and the teenage girls want to go back. I was afraid only the 4 yr old would like it but we got teenager approval. We want to go back!

Summary Heading: Kids loved it, parents were underwhelmed
Summary: Kids loved the waterpark - no surprise there! As parents, we were a little underwhelmed. You are trapped into breakfast with characters/loud music, whether you want it or not (at least, if you opt to have a buffer breakfast or a sit-down breakfast). Also, there are little to no activities in the early mornings. Activities and theme sections open up at 9am...and of course that's a bit ridiculous if you have little ones who wake up early. Saw many moms (and a couple of dads) doing the same laps with their small ones that we did in the morning. The resort goes a long way to be family-friendly but misses the mark by not understanding what families (whole families) need. As parents a decent-nights sleep (where you aren't woken up multiple times in the middle of the night with people

Had a great time at GWL.  It was our first time and will NOT be our last!  I have kids of three different ages and they had a great time.  I was glad to see that there are other activities the kids could take part in!  Food was good, however, the beds weren't so comfortable.

Everything was great and clean.  But I the wifi connection was terrible.  I felt like a 56k modem would have been better to connect to the internet. The staff said that they would reset the modem but nothing changed

Everything at the Great Wolf Lodge was excellent! The water park was so much fun! The hotel has everything that you would need that you didn't have to go anywhere else! The best thing is that we stayed 1 night but we got to go to the water park the day of arrival and the day of departure. They had showers which was great since we had checked out that 2nd day.

Summary Heading: Over 50 and can't wait to go back
Summary: I went with my grandson and met friends there.  We had an amazing time.  The waterpark was so much fun.  We stayed for 2 days and didn't want to leave.  The hotel room was clean, big and comfortable.  The food was yummy.  We ate at Buckets and Woodfire Grill...yum yum!  Cant wait to go back.

Summary Heading: Great fun for the whole family.
Summary: Excellent place for all families that want to have a good time. Wonderful experience, great staff, and my family had fun. I would certainly come back and definitely recommend this place to all families and friends.

Summary Heading: Great fun for children hotel and water park
Summary: I took four boys age 12 to Great Wolf Lodge and they had a fantastic time. The water park is indoors and filled with thrills and adventure. There is something for everyone. Hotel room was clean and comfy. Food was expensive ($25 for adults and $12.50 for children) at the Loose Goose buffet, but we all had plenty to eat and it was good. Most of all, the boys had a wild time and the adults sat around the pools, waiting for hours, in a huge space where you could not hear yourself think, yet drinking a truly delicious cocktail.

Summary Heading: Great experience for the while family.
Summary: We have 4 kids from 1 year old to a 11 year old.  We all had a great time.  We were there in January and inside the waterpark it felt like it was summer, it was awesome.  We had to cut our vacation short because my husband got sick but we will definitely return.

Summary Heading: A great place for the whole family!
Summary: This is a great place to bring your little ones and big ones alike. I love that you don't even have to leave your  hotel to have your day of fun, its an all in one place! Like all family vacays its a little pricey but if you sign up for their emailing list and wait for discounts then its much more affordable and on top of that you can select to apply for the payment plan so you can stress even less about the cost.

Summary Heading: Excellent experience for kids and adults alike
Summary: Had an awesome time here. I recommend you bring your kids fun time.... As there's some adult attractions too. Rooms we're really clean and spacious. Resort was clean and staff really helpful. Indoor water park is same temperature year round

We took our children and grandchildren to GWL as part of their Christmas present.   The whole family loved the spot as there was lots to do for all ages.  There were water slides here that they never experienced before.   They will have these treasured memories for a lifetime.   In addition, the staff at GWL were exceptional. Thank you

Summary Heading: Christmas break fun at Great Wolf Lodge!!!
Summary: Our family decided to take a trip to GWL over the Christmas Break and boy was it a GREAT DECISION!! The short wait times made for an amazing, fun 3 days!! Totally recommend if you like water slides! Will go again!!

Great Wolf lodge provides, comfort, convenience, cleanliness, and safety.  The enclosed water park is clean, safe, with lots of lifeguards and staff to watch and help kids.  Lots of grandparents come and it is so fun to watch the kids have fun.  The only place I know where you are comfy walking around in pajamas, swimsuits or clothes.

The staff was extremely helpful and always willing to go that extra mile. The restaurants were accommodating since I have had stomach surgery and had special dietary requirements. Check in was a breeze with the online app.

Resort has everything a kids want; waterpark, games, food, candy and fun! I think staff needs more training to keep the waterpark cleaner and look more professional.  Also, inspect your room when you arrive to make sure it is clean!!

Despite my room key signal kept failing to allow me into my own room our Family had an amazing time at Great Wolfs Lodge.  The food and beverages were pricey but surprisingly good tasting and and had a good amount of nutritional options which I found kept my energy level up.  Hope this continues throughout many more years to come.

Kids love this resort with all the attractions centered squarely on the kids experience.  I love the multiple full bars.  Drinks are amazing and usually one lasts me the day.  Rooms are clean.  Decor is on the dark side but there is everything a family needs.  I appreciate all the great water activities and the attention to safety.  You can feel secure when your child exercises their independence.

Towels were not replaced in room after cleaning, waited in line 45 minutes for waterslide. Waited 30 minutes for pizza because ticket number and buzzer did not match. MagiQuest items broken and not working.

Our kids 8 and 10 enjoyed every minute of our five-day stay.  They spent hours at the waterpark every day, and even more time than that playing MagiQuest.  We parents got a little tired of pool food, so we dragged them out for dinner and Medieval Times. Otherwise they never wanted to leave.

I booked a kids suite with 2 queen beds and cabin bunks for 2 adults and 5 children, when we got there we waited an hour in check in line, when we got to our room we found 1 double bed and a pull out couch with bunks, we didnt have enough beds for everyone, so I called down and they made it sound like I was wrong and very rude, I requested a rollaway and they sent up a small blow up mattress, no sheets, no blankets, no pillows, I agreed to sleep on the pull out but ended up sleeping on the floor because the mattress was so overused and old I could ferl everyrod in the bed, extremely painfull.The next day the mngment comped us an additional room and I was gratefull until we came back to oyr room after a long day, with 4 children and a toddler we had linen and towels and dirty

This place is way better than the theme parks. Less hassle, less waiting in line, more fun. All the staff are happy and helpful. This is our 2nd great wolf lodge experience (Dallas and Anaheim). We love this place!

constantly broke down devices made the experience a disappointment.  for the cost of the overall experience I'd hope it worked better. the water slide attractions were very clean and organized.  beds were ok, but sheets were cheap and hot.

Our family of 4 lives in Huntington Beach, CA, only 15 miles away from this hotel.  So we are really only drawn for the water park.   The price of the room being $250 per night ends up being over $350 after taxes and fees applied.   I find this to be a bit on the pricey side.   The theme of the hotel and experience is still very good quality though.   So I can only knock the rating based on a socal local wanting to come to the water park without the hotel stay.

The place is awesome and we have been here so many times (3 consecutive new years eve and many mid year visits) but the fun and customer service stayed great! I wanted to commend Brandy of Front Desk, she is so helpful and always attentive to details and she does not just look at what the guests needs but what the guest would love to have being in Greatwolf Lodge. Just a phenomenal staff member. Great company asset! -Andre Padua

I was referred by a friend to spend short vacation at Great Wolf Lodge.  My kids were very excited and looked forward to spending nights at G.W.L. Unfortunately, our staying didn't turn out as we are expected.  We actually had trouble with the heater, shower in the room and beds.  Our room number was 609. Honestly, this is my only vacation that I still remember the room number after the trip was over.1. Heater issue: there's problem with the heater fan.  It keeps running whole night non-stop.  We called front desk and they sent a technician but it didn't really fix the issue.2. Shower: the shower made noise. It's annoying but suggest to fix it.3. Beds:  This is a major issue. I, my wife and 2 kids(5 and 9 years old).  We felt itchy every time we lay down the bed.  We got worse

Summary Heading: Awesome, kid-centered fun for all ages
Summary: Our family of 5 had the best time! We are 2 adults, and 3 children ages 2, 10 and 12. Plus mom was 8 months pregnant at the time. And, the point is, the Great Wolf Lodge provided entertainment and fun for ALL of us. The place is not simply kid-friendly, it's kid-centered, which means the parents could relax seeing everyone is happy and taken care of. The staff were accommodating and the room was large enough for all of us to fit comfortably. We had a blast!

Summary Heading: Unprepared Staff had 2 horrible experience one in pool area and another in the pool restaurant
Summary: We contacted 2 Different supervisors and none of them gotta back to us trying to solve our problem overral too many youngsters with no customers service skill and there is no difference between staff and supervisors they all backup each other, either one said yes please go do the review

I really enjoyed this experience.  This was the first time for my family.  The entire hotel and facilities were clean and the workers were very kind.  The water park had a lot to do and my kids really enjoyed it.  Thank you for the work you do!

We loved the whole place accept the room we got was supposed to sleep 6 with two full beds and a sleeper sofa. The sleeper sofa was awful. My poor niece was stuck sleeping on the absolute worst pull out mattress I have ever felt. For the money they could invest in even a tin memory foam mattress that would be much more comfortable.

Summary Heading: A great place for the kids
Summary: Great Wolf is a great place to bring your kids to have an epic adventure. My kids were excited and active morning to sunset. The waterpark is great, but the adventures such as magiquest and the character adventure make this a really special place. The food and drinks can be a bit pricey, but they allow outside food and there is plenty of inexpensive options near the park if you plan well. The staff is great and the rooms are too.

staff are more interested in themselves and thier personal lives  than having good representation of GWL. bathrooms were consistently messy. food was WAYMORE expensive than Disney.the staff arent sorry or worried about your issues or bad experience

the hotel and environment of the place is pretty cool for kids. employees are friendly and very nice. however, there were MANY people who felt the water park area was cold, and my 4 year old woke up the next morning with a runny nose after being in the water for only two hours. the water is much colder than expected and after about an hour there you start getting cold. people were shivering. we wanted to check out the next day, because if we weren't going to go to the water park then what was the point of staying there. we told the manager, and were told the temp in there is 85 degrees all the time. but it definitely didn't feel that way. there were kids shivering and other parents felt the same way we did.

For the overall cost of our trip, I would say it was well worth it. We could have went to Disneyland and spent the same amount but it would have been crowed and we would not have had as much fun.The whole weekend we never felt like the place was crowed.

Summary Heading: Over priced resort that should be all inclusive
Summary: I had heard good things about this hotel and i was very disappointed that they have you wear this high tech bracelet that they can charge but don’t have the ability to charge all of the fun things you’ve already paid for instead you have to wear this ridiculous paper pass that won’t even survive water... defeats the purpose of paying for the paw pass. $99 x 6 down the drain.

Everything was very clean and nice many activitys for kids perfect getaway with kids! Water park was amazing and lots of fun very clean. Theme room was well worth it for the lil ones really made them feel special

Overall good activities for the kids.  They had fun with the water park . While the pool was heated the walkway between water park and the hotel rooms were freezing cold.  But the time in the water park was enjoyable.    Very efficient check in and check out process.  Very convenient that everything works from the water proof wrist bands, including room access, parking and charges.

It's a casino for kids, minus the gambling.   Funny though, alcohol is sold throughout the casino for adults.   Prices are high but they did offer a discount upon check in.   We had trouble with our wristbands and charging to our room that was inconvenient.   At the end,  our kids asked to come back for christmas next year.

Summary Heading: Best place for an indoor water park
Summary: This is our fourth time coming back and we don’t have any complaints accept the kids absolutely loved it!Room prices are different depend on how many people entering the water park. My family have 7 people. Two adults and 5 kids (14, 12, 9 and 4 years old twin boys). If we entered 7 people, they would direct us to a Grand Bear which is quite expensive. If we put 6, we can book double queen bed plus sofa bed with more reasonable price. However, we will be short 1 wristband for the water park. We asked for a complimentary wristband since the twins are only 4 but we ended up paying for extra wristband. We didn’t like that!!!Also, if you booked on a third party website, and you booked a room for 6 people, their price might be cheaper but pay attentiion... their price might not

I recently visited the aqua park and stayed at the hotel. Impressed on how clean the place was (it was packed), the staff was extremely kind and the park is really fun! My kids, my wife and me, had a blast! The only "but" would be the hotel's price and the food (dinner in particular), couldn't find a great selection. The breakfast and them park kiosk, had great food.We were very satisfied and surprised of how much fun is the place. If the prices would be lower, definitely this place would be a 5 stars!

Summary Heading: Fantastic Resort If Given A Few Tips
Summary: I booked between Christmas and New Years. Prices were high but that was to be expected. I got the Wolf Lodge Suite that can fit up to 8 and I had 7 people with me.Check-in process was good. I was able to check-in online and skipped the long line. I also got there early (1:00pm) so we can use the pool.We also ate at the buffet for the Character Breakfast and dinners.We had 2 Paw Passes that was given to the kids.We exclusively stayed in the resort.With that out of the way, here's the great and what can improve.The Greats: Very family themed. Lots of things for kids up to tweens to do from arcade, magiquest, bowling, glow mini-golf, water park, etc. The staff was super friendly and the life guards changed often to prevent burnout. The food was good and having a Dunkin Donuts with

That said it. Staff and rooms nice, but this experience is not how I want to bring up my children. WAY too big, and EVERYTHING is extra. How does one say no to a small child who is mesmerized by lights and come-ons. There is nothing natural about this place. Even the air is phony.

This is an awesome family resort! Tons to do onsite! We never had to leave (nor did we want to)! Staff was great, food was awesome and the water park was AMAZING! We only wish the water was a little bit warmer. Overall, great experience and we will definitely be back!

This is the best experiences for families with age ranges. There is something for everyone, including the adults! We cannot wait to go back. It was crowded but the size of the park absorbs it well. We never felt like it was too crowded nor did we have to wait long for any of the attractions. Cannot wait to go back!

My family will definitely be coming back every year I hope. My family had so much fun best vacation we've taken so far! Love how they sectioned off a toddler water park area and so many different options to have fun.

This is our second time visiting it has been amazing both times. Kids love it! So many fun activities. Water park is perfect!! Water is extremely warm which makes it even more comfortable to swim in. Slides for little kids are perfect as well as for big kids.

I received a 40% off email from the resort and decided to give it a try on Christmas Day. It was much bigger than I had expected. The kids were head over heels about the water park. The room we stayed in was a family suite nothing over the top extravagant but plenty of room for four of us to stretch out. We didn’t anticipate The arcade, candy store , gift shops and spa, so you do need a bit of extra spending money to enjoy those little extras. The best was being able to enjoy the water park even after check out

The whole environment was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There were lots of lifeguards on duty. We were extremely pleased with our experience and we will be back! Thanks for the experience!

Lots of fun for the kids. Short lines. Lots of lifeguards. Temperatures controlled. Best for kids 5-12. Staff is really helpful. Near Disney. Restaurants inside and down the street. Free in and out parking with your stay.

The trip was a get together with my brother's family (two small kids) and my family (4 y/o).  check in was easy (did pre check in and was given a room at 1pm).Food costs were reasonable (slight upcharge, but worth the price of convenience)  I'd  say roughly 20% upcharge.  With that being said there are a lot of eating places within walking distance and plenty of restaurants within a 2 mi driving area.Room 250 (did the std) was good enough for us, no real view. Water park definitely had a lot for all ages.  The one wish i had was they have an spa area for little kids to heat up.  As an adult I probably could've gone the whole day, but with a 4 y/o because they are small, after 1.5 hours,  they started shivering.  i ended up just running into the showers to heat them up.Overall,

Nice hotel, great parking  they lock the doors to the lobby at 9 pm so when you arrive after 9 to check in, you have have to bang on the glass and hope someone hears you to let you in just to check in. Poor dining options, poor food selection. Water park could easily be a lot better by simply adding a few more inner tubes so you didn't have to wait in line for 30 or 40 minutes. The other simple thing is to remind staff to be more efficient, their complacency and I don't care attitude will be the downfall of this place. Room was nice. Good location close to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Young girls upset trip cut short
Summary: We went for granddaughters 6th birthday with 6 girls....planned on swim and dinner first night, 2nd miniature golf, bowling and swim...3rd day spa treatment...only was able to swim since not able to accommodate our day 2 with a room....girls very disappointed, after waiting 4-6 months having it been planned....would have even settled for a regular room not themed, not even a sorry for the inconvenience

Hi This location doesn’t really care if you have a bad experience compared to other locations.  Too many things went wrong and I was overcharged and was given the run around and spent hours trying to resolve.  At the end I paid more than I should because I couldn’t bother to call again to resolve.

I went to the great wolf with my family and I did the mobile check in the room was available 3 hours before the initial check in the staff was good and the rooms were nice and clean also the water park wasn’t as busy as it usually gets so we were able to enjoy that part of the experience

Summary Heading: Bad for the price is terrible to much for  what are you get
Summary: Horrrible experiencia  The price is very high for what you get also you have to wait in line for each slide a long long time the parks was petty dirty a lot of food in the floor I’m really disappointed 🤮🤢

I Loved the staff smiles and the easiness of checking in and out. The kids had a blast all over the Hotel. The adult bars on both floors, and dinner at the restaurant was great. The water park was great. Definitely coming back with the kiddos🤗

Great kid-centered getaway! Lots of activities.  Staff were helpful and pleasant. Food was just ok, not great.  I'm a breakfast person and I was disappointed in the buffet.  (Food running out, temp was not piping hot, taste was meh on many items.) But we are looking forward to our next stay!!

Before this year I had never heard of Grsat Wolf Lodge.  My best friend told me about it and we had an amazing experience at the park in Anaheim.  It was clean not overpriced and the cistomer service and food and beverage services were top notch

We had an excellent family birthday celebration for my 10-year-old son! The seven children in our party had a fantastic time, and the adults were able to enjoy themselves, too. There was never a dull moment and there was plenty to do. A little on the pricey side, but a fun experience for all.

Summary Heading: Rat in suit 509. An unfortunate experience
Summary: First we have stayed here at wolf lodge many many times spend thousands of dollar, but it's all worth every penny for my children. But we just had the unfortunate experience of a rat being in our suit. An awful situation. Still waiting for response from the hotel.

We loved our stay at Great Wolf Lodge! Mobil checkin made the process super easy! Water park was awesome! I would certainly recommend purchase the Wolf pack! We made lots of great memories by using it!

Our kids begged to visit the resort for two years but with the birth of a baby we had to put plans on hold until the baby turned 2,  We surprised them and he spent our Christmas here, they absolutely loved everything about the resort and had a blast we can't wait to go back. We live over 6 hours away so we will probably return again toward the end of the year one of the youngest is a little older. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They were amazing!! They were constantly cleaning and offering assistance,  and I unfortunately witnessed a few occasions some Resort guests being rude but each time the staff handled it so incredibly well, they have an absolutely amazing team working. We had a perfect Christmas at the Great Wolf Lodge and would definitely do it again!

The looks on their faces was priceless! They ran around the house screaming with joy. My husband and I are so happy we made this their Chistmas gift. We took them on Christmas afternoon and they couldn’t wait to get there. They spent countless hours in the water park. In the evening they went bowling, miniature golf and the arcade. Back in the water park the next mourning❗️

If you want a great family vacation experience. Check this place out! It is more then just a water park. So many activities for all ages. My children loved it. We have been 2xs now and can’t wait to go back!

Great Wolf Lodge is AWESOME!!!  You will be so happy that you came here.  My whole family had a great time and my 4 kids range in age from 19-8.  There was something for everyone to do, the staff was so helpful and nice, the rooms were clean and comfy.  I loved that we had a mini fridge and microwave for snacks in our room.  The character breakfast in the morning was worth every penny and they make sure that the characters come to every table to say hi and take pictures!

Summary Heading: First experience was ok-  except the Candy Store
Summary: Hotel and pool were decent. They were clean IMO. The lady at candy store was rude and to became cold and short when we change our mind with buying 2 candy cups instead of her recommended 4 cups for $40. Made our first experience very bleh.  Dont think we'll be back.

The first time with big rooms for 7 peoplle is great (2 kids, and 5 adults) but for one family’s room is not. I like if the room are a little bit bigger. I was not that satisfy it was the general family room.

Our overall experience was great. We went the Saturday-Sunday before Christmas and the crowd level wasn't too bad. I just knocked off one star because the vending machines were not working with the RFID wristband for payment, and the wristband was a little uncomfortable. It's cold in the hotel but not in the waterpark, so when you're done swimming or playing in the waterpark, try to wipe off as much water before going back into the hotel.Food in the Lodge Wood Fired Grill Restaurant was good. My husband and I were expecting it to just be okay but expensive (typical theme park food). But we were surprised that we actually liked the Backyard BBQ Platter and the New York Strip Steak. In terms of customer service levels, it was inconsistent. Most staff were great and friendly, but

Came with family for Christmas - had a great time.  All the lobby activities, the water park, and the lower level attractions made sure there was never a dull moment!The rooms were spacious but the bathroom door squeaked every time you opened it and the beds were not the softest.  I did not sleep well but the kids enjoyed every minute of it.  I can't wait to come back!

Almost $400 a night, and we never got housekeeping until the third day I had to call and ask why, clogged sink had to send a repair man, loud water pipes and i mean LOUD like scary there is a problem loud, beds are ok had a little back pain in the morning.

If you want to escape to heat from SoCal during the summer time, this is the place. A huge indoor water park that kids would love. Efficient, fast and accommodating check in. Spacious rooms. Great indoor water park. Arcade, spa for kids, you name it , is there. Great places to eat for every taste.  While you stay there, you do not need to go out. Will go there again in the summer.

Such a great place for kids to spend holiday. Water park is nice and lots other activities for them. My daughter loves the magi game. Kids running around and such happy atmosphere. Food is ok. Arcade opens 24 hours. Not far from Disneyland.The one thing you need to bear in mind is that you make sure to bring your own amenities. They wont provide bath gel, conditioner, cotton bud, toothbrush, slipper, nor bathrobes (which is quite different from hotel in Asia). Dont have bottle water in room.

The only thing I know more destructive than termites to buildings are kids.  The Great Wolf Lodge was amazingly in perfect condition. So much decorations and detail to create such a fun environment.  As the kids ran though by the hundreds every single day, the place looked brand new and incredibly clean.  The water park was so much fun my kids didn't want to leave after 3 days.  They were in kid heaven.  The environment felt safe enough to let them play and have fun while I rested on the lounge chairs.  A great assortment of stores and attractions made it unnecessary to leave the facility.  We can't wait to go back.  Great job to the staff - this type of quality service doesn't just happen - somewhere, someone was putting in a lot of work.

So much fun for kids! My 10 year old daughter chose to stay here for her birthday. Loved our room with a kids cabin and the birthday upgrade. We got the Paw Pass and my daughter had the best time! Highly recommend for kids!

This is a must with the family. Everyone will have fun with so much to do. I felt like a kid again playing and riding the slides with my kids. They have an arcade which is great. Food was good and chefs are accommodating if you have food allergies etc.

Summary Heading: Fun time for our 3yr olds birthday!!
Summary: It was our first stay at GWL and we had a fabulous time! There was so much for our daughter to do inside the resort so the waterpark was just a bonus! We will be returning again and again. We paid a few extra dollars for a birthday package and it was totally worth ir! I do recommend the paw pass 100% it pays for itself!!

Great Experience at Great Wolf Lodge!  The kids loved the Wolf Den room.  The water park was fun.  Only complaint was it closed at 8:30 pm and it is expensive.  Other than that we had a wonderful time and we would go back with friends!

The resort, food, activities, amenities  and water park were amazing. It was very clean. The staff provided great customer service. However, mattress/bedding need improvement. It  was not comfortable and we did not have a good night of sleep.

The 2nd stay was better than the first. The bracelets you can use as payment, access to room and garage is a great idea. The water park has minimal lines and is fun for all ages (our kids are 12 and 14).

Fun trip, water park very clean. Resort fee is bogus. Not happy that I was supposed to have water in room and there was none. Her was comfy. We will be back. Very reasonable food prices. Character tour was out of order, that was sad.

Had a great time.the park was clean and the roo. Was awesome. I lived the chrisChri snow theme of the room the characters came in and brought Cookie and milk for the kids .loved that part. The parking was great. I would definitely do valet parking it's worth the 7.00 you already pay 20.00 to self park add the7.00 for the valet service. The food at the water park was bland. The nachos we're not great.

This is a great place for kids and families.  I highly recommend it.  We got a great price through Groupon which made it a very cost effective trip.  The ware park, free kids activities, and theme of the resort are great!  If you are on a budget keep in mind that there are A LOT of add on items and activities that can be very pricey.  The kids were bombarded with constant ads for things they wanted to do, and saying no to them was the only downside of of trip.  We also did not eat in the resort because again, it was very pricey.  But each room comes with a fridge and microwave and there are many cheap places to eat nearby, so we planned ahead and had no problems with that.  Overall it was a great experience and we will definitely be back!

Best family resort our family has ever been to. Great activities for the kids and the prices throughout the resort from shops to restaurants are not unreasonable at all. Definitely a great place to spend time with family.

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Our resort stay was wonderful.  My boys did not want to leave.  The staff was wonderful, friendly, and accommodating.  We all had a enjoyable time.  The resort was clean and had so many activities that the kids did not get a chance to do them all.

We loved these place from the welcoming to the time we left everyone was very helpful definetly coming back it's a family favorite. The water park rides were super cool and the wait time was amazing. Christmas theme was very beautiful

They show you a price per night. But then they add on a resort fee of $30 a night and then parking is $20 a night for self park or $27 for valet.  You have to pay for all of your food so price goes up quick

Summary Heading: Great affordable clean water park and hotel
Summary: The moderate price for the hotel comes with two days of fun at their clean and warm water park. I love that they have food and beverage service available at an affordable price. Rooms are clean. Water park is awesome!

First want to say  it is a cool experience. My 14 year old son and nephew wanted to go for my sons birthday and they had a blast. Some things to know before you go. The beds are horrible. Cheap hotels have better mattress. We bought the wolf pass ($99 each)for both the boys to play the magiquest game completed the first part of the game within a few hours. The second part of the game also costs 36 bucks. They really wanted to battle the totems so we paid for the second part of the game. To only find out that you don't get a totem you have to also buy that once you level up enough. Another $16 each.  Wish the guy would have told us before we bought the  second part of the game.

Summary Heading: Corey in Kids Experience made the difference
Summary: My kids made a new best friend in California!  Thank you to Corey In Children's Activities for making our family's first trip to the Great Wolf Lodge and the Disneyland Resort a great experience.  She was very kind to our children and they drew pictures for her. She was so sweet saying that she was going to frame them and hang them in her room.  I would like to send her a letter of thanks and more drawings that Tyler and Jane made of our trip that they would like Corey to have.

Summary Heading: GWL is a great hotel with great staff (Corey)
Summary: The hotel was large, clean and full of fun activities and amenities for adults.  It is a perfect family hotel.  The waterpark was awesome.  The restaurants had great food.  The shops had unique gifts so we did a lot of Christmas shopping.  The life-size gingerbread house was a sweet surprise.  We were not expecting a winter wonderland!  It was an awesome experience.  We appreciated the helpful valets and Corey at Kids Experience.  See you next time!

We stayed two nights, two adults and a 6 year old child. Pros: Santa Clause showed up after we checked in and posed for pictures with everyone and the picture taking was free. He was very nice and spent plenty of time with each and every family. Our 6 year old enjoyed the water park very much. It was clean, staff was friendly. No complaints about the water park.Cons: Our Room 213 which was a Family Suite was located right next door to the Iron Horse Fitness Center. There was a single wall separating our bed from all the treadmills on the other end of the wall. So each and every morning our sleep would get messed up because we would hear loud thumping and banging from people working out next door on the treadmills and it would wake us up and keep us up until they stopped using

Summary Heading: Fantastic fun for kids but overpriced
Summary: We have been to the Great Wolf Lodge four times now. My kids love this place and I agree. It sure is fun! However, it’s extremely overpriced. These are Holiday Inn rooms at Ritz Carlton prices. I expect more at this price.

Very overpriced for what is offered but my child had a blast. Don’t expect a lot of sleep, thin walls and loud hallways (totally understand excited kids like to run but at 11pm or 6am, it’s a little irritating.)

My daughter had to rescue a kid that was caught in a line because the lifeguards were just whistling for him to move. Obviously he was caught in the line and needed to be rescued. Good thing my daughter can swim as good as she does!

This place is amazing! My kids loved the water park and the kids activities! The buffet is pretty good and Wiley and Violet come out and greet the kids! The snow theme during winter was really cool and the kids had fun talking to Santa! I definitely recommend this place for families!

This place is so fun and it's impossible to get bored! We took our Boys (4 and 6 y.o) for 2 nights 3 days and they had a blast! It's clean and orderly, the staff is nice and accommodating, and the line wait times for attractions and food went fast. We hardly waited long in any line. We had the kids cabin suite and it was by far the cleanliness, most comfortable and quiet room we've stayed in and that's amazing and impressive for a childrens destination! Parking garage was clean, safe, good lighting, and easy to find a spot to park or do valet. Everything is in 1 building so it was so nice to not have to even touch our car the entire time. Not much walking and we didnt feel exhausted from having to walk so far like most kids vacation spots. People hardly needed a stroller. There

We love Great Wolf, making reservations to eat in the gingerbread house is a MUST! The holidays are so magical at GW! This was our second time and we plan to go every year! The buffet is yummy and the staff is all so friendly.

great experience for the family, loved everything, the magicquest was fun for me and my daughter, the customer service was superb, the hotel was clean. the best part there's a little for everyone in the family we would definitely be going back.

Summary Heading: Poor Excuse For A Family Resort
Summary: Adrian and Jesse ruined my son's 5th birthday. My card was ran in excess of about $600 in charges and then I get a 6'3"  individual up in my face in an aggressive manner threatening to kick my family and I out of the park if we do not pay. Luckily, the resort mgr stepped in and rectified the situation, saving the hotel from a lawsuit. She took excellent car of my family and I and apologized for the incident. -_-

The reason for my score was due to the customer service. The first issue was our television didn't work waited on hold for the front desk for 42 mins before I had to walk down to the front desk to get someone to come fix it. Also the light didn't work in the kids cabin no one came to ever fix that, again being placed on hold for an unreasonable amount of time I had to request towels to shower 6 times before finally getting them. The front desk made me feel as I was bothering them.

For character breakfast I didn’t know the online package of $85 would be MORE than what I would spend if I just bought there- it was me and my four kids which would have only been $60. I thought buying online would save and it was more.

Overall theme was good however food was cold and not good. The charters we were told would be out at breakfeast were not. We did enjoy the activities and the children loved the water park. Don't do the breakfeast

Not as expected.  Characters were not out as often as was told they would be. The same character was out the entire time we were there for our stay. At the meet and greet character breakfast the 2 characters who did come out where coming table to table which was nice but felt so rushed to get a pictures .  The activities were fun for the kids but cookies with Ms Claus was so rushed it didn't feel Christmas and didn't get to enjoy. Suggestion is that you allow the kids to decorate the cookie themself (have sign up upon check in for different incurments of times slot so it is not uncroweded ( where the kids can talk with and decorate cookie with Ms Claus like the title says cookies with Ms Claus. The title hot coco with the wolf kids was nothing more than a joke.  Line up get a

we enjoyed our stay with GW. The adults had a great time as well. The food places were awesome and pricing is just like outside, arcade at night after the water park is closed was fun, and all the free things you could do in the lobby upstairs is great, and there is a cool thing that you can do with the sword during the stay that was a little pricey but if you get the paw passes i believe its included. Our family loves this place cause we got to rest and have so much fun and it was all at our finger tips. With the package that we got too the girls were pleased with. ( birthday package- included the cake and banner for the door to surprise the birthday person along with many other things too) We will definitely be back for more fun!

Summary Heading: Best hotel for family and kids
Summary: Awesome place, a lot of activities on the lobby.❤ Good choice for kids, this is my second time to stay on it.The theme room its beautiful and very clean, friendly staff and very helpful.The food.... OMG super delicious the buffet. 👍😍

Normally, we have a great time at Great Wolf Lodge and have recommended it to many of our friends and family that have never even heard of it. However this time we didn't have a great experience.Room/Housekeeping:House keeping staff decided to leave her cell phone charging on one of our cords.Room safe wasn't working. Housekeeping only left a couple of tissues in the box so it ran out quickly and didn't replace shampoo.Waterpark:Lots of litter all around the floor.No hot tub, so when kids get cold its harder to keep them warm. Family became sick after spending the day thereHotel:Asked for late check out availability and was told that it wasn't available due to full capacity only to be told in the morning that it wasn't the reason and that we would need to pay for a late check

Summary Heading: All inclusive fun for the family
Summary: Keep in mind,this is a kid-friendly & kid-focused hotel so as long as you keep that in mind,you'll have fun.We stayed for the weekend & there was enough to do in all that space but it did get crowded. The first 2 hours when the waterpark opens is the best time to do the big wave rides and the Wipeout (boogie boarding)-after that the lines get annoying. It's not awful like 45-65 minutes at Disneyland but anywhere from 10-20 minutes depending on the attraction. The lazy river is fun when it's not crowded-when it is,it's almost impossible to get a tube and all you do is constantly bump into people.It didn't completely ruin it for me but having to be a hotel guest to enjoy the park led me to believe it would be less crowded.Still the park is large & we moved from area to area and it

This is the best place to take your kids, especially if you are an adult that either likes to play or relax. I have two complaints only: it is very expensive and the room was too small/bed uncomfortable. But, those are small complaints compared to the child paradise the place is.

We loved the resort. But my 2 years old got  vomit and diarrhea the very night after we were at the water park. The day later we stayed until 5:30. We went home my oldest son of 5 years old got vomit and diarrhea. Within 28 hours, my youngest if 17 months old got the same thing. Now the stomach flu got to us parents. I hope it wasn't the water park that got us in the flu. I hope it was just the flu season is around. But overall. We like the park. The kids got good time. We'll give it another try.

This was a plan surprise trip for our kids and the look on their faces was priceless. The service was awesome. The staff was very friendly. We all had fun in the water park. We are looking forward into planning another trip pretty soon. This was the best mini vacation.

We had an amazing 3 day stay here! Our suite were smaller than anticipated, and the beds weren't very comfortable, but everything else was AMAZING. The water park was so nice, wish the operating hours were longer! The staff was incredible and accommodating. I recommend!

Summary Heading: Wait For A Sale, Then Go!
Summary: They had a wonderful sale for black friday and were offering 60% off of regularly priced rooms. I had no intentions on ever visiting this place due to pricing, but was happily surprised to see the sale. I booked 2 nights. I was unpleasantly surprised to see the exuberant "resort fees" tacked on to my booking. The cost of the stay was $300 for the rooms/water park passes and ended up being $460 after resort fees. I haven't seen fees that high before at nicer hotels. Also, come to find out that parking is not included? Parking on site is an additional $20/day. The on site food is pricier that I expected as well, the buffet is $19.99 (simply because there's 2 characters that are at the buffet...). There's really tacky posters all around offering their "wine down" services to bring

The 5 of us had a really good time. The kids loved the water park and mapquest game. Room is clean with a fridge and microwave. If you are looking to save some money bring a toaster and a slow cooker for your own meals. Arcade and food is a little pricey. But other than that amazing fun for the whole family.

I’ve left only one prior rating for this resort here and it wasn’t a pleasant one. This one is much better, although I’m beginning to see that this resort fares better depending on the time of year for visits. So, basically summers are VERY LACKING on a great experience. Any other time of year your trip should be a-okay. The one issue that IS constant however, is the WiFi service. Yes, you are going to this resort for fun & not work. However, when you go for almost a week, then you are expecting a nice room experience as well. My child was not able to play any of his games via his game console due to the WiFi. I myself could not check on certain work related items. Other than the WiFi service, the rest of our trip was fine. If you can, visit this resort on its down time and NOT

Great place for kids, down the street from Disneyland and close to Outlets at Orange. Kids loved it and wants repeat trip. Things to do inside of lodge and outside. Lots of places to eat out nearby. Courteous staff, but pricy in total (esp. family of 5), but worth the joy of the children.

Having access to the water park, arcade and a variety of kid activities makes this place totally worth it.  Make sure to book the ginger bread house for breakfast and Book early and utilize the discounts

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the entire family!
Summary: Water park was huge, spacious and clean.  Well staffed—lifeguards throughput and clean restrooms and hotel.  Had hiccups at check-in, but the customer service agent (Ms Breily) was very helpful and made our overall experience fun and satisfying.

The Great Wolf Lodge is a fun, family-friendly, relaxing and clean facility.  We loved our stay from start to finish.  It felt a lot like home.  I would definitely recommend it to families.  I loved the decor throughout the facility.  Our room was comfortable and clean.  Each and every person we interacted with was gracious and polite.  The kids programming was really fun.  They even made it snow indoors!  The Great Wolf Lodge is a must for a relaxing, fun vacation.

It was a great way to celebrate a December birthday. The kids had a great time. The parents had a good time. The room was clean. The staff and lifeguards were friendly and helpful. Customer service was excellent!

Summary Heading: Dirty room, kids had a great time
Summary: Kids had a great time! Room: our room was dirty! There was a hair strand on a pillow, a pepperoni and cheese under the dining table. Food: BAD. The food is expensive and bad. Save your money on the breakfast buffet and eat outside. The service was terrible and breakfast was bland. Water park: was a lot of fun! Kids really enjoyed it. The only negAtive is the seating arrangements. It’s packed and hard to find empty chairs

My family had a great time and the staff is great. Plenty to do and I would recommend not staying there longer then 3days.
