We were worn out by the third day :) so many free activities to participate in. Park is great for small children. I recommend you bring your own life vest for the kids. The ones offered run out quick.

Great for kids and young kids. My kids loved it, but the had to clear out the kids area 3 times due to accidents. It takes a long time to clean which upset my young kids. It’s on the cleaner side of water parks and the indoor feature is nice during the winter. The Christmas theme is awesome! Loved it. Rooms are not as clean as I like, but it’s pretty budget friendly. We food baby food under the bed.

The experience was good overall, but the rooms are a bit pricey for what you get.  Our A/C wasnt working so it made the nights sleep less than great.The might consider a few more characters walking around to see the little folks during breakfast?

Aside from an overchlorinated indoor pool, very underwhelming resort experience for the price. You would never know it is a newer property based on standards of the rooms and poorly running elevators. But they all about the upcharge for everything. Have much needed  beer for a adults for the low low price of $11 dollars a plastic cup.

Take your family here. We took our 3 year old and 10 month old baby they both had such a great time. There's something for everyone to enjoy. The resort was decorated for the hoildays it was so nice..

My son cannot get enough of his experience and constantly telling me his experience. He is making sure we will come back. Personally, i felt i was a little girl again enjoying the slides and water. I love it so much. Looking forward of going back.😊

The indoor water park next to the hotel is an excellent idea.  Getting to play at water park two days for one night stay is good for us because we live only 30mins away.  Love the wolf theme.  The furnitures throughout the hotel are appealing.

Summary Heading: The best bundle of fun, entertainment and lodging
Summary: When you enter the Great Wolf Lodge, it is such an amazing place that my son feels like he is in heaven. Christmas tree, fireplace side Santa, frequent snows falling from the ceiling,m gingerbread house in December, and the waterpark is one of the best designed and maintained places for kids fun and safety. Food variety is decent, staff is very friendly, cordial and helpful, you get 5 star customer service from staff. Perfect place for birthdays or holiday escape with kids.

Summary Heading: Family Vacation at Great Wolf/ Disneyland
Summary: We took my daughter, her hubby, 8 yo grandson & 18mos granddaughter on a family vacation. We stayed here instead of Fisneyland which we have stayed before. This was way better. There were tons of things for the kids. My granddaughter couldn’t stay at the park till 11 pm so when we went to hotel there were tons of things for the 8 yo to do. It was awesome. Everything is charged in an armband so no keys or cards to loose. There is no money for the kids to loose. Even the vending machines work on this. The restaurant in the arcade had great pizza and pasta and they deliver to your room. The snack bar in the water park was great too. The buffet was ok and the fancier restaurant was good.  In the hotel there is a Dunkin Donuts, an ice cream/bakery shop a kids spa an arcade, a small

I would have given a 5 star review but while we were eating, with infant and young children, we were sat at a table where they were painting, the smell was overwhelming and my grandson got a migraine.  When I spoke to the front desk manager he told me he would let them know not to paint while people are eating.  I felt like he didn't listen to me, there was no accountability. Other then that the room was amazing, the entertainment was right on point, dozens of activities for the kids! VERY affordable! I take my grandkids there every year and they never get enough!!!!!!!!!!

Great place to relax and let the kids have fun.  It is a bit pricey but overall you will enjoy your stay there.  There are many attractions to keep the kids busy and the adults can join in the fun as well.

I would highly recommend Great wolf lodge for family getaway. The staff is very friendly, water park is safe , clean and the lines are not long. The water park hours could be better since they close at 8:00 pm. The rooms are clean however, but  bathroom sink was located near the entry which was not good for privacy. Cost is not inexpensive, be prepared to spend quite a bit on extras. Overall the experience was great.

Summary Heading: Such a fun place for the WHOLE family!
Summary: This was our second visit and we already are planning our next visit! My two year old loved doing the scavenger hunt and my six year old loved the arcade. Both me and my husband enjoyed the different activities. We ALL enjoyed the water park. Bowling is fun for everyone and the pizza place is perfect to please the whole family. Staff is always nice and the birthday package is worth it! Stay here and you won’t be disappointed! This place is better than Disneyland for our family since there is so much to do with hardly any wait time. My kids don’t do lines and it’s great to not have to leave the location if you don’t want to.

If your looking for a place to go for family fun no matter the time of year then this is the place. The water park was great and lots of activities for the kids. They let kids be kids and brings out the kid in the adults.

Had to request to get hand towels l, they don’t care if you have requested a certain room saying “it’s already occupied, sorry”, room wasn’t vacuumed, I got better service when I paid $50 a night hotel.

From the time my party arrived till check out we had a great time. We checked in around 9pm on Tuesday December 4, 2018 fast check in. The room was nice and clean. We all took showers a con was only 1 tiny bottle of shampoo per room. Shower was nice and hot the water pressure was great hair dryer worked. The bed was confortable the kids love the bunk bed and the pull out bed was decent could have use a another blanket. In the morning we went to the water park and the was very nice. The employees working the park were nice and helpful. Another  con was my 6 year old couldn’t go down the orange slide like her younger sister because she was “to big” I truly think that if they can go down by the self and would like to go down that there should not be a hight limit. The water park

Our trip was for my 11 year old son birthday the resort was beautiful my son has OCD and he loved that it was nice and clean. The resort was nice the staff was amazing! The resort was just beautiful all around highly recommend!

This place is amazing. They make it so easy for families to have a blast. From having free water at the water park to free granola bars in your room to having the perfect heated temperature in the room. The wolf den is super cute. They have their own tv and the room is sooo cute. I love that they are not expensive like other theme parks. Love this place

If you plan on surprising your kid with a birthday package there's a chance your room won't be set up. Very disappointing and took away the awe moment I wanted to give my eight year old. The resort is very convenient for swimming in cold weather, but one again the experience I wanted for her was not executed. No apologies, just. They just brought the stuff up as if it was an inconvenience for them, while ALL The surrounding rooms had their birthday signs up and balloon set up

We had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge! My 6 yr old son had so much fun as there is so much to do! We also went to CA Adventures and Disneyland and he alsways wanted to come back to go on the water slides, magiquest and play at the arcade. We had a great family trip!

Great experience , wish the place was 24hours , had smoking rooms, and more heat through out the lobby ! The great thing is after check out you can dtill have acess , i feel like extra risk bands should be giving IF birthday person wanna invite friends should be no charge and certanly not $50 or for replacement . And once again more heat !

Good customer service but prepare for some headaches with the smell of Clorox when you enter the water park. Food that is sold in the water park is to salty. Try taking ur own drinks u purchase soda snd no refill the cups are small size.

The water park is definitely the most attractive activity for the hotel. However, I found some areas where the toddlers play, have visible alga build up. Yet, our kid had great fun. Other activities are not so much interested to him yet. Facility itself is quite outdated, carpet torn can be found in the public area (stairs go to water park), the room facilities are really old, one of the lamp wasn't working and my husband had to fix it (it was really loose, the bulb wasn't even in correctly). Faucets are extremely dirty, looked like no one has ever cleaned it for at least 6 months. But I do admit I am more strict to hotel conditions than most of the guests as myself had worked at Starwood hotels and resorts for over 8 years, both in operation and in executives, I had also

Went here with my 4 yr old and the twins 1.5 yr old. They had a blast. Just wish the water park was not so crowded because the lines can be long on the popular ride. Room was clean and fridge is big. Overall a good experience

Overall fun experience, water park was fun, kids had  a great time, a little pricey but worth it. Lots of shops, arcade was a little expensive , bowling was fun for kids, glow in the dark golf was also cool. Bars for adults was great! Room was clean and comfortable.Kids enjoyed it, definitely will do it again.

This place can really use an update already. It hasn’t been open for long but everything seems so old and dingy. The cleanliness is not up to expectations. To top it off as we were checking out we needed help with of luggage but yet no one was to be found instead they were 5 guys standing on the side of the building smoking and talking not even attending to the valet or check in-baggage area

Everything was just awesome!! The only complaint are room pillows. Extremely firm, hard to rest.We love waterpark rides. There was no waiting time ar all as we were there on Monday-Tuesday but staff said it was really busy during weekends. Food was good, especially, kids loved the buffet downstairs. Overall, great experience!

Worth every cent. Extremely catered to children. Parent expect no rest :). MagiQuest recommended (fun for hours and hours). Food, pricey but delish and convenient.  Located in an excellent area (south CA) near restaurants if you prefer to eat out. Rooms clean, towels always available.

This is the most beautiful and well themed resort. We are a family that does travel a lot and have visited many resorts but The Great Wolf Lodge exceeded our expectations with the beauty that was all around. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing towards the children and made my very shy daughter feel comfortable and accepted. We can't wait to return again very soon.

Perfect mini 2 day stay at the Wolf Lodge, it was a first time visit with my grandchildren. They are 7 and 2 activities were geared for younger children but the water park had slides for all ages.  The kids loved it.

Each and everyone of my family members enjoyed our stay. So many activities I wish we could have stayed longer. Food was delicious. You have everything you need inside without having to leave. My daughter picked this trip for her 10th birthday and she was smiling the whole time. She got a special headband that let everyone know it was her birthday

Summary Heading: Inferior due to inefficient water slides queues
Summary: Somehow Great Wolf manages to be less efficient than Six Flags.  Most of the slides have long lines due to bad processes and untrained staff. On top of that they never had enough tubes. Sadly there isn't much to do for adults. They don't even have a jacuzzi.  The $35 "resort fee" (for fax, local call, coffee and other stuff that nobody needs or wants) and $20 parking are ridiculous.

Our 1st time here and it was amazing.  The kids enjoyed it very much, as well as the adults.  I definitely recommend bringing your families here for a fun, exciting time. There is something to do for everyone

We just got back from an overnight for my son’s birthday! I highly recommend this place. The staff was exceptional. They were all so friendly and helpful! The hotel was clean and well done. My kids had a blast doing several activities. We purchased one of the passes. The water park was clean and fun. It kept the kids entertained the entire visit. The food was reasonably priced and good. I was able to order breakfast from my phone at Dunkin and run down to pick it up which was convenient. Overall, it was a great stay.

Love the water park, there's something for everyone and it's clean! The food is delicious-our favorites are the cheeseburgers,fries and cheese curds-YUM!! We have relatives from WI and my husband is a California native so I'm so excited he can have them here! We didn't eat at the steak house this time but the food was great before. Our sons did the MagiQuest this time and it's great. Love that they have the outdoor pool and bar area. This has become our yearly "Griswold" vacation!

A really good place to visit with family. The rooms were great and the indoor waterpark was awesome. Only wish they'd turn down the A/C in the pool a smidge since it can get a little bit cold when you come out of the water. The complimentary towels helped a little bit, but you really can't bring them to the room.

I was staying two days with my 3 kids (14, 10 and 5), and they really enjoyed it. Age doesn't matter, this hotel has fun for everyone. The breakfast, room and water park was perfect for my family! I highly recommend the Great Wolf Lodge Hotel.

We planned this trip at the last minute and were blown away at the experience! There is something for the whole family to enjoy.  Every detail is designed for the ultimate experience. The water park is expansive and lines aren't too long. You can spend your entire day at the waterpark alone and will have still have tons of activites left to do. We are planning our next vacation around where another Great Wolf Lodge is located simply because the experience was so good!

My Girlfriend and I took her kids here for a 2 day stay, we had a great time. The room was a family suite, it had 2 queen beds and a fold out couch. The lodge has a nice variety of food available, the cost is reasonable. The kids really enjoyed the water park, it’s kept at a very comfortable temperature.  My Girlfriend really liked the micheladas, they do serve alcohol poolside and in the water park. The room price also includes unlimited use of the water park, they give you a wristband that is also your room key, it can be used to charge any purchases to your account too, it’s nice to not carry anything with you in the water park.

This was a great weekend vacation for my family. The entire resort is well staffed from the restaurants to the waterpark. Everything you need is right there at the resort and reasonably priced too. I was very impressed by the lifeguards. They work so hard to create a safe environment for the families .We had a great worry free vacation. I would definitely go again.

Family had a great time. Kids ranging from toddlers to teens all enjoyed the water park, even us adults enjoyed the water slides. Rooms and public are were nice and clean. So many activities without having to leave the hotel was great!

Summary Heading: Bed bugs bite, and they refuse to acknowledge it
Summary: We stayed on Saturday night at room 905 and left around Sunday noon. By Sunday dinner time my husband found bed bug infestation on his shoulder and neck. It's only by pure luck that my kids didn't got infested and we put all cloths into washers right after getting home.   I contacted the hotel and send the damage pictures. Some employee called back speaking in a very fast, indifferent tune - sounds like this is not the first time he has been handling such calls. He claimed that a 3rd party pest control team found no bugs in the room. When i asked for the pest control report, he answered no report can be given to customers.   This is just absurd.

Trip was great Overall, however I didn't agree with the rule of not being able to bring a juice or Gatorade into the water park. I have a diabetic and if her sugar drops she needs juice to pick her sugar up. I feel that part is very inconsiderate. They need to reconsider that policy. I get it they want people to have immediate special accomodations.

Summary Heading: Should be called, Just O.K. Wolf Lodge
Summary: Let me start out by saying this is a great water park with all the kid amenities. Great waterslides, and enough other activities to keep kids entertained. There are some nice adult things to do, if you'd like time away from the kids as well. It's really tough to complain too much and we had a pretty darn good time. We stayed in one of the themed rooms with the kid bunkbeds, which the kids loved.   The most disappointing thing about the trip was the staff and customer service. I realize this is probably more important to some guests than others, but the the pervasive annoyance of the front desk staff as well as the servers was hard to ignore. We checked without a "Hello" or "Welcome to Great Wolf", rather a " Do you have a reservation number", in a monotone abrupt voice. Each

Summary Heading: Check in from 4pm, but you can use water park before check in!
Summary: We arrived at the hotel 11:00 am and check in was 4pm.  The stuff told me that we are able to use water park before check in the room.  There is changing room and shower inside the water park.The locker is $10 and alcohol inside water park is $12... The parking was $20.

Summary Heading: Poor info and outrageous xtra charges
Summary: They have a $100 per night incidental charge, which on the website says optional and when you get there they tell you it is not optional. So if you stay more than 3 nights its ridiculous. We stayed 9 nights and they wanted $900 which is outrageous. If you need towels, it's like pulling teeth to get them. Their character breakfast is not worth the money, if you can afford a little bit more then go to the Disneyland character breakfast. It is well worth the money.

VERY slow internetVery crowded pools with long wait lines (the hotel is huge, the number of pools is small)The rooms are not cleaned very thoroughly The parking is not included in the priceThe price for breakfast online is much higher than if you buy at the hotel1-2 shuttles to Disneyland very early in the morning, get booked very quick. So basically no transportation.

We had a great time despite minor miscommunications with staff. Will come again! The themed hotel was really well thought out. My kids were busy throughout the whole day thanks to the waterpark and the combination of magiquest!

I took my kids to the Great Wolf Lodge over the Thanksgiving break. It was our second trip there in less than a year. My kids love the water park! The themed rooms are awesome! The service was outstanding! We will go again!

I found the park a good experience for my grandkids and their friends.  It was pricy so we weren't able to play the wizard games or too much in the arcade.  I found the beds very tight for the number the room was supposed to handle... should have had full beds on the bunk since it was marketed for 4 kids in 2 beds... the twin beds made it tight.It would have been nice if the overall theme had been carried into wall paintings or wall paper, seemed a little sad and drab on the decorating end for the price they wanted on the rooms per night. but the kids had a great time...

Summary Heading: Remember, this place is for kids
Summary: This place is for kids and family.  It is perfect for 2 days and your kids will have a blast.  The staff is great and very nice. They water park is clean there are plenty of life guards.  My only tiny tiny complaint is the cost of food.  Minor complaint, but remember to factor that into the trip cost.

This is our 8th time visiting since the hotel opened. My kids love the water park so that’s why we keep coming back. Since the hotel opened service has really gone down. Since the hotel prices seem to keep going up I would hope that Customer Service would remain a focus. Unfortunately that has not been my experience. Great family place especially during the holidays.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Kids and parents
Summary: Great staff, nice water park and fun activities. My 5-year-old daughter likes the water park, dance party, story time and other activities in the hotel. The staffs are very friendly. We had a great time while staying there.

This was our first time at Great Wolf Lodge.  The check in was smooth and we were able to get into our rooms right away.  The beds are a little small but worked out ok.  My kids and I loved the water park.  Its very clean and we were able to find a place to lay our towels right away.  The wave pool was their favorite and we must have spent hours in there.  The MagiQuest must not be missed.  At first we were unsure if we wanted to do it, but it was the highlight of the trip.  Be prepared to walk a lot to complete the tasks.  We walked over 8 miles in about 2 hours.  Waking up the next morning, both my kids asked when we can go back and said they missed Great Wolf Lodge.  We will be back for sure.

I took my daughter and 3 of her friends over Thanksgiving break for a birthday celebration. The girls were over the moon with their room. They had a queen bed, a pull out couch, and bunk beds with a TV in the bunk bed area, and a TV in front of the queen bed. The TV had YouTube which was a bonus for them. They all jumped in the queen bed at night to watch satisfying slime videos 😂. The lines were surprisingly not too bad for being a holiday week! We ate at the pizza place which was not very good, but the fries at buckets were amazing! Be prepared to spend A LOT of money!  Everything in that hotel is way over priced! That would be my biggest complaint,  along with not being able to bring any outside snacks in the water park!  I get not allowing full on meals, but when you have 5

Summary Heading: Good Indoor water park for kids & adults
Summary: We planned our kids birthday and had a wonderful time at the park.The waterpark was clean and the rides were good however we hoped that there were more rides/options available. The lines were not that bad with minimum wait time of 20 mins.

I was a little worried about the price we were paying at GW, but the value is there.  There is so much to do within the resort that the convenience alone is worth the price.  The fact that the water park is indoors is a huge plus.  There were activities for kids and places to drink and unwind for the adults, lol.  GW is also a unique experience with its own theme and characters, just like Disney.  If you find the resort dining to be expensive, there is a McDonald’s within walking distance and a Target about a mile away.  We want to commend Cory in the Kids Club and Lyta at the Front Office.

If you're wanting a great water park experience, I would not recommend this resort. The water park is small and pales in comparison to most outdoor water parks around the country. Besides the water park though, the rest of the resort is a lot of fun for kids. the Magic Quest was by far the best part. We were very impressed with the imaginative experience of the magic quest which our son loved. The restaurants were good , the rooms were very nice, the drinks were overpriced (~$10 for a draft beer) but readily available around the resort. The shopping, kids events (dance and story time)  and arcade was great. We were very disappointed in the fitness facility, which was tiny and offers only a few cardio machines, no free weights or weight conditioning. For a top notch resort, we

Besides having everything inside the hotel i was ankle to take snacks and frozen food for my son. He had so much fun it's a lil pricy staying there but it was worth my 3 year old happy face. Love it that toodlers have there own water play area.

I love the place, Hotel room was very nice and the water park was great too, I  love it too because we were able to got out and in without any problem to pay again the entrance.  this was very convenience for me . my kids had fun and my mother was very happy. thanks Great Wolf Lodge!!

This was our first experience at a Great Wolf Lodge.  We have a lodge where we live, so we will check it out.  It is not just a hotel, but a fun place with many restaurants and stores.  Our room was really big and comfortable.  I really liked the lodge themed decor.  We do not like water parks, so we enjoyed the indoor water park.  It felt more safe.  The kids activities were wonderful. We hope to come back around the same time next year.  Will recommend.

Had a great time with family and friends. I was worried about the price but took a chance and happy I did Great place with lots todo, price is worth every penny. Rooms are very big and clean and We would stay at great wolf again.

Kid cabin room was great but sofa bed mattress was awful. Arrive early to pool! The resort was clean, good food options, n plenty of kid activities. A bit overpriced but will def return. Kids loved it!

Summary Heading: My son drank a dirty pool of water and vomited for 3 days. We went to the emergency medical service of the hospital next
Summary: My son drank a dirty pool of water and vomited for 3 days. We went to the emergency medical service of the hospital next to the hotel. Our vacation was broken. My son vomited thirteen times and found medicine stable. The doctor said it was due to the virus in the swimming pool water.

We went on Veterans Day weekend with  our 1 and 7 yr old boys. The boys loved it! They had a great time. It was smaller than I imagined it! Okay so let me TRY to make it short and to the point - check in is not until 4pm but you can enter the water park at 1pm. By this time all chairs and tables are taken. It was super crowded! No floaties available for the lazy river and the wave pool is on the smaller size so it was very crowded. Lines were long for the slides too. I think it was super crowded due to the holiday weekend. They give you a wrist band which gives you access to the water park and is your room key and you can charge things to your room so you don’t have to worry about taking money in for food or drinks. Towels are Provided for you so you don’t have to pack any.

We’ve been Great Wolf Lodgers in the past since it open over the past 5 years. We just got back from HI and needed to cancel our reservation for December. Come to find out we book this a week ago for the $299 special that ended up costing $407 after taxes, that even though it’s a month out we were forced to pay $61 to cancel. They just lost a lodger. Which is sad. The kids enjoyed it. Can’t say I did with all kids running about with no adults to reel them in but back to the real waterparks.   Remember this when you book: 1 - the cost is not what your booking for, it’s going to be at least $100 or higher after they hit you with taxes and all the other fees.   2 - your locked in to stay there. They will rebook at a later date but it has to be within the same promotion period and

When we arrived I saw self park and valet, so I self parked . Didn’t know it was $20 a day to park until I got my final bill , along with a California Tourist fee and resort fee . Then I bought a beer on Thursday paid $7.55 after tax and tourist fee then on Friday bought the same beer and it was $8.63 ?Also save your $ when it comes to the pizza Yuck!!Gave this place a 3 star cause the water park was fun for my daughter and her friends and the staff was friendly and it was clean .

Well, I’ve been going here every year since it opened. Sadly this will be my last.  It is plainly obvious that maintenance is lacking.   Dirty carpets, TVs that can’t sit straight on the bedroom walls, drawers that fall out and injure you, interactive stuff in Wolf Den suite that doesn’t work.  I could go on.   My checkin experience this time was just short of shocking.  Ok I requested first floor rooms again as I was traveling on my own with 4 kids.  I had booked a Wolf Den suite with a connecting king bedded room.  It seems that you have to contact the actual property early on the day of arrival to be able to get your room request.  I had called the general number two days before.  They confirmed my request for the first floor but forgot to tell me to call the actual property.

You definitely get the experience you pay for gere. My family had a great time. My son was extremely happy and excited. But all the adults also had a great time and we're blown away by the water park. This is my 3rd review I have done about my stay and I will say it again Kyle at the bodyboarding place was super great!! The room is fine enough but this is a resort that focuses keeping you out of the room. The food and drinks are in the normal price range for a resort, so don't expect to not splurge, or plan a head & stop by the target down the street to stock your mini fridge or else you have pay $7 for water. Another thing is the hotel staff isn't as enthusiastic as the water park staff, obviously there's good in bad in both sides but my experience with the hotel staff just

Summary Heading: Think Again About a Winter Visit!
Summary: It was 80 degrees outside and a Southern California November heat wave so schools were closed. We were so excited to make the short 1 hour drive and try Great Wolf Lodge for the first time but the water park was freezing and I was shivering within minutes. Our 16 month old's feet were blue and I was shocked there was no hot tub or any way to warm up at all. I asked multiple employees if there was somewhere the water was warmer, or a dryer like they have at Legoland and there was nothing. Our older two were on their own in the water, I could not enjoy it all. I had to dry off our toddler and wrap him in towels to keep him warm. We left the water park after 1.5 hours and were shivering as we went to dinner. I specifically asked for no ice in our waters. Our dinner was fantastic

Summary Heading: great for kids. notsogreat for adults
Summary: GWL is great for the kids but the adult experience could have been better. upon arrival at the hotel, we found blood in our bathroom. however, when we called housekeeping they came and cleaned it up. the public showers inside the waterpark was dirty and not well maintained. however, the waterpark slides were great and the kids had a blast!

Would definitely come again and again!  No need to leave.  There was tons of entertainment and especially a spot to just relax near a cozy fireplace.  My family had a blast.  Celebrated our granddaughter's 9th bday!

Had a great experience from the water park to the pool.  This is the second location of Great Wolf Lodge we have experienced and it didn't disappoint.  We had yummy food pool side and everything was reasonably priced.

A great family fun time. You feel very safe in letting your kids roam free at the water slides and around the hotel. Very clean and cute themed. It is always busy so I suggest going on off seasons. Plan on spending a lot of $. Your kids will want snacks, the magic wand game, arcade cards, bowling, and to stuff their very own Wiley the wolf. Grab your paw pass! And don’t forget your go pro or a water proof phone case. I wouldn’t waste money on a cabana since the other chairs and tables are closer to the slides and water fun area.

The resort was great. Very clean always something for the kids to do. Great food all places. I highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge. Any time of year you can enjoy the waterpark areas. This would be a great place for a Reunion.

We had a great time. I downloaded the app from the App Store and completed the pre check in. It said we would be notified when our room was ready but already expected to check in at 4 since that’s check in time. We did arrive early for the water park, as were walking in i get notified our room is ready and we got to check in early. The water park is a blast for the entire family and it was warm which was Niven because we went in November. We only stayed one night but definitely plan on going back.

This was the worst stay.  Will not ever stay here again..  the staff messed up on my reservation I paid the room in advance and wolf lodge still charged my account for the room. If I were you I would stay someone where else.

Summary Heading: GREAT TIME W FAMILY- ***not smoker friendly though***
Summary: Kids loved the whole thing.  Slides, wave pool, food etc.  My only issue is that my husband and I smoke and the smoking area is very far and takes a while to get to.  You have to walk way down the hall(s) to get to the elevator.m, go several floors down (stopping along the way), walk through hotel/lobby, outside, then they put a smoking area like 50 yards from the front entrance.  A bit extreme in my opinion.  There is a back patio very close to the elevator and The Lodge does not allow smokers to utilize this area.  (It is empty always.  I have never seen anyone out there- been there twice).

My 2 and 4 year old fell in love with Great Wolf and didn't want to leave! The waterpark is so much fun, and the arcades and game quests where very exciting for them.  The staff was amazing to us!  They accommodated us without us having to ask.

This is not our first time here, probably 6th. My kids love it and keep asking to come back. Food and beverage are great and the chef was always able to accomodate my dairy and gluten free son. Plan it ahead of time and you can get a better price. You can also get a discount if you book 2 or more nights as well as a return discount.

Summary Heading: OK for kids, less fun for adults
Summary: This was our second time at this location. We opted for a large room this time given we had 6 travellers and we're glad we did. The room was fine. It was nothing special outside of the bunkbed room which the kids enjoyed. Other than that, the experience was much like visiting an amusement park which is either good or bad depending on your point of view. The water park is fun for the kids with all of their different attractions. I felt it was overcrowded and not really that enjoyable for me as an adult/parent. The lazy river is anything but relaxing given the throngs of people crowding it. I don't think we'll be back. I'd rather just go to a water park that has something for everyone.

Summary Heading: NOT JUST FOR little kids Water Park!
Summary: My almost 13 year-old & I had a BLAST! She was nervous that the park would be more based for little kids so she didn't invite a friend to join. SHE ADMITS SHE WAS WRONG!  BOY WAS SHE pleasantly SURPRISED! We are headed back for a stay for Thanksgiving and again in January to celebrate her 13th Birthday party with her friends. I've already bought 2 gift cards to gift my Real Estate clients as closing gifts for their families to experience after their move to their new home. Super clean and the food in the Park was DELICIOUS! ~De Martin, San Marcos, Ca

This place far exceeded our expectations, in terms of service, stay, and waterpark. Staff were all lovely and really accommodating, and they are all about giving the kids a good time which is really unique. Waterpark was absolutely fantastic- we have nothing like this in New Zealand, let alone in a hotel so we were chuffed. Well done guys!

This is the perfect place for the family.  Lots to do for all ages.  Water park has a lot to choose from and they have an outdoor pool if you want the sun.  They have more for the kids if you want other than the water park, i.e., arcade, glow-in-the-dark mini golf, etc.  Plus the food is really good and thank goodness they have a coffee bar - Duncan Donuts, which the adults could really use.  Overall, I think families would really enjoy this experience.

First of all, I was waiting in my confirmation emails, leading up to the trip, for an opportunity to do a mobile check in or other options for shortcuts. I was never given this information. Come to find out once I arrived, there was a separate line for mobile check-in. Since I did not do this in advance, I stood in line for 30 minutes to check in. There is no area for baggage check in for families to arrive before check in to enjoy the water park, it was necessary to walk back and forth to the car to enjoy the water park prior to check in, which was inconvenient. My child experienced hypothermia. It’s cold in that park when you’re wet for 2 hours.  There’s no sun to warm up, no hot tub and no hot showers. There are huge ceiling fans to cool you down though?!?!???  The water is

We spent 3 nights at the Great Wold Lodge. Our children are 2 and 4. They had the best time! There is so much to do and see. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was very clean! The water park was so much fun! Highly recommend going!

If you are looking for a great kids get away, this is the place for you! Constant activities to keep your kids busy and entertained. The staff are very friendly and the hotel is clean.  I suggest purchasing a Paw Pass for each kid.

It was a howling good time.  Check in was great.  We did the mobile check in.  They fulfilled all requests, and my room was ready 3.5 hours prior to check in.  I highly recommend doing the mobile check-in.  Check out was even easier with an easy text.  I got the receipt the night before, checked out any charges, and then checked out.  It was so easy and smooth.  Didn't have to wait in the massive line.

Check in was great.  All employees very helpful and cooperative.  Check out went well, too. I found everyone willing to help.My grandaughter loved the cheese pizza.  Ate two slices.The restaurant had very good food.  My salad was delicious and all was as ordered.  Dressing on side etc...My son enjoyed his salmon.  We had fun with our 6 year old at the bowling section.

We always had a great time here notonly mykids but also us. The only suggestion i would say is that. In the waterpark let it be more warmer the water in the kiddie pool. My one year old son got coldeasy and the water is not that warm.

On the last night of our stay we found a BED BUG on the ironing board. We used a tissue paper to grab it and bring it to the attention of the front desk staff. A report was made and we were offered another room at a discount for the night. We inspected our children and did not find any bites, thankfully.  Overall, we had a great time and our children loved the water park and activities, We have a 16 year old, 3 year old and 1 year old. There was activities for all of them. The wide range of activities made this trip enjoyable.  The only down side was taking the Extra precautions when we got home check for stray away bed bugs.

We have a great time with the family every time we stay at great wolfeboro...the place are clean the customer service are great the room are clean we love to come back here ones we have time again ......

Make sure to look at towels and bedding. I found dirty towels buried under cleaner ones. It did not appear that things were changed before our visit. Sheets were also dirty on both the pullout bed and the queen bed.

We went with a group of 11, with kids ages 4 to 16, and stayed in two rooms. All kids loved the water park and had fun the whole time we were there. Food options were good but a bit pricey. Our family of 5 spent over $100 for dinner in the restaurant, even though we didn't get drinks, appetizers, or desserts.

Summary Heading: Staff was careless to the needs of guests.
Summary: Went to celebrate my son's 12th birthday and was disappointed after the birthday package I ordered wasn't in the room. Staff dropped the ball starting at check in and again after trying to resolve it.

The Great Wolf Lodge is a really great place to take your family. They have fun rooms for the kids, the waterpark is awesome! They have so many activities for the kids to do throughout your stay.They also make things easy for the parents with a wristband that's opens your room, you can pay for food or anything extra in the hotel. I didn't need a wallet or anything! The employee's were all super friendly.  My Children could run around and be crazy and have fun without anyone blinking an eye at them. I will be planning my next vacation at The Great Wolf Lodge!

My kids (7 and 6 years old) love playing in water.  But in October and November most of the water parks are closed in California. I love that it is indoor so my kids can play in water even when the weather is cold.  Plus there are plenty of fun water rides my kids can choose from.

Resort offers something for every family member. The water park, yoga, Jammie jam, food options, etc are a select few of experiences to share with your family. Would recommend to anyone! The hotel staff was always willing to help and they are quick to respond!

Summary Heading: There is something for everyone in the family
Summary: My family had such an amazing stay at the hotel. We did not know there were other activities besides the waterpark so going in it was a pleasant surprise. Love that they use wristbands for keys and to pay for things, it makes it so much easier than having to carry around a bag to keep yiur keys and wallet in.  Beds are not the most comfortable but also not the worst hotel bed i have slept in.  All the staff was great from the stores, dance time, story time h front desk.  The paw passes are a great option if you plan on taking advatage of the activities I purchased all 3 diff passes for my children ages 1,7,14 since i knew they each would do different activities and that saved me a lot of money then purchasing individually

The entire staff was extremely accomodating. We went in the beginning of the week in November and there was hardly anyone there. It was an amazing experience. They even texted that the room was ready early and that we could come anytime.

We were greeted by the wonderful staff. Staff are extremely friendly, kind, and helpful. We were informed on our activities. Our rooms were ready on arrival. Room was clean. Activity centers were clean as well.

Summary Heading: Worst experience I've ever encountered at a hotel/resort
Summary: The room pulled in the outside air which consisted of extremely powerful cigarette and marijuana smoke.The staff made minimal efforts to resolve issues.The coffee maker was broken - the replacement coffee maker was brokenHousekeeping removed items paid forThe swimming area is WAY TOO hot with no air circulation what-so-ever...very uncomfortable for parents just wanting to sit in there and watch their children.

Summary Heading: California's first indoor waterpark really delivers!
Summary: This place is great for families, and very much oriented that way, however I was staying there with few of my 20-something friends, and due to other hotels in the area being booked, we thought we'd give Great Wolf a try on a whim, and boy are we glad we did! The level of service and cleanliness was top notch, the amount of things to do and eat was fantastic, and of course, the indoor waterpark was fantastic, I just wish it was larger, but it's already a really good size with a great variety of attractions inside. They make it a point to make sure the waterpark is not crowded to minimize wait times, and it is literally two blocks away from Disneyland, where we were planning on spending a lot of the trip, but believe me when I tell you they do a great job of making you not want to

The hotel has gone downhill. Dirty carpet; dirty waterpark. The walls are peeling, the steps are rusting and crumbling, the floor is stripping through in spots. Guest service was only adequate and first aid assistance was downright lacking. The hotel and waterpark were both understaffed causing long wait times. Prices are very high and therefore this lack of cleanliness and service means we won’t be returning until a renovation is made.

We stayed one night, but were able to use the waterpark the day we arrived and after we checked out. The waterpark was a nice size. Most of the attractions were inside, but they also had a large shallow pool outside. It was warm inside, but the water was on the colder side. I would think that the water would be warmer and a more comfortable temperature for little ones especially in the kiddie area. It was too cold for my 1 year old. My other kids enjoyed the water even though the had bouts of the shivers. The bathrooms inside the waterpark could use more attention. The snack bar inside had decent prices. They also provided towels, but the towels could not be taken to your room. The resort offers a lot of activities, we just didn't have time for them all. Our kids played in the

Extensive indoor water park to keep the kiddies occupied while attending the conference. Just a couple miles away from Disneyland with free shuttle (but reserve your seat). Very nice employees and imaginative decor for a different conference experience. Lots of smiles all around.

I totally recommend this place for a mini family vacation. My husband and I took my 3 & 5 year old for their birthday on October for halloween and we were so happy. All the staff are very nice and helpful and nice. Our room was ready as soon as we checked in and we were able to make the most of our time. We stayed two nights, went to the water park section and enjoy the many different activities the hotel offers. Since it was Halloween time, the hotel had very cute decoration and my kids got to trick or treat around the hotel. We are definitely coming back next year.

We had an awesome time here during the kids fall break. This is an indoor water park the water temperature is at 80 degrees. We loved our kids cabin suite so spacious. Kids had their own separate room with bunk bed and a separate twin bed. All 3 kids fit comfortably. Kids enjoyed the water park a lot so our 1 night stay wasn’t enough. We are definitely coming back.

We booked the room for my baby sister, who has been wanting to go back to the great wolf and she loved it. It happened to be my mom's birthday weekend as well and she loved her stay. We're actually looking into going back in December! It was my first time at the great wolf and I was amazed at how big this hotel is and how much it has to offer, and I work right up the street. If the rates weren't so high ( this hotel has a lot to offer, so it's understandable ) I would book a room here more often, even though I live up the street. Thank you to all of the staff who helped my family during their stay, they loved it!

So much activities to do.  I wish we could've checked in sooner to take advantage of all the amenities! The nice thing is that they have free activites for the kids too (balloon animals, story time, and dance parties).

Summary Heading: If you haven’t tried the GWL I don’t know why
Summary: Seriously, fun for the entire family in one place! You can’t even find that at home!! Food is good ! Entertainment is non stop. Just bring a bathing suit. Towels. Swim vests they are all there. Hop on a water slide already!

The place is nice but pay attention. I was charged 3 times prior to arrival with one being a $200 hold on my credit card plus they charged for parking prior to arrival and I flew in and didn't have a car..The prices at the restaurants and gift stores are over prices. There are several fees added to the room charge as well

Great Wolf Lodge is a wonderful place to take your family. A large group of friends and I just visited with kids as young as 1.5 and as old as 12 and the lodge was perfect for all of them. Every kid in our group was on cloud 9 and had the time of their lives. Even the adults had a blast! it was just a great trip overall. I'm a hard core Disney fan and go to Disneyland and stay in the Disneyland hotels multiple times per year. I can honestly say that we had just as much fun at Great Wolf and I actually enjoyed the hotel experience much more than the local Disney hotels due to the top notch customer service at Great Wolf. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and facilitate dietary needs. In fact, I'm considering staying at Great Wolf next month when we go to

Summary Heading: Great time for the whole family!
Summary: We had a blast at Great Wolf Lodge. I took advantage of the GroupOn deal and stayed on a Sunday night since the kids were off school on Monday. That worked great--it was crowded when we checked in (30 minute wait) and the water park was a bit busy but we still had a great time. Even my teen had a great time. There is such a variety of water things to do. The room was clean but a bit boring (we just got a regular room). It was about as charming as a Holiday Inn room but it was clean. The staff are very nice. The food was above average but nothing amazing. The game room is clean and has lots of games for its size but it's really expensive.

We had such a fun time. This place is clean, rooms are nice, the water park is loaded with life guards who do a fabulous job at keeping it safe, staff is very helpful and friendly, and the entire experience was wonderful. I highly recommend coming here at least once.

The hotel room was clean and Halloween dance party was fun. Our kids absolutely loved the water park and had a hard time getting them leave the place. We will try to come back at least once a year. Two thumbs up!

My family and I had a wonderful time at The Great Wolf Lodge!  The room was spacious and cleaned.  The food was good and the waterpark was awesome!!  I would like for the waterpark to open a little earlier or stay open longer.  Overall we had a blast!

Summary Heading: First Time Great Wolf Lodge Visit
Summary: We stayed in the Kids Cabin and we traveled with 3 children 2 adults. The room was spacious and alot of fun for the entire family. We enjoyed the entire hotel from the water park to the arcade and I love the set up! you can pretty much find everything there and nearby. I would definitely go back again next year! This place is wonderful for children engagement and you can find all sorts of things for your child to do!

The park is in a convenient location and has everything to accommodate children and adult but it needs better house keeping and maintenance. Our bathroom smells like a public park or beach bathroom.  I had to use baby wipes to clean the toilet and floor and sprayed essential oils to help mask the smell. Management should pay close attention to the cleanliness of the resort (rooms, water park, restaurant and arcade.)

The place is great for kids and very accessible. Food prices were reasonable for the type of hotel.  We ate for dinner in the buffet; the food was ok but I think next time we will eat at the restaurant.

Best family experience, waterpark was incredible for adults and children. Stayed in a wolf den suite and the kids loved the bunk beds. Happy we chose to stay here. Food was good, alcoholic beverages for the adults were yummy!

We had such a great time! Loved how family friendly it was! Such a great weekend and will absolutely come back! We loved the trick or treating and the night time story time. The smiles on the kids faces were priceless.

It was wonderful! Water park is nice and clean (great hours) no lines at all. The hotel itself was awesome! Arcade, activities, MagiQuest was the best! If you do decide to participate start from the first day you arrive (it takes a couple ours to complete). Lots and lots of walking (keeps the kids busy and good exercise). Will be going next year :)

Summary Heading: Great fun for the whole family
Summary: We had an excellent time! The wait times for the rides were manageable, the park was clean, and the rides were fun. The only negative was that the room could have been cleaned a little better before we checked in (namely the vanity/sink). The food was good, not great.Overall, we can't wait to go back!

great place kids loved would go back it perfect for a little get away and it was a great time food was great water park was great the them of the hotel was great and so was all the staff and very helpful

Summary Heading: We loved Great Wolf Lodge, Anaheim!
Summary: We and our kids (11 and 9), LOVED our 2 night, 3 day stay at Great Wolf. All 4 of us had so much fun from beginning to end. It really felt like we were on vacation and we didn't want to leave. A word of caution: A 2-night stay, during the week, when booked 60 days in advance, shows as only $180/nt, which is a great price. However, taxes and fees are another $180 approximately, making the 2-night stay about $540. They have plenty of food options at the resort, but they are costly. Our 2-night stay came to almost $950 with food purchases. You can do it much cheaper if you bring your own food to eat in your room. But it was all worth it!

I had been told by serval families that their children and/ or families got diarrhea after visiting the waterpark.  Well, it’s true! My son got bad diarrhea the first night. That alone, won’t be bringing me back to that location. Other then that, the hotel was nice.

The resort is very nice and clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and accommodating The food options are fantastic. Having the credit card details on The Wristband makes everything so much easier, because you don't have to worry about your wallet. We were there on a Thursday night, so the crowds weren't bad at all and wait times were like 5 minutes. The only downside is that the costs add up fast. We didn't do any of the paw passes, and our 7 year old son was fine with that. The buffet was really nice, but our son was so excited to get to the water park, that he didn't eat that much, so next time we'll just bring cereal and milk.

Great wolf lodge was great except for the fact that they failed to address the issue of my room smelling like urine upon arrival. The housekeepers came and sprayed febreze which made my headache worse from the smell and put wet coffee pods in my air conditioning unit. If this is how they operate, I don't even want to know how else they clean rooms. The refrigerator temp control was broken and after telling front desk, no one offered to a room change. The experience was great except for the room.

So much to do. With the in-door water park, restaurants, arcade, shops, golf, magi quest for the kiddos throughout the motel and more we never left the motel. The water park had a little something for everyone. All the staff we extremely friendly. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. A little loud when you’re located next to the quest challenges hearing them going off constantly but other than that We would and will go back again

Summary Heading: Great fun for not only kids but parents
Summary: Great place all year round!! New experience every time I’ve gone. Plan to go again! I think it’s a great price. Many family fit in the room comfortably. Also what can you ask for you can relax and have fun activities .

Great place for kids! A bit pricey at the shops. Alot of activities, and fun for all ages. I wasnt really impressed with their breakfast , there was a character that walked aound and took pictures. You can bring your own snacks in which is a plus.

Great Wolf is a great resort and water park for the entire family.  They have everything to entertain babies to teens.  We initially booked through Hotels.com since it had a better rate but GW still treated us like a regular guest and got us the lobby floor we requested.  We arrived a little after check in and there was no one in line.  Check in ran smoothly.  We got to our room with no issues. It was nice, clean and spacious.  Had a mini fridge and microwave.It was Halloween season so there were all sorts of activities to entertain the kids.  They even had a trick or treat path for the kids and the candies were legit.  They even gave out full bags of Harbaro bat gummies. Yum.  The water park was extremely fun.  The room is humid so it feels like summer all year around.

So we took the kids not knowing what to expect.  The water park was a blast.  Exciting even for an adult.  Lot of activities for little kids, bowling alley, mini golf, arcade, 6d experience, bars for adults, you can pretty much drink anywhere on the property. We checked in on Monday and out on Thursday so we didn’t deal with long lines or crowds. I did notice the parking filling up and the place starting to fill as we were checking out.  We stayed in a premium suite with a room for the parents and an adjoining room with queen bed and themed bedroom, a cool cave with its own tv.  My only negatives are; food at park not so great. Not terrible but nothing special, surrounding neighborhood not so great so not a lot of food choices in immediate area but tons about a mile down near

Our stay at Great Wolf was great. I have 3 girls, ages 2, 10 and 13. we celebrated the 13 year old birthday and everyone including adults had a great time. I love that we can still go to the water park and other attractions on the day of check out. We only stayed 2 nights, but overall we were satisfied.

i had never beennow i will go every other monthextremely reasonably priced, 5 mins from alternative foodwater tubes and slides are comparable to magic mountainmy family will be back very soonprobably even before christmaswe went during the week and had literally no wait for any ridescompare that to hurricane harbor

Summary Heading: Good but could have been better
Summary: Traveling with two 13 year olds and the kids are having a great time at the water park. The room is nice clean and comfortable. The first issue we have is the free shuttle to Disneyland. It's very limited and three hours before checking in it's already full. This will add an extra expense and hassle for us to get to Disneyland in the morning. They advertise the shuttle and if it's that popular then they should add more shuttle runs to accommodate the demand of their guests. Second issue is the indoor water park is rather hot, humid and noisy. For a Mom just trying to relax while her teens are running around the water park it's not that great. The outdoor pool is nice. We were enjoying the outdoor pool at 5 pm, it's warm and they close it at 5 while Many people are enjoying it.

Many thanks to Corey in Guest Experience for making my son's first vacation a special one.  He is a specials needs child and was a bit taken back with the large crowds in the lobby, but she took it upon herself to become his best friend.  We saw her on 2 of the 4 days that we were there and I am very grateful.  Fantastic job Great Wolf on your excellent customer service.  Cheers.

This place is good for kids, they have everything from a water park (indoor and outdoor), the magic quest which keeps the kids occupied for hours.  There are restaurants and outdoor hang out places for the adults.  There are also events every few hours for the kids to attend.  My daughter went to the scoops nail salon it was pretty expensive but if you really want to do something special for your daughter its a special treat they will enjoy.  Overall the stay was good.  We stayed in the 9th floor and it was nice and quiet.  Floors 2-6 had the magic quest monitors so kids would be running up and down these floors doing this game so my recommendation, stay on floors 7-9 if you want peace and quiet.

Summary Heading: Awesome place to celebrate our granddaughter's birthday!
Summary: Our grandchildren love it therefore we love it too !  Awesome staff , clean rooms & comfy beds . Downside: Water park hours should vary base on guest visiting the resort , very small water park with limited slides and attractions .

Summary Heading: A good time for all ages but all the little things add up
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge was my daughter’s dream birthday and it met all of her expectations!  My 4 star rating is mostly based on how much fun my children had. The water park caters to so many different interests and levels.  If you have one daredevil child and one very cautious child, there are attractions for both of them.  However, if they’re young and do not have co-conspirators, then chances are you will have to decide which parent or guardian will go on each ride or attraction with them.  The same goes for Magiquest, parents and children running around the hotel from floor to floor doing this scavenger hunt.  I think you have to do Magiquest at Great Wolf Lodge or else your child will feel left out or excluded without a wand to run around with.  If you have a wand but do not

Summary Heading: Weekend Birthday celebration at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We stayed in a Kids Club Cabin Suite with one bathroom for one night.  There were 6 of us and it actually sleeps 7 people.  The price included using the water park for two days.  There were several onsite restaurant choices.  We invited friends not staying at the hotel to join us for dinner at the grill.  Some of the restaurants and the lobby activities are open to the public. There is a viewing window to look into the water park.   A wristband is needed to enter the waterpark and each person staying in our room was issued the wristband included in the price of the room.  For $50 per day extra wristbands can be purchased.   The lifeguards were great, but small children need an adult with them at all times as the park can be busy.  My 4 year old grandson enjoyed the log rolling

We paid a lot of money for the room, you will barely be in the room. The water park was great though and really fun. Over paid for the room was upsetting though. Great environment very friendly, staff was on top of it. Dinner buffet was great.

We took our daughter and a couple of friends and they had a blast . Water park was fun for all ages .. Everyone had a wonderful time .. Food is just ok and very expensive... So bringing your own snacks is a great idea 😉

Summary Heading: The best place to take your family
Summary: I highly recommend this place. The kids want to come back and we love how you can experience this place all year round. Friendly staff and a clean resort. There is so much to do here from having an arcade to an indoor and outdoor water park, to a nail spa and bowling

Must Stay family location . Very awesome location. Great indoor activities for family.  They have a Dunkin Donuts -the best. Very clean water park. Lots of things to do. Toddler section is the best for little ones.

It has always been a fun time visiting and staying at the Great Wolf Lodge. We love seeing our two little boys happy and excited and that's what they always experience here. The waterpark, dining areas, arcade, bowling alley and the activities they have for the kids all throughout the day are just amazing.

Both kids age 6 & 10 love the indoor water park & can't wait to go back.  The room is clean.  The food at the resort is kids favorite & convenient.  This is the second trip to Wolf Lodge & my kids already ask to be back there soon.

My whole family had a blast!!!! From the youngest being 17 months to the oldest being 45 years old.  Things to do for all ages.  The best part was the buffet.  The food was amazing.  Breakfast and dinner.

My family and I really enjoyed our stay here  while celebrating my great nephew's 7th birthday. Lodge is very close to Disneyland. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite.  Hotel room and Water-Park were clean.

Waterpark was great.  Rooms were ok.  Lots of damage to lamps hanging on walls.  Beware there are hidden fees.  Parking and resort fees.  Water park is included, but everything else is super expensive.  Food, bowling, magic quest, arcade, games are all extra.  Other than water park, there is not much for older kids to do at this Great Wolf Lodge.

The resort was Halloween everywhere and they did extra surprises. It was wonderful time with the family away from the hustle of life. They had a kids den room available so we upgraded for the first time and the kiddos loved it. Very clean.

Summary Heading: A great place to visit without emptying your pockets
Summary: The staff was extremely nice and hospitable. The whole park was clean and everything was up-to-date and modern. We are already planning our next trip out there. The packages were very reasonbly priced and we got to do a lot of activities without going broke.

We have 3rd and 4th grade boys and this is our 2nd year visiting Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim.  The location is great (down the street from Disneyland and near many restaurants).  The facilities are clean and offer water and non-water activities to keep them well-entertained.  My 4th grader loved the water slides.  MagiQuest kept my 3rd grader running around and entertained.

The Hotel is about average for your basic no theme room but very clean and updated. Long hallways to walk but worth it. The water park made the whole trip worth it. So many things to do for adults, kids and toddlers. My family of 5 ranging from 10 months to 28 years old were very entertained and loved it. 24 hour arcade is rare to find but they need a little more staffing for that part. The month of October is Halloween theme and trick or treating every night with the costumes really made the kids happy and got more use out of the expensive costumes. Friendly staff for the hotel but young immature teens for life guards. Overall this will be our new family getaway.

the park was not overly crowded, so no long waits in line.  The wristband makes purchases so convenient so I didn't have to worry about a lost wallet.  food is reasonably priced. and plenty of activites for the kids.

We had an amazing time my kids absolutely loved the water park!! The staff was super nice and helpful! Everything was clean and comfortable. The characters came out and interacted with the kids during story time!

Summary Heading: Expensive and not in the best shape
Summary: This place is a money vacuum...they add parking to your bill whether you park there or not.It could be cleaner and the room a/c unit sounded like it was going to break apart, making for a couple of very hard to sleep nights.

We have 4 kids ages 17 -2. All hag a great time.  The water park is awesome.  There is plenty for kids to do.  You don't need to leave the resort. Elevators run slow because of the magicquest, but it's a great time.

My 5  year old made a best friend at the Great Wolf.  My son asked Corey in Kids Club to draw Batman when he was getting his face painted.  She did a great job!  The hotel was nice, much bigger than we expected with a lot of activities for kids, but it is really the service that sets this place apart.  Great job and thank you Great Wolf for a enjoyable experience.

Great gateway with the family. We visit every year in October for my 9 yr old birthday. She absolutely loves going. Seems like we have made it a tradition.  Everything is clean, staff is friendly. Water temperature awesome!

I have two kids.  They love the place.  They stayed in there for 8 hours straight!  We will be back after these messages!The staffs are friendly.  The room is clean.The favorite:  Wipeout, lazyriverOne suggestion:  The water park could open half an hour earlier.

Kids enjoyed some water fun and arcade time. Resort is clean and we went during off peak season so it wasn't crowded. They even offer trick or treating for the kids during the weekend we were there. Food wasn't bad either.

We had some issues during our stay. #1. We had a bellman who did not check the number of bags on our ticket and kept 3 of them in the back after we had left. They could not mail them back because it was a cooler and two other larger 30lb+ bags. We had left and drove 2.5 hours towards Sacramento only to drive 2.5 hours back. When we got there I asked if we could have a wolf pass or something where the kids could play around for a little as they spent 5 hours in a car and had 7 hours more in the car from the bellman's mistake. The manager said they would give us a few arcade cards. When we went to use the arcade cards only 1 of them worked and the person I spoke to on the phone wasn't there.#2. It was our daughter's birthday. We purchased a cake and left it with the restaurant as

We had a blast but really expensive when you want everyone to be able to do it! If you have a small group it would be perfect. Room was awesome and staff was helpful..the only down side is if all the kids want to do everything it world out to be $100 a person

Summary Heading: Wolf Den and Wand is a MUST
Summary: Recommending splurging on the Wolf Den for the Kids and buy a Wand - It activates the Woodland creature in the Den! Our Grandsons were in Awe of this! The Lodge Fire Grill serves teriyaki salmon that was fabulous. Breakfast with the characters was a blast, and so many things to choose from. Halloween trick or treating was funny and a dance party after! We are coming back soon, I've been told it snows in December.

We had a great experience. My kids (14,11,5) all had something to do and they were all very happy to stay there, even asked when we can go back.  There is plenty of life guards and I never felt like my kids were ever in danger.  The hotel staff is so nice and sweet.  Overall I was really impressed and cant wait to go back...

Arrive early on the day of check in so that you have more time to squeeze in the activities they have on site. Time starts to feel rushed when you have to find the time for the activities they have on site, plus the water park, arcade, bowling, dining etc. We went during Halloween and they had trick or treating and a costume parade but we didn't know to bring costumes and we live far so we couldn't go back home to grab them. The kids were a little sad to not have theor costumes like everyone else.

This was our family's second visit , we enjoyed the Halloween themed decor. We are excited to see what Christmas would look like. Kids were exhausted right after story book time, and went right to sleep.

Had a great experience at the Great wolf Lodge. We received an early check in, room was great and super clean. Water park was clean, fun and enjoyable. Restaurant staff was not too friendly but we didn’t spend much time there so wasn’t that important. Recommended to everyone I know!

Summary Heading: Turned dirty and hoodlums taken over.
Summary: Not what it use to be. Gonna miss this place.  I hope management can figure out a solution. No longer a clean environment. Turned hostile ,loud and obnoxious. Was never like this.  In the past I've rated this place to be 5 stars.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf is even better than I expected!
Summary: During our stay for 4 nights, our child always had something to do that made him smile, laugh, and have fun, something to eat that is even tree nut free, and was constantly amazed at more fun that was offered. Waterslides for all, activities galore. Everyone is welcomed and accommodated. We had a blast, so I hope you get to go!!!

From the online booking, to the first monent you walk through the doors and throughout our stay, The Great Wolf Lodge does Not disappoint. My family consisting of two children 5 & 9) and my wife booked a last minute weekend family trip. We booked quickly and easily online after utilizing the online assistance via text option, which helped and resolved with all of our questions prior to booking. Believing we’d just be going to another water park with a hotel attached and not having much background information, we decided to try out a new destination and booked Great Wolf. The instant we arrived we were greeted by genuinely pleasant and greatly helpful staff who pointed our children to the cupcake decoration station while we checked in. The check in process was simple and quick,

Summary Heading: Nana took the kids to Cali
Summary: This is a great place to bring kids for vacation.  With all of the activities, water park, bowling, putt putt, and food places you could literally spend a weekend here and never leave the resort!  There is so much to do!

Had a Great time, my kids loved it. My wife can't stop telling everyone about it. All the prices I think were fair, it didn't put a dent in my wallet like I had thought it was. We are already planning our next trip out there, maybe try to have a Birthday party there. Thumbs up !

we had way more fun than disneyland at this place. ITS A MUST DO ! 100 pct. all the staff had a can do attitude and a willingness to help out at all times. i will be going again in the near future for sure!

After visiting all of the Southern California Water parks this year, we ended up at GWL and glad to say that this was our best overall experience!Pro:1) Guest Experience: Overall friendly staff who seem to understand that its all about allowing kids to be kids and families to enjoy themselves.  2) Theme: Resort works hard to live their brand from lobby to room details. 3) Food:  Hot food hot, cold food cold, with lots of adult beverage options.  Most impressive: was the character breakfast buffet which was clean, well stocked, attentive, tasty.  Truly great guest experience!.  Check out the outside grill for more food options.  4) Clean:  Water park, room, and bathrooms, and restaurant buffet,were CLEAN!  Impressive effort to keep a very busy resort as clean as possible.

We stay here when we go to Disneyland and love it! The water park is the best part! Beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious, staff is friendly, parking garage is free, close to Disneyland, so many things to do at this hotel. Fun for the entire family

Took my Son for his birthday.  He was thrilled.  Smiled the whole time and enjoyed all the activities. I intend to go again with the family after the holidays.  I want a shot at that breakfast buffet.  I missed out this trip.

We had a great time... The staff was wonderful... A way better value then Disneyland!!! Are room was clean and easy to access... lots of activities to keep the kids busy even when not in the water park!!

We took this trip to celebrate a birthday and my sons bone marrow transplant anniversary.  The hotel staff was amazing at making my children feel important, they accommodated all my sons disability needs, and the room was so comfortable.  The attractions were great for all ages and the dining options perfect.

Summary Heading: Our kids had the time of their lives!
Summary: Our kids are 6 and 4 and had such a blast here.  We only stayed one night and definitely could've used another.  It is a bit expensive but no more than any other theme type parks.  At this age we didn't do the MagicQuest stuff but I can see how that would be a lot of fun in another year or 2.  The Wold Den Suite was perfect for kids and they are a little out of the way which isn't a bad thing.  The food was decent and their are drinks for adults!  The water park is incredible for any age - my husband had a blast too on some of the slides.  We are going back next year for sure.

We have been to Great Wolf several times and this time a few changes were made that made it less pleaseant. They have incorporated a new  strategy in an effort to cut down on the lines on the stairs to the slides. Basically,  they only permit approximately 5 to 7 inflatable rafts of each type  to be rotated which decreases the lines on the stairs. The issue: the lines now are at the slides exit pools and create a situation where you literally watch someone take a rafts, head up the stairs go down. You what this happen several different times which essentially creates “lost slide time” on the slides since there are large gaps when the slides are empty while the raft transition takes place. We would get rafts, head up and when we got to the top, all seven slides which required

Highly recommend for families. Such a great family experience. Lots to do for kids and the restaurants are great! Had lots to do for the kids...themed for Halloween which was fun for the kids. Would definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf uses your credit card later.
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge takes your credit card to charge food etc and uses your card later. I stayed in Aug and on October 11 I was charged $252.40 and on October 14 I was charged $252.40 on my Nordstrom VISA. During my stay fit two days I paid 297.00 for my room, $380 in incidentals plus two months later 504.80. I have called many times and around I’m circles. They says it’s a mistake then charged me again. Now saying new incidentals. I’m on a trip and needed my card available. They have been no help and have no customer service. Buyer beware. I never authorized Great Wolf Lodge to do as they please with my credit card months later. Go to Disneyland instead. Better customer service.

My family and I only were able to stay 1 night.  We squeezed it in before Halloween Disneyland and then a Disney cruise.  Hotel staff were amazing and accommodated us very well with making sure we could easily get into our room after Disneyland.  We did not get to experience all the attractions.  Only the waterpark for ~4 hours.  Areas were very clean.  Only minor complaint, the beds were uncomfortable and the pull out couch was very uncomfortable.  Other than that, the room was clean and accommodating with a mini-fridge, etc.

This resort is among the best resorts that I've visited. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. They treated me and my children with so much love and respect. It made my trip enjoyable and I will definitely recommend that everyone go to experience it.

We just had the best stay at Great wolf lodge garden grove. Kids loved the waterpark. Overall experience was amazing. Best hotel stay for family ever. Restaurants were great. Loved every minute of stay

We loved the fact that we could arrive before check in and enjoy the water park until our room was ready at 4pm.  We also returned to enjoy the waterpark after checkout.  Great value fir families with young kids and tweens.

Brought 4 11 year olds here and 2 13 year olds.  All had so much fun. The highlight wasn’t the water park for the 11 year olds.  Their favorite was the wand!  It  was all they really wanted to do!  The water park was a hit for all of us.

Go for Howl o ween, super fun trick or treating with the kids and monster dance party...great memories were made! Water park is alwaysfun, safe and well laid out. We love the bowling and the arcade too

We stayed here during Oct 2018 for 4 nights. My two kids had a blast at the water park. My only complaint is that the prices for the other activities like bowling and golf are expensive if you are doing it more than once for each kid. Bowling was $6 a game and golf $7.

From the moment we walked it you felt a happy and friendly environment. My kids loved it and they cant wait to go back. The pool area was amazing and fun for all ages. The rooms were nice and clean l. The hotel staff very friendly. Loved my stay.

Great atmosphere! We stayed in a normal suite. Two queens and a pull out couch for 4 adults and 2 kids. It was a little cramped, but it worked. The room was warm and inviting. Bathroom has low tub and water pressure was good. Mini fridge does not have a ice box in it. Water park was awesome for my boys. My 10 yr old does not know how to swim and he was able to go down the water slides. There are life vest  for the young and older children. I myself could not go on water slide due to my foot in cast☹. Food and bar inside the swim area. You could spend all day there. Plenty of restaurants and other food source on property. My wife and I are looking to book again when the cast comes off. Hope this helps.
