If you want fun all around for all ages this is the place to go. They really do a good job at being on top of safety and comfort. Our kids had an amazing time and are already asking to go back. The only reason I’m giving a 4 out of 5 is because the dinner buffet at Loose Moose was very disappointing flavor wise for the price.

My kids husband and i had a great time! Only issue was there wasn’t a birthday poster on our door like there should have been and the Manager (blonde hair) was extremely rude and not helpful at all when we paid $105.55 for the interactive wands and i wasn’t asked if i had the pass or not which include either a topper,wand,or belt long story short buy the pass and make sure to use it down at mapquest i only got refunded for the wands and a voucher which i will probably lose for the games i paid for that are included in the pass. My mistake on my part but if they would of asked if i bought passes it would of been a lot easier! Not to mention don’t they see that you bought passes when you give your info?Pillows are flat so ask for extra!!

If you have a family, you have to stay there, so much fun for everybody including mum and dad. Would definitely recommend,  and was a great few days had by all. Everything you need is there. Fun, fun, fun.

Summary Heading: Fun Times at Great Wolf Lodge.  Busy from morning to night.
Summary: Superb stay at the Great Wolf Lodge.  I thought it was a little spendy, however, when I got there and seen everything that was offered I was so impressed.  Do not hesitate to book.  Try to book in advance for the 50% discount.  It was so worth every penny.

Everything was good. Not a lot of things to do with teenagers and sign up for shuttle to Disneyland when you make reservations because they do not have many shuttles that run. They also don’t tell you about the shuttle before hand.

This was was my second time visiting the only complaint i have is the wet bread on floor from the visitors  needs a solution and because the majority of the workers are teens in the water area the should be reminded they will work with a lot of kids so patience is key. i only experienced one problem with this so i wont let one worker stop us from returning!

Hotel was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and comfortable. My daughter had so much fun in the waterpark that we are already looking into booking another trip next month for her birthday.

Summary Heading: Overall Great stay, beautiful decor during halloween, but dirty rooms
Summary: This was our 2nd visit with GWL and both times we had issues with our stay. The rooms are tidy, but very dirty. Everyday the kids had blacken feet from the rugs and in between the bunk bed and beds, were piles of lints, dust, dirt. We sneezed a lot during our stay. I hope the rugs will get a deep clean soon. We understand it is a hotel but there should be regular deep cleaning then just the vacuuming. The towels are raggedy with rips but still used.  Upon leaving on our last day, as we walked out with our luggages, a housekeeper cleaning another room asked if we were checking out and we replied yes. We didn’t think anything of it until we went back to grab something we forgot to find that the tip left for the house keeper cleaning OUR room was missing. I think the staff needs to

We came not really knowing what great wolf lodge was and was so happy with our stay. We have a 2 and 4 year old and they had a blast! Huge rooms, so many amenities, and fun little activities during our stay. We will definitely v2e coming back!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with great amenities for a good price
Summary: We stayed at GWL because we had visited the one in Washington before and they were running a promotion that included Disneyland tickets and this was perfect since we were planning our trip to Disney anyway. We used the pool are just one time in the 5 days but it was amazing as always!

We had a blast on October. 8 2018 we celebrate my daughters and niece birthday it was wonderful my kids love to get the free stuff n go to the magiquest hunt n the coins that we got for them they love the paw pass it had so much stuff next time we are getting the wolf pass

Visited with my daughter and her friend as a part of her 13th birthday gift 10/6 and stayed 1 night.  Arriving: Start off be saying be easy to pay $18 a night for parking despite staying at the overpriced hotel.  Check-in: relatively easy did the pre-check in and got into our room early at 2:15p. This was the easy part.  Room: was standard nothing special about it dbl beds with sleeper sofa TV bath with toilet and shower/tub combo. The sink was outside the room for washing face, hands, etc...  Price: started off at $399 for 1 night ended up being a $600 stay huh figure that one out.  Waterpark: very nice and clean, but of course very crowded on a Saturday. Halloween themed and no where to sit or place our belongings to ride slides. Walked around at least for an hour to find a

We went to GWL in the middle of the week during my son's fall break. The hotel was not very busy and since it was October it was decorated for Halloween. We went with my almost 6 and almost 3 year old sons. My oldest son had a blast at the waterpark and enjoyed the mini bowling and mini golf. My younger son was not as interested in those things, but watched and hung out with us. My husband also took my older son around and they completed the MagiQuest game and my son was dubbed a Master Magi the day we left. We had an upgraded room with bunk beds for the boys, which they loved and there were things in the room that responded to their wands. My boys were perfectly satisfied with the pizza, burgers and chicken they could get from the restaurants, but we did the character breakfast

Summary Heading: Park Great, Hotel Rooms not so much
Summary: The water park was great but crowded with very few areas available to sit.The Room was clean but there were loud grinding and banging noises through out the night which I believe were water pipes.   Too bad you cannot use the park with out staying at the resort, it would of been better if We could of stayed else where.

It was a good weekend stay. My kids enjoyed themselves us No the outdoor pool. It was crowded on Sunday but Monday was just perfect. Story time is nice but needs a little more organization on seating area and lines to take pictures

The rides were thrilling enough for the ages 4-45+.  I would recommend to bring water shoes to walk and wait in line.  The room was in good condition and clean.  It was very convenient to have the restaurants on site.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay/have fun with family and friends
Summary: This place shattered my expectations.  The rooms are very spacious and the beds were some of the most comfortable I've slept in.  The food on property was great.  Only recommendation I would make is to offer more breakfast options.  There's a Dunkin Donuts on premise as well as a buffet you can hit up for breakfast.  It would be nice to get something more along the lines of a dedicated bakery.The water park and all the other attractions were amazing.  There was a good sized crowd at the water park, but not really any wait times to go on the slides.  Longest wait time seemed to be on the indoor body boarding.  They have an arcade and mini bowling lanes as well.  We had a great time here and I would highly recommend it.

Great wolf lodge is a great family and kid friendly resort, never have to leave resort all you need is in one place, great restaurant , fun center, games and story time for the kids, magic quest game , great place highly recommended.

The room was comfortable, clean and spacious. The water park was a hit with our kids and my wife and I relaxed outside poolside. Dinner are the buffet was great. I stuffed myself. We went with our neighbors so the kids played together and the adults chilled. Really did enjoy ourselves.

Our son loved it.Food was better than expected and potent potables were better than that.  Every ride was fun in it's own right and the lines move pretty quickly.  Park cleanliness could be better maintained throughout the day and I wish I got more time on the Flowrider, but overall it was a great time and good way to make memories.

One major incident only an hour after arriving:  My 9 year old was thrown into the wave pool, by his lower leg, by a bigger (11-12 year old?) kid.  Luckily he wasn’t horribly injured, but he was very upset.  My husband immediately complained to the lifeguard on duty in the wave pool area and all he said was sorry and he’d “keep an eye” on the kid who had assaulted my child.   We left the water park upset and I have filed a complaint with Great Wolf.   I feel the kid who threw my son in the water should have been asked to leave.   We stayed four nights and did not see the kid after that.   Notibly we never saw his parents at any point either.  I must say that the rest of our time there was much better.   The staff in the restaurants were so kind, helpful and friendly!   The food

Summary Heading: Excellent family location, something for kids of all ages
Summary: Wonderful location, our family has kids from the age of 3 to 24 and there was something for everyone. The adults also had a great time. The Lodge restaurant is outstanding.  Several different food outlets available to fit any budget.

Great place to bring the whole family. Young or old you'll have fun. Food was not overpriced and it was pretty good. I have two boys and they never get tired of going there. The staff are great too, they make you feel at home. Lifeguards in the water park are very nice too.

We had a wonderful time at the Great Wolf Lodge!! The staff were extremely kind and extended themselves to make sure we were having the best vacation ever! The water park was a lot of fun for all ages! The breakfast with the characters was a big hit with our kids and the food was really good! We’ll be back soon!

It was an awesome stay, I definitely recommend it. My boys had fun specially at the water park. The food at the lodge was really good for the price we paid. I did not get the theme room because my boys are older but the room that we got was clean & well managed.

We took advantage of the online check-in. When we got there, we were assisted right away. The mobile check-out was a breeze. The reaort features various activities which caters to different age levels. I will definitely go back there and stay longer. And i will recommend the resort to friends.

It was our first stay at Great Wolf Lodge. The check in  Staff was friendly.  Would recommend bringing water shoes for water park. My husband and I relaxed as the children played. Highly recommend for a duly vacation.

This resort is a wonderful weekend getaway with the kids. The food is great, pool area is clean and ideal for each age level, the beer selection was great and the extra activities for kids made it ideal.

We came here for one night to celebrate my son’s birthday!  The front desk staff were awesome.  They have really streamlined the checkin process compared to previous visits.  They also changed the way you stand in line for the water rides, which also was an excellent change for the better!  Magiquest staff were awesome at this location as well!!

My 8yo who celebrated her birthday there last weekend.  We all had a great time except that she lost her camera that she received as a present that day and no one turned it in.  It's disappointing that some people who can actually afford to stay there would also actually take things that don't belong to them. C'mon, let's practice some honesty. My daughter was so heartbroken when we left the resort.  At least the staff could've offered us something other than sorry. Other than that, we had a great time.

Summary Heading: A fabulous time for the whole family!
Summary: We had a blast! Everyone had a great time. There was not one bit of whining or complaining! The Great Wolf Lodge had lots of activities that everyone got into, from questing to bowling, waterpark, great food and beverages, fun kids activities!

The hotel was very nice! Loved the theme throughout the hotel. The  hotel activities kept the whole family busy and excited for the next one. Water park was great. Almost no waiting!! Such a great experience! Can’t wait to go back

My family and I had an amazing stay! Brandy at the front Desk was absolutely amazing, she was so helpful & let us know about all the different activities going on around the hotel. Then, Brinley was our personal assistant, she texted us important info about checking in & out! We had a blast during our stay. I’d recommend this place to everyone!!!

Summary Heading: No need to leave the Lodge
Summary: Perfect family vacation. We came here for Spring Break and it was amazing. The Customer Service is excellent. We purchased the Wolf Pass for the kids, and loved it. They got to do everything at the Lodge. The place was very clean and convenient for families. We never left the place in 4 days. Plenty of activities for the kids. Lots of food options, we ate at the buffet for breakfast one day and one time for dinner too. Also the food around the pool area was great too. Drink options for the adults also available.

Summary Heading: Bloody sheets and late check in
Summary: Great wolf is an amazing resort for both kids and adults. A wonderful pool area with so much to do. Their water staff were always on point and  food options reasonable and decent. The kiddie shows and events were a good addition. Unfortunately, our rooms weren’t ready as promised (more than an hour after the slated check in time) and the bed sheets had obviously smears of blood. The staff fixed it immediately (we left the room) but no one followed up w us. They tack on additional fees to what originally appears a great price and I didn’t appreciate that.

This is our third time visiting and we recommend it to all of our friends. No sun screen, you don't have to worry about the weather and it's never crowded. The food is OK, but very convenient. The arcade is fun, but expensive. Some of the games weren't working.

Came on a Sunday for 2 days at great wolf. We were here for the opening day 19 February 2016, this was our 2nd trip. Kids had a blast food was great and the water park never disappoints. Breakfast buffet is always awesome, and there’s so many options for picky eaters!!

Had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge.  Everything was pretty positive.  I think my only suggestion on improvements would be to move the queen bed over a bit so we could put a side table for the person sleeping on that side and not be squished against the wall.  Only you guys need a shuttle to Disneyland.   We will be back for sure!!

This is our third trip to Great Wolf Lodge. They were running a Fall promotion which we took advantage. We stayed for only 1 night but did a late check out (2pm) which I highly recommend. If you have an 11am check out but stay at the water park that day, you’ll have to pay $24 for parking when leaving. Late check out waived the 2nd day parking plus we got to sleep in, no rush going to the water park again and had plenty of time to go back in the room to take shower. We have 3 girls who wanted to do the scavenger magi game so we decided to do the paw pass (worth every penny). They spent our last day completing the stages and redeeming the items on the pass. As for the room, plenty of space for 2 adults and 3 kids. Regular room is the best way to go since we spent most of our time

Summary Heading: Great for Kids but FILTHY Carpet
Summary: PROS: * Water park on property included with nightly rate * A lot to do for the kids * Themed rooms available * Room soundproofing was surprisingly good * Great location for Disney and close to Target if you forget anything * Lots of food options on property and nearby * Free daily activities/entertainment  CONS: * Carpet was FILTHY (big and little stains here and there, socks/feet turn dirty just walking around, had a weird moist feeling even though we always changed first after swimming) * Bed was so-so (not uncomfortable, but not comfortable either) * Room is pricey for quality (take away the Wolf Den and the room is a Four Points Sheraton or Best Western Plus at best); 3 star property but 4-4.5 star prices * Paid activities can get pricey if you do multiple times * Parking

Summary Heading: The best place for young children
Summary: One night to spend strictly with kids. One can arrive in the morning and use the water park even if your room is not ready. Many slides and family rides. Food is very tasty and not expensive. Big size fries shareable $6. Humber $7. Mac and cheese $5 You don’t need to carry money or cards around. All your info is on your wrist band. Once in a While I found great deals to come out here for $240 a night all included. Enjoy!

If you have kiddos, go here, fun for kids and adults. Food is a bit pricey, but it’s decent and even the room service was good too. We will definitely be going back to take the kids, the aquatic park is literally the best indoor park I’ve been to.

This is a great place to visit with kids. We visited for a birthday celebration in a large party. There are really affordable rates for hotel and attractions included in the rate.. Mid week and advance purchase are best rates. Lots of fun activities, close by and onsite dining options.

Summary Heading: Maximum Capacity = Decreased Fun for the whole family
Summary: We came celebrating our daughters 7th birthday. The resort was at maximum capacity which made the lines extremely long, people bumping into each other, no open chairs and an overall level of stress that we weren't expecting. We were never able to get an inner tube at the lazy river nor did we commit to the long lines. We weren't staying too long at the resort and didn't want to waste it waiting in 45 minute to an hour long lines, who knows they could have been longer.  The bathrooms were super gross, most likely due to the high volumes of patrons. We might try this resort again, but never on a weekend as the front desk said that the weekends are always like this. Everyone was really nice though and if you don't mind waiting in lines they have some pretty cool attractions.  The

We went for my daughter's 7th birthday and it did not disappoint.  A bit pricey for a Saturday night stay, but when you take into consideration you have 2 days at a 'theme park'  that includes the hotel it is not bad. If you book in advance and take advantage of a good discount rate it is a major score (NOTE:  Taxes and fees are steep).  Perfect for our kids' ages (7 & 8).  Maybe not as exciting for older teens.  Rooms are super spacious.  The water park is kept VERY clean.  Was so impressed with the restroom/shower areas.  And the convenience of the wristband to pay for all the resort amenities is awesome.  We will definitely return.

Unexpected great time for the whole family.  Hotel was super clean, staff nice.  My kids loved the little bowling alley and the arcade.  We had a range in ages from 3-10 and they all loved the water park and was able to keep busy for hours.  Loved the morning yoga and reading time.  Truly was a hidden treasure.

Best resort for family vacations. Love this place;  the theme and amount of things they have at the hotel to do is amazing!!! Will come back again once my baby gets a little older but still had so much for even toddlers to do!!

We booked 3 nights at Great Wolf Lodge. Our kids love the water park and didn't want to leave. It 's clean, and lots of fun. There are lots of activities for kids (story telling, Arcade, etc.,) The room is clean. Overall, it is an great vacation and lots of awesome memories at Great Wolf Lodge.

My kids, my husband and I really enjoyed the place. We had gone to the one in Centralia, WA. But this one is a lot bigger more slides. 1 day was not enough for us, it was so much fun. Staff were very friendly, I liked the fact that someone was able to txt with me in case I needed anything or had questions.

Great place close to home, did the Groupon. Wolf Den Suite was great for the 3 girls. Food was good and had plenty of choices. A bit pricey. Overall stay was great, water park had plenty of slides for adults too. Will definately come back again!

Stayed one night with a family of 6. It was a good time for everyone so I can say that it is good for all ages.Rooms were nice and clean, but the beds weren't the most comfortable and the lighting in the bathroom was very dim. Staff were friendly and the lifeguards on duty were very attentive watching all the swimmers.Food was pretty good, but nothing amazing. (We ate at the Loose Moose Breakfast buffet, Hungry as a Wolf, Buckets, Bear Paw, and Dunkin Donuts) Best thing oddly enough was probably the hot dogs at Bucket in the waterpark area.Waterpark was fun, but your fun may be interrupted if their is a bodily fluid accident. That happened in 2 areas on our check-in day and once on the check-out day.Waterpark bathrooms had enough bathrooms and provided showers with shampoo and

Had trouble with my room the staff did everything they could to provide help only to offer me a better deal next time I came into saying they would email me with all the details. It's been a few weeks now and that email never showed up so it was just a lie to get me to back down and shut up...

Summary Heading: Filthy rooms but waterpark is fine
Summary: The rooms are disgusting. Filthy carpets and crap leftover from previous occupants scattered under sofas and beds. Please do something to improve housekeeping! Waterpark was clean and well run. Courteous and friendly staff.

I'm sure it was not the norm, but watching waterpark staff taunt the young girls at the top of the slides left me unable to feel comfortable allowing our kids to play without me right there...And our kids were super disappointed that there were no new magiquest games to play since our previous visit (one which we experienced no taunting waterpark staff)

Summary Heading: If you haven’t gone your missing out!
Summary: I recommend this place I have taken my kids 3xs this year we love it,fun for the whole family I recommend the kid cabin it’s super cute kids enjoy it,breakfast is delicious don’t forget to take your 5min break at the outside bar while the kids are enjoying the outdoor pool :)

My kids had lots of fun at the water park, overall public restrooms and showers were clean. We stayed two nights, room cleanning service for the first night has not the best review. We    however; found our room clean when we first arrived.  Room theme was fun.  Food is not expensive, but is not the teasties either.  Arcade was fun, bowling experience was fun. Hotel personel kind and helpful. Would like to go back

We did Disneyland during the day and the water park at Great Wolf Lodge in the evening. The water slides were a blast and even my 4 year old could do most of the slides. We can’t wait to go back again!

Our wolf pack had a blast for 4 days at GW. It was perfectly located near the theme parks and restaurants. There is never time to be bored at this hotel. Our kiddos were occupied all day long! I highly recommend this to families on vacation.

Our family of 5 had a good time, we were a little disappointed on indoor water park size. My teens didn’t have as much fun as my 7 year old. Hotel caters more for small children & not teens. Hotel was clean, food was good and fresh, staff is very friendly. Best of all they made my 7 year old feel very special on his birthday mini vacation.

My kids didnt even hesitate when asked.  GWL over Disnayland ANY DAY!  so very fun for all ages.  There is always something to do.  As a parent, I felt safe with my kids swimming in the park or doing quests around the resort.  The staff is all too friendly and very tentative to the kids.  Safety 1st!!!

This is a great place to take your family for a quick getaway... Kids of all ages (and adults) will have a blast. Resort is super clean and the entire staff makes you feel welcome. Can't wait to return again...

The amenities were plentiful and clean. The room was great; sizeable and comfortable. The water park and other attractions kept us going as there was always something to do during the day. The biggest two things for my family was how clean and convienent everything was. We practically didn't have to leave our entire stay. I definitely recommend Great Wolf for all families. You can have a great time on a budget.

Was awesome and everyone was so nice and helpful. the room was nice and clean. I absolutely enjoyed the water parl. I like the family atmosphere. My family will definitely be there again soon. I definitely recommend it

Great Wolf lodge is like Las Vegas for kids.  There are plenty of children amenties (water park, bowling, mini golf, arcade).  Be prepared to pull out your wallet as everything costs extra $$.  The food at the resort was fine and priced similarly to any restaurant. The staff overall were friendly.  The resort was clean.  The hotel rooms were just ok...similar to any standard hotel room.  Overall, the kids had a blast I just wish some of the extras were included in the price.

What a trip! My family and I will definitely be back! We had great customer service from the start. Great Wolf Lodge offers a pre-check in that you are able to do from your cell phone. Shortly after my pre-check in I got a text message from a what a trip! My family and I will definitely be back! We had great customer service from the start. Great Wolf Lodge offers a pre-check in that you are able to do from your cell phone. Shortly after my pre-check and I got a text message from a  Hotel employee giving me updates on my room being ready and asking if I needed anything in advance. At that time I asked if we could have the same floor level and possibly be close to friends who are also staying there at that time. She was more than happy to oblige and was able to switch our room

Family friendly with an amazing staff. We were able to keep our family entertained at all times with activities the resort provided. The selection for the breakfast buffet selection was great and the characters where just the sweetest!

2 of the boys had asthma attacks and we all left with headaches after 3 hours. we didn't even check into our room.  maybe better ventilation or keeping the doors open to the outside pool area/bar will benefit.  a roof that opens to help ventilate the chlorine and chemicals.

Summary Heading: Great time was had by all
Summary: Celebration for my daughter's birthday. We took all three kids ages 5-13 and they all enjoyed it tremendously. Food was pretty good especially at the Grizzly Jack's and Buckets. Pizza is pretty good and reasonable too. Loved the Wine Down Service.  Staff is friendly and took good care of us. We will be back soon

the only problem i had was a clogged toilet in our suite. took long time to get it fixed. ugh they would have change our room but rather had us waited and had some one fixed for us. it takes a long time for housekeeping to arrived

I always have a great time here at Great Wolf Lodge.  They have a very friendly staff and my son always has a great time full of wonderful memories.  And they always have great deals.  The water park was fun, the food choices are great (my son loves the pizza) and so many things to do for the kids.  They even have drinks for the big guys!  Don't miss out!

We had a great time. The kids loved everything from swimming, magiquest, bowling, arcade,scoops, the themed room. The resort was clean, cute decor, friendly staff with excellent customer service! The only thing that was a little time consuming were the elevators. They were small and took longer than normal but overall the experience was lots of fun where the kids did not want to leave.

Summary Heading: I want to give them 5 stars but I can’t
Summary: I love these resorts and have gone to 3 different locations in 3 states. Please for the safety of yourself and your kids DO NOT RIDE THE ORANGE AND PURPLE SLIDE!!!!!!. My son and I went backwards and flipped when we came out.  Causing him to be injured and so scared he refused to get on any other slides with me. Which was hard because this is what we do together.  My friend fell off the inner tube and it went over her while her daughter was still on top of it. When they came out her daughter flipped and hit her head on the bottom of the pool. At least 5 people who were in line and saw this came up to us later and told us they had similar issues with that slide. And 3 staff members told me their stories as well.  This all happened on my sons actual bday. Which ruined a lot of the

This place is fantastic. My kids absolutely love it and have such great memories. This is our second time back and plan on doing it more often. The fun of the water park has helped overcome fear of getting faces wet and enhanced their desire to learn to swim. Highly recommend this for families. A bit pricey which is prohibitive from going more often, but a great experience.

Summary Heading: A lot of money for an average experience
Summary: Upon arrival the lady that checked us in was extremely nice and was very friendly, She made the check - in  experience an easy and pain free experience.  However immediately after things began to go down hill from there... When we arrived to our room our Tv wasn't working properly, which was no big deal as my children had brought their Playstation so we could watch Netflix. We hooked up the playstation as we had done the first time we stayed at great wolf and it was working just fine however we could not locate a wifi signal. So I called front desk to ask them about the wifi and they told me they would send a tech up. Once the tech arrived to the room I allowed my two older children to take my debit card and go downstairs to the gift shops or too the arcade so that he could

We are locals and my eight year old selected Great Wolf as his birthday. Easy check in through their app. Fun that all guests receive wolf ears. They had just started decorating for Halloween and did a great job in the elevator area with a Dia de Los Muertos display. They were in the middle of building a little haunted house for kids. While our crew had fun at the water park, the highlight of the stay was the Magic Quest wand scavenger hunt. Our three kids shared one wand ($40 for the wand and accessories, $15 for the game itself which you have three days to finish). Even though we have already checked out, we've taken our little one back to keep playing the game. Best part was feeling like you are at club med and using the wristband for everything, including purchasing

The experience was outstanding. I took my kids and we all had a blast. Make sure to bring extra money for food and entertainment. The water park has many attractions that will keep you occupied. They should make more convenience and can lower prices for on site food / restaurants. You will definitely have a lot of fun

Room was not as clean for a supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Refrigerator only kept the drinks Luke warm, carpet needed to be shampooed, bunk beds for kids were Dusty which pause my son to have a severe allergy attack and unable to enjoy water park

My family and i went here for my sons birthday for the first time. We had the best time. There is never any wait time to anything. The service was amazing. Everything is clean, the staff is friendly and we will definately be back.

What’s not to love. 2.5 year old completely satisfied. Husband satisfied with food and beer. Hotel theme was on point. Not crowded at all for a Wednesday-Thursday stay-cation in September! Staff always smiling. Just Perfect

Summary Heading: Family of 5 with one kid in wheelchair
Summary: This place was fabulous.  The supervisors at the water park were more than helpful assisting us with my child in a wheelchair.  Can't say enough about them.  The staff were also very friendly and helpful.  Great time to go very little crowds.  Very safe environment.

We love the Great Wolf Lodge.  It has something for everyone, my 18 month old loved the area for small children, my 9 year old love the big slides and my husband and I loved it all.  Both the kids enjoyed the activities and parties and bowling!

Where to begin? Soooo much to discuss about this property. I hope a general manager reads this review since I spent years in the hospitality field and I used to do marketing. But i haven't seen much feedback from GWL on these boards so I'm not very hopeful.  The good: we got a good deal on groupon so it wasn't a very expensive stay. The rooms and water park seemed clean. My 6 year old son loved the experience. The staff, for the most part, were friendly and efficient. There were many activities to keep the kids busy throughout the stay. The lifeguards appeared very diligent. The wristband that they give out is very smart since it acts as a room key and credit card as well. I wish the kids wristband could open the doors as well.  The bad: the design of the hotel seemed like it

My children have been wanting to go here for over a year. It is a bit pricey but based our kids enjoyment! It was worth it to see their smiles. We didn’t do the additional add-ons. The next time we will save up. These add-ins include going around the hotel on scavenger hunts. We signed up for the email notifications so that the next time we will get better hotel discounts. It was great that they had life-vests available at no charge! Our kids had a great time in every water slide. Of course it was crowded! I would suggest that the day you check in, arrive early because the check in line can be very long. Or if you actually book through the website, utilize the online check in service. You can’t do this if you book through a third party. The kids loved getting their little wolf

There is so for the whole family to do! You never have to leave the hotel to be entertained and have loads of fun. From food to the water park to relaxation there is not anything else we could ask for. The entire hotel is clean and the theme of the hotel stretches throughout ALL of the hotel.

Loved everything about the resort. My only wish would be for drop off child care, so the adults can play a bit too. Also be prepared to be surrounded by sugar.  We brought healthy snacks and lots of water to keep in the room.

If you have kids and you live in California, this would be a great place for a stay cation; however be prepared to spend lots of money; because everything tends to be a little overprice though I guess it is expensive to maintain a huge water-park like this. A single night averages between $200-$300 although you can stay in the water park until closing time even after check out. There are restrooms and showers located inside the water park. One of my favorite things was the indoor arcade and the spa for little girls. Everything was designed for little kids and teenagers and there's plenty of stuff to do for a 2 day trip. I recommend going here to the end of September since its the end of the summer and less crowds which are good for the water park rides.

Great Wolf Lodge 🐺 is a perfect vacation place for the young and old! Everyone that worked there were kind and helpful! We had a great time. This was our second visit in six weeks. I can’t wait to go back!!!

We spent 4th of July with friends who also had two kids at Great Wolf Lodge. We shared a two bedroom suite which offered an ok room but the highlight was a cute custom cabin inspired bunk beds which the kids loved. It was expensive but worthwhile to have access to the wonderful water park. We spent two days and enjoyed the toddler area, the multiple pools, wave pool and large rides fit for both adults and adventurous kids. We opted for a cabana which was a great choice to have a private place for all of our items. They offer cocktails and wine plus basic snack bar food which was just ok. After the water park they have loads of kids music and dancing classes. We upgraded for he character breakfast which was fun but not sure we would do it more than once. Overall it was awesome

Summary Heading: Fun for all ages and clean!
Summary: Park has both indoor and outdoor sections.  Great place for 1-100 year-old! The wait times for the big rides were minimal and all the other areas had no wait. Towels and water are provided. Bars and food everywhere, (food and drinks are not included).

My family and friends had a wonderful experience!  It was my son’s 10th birthday and it was a surprise. He was excited when we arrived and even more ecstatic that his friends were going to join us. We all, kids and adults, had a great time.  We can’t wait to go back.

great indoor water park, great food nice prices on the food. Go off season or on a week day and use the deals tab on their website to save a lot of money and less crowds in the water park too. One night is enough for locals to do all the things in the water park.

My family and friends attended with the International Down syndrome Coalition event and the staff was amazing with our kids and families! Thanks for giving us and incredible experience we will never forget.

I would have like to enjoy the place for the price i paid...seems they need to control the max capacity for the guest staying there...would make them alot more happy...i am unhappy with my trip to the  crowded wolf lodge

My 2 year old daughter was in heaven.  The adults had a great time as well. We love the use of the wristbands as key card, money and garage key.  Mid week was the time to go. The crowds were small and the lines were short. We can't wait to do it again.

What did I pay for is the question that I'm asking myself after this past weekend. Almost $750 on the resort for 2 nights so what I paid for was a water park open from 9-830 & a basic hotel room. Was it a fun time yes...do you ask yourself at 830 what you do with older kids now yes...will I go back no. I'd rather go to circus circus in Vegas for alot cheaper and way more things to do. If someone asked me the should I go question I would absolutely dont waist your money!

Every single employee we encountered went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing experience.  The front desk was very helpful and informative.  The characters greeted my kids and spent ample time dancing with them, giving hugs and high fives, and allowing us to take pictures.  We never felt rushed.  The lifeguards were awesome and friendly and the food was great!  We can’t wait to go again!

It was an amazing experience. I live only 30 minutes away and it felt like I was in a different state. The hotel, hotel staff, food and water park were all great. I recorded my experience on snapchat and received lots of messages that it looks cool, oh how fun, where is this at etc... as you can see even my friends enjoyed the lodge :). I will definitely be coming back.

Summary Heading: Great places for kids of all ages and families of all sizes
Summary: We love Great Wolf Lodge. The kids have so much fun and get worn out by all of the activities. Stuff to do for older and younger kids. Bars at every turn for the adults and Magi Quest is a winner for them in the evenings. Safe and friendly atmosphere.

We've stayed here 6 times, so I feel I have had enough experience staying at this property to come to a conclusion. While the waterpark is naturally a hit with our children, the price does not reflect the room nor the service I would expect for the cost. While they have frequent "deals", the extra fees, taxes and parking ($18/day) really add up. The rooms are consistently poorly heated/cooled, inconsistent hot water, uncomfortable beds with sheets like sandpaper and cheap pillows. Service is not friendly nor accommodating and we've had several rude interactions with staff. Food leaves a lot to be desired, so we find ourselves leaving property for every meal which is inconvenient. I feel we have given it a fair chance, however we will not be staying there again.

We upgraded our suite to the room with bunk beds the kids loved it but for the $80 up charge all it was was a plastic wall and a bunk bed instead of a queen bed that you would get in the lower suite. The resort is great the price is just too much for what you get. We ate one meal there and for less than 24 hours we spent over$500 and we didn't do any of the other attractions or games

Not satisfied with this stay. Was told at Check in if we lose wrist bands they could replace them but forgot to me took its 50 dollars to replace . Also would not allow food into water park and my child is autistic and a very pickey eater d/t sensory issues . Water park bathrooms dirty . Toddler pool closed so many times due to vomit and poop accidents really kind of grossed me out ! Kids had fun though so that’s what matters

Rooms and establishment is clean and everyone friendly. We have been here 3 times in the past year. Such an easy stay and great deal. You can purchase food outside if you want to stretch your budget (lots of options nearby). Tons of free activities and we love the pool outside ... 4yo can play easily and safely in the 3 ft deep pool and the restaurant has yummy adult drinks and food.

Me and my family had the best stay while attending Great Wolf Lodge. The staff was awesome and my kids loved the bunk beds in the wolf den. We couldn’t have asked for a better stay here. Food was awesome and no wait times for the tube rides. Awesome time.

We celebrated my daughter’s birthday at the Great Wolf Lodge. The check in time was 4pm but we arrived earlier and to our surprise the room was already ready. We add a birthday package so there were a birthday poster on the door, balloons, cake, and paw pass card in the room. Then we went to the waterpark and spend most of our time enjoying all the food and activities there. We really had so much fun during our stay at the waterpark.

Attend during the week when the crowds are at a minimum. Great for kids of all ages and plenty of things to do. The kids activities at night at awesome for the smaller kids. My 3 year old grand daughter loved the dance party and jammie jam. We had a great time.

The kids enjoyed the water park to the fullest. My husband and I enjoyed the food. Staff was Excellent. The only downside was the check in time since it's only during a period of time, We had to wait in line to check in for almost 45 minutes. But overall we had a great stay and will definitely be coming back. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

We had a lot of fun. It was very nice and clean. Everyone is so nice there in Anaheim Great Wolf Lodge. I love u can go to the Waterpark before your room is ready. I love how the next day you could go again to the water park before you go home.

Exceptional....the children and Dad couldn't stay out of the water. The water area is clean, staffed with lifeguards at every water slide, pool, boats etc. The front desk responds quickly and restaurants (especially the family kitchen) provides for all choices and dietary needs. The kids are entertained and takes pictures with the Wolf and Racoon.....it is the vacation spot for the whole family

The great wolf lodge was a truly magical and amazing experience for our kids.Great fun for the whole family! The adults had a blast too! I have no complaints at all. We will definetly being going back for another visit and definetly reccomend to others.

This place was great for all ages even for my teenager. There are lots of rides and things to do for small and big kids. Also there is a good court inside where you can buy food and drinks for the adults.

Never thought a whole family can truly enjoy their stay but we did. We didn't parttake in all the activities but still enjoy our stay. The waterpark was the best for our family. The food was great. The buffett breakfast was really nice with the characters coming through.

Fun! Kids loved it! Check in wasn’t as great as other times. Both employees on two different days during our stay were unfriendly and cold. Lots of stairs, it was very hard for my son with muscular dystrophy to enjoy most of he slides. Park isn’t very handicapped accessible. My other kids had a blast.

Summary Heading: Awesome time for families all year long!!!
Summary: We had an AMAZING time celebrating my nieces 9th birthday at Great Wolf Lodge!!! There's so many different things to do and my niece really loved her wand and Wolf Pass!! If you've never been please take tour kids there, they will think your the BEST DAD & MOM IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD!!!!

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge was so much fun
Summary: We had a good experience at great wolf lodge it was our first time. I highly recommend this place the staff were amazing and the resort was clean and had everything you could need in there. when i purchased my packet on line i didn't think of purchasing the birthday packet. i purchased it the next day of our arrival and it was my sons birthday that day. It took less then 20 mins for them to get the birthday packet together so when we w3ent back to the hotel room it was decorated and my son was so surprised. the whole family had a great experience we would defiantly be going back

We had a great time.  Our kids, 5 and 3 loved it.  Food choices are not great nor healthy for the most part.  They have a nice beer selection.  We found ourselves leaving the park to eat.  There are plenty of places around to eat/dine.  Lockers are pricey $15 for a large (which is actually a medium size).  I just think it is ridiculous to charge that much for a locker when you are staying at the hotel.  It is convenient, so you do it for peace of mind.  You can't check into your room until 4 so if you get there at 1, you have no where to put your stuff.  The next day, you have to be out by 11 so you take most of your stuff back to your car but you want  a change of clothes, phone, money, etc. in the locker. The wristbands are great because it has your room key and credit card

Very fun for the whole family. Great rides for all ages and adventure levels.  My kids and I want to return when the price is right! Have to wait for the deals though since travel dates can be very pricy.

Summary Heading: Clean Resort, friendly employees and happy kids
Summary: We have stayed in this resort 3 times in less than a year. We've always loved the resort, it is clean, employees are friendly and the kids have had an amazing time every time. The water park is very clean, I love that the temperature is at a comfortable setting and you are allowed to used before your room is ready! They have an option for a later check out (2 pm) for an additional fee, we have taken advantage of this before, although, you are welcome to use the water park after you check out as well. We will be back because we love it so much and the kids do as well!!

Summary Heading: We had so much fun and the staff always smiling very kijd people.
Summary: Great place for family vacation the room was nice and clean the staff always smiling and kind the story time was amazing all the kids dancing the parents takimg pictures, we going back very soon to have a nice family time.

We love Great Wolf.  The rooms are large, and the walls are thick!  You hear nothing, so your wiped out family can sleep in late.  There is no better hotel staff around!  The chef in Santa Ana is crazy good!!

We love how the waterpark is indoor, so no matter what season it is, it's always nice to take a dip and then just relax on one of the chairs. Room is always clean, beds are comfortable. Resort is nice and clean. For a resort that boast on their waterpark, unfortunately they don't provide a great quality of shampoo and conditioner. And people do need them after being in the water for a while.

Summary Heading: Great time for the whole family
Summary: The hotel is clean and comfortable. They have everything you need so you don't have to leave the premises. My kids loved the entire experience. They got a Wolf Pass which gave them all sorts of goodies (MagiQuest, wands, candy, stuffed animal, etc.) They enjoyed the water park and running around the entire hotel on their MagiQuest adventure. We were there 3 days and took advantage of the water park every single day. Although my kids can swim and I trust their abilities, it was nice to see plenty of lifeguards on duty. The only con is the wait times at the water park and checking in. Otherwise, lots of fun and well worth the stay.

We took a total of 5 kids here for a birthday celebration. The best I can describe it is a casino for kids. No windows or fresh air. Hotel is extremely overpriced for value of what’s received. Water park is humid, and way too crowded. Extra amenities are way too expensive for the services provided. Took 5 girls to the ice cream spa for facials. Was told they would be 30 minute services. The facials lasted 15 minutes at the most. Kids didn’t want to wait in the long lines for the slides. The rooms are small and hot. Air conditioning didn’t work. After day 1 they we’re begging to go home.

I've been wanting to bring my family here for years!!  Finally decided to go and experience GWL for a couple of days and I could NOT be more disappointed. The water park and resort are nice. The service is OK, however, if you are looking to get a good night sleep, THINK AGAIN.  I can oversee the running in the hallways by kids in this "Kid Friendly" hotel, however when the plumbing pipes are banging ALL NIGHT LONG, it really just makes you want to go back home asap!  Which is what we did. I dont remember the last time I was so eager to check OUT of a hotel. ( I checked out at 7:45AM)Hopefully, they can fix their plumbing issues on the upper floors.

We had an amazing time! My son was able to to enjoy his stay without us trying to entertain him and I felt relaxed while he ran around doing his MagiQuest!  We timed it right for less people in the hotel which I know made it more fun as the lines were really short for the water slides!  Our whole family and friends had a wonderful time..highly recommend!

Our stay was too short! We had the best time ever. The hotel was so clean, staff was extremely friendly and the water park was amazing! You never have to leave because everthing is under one roof. Can't wait to go back.

Overall, my family had a great time.  We even invited the nieces and nephew to join us for the day use.  I was just disappointed by how dirty tables and chairs were.  They had old food and trash just left there and no one utilizing them.  We asked one of the workers and his comment was. “We just wait for the park to close before we clean our anything.”  I made sure our “personal assistant” was aware of this situation.  The next day seemed to be better.  Another huge disappointment was the lack of towels at the waterpark.  A few tikws I ne see to grab a towel and was told they are out and to come back in 30 min.

Great Wolf Lodge is an affordable family getaway, packed with fun for the children. We have been twice now and enjoyed our stay both times. The swimming, arcade, mini golf, bowling and show are perfect for small children and a fraction of the price of most themed getaways. I highly recommend going if your children are preteen or younger.

rude staff ruined experience.  waiter at breakfast didn't mentioned we had drinks included with purchase of the $100.00 voucher.  Men's bathrooms smelled of urine and some water park staff appeared like they didn't want to be there and I was inconveniencing them to provide me a wrist band they required for one their rides.

We loved this hotel!  There is a parking structure so our car was not in the hot sun.  The Lobby was huge!  There were many restaurants and stores.  Our room was large.  Not fancy, but it had everything we would need.  The AC was a little loud, but that was about the only negative experience.  The water park was enormous.  The kids loved the slides and wave pools.  We would like to recognize staff member Corey for her outstanding service.  We hardly left the hotel because there was just so much to do and see.  Overall a great stay.

Summary Heading: We love visiting Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge 3 times this summer.  Our Family really enjoys visiting Great Wolf Lodge, it's like a mini vacation.  Hopefully Alejandra will be working when you visit the kids shop.  She will make your child the best build a bear.  She's the BEST.  Thank you Great Wolf.

My sons had so much fun.There are lots of activities in this indoor pool. Not only for toddlers as well as for teens and adults too  I love their hotel. Our room is super clean and with the friendly wolves ambience Me and my husband also enjoyed the pool slides of different kinds. We definitely be back for sure.

Disappointed. Valet staff was standing around talking. We had to go up to them to help us. Then we found out at the front desk we had to pay for the 2 additional guest in the room. Called before trip and never advised. My entire family recieved messages that there room was ready but us. Food at the buffet was soggy and overpriced. The app gives times that are incorrect. Woke up early and waterpark was not open. Then we were charged twice for a wolf pass. Not relaxing. A lot of time waiting in line to get things fixed.

Summary Heading: Quality of the place is going downhill
Summary: The customer service and the quality around the hotel are not as nice and accommodating as the first few times we have stayed there. Old towels that are shredding and falling apart in our rooms, room and bathroom smelling like mildew and musty. Visable Rust spots. One of our little ones choked on a dime from the dipping dots that somehow ended up in her cup. Upon closer inspection after speaking with the associate, the containers for the dipping dots have no lids and they sit inside this area where they zip open and close below the associate and cash register. When they transport the dipping dots, again no lids throughout the water park. So all that water and spray can get into the expose food. My child was upset after the incident that it put a damper in her mood the rest of

I was surprised by how clean the water park was. It did not smell overly clorinated, the water was the perfect temperature and the staff extremely nice and helpful. Best tip is to download the app to be able to check in using the mobile app the morning of your arrival. Our room was ready by 11:00 a.m.🙌 Plus there is a separate (and extremely shorter) line to pick up your wristbands and ears. The line for “regular”check-in was crazy long and outside the door shortly after 1:00 p.m. (yes, they are not kidding when they said their busy time started at 1:00 pm). The mobile check in line was only 4 people deep🙌.  Valet parking was the way to go! It was only $5 more per day and was extremely convenient. Plus they were very courteous and quick. Leave personal towels at home. It’s

When I showed up to the hotel I decided to do valet, terrible decision I had to find an employee to take my keys and give me a tag. Never told about up charges for my two children. App was wrong on all information. When told staff they were extremly rude. Buffet was terrible for price save money.

This resort is perfect for kids with children. With the water park being indoor I didn't have to worry about my kids being in the sun all day long. That was my highlight!It's a mini city; no need to leave the hotel for anything. Both my 10 & 4 yr old had the best time ever. Even though we only spent 1 night, because we live 30 mins away, the kids felt like they were on a vacation far from home. I loved the family environment.

We arrived an hour early to check in thinking we would go straight to swimming. My 8 year old autistic son was overwhelmed right away being that it was a new place for us. He was nervous and was ready to get to his room. The gentleman at check out found us an available room on the first floor so my kiddo could get into and wind down a bit before we could explore. My son regrouped and after 20-30 minutes was ready to give it a go. He had a wonderful stay the rest of the time we were there. We will be back. Thank GWL

What you pay for and what you get are two completely different things. The rooms are nice and comfortable and the waterpark is convenient but their staff for all other activities are not worth your stay. Story time....you can barely hear the story as the staff does not have good control over the audience. Building your own stuffed animal character, the staff had bit of an attitude and rushed us.  Miniature golf, bowling and laser tag were not fun as they are very small attractions and with the number of guest they book, you have to rush through each attraction. The character breakfast was not worth the time or money. We saw one character for about 1 minute and their selection of "buffet" food is ridiculously small.

Summary Heading: Would have been a 5 except for one incident.
Summary: Overall my grandkids had fun with the exception of the final day.  Pete at the water park entrance was intimidating to my 4 year old grandson, who was not going to swim , and would not let him enter unless he stood against a height ruler to determine what color wristband to give him.  That's fine and not the problem.  The problem was he was clearly in the red area and Pete was insistent that he take his shoes off to make sure he was in the red area.  The area was soaking wet and he wanted him to stand in the water in his socks to confirm he was within the red area which he was in with his shoes on. Common sense tells you that taking shoes off will make you shorter anyways, which I tried to explain, but instead he choose to scare the 4 year old!   We ended up having to leave.

Water park was great, not over packed , lines were short, sometimes no lines at all. The room was clean , just had a problem with the pull out sofa, also the arcades are a bit too pricey , wasted 30 bucks in like 15min playing there . other than that it was great.

I would say everything was great. There was some small issues with the buffet. Food was always cold I went there 3 times. Service was good. The pizza parlor down stairs I would stay away from. My experience there was very bad but I honestly can't take away from the whole experience . Overall it was a nice trip and I like they staff. Just minor adjustments would make it perfect.

Summary Heading: Great place for the entire family!
Summary: A great place to visit with the entire family.  Entertainment for little ones and grown ups in the same place.  Lots of activities going on during the day to keep kids entertained inside and outside the water.  Food prices are reasonable too.

We stayed here looking for something to do with our 13 month twin sons. The rooms were clean and safe to let them walk and crawl around with no worries. The huge lobby was clean and large enough to allow my sons to walk and crawl around with it not being so crowded. They had fun activities all day we were able to do with our twins. We love the fact literally our twins only needed swim clothes and PJs. Once we were done swimming all day we bath them and they were in they're PJs for the family game night, Jammie dance party, story time and then dinner.  We definitely see ourselves returning every year.

This was by far the best! Worth every penny! Such a great atmosphere for the kids. They haven’t been able to stop talking about it! They loved it and so did we. Their is always something to do while at Great Wolf Lodge. Activities going on all day and they are free! We will be bringing the grand babies as well for the next trip!

This hotel has changed from when it first opened 2 years ago... for the worse! They should consider having children wondering the halls to be accompanied by an adult.  Employees at the outside food section were rude everytime I made it out to make a purchase as well as the buckets employees inside. GWL should consider customer service training for these 2 departments.

Great place for kids!!  Fun water slides for all ages. They make it very convenient to spend money with the hotel wristband (make sure you have plenty its not cheap) Save yourself and your money Don't eat at the buffet for Dinner!! Breakfast isn't that horrible.

My family of four stayed at Great Wolf Lodge in CA. Here are the reasons why we loved our stay and highly recommend staying here:-Booking online was very easy on their site -Parking was plentiful-Check-in at the counter was quick-Our themed Wolf Den room was clean, the kids loved the bunk beds and our (parents’) bed was very comfortable-We love that the wristbands are our room key and used to pay for everything (no need to carry credit cards/cash)-Since it was our first time, we had a lot of questions - and it was great that we were able to communicate with the staff via text-The water park was clean and the lines were not that long-We have a small 5yrs old and a 9yrs old and there were a lot of slides for both kids (and adults) to enjoy!-The food selection was plentiful-The

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge in the O.C.
Summary: Recently took my son and his family to the lodge. Both my 10 year old grandson and 2 year old granddaughter had a blast. Enough for both of them to enjoy the water park. Staff was very helpful and the check in experience was quick. Especially since we arrived at 4pm which is check in time. The park was very clean. Also the lifeguards were very deligent and never took their eyes off of the water. Food was good and reasonably priced. Our room was clean and adequate for the six of us. We are definitely going back.

If you like breathing chemicals then this is your place!  As much as they say all their chemicals are on point, there is no reason your eyes and lungs should burn walking in.  We could not enjoy any part of the indoor pool and strictly stuck to games...which defeats the purpose of going here!

Summary Heading: THE BEST INDOOR WATER PARK AND RESORT!
Summary: Omg! This place is awesome! I booked my trip through groupon for my daughter's 8th birthday. I used to see advertisement about this resort all the time, but I never been. So I decided to give it a try, and to my surprise it was everything I dreamed of and more! My husband and I felt like little kids, we were so excited by all the amazing things to do! When we first arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and they acknowledge my daughter with a "Happy Birthday"! They made her feel so special, All of the staff here was so kind and helpful. Especially, Mrs. Tracy she was so helpful in directing my family to the best places to eat, and told us about the breakfast buffet! The whole environment was super clean and peaceful. The food was so fresh and good! Our room was so big and

Summary Heading: Blood stains on the sheets and bed bugs
Summary: Filthy room .discovered blood stains on the sheets, woke up with bites on body.Was offered 50% off room or another stay.No chance we would go back . I feel I should of had a full refund plus refund for the time spent cleaning my luggage and anything else that was In that room.

This is my second trip to Great Wolf.  I had four kids age 11 and 13.  They had the time of their life.  MagiQuest was so fun when they were not taking me on the biggest rides.  Perfect resort for all ages- good clean family fun.

Summary Heading: Very Fun expect to Spend some Money
Summary: Excellent time for all.  I had children and adults.  Take another adult if you want to give yourself a break!  Kids able to do the magi quest without you.  Bring snacks and prepare to spend no less than $55 per meal you pay there.   Self park, we never left the Lodge.  We will go again as everyone enjoyed it.  One rude staff. Majority were excellent.   My complaint was room was not cleaned once of our 3 night stay.  Will return again.

My family and I had the best time here. This resort is jammed pack with everything you need to entertain even the toughest critics! I loved that only personnel staying at the resort could use the water park. It keeps the lines and wait times small. The kids were completely wiped out by the time we were leaving.

It was a fun trip! We brought our Girl Scout Troop for a day. They let you check-in early, have fun in the water park, and have tons to do around the hotel. We planned on initially leaving the hotel to eat dinner. However, after arriving we soon found out it's easier to eat there with the different restaurants. I like that the room key, and credit card is attached to your wrist band as well. This way you don't have to bring anything with you when going around the hotel or in the water park. The water park was smaller than I expected, but provided enough fun for the girls. Initially when you walk in it feels pretty warm. However, after going in the water the air temperature feels just right. Also, I did not know there were other activities to do. They have MagiQuest, miniature

This place is amazing.  Everything a parent/kids want to do as a family is all available within the resort.  Duncan Donuts clearly the icing on the cake for me...love this place will be definitely coming back.  The support our military service members/family with a reasonable discount.

I have 3 children ages 6, 11, and 13.  I think the water park was enjoyed by the teenagers but to get an overall experience, I recommend this for families with children under 8.  We personally will not be coming back.  The factors being the high chlorine smell in the water park which gave my husband and I continual headaches and irritation in our nasal cavaties.  One of my children developed some sort of rash that turned into hives due to some of the chemicals in the pool area.  The resort itself is absolutely beautiful.  The water park could have been a little bigger, specially the lazy river.  For what we paid (around $250/night), we would have rather gotten a hotel at the beach or done a day at Disneyland.  The surrounding restaurants/stores were a little on the down side in

We had a great time at GWL!  My kids are all under 7.  It was an overall clean facility.  Food was hot and yummy! Food prices were reasonable!  We were there for 3 days and felt that was enough days.  Our kids had a great time on all the slides.  There were no wait time on the slides.  Vest and floats were easily available.  Towels were clean and we had a great time!!

Great room, plenty of choices for food and lots of kid activities.  We were able to check in early & check in line went fast.  Room was very clean, it was quite spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Overall great experience.

excellent customer service, awesome food and fun water slides- we got a great room that was clean and well stocked with extra pillows, the restaurant Wood Fired Lodge was excellent as to their dinner food....didn't taste processed or frozen - tasted fresh and seasoned with flavor and the kids food was good to according to my kids although the portions were small for the kids but fine for the adults----------the service from wait staff was excellent in the cabanas, we got an outside cabana as the indoor ones were a bit stuffy with the chlorine smell and indoor humidity from the waterslides, the outdoor ones were awesome with a server assigned to you-overall a great time

We had a great time on this short getaway, if I could plan it again, I'd only go on weekdays. The hotel rooms were clean and acceptable, their idea of a picture window is quite different from mine, but it didn't cause any issues. The staff was great and the water park a lot of fun. Personally I would not got here with small children, though they do have designated area, I would not be comfortable trying to maintain control over a small child. Our grandson was old enough (9) to understand our rules and personal safety, that for us it worked out well. There are pros and cons of the indoor water park, but we did have a great time. We opted not to add on any of the extras, which weren't necessary, and we went off site for dinner. What food we did have at Great Wolf was good, just

Family went to GWL for our child's birthday trip. We were all extremely happy with the experience and can't wait to go back. The staff and facilities are excellent and attend to all needs making the trip that much better!

The resort was clean and filled with lots to do. My kids loved the waterpark, and they also loved the other activities in the hotel as well. GWL offers a lot of things to do - so it makes taking a break from the water super easy on the kids. Food at restaurants was good too! Wish we could have stayed longer and will be going back!

Summary Heading: Amazing time at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: I had such a wonderful time that I am planning to spend my son's birthday there. The park was clean, the staff was friendly and there was a ton to do! Can't wait to go back. Initially, I was concerned that an indoor water park would feel unclear and oppressive. I found it to be the opposite.

This is our 3rd summer coming to Socals Great Wolf Lodge. We thought by the 3rd time around we wouldn't be as intruiged at the first 2 times, boy were we wrong! There ia always something going on! Always some sort of resort activities by the staff, they even have an abudance of games in the lower lobby and quest games throughout the resort. The indoor water park though is the major star! They even have little food stand and adult drinks in there! We loved every minute of it. Our only regret is not staying longer!

Family trip. Everyone enjoyed all the different water slides and pools from ages 6 - 19 yrs old. All indoors so climate inside was warm, water was warm. No need for sunscreen because its indoors. There's towels available both at the pool and room. Definetly will visit again.

When we got there at 10 am we went to the desk to see if we could get our bracelets to enter the park since our check in wasn't until 4pm. They let us know that our room was ready and we had access to everything. The concierge gave 2 of our children the wolf ears with the birthday hat on it. Our 11 yr old and 5 yr old loved them. We got regular ears and they gave us one for our 1 month old as well. The facilities is very clean, inviting and a very large resort. The room was very clean and spacious and was just as nice as our room at the Hilton the night before. The water slides were great, the longest we waited for a slide was maybe 20 minutes.  My 11 year old liked the obstacle courses and water basketball. My 5 year old loved the huge play structure and wave pool. I suggest

Very good indoor water park place. The service and hotel staffs are very good. I only had small bad experience that the room cleaning staff saw I took my luggages to my car and they assume I check out even it is just 10am which I have 1 more hour to stay in the room since check out time is 11am. My kids were still playing so I planned to watch TV in the room for 1 more hour but the cleaning staff opened the door and started cleaning while I brought luggages to my car. When I returned to the room, the room was not available for use and they said it had been checkout which I DID NOT.

Summary Heading: Nice but late check out was a problem
Summary: We had enjoyed experience there.  The only problem we had was when we were locked out of our rooms early. And we booked and paid for the late checkout at 2pm only to be locked out of our room around noon time.  Then again 15 minutes before 2pm.  Come on! We shouldn't have to deal with this if we are paying daily resort fees. Had to go down to front desk to get it taken care of. Then everybody in our group had to go back down to get their wristbands reactivated. FYI:  pillows were not that comfy and tended to get flat later on.

All I can say is FUN!! Clean rooms, great food, awesome service, wonderful staff. We will DEFINATELY be back!! The waterpark was tons of fun. My son is 7 and not quite tall enough for the Howlin Tornado slide, but he loved everything else, especially the race slide! My favorite was the Wolf Tail, but they were all super fun.

We went here on a Sunday/Monday hoping that the crowds would be manageable, despite it being July. We were very disappointed, but perhaps should have known better given the location (hence the average rating). The lazy river was so crowded that you could hardly find a space to be, much less relax. The wave pool was also incredibly crowded - I felt uneasy with just 2 lifeguards watching over so many little kids. The lines for the slides were equally as bad. The facilities were nice, but again, due to the crowds, things were a bit dirty -- the bathrooms, the floors, etc.  The room was fine, nothing to really highlight -- good or bad. All in all, I don't think we will return. It was very expensive for the experience.

This was our family's 2nd time and  we had a blast!! 2 days were perfect for us to enjoy! So bummed we missed story time on this trip. My daughter opted for a vanilla scrub pedicure. The staff made her feel like a real princess!

Not exactly what we expected. Was surprised at the discomfort of the temperature in the rooms even after turning on the air and the hardness of the beds. The water park lines were really long and the stairs to walk up to rides were really dirty, so bring water shoes so you don’t step on dirty areas. Food was ok, probably will go outside the hotel to eat if we ever return.

Wonderful stay just wish their was a hottub for grown ups and shorter ride wait times! Check in was fast! Check out sinple and they even allowed us an extra hour to checkout. Parking and dollys to carry in items accessible on every parking level for free too!

Parents had fun too!  The only recommendation I would maybe make is that the rooms are SO BASIC.  They could do so much with the themes.  The headbands are a cute idea but you can't wear them to the waterpark which is where you're going to spend most of your time.  So, maybe another type of article to give away might be a good idea. My son had a great 9th birthday.  If I could make one other suggestion, it would be to not charge extra for the other stuff.  You pay enough to even stay at the resort.  Why nickel and dime like all the other resorts?  Make it super pocket-friendly.

We just surprised my son with weekend at Great Wolf Lodge for his 9th birthday. What an amazing weekend, my boys will definitely remember this. The facility was clean, staff was amazing and the food ... I couldn’t ask for anything better. Great time!

Family getaway-  we had a great time checked in on Monday afternoon the line was quite long and we were not able to check in online due to a glitch in the system. Because we got there early before check-in we were able to valet our belongings so we can go straight to the waterpark in play. The valet people are extremely kind and helpful. The entire hotel is designed for children and it was great. Our only complaint was the lack of ventilation in the indoor waterpark.  For some people it is extremely intimidating because it is difficult to breathe and very humid. But the kids did not seem to mind and they had a great time.

Just got back from GWL and had an amazing trip. Only stayed for one night but with waterpark access on both days it seemed like longer. The girls (6yo) loved everything about this place. Water slides, 3ft pool outside, wave pool (hilarious to watch), wipeout simulator, glitter tattoos, pedicure, arcade, dippin' dots etc. Will definitely be coming back for 2 nights next time! It's also very close to Disneyland so we will be killing two birds with one stone! Can't wait!

Great place for family experience. Brought with me a 2 year old, 4 year old and two teenagers all very happy and really enjoyed our stay. Will go again next year make this a tradition. Very close too home.

This is our second experience with GWL (1st one being is eastern MA) and this location did not disappoint. We noticed everyday that the staff within the water park were amazing. Not only are they constantly watching for our safety but they were fun too. Our food was great, rooms were clean and comfortable. Plenty of activities for the whole family from little little ones all the way up to adults! We created great memories!

What a fantastic resort!  The water park was huge with great slides and features just like the commercials lol.    The hotel had a consistent forest theme throughout the hotel.    I was surprised how roomy the rooms are.  Comfortable furnishings with a lodge look.    Extensive children's programs and activities.  Staff members Corey and Arla were super.  Great job guys.  There were many dining and dining options.  Overall a wonderful stay.

Not impressed!  Cleanliness is not paramount to this location.  Been to others and had better experiences.  Way, way over priced food and drinks.  $1000 for 3 days stay.  Little ridiculous.  Bring in your own food and drinks.

Summary Heading: My kid's never wanted to leave!
Summary: This was such a great experience. Every detail was thought of to keep the kid's occupied and having fun. The water park was awesome. Even when the kids were tired of the water park there was other things to keep them happy.

We took our 4 grandkids on vacation here. Ages 9,8,3 and 2. There was something for all of them to do. The littles loved the character walk and the small kids water area in the water park, they also loved going to storytime in their P.J.s every night before bed. The food was reasonably priced and very kid friendly. They all want to go here for vacation again!!!

Celebrated my niece's birthday here! We had kids from ages 6-16 and they all enjoyed it - us adults too! Water park was clean and the staff/life guards were very friendly and attentive. We got the Kids Cabin which was super cute! The kids were excited to sleep on their beds. The ambiance in the room was perfect for the children. My niece noticed HAPPY BIRTHDAY posters on doors but she didn't have one :( Whoops! Be sure to add the birthday package during reservation!! They also had a small arcade that is open 24 hours! That was a plus.   The guest services staff was very helpful and friendly. Shane at the front desk had lots of information and Jonathan with the bellmen was very helpful, as was Nick (doorman?)   The only downside was trying to get coffee in the morning! They have

Summary Heading: Great place to take your family :)
Summary: Rooms very cleanWater park very fun even for a 14 yr old.Bathrooms & showers at the water park smells very strong urine in there makes it very uncomfortable but other then this I will take my family back for sure we love our stay.

Me and my kids had a great time it’s such a fun place to be with family and relax!!i will be coming back on holloween my kids just don’t want to leave when we go I truly recommend this place to everyone💕

Summary Heading: Looking for a Perfect Family Adventure?
Summary: This place may just be the right one for you. With plenty of choices for fun and excitement at the Water Park, thrilling games for the kids, restaurants/food and shopping, Great Wolf Lodge is truly a one stop shop for Family adventures!

Wonderful and affordable quick getaway! Everyone in the family had a great time. Facility was clean, food was affordable, water park was clean, my family felt safe due to the amount of life guards on duty.

Summary Heading: Excellent water park - no sunscreen required!
Summary: My kids enjoyed the water park and even my littlest one (5 yr old) was able to do almost all the attractions. Restrooms were surprisingly clean and not muddy. We had a blast! Being able to charge items to the wristband/room is a plus for me as I didn't have to carry a wallet.
