Summary Heading: I would not stay at this Lodge Again
Summary: I have stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge in WI and MN.  Both were great experiences.  Here no one cleaned our room, we had issues with our toilet and shower and it took an entire day to get it fixed.  We would be out of our room all day then when we were getting cleaned up after the waterpark at 7 or so they would show up and ask if we needed anything and then we would not want them to come in but they never had enough towels or supplies to give us since it was so late.I did love that I could Text someone with my issues and that person was very nice but the staff were all very grouchy, non engaged and sometimes rude to myself and my grandchildren.  I was there 7 days and spent a lot of money and would never go back to be treated as we were.

Kids have fun in the water park, the food was good, the room was OK, it wasn't that clean but manageable. I paid for my daughter birthday experience so she loved to find the sign at the door and the cake in the room.

All in all the experience was great. A little disappointed because  online it said the waterpark didn’t open until 1 PM so we didn’t show up until around noon. Then we found out that it actually opens at 9 AM so we could’ve spent more time. Room was great except wasn’t thoroughly cleaned. There was a open bottle of wine in the refrigerator still, a sock and toy under one of the beds also

Great Wolf Lodge is a huge money pit.  It is overcrowded and ran by primarily what seemed like kids, meaning in their very early 20's.  Their text when room is ready didn't work and had we not have asked after 3 pm we would not have known it was.  The slide area is dirty and their is limited seating.  Being from Southern California I know next time I'll stay on the beach and do the slides at a real park.

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge not so happy place
Summary: The resort allows too many guests and not enough staff. Keep an eye on your kids because the lifeguards will not. The lazy river is a joke, they do not have enough inner tubes for every one and it’s a free for all; this also applies to pretty much all areas of the water park except outside. The one good thing is that there is a place to enjoy the pool with fresh air. Rooms were large, nice & clean. There was audio problems during story time and again no staff came to update us. Seems like they just want your money. No thanks! I’d rather go to Disneyland

The resort is very clean. Staff was very nice. Loved how there was nothing but families enjoying themselves. The arcade was great for kids to have fum with interactive games. The free activities they have for kids was very appreciated.

This was our 5th stay at the Great Wolf Lodge.  Super fun for the kids.  I had my grand kids, 14, 10, 6, and 5.  They love the water park and the arcade.  The food is very good, maybe a little pricey, but good.  Room was nice.

We are a family of four whom have different opinions of what fun is, I LOVE that Great Wolf Lodge has so many things to do! One kid loves the water and the other kid loves MagiQuest and that is why we are going to make it a tradition to go every year for summer vacation!

My wife and I took our daughter to celebrate her birthday to the Great Wolf lodge and we had a great time. We were very impressed and we all had a lot of fun especially our 4 year old birthday girl. The food was great, there was plenty of family activities and the property was beautiful. We definitely will visit again.

Highly recommend this fun getaway with the family! We plan to go back yearly because it was a wonderful experience. Love everything from the theme characters that my sons fell in love with to the awesome indoor water park. There are so many fun activities for everyone in the family to do.

It was a great vacation, its very convenient when the hotel is right there, the water park is awesome, not as big as the outdoor water park but still great. The water park was a little humid inside. Definitely we would go back again, hopefully soon.

This hotel was great and was more than the kids expected.  The hotel is about 4 blocks from all of the other Disney experiences.  Everything is contained within the Resort so there is no reason to leave.  But if you do not like the choices there isn't  anything within a short walk.  The rooms are great.  Beds were very comfortable.  The room had an easy access to the pool; I especially liked not having to walk through lobby areas going back to the room.  The pool area was very busy and not place to put towels or shoes while swimming.  Cabana rentals were for the outside pool area not the indoor water slide area.  Pool areas were cleaned routinely but will the large volume of people many slide pools were not as clean as they should be (lots of trouble keeping the indoor wave pool

We had so much fun at the water park, very clean. Each employee encountered was helpful and pleasant. There was great food at the breakfast buffet and the tator tots were perfect. Made my kids' stay one of the best in their book and mine too!

You've got kids if you're coming here, right? Because this is really a kid-focused place and I'm not sure what an adult would be doing here if they did not love a child. The water park is smaller than I would have thought but still fun and (we were here on a Monday-Tuesday in the summer) crowded but not ridiculously so. It is deafening in there; you walk into the store to exit and take a breath because it's so quiet. We definitely felt like they were throttling down the capacity of some of the slides and the lazy river by not adding more tubes or staff, but the slides were all fun and the lifeguards generally friendly and watchful.  They get you in the door with the free water park, but there are so many other ways for you to spend your money here, the most notable being

In the kids eyes it was awesome. Wait times were a tad bit too long for the slides. Everything cool in the kids eyes cost extra like magiquest. Water park is small. There is not enough tubes when hotel is at max capacity.

Fantastic and safe... Clean rooms. Restaurants not too busy. Wait times for the rides were a little long but they are working on that. Check in and check out was a breeze and all of the staff were helpful and cheerful.

We arrived early to find our room ready and extremely helpful staff. The water park was amazing, although they could add a few more slides. This was a great experience for the entire family. The lines were manageable and we waited less than ten minutes for any of the attractions. The food portions at the water park restaurants were a good size and value.

Summary Heading: Worst Way to Spend $500+ for a 1 night stay
Summary: Everything wrong that could happened that day happened. It was the most horrible way to spend $500. We booked one night of stay on Aug. 18 for our daughter's 8th birthday. Unfortunately, her mother decided not to give us our daughter that day. Sure, it's a custody issue that is not Great Wolf's fault. But upon arriving at the resort, instead of being amazed with the place. We were utterly disappointed at how small and different it is from the photos in the ads and website. We tried to enjoy the place regardless but by a couple of hours after checking in our eyes are hurting so much from the concentration of chlorine and humidity in the building. We called it a night early and planned on enjoying the following day. But by morning of the next day, we were honestly just fed up with

We had such a great stay here.  My kids ages 12, 8 and 4 all had lots of fun! We didn't have long waits because school was not out for most yet. We loved the restaurants on site. The quick breakfast option at Dunkin Donuts was also nice yo have. The rooms were clean amd and spacious. The hotel theme reminded me of the Grand Californian at Disneyland. We will definitely return.

Love the water park. It’s surprisingly clean. Love that it’s indoors and love that all the rides and attractions are in close proximity to each other. If you want to try surfing, go 1 hr before the park closes or first thing when the park opens. I wish I knew that. The room is big and clean but nothing fancy. Small bathroom.

If your children are between 6 and 13, this will be a mini paradise.  For the adults, you have to be comfortable with noise noise noise, a warm humid environment that is fine IF you are in the water too.  It's safe, but I made the mistake of taking an infant and a 4-year old and was essentially overwhelmed by the water park.  Food at buffet was great.  Room cost was exorbitant, but quality is high.  Wristband that unlocks room doors and allows you to charge anything and everything was a great touch.  Think Chuck E Cheese on steroids with water and decide for yourself.

Great wolf lodge is a wonderful place to escape the heat. We are local SoCal dwellers and wanted to do a fun trip before school started. My daughter turned 6 end of July so we added a birthday package to the room. They have incredibly reasonably priced packages for all budgets! I recommend getting the paw pass as it has loads of things to do that are included in the price. The best part is it is pre paid and you don't have to pay every activity so that means you can walk around the lodge wallet and cash free!! You use your wrist band to charge to the card on file linked to your room and the pass for the kids is prepaid so really you don't have to worry about anything getting lost. It was a wo derdul family staycation. The water park was clean and well staffed. Clean towels and

A great family experience. Took my six grandchildren, mother and daughter. Can't wait to go back with just adults!! Rooms are roomy, clean and have a refrigerator and microwave. You are able to bring in food. Look for reduced rates throughout the year.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money anymore. Run down.
Summary: Staff is terrible around the resort! Were stayed here 4 times and it's been going down hill each time, this last stay will be our last after how we were treated on multiple departments. Think twice before hiring non friendly, rude people at a kid resort. Not to mention it's becoming more and more busy, they pack the place like a can of sardines. We didnt even feel safe inside the lazy river or wave pool due to over crowded.

Too crowded. Dirty. Not enough staff to accommodate u. We checked in and no one cared to give us the wolf ears. Very disappointing. During reservations, they asked if we're celebrating anything and I put down a birthday and nothing special was done. I don't understand the point of asking. Elevators take forever to open. U have to wait 15 minutes for elevators to open while you're freezing. Mobile check in sucks. No one said welcome. They talk to each other mostly and never even bothered to smile at u. The rooms are ok. They're clean. Nothing special about them. My family and I are still here but we can't wait to leave to go to Disneyland to start our real family vacation. Please don't come here. This place sucks. Not worth the price!!! I wish I didn't pay extra for late check

Thank you Great Wolf Lodge for another year in the memory book.From Check in ,checking out,staying at the water park,everything was just amazing .The hotel staff ,waterpark staff,and rest of all the staff,was super attentive ,helpful and there when we needed Any help with stuff.Cant wait to come back again soon.

We had the best time celebrating my daughter's 8th birthday at Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim. She loved the MagiQuest scavenger hunt game and the wave pool and crazy creek! We only stayed one night - experienced zero problems and enjoyed our stay. Two days of water park fun was plenty! We will be back!

Summary Heading: Roaches in our room. Very disgusted!
Summary: I visit the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove pretty frequently. Two of my last 3 visits have been less than desirable. Last August of 2017 we had a fight occur right outside our door at 2am. THAT was fun! One of the individuals was intoxicated. And this was before this recent visit in August of this year where now there are MORE alcohol stations! I understand that parents need to be entertained as well, but it was a bit much. The second issue that we’ve had at this resort occurred this last visit in August. We had baby roaches in our room. Very disgusting! Imagine going to dry your face with the face towel and there are 2 baby roaches crawling on it! I had had others on the floor and had killed them. I was trying to be nice and not make a big deal about it, but THAT was enough!

everything was fine . the bedroom very clean excellent, the staff very friendly and the water park very fun. of course I would return. When you stay at the hotel the tickets to the water park and parking are free ...

GWL gave us the opportunity to relax and have fun with the family without stressing about safety of the place, or stressing about the drive d/t its proximity. Everything you would want and need is in the facility that you don't need to worry about anything and you could just focus on spending an enjoyable time with your family. Definitely worth every penny you spent.

Great Wolf Lodge caters to children's needs. It's a family friendly hotel that has everything that you can think of. The food is amazing ,the staff are super friendly and the hotel is constantly entertaining the young at heart with activities. They thought of everything when they created this Lodge. The experience my son had this pass week will forever stay in his heart ❤

Summary Heading: Dirty Rooms and Showers- No seating to be found in Water Park.
Summary: The staff here is young and I found them to be uninterested and not helpful in addressing concerns. I found no seating in the water park and was told they were almost at capacity and that seating was first come first serve. Our suite had dried top ramen noodles on the living room floor and hair in the master shower which I was told by the front desk they would have housekeeping clean. They never showed up. Upon my arrival upon entering the facility I broke my toe on uneven, unmarked pavement. All our concerns fell on deaf ears. What a waste of my money and time. I took my grandchildren here for a last getaway before school started. I will NEVER go back! Not even if you gave it to me free!

Had an awesome stay here.eventhough we were on a budget and just stayed for one night,it was extremely worth it.best theme park ever so far!can bring own food,there's my fav Dunkin donuts,attractions were not rip off because it was not fast and waiting time was 2-5 minutes.,not so crowded.

I had such a great time with my grandson, 7 years old, that it didn't  seem so expensive. They run it very well and it was clean. All the guests were happy and having a great time.I loved how everyone ran around with the wolf ears on.  I'm planning on bringing the rest of my family next time.

Very clean, this is our second time. My kids enjoyed the waterpark and evening MagicQuest scavenger hunt. Ice cream, Dippin Dots, Dunkin so close by and not overpriced. Too many people at Lazy River, wave pool is always great!

If you are looking for a great indoor water park you have found the place.   Things to know:  1).  You cannot buy tickets to the water park par se.  If you book a room here you will have access to the water park.  It is included in your stay.  If you book a room for 4, you will get 4 wrist bands for the water park.  However the cool part is they will allow you to buy "Guest Passes"  for your guests.  The guests passes are $50 each.    2).  The day you check in, you will have access to the water park starting at 1PM even though check in time is 4PM.  They can text you when your room is ready.  There are large showers, restrooms, lockers and even a swim suit dryer.  Check out time is 11AM but you still can stay and have access to the water park until it closes (8:30pm).    3).

Had so much fun with my family. Not just for kids they have something for everyone. Food prices are reasonable and so are souvenirs. Loved how they have a souvenir cup that has free refills so that saves a lot of money for drinks.

Our kids enjoyed their stay at the hotel- loved the yummy food and fun water activities. It's just an exciting short adventure each time. They especially love the wave pool. When CA weather- too hot and air quality is not acceptable, this is a good indoor alternative.

Summary Heading: Great Place For Water Park Lovers
Summary: I have a lot to say about this place!  For people who love waterslides and water play, this place is fantastic.  There are also lots of non-water park activities, many of them free (e.g. craft time, story time, and the like).  My kids absolutely loved this place on the whole, though they did not want to return to the water park after the first day.  It was paradise for them.  For the parents, not so much.  The service here is really quite good.  It is awesome that you can send a text message for anything that you need (particularly since they don't always answer the phone), and it is provided promptly.  Other hotel chains could learn something from the service at this property.  We arrived at about 1pm and so did everyone else since that's the time you can start using the water

Summary Heading: We had a blast here this summer!
Summary: This year was our first time at a Great Wolf Lodge and we had a blast!  It's an all-inclusive family hotel.  The check in is a long line and a slow process because everyone wants to get their wrist bands so they can get to the water park but they give you wolf ears and serve cookies and you can see stuff going on in the lobby so it goes fast.  Our room was a standard room with two queens and a couch, but the layout made it seem roomy.  Having a fridge and microwave with kids along is so convenient and there was a ton of counter space for all the stuff we brought.  The water park is just amazing!  Our favorite was the lazy river.  We spent hours in that thing.  We also ate at the food stand in the waterpark and it was good.  To take a break from the water, there is a little

It was our first time there and we will definitely come back. It was my son's birthday and the staff made it special since we first checked, even through dinner, because we had not made any special requests  yet they went out of there way to bring a cupcake and sing happy birthday.

I visited this hotel at their peak busy time because I was in town for a meeting.  We never felt over-crowded.  The hotel is so well planned that you truly never have to leave.  All entertainment, food, etc. is contained within the hotel.  While the stay and "extra" activities were quite expensive, it was truly a memorable trip and a hidden gem.  Parking was easy, the wristband/all access was amazingly convenient and the staff was friendly.

I highly recommend the Great Wolf Lodge to anyone with young kids.  My kids are 4 and 6 and loved everything about this place!  We will definitely be back!  From the waterpark to the dance parties to story time, we loved it!

First time at the resort and celebrating daughters 7th birthday. We had heard great things and we were excited to go. Water park was great but the room was not. Bought our daughter $40 wand that was supposed to be interactive with the room. It didn't work with anything in the room and while playing she found someone else's sleep mask in her bed. She thought it was a gift for her bday. Made us feel that the room was dirty. Complained to front desk and the manager for the maids came up. She had new sheets on the kids bed, refunded the charge on the wand, and got us 40 percent discount. Very grateful for that but I was surprised that no one from the resort followed up. We left with mixed feelings about our visit. Not how I wanted to celebrate my daughter's special day and not the

This was our 2nd time at the GWL!!!! It was great.  Our 8 year old grandson had a blast.  He especially liked boogie boarding.  A lot to do inside and outside the water park.  And the food was great (adult beverages a plus)!!

The whole family enjoyed the experience especially the children aged 9 and 11. They were very excited about all the things to do and were on the go from the beginning of the stay to the end. They particularly enjoyed the MagiQuest game.

The hotel staff are wonderful.  Everyone we encountered was smiling and helpful.  The dance party, drawing session, and the great waterpark were perfect for our grandchildren.  We had  a great stay and couldn't have had more fun!  The kids loved it.  Went on a weekend, which was all we could do, so it was busy, but it didn't take away from the experience.

Check-in was fast.  They offered us a suite room, since I took an extra person in our party.  They charged me less then, what on-line had said for an extra person.  2 thumps up!!    Birthday package for my son.  It came with a welcoming sign on the room’s door with our son’s name, we found colorful balloon when we walked inside the suite, a small cake just enough for the 8 of us, birthday card and much more… Suite room was spacious.  Two separate rooms with their own doors and TV’s, 2 bathrooms, sofa bed, sink, microwave, mini fridge, just right for us.  The room was clean and very comfortable.   Food was delicious.  Water park was fun!  They had different pools and activities for all ages.  That’s a plus! All the kids enjoyed the water park.  Clean, life guards on duty,

Pros: 1. Lots of things for the kids to do, especially the littles. 2. My 9 & 11 year old were more about the magiquest and waterpark then the other activities that were offered. 3. Water park itself was large enough to handle the crowds and not feel like sardines, it was clean, bathrooms were clean, lifeguards very attentive, towels a plenty and warm. 4. Staff was friendly and helpful.5. Room was clean and kids loved that it “smelt” like a cabin. 6. We would come again - with sweaters 7. Food in buffet was good with plenty of options. The service was good and polite. 8. Food at the “Grill” lobby level was good. Our waiter was a bit inattentive but his coworker picked up the slack very politely - with a bit of gentle ribbing - that they were a better server that night. Our

We had our two young grandsons with us and they had the best time.  They have thought of everything for your kids to have a first rate experience.  We will for sure be back!  The suite was perfect and our grandsons loved having their own bunk bed cabin area with tv.

From the moment my family and I walked in we felt welcomed! The entire staff I came in contact with was friendly, professional and helpful. The room was clean and comfy. The dinner buffet had a great selection and everything was fresh and delicious. Hungry As A Wolf had the best pizza, pasta and Italian sub! Dunkin Donuts was a plus and so convenient to have fresh baked donuts & coffee! I had the best fruit tart at Bear Paw Sweets & Eats! Looking forward to our next family vacation enjoying hours at this awesome indoor water park!

Summary Heading: Amazing first experience at the Lodge!
Summary: The employees were very welcoming, acomidating, and helpful. The room was clean and functional. There's everything you need at the lodge. Shoping centers near by, and restaurants and bars inside and outside the water park!

I took my 9yr old and 1yr old sons. We had sucha a wonderful experience. We enjoyed everything. Check in was fast and easy. All the staff was very kind. Both of my kids had a blast at the water park. Towels are provided which is great. I was a little concern about the room because of other reviews but it was really nice. The room was very clean and comfortable. We really loved this place and we really want to go back soon.

We were three generations, age 80 to age 6.  Had an absolutely fabulous time in the water park.  So many things to choose from that lines were never more than five minutes -- except for the smallest kids.  Everyone had a fabulous time.  The pace is clean and the staff friendly and helpful.   We had the room with the "cabin" which sleeps seven.  The only comfortable was the regular queen bed.  The singles in the cabin were so uncomfortable that one of the kids opted to sleep on the floor.  The had the worst mattress I've ever slept on and tilted so we had to sleep with our heads at the foot.  No wash cloths provided, so be sure to pack some.  Also room for seven had six towels; and we needed to request extra pillows. If you have a choice between here and Lego Land, definitely go

We stayed here for two nights and had a great time.  Plenty of lifeguards watching over everyone and helpful in answering questions, and we were surprisingly not "freaked" out by the indoor water park.  The slides were great fun and the wave pool (even though crowded) was also terrific.  They keep the park clean and our room was well thought out even though basic.  I would ask for a room away from any of the 'wand" activities since we were hearing those noises all day (and pretty late into the night - 9pm?) and the front desk gave us a late checkout for the trouble.  We did the storytime at night, including a photo op, and also the kids dance party one day.   Overall a fun quick getaway and we plan to return.

My 2, 4, & 10 year old had a great time. There is something for all ages, Arcade, bowling, & of course the water park. Designed for all ages. Never needed to set foot outside the hotel, they had everything I needed. Room had a nice design & beds were comfortable. Charged everything to my room, no need to carry cash or cards..I will definitely return..

Summary Heading: Great Water Park and themed rooms
Summary: Overall it was a great place, I would return but I would consider my food options, that was the only downside. The lines for water rides needs to be better organized but overall experience was awesome, our daughters loved it. The tornado ride is one for the books would go back just for that lol. The themed rooms are great but you're really not in roommuch. I love the activities they have throughout the day for the kids, and the arcades and bowling is a plus. A little overpriced for the arcades, bowling, & theater since you are already paying a good amount for the stay should have better priced bundles for the additional things. Overall experience was great we would recommend

Awsome place our stay went by soo fast, i will defenetly go back. The only thing I did not like was that my last day the most wonderful water slide was close (tornato) but other tha that i did like it and my family really enjoyed the stay

This is a kids Vegas!  Parents like the sound winning money, kids like the sounds of finding the jewels.  Parents like relaxing pool side, kids like all the water slides and wave pool.    Fun time, lots of different things to do. This is really a fun place for the kids.  Had amazing time.

Summary Heading: Indoor waterpark resort that’s a must go!!
Summary: I highly recommend this waterpark resort because it is family/kid friendly, reserved for hotel guests only which make it less crowded compared to other outdoor waterparks. They have everything in the resort which make it so convenient. There are nearby walking distance restaurants as well. We had a blast and can’t wait to be back here again next time. Great customer service, clean room, decent food, and lots of slides to choose from. A great family vacation destination. Must try!!

Great place for kids 4-14, water park could have stayed open longer since it is in the lodge. It was over-priced for everything, but the staff was GREAT! Couldn't ask for a more attentive and helpful staff. They will help you with anything at anytime. Long wait times for the lines, and not enough seats at the water park. Should be included in your resort fees.

My kids love this place they can stay at the waterpark for hours it's clean and I love the fact that it's indoor. If you want to take your kids to a fun place you need to go to Great Wolf Lodge. I know they will enjoy it and have a blast

I booked a suite for eight of os (four adults and four children) for my birthday and it was amazing.  The suite was comfortable and roomy - the kids enjoyed the themed bunk beds.   The water park was amazing and perfect for the children.  We never saw the teenagers unless they were hungry and returned for food.  The little one enjoyed much independence and water slides all to himself.  The park hours were great.  I never felt too crowded and the wait times in some of the lines were more than reasonable.  Even thought it felt like a

The activities offered are at very limited time, and unfortunately my kids do not sleep at 815pm when they offer bedtime story. Kids were full of energy the pool was closed and arcade is pricey so it made for a long night.

Better than major theme parks. Fun for the whole family without breaking the bank! Short wait time, friendly staff, great theme. Decent price point for food. Good size portions. Highly recommend for the family!

It was the worst experience ever I got to the counter then made a mistake on my reservation and then when I don't have them fix it they said there was nothing they can do Some lady cut me in line after waiting 45 minutes and they did nothing. I've been there 3 times 3 years in a row.   Never going again

The rooms were not cleaned, I request 4 times to have the room cleaned and when it was finally somewhat cleaned it was done to the lowest standards. Did not get what we paid for. The night time Housekeeping make any excuse not do do their job.

Summary Heading: Taking our Bearcubs to meet The Wolf
Summary: Our grandkids (The Bearcubs) thoroughly loved Great Wolf Lodge.  The water park was the obvious attraction, but all the other activities for the kids was a bonus (of course, you have to pay for them)  .The Magic Quest was their favorite (ages 9 and 10).  The staff was courteous and appropriate in dealing with kids.  My only complaint is the burning eyes after being in the water park.

Fantastic water park and hotel, very suitable for kids. Staff is friendly. I enjoyed my stay. A lot of water games for tall kids and adults. I would recommend this hotel for short visits because games will consume all your power :), specially with kids.

Great waterpark experience. Employees were friendly and accomodating. Disappointed with the room. AC was loud and kept us up and mini fridge did not work properly and food went bad. Food credit was offered but not applied.

It was so much fun and relaxing i got to spend time with my husband one on one will be back soon recommend it to all that want to get away and enjoy family time  the food is so good staff is great special Stacy from wood longe grill thank you for helping me pick out my wine

Summary Heading: Great place for kids to have fun
Summary: The room was clean, staff was friendly. Kids had a lot of fun. don’t go on a weekend lines are too long, it was a bit crowded, story time was great. Fun for the whole family just  too expensive for a weekend getaway.

I had never heard of Great Wolf Lodge until recently. My husband and I thought it sounded like the perfect place to go for a last “all of us together vacation” before our oldest moves away. It was so perfect. All three kids (18, 12, 7) had a blast. The room was a nice size for all of us, the fridge was big enough to pack a couple of days worth of food and drinks (on a budget). The staff and life guards are top notch. Just wish that the raft lines went a little faster... but if you go early in the morning it’s not so bad.

So much to do that there was no reason to leave the resort! Very kid friendly and fun for adults as well! The atmosphere was amazing and so many people enjoying themselves that everyone was friendly, including the guests!

I have 3 kids different ages and all of them had fun, the water park is a really nice and clean and they have many activities for kids all ages... plus for us parents there is good food and good drinks Definitely will go again soon

This hotel caters to All the needs a kid could want. From the hotel room to the activities, amenities and water park. The arcade is open 24 hours, they have activities through out the whole day planned out for kids. Will definitely book again and again!

Summary Heading: Fun Times with my Granddaughter, and Niece & Newphew
Summary: It is always fun they have changed the way they do he lines and it seemed a bit long and over crowded, but everything was lots of fun, most of the staff were excellent, but one was so bossy.  Also they had not enough at ties on Friday they ha one person to man three stations at the top slides they used to have one for each slide so it seem to take longer, the food and drink staff excellent, and fun, we will be back for sure

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stop in Souther California with Kids
Summary: My grandkids aged 7-12 liked this place.  Slides a little too much for this guy.  Hard working staff. Price reasonable compared to other attractions and the fact that they limited entrants to hotel guests is good.

Kids had so much fun, they enjoyed all rides, all staff were helpful when we checked in and stuff at water park were more than helpful, definitely I will come back, but might be weekdays, it would be much better

Both kids and adults can enjoy the day here, love the kiddie pool area for the lil ones and the food is great. Buffet is a lil pricey $25 approx for adults but well worth it.. And the Cajun fries at the buckets restaurant are amazing!!

Took grand kids for a one night trip..They loved it. Something for everyone. All ages even this Grandma !! Food services that are provided and very good. Character buffet breakfast was yummy! Smore' pizza was wonderful and even tater tots

Great Wolf Lodge has a decent swim experience for the kids however the unnecessary and excessive fees to do any of the other experiences were surprising.  The rooms have very cheap soap and very little hair products considering you are in the heavily chlorinated waters for hours.  Finally, we were overcharged for amenities - be careful and review your billing before you leave the hotel!

You will spend an enormous amount of money for an average hotel room and average waterpark where you will spend more time waiting in lines then having fun. You are much better off taking your cash down the street to Soak City AND Knott's Berry Farm and will still have cash left.  Place is way overpriced and not near as grand as you'd expect.

Try GWL, a family expierence worth trying. As grandparents taking our 6 & 7 year olds for a different experience which included an over night stay, perfect! Very enjoyable after a nightmare Disneyland expierence!

Summary Heading: Place is very clean and friendly staff
Summary: Friendly staff is a big plus for me my first time here and they were very helpful and the whole place was very clean and fun for my kids, the waterpark was fu. But just wished it would be open longer.

My four boys loved this place and they are ages 4 to 14. If your kids like water they will love it too. kids of all ages.Adults would like it also, I did. It is a little humid in the water park , but overall I liked it. They do have an outside pool as well, which is nice.

This place is a little pricey but it is worth it everything was clean and specifically made for kids my son had a blast and the best part there are no lines no crowds I would start saving up for this !

didn’t clean the room the next day we run out of toilet paper and clean towels. We ask few of the housekeeper outside said they aren’t assigned to clean the room so we waited until 7pm which nobody came. I called front desk and they delivered the stuff but didn’t clean the room.

I went to other Great Wolf resort and this is by far the worst condition.  I think they used an old hotel and flipped it.  I feel like I was in a motel.   I had two rooms. Bath towels were shedding, bed and blanket feels old.  Whenever someone or next door is taking a shower a loud noise came from the water running...pretty bad....

Summary Heading: So much fun but the food was overpriced and disgusting
Summary: This place is really cool, clean and fun for younger kids. However, it is kinda expensive and the food quality did not match the price. We tried eating at two different spots in the hotel and both were disgusting. Good thing there are a lot of restaurants close by.

The rooms were extremely cheap for very high price. The beds were extremely uncomfortable, entertainment options were scarce while in the room. The only thing offered were a few channels and hulu with your own account which I dont have. Parking was extremely epensive and the walk it took to get to our room was ridiculous. The restaurants were expensive and for how much you pay for the room the prices and quality of the food were awful. Basically all they care about is getting money out of their clients instead of offering them quality for the price they pay to stay at the hotel, I will never stay at these hotels again.

We loved it! We will be coming back for sure! Everyone was so helpful and everything seemed clean. Love that’s theres other free activities like story time, dance party, etc. Do wish the bowling and mini golf were included  and not a seperate fee.

Summary Heading: Loads of FUN for the ENTIRE FAMILY
Summary: We visited on 7/31/18 for my daughters 10th birthday. The mobile check in was super quick and easy, our room was ready 3 hours ahead of check in time which was nice since we get water park access as early as 1pm. However, the line took so long to pick up our wristbands we did not make it to our room until around 3pm. Shortly after the coffee maker malfunctioned without being touched, squirting water and coffee bean residue onto my sons hand. We called front desk to inform them of the incident and got a simple we will make note of it response. This put a damper on my sons time as he was in pain from the hot sprew and did not feel up to any activities the rest of the day. Plus they never came up to replace the coffee maker, so my husband had to buy coffee from Dunkin Donuts

We were very happy that our room was available before the check in hour, and we were allowed to access it early. The wolf den themed room was perfect for our son and he had a blast.  The waterpark was perfect for all ages and it had plenty of workers around to help keep our kids safe and they were very responsible. I liked that they served alcoholic drinks and the food was good. They have everything you need there. Can’t wait to stay there again.

Fun experience, clean rooms, friendly staff. The floors in water park get kind of slimy feeling, the water park is tailored to very young children, wish it were tailored to older kids as well, maybe offer things that 8-15 year old children might like. Overall decent experience.

Great place to go! This was a mini vacation for my sister, our kids and I. My sister and I enjoyed ourselves and our kids had a blast! That's a Double High 5 if you ask me. Everything was Great! We just left and are planning our next trip already

We loved it. We had everything that was needed it. They even had a bathing suit dryer spacious showers. Out family enjoyed the water park boy long lines. Friendly staff members. I recommend it this place is awesome!

Summary Heading: Get Ready for the Family to have some fun!!!!!
Summary: Our family celebrated my sons 4th Bday. I have a 14yr, 11yr and 4 yr old.  They all had a blast--we got a wolf den suite and that was a true MUST HAVE.  The price is right, the park passes are included with each hotel stay---you cannot beat it.  Plus the food was reasonably priced, I didn't feel like my bank was getting broken everytime my kids asked for something.  The executive chef--Hanni Ali is the bomb.....this resort is lucky to have him.  We cannot wait to come back!!

The room was great and kids loved it. It was easy to take a break from the water and rest in the room. Food choices were not bad and we enjoyed been able to take the food to the room whenever we wanted to without leaving the building. Great place for kids and teens.

Summary Heading: Great Value for your Dollar When You Do It All
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge offers so many activities for the kids such as face painting, crafts, yoga, learning, dance parties and bedtime story.  Along with the included water park tickets that are offered EACH day of your stay, and the whole downstairs with bowling, mini golf, arcade, and more, this place will keep the family entertained and make memories for a lifetime.  We got the Pup Passes too, which included a LOT of great stuff for the kids.  We are definitely coming back-actually booked another stay!  The room was comfy too-we stayed in a kids cabin suite.  We didn't want to leave!

We had one of our best family vacations ever. It 's always stressful to travel with our entire clan, but Great Wolf was perfect because the suites were spacious and we barely had to leave the hotel to have fun.   Parking was a breeze with helpful valets to direct where to go. It was great that there is an actual parking structure so our car was not too hot when we had to use it.   Checking in took a long time, but we arrived right at check-in time. Everybody was super friendly and helpful.  My hubby and I were surprised at how big it was on the inside with plenty of restaurants, shops and of of course the kids loved the water park.  I always have to make sure that the kids have sunscreen on and it was nice that it's mostly and indoor water park. We went to Knott's Soak City a

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Fun Indoor Waterpark
Summary: I purchased through groupon and I think I had a good deal.  The place is nice and clean.  Cost of food is very reasonable (to be exact, it's cheap comparing to other places).  Unless you are craving for anything in particular, otherwise, you can dine at Wolf Lodge.  The wristband with built in chip is convenient for waterplay because I didn't have to bring wallet /key to buy food or to get entry to my room.  Will definitely comeback again this year.

My Grandkids had an awesome time in the water park.  As for me, no worries of sunburn,,, lol, and ample seating areas.  However, I was disappointed with the water park hours.  I was informed by hotel staff that on the day we arrived (Saturday), that the water park was closed at 10pm.  We were informed at 8:30pm they were closing.  Other patrons, were also informed about the 10pm closing time.

From the minute we arrived, it was one horrible experience after another. It took over 45 minutes to check-in due to a super incompetent clerk who couldn't figure out the simplest of details. I had to provide the confirmation number and  show her the reservation emails with details of prepaid features selected (Disney tickets, etc) and she still couldn't manage to figure out how to get everything together. We wanted to purchase additional Disney tickets which was a COMPLETE NIGHTMARE - DO NOT PURCHASE DISNEY tickets here. After multiple requests, I was sent to a business center to use the computer to purchase the tickets which is basically you go to the Disney website to purchase tickets directly so there is no customer service benefit in this area. The manager offered me a
Manager Response: Pam,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  We are truly sorry for the challenges you encountered during your visit, as this is not normal for us.  We would love look into this for you further; if you are willing, please email us at guestrelations@greatwolf.com with your reservation details and the best way to contact you.  We will be able to start a conversation with the executive leadership team in Anaheim.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary Heading: So much fun under the same roof
Summary: We highly recomend this place to everyone, everything is really accessible, food, fun, and so many activities for the kids. The staff is really friendly and helpful they always greet you with a smile.

Summary Heading: Not the worst not the best
Summary: Room was ok. Nothing special. View was poor. Amenities were awesome.  Food was alright but pricey.  Our kids were able to stay for a week and never leave.  Waterpark was awesome. They have an entire inside world.

Summary Heading: Don't expect Disney level customer service
Summary: Good for a large family on a budget. Bring your own alcohol, otherwise it's $12 for each mixed drink/shot, period. Cabana service was laughable. When we were there the pool opened at 9; but that's only the indoor pool, because the outdoor pool doesn't open until 10. Towel delivery didn't start until 10 - which means no one had any towels, unless you brought your own. Cabana food service doesn't start until 1100. Our outdoor cabana was hot, with poor air flow in spite of the single overhead fan - bring back-up fans/cooling devices if it's >80 degrees out. The cabana description online states

We loved everything about the stay! Definitely will be returning! The customer service was amazing. The only negative was the check in time being at 4 and the Waterpark closing at 8:30. Our family loved everything else!

My kids and I enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very clean and comfortable to sleep in. The water park is fun and enjoying. The environment in nice and clean. The best park is the indoor water park. No need to worry of getting sun burn.

My friend asked if my family wanted to join them to Great Wolfs Lodge.  I was a little hesitant at first because I live in LA and didn’t really want to spend the extra money on accommodations there.  You basically have to stay to play.  However, I figured I would give it a try and I’m glad I did.  There was always something to do.  There is an arcade or a mini bowling alley ($6) per person.  At night there is story time and afterwards a dance party.  The food could be better that’s for sure.  However overall the entertainment was fun for the family.  We would probably go again.

We felt that we were not treated with respect and Dignity, by an employee who is white. We are a Mexican-American family and felt we were being racial profiled by a white female employee at Great Wolf Lodge. I have sent the hotel an email message about our trip. We were celebrating my daughter’s birthday. She loves the water park, but my husband and I feel like we will be spending our $800+dollars elsewhere. We had a half eaten pie that was left in our fridge in the KIDCABIN SUITE.  Then we were treated with disdain by a white female employee. Overall the kids enjoyed the waterpark, but the cashier in the Candy store soured our experience. I won’t be signing up for this treatment again.

This is not  a relaxing resort for adults.   If you go, keep in mind it is all about kids and the kids did enjoy it.   The rooms are clean but basic and very expensive.  Book way in advance to avoid paying most expensive rates.  Maybe off season would better with regards to crowd sizes. I was really looking forward to the lazy river and was most disappointed by it.   It was not in a nice peaceful atmosphere.   There were too many people in it and not enough tubes....opposite of lazy/relaxing.  At least they provide alcohol but it is, as expected, overpriced.

Rooms were clear, beds were comfortable and in excellent condition.  The resort staff was more than friendly and went above and beyond.  The waterpark was fun for not only kids, but us adults too.  The lines were great during the week but became a bit long on the weekend- yet still doable.  Condition of park was clean for the most part and they did a great job of trying to prevent slippery surfaces.

This is my second time visting great wolf lodge and i will be going again, such a great place for celebration or just to take your family and have some fun. I went for my son bday stayed their 3 nights and my whole family loved it, its great for all ages i took my grandmother and she loved it. The only thing we were disapointed with is the loose moose dinner buffet. But their are other places to eat and you can also drive in and out of parking structure for free to eat somewhere else.

We arrived not knowing what to expect, but what we got was two full days of water park joy, incredibly kind, encouraging and dedicated staff members, a clean, extremely well organized park! The room was super fun for a cousins reunion, and there was a Dunkin Donuts in the lobby, a savior for weary parents on day 2;). We'll be back!

The water is poop infested. The staff thinks it’s a joke. When we complained, they said,” it happens all the time.”  Don’t waste your money. Go elsewhere. So many better places. Legoland. Hurricane harbor. Ragging waters. And the staff and employees actually care at the other places.

Stayed 2 nights last week (July). My Husband and I have multiple beds bug bites throughout our bodies. Luckily my son does not have any. Looks like it was localized to just our bed. Our room was on the 5th floor. Seemed clean, but from now on will be double and triple checking all bedding wherever we stay.

My grandchildren's first visit to Great Wolf Lodge was a huge success.  They were so happy at all the choices of attractions. They hit them all and were able to participate on them several times. The rooms were very clean and neat and the beds were very comfortable.  The entire atmosphere was one of fun and happiness.

The whole hotel/water park theme was okay, nothing spectacular.  I was at first confused by all of the lines for the different water rides, not knowing which was which, but after a few times I was able to figure it out.  The staff inside the water park itself were superb.  I did notice that they have their lifeguards sufficiently staffed and are also very well trained.  They continuously walk their areas assigned to them and make it a point to scan the water making sure that everyone remains safe in the water.  Good job.  However, I was very dissatisfied in the breakfast we had at the Loose Moose Cottage.  First, the person seating us just dropped our place settings on the table and walked away without saying a word.  Second, it took about 10 minutes for the server to come over

Friendly staff, food was decent. I would say that we had a hard time finding the entrance to the water park when we first arrived because that information was not given to us at check in. There is also a pass that we had the option of purchasing but was not explained to us. We were being a little rushed at check in but other than that we had a great time in the water park and the arcade.

Do not eat at tge Lodge Wood Fire Grill it tasted like food made out of cardboard. The staff was helpfull in trying to resolve my food wxperience but it did damage the experience. Great hotel for kids.

Summary Heading: Hotel is anything be Great, water/swim facilities were good
Summary: Clearly efforts are placed on the water and swim attractions. Rooms are just ok, felt like a cheap hotel in Reno. Poor valet and housekeeping services, hotel felt bare minimum. Would have expected more in this area considering how expensive the rooms are. When we drove up to valet no one offered to actually valet our car or help with our luggage...it was the strangest experience.

Do not be fooled by the saving coupons bc when it comes down to it they charge 30 for parking and a 30 dollars for the resort fee is this vegas? There are to many fees and they said the city told them to charge this.

Summary Heading: I am very happy about how Great Wolf Lodge Garden Grove giving me no help with my sistuation
Summary: My booking was from Jul 23-24/ It was great staying there until i left and immediately found out that i lost my bracelet in the room #102.  i know exactly because i took the bracelet off when i took shower at night time, i put it in the top left cabinet and in the morning of Jul 24 i forgot it when i left. I called immediately but all they said is that i needed to filled in the form online and someone would contact me. in 3 days no one call. I called backed on Jul 27 and again after many call transfer, they transferred me to Lost and found department and no one picked up phone, I left voice message and said that bracelet is very important to me and ask for help. No one call until now. Is that how your resort help your clients when i have trouble? I assumed that i lost my

Fun place. Food is good for resort. Easy parking with in and out privilege. Microwave in rooms. Chlorine smells strong so we take shower breaks. Arcade and bowling plus lots of other fun activities. Perfect value for families!

Great stay. Park provides useable things which makes packing less stressful. For example no nedd to pack towels and sunscreen. Activities for kids are wonderful and exciting. Staff is very nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge! Our kids range in age from 3 to 13, and they all had a great time! We purchased the Paw Pass for the kids and it was worth it for our first time. The kids enjoyed all the extra things they got and we had fun walking around the resort exploring. I would recommend visiting in a heart beat!

Our first time at GW! My boys had a fun time at the waterpark. We felt that the waterpark should have stayed open later due to the amount of money you spend on your stay. My oldest son had a great time playing MagiQuest. There are a lot of activities at GW. We bought the PawPass which included the MagiQuest wand and games, candy, glitter tattoo, a name bracelet, 20 arcade credits and a build a Bear type animal.

Summary Heading: Would be  a 5 star review except for...
Summary: We went to this hotel with our 6 year old granddaughter. She loved  everything about the trip. The water park was very crowded but they do a good job of keeping tabs on safety issues. I was impressed by the alertness of all the lifeguards. I really enjoyed the snack bar food. The cheeseburgers were fantastic. The morning breakfast buffet was okay not as good as I would have thought. The characters walk around the dining room greeting kids and taking pictures which was nice. The activities the staff plans for the little kids were unexpectedly entertaining. There was a dance party and a story time with pictures with the characters afterwards. This was great fun in the eyes of our 6 year old granddaughter. So why not 5 stars?  The rudeness of the people in the room next door was

This place is amazing!  My kids had a great time and would definitely come back for another stay.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are spacious.  I love seeing kids go on the MagiQuest, kind of reminds me of Harry Potter.

Love coming back here. Third year in a row! Great adventures for kids and adults. From water games/play to restaurants to bowling to arcades and more! Never disappointed! They have variety of restaurants from elegant to fast service food.

Such a fun experience. Booked it for my daughter’s 8th bday and had the BEST time! Definitely recommend. Your kids will go to bed happy and tired which calls for an early wine down. ;) Didn’t have an opportunity to explore with our wand but definitely coming back to put it in use.

My grandkids loved the water park! I loved the water temp. It was just right. There were lots of activities for the kids and a variety of eateries! Our room was nice. The only problem for us was there wasn't a luggage cart available to use when we departed.

We had the family suite for 4 that slept 6. Having a sitting area and table AND a small dinette makes for a more comfortable stay.  The beds were comfy. The sofa beds - springy and not comfy.  Little fridge and microwave just big enough for keeping drinks cold, a little fresh fruit and heating up leftovers. Water park had a LOT of activity choices in a compact area, from mild to scream all the way through it! You can park your self in a location that allows you to see your kids as they wander around. Our 10-11 year olds favored the wave pool, floating in the lazy river and the water house/play structure with a variety of slides all manned by staff that paid attention to safety.  The water park attractions were exhilarating! We were only brave enough for the River Canyon Run. The

My kids had a lot of fun they love the water park and arcade. I will have to say bring lot of money for the arcades I went through almost $200 with two kids and myself in about 45 minutes .. pretty cool how they have a couple full bars...

Great vacation for kids - my kids enjoyed it to the fullest. The rooms were cleaned, the times for the activities were great for the kids. My kids loved the scavenger hunt with the Magiquest. And the indoor water was just plain great as well.

We booked 2 nights, standard room! It is very expensive and the rooms are just ok!  The wave pool kept shutting down for vomit ... within minutes they would turn it back on which was a red flag for us not to go back in there! We enjoyed the slides and the dippin dots cart that was in the middle of the attractions! The food is your typical amusement park food... hot dogs , hamburgers, fries ,and pizza! The staff is friendly . The WiFi kept shutting down due to technical difficulties , per the front desk. The parking is 18.00 per day , which they add in w/ room fee + resort fees ! All that matters is that my daughter enjoyed it ! After all that Is why we , parents , do this ... for the munchkins !

I took my grand kids ages 5,3,1 to the California Great Wold Lodge and I was so highly impressed with everything they had going on for all 3 of my grand kids to enjoy. From dancing, to story time to face painting, to the water park, bowling etc. All 3 of my grand kids had fun. I cannot wait for the one in Scottsdale Az to be open we will visit that one as well.

Overpriced and overrated. Paid over $800 for 2 nights I thought the resort would be nicer. Lobby and the room were ordinary. The food from the buffet were good. We had both dinner and breakfast there. Spent $200 for 2 adults and 2 kids for those two visits. All of my kids loved the arcade. My 13 y/o said the water park is more for younger kids. There were only 4 slides for her age. Would I go back? Nope.

We heard a lot of things about this place and I know that we had to take our kids or experience... everything was clean rides for all ages air conditioning worked great food was okay fun even for parents we would definitely plan another trip price maybe a little high but totally worth it

Our family found the resort very clean!  The hotel staff is really great.  Very surprised at how comfortable the indoor water park was and the lines were very short compared to other water parks in the area.

Summary Heading: Great place for families. The kids loved it here
Summary: All the amenities are in one place. We arrived and everything was pretty much all within th facilities or close by. The hotel was clean and staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Safety measures were in place at the water park. The food at the resort was good and reasonably priced. We are looking forward to another trip soon with more family and friends and already planning our next stay. The location is also conveniently located close to other great spots like Disneyland and good restaurants.

Great Wolf was an amazing experience. It had activities for ever member (all ages including adults) in our family. The staff acknowledge our daughters birthday everywhere we went. We were so pleased and can’t wait to go back next year.

Great service. Staff was very friendly. Love the water attractions. Accommodations were great. Seemed a little pricey, but worth the money.  Room was kept very clean. The food was also great. Enjoyed our experience.

This place was amazing ! plus the price was decent. Great water park and great service. All the staff was very helpful and kind. checked in and out of the hotel with no issues.  Definitley would reccomemend the is place to anyone. I absolutely loved the smaller pool since I have a 2 year old and felt comfortable with him floating around since the pool was not that deep.

Love this place! Tons of things to do in the water park even with my 4 yr old. Only one or 2 rides he couldn’t get on. Super clean and friendly and helpful staff. The resort had ton of activities to keep them entertained. Family of 5, so a bit expensive but we’ll worth it. The paw pass is worth it too especially if it’s your first time

Summary Heading: Great Time..need more than one night :)
Summary: Stayed one night with family of 3 children 13,10 and 8 years old husband and my self. Had two queen beds and pull out couch. Got wolf pass for kids. They had a blast in water park but really rushed to do magic quest and other attractions before we left next day. Did not fully enjoy entire experience. Could have used another day. Good time overall. A tad pricey but definitely a great vacation spot

My family had a wonderful time. I wish we had one more time for my son to finish the magic quest. Staff attentive, excellent lifeguard, room clean, No wait on rides, great food prices, love the Nachos😊,   👍👍👍

Kids had  a blast the lines to the ride went by fast kids always had a smile the  activities are amazing food is a little pricey but pizza place feeds everyone for a good price they have a ice cream place OMG yum

We had an overnight with our 11 and 10 year olds.  During our stay we used the waterpark only and did not partake in the other activities.  My entire family had so much FUN! The staff was friendly and the facilities and rooms were clean.  We luckily found a table with chairs in the waterpark upon entering, but after observation finding a spot can be challenging for families unless you get there early in the morning.  We were dissapointed though that they started closing down all the rides and pools at 8:30 when they told us it closes at 9:00. When you  pay $400 for a 1 night stay every minute counts.

My kids range from 2-8 years old and they all had so much fun at this place that they are asking when will they be coming back and if they can have their birthday party here . I don't blame them for asking because me and my husband had so much fun too.

GWL was a fantastic experience for our kiddos ! We stayed at DH last year and it was fine but GWL had more activities for kids .  You’d think Disney would have more stuff for kids, but GWL was better by far .   Water park was a blast .  Just like the TV commercials !  Didn’t disappoint fr sure .   Brandy at the Front Desk, Ximena at the Wood Fired Grill and Corey at Kids Corner were great  .  Brandy was helpful when we called about arriving early . Ximena was super nice when we dined at Wood Fired Grill . Our kiddoes really enjoyed dancing with Corey .  The valet guys were great and the Housekeepers did an outstanding job of cleaning up after our mess every day !  With Dunkin’ Donuts, a pizza joint and breakfast buffet right at the hotel it was like we were staying in a big

Summary Heading: Way to expensive for what it is
Summary: My 10 year old daughter had been begging to go to the Great Wolf lodge for a long time, and we finally broke down and booked a stay.  With great anticipation, we arrived and found no spaces in the huge parking lot, so ended up using Valet to park.  Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, so no complaints there.  Rooms were nice and comfortable - we had the kids cabin and found that you have to buy this overpriced wand to activate some of the features of the room.  Found the water park to be much more crowded than we thought it would be.  Early the next morning was the best bet.  Our family did enjoy the water park features and found it to be quite similar to other water parks we have been to.  I really didn't like the overpriced buffet - thought the food was terrible.  Also

Single mom, could only afford one summer adventure for my kiddos. Decided to give Great Wolf Lodge a try... It was fun, but not sure we will return. Fun water park especially for kiddos up to about 7-8 years old. But the options for slightly older kids (I have two boys ages 8 and 11) are not much...only a couple slides which all the older kids are at so you can imagine the long lines even on a weekday. Even the outside activities are geared towards the younger set: the bowling alley is tiny with tiny balls and tiny lanes. Older kids could go to the fun arcade but really you just dropped so much to stay overnight in the hotel! It would be great if they had options for older kids, pre teens and maybe even an activity or two for older kids...my 13 year old niece was just following

We just got back last week from a trip to SoCal and the Great Wolf Lodge.  This was our family’s first experience at one of their properties.  We had some minor issues like a super long lines at the Front Desk when we arrived and noisy AC in our suite, but the friendliness of the staff made up for it.  The hotel itself was huge with many dining options.  It was a surprise to see how many shops and attractions there were INSIDE the hotel.  We hardly left property except to walk to McDonald’s across the street.  The kids had fun and at the end of the day, that’s all that matters.  Ava is looking forward to coming back to see her bestie, Corey, who I believe works in the children’s department.  The water park was super crowded, but again, friendly employees made it work.  Nice job,

We went for my daughter's 8th birthday and overall it was a little too expensive for what we got. In the future we might only visit the water park but eat and sleep elsewhere. The food was not that great and grossly overpriced. The coffee machine was broken, there was poop in the kiddie pool, and the cable in our room skipped so much we couldn't watch a movie.

Lots of activities besides the water park that gets the kids engaged. Fun, friendly and clean. Checking in during peak time is madness but that’s expected. It’s a little pricey but worth the cost since we have access to the water park on both the check in day and check out day. would definitely come back.

It was an amazing place, but for the price we paid it could be better.  If only it can be a little more affordable and reasonable in that way everyone else can come.  It would make it easier to consider joining.

great family fun place, rain or shin the water park operates indoors. have been coming the last two years . hotel very new and well kept. comfortable rooms and beds this is my 6 year old grandsons favorite place to stay

Expensive weekend retreat, however worth the time with family and friends.  Next time we are considering bringing our own cooler of cold drinks and food in order to save on meals and beverages.  Our family was happy to be in the suite after a long day in the water park.

Summary Heading: A perfect resort to celebrate a child's birthday!
Summary: Loved everything about my stay and experience at this hotel. The water park was amazing and had tons of activities and attractions for all ages. The staff was very friendly, the food options were excellent and everything tasted amazing! There is so much to do that I wished I had planned to stay more than 2 days.

Summary Heading: Fun place to stay with kids
Summary: My daughter enjoyed the slides.  She had fun. You just don't have a variety of choices of food if you will stay and eat inside the lodge during your stay.  Staffs inside the water park should always be helpful especially in assisting small kids in the slides.

New experience for the kids, nice place to beat the summer heat. Everything you need is under one roof but we did go out to eat , there’ s plenty affordable restaurant around the area just walking distance.

So many varied water options w/o the wait or sunburn.   Thought I would be over it after one day but couldn't wait to use the complimentary 2nd day.  Wet or dry - there's a lot to do.  Go be a family!!!! Go be a kid again!!!

Friendly Great staff Fun for your whole family , no need  To worry about the outside weather conditions Many activities to keep every entertained (Children  5-17 ) we all had a good time and Will be going back

This is a great place for the family, our kids always have a good time here, everything is there and you don't have to leave the hotel for anything. Service and the rooms are great, it doesn't matter if it's raining or shining your family will have a great time in the pools.

I went to celebrate my grand niece's 4th birthday.  She had a blast.  Everyone was very nice and welcoming.  The room was comfortable.  The water park was a lot of fun.  I felt the lifeguards were very attentive and doing their job well.  My mother, who is 77, joined us just to experience the resort and we didn't see her for the entire day...she was too busy going on all the slides!!!!

Summary Heading: Excellent experience . I came for the first time for a family summer vacation, we all had fun as a family.
Summary: Excellent experience.  I came for the first time for a family summer vacation. Not only did the kids have fun but also me & my husband. I definitely would recommend this place, I think next time I will book more days.

Summary Heading: Well They make it work!  The whole Family had Fun
Summary: I was a little worried at first about going.  However, they have figured out how to make an enjoyable experience out of chaos.  The place is laid out nicely, with the indoor golf, water slides, bowling, bingo, and games for the kids.  The cocktails are actually very good for the adults.  Other than the non-stop stimulus, and the slight smell of chlorine in the air.  It was enjoyable.   Also felt very safe, plenty of lifeguards, security, always someone cleaning the bathroom, mopping up,  always clean towels. etc  we had a good time, and will return

My self, wife, son and two nephews stayed for couple nights and we loved it, we had a great time together. Our room was clean and the customer service was excellent. We purchase the paw passes for the children and they had the best time ever.

Something for 3 to 71! Perfect for a family vacation ❣Year number 3 and grandkids already asked if we can go again. Recommend and so less expensive than Disney . If you have water babies,  this is the place to go .

Summary Heading: Fun but expensive & needs to be cleaned
Summary: Not something that we would do over and over again, it’s too pricey for that. The wands are extremely expensive with the toppers - we bought 2 for $86 and some change, and you STILL have to pay for the Magiquest game. The water park needs some maintenance & deep cleaning. There is hair everywhere, which is gross & the paint on the walls is bubbling & peeling. With that being said, the kids had a great time. All the kids cared  about was having fun, which they did.

My kids, 2yrs and 8yrs, had a blast here. Staff is extremely friendly and attentive and there are so many activities to do. On the down side, some of the magiquest chests were broken and some of the sensors didn't respond very well to our wand. The Dunkin Donuts coffee was really watered down, nothing like you'd get at a regular Dunkin store. Our first room was dirty and smelly but after a quick phone call we were transferred to a cleaner and better smelling room...and given a breakfast voucher as compensation! It was all worth it to see how happy my children were the whole time we stayed here. I highly recommend the Great Wolf lodge.

We went to Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim for my daughter's 12th birthday and it was an absolute blast. Sidney, the Guest Services Manager went above and beyond to make sure that everything was right for us and couldn't have been more accommodating. The waterpark was clean and had slides of all different intensities that both my 12 and 18 year old daughters enjoyed. We had lunch at the Lodge Wood Fired Grill and the food was delicious.  We will definitely go back.

The kids had so much fun and will be back soon.the food prices are great and the pizza is the best. Everyone had the best time.you will not be disappointed. The staff here always has a smile and are willing to help with what ever you need.so if you don't want to deal with sunburn kids .This is the place.

Summary Heading: Howling fun at Wolf Creek Lodge!
Summary: Wanted to do something fun with pre teen grandkids. Perfect timing. Extreme heat wave occuring so we we were totally comfortable being inside for the whole 2 days. The only time we went outside was to view the Dland fireworks from the GWL rooftop parking level.

The Best 2 day family mini vacation we ever had. We had an awesome time & the kids didn't want to leave. It brought out the kid in us. My husband & I became kids again after a long time😉. We'll definitely coming back!

Just wanted to thank the Great Wolf Team for a wonderful stay.  Our family had a great time.  we were surprised at how may restaurants and shops are inside!  Kudos for Corey in Kids Club for making my little girl feel like a VIP!  This was the first time we had stayed at a Great Wolf.  We have one back home in Washington State, so we are thinking about having Carlie's next birthday there.  We saw other guests with birthday posters on their doors so we can make it a fun, local getaway.  The waterpark hotel here left a good impression.  Our family enjoyed it more than Disney!

Summary Heading: Great in theory, horrible service and execution.
Summary: We live in SoCal and have been wanting to take our son to the GWL since it opened a few years ago. We finally found time to go and decided to spend 3 days and 2 nights there this week to celebrate my son’s birthday. While we were very impressed with the facility itself, the water park was impressive, the arcade and other kids’ activities fun and entertaining for kids of all ages, and the food and shop selection large and satisfying for a hotel small in comparison to its competitors (Disney/Universal/Knotts), the service was HORRIBLE.   From blatantly rude, inattentive, disrespectful teenage ice cream servers in the water park, to bussers by the dozen who literally stood talking behind us as we had to stack clean plates on dirty ones to eat at the dinner buffet, to a waiter who

My children had a great time at the water park. Food was ok,  a luttle pricey. Many specialty stores in the complex made it convenient for us to shop. My children had  a blast. Overall, we would definitely come back.

We thought of try something different this year and selected the Great Wolf Lodge instead of the usual Disney, Knott's Berry,Sea World or other southern Cal spots. Our visit was three days/two nights. The mobile check in was a nice touch and our room was ready as we requested. The room was clean but the AC made a lot of noise and the TV reception was intermittently pixelated making viewing programs awful. Some of the dinning staff were friendly and helpful during our family vacation stay there but they definitely had their favorites..   There wasn't as much of interaction with the lodge characters as in other parks like Disney as we anticipated so that was disappointing for the children.   The water park was fun and the kid enjoyed it. Can't go too wrong there but overall, the

Brought our 2 grandkids here for 3 nights. We got the Suite with the Den sleeping quarters for the 2 kids. The room was plenty big enough. We were on the 3rd floor and it was quiet.   The water park area is huge and crowded but we still found a couple of empty chairs to dump our stuff on.  Being in our mid-sixties we had a blast at the park riding the various slides.   Yes the food is pricey but so is Disneyland so just pay and enjoy yourself.   I would definitely come back here again. 👍👍

After debating on where to go, we decided on Great Wolf Park. We fell in love with this place. We especially loved the wave pool. Brinley, our personal assistant, was so helpful and knowledgeable and answered all our questions in a timely manner and with a good attitude.

At check out we were charged for 3 services we never received, apparently, people can go anywhere in the hotel using your room number and wristband or other means to charge to your room without you knowing.  The person at the counter said they can pull camera footage to check and we won't be charged, but that's not the case - it was charged to my credit card, I called the Lodge and got voicemails, nobody return my calls.  I ended up filling a dispute with my credit card company - what a waste of time.  If you have other options go somewhere else.  Terrible customer service.

Our mini family summer vacation was just amazing, my kiddos enjoyed every minutes we were there. They love the games and water park, they want to stay for another day. I recommend this place to anyone, it’s perfect for me because my kids are toddlers and infant, perfect indoor activities.

We will never go back! Dirty, overpriced, and the staff was not on point I was injured and didn’t receive any help. My kids didn’t enjoy it and it closed way to early for an all inclusive resort for kids and their parents.

Went with the family for a 3 day vacation. Did everything we could possibly do in that time. My 8 year old daughter got the wolf pass and enjoyed everything that was offered on it. She also really loved the magiquest. Waterpark itself was cool. Would definitely go again. Thanks Great Wolf Lodge

Friendly staff, lots of activities, comfortable beds, everything you need in one place.  Loved the variety of activities for the kids.  Staff members helped us when we had questions and concerns.  We’re in love with this place.

All the kids had a wonderful time.  We got a cabana and it was great.  Service was exceptional.  Adults had fun to.  Rooms were nice and clean.  Lots to do for the kids.  Story time for the little ones.  It was great.  Lots of things left to do for next time we visit.

It’s a Great Wolf Lodge.   We have stayed in several accross the country and they are all pretty much the same.   The room was clean and there was plenty of room in the Wolf Den Suite.    The water park had lots to do but nowhere to sit.    Unless you got to the water park at 9am, and put down 12 towels to save chairs, there were no chairs left.    Very disappointing that staff did not monitor this.   It’s water park was better that some of the others and my kids had so much fun.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun, a few complaints
Summary: My son had a blast. The water park is great, the MagiQuest game is a lot of fun, and it's just a great place for kids overall. I also have complaints, but nothing major enough to ruin the trip or make it any less magical for my son. Basically everything about this place is either really fantastic or really aggravating. The staff at the pizza place is incredibly rude,  and the pizza is awful (my son loved it, though.) Housekeeping is hit or miss. For two days they brought only decaf coffee and I had to call to get regular coffee. When they came the next day, they brought regular coffee, and took the coffeepot. (I tip well, in case anyone wondered.) The rooms are missing basic things that even the cheapest hotels have, like pen and paper, and a "do not disturb" sign. (I did get a

Great place for a great price! Love that the water park is indoors. Rides are fun for all ages. Food was fantastic. Activities are geared more for elementary and middle school students. Room was clean and comfortable. Overall, a very family oriented environment. Looking forward to coming again.

Water park feels like a gas chamber-couldn't stay more than 2 hours per day.
