Rooms are dirty, room carpet was sticky, not enough kids entertainment for different ages, no kids club, housekeeping is horrible-missed items everyday, did not show up at ALL one day, and are not accommodating, food quality is very low, except Dunkin- We had to get meals from outside. will never come back nor recommend this place. Will actually warn people for this place. I wish i can get my money and time back. I need a vacation from this horrible experience!

very over priced for very poor quality of rooms , food and amenities. paid for a large suite for my family that was run down and couldn't open curtains to living room because had allyway as my view : (

Enjoyable wholesome family experience for the whole family. Amazing fun things for kids to do from entertainment, games and scavenger hunts; too much to list. Fantastic water park for Adults and of course the kids. They didn’t miss a thing in this adventurous place!!

A great place for a family fun time in the water! Kids and adults will have a wonderful time there. Really nice clean and comfy rooms, with excellent fun features for kids. Water park have great attractions but it was too crowded.

After hearing friends rave about this place, we decided to stay here for two nights in early June. The water park is fun but underwhelming. Indoors, there is a gated area with a play structure for the infants and toddlers, another larger play structure for the older kids, and a lazy river. The wave pool is fun, and the body surfing area is also entertaining (for spectators and participants). Then, there are the big slides for the adventurous people. All in all, this area is clean with friendly staff. As for food, the resort is known to be a place that can cater to those with peanut and tree nut allergies. As a family with severe peanut & tree nut allergies, we were looking forward to not having to worry about allergens. However, when we had questions about cross contact (from

Summary Heading: One and done on this place.
Summary: Never again. The water park was nice but the place was packed.   I paid for my children (6&9) to have the Wolf Passes which included the Magiquest game. I wish I’d known this was a 6-8 hour affair! Rather than enjoying the water, my kids were sucked into this game which had us roaming up and down the elevators (literally!) 100 times. While the people managing the game and in the store were absolutely lovely, the game itself is pretty ridiculous. My children love scavenger hunts but this one was repetitive and lame. I think it could have been about 80% shorter and would’ve been much more fun.   Also, why do “family” hotels have to suck? Since when do $400/night hotels not have nice linens, soaps, etc? Great Wolf Lodge is like Las Vegas for children if the only accommodations were

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge - you gotta go!
Summary: Great rooms, great service and great activities (including their awesome indoor water park).  So much to do, so much to see.  One of the best family trips we ever had and so close to home!  Don’t forget the Wolf Passes for your children!

Summary Heading: Be prepared to spend ALOT of money!!
Summary: I took my 3 grandchildren (ages 3, 5 & 11) and my daughter for 3 days and all though we had a great time and enjoyed the water park, I found everything to be extremely expensive and I wasn't impressed with the breakfast at the buffet.  The rooms were comfortable enough but I couldn't get the coffee maker to work and the water pressure in the shower is very poor.  I don't think I would give this a 4 star rating at all, more like 3 star.

Fun location for kids. Clean but very crowded. Sometimes there was nowhere to sit to relax. There is also a no outside food or drink policy.  This was disappointing because all of the food purchases are at the hotel. In addition the room has a mini refrigerator and microwave to accommodate for food. Overall fun for kids but as a parent they could have a few more aspects to make life a bit easier for the parent life...

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge - Great Fun for the family
Summary: This hotel is very fun, there are a lot of things to do. The water park is very equipped, the magic quest is very detailed. Things you could do better are to have a laundry room or a place that can wash clothes because, if people want to swim and they only brought one pair of swimsuit, therefore they won't be able to wash it. Also, you should try to let people finish one level on magic quest, then ask them to pay. The breakfast needs to be improved, but the good thing is, you get to take pictures with the characters of Great Wolf Lodge.

Overall my family had fun at the water park but a few things made the experience sour. There was incorrect charge on my bill upon check out and when I spoke to the front desk, they said they can not remove it and someone from restaurant will call me. This is the first I’ve heard that the front desk can not fix incorrect charges which left me very upset, especially since the amount was less than $10. Also when I checked in I was told parking was included in the room rate but saw a charge of $18 on my bill upon check out. The same person on the front desk argued with me that I wasn’t charged and after a few minutes he actually looked at the bill and realized I was charged then proceeded to tell me it is because I didn’t book directly with them. His name is Alii. He seriously needs

We had little vacation for our family in Great Worf Lodge for 2days. We had really nice time with my son  and his friend. My son enjoyed so much and come back again soon. He loved in Wave and slides. All of us enjoyed so much!!!

At the end of the day, it's not Disney, but it's a spotless water park with great services for the kids.  They have a lot of wonderful things for a family here.  From wolf ears for everyone, to planning morning and afternoon activities outside of the water park, you will feel safe having your kids play here.

The concept was great but very, very pricey for what you got. The water park was entirely too hot.. Poor parking and people didn't control their kids. Lots of running in the halls and yelling late at night.

We went away for a few days while our bathroom was being renovated and due to the prices of two rooms for our family we were looking for lodging plus activity and we got that and so much more. The wristbands as door keys are a stroke of genius! We felt safe letting the kids run around from questing to enjoying the waterpark with limited supervision.

Kids love the water park, its a lot activities but they close at 8:30 if they can extend until 10:00pm. Have shopping store inside, restaurant but if you want to eat outside its nearby. We will come back again!

My family and I stayed at the so.cal location and we had a wonderful time. From the time we checked in we were greeted with a smile and the front desk personnel was very patient with us, helping accommodate all of our needs. we celebrated my daughter's bday the day we got in. The room was prepped with balloons, cake and other decorations. the room was very clean and we even got a nice little bday card for Antonella from all the staff at great wolf lodge. the waterpark was a little crowded the first day. but the second day was better (Sunday) we wanted to stay an additional day but the hotel was completely booked. by looking around and watching other kids and families they seemed to be having a lot of fun too! I would definitely recommend this location in Southern Ca.  we had a

Its a really nice place to take the family or friends to have a comfortable stay at the resort, cool waterpark and shops. The babies even have entertainment. A bar for the adults if you want to relax. Overall cool place. A little pricey, but  a fun experience.

My family had lots of fun! And the staff was great we can’t Waite to go again soon. The kids love every minute of the trip. And they have everything really organized and clean. The prices are really good and affordable.

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Everthing was good for us had no problems checking in ususally we go to a hotel and there is always some kind of problem not this time rooms were readu also when making reservations for the stay at the lodge the person making the reservations was very helpful I asked about discounts they saw to it that they found me the right one, checked in the hotel with no problem.  Went to dinner resturant was very good they serve us in a timely manner food was good., had breakfast at the buffert was also good. The wrist band for the kids was so amazing it worked out good for everyone especially the kids getting in the room since they were going. back and forth from the park area.

Great Wolf Lodge is in need of TLC. The paint in the water park is peeling and the steps to the water slides need to be cleaned and repaired. Employees need to answer guests questions and help them instead of brushing them off.

Very pricey.  No shuttle service to Disneyland unless you reserve far ahead of time.    Urine, feces, and vomit in/and near water structures.  Not a lot of good food choices for healthy eating (lots of fast food).  Sofa bed squeaked whenever the person rolled over or moved.  No remote control for tv.

Such a blast!  Kiddos were on a two day high, swimming, sliding and eating - great way to spoil the Grandkids! Keep up the great friendly service and quality of eateries.  You will have many repeat customers, and we wish you all the best!

Summary Heading: Great fun at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Overnight stay was not enough. Enjoyed the water park. My 4-yr old daughter had so much fun. My wife and I had fun fun as well. I highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim .We will certainly go back.

Summary Heading: The Lodge Is Not That Great
Summary: My son saw the commercials for Great Wolf Lodge and really wanted to go.  We made the reservations online.  Because we made our reservations two months in advance and planned on staying a minimum of three days, we got a 50% discount.  Great!  However, when we got there, my boys were disappointed.  The room was tiny!  Not at all what it looked like on the website.  I was going to ask for an upgrade, but my husband and boys said that they just wanted to stay and not bother with that.  Ok.  We went down to the main floor to get something to eat.  The Loose Moose Buffet was decent, but not great.  We figured we can try out the other restaurants.  All the other eateries were a disappointment!  The Lodge Wood Fired Grill was the worst.  The food was all salt and grease!  My oldest son

Why do we need an indoor theme park in Southern California? Sunblock and wind. The kids were ecstatic not to need sunblock, and I was ecstatic not to reapply to wet bodies throughout the day, and no sunburns! The kids (not I, ahem) get cold coming in and out of the water with outdoor winds, so it was a luxury to run around an indoor park. The room was conveniently located, wristband chips meant that we didn't have to remember keys, credit card, etc. Mobile check-in was easy and awesome, and our room was ready early! Two waterpark days for the price of an overnight stay made this an affordable short vacation.

Our first family visit to GWL GG. Overall it was affordable and enjoyable for all 4 of us. We didn’t have any issues with check in or out. Water shoes are a must for the water park (feet stay clean) Kids had a great time and we can’t wait to return!

Nice place to spend with family.. only thing is kind of expensive, over $800 for 2 nights.  The water park isn't that big, kind of crowded because isn't that big....our room was great , clean , and roomy.

Summary Heading: Wow Even the Adults WIll Have Fun!
Summary: Didn't expect to have fun here, but we did!  We were doing this just for our daughter, and ended up having a blast ourselves.  This is a great place for families!  It is a bit of a splurge with all the add ons, but it is a great trip!  Nice roomy clean suites!  Friendly professional staff.  A great time!

Summary Heading: Most of the staff is great
Summary: Check in took 45 minutes on a Monday in June. Park is small and crowded. Restroom in water park was not clean. Teens got bored after 24 hours stay. Room was clean but sofa bed very uncomfortable. Dining is overpriced.

We had a great time. Staff was great, the food was delicious. There is so much to do but it was both relaxing and fun. I even participated in the Quest game with my daughter. Can't wait to come again!!!

Summary Heading: Great Local Activity for Young Kids but needs some Improvements
Summary: Make sure when you request for an item, ii.e.crib, during reservation, to double check w/ staff that it was supplied in the room before going into the room. Also, it would be nice that when checking in to your room that any staff, even the main check-in staff, will assist you rather than having wasted 15-20mins in line only to be told you're in the wrong line and have to wait again at the mobile check-in. Lastly, when placing extras to your order double check that all your extras are on the tray rather than having teetering w/ a full tray and your kids to far away tables that's not even close to the food counter. It's terrible that there's only about 6 tables right in front of Bucket's and the rest of the tables are about 500 feet further when you're rustling w/ young kids & a

Our family stays a could times a year.  It is great family fun in a safe environment.  Keep an eye out on prices because they change all the time.  It can get crowed during the summer and holidays so try staying on off peek times.  Have fun and relax!

She had a great time very clean and safe lots of things to do places to eat...tiring but fun. May seem pricey but with entrance to the waterpark included makes it well worth it...only issue I had my room wasn't ready st 4 like promised any I checked in a 1 other people checked in after me and they got there room before me

Summary Heading: Great for kids, McDonalds across the street and KFC down the street to save $
Summary: This is a really fun place if you have little ones under 12 or so. Older kids might be bored. The bowling alley is super tiny and you roll a softball size bowling ball maybe half the length of a regular bowling lane. We save cash by having McDonalds from across the street (5-10 min walk, or they deliver via uber eats) and lunch/dinner down the street, about 10 -15 minute walk, or order anything via grubhub and have them meet you outside or in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Get in while it is new!
Summary: Great place. Still new, clean and quick lines. Can't beat that. And that is all I have to say but now this little box is making me add more characters because if you do not have 200 characters than it will not let you close it out.. and I just hit 200. Bye!

Staying at Great Wolf Lodge was quite expensive but the kids loved the experience.  Got smarter this trip by eating outside of the park for breakfast and dinner one day.  We did snack in the park.  The kids had a ball.

This was our 1st visit to the Resort and the kids had a great time. We celebrated my sons 9th birthday. We appreciate the easy check in/check out as it was extremely busy when we got there. I was afraid I'd be stuck there for a while But it was a smooth ride. When we got to the park our teenagers headed for the slides and my son and husband spent their time outdoors and I love that we were given that option since indoors was a little to

The water park is nice, fun, and warm.  This park in a medium size park and there is a ride for every member in your family. If you participate in the wand game with your family, start on the first day.  That game will take about a day and a half to complete, if not, don't waste your money.      The pillows in the room smell like chlorine and there are water spots all over the floor. I only stayed for Saturday and left Sunday.  I read other reviews where people stated they stayed for longer periods and the whole family was sick afterward.  People have to realized this is a water hotel.  There was a lot of moisture in the air due to this fact, staying longer will cause sickness.  As with the other reviews, the whole family had diarrhea at the end of the stay and when we got home.

Stayed 2 nights with 2 other families. This place is great for people who have kids younger than 14yrs old. My 17yr old was over it quick. The bowling alley is like mini golf. The whole water park could be seen and done in 1 day. The rooms were really spacious. The beds were comfy, but the sofa pull out was not so comfy. The springs were sticking out of it. The bath towels in the rooms are small. Barely wrapped around my niece and nephew who are average 10 and 11yr. There's no clothes line in the shower to hang wet swim suits. Overall the kids had a great time. If we do come back, 1 day stay is enough.

Our family had lots of fun here, our kids are 17,11 and 8 and there was something exciting for them to do. tons of activities aside from the awesome water park, we never got bored. We were there to celebrate our daughter's 8 bday, and ALL the

Summary Heading: Fun place but rooms could use more help.
Summary: My out of town family invited me to join them for the weekend.  Make sure to go early and line up for check in because the line was LONG.  They told us they had mobile check in but during that day it was out, so be prepared.  We checked in to what they called "the wolf den", I think?  There were two bunk beds  for the little kiddos with the TV in the area,  which was cute. Then there's a queen bed and a fold out bed.  The fold out was horrible!  The bed was hard and squeaked each time you moved and I felt like there was a bar in my back the whole time I slept.  I woke up with a sore back!  Both my families(in two rooms) thought that the beds were hard!  The A/C was not strong enough. Last, what I found weird was that the bathroom sink was way into the room?!    As for the water

Fun time with the family. Pricey food, good overall section of food. Great and fun time in the water park. Long check in line, but over all worth the wait. Make sure you have your ID and credit card ready to help move along.

Something to do for everyone and all ages! This is our second year in a row visiting and plan on returning every summer. Next year bringing more families. But be warned it is a pricy weekend. Room and water park entry is reasonable but the meals can all add up!

Our family had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge.  Great staff.  Lots to do.  Good food at reasonable prices.  Rooms were comfortable and clean.  Water park has a big variety of water activities.  Outside pool too!  Would recommend.

Summary Heading: Our family of 4 had a great time!
Summary: Our family vacation was for a week and was supposed to be partly at Great Wolf Lodge and Disneyland. Motels around Disneyland were just as expensive as the Great Wolf Lodge, although not the Disneyland hotels themselves. Since the GWL offered a promotion for complimentary Disney tickets, which ultimate brought down the average cost of the room stay at GWL, we elected to stay at the GWL our entire time. Rather than using their shuttle service, I chose to drive to the Disney parking lot and pay the $20 parking fee so we would not be restricted to the GWL pick-up/drop-off times so I cannot give a review of that service. Overall, the waterpark was wonderful, the arcades and activities area was very imaginative, and the front lobby and restaurant was pleasantly decorated with

It is a bit pricey to stay here-the good was good but pricey as well, my biggest complaint is that you aren't allowed to bring drinks and snacks to the pool area:( I understand they wanna sell their food and that's fine, but you should be at least able to bring in some juices and waters for kids! Also, prepackaged snacks would be nice too-I understand not wanting full blown ice chests down there because that would lead to a lot of trash and chaos with sandwiches and stuff( and would cut back on their food sales!) All in all we had a nice time💕 And would go back if it were cheaper or allowed to bring own drinks in pool area:)

He made my son’s 5th birthday party an incredible day!!! The kids and the parents had so much fun, they truly enjoyed themselves. This all happened because of Director Jesse who was very supportive, attentive and personable. He made all our request possible!

Summary Heading: Not a good place to take teenagers
Summary: I would not recommend this place for children over the age of 10. There should be more documentation on the website that this place is geared for young kids, not meant for kids over the age of 12.  For example the “bowling alley” is tiny and the bowling balls are the size of softballs. The pullout sofa bed was flat, uneven and had springs sticking up everywhere. I was up at 2:00 am with a neck and backache.

Summary Heading: Stayed two nights with my two preschooler
Summary: Doesn't worth the money, the hotel quality level is at a 2 star hotel and the water park is overly crowded. They tried to create a Disney experience but it feels like a cheap knock off. Our five and three year old enjoyed their time there but my husband and I were so dissatisfy we checked out a night early even-though we've already paid.

The resort was fun for the whole family, however the room when we arrived had a broken AC unit and the sheets on one of the beds had obviously not been cleaned. The AC was replaced quickly but it took multiple calls to the front desk and over an hour for the maid to come and change the sheets.

Whole family had a blast at the Great Wolf Lodge. Very friendly and helpful staff. Resort was clean and inviting. There were many activities for the kids to do. Great location. Check in and check out was a breeze.

Summary Heading: No view room but who cares
Summary: Didn’t go for the view anyway. It’s in Garden Grove! Water park was good, a lot of food choices. And everything kids need is inside, no need to go anywhere else. But if you need to close to just about anything.

Summary Heading: The next best thing to cruising
Summary: My family and I just got home from two days at The Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove, Ca. We all had a wonderful time and my daughter was sad to leave. All in all our experience was great. One a scale of one to ten, I’d give it a strong 8. The water park is awesome, and the food although a bit expensive is pretty good. But we found ways to economize and did pretty good. Some of the attractions are a bit pricey, but that too was doable. To me anyhow, it’s the next best thing to taking a cruise. We only stayed one night. An entire week would cost around $1500 and doesn’t include your food.

Summary Heading: First time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: My kids and I had an overall great experience. The only downfall was that our room smelled very bad of mildew. I chose not to even complain because we only stayed one night. Would have liked a better smelling room! Maybe next time

Water park was awesome...just wish the lifeguards could be more friendly and cleaner bathrooms. My kids love magi quest and overall we had a blast on rides and all the water park fun. I would go back just wish management worked on customer service.

The kids had a great time!  They loved the water park.  The entire staff were friendly. The kids activities that were free (yoga, coloring, face painting, Jammie jamboree and family game night) were enjoyable. The kids enjoyed doing things outside of the water. Winding down in the evening was nice.  The wolf den suite was a queen bed, sofa bed and 2 bunk beds. Nice enough. Not as roomy as I thought it would be.  The prices for anything else you wanted to buy or do were astronomical.  Obviously an arcade is pricey to begin with so I knew going in that would cost me. What really bummed me out was the price of a child’s manicure and pedicure. It was 3x the price I’m used to. It was more than what I pay as an adult. Maybe I’m cheap?  Our stay cost $1200 for 2 nights for 2 adults and

Summary Heading: A howling day for my family...
Summary: This is the 3rd time in a row. Every once a year we come here. Everyone loves water and they made it more fun because of the slides and the waves are cool! Foods are great too.. You feel like your back to your childhood.. playing all day! Staffs are all friendly. Thank you for the experiences.

the service was a good. staff and maid service friendly. quick respond from housekeeping .rooms were clean. Valet retrieved vehicle quick. water park needs repairs. water park had litter on the stairway to the rides.

We paid $500 for a room for one night for our family of 5.  That is a lot!  Plus the water park was extremely crowded.  The lazy river was packed with people, and so was the wave pool.  The room was really nice and clean, and quiet.  Food there is expensive and you are not allowed to bring in outside food into the water park.  It was fun, but so crowded.  I doubt we will go back.

Fun family getaway, easy to navigate. Waterpark had options for kids of all ages. They pack a lot of dry entertainment as well including mini golf, bowling, arcade etc. Room cost is high but includes 2 days of waterpark so worth it.

beyond fun.  No reason to worry about the weather or having to hoover over your kids, safety everywhere and so much fun. I totally recommend this place, constant cleaning of the facility, friendly staff, kids able to have a great time, while parents sat and enjoyed ourselves.

check-in/check-out are super fast and very convenience. great idea incorporating mobile and text msg to check-in/check-out. another great feature was the wrist band has the ability to unlock rooms, make payments and its waterproof.

I give it two thumbs up. My kids and my nephews were super excited and had lots of fun there, we were happy to have more than one thing to do there since there are other things besides just the water park

Great location, less than 2 Hours Drive from anywhere in Southern California. Resort was great for all ages. The only negative comment I have to leave is that the bedding was extremely uncomfortable especially the pillows. For the price that the resort charges, I think they can afford to spend a few bucks more on decent pillows. Those times that we have stayed at the resort, I have not wanted to spend more than one night knowing that kids would be restless as I predicted and we would be unrested ( due to discomfort of pillows and bedding).

I have an 11 and an 8 year old. We went to the Great Wolf Lodge on a whim and stayed 2 nights. After the first 2 hours, my kids had done all of the water park and were kind of “over it”.  Be prepared to spend more there. Food, arcade, drinks (need something to help deal with the kid crazy all over the place). The pizza was good. The ice cream shop is reasonable and the bars were well priced for good drinks. I am that mean mom that did not spring for the special theme room. Our standard room was far from luxurious. The water pressure was terrible.  Kids knocking on doors in middle of night thinking they were funny... We won’t go back. I think it was a fun experience for the Most part but we are 1 and done. I like my sleep too much and a nice shower and a free breakfast.

An expensive water park inside a hotel minutes from Disneyland. It is 84 and humid inside the water park but the kids loved the experience. The food is average but for most places in this region that is actual pretty good.

The pool area smells so strong it burns your eyes the moment you walk in the place. Then as soon as you get in the pool and get water in your eyes they seem to be on fire. Obviously not chemically balanced. The food we ordered at the pizza parlor onsite made my whole family sick. The pool side grill service was horrible and took 30 minutes to get some ice cream. I was very disappointed in this place as it was my bday and Father’s Day weekend and chose this place to be with my family. I will be looking for a new place to enjoy family time.

Our family visited the Wolf Park last year and had a great time. We decided to come  back this year and we had another fun experience. We plan on returning the same time next year; the family can't  wait to return.

I paid for my stay ahead of my check In through Groupon, upon checking in to the hotel I was asked for my debit card to hold the standard $50 incidentally fee but noticed the next morning I was charged close to $300! When I reported this to the front desk the lady casually says it wasn’t their fault but Groupon, I made sure when we checked in that they saw we were paid in advance and our Groupon was good they said, she seemed like it wasn’t a big deal when $286 (i believe it was) was charged to my card for no reason, is definitely a big deal to me! She went ahead and refunded me the charge but was told I had to wait for the 3-7 days to see it back in my account!!! Will be looking In to what I can do to report this, it’s day 5 and am still waiting on my refund to go through!

Check in was fast and easy. They have us an itinerary of all the activities and times for the rest I'd the day and the next. I received a text with hours of checking in from a personal assistant whom you can text at any time for any questions. That was great!  Rooms were off a good size, everything was fine. Beds were very comfortable.   They have lots of options for restaurants on the main level which are kid friendly. They also have a bar and a dunkin donuts for your convenience!  The water park is great for any age. My family and I truly enjoyed it and plan to come every year! We highly recommend it!!

Summary Heading: Front desk experience in one word—-nightmare
Summary: Pre check in is not accurate here. The agent at pre check in was horrible. No eye contact, no smile. She definitely made me feel like I was another number, another paying customer. The resort was overall nice, just very loud on the guest floors until 1am. Kids running everywhere.

Summary Heading: Good value for what we paid but.....
Summary: We stayed 2 nights at Great Wolf Lodge and were MOSTLY satisfied. Check in was abysmal - we took our time getting to Garden Grove on the advice of friends who said their rooms took forever to be ready. The line at 4 pm was out of control and the front desk only had 3 people checking people in - it took FOREVER. I had questions about how to use the PAW pass and whoever checked us in sped through the explanation (probably in an attempt to speed up check in). Our room was on the 9th floor (906) and was fine. It was big and bright and clean. We went directly to the water park. The whole family loved it. My advice is make sure you take breaks - all our eyes were red from the insane amount of chlorine they use inside and it’s not perfectly ventilated. The PAW passes we purchased were

This was our second trip and we love it! Tons of family fun, prices are very comparable to all amusement parks. The staff is very friendly and the resort is very clean. I’m very happy with the amount of lifeguards in the waterpark.

Went to GWL for my daughters birthday.  I went all out with the birthday bash, scoops, and wolf pass.  Birthday bash package was awesome revived a cake in the room, a 40 dollar credit for food, and a 40 dollar credit for arcade.  Which meant i only relay spent 10 dollars for a cake and balloons since i would have spent the money on the arcade and food anyway.  Scoops gave my daughter and her friend a great time and treated them like royalty and at the end they ended up with little perks from scoops that was included into the price i had to pay for them,  The Wolf pass was well worth seeing my kids and their friends run around doing the activities that would have cost me a lot more if i paid for them separately.    What i would recommend is when booking look at what packages they

The Great Wolf Lodge is a great way to spend family time and go for a family vacation.  I would definitely recommend this place to my relatives and friends.  There are many fun kid-friendly activities and it is a safe place to be with children.

Summary Heading: Our Food Allergy Story at Great Wolf
Summary: As someone who has a history of anaphylaxis due to severe multiple food allergies (including peanut, tree nut, egg, soy, sesame seed and shellfish), my son has always been anxious when eating out, but after reading good things about Lodge Wood Fired Grill in Great Wolf Anaheim, my husband and I treated our son to his very first “non-fastfood” restaurant experience there, and it turned out to be the best dining experience he’s ever had in all 15 years of his life. The server Arthur was very accomodating and patient, and the executive chef Hany Ali came to our table and really spent a good amount of time to talk to our son about his food allergies. For the first time, our son truly felt that his needs matter to a restaurant chef and his staff, unlike most of the time when others

I hate to write this review because I'd rather not have more people going to this resort, I'd like to keep it to myself, but, you have to take your kids. The water park is so much fun, get there early if you plan to stay in there and want chairs. The Magiquest game is a lot of fun.....bring your walking shoes parents, you WILL get your steps in! The resort is clean, every staff member we encountered was friendly....that doesn't seem to happen much anymore. It is only 3 miles from Disneyland and they do have a shuttle you can sign up for. For Angels baseball fans, it is close to Angels Stadium also. If you want to spend a day at the beach, that's not too far away either. Even the other families that were at the resort at the same time as us were friendly. It was just an all

I had a bad experience checking in. I did a mobile check in and I got a text confirming the room and everything however when I said I won’t be able to be there early enoughcoz I was still in a work meeting in the area but my family would be there and if my husband can just go and my kids and for my husband to show his ID and the credit card since we have the same card and the Rep said it’s ok and she will make a notation on it. However the opposite happened. My family went to the resort and was banned not to go to the room to rest or get changed because I have to be physically present for them to be able to get in there despite the confirmation I got from the rep. You imagine how frustrating and upsetting it is for them to go to the hotel and to be turned down. And then the rep

I brought my 14, 13, and 10 year old and they all had a great time! It was very convenient with the system they have in place. It is very clean and they have so many different options. You can find things for different budgets. I would highly suggest it for a family. It comes with access to the water park and a refrigerator and microwave in the room. If you bring food, you could get out paying only for your room.

Beautiful venue.  Friendly staff. Great rooms, food and service.  Kids had a great time!  Only complaint would be the length of time it took to check in. Food was very good but they could have had more characters roaming the restaurant during breakfast.

Children and adults alike will enjoy the waterpark. Having other activities helped entertain our children when we wanted a break from the chorine.  Grizzly Bear Suite gave us plenty of room for our family and was comfortable except for the sofa bed.

The park is fun, the gaming is fun and the atmosphere is what you want for kids. This is a perfect place for kids to enjoy water park activities and it's perfect to have adults there with them to enjoy the park also.  But the housekeeping and front desk need a lot of help.   Sincerely, My Madyson

This is great place to spend time with the family. It 's a clean and friendly environment. They have enough things for parents and children to enjoy. We enjoyed both outdoor pool and the indoor water sl slides.

Summary Heading: Ballon lady screwed up of trip
Summary: Long story short my kids wanted a animal ballon and they closed up shop 8 mins early for no reason at all.left bad taste for me knowing what I spent there and seeing my kids see other kids with balloons

Nice attractions. Towels always available. Should have more tubes at the lazy river. The wave pool is fun.  I'd like to commend Victor,  at the mobile pre check in, on June 11 at 1pm. He's so helpful and kind! Thanks again, Victor!

We have been to Great Wolf Lodge multiple times and love it there. We always have a great time. This was the first time we’ve gone during a busy season and service was horrible. Maybe too many seasonal employees who are not properly trained? I hope so. Planning on going again during off season and hope the service goes back to normal.

It was a nice location. The indoor park was very loud and too hot. The floor was slippery and in some places it felt slimy. The food was decent. The lines were reasonable. I didn’t like that all the bathrooms didn’t have toilet seat covers.

Summary Heading: A lot of fun for the kids.
Summary: I highly recommend the Wolf Lodge for family with kids.  If you live in Southern California and you have kids, you must take them here, it is worth every penny.  My 10 and 13 year kids had a great experience, i wished i brought them to a place like this when they were younger. At the water park, there is something for everyone although It is ideal for elementary school kids and younger.   I have to bring the kids  back to this place before they get older. Without kids, i don't see a reason to stay at this place.

The kids ages 6-12 had a blast along with myself, lines not to long and best part it wasn't hot while waiting. I love being able to just walk to your room after a long day at the park.  I also love that you can stay even after your check out time.

Summary Heading: Perfect way to kick off Summer!
Summary: What a wonderful place the Great Wolf Lodge is! It was picked over Disneyland by our family of 7 for our summer vacation. With kids ages ranging from 10 to 1 years old there was something for everyone. Never ending smiles, Food was tasty, staff was friendly, suites are spacious and the kid cabin made our trip that much better for our kids. Queen size bed was too firm for my liking but my husband enjoyed it. Bathroom closes to entrance in water park seemed to always need attention. Other than that it was perfect! We’ll be back! Definitely recommend!

Enjoyed watching my little guy have so much fun. We literally stayed the first night at the water park until closing time. Best for families with little one's ages 0-12 years of age. And the rooms were amazing!!!

Good place for a family vacation or staycation, something for the entire family. Try and stay before the summer crowds. Stay at least two days to really experience what the resort offers. Like that the water park can be accessed before checking in and that it can be enjoyed after checking out too.

Great Wolfe is great for kids because they don't notice the details that matter. The staff inside the water park were rude and not helpful not a place to bring your baby. The beds are extremely hard and so we're the pillows.

One of the best options for families! Fun for everyone. Great Resort!!! Only thing I would change is to have spanish entertainment for spanish speaking children. The water park is amazing!!!  The rooms are huge and clean. We will be back!

Pros The additional day at the pool after checkout  Staff was nice  Kids will love it lots todo   Cons Waiting for the elevator. Some guest cut and don’t wait their turn  Cost of the games at the arcade  Parking fee. It’s not free if you pay for it.

Great Wolf had numerous miss charges even prior to arriving. After, there was over $500 is miss charges. It took numerous phone calls with over 10 minute wait time to get the first set of charges reversed. I am still working on getting the $500 reversed.

We had a fun time at the Great Wolf Lodge. Lots of things to do inside the hotel that you never feel like you need to leave. The food was great and reasonably priced. It can be very noisy! Kids were running around the hotel halls all hours of the night. I also thought it was a little ridiculous to charge for parking, but everything else was a good value.

Close to family's residence. Great for family reunions and birthday parties. Love the spacious rooms and bathrooms. Love all the amenities and entertainment. Will continue to recommend the place to family and friends.

Great experience, clean, kind staff, fun water park it was awesome having a microwave and fridge in the room. Coffee in the room could be better, very watered down. Should have an option to make your own in the room. Other than coffee everything was amazing!

Loved everything about this place. I didn’t know there was so much for the kids to do. I was impressed with the text assistance. A staff member texted when I got there, and during your stay you can text her any and all questions. I asked for water park hours and if there was a business center with a computer and she responded. It didn’t seem computer operated. I also liked that you could text valet for your car and it will tell you when it would be ready. However, the one downside is the chlorine smell was pretty strong. It was burning our eyes without even getting in the water yet. You can smell it the minute you pull up.

This was our first visit to GWL. We have done water park trips at another resort in Carlsbad for a couple years and tried something new. We were not disappointed at all and will come back for sure in the future.   Pros: indoor water park, two days of play for one night stay, enthusiastic staff, texting capable concierge, not pressured to purchase the wolf/paw passes, clean water park and hotel  Cons: magi quest is a bit pricy but it is fun

Great water park for kids but ragging waters and other water parks maybe better for your buck. Iwould never suggest going here during summer months. Rooms are basic but everything you need and clean. Look for discount or off-season prices.

Was a great experience..just very expensive. Perhaps more coupons or discounts would have been more enjoyable. It sucks to say no to your kids because there is alot to do and hard on a budget or with multiple kids.

I asked my 3 year old: “Are you having fun? Or is it a little bit crazy?”  He said, “Um ... it’s a little bit crazy.”  All the kids had a great time, nevertheless.  We stayed in the Wolf Den Suite - bunk area is perfect for the kids, and it was dark in there, which was great in the evening when husband & I wanted to relax & watch TV.  We did get an unexpected treat in the hotel room - a gummy bear!  Affixed to the comforter!  And we didn’t see it until the next morning, after we slept with it!  Apparently, someone was saving it for later.  In Wolf Lodge’s defense, it was a white/clear gummy bear, so it was perfectly camouflaged.  Kind of funny, but also kind of gross.

Front desk was very unhelpful and not welcoming . Not handicap friendly for being a family place. Don’t wast your time and play there magical wond game. Over priced and if someone is behind you they can erase your game with there wond.

We had a great family trip to Great Wolf Lodge!. The water park was amazing and had many options to please everyone. Food was great as well. Our room was very comfortable and quite, comfortable beds.I would recommend to my friends and other family members to come here.

This place gets 1 star because my kids enjoyed the water park. However, I have nothing else to say about this place that is positive. The rooms are incredibly expensive given the room quality. When housekeeping actually cleans the room, it is not until after 4:30p, which may interfere with evening plans. When contacting front desk, room service, valet, etc., be prepared to be on hold for 5-10 minutes before a pack member actually answers your call (although they are courteous when you do speak with someone).  Our experience was as expensive as it was disappointing.

Kids had a great time expioring the park, and we enjoyed seeing them having fun! Great mini vacation. Room was spacious, and location were perfect for other fun activities in the city after they were done with the park. We will be coming back.

Such an amazing place to come with family and little ones. They have accommodations for all ages and the staff is on top of it so there’s no need to worry of the safety of your children. They have many activities for the kids and also provide many fun options for th for the adults. Definitely a fun spot to come! We will definitely be coming back

Perfect family getaway. Location is perfect. Many things in walking distance. Staff is friendly. Water park is fun for all ages. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a great experience. We look forward to coming back.

Great place for family and kids to spend a few days at an indoor waterpark. The Indoor waterpark was great.  Plenty of rides and fun for the kids to play.  Accommodation is good but can be better. No complimentary toothbrush or shaving kit.  Surprised for such an up-scale place and they don't have such basic amenity.

Summary Heading: Great Family Fun- Add this to your vistit to the Anaheim Resort area
Summary: We had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge.   Lots of water slides and play area for kids of all ages including this big kid.  Water Park: again, lots of stuff for all ages from mild to wild. I enjoyed every bit . Mind you, this place does get crowded and lines/wait does occur, however the operation is efficient enough to keep things moving. There are height requirements for the slides- each child is issued a color coded wristband in accordance with their height. We enjoyed good food and drink (even adult beverages) in the pool area. Bottled drinking water is okay to bring to the area, not sure about your own food from Walmart. Note: Wolf Rider Wipeout allows standup surfing during the first and last hour of the day's operation. In between, bodyboard riding is going on. The

This was our frist trip to The Great Wolf Lodge.  The waterpark, arcade and bowling alley were awesome!  However the price and quality of the food, as well as the friendlyness and willingness to help of some of the staff was definitely NOT!

Something for everyone. The safety measures, measure tge little ones and give them an additional band so other lifeguards know What rides they can go one without having to treasure them every time.you can just let the kids run free in the water area

Summary Heading: Awesome family hotel and water park
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge is a fantastic family getaway with something for everyone in the family. The customer service is five star. The food is great with my favorites in the Grille and the Buffet. The waterpark is great and I love the cabanas that are available to rent.

Fun waterpark lots of slides for all ages,  big downfall the water was really cold, dont believe it was 84 degrees as stated, great location, only a few minutes from disneyland, pretty pricey, we stayed mid week and paid over $600 for 2 nights, that was just the price of the room, definitely a splurge but would come again

Careful with the food at buffet, my child got burnt with the hot chocolate they served, tried to make it seem lilt it was my fault. Got a credit afterwards but overall attitude of manager not good.besides that everything very good!

We had an amazing time at the Great Wolf Lodge!!  There was so much for every member of our family.  I am not usually a water person, but I even had a lot of fun!  We have teenagers and a 6 year old, and it is hard to find family fun that fits with such a big age range!

excellent place but expensive, You do not need the weather to be hot to enjoy a water park.the rooms are very clean , staff very helpful , valet parking to accurate nice place mi kids love it the price is high I hope the company lower the price to stay more time.

Our family had a fun experience for my daughter’s birthday. We only stayed one night but the atmosphere was pleasant and the rooms were comfortable. My only complaint was that the food at the breakfast buffet was mediocre at best for the price. But we were able to enjoy the water park even on the day of checkout and we had a great time with that and my daughter loved it.

Summary Heading: Dirty room even after they cleaned it TWICE! Kids cabin not working had to get them to fix that too. Felt disgusted!
Summary: Dirty room even after they cleaned it TWICE! Kids cabin not working had to get them to fix that too. Felt disgusted, disappointed, and frustrated throughout my whole stay there! I spent most of my stay waiting on the phone or in the room for someone to come and fix every single problem.

Summary Heading: Great stay for great family fun
Summary: We’re always in the area for DLand so decided to try something new. Kids loved it. The water park had tons of different areas for kids of all ages. Wave pool, tons of water slides and a couple that were family ones for 2-4 people.  There are showers and changing areas in the water park.   Rooms were nice and all accessible by wristband(adults) and also allowed for charging to the room. Some food options inside the hotel and many choices around the area within walking distance.   There are a few free entertainment options and tons of paid entertainment if you want to break from being in the water.   Food options in the water park area and inside the hotel are decent priced.   Best thing is, you have access to the water park on check in day as well as check out day.   BE AWARE OF

My kids 7, 10 and 16 had a great time! The room and hotel was cool and interactive with the magiquest wand (seperate purchase). Plan on spending money because its slightly pricey but comparable to any amusement park. The nice thing is that they allow you to bring in outside food (except in the pool area). The pools and hotel room were clean. The staff was nice. The couch/pull out bed was awful to sleep on but the

As a single mom of three, one special needs, trips are not ready, but Great Wolf Lodge creates a safe, fun, and comfortable adventure for all! We had fun all day long! Child with autism explored park 3/lifeguards helped guide him to be safe. My oldest enjoyed the bigger slides and loved the Jammy Jamboree

Our third visit to a GWL property and still love the environment. This time we stayed in the Kid Cabin suite and it was definitely worth the upgrade (4 kids). It was very nice to tell the kids to go to

Summary Heading: Schools out for summer! Local family makes a visit to GWL
Summary: I have been on the email list for GWL since they opened this location. I keep an eye on the deals and found one that didn’t break the bank. The promo was $189, but with an extra child and all the fees, parking it ended up being $272. The offer was a family suite that could sleep 6, with a pull out couch. It worked for us, we had two 10 year olds, 12 year old, 3 year old and an adult.  Room was clean, had a fridge and micro. We used that in our favor and packed lunch and breakfast for our overnight stay. They do not allow food in the water area unless it was purchased from GWL, we ate in our room before heading down to the water park. The day of check in, we did the pre-check in online and were notified our rooms were ready prior to arrival, that was a nice feature, knowing if we

Room was clean staff was friendly and it was a great family time. There weren’t long lines and there were always fresh towels. Food choices were great and they had lots to choose from. I took 8-15 yr olds and there was something for every age to keep entertained. I will definitely be back next year

Summary Heading: Bad Customer Service and Safety Issues
Summary: Watch out for the mats in the Waterpark at GreatWolf in CA. My little 2 year old tripped on a mat that was incorrectly fitted. We reported it to 3 people and no one cared. This hotel sucks for safety. Go somewhere else.

We visited Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove for our child's 8th birthday, and had a fantastic time. The major highlight was the water park. My husband, kids, and I all had a blast on the water slides, wave pool, and lazy river. Over the course of two days we ate at every restaurant and eatery there, and it was all tasty. If you wanted to plan ahead, you could save money by bringing food since there was a mini fridge and microwave in our room, or by leaving the lodge and walking to one of the strip malls nearby for cheaper meals. But we wanted maximum time in the water, and chose to stay on site. Staff were all friendly and helpful, beds were comfy, and the best part for me was not worrying a single second about sunburns or reapplying sunscreen! Lifeguards did an excellent job of

All my 3 children had an awesome experience.  Staff extremely friendly.  Buffet was excellent.  Cant wait to go back. Loved the fact that it was so close for a quick get away full of family fun. The only draw back was the treat we orders took forever for staff to finish.  I would totally go back.

The lodge was ok and the staff friendly, The food ok in quality not great but doable. The main problem is the air quality in the water park and the heat. There seems to be no ac in the pool area and the lack of ventilation makes it unbearable to be there while you and the kids breath in HUGE amounts of chlorine filled air. The kids were so affected they could not breath or take solid breaths for several days after leaving the pool park. The heat in the pool area were so hot you had to be in the water just to keep cool. That was crazy. In addition there are no lounge chairs just chairs that sit up right. This makes it impossible to relax and rest as a parent. So NO I will NOT be going back . It is a one time deal.

My Family and I had a great time. I have a 2, 5, and 8 year old and there were activities for all of them. Comfortable, all inane place. It is pricey for meals and adults drinks but totally worth it! We had a mini vacation and stayed 2 nights!!

Summary Heading: Do yourself a favor, don't come here
Summary: Saw the hotel on television a lot , decided to use it for a quick Disneyland getaway, the proximity to the house of the mouse is probably the best thing about this hotel.   The price of the rooms even after discount is extremely high for the best rooms, and with only one elevator you end up walking a lot.  The food and everything around is very expensive and just not worth the money. The main restaurant food was great however the first night we were refused to be seated 15 minutes prior to closing  When requesting a late checkout i got a very rude response of

We are only about 50 miles from this hotel/waterpark but never heard of it.   I wish we had known about it when our kid was younger.   If you have kid between 3 to 10, this is the place for you.  We took our 12 years old here last week.   He still has fun but definitely not as much as if he was 5 years younger.  As an adult, I think this hotel has really great management and staff.  I have been to many Disney resorts and Universal resorts and this hotel ran as good or many cases better.   There are so many kids everywhere but it is organized chaos.  The staff knows what they are doing and seems like everyone was having a good time.  The food was surprisingly good too in all the food places and affordable.  I was expecting to pay "Disneyland" prices, but it was more like your

Overall, a lot of fun. All of the family enjoyed everything they participated in, the water park, mini golf, my 3 year old learned to bowl and tried water slides for the first time and he loved it so much. We did the wolf's den room which everything was awesome, the magiquest wand was making the critters in the den react, my son had a ball with that. Room wise my wife and I thought that there could be something done for air flow in the den. It seems to be much warmer in there then in the main area, a fan could help. The check-in process is the other reason I cannot 5 star this, the staff was extremely helpful but the process lacks efficiency. Mobile pre-check is for attraction services btw, not your room.

So much to do with the water park, yummy food, nice rooms, and tons of free kid activities. It is a very expensive stay, we have done one night twice. Great fun, for a special occasion.  Everyone seemed very modest in swim clothing choices. It was a good thing, relaxing, just having family time not feeling exposed.

Great wolf Lodge is the perfect family friendly place to go. Guests of all ages will have a blast. It’s all in one place to go for a vacation. You don’t ever have to leave because you can find everything from food to bowling here in the resort.

There's something for everyone. The room was super clean and updated. The check out was fast. Also you can bring or buy your own food from outside to your room. The wait time for the slides were reasonable.

so much fun, everyone is friendly and kind and the rooms were very nice and clean. Our experience was great and will be definitely returning. The kids had so much fun and so many things for them to do. We enjoyed our stay

Summary Heading: The Good, the bad and huge unexplained charge at the end aka CHECK YOUR BILL!
Summary: Great trip until the end unfortunately we left upset & frustrated due to an unexplained charge of $669.00 on our debit card. Upon reviewing my bill before we left  I saw this charge & immediately went to the front desk for answers. The only thing they could tell me is

Had a wonderful one-night stay at the Great Wolf Lodge! Since we live close to the resort, we were looking for something fun to do with our Daughter. The resort is quite large filled with just about every activity a child would enjoy. The water park itself was larger than expected and was filled with all types of water slides and activities. Would highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Horrified and worst experience ever (even the management would sadly agree). At least my kids had fun.
Summary: The good:   -My kids had fun.  If things had been different, my opinion would have been entirely different.  The bad:   -Maybe I was expecting the Disneyland of customer service and experience since so many have raved about the Great Wolf Lodge, but I just found things lacking. I thought it would be larger, but I grew up with larger outdoor waterparks elsewhere. -Check in isn't until 3pm, but you can check in and start using the water park at 1pm. I didn't have the pre-check in email, so I waited almost an hour in the registration line to check in. -My son and daughter wanted to change at the park vs. before we arrived, but there are only 3 unisex restrooms to change in, and one was out of service.  There are no actual changing rooms for the hoards of people who arrive early.  A

Fun around every corner for every kid and the kid in you.  As great as it is to have their beautiful and well supervised water park, the strong chlorine was problematic with my asthma.  If I went again I'd wear a protective mask when out of the water and possibly limit my time in there.

Great experience with plenty of extra activities for the kids!  We stayed in the wolf den but I would try the Deluxe Wolf Den Suite just to have a space away from the kids.  All in all, my kids had fun and so did I.

We visited Great Wolf Lodge for our son's 5th birthday and it could not have been a more successful trip. We had such a great time and the staff is really on their game about keeping it a fun and safe environment for the kids. We can't wait to go back!

We really enjoyed our stay, there could have been a little more instruction with Quest game, but all in all fantastic family getaway.  Check your receipt when leaving, I was charged $110 more than I should have been, they are crediting the money back, but didn't seem to surprised that it happened, so be sure and look over your receipt.

Summary Heading: Not for kids over 7 years old
Summary: Adjust your expectations.  It's for little kids.  No privacy in the room. Everything over priced... Over $3 for a plain chip of coffee!  Kids got bored really quickly.  Definitely seems bigger on the TV commercials.

everything was excellent the staff was very kind, friendly and the rooms and the park very clean, the kids enjoy every moment , they have different activities so you can  have a very good time...... we love the place.

Yes, I get it tgat this is supposed to be a old-timey country themed hotel.  However, the hotel and rooms are dated, in need of a makeover, and the long lines at check-in will insure I'll never return.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for young kids
Summary: Great for kids on the younger side. Look for discounts available. The standard room was really nice and big. Cabana is worth it if you check out and stay the day. Seating fills up early.This was our 2nd year going and we will be going again.

The water park is well set up and lots to do for all ages. Indoor and outside pools. The rooms are clean and well appointed.   The only negative I can I can list is that all the vendors (Restaurants and shops) don't take Apple Pay or Samsung Pay. So carry cash or your card on you.

We had a great time on our family vacation.  There was something fun for everyone.  The waterpark was clean, had plenty of towels, and the staff was on point.  It was a little pricey for some activities, such as the arcade or spa experience (for kids).  Overall it was worth going and we look forward to visiting again.

Summary Heading: The customer service tops Disney!! Amazing Birthday party place for my daughter!
Summary: We just arrived home after staying at the Great Wolf Lodge for 3 days and 2 nights for my daughters 6th Birthday.  We invited her class friends and parents to have lunch in the courtyard and my sweet husband paid for water park entry for 2 guests per invitation for the day. This was a bit of work to transport balloons, cake and etc..  However I came down to the Hotel three times prior to the event to make sure things would run smoothly and I can only tell you that the service, staff and hospitality was amazing. From Albert in retail who stopped during his busy day and gave my husband and I an entire tour of the hotel and waterpark and made sure we had  birthdaycake and balloons when we arrived. To Brandy at the front desk that explained how the water park entry is crowded in the

Best vacation we had! Everyone was always accommodating and friendly. The room was clean and the waterpark is amazingly fun! The activities are a plus for kids. The automatic check out is just so efficient, you don't even need to rush. The dining options are great.

We was there for my nine-year-old was turning 10 she had a wonderful time so did i would have been nice for the room to be ready before 4 day is almost over at 4 for kids just would have been nice to have the Privacy to go upstairs and change get comfortable

Summary Heading: Great Wolfe Lodge is great for the entire family
Summary: GWL has something for everyone, the slides are fun and there is something for all ages.  It gets really expensive if you eat and use the other amenities at the park like spa and arcade. The crowds are a little rough, a lot of inapropriate tattoos and trashy people but it's fun for the kids. Try to go on a week day to avoid crowds.

Summary Heading: Not the best Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Rooms are VERY basic and dusty. Water attractions kept being closed down during visit. Toddlers area didn't have much to do, some items were broken. Overall for 2 year old water park very dirty Magiquest boxes & screens didn't all work.  Very expensive trip for 2 days

Summary Heading: Great Fun for the Whole Family
Summary: Great time, Everything was clean and the staff friendly.  Only negative was if you stay for more than one night housekeeping does not make up your room or even take out the trash.  You only see them when you call or if it is check out time.  House keeping tries to rush you out of your room.  Other wise I would have given them a higher rating

Great family destination for hours of fun and will be back soon. The water park was great and the kids loved the wave pool, slide and all the other attraction at the hotel. I will definitely  book in advance in the future to get a better deal.

Had a great time, spent a lot of time at the waterpark, lockers are pricey (we had to use one since our room wasn't ready when we arrived at noon).  Lucked out and got a very good deal for one night - booked months in advance for a Sunday arrival.  Bring your own food, snacks and drinks to save some money.  The buffet was good, not a lot of selections, and waaaay overpriced.  I should've ran across the street to McDonalds.  Everything is fairly expensive, we spent $20 in the arcade and it lasted about 10 min.  Overall, I would go back, though I'd prepare better next time in order not to fork out so much dough.

GWL was recommended by a friend.  Glad we went.  Had a blast.  Our son had three two days of morning to night fun and activities.  So much to do and all conveniently located in one central place.  The Magi Quest was particularly great and active.  Highly recommended.  We look forward to going back.  The water slide is only one part of what is offered. Great vacation destination and awesome staff.

My family loved it and were planning to go back soon.i loved everything about the park. The activities were nice and my kids really liked the dance partyand story time. The water park was fun. I cant wait until we go back.

I was happy until we got stuck in the elevator they had a power outage and no one came to help us until the power came back on and the door opened but until that the kids had fun and the water park needs to be open longer it close too early

Great family hotel and vacation! We would definitely come back and recommend this hotel to our friends and family. The only thing that we were displeased about during our stay was there were a distinct smell in certain areas of the hotel.

I contacted customer service and was told that the nightly resort fee covered parking, but upon checkout I was charged an extra $18.99/night for self parking. I heard about this happening to other people, and it happened to me. You've been warned.

It was easy to check in, get settled and enjoy the park. We didn't experience any of the arcades, resort programs, or dining areas but our entire time in the water play area was fantastic. We will definitely come again.

Summary Heading: Best family value I can think of
Summary: Go to Great Wolf Lodge.  You and your family will have a great time, you will be treated well, and you will want to go back.  Something for everyone.  It is both fun-filled and relaxing, because you don't have leave the property.  Staff is terrific and the theming is spot on.  Trust me, you will not regret spending a couple of nights there.

Experience was great! Family of 7 in a kids cabin worked out perfect! Friendly staff relaxed environment take advantage of the coupons  or bundled packages like the pup pass! It's worth it for the little ones!

Summary Heading: Fun but a couple annoying things
Summary: We loved the waterpark and the rooms were nice but you can't take towels between the park and your room ( you can't take room towels to the waterpark and can't take towels from waterpark to the room). They have showers at the park however you can't wash , dry,  and change clothes for little kids in there and the floor is grose,  not setting my baby on that floor. So we had to walk quite a distance dripping wet and cold to our room when leaving the waterpark.  Also the shower pressure in the bathrooms of the room was horrendous. Even turning to hot water made the pipes rumble loudly. Took forever to wash the soap out of my hair the water is barely coming out of the shower.  If that doesn't bother you bring your own towels and enjoy.  Everything else was great, employees are very

We had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge. The reason for 1 star less is because the pizza that we ate for dinner was terrible. It was cold and not tasty at all.  I would recommend the restaurant that is located outside by the raccoon pool. Overall, we had a really fun time and will most certainly be back.

Summary Heading: Value alternative to outdoor water parks in the LA area.
Summary: Great value for Garden Grove/Anaheim area hotel. Rooms are large and clean and beds are comfortable. If you get a great promo code for the stay nothing beats the Great Wolf for hotel and family fun in one convenient location. There is more to do inside the hotel than just the water park. Kids have story time and character meets and the Magiquest games and a mini kid Vegas arcade. Just be prepared to spend and spend.

We have a large family- 6 kids to be exact and this is our second stay. The rooms are super convenient and the food doesn't break the bank The only caution I have is to make sure you double check your reservation. We booked a cabana. I verified the booking at checkin and then when we went down to find it I didn't have one. They offered a Pop up but it was just chairs and a table.... no cabana amenities! They did credit it back but I was prepared for a relaxing day in the cabana that did not happen.   Other than that our stay was fantastic

This place is for families and is child friendly. There are things to do for both the parents and children. My son turned five and he kew he wanted to go back to the lodge. I would recommend this hotel for any family with children. My guest also enjoyed their visit.

This was our second visit and we had a great time. The water park staff is very alert to safety issues. The price is reasonable when you consider the cost of water parks and lodging. It was cool this visit, but the inside portion was perfect.

My grandkids were very happy with resort and want to go again. I felt that it would have been nice if we could have had our own snacks to go in park, as the the food at resort was fatty and lots of salt content, i like my grandkids eating healthy foods. Of which they couldn;t eat.

Summary Heading: My kids can't wait to go back
Summary: We went for my son's birthday..Everything was above and beyond our expectations..From the staff to the room,all the activities for the kids and of course the awesome waterpark..We can't wait to go back...

I recommend for kids 8 and under.   Staff extremely helpful and friendly.  Facilities run down.  Food excellent.  Very very crowded.  Too bad because staff so nice and food great.  Good potential but facility run down and a million kids running around

We had a wonderful visit! Arrived Monday left Tuesday so we could take advantage of a cheaper rate and fewer people. We booked a Wolf Den suite and had no complaints...everything was clean and well stocked...we were facing Disneyland but fell asleep before the fireworks :(  Got a Pup Pass for our daughter...get one, don’t even question it...your kid will want everything they see and this will kind of give them a limit.  Our meals were all really great...we ate at pretty much every place except Dunkin’ Donuts...the Lodge restaurant is excellent food for a hotel...my husband had the filet with mac n cheese and I had the mushroom risotto...large portions and flavorful. We reserved a cabana for our second day and have zero regrets...finding a seat or table can be difficult (even

Time well spent with our Families and Friends. WE went as a big group this time around and it was so worth it ! Loved everything about this place. Great staff members. Love the accommodations, all in one spot easy !

This was our first trip to The Great Wolf Lodge and we were very pleased with our experiences!  My 5 year-old grandson was THRILLED!  There are so many activities for the little ones and big people too!  It's a great family trip!

Water park was fun, but crowded, plus the price tag was expensive.  The convenience of having the water park so close to your hotel room is the only perk, but comes at a high cost.  If you are considering a visit, shop around, and don't go on a weekend unless you like being in a crowded water park.

Cholorine was noticable but id expect tthat since we are in an enclosed area. My kids had a blast. For the environment, I enjoyed the family time there but bear in mind it is not going to be enormous like other theme parks. It was safe and fun. Like the room being vlose by so we can rest more.

It was a really fun time! The resort and water park was very clean and staffed perfectly. I love the wristband that has your room key and you can use throughout  the resort for food or other items. No need to carry anything with you ❤ All and all a great vacation for my little family!

the only complaint I have is the food was horrible. other than that everything was perfect and we had a great time.the water was a bit cold n kids were shivering even though it said 80 degrees. but we loved it

I took my son, mom, sister and niece here for a 2 night stay when my kid was 2, and he STILL talks about it over a year later. It’s pricy but they have great deals on Groupon so keep an eye out. The pools are great and have enough for the little ones to do, while keeping the parents entertained. We loved the Halloween theme when we came (we brought our costumes and they had “trick or treating” throughout the hotel!  We also enjoyed the arcade and the games they offered around the place. The food was ok, but we left for some meals which was fine — lots of family dining nearby!  It was a perfect weekend staycation!

Quick summary: It's not worth it if your family wakes early (like most families with little ones) or if your little ones get cranky while waiting in long lines or if you're expecting the level of service other hotels in this price range provide. If your kids sleep late and stay up late and you like lots of noise, this is a good choice.  The good: The water park has lots of options and isn't subject to the weather. The beds were comfortable. We didn't hear other families while in our room.  The bad/frustrating: I did their online check in the night before as suggested.  There was no line when we arrived, but we still spent 30 minutes with the check in person.  Then they didn't even tell us which room we were in!  Rooms are often veeeery far from the one set of elevators.  Loud

Great service. Wonderful staff. Clean hotel and waterpark was great. I would not recommend a Saturday just because it gets super busy in the waterpark but other than that, everything was perfect. So worth the price

During our vacation, we went to Disneyland, California Adventure, Legoland, and the Wolf Lodge.  So when our six year old son tells all of his friends about the vacation, he tells them that we went to Wolf Lodge.  Apparently, it was the most memorable part of the trip for him.  Dad and I agree.  Out of the six days we were there, three of them were spent at the lodge enjoying the water park and the MagiQuest scavanger hunt.  I would agree that the food is too expensive, but there is an El Pollo Loco, KFC, and a Chinese seafood buffet within walking distance.  I think the hotel is a little expensive also, but if you take advantage of the waterpark and MagiQuest I think the value is there.

Fun but needs some improvement. Supposed to get a 15% discount due to Loud Noise in walls of our room. haven't seen it yet. Prices our WAY TO HIGH for food. $4.00 for one Croissant. Slides are fun but walls on the way up the stairs are peeling paint.

this is our 3rd time here. we always have a wonderful time, the staff are always very pleasant and the rooms are nice and clean. we got a really good deal online and they always send me promo codes which i share with my friends and co-workers.  we'll come back again.

My 7 year old said this trip was the best trip out of all our trips. I haven't been in a pool or water park in over 10 years. I got on the water slides with my family and they were all amazed that I joined in for the first time in 10 years!!

Summary Heading: Great if you get a good deal.
Summary: Waterpark is super fun.  Lifeguards are attentative.  Staff is super friendly.  Birthday package was worth it and a huge hit with my daughter. Game night was a disappointment. No complete games to play.  They took away the second magic quest and that was a huge bummer.

Summary Heading: THEY HAVE COMPLETELY FORGOTTEN ABOUT THOSE WHO PAY FOR THIS ADVENTURE!!!!
Summary: Thank goodness I got this 'vacation' on a Groupon. It softens the blow. My seven year old enjoyed the water parks both indoor and out, although the outdoor pool/park area leaves much to be desired.  Your experience, and safety, however, at said water parks are so dependent on the attendants who may or may not be paying attention to the people around them, some are wonderful, some have there faces stuck in their phones - ON DUTY IN THE WATER PARKS! Granted, my daughter is MY responsibility, but many parents DID NOT feel the same level of responsibility, partially because (IMHO) a big seller at the park is cocktails! - all day long.  Hard alcohol, wine/beer, and a gym are the only concessions to adult entertainment or enjoyment of the facility this 'resort' makes. There is a gym,

Stayed here for the first time, We where on our way to a family vacation to washington amd decided to stop by for one day. It was a reaaly great experience. Kids where very happy with all they had available for them. Rooms where very comfortable and big definitely staying here again.

Summary Heading: The Great Wolf Lodge is AMAZING!
Summary: I thought this place was a perfect family getaway! My kids 3 and 7 enjoyed every bit of the fun at the water park and inside the hotel. I highly recommend the Great Wolf Lodge it's got something for all ages! WE are going back!

wonderfull because the food was great!, the waterpark was clean and right temperature. the water was not cold. the magi game was exciting and the wolf den for my kids was super fun! the frog s and fish came to life with the wands. the wands have great toppers that matches my kids personalities and likes.

it is a must family adventure!  great family fun..alcohol for the adults, safe water park for kids and adults, many free kids activities, great food, we did the golf and arcade...get there at 10am for a soft check in and get 2 full days of the water park!

My daughter chooses to go here over Disneyland.  That's how fun it is.  Even my autistic son likes going there and he doesn't like going anywhere.  It's a wonderful place to spend quality time with your family.  Even though I do not drink alcohol.  It seems like a lot of pants enjoy being able to drink and enjoy theirselves.  It's fun for adults and children.

Excellent resort, would return if I can afford it this year.  My kids love the water park they always have the best time.  I'm looking to go next month if I can get a good rate. defiantly recommend this resort to all my friends.

Summary Heading: Good for kids but very expensive!
Summary: I paid more than $500/night because it was a mother’s day weekend. It’s our first time here so if I’m paying a lot for a night, it should be worth it. I did the mobile check in but you think it will be quick for you to check in, you’re wrong. It still took probably 30 min to check in. The water park was good, nothing special but my kids loved it so I’m happy. The smell of chlorine is overwhelming! We did the buffet and we really enjoyed it.  I called the desk to ask some questions, waited for a long time then hanged up on me twice! Overall, I might not go back again. If I go back, I’m not paying more than $500/night for sure!
