This place was amazingly organized and the kids had a blast! I'm completely satisfied with their service! We would definitely come back! The staff was exceptional! Our room was awesome! The kids had the time of their lives! Great for big families!

Summary Heading: Save your money! Parents of children with ASTHMA beware!
Summary: This was the most overrated & overpriced place! The water park is a lot smaller than Six Flags Hurricane Harbor which we would have rather gone to. My kids are 10 so most of what this place offers besides the water park were for younger kids I'd say ages 3-8. Everything was expensive! The food quality was not good, the rooms were average and not worth what you pay per night to stay! The waterpark was crowded with out of control kids kicking & pushing you to get through while in the lazy river. The lazy river is tiny & very narrow. There is virtually nothing here for adults. The larger pool & wave pool kept being closed due to kids having accidents in them. The list goes on & on...their breakfast buffet was edible at best, no one there tells you when you get there what all they

Summary Heading: Great Vacation- but sleep in if possible
Summary: We were first timers and had an overall amazing time. I would recommend this vacation more for people who's youngest is around the 3-5 age range. My kids, ages 1, 3, and 5 at the time of travel, like to wake up at the crack of dawn. We were a little shocked to learn that the waterpark (in non-peak times) didn't open until 10am and there isn't much else other than the arcade and the mini bowling alley (if you pre-purchased the bowling credits because there isn't an attendant downstairs prior to the waterpark opening) to do in the morning. However, the character breakfast food is amazing! Violet came by and spent a good amount of time with my daughter and we got a lot of really good pictures.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the water park!  Kids had a blast!
Summary: Everyone was very nice and wanted to make sure our stay was over the top.  The kids had a blast in the water park.  They enjoyed the glitter station where they were given tattoos.  They were warm, welcoming and made our stay every enjoyable.

I could only give this place an average overall rating, mainly because of the cost. This place is way overpriced, in my opinion.  We were also put in a room that was so far from the rest of our family and literally as far from the elevator as possible. The bed was hard. The pillows are hard. Very mediocre room for the cost.  It's all about kids though, and the kids had a great time. I wouldn't go back again, however. The pool area has so much chlorine it stings your eyes just being in the room. All of the water activities are very fun and we all enjoyed it, even with the strong chlorine smell.  The food value is terrible. Not bad food, but way overpriced.   Our two day stay ended up costing us around $2,000. So not worth the price.

Great fun for people of all ages. Check in was very quick and easy. Food was great. Waterpark was excellent and couldn't have had a better time elsewhere. Plus. Gotta love Dunkin Donuts! Definitely will be back soon.

Great Wolf is a fun time for the family. There is a lot to do. You don't need to leave the resort for anything. Plenty of food options and activities for all ages to do. The water park is not crowded. The rooms are very clean and comfortable .Very safe and friendly atmosphere .

Our daughter said over and over this was the best place ever. We are even more excited to learn they partner with Disneyland and can do a combo package next time. Already planning another trip for October.

We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was very nice and clean, we loved how the restaurants are located on the property. The Water Park area was kind of messy, although it wasn't due to staff not cleaning, it was mostly just really messy people leaving their trash everywhere and not caring. Also, it was a little difficult to find an empty table, they use so much chlorine, and the indoor water area is so humid and stuffy. But our children really loved it, and we do plan on taking them back again.

One of our party sustained a major injury and the lack of compassion from staff was appalling. Be very careful because the park has SO many areas where you can slip and fall.  Beware they allow under 18 on the wave rider by checking over 18 box for the child, will not return to this establishment.

It was expensive but the kids had so much fun that they are already begging to go back. The pizza and breadsticks, and the sweets in the bakery were amazing.  The staff was all very friendly and helpful.  It was super clean and felt very safe.

This was our first stay at a Great Wolf after much anticipation. I took advantage of booking 60 days in advanced and was given a very reasonable rate (particularly considering the proximity to Disneyland) for a basic room that sleeps up to six. The room was motel-like in its amenities (there is no hair conditioner provided) complete with ratty string-laden towels and a clunky wall unit a/c.  On the upside the a/c unit was immediately fixed or perhaps even replaced when we called the front desk. For that we were tremendously grateful. The water park which is included and plethora of other kiddie activities which all cost extra are well appointed and much grander than I anticipated. This is truly a full scale indoor water-based amusement park. That said it is also a balmy 84

Summary Heading: Value was excellent with the Groupon offer!
Summary: Used a Groupon that included a 2 night stay in a standard room that slept 6 with waterpark wrist bands for 6.  Grandkids had a blast!  Two were immersed in the Magic Quest game and two spent as much time as they could in the water park.  All loved the Paw Bowling and arcade.

Kids had a blast!  Went for my son's 5th bday and he felt so special with the ears, room decorations, etc.  He loved the character station and the magiquest!  He was also excited about story time, the PJ jamboree and arts/crafts.  There really was something for everyone!  It is set up for the WHOLE family to enjoy each other and have fun!

Summary Heading: Awesome place to bring your family to
Summary: staff was friendly and the place was so clean. Not to mention the rooms are comfortable. There was so much to do for the kids and I strongly recommend getting the pup pass for the kids. Its a great value for them to experience every part of the resort.

My two boys, 4 and 6 year olds, and my husband didn't want leave. There are so many things for families to do without leaving the grounds. Rooms were clean, not the most comfortable bedding but ok for a short stay. Staff is so friendly and accommodating. The water park is small but all rides work and if you go on weekdays it is not crowded at all. Towels are available and clean, no need to bring your own. We will be back.

This place has something for every member of your family. Parents can relax from having to hear what are we doing the water park keeps the kids busy for the entire day.  They have a cute story time for the little ones, a dance party, a nail shop, bowling and an arcade ... what more can a parent ask for.  My suggestion ask for a room closer to the elevators it can be a far walk to your room.

This was a great trip for the family and the kids had a great time.  Beside the water park the lodge had great activities for young and older children.  The food venues were very reasonable in price and was very good.

Very clean and fun place! Front desk staff are super nice! A little too expensive for my budget but for a once a year experience it is worth. They have a lot of fun activities for the kids and the water park is amazing!

My family loves adventure. Of course we had to try Great Wolf Lodge! When you think about Great Wolf Lodge, you immediately pair it with water parks. What we didn't know that we would be getting was all of the other adventures. There was the dance parties, bed time stories, balloon animals.. The list goes on and on. My girls ended up getting a 'Pup Pass' which included glitter tattoos, ice cream, candy... And a stuffed animal that took them on a SCAVENGER HUNT throughout the entire lobby and downstairs. They loved it.. Even my 2 year old! For the older kids, they have a Magic Quest game that comes with a Harry Potter type wand (more catered to 9+ year olds). It is amazing! So much more than

Summary Heading: i will not make it again
Summary: the price was expensive for the stay for 2 nights 1500 dollar with tax without dining , the experience was nice for the children , it was  crowd in the week end , a lot of people , but i will not repeat it again

This resort is a great place to take kids, especially little kids.  The staff are very helpful and attend to all problems quickly.  You can arrive early and enjoy all non water park activities, and even the water park after 1 pm.  The Kids Cabin is really fun for the kids, especially if they have a magi wand to activate things in the cabin.  I food was not great.  There is a fridge and microwave in the room.  We brought cereal and snacks and food.   The kids were able to run around the hotel on their own doing the magi quests and in the water park.

We have only been to Great Wolf Lodge for several birthday party celebrations but never actually stayed there. We finally booked Grizzly Suite for our daughter's 10th birthday sleepover with 5 of her girlfriends. Considering that it's Cinço de Mayo weekend and very busy at Great Wolf Lodge, we were treated royally by the staff. From the time we checked in, our room was ready, bell hop got our luggage in the room, birthday banner and cake was waiting in our in suite, cabana server was on point, everything was magical! Our daughter thanked us and commented that this was the best birthday ever. Thank you Great Wolf Lodge for making a memorable 10th bday for our child!!!

Great times at Great Wolf , would recommend to everyone.  The restaurants there at Great Wolf are absolutely delicious.  The rooms are clean and it's also quiet, considering that there are many kids running through the halls.  Love this place!

This place was very overpriced. The resort rooms were in no way up to date, outdated and minimalist. The staff did not seem happy to be there. Almost as if they were just as tired of the children running around as some of the adults seemed. Overall, I likely would not recommend this place. The only benefit was that you have a place to sleep if you do not feel like going home, and you can go to the water park for a second day before leaving. Otherwise, we could have just gone to The Cove in Riverside, or Raging Waters in San Dimas, or even Knott's Soak City nearby.

Excellent in every area. My family and I will be coming back ASAP! The room was very nice. The staff was superb. All the restrooms were clean and tidy. The food was great. jnbvksjdgksjfngksdngfskdnfgksdnfgksdngfksdnfgksdngfsngsadkjngfs;lkfedng;sdlkfng;s lgfdlk

great time room was ok i can say we really had a good time....just a bit sad because I told them it was my daughters birthday & they didn't do anything especially being the 1st time we went. I think the resort overall was amazing & overwhelming with all the activities.

Your facilities was amazing and very clean the staff has excellent customer service everyone had a smile on there face loved it the pool was so clean and huge we had so much fun the rooms were very spacious and clean!

This is a fun place to take kids of all ages. Even though it is geared a lot towards the younger ones, teens like it too.  It is a good value since you get the waterpark and a place to spend the night!  It is clean, well kept and staff is friendly and competent.

We went for both of my kids birthdays and really had fun at both the water park and the magic Quest as well as a arcade. The water slides are fun and exciting for all ages. It don't drinks at the waterpark were surprisingly delicious. Blue Hawaii slushy and the Hendrick's Gin mojito are recipes I would make it home! The beef brisket sandwich and all the kids meals at the grizzly restaurant we're really delicious as well. Service was friendly and lovely and everyone was attentive and helpful.

This room is great a lot of different things to do great water park and awesome personal assistant that's is available threw text or call several different rides at the water park not a very big menu on food but the quick of what's there is great golf interactive movies Bowling for the kids treasure hunt threw the building activities threw out the day with the hotel crew it was just a awesome stay

My family and I really like this place and we will be coming back soon, and the thing that make this place even better is how family and kid friendly it is. Love it.i love how awesome and friendly the staff was as well.

We came here for a couple of days with our 3 and 4 year olds and some friends with kids around the same age. They were all a little too short to go on all the slides, bt could go on most of them. There was so much to do, they didn't even notice they were missing out on a few things.  On top of the water park there is also an arcade, mini golf, mini bowling, lots of places to eat, crafts, games and so much more. All ages of kids were equally entertained. Day passes are available if you are staying at the resort and have someone joining you for the day. We paid $50 for each of ours. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious. We had a good time. 2 days was more than enough for us though. We we're exhausted by the end.   We will be back for more

Summary Heading: 1st Time visitors to Wolf Lodge - good times but read our notes!
Summary: We stayed two separate nights during our Disney/LA vacation to have a room for the nights my timeshare was booked, and check out this indoor water park. First night we used a Groupon... it was a Saturday night. That place is super busy on the weekends! The elevators were annoying, they were often full when the doors opened. And one of the two garage elevators was broken so there was a super long line to get up to higher parking lot levels on Sunday which was very inconvenient having a double stroller and kids stuff to carry. Our 2nd night was a thursday night which was WAY better, with the hotel being less busy. But the water park closed at 8 and not 8:30 which was dissapointing. AND I had to go waste 45 mins trying to go buy the right floaty for my 3 year old, she HATES the

Summary Heading: Fun for kids of ALL ages!!!
Summary: We spent one night at the SoCal location celebrating 2 children's birthdays. It's probably the best birthday that they've had. These kids LOVE the water so it was perfect!!! It can get expensive but with planning ahead you can get a better deal. Not sure what it would be like in the summer but I'm sure it might be a bit more crowded. The fact that most of the water park is indoors makes it so that you can enjoy being in the water without worrying about sunburn. The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Pillows were AMAZING!!! I tried reading the label but they didnt have one. Since some of us had dietary restrictions, it was perfect to have a fridge and microwave in the room. Will definitely return but likely during low season to get a better rate.

Summary Heading: 1st time visitors to Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Our family of 5 greatly enjoyed our first visit to Great Wolf Lodge.  Our kids range in age (1, 7 and 9 years old) and all had a wonderful time.  They enjoyed the water park, both playing together and playing individually.  The water park has activities that can be enjoyed by people of varying skill and thrill levels.    We had the breakfast buffet at the Loose Moose Family Kitchen.  There was a wide selection of offerings: pancakes, waffles, biscuits with gravy, breakfast burritos, eggs benedict, scrambled eggs, bacon, pork and turkey sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereals, breads and pastries - something for everyone.    For lunch we had pizza from Hungry as a Wolf.  We weren't sure how big the pizzas were so we ordered 2 for $18.99 each and loaf of cheesy garlic bread.  1 pizza

We came with our kids (ages 4 and 1) and loved it. I would highly suggest more adults to kids ratio for younger kids or minimally a one adult to one child ratio. Younger kids cannot go down the slides unless a cast member makes eye contact with an adult at the bottom of the slide. The arcade is prominently on display right outside the water park, so be prepared to spend some time there. There's plenty to do, especially if you want to take a break from the water park. There's story time, dance parties, games, karaoke in the lobby.  There is a lot of chlorine in the water and in the air, but it is really necessary. There are signs everywhere suggesting guests take breaks from the waterpark. Also, you can bring in food from the pizza place (next door to water park).

We were able to take advantage of an amazing Spring Deal Great Wolf Lodge had.  We decided to use the trip to celebrate my son's 10th birthday.  They offer an affordable birthday package where they put a poster on the door of your hotel room, have some balloons, and they provide birthday wolf ears.  The whole family gets regular wolf ears.  They also give you a coupon for a free scoop of ice cream.  We only stayed 1 night and honestly it worked for us.  In the future if we do come back we may end up staying 2 nights so the kids can play Magi-quest.  You gain access to the water park at 1 p.m. the day you check in.  Our room wasn't quite ready when we checked in early but they sent us a text about 30 min after check in to let us know room was ready.  Your wristband acts as your

Summary Heading: Great resort for Grandparents and kids
Summary: The resort is totally self contained.  The restaurants are good.  the waterpark has lots of pools and tubes.  it was very clean.  the kids loved their wolf den room with the bunks, lights, and talking pets.  there are plenty of things for kids to do in the evening too.

Summary Heading: Great place to have fun with the whole family
Summary: We were on a two week vacation in LA and this was a nice place to stay over night and enjoy time with the kids.  The restaurant has delicious food and they do keep it very clean for having so many kids.

Great Wolf Lodge is the best kid friendly vacation spot I've been to. They thought of eveything! Your wristband is your room key, credit card, everything...the rooms are great, enough space for our family of 7, kids loved thier log cabin room with thier own tv...the whole resort is incredibly clean, I was really impressed. Will be going back for sure.

Very safe environment. Lifeguards are very well trained. GreatWolf makes everything so easy from the time we parked to when we packed up. Big enough to do alot, small enough for older kids to roam free. Good drinks!

Summary Heading: It is All for the kiddos
Summary: Honestly this is a great family vacation spot.  There is so much to do for the kids.  We have been 2x's and already have 2 more trips booked.  My kids are 5 & 8 and they love the place.  The 8 year old loves the water park but the MagiQuest game even more.  It is a TON of walking and can be a little confusing but it was also a ton of fun.  My youngest loves all the fun activities.  The bubble party, balloon animals, dancing, arts, crafts and story time keep her entertained.  We have stayed in the family suite and the wolf den suite.  The kids loved the wolf den but for some reason the bed in there wasn't my favorite it was a little too hard for me but the bed in the family suite was fine. I like that they have so many food options on site, The pizza place is our favorite.   The

Please have the maintenance people clean every single part of the room and bathrooms good including the bathroom walls room 130 on April 26 had popo stains in it.over all It was fun and my kids loved it

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge- Garden Grove, ca
Summary: Great for family trip. Water park is appropriate for all ages  and swim levels. Lifeguards look like they hate their job and aren't very friendly. Eye goggles are allowed but they do not allow the face goggles that cover the nose which was a bummer because it's the only kind my children feel comfortable wearing while swimming. No outside food or drinks allowed inside park with exception of water. They do have a snack shack and bar inside park.

Amazing place to take your kids! Quiet rooms, fun waterpark, great service, and excellent food! We will definitely be back! We especially loved all the things you could do with a toddler like the character breakfasts, the bubble wand dance parties, and the bedtime story.

We loved our stay. Kids of all ages will surely enjoyed the amenities and different activities. Would love to come back for at least 2 days stay. One day is not enough for kids. Food is fairly good but a little pricey although there's an option to buy somewhere else and eat out. Haven't tried the buffet though maybe next time!

Summary Heading: World Class Destination and fun for the whole family!!!
Summary: World Class Destination and fun for the whole family!!! Good clean rooms, good food, and great waterpark for all ages!! Can get a little too crowded on the weekends but it is what it is. Watch out for the $69+ extra fees added on to every reservation even a $99 a night room.

Great family environment with a variety of activities.  My 57 year old husband and I have as much fun as the grand-kids.  We only use the water-park.  This trip was our second time, and we will definitely go back again.

great weekend vacation. My kids love it. This is our 3rd time coming and we are happy every time. Great price for the hotel if booked early. Very close to Disneyland. Walking distance to many restaurants.

Summary Heading: Best Water Park and Family Resort
Summary: We have always loved GWL and go every year. The park is clean, the rides are for all ages (baby to adult) and the food and attractions are top notch! We can't say enough about this resort. We threw our son his 7th birthday party here and they did a GREAT job. Laurie Reynolds was easy to work with and everything was perfect. We had the restaurant to ourselves,  the food and cake was delicious and all the kids and adults loved the water park. We have made this a family tradition. Beats Disneyland in cost and fun too!!

I love the idea of an indoor waterpark. You don't have to leave the resort. The hotel has activities for children of all ages, the waterpark, good food. I love the concept and my 5 year old loves it. Since it has opened we have been trying to go every 6 months. We love it!

We had a great time and the staff was extremely friendly, nice, and willing to help. This was a great family trip. Next trip to Great Wolf Lodge we are definitely going to join in the daily activities available for guests!

Summary Heading: My Birthday treat to my grandchildren
Summary: My grandchildren enjoy the water park, but still price is not acceptable. This place is not for ordinary family. I suggest, you must offer a promotional discount for local residence. People wonder what do you have to offer. For me I have to save a lot to be able to return with my grandchildren.

Check in was a nightmare with 2 small children. We called on our drive up and asked if our room would be ready or close to ready when we arrived at 1:30. We were assured that our room was going to be ready by the time be arrived. We happily accepted that it would either be ready or close to being ready because we knew check in was 4pm. So we continued our drive directly there and did not go visit family members on the way:( When we arrived at 1:30 the front desk told us that the room would be ready really soon.  Finally after asking several times before 4 pm and twice after 4 pm check in we were told by the front desk that the room we were supposed to be checked into smelled like vomit and they were still cleaning the rugs. Wow I was glad he finally told me and then after hours

We had the best time. Its very $$$$ but it was worth it.....we had a blast! We will love to go back soon. There is so much for kids to do and very fun for the parents too! We went there with friends and it made special. We stayed in the waterpark over 5 hours.

my family had a great time in this resort. it was clean and all the staff are nice and friendly. I was amazed that the waiting time for the water slides are fast and efficient. I love there is an option for outdoor pool.

We had a great time! The staff was super educated and we felt very safe at the great wolf lodge. Would highly recommend it! Everyone was so nice and accomindating. The staff was well trained and polite.

Summary Heading: Heaven for kids, fun for adults
Summary: My family just spent a weekend at the Great Wolf Lodge, and had a wonderful time. We are from Japan, and had never heard of Great Wolf before, but decided to give it a try as our three-year-old loves pools and swimming.   Access is easy, Great Wolf Lodge is on Harbor Blvd, not far from Interstate 5. We had arranged a Prime Time Shuttle through Jayride to bring us from LAX to the Great Wolf Lodge, but the shutter never showed up. After looking at the reviews for Prime Time Shuttle, I was horrified to see what a terrible service it was. We ended up having to take a Taxi, even though we had prepaid our shuttle fare. A taxi from LAX to Great Wolf takes nearly an hour, and cost $110.   My wife had checked in using her cell phone, so checking in to the lodge was painless, with no

Great place for kids, A lot of activities for all ages of children.  Room was comfortable. Pillows,  edging, mattress very good Fairly pricey but this was rare treat for our grandkids who live on opposite side of country

We went with a 18 month old and a 4 year old. There were life jackets available on first come first serve basis. There was plenty for both kids to do in the waterpark. I think it would be more fun with older kids because they can do more by themselves. The outdoor food and drink were very good. If you have a group, I would recommend getting a cabana so you can have a

My children had a blast. The staff was nice and always avaible. The life gaurds were always watching the pools. Towels were always avaible. The other thing I love about Great Wolf Lodge was the gusts were nice as well. They looked out for other children and alway smiling.

The resort was clean, comfy and super welcoming. The water park was very fun. Lots of other activities to do if you're not into water parks as well. I loved being able to sleep, play and eat all at the same place, it made it very convenient.

Very clean resort, clean and very comfortable beds. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Many activities for kids, but a bit pricey. Water park is very enjoyable and small enough to keep track of your kids. Will definitely return again when the price is right.

great place, you do not need to leave the resort. It has everything you need. Food is reasonably priced. A list of variety activities for the kiddos of all ages.  Sleeper sofa is not as comfortable as Embassy Suites

Great time for the kids. Unfortunately water park closes early this time of year and we were not aware. Very disappointing for kids after a long day of travel to get there. This was our 2nd visit to Great Wolf and I suspect we will visit again.

Summary Heading: Pleasant and relaxing indoor water park !!
Summary: Kids enjoyed the comfortable indoor water parks with exciting but not crazy water slides and various facilities... Friendly staff and safe environment. Great family outing, I have recommended to friends who also came and enjoyed their stays too

4 moms plus 8 kids spent one night in 2 kidcabin rooms. We brought so many snacks because we didn't realize you couldn't take food into the water park (but you can buy food and drinks from the snack bar there). You can take water bottles in with you though. We did discover that they make a mean pitcher of sangria. The hotel was surprisingly quiet at night but the pillows were so hard that our ears hurt in the morning from laying on them. There is so much chlorine in the air at the water park that your eyes sting without even going into the water. My whole group had a blast and we would probably go back and do this again. There is a McDonald's across the street so if you want a cheap dinner at least that is in walking distance. Get to Dunkin donuts early for your coffee. No line

We decided to come here snd spent the nite, reserved 2 rooms and the kids had a blast, indoor pools close at 8pm, after that we went to have dinner at a walking distance sushi place, back to the great wolf lodge for ice cream, the place is amazing, the staff is great, there are gift shops, candy shop, ice cream shop, pizza place, buffet restaurant, theres no need to leave the resort for anything, cheaper than Disneyland with a lot more fund thing to do for the kids included in the price.

Summary Heading: Being a kid is so much better than being an adult ...
Summary: I have been looking forward to going to GWL since I heard they were going to be opening. It took a while for my family to make the move since the prices are pretty steep. Thank goodness for the off-season!   The resort is pretty awesome. It had all the conveniences that you would want in a kid-oriented resort! Waterslide park, multiple restaurants, and lots and lots of activities for kids! Our visit was during the off -season and already crowded, I cannot imagine what it's like during the summer or peak season. I don't think I would come back at that time. Anyway, my 4 year old has an absolute blast and I'm sure is willing to go back at any time!   Now as an adult I have a few complaints:   The entire place is definitely too cold! The lower level, the restaurants, the restrooms.

Grandkids were always activie. Loved the water features and sense of safety that was always present. Employees were attentive ands informative. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Food was surprisingly delicious and reasonably priced.

Kids are already picking this place over Disneyland! So much fun. Every staff member we made eye contact with was friendly and said hello. Customer service was fantastic! Room was clean, and I slept in til 10AM for the first time in about a decade. Cannot wait to return!

Was not allowed to bring in snacks and food to water park. However we witnessed multiple families who hid items and brought in their own refreshments and snacks. We were singled out for being honest and open during the bag check. The confrontation was uncalled for considering we spent about $1000 at the location for 2 nights. AC unit in room needed repair as it was loud and lugging.

We've been here about 4 times now, and we just love it. Relaxing, fun, and always a good time. Prices vary depending on when you plan your dates, but we usually come during weekdays. We've spent holidays and weekends here too, and its always pleasant, well organized and just an overall good time. The line at Dunkin Donuts gets a bit long in the AM, but this last trip was nice, they worked out a new system having an additional person taking orders at the line, and it seemed to move quicker. The restaurants offer a nice variety, and you gotta try the pizza....best pepperoni ever!

okay for first time not for second visit. If you are sensitive to smell of chlorine, be aware you'll smell them constantly at the indoor water park.  The price is bit high for the room and at the restaurant. But if money is not your issue and chlorine smell don't bother you? Then It's great for the kids!

If I could give negative stars I would and there is not nearly enough room to explain all the issues. It was so bad the children do not even want to go back there ever. We have told everyone we can about the conditions and lack there of service at this place.

We Absolutely love this place. Services, lifeguards and the whole park itself is Fantastic! We Highly recommend it if you want to experience fun in the water in a whole new way for the entire family!!

The Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim was a fun 2 days for our family. (2 kids between 5-7). We also saw friends there which made it even more fun for our kids! Since we weren't going to Disney or Knott's, 1 night stay was perfect for us as we were able to spend 2 days in the park.  I highly advise going in the middle of the week if you can as it was still busy but, not crazy. Food options are reasonably priced but, don't forget you do have access to a microwave and refrigerator for those snacks (or even reheating leftovers).

Insanely overpriced for what you get. Save your money and go to a regular waterslide park instead.  Every activity costs extra money and the poor quality food is more expensive than an airport!  The indoor waterslide park burns your eyes with chlorine and is too warm and stuffy.

This is an expensive place with a long check-in line! The pool activities were adequate and the lifeguards appeared to be very attentive.  The shower in our room (255) made the loudest noise-it did sound like a wolf howling. The food at the restaurants was satisfactory. We wished the outdoor pool could have been bigger.  Our grandchildren can boast that they’ve been to Great Wolf, but we won’t be returning.

The hotel is 10 minutes from Disneyland and has a lot of activities and a great water park for kids so the combination is awesome.  It doesn't include breakfast which, I think, is a problem given the price of the rooms.

Park was great. Staff sends a text message when you're room is ready. They gave us birthday wolf ears when they knew it was my daughter's birthday. Water slides are great. Lazy rivet could be a little longer, but we had fun in it anyway.

We have traveled to GWL a few times and have not been disappointed yet! Lots to do for the whole family, mini golf, bowling, Magiquest, bubble dances, and most of all the water park! The food a the restaurants are good quality and not a rip off!

We woke up on a REALLY windy day and decided to get out of town for a family trip. We booked our room that day and left! We arrived at 2pm. The room was already available. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. There are a few things I'll do different next time. The Loose Moose Buffet is horrible. The food was terrible and WAY overpriced. Our overall experience aside from that was fantastic.

Summary Heading: Experience overall and one bad apple
Summary: Overall my kids had a great time however had one very bad experience with an employee at the water park.  My kids and I waited a while in line to get on a slide and where in line before 8pm as we got to the top the guy told myself and my kids with a smile on his face that it's 8pm and it's closed.  Not sure if those are the park's rules.!!  But totally not fair to turn my HAPPY kids away when we were the next one's to slide my kids and other kids right behind us were heart broken, if this is a rule it's needs to be corrected and an employee should be placed at the bottom of the line for guests that were in line before 8pm.. it was very hard to see my son cry because he couldn't get on one last ride that he was in line before closing.  What made it worse was employee has no

Summary Heading: Lots of Fun for the Family
Summary: The indoor water park at it's finest. This is a water park first and foremost. The hotel really comes second. The water park is a good size and offers varying degrees of intensity of water slides for each adventurer. There is something for all ages. So no matter the age, you will find something everyone likes. The rides range from tubes and mat rides to wave pools and lazy river. Fun play area for little kids to a wave pool and bodyboard/surf area. The seats can go quickly, so if you find a spot, take it. You have food options and there are adult drinks for the parents.   The hotel rooms are spacious and there is a refrigerator, microwave, and safe in the room. I will say the towels in the room are tiny and barely cover half your body. This needs to be fixed. Besides the room,

My kids and I have been to the GWL multiple times and even though they are now teenagers they still ask to go back.  It is a great spot where you can relax and feel totally comfortable allowing your kids to enjoy the rides with our without you at their sides!

Alot of minor problems out of our control could have ruined our stay. Alot of patience is needed. It's very clean and activities are fun. For every 1 nice staff member there are 2 not so nice.. Lazy river goes really fast.

Summary Heading: An Ideal place for couples or families!!
Summary: This is an awesome place to go to! The staff and the services were amazing! They made sure you had a great time there. I had a family emergency the first time there and their staff especially Diane Harrison with her awesome team of assistants made sure that we had the full support and comfort to resolve the emergency situation with ease. The MagiQuest game is totally a blast and even though it takes 6-8 hours to complete one section, it sure kept us busy and excited during our stay. The Waterpark... it truly speaks for itself.... Love that Wolf Trial ride!! Its a must see!

Summary Heading: Our family's 1st Great Wolf Lodge Experience
Summary: We loved the room. It was so comfortable and clean. We loved that there was free wifi. We loved the waterpark. The only thing we didn't like was that the food was a bit overpriced and the quality of the food was not good. We loved the  fries though! But there was one time we ordered a huge fries and it was completely burnt. There also wasn't much variety on the menu to choose from. Location was great. Parking was great. The staff was wonderful! Overall, this place is amazing!!! And my family LOVES wolves! :)

I felt the need to review this excellent place again. I brought my kids and their friends for a short getaway last weekend,  and as usual the kids had a blast.  The food at Great Wolf Lodge is reasonable and good. Plenty of choices from Dunkin Donuts to sit down restaurants.  You have to try the ribs at the Moose Lodge restaurant,  one of the best I have tried and reasonably priced.  Also,  guest can use the waterpark for two days for an overnight stay,  the time you arrive and the next day.  South Coast Plaza and the Orange outlet is not far away either. The best part about Great Wolf Lodge is there are so many lifeguards that I feel very safe with my kids using the waterpark.  I really need to mention also, the employees are very honest,  2 years ago we forgot a necklace at

When your child says it was the best vacation ever, and you feel like you deserve a Mom of the Year award, you know it was a great trip!! Hours on end of water play and a bubble dance party at the end of the night...enough said. My daughter enjoyed all that Great Wolf Lodge had to offer. She was excited to stay in the Wolf Den Suite, where she had her own area with bunk beds and TV. The water park was also great and my daughter is not an experienced swimmer. There was plenty for her to do all while being completely safe. The arcade was a huge hit. Although I paid $50 worth of games, there are some big ticket earning games which made the time spent in the arcade so exciting. She walked away winning over 1000 tickets and claiming 4 prizes. I could go on and on, but I'm going to

Fully satisfied with the location to celebrate my daughters birthday with her friends. We were there with 7 children ages 9-10 and they were safe in every ride and were safe just walking around the park in a group.

this place is great, very warm welcome and professional service, the water park layout is excellent for for family especially with young kids and children, we had a great time with the park even only one night, we will come back to stay longer and would highly recommend to all friends to visit the Great Wolf Lodge. See you in August again

My two grandsons, 11 and 9, had a good time.  But the packages are quite expensive and the add-ons just make it worse.  Plus, the major restaurant is VERY expensive, while the food at the cheaper places isn’t very good.  A fun trip as a one time deal, but not worth going back.

We have been going to Great Wolf Lodge for the past 2 years during the Summer. My daughter has been choosing to go there to celebrate her birthday, this will be the 3rd year in a row! We can't seem to bribe her to go or do anything else! We almost had her, with a unicorn party. But as dad and I were getting excited to have her celebrate with friends of her own and out of her big sisters shadows she put a halt on the party planning. She's requested another year at Great Wolf! They seem to be doing something extremely right the kids aspect I guess. Kudos to you, you win this battle Great Wolf Lodge. From the parent aspect, as much as I want to complain a little about the sometimes ridiculously high prices, I won't. The hotel is clean, the pool was great, the water park is clean

it was amazing and i had much fun over there. but, someone with a big tattoo and kids started saying cuss words to my children randomly. overall, the service was amazing, despite that mean man saying those words.

We had an amazing time and felt at peace with the family environment. I loved watching kids walk around barefoot and adults in swimsuits. My family will be planning a return trip. Thank you to all the staff.

I would recommend this place to everyone.  My young children enjoyed it as much as I did.  There are things for kids of all ages to do.  Some activities are even free.  The hotel was nice and clean.  The staffs were friendly and helpful.  I would definitely go again in the near future.

Summary Heading: If you have kids they will love this
Summary: You wont have to leave your hotel. Plenty activites to do as a family with the kids. There are areas where adults can enjoy themselves late late after kids are asleep. Does get a little pricey but definetly lots of fun for KIDS.

Feel like I wasted my money because I brought my two kids primarily for the waterpark and they became so cold that we had to depart after just one hour.  There are NO hot tubs to warm up in, the water temp and air temp is too chilly for small children.  Even as an adult I did not enjoy the temperatures.

Stayed here for Spring break. We stayed in the wild fen room. No groupon available and it was packed, so the price was more expensive. Kids had a great time. Pool was heated. Lots of people and not enough seats. Either that or people just left their towels on the chair but never actually use it. Lots of retairants outside to eat. The magiquest for kids are great way to walk and exercise. Overall great experience

One of the best family vacations ever! Nice to have all your entertainment in one place!! My kids had an excellent time! Loved the arcade and the relaxed environment! It was a pricey vacation but definitely worth the experience!

My husband and I took our 9 yr old son to the Great Wolf water slide park.  It turned out to be so much more than just water slides.  I guarantee you and your kids will have a great time.  There was always something fun to do.  We highly recommend the Magi Quest.

We had a great time at the waterpark and my kids had a wonderful time playing Magicquest.  The front desk staff was friendly.  When we upgraded our room to the kids cabin we were given a room facing the Disneyland fireworks.  Was great entertainment to watch before bed.  The only negative was how uncomfortable the bed was.  The kids also were not able to sleep in their beds and they complained about how hard their mattresses were. I would only suggest two days though as it can get old.

They have a lot of activities for kids and provide a safe environment but be prepared to spend a lot of money.  The room was not worth the price of the stay (the hairdryer had almost no power and the room was never made up) but the water park is exciting for the kids.  My kid loved the magiquest so it's worth checking that part out.

Awesome experience for the whole family...great variety of activities...waterpark was amazing...!!! Staff was friendly and accommodating...reaort was clean and well taken care of...convenient location...Kids loved every minute...!!❤❤❤❤

Everything was great! we loved it! My kids and I had a great time and enjoyed every minute! We felt safe and enjoyed the food too! We are recycling and saving our money so we can return soon. We are telling everyone we know to go and enjoy!

This place was on our way to San Diego and was just the right thing to break up the drive and give the 4 y/o someplace to burn off some energy.  He can't swim yet but the provided life jackets made us (and him) feel safe.  We were impressed with the technology when booking, the attentive and thoughtful detail of the staff and management in thinking about families and the WOW factor of an INDOOR water park.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, the elevators were fast and plentiful, we never felt rushed or impatient, and we had a blast from the moment we walked in 'till we had to leave.  HIGHLY recommend this place for some family fun.

Dirty rooms, Elevators did not work most of the time. Poor customer service, and overall not satisfied. It would be helpful to the guests if you have an automatic doors for ease of use especially when we re bringing in and out our baggages. Not likely to return as hotel guests.

The wolves ears you receive at the check-in may be the highlight of your trip. The wolf den rooms are cute for the kids but little luxury for the adults (instead of a nightstand, there was a small wobbly table, the bathroom in the wolf's den is very small with one sink for 4-6 people. The property is clean and you will never have to leave since entertainment and restaurants are on the property. The service in the restaurants is generally very inefficient, long waits for little reward. The waterpark is very crowded, especially in the afternoons. Go on the popular rides early in the morning to avoid the very slow moving lines - the lines are slow because the people who work them are very young and probably not well trained.

Had a fantastic time with my 8 and 10 year old boys. They loved the water park and the fantastic Magic Quest Game. The water in the water park is a bit chilly to be in there several hours, and the lines are a bit long in the afternoon for the big slides, but they sure got their exercise playing Magic Quest. They loved that best.

Fun indoor water slides, wave pool, endless wave wall for surfing or boogie board. Great fun for the younger kids, arcade, mini golf 9 holes, 3d first shooter ride, the Magi quest game was fun but tiring running around the hotel finding clues, story time, yoga, mini bowling. The rooms are nice not overly done, but they do have some theme rooms. Food was reasonably priced and decent, the candy store was WAY OVER PRICED the only downer of our stay.

Great wolf lodge is by far the best family vacation we have ever taken, better than our family cruise vacation last year.... I'm already looking into our next stay.  Thank you Great Wolf for our phenomenal stay

Kids enjoy Great Wolf Lodge, the water park and activities are great some of the staff is great. Be careful with paying for the spa in advance with your reservation it can be troublesome making appointments.

Good experience.  Kids had fun in the water park.   Food not to stellar but a good thing McDonald's was near by. Overall,  I wouldn't mind going back, just need to find a good reasonable price.  Amenities are nice

Summary Heading: Best Vacation Ever!! Food Allergy Friendly!
Summary: We visited Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove as a last minute Spring Break Vacation. We reserved 2 rooms, one for my family including my husband and 2 children, 6 and 3 years old as well as a second room with my sister and her 2 teenage girls. This place has something for everyone!  Upon arrival, we were able to easily check in at the mobile kiosk as we had completed early registration the night before via an email we received. I highly recommend completing early registration as the regular check in line was pretty long. Either way, the lobby is amazing with tons to look at and activities to participate in. There were balloon animals being made and other fun activities when we arrived. We also participated in story time in the evening which was fun.  We were able to get in to our

Great place for the kids too have fun in the water wish there could have been a place for adults to swim something deeper. Overall stay was good the kids were sad they couldn't have their own little smacks but we managed

Summary Heading: over priced, hard with little ones
Summary: over priced. They say there room with 2 queen beds is a family suite. Showers stink. Beds are uncomfortable. Not really impressed with water park. Water too old for littles. 800 bucks for 2 days. Wont do this again.

Kid friendly resort with tons of activities and a safe environment. My pack of 5 are returning guest, my children speak of Wolf Lodge all year long. And were so excited to hear about our stay. Happy spring break! Highly recommended.

The hotel was good but it caters to young children. I have 4 kids ages 10-15 . They were bored after a few hours at the water park. Don't get me wrong if you have little ones they will enjoy it but for pre teens and teenagers it's very limited.  I wanted to check this hotel out so I can say I've been there. Done that.  But I doubt I will be back because my kids are getting older and it's kin of pricey.

Went for 1 night with family.  It was a good time. Rooms were the best. Very spacious and comfortable.  Probably one of the best beds we have slept in. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch. More than enough room for 4 of us. The rooms to me were the best part. Also, free WiFi.  Kids enjoyed the arcade and obviously the water slides. Several to choose from. It was very busy but there is so much room to move around and things to choose from. The only downfall I would say is that you are not allowed to bring in your own snacks or drinks. It makes it hard when your child just wants something small such as gold fish or something healthy without having to go buy a large meal. They allow food purchased within the hotel but yet again not anything really healthy or small

great customer service and kid friendly. it is a little pricey but when you put it together with being able to walk back up to your room after a day in the water ... its actually pretty cool.  they have a dunkin donuts,  pizza place and restaurant so you dont have to leave anywhere.  GO!

We have been here 3 or 4 times and my kids LOVE this place! From the awesome bunk beds in the theme rooms, wonderful Grand entrance in the lobby, downstairs you have a fantastic game room, a bowling alley, a kids spa, magic wands that open up new worlds( a wizard game), and then this crazy indoor water world, smelling like chlorine but filled with smiles and laughs. The food is pretty good, the outdoor bar has great adult food! Donuts and coffee are perfect for breakfast, just enough time to full ur belly before another day of fun!

I have a grandbaby that has severe food allergies. We have to have the epipen with us at all times. It is difficult to take the whole family to restaurants, because of the risk of the wrong ingredient being in the food, or cross contamination. Chef Grant made us feel safe from the 1st time we went there. We wanted to go and stay there for the water park. We live in Anaheim Hills, so we thought we would bring food from home for our grandbaby. We could get back home in 15 minutes if we needed to get more stuff for her. The water park is perfect for all ages. So much to do for everyone. We saw the buffet restaurant, and it looked good. Chef Grant was there, and he assured us that he would cook safe food for our grandbaby. He did, and she loved it! This facility is nut free also. We

Nice water park, great activities, good location, friendly staffs, room services are a little late toward the end of the day but it seems like they're understaffed or just too busy.  Kids love this place and always ask to come back for next time.

This resort has so many wonderful ammenities. Our kids didn't ever want to leave to go anywhere else! The resort also has parents in mind by making the waterpark hours work around bedtimes and the MagicQuest game ending at 10:00.

We took our daughter for her 13th birthday (along with 2 of her friends) per her request...and there are numerous reasons why we most likely will not return:  1. Although lots of different water slides and activities, they were bored after one day. It may be best suited to families with kids under 12. It would also be nice to have outdoor water slides as well.  2. The room was BASIC. We had a kids den and the bed and bedding was not clean, the mattresses were paper-thin, and the bed frames creaked loudly every time you moved. The kids did not sleep well, and that's saying a lot.  3. The food was average at best, and very expensive. Best meal choice would have to be at "Lodge Wood Fired Grill." Pizza was also good at the "Hungry like a Wolf" cafe. Tip: after check-in go by the

It was a pleasant experience visiting Great Wolf Lodge for the first time. The kids had a great time, but the hotel is pricy and everything in there you have to spend for. I wished that maybe at least breakfast will be included. Loved the indoor water park though.

Great activity place for family with young kids, food is great, lots of variety too. Great place to go with extended family too, safe environment for kids, scheduled activities for younger kids, very fun.

had a great time. staff was super friendly and helpful. Flo-rider staff took time with both my six and five year old girls to teach them. wish they had better security at the exit, too easy for little one's to leave

was so much fun like sunmer all year long great for kids off all ages we all had a blast kids and adults both. Was very clean and fun friendly staff great food and drinks. Food and drinks are pricey though would be nice if could bring outside food to pool area other than that would definitely recommend. Best family trip.

we have  2 days stay here  1st day  we  dont need housekeeping service but when i fix the bed it was gross coz i see stain from previous guest  i call front desk and ask new blanket but never hear any apology , i  answer all reviews abt my stay thru my email they send me but nothing action and never heard from them.. unluckily  i work as a housekeeper too so i know if the blanket was used by previous guest or not  one stain is gross ,,other small stain was from cheese chips powder .i send message from facebook no response...

Excellent family trip for my 7 year old birthday. Fun activities and adventures throughout the hotel. Never a quite moment. My girls did not want to return home. Regrettably we will not be going back any time soon, It was very expensive for 2 nights for 4 people. I would like to stay the week for the price I paid for 3 days/2 nights.

we did have a good time.. it is a fun enjoyable experience... buyer be ware.. orange county is having major homeless problems and they are passing the expence to the tourist taxing you a 14% transient tax.. HIDDEN FEE also there is a resort fee.  parking fee.  my son had dirty linen in his bed from the previous user in the wolf den.  the good thing is there are alot of different places in the surrounding area to eat the eateries they offer here are expensive as well.

The staff was quite unfriendly on a handful of occasions and when anyone on the floor used the hot water, the pipes screeched enough to wake even the deepest sleeper. Super fun and clean water park - but for those two reasons we wouldn’t visit again.

Summary Heading: Other than the uncomfortable sleep, resort is great
Summary: pillows and beds are extremely hard and lumpy. kids can sleep ANYWHERE, but not here. My 3 kids had horrible sleep because of how hard the mattresses were. The queen bed was extremely hard and pillows were lumpy. Besides the sleeping situation, the resort was fun and clean and very friendly staff.

Summary Heading: I really wanted this to be a great family vacation, but the rooms were a deal breaker.
Summary: The problems encountered with the hotel room itself drives my rating down to 3. The water park was a great feature, and the kids had a blast, but when looking to relax after a fun filled day only to be woken up throughout the night by clanking pipes, squeaky doors, and nearly burning the mouth of my toddler with what is supposed to be cold water/only to find out that the plumbing in the room is backwards (Hot was cold, cold was hot), leaves me with a feeling that I will not return and cannot recommend the hotel to friends and family.

There is very little reason to leave this resort once you get here. There are activities all day and night for kids of all ages. Besides that they have the water park, character appearances and many other activities like an arcade and mini golf. There are many different food choices and all rooms are made for families and includes microwave and fridge. Accommodations were fine. We are a family of 5 and all were comfortable in a regular 2 queen suite room. All restaurants cater to adults and kids and every staff member we had contact with was awesome. We will definitely come back here.

Our family spent a weekend in March at Great Wolf Lodge and it far exceeded our expectations.  Two adults, a 9 year old, and a 17 year old all had a blast at the water park.  There were plenty of rides to keep us busy on both days, and they had water activities appropriate for small children as well as adults.  The longest line was 20 minutes, and in many cases there were no lines.  (We were not there on Spring Break or in Summer, though.)  It was warm in the building and in the water.  Everything was clean, safe, and well organized.  Staff was friendly and the place was well-staffed.  There were plenty of towels.  There was also a variety of food and drink available poolside, including a bar.  And our hotel room was only 5 minutes away!   The rooms were nice and new-looking and

Fun for parents and kids! You never have to leave the premises!! Not only is there a waterpark, but also a bowling alley, arcade, miniature gold, 4D movie experience, daily shows for the kiddos, and plenty of ways to make the whole family smile!

Great family water park hotel with lots of activities. Close to fast foods and target, Walgreens. Lots of security and great customer service. Being an indoor water park, tends to get very hot/humid and strong chlorine chemical smells, eye burn.

We are already planning are next trip. My kids said they like Great Wolf Lodge more than Disneyland!! Big DEAL! The waterpark is great all year long. The bowling, arcade, and other activities are fun as well. We will definitely be coming back soon.

It was very clean and well kept. Many activities for the kids to do including the water park, towels provided inside were a huge help. Lots of space for little ones to run around. Love that the wrist band links up as the room key, parking for in and out of the garage and even with your credit card for easy charges.

Great Wolf Lodge is such a great place for the entire family.  The water park has activities for all ages, and the other activities for the kids are also great. Our family just completed our second trip to Great Wolf Lodge and are already planning on another.  We are also very excited about the new resort opening in Arizona, which will make weekend getaways

Great resort.  Fun times for all ages. Would do it again.  Food was great and no big lines. The resort doesn't over charge for food.  $10 kids buffet was great! The Food and beverage manager was great. Thanks Carlos .

We are here today and my four grandkids are having a Blast!  Ages, 15, 19, 9, 7.  Place is huge, all water rides are clearly marked for level of fright.  Kids tried the boogie board ride, with water raging underneath like a real SoCal beach.  Nobody has gotten hurt.  Kids do their own thing and have not whined about being bored for hours!!😉

Summary Heading: I do not recommend this hotel
Summary: For such a new hotel it was very dirty. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone. It is a cute idea but the staff really didn't seem to care about the problems at hand and the service was very slow. The menu options at their steakhouse are limited and the drinks are so sugary and nasty. The waterpark was fun and seemed to be the only area of the hotel I would deem clean.

Summary Heading: Best vacation ever we can't wait to go back
Summary: We can't wait to go back we are planning it already we can't wait till they open one in Scottsdale Arizona the family had the best vacation ever and we are so excited the best place to stay ever clean this people are so happy and excited nice very clean rooms food you don't have to go anywhere glasses vacation ever

It was very nice. It was a little bit pricey @ 631.00 for 1 night.  It was more than Vegas. But my kids had fun. That's what matters in the end. The money was already spent. We will be back. Just hope it's not as expensive next time with 4 kids.

Summary Heading: Worth the price.. definitely coming back, my kids had a blast
Summary: orth the price.. definitely coming back, my kids had a blast.everyone was helpful and nice . Even though checkout was at 11 , we were able to stay at the facility till about 8pm . We are already planning a return trip in june

Such a wonderful, clean and fun filled hotel! Kids had an amazing time. Nothing short of excellent. The water park was perfect for all 3 of my children ranging from 5 to 10! The staff was so friendly and helpful

This is a great place  to spend time with family.  Fantastic for kids. Love the price for the quality of the place. Very organized and clean. The room and the food very good. The staff was increible nice.

My grandchildren ages 5 to 10 loved this park and look forward to returning next year. The kids really enjoyed the activities that were included. The additional activities are a little pricey when you are buying for four kids. The package deals are a fair vale. We bought the 79.99 pkg, and it kept them busy with the free activities and of course the water park.. We will pay for late check out next year. I did not realize this was an option at point of reservations it was not offered. Definitely recommend the experience and we will definitely be back. The rooms are clean the bedding is good. I consider the rooms average. We spent very little time in our room. I purchased the kids cabin thinking it would be a treat. Next time, I will just purchase a standard room and save my

Summary Heading: Not putting their money into upkeep
Summary: Not nearly as pleased this time as we were in 2016.  There were a lot of things broken.  Seems like they just aren't putting their money into upkeep.  Staff were friendly, food was fine.  Also, the water temp/air temp was a little off.  They say that the water and air are both a lovely warm temp, but different attractions definitely had different temps.  That was also different from our last visit.

Summary Heading: Safe, fun and clean, no sun burn
Summary: Nice indoor water park, we will be back. Any of my friends want to go too. Y kids had a blast. Thank you. Safe, fun and clean, no sun burn. We spend a night in the lodge and enjoyed two days park activity. Great value. Beds are comfy and clean.

We love going to GWL with out little one. It is a safe environment with great food and lots of entertainment. The Paw Pass is a great value and adds lots of fun to the trip. We've traveled there now with a 2 year-old, 6 year-old, and 10 year-old, and we've always found perfect age-appropriate activities and food when we go.

Summary Heading: An inexpensive way to have a great experience
Summary: We took the family here back in May 2017.  I can tell you that if you're looking for an inexpensive way to have a great time, this is a definite.  The hotel room was really nice, lots of room and comfortable.  Only people who are staying in the hotel can use the water park.  The water park is mostly indoors but there is a small portion that is outdoors.  There is a lot of variety on the water features.  there are major adult rides, infant attractions and everything in between.  The hotel itself also has lots of activities for the whole family, such as family yoga and character visits throughout the day. If you're looking for a fun family time, I highly recommend this visit.

My battery died and I needed a new one for my truck. The staff offered absolutely no help in a solution and acted like it wasn't their problem. very disappointed. Everything else was great, and despite the battery incident, was very great.

Our overall stay was great, the check in process was a bit slower then we anticipated to be. We waited for a few hours to check in when initial we were told that if we arrived earlier than noon we'd be likely to check in as soon as arriving.

Everything from the beginning to end went smoothly! My kids had fun and my husband and I did too! Love the fact that you can stay at the water park even after you check out! We will definitely be going back soon!

Summary Heading: Such a fun and entertaining place
Summary: The lines aren’t too long, the rides are fun, and the kids play area is great!! The food at the grill inside the waterpark was ok, not great. But the food did come out quickly. And the kids area was perfect for my 2.5 year old!

We love this place, it's not our first time and it most definitely wont be the last. We don't have to worry about anything. Disneyland is not our favorite anymore. Kids love water and when the parents don't have to stress out its a done deal

Overall, Great Wolf Lodge is a fun little get away for our family, primarily because of the water park. But each time we have stayed, the food has been horrendously bad. They have several different food options, and all of them are terrible. So, while we had fun, we wish we could buy some food that we wouldn't regret eating.

Summary Heading: One of the Best Family Fun places
Summary: Great Wolf is a fun family place. Last year I took the family for a 4 day stay, and this year we just finished up a 2 day stay, and the kids are already asking when we are going back.  I highly recommend taking your children for a visit.

Summary Heading: 1st stat was better than our 2nd stay.
Summary: The thing thag I didn't like was that our room was so far from the elevator. I also didn't like that it was so packed compared to the my last visit here. The first time was way better for me. Besides that the kids love this place & they have so much fun

We come here a few times a year and are never disappointed.  This resort has everything you need. We find ourselves never wanting to leave. There is plenty of food options and activities for everyone . The water park is clean, safe, and well maintained. The amount of lifeguards who are actively patrolling their areas make me feel comfortable with having my children around so much water.

Summary Heading: watch your credit card bill after checkout, had lots of charges from hotel that were incorrect and they will not reverse
Summary: terrible front desk...watch your bill and cc stmt after, I had four charges from Great Wolf that were bogus, they charged me for parking four times  but i didn't even park at the hotel ever. I tried to challenge all these charges and they claimed they are allowed to charge you, how is that legal?  I really wanted to love this place. I booked two rooms for my sons birthday. The hotel itself is just ok. The front desk is a nightmare. It takes forever to check in and they nickle and dime you on everything. They asked if i wanted a piece of paper on the door to say happy birthday, cost $10. I literally printed a piece of paper and put it on my door and it looked way better and it cost me nothing. Then after our stay I got our credit card bill and was over charged fees here and there

We really had a great time beginning with pulling on to the property. Very friendly and felt the value was good. We only stayed one night but were able to visit the water park the day of arrival and the entire next day.

Summary Heading: Great way for a family staycation!
Summary: It could get crowded.  We checked in on a Sunday, it was still crowded.  Do use the mobile pre check-in -- that line is way shorter than the normal check-in counters in the front desk.  Also, check your final check-out receipt.  You might be billed twice whenever you use the RFID wristbands to pay.

Summary Heading: Terrible front desk...watch your bill and cc stmt after, I had four charges from Great Wolf that were bogus
Summary: I really wanted to love this place. I booked two rooms for my sons birthday. The hotel itself is just ok. The front desk is a nightmare. It takes forever to check in and they nickle and dime you on everything. They asked if i wanted a piece of paper on the door to say happy birthday, cost $10. I literally printed a piece of paper and put it on my door and it looked way better and it cost me nothing. Then after our stay I got our credit card bill and was over charged fees here and there which is so wrong and annoying. Plus, two of my guests ended up getting sick after we left. The flu is going around SoCal and that place with the heat turned up instead is a breading ground. You've been warned.

Kiddos had a great time. A bit over priced for the quality of beds and the location. Our room was missing the tv remote. They kept kicking us out of the water for maintenance. Other than that its a neat experience. I was not impressed by the food at the restaurant.

Everything I mean everything costs money. $50 for a buffet breakfast for two. $4 to play one arcade game. $7 to play 9 holes of miniature golf. Kids running up and down stairs to find wizard clues. Monopolizing the elevators to seek clues from lobby to 6th floor from 6 AM to 10 at night. P.S. $10 for a beer.

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge - Not worth it.
Summary: The hotel room is very basic, there is also no clock,or suitcase holder. The carpet inside the room felt dirty and gross and the bed sheets smelled. I was highly disappointed with the wait after we checked in to even get a hotel room. If you pay for a day then don't count on having a hotel room for 24 hours. The lockers to hold your things start at 12 dollars a day. We had to rent a larger locker at 15 dollars a day to hold our items so we could use the water park while we waited for our hotel room to be ready. The elevators took sometimes 10 minutes for us to be able to use them.  Considering the amount of money, I would've spent it on a nice hotel and a day at another amusment park.

Summary Heading: Make a phone reservation vs. online to ensure accuracy
Summary: Kids had a blast! Tons to do, however two, of our three rooms were double booked. After 3 hours with the manager, we were comped the two rooms, however we had to dispute some credit card charges because the family who ended up with our room, had our credit card info attached to their room key per the hotel staff mistake. More info (schedule) is needed regarding kids activities as well.

However, our room had water issues and loud noises from the pipes. This was very disruptive and even caused us to be 2 hours late to our trip to Disneyland, which was the whole reason we came to California. Then when we had no hot water in our room, the engineers tried to say that we didn't wait long enough for the hot water to arrive. I was able to take a shower in barely luke warm water and the hot water still had not arrived to our room. We know it was a boiler issues and it was disappointing for them to say it was us. Also, a staff member told us the Loose Moose kitchen would be open for dinner and even listed the menu for that night and when we came down for dinner, it was closed. We had planned our whole day according to dinner plans and we were upset that we had to go

We had heard so many mixed reviews from friends about the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove. To our surprise, this place was perfect for a short family get away. You have to keep in mind this is a vacation simply for the interest of kids (of course there are parental pearks that I will share with you as well)  Check in- Do your pre-check in on your phone which will be emailed to you before your stay. There is a separate line that is much shorter if you do so. Check in is at 1 pm, and you can use the water park at 4pm. That gives you plenty of time to arrive, play in the arcade, go bowling and get acquainted with the hotel.   Water Park- Get ready for some water soaking fun. There is indoor and outdoor area, plenty of lounge space, but do arrive early if you want a round table to

The rooms are amazing, the water park is awesome! Their was plenty for the kids to do.  Wish they had an adult day spa and the costumer service was horrible!! Seemed like everyone their hated their job with their attitudes.

This lodge is pretty nice with an awesome indoor Waterpark that stays a good temperature all year long.  Water cleanliness was very good. If a child wants a break from the water there are other activities to do in the lodge.

Great wolf lodge is a great place to have water fun even in this cold weather. The kids loves the Magic Quest, 3D movies and  the arcade. The hotel is easy for the young ones to go around and there are so many helpful staffs to ask for help.

We just got home from Great Wolf Lodge, and it was so great!!  We were with our son, his wife, and their 6-year-old and 4-year-old.  The registration was very easy and they were so accommodating, making sure we had rooms next to each other.  Each person gets a wristband that gets you in the room and buys food and things around the whole resort.  The water park has super fun activities and rides for every level and age, and we tried them all!  We bobbed in the gentle waves with our grandson and we screamed our heads off with our son on the Howlin’ Tornado.  I cannot recommend the Great Wolf Lodge enough for bringing the generations together for tons of fun.

Summary Heading: 1day at Great Wolf is all you need.
Summary: This place is a lot of fun. I went there with my husband and our 3 kids (ages 8,10,12). We stayed in a family suite. This was perfect because my girlfriend and her 9 year old son joined us. The water park was fun, not amazing. There were also plenty of free things to do throughout the day (yoga, balloon animals, dance party). But there were more paid things to do that seemed to be more fun (bowling, magic motion rides, girly spa). The Lodge Restaurant was really good. The Virgin Pina Colada was delicious. Seriously the best pina colada I have ever had...EVER. This park is small enough that you can ride everything the first day after Check-in and then in the morning when it opens, re-ride what you liked most. There are fridges and microwaves in the room so I suggest you bring

Summary Heading: Fun place to visit, that your kids will love!
Summary: My son and I had a blast! The staff was friendly. It was better than staying at the Disneyland hotel. The cabana was nice. It was great family bonding time. Great way to vacation and to get your kids off the electronics!

Summary Heading: Amazing fun for the whole family
Summary: This place is amazing! The staff keeps the entire resort very clean. There is so much to do for adults and children that you never have to leave. The food in all the restaurants is great and fairly priced. I loved my encounter with every staff member except for the staff at the pizza place. We were rushed and given attitude by Aurora the girl taking our order. So much to where I had to ask if everything was okay because of the way she was treating us. During our meal everyone at our table caught the entire staff behind the counter laughing and looking directly at us several times. They made us feel so uncomfortable and not welcome. The food was great but we will never go there again. The next day we had Janeth at the Wood fire grill and she was so attentive and friendly. Overall

The water park is great for young kids (4-10 years old).  It is a pretty good water park for the young kids.  They don't have really big rides, but it works.  Adults and older teens can enjoy the slides, but the slides are pretty tame.  It is nice that it is open year round.

It’s a very fun indoor waterpark. There is also a fun interactive computer game called MagiQuest. We celebrated my daughter’s birthday. She loved it! I would highly recommend arriving early around noon on Friday to avoid the check-in rush.

An amazingly fun place for all ages. Customer service, cleanliness, rooms, safety, activities & our overall enjoyment at the resort exceeded our expectations greatly. For adults & children alike, if you don't have an unbelievably amazing time at the Great Wolf Lodge, there is definitely something wrong with you!

Chuck E. Cheese meets Wet-n-Wild. I’m sure it meets the expectations of its target demographic, apparently young families with multiple kids, mostly 3-8 yrs old. Candy, donuts, pizza. Buffet with character visits.

Went for my nephews birthday, a party of 14 -2 rooms . We went to my brothers room the neighborhood opened her door and was saying racial remarks to us . Messed up our whole time there . All that was done was my brothers room moved which I didn't feel he should of move we did nothing wrong . I understand this is a business but at the same time I believe in customer service . Atleast a redo even a phone call . I have wrote in regards to this with NO RESPONSE .

If you're used to Disney resort-level quality, this place will disappoint.  The water park doesn't have enough variety of slides, and it was overcrowded.  Expect to be nickle-and-dimed on everything.  The rooms are blah, at best.

Summary Heading: Pricey, but we'd do it again!
Summary: We had a fantastic time with our two year old twin boys.  They have attractions for kids of all ages and I was impressed at how well everything is kept up.  The lines aren't long and the staff was great.  The cost is pretty high to stay, but from the experience we had, I think it's worth it and I'd definitely come back.  The room was also larger than I expected.  If you come, I'd recommend wearing something to keep you warm in the water park.  We got pretty cold and I'd bring at least a long sleeve rash guard next time to wear and possibly spring wet suits for my little ones.

The adults had just as much fun as the kids. The food was surprisingly good for a fun park. There was something for all ages but the kids were really the center of attention for the attractions. Even if your little ones get tired at the park from swimming and slides, there is a lot of other activities to keep them busy.

This is a great place and my kids love it. We have the smallest room and still very spacious. The park provide full days of fun, for kids to teenagers and they will not get boring. The water park is not too crowded and on Sat, it take about 15 to 30mins max for the busiest ride, being say that most of the ride take less than 15 mins wait time. We definitely visit again.

Make sure to sign up to their site so you get coupons.  My only complaint is I wish there was a jacuzzi.  Also it’s obviously heavily chlorinated so be sure to rinse off well after you swim. My son always gets a rash from the chlorine.

Summary Heading: Accommodations Not as Good as we expected!
