Summary: We made reservations at Great Wolf Lodge in So. Cal after seeing online advertisements. The water parks are good, the Lodge rooms are not as good as you are made to believe they are. We also had driven with a 7 year old and an almost 3 year old for over 6 hours and arrived after the 4 pm check in, only to be told our room wouldn't be ready for some time. We were disappointed in the check in counter service (too few agents helping customers) as well as the non availability of a clean room for our stay. Now remember check in starts at 4 pm I was told, but check out is at 11 am. That to me is a problem right there. Too few house keeping employees I guess. We may go back, if given a discount as a return guest as well as being able to check in at 4 pm and not later.

Great Wolf is my son's favorite place to stay in Anaheim. The waterpark, indoor golfing, kids bowling alley and great customer service are top-notch. The price is top-notch too. Rooms costs me an average of $350/night after fees and taxes for a non-weekend night. Yikes! And that was through a broker....Booking.com. Also, watch out for a Pizza Crust Swap at the Pizza Restaurant in the basement: Hungry As a Wolf... the pizza dough they are selling for the slices (delicious, hand tossed) was not the crust we got when we ordered a pizza to go for the room (flat, processed, bland). Beware! Overall the staff and facility are great.

Great Wolf Lodge Southern California exceeded our expectations.  Everything we needed was in one location.  The lodge was very family friendly and provided a variety of activities to keep my granddaughter entertained.  She thoroughly enjoyed herself.

If you are a local Southern Californian and you are looking for something fun to do, then this is the place. We went to Wolf Lodge for my daughter's 10th birthday and we had an amazing time. I told the kids that we will go back on my 50th in June.

This was our 2nd time going. My son has severe peanut/treenut allergies and this seems to be the one place where we can take him where he can eat everything in the resort! He has requested to come back here every year for his bday. They have a ton of activities to do so I would recommend at least a two night stay or if you stay for only one, get there early the day you check in so that you can enjoy it all. 3 days would probably be a bit much. Overall this is a great “annual” tradition for my wife, my little guy (9 Year’s old), and I. I think next year we will try to go with a group of friends and their kids to see how that experience is...

We found it to be outrageously crowded for a mid week February trip. Lines at the water park were long with not enough attendants handling each ride. Lines for food were also long. Also, one central hub for the elevators made for claustrophobic smashed in rides up and down. I would also suggest you make sure to ask that the magi quest finds are nowhere near your room. It is loud being by those. That being said, my kids had a blast and tended to only be bothered by the long lines at the rides. The rest was bothersome for adults.

Summary Heading: Impressed, fun time for the family.
Summary: My wife, 4 1/2 year old son, and I stayed here over President's Day Weekend.  It was booked kind of last minute on their website.  It was a place that my wife always wanted to take our son, but I never really cared too much to go.  I had a preconceived notion that an indoor water park would be unhygienic and dirty.  I was definitely wrong, and was actually quite impressed.  We checked in on Saturday at 1pm.  Check in was easy and fast.  You can either self park or valet.  Valet costs $23 a night, and $18 nightly for self park.  I had asked for a "wolf's den" room  upgrade during booking and they had one available for us right away.  Your room keys are your armbands that they give out.  The arm bands have chips in them to open your room and you can also pay with your armband.

Summary Heading: More Fun then expected! Great kids 9 and 11.
Summary: What a trip from Unicorns, bubbles and PJ parties great get away with a really nice policy on time at the resort get a really full experience. Get treated with great service and felt like a VIP. We had a great family vacation where everyone had a great time.

This had a lot of family activities. Too many really. The kids can swim, water slide, play magic quest, arcade, mini bowling, Pajama dance party, kids yoga, eat candy and ice cream...... on and on. It was very very busy with children.  It was clean and comfortable. Be prepared for kids running around absolutely everywhere and the odd atmosphere of people (mostly moms and kids) wearing their pJs around most of the time

This is our second year in this place is always fun and great vaction to the whole family. Food and things to do for the kids absolutely great. We will definitely book our next President week vaction next year.

Summary Heading: Way too little bang for your buck
Summary: I’ve been to another location and it was smaller but awesome. This has great rides, variety, fun to be had. I hated that the staff wasn’t helpful, some not friendly, and towels were only at the entrance. Sucks when it’s a huge park. There were so many hidden fees at the end I ended up paying nearly $200 extra. Not cool at all. If you’re planning on using the sofa bed, expect to be in a lot of pain in the morning. Anyway, if you’re cool to spend a lot you will definitely have fun!

We had a great family bonding at the lodge.  I had peace of mind that our kids will be safe going on the rides and activities.  As a parent, I had fun too!  There was no long waiting.  It is not overcrowded.  I went on the rides too!  I feel like a kid again!

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what we got
Summary: Waterpark has poor ventilation. Strong, over-whelming odor of chlorine. Waterslide attendants and waterslide food workers very slow and no sense of urgency. I felt as though I was being nickel and dime to death. Not a good value for what you get.

First time visiting,  my child had a blast. Will definitely make a return trip.  Suggest to bring multiple bathing suits and water shoes.  especially if you will be going in and out of water park.  No fun putting on a cold wet suit lol

This is our 2nd time at Great Wolf and we love this place!! My 2 kids love the whole experience. The water park has so much to offer for all ages and the lifeguards are very attentive and watching everything. I feel very safe with my kids in the water. Outside of the water park there is so much to do. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A wonderful experience for the whole family!!

It was an okay stay but bring your own towels, the towels they provide are too small. If you can stay at the resort using a coupon, do so, don't pay full price-it's not worth it! the kids love it but from the adults point of view, it's too overrated.

This is our 4th time to use Great Wolf Lodge for our filth reunion. Twice in Texas and twice in California. Always fun, clean and safe. There are usually about 25 of us and we have a lot of fun with lots of things to do.

The Resort was great, but is was disappointing to arrive and our room was cleaning and housekeeping took two visit to the front desk before anyone came to clean and two more visit after taking photos and then coming back to clean the room. At that pricing the room should be double check for cleanliness.

Summary Heading: Convenient, safe and one stop for all
Summary: Good place to take your kids. Very convenient location with many amenities. Little bit expensive but worth going there at least once. Family oriented facility and programs. Most staffs are very friendly  and food were not too bad.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel if you avoid the waterpark
Summary: The family resort is great, except the water park. My kids had fun but we couldn't stay long due to the chemical smell. It burned our eyes and upset our stomach. No circulation whatsoever. My kids played I. The water for a little over an hour and we left. So disappointed  if they could fix their ventilation this place would be great

This place is a money pit. They will entice your children to do other activities other than the water park and the other activities are EXPENSIVE. They say they have free activities, but those are mostly for very young children. Beware of the resort fees, daily parking fees, and the occupancy tax. Those add quite a bit to the bill. Stay one night to get it out of your kids system and spend your money somewhere else.

Our kids had a blast! It was nice to have entertainment for the kids all in one places. And the plus side was that it was great to have a water park inside because the days that we were there, it was very cold.

This place was so much fun for adults and kids. Wayerpatk itself is kept at 84 temperature and slides for adults are fun as well. Lots of other entertainment options available when you are done at the water park, so basically you don’t have to leave the resort at all. They have lots of restaurants, activities, little kids spa, and much more. The only think is that prices were a little high. There is a grocery store nearby and restaurants nearby as well if chose to go outside the resort.  Rooms are not too upscale, to me they looked like motel 6 rooms. Gym area has no restroom so have to go all the way downstairs or upstairs to your room to use restroom and elevators are always busy and slow. Other than that it was an amazing stay, my family definitely going back again.

It was 45 degrees outside but we were indoors enjoying a water park. Clean and full of family activities .we never left the resort everything we needed was on-site. Food was good and so where the drinks.

Summary Heading: The kids and adults all loved it!
Summary: We had the best time at Great Wolf Lodge! The whole family was able to enjoy every ride! The lines were short even on a holiday weekend! We hope to go back soon! The prices for everything was very reasonable and worth every penny!

People.  People everywhere.  EVERYWHERE.    Admittedly, I don’t do well in large crowds.   So what was I doing here?  My kids, of course.  Who, to be fair, had a great time.  Honestly, for what they do, Great Wolf does a pretty good job.   Decent staff (although morale seems pretty low), Food was surprisingly good (and not TOO pricey), and I appreciated their use of eco-friendly products.    Room was a let down.  I didn’t expect luxury, but I was surprised that it was so drab.  Think Radisson/Motel 6.  Comfy bed though.   The check in process was like getting on a Disney ride.  A loooong line.  Back to the people.  Scores and scores of people drinking every alcoholic drink in sight while their children roam free.  The water park is actually quite nice, but chaos.  Slides were

Overcrowded uncontrollable chaos.  Overcrowded.  Extremely long lines just to access the elevator to your room.   No organization for the water slide lines.  Long delays.  Too many rooms for the advertised activities. Difficult to find a place for a family to sit in the water park.  No food or drink allowed in the water park.   High dollar for nachos, fries and beer.  No health conscience alternatives.   Chaos minimal to no supervision of the hotel or water park supervised by minimum wage very young employees.  Food and beverage is marginal at best with high quality prices.  Plan on spending a lot more than your room for food and additional entertainment.   Poor communications from the hotel side front desk.   Spend your money elsewhere!

Summary Heading: Nice end to our SOCAL Vacation
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Great Wolfe Lodge and will most likely return although probably when our daughter is a bit older.   We stayed here after a 4 days stay at Disneyland.  We did not stay at this hotel for the Disneyland portion of our trip, although they do provide a shuttle to Disneyland and are only about 3 miles away.    Pros –  They really have designed the facility and programs around families and kids.  It’s a nice place for kids to stay and feel engaged from sun up to sun down.    Staff: The staff was great.  Everyone we interacted with was very kind, always engaged our daughter, and always made sure we had everything we needed.  We had a late breakfast at the buffet in the morning and Wiley one of the characters spent a ton of extra time with our daughter dancing just

Waterpark was awesome, though the chlorine-laden humid indoor air gets to you after a few hours. Recommend going to outdoor pool a few times to breathe fresh air. LIfeguards are attentive and helpful. System of wearing waterproof wristbands with which you can pay for everything, open your room door, and open parking garage lever is a great system. ROOM was VERY NOISY with pipes knocking all night and A/C so loud we just turned it off. Poor sleep! Also, charging $15 for a locker in the waterpark seemed unreasonable. Overall, staff is accommodating and friendly and kids loved the waterpark. Just bring your own soft pillow and some ear plugs!!!

Great place!  Clean and fun for all ages.   2nd time here, and we'll be heading back again this summer.  Had a group of 25 people with us, and it was a lot of fun.   They have everything you need right there, so you never even need to leave the resort once.   The lodge has great food, the bbq platter is awesome!

The place was ok. Paint peeling on the walls by waterslide. No jacuzzi/ hot tub/ or sauna to warm up in. The room was ok but tv didnt have Disney Jr or nick Jr or sprout. They had kid networks but it was all for the teenage crowd... NO kids cartoons

Anytime we visit Disney, we will be staying here to relax after long days waiting in line at Disney. Very relaxing safe place to let the kids run around the water park while I relax watching them. 2nd time here and will continue in the future

Beds ar horrible and rooms are just average as any other hotel room. Water park would be the only thing I would recommend, nothing else. Staff was dull and was not smiling. For the amount of money and being our first time you would think they would have made our stay an enjoyable one.

Summary Heading: Reasonable, safe, and fun for the whole family
Summary: We LOVED everything about the lodge.  Every staff member we came in contact with were friendly and helpful.  The prices were reasonable, the property was clean and comfortable for everyone.  We will definitely be back.

I enjoyed this vacation at the Great Wolf Lodge. It was clean , Fun and safe for all my kids. As long as they keep up with this place in cleanliness and safety I will continue to go twice a year. Only thing I would change are the beds. They are too firm.

I went to Great Wolf Lodge on recommend from my co-worker and my little girl saw advertisements on TV. We went there for my little girl birthday celebration and she was so happy. I never seen my lil one smile so much. We spent most of our time at the water park area and there was so much to explore. The best vacation/ getaway ever. I wanted to bring friends and family but wasn't able cause place is a little pricey, but with all the services they provide it is so worth it. We had a blast. I was so amaze about how huge and spacious the rooms were and also how clean.

Summary Heading: Just make sure you don't "save" anything for future visits
Summary: They will not honor at least not without arguing and ultimately proving your issues on Wolf Passes from the past visits. Arcade things will not work each time because of changes.  Room decorations to wand interactions did not all work properly or at all in some cases.

Staff was very friendly and attentive my kids were happy all the staff would high 5 them or compliment them our room was very clean and ready by 11am didnt have long lines or wait time our stay was completely amazing

My son was thrilled and I loved that he was entertained without me being exhausted. It really was a great experience for every member of the family! We were already planning our next trip to Great Wolf lodge before we even left!

Love, love, love it! We are already planning our next visit. The wand adventure is a must. Play at the Water park all day and then use the wands at nights. The wolf den room interacts with the wands. So much fun!

A water park indoors is the best invention ever created! Even he smallest room is huge. My family of four fit comfortably. Resort slides and pools are sooo much fun! This is the place to be every year!!

Summary Heading: Careful with your reservation and check your bill thoroughly
Summary: The most important thing I’m going to say is don't expect the water park is included in your ride. The second most important is if you did not drive make sure they don't bill you $18/day for parking like I was automatically charged and was never told until check out and I was reviewing the receipt on the ride to the airport. They will take the charge off I’m told but it could take up to 2 weeks.  My complaints are multiple: First the water park is not part of the resort fee, that is another $50 per person. What is included in the resort fee? I was told room cleaning, towels in the bathrooms and 2 bottles of water when I asked at the front desk. Since when do basic necessities rise to the level of being resort quality. I purchased this hotel stay on Priceline. With Priceline you

Staff was friendly, hotel was clean! Close to Disney, which is why we chose this hotel. We were able to get a room during one of their promotions so the price was only $40 more total than the Howard Johnson down the road. Our 4 year old loved the hotel!

Room was not ready by the latest promised time of 4 PM and in fact, we were NEVER notified of our room being ready.  After we checked back with the front desk ourselves, we didn't get into a room until close to 6 PM.  Had plumbing issues. House keeping walked in on us. Our bill upon checkout was incorrect. The main conveyor belt in the water park broke and shut half the water slides down while we were there!?!

Great place for families but the rooms are usually not spot on clean! Check your room before you get comfortable! I been twice and both times had cleaning issues! Other than that everything else is great!

The great wolf lodge was amazing! I would recommend it to everyone looking for a getaway with everything under one roof.  Plenty of fun activities for the entire family.  Looking forward to coming back!

Very comfortable atmosphere, the quality of the lifegaurds and how they constantly have an eye on the water made me feel at ease. Lots of activities for the kids, they were never bored. I reccomend the paw pass!

Super friendly staff and the location was very clean. My only complaint would be a tiny bit pricey but at least you do feel you are getting your money’s worth with the excellent condition of the water park and the great staff. Will visit again in the future!

Come early and stay late to fully take advantage of the park and the amenities. It was our first time at Great Wolf Lodge and we will definitely come back for special occasions. The best rates are on weekdays. There is a good selection of restaurants conveniently located throughout the resort.

Summary Heading: Great place to celebrate our sons birthday
Summary: Thank you Great Wolf for making family fun for everyone! We will be back!! Lots of things to do in the water park! Something for all ages! The food options & drinks were really good I was surprised! Fresh salads, and tasty treats too!

Summary Heading: great place for kids to have all day fun
Summary: water park was extremely fun for kids to explore. We got a deal from Groupon and the value was great.Tons of life guard that you can enjoy your own time and have them watch your kids. Close to all kinds of restaurant.

We booked this hotel as our place to stay for our Disneyland vacation. We were told that we could purchase Disneyland tickets at GWL and that they have a shuttle to take us to and from the park (as every other hotel in the area) but were told upon check-in that we could only purchase them if we planned to visit DL in more than 48 hours, because it can take up to 48 hours to receive the tickets and the shuttle had only 7 seats and limited trips (drop off at 715a, 815a and pick up at 930 or 1030). When I requested a drop off they were booked... frustrating. So, we uber'd since it is too far to walk and NOT a great neighborhood. Then I requested our room be cleaned and supplies be replenished while we were at DL, this didn't happen either of the days we requested it. We lost a pair

We celebrated my sons 3rd birthday. There is so much to do, you can spend two nights and never get board. My kids love the dance party and seeing Wiley and Violet. The staff is very friendly and polite. The food was yummy for adults too!

Summary Heading: It all adds up, just go to Disney! It'll end up the same price. Trust us. Parking is actually cheaper at Disney!
Summary: Way too expensive when you add on parking and all the other activities! Parking at Disney is cheaper and it is crazy when you add in other activities and being wet for 9 hours. After doing the math, we thought this would be cheaper than disney and it ended up being the same price.

Awesome place to stay .highly recommended .all year round of water fun activity for the whole family. Lots of activity around the resort after the water park hours.the arcade is addicting,at the end of it they got good prices to choose from with.

Great place for the family, kids love it and you can relax because you know they are safe and constantly entertained. There are a number of choices for snacks and meals so you never have to leave. The rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Perfect staycation for family with young kids.
Summary: It was everything advertised and much more. We have kids age 1 and 4, and they had an amazing fun filled adventure every waking minute of their day. The resort is safe and family friendly and not too hard on the wallet. Their are a lot of included activities and the food on site was good quality and value. We'll definitely be coming back soon.

Similar experience can be had by simply renting a hotel room and taking the kids to boomers.  Ideally, the beach would be much better.  Water park rides are kid friendly.   Your going to spend a lot of money to get the full wolf experience. Over all great hotel but way too expensive. For the price entertainment part should be all inclusive.

They had great entertainment for the whole family.  The water park was the best!  Great for all ages.  We will be going again.   The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel was in close proximity to many restaurants and close enough to Disneyland.

great family fun!! the rooms can be pricey rooms and city tax is unheard of..but my kids love this place!! we have so much fun!! i would recommend to go and try it out at least once with young or older kids!!

Summary Heading: Great Family Time at Great Wolf!
Summary: Everything was great during our one night stay! Traveled with 4 kids aged 11-14. Had never been nor did we know of anyone who has stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge, so we were not quite sure what to expect. We had the grand bear suite which is 2 connected rooms, 1 bed in one room and 2 beds plus sofa sleeper in the other. It was kind of pricey but I felt worth it as it includes the room plus the waterpark for 2 days, and lots of other activities. Did not realize it was a resort with so many options for food and shopping.   For an extra charge I also reserved an outdoor cabana and I'm so glad I did. It gave us adults a nice place to relax plus it included towels, soft drinks and a cabana girl. I would recommend the outdoor cabana as opposed to the indoor as it seems a bit quieter

everything from the time  i got there until i left was great , food , vibe and suite . The best part was the water park great for all ages , the smile on the kids faces is truly unforgettable . will travel again soon

We just returned from a one night stay at Great Wolf Lodge for my daughter's 8th Birthday. All in all we had a pretty good time. We arrived in the afternoon to find a really crowded parking garage. We decided just to go all the way to the top floor where there was plenty of parking available. Not sure if your room would be ready yet we left the bags in the car and headed to the lobby. I was surprised how busy the place was. Tons of people in and around the lobby and I was expecting a long check in. To my surprise, check in was quick and easy, our room was ready before official check in time and we were granted an upgrade request to one of the rooms with the bunk beds in a "cave" for the kids.   My kids loved the room. There is a TV in the bunk bed room with YouTube so they were

Everything about our trip was wonderful.  The staff of the waterpark is very helpful with the smaller children.  I was the only adult there with my grandson, they were very helpful on the slides.  The raft availability was wonderful.

Summary Heading: Too crowded even during off-peak stay. Excessive resort fee.
Summary: This is my family's 2nd time going.  After the luster rubbed off from the first stay, then it became obvious that it is too crowded even during off-peak stay. The attendants in the more advanced ride showed no interest in facilitating the long lines.  The resort fee is excessive.

GWL is a great place to spend family time where everyone can enjoy themselves. It covers an array of ages. There’s something for everyone to enjoy. And it is very clean. Water parks are sometimes scary when it comes to germs, but they have it covered.

Overall it was really fun and the kids enjoyed themselves. The water in the park was kind of cold but I understand they need to appeal to all people. The variety of slides, wave pool, play thing, and surf rider were really cool.  The room was not that great...the bed was lumpy and I woke up with a back ache and the air conditioning clanked all night so that part was awful. Overall, my family enjoyed it.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here. My 9 year old asked to come back for her birthday. The resort is very family friendly. The water park is great for all ages. My husband and myself had a great time on the slides as well as the kids. The only downside is that it is super crowded on the weekends making it hard to find a place to sit down or someplace to put your stuff. There was trash all over the ground outside and on the tables inside. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and stayed for 1 night. We thought the lines would be less on Monday but we were surprised that they were just a long.

Stayed for 2 nights. The overall stay was good. The purchases after check in are expensive (just under $9 for large Dippin dots). Spent over $100 on build-a-bear with scavenger hunt. Beer and wine servings are very small. Staff is great. Food quality is great. Although if rather go off site for food.

Loved this place, water temp was amazing. Amazing place for kids and adults, also loved the express check-in via text and check out, super convenient. Best place to come and spend time with family will totally come back.

It's a cool idea.  Decently clean. Seems like lots of (expensive) things for kids to do... However, I didn't realize any of this when I was booking the hotel for my business trip... what a wake-up call. Obviously that isn't the hotels fault but my own and who I booked through. Children running amuck through the halls and lobby (where in the world were the parents of these kids??) Which is apparently normal everyday according to one employee... good grief. I wish I was exaggerating that part but I'm definitely not.  The second night we had the smell of wood fire type smoke in our room. Called the front desk and maintenance came up and checked. Said he didn't smell anything, pulled the A.C. apart and told us he was looking for cigarettes... neither of us smoke. He kept asking if

We had a great time. It's always a blast to get away in the middle of winter to a warm water park. The water park area was a little cold for us but it was still fun for the kids to take advantage of the lazy river, wave machine, and water slides. We also upgraded to a Wolf Den and my kids loved the theme room with bunk beds.

We had a wonderful time at Great Wolf Lodge for my sons 5th bday. The proximity to our home was great, easy access and you don't need to travel excessively far for some fun.We had plenty of fun activities and choices for food. I would highly suggest checking it out.

Great place. Kids loved it and we all had a lot of fun in the water park. The rooms were not great. Beds were small although they claim they are queen standard and the pipes are so loud that when anyone around you showers you feel like they are drilling near you. So we couldn't sleep much but we had fun.

comfortable beds hot showers great place to stay. lots of kids but understandable its a family place. but i had no issues with noise. very nice place. i did not know there was a hot tub or id have been in it every night lol.

Came here for my son‘s 10th birthday. He was so excited to come! We got up to the desk to check in for our room and barely got like that. It took us forever for us just to get through the line. By the time we got the keys and got up to her room and through all of them Mayham going on in the hallways from the staff we made it back down to the pool area. There is I ton of people and children the lines for food took incredibly long and the food was not good or healthy. By the time we were ready to leave the kids were over it before we were.

Good fun, but needs earlier swimming hours for people that have to check out at 11.  The kids get up at 7 and the swim park doesn't open until 9.  Not enough time to swim, clean up and check out.  Seems like a wasted day.

Summary Heading: great lodging for a growing gal
Summary: When I return home from Manatee Central, Florida, I go here to Garden Grove, I put my nose in the air, and sniff the grove that is a garden and I feel  better about myself because in my profession I treat people like dirt and I need to go home to get rid of the guilt. Garden Grove - Great wold - great lodging for a growing gal - I grow with guilt - I shed it here. Look out!

There is something for everyone, the youngest at age 6 was probably at the largest disadvantage because of height restrictions for a lot of things. We went for one night but I do think to really take advantage of everything you need two nights. We did everything but the MagicQuest, but as the people working there pointed out spend as much time as possible at the waterpark because the rest of the activities can be used without being an overnight guest.  I wish there were more vegetarian food options at the various restaurants.   HINT: Do not stay in room 901 or 903 because there were clanking pipes all night that kept most of the family awake

Summary Heading: Words can't express how wonderful our stay was
Summary: I contacted the resort prior to our stay that my daughter is celebrating very special birthday, and on top of that, it was a thank you to her for everything she did for her mommy while she was sick with a stroke and also cancer. The resort went above and beyond my expectations on what they did for my daughter to thank her. Every Department of the resort did something special for her and it is not something I'll ever forget nor will she.   On top of that, the rooms were comfortable and nice, food every restaurant is fantastic, the staff always friendly.... I couldn't have asked for a better mini vacation

We enjoyed our time at the Lodge, but please, skip the dinner buffet.  The price of $25 sounds enticing, but the food is not good, at all.  The breakfast buffet was edible, but dinner was a waste of $$.

Kids had a blast and pretty fun for adults too.  The rooms were very comfortable stocked with everything you need. We went for a birthday celebration and the water park was all anyone wanted to do.  The water park is open from 9 till 8 pm and kids are beat by then and ready to watch some tv and go to sleep.

Summary Heading: Great place to visit, but make sure to check your bill before you leave!
Summary: Great family vacation, but be aware that if you have any billing disputes they take 3 days just to contact you before you can make a claim that will be "investigated."  Who knows how long the investigation will last so your dispute could drag on for weeks before you get your money back.

First visit and we were impressed! We were treared well. Got upgraded to a SUITE! Awesome place close to home. My 12 year old daughter had a blast! Lots of FREE activities included in your stay. A one night stays gives you 2 full days in the waterpark.

As mentioned, Water Park is great.  Everything else is pretty much up in the air.  2nd year coming back with a complimentary room upgrades but nothing changes from last time around.  Staff at front desk are very welcoming but the rest of the staff (specially food service) are not so great.

My family of two adults and 4 & 6 years old stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. This is a great resort to spend a few days in. The kids had a great time in the water park, arcade as well as bowling place.   The water park is AmAZING. It is great for kids and adults with multiple slides, wave pool, boogie board pool as well as a full bar and restaurant.   I full y recommend this resort.

Summary Heading: You can swim and ride slides during winter.
Summary: It's fun place. You can swim, ride slides and have fun during winter. But it's bit cold especially in the restrooms. All of workers are very nice and friendly. When you check in the lodge you will get hair band that looks like wolf's ears. It's cute and fun.

Summary Heading: great experience for kids and parents
Summary: place is full of fun activities for all ages. parents can easily relax while the kids are all over the place. everything is there and you don't need to leave the place which helps a lot to make it a relaxing weekend

Summary Heading: Fun for kids but such a money pit for adults
Summary: My kids like this place but it is really expensive.  The $3.50 tiny bag of popcorn really pushed me over the edge.  It's amusement park prices and it adds up really fast.  It's well maintained and fun for the kids.  The food is average in the buffet but the restaurant and pool side food is decent.  It's really all about the kids and I guess that is why you go.  It might be a once every two year kind of place for us.

A great family activity! Worth the money! Healthy food options. We were totally suprised by all there was to do. We cant wait to go back! If we had known how much fun this resort is, we would have come sooner. We planned this along with our Disney vacation. We definitely need to come back and just play in the lodge. So much fun!

The room was very dirty. Hair in beds and sinks. The service was ok. Scoops spa was great. Food needed work.  They have fees for every little thing here. The bill is complicated. Every tax broken down as low as  20 cents the water park is amazing. Bathrooms were not. Stay somewhere else or your bill will be 3 times the amount you thought you where supposed to pay.

This is a great family vacation place!! The water park area is so fun! So clean! And so safe! Some of the best water slides! Things for the adults that are fast and daring and things for the Little’s that are low and slow!  The restaurants have a good variety of foods, treats. Bowling for the kids, kid size of course!   Beds are comfy and the staff doesn’t ever complain when asking for the most ridiculous!! Housekeeping is friendly and super efficient. The facility is beautiful.   It’s a great place. Be prepared to pay for it. It’s not cheap. Don’t come to relax and have quiet time. It doesn’t happen. Kids are awake early and up late and not quiet in the hallways outside your door.   I think the parking should be included in the price of the stay, $18 daily, but maybe that’s a

Lots of things for all ages do do. Indoor water Park!! Arcade open 24hrs with staff there from 9a to 10p. Magiquest game lots of fun to play with helpful staff if you get stuck. Friendly staff willing to answer any questions. Central location in Orange County close to Knotts and Disneyland, not too far to beach, about an hour to Legoland. Try to book one of the suites, kids get their own sleeping area (nice and dark) and TV.

We love the Great Wolf Lodge- it's fun "East Coast" feel is a great getaway from LA. The amazing water park, arcade and children's activities- keep the kids entertained while the parents play or relax.

This place is amazing! Absolutely over the top kids love it non stop I love it everything is perfect and always sad to leave only way the kids let us leave is by promising to come again a few months later

The hotel is very family friendly and clean. The water park was sooo much fun. The kids absolutely loved it. Highly recommend the water park. It was clean, lots of lifeguards for safety, easy access to food, towels, and lots of chairs. It’s a five minute drive from Disneyland. The only reason I rated it average was the beds. We had the Wolf Den. The kids loved the separate decorated room with bunk bed. The bedding was terrible on the bunk beds and full size bed. The sheets were like sand paper and very loud. Every time someone moved you could hear the sheets. The blankets were very thin and overall low thread count in quality.  The beds were not comfortable. We reserved the room from Thursday to Saturday. We were so uncomfortable and tired from our first night there. We spent

The great wolf lodge is an amazing place suitable for all ages! I have three children: 7, 6, and 1 and they were so exhausted from all the swimming and activities the hotel offers that they were in bed by 7. That is any moms dream. It was an adventures vacation for all but for these parents it was also a time for lots of rest and lounging in our hotel room.

Had a great time our 3 boys loved the water park, we are looking forward in going again. Now we don’t have to wait for the summer to enjoy a water park. A must for all kids!!! The food was great and not to bad in price.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay with lots of kids!
Summary: Even if you are visiting So Cal for Disneyland, this is the place to stay. We went with 5 kids and 3 adults. The family suite sleeps 6 (2 queens and a hide-a-bed couch). There is a microwave and your standard mini fridge and coffee maker. The rooms are huge so even if you have 6 people in a room you don't feel like you are on top of each other which is fantastic if you are claustophbic like me! There is also so much to do in the hotel like the HUGE water Park which includes a number of slides, a toddler splash park, a larger splash park, wave pool, Learn To Surf (body board) and an athletic type pool. Then there's bowling, glow mini golf and an arcade. Oh and there is a Magical Quest that you can set your kids loose to do in the hotel all you gotta do is pay for the wand and

My kids had a winter break this week. When I asked them what they want to do, they are all said: great wolf lodge!!!.... good choice we have made, very pleasure Time we had. We will definitely return again

Summary Heading: Couldn't have had a better time.
Summary: This resort was amazing.  Our grandkids loved it more than Disneyland! We would love to come again. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially helping the kids learn how to boogie board.  Beds were comfortable and room was spacious and clean.  The only thing I missed (and it is a minor thing) is a swing out mirror to make it easier to put on make-up-kind of hard with my grandma eyes to reach over the counter to see the wall mounted mirror.

Great family experience, water park was clean and warm could be warmer but still allot of fun.... had to request an early room cleaning twice, it was not completed when I first asked but once they cleaned it it was done properly. I would highly recommend for a good family time.

Summary Heading: Great time with family and friends
Summary: Suggest booking during the week lines are shorter and best deal for the buck.  Great fun and adventure at water park for my teen daughter and friends. We could rest while kids ran around water park and could still keep an eye on them

Great vacation and good value! Never boring- always something to do. Kids LOVEDDDD it and still talking about it. ONLY downfall- Dining is very expensive so bring your own food if possible!  Will come back FOR SURE!

It was fun for kids.. expensive but ok.. food was good.  Friendliness and cleanliness. Water park restrooms need more attention and they have the ac on full blast. Cold.  We live in Soledad so the drive is far.. but my kids love it... and they had fun.

I had seen some bad reviews online about Great Wolf not being understanding to families with special needs kids.  However, what I experienced was an understanding, thoughtful environment with staff willing to make some concessions to make sure our son had a great time.  My son is severely autistic and nonverbal, so vacations can be challenging, but the staff was really great about helping us meet his needs.  Our family had a great time.

I was looking forward to having a great staycation with my family but unfortunately I had an unpleasant experience. The check in staff did not give me our Paw Passes at initial check in. The Magiquest staff said I should've looked into the activity before buying the Paw Passes because my kids are "too young." The queen bed in our Wolf Den suite was overused and indented in the middle making it hard to sleep. The kids blankets on the bunk beds were dirty with black stains. The water at the water park is not that warm and the temperature outside should be warmer. I noticed kids, including mine, were shivering every time they got out of the water. This place is overrated and I would not recommend going here if you have young kids.

This was our second trip to Great Wilf Lodge. Last time the valet was terrible. This time, we noticed improvements but they still are substandard compared to other hotels in the area. My husband wanted to put our bags in the car and when he approached the valet, they were counting their tip money and seemed to be bothered by the request. My husband was eventually directed to the car, but felt the valet could have been more polite in their initial response. The valet still needs work.

I would check for bed bugs.. freaking out about carpet beetles. great for a family trip its fun kids love it. its really just for kids and some fun for adults and teens. Other then creepy crawlies...it was a great trip truly fun and great for families. A must do for child to enjoy the water

the front desk lied to me about my upgraded room. I waited 3.5 hours once I updated , even tho they said it as ready. Never received a text message indicating it was ready. At 4:05 I went to the front desk

Summary Heading: Amazing resort but water park disappointing
Summary: The great wolf lodge is  amazing resort with great staff and amazing activities. Our wolf den suite was perfect for separation from our kids at night which allowed us to stay up later and enjoy wine. Now getting to the water park it was a nice room temperature but the water was freezing, we were shivering the whole time and it was very uncomfortable maybe it was just a fluke when we were there but was bad enough that we were only in water park for 2 hours.

It was a fun one time thing, but I probably won't be going again.  The water park was kinda dirty with trash was never picked up off the grounds or tables.  Lifeguards & Staff also not the friendliest.  They looked like kids that hate their jobs.  Hotel rooms were really nice though & comfortable beds.

This was a wonderful place to bring the whole family. The kids had a blast, adults were very comfortable, whether using the water facilities or just people watching. We were very comfortable with the atmosphere and didn't feel the need to "hover" over the 8 & 10 year old, they ran all over the place. I've never slept in a more comfortable bed in a hotel.

Summary Heading: I overpaid to be at a gross McDonald’s playground feel
Summary: Rooms are small check in was terrible long lines gross people. Only kids working at the place never saw anyone that looked over 20 or management. Feces rubbed on wall in bathroom stall. Wave pool closed because someone crapped in it. I felt like I overpaid to be in a dirty McDonald’s playground. Just gross and crowded

Our family trip to GWL was so Fun! Only complaint was my eyes were sensitive to the chlorine in the air in the water park area and it was kinda loud during the night maybe the a/c unit above us.Over all it was a great experience!

We recently took advantage of a holiday weekend to take the family to Great Wolf Lodge. The indoor waterpark was fun with a wide variety of slides and pools, the restaurants had delicious food (albeit at resort prices), the staff was friendly, and the kids had a blast—none of them wanted to leave and are still asking to go back over a week later. Some of the rooms have a themed kids area—ours had a cabin that slept 3, and they loved that. We went mainly for the waterpark, but there are so many other activities we may try if we go back someday: MagiQuest, mini-golf, and arcade games are on the list. They have other activities for kids (games, story time, dance parties) so you can dry them out when they start getting water-logged! The convenience of not having to drive anywhere is

Fun place to be with family. I did not like my rate. Online was quoted at $249 per night. Adding taxes $330.00. Added Birthday package for $69 which amounted to $417 which was made for 6 people. Upon arrival, I checked in and the desk had 1 adult and 3 children. Reservation was for 6 people. I had to pay an addition $100 for two adults. Furthermore, I did not like the checkout tim at 11am. $249 went to $520. Don’t believe online prices!

I highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge! It is a blast especially during the winter months when you would like to enjoy a water park. The slides are well kept as well as all of the other amenities! I can't wait to visit there again!

The overall stay was good, excellent if you have kids.  However I no longer have kids at the average age that was mostly at the hotel (12 and under), therefore I can't give an honest, true assessment of my visit.

Summary Heading: It’s SOOOO worth it!!  Rest assure!
Summary: This is our 2nd time there ( were there the first year they open) it’s certainly worth it you can rest a sure that you’ll feel safe and if you have older children they can literally room the water park without any worries in the same thing for your little guys they have the best little play area to separately areas and they have lots awesome slides  & the wave pool  along with the lazy river you can’t beat it!

A lot of fun but too expensive. Beds are hard. Food is good. Service is great. They need to step up their game with people and kids who have allergies. Always able to check in early. Weekdays are better than weekends which are very crowded.

Visited GWL for the first time as part of a convention. The whole family had a blast. My only friendly warning would be if you are sensitive to chlorine you may want to limit your exposure in the water park itself. But the rest of the resort is great as well.

We only live 45 minutes from the resort, but friends had told us we'd love it. Great Wolf Lodge didn't disappoint. The water park is amazing with rides as good as any stand alone park, super warm water and perfect warm air temperature all day and night. Really friendly and helpful staff, close easy access parking and tasty restaurants on property, made our stay an incredibly fun 1 night and 2 day getaway. We will definitely do this again.

I have all boys- a 15,13,7, and 4 year old. They all had a blast and so many activities to do throughout the day and night. Food was delicious at the Lodge. You really don’t have to leave the resort. Rooms were spacious and it was wonderful family trip!

We have been three times.  Two of the times had moderate crowds, and that was a blast.  But when they are crowded close to maximum capacity, you have long lines, you're in the wave pool with a sea of people, you wait forever for their restaurants and snack bars, and the staff is noticeably grumpier.  I'd recommend that you do a little research to determine when their off-peak times are.

The complex & activities were great! Couldn't figure out why the taxes/fees were as much as a 1 night stay. $30 resort fee/night, $28 transient occupancy fee/night (my family are not transients). $18 parking fee per night for parking in the garage (maybe for valet but for the self parking? - expensive). The fees were OUTRAGEOUS!!  Why not add it to the cost of the room instead of at the end so people actually know what they are paying for? I did not get the breakdown until we checked out. You can't see these fees when you book the room.

Went for a weekend. Both kids had a fantastic time in the water park. The 3 raft rides, the mat races, the family raft ride, and the lazy river were all excellent. Kids were thrilled with the boogie boarding and surfing Flo-rid. Easy place to be a parent. Very well run hotel. The restaurants were what you would expect for a resort. And the additional attractions/activities were fun.

The resort was nice the kids had fun to many add on taxes for homeless resort etc but the kids liked it. And the food too expensive over all not a good value for 2 days but the kids had fun. I wouldn't repeat. Can't afford to spend that much for what we gotit just didn't seem worth it.

A little under staffed for the water slides, food and games but overall a great experience. So many activities for all ages. Yes they have adult beverages and an excellent choice of food. The buffet was awesome. Wave house, flow rider surfing, lazy river. So much fun.

Summary Heading: Great Place and lots of fun
Summary: This place is a lot of fun for the kids and adults.  The only thing is 2 slides were non functioning  and we only stayed one night so we missed out on it.  The staff is really friendly.  The arcade is great and gives lots of tickets which makes it so exciting for the kids.  The dunkin donuts coffee was terrible, it was not the real dunkin donuts coffee.  The park should open at 0800 instead of 1000 so guest can utilize it with ample time before checkout and going to their next destination.

Water park stay. Family vacation. Birthday celebration . All and all it was good. Anything can improve of course. Sleep is important on a vacation and I got none so that’s my only complaint really. Kids love it though

This place has customer service figured out! Every moment we were treated respectfully and felt important. They are amazing with the kids, the hours of fun you can have are limitless. We had our doubts due to price but honestly so worth it! We will be going again.

We all loved this place!  It is clean, well kept, with wonderful staff.  The waterpark was super fun.  Even for grandparents - we both went down tubes with our grandchildren.  Pleased with the amount of lifeguards too. Good time for all.

I would recommend this to everyone. We had the very best time. We had so much fun. The waterpark was so fun and even though we were there in January it was still beautifully warm in the there. Can’t wait to stay again.

Summary Heading: Pedophile and they did nothing about it
Summary: I hate to even right this review but you have to be aware of the kids that are managing this place.  We are were waiting in line for our turn to come on the tube ride when I looked next to my right and the young man next to me was master bating while staring at my 6 year old son. I thought I was seeing things and he looked up and I told him to stop immediately and he did. I looked back 2 minutes later and there was doing it again, this occurred several times and I had to same something to ride operators. They reacted fast and called security.  Now we get to the end of the ride and the young man who was doing this came down just after us. So I walked over to security and said this is the young man touching himself while watching my son. HIs answer was that he's a special kid and

The water park is neat if you or the kids haven’t been to many, but if you are the type to do Wisconsin Dells every summer the old resort, knock off attempts trying to be like Disney and cheap food and some worn out decor is going to turn you off the moment you get there. Just feels like an older place and you quickly see where all the budget goes (water park).  Our kids were too young to notice any of this and wanted to spend all day in the water park so the trip worked out well, but we were never comfortable or wanted to be there longer than we needed to. We canceled out late check out on the last day and headed over to Disney early.

We have been going to the Anaheim location since it has opened. We were so impressed by the lodge we keep returning, just for fun or even pair it with a trip to Disneyland which is only down the road. We recommend staying at the lodge to many of our friends and family and they have all loved it!

Summary Heading: Average decent stay, not much of a value
Summary: We are a repeat guest. This was our fifth visit since opening year.  The value has gone down considerably. There is too much variance in the rate and too many promos that run simultaneously and if you are not savvy you will end up over paying for the room. The room quality is good regardless of what type or size suite you choose. The nagiquest game staff is amazing and so kind/helpful with the kids. The arcade, water park and resort staff not so much. They are disinterested in their jobs and the kids. The spa is over priced for economy services. The wolf pass the is best deal for the kids to really enjoy a little of everything.  The water park is filthy now and they have stopped with the salt which is a disappointment as it was great for bacterial control and growth and slip

I incur some hidden charges when I arrive that were not explained to me by the telephone booking agent. At the resort, the check in clerk was rude, not giving mea blind lady, clear directions to facilities. Our room was not ready at 4:00 as promised, not until $5.30, and was not equipped with the $72.00 birthday paackage I I ordered until my husband complained. There were also some safety issues such as protruding bolts of water slides that myself and grandchild scrapped ourselves on

This resort was so much fun we took our daughter for her birthday the resort was nice and so where the rooms. The water park was small but enough to keep the kids intertained for hours, i will visit again.

Water needs to be warmed. and 5 bands per rooms should be given not 4. All in all it was a good getaway but warmer water would  have made it comfortable  . The food options were good. perhaps can stay open longer. need 1 24 hour location open on premises

To celebrate her 4th birthday, I took my granddaughter and her lil bff to stay for a night at the Garden Grove Great Wolf Lodge.  We very much enjoyed ourselves!  The water slides are a blast, and the free family activities kept us occupied and happy.  We enjoyed a dance party, a show, story time, yoga, caricatures drawing.  The Lodge provides a small refrigerator, a microwave, and a coffee pot - all things that we used and were very thankful to have available to use at no extra cost.  Honestly, I don't have a lot of extra funds to spend on get-aways like this, so I appreciated being able to bring pre-made pasta to warm up as needed to fill up small tummy's.  I ordered a couple cocktails, and the $10.50 price was a bit hefty, but the pours were good and so I was happy with my

Summary Heading: My family's favorite place to go
Summary: I cant wait to come back.   I try to come every 90 days. But I think Im gonna come back within two weeks this time. Its something for everyone in the family to do.  Kids in the water, Mom watching TV in the room, Dad at the bar.   Meet up for dinner later. All under the same roof. I love this place.

Overall, our family with very satisfied with our staying at Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove and definitely recommend others.  The service was excellent and atmosphere was great. I just regret that we had some skin rash at the end but we will recommend it for any family who want to get a full package deal.

The kids love it but I feel that the quality of the water park is going downhill. I probably would return because of how much the kids enjoy it. The room was really nice and comfortable. The one negative is we couldn’t get the TV working it was set on like a home screen. It took a while on hold and then longer for someone to come up and fix the problem. Complimentary shampoo and soap provided is extremely skimpy considering what the rates for reservation are and the fact that they know group size that will be lodging.

This resort is the perfect meeting place for family and friends to share a get away together. The attention to detail and customer service went far beyond our expectations. The water  park, of course,  was the highlight for the kids. Relaxation for the adults. Highly recommend!

Although the beds were not the most comfortable (not sure if it was because my daughter made me sleep on the bottom bunk) and everything seemed to close really early, it was an overall fun experience and we definitely want to return asap

Our room was comfortable, the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  The prices of food and snacks were high.  That's probably the only complaint I would have.  The waterslides were great!  The MagiQuest game was a lot of fun for my grandsons.

Only issue was rooms were very dirty. Rate is reasonable, but..... there are other options for the price. Staff is very friendly, resort restaurants are pretty good with a great variety. Welcome was great and very efficient

Loved this resort for our family vacation. Room was clean. Staff was friendly, but a few didn't look very professional. Water Park was fun. Not too busy during the week. We didn't visit Disneyland while we were here, but it is very close to the park. Would be great to include that in our next visit.

Staff was friendly and helpful. Water park was incredible. Price was well worth it with all that was included. We spent some of our time at Disneyland and they provided a free shuttle there and back. So much to do at the hotel.

Very fun experience with my family! Loved it!! Thank you to all the staff!! My family had a blast. The waterpark is amazing so much to do for all ages. Had clean towels for guest. So pleased with my stay & will be visiting soon again! Thank you

Nice size room for the amount of people, hotel was clean staff was nice. Kids enjoyed the slides, but unless you have a ton of cash for the extra activities, the waterpark is ok for a day or two. Will go back during the winter months for a day or two.

My family of five visited Great Wolf for one night in March 2017 and we had a blast! My boys (both 11 now) had been seeing advertisements for GWL since they were about 5 years old, and when we found out GWL was coming to the OC we were so excited! Unfortunately, it is extremely pricey to vacation with a family of five, this trip to GWL ran us $500 for one night just for the room. My suggestion is to make sure to sign up for their e-mail list and book when they have deals.   When we stayed we chose the basic family suite, which is small for the price we paid, but given the fact that we didn't spend much time in the room it was fine. The room was clean and comfy and had all the basic amenities needed.   The resort has plenty of places to eat and grab a snack. We got dinner at the

Great time. If your kids want to do Magiquest have them start right after you check in. It takes several hours to complete & you should be able to work it in through out your stay. My kids didn’t get to experience the fun because we waited. But other wise they had a great time.

Wonderful place to take young children! The water park was CLEAN, the staff is helpful and kind, the lodge is full of great food and fun activities! Our kids loved the pup pass so they could try a little of everything in the lodge. We can’t wait to go back!

We absolutely loved our stay at Great Wolf. Staying longer would have been the only change we would have made.The facility was very nice and clean. A lot of activity options besides the water park. The rooms and staff were super nice as well!

Our kids loved the waterpark!  And it is a legit water park.  But you have to value that amenity, because it's an expensive place to stay.  There are lots of other things to do at the resort, but all pricey.  Lobby and common areas are nice, rooms are just o.k.

My previous review of GWL detailed how the water park was very hot, humid, and eye burning because of the chlorine.  I just went back and although it was still warm, the humidity and chlorine in the air was significantly improved.  My eyes didn't water at all and I didn't start sweating the moment I walked in the door.  I don't know what they changed, but it made the time in the water park much better.  It's still a blast for the kids-I took three 11-year-olds this time and they spent pretty much all of the 3 days on the water slides, wave pool, and lazy river.  Our first night we went next door to the Round Table Pizza and then the Nickel Nickel arcade, which was a reasonably priced way to spend an evening.

we were very disappointed not to have the banner and cake ready for the birthday boy.  This was suppose to be ready when we arrived and they explanation was that the staff were not ready to put the banner and cake on time.

Summary Heading: Fun water park, lousy service, and bad food
Summary: From the moment we walked it we were treated like cattle.  We had to push to get someone to help us with our luggage and help us check in.  Check in was late because someone was supposed to text us but the system didn't work. Front desk completely unhelpful.  It was my birthday and the restaurant forgot.  Our food was 30 minutes late (for noodles and a sandwich) and it was gross. The chicken tenders were disgusting.  It seems like they don't know how to handle a lot of people and have immature staff who are running the place.  Maybe that's what you expect from this kind of chain.  The actually water park was a lot of fun and saved the trip for us.

Friendly helpful staff. Easy check in and check out. By fart the easiest hotel stay I have ever had.  Rooms were clean and roomy. Water park clean and staff are on alert at all times. Food was a bust, but everything else was great.

Great family fun hotel. Good location to Disney Land however shuttle from the hotel to DL not very convenient . The lodge itself is clean and very kid friendly. I miss that there use to be lots of puddle jumpers for the little kids to wear. Will book again in the future.

Summary Heading: Very expensive but safe fun for the family.
Summary: Kids of all ages can play here so the little ones don't get left out and the bigger kids can run around and play and the adults can enjoy a cold one or glass of wine too. Food is super expensive so take your own snacks.

Overall was a wonderful trip for our family!! We had a wonderful time and already talking about coming back again and with other families . We found an excellent price in Groupon which made it very nice and we surprised the kids with this for Christmas

it's our 4th time cheking in already! always a fun time for the family! very clean and cozy place! kids enjoyed swimming, playing, and eating! we could eat out too because the location is close to other restaurants!

It's good to visit Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim.  Kids love this place. One thing that you ought to prepare is to have reasonable staying time in order to play or to enjoy MagiQuest for you kids.  If not staying 2 nights, the MagiQuest is kind of expensive to play.

We had a great time as a family! Our kids are 6 and 9 and they could go on all if the slides and had a ton of fun! I wouls Definitely go again and do some of the other activities the resort offers. The food was great as well!

no complain just love love love! best place to spend your family time, kids are extremely happy you don't even see them because they spend the whole day in the water park, the park is super clean, food is super good, and very reasonable price

Clean and the kids loved it ! We went for my son's 10th birthday. The arcade  was also a hit.  The room was pricey since we needed a suite.I would recommend for special occasions. Friendly staff and attentive life guards.

Too expensive. Needs to clean water park often. Internet check-in was useless because the wait to get the key is still long (almost 30 min.) Does not allow earlier check-in or a later check-out. Our housekeeper does not speak English & could not understand our requests, not very friendly, & looked annoyed.

We had an amazing time visiting! My wolf pack... all 10 of us spent time celebrating a birthday, water playing, enjoying family time!   We loved the free activities for all ages. Perfect for a small break, sensory break and lots of activities daily.   The attractions are great. Did bowling twice and spent some time in the arcade. So much fun.   It's everything you need for a family vacay without having to leave the property. But super close to disneyland and orange county events.   We loved the service and kindness of everyone and even had help with my nephew who is in a wheelchair.. my brother was able to take him on a water slide.   Can't wait to go back and visit the lodge soon. Seasonal events and festivities too.   We love Great Wolf Lodge!

We're repeat patrons of GWL.  Our first time at this location, for my son's birthday celebration.  This location is much smaller than the one in the Poconos but keeps the kids within view.  Overall, the kids had a good time and we would go again some time in the future.  Groupon price is worth it, but not full price. The bathtub had a few stray women's hairs in it.  I was kind of grossed out when my son (7) handed them to me as he was bathing.

Summary Heading: Fun for kids, accomodation for my son with special needs
Summary: This is our 6th or 7th stay at this location in the last 2-3 years. Lots of fun and stuff for the kids to do including water park, arcade, mini bowling and golf, interactive movie/game. The Magiquest games can keep your kids entertained  for hours. All this inside one building. The staff including the chefs were beyond accommodating for my son with special needs (dietary and activities).

This is a great resort tons of different things to do. It is way more than just a water park. That being said the water park is amazing!  Fun things for kids of all ages and adults to enjoy. Food on site is good and prices are what you would expect when eating a nice meal out- not super overpriced.

My grandchildren had a great time. However, it is costly. Be prepared. The room sofa was very uncomfortable.  The adults were enjoying the Water park as much as the kids! I found some of the rides had long lines but I did not think it was unreasonable. One tip: please only hold chairs that are necessary to accomodate your family.

Took several grandkids and they all loved it - lots to do in a safe, self-contained environment.  Something available for all age groups.  Came for two nights/three days and never left the hotel because there was too much to do and see.

Summary Heading: pricey at high season, but a nice, fun place for the family
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel.  We didn't get any packages, which seemed overpriced.  Room was expensive in high season, but factoring in two days at a water park, it was not too terribly priced.  Kids enjoyed the wolf den room with the bunk beds, but they have no outlets for night lights.  They also have no alarm clocks in the rooms, so I guess they assume we can all use our cell phones as our clocks.  Room was clean and in good shape.  A lot of the rooms are a LONG way from the elevator, so if that's a problem for one of the members of your party, you may want to request a room close to the elevator.  Beds were comfortable, although my wife did not care for the memory foam pillow.  I suppose they had other types we probably could have switched to.  I thought the

Don’t waste your money! Given the pricing, I was expecting so much more. There’s nothing wrong with the Great Wolf, it’s just not fantastic. Average all round. Staff seem abivalent at best, some rude and lacking in care and customer service experience. It felt like the resort had just opened and the staff didn’t know what they were doing. The rooms are ok. We had a Great Wolf Den, thinking that our girls, aged 6 & 9, would love it; but they found it a bit mediocre. Weird that the bathroom sink/vanity isn’t actually in the bathroom, but out in the main part of the room. Coffee machine provided, but only decaf coffee! The waterpark is ok, some areas needed a good clean. It was very busy when we were there, used towels on almost every seat. We’ve previously stayed at the Howard

This was a fun family trip. I was concerned that my 13 year was too old for this water park but she actually had a lot of fun with her brother and nephew. This park/hotel was like a Vegas casino for kids!

I enjoyed the short trip to Great Wolf Lodge WaterPark but come prepared with footwear water skins and your water proof cases for your phones if you want to take pictures otherwise you will pay a pretty penny  I suggest the valet parking for the extra $5.00  It gives you in and out privileges which gives you the ability to eat outside the resort without the long waits and price hikes  We didn’t get the chance to do all the activities but my daughter had a blast There’s only 1 bathroom in the family room which absolutely sucked with 6 people; next time I will do a bigger suite Over-all, I got a good deal with my purchase

Summary Heading: Pure fun for the whole family
Summary: The Wolf Lodge is offering a great package with the focus on the waterpark. The slides are super fun, specifically the Tornado and the orange/ purple slide; this place is highly active; there won’t be any time of boredom. I recommend it for a wintertime visit.

we had a lot of fun. staff was courteous. lots of places to eat. lots of different things to do. it was so place was clean, rooms were great, 90% of the staff were in a good mood, you could easily spend a lot of money here.  it is nice that everything is in one place, you don't even have to leave the resort. I have a special needs 14 year old, so she enjoyed it a lot, (the magiquest was her favorite)  if you have younger kids it is the best place ever. if you have teenagers I do not recommend it. most of what they have is geared towards the younger crowd, even the waterpark.

Super great place for kids but is a bit pricey. Two days for 2 adults and a 2 year old ran over $860! They need way more seating (or seating at all) outside of the wall up and order food places.   The watermark is awesome for kids of all ages. It’s clean and safe and kept warm.   I expected a bit more decoration in the public areas but overall the resort was cute.

Summary Heading: Great facility but cleanliness and function of the room could be better
Summary: The room was not as clean as it could have been. In the shower there was still hair from the previous family that stayed in there. The pad/mat in the pack and play looked like it had dark stains or was wet. Some of the Tv channels did not work. Lastly, from 1-5am, the AC unit would turn on every 20-30 minutes while making a loud humming noise. We did not get a lot of rest during the night.

Rooms are clean. Staff is great! Water park is worth the cost. Buy the cheapest room because you won't spend much time in it. Food/beverage selection is great. And the kids will love the Magiquest game.

Serious money for a little tiny room and make sure you don't forget anything in the room when you leave because you won't get it back.  All adults and one of the children had back and/or neck pain from horrible beds.

We had a wonderful time at the water park. The food was very good at the buffet as well as the restaurant on site.  The food was a little pricey but good. It was awesome to be able to check in early to go in the water park and then after check out time, you’re able to stay until it closes.  Great idea.

For the price and the advertisements, this resort was smaller than expected. Our rooms were damp and we had to ask for clean sheets as the old ones had blood stains on them.  Disappointed. Probably won't return

This is our second trip to great Wolf Lodge our first trip we took our son daughter-in-law and granddaughter we loved it so much that we brought our second granddaughter this time for winter break a.k.a. Christmas vacation.  Our eldest granddaughter seems to be hyper active so we do good when we have her to keep her as busy as possible the great Wolf Lodge provided enough busyness that they both granddaughters had a blast couldn't think you guys more beautiful resort love it so kid friendly they walked around in their pajamas thought they were in heaven may God bless you guys for all the smile  that are on the kids faces you're doing a great job keep it up!

Summary Heading: Great family vacation with lasting memories
Summary: Awesome trip for kids to enjoy. My kids are still talking about it 3 days after we left. Wish it wasn't so expensive so we can return. Lots of activities to choose from to keep the kids entertained all day long.

We had a blast. Our party consisted of a wide age range from 3 years old to adults and everyone enjoyed it equally. The resort is like a cruise ship on land. There is so much to do. We are already planning our next trips.

Our family wanted a fun quick getaway and we loved having the water park and amenities at great wolf lodge!  It was convenient and the kids loved the water park and arcade!  We would definitely visit this hotel again!

It was our first time and our 10 year old and 14 year old love the water park and the different slides. It is an ultimate adventure for all of us. Well-recommended for families. We enjoyed Dunkin Donuts on site too.

Our family had such a good time here ! Just an hour drive from our home (L.A.). The resort is clean, rooms are cozy and water park is so much fun! Our kids did not pick up their phones all day (they were so busy with having fun) and were passed out early. It was a great family bonding experience. Food was excellent.

WOW - what an awesome hotel!! we opted to stay here Xmas Eve and Day and had the best Xmas. Check in included about a 30 min wait but it was Xmas so we were expecting that!! Room was super clean and nice and quiet considering the number of young families in the hotel. We didn't do any of the add-ons the hotel offered - my kids had just spent 2 days in Vegas so weren't interested in the arcades etc....they just wanted to swim. However they LOVED the snow in the lobby - you'd think they'd never seen snow the way there were bouncing around (we live in Canada!) We loved the ears you get at check in - super cute! Water park was awesome - clean, lots of staff around, plenty of space to sit etc.. am sure it gets really busy in there with long wait times  - I think the longest we waited

This is a great place for kids and families. Lots of family fun any time of year.  Food is a little expensive but the buffet was excellet. Recommendation - bring goggles, water shoes, and own beach towels.

Summary Heading: Not the best Great Wolf by far
Summary: We stayed for one night to celebrate my son's birthday, overall a very mediocre resort. I would give it 2.5 stars. Even my kids did not want to come back.   pros:  Sit down dining restaurant was reasonably prices and the food was good.  Staff is very friendly Flow rider in water park was awesome!!  Cons; Air in water park is too cold once you are wet, I have never been cold at an indoor water park before and is it very uncomfortable! Small water park compared to others I have been to including another Great Wolf location (WI Dells) No Jacuzzi! They ran out of towels on the first day we were there and had a 20 min wait for more. that is crazy- a water park should never run out of water or towels! Sweet shop ran out of waffle cones and sugar cones Several stations of the Magi

Excellent and fun place to visit.Everybody had a good time.Definitely to visit again! Good location too...they are many restaurants close to the great wolf lodge.More fun if go with big groups.So thankful for this experience.

We visited this place to celebrate the New Years Eve and with a 3 year old, we never felt like missing the fun. They had plenty of activities all the day for the young ones that you never feel bored. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The indoor water park was pretty awesome. All the rides were good and you will actually not feel how to time went by. All the staff members were very accommodating and courteous. We would suggest this a must go to place for everyone with small kids.

this location is amazing we absolutely love it there, we will make this a yearly vacation destination. My kids age's 8 and 6 love It here. My youngest son is autistic and loves it here, I love the fact that they have  section for all ages.

The hotel is very nice in general, with themed decoration and lots of activities. The room was spacious and the service in general was very efficient (e.g. very quick check in, no need to check out). The water park is super nice, safe (multiple life guards per pool, plenty of life vests) and the lines moved very quick. Overall it was a great experience.

Me, my husband and 3 boys enjoyed our overnight stay at the resort. We will definitely go back and recommend the resort to our family and friends. We enjoyed the resorts amenities and attraction that are for everyone.

Summary Heading: Excellent water park venue for the whole family
Summary: The park was excellent and the wait times were reasonable for all except the flow rider which is the biggest attraction.  The resort itself has lots of amenities for the kids which we did not have time to partake in but seemed fun for all participating.  The rooms were average for adults but kids liked it for the theme  Service in the hotel side was a bit lacking and hence the average review

We stayed at GWL for the  NYE weekend.  The hotel is huge and it was full, but you would never know it because it does not as crowded because it’s so big.  The indoor water park was the main reason we stayed and the kids loved it.  The water is not heated, so it’s a little cool in the winter but you get used to it.  There is plenty of sitting so it’s not difficult to get a table or chairs.  One drawback was that they were running out of towels, so it was a major inconvenience to have to wait for clean towels.  Staff should be on top of making sure towels do not run out.  The water park is clean, and well staffed with lifeguards.  There are plenty of food options within the hotel and nearby.  It’s very close to Disney and the highways.  Rooms are clean and spacious.  There are

This is a perfect balance of family fun. Kids have a blast and parents feel like kids again. So much fun! We went for New Years Eve 2017 and made it a point to return New Years Eve 2018. And will we will return again, even if it is an 8 hour car ride.
