Summary Heading: Good place to go with kids
Summary: Good family oriented environment with friendly staff! Room was ready when they said it'd be ready.  good amenities, nice restaurants, very kids friendly!  Only stayed 1 night, but we were able to check in early, change, and hit the water.  My oldest son loved it as well as my youngest.

The kids have a great time. It’s very clean and the staff is so nice.  We will be going back. However there are a lot of fees they don’t tell you about so make sure you inquire about everything. Ask about valet parking resort fees and a lot of taxes that are added to your room rate.

Summary Heading: A New Year's Eve Adventure of the Whole Family
Summary: Such a blast for the whole family on New Year's Eve with a 3-year-old and 9-year old. We spent most of the time at the Waterpark (9am-8pm) and then the arcade (open 24 hrs). Waterslides for all, in the winter, with warm water, and no sunburn for the win! We stayed in a wolf den with just enough privacy when tantrums get to be too much. The beds were so comfy, even the sofa bed. We thought about the paw pass but didn't partake in those activites, and really didn't miss out once we saw them. They have convenient RFID wristands as the room key, parking pass, and  for room charges for food and beverages. The staff also offers interactive texting if you have questions about your stay. We drove a few min for food/drinks to go from Cheesecake factory and Starbucks since we had

In California there are much better, more fun waterparks to visit at far less money than this Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove.  We found a pubic hair on the shower wall in our room and did not even use the shower yet.  The room is no better than a Hampton Inn but at a far greater price.  I would say go to the Knott's Soak City or Raging Waters at far less money and a better experience.

Room service was horrible. I called several times to get towels. Took close to hour to get towels. Was hard to get chairs in the waterpark in the afternoon time. When I came into my room there was a coffee cup full of coffee. The room want picked up. I doubt like the shower option I could only shower and the kids wanted to take baths. They had brought bubbles to bathe in. That was disappointing.

The place is amazing and it's really good for the whole family specially with younger kids. All the staff are very friendly, polite, very helpful and knowledgable about the hotel activity. Great Wolf lodge is a great place to be to enjoy your vacation

Nice facility and room.  However, staff were great, sometimes not.  Food was pricey and only passable, and sometimes not (mold on buffet food two different meals).  Stayed once before and had great experience; if this second stay was the first time we had gone, we would probably not have come back.

The resort is not bad for a short getaway with children. The waterpark was a little scary at first with all the people inside and concerns about cleanliness, but it seems like they use copious amounts of chlorine. Lifeguards are everywhere, which is great. Food is average and pricey in the restaurants, Kids activities are minimal and the resort  relies on a couple of robotic lethargic animals for story time and songs. Valet parking is extremely slow and inefficient. Resort seemed understaffed during our stay. Staff did not give accurate information about resort and activities. The rooms are just OK. No place to hang damp swimsuits, surprising for a water park resort. Carpet seemed dirty.

Was not worth the value and the food was horrendous, was puking within 30 minutes of eating at the buffet which was disgusting. Buffet cost $120 for New Year’s Eve and there was nothing special nor tasty about it, it was gross! Who flavors fruit with a jolly rancher flavoring to make it taste more like a fruit?? Did not even get to enjoy the new year as I was sick due to the food.  The water park was nice and my family had a blast there, it wore us all out and we slept well the night I was not sick. The food in the park was very par, if that, so we venture outside of the hotel for meals.   All in all, we had fun but it was not worth the expenditure for me. I would prefer to use that large sum spent on a week long family vacation instead of two nights in a water park = $900+ for

Great family trip and experience one every family should experience once. Children love how interactive and fun the whole hotel is. Hotel and watrrpark are safe and parents can actually relax and enjoy themselves

During this California cold weather, you can count on your children, including yourself to find an indoor waterpark resort. Nothing will prevent you from having fun regardless of the weather.  Be prepared to have plenty of fun and family memories.

Great water park.  Great time for kids.  Amazing activities.  Everyone really enjoyed their time at hotel and outside of the room. The New Years activity was fantastic. The rooms were vdisapointing and need to be upgraded.

Summary Heading: Family time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: This is the second year that our family has spent time together  celebrating  Christmas and coming together as a family. 6 kids (9-15) and 8 adults (40-82). Everyone enjoyed the water park, great food and service, very comfortable and welcoming accommodations. Looking forward to continuing this new family tradition. I particularly love how the kids are all so treasured and welcomed.

Summary Heading: It was a lot of money! My 10 year old had a blast
Summary: I don't think I will go back, however my 10 year old had a blast for his birthday. The chlorine smell was so strong it burned my eyes. The staff was very pleasant and the rooms were average.  The food was okay.

If you have kids that love water parks and like being entertained, this is the place for you. Once you park your car you never have to leave. Great food options for all meals. They have a convenient wristband attached to your card so you don’t have to carry a purse or wallet while you’re there. If you need something, you texted and they bring it right to your room. Awesome experience!

Great place for a family celebration.  Only downside of dealing with the Great Wolf Resort is the amount of time you have to wait to talk to a representative.  When booking a place for the first time online booking doesn't always have all the answers and waiting 20 minutes means they need to hire more reps during heavy booking times.  Otherwise everything was as advertised and a great place for making family memories.

Resort is all about convenience and you get that here at Great Wolf Lodge. All staff members encountered were all friendly and helpful. Location of resort close to other eateries and shopping places to get necessities. I would definitely recommend this place for families with kids from toddlers to maybe 15 years of age. Or really, anyone who are a kid at heart!

We had a memorable holiday for years to remember and enjoy at the great wolf lodge. We will recommend it to all friends and family. Great place for the whole bunch. You will not be disappointed with the tremendous amounts of activities

This is place is all about the kids.  The water park is impressive, with options available for children of all ages.  Even Disney's Aulani resort can't match the Great Wolf for waterpark fun.  If your kids get tired of all the water, there is still plenty to do, for a modest fee.  My kid just wanted to go down the crazy slides, so we kept the trip reasonably affordable. One bummer, no real room service here!  The in-house pizza place delivers to the rooms, but that's it.

Summary Heading: Great fun for kids and adults!
Summary: When visiting this super fun resort, be sure to stop by the Bar at Lodge Grill and say hello to Stacy!  Have her make you a drink, you will not be disappointed!  Also Angel in the kids entertainment are was super fun with the kids.

Excellent family vacation & location. Another place to explore other than Disneyland.   Nice Indoor environment (warm and comfy).  No need to worry weather (rain or winter time). Breakfast buffet is good but I won't call it the best for the price.

I had heard a lot of good things from friends about Great Wolf, but our visit exceeded our expectations!  This is a high quality resort, has an outstanding water park!, and many other fun things to do in the resort.  The restaurants inside the resort are very good also.  I also was surprised on how many planned activities they did for children throughout the day.  Pricey resort, but well worth the money!

Awesome place for large families with multiple ages 17-10watch your credit card statement as they double charged us. It was corrected but annoying. Extra charges for Everything ( parking etc.) Overall a great place.

Summary Heading: Fun, pricey, everything you need, but could still improve
Summary: The family and I just went on an impromptu trip to the Great Wolf Lodge literally booking the whole trip the night before.  The good: - the indoor water park is fun and is inclusive with the price of the hotel stay.  You get to play in the water park after 1pm the day you arrive so even though check in isn't until 4pm, you can play in the water park until check in.  The water park opens at 9am and closes at 8:30pm, guessing that is the winter hours, so you get a whole long day in the water.  You also get to play in the water park the day of check out.  The way I saw it, the water park is easily a $35 - $45 value per person, per day, so the cost of the hotel doesn't seem as bad if you look at it this way - crowded but a manageably crowded.  don't let the packed parking lot fool

Upon arriving to our room after utilizing the watwr park, we layed our children (1&3 y/o) in one of the beds the kids had kicked off the covers and when they were tucked in we noticed under the top sheet was a stained fitted sheet and matress protector

Ok here we go - knowing going in that you are going to a “themed” place and profit is the name of the game, there are certain shortcomings that you could be willing to forgive. BUT, this place takes things ten steps beyond forgivable and is an absolute waste of money and vacation time. They only care about upselling you at every turn, cram as many people in as possible and staff minimally.  Also watched a toddler nearly drown in the outside pool with the lifeguard standing feet away watching the door instead of the pool. The Mom screamed and Dad jumped in thankfully but the “lifeguard” was shortstaffed and obviously undertrained.   First back to the “hotel”- barely Motel quality, linens are crusty, rooms are tiny, thin walls and they put some pay-to-play magic quest game on

We had an amazing experience at the great Wolfe lodge. We enjoyed our stay and had an awesome time in the park riding the rides and playing basketball and the various activities provided. I would recommend this for any family.

Three days and two nights of birthday fun. Our family of five had a wonderful stay and tried to check out everything. Bowling alley everyone can play with the smaller lane and ball, gutter rails extend with the console.  Magi game is a great way to explore the entire building with quests over six floors. Families can save money by using only one wand for the entire family.  Some will lose interest and some wanted to complete it all. It's easy to overspend but getting the wizard hats and add-ons but our budget allowed a bit of souvenirs.  It's easy to get spend too much with the wrist band but it's a great convenience. Swimming is what you're here for so let's get to it. Tons of fun for everyone. We have three kids 12, 8,6. Eldest could too on every ride, middle all but two and

Summary Heading: Our first time but not our last!
Summary: Family Holiday Trip. Our first time to Great Wolf Lodge. We will definitely go again. It was a very good family trip. My 7 year old granddaughter had the time of her life. She did so many activities. Made some new friends. Could not get her out of the wave pool. Staff was amazing. Only downfall was the food. We are Dinner at the Lodge restaurant and it was expensive and food was not very good. Service of course was good. We also ate lunch at the grill place by the pool and it was a little expensive and food just ok. When we go again we will eat somewhere else. We did Disneyland the day before and really did not want to leave once we got there but will for sure eat elsewhere next time. Chlorine is a little strong.

Since we don't want to play in the water during all of our waking hours, we inevitable do the other activities, which are way overpriced. Still a fun time, and we will probably be going back. The birthday package isn't worth it, though--the cake is the most flavorless cake I've ever eaten.

This was our first stay at this hotel / water park / resorte. The kids preferred to play here rather than visit crowded Disneyland. We will definitely return and recommend this resort. They don’t allow non-guests to use the water park which greatly alleviates overcrowding. They have adult drinks in the water park! Fun for all

Great alternative to Disney, could easily spend three days here and enjoy the whole time.  Food is a little pricey, but vacation food normally is.  Great experience with a large group as well. Definitely plan on visiting again, maybe even a different location.

We had a blast as a family at the great Wolf Lodge. There's plenty of rides to keep everyone happy. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to have a good time with their family. The rooms were clean and nice and the beds we're very comfortable.

There's a lot about this place that is ideal and caters to kids 4-9, but don't let that deter you.  Our boys are tweens and they had a blast!  Loved seeing people of all ages - even grayed haired grandparents on some of the thrill water slides.

The rooms were dirty. Food is overpriced, dried out, and bland. 2 employees made specific rude comments. The water park was fun, my 10’year old enjoyed the magi quest golf and the arcade. Not much for kids older than 12 years old.

Had an enjoyable one night stay over Christmas. 9 yo twins LOVED the resort, specifically the water slides, arcade and wolf den rooms. Wife and I also very much enjoyed the water slides as well as the cleanliness of the resort, the very attentive staff, the Lodge grill, cocktails available at the water slides and the overall fun feel of the resort.

Summary Heading: Resort getaway for parents and kids!!!
Summary: Enjoyed everything to the fullest. Kids had the most memorable experience. I will definitely come back for Bdays  and family getaway.... mostly I enjoy the scoops spa for kids my one year old try it and I... Full spa makes u feel like a real princess 👸 thanks Evelyn !!!

Kids had a blast!  they did not want to leave. Spent the day at water park, after we ate, we went up to our THEMED room, showered and enjoyed all the fun activities in hotel (i.e. dance party, movie show, bowling, arcades, and shopping. After a fun filled evening, wolf characters came to our room with milk and home baked cookies and took pictures with the kids- wow!  They will never forget the fun!  Great Family Fun all under one roof!   Cant wait to go back :)

Summary Heading: Family time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: 3 generations met in CA for a Christmas vacation.  Great Wolf Lodge Anaheim was the end of our time together and we played hard! The food was a little expensive but there are so many choices of eateries close by that a little walk was easy.

My family arrived on Christmas and stayed for one night. Had an amazing time! Would recommend it to all. My children are 10 and 5 yrs old and they had a blast at the water park. My husband and I did as well. Food was great and reasonable and the drinks from the bar were well poured by the bartenders. The beef brisket sandwich at the Lodge grill was out of this world!

This was our second trip. First trip was great. With a year between visits, we hoped to have something new at the park. But we were disapppinted. Excellent for first timers. Rooms were clean. Bandaids stuck in the sides of the pool.

Great fun for children 15 yrs. and younger. Love the fact that you can go at anytime of the year regardless the weather! My girls ages 9, 11, 13, loved the water slides and magic quest the most. Lots of fun!

Summary Heading: Great place for families with children.
Summary: This is our second visit to Great Wolf Lodge and it was just as much fun as our first.  Our 12 year old granddaughter loved playing the “scavenger hunt” (not sure what it’s official name is) as much as she loved the water park.

We were told all Lodges are the same but after visiting the one I’m TX and then to CA we were disappointed.  No grown up spa.  No outdoor climbing.  Location is surrounded by houses and busy street so no good view.  The bathrooms in the water park were 65 degrees so going from 84 to 60 was freezing.  I guess keeps bathrooms empty.   It is not a cheap trip. The arcade and buffet are over priced.  Magiquest is expensive if you are only going for a few days.   The buffet doesn’t have very healthy options for a buffet price.  Breakfast was always good though.    The hotel is clean and rooms are great.  Service was excellent no matter where we were.

My son had a great time and enjoyed all the activities it has to offer! We will come back in the summer for some more fun! The best was the 6D very thrilling and exciting for kids who never experienced this kind of movie attraction!

We had an amazing time here at great wolf lodge. Our check in was quick. Our room was perfect for all the kids traveling with us. Very clean property and safe. Very convenient location. My favorite part was being able to go to the water park in the winter.

The park is great except lacking the security for children not running outside by themselves is a major concern for us.  It is ok for big kids.  But I think they should add additional security check for kids leaving the park.

Outstanding resorts and good service good for family bonding, highly recommend for my friends. We need to come back here. But we need to plans in more time to get a good deal. This is a better water park than in Virginia wolf lodge

very fun. my friends were visiting from alaska and were able to join us. the experience was great the staff was awesome. the biggest bummer was the line at Dunkin donuts. water park was super fun and felt safe even for non swimmers

Summary Heading: The best experience a family could ask for!!
Summary: Our experiences at the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove has been the best that money can buy. The prices are very reasonable and the food and fun are top notch. Every single staff member we interacted with was knowledgeable, friendly and very attentive to giving our children a great experience. The Geat Wolf Lodge is the best water park experience we've ever had since our whole family gets sunburns easily. I'll be recommending this treasured spot to all of our friends and family.

Nice place to have a gateway with children! Lots of kids activities through the day, some are included with your stay, some are not. Worried about how crowded the water park would be, but it wasn't bad at all. Very well educated(trained) staff.

Summary Heading: First Time at Garden Grove Location
Summary: Phenomenal experience from check in to check out! Hands down the best service we have ever received. The lobby was beautiful, amazing decorations and clean. The service was great, room was perfect and we had a wonderful time.

The water is freezing cold 84degree is a total lie went there 2 times don’t recommend during cold season . If the water temperature was warmer it will be great for kids. Can they raise the temperature of the water

Great mini vacation. It's safe and full of fun for the whole family.  Rooms are perfect, staff is accommodating, and a nice variety of restaurant options. We celebrated my son's 11th birthday with 5 of his friends, everyone had a wonderful time.

Great time. We go to this Great Wolf all the time (5 times this year)   We love it. The beds are not the best but the kids are tired from the phone and be prepared to pay a ton for food. Other than that have fun!

Great place for family vacation. Can stay in the resort for days happily. Look for special prices on rooms and plan on visiting other attractive ns in the area.  Great location.  Get the younger involved in all the activities.

Went over the Holiday Break as our kids (10 & 13) have been wanting to go. Everyone had fun BUT I think they were on the upper end of the interactive things to do. Our daughter (10) loved the water sides but our son (13) doesn't like rides so he spent much of his time in the wave pool and playing basketball in the pool area (pool court area). We attempted the MagiQuest in the evening, but after a full day of playing and starting it late, they were wiped out quickly and frustrated because one of the wands wasn't working properly (we borrowed them from friends so it had nothing to do with the GWL and the customer service rep went out of his way to try to help/resolve our issues).   Because of our kids' ages, we didn't make use of all the other activities (Santa, dance party, etc.)

Stayed in the kids themed cabin. The kids had a blast and stayed at the water park both days during our visit. I was tired from an entire day of swimming but the kids just kept in going. Had so much fun at the water park they didn’t want to leave! They slept good the next few days after. It was a great experience and a vacation we will remember and cherish!

Great place for family and kids! Water park is great! Northern lights is a little expensive some games are 2 dollars a little much for an arcade game for the value. Other than that the park is wonderful.  Kids loved it. I will be back.

I was very disappointed in my stay. The room was not ready by 4. When we inquired about it, we were to,d it was finally ready and when we went up, maid service was still in there. The staff was very unfriendly. The quality of our stay for the price we pay was not worth the aggravation. One of the kids got hurt on a sharp point on the bed and hot an inch cut.  We were told no stitching was needed by the first aid teenager..the cut continued to bleed and we never heard from to management to make sure he was ok.

Overall we had a great time.  There was lots of stuff for the kids to do.  The kids cabin was great for the kids, however, there was a horrible smell in the room more than likely caused by bad plumbing.  The front desk was notified and said they would look into it.  Housekeeping sprayed air freshener but that only resolved the issue for a few hours.  Luckily we were in the room a minimal amount of time.  If not for the room issue this resort would have gotten a 5 star rating...

Hotel was decorated and very nice. Just a bit of a design short fall compared to the other properties not as fun in the water park area. Very small lazy river.   Virginia and kanas city was ten times better

I visited this location with 4 boys (2-12 years, 2-15 years). They all had a blast. But they also said it was fun but wouldn’t go back because they did everything they could and then it wasn’t as fun. Definitely geared for the 12 and under set. Lots of fees added-parking, resort fee etc.  High food and drink prices but we only stayed one night so it was ok.

This was a great place. The waterpark was clean and fun. The kids stayed the entire time from opening until closing. The food in the waterpark was reasonably priced and quite delicious. We also enjoyed the bar on the outside that had excellent grilled corn iaswell.That other activities outside of the water park are a little on the expensive side, but the glow-in-the-dark minigolf was reasonably priced and enjoyable. The rooms were nothing to get excited about and had all the required amenities needed. We did not spend much time in the room except to sleep, so so that is not a negative on this trip. Overall it was an amazingly time had by all. Ages 7,10, 13 and adult. We will be back! Groupon had great prices.

I would have gave it 5 stars, but this place price gouges you on food and everything else. If I ever go back I will take family out for dinner, food wasn't that great and way overpriced, not worth the convenience especially with dinner.

So much to do, be sure to take it all in! The staff was wonderful from check in to check out everyone made our stay extremely enjoyable. I would say my only complaint would be they needed more staff in the game/prize area. The line was always long to redeem tickets for prizes and those working there were really hustling, but you know how kids can be as well... I want this no maybe this etc...  Everyone needs to go at least once at Christmas time to see the snow falling in the lobby, that was so cool and all the kids loved it! The water park is so much fun it was terrific! We loved our stay!,

Safe and fun in the water park. There were great rides for vistitors, fun area for kids and babies. The staff were friendly. The place was clean. Other than great swimming facilities, Great Wolf Lodge also had fun programs for family activities.

Summary Heading: Wonderful facility but a couple unfortunate issues
Summary: We had a great time at the Garden Grove Great Wolf Lodge.  The front desk staff were great, the rooms were comfortable, the waterpark had a good variety of options, and the resort had some fun activities like free hot cocoa, Santa in the lobby, and storytime.  We had a problem with one of the buckets staff members who was extremely rude but the other staff members were all kind and helpful. We were grossed out by people pooping and vomiting in the pools several times during our stay and really grossed out that the staff scooped poo out of the wave pool without closing down the pool to clean it. A couple times they closed it down but on a few occasions they did not.

Wonderful experience for my grandchildren.We plan to come to park next year. The children enjoyed the cub room. The room is open,but they felt like they had privacy. We had dinner at the pizza restaurant. The food was very good.

Everyone in the family enjoyed it. An adult has as much fun as the children. What amazed me the most was the cleanliness of the waterpark and everything in general. Every staff of the hotel was very generous and help you in anyway they could.

Property was clean, staff was friendly, food was good and the kids had a blast. Not sure I can add more. Went to California to spend time with the grandkids and they requested Great Wolf Lodge since we had already visited the one in Tennessee.

The best family time ever Is such a wonderful place to be able to feel safe with the kids to have such a clean environment the rooms were very comfortable the waterpark is so much fun and there’s so much other things to do activities for the kids to do free that they do storytime/dance parties is just a really nice family oriented place time to bond!!

This place was pleasantly surprising. Its a resort so not really any reason to leave. Food prices are reasonable. Get the $10 Dunkin Donuts coffee cup for unlimited coffee drinks. Online checkin was very easy, staff is very helpful and parking included. I am sure the chlorine levels are higher than a neighborhood pool but I guess that would be expected. No one in our family got sick thank goodness. No asthma flareups here either.

Summary Heading: Family fun from start to finish
Summary: Had to reschedule our trip several times, the level of cooperation and help from the staff was fantastic. Once there it was as much fun as we wanted when we wanted it. The Suite was fantastic, kids enjoyed every aspect of the trip and it was well worth the cost.

We had a blast and so did our kids and grandkids.  It was such a great time for the whole family.  There is nothing like seeing all the fun that was had that couple of days.  The bunk beds were a big hit for the kids AND their own TV.

love that you can enjoy the water park even before your room is ready and after checking out of your room!  makes the overnight stay a good value.  SAFE and fun waterpark -- lots of lifeguards, elementary school age kids can roam with friends in a safe environment. highly recommend MOBILE CHECK-IN, as front desk check in line is long and moves slowly. grab a free LUGGAGE CART as soon as you see one - they may be clustered in parking garage. best to go with other friends/family so one person can deal with check out and moving luggage while another supervises kids in the water park.

I just live around the area, one reason we stay there was to unwind and enjoy the waterpark, he comes the waterpark were the water burns your eyes and skin, all 3 of my kids including me are sick, we where there as a family to enjoy and have time off since its christmas, unfortunately greatwolf was a very bad experience if u ask the people in the water park they cant even answer y the water is hurting our eyes and skin, the next morning i woke up early because the fire alarm set off we had to evacuate and there was nobody for assistance even the evacuation area nobody represents greatwolf very bad experience i do not recommend it.

My kids were plseantly surprised!  They had no ideas until the very end that they were going to have the best time of their lives. By good friend had recommended the place and I will definitely recommend it to my other friends and I will most definitely come back again next yeast. Thank you so much for putting a BIG smile on my kiddos faces. Happy New Year Ana god bless.

I took my daughter and her friends to GWL for her 10th birthday. We did mobile precheck which is supposed to expedite the check in process. The concierge wasn’t knowledgeable - no one called or texted me to let me know the room was ready. I had to leave the waterpark to check only to find out that it had been ready almost 2 hours ago. Upon arrival we go eat at the Wood Fire Grill  Restaurant - the appetizers came out super quick - the food 40 min. The catch is that we were the only people in the restaurant - the waiter disappeared. So this started off pretty rocky. I like great customer service - that’s not what I experienced. Also, there was food on the floor in my room. With all of that being said the hotel is a great place for kids.

It gets better and better.   Kids were excited as this was our second visit.   Good selection of different water park areas for all ages to enjoy.   Overall pretty good food.   We liked the buffet.  Kids really like this place!

Summary Heading: Great time was had by all
Summary: We were there to celebrate our daughter's birthday. The staff is incredibly friendly and makes you feel welcome - from the housekeeping staff to the life guards to the wait staff - they make you feel like you are part of the family. The water slides are exciting, but not terrifying so they are appropriate for most and there is a place for smaller kids to play as well. Food is surprisingly good at all the locations at the resort and pretty reasonable given the location. We will definitely be back

Great place to have a vacation. Very clean and our kitchen da really enjoyed staying there. A lot of activities and places to eat. They really enjoyed the indoor water park. Very convenient if the family decide to have a pool party during winter time.

I’ve been here twice and both times were amazing. For the price you pay for a night at the hotel Plus water park wristbands included day of check in and checkout it’s so adorable. Plus they have family events all Thur out the day for free.

I was given a certificate to use at the water park. I was so impressed with the water attractions! This is a wonderful hotel for families with children age 14 and under to use the water park. I loved the variety of slides.  And the wave beach was fun to swim in as well. And the boogie board wave place is a great extreme sport! It's like a mini town at this hotel. Food prices are reasonable. There is storytime and yoga for children and the parents.

I really liked that they have asl interpreters during reading time and for creating that inclusivity. Thank you to all the staff for being so kind and helpful. Not many hotels has this luxury and it is a nice experience for all children to have.Awesome!!

I had a bad experience with a $100 birthday package not being set up upon arrival.  I felt that we didn't get what we paid for.  We expressed our dissatisfaction to the front desk who didn't seem to think it was a big deal.  We submitted our comments on line and never got a response.

The uniqueness of the resort makes this place very attractive but the overall value for your money leaves more to be desired. The value of the stay is reasonable but the only thing you get for that is a room and the use of the water park. That sounds good until you see all the other attractive things there is to offer. There are MANY other activities available, most of which cost extra. The attraction packages offered make it nice to bundle activities but can add up very quickly with multiple children. And the availability of different food options are great but also pricey. The included lobby activities for kids are fun and interactive but many are offered during water park open hours so if you are trying to get your money’s worth and use the water park as much as possible, you

Getting there and checking in was easy and fast!!! The Christmas feeling all around was awesome! The staff was very friendly and fast! The rooms were ready early which was great! The water park was not crowded and plenty of places to sit. The food is good and a convenient price. Overall the experience was worth it and my family and friends had a blast! Thanks

A little pricey but a great time, we will be back for another borthday ! The magiquest is awesome and the water park is great, there is hardly any wait for the slides and the lifeguards are very attentive to the kids, I felt very safe having my toddlers running around!

This is our 4th time visiting since in the last 12 months. Our first 2 visita were great but on the 3rd visit I noticed that the customer service was not as good. We didn’t go for quite awhile and tried it again. This time the customer service was even worse. The biggest issue is at the front desk. The staff are not very friendly and you will get different information every time you speak to someone regarding the same issue. The water park is the best part of the hotel and our kids love it.  We have Disneyland annual passes and always stay at the Wyndam down the street and the service is excellent. I think I’m the future we will by day passes to the water park and stay at another hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Getaway for the Entire Family
Summary: Cozy atmosphere, the kids had a blast inside the water park, the food was great, and the extracurricular activities for the kids were fun and interactive.  My family truly enjoyed our stay and we will definitely be back!

Waterpark was great! We’ve been before but this time was much better because my son was 42” tall so he could join us on the rides. We liked the snow in the lobby. We wanted to upgrade to a theme room but it was too expensive to upgrade.

For one night stay with two rooms with family, I literally spent $1000. Kids spent some time at Arcade area where is just in front of pool entrance and spent $200 in 2 hours!!!!!!!!!! If you are thinking about your budget for your vacation, don't visit this place. Way to expensive and not worthy.... very disappoint this time.

I had reservations when our son requested a short stay here for a family vacation, but went along with the plan, and was pleasantly surprised!  Facilities very clean, staff incredibly friendly and attentive. Plenty of water activities for children of all age groups.

We had a great birthday for our six-year-old daughter at great Wolf Lodge it was a great value we were able to stay in the room which is two king beds and a pull out couch had so much fun there’s lots of things to do we will definitely go again

Our son requested Great Wolf Lodge for his 10th Birthday. We’re so glad we came here. It was definitely a memorable vacation. The kids had a blast in the water park, arcade, bowling, and activities! We even got to take a picture with Santa! We ordered the extra birthday package for my son and he loved it! The was a big poster on the door. There were cupcakes, balloons and a card for him waiting in our room. He was so thrilled! We had a blast and will definitely be back!

this place has it all, the food was great except for the breakfast buffet, not impressed but every other restaurant was great. the water park is fantastic and plenty of places to swim and enjoy there. great kids programs.

Summary Heading: GWL fun for the family affordable for dad
Summary: great place, cleanrooms and water park, everything in one hotel, a hidden gem . and you wont feel like its a money vacuum good prices. the whole family all ages will have a blast. we are already planning or next trip

2nd time here and this it was just my family. Re river great customer service from everyone especially Theresa at Front desk. We love going here because it's so close to home and we have a lot of fun. It's indoors so it's also year round! Thank you Great Wolf Lodge! Stay classy

our stay was great.  2nd time here for a birthday.  We enjoyed the amenities and so did the kids.  Food is great too.  regardless of the weather, you're indoors so you can have fun year round.  It's close to home so we'd return again and again

Summary Heading: Definitely fun for the whole family
Summary: My husband and I brought our nine year old daughter for a two-day stay and had a great time.  It can get very crowded, so going off-season is a good bet.  The rides are fun, there is plenty to do on-site, and there is an overall great vibe.

Summary Heading: Don't miss the chance to experience the Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We can't wait to return! The whole experience was the best. There is no water park quite like it. Fun for the entire family. Clean, safe, protected from the sun, a blast the year round. This is something you do not want to miss!

We love this place so much! We have been twice and can’t wait to go back. The staff is amazing and accommodating. If you need anything they will help you out. Since our first visit they have streamlined check-in so you can check-in ahead of time to avoid a line at the front desk. 10/10 would recommend. My boys are 12 & 14 and still had an amazing time.

We stayed at the property for 8 nights in there most expensive room and felt the service was very poor. The shuttle service left us stranded at Disneyland two nights and my 4 young childeren were sleeping on benches waiting for them to show up. The front desk staff was unfriendly when checking in could even say rude. Our kids did enjoy the different activities the hotel offeres and enjoyed the stay. Just thought we would be treated better for staying in there most expensive room and spending a lot of money at the hotel.

Summary Heading: It's always a great day at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: Love, love love this place for it's convenience, cleanliness and all around fun experience.  This was our 5th trip to GWL and we will definitely be back!  They provide consistent products and services!!!!

Too much went wrong and the price was way too much for we had.  I could have done one night, should have done one night. First it was a 45 min wait to check in, second a broken crib got delivered to my room.  2 hours later another one showed up.  Half the Magiquest stuff was either down or needed to be reset.  We ate at the buffet twice and it was bland food at best.  There were no room for the kids to sit and do activities so we sat on the floor.   I don’t know what was wrong with the elevators but most of them made horrible noises and took forever.  Water park was small and could have been done in a few hours.  After about 5 hours the chlorine from the park was so bad we had to go outside and hang out.  Everything is priced like a tourist trap and over expensive.  Water

Planned on visiting a theme park near Great Wolf and came across this, decided to check the venue/prices and stayed here instead. Very nice clean property, the kids had a blast and we didn't break the bank! Will definitely be going back!!!

We went to GWL for my sons birthday. We spent the entire time in the water park. Lots to do for the kids. They were completely entertained for 2 days. Easy, fun family vacation.  I would recommend his hotel with anyone who has kids.

Great place nice and clean better then going to raging waters. Kids enjoyed themselves. I have a 16yr, 13 yr and 7 yr old children. I would go back you are able to take water into the water park but no snack you need to purchase their food only.

This was our second trip to Great Wolf!  This time we recruited my brother and family to join us!  It was even better than last time!  They got us in neighboring rooms and we all had a blast! We made amazing memories and will be returning!

For a "family-friendly" place, this property does not have a laundry facility.  There's a charge for EVERYTHING.  Compared to hotels charging similar rates, you would usually have access to a self-serve laundry room and late check-out is complimentary when available.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge Garden Grove CA
Summary: I had seen a couple poor reviews on this property, and was prepared to be a little disappointed, but I found everything to be exceptional and could find absolutely nothing to complain about.  Had a great time!!

We had a great time! Each experience from the water park to all the different activities was fantastic. We will definitely be back. We stayed last year for Halloween and this year for christmas. My only wish is that the kid cabins were more affordable. The place was clea, the beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly!

found facility nice, noisy, lots to do, if you want,  water park was not as exciting as expected, being first time.  Other water parks we have been seem to be more items and better value..  was disappointed in water park, not interested in other side activities in facility...

This is the second time I brought my family and both times have been exceptional experiences want to thank the staff for being so attentive to my five-year-old who was ill and for keeping the park so clean and organized.

Excellent waterpark Attentive lifeguards Friendly and helpful staff throughout property Safe environment Many activities Dunkin Donuts on site Variety of places to dine Spacious property even when full

Had a great experience overall. The staff was great. The place was very clean and organized. Great detail to everything. We went on a Monday in December so the lines weren't packed at all. The water park was very fun. The arcade area was great and tickets you get are worth the price. Food is a little pricey but it's what you typically expect from a theme park. You can bring in food and keep in fridge and microwave. Would recommend

Summary Heading: Happy birthday girl she’s ready to go back for her next birthday
Summary: The resort was very clean. I felt safe to have my kids run around at the water park because I knew only guests with their children are allowed in. Edwin at your cabana bar was amazing, well your staff was also great but Edwin stole the show!!! We will be back in a year because my daughter said she doesn’t want to go any where else but the Great Wolf Lodge. She’s counting down the days.

It was fun for the entire family! Friendly staff and family friendly amenities (bowling, arcade), but the carpet in the room was filthy and turned all our socks black! Please carpet clean the room more frequently!

clean, safe place for kids to have fun and easy for parents to relax with a great staff and many mant things for children, way easy, if you eat healthy bring some snacks and fruit, they have a lot of fried stuff and that is not for us, but other than that great review!

We had a blast, our 4th time at the park. You can see some wear and tear beginning to happen. Hope they stay up on repairs and cleanliness.  The burger bucket was grossly understaffed, and we waited about 30 mins for hamburgers and fries!  But love the water park.

We are a family of 7 and we all had a blast!! It’s a very expensive place but we had an amazing time. The staff are all super nice, and we only stayed 1 night. We were celebrating our daughter’s 8th birthday and she had a blast. Because we only stayed one night all we did was enjoy the water park everything else they have you have to pay extra. Not sure why if we already spend close to $900 on one night. Any who if you’re not on a budget this is a cool place to check out. We spent so much money we called our trip a staycation. We live 30 min away from this place. They check your bags at the water park before entering so you can’t take your own snacks or food. Parking is $18 and wasn’t sure if it was every time we left the parking lot so we ended up not going out to eat at a near

Would be nice to get quality food out by the pool, $5.07 for a tiny hotdog is ridiculous! Costco sells hot dogs for less and they are way bigger.Allowing guests to bring in certain snacks should be allowed, we already pay an arm and a leg to stay, then to not be able to bring food or drinks in is a bit harsh.  Take into consideration those families who spend the money to go stay there but don't have a lot of extra spending money.   Think the free amenities were nice, although, for the money you pay to stay there, you should include at least 20 paws or so per child to the arcade. 8paws a game is a huge rip off for most of those games.    The main thing for me would be to up the safety of the children, since it is a family resort.  Wrist bands should match and be checked when

A great place for a family vacation. My kids love the water park. If you have back pain this hotel is not for you cause the mattress is very very soft and uncomfortable. Food is great with very reasonable prices compare to other parks. Overall it was fun for my children and that's what matter.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge - Girl Scout Event
Summary: Our troop raised enough money to pay for our trip.  We had an amazing time!!!!  We are looking forward to our next trip to the Great Wolf Lodge.  The rooms are truly big enough for 4, we had the Kids Wolf room with a bunk bed, a queen size bed and pull out sofa.  With additional people it would have been crowded in 1 room.  The breakfast buffet changed up their menu and it was really good, the girls loved the create your Milk Shake bar.   You would try the Omelet Bar, very fresh and made to order.   The pool area, is very clean, but be prepared to be  hot, the air is kept between 75 - 80.   If you are not going in the pool you will be very hot.   The pool food is good, keep an eye on the line as they do not move very fast.  The best value is the Pizza, 8 slices for under $20.00,

Summary Heading: Good value if you get a promotion, otherwise it's pretty expensive.
Summary: Great for kids. You can safely leave them alone. Convenience of just walking up to your room when done. Bracelet has a chip with which you open your room door and charge food/beverage, so no need to bring wallet or keys! On the downside, lots of fees and taxes...my rate was $140/night...but ballooned up to over $200 with taxes and resort fees...

Awesome expierence, water park was amazing. We really annoyed our overall stay. Sign up for their emails, they offer better deals then Groupon. We will most likely come back and stay for a couple more days.

Great family resort and very close to Disneyland.  Price was excellent.  Staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful.  We had an excellent time at the waterpark and the water was nice and warm.  We will definately return.

Summary Heading: Great place for a mini family vacation!
Summary: Not being a water park fan in general, I was beyond surprised at how wonderful this place was!   This is our second year coming and as a family have decided to make a tradition out of it the weekend before Thanksgiving.  Plenty to do in a very clean and kid friendly (and secure) environment!

GWL truly is a place that caters to all ages to enjoy and/or relax with family fun. The dailly/hourly itinerary was most helpful in mapping out the type of schedule/fun we as a family could take part in.

Summary Heading: Issue with the check in process
Summary: After traveling and being in the water, it was unfair to be told your room was not ready and no one knows when it will be ready as per the check in process especially when room and water park was paid in full and in advance.

Great for kids and adults.  Lots of fun.  Lots of activities.  Great value.  It's great that you get to use the water park for 2 days even though you are only staying one night.  They did not have the suite we booked but gave us an extra room to make up for it.

This was our first visit to Great Wolf CA and we had a lot of fun. My kids (ages 10 and 7) loved the waterpark. Be warned there are a lot of other fun activities there too mini golf, Magiquest, arcade, spa, bowling - and you have to pay for them all! We had a Wolf Den room which was really nice for the kids (and adults) which although not quite a separate room it does give privacy and the kids love the bunk beds. You also get a fridge and microwave which is handy. We will go again I'm sure.

First time visiting. Never been to hotel where I've driven up to check in and told I had to park in structure first. Check-in was fine but when I booked, I was suppose to get 2 Disneyland tickets with the promotion and was told they would deliver them that night (didn't happen), next day called and asked again and was told I would be called back when they were ready (didn't happen), I finally went down and asked again and was given the impression I was inconveniencing them but I finally got my tickets the afternoon before checkout. The room was good size but when we initially entered, it was dark and had to find switches on lights to turn on (wall switches werent synced) also one of the bedrooms was locked and had to call and ask how to open 2nd bedroom. We received an

It was a perfect weekend, this is our 4th time at Great Wolfe Lodge and the kids never get tired of the water park.  The lifeguards on duties are very attentive, there are enough staff to watch over the safety of the kids. Manyfood choices depending on your budget.  I love the Tippin bucket ice cream ( good for sharing with the group).  Housekeeping was awesome.  The weather was at 90 degrees, and view from the 9th floor was awesome,   who can ask for more.  Will definitely be back again and again.

Here is fantastic place for kids. Kids could   enjoy a lot. Especially, there are lots of fun slides. This swimming pool provide reasonable price, but you have to plan and reserve at least 3 months ago. Anyway you should come with your family.

Beware people. You will be charged for parking on your bill whether you use it or not. $18.00 a day that you have to catch on your paper bill yourself & ASK for the charges to be reversed. Always ask for a paper bill so you can carefully check all charges.

The park was awesome. It's the food and the price that is the problem. We spend a lot of money to go to this place but the food is not healthy or good. The hotel needs to accommodate vegan families because we pay a lot of money to take our families there yet we don't have many food options and the ones we do have are not good. We are forced to go buy outside food. We paid 156.00 for thanksgiving dinner and it was horrible. We had eat oily veggies and salty mashed potatoes. I highly suggest this place redo their menus.

Great Wolf lodge is an amazing place for a little family get away or for a birthday party. It has many attractions for kids of all ages. It is a little expensive though and the water park isn't that clean.

Another awesome family trip with the kiddos.  Love all the fun and  the exceptional staff.  Wish we could go more often. We love being able to enjoy a 2nd bonus day at the water park and being able to check in early.

Summary Heading: Extreme Water Park and Play Land
Summary: This is an overall great family experience with water activities for all ages and adventure level.  The check in and check out procedure was well organized. Try to get there before 1 pm as the lines can get long, or do mobile check in the day before. You will get a text message inviting you to do so.

Summary Heading: Wonderful time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: It is a fun, safe and secure environment.  We felt so relaxed!  The food stand was very close and accessible.  Towels were provided.  My daughter loved her 1st time at a waterpark.  Looking forward to a return visit!

We absolutely recommend this place for family trips! Everything was clean and cozy. The rides were never long waits. It makes your vacation so easy when you can go back and forth from your room to the water park. There are so many on-site activities and places to eat. We love how affordable everything is inside the water park too. There is a great selection of beer and got to have a red trolley while my two year old napped in my arms.

Summary Heading: Go for the fun not for the comfort.
Summary: You can have as much fun as you can afford. So if you get a good deal on the room, be ready to give the money you "saved" right back to them for all the extra things they offer. The waterpark is awesome and included, but there are other things they should be included that are not.

Summary Heading: Great getaway with friends and kids!
Summary: 2 moms, 4 kids, fun time!  Was pleasantly surprised with entire experience! Mediocre food, bring your own snacks and drinks in room.  Wristband key system and room-charge was so convenient!  Kids had a blast, And moms had a good enough time too, mission accomplished!

We stepped away from the Thanksgiving chaos and spent Thanksgiving at the Great Wolf Lodge. Best. Decision. Ever!  Our experience was fantastic. We reserved the Wolf Den Suite that has a bunk cabin for the kids Wed-Fri. Check in isn’t until 4 but you can use the water park and all facilities as early as 1pm. The worst part of our stay was the bed. Both bed and pillows were not comfortable! Despite this, I still highly recommend. The water park is a blast with areas for all ages and there is an outdoor water play area which is great to get some fresh air and sunshine. Lucky for us it was in the high 80s on Turkey Day so we even came home with a bit of sun. A great perk is that the water park is only open to hotel guests so the wait time for slides never surpassed 10 mins while we

This hotel has a lot of areas of improvement. The customer service was what I would expect at a cheap motel and not a family themed resort. Especially what you pay to stay here. They should take notes from Disney owned resorts and bring in that level of customer service and enthusiasm. Had things to do in the hotel which is nice but every thing is very costly and you do not get the experience that you pay for. This hotel has potential but only if the higher ups do some serious training. The maid service was horrible and had all kinds of inconsistencies. The water park was great ad this is the only area of the hotel that any of the staff interacted with my kids and made it a good time for them. If you have a very young kid this hotel would be good not great for older and teens.

Parents would mostly like this if you understand its all about the kids. Though some of the larger multi person slides can be fun too!  A much better choice than Legoland for the months of November/December through winter since its mostly indoors. And the food options are better, not by much, but definitely better. Why don't these places have healthier options, I have no idea why not, other than cheap food has higher margins.  In short, if Embassy Suites and Chucky Cheese has a baby, this would be it.   We will still probably make one more visit before the kids get too old. But, we would probably stay at another hotel property.

Summary Heading: Nice Idea but water is too cold.
Summary: Room was really clean, I liked it. We did not do any of the extra junk they charge you for, just bought a few souvenirs. They sell a video game that takes 7 hours to complete if that's your thing but its almost $50 to play. Food was not too expensive, we ate on property, but the food quality was not that great. The meat was still raw. The single reason for the 3 stars is that the water was cold, I can't give you a temperature estimate but it was cold walking in and you needed to be constantly moving to stay warm. My son got cold after a 1.5 hours.

Summary Heading: Geat wolf lodge - water leak in bathroom from above
Summary: Our bathroom leak water from the bathroom fan and light from the ceiling around midnight.  The staff refuse to give us another room and told us that they are fully booked. It took them a while before they issue us a room with no compensation.

Summary Heading: Fun place for the whole family!
Summary: It was a great experience for our family.  We will definitely come back again.  The facility was clean and very organized.  The wristband system was very convenient- no worries at all bringing your wallet around the facility.

The food for the adults was on point and the service went above & beyond. The Bday girl felt special & the ammeneties weee a lot of fun. We are looking forward to another special iccasion to celebrate.

Summary Heading: Grandparents great adventure with whole family
Summary: My granddaughters loved the water park and Magiquest game. They were never bored so many things to do. Suggest you stay at least 3 nights just too much to see and do for all ages no need to leave the Lodge to eat had a good selection

Lots of fun for kids and adults.  I wish the vending machines worked better.  Some floors only excepted cash or to use the wristband.  The wristbands didn't work it would be better if they offered to use credit card.

Great Wolf Lodge was a fun place to be and definitely catered for families with younger kids. I thought the prices were a bit high so I don’t think we’d visit again. For a similar price you can go to Disneyland. But for the littlest kids its pretty fun and exciting. The waterpark was fun but crowded, which is expected. Their fitness center was not much - they had 1 elliptical, 2 recumbent bikes, 1 cybex machine, 3 treadmills, 1 seated leg press machine, 1 tf multiuse resistance machine.

Three main issues with this resort. 1) loading dock outside rooms, can’t sleep in!! 2) no breakfast room service?! 3) elevators very slow and old. These three issues don’t seem like much but when dealing with three cranky kids it can greatly affect experience.

Summary Heading: Super relaxing, fun and great value
Summary: Had a few days with grand kids before Thanksgiving.  Found a 20% off deal at GWL Garden Grove.  Had the best 3 day, 2 night time that was fun packed, but not stressful or overly tiring.  Lots to do for all, and no lines more that 5-10 min (for the biggest water rides.  Not overly crowded, very friendly staff, clean and gearing up for holidays.   Can't wait to go back.

I have a large family with wide range in age from 65 to 3 in age 12 of us stayed at the lodge and all enjoyed the stay. Truly one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had in long time . Felt the children were safe had areas for both my oldest children now 30 and 26 and my youngest son who is 8 and grandchildren ranging in age from 8-3 to have fun and adventure. The little dance parties with bubbles and staff was great fun for the smaller children to interact with others out of water and show off their individual dance moves.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf is a great place to stay and play
Summary: My family had a great time at Great Wolf.  We enjoyed every minute.  I had no complaints.  The water park was great and there were many attractions that were entertaining.  The hotel and dinning was great.  Room service was also great.

We had a great time. Overall it was somewhat pricey, but then kids loved everything from the Wolf den suite to the waterpark itself. They especially loved the wave pool and i could barely drag them out of it. The waterpark itself was clean. Towels were abundant, and we could even frolic  on checkout day. They had swimsuit spinners in the locker rooms, so I didn't have to pack dripping wet swimsuits!. Kids especially had fun meeting the Lodge characters.

Perfect for family getaway.  Our kids enjoyed it.  Fun for all ages and room size is perfect.   Specially when summer is over,  you cna atill enjoy the waterpark as you are in summer season.  Water was warm and resort was clean.   Wish the waterpark hour was little longer.  But we were able to enjoy the waterpark two days.  It was nice that we still had an access to waterpark after check out on same day .

Great wolf lodge is a great place to stay if you want to have fun with the water. Excellent place for families. Beside the water park, this place has other amenities for all the family. You would be getting all your money back with all the satisfaction and fun.

This place is your best bang for your buck.  Lots of fun for kids, and parents can feel secure knowing their children are having good safe fun. The staff is very pleasant. The only dislike is the ground of the water park gets pretty dirty with trash.

This is our second time to visit Great Wolf as an addition to the Disneyland trip. My kids love it and so do I. Lots of great slides and the rooms are as nice as the Grand Californian. Lots of food options - especially for Gluten Free needs. Take two nights to stay here and you'll be hooked.

Summary Heading: Still nice and clean during the 2nd year of opening
Summary: This park is the preferred park for my two kids ages 15 and 6, sometimes they prefer this over Disneyland. The environment is not as wild and out of control as public water parks can get. We enjoy the convenience of the rf wrist bands for purchasing food, room key and parking functions. The slides appear to satisfy enough of the daredevil in all of us without putting you in danger. Overall a very fun, safe place for a family vacation.  The whole package!

great place for kids, went here for a conference and had the family come over , very family friendly but adult friendly too will come back again for birthday celebrations , bracelet tied to room key and charges super convenient

This was our first time at The Great Wolf Lodge and it definitely won’t be the last. We came to celebrate our firstborn’s 5th birthday and this place did not disappoint. There is so much to do! The water park is amazing plus there were pajama story times & dance parties, like one big slumber party. There is yoga in the morning, bowling lanes, an arcade, and buffet breakfast with walk around characters! Food opoptions were great. Overall a fantastic family weekend getaway!

It is a fun place for families.  Get in early and stay late to get the full use of the waterpark.  We recommend leaving and arriving very early to beat the traffic.  The hotel has food and activities that go until 10pm for kids.

never ever again! booked a room for one night $749.00 check in is at 4, but we got checked in at 5:19. they let the kids use the water park starting at 1, but if you have an elderly father, you have to sit w him in the lobby and wait and not watch your kids...then got our room and there is no bedding for one of the beds and a hole in one of the walls...absolutely awful hospitality. I have no idea how they can get away with this...i will let everyone I know, never go there!

My family was a party of 16 people. From the start they made sure we were together. There was something to do for our youngest being 1 to grandma and grandpa. The front desk girl was very helpful in answering questions and our situation because my daughter has really bad skin issues. We are already planning our next trip. And taking more family members. Thank you for making this a very special memorable stay

overall great experience, our 10 year old loved it. there is plenty to do for all ages. i recommend in getting the interactive room if you have children. go during the week after a holiday and you will have run of the place

Summary Heading: A Great Time at The Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: My family and I had the best time playing in the water park at The Great Wolf Lodge. We stay in the water for four are five hours. The room was clean and comfortable, it was ,six of us,. Four girls and the two of us, my kids stayed busy the hold time. The beds we're very comfortable, ( had to look at the name brand of the bed.  I am going to buy a new bed a.s.a.p.😂  We enjoyed eating 🍕 pizza and playing games.  My girls loved the story time, Craft time, and the animal show.  Oh....My nine year old had the best day every when her birthday cake, balloons ,  poster, and fun game card was delivered to the room on her birthday..🎂 This was a Birthday Party  she will always remember.

They need further training on how to be happy.  They all look like they hate their job!  This is a family resort, they should greet their guest with excitement and joy.  The process to check in was very slow.  Other than that, the resort in itself was great!

Definitely worth the money!! This place had great service. The bed was a little uncomfortable but that's the only negative. I highly recommend this trip!! We had a blast and all of the employees took great care of my family!

The amenities are nice and very clean. The majority of the staff is helpful and nice. Unfortunately there was an incident where my daughter and I were changing out of our swimsuits in our hotel room, and one of the staff walked in on us. He used his keys to unlock the door without knocking and barged in while we were undressed, and I did not feel comfortable the rest of the time I was there. I immediately called the front desk and they said they spoke with him and he was embarrassed, although seeing as how we were the ones in our underwear, I don't think that he was as embarrassed as us. They apologized and said they added a late checkout to our room, which we didn't need, because we left early the next morning anyway. On the flip side my waitress at the Loose Moose that morning

I can say enough about the staff and how accommodating they were. Great business model for others to follow. I would highly recommend it for business needs or just a great family experience. You won’t be disappointed.

My husband, brother-in-law, and I took our kids (ages 4 and 18 months), and we all had a great time.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  The water park was fantastic for all ages.  Our dining experience was great.  We can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Great place to treat your kids to fun; don't expect anything lavish for adults
Summary: Took my 13 year old son and a 13 year old friend to Great Wolf Lodge for one night.  Even though I would say this place if mostly for YOUNGER kids (ages 5-10) they had a great time.  If your kids are 5-11 they will LOVE It.  Hotel grants you access to indoor water park.  There were some teens there who went on the big slides all day, but there is much more for younger ones there.  For smaller kids, a harry potter like wand that lights up things on a treasure hunt throughout the hotel and a mini bowling alley (smaller alley and pins) is a big hit.  My son loved the 6D movie theatre - zombies lets you experience the 3D movie plus shoot all the zombies like an interactive game (I liked it too) and the arcade which (like all arcades) is a rip off but kids love them.  Our 13 year

We only stayed one night but had the water park from 1pm on the day of check in to closing the day of check out.  We travelled with kids ranging in age from 1-6 and adults in age from 26-33 and we all enjoyed ourselves. We stayed in the water park most of the time since we were only there for a short amount of time,  but the hotel offered many fun things for the kids to participate in duck as story time, mooring yoga,  pajama jam, and lunch time crafts. You czn also purchase extra passes for extra activities they have which we did. We ended up getting the pup pass that included a stuffed animal, a scoop of ice cream, a glitter tattoo, credit for the arcade, and a bucket of candy. Even though our stay wasn't that long this trip was way worth the price and we will definitely be

We came for a family vacation, and was great until we got our “Rekindle the Bonfire” wine amenity (please see attached picture).. A nice bottle of bubbly with 4 pieces a small strawberries.. As a hotelier of almost 20yrs experience, this is a joke of an amenity.. I know they want to make a little extra, but c’mon 4 pieces of small Chocolate covered strawberries that are supposed to have a paw print, their signature print ?!.. very disappointing!!
Manager Response: Sandy, thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention!  We are deeply sorry for our shortcomings when it came to your Wine Down package.  We would like to get you in touch with the Food & Beverage team in Anaheim.  Please email us at guestrelations@greatwolf.com with your reservation and contact information.  We hope to hear from you soon!  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Feels like a cruise you never leave the hotel because everything is there that you need. Great food, so much fun for everyone. Its truly for all ages my boys are 1 and 4 we still managed to have a blast.

This was our first time- after my kids begged to visit for months. We had a great time and the water park and kids activities were great, however the rooms were below average even for a kid- friendly hotel I️ would have like a little more comfort/luxury for the price. Overall very safe, fun environment.

Summary Heading: Great fun for 2 days, but if you lose your kid the lifeguards will get mad instead of help you
Summary: We went here with 3 families over spring break 2017. The 8-12 year olds had the most fun, the 5-7 had a fun time, but was a bit over it after a while, the toddler had a blast at the wave pool and toddler area. The bigger kids absolutely loved the magic wand quest all over the hotel at all hours of the day (including past 10 p.m.) and the free balloons and little entertainments at the lobby for the little kids are very nice as well. Overall, the fun part of this place was great. We stayed for two nights. Kids started going in the pool area at 1 p.m. until close, then all day the following day. By the check-out day, the kids were done even though we could have stayed for another whole day. They let you stay as long as you clear out the room on check out day.  The negative: I lost

We visited Great Wolf lodge just before Halloween.  They had the placed decked out for Halloween, with a huge balloon spider in the lobby, orange wolf ears for the kids and tick or treating every night.  The room was nice and clean.  The water park was fun and not crowded.  Food at the restaurants within the lodge was good.  We had fresh fruit in the waterpark area and there was a nice family restaurant with good food and beer.  Additionally there were great local places to eat as the lodge is down the street from Disney.  Additionally there is a target nearby, where we bought breakfast items that we kept in our room.  We have also visited Great Wolf lodge in Dallas.  The Dallas facility is larger and seemed to have a lot more people.  But Anaheim even though it was smaller had

Summary Heading: Great place to visit at least once
Summary: We tried wolf den and the room itself, exceeded my daughter's expectations.  Quiet, clean, and enough sizes for home away from home.  Indoor pool was great with so many different options than expected as well.  It wasn't small either!!!  Almost the size of regular water park.  Anyway, overall we enjoyed many rides, foods, and had great time.  Room service was somewhat slow + we requested a repair on some minor bathroom issue and they never responded on that.  With the amount we paid, I would of expect better service.

What a terrific hotel.  Best hotel in Anaheim.  10 minutes from Disneyland. Super hotel that caters to kids activities plus what a fantastic water park. All the kids and family members become part of the 'wolf' pack.  Rooms are big, staff exceptional and activities are over the top.  Would stay there again and again. Parking is enclosed. The best part is they use a wrist band for room key, credit card etc.  No carrying around purse or wallet.  Loved it.

We had a wonderful time at the Great Wolf Lodge. This was our first time and didn't know what to expect. From the pre-check in process to the rides and food we were very impressed. Looking forward to returning again soon.

Water park and hotel rooms are okay but staff and their customer service skills are bad. A lot of young people working here that does not seem to like what they're doing. No thank you's, no hi or hello's, no one ask you if you need help but all they do is chit chat with each other. My family and I visited when they first opened and customer service was still good then, but not anymore. Water park temp is good, but as soon as you leave the water park, temp goes to freezing. Make sure not to catch a cold. Not a lot of food choices and very pricey.

We only stayed one night a few days before Christmas. Our kids (ages 13, 11, and 9) were done with the water park in less that 2 hours.  It was so hot and stuffy and the chemical stench was too much for me.  I lasted less than a hour.  We loved the Christmas Pajama Dance Party and meeting Santa in our PJ's. Morning Yoga was a hit with my youngest.  Nearly a year later our kids are ready to play the wand game again.  We stayed longer on check out day so they could run around hotel floors to complete levels of the game with their wand. If you have video game obsessed or older kids, then this is what they will remember, not the hot and stuffy water park.

Summary Heading: Don't think we will be back
Summary: Every stay seems to be poorer and poorer. Staff used to be friendlier. Rules are inconsistent and cleanliness  is hit and miss. Not all that friendly with everyone there. Is never too crowded there. That's the only upside.
Manager Response: Maggie, thank you for returning to Great Wolf Lodge - Anaheim and for sharing this with us.  We sincerely apologize for our shortcomings in pack member friendliness, cleanliness and water park guideline enforcement.  Your concerns have been shared with the executive leadership team in Anaheim.  A member of our pack will be in touch with you soon.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Found out about this place from a coworker. Perfect for family outings. A lot of activities to do, was not able to try all the activities. Will stay longer next time. The only downside was our room was not cleaned the second day. We stayed for two nights and for some reason, housekeeping did not clean our room.

The whole family had a great time- my husband and I were able to ride some slides early in the morning, my 3 year old loved the water park and wolf den, and the newborn was comfortable sleeping at the water park. The staff was awesome. Rooms were awesome. Food was great! We will be back soon!

Great place to entertain your kids, they'll love it.  It's an indoor waterpark, so you can enjoy a waterpark any time of the year, regardless of the weather.  The park is clean, if accidents happen, the crew will clear out the attraction.  There are cleaning crews everywhere making sure the park is clean and safe for everyone.  The constant 85 degree indoor park and heated pools make it fun for everyone.  The room (at least ours) was clean.  The bed was super soft and comfy.  Kids enjoyed the Wolf Den in our room, worth it to splurge if you can.  It will keep them out of your hairs.  Food options are good within the resort.  Otherwise, there are plenty of food options around the area. I would definitely book in advance by taking advantage of the early booking deal.  Considering

You can rack up a pretty nice bill here, but its worth every penny. An experience that You’ll never forget, yet an experience that you will want to have again. Deffinately booking here again soon. I️ love the fact that the surprises didn’t stop with just the water park! This place keeps those little ones entertained.

Great place kids and family! This is a great place to have fun with your kids. You don't have to leave the GWL because you have everything you need. My family had a great time and we will definitely be back!

>checked to uncleaned room and showed front desk pics of if  >wrist bracelet would not allow re-entry of room  >Wood Fired Grill assistant Mgr asked my party of 5 to leave because another party was waiting

Very nice hotel and very nice staff. I mean beyond great customer service.  We had fun.  The water park isnt a place I would want to go again, I wasnt doing the slides or anything just there to watch the kids but its very hot inside since I wasnt going in the water and my eyes burned by the end of the day.

The room was great, the kids loved the wolf-den decore. the waterpark was fun and well kept. the food was pricey and more options would be appreciated. check-in was slow. would be nice if there were more staff members available to check in when the line is long.

The Great Wolf Lodge is definitely FUN for the entire family.  However, you need to truly budget for it and make sure you have plenty of money to spend.  Every extra activity is a cost, except the Water Park.  The water park is so much fun.  My little nieces had an amazingly fun time and I loved watching their faces light up as they went on all the water activities.

The Great Wolf Lodge is Parenting Heaven! Forget all those other expensive crowded theme parks, THIS is where I will bring my boys for a fun weekend of play and family-oriented adventures. What other kid-oriented resort blends great exercise and thrill rides in a safe environment, with the convenience of food, alcohol, and comfortable accommodations to crash at the end of a long day? My boys and I LOVE this place and I am signed up for their email list so I can take advantage of their web specials which saves me a ton of money!  My favorite thing about this resort is the staff. Every single person we encountered impressed me with their professionalism and kid-centric mannerisms. They would take the time to carefully explain to my hyper boys why we "walk, not run" and were

Summary Heading: Nice place but not for special needs children
Summary: Loved this place my 2 kids and I stayed for 1 night. The room was clean and quite. It was so convenient to have multiple places to eat without have to leave the hotel. I only had 2 problems. The buffet was super expensive. The other problem was my special needs child didn't get to enjoy the water park. We needed my 16 yr old to be able to go down the slide with my 9 yr old special needs daughter. She can't swim and doesn't know when to hold her breath. They said for "safety" reasons they only allow 1 at a time down the slide.  The supervisor said It was because of the way it was built. He said I could go down the slide at 250 pounds  but my 2 kids weigh less then that together and weren't allowed to go down together with the special circumstances. I feel that they should adjust

Summary Heading: Fun Experience, can't wait for that next deal!
