Summary: The overall family experience was positive. The kids loved their treehouse bunk beds in the room. Our 7 & 9yo's were thrilled with the waterpark. The 5 & 3yo's could still participate to a degree, but for the price, I was disappointed. The food at The Lodge Grill was fantastic and the staff was equally wonderful. We were disappointed with the soggy pizza from Hungry As A Wolf, hoping that eating it in our room was a factor... We loved being able to enjoy water play with our kids without the dirt, sand, bugs, and birds that come with other venues. The whole facility was immaculately clean, and we enjoyed the good prank between pack members that actually proved they were doing their job!

If you get a chance to take your family to a GWL anywhere do it! But be prepared to spend a couple hundred dollars above the room cost for souvenirs and food plus Pup or Paw or Wolf passes. We feel the Paw pass is the best deal unless you have 5 and under age the Pup pass is sufficient

Had tons a fun here and my grandsons.  They loved the arcade and   the Quest. My grandson actually wanted to leave Disneyland early to finish his Quest. We will definitely be back soon either on CA or Wa.

Clean environment and friendly knowledge staff defenetly family orientated and kids of all ages will have a blast they have activities for everyone of all ages rooms very clean and nice  we went for the Halloween event which was very fun for the kids they were able to go trick or treating dance see a punking patch as well as got to go in the water and have fun inside the water park then later alone my husband and I went alone to enjoy the fun slides they have defenetly recommend this place speacilly if you have any kids

Summary Heading: REALLY HORRIBLE AIR VENTILATION AT WATERPARK
Summary: Its like smelling bleach straight from the bottle. The air ventilation inside the waterpark needs major improvements. Its not safe...nor should it be safe to be in the water park with no air ventilation. I asked a few life guards if the air quality of the water park was normal that day and the life guards stated it was. I feel extremely bad for the employees and guest who stay there

We planned our visit with 3 other families and had a great time. It’s not too big nor too small for us. The variety of rides was perfect. We did rent a cabana, which made things easier for us. Over all a great stay and we’ll be back.

Was happy to do mobile check in. Was texting with the stafd the whole time i had question. Amazing experience for our first rime. Clean, attentive staff. Too much to describe.. will definitely recommend and go back for sure!

The suite bed was very uncomfortable , the bunk beds aswell.  We all left with back aches and neck aches. The padding on the bunk beds was extremely thin. Kids dont want to go back not even for the water park

Good place to spend the day with family.  Or a good landing spot for days at Disneyland, especially if you have at least 3 day tickets.  Parents can relax in lounge chair with a cocktail while the kids burn off what's left of their energy.  Then you can have a comfortable nights sleep before returning to the Magic Kingdom.  Enough restaurants in house to satisfy most tastes and many restaurants within walking distance.

Food lines are long and then they are out of the food you want when you get to order.  All extra activities are overpriced. I did feel safe with the amount of lifeguards.  Bathrooms were clean.  Rooms were good.

Other than it being to much chlorine that it burned my eyes within the first 2 min of being there and the lights in our room not working and flickering until 3am, the park and everything else was very nice.

It's a nice staycation for family fun weekend get away 😊 We all enjoyed the cleanliness and the friendly staff members of the water park.  Very convenient location, close to or walking distance to multiple restaurant and attractions as well.

My kids chose Great Wolf over trick-or-treating this year! They didn't miss a beat, or the candy. They want to make this an annual tradition. Resort was not crowded. Environment is family friendly and feels safe. It was awesome!

Great place to take the family. You get two days of waterpark and a great night sleep with the package.  A can't miss if you have kids of all ages.  Get in line early and head to the wave rider if you want to try surfing. They do that for the first hour. The after that they do boogie boarding.

We came to Greatwolf for the second time and we had so much fun!!!! We bought a protector for our phone in the swim shop and took awesome pictures and videos on the slides and in the water! We got a wolf cub suite with bunk beds and my daughter loved it!

Overall. it was a great place to take the kids!  It was very clean and the staff is very nice and helpful.  Security in and out of the Waterpark could be better. Anyone could walk out of the waterpark with my child without question. Either way, I would recommend it for a family fun vacation.

It's perfect for a family get away and it's right down the road. I'll definitely go back there again and again as long as they got deals. Price is a little too much with out any sort of deal offer. We love it!

I was here for a conference and decided to take the family with me since this place had a water park. I was pleasantly surprised at all of the activities for the kids. The staff was also very nice and prompt. Most kid-centered places now are either not clean, or not well staff and there’s always a wait. We actually didn’t experience any of that here. I was really surprised! It was such an awesome experience. My kids keep asking me when we will go back!

Wonderful family vacation for our child's thirteenth birthday. She said it was the best day of her life. Staff was very attentive and incredibly friendly. Rooms were very clean and easily accessible. We will absolutely recommend to friends and family and are already planning our return.

Great place for families and adults.  Must love water parks. Should stay at least 2 nights.  All ages. (except babies)  Food is excellent and a good variety.  From pizza to starbucks and ice cream to a buffet.

I spent the past weekend at the Great Wolf Lodge celebrating my son's 10th birthday. I opted for the kids cabin suite which suited the needs of my family of 6. The amenities of the lodge covered all of our needs. There are plenty of restaurants within the facility; moreover plenty of restaurants within driving distance of the park. I especially appreciate that you can exit the parking structure without having to pay each time. The rides and attractions at the park suite the needs of all ages.  I spent a total of  $790; this includes a $40 credit each for food and entertainment. The credits are part of the birthday package which also included a birthday cake, balloons, and poster outside of the door.

Always a fun time there. Food and drinks are excellent. Clean atmosphere would definitely go again. Warm enough to go in the winter. Always have great decoration for the season. Pictures with Santa and snow.

Not worth the money!!! Rooms are not with 300+ a night. If you want to use the water park stay at another hotel. You will be wishing you had by the end of you're stay. Could have used the money on my kids.

Summary Heading: Excellent! Great fun for kids and adults!
Summary: We stayed with another family in a two bedroom suite.  Plenty of space for 3 kids, 4 adults.  Mini fridge, micro, sink and food prep station in the room.  Kids (ages 9, 12, 13) all LOVED the magic quest game. Be sure to get a description of the games before deciding.  We found out afterwards that the second (longer) game would have been better for the kids, but by that time, we didn't have enough time for them to finish the quest.  We brought our wand from a previous stay. No problems, just buy the game again.  Waterpark is as expected - very fun.  Outside swimming pool is a nice feature with a quieter space to relax.  Inside the park can get noisy at 2pm when next round of checkins arrives. Lots of chair/table saving with towels, but we did see staff go around and collect

Great place to spend a few days with your family for some water park fun.  Facility is in great condition (less than 2 years old, plenty to do, tons of fun, great staff, attentive lifeguards, great location).  If you can score a decent deal, this place is a no brainer.

My son's 11th bday. We booked 3 hotel rooms for 11 kids. We also rented the cabana - an absolute must! We ordered pizza to the cabana during the day. We had dinner reservations for bday dinner at night. We also purchased the bday package includes decoration on door, balloons, and cake. Great fun!

Tips: 1. Follow the driving directions to the lodge carefully. 2. You have to pay for parking per day (ours was $18) 3. You receive wristbands for the water park (don't lose them, they will charge you to replace them), plus your wristband is your room key-so you have to wear it your entire stay. 4. If you are going for a birthday, I recommend the "Birthday Bash" package upgrade. I felt it was worth it, just be sure you understand how to use your dining & attraction credits.  5. I highly recommend taking kids to some of the events offered.  6. Going to the water park early & outside of the busy times (1-4pm).  7. Didn't really care for the food at the buffet, but we enjoyed the pizza place, Dunkin Donuts & the Sweet Shop.  8. I recommend checking in at 1 & leaving your things in

Great family vacation!  Prices included h20 park passes so the park is never crowded and is always clean and the lifeguards are attentive.  The birthday package is well worth it as it included a giftcard  for food and activities

I really had fun great time with the whole family. My son's 5th day birthday celebration could not of been better.    Water park was awesome. The room was great and the kids loved the them suite.   Food was great. I really enjoyed the Halloween decorations and the trick or treat event they had for the kids the first night at the lodge.   overall amazing experience...

This is our third trip to Great Wolf Lodge. I think the price is good and my kids enjoy it so much. There are alot of activities outside the water park too. The arcade is very fun and generous with the tickets.  We will definitely go again.

It was my family's first visit for my daughter's 5th birthday.  The park was great.  I paid for a cabana for one of the days and it was worth it.  Otherwise, try to get there at opening time to pick your chairs.  I would not recommend their birthday package, the cake tasted awful and they don't write the birthday name.  The balloons are not helium, just 5 blown up and put on a stick.  Might as well bring your own balloons and blow them up.  I could have done alot more with the $100 in decorations and cake, there are plenty of stores nearby.  We did not get to try the restaurants because the wait list for dinner was 1.5 hrs long.  We walked to Red Lobster.  In the morning Dunkin Donuts in the hotel was also super busy, took a long time to get food and they ran out of donuts.  So

My kids are ages 4 & 7, they both had a blast. Parents enjoyed going down the big rides with them and allowing them to play with each other in a safe environment without us having to be next to them all the time

We enjoyed our stay at Great Wolf!  We had many activities planned this trip.  Everyone enjoyed our stay except the beds were really hard and we didn’t get a lot of sleep!  We rented a cabana and that is nice to have with small children.

Great place, great deal, close to home. Food was good. Nice that you can also take some food to the room to save on money. Loved the beds they where so comfortable. We had a great time and we are planning on returning next year.

We spent one night with our 2 1/2 year old and 6 year old. We stayed in the wolf den suite which wasn’t necessary since our kids didn’t sleep in the bunk beds but it was a darling room. Definitely don’t need to stay in a special room. You spend all your time at the water park!! The water park is surprisingly clean. I was expecting to be grossed out by the water but the water is clear and nice. I would recommend a wetsuit for small kids. The water is chilly. My 6 year old didn’t stop for 9 1/2 hours on our second day. We went on a Wednesday so it was not crowded and he could run into every slide. The extra activities provided for Halloween we’re so cute and fun. I would go when they have something special like Halloween/Christmas activities. Not sure what they do on normal

We love Great Wolf Lodge.  My son is crazy for waterslides, and I love that we don't have to put on sun-screen to have fun on them if we don't want to.  The food can be expensive, but if you're careful, you can keep it under control.

The pool times at this hotel are terrible. 10 am to 8 pm!? My kids get up at 6/7am and were excited to go to the pool but we left by 8 or 9 to go do other things then just wait around the hotel all day for the waterpark to open. When we got back around 6/7 pm we hardly had time to play. My youngest didn't even get a chance to play because she usually went to bed then. We stayed at this hotel for the waterpark. Not worth the price in my opinion.

This resort hotel was amazing and had something for everyone!  The fact that the water park passes are included with the room was a huge plus.  We asked for an early check-in and received a text at 12:30 that our room was ready and available.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Every member of your party receives a wrist band that's coded and is used to open your hotel room door and pay for any purchases, including food and drinks.  No worrying that you might lose a card or get hacked!!   Everyone receives a pair of wolf ears, also, at check-in, which the kids LOVE!!  The water park itself was fun, fun, fun!!  The kids were busy sliding, swimming and having fun all day.  Towels, food and bathrooms were readily available and there was plenty of staff to assist you with whatever

There's rides for all ages! Obviously there's going to be more rides for kids, but there is a wave simulation ride (perfect for adults) where you can either surf or boogie board a powerful wave (like those ones you see on cruises). The lines are much much shorter compared to Raging Waters, Hurricane Harbor, and Soak City. Longest wait time is 15-20 mins.

A great family fun vacation.  There is something for all ages in waterpark.   Restaurants , Arcade etc.   Take your pick.  so much more!  Staff and programs etc all exceptional.  This was our second visit and we will be back.   The lodge is beautiful.

No need to worry if it’s too hot or too cold outside, with this indoor water park you will always have fun. Something fun for every age range, my children are 2 and 4 and both had a blast! The adults enjoyed it too (but if you want to save money bring food to put in the refrigerator in your room)!

The Great Wolf Lodge was fun. We used it as our home base for a So Cal theme park vacation. We stayed as a couple with no kids so we didn’t get to fully experience GWL but we did spend a lot of time around the resort and had many interactions with the staff since we were there for 5 days.   Check in was smooth and easy. We were given a map as well as a listing of hours of all the goings on. We reserved a King Suite but they didn’t have any left so that was a bit disappointing. Other than that the room was clean and well equipped with a microwave, coffee maker, and small fridge. Nice LG TVs with plenty of channels, a small couch and a table with 2 chairs. Beds were pretty comfy (we were pretty tired after long days so we could have passed out anywhere) and there were lots of

Every room is charged $18 each day for parking and it's patrons responsibility to check bill and dispute charge if they don't use parking garage.  Promised shuttle to Disneyland but it didn't show up. After waiting an hour ended up finding our own transportation after front desk twice promised alternate ride was coming.

Not our first time going to Great Wolf Lodge and will be going again. It is a very friendly and safe place for all ages. The water park has different slides that are geared to all levels from very tame to highly exciting. Great for all family members

good to experience but very expensive a try once kind of place. Many other options in the area that give you more for you money. Basic packages are small and you will have to spend a lot of money aside from room cost fro you kids to feel a part of the experience.

Great Wolf is a terrific place for a quick family getaway. The waterpark is always a fun time, and when you add MagiQuest and the arcade, the kids come away with great memories. MagiQuest is cool because the kids get to sort of be independent and solve the puzzles on their own and then get a sense of accomplishment. Food choices could be better at this resort, however. The buffet is way overpriced, and the waterpark restaurant "Buckets" is pretty terrible. Rooms are nice.

GWL is definitely a one night destination. You tire of it after that second day of playing in the park especially since the chlorine vapors really do something to your lungs. The kids really enjoyed it, but as I said, there's only so much park you can endure.

Summary Heading: This is a perfect place to take the family. It was super fun for everyone!!!
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge is an excellent place To take the family. Convenient to stay there and be able to go up to your room throughout the day. My kids loved it!! Even the big ones. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: They never clean my room n we stay for 3 days
Summary: Everything was good but unfortunately they didn’t clean my room  I have to call them and request toilet paper towels n  I have to take out my trash cuz they didn’t not good at all n for wat we paid is not good

The indoor area was bare bones. I expected decor equivalent to Disney attractions or The Rainforest Café. Waterpark was small for the amount of people in attendance. A sign was displayed saying bowling went until 11 but it closed at 10. We took our time at the arcade and were disappointed to find the bowling area closed. Beds were very uncomfortable. Pillows were hard. The air conditioner made a thunk thunk think noise constantly.

Your kids will have a blast.  Resort is expensive and they will process you... kind of like you are being made on an assembly line.   Attractions make all the BS worth it in the end; my kids were super happy.

We found this hotel as my daughter wanted to go to a Dunkin donuts and she searched online to see the closest. We found out that it was inside this hotel. We found a special online and booked it. Was one of the best hotels we have stayed at. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Not for kids with special needs. Not enough security or safety measures.
Summary: If you ha e children with special needs who elope or wander - skip this place. It is your worst nightmare. Exits everywhere and NO security. Even for regular families, there is NO security preventing just anyone from grabbing your child and walking out of the water park with them. Nobody stands at the door, no security, nothing.

Found blood stains on bedding....on both beds in the room. Took 3 attempts from housekeeping to actually put clean bedding on. The hotel is swarming with kids, which is to be expected, but was very loud and chaotic.

Great get away with the kids, family and friends. Have returned 9 times and each time is new and exciting.  New Years was a blast and highy recommend spending the holidays here.  The decorations and details are very nice.  Christmas is a must see.

This resort transforms you right away into a family of wolves, seeking out fun and relaxation! From the rustic details and the spaciousness of the comfy rooms to the friendly staff and available outlets for activities, there is truly something here for everyone. We were here during Halloween and there was a balloon spider over two hundred feet long way up in the ceiling! Very cool. They go all out. And the lines were short for the water slides. Lots of fun!

I was at Great Wolf Lodge for a business trip.  However, everyone I encountered on the elevator was having "the most amazing day" and "the best day EVER".  Grandparents were happy because they were able to be with their grandchildren in a safe, clean environment.  There were happy faces everywhere and the staff was comfortable with the children.  Not a place for FOODIE's.

I was very disappointed with almost every aspect of this place.  First and foremost it is too expensive and not worth it.  We arrived at 5:00 on a Friday and left at 11:30 am Sunday, and the cost was 1,033.  I am still wondering why it cost so much.  The rooms were nice I will give it that.  However; we had to call housekeeping on several occasions to get our room refreshed and when they did arrive it was around  6:00pm.   FYI, they have a  breakfast buffet for 17.99 per adults and 14.99 per child (which is the cheapest you will find besides Dunkin Doughnuts) not to mention there was a long wait.  After reviewing the prices for Lunch and Dinner we opted to bring in outside food (which is allowed) way more cheaper.  They said laser tag when it was laser frenzy, which was nothing

Our family went for a safe Halloween event. Our children and grandchildren absolutely loved the entire weekend. There are so many different activities for the entire family to enjoy!. The parking was easy, the check in was very simple with mobile check in and the food was excellent!

Summary Heading: Our second time and not disappointed!
Summary: We have been to this resort twice, and we have been impressed with the quality both times. There is so much for the kids to do (11 and 9), and we don't feel the need to helicopter over them the entire time we are there. We especially love that our arm band behaves as a charge card, eliminating the need for wallets and purses the entire time we are there. We can just charge everything to the room. It is a bit on the expensive time, but it is a fun and safe family trip for all ages. We will go back again and again.

My family has stayed at Great Wold three times and had so much fun each time. The park is clean, the lines are short and the staff is so friendly and helpful. We have recommended it to our friends who also couldn't believe the quality of service.

My grandson celebrated his 11th bday at Great Wolf Lodge this weekend. The food was reasonable. There are lots of attractions for the kids to enjoy arcade, bowling and miniature golfing, ice cream. It is more than just a water park.

We brought our 1 year-old grand-daughter here to celebrate her upcoming 2nd birthday. There was plenty to keep her entertained all day long. The rooms were quiet, not too much noise from the hallways. The staff was friendly and helpful. There were a lot of healthy food choices, fresh fruit, veggies, salmon and then there was the not-so-healthy too. Resort fees in California/Anaheim are ridiculous so plan on adding another $60 per night to your room rate.

Fun experience for the whole family, my kids LOVE this place. Very clean, great staff. My kids think it’s a kids hotel, since it’s so kid friendly. You never need to leave the resort, everything you need is located in the hotel.

Great experience , real nice and clean hotel  . great waterpark ,we had a Super good time during our (short) stay of 4 days , but we'll come back again that's for sure .lots of things to do for the kids , good restaurants , dunkin donuts is always welcome (store at the lobby) , nice big clean room , with big TV .

Summary Heading: Worst trip to Great Wolf Lodge yet.
Summary: My family used the online check in before arriving so all we had to do was go to the front desk and get our prepared wristbands. Our room was ready and we received the room number by text. We arrived and went directly to our room and unpacked. We went to the water park for a few hours. After 3 hours we found out that we needed to switch rooms to an identical room. So we had to put our family vacation time on hold to appease Great Wolf Lodge. We also experienced incorrect  room billing as well as have to reactivate wristbands to re-enter our room. Definitely not the relaxing, fun family vacation that we had envisioned. Our time was not on the mind of the staff or valued in any way.

The kids loved every aspect of this experience.  There is a ton to do without spending the extra money, but if you will be there for more than a couple days the extra activities do help.  Schedule shuttle to Disneyland if you need it, as we were never able to as it is very limited.  Beds are very firm and my AC didn't work, so sleeping was not the best.  Very family friendly.

Summary Heading: Cold water, but best family fun!
Summary: I wish they had more locations in different areas. There's already so much to do in southern Ca, why couldn't they put a great wolf lodge in northern Ca? The water in the park is a cold. My kids and I could only swim for an hour because we were FREEEEEZING! Other than that, best family trip I could ever ask for!

Kids had so much fun at the waterpark. The rooms were clean and staff was friendly but incredibly busy. The restaurants are very understaffed, wait times for food are way way too long. Don't eat there go somewhere else.

99% of the staff that works on the water Slides were amazing,upbeat, energetic people made the experience worth it, Story time Broke there was no Audio so it got stopped. The staff at the front desk, didn't explain much to us, like where our $25 credit a night went and how to use it, found out later, also it says free bottle water with stay so we didn't bring any with us counting on that which ended up being only 2 bottles of water ONLY 2! for a family of 5 that was staying 2 nights/3days... They should remove that from the booking info VERY misleading!! The buckets eating place was enjoyable food along with the pizza at the hungry as a wolf place. The dinner Buffet was not worth $90! Food was like school cafeteria lunch, prime rib was super dry, dessert selection very limited

We had a nice time. Would return again. Nice comfortable room. Decorations were wonderful. We went with a school trip. We do wish there were things geared toward older teens and adults like a hot tub or play area with deeper water or axplsce where older teens can swim. My 6'2"+ teenage son only found about 2 feet of area where he could be at least be submerged in water half way up his chest. Or activities for an old teen like and outdoor rope climbing area

Excellent waterpark for guest of all ages. My kids enjoyed the body boading and the waterslides. They have 7 restaurants to choose from to eat. The rooms comfortably sleeps 4 but can accomodate up to 6. Indeed it was an enjoyable stay for us.

wonderful staff, great time at the water park for kids of all ages, even adults. Highly recommend!  Close to Disneyland Park.  The Buffet they have inside the hotel is clean, and good food. My daughter's loved this place, and so did we.

Extremely expensive..for the amount $1500 two nights king suite, The amount we spent we could have stayed at Disneyland Hotel! Magic quest was expensive and confusing for a 9 year old (you have to go to different floors of the hotel) which I didnt like :/ They are friendly though...

Came for the first time to celebrate my sons bday. My 3 boys had a blast! Park is very clean and organized. Staff is very friendly. They have many activities scheduled through the day, which the boys loved. We will be coming back soon.

The room was dirty, used towels with blood and dark stains were rehung and not replaced with new unused towels, refrigerator was full of old rotten foods and drinks. Very unsanitary, unhealthy and very rude front desk clerks. The indoor water park was overwhelming with Chlorine odors which made our eyes teary and uneasy smell.

Great place for extended families as there are plenty of activities to please everyone.  The waterpark was a big hit and the kids also enjoyed the arcade.  The staff is very friendly and makes sure to keep the kids happy.  The breakfast buffet was extensive and very good.  The pizza was ok.  Hotel was decorated for Halloween which made our stay seem special.  The kids loved that they could wear their pajamas in the game room after dinner.  Everyone had a great time.

It very fun. We love it.  We met a nice lifeguard. Everyone was awesome. The food is really good. The nail place is a little expensive and  in the polish chips but other than that it was very very good.

The water park area can really use some serious ventilation, the smell of chlorine was very strong making my eyes burn the whole time (and the day after), I had to get out of the water park every 15 mins or so just to breathe. It is also very loud inside the water park since it is an enclosed space.The rooms are spacious and clean; clean towels are abundant in the park.

Unfortunately, our party of  6 were disappointed in the weekend, the activities, the friendliness of staff and overall experience.  We did not feel that it was worth the cost at all.  Even our youngest, who is 9 years old, said we could have chosen other things to do for the cost that we paid.

Summary Heading: Great fun for full family, safe enviroment.
Summary: The kids had a great time with Magic Quest and their wands, figuring out the adventure.  It  left time for relaxation for the adults. We all enjoyed the water park and the restaurants.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  We will go back.

Great wolf lodge has something for every age. Our whole family had a great time. Loved the personal assistant we could text at any time of something was needed. We used it for more blankets and they came so fast. The water park was so much fun! The convenience of all the food options was great.  Our only complaint is that our bedroom wall backed the gym and there were kids playing in there all night. We could hear the machines after hours and they would wake us. So we did not sleep great.

Had a family vacation here. Staff was wonderful. Had tons of extra activities for kids, and even adults enjoyed!! Everything was very clean.  There are a ton of people there and some how they keep everything clean. We will be back soon.

We had a blast!  The rooms were nice, the water park was awesome for kids as well as adults and the food/beverage prices were quite reasonable! They don't gouge you like other parks! We called it the "kids vegas" hotel.  The entire bottom floor had tons of activities once we were done in the park.  There is no reason to leave the resort during your stay.  We anticipated splurging on this trip and just going once to knock it off our list but will definitely be back!

Very frustrated with how much money was spent in relation to what we actually got out of the resort. We were upsold the wolf passes and that ended up being a waste of our time and money. It was a nice trip but it was just way too much money for little value.

Summary Heading: Fun Waterpark but not even 4-star quality
Summary: While the room(s) were large enough to accommodate our family of 8, I had greater expectations. The room was a basic room jazzed up with a tree bunk bed.  We had to essentially beg for housekeeping service which was half-a&&ed at best when they finally did show after 4 requests.  I had specified a request for a pack and play, and had to ask for that three times as well.  After housekeeping staff finally did show, I found that they had left a plastic bag in the pack and play under a sheet - completely putting my infant at risk. The food was not wonderful and there was not even any room service.  For the cost of this type of room, I had expected the quality to be a bit better with more amenities.  Based on our room location, we also heard semis making deliveries with the "beep

Great experience from easy online check in to check out.  Friendly helpful staff clean rooms clean facilities.  Good food.  Lots of fun. Lifeguards are very attentive. Your little ones will be safe.  Lots of activities for the little ones.

Great  place for family fun time, shopping, eating, and relaxing! There are a  lot of amenities and activities for the whole family. My kids really enjoyed the waterpark, bowling, and the arcade. I enjoyed the workout room  (had a great workout0

First time at the resort and celebrating my daughters 7th birthday. We had a great time at the water park all day. We had the food at the water park and i do not recomend it. The food is overpriced and not the greatest. Go outside the resort to eat.

Awesome trip. Room is expensive but even if you don't have a coupon it's totally worth it. Lots to do with the kids... ages 5 and 3. They loved it. Lots to do even for the littles ones. Will definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Nice water park, bad customer service.
Summary: Again the water park was great, but the customer service was lousy. No one seemed to ever know the right answer to give. A majority of the staff always seemed rushed, and a little impatient. The rooms were nice and the a/c worked very well.

We will definitely be back. My daughter who celebrated her 7th birthday had a blast. Us adults, had fun, but mostly exhausted for trying to keep up with our kids. They have everything for your family. I love that they allow you to go out and get food and does'nt require people to just stay indoor and buy just their food. I say give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

From check in to check out my family and I LOVED our experience! We took advantage of a deal that was sent to our email. This included a standard room & a $25 attraction credit. Upon arrival we were greeted,  and checked into our room earlier than expected. We immediately hit the waterpark. It was so nice to know that my kids were safe and my husband and I could enjoy our time with them and relax.  After the waterpark we also enjoyed the bowling and the mini golf.  The food ranges from average to above average, you kind of need to figure out which items to get. My only complaint is the size of towels in the waterpark. So tiny! Bring your own towel

My daughter and her friends love to visit Great Wolf Lodge.  It is a great place for children to have fun and for parents to relax (and also have fun). The facilities in hotel room were wonderful. Especially with microwave and refrigerator.

Great place for families.  The water park has everything other water parks have and stays open longer than other water parks.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  There were a variety of restaurants that were all very good. Great activities for the kids.

My family and I visited on a Saturday in October. From all the horror reviews I expected check in to be terrible. It wasn’t! I got an email the night before about pre-checking in. Next day, check in day I got a text saying my room was ready - at 11:30am!!!! Yes there is a strong chlorine smell - duh, it’s a water park that’s indoor. I recommend goggles for sure, for your kids. Get a seat outside for some fresher air. The place is remarkably clean. Staff everywhere, 5-6 maid carts on the room floors at all times. I truly have no complains about our visit. Order pizza from the local Dominos for dinner, they deliver. Almost directly across the street is a McDonalds, and across from there is a shopping center with Mexican, Thai Food, and a Subway! You just can’t take outside food to

Summary Heading: We will definitely come back again
Summary: This is our second visit here.  It has excellent year-around facilities and very clean.   Both kids and adults had a lot of fun.   We recommend to come with friends and family together which would be more enjoyable.

Pubic hair next to toilet, bed started to smell of urine once it warmed up. Food prices are insane and the quality is nothing worth half of it. Most of the people I saw were bringing coolers with food and snacks due to food prices. And I felt bad for having some granola bars and some fruit.

This was our second trip to the Lodge.  We love it.  Great fun for the entire family.   The water park has a lot of variety for all ages, plenty of food options around the resort.  Room are quiet considering the amount of families in the resort.

We stayed 2 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. Refrigerator, microwave were both there, working and clean. There's a coffee maker in the room as well, but I haven't used it as I bought the refillable cup from Duncan Donuts, conveniently in the lobby. All the coffee you want for $10, for the entire stay. Unbeatable!  My 8 year old son LOVES this place! He loves the waterpark, the arcade, and especially the Magiquest game. He will definitely want to come back here. I'm sure we will come back, but if we do we will be doing a lot more of self-catering meals and/or eating off-site. For a world-class entertainment venue, the food was over-priced, which I expected, and not very good, which was rather disappointing.  The pizza was good, but $17 for one topping.  The breakfast

The parking was overpriced, Wifi didn't work (it was out for hours in the entire building), terribly humid water park, overpriced for what you get, my children were disappointed.  You've been warned.  Go at your own risk.

I thought things were overpriced from the room charge, the meals, wand for MagicQuest, etc.  It was nice that only hotel guests could be in the waterpark because it was BUSY.  We were celebrating a birthday and we received nothing extra except different wolf ears.

Excellent time! So clean from the water park to the bathrooms at the water park. The food was good. So much to do you never actually have to leave. The staff was excellent, friendly, helpful. The activities all day and evening for the kids was great. Overall really great experience. We will be back.

Kids had a great time and would love to go back.  Probably won't.  Food is outrageously expensive and there are no cheap options other than leaving the site and driving to fast food.  Bringing food seems a lot of work for a vacation, although rooms are well equipped for in-room eating.  Waterpark is fun for young kids, not so much for adults or older kids.

Summary Heading: Best Birthday For my 10 year old!
Summary: This was my first time visiting. I hope it wil not be the last. The staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were in great condition. I would recommend this place to all families. PS this was a birthday party package my daughter loved all the attention from the staff as she strolled around the resort.

We had a really nice time here. It was very welcoming and family friendly. Everything was at our disposal. We can't wait to go back!! the Halloween festivities was the icing on the cake! my kids had so much fun dressing up and running all around. it felt like being on a cruise ship!

My reservation was accidentally changed. So when I showed up on the day I reserved online and charged for, the room was unavailable. After 10 minutes or so it was sorted out and I did receive an upgrade. However when I checked out I was charged for the upgrade. My credit card was charged an extra $400 which, 3 days later has not been reversed. Staff was overall nice but when I called in to disputed my charges, the front desk agent was very rude and condescending. Water park was nice. Kids had fun.

Summary Heading: Awful experience at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Overall, our experience was awful.The only thing that saved the trip was the fact that my kids enjoyed the water park and Jesus the shuttle driver was great. The adults were miserable and fed up with poor customer service by the end of our stay.  From the moment we got there it seem like the only thing the hotel cared about was making a dollar.  It was so bad, we actually had a list of the negatives, with only the two (somewhat) positives above. •	Check in staff showed no interest when found out we pre paid; didn't discuss additional add-ons or explain what would need to be paid separately (like wands and screens/games associated with them) •	Random fees we didn't know about (parking and increase to parking fees, additional $50 held for incidentals) •	Doesn't explain where

This location resort I visited since First day of open... Services getting better and better... now they have pre check-in system ... before this system they have waiting time was at least 1 hour ... so glad they doing this system

We had a great time.   It was fun but very pricey.   Not something that we will do again for another few years.   Also, we thought that the resort should have some sort of procedure in place to make sure that a stranger isn’t leaving with your child!   Just a thought.

We had an awesome time. Ten times more fun than Disneyland.  Lines were reasonable, things for every age.  Little ones had a ball.  The one restaurant, Lodge Wood Fired Grill, was expensive and horrible service.  We stood there for 20 minutes and were completely ignored by everyone.  It was expensive but we were hungry and willing to pay.  Ended up walking away and down the street for food.  Otherwise, the entire experience was enjoyable.  The kids had a wonderful time and it was memorable for all.  I love that the park is inside, but the noise gave me a headache after a time.  All in all though I would go again. Impressed with how quiet the rooms were considering the amount of children. We had a great time.

Waterpark is fun for all ages of the family. Life guards are everywhere to ensure safety of children. Outside of the waterpark, there are other activities for the kids to stay active and have fun. So worth the money!

Summary Heading: Okay hotel but not worth the cost
Summary: Nice hotel and cool waterpark but definitely not worth the price especially considering that the advertised Disney shuttle was not available on any of the days we were there. It is also too far from Disney given the lack of shuttle to be a Disney hotel and just as expensive as staying on resort. The waterpark is cool but we only spent a few hours there overall.

This place has your children and family in mind. We all slept well amd had so much fun. My 4 and 2 year old are still talking about it. The food options were diverse. I would recommend for a one stop vacation spot.

We recently spent our Fall Break at GWL.  I was especially impressed on how clean and wonderful the resort was.  All my children had a safe and fun time.  We will most likely return in the future! My ONLY complaint, was the taxes and fees.  California has some of the highest taxes & I found the additional $90+ in fees and taxes painful.

This was our second time heading over to the Great Wolf Lodge in Orange- right across from the block in Orange. We really enjoy the resort and my boys always have fun. The service is ok, not a 5 Star but if my kids are happy 😃 then I am happy. The water park is pretty amazing and they do have so many other activities for the families to enjoy during their stay. My only complaint is they don’t have room service so you need to either go to Dunkin Donuts 🍩 or the breakfast buffet or a restaurant for dinner. When you have been going all day it would be nice to call up Room Service. It took me an hour in line to grab donuts in the am at Dunkin’ Donuts . We booked a two bedroom suite which was very nice and I also upgraded to the birthday package with a cake and a gift card. Overall

Great assortment of water rides and activities: wave pool, lazy river, boogie boarding, toddler water area, lots of tube slides, and mat racing slide. For added $$ you can play arcade games, mini golf, spa, and more. We chose the wolf den room this time which is a blast for kids. It is like they have their own room with a tv.

Very family friendly with great amenities.  The kids games and opportunities for entertainment are fantastic.  The only reason I gave the resort a 4 and not a 5 is due to the food...  very bland, burnt to a crisp ribs, and brisket with the consistency of shoe leather.

Housekeeping services were not good  Rooms were good and kids friendly  The staff was helpful  Water park is great for kids  Good activities in hotel for kids and family  Checking out was efficient  Need to improve housekeeping services

Great Wolf Lodge has thought of everything. We had kids with us ranging from 2 yrs to 10 1/2 and they all had a great time!  Something for everyone, adults included. There is always something to do, the staff is superb and we can't wait to return.

Summary Heading: Great place to visit & not get sunburned!
Summary: They have a variety of slides, which make it fun for most people (though if you are physically disabled you can get exhausted quickly) of most ages. It's great to be able to hang out with your family at a water park where the sun won't kill you! The food is decent & the snacks inside the park aren't horribly expensive. We hung out a good chunk of the day, but we were worn out by 3pm or so.

Another amazing vacation with the kids. I highly recommend this property with children that don't do well waiting in long lines of traditional theme parks. Mine are 4 and 7 and have fun all day and night long with the events, magiquest and the water park there is always something to do. We will definitely return.

Great place, clean, awesome, super comfy beds , going back. The bathrooms where immaculate, the water park was amazing fun for all ages. Lots of food choices, great buffet, large spacious rooms. Lots of activities for the kids.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge, Anaheim: Ask for Room 202!
Summary: Room 202 is one of 2 rooms that OVERLOOKS the WATER PARK!!  The kids LOVED the view!! Everything was clean, spectacular and the park had a perfect mix of big and little kid activities.   A bit on the pricey side but they do have occasional discounts. Plan on bringing your own food if you want to save money.  It was $80 for a family buffet!!  Lots of local restaurants to choose from also.

I have a 10, 6, and 3 year old that had a fabulous time! They said it is better than Disneyland. I just got back yesterday and booked another stay for May. They loved the waterpark and enjoyed the indoor activities as well.

Don’t waste your $$$$ Not only is this place way over priced, the beds are terrible, our shower didn’t work, the mixing valve was broken. So you either had a super hot shower or a super cold. After going down to the front desk and letting them know, they assured me they’d fix it. They never did. Next day at check out, I told them again. No apology, no offer to make it right. We came here to celebrate my daughter’s 5th bday. She’s been asking to come here for MONTHS...so we were all looking forward to it. Man we’re we disappointed. We found out after we got there, that they offer a birthday package, for $90, which gets you a poster on the door to your room, balloons, a cake, $20 arcade credit and $40 food credit. Problem was, you have to order it 24 hours before check in. We were

A awesome place with many activities for kids to do. This was a very exciting place and different from other attractions within the area of the county. I highly recommend going to this place during the weekday.

We had an excellent time at great wolf lodge.  The service was very good at every turn.  The resort was at 99% capacity and we never struggled for chairs by the pools or for service.  We had a king suite with an adjoining room with bunk beds another queen bed and a pull out couch.  The kids stayed in the bunk bed room while we had a private room for our selves.  Worked out great.  They loved the paw pass with all of the different activities.  I would do that for sure.

Celebrating parents 44th Anniversary. Fun family entertainment lots of things to do for the whole family. Water park was very fun & facilities were clean. All the workers were very helpful & friendly.

Had bad service at breakfast buffet. Rude enough for a 6 year old to notice. Our plates were never picked up, we had to put them on the table next to ours. We Got our drinks 20 min later. 2nd refill was brought when we were all done. This happened both days. There was 4 other families there so they were not busy for us to get that service.

The price will say one thing and when you check out it reflects another.  The resort fee of $30 a Day is not worth it.  The resort fee is for outdated stuff and who needs a gym when you have to climb all the stairs and carry mats and tubes.

Great Wolf Lodge is a wonderful place to go with my family. I have 3 young kids who love swimming and this place offers a year-round place for all of their water fun needs. The resort offers on-site amenities that makes it convenient for everyone. From bowling to manicures, snacks to buffets, everything is there in arms length. My family loves this place!

This was our second visit and we love it still.  So many activities for the kids....never have to leave the resort.   Beds aren't very comfortable, but the bunk beds are a hit for the kids.  Place never seemed to be too crowded, which is a plus.

We only stayed one night in the week.  We came for our two children's shared birthday. One was turning 12 and the other 7.  All 5 of us had a wonderful experience and the kids are already begging us to come back next year.

Our stay here was so much fun! Our 3 kids absolutely loved the water park, arcade and magiquest. There was so much to do, it was a lot of excitement from start to finish! We checked in with Lisa who was super friendly and made us feel very welcome. Our check in to the hotel was actually fun and I can't remember EVER thinking that before. Lisa was great, anytime we needed anything, she made sure it was done quickly. Big kuddos to her.

Amazing place to take small children. WE never left the resort and never ran out of activities. The resort gave you everything you could ever need. We checked in at one and left the next day at 6 in the evening. We managed to do a lot in our stay effortlessly. off season is the best time to go.

Awesome experience. Very clean, super friendly. plenty of activities for our range of children's ages. rides/slides had great variety. plenty of space to not feel packed. rooms were will stocked and very clean.

Out of 8 elevators only 2-3 were operating. We waited approximately 8 minutes for an elevator at one time. People were lined up waiting for elevators to their rooms. Only 3 elevators were available with about 30+ folks waiting. Many of these people had small children who were wet and in bathing suits. They were cold and tired having been in the waterpark.

Great family fun for all ages! My family of 5, ages from 19 all the way down to 8, and everyone including my husband and I had such a great time! The water park was super fun for all of us. It was a great time!

Summary Heading: So much fun for the whole family
Summary: Spent our family vacation here. We all had a great time playing in the waterpark and enjoying the other activities available. We will make this a yearly trip for sure. The only issue I had,  was the smell of chlorine in waterpark. But it only seemed to bother me, not the rest of my family.

"Best birthday ever!" according to our daughter.  She enjoyed every minute of it.  The water park is clean and safe.  Our room is well maintained with comfy beds.  Our family had a great time.   Thank you for that memorable weekend.  :-)

Summary Heading: worth it, except for the aracde prices
Summary: Awesome resort for adults and children. Lifeguards on duty ensure safety of kids. Any needed towels for drying off is provided as needed. Local shopping very near less than 5 minute drive to major stores and restaurants. Only down side, majority of the arcade games are $2 a play, very few $1 a play games so pretty expensive to play in arcade with several kids. $10 game card for each kid only allow them to play 5 games

The park is an amazing place to take your family. My family of four had an amazing time there and will be returning there in the near future.   Note: Plan to stay more than one night due to the NUMEROUS activities Wolf Lodge offers.

Summary Heading: Great Family trip for little kids!
Summary: We had a great time!  With two little kids (5&3) it was easy and fun and since we are local it was very convenient!  We will be back for sure.  If you are looking for something easy for a short trip this is a great place!

Summary Heading: Vegas for Kids!!!!!! this place is so much FUN!!!!!!
Summary: Excellent place, I came here with my sister and her 6 year old grandson.  We hadn't ever left and he was already making plans to come back.  Everything about this place is geared towards kids, they thought of everything!  Thank you for making our stay a very pleasant one I won't get tired of saying that Angel, Destiny and Danielle are the best hosts, they are fun, funny, friendly and you couldn't have chosen better hosts for the nightly Party!!!!  Thank you and see you soon!!!!!!

lots of fun for kids of all ages...Just be aware of the constant smell of chlorine. Rooms clean staff friendly great stations for kids and grown ups small fridge so you can bring some food or snacks for yourself or kids

We had a birthday celebration for my daughter and a few friends.  They had a great time.  They do a great job at the lodge.  There were plenty of activities besides the water park.  My daughter can't wait to go back.

There were 6 of us ranging age 65 to 2 years old. It was so much fun and so much to do besides water park. Free activities throughout the day. We made bracelets, face painting, story time , trick or treating, dance party, character meet and greet, and so much more.  The staff was amazing and we love this place. We are already planning our next visit.

I guess the resort places more value on the activities on site than the quality of rooms.  If it were not for upgrading to the wolf den suite, the rooms would be just a standard ordinary room with two beds.    Even then the suite is not a traditional suite with a separate sleeping area.   The beds were too firm that it caused a lot of sleepless nights.  The wifi hardly worked as it cuts out very frequently.  Using the cell signal was poor at best.   You would have to go towards the front door to get any type of cell signal.    The water park itself had plenty to offer.  The kids wanted to stay all day at the water park.  There was a place to lounge outside for the adults to enjoy their beverages.   The food was a tad bit overpriced, but again the value was all centered on the

This is an awesome staycation destination. Great for kids and parents. Lodge has other activities for children other than the water park. A good balance of fun. A lot of food choices as well. We got the kid cabin this time and my kids and their friends loved it!

Was very glad to find a waterpark like Great Wolf Lodge, 30 mins away from home. My kids had a blast every time we visit. A great place to entertain kids. The best part is they allow you to bring food and beverages!

I had 2 minor issues that were immediately addressed by the staff.  I was appreciative that they cared to make sure that my issues were immediately taken care of.  The room was very clean, the water park was clean and seating was available and the restaurants had delicious food.  I will definitely visit a wolf resort again.

Easy to get to; easy check in/check out, lots of family activities to do, room very clean; staff was helpful.  My kids enjoyed the stay.  They were active the entire time and it was not overwhelming to do.

Rooms looked nice, bed not comfortable at all, especially for the price of the rooms. I've stayed in motel 6 with soft nicer beds. One staff membe made me not like my stay. Be nice if companation could be offered.

This is an excellent family holiday hotel in terms of proximity to Disneyland, food options & hotel activities/features. Staff were excellent, particularly in the water park where it felt completely safe for the kids.

Never again. In August I took my son to Great Wolf Lodge and had a horrible experience. I wrote an honest and fair review not expecting to hear back from them. After a few weeks, a manager had reached out to me to apologize for the staff, and offered to “extend a hand”. Not really sure what that meant, I emailed him back asking for clarification. After about three more emails, he told me that if I was to give them a chance to make it right, he would give me an upgraded room, and free breakfast for my son and I for our stay. I planned another trip, hoping to change my mind about this place. I was wrong, and it was even worse the second time. If you’re going there expecting the same level of customer service as theme parks/ hotels in the area, you’re going to be seriously

Summary Heading: Whole Family Loes Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: We live local in Orange County and came here same time last year.  It was a no-brainer that we would choose to come here again.  It's totally kid-friendly, big and safe, beautiful, fun.  Lots of activities for the kids, the staff and accommodations were wonderful.  The water park kept us busy for hours and hours!  The water and inside temperature is kept at 84 degrees and that's just perfect!  There's something for every age level, which is soo nice!  There's also an outdoor pool with basketball, water buckets and sprinklers!  The only problem I have is that the pillows were very flat and hard, so if you live local, make sure to bring your own!  Other than than that this is a great place.  There are a lot of food options inside the lodge, but just across the street is pizza,

Summary Heading: First time at The Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Our stay at The Great Wolf Lodge was perfect. I upgraded the room to a "Wolf Den" and my 6 and 4 year old loved it.   There were so many things to choose from without having to pack up my kids and leave the resort. My kids enjoyed the room and dressing up for the trick or treating!   I was very impressed will absolutely be back!

Summary Heading: The inexpensive alternative to Legoland Resort and Knott’s Berry Soak City
Summary: The room rates are competitive and can accommodate up to 6 pax. Thrilling rides in the water park. Truly a unique and wonderful experience for the kids who cannot stop thanking me for bringing them there. I would have spent the price of 2 one day Disneyland tickets for the price of 1 day hotel accommodation of 5 persons at this place. And I am glad I didn’t. Please check this place out. I never done online reviews before but I felt the need to share this amazing experience.

Great stay if you have a family. The waterpark was enjoyable for me and my wife and our 3 year old and for our 9 month old. There was a Halloween themed event each night that our daughters enjoyed, it was just a small trick or treat type event. The stores and restaurants are great if you don't wasn't toy leave the hotel but if you have a vehicle with you, go out to eat or shop. Overall, worth the visit but not recommended for more than 2-3 days.

This place has sure went downhill. People are not as friendly or helpful. Their staff member named Olivia was rude and condescending. She should never work in customer service. I had a question about why I was charged more than the amount I booked the rooms for and she made it seem like I was wasting her time. Although it's only a $6 difference, it's the principals. They should have notifies me or even just a simple receipt with explaining they are charging me more than the amount I confirmed for. I thought it was a mistake so silly me, I decided to ask when I checked in. Olivia told me I should have received an email or something but it was confirmed by her manager, Adriana, that an email was never sent. They raised their prices on parking so they decided to change the price on

Summary Heading: Great place with not so great staff.
Summary: Staff lacking training and cannot answer basic questions. Some of staff seemed to be annoyed at children of which this is clearly the bread and butter of the resort. Magiquest game lacking technology and doesn’t work correctly half the time. Arcade is old and beat up. Water park facilities are great! Leaps and bounds better than the rest of the resort.

I got a great deal online with 30% off. My two year old and four year old had a blast. We have gone twice and both times the service was great. On the second time I was offered an upgraded room for a cheap price just for being a returning customer. Cant wait to go back.

This place has everything you need and is a kids dream. The water park has just enough activities for all ages. We had so much fun. The room was cute (but the furniture/beds were terribly uncomfortable.) We stayed in the kidcabin and the kids liked that they had their own bunk beds and tv but the interactive wall didn’t work well. They came to ‘fix’ it but it still didn’t quite work properly. (I’m not sure it would have been as entertaining as they make it look in the commercials anyway) But good thing there is plenty of other things for the kids to do to keep their attention. It’s packed with options. The little bowling alley was cute, and the 4d video game looked entertaining. My oldest was obsessed with the Magiquest game ( I don’t get it but it looked like great exercise) it

Well worth the price, so much to do for the kids. Lines were long on a Sunday, but to be expected. We went to dinner & came back a few hours before waterpark closed and almost no lines. We definitely got our monies worth.

Don NOT use GROUPON, book with the hotel directly!  If you're staying with a large group you'll never get rooms close together - let alone on the same floors!  The water park is beyond humid, it would be perfect if they would just crack the many windows to allow the chlorine filled air to escape and let some fresh air in.

Front Desk Clerk Kellie was exceptional and was very friendly, efficient, kind and had a very great personable skills and great customer service. Thank you for making my 10th year anniversary and my daughter's 4th birthday memorable. So much family fun filled adventures and activities to do! Water park was the best by far I've ever experienced. Staff so extremely helpful and kind, housekeeping was friendly and very efficient.

Summary Heading: The cost to stay here does not match the service/quality of the stay
Summary: CONS:  1) poor valet service  2) open tool box (pink color) with box cutter in the middle of the main floor during a construction of a house. 3) watch out for the corners of the cement stairs...don't get scraped! 4) no employees to ask questions around the resort...you have to look for one.  PROS: 1) the lifeguards are diligent in guarding and have a good rotation schedule 2) employees 'inside" the water park are nice

Rooms need to have some sort of aid for the little ones to be able to reach the sink to wash their hands and brush their teeth. It is a resort aimed to kids after all. Small details like this make the difference

This is a fun waterpark. The staff was friendly and rooms were clean. Lots of extra activities. they had lots of extra stuff for Halloween like trick or treating. The lines for the rides are not that long.

What a fun place! My family of 6 had a blast! Room accommodations were great! Comfy beds, big flat screen tv with cable, the showers had great water pressure! The water park was phenomenal! Way better than aquatica in San Diego! The arcade was a big hit with the kids! The Dunkin donuts was a lifesaver, I needed that caffeine boost to keep up with my kids! We will definitely come back soon!

This resort is perfect for families with kids of all ages. We rented a cabana and it was perfect as it allowed us to check into the hotel and get into the pool at 10:00. Since we only had one day here it was ideal. We were at the pool from 10 until 7:30 and the kids had so much fun! The food prices were reasonable for hotel food and the food was surprisingly good.   The cabana comes with unlimited nonalcoholic drinks, a TV (unnecessary, but came in handy for the sports fans with us).  The service at the cabana was excellent.   The attractions at the water park were so much fun with a lot of variety for all ages. There were more than enough life guards and employees and everyone was paying attention.   The hotel is designed for families with kids. The phone even has a dedicated

Great Wolf Lodge is very family friendly. Lots of free activities for children, my kids loved the button making and balloon twisting. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Awesome water park. Reasonable rates. Will come back!!

You and your family will love this highly recommend the have a lot of fun things for kids to do not just the water park like arcade games dancing with pajamas story time ect All kids love this place 😊😊😊

I recommend staying at the Great Wolf Lodge for families. Older children (teens) might not enjoy it as much, but my oldest is 11, and the resort was a huge hit. Plenty of activities in addition to the water park.

All the kid friendly attractions were fun for the whole family.  The adult drinks were really good, especially the bloody Mary's...the fried jalapenos were the best topping ever.  We would definitely stay again but will save some money and stay away from the 'suites' (really just 2 adjoining rooms).  Not what we expected at all.

Summary Heading: Great Value Plenty of Room to Roam!
Summary: Overall experience was great!  The way they keep activities separated made it feel like it wasn't crowded at all.  The water park has ample seating spaces and activities for our beginning swimmers. One regret was that we didn't get to experience the water park both days, check in and  check out day which would have capped and otherwise great value; our fault. Definitely coming back!

Resort was clean, staff was friendly, water park rides were awesome and food was very good. Considering room prices, It seemed a little understaffed in the service areas outside the water park. We will define my return when they offer special pricing.

The water park and hotel are clean. They only have a few slides for big kids inside. The wave pool and lazy river are small and shallow. I will recommend this park for families with children 10 and under. The stay per night during the weekend after fees and taxes is close to $500, per room or family of 4. The restaurants had a long wait. It took me 45 minutes to get breakfast from Dunkin Donuts.

Summary Heading: Family vacation gone sour due to improper billing
Summary: Check your final bill! Anyone can erroneously charge items back to your room! They give you a wrist band but come to find out people can just give a name and room number to have items charged to the room and staff will tell you this always happens and they just compare the receipts for signatures? Seriously?? I can't even tell you how many people out loud would tell the bartender their name and room number for all to hear and scammers easily just pick up the details and use it to their advantage!

Went to celebrate my daughter's 10th birthday this past weekend. We did the mobile check-in and was able to get in to our room before 2 PM which was a plus as it made for more time to do other activities. Room was spacious and clean. Loved the arrival gift for the family, wolf ears, and a special birthday pair for my daughter with a birthday hat. The resort is tailored towards families with kids and the atmosphere was great. My kids had a blast. We will definitely be going back.

The room's sink faucet hot and cold switched so my kids got hurt when they washed the hands!!  This is a serious safety issues!!  The room does not provide the luggage rack, I have to put my luggage on the table.

Terrible, overpriced for what it is, WAY too many people. Glorified Motel 6 with a water park. You will suffocate from the smell of chlorine in the water park. Mediocre overpriced food. Money pit for parents.

Had a great time! Bathrooms were not very clean. The kids had a great time at the dance party and the quest. We had fun at the bowling ally and water area.We would have liked for the out side pool to stay open longer because of the warm day. The food overall was good and there was lots to choose from.

For the kind of money that was spent on a room for 24 hours accommodations should be considered possibly a future room discount I visit your hotel often as I am in Southern California resident and 10 minutes away

Summary Heading: Waterpark was fun for all ages.
Summary: over all the experience was ok. When I looked at the website it showed a lot more activities at the Lodge during afternoon and evenings. My grandkids are 3 and 5. There was coloring, but they ran out of paper. Storytime was not very good. Arcades were very expensive and too difficult.

1 day stay in sufficient...............  unless you do not get to experience waterparks often enough.  It is a bit stuffy since it is indoors, better ventilation is needed.  However, the kids enjoyed themselves so that is all that mattered :)

Wonderful place to take the kids entertainment wise. They'll have fun from beginning to end. However, room accomidations are not worth the price. Our suite was missing the room number and since their numbering system is not in numerical order it was a mess. One of the kids bed's had dirty sheets and half of the appliances were broken.

We love staying and will keep on coming back at Great wolf. It was so much fun for the whole family. The whole place is clean and well maintained. The rooms are spacious and clean. Not only your kids but your whole family will enjoy.

Family & friends had a great time at Great Wolf Lodge.  We visited on a Thursday and Friday night and were able to experience all the slides without very long lines.  I was impressed by the life guard staff and how conscientiously they monitored all the pool areas.

We had a really good time with our kids.  My only complaint would be the restaurants/food service. It's highly overpriced for the amount of food and quality you get.  It's not affordable to eat there as a family!

Summary Heading: Great fun for a hefty price
Summary: The standard rooms are superbasic. Be prepared to spend, but your kids will have a blast!I went in a Thursday/Friday so the lines weren't terrible, however, there was a line for everything i.e. Dunking doughnuts, check in, and the water park.

We have a 6 and 7 year old boys who absolutely loved playing at the waterpark. It really is fun for the kids. The hotel itself is clean and the staff are friendly. The rooms are reasonably sized and clean. However the layout of the hotel can make for a long walk to your room from the elevator. The waterpark itself has all sorts of fun and entertaining options for the kids to do solo, or fun for parents and kids to interact.  The downside is that there is no sort of control system to keep your child from leaving the water park area. Essentially your child could walk out and you would not know.  Everything inside the hotel is an extra charge, and some of the restaurants are very expensive. Parking is a daily fee.  We stayed for a few days and went to Disneyland during the day, and

Summary Heading: Great place for parents and kids!
Summary: We went this past weekend to celebrate our son and daughter's birthday since they're 3 weeks a part. We'd been seeing the commercials on TV for awhile so the kids were really excited to go.   We got a really good package deal for a one night stay in the wild den suite which was just enough space for the four of us. We upgraded to the bday package so when we arrived they got special Wolf ears and there was a bday poster on the door as we entered our room and a cake with balloons at the table! The kids felt sooo special!  The water park area was amazing and it wasn't too crowded for a holiday weekend, which made it even more enjoyable.   All the staff were very nice too. Oh and the food was really good too! We had a $90 credit and $40 arcade game credit so it felt like we were at

Summary Heading: Surviving a birthday party with too many kids
Summary: We celebrated my daughters birthday along with her cousins birthday here at the end of September. We decided to only do a one night stay because the prices are so high even with a 30% off promo code we received. There was 8 of us (2 Adults and 6 kids) and in total we spent about $1000 for a one night stay (Additional fees were about $100). Overall everyone had a great time and a lot of memories to take home with us. Here is how things went for me:  Tips: Bring your own water and chips (it is expensive) Bring water shoes (walking in the water park hurts your feet) and shampoo/conditioner Stay on higher floor (rooms below 7 have a lot of traffic from kids playing MagiQuest) Purchase the breakfast package  Kids under 9 need help playing the MagiQuest game Have kids wear bright

This was my family's first time to GWL. We absolutely enjoyed ourselves! With so much to do in the water park my children didn't even hint to do any of the kids activities offered. I will suggest to bring your own food. The food is quite pricey and so are the drinks. Thankfully we did just that and only had two meals at the restaurants in the lodge which cost about $90 each. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the rooms so I made sure to bring cold food items( deli sandwich fixings, hard boiled eggs, fruit and veggies with dip) lots of water and baggies of oatmeal for some breakfast. Just make sure to bring your own disposable plates, bowls and utensils.

Where do I start? When we first walked in, it was like being transported somewhere magical. The lobby was amazing and the staff at the front desk were absolutely fantastic. The lobby was very clean, very big, and smelled like cedar. It definitely takes a minute to take it all in.  Our room was really nice. Definitely not the biggest room we've stayed in, but cozy and clean with everything you need to store and warm up food. Please allow me to give the highest level of respect to the cleaning staff on the 7th floor. On our second day I was able to see firsthand how hard the staff works to get these rooms clean. I watched the staff clean and sanitize the rooms adjacent to mine, as well as get down on her hands and knees to make sure under the bed was cleaned. The cleaning staff

Summary Heading: Postal Stamps.  Something that kind of scared me.
Summary: You sold $1 postcard and had a postal drop in rhe lobby but no stamps were available to purchase.  Bummer!  I was sitting in my room when someone knocked on my door.  Before I could get of the bed to answer on of your cleaning staff employees walked in.  She did announce herself and quickly left with a quick apology.  Freaked me out that maybe she was going to come in the room and go thru our things.  The room had already been serviced hours before.  She had red hair and spoke with an accent.   Totally not cool.

Went down 9/17 through 9/19 for a 2 night stay. Thought we would give it a try since we received a 48 hour code with a great deal. The place was all we hoped it would be. We all loved the kick back environment of the lodge and the water park of course. The food at the Loose Moose breakfast was awesome (we ate there both mornings).  We will be staying often when we have to go to southern California for anything. Over all loved our stay so much that we are returning for another 2 night stay just 2 weeks after our first ever stay.

Very much recommended for family vacation the location is. near other good places to visits during your stay at greatwolf...very good place specially if you have a little one lots of activities for them to explore for sure they will enjoy in the water park you can assure they safety lots of lifeguards around watching and securing the safety of all...

Summary Heading: Great time at great wolf lodge
Summary: I took 6 guests and stayed in a non- themed suite for my 12 year old daughters birthday. The room was spacious, clean and had a huge television.  There was also a refrigerator and microwave so you can bring your own snacks and drinks to save money!  The indoor water park was awesome!! It's climate controlled and the floors are anti-slip. There is an arcade, bowling and laser games too.  Everything is inside the hotel and at night kids just run around in their PJ's. There was more than enough bed space as well, 2 per bed.  We will be back

Summary Heading: Fantastic, Fun time at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: Rooms were great, Staff was great, and the waterpark was Amazing. The price was reasonable to include the waterpark also. If you live close to Great Wolf Lodge, stop by for a tour, with big viewing windows, you can experience all the excitement happening inside. You must go here for your next vacation, you won't regret it!!

Summary Heading: Loved it but wished it was more affordable so I can come back
Summary: I absolutely loved the water park that was the best and amazing! The arcade was a little too much money, golf was awesome,  and gift shop was decent priced. Thanks again for a great time. I wish it cost less so we can come again. Storytelling wud be better if there were different stories and better songs. Better free crafts for kids too.

Summary Heading: My 3rd state - Great Wolf Lodge Resort
Summary: I have travelled to three states visiting Great Wolf Lodges.  This was a terrible experience.  People were sitting on the floor eating while waiting to check in.  Customer Service took away my $50 meal credit because I wanted this to be a cash visit only.

We enjoyed Great Wolf Lodge for the first time on my son's 9th birthday. We had a really fun time. The room was perfect size for our family of 5 and our favorite was the big yellow slide and the lazy river. We will definitely be back again soon!

This place was an absolute blast for the whole family! I love how convenient it is to use the wrist band as your room key as well as to charge things to the room - so freeing! Some of the restaurants could be better and the weird thing was that the buffet actually had the best food for the best price - who knew! The downfall is the price is so high for a room here on the weekends it's crazy.  We would go more if it was a more reasonable price.

Kids had a blast. Everything is accessible at the Lodge (food, games, arcade, bowling, spa, water park), you can literally NOT leave the place for your whole stay since everything seems to be there! there are loads of fun stuff to do for the kids. Wished the waterpark was open longer in the evening though...

This is an overly rated not adult friendly resort. I would not recommend this resort to anyone. All 6 Kids were getting sick the next day coughing up from whatever they put in the water. This place was overly crowded that there was not one seat available for adults to sit and watch kids.

Summary Heading: It's the "Disneyland" of water park for families!
Summary: This place is awesome! No sunscreen needed. Everything you need is there: candy shops, bowling, video arcades, restaurants in the earl park area and outside, actually good food (except pizza - it was gross), ice cream shop, beauty spa etc. we loved it and the kids absolutely loved it.

Summary Heading: Chicken wings fried with fathers on it
Summary: Chicken wings fried with fathers on it.the management there told me that's how there delivered, and that it's not bad for your health cause the young kids had eat a dozen of them , so he said if don't like them we will just refund the wings after I spend more 100 dollars on pizza and wings .
