We had a great time with the kids, not our first time, and definitely not our last. They treat you very well, and they make surenyou have a good time. I recommend to everyone with children. Food options are not the greatest, but everything you know and like back home is close by the neighborhood.

I took my 9 year old daughter and her best friend and they had the time of there life. So many different things for them to do. You don't have to leave the resort for anything, they have everything you need right there.  A wonderful staycation..

An excellent place for kids of all ages to have fun. Keeps everyone one busy from opening to closing All the water slides are so much fun and everyone had s fun time. My Granddaughter has been there 7 times, and already wants to go again..

Great Wolf Lodge is amazing!  There is so much to do and the ease of having the chip in your wristband was the best. I was not told upon check-in that you can also use your wristband to enter and exit the parking lot so be aware of that!

We went recently to gwl for the first time and we will definitely be back. Everything was so well thought out. You could use any source of money it didn’t have to be charged to a card. The rooms are great no matter what you got. Price for stay is pricey if you book for for a more recent stay but if you plan it out and book a few month in advance you get a great deal and it was so worth it! We will be booking our next year trip in advance again. So much fun and our kids are 4 and younger.

Summary Heading: Kids had a blast, "Lifeguards" need better training.
Summary: The kids have the best time ever! The food at the restaurants was pretty decent. However, the food in the water park area was not good at all. They wouldn't let you bring your own food in so you were forced to eat the food there.  Besides that, we had a great time!

I stayed at the hotel with my husband, son, sister, and her fiancé. The hotel was extremely clean. The staff was fantastic. We spent our day at the water and had an amazing time. The provide life jackets for the smaller children if you decide to use them. The water park was very clean as well. They have great choices for food at the hotel as well.

Had a better experience the 1st time we went. Will have to think about a 3rd visit. Discounts 2nd time around for return visit not worth it. After being there 2 time offer better return discounts. Thx

This was our 2nd visit. We had such a fun time here that we want to plan another visit. Kids age 16 months and 5 years old love it. Love all the other activities there are besides the water park. Such a family friendly resort!

Our family took a quick trip to Knotts Berry Farm and decided to try Great Wolf Lodge out for our hotel.  We ended up enjoying the hotel more than Knotts.  Amazing family hotel. We are planning a trip back and taking a few other families with.  Great Wolf Lodge, is a MUST stay, if you are going to Anaheim.

The rate for our 3 night stay was approx $2400.00 for 4 adults and 2 children aged 4 years and 7 years. Over $700.00 per night. Room was a dual occupancy style.  Ground floor, view facing driveway for deliveries therefore no privacy unless you kept the  curtains closed and had very little light as the lighting was quite dull, or leave the curtains open and have no privacy.  Waterpark is fine, however if you stay 1 night you have access to waterpark as soon as you arrive. You can then check in at 4pm. The following day, check out on time at 11am and stay till the waterpark closes. Definately the most cost effective way to enjoy the facilities.  Weekend really busy, weekdays really quiet.

YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!! Totally worth your money and time with family ;) Such a fun, clean, and great environment!! It felt so homey! We can't wait to go back!! We were saddened upon departure but all good things have to come to an end❤️

Although it's a little pricey, I believe the place is great for kids. Six of us (friends and family) stayed in one of their suite rooms which basically was an adjoining rooms that could accommodate up to 8 people. It was clean and spacious enough for all of us. Their toiletries were of high quality; towels were clean and smelled fresh.  Their concept of an indoor water park is exquisite and appropriate for kids of all ages from toddlers to teenagers alike.  The place has a restaurant, coffee shop, arcade and bowling alleys.  They hold story telling in one corner of the lobby and other fun kids activities everyday. The concept is great. During our stay, however, the sound system was not quite functioning as it was inaudible to the audience and to top it off, (on the very day we

We visited the resort for my kids birthday, they had fun and loved everything about it.  I would say its expensive staying here, maybe lower the prices on some stuff like the spa. Overall my kids had a blast.

Summary Heading: Great experience for the whole family
Summary: Activity for all ages.  Kids and parents loved the water park.  The arcade was great too.  Room was comfy but the AC was very loud and would rumble through the night.  We stayed on a Sunday checking out on a Monday so the hotel was at 40% capacity.  Lines were not long for slides which was great!

Very nice big rooms. Great food in restaurants and they dont rip you off on the food either. THe water park is nice not huge but plenty to do for little kids and big kids. The big water slides were fun and kids liked the smaller ones.

The rooms are basic. We ended up in room 740 and it was surprisingly quiet. Got a great night of sleep and i am a light sleeper. The 8:00 yoga class was only 15 minutes long and was not really of any value. Any kids over 8 will not be able to stand it. It was all girls 3-7  You should avoid the outside activities and stick to the water park. There is a window when the wipeout surf ride will let you try to ride standing up. The first hour of operation and the last hour of operation. This was by far the best activity at the water park. Highly recommend it. And my son loved the boogie boarding during normal hours.

Whether you a child or a child at heart this is the place for you.  They have it all!  Water slides that give you the thrill of a roller coaster, to a peaceful  glide around a steam.  You do not even have to be a swimmer to enjoy.   Plus the hotel offers so much more, good food, soft beds and things to keep everyone entertained.  Can not wait to go again

We live in Southern California so Great wolf was a fun weekend getaway. The water playground is so much fun for the whole family. If another great promotion comes our way, we will definitely will be coming back!

This in not just your kind of water park. 20 bucks and you come on in. Nope, you have to get a room here. and its all in doors. Everyone can have a good time here. They have adult drinks here too. The water park is open till 9:00pm. And after you check out, you can stay till 9:00pm that night. My fam had a good time here.

My 5 year old had a blast she can't wait to come back. My 16 year old wished there were more kids his age but was still able to enjoy himself. I suggest 2 days minimum to enjoy most of the festivities.

Water park is great, customer service is great, however, the park doesn't open until 10am. Our family stayed the night before and woke up early excited to swim. But there is very little to do in the hotel early in the morning other than eat at their restaurants. We wanted to play! So we had to wait around like many other families until the park opened.

If you have kids or you love to play with water this is the place for you. They have an indoor waterpark, arcade, miniature golf, restaurants, a Dunkin dounts and a quest journey for kids to enjoy all inside this big hotel. Will go again and again and again.   P.s. when you check in they give you wolf ears lol love this place

This is a wonderful family resort.  The staff is top notch.  Everyone is so friendly.  It was such a joy to walk around and see so many happy families.  We have teenage children and even they had a great time.  The family spent hours in the indoor water park, together and separately.  The water park has rides for children to adults.  They also have an awesome miniature golf course that has black lights, our teenagers loved it.  Everyone needs to see their “Northern Lights.”  The gift shop is worth the visit even without staying at the resort.  The gift shop has a great selection at reasonable prices (for a resort). There are plenty of unusual restaurants within walking distance.  We ate Thai food for the first time and loved it.  There is a refrigerator in every room, so you can

Our family went during their slow season. It made the stay more enjoyable to not have to wait in line for hours for the water slides. The hotel was impressive and the staff was very friendly. Our only disappointment was in out room. Our TV shut down on us constantly. There's only like 5 channels to choose from. Our pillows were very flat and uncomfortable. I really regretted not bringing my own. The water park was a blast. Just be prepared how hot and humid it is, in the water park. At times it was miserable so we cooled off in the wave pool. Overall, out family did have a great time. I would recommend it to other families looking for something fun to do.

Summary Heading: Book straight through great wolf lodge website!
Summary: My reservations didn't show up in the great wolf lodge system after booking through a third party website but the front desk staff took great care of me and got me into a room right away. Very helpful and very professional. Everything about my trip was great!

Overall, exceeded my expectations and have made strong recommendations to family and friends.  Everyone had a great time.  Fu at any agr and planning our next family gathering with mutliple families soon.

Fun for the whole family! Clean hotel and friendly staff. The rooms are quiet considering how many children are there. This was our second time and not our last. My son was older this time and enjoyed playing the MagiQuest game a lot! You can never be bored at GWL!

We had a wonderful, our room was clean and nice, but food VERY expensive, the menu and wine list are limited and isn't good so eat somewhere else. Waterpark and activities are targeted to younger kids. My 12 & 15 year olds were bored. I couldn't get the 7 & 9 year olds out of the water.

We brought our Grand Daughter here!! Such a GREAT place for ALL ages!!!  Margarita's for Grandma.... splashing FUN & activities for a 15 month old..... Dunkin Donut Coffee for baby's Momma!!  Fun, Fun Fun!!!!!!  LOVED Frankie @ the Front Desk!!!!  Thank you ALL!!!

Summary Heading: 5 Stars For Kids, 3 Stars For Parents
Summary: Family Profile: We're a family of 4 with 2 boys (8 & 9.5)  Ease Of Check-In: Great check in process. Their policy is 4:00 pm for check in. We arrived at 2:00 and were able to get our room. Yay!  Tip for booking: When booking your room, you might choose a room that sleeps 4-6.... but what you may not know is you'll only get bands for the water park for 4 people. Every person after 4 is charged $50 per day. If you've got more than 4 people, check rates for rooms that sleep 6-8. You might be able to get these larger better rooms for the same price as the 4-6 people room + $50 per extra person. This way, you get 6 bands AND a larger better room for about the same price. Definitely more bang for your hard earned (and even harder to save) buck!   Avoid 4th, 5th & 6th floor rooms that

The best water park / hotel. The food is so delicious (PIZZA). The water park is clean and there are always towels available! The bathrooms are clean and big. The hotel room is beautiful! I have a 2 year old and a 7 month old and they had a BLAST! OVERALL THE BEST EXPERIENCE!

Lost of things for the entire family to do. Free activities for the kids to do, arcade, (extra), Magiquest Game, (extra), different food options, ice cream parlor, pizza place, buffet, bowling, (extra), drinks for adults. The buffet was ok, we ate there twice for dinner and once for breakfast. You do have to pay extra for a lot of things, but you pretty know that going in. It is pricey, but our overall experience was a good one. We got a standard room, otherwise we would have paid about and extra $300. We took advantage of the Heroes promotion, but I expected it to be a better deal on the price. Overall, it was fun.

It's spendy. Unless you have an unlimited income source, be prepared to save up a long time for this one. It will be worth it, though. Such a great time had by all in our family; Grandparents, Parents, and the kids all agree, we all had a blast here. It was worth the sacrifice of saving up for our visit. Would definitely do it again. Tip: if you have asthma medication BRING IT. The indoor water park has strong smell of chlorine in the air-as it must, so be prepared to need inhaler.

it was everything almost perfect until you need to go bed because beds are terrible very bad for that only thing. Food is ok there are a lot of places around that you can go walking in less than 5 minutes

Overall good place. Great idea for kids to enjoy the pool even when cold outside. Only disappointed that room was ready late, pool was cold for baby,, early check out. Felt that little bit was overpriced for what I got.  By the way the pillows in the room so uncomfortable , did not sleep well and after, had horrible neck pain and spasm  for 2 days after sleeping on those pillows.

Overall a great time hope to come back and this time change my grandson in the pool area so he won't get sick I think it was too cold for him walking wet to the room! Had a  amazing time except for me grandson getting so sick!

This place is not what it seems. First off it is TOO DARN EXPENSIVE! The water area is HOT and Stuffy. I felt like I couldn't breath , definitely not good for someone who's claustrophobic. The water was cloudy and so much Chlorine in the water. My eyes kids kept complaining that there eyes were burning.       As for the rooms, in the kids DEN area, our T.V. in the room was not working and the light in the kids DEN would not turn on at night.                                                                                   Overall, I am very disappointed with the stay here

This indoor water park is the best.  Geared to all ages and really makes sure the kids have a great time.   Dress comfortable, you are at a water park.  The food was great. I like the wrist bands, because you don't have to worry about your room key and can have your credit card linked to wrist band.  Going back next year, for a howling great time!!!

We had better experience with other water parks in Southern California. First of all i was expecting a lot more from our staycation. It was a bit pricey we spend $319.00 for 1 night and was told we can use the waterpark at 1PM and finding out later on that they open at 9AM!...We were bummed because we couldve use the park more if they told us that since in the afternoon all the rides have long lines already. On top of this the place is so humid and dry. I know its an indoor water park but it couldve been nice for them to place huge fans just to have some air in.

Summary Heading: Great family trip just be aware of the Hidden costs
Summary: The hotel is beautiful and is basically like a casino for children. If the room is 200 night expect to pay another $100-150 in fees and and taxes, parking, And that's for the cheap room. This is a great place to go for a couple of nights if you do not plan on going to Disneyland there is a lot to do. My kids had a blast. This hotel is a very clean and very well decorated and the staff were all very kind. My only recommendation is at they lower the prices of the arcade games which was a dollar to $2 per play. We will definitely go back. We knew it was going to be a pricey trip but to watch our kids enjoy themselves to that level is pretty amazing. Our kids are 7, 9 and 2.

Disappointing to say the least. The accommodations are less than desirable (hard beds, crappy rooms, very poor quality food,etc), the water park water was very cold during our visit. My 6year old was shivering with purple lips and spent most of her time in the toddler section because it was the only reasonably warm water. The staff is mediocre at best. Not a great birthday weekend for my child. I do not recommend Great Wolf Lodge.

I recommend Great Wolf for any family! The staff is polite, courteous, helpful and always so positive! There were so many attractions, rides and entertainment throughout the day that we could not get through everything. Next time I will reserve more than a weekend! The kids were so happy and had the best time! It's perfect for a birthday party too!

My family cannot wait to return to the Great Wolf Lodge. We all had a great time and an overall great experience. The water park is awesome and the hotel is huge. There was always something to do and there was never a boring moment. The staff was awesome.

Family friendly.  Memorable time.  Overpriced food but its the convenience of not having to drive out of the resort.  Our time spent was just one night, but we already want to come back again.  They made my son feel special for his birthday.

The beds were comfy, no back aches. The variety of slides for all ages was excellent. The resort is definitely geared toward kids.  Excellent family vacation! Fun for all ages. Plenty of activities to choose from.  My husband and I had a blast.  Shrimp Tacos from the outdoor grill were amazing.  Be prepared when you go though, pool hours were 11am-5pm! That was pretty much the only disappointment.  Waterpark hours were better, 10am-8pm...at least while we were there.  Convenience of restaurants and food was great. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We plan on returning and making it an annual vacation!

My 2-1/2 year old grandson and I stayed at this lodge for three days and two nights.   Cons: It is going to cost you a lot of money.   Pros: So many!  The check in was easy. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. The check out was automatic. You just need to be out of the room by 11am.  The park is a wonderland that has something for every age. There is an area outside (for younger kids but it also has a bar) but we stayed inside most of the time.  They have a snack bar in the water park with a good selection of kid's foods and some healthy adult choices. In the hotel, but just outside the waterpark doors, they have a pizza place too.   They will connect your credit card to your wristband, if you want, and it makes everything efficient and easy. We left the room

undersized park for all the guests that were crammed into facility is not a well planned concept. For the price of the stay we should feel luxury, instead it felt packed like sardines. I thought Disneyland had long lines, but GWL has them beat. A 2 star room for a 5 star price. Long lines for check in also, just did not feel anything convenient about our visit.
Manager Response: Anup, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We sincerely apologize for the lines you encountered in the water park.  A member of our leadership has reached out to you via email to discuss your stay in greater detail.  We hope you will consider staying with us again after you connect.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Our friend's son celebrated his birthday here so we all booked rooms with other friends and stayed overnight.  There were a lot of water rides and the waiting was not too bad. I think we tried all the rides. Everyone in our group of 20+ enjoyed from grandparents to little kids. Apart from the waterpark, there's an arcade inside.  We ate at the Loose Moose all you can eat restaurant at Great Wolf and the buffet was not bad. There are also restaurants outside if you don't feel like eating inside all day. We also got some Dunkin Donuts for breakfast and the line was pretty long.  I would recommend this park for anyone looking to have a great time and don't mind the smell of chlorine and getting wet.

Awesome place to take the kids at any age. The hotel part was very clean and the rooms were spacious. Kids could stay busy at this place for days. When we got home from the trip my son was already asking when we were going back.

Great fun place for adults and kids. We celebrated a birthday and the kids had fun the whole time going on slides, swimming, and playing in the arcade. We even went miniature golfing at night. Ready to go back already

Very friendly staff, great activities and prices are reasonable. Only issues were the food. The burgers had a funky smell and taste. While at the ice cream shop we were given stale and old ice cream cones. Great environment for kids and family.

Summary Heading: Excellent time at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: We had such a great time here. Great family vacation. Food was great, room was clean and waterpark was so much fun! We will definitely plan a trip back to this location next summer for a mini vacation.

Great place to spend a family vacation! Super recommend it to all families I already want to go back ! Love that there is plenty of food inside hotel no need to go out to eat, my kids loved it definitely going back !

Stayed Thurs-Sun in a basic family room. The room was really spacious for being the most basic accommodations. Plenty of room for our family of 5 to sprawl out and recover every night. The fridge and microwave were a great value and we were able to eat breakfast and lunch in the room.  The main draw is of course the waterpark and I have to say that I've never seen lifeguards who are more attentive. During our stay a boy needed to be rescued from the wave pool and the response from the lifeguard was amazing. Within a split-second of identifying the situation, she dove in, pulled him out, and had him on land. The attraction was shut down for several minutes so that staff members could investigate. Really, very efficient!! I felt completely at ease knowing they were on the job!!

Haven't received $50 deposit back. Trying to contact the hotel for over 2 weeks, only able to leave many messages  but no one replies. I also sent the email and left VM for a manager. So frustrating! !!

Summary Heading: Management needs to work on communication!!
Summary: Obviously the waterpark is a lot of fun! My kids love it!! I would give the waterpark by itself 5 stars. The issue I have is with GWL's communication with its guests.   First issue, I called GWL to pay the balance for my room but when I arrived to check in I was told that I owed an additional $100. I wasn't too happy with that surprise. Why wasn't I told about the $100 when I called the first time?   Second issue, I was told the morning before and the morning of that the water park opens at 10am. Around 9:20, as my kids were eating breakfast, someone came by and told us that the water park had opened at 9am! So my kids ate their breakfast as fast as they could and got their bathing suits on in a hurry so they could hit the slides. If I had known that actual opening time, my kids

Summary Heading: Lifeguards need to be trained in customer service
Summary: Especially the bag check and height check staff. They are the FRONT lines, the first impressions entering the water park and they really leave a BAD taste in our mouth, almost ruining your time with their horrible attitudes!  Front desk and registration/check in staff were all so friendly and great to speak with, it is unfortunate they do not have the same quality of staff/training inside the water park.  DO NOT even think that being exactly 41.5" will allow your child to get the opportunity to ride the 42" rides even with both parents. They didnt even BOTHER trying to measure our child, they can apparently by sight see that there is a half an inch discrepancy to automatically assume they are not tall enough for the yellow 42" band.  Yes, it is for the safety of the guests, I

It was great to go to a water park and not have to worry about sun screen the hole time. he rooms were cozy and the staff was nice.  It was a great staycation. a little expensive for just 1 night but still worth it.

Good for a family of all ages.  lines are a bit long for the slides, more rafts needed for Howlin' Tornado.  The food at all the restaurants is very good, the buffet was delicious with a great variety of food.

Summary Heading: 5 as a child 3 as a parent
Summary: The kids loved,loved,loved it everything from the water park to the story time and dance party. They had fun at the morning walks and the daily activities. As a parent of 2 and although hubby was also there it's almost impossible to keep your eyes on them at all times especially in he water so it is great to have so many lifeguards at each attraction the only bad part is not all of them are as great. One lady saw a little boy struggling to stay up during the waves at the beach and helped him to the stairs on the side but the lifeguard just made him get back off, she told her he was having trouble and she didn't care, another lady grabbed him and pulled him to the exit but had they left it upto the lifeguard he would've probably drowned.  Also, being that you're asked if your

Summary Heading: Tons of fun for little kids
Summary: Spent a night here and we all had lots of fun in the waterpark. We went on a weekday, so it was not crowded at all but the crowd came in when we checked out on Friday. Kids enjoyed the water slides at Fort Mackenzie with its big bucket of falling water and the water guns. Only complaint at the waterpark - washroom/changing room though was clean, had some drain flies in it. We had meal at Wood Fired Grill, of course it's not comparable to Lucille's, it's not bad either. but Price is a little on the high side due to the convenience of not having to leave the lodge. Room is bare with only basic amenities, I found a small old stain on the bedsheets and the dining table had a thick layer of dust when I wipe it. Overall, it's still an awesome experience, but I wouldn't pay full price

Summary Heading: Eye irritation within an hour of being at the waterpark
Summary: Beware when visiting the indoor waterpark, chlorine levels are beyond imaginable. Granted the kids won't understand, but their health will deteriorate. Also, smaller than the other great wolf lodges I've visited and nowhere near the eye irritation and coughing I had experienced. Rooms were average, food was subpar, and fountain drinks were average. I wouldn't visit this location again. Good luck!

We have been to three GWLs now and this one, the newest, stood out in someways.  The Great,  - The staff, with the glaring exception of the restaurant staff, was awesome. Check in was friendly and fast (mind you we checked in later), with a staff member giving arcade cards to my kids which was nice. The lifeguards would play rock/paper/scissors and such with the kids while they waited for slides and seemed genuinely happy. The arcade staff gave extra tickets and helped my kids win games. The salon staff went above and beyond to make my daughter to feel like a princess. Unlike every other GWL I have been too, the staff was a stand out.  -The waterpark is clean ,and well laid out. Has lots of tables and lots of varieties of slides.  -The breakfast buffet was good and a good value

Summary Heading: Great place for kids not for your pocket!
Summary: I stayed in the middle of the week and yet I paid $475 per night, my kids had a blast which is what matters but I am not going back unless there is an offer of at least 30% discount. Overall it was an OK experience!!!

Arrived early and was able to go to the waterpark but never received the text/email that room was ready. Went to the front desk after 5pm to find the system didn't work. Found a doughnut hole under the table in our room (we never bought doughnuts)

Price from what I thought I would be paying ,ended up being way more than quoted price. kids had a good time. smells like pure chlorine in slide area. Room is clean and spacious. Staff was friendly. it'd be nice to be told of activities on site.

We are definitely coming back. Only complaint is that the vending machines and inside stores were overpriced. The restaurants were not in my opinion high-end, but it had high-end pricing. The vending machines had the cheapest item at 3 dollars. $3 for a soda is unreasonable.

Our first time at Great Wolf Lodge. We'll definitely be going back. The place is massive. Everything is clean and well taken care of. Staff is very attentive and friendly.  Lots of activities for the smaller kids.  Food is delicious.

Life has been so crazy, so we packed up the family for a 20 minute drive and had a blast.  The staff was wonderful and the food was sooo good.  The water park didn't fail. There was something for everyone.

Summary Heading: Decent accommodations although fun for the kids
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge is a fun place for the kids without a doubt. However, due to the price which was over $500 for the night I would say that it is overpriced. The rooms were small even though we stayed in a suite. It was decent.

Summary Heading: Great family venue, but service less than stellar
Summary: My family of 5 (myself, husband and 3 boys ages 10, 13, and 15) had a great time, but the service at this resort and the value for what you pay for could use substantial improvement. Restaurant options were limited (we walked a block away to have Vietnamese food at a local shopping center) and the cost of entertainment was crazy -- $30 for only 120 gaming points at the arcade with each game costing about 6-8 points. My kids went through their games cards in less than an hour! Water park is clean, slides and wave pool were fun. Food service and bar at the water park were decent. Room was clean, but a slight stench from the refrigerator section (only noticeable if you lean over the fridge), TV in Kids Cabin was broken and had to call front desk 3 times to get someone to come up

The service was ok. My grand-daughter enjoyed The Den (bunk beds were a little squeaky) The location was great.  We didn't get to take advantage of all the activities, but we will return to get the full experience.

Summary Heading: Very poor first impression when check in.
Summary: for what you charge the service at the front desk should be first class. It took us 35 minutes to check in, with a non friendly, mechanical Staff. Lack of Guest interaction, we didn't fell welcome. The water park and theme suite were great. I received invitation to do on line check in, a day after my stay.

Expect to stay till next day and enjoy another day at the water park.Take extra clothes and have the kids get wet for a few hours before leaving. Who wouldn't want another day at the pool! Very safe to leave stuff in chairs and wonder around.

Overpriced you will get charged lots of additional fees. So when you book take that in consideration. They really need to bump their game when it comes to healthy food options. Cheap cheap is what they are about so if you are a mindful eater and care for your health and your child's plan not to eat their at all. Minimal vegetarian/vegan options healthy snacks are hard to find.  The kids enjoyed the amenities, thus the stars. It was my sons birthday and they don't accommodate that at all. You'd think that at a child inspired resort they'd at least but a balloon in the room a card or something but on top of their high prices you need to pay for that. I understand paying for a cake or something but really?  Just found it weird that the staff couldn't answer any questions.... such

I had a horrible experience with the water park staff and at the wood fire restaurant the BBQ Platter is disgusting.I have never written a review before but for the price people should be treated better.

Summary Heading: The strength of the pack is not the wolf.
Summary: We decided to finally go to the Great Wolf Lodge.  We took our little girl there for her birthday and she had a blast.   They lodge is huge and the entrance into it is, grand.  So many eateries in there.  It would warrant us to go back there again. They have their own Dunkin Donuts shop in house. (get there early or call in an order for pickup). The lines get long. The pros:  All the pools are great.  I could have spend all day in the boogie boarding if they let multiple people on there.  That was a blast!  The Wave pool is cool.  If you have children(under 4) The best place we found were the little kids pools(inside and out). I spent most of my time with my little one in these pools. The slide pools(The best one was the yellow one).  Had a blast going down this one with my

Summary Heading: Water park is fun. The hotel/resort is not great.
Summary: The water park is a lot of fun.  The kids also had fun with the Magi quest activity.  The food and wine are not good at all. Even in their "nice" restaurant.  Additionally, that restaurant and bar area  is way too brightly lit.  No ambience whatsoever.  They have nailed the kid experience, but there is nothing great for the adults.  If we come again, we would stay at a different hotel and just use the water park.

An amazing vacation add on that I will make sure to make part of our future family vacations. Very family oriented and extremely clean. My kids were 3 year old twins and 6 and had the time of their lives. Lots of other activities we never got to because they loved the water park so much. Looking forward to returning soon.

Don't waste $ on themed rooms or eating upstairs.  Water park is great and there's also an outdoor pool area.  Staff service is phenomenal and very accommodating.  Food and games are good downstairs and beds are very comfortable.  Excellent deal when you consider that the water park tickets are included, you don't wait long for the rides and you get two days of the park for only one night of hotel.

Perfect but humid inside. Not too busy and very friendly and attentive. My son had a great birthday there. Check in was earlier then they described. It's nice you can enjoy the water park the following day as well but you'll probably be burnt out lol

Great place to spend quality time with the family.   Fun activities,  Friendly attractions for all ages.  Good location, different stores and restaurants near by.  Not overcrowded, so you get to enjoy the attractions.

Great Fun!  The water park was exceptional, enjoying water activities and no sunscreen needed.  It was so hot out so it is nice to have indoor water amusement.  Friendly people and staff.  I would come back again.

From the check in to check out everything went great. Service was outstanding. All my questions and concerns were answer. Staff were very friendly. I will definitely be coming back soon. Great place for family with kids.

The worst indoor water park in the world. Huge lines, loud, overcrowded, not enough tubes or equipment. Cheap hotel rooms, miles of hallways to elevator. Unprofessional service. Having other indoor water park experience this one was a sad disappointment.

This was our last day in SoCal and we debated a lot about what to do. We had already done Disney, Legoland X2, Sea World and San Diego Zoo. We were staying in Carlsbad and debated between Aquatica and Knotts. The weather was calling for a very hot day so I searched online for water parks. Reviews for Aquatica were not great and the Knotts water park was closed and the rides park was not appealing given it was supposed to be really warm but I did come across this spot in my search. I called the hotel and you could not take a day pass, however, they had a great rate for the night at $199 with $50 dining credit so with taxes and fees it was $272. We decided to book it and header north. We got there at around 10am and our room was ready. We got out 4 waterpark bracelets as well as

We have a 19 yr old, a 3yr old, and an 8 month old. Our 19 yr old liked the arcade and the bigger slides of course. Our 3 yr old is mildly autistic and has a severe speech delay, so more like a 2 yr old. She did enjoy wading around in the indoor and outdoor kiddie area, but I think she would have had more fun if she was a year older. She was too scared to go on any of the slides, and they don't allow parents to hold children on their laps on the slides for safety reasons. My husband and I took turns going on the slides and definitely had fun. We rented an outdoor cabana, so that we didn't have to go back to the room to get stuff for the kids and to get out of the scorching sun. Though it was still hot in the cabana, it was nice to have our own little private  space to relax and

We saw that great wolf was on Groupon so we decided to snag the deal and spend some family time together. Hotel appearance was amazing. So much to see and do. First day (Monday) the water park was crazy crowded but Tuesday was perfect. We enjoyed our time and the staff was great. Beds in room were comfy and hotel was clean.

We had a great time. Our kids said they liked this place even more than Disney land! I suggest going on a weekday during school months, as it gets pretty busy even having only hotel guests and not open to the public

We went on a staycation with our 6 and 3 year old and had a blast! Best water park we've been to. Clean, great activities and friendly staff. There were lots of activity options to keep the kids occupied the entire time day/night so you don't have to leave the site. We will be back!

We have been to Great Wolf Lodge twice in the past two months with different friends and we loved every minute of it. Staff is very friendly and service was great. Will definitely return again. Thank you Great Wolf Lodge!

Its a nice place, but please Change your sheets after each gest that checks out, ask the customer would you like for me to take your bags to your room. The water park is nice we all had a good time i will come back soon.

Overall a great experience.  My girls (8 and 10) loved it.  Spent hours in the waterpark...it wasn't too crowded for the most part although the slide lines could get long.  Lockers start at $15 so beware!  Food was decent, people get so hung up on this but it was passable, you are definitely not there for a gourmet experience.  Dunkin Donuts was awesome to have in the lobby.  Kids loved the MagiQuest and I was really impressed with it as well.  We finished but took probably 6 hours total.  Arrived at 12:30 and our room was ready (mid week, keep in mind), and although we checked out at 11 the next day we stayed until 4 to finish the quest and use the waterpark.  Mini golf was okay, the arcade was fine too.  Everything was expensive, so plan to spend more if you want to do any of

Summary Heading: Wolf Lodge is the best place to have fun with the family!
Summary: This was our first visit to Wolf Lodge. My kids had a great time on the watersides and other activiteis at the resort. It's a great place to have fun with the entire family. The indoor waterpark has slides/areas for all ages. Can't wait to be back and have more fun!

Had such an amazing time here. The water park was great, rooms were comfortable and the service was pleasant. Prices for meals and other activities were a bit on the high side. Loved the exclusivity of the resort and that the room keys and credit cards were linked to a braclet so you could roam the hotel without carrying a lot of things. We will for sure be back again!

Wow.  What could have been a ten was a five or less.  Great rooms, great staff, great activities. The worst pizza we ever had in our lives - greasy on top, soggy beyond belief on bottom. We had to use a bath towel to dry it out. And the fancy dinner at the Lodge restaurant wasn't even up to Sizzler standards. We expected a nice fine dining experience for the price and per the online advertisement.

Fun for the kids and relaxing enough for adults, though the water park is crowded on weekends. We appreciated that our room was available for an early check in. Food options are better outside the resort.

The water park was amazing. Food at the bar and grill inside the water park was gross. The bartender was rude. But over all we had a great time. I will be coming back very soon. The front desk personals need better training.

This is a fun place for sure our whole family had a blast!  However I believe they can do a better job cleaning this facility.  The restrooms are disgusting, and our room had not been cleaned nor vacuumed we found candy foil wrappers and sunflower seeds on the carpet.  The pull out smelled like vomit!

The Great Wolf Lodge is an Awesome place.. Many activities for all age ranges, every one of my 5 grandchildren enjoyed themselves.. Definitely a return trip in the planning.  Waterpark a MUST! Food is great in every location.

We love GW. Wish it is more affordable as for the rooms and in-house food. The environment is very relaxed and they have a variety of activities that will keep the entire family entertained. Love GW!!

this is our second time visiting the place and still we are loving it... and will be back again.. all the staff were accommodating... we didn't get bored, a lot of things to do.. Great wolf is for all ages.. Keep It Up!

Requested a room near the water park and ended up 2nd to the last room in our floor. Mentioned that this was a surprise bday gift to our child who wanted to go to Great Wolf Lodge since she saw our friends' kids celebrated their birthdays there. No poster or anything. We ended up asking for the headbands and no staff offered them during check in. While she was in the lazy river, her bracelet become loose and lost. We saw the bracelet floating but unable to grab it. Told and pointed to the lifeguard on duty what happened. Was advised to go to front desk for replacement. Went to front desk and advised we need to pay $50 for the replacement. Ofcourse, we were upset though in the end we got one replacement for free. It just ruined the excitement and the happiness of our child

We stayed on a Sunday and Monday. 3 Adults with 1 6year old.   Arrival - Arrived at 1pm. Rooms are not ready till 4pm. Valet Parking was excellent. Went to Front Desk and were told that we would receive a text when room was ready. Called desk at 3;30 to check on room and were told room was ready. Proceeded to room to find Housekeeping cleaning the room. Were told to return in 15 mins. We waited at Outdoor Pool.  Room - Nice size room for our crew. Very clean and well organized. Coffee pot, Skittles and water. No issues what so ever with room. Room 206  Water Park - Outdoor Park was nice. Clean fresh air. Pool was very crowded. But kids loved it. Got a hold of a table and chairs which were hard to come by. Out door bar were adults could get a cold beer along with other drinks for

Great place to set the kids free! Great staff, very clean rooms and lots of things to do. No long lines for the rides. Will always recommend to friends and family. Keep an eye out for specials on the web.

My family and I truly enjoyed ourselves during our stay.  We had no idea the waterpark was so large.  There are areas that accommodate the smallest child in the group all the way up to the thrill seeking adults.  We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was very well priced and had an amazing selection of items.  Everything was fresh and constantly changed out to make sure it was full. The story time was a little on the boring side, I Think they could've used a bit more interaction, especially to keep the smaller kids entertained.  We had a great time and will definitely return.

Summary Heading: GO ONE TIME, THAN THINK ABOUT A SECOND TRIP.
Summary: Very Good Lodge. To Close To Disneyland. Prices Are To High For Everything. Very Good Staff. Plenty Of Stuff To Do. Lodge Is Very Clean. They Do Take Care Of Any Problems. The Water Park Is Great. Feels Like Florida Inside The Water Park.

perfect family vacation with little kids. very kid freindly .  the water park was big and age appropriate for different ages,  the rooms were big and clean including a mini kitchen with microwave and fridge

Don't go.  That is my tip.  Terrible service and filthy.  The place was so busy, that you had to muscle your way around anywhere, even to get a table to sit and eat.  The customer service was beyond bad.  DON'T GO!

Summary Heading: Fun and nice but beware of chemicals in the pool
Summary: Kids had fun. Bunk bed was totally worth it for my kids.  Wish they had better air circulation because my eyes were burning from the chlorine and my kids eyes were irritated. After we left the water park, my kids started coughing and sneezing including my husband who spent most of time with them. Kids had fun and want to go back so we really hope they work on air/water quality.

Our pack (Grandma, friend, and 2 granddaughters) had a wonderful time at the Great Wolf Lodge. We had a Wolf Den room, so the little girls had a bunk bed inside a cave/den with its own TV and cozy feel.  There was so much to do, we barely scratched the surface in the 2 days we were there.  I'd recommend a longer stay, except we wore ourselves out at the water park!  The water park is huge and has literally something for all ages.  Everything looked clean and well cared for.  We enjoyed ourselves a lot!

We had a great stay.  My kids love the water park.  And all of the other activities are funable oo, but a little pricey.  Our room was very nice.  Although at least one light didn't work.  I wastill surprised to have that in that hotel.  The Waterpark was a lot of fun.  The stairs getting into the pool by the basketball hoops were very slippery.  I slipped getting into that pool and bruised my feet and legs pretty bad.  They needed some kind of anti slip stuff in them and /or a sign.

We stayed here for 1 night but get to play for 1.5 days.  We had a great time playing in the water park.  Very fun.  The water is sort of "heated" but not that hot, maybe it's because it's summer time.  It's a little expensive but with the 60 days advance deal, it's not too bad since waterpark fee is included.

Summary Heading: Had so much fun! Excellent resource for family time!
Summary: Had so much fun! Excellent resource for family time! So much to do and see! Loved being able to lay outside In the sun as well! We will definitely make another trip! Thank you Great Wolf Lodge for an amazing time!

Great family environment. Very accommodating facility. Worth every penny spent.   The family had a great experience.  The water park was excellent.   The food was awesome. The family enjoyed their stay at Great wolf Lodge.

little bit pricey, but really well maintained facility, good programms for kids, safe environment, not big lines for rides, grill restaurants menu could be bigger, but quality of food is very good, we all liked specialty cocktails been served

Summary Heading: Clean and spacious room, fun waterpark
Summary: First time staying at this resort. Went with my family of four. I was impressed with the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room. The water park was a lot of fun for all. There was also free kids activities available each day so there was plenty to do. Also great location.

This was a wonderful place for family. They have everything you need in one place. Wrist bands helped out a lot to from buying your food to buying products. Food wss good at all there Restutants very tastey.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge is a fun in a box!
Summary: Our family really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious and large. There were many food options and different proce lointd. The food was all very delicious! All the staff was super hospitable. We look for to our next stay!!

We took the 4 grand kids to the Great Wolf Lodge for an overnight stay before school starts.  My grand kids ages are 4,5, 9 and 13.  Something fun and exciting for all of them.  They had a fantastic time. Fun slides for adults too.

Summary Heading: Great place to take the whole family from old to young we all had a great time
Summary: Rooms are clean staff very friendly very safe for kids my advice is to eat out there is s little expensive there is slot of places to eat on harbor and can go to Target down the street to get snacks for the famil

My family and I had a great experience. I traveled with a 2 year old and a 5 month old. They both enjoyed it. My toddler loved the water park. I loved that the kiddie area was only 2 ft deep. We enjoyed the activities they have in the lobby. Our favorite was making buttons cute little souvenir made by the kids. I do recommend getting a pass (depending on the kids age you can get a pup paw or wolf pass) Making a bear was fun it comes with a scavenger hunt activity that has you running around. Over all our experience was GREAT!

This is like Vegas for kids. The water park alone will keep you busy but when you've had enough chlorine for the moment there's characters and story time and bowling and mini golf. You will sleep hard which is good because the beds aren't the most comfortable but the rooms are nice size and clean.

Summary Heading: A lot of fun, but very expensive
Summary: We had a great time but spent a ton of money. My kids and I really enjoyed it but it was just too much money for the amount of time we spent there. The staff are very friendly and the resort is clean.

The rooms were cute, but didn't see the sign until later that the room was interactive.  The deco on the wall started talking and scared our toddler and us! The water park felt dirty.  There were used bandades on the ground with no one going around and cleaning and sweeping to keep it cleaned.

Great wsteroark, room wasn't clean. We love the place, it is our second time. I wish they would make sure the rooms are clean, although you spend most of your time st the water park. It is the best place for kids. I would recommend to bring food with you or order in as the the food there is not the greatest.

We didn't really like the fist trip and we gave it a second chance. This second trip was worse than the first. My kids said they don't want to go back there. Overall, we were disappointed in many ways!

Horrible staff service.  Overpriced resort with bad services and amenities.  Spent over $700 for two nights and was not worth it.  Water park smell horrible, housekeeping came after 5pm, waited 40 mins for bell service.

The hotel was a great set up the staff all. Dry nice, after saving for a year this was pur family staycation but everything so over priced, all activities a bit much, the beds so hard very uncomfortable f the pull out much worse if the blood doesn't rush to your head as you sleep at a very bad angle

Summary Heading: Fun times at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We really had a great time. Friendly and helpful service and lots of fun at the water park. The kids really enjoyed the wave pool and water slides. The food at the buffet was amazing with lots of fresh fruits.

Summary Heading: We did it, don't need to go back
Summary: Overall, my children (10 & 12) had a great time on the slides. The magiquest games were a bit juvenile for them, but I could see a younger child being excited about that. The water park was over crowded at the time we went, which would have been ok if it was staffed properly. There was only one attendant to service 4 different rides on one level and 2 attendants servicing 3 very popular slides on another level. If there had been one attendant per slide, the lines would have had a significantly reduced wait time. The body board wave ride was over an hour wait. That has got to be run more efficiently. The bathrooms in the waterpark area were dirty and the toilet was overflowing, I had to find a staff member to notify them. The beds were uncomfortable, the restaurant food was

On day of check out we were still allowed to stay at the water park, I left my bracelet at the TV stand..the bracelet that was given to me by one of my good friends from college, has a sentimental and spiritual value..called the lodge, left a message, no call back! Filed a report, auto report came back states none found! I am certain it was at the TV stand just below the safe!..when we checked in we had to ask housekeeping to change the bedsheets because it was stained and their excuse was the washer and dryer!

We celebrated my daughter's 5th birthday weekend and my family had a blast. I appreciated that they had a toddler and baby area for my 2 year old but the park is better enjoyed by kids 5 and above. The lifeguards were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Good but could have been better
Summary: Our experience was good overall. There is friendly and responsive staff who provided great information and direction throughout our stay. I water park offered a variety of age appropriate activities and was a blast. The pajama dance party was awesome and so was the Moose lodge dinner buffet. Overall I would recommend this place.  There were 4 negatives I will comment on: While showering my kids I noticed our shower drain was clogged with hair and soap bars. I was disguised and called the front desk. The staff was responsive and resolved the issue but I would have thought a manager would have responded.   The temperature of the resort (other than the waterpark) is cold so packing a sweater for wearing after being in the water park is a must.  The story time show was a waste of

Summary Heading: Safe, clean fun for kids and adults
Summary: If you're a parent of elementary school children, you know how tough it is to find an activity that's fun for all the kids and the parent. Great Wolf Lodge is just that. The water park is clean and has rides at all thrill levels from toddler to insane (although the park is geared mostly towards families with kids under 12 years old) - most are indoors so you're shielded from the weather (although being in Southern California does that too) and the water is warmed to a comfortable temperature. Towel service is included and they don't seem to run out of towels no matter how quickly people go through them. The lifeguards are excellent and vigilant. I witnessed a very embarrassed teenager getting tossed around by the wave pool and the lifeguards immediately noticing and jumping in

For our first experience it was a good one beside us having to wait for a very long time for our room and our bathroom tub not being so clean. We waited a very long time for our room to be ready I even offered to pay extra just for us to have a early check but they say there is no fee for early check but you have to wait until the housekeeping is down. But come to find out after it was was after 4:00 the room we was suppose to be in was not ready we had to get new wrist bands and then wait for a phone call or a email when I New room would be ready

Summary Heading: Great fun for adults and kids of all ages
Summary: Great place for kids and adults without worrying about sun.   Convenient that our bracelet allows us access to pool,  room and payment for other purchases.  Great location and close to Target, restaurants,  Disneyland and freeway.

Great wolf lodge is a Great place for the entire family, theirs to do than just a water park ! Great attractions and daily activities some even at no cost. No sun tans kids are safe and have fun throughout the day!!

ya gotta check it out, there's something for everyone, excellent service, kids always had something to do, very nice rooms and this resort handles crowds extremely well, quick check in, room was available early and check out a breeze, parking super convenient

I brought my wife and kids here for my birthday and it really made me feel like a kid again. The water park is AMAZING! They keep the entire property very clean and the staff is very nice. I can't wait to make my next trip.

This resort allows you to put your keys away and enjoy yourself. They have everything you need there is no need to leave once you check in. They have the most friendliest staff I have ever had the opportunity to meet at a resort.

Summary Heading: Excellent getaway close to home for the whole family
Summary: Clean, entertaining and amazingly fun indoor wager park for every member of the family.  The room we reserved was basic but we didn't need much.  We were wiped out from a lot of swimming, climbing, sliding and just so much fun and all we needed were some comfy beds.  They think of everything and you can literally spend all day every day in your bathing suit!

Took the family to Great Wolf Lodge for a day and had the best time. The place is clean and the staff is polite. The food was ot as either. We are definitely going again!! They have great kids activities too!

Beware my credit card was overcharged at least 4x's. That was very concerning to me. Overall, my kids had an ok time not great but not bad. We payed over $450 for one night. My daughter 10 years old did not like the room. They are used to nicer hotel rooms. The shower was dirty with a lot of hair left behind when we checked in. Too tired to ask for someone to come do a thorough cleaning... They were so busy I had stayed on the phone for 10minutes. I would consider going back but not for $400 again. Everything is overpriced and the food was not that good. My kids liked Dunkin donuts for breakfast.

Love everything and especially I was given the room remotely furthest from the elevator. My family didn't mind the long walk and enjoyed the quietness away from the hustle and bustle at the elevator lobby. I also especially like that our room is on the highest floor. Lastly, I love the offer of mobile check in where I can skip the waiting line.

This was our first time visiting a Great Wolf Lodge resort. We were so amazed by this place from the moment we walked in. It offers everything our family loves to do, and more. We will definitely visiting again!

This place is a fun place for kids and adults of all ages. There is something for everyone to experience here. This is a one stop shop type of place there is food and fun all rolled in to one here at the Lodge so take time out of life and enjoy your next family trip at GWL.

great fun ,something for all ages ,clean ,very friendly a safe place ,  the water park has lots of  safety  people who really watch the water rides, cabana are a great feature every thing easy to fine  Nice rooms

After looking at the waterpark attractions, I was initially concerned that the kids (ages 12-14) wouldn't have enough "big kid" rides to keep their interest during our two day stay.  I was wrong!  They enjoyed the waterpark attractions for two full days (and probably could have stayed longer).

Summary Heading: Good luck with "Flow Ryder" water attraction
Summary: Good trip over all but flow Ryder is a joke. You will wait over an hour and if you are good you get more time but the little ones who aren't as good are done quickly. Super inconsistent in the times given to ride the "wave" some get 5min some get 1.

Fun for the whole family, but pay attention to charges. Had a great experience until I reviewed the charges. Was told we received a credit then I seen charges in the exact amount of the credit. Fun but disappointed with the charges

Summary Heading: Small venue and front desk was rude
Summary: Upon checking in I was missed informed on the payment process.  When I brought it up to the front desk when I checked out they were very rude and uncompassionate.  Another thing that concerned me while staying here there was a belligerent drunk man in the hallway that wanted to start a fight with my husband with my kids there there was no security around nor did I feel safe walking to my room.

The hotel is nice specially for kids. The rooms are clean and very basic. The water park is nice and overall clean (I am VERY picky with water parks). We had some bad experiences with the service... The water at the Loose Moose was terrible and the Girl that helped us out at the "Buckets Place" was in a very bad mood and was yelling at everyone...  Overall I think its very expensive for what it is and EVERYTHING is extra (arcade, "quest", etc) The water park is included but nothing else. The water park is showing some signs of use... oxidation, color, etc. And some people are discussing disgusting (there was poop on the floor in an area, but the staff closed it off and it was cleanned).... Its fun for kids, 2 nights is MORE than enough.

Getting very busy.  And some of the life guards have issues with attitude there, the food's good in the restaurant Lodge.  Fun out of the sun.  But there seems to be an issue with 1/4 of the park closing all day long.  Either the wave pool, the play pool or the lazy river.  Which causes 2x's the crowd in other areas.

Let me start by saying that my 3 kids (aged tween all the way down to a toddler) LOVED this place. This review is to help the parents because I am willing to bet if you take your kids, they will love it too. Check-in was pretty long but they do send you an option to mobile check-in which will put you in a shorter line upon arrival. Our room was not ready when we arrived but we were able to head to the water park. I would recommend leaving your luggage in the car until you have keys to your room! Our room wasn't ready until almost 4:30 (even though it should have been ready at 4 and we checked in at 1). The rate that we were quoted for our room seemed reasonable, however it was almost an extra $100 in taxes and fees, not including parking, so you will need to factor that in when

This is a great place for families to enjoy a vacation. Lots of a activities to enjoy for kids and adults. A variety of restaurants that caters both kids and adults. The quest was a great idea that my wife and daughter enjoyed.

Best for children over 5....and families that can AFFORD to participate in the fun activities that are available.   I brought my 3 year old grand daughter here for her birthday.  She loves it here.  Wish I had won the lottery before we came so we could have participated in the "special" things offered. Without the additional cost offerings the two water park sections (lazy river and child area) were all we were able to enjoy.

Great family fun for the kids and parents.  A very clean and friendly environment.  There was plenty to do inside and outside the water park.  Food and beverage choices were great. We look forward to coming back again.

Great place to vacation with kids of all ages, there is so much to do they will never be bored. The rooms are large enough for the whole family besides waterpark these an arcade and best of all the wizard game

Very good place to spent time with your family and friends. Very welcoming environment a lot of fun indoor activities for my kids they love it. Building memories with my kids and this is one of them is priceless. They can't stop talking about it on our way back home they are already asking if they can go back. Love it!

Summary Heading: Like Chuck e Cheese with a hotel
Summary: Definitely more geared toward families with younger kids 10 years old and younger. The water park has a very strong chlorine odor and just feels overcrowded and dirty which younger kids don't mind but teens and adults wouldn't enjoy. The rooms are average, but the beds are comfortable. One night is more than enough for the experience.

Great place for a stay-cation.  Clean and extremely fun water park.  Very safe.  Lots to do!  The restaurants were kind of expensive & the service at the restaurants wasn't exceptional... but not completely bad.  The front desk staff & parking security was excellent!!

Summary Heading: Fantastic venue for the whole family
Summary: Our family could not have enjoyed our overnighter at the Great Wolf Lodge more! There are some things we plan to do differently on our next visit, including staying more than one night and seeing how many friends and extended family can join us, but given that it was our first time there, I think we made the most of it.   We focused on enjoying the water park - it's why we were there! We didn't get distracted by some of the other activities on this trip, but plan to try a few of them on our next trip when we have more time. The staff working the water park was very attentive to making sure guests had a great time, as well as keeping it safe (scolding those running, for example) and calling out any line cutters when they saw them. They worked hard to keep those lines moving so

We decided to visit for 1 night and try it out.   For about 1 day entrance cost to any LA amusement park,  we got clean large room,  2 days (spend about 9 hours in total but you can actually do much more) in a indoor water park,  dinner and breakfast buffet (again,  exceeding expectations).  It was fun for the kids, safe,  clean and comfortable for all of us. My 8 and 11 year old had great time running around the water park. The decor and the activities in the hotel are all aimed at kids. Extremely friendly and helpful stuff members,  again exceeding expectations.  For front desk to the lady that thanked us for visiting and was in charge of the omelet station at breakfast.  Tips: 1. do the mobile check in 2. Come early and plan to get the kids to the water park prior to having a

The amenities and the rooms are Great! Location far from Santa Barbara but worth it. There was something for everyone and the staff was very friendly.  All the rides seemed very safe and clean. Delicious food and clean rooms.

Perfect for my 13 yr old & 11 yr old's birthdays instead of big parties! I was happier relaxing while the boys played! They loved MagiQuest so much! Playing that games takes time so it was perfect throughout our stay during breaks from the waterpark

Nice that the water park is indoor and the operating hours are great!  The kids really enjoyed Story Time and the arcade after hours.  The location is also a plus - nearby Disneyland and a lot of good restaurants.

My wife and I, plus two kids, ages 5 and 7. First time visit. We stayed two nights, but you can have a great experience by staying one night as you get full use of the facility the second day, even after checking out by 11am. Kids started in the small pool area, which was a nice way to begin. Eventually we explored the much larger slides and other fun things to do, such as the wave pool and the lazy river. This was a fun place, it was obvious that adults and children were all having a good time. Very safe and family friendly environment. It was not especially crowded, but I can imagine that would be a negative if you happen to be there at a busy time - the lines for the slides moved quickly in our case. The other features of the resort did not appeal much to us and were an

Summary Heading: For families with children 11 and younger!
Summary: Honestly it's not a bad place at all but it's really for families with kids that are 11 and younger and the food isn't horrible but it isn't great either.  I think the prices are really high to stay there and to attend the water park but that is just my personal opinion.

Waited over three hours total to check-in. Staff told us they would text us when the room was ready. They never did. A pretty disappointing way to start of the trip by wasting our time and checked us in way late in the evening. Parking cost is way high and the hotel will nickel and dime you for just about everything. Staff valet wasn't helpful with luggage or carts and assumed I didn't need help with anything. I had a family of six and they told me to go find a luggage cart in self parking. Pretty bad. I wanted to like this place, but I was really annoyed.

My family had a great time and we're busy all day with multiple activities provided. The rooms were nice but the beds were not very comfortable and the coffee maker and coffee were less than desirable.  We had a keurig at cheaper hotels, the upgrade would be beneficial.  Food was mediocre,  bear paw sweets was delicious.

The Great Wolf Lodge was a total hit with my family and friends.  I invited friends to join us at the water pack and then we had diner together. Everyone said they really enjoyed themselves.  Looking forward to our next trip.

We went to celebrate my daughter's 10th birthday and the staff greeted us every time and said happy birthday to her and made her feel welcome and acknowledged that it was her special day! Great experience for us all!

Summary Heading: Already booked TWO more weekends here
Summary: I absolutely LOVED this resort! We booked a Wolf Den for our family of 5. two kids in the bunk bed and rented a pack n play from Babierge.com for the baby. The water park is fantastic! I was extremely hesitant about the littles around water--age 1 and 3. Great Wolf has thought of everything in advance--life jackets, slides for all sizes and ability levels. Lots of fun shallow water to play in. The slides for us big kids were amazing! I've been down water slides before but not like these!! Lines were easy even on weekends and the water park is kept at the right temp so you're never too cold.  I absolutely dread amusement parks/beaches/long outings because we have fair skin. Water activities especially...are they wearing sunscreen? did you get the tops of the ears? toweled off?

Something for everyone-from 2-102.  My kids enjoy the freedom to roam the property while in a safe environment.  They like having a wrist band that opens our room door.  Besides the water park, they were able to quest and play games in the arcade.  The food onsite is very good.  I, especially, enjoyed the coffee at Dunkin Donuts. My family tells me the quality of donuts at the hotel is better than the Dunkin Donuts we visit back home. (You can't fight the honesty)

We live locally, but wanted to go to enjoy the indoor water park for our little kids.  They had a blast at the water park and also all of the activities they offer.  Everything we heard about it was true.  We are already wanting to plan another time to go.

Cool water park. More stuff do than just the water park. Two nights stay is all you need. Look for promotional deals. Get the paases for kids, it does save you a bundle. Food and drinks were pricey., but not outrageous. McDonald's is across street and other restaurants just minutes away.

Book in advance for big savings. Pack your swimsuit separately & check-in early o enter the water park, usually room is not ready until 4p. Enjoy the water park while you wait for your room.  Be early to save a spot in the water park lounging area esp when it's packed. Outside food is not allowed in the water park.  Outside food is allowed in the room. Park closer to elevator if possible for easy access to you car.  Check out is 11am but you could still enjoy the water park until closing on your departure date. There are shower & change area in the water park. FYI parking fee is not included in you bill be prepared to pay $15 per night. Grown & kids enjoyed the place.

In 2016 the head of our family passed away and we knew holiday season was going to never be the same. To compound the our grief his birthday was on Thanksgiving day and we all decided we did not want be home. We are season premium pass holders to Disneyland but I worried about bad weather and then I remember seeing you AD on tv. There it was the answer to my prayer, I didn't have to worry Bout the weather, we could play and loose ourselves and run away from this new world we found ourselves in, all our needs and wants would be fulfilled so I made reservations for myself, 2 daughters, son-in-law and year old granddaughter. Well let me tell you, from the time we pulled up and through the next two days you made us feel like family, you were warm sincere and caring for our every

Arrived on a Sunday afternoon. As expected, the line to register was very long.  Given our room number. No directions on how to get there. Finally found an elevator. Our room was literally at the end of the hall, picture the hallway in the movie the Shining. Long, long, long. Got to our room. Two queen beds and a couch bed. Room was clean. Day two left room at 11:30 am. Came back at 3:00 pm no house keeping. Day three left the room at 10:30 am came back and checked to see if f housekeeping had come at 1:00 pm. Nope. Went out asked an employee who was cleaning a room further down the hall if we could have our room cleaned (towels, shampoo etc). Was told no problem it will get done. Came back at 3:45 pm. No housekeeping. Frustrated called housekeeping advised we have waited most

We had a great time.☺ we want to see if we can visit again this month before the kids go back to school. They love going there they never want to go back home it's never to much for them they always want to stay longer its a perfect place for the family and friends.

Celebrated my two sons birthdays and they really enjoyed the wolf den suite with the bunk beds. They loved being in the indoor waterpark. There is really something for everyone. They had an incredible and memorable birthday.

There were not enough tables and chairs available in the pool area.  Plan to go early.  Most of the food was tasty in the pool area.  The dinner at the grill restaurant was slow service and the good was cold when we finally got it.

Kind of pricey for a water park. Too many fees per day not including food and other entertainments, no discounts for returning guests and can get overcrowded. Front desk staff are very friendly though especially Adrian, made my family and I feel welcomed.

All the staff went out of their way to make our family feel comfortable.  The activities provided were well thought out and were arranged for all age levels.  The food was good quality and the wait staff were very attentive.

We spent my daughter's birthday there and it could not have been a better experience for her.  This place truly is fantastic.  It is well worth it to do the Magiquest.  All the kids loved it.  I highly recommend the Lodge.  They really do it right.

We had a great time.there was something for everyone.no matter what time of day it was,there was always some fun activity​. I was really impressed with the parks hours of operation.it was pretty cool that you csn use the water park all day .we will definitely be coming back.

Took my family for my son's birthday!  It was fun, clean and we felt very safe.  Birthday package was overpriced, and the cake was terrible.  But, all the food was good.  Cabana was great! Loved that it was stocked with beverages.

Summary Heading: Our family trip was a success!
Summary: We loved everything about this hotel from pre checkin, to the amazing staff, reasonable prices for food and the activities they have for the whole family, and so much more! We will definitely be back sooner then later.

We stayed at the resort for one night and two days. We rented the cabana the first day which was great, it was outdoors and worth the money. There were drinks and a safe to keep the belongings. The whole family loves the water park and did not want to come home. I am going to get a wolf pass for my boys next time.

First time here since many of our family friends with kids recommended it.  Arrived here as a four family group Sunday morning, check in time is 1:00pm but you can start swimming earlier.  Loved that they have ample number of staff and  life guards around every ride and swimming area. Did not have to worry about the kids safety.. our kids aged ranged from 6-10 .. deepest pool is five feet. Loved all the rides especially the water rafting, since we were able to ride as a four group.  Food is much less expensive than other amusement parks. Liked the convience of having the wrist band to pay for stuff.   Recommend to start using the park right at 9am before next guests arrive at 1:00pm and gets crowded.  Overall very clean, reasonable priced especially for families with kids..

This was a family trip with our 13 and 10 year old daughters. The 10 year old bought a friend. The girls ran around like they were at camp. We bowled, played put-put golf, and they ran around the arcade. The food is ok quality and you would spend a lot more at Disneyland for the same quality of food and drink. We're planning our next trip now!

This place is great for everyone of all ages. It's a lot of fun and there are activities and sections that can appease everyone from young kids to adults. The restaurants are a bit pricey but there are many options and most people can find something that fits their budget and taste. I would definitely come back here again!

Summary Heading: Great place to go but watch out for being charged when you didn't buy anything
Summary: We stayed 3 days 2 nights, used my wristband to make purchases at food stands during our stay except for the day we left. Got my receipt emailed to me around 8am day of departure but they had already charged my card earlier at 5 am for everything on the receipt, even though we checked out at 11. Then 2 days after we were back home already I see a charge from them for $270 on my credit card, I am still trying to get it taken off but they are not good at responding or providing an explanation.

I was pleased with the availability of my rooms at 1 pm and all the staff. There were plenty of towels at the water park so you did not have to use your room towels. Shops were very clean/in order to.

Summary Heading: Waterpark is great for kids...could use some other improvements
Summary: Overall, my son loved this place and he was indeed very safe and secure. I think the rooms are overpriced as far as what you get decor and amenity wise. Cleanliness and service requires attention. Bathrooms need to be checked more frequently and trash in dining area outside by pool requires review as well. The cans were overflowing and stayed that way for hours...perhaps they were short staffed.  Service could also be improved upon. Staff were nice but perhaps just too busy or overwhelmed.

Great place for everyone! Great environment and overall welcomeing experience. Kids had a blast and would deficit recommended this resort to everyone. Great prices for food and lots of fun activities that kept the kids occupied.

This was our first time at the resort.  We traveled 2 1/2 hours but had a flat tire, had to stop at a tire shop & replace tire and then got traffic so we actually were on the road for 5 1/2 hours. We were all tired and frustrated. Once we were there we all forgot our long drive there.  Kids had a blast!!!

My children had a great time... we'll be going back... but they need to something with the room keys because if you lose you wristband then you have to pay 50 bucks for a new. What if you dont have 50 bucks, that means no access to your room.

Awesome park lots of fun for kids and adults to. We will be going back with the family as soon as we possibly can it was an awesome weekend lots for the kids to see do you and interact with very enjoyable

Very accomodating staff, everybody was friendly, very convenient stay, easy to check out. The lady in the frontdesk was very helpful help us to find the stuff toys  that my daughter left in the cart.We had a blast on our second stay and we will definitely come back again!

Front desk staff was not as friend as I would have liked. The first person I talked to didn't help out. I felt like she just wanted to get rid of me and not answer my questions. Only 2 out of 6 received wolf ears. This experience could have been better. My 10 year old said it was an okay experience, but was expecting more fun. The associate at the prize area in the arcade was ride to my kids and skipped them when they were next in line. Average hotel stay for us.
