We had so much fun! The pools were super clean. We went for family staycation. Our girls are teenagers but lived the experience. I lived the wristband idea! The girls were able to get stuff without needing us to be with them!

On arrival Monday, our door key would not work. After 3 trips, back and forth from the 9th floor to the front desk, someone final called maintenance up to our room. It turns out the batteries were dead and the electronic door opener would not work. So after a 7-hour drive to get to the hotel, we were stuck with all of our luggage outside of our room for over half an hour to get in.  On Wednesday, we returned to our room @ 7:45PM after all day at Disneyland and the beaches. we returned to our room to have showers and get changed and return to Disneyland for the evening. Our room was NOT made up from the day and we had no toilet paper or towels etc.. I phoned the front desk and the person that I talked to said he would send up someone right away to make the beds. I advised him

The beds were very uncomfortable and for the price you pay, what you get does not equal the cost. Service at the Buffet and Wolf Grill were very poor, quality of food, also not the greatest, the pizza is very good,

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge Southern CA - great place, average service.
Summary: Great property and concept for kids.  If they improve service, it would be exceptional.  Extremely long waits for the most popular rides, and very obvious staff was allowing local friends to "cut to the front."

If you would like an all inclusive family resort this is it. Local and everything is clean and themed. Everyone is welcoming helpful and courteous. I'm not into the decor but it is not cheesy by any means and the rooms are clean and up to date. But one thing is not good, if you and 1 child come he value of your stay goes down! It doesn't make sense! I would definitely come back it they offered half price stays during off-season times.

Summary Heading: Good family fun even with 12 year olds!
Summary: My son and his friend enjoyed the big slides, flowrider, the wave pool and river.  My husband and I did everything with them as well and we had a great time. The room with the slides is a little humid if you're not in the water but it was understanding and bearable. The food was really good at each location we ate. No complaints.

We enjoyed our stay very much. We had a standard room which was very nice. It's all we needed. Our kids are older. I do wish the park had more slides for the bigger kids. We wanted to ride the wave rider but the wait was too long. Need to find a way to make that more efficient. The kids working the rides were fun!!

Summary Heading: Not worth your time or money
Summary: This place feel like being at chuckecheese. You have people working there that doesn't want to be there. My overall experience was terrible. Definitely not a destination that we would come back to. Better off spending your money at a Disney resort or at a another hotel.

The kids will have a great time. House keeping was not helpful, therfore our room was not cleaned. We had to get our own towels etc. I thought I was getting a good deal through Zulilly, but with all the resort fees it really wasn't any deal at all.

Great wolf lodge is great for families!  After reading mixed reviews before arriving I wasn't sure what to expect, but we had a great stay with no issues at all.    We were able to check in easily and were contacted via email when our room was ready. We stayed in a Wolf Den suite, I inspected the room on arrival and it was very clean.  My only suggestion for the room would be a king size bed instead of a queen in the room.   The waterpark was lots of fun and there was something for everyone to do.  Lines weren't long for water slides, there was plenty of seating if you looked for it, and the waterpark was clean.  Bring your water shoes the floor gets slippery later in the day and we saw lots of people slip.  Overall great stay and will definitely be back.  My daughter loved the

It is a perfect place for family vacation . If you are not a fan of hot weather , then go here . You can enjoy the water in a clean environment without the sunburn. Rooms are kid friendly . Staff was great . We will return

Had a great water park experience with my family! Whole place was clean, food and drinks were readily available at a reasonable price, unlimited towels at the water park, nice and friendly staff, just fun for everyone! We'll definitely be back for more fun!

Long check in line-3 hours 4:45 PM Not friendly at all :they didn't let us celebrate my sons birthday with cake and candles because it was fire hazard(2 1 inch candles) My kid fell and injured his knee on water park and nobody cared or said anything Waiting times were more then disneyland for the rides i let them know we are going to celebrate my son birthday 2 months ahead but no sigh of that at all on our stay,other rooms had happy birthday poster but maybe our 3000$ for 3 nights were not enough for a poster very expensive and not worth it for the quality of services

This is a great place for family fun. The water park is perfect siz for the kids. The lodg has many fun activities.  The only thing was that the dessert at loose moose buffet was not good. The food was delicious.

It's expensive.  The rooms and the food.  We didn't do anything other than play in the water park.  There is an arcade thing and bowling and other activities that we did not make use of.  We checked in on a Sunday and our room was ready before 4pm.  Stayed only one night so we had the water park to play in all day on Monday and it was a lot less crowded.  Highly recommend going during the week.  we did go big on the room and it was nice.  It was really hard to find even one chair when we first arrived on Sunday, it was much easier Monday morning.  We did have a lot of family fun on the slides.  When we got home Monday night we all started coughing and sneezing.  Tuesday I was a mess and felt like I had a cold.  Lots of sneezing, runny nose and coughing.  I was fine by Wednesday.

My 12 year old couldn't fit in the bunk bed comfortably. I paid extra for the kids cabin and it only fit my 5 year old.  Overall our stay was good. My kids both enjoy the waterpark side. My younger child enjoy the activities they had.

Was not happy kids were too old did not enjoy. Prices too expensive. We were suppose to have a suite and we got a tiny room that was terrible!!! We should have been accommodated with dinner or something else

We had about 60 families meet for a long weekend from all over the US. This was a perfect place to meet and have our families socialize. GWL was accommodating in allowing space for Meet and Greet, and lots of venues for groups of kids from youngsters to teens to find an activity to want to do.

Pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the resort and the variety of activities to do. The water park itself has something for everyone to do from infants to adults. There's a few dining options and daily activities for kids. Can't wait to return with more family soon!

Didn't like the staff ,The wait time to check in was crazy and they charge to much in all the restaurants. The rooms weren't bad they were really nice I believe that if the rooms weren't nice I probably would have left sooner than I did. The parking is ridiculous I heard from a lot of friends the experience was great yet mine wasn't the same

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in hot summer
Summary: It's fun for little one and adults. The room is big clean and comfortable. But the water park is over crowded in the weekend. You won't able to find a chair if you go late like after lunch. They have locker, but it's very expensive. those line for the slides are confusing if you never been there.

Summary Heading: Safe and Fun for young kids
Summary: It's a very good and relaxed vacation with your toddler and young kids(4-10).  For those who are already going Raging Waters, it might not the place for you.  For those toddlers always waiting for the elder siblings, this is the place for them.  And, they won't get bored and it's safe over there that you won't need to worry!  If it's a public holiday, it gets a bit crowded!  If possible, try to avoid the busiest holidays.

We had such an amazing time there. it was fun and filled with something to do every day. My kids enjoyed the waterpark and all the fun games that were available. Was amazed at how big the waterpark was and fun.

Summary Heading: You must visit the Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: This place is amazing! If you have children, you have to make a point of staying at the Great Wolf Lodge. We have a 14 year old and a 10 year old, both of whom had a blast! There are definitely more options for younger kids but the older ones really have a great time too! My 2 recommendations are book early, we paid a lot for one night but only booked two weeks in advance and bring a lot of cash for the arcade!

My daughter seen the ads on tv & asked to go here for her birthday. It was the best trip we have taken so far. We are definitely going back, hopefully soon.. If you plan ahead you can catch some good deals. The food was reasonable & we didn't have any reason to leave until check out..

Our only significant disappointment with our experience was the bedding in the Kids Cabin suite. The room reservation page specifically says "This suite features a log cabin-themed sleeping area, three twin beds, a queen bed and a full sofa sleeper." The bunk beds are clearly smaller than normal twin size, with smaller sheets as well, which made for a less-than-ideal night's sleep for our tall 12-year-olds. Note that this description of the bunks appears on the reservation page but not on the general information page about the room types. When I specifically asked about this at check-in, the desk clerk (correctly) did not claim that the room contained twin beds, but he didn't exactly say that they were not. A different, more accurate description of what was in our room would

Summary Heading: Trip advisor is a rip off and they have horrible customer service.
Summary: I was ripped off by trip advisor. I ended up paying 185.00 over than I would of if I just booked thru The Great Wolf Lodge itself. I went thru trip advisor they sent me thru Book a room.com. It's ridiculous to go thru a secondary website to get a deal and then pay that much more. I would never use trip advisor or book a room.com again. Their customer service could care less. I even spoke with a manager and he was very unprofessional.

Summary Heading: Kids loved it, I'd rather be outside
Summary: First time visitor.  Water slides were so fun for the kids; they really loved it.  For me, it was like Las Vegas for kids.  All indoors, no air, funky lighting.  I would have preferred to be outside at the beach in real waves and water!!

i highly recommend this place when you're down here in So Cal. It's a great place to take the kids and also fun for the adults. All the GWL staff are friendly and knowledgeable and services were great!

Very good Hotel for family ,special for kid to have great times,hfgir erkuhrvhurwjnzrc,jkc jcd kbjsdkjdsjkbsdvakjbv kjbdfjkgk zhdjkbcdk jbvkjbz sdkjbvkj∂bzsmbv zkjdcghuoawi hfohf g fg dlkjre drlijtj ijtgje lijdrgjiet ljdgjer lkjdtgijesr lkjrg. lkjrgi lijrier rhaeirjh ekjg

Great Wolf Lodge was a great family vacation. Plenty of rides for all ages. It's also nice that most rides allow 2 or more people per ride. They allow ice chest in the rooms, so its a great way to save a little cash. Great experience for all....

The waterpark rides are for all ages. So much activities for children besides the waterpark. Recommend to get the passes.  The only flaw is trying to get lou ge chairs when the waterpark is packed.  Musy get there real early to find seats.  Will recommend for any family.

We stayed in a KidCabin Suite.  It's not as roomy as it appears on the website pictures.  The bunk beds for kids are small.  The sofa sleeper is uncomfortable and squeaky.  But, it is worth visiting if you are SoCal residents and never been there yet.

Fun but online r serrations didn't include important notes on my room requests. I had requested 1st floor and I was assigned 9th floor. Travis worked hard to get me a room on the 1st floor. He was very kind and understanding.

We were looking for a little getaway close to home and realized that this resort was not open. It is a great time and a great deal. We love how family friendly it is. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because they didn't have a hot tub which I think would make this place perfect.

The water park should stay open just a little later, water pipes when taking a shower were loud and obnoxious, housekeeping staff was rude, maintenance were great and fast response even though no fixing the loud noise while showering which was very very loud and uncomfortable, either need more elevators as it took so long to catch one up other than that it was hands down a wonderful environment for us and our kids!

Staff went above and beyond to provide us with an amazing experience! We had a health emergency during our stay, the staff was helpful and professional and quick to respond to our emergency. They helped calm my children and took care of my family! All staff was great and the facility was clean, safe, and professional. Price of the resort was great, very reasonable. I will be returning and would recommend this facility to families of all ages

Beautiful Lodge great place for kids of all ages.  Check-in & Out was easy.  They provided excellent customer service throughout the lodge.  Place was kept clean at all times plenty of restrooms throughout.  Room was relaxing with a sofa, table for eating, big screen TV, microwave, frig, coffee maker, big tub with shower.  Plenty of activities for all kids besides the water park.  Bowling, Mini golf, great Arcade we all add fun in there.  We won a lot of prizes too.  Lol  Plenty of food choices 1 restaurants 1 Buffet , Snack bars including one inside the water park area.  I loved the way they set up the activities throughout the day.  Water park was amazing again the set up was fabulous.  Different sections for the appropriate age group.  We loved the pool with the waves.

My kids and I enjoyed last year and decided to come back again but for 2 nights. It worked out perfectly, especially with the 25% off since I have 4 kids. The prices of things were kind of high and since there was an event going on, we weren't able to eat at the buffet since it was always crowded with the same people ( cheer event ).

wonderful my family loved all the rides and all the things we could do at the place. my kids love the arcade. the room were lovely clean and all the staff was so wonderful and very helpful they are. I would come back.

Great for young kids and their parents. People over 12 boring. Need a regular pool that doesn't have equipment in it. I liked the soft sheets and not any blankets on the bed. Found the members to be very helpful and pleasant.

Summary Heading: Great place to spend time with your children or grandchildren.
Summary: I had only 2 days to spend with my young grandchildren and their Mom's and this was a perfect place.  No need to wear sunscreen and sunglasses.  Just enjoy the water slides and activities in a safe indoor environment.

The trip to Great Wolf Lodge was a safe, friendly, comfortable, and awesome vacation. The room was clean and nice. The location was pretty good. We mostly liked the water park, restaurant, and games. We didn't like the most was the bathroom be cause the sink wasn't together.

This was a great family trip. The kids loved the interactive treasure hunt. The water park was fun and well maintained. The bathrooms need attention. The food was ok but the Buffett was over priced and the meat was all over cooked and the selection was only ok. Would go again.

I live 7 miles from this resort. And as many of you know, there is no daily entry fee, you have to get a room to use the water park.   Being local residents we paid $330 for 2 adults and 2 kids. Used the water park but went home to sleep. I'm not complaining about their business plan, I knew the terms before making reservations.  I only wished that they would offer local residents a daily use fee without getting a room. I'm not saying charge $10 for 1 day entrance, I think $50 per person regardless of age is reasonable for this place. Then my family would have spent $200 and still saved money, and I would be more willing to come back often.   Facilities:       Excellent!  Rooms:          Excellent!  Parking:         Excellent!  Water park:   Very good   Value for money for local

Very clean. My boys are 6 and 9 yo, and they enjoyed everything about the lodge and water park. They loved magic quest, and after walking around with them the first day, husband and I decided they were safe to do it themselves during the rest of our stay, as long as they do not leave the hotel, check in with us every ten minutes, and they are not rude to other people. A great family vacation, we will be back again for sure!  Just don't get donuts from Dublin- they were stale!

My kids love to stay at Great wolf Lodge. Special the room for kids has beautiful and cute decration for the kids. They also like the buckbed. 😊 They love the indoor water park. They had so much fun while they stay here. We come back soon for winter break.

Not only did my daughter have a blast, but I felt like a kid again! The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Can't wait to go back and have this fun experience again.

The Great Wolf Lodge has everything you need for good family fun.  From the water park to the various kids activities throughout the day, it is very difficult to get bored.  It is a good family destination that appeals to everyone.

Life guards are on top of it, everyone seems to really like their jobs and walk around extremely happy. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Safe, feeling atmosphere and employees are very helpful. Will be enjoying the facility again.

Summary Heading: I didn't think I'd like an indoor water park but I did
Summary: Super fun for families with arcades, attractions, magi-quest, shows, etc all in house. The indoor water park had a nice progression of slides from toddler size up to adult, and you don't have to worry about sunscreen/heat, or cold weather. Make sure you book 3+ months out to cut the rate way down otherwise you'll pay through the nose like me.  Count on spending upwards of 15% in stupid fees! Oh -- and don't order their pizza... it was greasy and bland.  Overall it was a lot of fun and even my teens enjoyed it.

Quality of the rooms are ok not great so don't expect a magnificent room in this case I got the family suite with picture window. Rooms are small but great location but very pricey! Not sure if I'll be back.

Wonderful loved it my family loved it kids had so much fun can't wait to plan another trip soon there service is great everyone was great nice and clean vary friendly food great there I plan on making another trip out there soon this is a place I would recommend to others

It's a kid's paradise! The rooms are spacious and nice. It's nice to easily book a room large enough for my family of 6. It is a good deal. You can use the waterpark before you check in and after you check out.

I was very happy that my children enjoyed themselves. I hate that they didn't tell us how to get to our room so we had to ask around. Also room service never came to our room to clean. If you loss your wristband to the pool it is $50 to replace it.

Great Wolf Lodge was an awesome vacation destination if you have kids. They will love all the adventures that await them.  From toddler to teenagers, to grandparents,everyone will enjoy their stay.  Magiquest provided a fun adventure for kids to emurse themselves into an interactive video game experience that was fun for all to experience.

We celebrated my 2 year olds birthday and wanted to do something exciting for him without the hassle, Great Wolf Lodge was the perfect answer.   This resort is perfect for kids and families alike.  It includes an indoor water park with all the best attractions from huge water slides, wave pool, lazy river, surfer pool, and even the child's pool area.  Once you check into hotel, you're given wolf ear head bands along with a wristband that doubles as your room key, and also a form of payment throughout your stay.  (Such a convenience.)  The rooms are particularly clean and the beds are comfortable.  I commend this location on their quality bedding, it is appreciated, especially after a day of water activities.   The rooms also included a microwave and refrigerator and with small

3rd visit to the park. Family had a wonderful time spending the entire day swimming, playing, and grubbing. For families with small children still in strollers and/or during check-in/check-out the centrally located elevator situation is chaotic taking much longer than necessary most of the time.. Whatever happened to first come first served? My recommendation....stay on the 1st floor.

Although I loved this resort and my stay two night stay there was great, I would stay only one night because the kids get tired after the second day. My children and niece and nephew were also tired after the second day.

really nice place and its nice to use the water park and just go back to your room. realax then go back to the pool later. the rides are just a few minutes wait time. the water are warm. and a lot of activities for the kids

We had a great 2 night stay at the Great Wolf Lodge and highly recommend. For families with older kids (10+) a one night stay is probably enough. We will be back for sure.  Pros:  Food was good, some better than others, and reasonably priced. Resort was at capacity, but it never felt packed or crowded. Good activities for children other than the water park. Staff was friendly.  Cons: Room stay includes the water park, so why is there another resort fee? Wi-fi was terrible Need a clothesline in the bathroom to help dry suits Need more channels on the tv, with cartoons like Disney jr Could use some free weights in the gym

We decided at the last minute to go to Great Wolf Lodge after being in Palm Springs for a few days on vacation.  I was dreading going, but my kids really wanted to go.  I mostly was dreading it because it's indoors and I'm claustrophobic.  I was pleasantly surprised!!  The rooms are a little expensive, but the food, drinks, etc.... are reasonably priced. Kids LOVED it!!!  There is an outside pool that you can enjoy too.  Definitely recommend

This is the second time I took my grandchildren to Great Wolf Lodge near Disneyland for a few days of waterpark fun.  It was crazy busy with tons of families plus a cheerleading convention that came in and practically took over the hotel.  Last year the resort had just opened.  So this year it had had enough time to work the kinks out.  The positives were:  very fun and safe water park with inside and outside activities; affordable food options all over the resort; large and comfortable rooms, especially the theme rooms with interactive characters; adult beverages available, along with coffee options for the caffeine-challenged; the arcade is one of the best I have ever seen; mini golf and bowling are also a lot of fun.  Could be improved: 1) NO kid movies available on the TV.

Great Wolf Lodge has everything inside that you don't have to leave for anything, hence the price that comes for the hotel room (in LA) and the water tickets.  You can pay for just a room here if not going into the pool areas.  They have a great arcade, small black light mini golf, 5D short movie theater (10-15 min), little girl spa (pedicure), pizza, bar, steakhouse, Breakfast, lunch, dinner buffet, outside lounge, and multiple kids activities near and around the lobby. Dunkin donuts in lobby that gets very busy in the mornings if you don't want the breakfast buffet.  $16.99 for adult, $8.99 for kids. You can pay cash/card for everything in the hotel or use their electronic wrist band system that has you CC info on it.  The wrist band is also how you get into your room and

This is our second stay at Great Wolf Lodge and they have come a long way in one short year.  During our trip in Summer of 2016 things seemed quite a bit disorganized.  Enough so that I considered not returning.  I wrote a letter to their corporate offices providing feedback on our personal experiences and their response led me to want to give them another try.  I am so glad I did!  They now have a convenient online check in (which helps to avoid the lines that can get long) as well as an online check out.  As simple as that sounds, they did not have that last year.  The amenities are perfect for families with children of all ages.  We traveled as a group of 15 which included 9 kids ranging in ages from 6 to 17.  All had a blast!  It is a great and safe place to make fantastic

numerous slides for all-supper awesome.  The only complaint is the huge fans above running to keep workers cool but bad for my littles got them sick along with humidity of chlorine air swooshing around.  Even though we got sick-we'd do it again for the slides.

The indoor water park was great for my nieces.  There was an area for the smaller kids which was great so they weren't overwhelmed by the bigger rides and kids.  The lifeguards were very attentive.  The staff at the resort were all fantastic and very enthusiastic.  The food is average and what you would expect at a kids venue.  The rooms are pricey but include the admission to the water park and you can stay at the water park until closing the day you check out.  Definitely a plus. They have several changing rooms and showers so you can change before you head home.  All other activities are a separate charge and if you have more than one child pretty pricey so expect to drop a bundle.  The only real downside for most adults is the bedding in the rooms.  The mattresses are hard

We stayed here for my daughter's 4th birthday and from the moment we checked in till we had to leave my kids had a blast! There are things for every age to do my 10 year old loved the arcade and the bowling ally, it was even fun for mom and dad! (Side note they serve alcohol lol) The rooms were clean, decent size it was like a last Vegas resort for kids! The water park was awesome! All in all no complaints... I highly recommend this place!

Will be back when my next grandchild turns 6! We started the tradition of Great Wolf Lodge when our first grandson turned 6...and each subsequent grandchild has looked forward to their trip with Grammy and Grenddude.  Had a blast for the second time, and looking forward to two years from now.

Summary Heading: Great time at park but the lady at the game room ruined our entire trip.
Summary: Enjoyed our trip at the water park. Kind of expensive but we don't go often as we would like to. Food is great and reasonably priced. Drinks at the bar were great and reasonably priced. You just have to ask for the cheaper brands. They could do better with the seating situation and towel and shoe storage should be free . Trip was ruined when my son exchanged his video game tickets for candy and received a hard n stale twizzler. The lady wouldn't allow him to return / exchange the twizzler. Maybe she feared it would bankrupt great wolf lodge and their demise would be all her fault was. Was truly disgusted with that experience for what I paid for the room and a 5 cents twizzler. Really?

Summary Heading: Fun for the kids but not the pocket book!
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge is great fun for the kids and the daily activities were great. However the price you will pay for food is exorbitant! It's much cheaper to eat outside of the resort! And the Loose Moose restaurant's food was not worth the price they charge! We were very disappointed in our dining and the service at the Loose Moose!

Great bang for your buck! Cheaper than Disneyland and less crowded! Rooms were great size, location was key! Don't eat at the Bucket restaurant. Food was not worth the $50! The Wood Fire Grill was great!

After room tax, sales tax, resort fee, parking fee our room cost us $460 for one night. The waterslides were fun, despite the long lines. There weren't tables and chairs in the water park area, but there were always plenty of towels .

Something different and fun to do.  Unstoppable splashing fun and very relaxing.  There are other things to do dry such as the bowling alley, the arcades and the 4D ride.  There really is no reason to leave the premises if you stay the night, because everything is right inside.  The food is a little on the pricey side, but the service and quality is good.

I will have to say that The Great Wolf Lodge is an AMAZING experience for the WHOLE family👍There's ALWAYS something to do🎉  We stayed for 4 days and NEVER had to leave the hotel😀The hotel itself is exceptionally clean and the staff is not only helpful, but EXTREMELY friendly, they go above and beyond to make your stay one you'll never forget 🏨  already trying to pick the date for our next stay🎉🎊🎉🎊🎉🎊🎉

Frank from front desk went above and beyond to accommodate my family. It was fun for the whole family. Safe for the teens to enjoy by themselves. The food was delicious in all restaurants. Our stay was pleasant from the beginning to the end.

This is just an overall fun place to go. There is no hurry to get to this ride or attraction and wait in line. Food is good and ready when you are right in the water park. I will be visiting this Lodge again and soon

Summary Heading: Check-in was excruciatingly long (45 minute wait) but the resort was fun.
Summary: We enjoyed Great Wolf Lodge in SoCal, after finally getting through the monster check-in line. That was a huge time waste and a rough way to start our vacation. We arrived around 2pm and so did everyone else.  Check your email the morning of arrival for an email to do online check in. It expires at 1pm. The food is ok, but greasy and expensive. We brought a cooler to the hotel room and ate breakfast a lunch from the cooler, then bought dinner and some snacks at the resort. That saved some money, time and calories.

On the day of arrival I had received an email regarding an online check in . I filled it out and requested the time I wanted to arrive at , that being 2:00pm. As I arrived to the lodge at 1:30pm I went to the check in desk in the front and had let them know I had arrived and went to get the keys . They had prompted me that the room had not been ready yet and it should be soon. So I waited in the lobby and around 2:30 went back to check on the room . They had told me I should receive an email letting me know my room would be ready. So I continued to wait in the lobby for another hour waiting to receive the email that never came . I check back in the the desk and the man there let me know he had forgot to call me about the room that there had been changes . Terrible to know that I

Kudos to an awesome staff throughout the entire property from the pool staff, maid service, front desk, carpet cleaning gentlman, quest assistance (we couldn't defeat the dragon), to hostesses and waiters to storytime dance party facilitators.  The staff was awesome!  We enjoyed he staff celebrating anither staff members bday at the grill!  How you treat your staff and how they treat guests makes all the difference.  You make working there look like fun!

Summary Heading: It was fun for my 6 and 4 yr olds while I attend the LuLaRoe convention!
Summary: We, as a family, had a blast! My kids enjoyed their time. They did not want to leave. I came to attend the LuLaRoe Convention. I didn't have to worry about my kids and husband as they had plenty to do.

We had a lot of fun. Our two teenage sons had a very good time, this place is certainly for all ages. The room was in excellent condition. We loved the facility and all the activities to do inside the resort. There is no need to leave anywhere once you arrive,

Great place for kids and adults ,  I enjoyed it as much as my 6 year old twin  daughters . Staff is very friendly and attentive.  There is a good selection for places to eat within the resort . The rooms are a good size and are very clean

Our stay here was okay, after our vacation I was sent a 50% off next time I book, I just think that 600$ a night for a wolf den was overpriced.  I would not be fooled and pay that much money again. Breakfast was really bad. Choices were Horrible, quality of food zero

Summary Heading: Nightmare check in turned great experience
Summary: We happened to book a room while a huge convention was in town (LLaRoe) the resort was sold out and they couldn't find the reservation that I booked through Groupon. After 45 mins in line to check in, Ricky was able to get us a room at the same rate, and was extremely helpful while I was having a minor emergncy with my father in the parking lot (he cut his toe deeply somehow and that's how our trip started, no fault of GWL) and my kids were antsy and ready to get checked in and into the water. Ricky made sure I knew how to contact Groupon and provided me with everything I needed to get a refund from them for their mistake. He made the whole distaste check in seem so smooth and offered compliments on how I was handling the kids, the line and my emergency. He was wonderful and

Summary Heading: Too expensive for the lack of service
Summary: This place is a great idea, but there are so many area where thy could improve!  My daughter loved the waterpark in a hotel idea. She could nap then go back to the park and play. The park itself has a little kid play area, a bigger kid play area, lazy river, wave pool, 6 slides, a pool with basketball, and an outdoor swim/play area. The rooms were fine, standard really.  Now for the negatives:  Customer service was lacking. With Disney prices, I expect a similar level of service. Instead, three calls to housekeeping after our room was not cleaned went ignored.   The workers in the lobby were completely clueless about their own policies and activities that were available. Questions were met with blank looks. It was not nearly as clean as I would like: there was a lack of

Summary Heading: 1-2 day at most fun at Great Wolf
Summary: Currently the place is fairly new.  So place is very nice and clean.  I recommend staying at most 2 days.  The children get bored with the same items on day 3.  If you take them to the arcade, beware, it's 2 per play.  And some of the machines are rigged.  You think you've won and the claw drops the toy that the child just thought they won.  Very disappointing for children.  Don't play those games with them.  They get really upset and sad.  I know it's a part of life but to rip them off when they've won it to drop it is wrong.

Kids had a great time. Try to book ahead of time for discounts. My kids are already talking about going back. Adult drinks wee a plus too!! Magic Quest is a game in addition to the water park that they love. Just know it takes lots of time!

I loved my stay at great wolf lodge. A lot of fun things to do their.  I recommend for everyone to book a trip to great wolf lodge and they will love it as much as my family did. They had great service and fun activities to do their.

The water park had something for everyone and the variety of food made it so you didn't have to leave the resort...Kids had an amazing time at the water park...there is also bowling, miniature golf and an arcade...lots to do!

We loved the Great Wolf Lodge. Our 7 yr old daughter had a great time. So much so, that she wants to come back in December for her birthday. I was impressed with literally every aspect of this property. The people were amazing, I have never seen such attentive lifeguards anywhere. But, when my daughter had lost her magic wand only hours after purchase, they replaced it for free. Classy move.  I didnt expect the food to be to great, but is was really much better than expected. My husband ordered a steak and it came out cooked perfect. The buffet was good, and the pizza was very good. the burger at the water park was not my fave. (very well done) But, all and all.... We will definitley come back to Great Wolf Lodge. We just loved it. I was impressed over and over again.

After going to the Great Wolf Lodge in MA, we were excited to visit the park nearest our house. This one didn't disappoint! We had a super time riding the rides until we were crazy with exhaustion, stuffing our faces with buckets full of ice cream, and smiling g so much, the kids were even smiling in their sleep on the ride home. It was an excellent, albeit pricey, birthday! Will definitely go again next year!

Very nice alternative to being out in the sun. Not cheap, but worth it. The place was very clean and not too big. Typical overcharge in food, but good availability. They even have a bar in the water park. One way in/ one way out, so it feels safe.

Great place for families. My kids had a wonderful time and we can't wait to go back. We celebrated my sons birthday there and he was greeted through out our stay there. The staff was friendly, thumbs up on the cleanliness, comfortable and fun. We got to meet some characters, the kids stay busy with activities and the fun slides (water park). Its nice that the rooms have microwaves and a small refridgerator.

Great trip for the family.  Expensive, but duper fun. Rooms are great as well as service. A little trouble getting information on the website and be prepared to spend a lot. Rooms include a fridge and microwave and the arcade is 24 hours

If you and your family are looking for a convenient place to have so fun, Great Wolf Lodge is the place to go. There is fun for the whole family and the water park is amazing! It made us feel like kids again

Summary Heading: A great time for the kids and the kid in you
Summary: The review is based on 2 events:  The Hotel and The Waterpark The hotel in itself is 8 floors and the hallways are almost Vegas like in their length.  The regular rooms are on the small side, but comfortable for a family of 4 (small kids, teens will need their own rooms).  All rooms had a mini-fridge, so you can bring outside food and drink in.   Using the hot water in the shower seemed to vibrate the plumbing.  You could hear the issue in multiple rooms walking down the hall in the AM.  It was weird that would happen in such a new facility.  Other than that, the room was fine.    The waterpark is a great facility.  At the time of our visit, the Wolf Tail was broken, so we could not go on that.  It was a little bit of a letdown.  All other slides were working and were awesome!

Exceptional service, staff really go out of their way to be friendly! Kids had a blast, super fun for the whole family! We'll definitely be visiting again!! Check in and check out was easy! We love that you can use the facility both days!

Best family trip ever! Our 2 year old loved it and so did my husband the salmon at the lodge restaurant was delicious and the wristbands as our key was an amazing idea. I wish more hotels did this. The rooms were very clean and all the staff were so friendly.

Dirty eatery rude, overpriced,fire alarm went off and it was scary chaos.Kids separated from parents,many parents upset.My 2year old Kid was turned away from the mascot until we could prove we had a extra pass which was 9 floors up,really. Your stay doesnt allow you to see all mascots.This place will trigger you the Hyatt is peaceful and has bunks. Save the money and buy knottsberry swim pass. Over $4000 wasted ,robbery.

Summary Heading: Great Wold Lodge is truly GREAT!
Summary: Our family of six went during the peak summer season. Even with the business of the hotel, the service was quick and friendly. As with all destination vacations, it's expensive, but if you book far enough in advance you can find some great packages on their website. It's not JUST a water park. If you have kids that enjoy video games then they will LOVE Magiquest. An interactive "quest" takes them all over the hotel entertaining kids for hours. There's miniature golf, miniature bowling, interactive XD theatre, arcade and more!  Just 2 miles from Disneyland you can Uber there and avoid the hassle of parking and trams. Our GWL package even included tickets to Disney!  We are so glad we chose GWL for our annual family vacation!

I took my five kids ranging in age 20-9 and they all had fun. We had to leave early the next day, wish we could have stayed longer. We will definitely be back!if you are planning to get coffee at donlins make sure you do it really early. The lines were long but moved at a resonable pace.

I needed someplace to take the family that wasn't the same old thing.  I booked a night at the Great wolf Lodge.  One night cost my $393 with a $50 food voucher.  One night will give you 2 days of the water park.  The day of your arrival you can get your water park wristbands at 12pm.  Plenty of slides for the whole family.  40% of the place is for the smaller kids.  Be prepared to climb stairs for the slides.  They also have a wave pool and a flow rider for wave riding.  You need to get there early of you want to claim a table.  The lodge does not sell tickets to the public for day use.  They do allow you to purchase tickets for other people to join you for day use.  $50 a ticket.  Parking is inside a parking structure and is included.  The food voucher fed my family lunch and

We took our 8 yr old granddaughter Sunday through Wednesday.  On Sunday when we arrived the lobby was packed mostly with people checking out and some people checking in. We were approached by a girl with a clipboard who asked us if we were checking in, when we said "yes" she said "great, give me your name and we will put you in "line" in our system and we will call you when your room is ready. Meanwhile enjoy the facilities with these temporary wrist bands".  This was at 1pm.  By the way, there were NO parking spaces left the entire time we were there.  They charge for self and valet parking.  People were complaining about it to the valet when our shuttle dropped us off and at the end of our stay when it picked us up.  We decided to explore and eat lunch.  When we had not been

Check-in/out is a breeze, rooms are cozy, resort is clean, food is good, wrist bands make life easier, water is perfect... we all had a great time.  Temperature in the waterpark was perfect. My son was given the choice to choose a birthday party with friends.. or to go back to Great Wolf Lodge.... this is his 2nd year choosing family time at Great Wolf.

The rooms were nice, the beds were comfortable, the rides were fun.  We ate at the buffet.  Prices were not that bad and the food was good.  A wide variety of selections (great when you have 6 little girls).  We took our Brownie troop as a reward for hard work selling cookies.  We had a great time!

Summary Heading: Bring your RASH GUARD, if you don't like being cold
Summary: Our family went in June of 2017 and we thought it would be heated to at least bath water, but it ended up being too cold to enjoy the waterpark. Our sons lips (he's 5) turned blue every day we went. Great fun place for the family but bring your rash guards or suffer the cold temps.

Everyone at the Lodge was very pleasant and helpful.  Activities and passes all worked for my grandkids. They had a great time. Check in was so easy.  Got our room right away, the room was ready and cleaned.  The water park itself was clean and clean towel were always available.  Only thing not enough table and chairs for eating.  Overall great experience.

Great trip with family. Kids love water park. It would be better with more kinds  of food and we don't have to go out for.the staff's are excellent and especially front desk. We asked for room before 4 and the room available 15 minutes after. We will come back and stay more day

The only bad grade was our suite was not really a suite.  Basically a joining room. You can't promote a suite to families charge them for a suite and sell them two rooms ridiculous.  everything else at the Great Wolf Lodge was first class and I would definitely refer other families to visit

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge doesn't respect 11:00 am checkout they start knocking on your door by 8:00am ending your welcome 😡
Summary: It's a family environment that you can't even relax because it's like they want you out of there before checkout and even if you complain nothing changes and it disappoints the kids who are happy to be there

So much easier to keep everyone together than on a cruise ship.  On our two night stay children had a wonderful time as well as adults/grandparents!  Very clean resort, rooms were great, there are a lot of staff members everywhere, and the next time we go there is still a lot more to explore! My DIL said the wolf den is great because it keeps the area dark  in the morning and her children actually slept in and were well rested for the day!

Great people. Both the employees and the clientele. Lots to do and you will never get bored of the water park. The rooms are very nice and the kids will absolutely love the whole thing. The only downfall I can say, which is unavoidable, is the chlorine is very strong from it being indoors. Bring eye drops and give yourself a break and go to outside section every few hours.

My 17, 7, and 6 year old children loved it! We only stayed one day and we swam and played from 2:00pm  to 9:00pm. Taking a small break to eat in the very convenient  food area in the water park. After cleaning up we ate dinner  at a very nice restaurant on the first floor. My husband took the kids to the arcade after dinner. The next morning my 7 year old son wanted to purchase a wand and play the magic game  that took you all over the hotel. He could have played that a whole other day. It would have been nice for him to  stay one more day. There was still much to do that we didn't get to  do. We still had a blast and my kids already want to go back.

Summary Heading: Water Park is the best part of the stay!
Summary: The best part of the hotel is the water park! It was our first time staying at the hotel. When reservations were made, was not given all the details and policy. Came across a little issue at check-in and did not feel the customer service at check-in.  We stayed one night and our bill was close to $500. It is a little pricey.

Place was amazingly fun. Buffet was horrible. Food tastes like hospital food and is ridiculous expensive. Literally played that much for a continental breakfast! That's as much variety as they had. Other than that no complaints.

They have in door water park, game room, bowling and so much more. Perfect place for kids. No need sunscreen. My 5 year old soon loves this place. The game room uses a card and you get tickets to claim prizes. The room have a wolf den which is cute.

Great family fun for all age kids.  EXCELLENT life guard presence in water park area.  Really liked breakfast buffet.  Please get some Scoops items such as shirts in adult sizes too so moms can match their daughters

Customer service need to improve it took me an hour to check into the hotel because the line was so long that's at the front of the line the agent was rude with that horrible attitude  extra speak to someone else he then told me she's going to tell you the same exact thing I told you but if you want to  speak with someone else so they can tell you what I told you sure just hang on

Great fun for the family. Rooms are very expensive $350 a night for a standard room. Dining is also tough on a family on a budget. We were able to bring in pizza from outside for dinner though which was good. Other than $$. The staff if very friendly and patient. The only problem is it is very over crowded. We went on a Thursday hoping there would be less people but very long lines...10 minute wait for an elevator. 30 minute wait for breakfast. And 40 minute wait to check in. Water park is very clean and well kept and the over all atmosphere is great for a family trip.

I felt like it was good to go once.... 2 days is all you need!!  Just be prepared for all the upsell charges on the property ....  The water park itself was fun for all ages .... The restaurants on the property are all  worth  trying , there's something for everybody ...

Summary Heading: Definitely the water parks is children friendly for all ages!
Summary: I would love to go back but the older children need more choices. I love the  convenience of the outside cabana with  waitress service.  I appreciate all the lifejackets!  The older children feel safe.  Great water building confidence with the babies!

Summary Heading: Go to Knotts Soak City or Disneyland!
Summary: Too expensive!! Food at the buffet does not get replenished and its gross. Lodge restaurant has a terrible menu. You can't bring any food into water park. Lifeguards don't pay attention. Grown drunk adult threw up in outside pool and closed it. He was near drowning, he was so drunk. Scoops salon store for girls is outrageous, $50 for only a pedicure. Save your money for this very expensive hotel and stay at Knotts hotel and go to Soak City and Knotts, for the price of Great Wolf!

The customer service is the best I have ever seen. Everyone has a awesome attitude. It is clean everywhere all the time. Loved that the waterpark was not over crowded. Had a great time. The grandkids are looking forward to coming back. One of my grandsons will not take off his wrist band. Lol

Summary Heading: DO NOT MISS THIS GEM IN SO CAL.
Summary: GWL is a brilliant place to spend time with the family. The water is 84° and the water park air is 84° so you are comfortable in and out of the water. The slides are super fun and there are activities for babies to adult that are fun. Magi Quest is a ton of fun (a digital scavenger hunt meets pokemon type battles) and you end up exercising all day and night. The rooms are HUGE, comfortable, clean and if you have a themed room and a magi wand the rooms come alive when the animals and bugs start talking and dancing. The Lodge has hands down the BEST steak in LA (Better than the Pacific Dining Car) and the staff is warm and friendly. Everyone has a blast there. It can get crowded but with only hotel guests allowed in the water park it's not too bad. The most we waited was 20

I booked a room for $99 but when I showed up they charged me $400.  The manager told me there was nothing he could do to accommodate me and said I had the choice of either paying $400 are leaving the resort.
Manager Response: Mike, the reservation you had made was using an employee discounted rate that required a voucher to be relinquished at check-in.  With these types of reservations, if a voucher cannot be provided we will either cancel the reservation with a full refund or update the reservation to the best promotional rate available.  We are sorry this did not meet your satisfaction.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: So I had heard mixed reviews of this place so my expectation was minimal.  I was truly pleasantly surprised by our experience.  In terms of value, I purchased a discount voucher and me and another Mom shared a Kids Cabin with our 4 kids ages 7-9.  Check-in was a breeze and we headed to the waterpark at 1:30pm.  I was sent an email by 2:30pm letting us know our room was ready. We went on a Tuesday-Wednesday so the park was not over-crowded. Lines were manageable and the kids had a blast! I just sat and chatted and watched them in each section until all were ready to move to the next section then sat and watched them there.  The room was clean and spacious enough for all 6 of us.  Now this is not an adult luxury experience, it is a KID experience and they LOVED IT!  We had a

My son been wanting to go here for his birthday celebration so we book it 4 weeks in advance the day before he developed a eye infection pink eye super contagious and his eyes shut swollen and I contacted wolf park to please allow me to reschedule for next weekend because Dr didn't think it was a good idea to be in the water because it could worsening the eye and infection pink eyes is very contagious and the Hotel said no I did cancel in the 72 hours cancellation windows and I will lose my $425.00 we didn't want to cancel the trip just want to have a credit and use it for another day. So becareful before you decide to book your reservation!!
Manager Response: John, thank you for taking the time to share this with us.  We are sorry to hear your son isn't feeling well, but noticed we were able to reschedule your reservation to another date.  If your reservation had been made directly through Great Wolf and not facilitated through a third-party website, we would have been able to address your concerns with other options.  We hope your son feels better soon and we look forward to welcoming your pack soon!  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary Heading: Fun for teens, adults, and little kids!
Summary: Great rides, short lines, safe environment, nice staff, clean--and lovely adult beverage selection that you can partake of in the water park!  Breakfast buffet rivals fancy resorts we've stayed in--no kidding. Pizza place is very good with great adult beverage selection--awesome to have arcade right next to it so kids can play while adults finish their meal leisurely. Cheesy animal characters don't quite fit with nicer "woodsy" lodge decor--but little kids seemed to be happy. Lots of non-water activities for smaller kids which I'm sure is great for younger families. My kids (ages 13 and 7) have mostly outgrown that stuff, but they were very happy.  Magiquest game looks cool, but kind of weird, too--not sure how that theme goes with the overall lodge theme, but other families

Its a  fun place to take kids and make memories. My kids and their cousins loved it. There is a variety of attractions to meet the needs of all ages. This is our second visit and had a great time. We will be back

The great Wolf Lodge was a wonderful experience for my family. There was a lot of stuff for my kids to be entertained from morning on into the night. Both my 10 year old and 3 year old had a fantastic time and wanted to stay longer.

We stayed at Great Wolf for 2 nights.  This allowed us to enjoy the waterpark and also be able to see other location attractions without feeling in a time crunch. The lodge is located centrally to many other activities and we were able to take advantage of several of them while staying at Great Wolf. Great service, food, and fun for all.

Place was OK self-contained your kids have some level of security and freedom resort need some work in check-in cleanliness in the waterpark with all the wet towels just sitting around hope it gets better as resort grows

Summary Heading: Good Place for families with lots of kids to enjoy!
Summary: Not a place for me! Too many people, too hot inside water park attractions......good for kids 5 to 12. Food and room were great and the outside open area was good once I fount it.  Also, need a good map, the map provided was no help at all!  Also, you need more servers in the food places for this amount of people attending..........long lines just to get a hot dog...waited 45 minutes after I placed my order.

We had a blast. It is on the pricey side but well worth it. We ate lunch at a local park. When we arrived at the lodge having a luggage cart available in the parking structure was very helpful. We had registered prior 4pm and the room was available. We played all evening. Planed on going bowling but after we made dinner in the room, realized we were exhausted. Slept well. Made breakfast in the room, packed our bags up and continued having fun at the lodge until mid-day. If we hadn't had evening obligations we probably would have left much later then 2:30. Enjoyed lunch at tables available to guests in the lobby. I hope your able to experience the water park at the Great Wolf Lodge.

Summary Heading: Great place for family with small kids
Summary: Convenient restaurants but expensive and water park. Very nice hotel. The water park was a little crowded. The room were clean, the peesonel is friendly. Not much to do for teens and adults. Parkiing is free.

Had an amazing experience.  Took my son and grandsons. Safety awareness was awsome and on point. Staff was patient and welcoming at all times. The story time was entertaining for all ages. Kept everyone attentive

This is a great place to stay if you want more to do on top of visiting the Disney resorts. Something for everyone, my 14month old enjoyed the dancing during the evenings. My 12year old and my parents loved the water park of course! And my husband loved how they made omelletes to order at the Loose Moose breakfast buffett!

Hotel room was spacious and comfortable. Tons of things to do. The food was great and the waterpark was amazing. The water was warm. I had a 4 year old and 1.5 year old and they had an amazing time and are begging to go back.

Took the family here and had a horrible experience.  Tge front desk people were rude.  Housekeeping never came until I brought it up.  When needed toilet paper I had to ask twice and then 30 min later I got it. The bar service kept forgetting my food and kept charging me for ever mistake.  The little kid pool had life guards that don't pay attention.

Summary Heading: Not sure if we will return
Summary: All in All it was a good experience but AC in the room was horrible and very inconsistent , either way to cold or way to hot. Due to lack of sleep I'm not sure i will return. Sincerely  Ben Macias Maciasconsulting@gmail.com

Summary Heading: You have to stay at great wolf lodge
Summary: Our eight years old draged me out of Disney hotel. I now a believer. Every staff is attempting to make you feel special. The water park is awesome, kids are happy and you are certainly having a best family vacation. My 6 and 8 years old love every minute here. Book it!!!!

We spent 2 days at the Garden Grove hotel and had a wonderful time. The whole place is very clean and well run. The food by the pools, although expensive, was delicious. My only complaint was the price of parking.Too expensive!!

Poor dining service at GREAT WOLF LODGE , restaurant called THE LODGE WOOD FIRED GRILL. I was served  waffles in a metal basket with a paper lining.  That's something finger food should be served in. I spoke with the manager,  his response was "THATS THE WAY THE CHEF LIKES TO SERVE WAFFLES"... WTF...IN WHAT COUNTRY?

Awesome smiling staff, plenty to do and an overall amazing time every time! Just enough things to keep you occupied the whole time and change it up a little bit each time we go. Love that they have a bar for adults too!

This place is amazing! There is so much to do for all ages! The inside temperature is perfect and the water is perfectly comfortable. The lines were fast for the tube rides and the activities for the children were exciting for them. So fun!

It would be great to give return guests a break on additional visits. The pizza quality at Hungry Wolf has gone down. I threw away a entire pie because it didn't taste good. Iv had better pizza from Dominoes at half the price! Also, the check in process was a bit slow.

My children(ages 7 and 8) had a great time and loved the Great Wolf Lodge Anaheim Resort. The arcade, bowling, 3d theatre and other additional activities enhanced the overall experience.  We will definitely return again soon.

Summary Heading: Horrible service especially for the price you pay
Summary: When we checked in we were told that parking was covered, yet upon check out we had been charged daily. The pizza was horribly soggy and we paid $40 for a pizza. Right after we checked out, we realized that my husband left his mouth guard in our room, so we called and they transferred me to security and I had to leave a message twice, no one called me back and finally I got ahold of someone. We had to drive an hour and half, so we didn't have time to wait. When we went back to get it, my husband stood at the front desk for almost an hour to get it back, they tried to tell him I already picked it up. Horrible. Great water park...but thats it...not worth the money.

Family trip for our family, it was great except our room was never cleaned on the 2nd day until I complained twice them they came at 7:30 pm.  Other than that it was a good trip. We will probably come back again next year.

Summary Heading: Best time in any water park ever
Summary: We came in not thinking this place could be so much fun for all ages. We have a 15,8,and a 2 years old and all of them including us had a really great time. Now we know where to go for our next kid birthday!

Kids had fun, I wasn't out in the sun win, win! The rooms were clean, the staff was great! There is a few places to eat inside including a buffet, dunkin donuts, ice cream shop. There is also places nearby if you feel the need to go out of the hotel.

The kids enjoyed the water park very much.  The life guards were definitely on top of things, however the cleanliness of the park area and their bathrooms was not good at all. The food at the restaurants on site were not very good either.  The snack bar within the water park was good for the kids. Overall I felt that you did not receive a very good value for what you paid per night for the rooms.  Overpriced waterpark with poor housekeeping and poor food quality.

Summary Heading: Really fun place for the kids.... oh and adults who like to kids too. Lol
Summary: Really fun place - the slides are great and nonstop laughing.  I would definite go back but not during weekend in the summer.  It can get super crowded and long lines. You have to stay the night to use the slides.   No day passes.

Summary Heading: Fun place for a day or two
Summary: I have two boys 9 and 13 years old. Check in was easy, get here before 1pm. The line was crazy long after that. Food isn't too ridiculous priced, tho we didn't eat in the restaurant. I think that's more pricey but nothing I want to eat. The video arcades and other games, like mini golf etc are ridiculously priced but kids love it. Dunkin Donuts was not expensive and good. The water park is fun, tons of chlorine and a bit stuffy but it's an indoor water park so that's to be expected. The bathroom need to be better maintained in the water area. Slides are faster then you expect. Wasn't happy that the one and last hour of the day at the surf area is for stand uo surfers only. We didn't notice it back there till the last hour so my son missed out. There is some kind of envolved magi

We were looking to do something local with or family. We heard so many good things about this resort and we were so amazed by the quality and character of the property. Loved all of the detail and how relaxing the atmoshphere was. We did not feel pushed at all.   The whole family is excited to visit again. This time for a couple nights!

great experience for me and girlfriend, and our boys to get to know one another.  Looking forward to going back but will try one in another state.  I heard they are all different experiences at their different locations.

I work in a hospital dealing with stressors daily. This trip with my 7 yr old grandson was just what the Doctor ordered!!  What a stress reliever.  I hadn't laughed so much in a long time.  What a great time.  I've told everyone about this place ( from friends at work to the grocery store clerk). Can't wait to go back and that it's indoors doesn't matter what time of year.

Summary Heading: The best place for the family
Summary: Best place for the whole family and it's next to everything best location . 15 min from Anaheim and all the good resturant and shop over there. The resort so clean and safe for kids my 5 years old just love it and he's saying that's the only place wanna go to next time he love it more then anything and my 10 months old just love the water park and was so safe for him and fun

Summary Heading: Lots of Fun but water park is small.
Summary: Overall way to overpriced for what the resort has to offer. For the amount paid for a two night stay. I could of taken my family on 5 day cruise. Just not a lot to do to fill up the day and what little there is the prices are outrageous.

Our kids love Great Wolf. We went during a busy time but we're still able to have a great time. The staff is very welcoming and there is so much to do. Kids are never bored because there's a water park, arcade, and more! Not to mention, the food and drinks are amazing! Great price for quality food. If your kids like to go to water parks, I would highly suggest booking a trip with Great Wolf.

Summary Heading: Service is poor and toilet was clogged
Summary: Unable to give us higher floor as we specify upon booking. Ok if it is really not available but they make it look like I lied cause they could not see it in their computer. When in fact I double check it with the agent when I called if she wrote it down and she said yes. The toilet is clogged unable to use it until service came up which took a while.

I would recommend to everyone to at least go once, it's a fun experience, had a blast. The beds were very comfortable!! Staff is very friendly and kid friendly, a lot of activities. The food was very reasonable pricing.

This is our second summer coming to great wolf lodge we love it!!! Just wish they had more food options...the lines for ordering are to long nothing we can't deal with but wish therec as more options so the lines won't be so long. Other than this we truly enjoy our stay.

Summary Heading: So cool play my family's. I like here.
Summary: My sons like here. My sons said want  come back next year too.^^* When I was checking in  that   Mrs. Knight was so kindly for us. She was wonderful. We was trips  in LA  and Viste here. Thank you . We rested so good.

Summary Heading: Fun, but watch out for the Great Wolf Logs in the pool!
Summary: PROs: I thought that the rooms were nice and even standard rooms have fridge, and microwave.  Resort. Its nice that you can charge expenses to your room, so you can leave your  wallet behind.  CONS: Other activities like bowling, and games are too expense  and Disappointed that management seems to cares more about preventing food from entering the waterpark than checking babies and toddlers for Swimmers.  Too Many "Accidents" from crap in the pool

Good for quick get away for family, everything you need in one place. Kids have spent most of their times playing instead on using their gadgets. Lots of activities to do that 2 days is not enough for a stay

Room was nice, and the water park was awesome. The restaurants are cool and kid friendly. Really love the all day free activities. Don't worry about buying everything your kid sees because they offer a lot of age appropriate activities to help curb expenses.

Good resort to stay especially for kids. My kids enjoy our stay and had so much  fun at the water park. Highly recommended for family activities. Very nice and clean resort. Very nice ventillation. Good food.

My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Great Wolf Lodge. The children enjoyed the indoor water park and as a adult I enjoyed the variety of things to do. I highly recommend the Great Wolf Lodge to anyone with children and teenagers. My family and I plan to return

Summary Heading: Staff are amazing with the kids!
Summary: My son felt extra special during our stay for his birthday with the birthday package. He walked into the room with a cake on the table balloons a big sign and he got to wear wolf ears with a little birthday hat. All the staff members told him happy birthday during our stay which made him feel super special. The water park appears to be very clean and they have lifeguards that are very tentative.

need more water best for the kids not enough around I hope to see deals once in a while coupons  or anything to make it more affordable that can help us  to visit it yearly over all we had a great time thanks

Had alot of time to bond with my kids on this trip mainly the younger ones as we played outside in the warm pools and inside in the lil play pools. My teenager made friends and forgot he had a family, which was ok. I would go again. Real close to my house.

Stay away from room 408! You have an ugly lot as a view and if you keep your curtains open, you get blinded by a flood light located down a pathway that shines right into eye level when you are  in bed trying to sleep. Also with fees and taxes, plan on paying about $100 more than the cost of the hotel room. Otherwise a pretty fun trip. My son had a blast!

Great wolf lodge will always be a place for my family to visit. It's the best water park ever. The hotel is always very clean. The staff is always helpful. The food is great. The water park is fun and exciting. I love the fact that we can go all year long.

Our trip was enjoyable over all but little things like rude housekeeping staff (I mean who leaves 2 towels in a family suite with 4 people the second day? and then tells you to call down to housekeeping when they are just down the hall in another room?), and a buffet that was overpriced for the food that was available. That being said, pool and overall resort is clean, and the rest of the staff was friendly (including the buffet service which was great.) We have stayed here before and the housekeeping staff was fine. Skip the Buffet and stick with the pizza place which has HUGE meatball sandwiches that are fantastic, along with their pizza. Burgers are good at the restaurant in the water area, and the ice cream shop has really good sandwiches and pickles.

It's a great place for all family members, very secure for the children and vest part is indoors . They have a lot of activities for the children. They have a big parking structure. The rooms are very clean and the furniture is great.

Summary Heading: First time stay and will definitely return!
Summary: Stayed two nights, comfy rooms, water park is good size, easy to keep an eye on your little ones. Pizza and burger restaurants were very good. Dunkin Donuts was also a nice treat. Kids had a blast, purchased paw pass and totally worth it, the magi quest game was a hit. Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

Undfriendly staff and prejudiced with asian. One staff jessica in a snackbar bear arcade was so rude. Room not ready as promised. No integrity. Buffet sucks. Front desk so hostile and unfriendly with asian.

Summary Heading: You might as well go to Disney for the Price
Summary: While my kids enjoyed the stay, my husband and I could easily tell that this location was not like the other two GWL we have visited (Dallas and Kansas City). Very expensive and way smaller. No hot tub/Adult area or outdoor area. Lazy river was tiny. If you want a water park go to Legoland or Aquatica. The Magi-Quest improvements were nice.

This hotel is great for kids to have fun especially the water park.  The room is very clean and comfortable beds.  The service is good.  My kids love it.  It also close to Disney Land.  We definitely will come back again.

I had an overall great trip. It was kind of difficult to get situated once we arrived at 1, since our room wasn't ready. We decided to go straight to the water park, but it took a good hour of wandering and asking multiple questions before having fun. I would suggest more staff available at the entrance of the water park to help first time visitors get situated.

Summary Heading: Great day in the water for kids!
Summary: Your kids will be exhilarated and exhausted. Lots to do and a ton of food and entertainment options. Great family day. Well located off the 22 freeway and I like that you can actually spend two days in the water park with a one night stay over.

My Grandkids, ranging in ages from 3-13 loved this stay better than Disneyland.  It is worth it for the Magic Quest but it does take 6 hours... they did not get to finish it.  Great idea and great fun.  The water park was great fun.  As a grandparent I could not see all rides the older kids went on, I wish there was a vantage point.   I stayed with the younger ones and we had so much fun.  My granddaughter is deaf and there was a life guard that did signing with her.  Awesome.

Summary Heading: Fun and unique resort, had a great time!  Enormous water park!
Summary: First off, let me apologize in advance for my long review.  Sometimes I tend to get wordy!  Had it not been for the expense of the place, I would have given it 5 stars (wanted to give 4.5 but wouldn't let me).  That being said, I used a Living Social deal (very similar to Groupon) and got half price, so for us, it was a great deal.  We got the Kid Cabin suite for $349 which we split with another family--yea I wasn't excited about that but felt I could hack it for one night to save money--the suite held 7 and between us there were 3 kiddos and 4 adults so it worked out perfectly.  Our deal also included water park passes for all for 2 days and a $50 dining credit, so all in all we were in for about $225 including the hotel fees/taxes, which isn't too shabby for 2 days of water

This was my first vacation with my family after losing a leg.  I was unsure about being able to participate and have fun with my wife and kids.  But the resort was amazing.  We had the most comfortable and safely accessible room that I've stayed in so far.  And I was able to take advantage of every attraction in the water park despot only having one leg.  (Except for climbing stairs - and although it was possible - doing the more aggressive slides took some planning an collaboration.).  It was an amazing feeling and a great mini-vacation for our family of 5.  And while it may seem a little more expensive that some other hotels, when you factor in the lower price of parking and meals, combined with the convenience - it actually is a much better value than it appears at first

Pipes are extremely loud and will wake you up whenever the next room uses the toilet/shower/sink.  The AC in the room didn't work so it was extremely hot in the room.  Everything is extremely overpriced.  Room we had booked was changed to a different suite which left no where for our 2 young kids to sleep (they ended up sleeping on the floor).  Front desk was rude and uncaring.  Told us what whatever they could to get us to leave the front desk and then turned around rescinded the offer in the middle of the night while we were sleeping.  Food was just okay, not worth the price.

My 11 to 14 year olds LOVE this place. Their friends can join us (for a fee similar of other local water parks) without having to spend the night. 1 visitor pass per lodge room guest. Meaning room sleeps 6 = 6 visitor passes. VERY Clean, secure, surprisingly good poolside food & drinks. Staff wants you to be comfortable & have FUN! LOTS of additional non-water things to do for LITTLE kids.

My kids from 6 years old till 21 years old enjoyed our stay there. Experience was priceless. My 6 years old wants to go back right away  :-)  As soon as we got there around 12:00, they were very accommodating even if the check in time is at 4PM our room was available so they let us check in. The room was very clean. The waterparks are nice and indoor, the kids tried all the slides and activities. My 6 years old daughter enjoyed the MAGIC QUEST, she get to do a scavenger hunt with her sisters.  The food was good, I like that they have Dunkin Donuts for my coffee :-)

We brought our 16,14, and 3 year old children to the resort for two nights and they all had a great time. There were a few times things like bandaids were floating around in the different water park area but other than that the park was very clean. It is a little pricey to stay there and the activities other than the water park are not cheap either it kept two teenagers and a toddler entertained for two days so we loved it.

Visit to Great Wolf Lodge - disappointing. Check in was abysmal, staff in accommodating, food really poor and not worth the price. In general very disorganized and chaotic. Restrooms were a mess and floors slippery and dangerous

stayed in the wolf den suite, room was big and roomy with 2 queens and a bunk bed. was here for 1 night, which i think is the best bang for your bucks. You get to enter the water park at 1 pm and stay all the way till closing.They meet you in the water park to do check in when your room is ready. Next day check out put your bags in the car and enjoy the rest of the day at the water park from opening to closing . they have  shower area and dressing rooms , so you can freshen up before you leave the water park. slides was fun,no more than a 10 minute wait. except for the wave pool which was about 30 minutes. only because its one at a time and each guy stays on there for a couple of minutes.  Cons : Expensive , you pay for everything            Parking, late check out, food,

Best tips would be rooms can be quite afar from elevators and have high traffic. Check in is super easy. We got to go into waterpark at 1pm and received a text message when our room was ready. Perhaps in the future they should have an option on tv or website where you can view your bill. Triple check you didn't leave any items behind, 100% positive no effort would be made to locate item. Love the fact you can drive in and out, parking included in package. A one night stay should be enough. We packed tons of snacks in our room to save money. Good luck to parents who have small children, be prepared to empty your pockets. Overall, have a positive attitude and enjoy this get away.

Summary Heading: Awesome & Exciting Fun For The Whole Family!
Summary: From the minute that we arrived at the Great Wolf Lodge Southern California/Garden Grove, the magic began. From the warm and funny characters, like Wolf Violet, who greeted us when we walked in...to the dance parties and water park fun, we had the most exciting family adventure!  We will definitely be back again in the near future for more fun!

This is something to try if you've never been in an indoor water park. Yes, it is pricey but they have several discounts available. I got the 4th if July discount and if you get lucky sometimes you can get a great deal from Expedia or Priceline like my brother did for $99 per night. For me one night is enough since you get to use the water park from 1 PM of the day you check in til 9 PM of the day you check out. Of course your actual room check in is @ 4 PM and check out time is still 11 AM.  Food is a little pricey too but should be expected, it's a theme park after all.

Summary Heading: Humid, dark, slow slow check in and food service
Summary: After viewing their web site and internet ads, I booked a 3 night stay in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. I took my 3 grandchildren (ages 10, 11, and 12) and my daughter.   A lot went wrong.  Long slow lines to check in, couldn't get into our room until almost 5:30, the water slide area is much much smaller than pictures present, good for little kids, not so good for over 10, very humid in water area - almost suffocating, long long slow slow lines to get food from the one food place in the indoor water area, bowling alley is super small and only works for tiny kids, arcade is smaller than pictured, room was dark facing cement building, refrigerator did not keep anything cold and maintenance told me that its not really a refrigerator, its more like a cooler and I should put bags of ice
