If you think you are getting a good value for your room and water park, think again. They gouge you in price for everything else. Including vying on kids wanting all of the extras... and there are a lot of them.

We had a wonderful time here! The pros to going to this waterpark is that there's something for everyone. The staff is excellent and we were pleased with how clean it was. The downside is that everything for the most part is indoors and it's very hard to breathe!  Also, plan to spend a lot of money in a very short amount of time. We spent around $1000 for four people in 24 hours. That was being conservative. It did include the room, food, drinks, bowling, miniature golf. We really enjoyed our stay and plan to go back when we have a deal on rooms.

Great Wolf Lodge is an indoor waterpark/resort with plenty of activities outside the waterpark to keep the kids entertained.  Staff is friendly and great with the kids. Plenty of options for dining within the resort or a short walk to McDonalds and other restaurants outside the resort.  The Great Wolf Lodge went above and beyond to help make our 4th of July/birthday celebration special, including a dance party on the top floor of the parking garage to view the fireworks throughout the city. From our room, we were able to see the nightly firework show at Disneyland just a few blocks away.  Great time and well worth the money spent!

Do not stay more than two days. Park is smaller than expected and we were over it on our 3rd day.  Overall the waterpark is fun for all ages, the attractions are fun and the wait time in line was no more than 5 minutes. The only attraction you do wait over 30 minutes is for the body surfing. Food is not all that great and the menu is very limited.

It's expensive but we got a deal on groupon so it was worth it. That's the only way I would go again. Other than that, it was a nice place. The kids loved it. It was nice that everything was ion one place. Staff was very friendly and our room was available o time.

So many activities for kids of every age. Super clean. Excellent, friendly staff with great customer service. Everyone was so knowledgeable and accomodating. Wish the lines were a bit shorter but way shorter than theme parks in general. Plus, I didn't have to put on sunscreen on my kids! That's always a great thing. If you have kids who love the water, this is a must!

Overall great time! Arrive early and get wet:) if you have small children upgrade your room. I wish we had. Our grand children had a blast. Took snacks and some food to keep costs down since we were a party of 6 but also enjoyed a meal and snacks at the resort.

It was a nice day to spend time with fam, kids had lots of fun! I would highly recommend this adventure to another family.  Would like to have a bit more water attractions though, but nice water park for little ones.

Summary Heading: Ideal to entretain a 6 and 2 years old
Summary: Employees are friendly and attentive.  It was unique because usually while traveling you come acroos a nice friendly person and look for this person when you need something, but here every one was attentive. I did not care much about the breakfast buffet. To my taste it does not have quality items to justify $24.00 per person.

Good location for us.  Property was clean, staff was courteous, efficient and welcoming.  Food choices were excellent and very reasonably priced.  We never felt the pricing for anything was overpriced.  We had four 10 year old boys and we felt the environment was safe enough to let them be on their own for periods of time.  This is the most important part of the experience.

Our two granddaughters had an awesome time at the water park.  We did not get much sleep for two nights because kids were running up and down the hallway screaming and yelling until about 1 a.m.  Very hot and humid while you are in the indoor water park.

It was 6 of us and we all had a great time. I did notice thought. That as soon as you walk in the indoor water park my eyes were watery and felt like burning sensation because of the chlorine they put in the water. Also the day we were leaving check out was at 11am and at 9 am I was already receiving emails to check out. I felt I little pressure to get out of the room.

No one clean the room despite numerous calls for housekeeping.  Should not spend more than 1 night.   We were stucked with dirty towels and bathroom.  For this kind of price, I would have expect some housekeeping service.  Not worth the visit.

Fun for the entire family from age 0-100!! The food was great. The water park was amazing fun for all ages. Plenty of life guards to keep the kiddos safe. It was clean. All the staff were super friendly and accommodating.

Busy, noisy, but kids will love it.  Not a place to relax, but you wouldn't come here for that and you have to view it for its purpose; Disney-lite mall entertainment in a giant indoor warehouse, themed as a lodge and water park.  Be prepared to be in close proximity to people all day. Reminded me of a Vegas for kids. One night was enough - the kids bedtime story show was very cute - but it's fair to say for what they do, they do it well. And the food was Ok; buffet style.

First time to the Great Wolf Lodge with my 2 girls (ages 5 & 6). They had a blast! Rooms are a bit pricey but at the end of the day their smiles and laughs made it all worth it! Room was comfortable and clean! Ordered a pizza to the room and it was delivered quick and was tasty! Can't wait to go again!

This is house of too much fun! My kids have enjoyed our stay here. For the first time I never heard them say "I'm bored".  The resort is very clean, friendly staff, variety of restaurants to eat. Kids fun program

Excellent waterpark to spend the summer days. My boys ages: 1,6,8 enjoyed it very much. Waterpark was awesome! Slides were fun! My older boys played the Magiquest game and although it required a lot of walking and searching for different objects, it kept my boys occupied for hours! The arcade was a nice area to hang out as well. We really enjoyed our 1st-time stay here at the Anaheim GWL. The Family Suite was huge!!! The separate bathroom/tub away from the sink was perfect! Beds and pillows were comfortable enough. Wish we could have spent a week here! Will surely return next summer!

The kids had a lot of fun but be prepared to spend an additional lump sum of money for the add-on activities.   The beds were comfortable but for the price the non-cabin rooms were pretty plain.    Overall, it's pricey for what you actually get.

Summary Heading: Great fun hotel for little kids and us big kids!
Summary: This is a great place for Kids.  My kids are 7,9 and 14 and there is something for all.  The Arcade is very expensive so we dont go there anymore, spent $60 between the 3 kids in 20 min.  The bowling ally is more for little ones, the lanes are small.  The Waterpark, being the main attraction is so much fun for everyone even us over 40s!  They have Yoga in the morning, story time, dancing, restaurants...the list goes on. Rooms are clean,staff is friendly. We usually pair our stay with Disney or Knotts Berry Farm and once you get back to the hotel there is more fun up until bedtime and then again in the morning as the water park opens at 9am.  Advice is to just really stay on the kids at the Waterpark if they are under 13.  There are Lifeguards, but be alert. My sons tube flipped

Summary Heading: Overpriced, unsafe, and overworked employees that show
Summary: Unprofessional management Staff seems tired and overwhelmed Property is already run down even though quite new Definitely did not get what I paid for Water park was unsafe for children because it was too crowed and slippery.  Lifeguards and staff did not provide clear instructions on each ride (what to expect, how to sit, etc)

Summary Heading: Awesome place to take the family
Summary: We just had our third visit to the lodge.  Our kids love it.  The waterpark is fun for all ages.  I do recommend water shoes because you can easily slip and fall.  I also recommend taking a break from the water, due to the chlorine smell.  Other than that the water is perfect.  This last time we went in one of the busiest times, so had a known, I would have taken my daughters floaty vest.  They seemed to be all out during the end of June, but back in February and November, it was not an issue.   The restaurants are pricey, but for the most part the food is good.  We also encountered long lines at Dunkin Donuts every morning, but if you prefer McDonalds was right across the street.  They have lots of free activities for the kids throughout the day, so we certainly took advantage

Told that check in was at 4pm but we could use the facilities at 1p. We were so happy that our room was also already at 1pm.  It was very convenient for us.  Our children had so much fun and did not want to leave.  We went during the 4th of July and enjoyed the viewing party to catch all the fireworks.  It was awesome!

My husband and I, along with our two boys (one teen and the other 8 yo.) enjoyed our stay at the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove. I had a few co-workers and friends tell me about their experiences at the Great Wolf Lodge and they had nothing but good reviews of the place, so we were excited to say the least.   We stayed overnight from May 30-31. The cost of the stay includes your admission to the water park.  Upon check-in, there were many guests but it was a breeze. The person that checked us in was very nice and helpful. She was very enthusiastic as well.  We were even able to get our room prior to normal check-in time, which was a plus. Our room was on the 2nd floor and it was the family suite.  There were two queen beds and had the amenities of a normal hotel room.  After

A friend recommended this place and we had a great time!the room was spacious for more than 5 people. The water park was very enjoyable and the staff was very helpful! It wasn't crazy crowded we were just in line for the slides like 10-12 mins. The pools were clean and food was great! Definitely will come back soon!

Took our 8, 7, 2 year olds, and 5 mth old and we all had an amazing time. We cannot wait to go back. The only thing I would change is the prices for the summer. Overall we all enjoyed and our 1 night stay was perfect .

We Had a great time and the water park is awesome.... The pack members were awesome and the kids activities were good as well. The Great Wolf Lodge is for Family and Friends to create great memories ..

The atmosphere was very kid friendly and safe. Check-in process was smooth considering the amount of people checking in, the process was very efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the microwave and refrigerator were an added bonus.

Amazing trip our daughters had a blast and the husband and I had a wonderful time as well. Great food and drinks!!  Not too far away from other stores and I would recommended to any family or friends. We can't wait to book again since I received an email with an offer we can't refuse!

This was our first time here and we loved it! Just be prepared for the humidity! It gets overwhelming in the waterpark after awhile. The food was great though and you can't beat the convenience of having everything to do in one place.

We stayed for 4 nights and felt that it wasn't enough. Great wolf lodge has lots of awesome activities for kids, besides their  wonderful inside water park . Definitely we will be back anytime soon or for another season!

Our grandkids enjoyed the water. Bring your own puddle- jumpers(floaties). There are not enough to go around. If you have little kids that need naps, do a late check out. The lockers are a one time use at $15, pricey. They are not unlimited use.

Summary Heading: Great family fun for the whole family and grandparents too.
Summary: The place is amazing.Very clean! The staff is friendly and great. Every family should go and see for themselves.this was the third time we've gone since they opened in Garden Grove ,California.give your family some great fun.

Great wolfe lodge is a great family get-away! All ages will have fun at this place, indoor waterpark makes that temperature of the place pretty much controlled, it's not sunny or windy! There are eating places you can select if you want.!and if your not in the pool, there are more activities that kids or teens can indulge on. I like that the wristsbands serves as your room keys too!

This was a fun experience for our family of three. My son is 5 years old and he enjoyed every parts of the resort, especially the water park. The hotel room was clean and bed was comfy. However, I must say you have to walk long hallways to get to your room. Our room was in the 160s range, and we walked a good 5-7 minutes just to get back to our hotel room. The water park was suitable for all ages. I love the wave pool, but make sure you put a life vest on your kiddos. There was a Dunkin Donuts and good eateries around the resort. The arcade was a fun place to go after we had dinner. The adults could enjoy the 3-D ride, which was super awesome. There was a cute bowling alley for the kids. you don't need to go out of the resort to find food. The resort have everything you need. We

Awesome Experience second be Time here planing to come in the winter .....This is truly  a Big Blessing to have this family getaway place so refreshing and a great place to get restored from all business life brings us ... beautiful memories to cherish with the family

All family members will enjoy this fun trip! Kids get exhausted from so much fun and parents have the opportunity to relax and have fun too! Our room was great and the atmosphere of a lodge feel is definitely present.

My family had a great time the places was so warming  and fun for the whole family.Recommend had a blast will come again .Just planned head better pricing if reserve weeks before you go .Just needs better meun in buffet .

Summary Heading: Very unfriendly front desk, but water park was good.
Summary: First time visiting this place. Was excited to play in the water park, but the front desk was very unfriendly and made me feel very unwelcome the first moment our family entered the resort. He spoke as if he was talking to himself, in such a low and fast voice that I couldn't hear anything or understand anything, and was just trying to rush us through the process. I had to ask what he just said several times, and I had to repeat my question several times as he assumed that I understood everything and just went to the next step. For example, he asked us if we wanted any hair bands, and as I didn't know what they were nor did I know if I had to pay for them or anything, I asked him "What are they for?" and he just answered "Alright" and gave me four hairbands. I repeated my

We booked Great Wolf Lodge to celebrate our son's birthday.  While we felt that it was a fun experience for our family, we felt that the stay and all additional activities not included in the hotel/water park pricing werte significantly overpriced.  An additional issue was that there are not enough elevators to keep from crowding and sometimes a long wait to get an open elevator.

Although this was a very nice, clean, and friendly resort it was way too expensive to stay here. We've traveled a lot with our four children to many places and I just can't pay this much for what you get. First, you cannot use the water park unless someone or yourself is a hotel guest (this is where they make the money). For our family we like to get the whole experience, meaning we like to get the themed room and show our kids a wonderful time. That being said, this hotel was more expensive to stay here than it is to stay a night at Disney's Aulani in Hawaii!!! For the price you pay...breakfast should also be included. We had a wonderful time...but there's other vacation spots I'd rather do for the money.

Had an exceptional time.. very kid friendly!! Everything is available within the hotel.. Loved the Cabanas.. planning next visit already. Would absolutely receive recommend the Great Wolf Lodge. Fun for any age group.

The concept sounds great but not well executed. Having 3 separate lines without some sort of dividers in a narrow stair well caused lots of confusion. Constant butting in line and pushing amongst guests. Also the type of tube and/or location to get them wasn't identified well. Also holding a tube with 3 lines smashed together didn't make the wait for the attraction very appealing. The amount for the stay and the amnesties just didn't seem to fit the value.

Summary Heading: Honor the time of  arrival that are given on different websites
Summary: I got my offer through Groupon and my check and was supposed to be at 1 o'clock and I ended up checking in between 330 4 o'clock which I found a little unacceptable that that was not honored. And that would of been nice

The pull out sofa was very uncomfortable. The bathroom at the water park was a little dirty including the floors at the water park. I have seen a lot of hair on the floor. The arcade games were a rip off. I managed to grabbed the stuffed toy 3 times with the crane and once it was ready to drop into the hole, the crane was still shaking and threw the toy back into the pile. I was so pissed cause I spend 58 points just to get that stuffed toy. I complained to one of the workers and she was not helpful at all she only gave me a replay where I wasn't able to get the stuffed toy so it was pointless. Other than that everything else was good.

This was a nice trip for our group but torn if I would go agaway n. I did not get a groupon like many and paid the online price so with that, although there was a sale, it felt really expensive for what we got from the trip.  Disney would have been cheaper for us on the right night.

We had an amazing time and plan to come again. We recommend noise control. We were not able to sleep comfortable because there were children screaming and running in the halls. We hope you can find a solution for the issue.

Save your money! This place is a rip off. We felt as if we walked into the ghetto. The waterpark is small and dirty . The elevators do not work and there isn't enough space for guests to get in one to go to their room. Food was not at all good and way over priced for everything in the resort. You have to pay for parking on top of the already expensive resort. I've never experienced a place so terrible like this where I am compelled to leave a review.

Thank for a wonderful time and keep up the good work. We went for my 10 year olds birthday and she had the best time ever   The suit we stayed in wase very clean and way cool atmosphere with the bunk beads. We hope to see you all next year again to start off the summer.

we had a wonderful time and will be going again.  my grandson loved everything about the resort as did I.  And Disneyland was just down the street.  after a day at Disney, it was wonderful playing in the water park.

It was fun, and it was close. It was a vacation without transportation cost. We brought our kids and cousins and they were able to navigate the water park without difficulties. There were also lots of staff on hand whenever we needed help.

Summary Heading: Extremely Expensive for What It Is
Summary: We saw a commercial for GWL and thought it looked like fun. We stayed two days in a basic room. The water park was fun and the kids loved it. You can buy a wand to play an interactive game throughout the hotel. HOWEVER, the wand is about $20 and then an ADDITIONAL $20 to be able to play the game! I thought that this was outrageous. I realize that I did not have to buy it, but you don't find out about the additional charge until you pay. The kid already has the wand and they are all excited. I think for the two days I spent about $1000+ not including souvenirs.

My kids have been begging to go to Great Wolf Lodge for vacation so we packed up and did the 8 hour drive to SoCal.  The first night was good and everyone was happy. The second day is where it went bad. I was in the water park with my kids. They wanted me to watch them go on the "Wolf Tail" ride. So I walked up and watched the go down. As I was walking back down the stairs to meet them at the bottom I slipped and fell down the stairs. I was badly hurt on the entire right side of my body and could not move at all for a few minutes. Someone yelled for help and the team members clearly did not have training on what to do in situations like this. They asked me twice to get off the stairs after I told them my ankle was really hurting and I could not put any pressure on it to walk.

Summary Heading: Fun in the waterpark but sad regarding room requested!
Summary: When we checked-in the staff told us she'll give us what I requested for room upgrade and have a good bday celebration but sad when we gone up to our room and we still had the family suite she gave us and too far from the elevator. Celebration Sad.

Great time for the entire family! We will definetly be back. They need more life jackets though on Thursday by the time we checked in there were non left! The helpful staff of Magiquest made the wand game so fun for my 7 year old son.  The food was great but the lines were long at Dunkin Donits in the morning. The rooms had refrigerators and coffee pots so that was awesome.

My children loved this vacation stay. We will definitely be back. The food was great, the activities were great. It's kid friendly I love it. The only thing was that the chlorine was very much in the air might need to vent the air a little more. But other than that I have no complaints.

Our kids have been begging to go to Greatwolf Lodge since it opened. It did not disappoint! The waterpark has something for all ages  Even our 3 toddlers got to go on waterslides.   Our family had a great time and best of all, they slept in the day after we returned home!!!

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge- Southern California needs to staff up!
Summary: The kids loved it, but they really need to staff up and work on customer service. The costs involved in visiting the hotel are high, so they need to match it with high levels of customer service. The establishment is clean. The food could be better, the Wood Fire Grill was great though. It's a good thing that alcohol is readily available throughout the hotel to alleviate some of the frustration with the lack of customer service.

Summary Heading: Very disappointed and sad about the service...
Summary: The staff are not very friendly. Do not smile, Do not hold the door for you even they see that you are having a hard time carrying your stuff. The lifeguard is not enough so they will close the area and you cannot use the pool until they are available. This is a water park place they should hire more than enough. The life vest for the kids is also not available all the time because they do not have enough. The Guest are fighting for it...its really sad because that is not the guest problem.. I am not happy with my experience and will not come back again...For the price you have to pay this is not the pace I will recommend to my friends and family...Lego land is the best...

Bought a Groupon and was so worth it. The water park was fun and lots to do for all ages.  The rooms are very clean and  comfortable.  The extra attractions are a bit pricey but other than that it was a great trip.

Summary Heading: Fun for kids, not so sure for adults
Summary: Water park is impressive and worth the trip. My kids want to go back, so I think I would only when there is a great pricing deal.  Otherwise, not a great value.  Hotel service is not great.  Our room wasn't cleaned the entire day, and it was very frustrating to call down to front desk or housekeeping to remedy--very long holds and multiple calls made before anyone picked up.  One staff person on duty at check-in at 7:30pm, maids wake everyone up at 8am with loud chatter in Spanish in the hallways and in adjacent rooms when cleaning, and garbage is overflowing in waterpark by mid-afternoon and towels are strewn all over the park.  Need staff to do intermittent cleaning in the waterpark during the day for the prices they charge.  20 minute wait for a hamburger at the waterpark

Our family had a great time from start to finish. Great Wolf Lodge is now definitely on our family's list for quick a get away! The staff was very friendly and readily a available for any questions or needs during our stay.

Kids had a blast, the water park is great for all ages. They loved the MagiQuest Adventure game, but set aside 4-5 hours during your stay to comete it, but it was the kids favortite part of their stay. Only down side of whole trip was the we had an issue with the shuttle to Disneyland. Did not make pick up run at night so I had to go pick up my kids myself.

The experience was great. Pizza was undercooked, beds were uncomfortable... despite those things, the fun outweighed any negative things. Our family will definitely be going back. The Lodge gives you wristbands that link to your credit card and serve as your room key.

I loved spending quality time with my grandkids. We went to the resort with our three grandchildren (aged 3, 4, and 6)  They enjoyed having their own log cabin in our room. They had a wonderful time! Their grandpa and I are pooped! Lol!

This hotel was great for our daughter. The water park is amazing and super fun for both our daughter and us. The rooms were a little dated and probably needed an update but we didn't spend a lot of time there anyways. My daughter also loved the activities.

It was awesome. I felt very comfortable allowing my 13 and 11 year olds roam the halls doing the MagiQuest late into the night. Waterpark had a lot to offer for all ages. Take air breaks outside ever 45 minutes to avoid asthma-like symptoms. As soon as you walk in the chlorine burns your eyes! But you need that much for so many people. We stayed for 4 days 3 nights just right to feel relaxed and be able to do everything. Our room had a wolf den; the kids loved there own space and TV- my husband and I did too! Wolf Pass for the kids is the best value. The grill place outside had the best food poolside! I would recommend bringing some snacks of your own, we had microwave and frig. A great time was had by all!!

Family friendly...kids had an awesome time! It was really fun within the safe environment. All of the areas were age appropriate. Price was a little steep as we stayed in the Wolf Den. I think the kids would have enjoyed the extra  $$$ to spend inside bowling or arcades...wish it was more cost effective after paying over $500 for our stay including the water park. It's like an indoor Knott's Soak City. Food decent but there's fast food at walking distance. Note: If your child has any food allergies or only eats organic food make sure to pack your own.

The room was nice and the water park had many fun rides and something for all ages. The low score is because it was booked to capacity so check-in and check-out took a long time, our room keys didn't work the first time, we couldn't find a cart to get our luggage to the room, and everytime we needed to use the elevator, it took a tremendous amount of time. For the price of this resort, I would have liked to have felt a bit more pampered and a lot less stressed.

Great wolf lodge is a place where kids could really have fun. The place is not that big. One whole day is enough. It can get expensive because of the games/arcade which is not included on the room rate. They sent coupons via email that can be use to purchase merchandise or souvenirs from their store. Overall, very good staff and clean place.

Great experience with the family. Very clean and welcoming. Many things to do and keep your kids busy. I would recommend more discounts and summer deals. A bit too cold where you begin feeling incomfortable, but overall a great experience.

This is a great place to go with little ones and multiple families.  Not so much for pre-teens/teenagers, though. The water park was fun, the food was good, and the beds were comfortable.  The rooms are spacious enough for families to not feel so on top of each other.

Summary Heading: Fun for the kids, Great bar, Needs a quiet or adult only space
Summary: Really loved the hotel itself. Rooms were standard hotel rooms (at least ours were which was fine with us as we didn't spend much time in them. It was beautiful and perfect for kids to run around and not get angry stares from hotel guests (MagiQuest ensures the kids runs around the hotel).   Positives: great bartender (Stacy!!) and rarely saw the kids with how much they ran around completing the MagiQuest and the waterpark. Food at the bar (also a restaurant) was good as well. We ended up eating there the whole time (we brought snacks for in-between meals). Liked that the waterpark wristband got you access to your room and you could charge everything back to your room with the wristband too. Very convenient. It bears repeating: if I could get the kids a day pass I would totally

Great wolf lodge is completely overrated and overcrowded!  The chlorine is extremely overwhelming  and the alcohol and the amount of alcohol that is served there is ridiculous for a family friendly environment! It's nothing like what we expected. The rooms were comfortable the staff was friendly but the waterpark is a big disappointment.

It is a great place to take the family and have lots of fun, but know that once there you will be spending a lot of money on food and other activities. We ate at the buffet and for the four of us our bill came up to 95.00, so plan on bringing extra cash for food and games!

I just wish you would give rooms earlier. Or at least check out would be around 2pm. But thanks my kids really love it. One of my son have a broken clavicula so he did not have much activity. Now he is telling me. "Mom when I get better can we go again so I can get into one of the water slide ". I told him. We might.

I have never written a review, but, I wanted to share my experience due to the amount of money it costs to visit this place. We have been to the GWL in Sandusky, Ohio. This is our first trip to this location. To avoid being wordy I'm going to do a pro and con list: Pros:    Front desk staff were great, check in was busy and they were efficient      Bellman I met in the elevator was very helpful      Housekeeping were very nice with our questions       Park was bigger than Sandusky park  Before I begin with the cons I want to say we didn't get to use the park for as long as we wanted we ran into traffic driving in and had to stop due to car trouble. We used the park from 4:30 on Monday til about 2:00 on Tuesday   Cons:     Slowest elevators ever     When we got to the hotel we

Arrived on a Thursday at 12:30pm and did Valet parking. Valet attendant was very helpful, check-in was fast, and our room was ready. We had the family suite which was VERY basic for the money we paid. It does have a microwave & mini fridge. The vending machines by the ice machine was empty with only about 2 things to choose from. It was never filled up.   We went to the water park (which you have to enter through the bear essentials store). They do check your bags but you can bring water and snacks inside even though it says no outside food. It was very Hot & Humid inside. The waterpark is pretty small. They do have a good size outdoor pool. Don't forget to bring your goggles, You need Goggles or your eyes will burn like crazy. They have life vest but if you have your own I

Summary Heading: My kids could not have had more fun!
Summary: We had a blast here!  My kids aged 7, 9, and 10 absolutely loved doing MagiQuest.  This place is all about the kids.  It was a treat to not have to deal with sunscreen in the indoor water park (and, as a side note, my 7-year old also appreciated that there were no bees :)).  Mini-bowling was fun, too.  The rooms were clean and the water-park had activities for all ages and stages.

The kids loved the bunk beds and we had a blast doing the Magiquest. The waterslides are always fun. We also tried the outside pool and that was really fun for the kids, too. Great selection of cocktails for the big kids. Staff are great and lifeguards are always ready to enforce the rules or jump in to save someone. I feel very safe there.

Went with family and friends. We had so much fun. Water slides are awesome. I liked the variety of activities for little kids and outdoor bar for grown ups! I would definitely stay again and recommend great wolf lodge to anyone!

Summary Heading: Interesting place... for a short time
Summary: This was our first time at the Lodge. We were putting our conference at VIDCON - Anaheim, together with the fun we've ALWAYS had at other water parks. First of all, I was shocked to find that most of it is indoors....? If this was in New Hampshire or Montana I'd understand the need to keep it indoors and fend off Mother Nature - but not in Southern California. You walk into the huge, 85-degree, sprawling water park where there's quite a lot to do and rides to go on, but where I was always a little suspicious of the "quality" of the water.  Outside they do have a decent sized pool but that closed quite early. The rest of the park is open till around 9 p.m. We had food from the on-site Dunkin' Donuts - always good - but the lines in the morning are AWFUL. PLEASE turn your head

Probably like most reviews, this is going to focus more on the water park.  It has all kinds of age group related items.  Small children (like 5 and under) have their own water park playground.    Then as the kids get older, there are bigger attractions, and even for the adults.  There are height requirements for some of the more advanced tube rides, but I think if you're over 48", you can ride everything (just double check that).  The only problem we had is the water basketball area.  That's a pretty popular place, and there are only 4 baskets, and not enough balls for the crowd that hangs out in that area, so you're constantly fighting for a ball to just shoot.  Not a great feature, so they need to fix this.

If you take your families to amusement parks for vacation you gotta try this place. This all inclusive destination was a great break from the hustle and bustle of the larger more well known parks. The location also gives you great access to other venues off site.

Summary Heading: Not for us (3 12 year old boys)
Summary: Food was $$$ after 1:00 lines for water park long Better to go to water park 9-1 bring snacks and food to eat in room. Better for kids 5-10 it was really hot I. The water park area. The mini golf was fun but a little $$ for the size. We had fun but would we go again no. Service was awesome very nice. Clean rooms the bunk beds were a hit along with tv in that area

We loved everything about this resort. Our family had a lot of fun, and it was worth every penny we spent. There are so many different activities to do as a family. Everything comes at an extra price, so make sure you take extra money with you.

Summary Heading: Some people may love it more than others
Summary: I found this to be okay, but the grand-kids loved it.  I am not a fan of chlorine, so an indoor water park with chlorine hanging in the balmy air was not my fav.    Here's what I liked:  You can just stay in the resort and you have everything you need to be entertained and fed.  I thought it was awesome that they gave you access to the water park the day you check in, even earlier than your check in, and the day you check-out even after check-out.  (Home to the most half naked people checking out that I have ever seen.  People get their bathing suits on and then load up the car.)  There are plenty of places to eat.  It is clean and well maintained.  Lots of eyes on the water and kids by their lifeguards.  Is probably super awesome for younger kids, like 5 and under.  Here's some

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge Southern California Experience
Summary: Overall, my experience at the hotel was fun during my stay.  My son enjoyed the entire stay there. I loved the Waterpark and activities for the kids.  It was a very family friendly environment.  I felt the food and drinks they offered was reasonable for a resort.  Keep in mind, they check your bags before entering the Waterpark so they are strict in trying to get you to purchase only their food.  Any type of snacks or drinks outside are prohibited.  Seating in the Waterpark is very limited so if you are planning to get any lounge chairs get there early.  Even though the Waterpark is limit to only hotel guests the place can get very packed and there are still lines for everything.  If you're looking to have any kind of housekeeping service needs, be prepared to wait on the phone

We're from Northern California. I recommend this waterpark for a family fun vacation. Worth the travel. Location is very convenient to nearby restaurants, stores and shopping area. The water park is safe and lots of fun things to do for kids and adults alike. Our room is spacious and very clean, just hoping for more quality hair shampoo & conditioner. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Great for family like us who likes to do staycation. My kids loved the waterpark and all the kids activity, my 3 yr old son had fun playing bowling & arcade. Price per night at the resort a bit pricey though. As well as the breakfast & dinner buffet price.

Great water park, great service in every aspect.  Great food! Everyone left exhausted but ready to plan another trip back Will definitely go back and probably stay longer.  Best water park in southern california

There was an issue with my room but it was resolved. The water park was fun and the slides are great! I came with two older & two younger kids & the younger ones enjoyed it better. For a place crawling with wet people & kids, it was SUPER clean.

Wonderful experience. Family friendly environment. Staff are welcoming and polite. My son and our family, had a great time on his 10th birthday. Great time. Great atmosphere.  Overall best time ever!!!

We went to celebrate my daughter's 8th birthday. It was really fun. We found candy trash in between the blankets and the bed.  We didn't get a text, call or email telling us about our room was ready. So if this happens to you, go and check at the front desk at 4 pm. Other than those details, everything was fun... a little pricey if you are on a budget but fun. I like that you can bring your own snacks and food!

Great family resort.  Pricey to our family.  Lot of food options.  Fun and safe environment for kids of all ages.  We had a family of five, ages 6 - 1.  Bummer only one kid on the slide at a time.  My daughter needed help but I wasn't allowed to go down w/ her.  Lots of options w/ water park, little tikes area, wave pool, big kids area, small / medium slides, and big kid slides.   Lot of food options, very limited healthy options.  Lots of sweets and unhealthy options.   Pool open early and late.  Food open for long hours. Staff very helpful.  Very busy at checkin.  Poor communication on multiple occasions.   Overall great stay.

We experienced an exceptional time at Great Wolf Lodge. The water park and kid activities kept us busy and excited to participate in more. The staff were welcoming, checked in with us throughout our stay to be sure we were having our needs met.

Go here if you are looking for a fun place for your family. There is always something to do! Our family of 4 had a blast. It can get a little expensive since you must buy everything that you need inside the lodge, outside things are not welcome, but they are not needed as long as you budget the extra $$$ money to buy them.

Great wolf lodge- only bummer was the pull out bed being extremely uncomfortable. It was clean, safe, wristband pay genius, water park was phenomenal! I would both recommend it to others and I myself will most likely revisit this location.

Summary Heading: Great Experience, but be prepared to empty your wallet!
Summary: My kids absolutely love this place, and so do I. We have been to a GWL before, different location, and this one seems to have much higher prices than at other locations. (It's Southern California) However, the park was great and we had a great time. Great park for year round fun, the kids will NEVER be board.

Summary Heading: Kids love, adults not so much
Summary: Kids love, adults not so much. All activities and food too expensive.  Outdoor area should be expanded.  No keys...only chips on wristbands for adults....older kids can't be as independent to go back to the room for things. But KIDS LOVED IT ALL!

Summary Heading: First time at great wolf. A++++++
Summary: This was our first time at Great wolf lodge. We brought or two girls ages 7 and 3 after hearing our friends hype it up. We had to check it out for ourselves and we are hooked! As you can see or daughter's have different lines and abilities based on age and bright. There was more than enough for each of them to do and tbd best part was the older one enjoyed the activities with the little one. A bit pricey...yes. But worth EVERY PENNY. Couple recommendations are 1. Water shoes for the kids, gets slippery.2. Water proof pouch for your smart phone. They don't sell them at the park had to go to target down the street. 3. Get one of the paw passes for the kids. Daves you money and spread out there items over the days.4. Have a great time!!! We already booked our next stay in September

Summary Heading: It is a fun place for family
Summary: The employees were very helpful the check in was kind of long  because every body was coming at 1 pm there was a big line but the front desk people were great they have free activities which is nice the water park was clean and also the bathrooms was clean too

The park itself is not very big, so our older kids were done in a few hours.  That left wandering around and finding the arcade, where the games averaged about $2/per play!  I think this is ideal for kids under 10.  Grandma who lives nearby has to pay to get in ($50 guest pass), even without swimming.

The park was nice however for the cost I was expecting more. We were not informed that there was a charge for overnight parking in addition to our room cost. There is a charge for everything that is not the waterpark so that was disappointing. The restaurants were ok but if you want anything other than pizza brought to your room good luck. Also there is only one option for breakfast and that's the buffet and I have a 4 year old that only wanted a bowl of cereal so we had to pay the full price. I was told that if I wanted to get her what she wanted I would have to go off the property so that was not cool.  The only reason we went was because they offered half priced rooms I don't think that I would ever pay full price to stay unless I felt I had over $1000 dollars to throw away.

Summary Heading: Let's Face It, We are Here for the Kids
Summary: Clean... Friendly...Oh and Clean... So we (2 adults and 6 yr old son) booked a three night stay with no real plans other then Disney one of the days. Once you are in the Hotel you could stay and not go anywhere else. They have entertainment galore. Packages are available that I think most would like, however, our son isn't into bowling and a few of the other things offered with the packages. Ala Carte it is for us. Speaking of packages the ONE thing I wish we would have done first is get the wand and do more of the hotel wide scavenger hunt. Our son thought that was a blast. Very interactive, kind of a pain for a parent with small people and sure glad the elevators didn't fail.   First afternoon, we got there with plans to go to the Jammie Jamboree Dance Party at 7 and the Story

The kids had a blast. Most of the park was catered to younger kids. We had fun doing the lazy river and the family river run ride.  Everything was super expensive though. Kinda a one and done thing. Everything besides the waterpark, you had to pay extra. The kids wanted to play Magiquest at night, but the wands cost $20! The theater, bowling, arcades, etc all cost money. I thought it would be a set price for all the fun activities, but the main cost only included the water park.

I recently took my 4 grandchildren (ages 7, 10, 12, and 14). They all loved it. We went in June for one night (plenty of time). You can access the water park the day of check in and the day of check out. I was very impressed with the number of lifeguards. There also was a great arcade (extra charge). The food can be expensive and there was an resort fee, parking, fee, etc. You can bring snacks and food to your room but not into the water park. I recommend the souvenir cup for drinks (free refills for your entire stay). Register for their e-mails to get specials and discount days. We will definitely return.

It was just okay.  I expected more for the price we paid (and that was after getting the discount through Groupon).  I thought the service could have been better (e.g., the restaurant staff forgot to celebrate the birthday that we had just told them about and was the main reason for our trip and the front desk staff was rude when we asked to change rooms because of noise).  Although there were some great staff, the restaurant mess up kind of ruined things when we had to get up and hunt down our waitress. We also wished the water park was a bit bigger.  This comment includes wishing the cues for the rides each had their own space.  For some reason they cue three slides in one staircase.  It's a very tight space (think of three adults standing shoulder to shoulder in the a

When friends planned a trip to Great Wolf Lodge, I imagined that an indoor water park would be dirty and unsanitary like many of the outdoor water parks.   I was wrong! GWL is spotless--they clean constantly and do an amazing job keeping things spotless.  More importantly, it's so much fun! We loved the tornado and the orange slide (although all slides are fun).  The hotel rooms are extremely clean and family friendly.  There's so many activities for kids at the hotel.  I especially liked the food I ordered at the outdoor pool.  Overall, GWL is a great getaway.  We can't wait to go back!

easy to get to, close to 2 major amusement parks, near major mall and short drive to beaches if you want sand instead of an indoor water park. resort fairly new and well kept. Disney shuttle available .

This was a great place for all ages to have fun. Great Wolfe Lodge has plenty activities to keep the kids entertained! The water park was great! The water was warm and there were slides for my big kid to go down, and a little kid play area for my one year old. We loved our stay. We will definitely be back!

Overall good experience for kids who love pools, slides, wave pools etc. Food is not up to a  high enough standard  for what they charge for it. Staffed by a lot of young very unexperienced kids. Very busy--

The room was dirty the pelow & sheets where Dirty trying to call from the room front desk never aswer the Manager In the Front Desk Tell My Wife That She is A Layer and Starting To Use Bad Language and told Us The He bean Working There For 9 years and told Us He Can Do That Ever He Wants bad Service & bean Rude To Customers this Place Is No More Than 1 Star * Hotel cheap Service Not Happy At all

Great Wolf Lodge Southern California/ Garden Grove is a wonderful place for families to visit. The staff is excellent. The rooms are immaculate. They attend to your needs right away. It was awesome that they had something to do for every age group in my family from my toddler, pre-teen, teenager, & my husband & I. We will be returning again.

A trip that was falsly advertised as a woderful family trip. it shouid be adv. as a trip for Mothers and kids 12 years and under...we were very unhappy .Everything was so very expensive. i took my grandkids 6 kids and 2 adults..There was nothing for adults to do .Yet they advertised for a fun filled family trip..Not true....

We booked 4months advance to get the best deal & room we wanted for 2 of our daughters birthdays. Skipped on the birthday package cause I didn't feel like it worth it for the price (which it wasn't in my opinion) Love that the life guards go back & forth checking everywhere & making sure all guests were safe. Plenty of towels & seats for everyone. Restrooms/showers were very clean for being a water park. Liked that I didn't have to take my wallet everywhere.

This Hotel could be improved. water park has strong chlorine  smell. Staff poorly posted and not in areas where they should be. Staff should  explain  water park to first time guest in greater  detail. Rooms are shabby and small for the price. Similar layout to motel 6.

Summary Heading: Great Time for the entire family;)
Summary: We had an excellent time during our stay. The water park was a hit with the entire family and the kids loved the time spent there. The magi quest was a great way to spend the evenings if you have children that are old enough.

What an awesome place for a family. Every other vacation our family has been on we hardly spend any time at the hotel, we are on the go, sight seeing and trying to find activities to keep the kids entertained but not this time.  This time we never had to leave. There was so much to do, it kept us all entertained.  The kids had a blast and we are already ready to go back.  Getting ready to book our next trip ASAP.

We had a great time at GWL. My son who is 5 was scared of some of the slides but just hanging out at the kiddie area and outside pool was enough for him. The wave pool is also great for all ages. The room was nice and roomy and had a fridge,microwave,and coffeemaker. I brought water and snacks but next time I will bring more food since you can store in fridge. Price was a little steep but I found a deal on Groupon and I went in summer which is the priciest time of all.

It was a lot of fun. The place was super clean. Friendly service. The food was super expensive and not good. The kids really enjoyed the wand thing running up and down getting clues. Just wished I would have started earlier. It did take a while to get our room as we checked in at 10ish and they said they would text when the room was ready. I had to go back and ask as we were all tired and wanted to go to room I had to ask at 4.

This is basically a cruise ship on land. Lots of activities for the kids. Rooms were amazing. The kids loved the separate room with bunk beds. I loved the refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker which allowed me to bring lots of snacks. Kids are already planning the next visit!!!

It was June 7th a full moon was out. I expected a thrill and a great family getaway and got the apposite. My 3 boys ages 5 to 9 loved the pool area. The place was humid as expected in an indoor water park. The Bad was that the upkeep and sanitation is taken lightly in a place where kids are the main guest. Poop on the floor was only pushed by employee to the floor drain. Disgusting especially when it reads avoid water in mouth this is recycled water. Took my boys and left the pool ASAP.  The miniature golf was great as well as the arcade. Cast members in this area more attentive and interacted more to meet our needs. Side pizza joint was good. The Bad is when we reached our room we encountered baby roaches and a big roach. We notified front desk only to have someone come up and

Was a good family trip. Water park had something for everyone. No outside food or snacks in the water park, but food choices are good. Full bar inside water area and outside water area. The room was perfect with fridge and microwave. Beds were comfortable. We will be back!!

Something that was upsetting was Magiquest closed at 9pm, we got there at 9:02 knowing what we were going to buy, literally would take  a minute to purchase. There were still customers in the store and we were denied access stating they register was already cashed out when I can see there are still people at the register- very upsetting as this happend in front of my twins on their bday.

Our kids had a blast! They are 2 and 4 years old; the older kids seemed to be having a great time too! The "adult' rides are great too! Great to go when it's warm outside so you can enjoy the outdoor portion too!

Summary Heading: Amazing fun for the whole family!
Summary: This was a surprise visit for our 12 year old son!  The fact that you get to use the water parks for two day was a huge benefit. We had so much fun as a family.  Lots of laughing and silliness!  We loved it.  The Hotel property and grounds were absolutely gorgeous indoor area nicely groomed and taking care.  Friendly staff.  My surprise was how nice the cabin rooms were decorating and supplied.   I was not expecting this, and the hotel room hit the ball out of field.  A beautiful themed rooms, lots of addition.   Our family got to relax, laugh and have fun - well done Great Wolf Lodge!   And, we love the ice cream dessert shoppe down stories.  Good family fun!

Brought my son here 2 days ago for a 3 day stay at the grand suite for his 3rd birthday. His friends had a blast. My son cant stop talkong about how much he loved it and how I am the best mom ever. We all had a blast.

Me and my family were not able to sleep due to the location of our room. The life guards were really attentive and paid close attention to patrons safety. I would return for my next family excursion if I was guaranteed another room.

Water park overcrowded you couldn't enjoyed at all kids smashing one to an other on the wave pool not to big for the amount of people on the water park.. I'm posible to talk with reception because lines was to big ...

Great fun and safe environment for kids! My daughter had a great time with her friend ! The room was perfect and fun for them they truly enjoyed every minute there. And staff went out of their way to say happy birthday to my daughter!

The hotel is huge and the water park is huge. The Orange County, CA location is bigger, newer, better than the Grapevine, TX location. Grapvevine, TX is very crowded and poorly run. There are several more rides at OC (such as a toilet tank/drop, a surf experience, carpet slides, and just more organized wait times and lines for the rides themselves) than at Grapevine so this location gets boring much quicker. The staff is NOT AMPLE. Checkin front desk only had two people working at 1pm when check in begins and the line was over 30 minutes long. Parking is $10. We stayed two nights last fall. It couldve been better. The hotel room was clean but not sparkling. the dunkin donuts line was ririduculously long. Grapevine location has a starbucks which wouldve been way better. But i

Summary Heading: Great vacation spot but starting to get packed
Summary: This was our second time. It is always fun and a great place for kids. Everyone is super friendly and when you are not in the water park you are playing magic quest with the kids or golf.  The water park is much busier this time around and the lines for the slides or surfing were too long at times. We werent able to get on all slides.  WE would still return next year because the kids had a blast.

My family and I chose to go on our first vacation. We have children ages 7mos, 2 years, and 4 years. From the water park to all the activities that were available inside the hotel made our stay incredible. All of my children enjoyed it just as much as my husband and I. We will definitely be returning.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The lifeguards were very safe, professional, and efficient. We were very impressed watching their process of ensuring the safety of others was met. The waterslides were fun and family friendly. We will be back.

Summary Heading: Great, fun for kids but pricey
Summary: Lots of activities there. One day isn't enough to participate with all the activities. Room is small even I got the wolf den. The bunk bed is nice but uncomfortable. Arcade game is expensive. Be prepared to spend money

Its a great place to spend summer with family. My kids love the cabin room. The hotel price quite reasonable since it includes the water park. They have promo on off peak season though. Kids will really enjoy the place.They have good selection of food and beverages.

Time spent with the family, enjoying this delightful place it was a lot of fun the kids and I had a blast  I would highly recommend it as a great trip! the staff was great the place was clean. the price was far.

Finally, we got to experience Wolf Lodge. My kids saw the commercials for this place on tv and were excited to go. It did not disappoint. Although there were many free activities during the day, i couldn't get my kids out of the water park. They were there for 7 hours. They would just come out to eat and drink and then head back. They were in heaven! This would not have happened at an outdoor water park with the hot sun beating down on us!  Kids enjoyed the arcade. The bucket of ice cream is huge- its a must!  I loved that all staff at Wolf Lodge was great- very helpful and amiable. No moody or rude employees- everyone was sooo nice! Overall great experience! Can't wait to come back!

we stayed in june for my son's 3rd bday!!we had A blast!!!we got a live g social deal for the room!!starting from there from booking to staying there and enjoying family time!!We enjoyed every bit of it!!Keep up the good job GWL!!!we can't wait to come back !!!To make more memories!!

Summary Heading: Only thing missing is table side service at the water park.
Summary: My family had a fantastic time. The water park was full but everyone was in a great mood. The only thing that would make it absolutely perfect is if they had a wait staff at every section delivering food and drinks.

Our whole family enjoyed both the room and the waterpark.  The food was pretty good too!  We have both teenagers and younger kids and it accommodated everyone.  We will plan another trip there soon. I love that the waterpark can be used both check in & check out day!

Summary Heading: Jaffe's family trip to great wolf lodge review
Summary: Our trip was amazing as always. This was about our sixth or seventh time staying at the hotel. We are always pleasantly pleased . The waterpark and hotel are geared towards kids . So even if the kids get a little loud you don't have to worry.  Totally worth every dime spent

It's a big indoor place for a bunch of swimming related actictives.it has also an outdoor pool which is super awesome. Friendly staff and everything you need is there! No need to bring anything. Have a fun time!

Check in was super easy. We did not even have to wait in line, we did the quick check in and were immediately given passes to go into the water park. Got a text at 4pm when the room was ready. Check out was just as easy.

This resort may be a little pricey but you could find a really good deal on Groupon and on their website as well.  From time to time they would have specials.  It is so worth it.  Me and my kids had such a blast.  Love the family slides such as the Tornado.  It may get tiring walking the stairs and waiting in line but it's so worth the effort especially with the whole family.  You get to experience it all together.  Then when you get a bit tired you can go to a pool called the lazy river. You can just lay in one of the floaters and you'll just be floating around and just relax.   I really enjoyed the experience especially with my children.  Their are so many slides and pools to choose from you absolutely won't want to leave this delightful place.

Such a great place to take your family vacation.  we had an amazing time. Food was good and the water park was the best. We already want to go back. We will be having another family vacation here. The loose Moose kitchen had a great breakfast buffet. And the pizza at Hungry as a wolf was very good. At night they have a dance party for the kids and it was such a fun time. our 2 year old was dancing all night. We really love this place.

Great water park and wristband convenience. WiFi and vending machines didnt work. Rooms cramped and under resourced. Great friendly staff. I would come again but stay at a different hotel and just use park.

Lots to do for the kids! The water park was our reason for coming, but it was only the beginning of the kid friendly activities. I really wanted to love this place, but the only part I really enjoyed were my kids smiling faces. Check in was SLOW! After waiting quite awhile in line, an employee was pulling people and doing "pre check in". He said he would take all our info, give us our wristbands, and we would receive a text as soon as our room was ready. Sounded good to me. Getting a bellman to then check our suitcases in took another 15 minutes of waiting. We went to the water park, the kids were able to change and get wet, but all my swim clothes were in the suitcase. Oh well, I figured I would get a text at anytime with my room (this was at 3:00). It is very warm and stuffy

We had a great experience. I had 13 girls ages 8-11 and 6 adults. Even though we were on a tight budget the girls had a lot of fun. There are a lot of activities you can participate in that are included when you book a room. They also have activities that you pay extra for like bowling, arcade games, magic wand game, and a beauty salon but the girls didn't ask for any of them. They had a lot of fun and were busy playing in the water park.  The lifeguards in the water park are very professional and take their jobs seriously. Everyone was friendly and helpful. They do not have joining rooms in the hotel so I asked for the rooms to be close together and on the first floor. They were able to accommodate us and we were very happy with our room locations and the size of the rooms.

The indoor waterpark is the main attraction, but they also have lots of other activities for kids. The main reason we like to go is because we don't have to worry about our kids getting sunburned while enjoying the water!

Had a good time  mostly likely to go back .I would like to see a more kid friendly restaurant.  The prices of the buffet and the grill were to high for what my grand children would eat. Would like to see maybe a coffee shop or toe restaurant

I have stayed at the Great Wolf lodge in the Wi dells over a dozen times and loved it, we moved to AZ and decided to try the CA location, every thing was about the same except the price, CA has so many taxes and extra fees that it literally cost double what the other locations cost. we will continue to visit Great wolf but we will never go back to the CA location because of the cost.

A fun place overall, great for kids, but be prepared to wait in some long lines.  I waited in line 35 minutes (yes, thirty-five minutes) just to check in!!!!  And I had made reservations weeks ahead.  The only reason I'm giving three stars instead of two is they permitted early check in, which was very helpful.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf CA, great family fun!!
Summary: A wonderful experience. Lots of family fun. Safe and nice environment for kids and adults! Lost and found did a great job searching the room for our lost stuffed animal the day we left. Did not find, but was nice try! Felt comfortable letting pre teens go on slides and meeting with us later. Lots of life guards around. Water temperature is perfect. Never cold! Lots of towels available. Bathrooms and showers are great. Even have a little dryer for suits. Food inside park is pricey, but pack snacks or lunch and eat right out the doors or in your room. Kids loved all the activities that are available. If you can spend extra, the Madiquest is many hours of fun...but lots of walking! Kids fell asleep in seconds at the end of the day!!!

We came here to celebrate the kids last day of school. We checked into the water park at 1pm and into our room at 4pm and we're able to play at the waterpark the whole next day too. We honestly could have stayed one more night there is just so much fun to be had! Make a plan ahead of time about what extras you're willing to pay for and hold firm. Do not expect Disneyland style customer service in the hotel though. We met one or two rock star employees but most were teens that didn't seem to give a hoot. Big shoUT out to the lifeguards- they do not take any chances and are lightening fast! It felt safe and like I didn't have to be a helicopter to a 9 and 7 year old.

Summary Heading: Fun for kids...grown ups lower your expectations
Summary: We went to make the kids happy and they had a bast, but all of the services for adults (cabanas, restaurants, etc.) really need an overhaul in quality and service. The quality at other family resorts is much higher. Just lower your expectations and focus on the look on your kid's faces!

take your kids, this place is fantastic.  The service, the staff, absolutely worth it.  and I love that it is indoors..They do have an outside pool if you would like some sun!  Everything is either there or very close.  Target is across the street if you forget anything!!

He attentiveness of the lifeguards in incomparable..my sister and I watched at the lazy river for almost 30 min. They were constantly in motion never sitting and never engaged in conversations that would distract for their job. I've never seen more attentive lifeguards not even at the beach!!!

My daughter spent her 11th birthday party here and had the best time ever! After 2 full days at the water park her and her friends were still not ready to come home!! Wonderful, family fun! We all can't wait to go back!

the overall experience was fun, staff were great. pricing for stay a bit expensive. for a first time my family and I enjoyed it. the rooms were nice and clean. although the bathroom were small. location was okay, there were other restaurants near if wanted outside food. we really enjoyed the waterpark itself. the other fun activities we didn't do, prices were a bit high.

Ive told my kids to going to costco,  end of it we went ti Greate wolf lodge. My boys were shock and have so kuch fun there. It was our first time trying it. But our family love it and will come back again!!

Water park is fun.  Better check in this time. Someone helps at the line and give you wrist band to go to water park first before actual check in is a good idea. This give you more time at the water park.

High priced but memorable for kids. For myself and my son I know I spent about $1,000 for 1 night stay and 2 days at the resort. They charged for everything and nothing was cheap. The inside and outside pools were great. The magic hunt was a little tough having to ride the elevators constantly from the lower level to the 6th floor.

We love this place. It's a great place for families. We plan to continue visiting Greatwolf Lodge, every chance we get. The staff is friendly they have great activities for all age groups. The food and atmosphere is the best. My family has the best time here.

This was a great first time experience. We had a great time, we were close to home, having an attraction, lodging and dining all in one place was perfect!!! My son loved the slides and we as parents did not have to worry about him roaming around on his own.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel/Water park we've ever been to
Summary: This vacation turned out better than I expected as the place was amazing and the service even better I would recommend this place to my friends. We rented a cabana and our waitress took great care of us

Great place for any type of vacation whether it be a big vacation getaway or a small Staycation.  Good value since it includes a water park that's fit for everyone. The resort is overall a great place.  The waterpark was clean (including the restrooms) and the room was comfortable.  We had a short stay, but was able to use the waterpark both days.  Definitely worth it if you come across the value days.

You need 2 nights here for the kids to finish all the activities that come with the wolf pass (if you purchase the wolf pass) it's well worth it . My child hasn't stopped talking about it since we left

Highly recommend this place, its great. Staff is super knowledgeable and friendly, the water park is great. They thought of everything to make sure that you are comfortable the entire time. Great family vacation spot!

Nice, quiet place to stay.  Very safe for everyone.  All attractions (arcade, water park, shopping, hotel, parking, etc.) are in one building.  The staff is very friendly, and the place is fairly clean.  Easy to check in and out.

My grandchildren enjoyed their time here with us. They came from Texas for three weeks and and we wanted to do something fun and different for all of us. They totally enjoyed themselves as well as we did too! We would definitely comeback on their next visit.

Summary Heading: Clean resort but way over price for what it offers
Summary: Nice resort overall but way over price. The water park is pretty small but very clean be prepared to spend everything in this resort is pretty expensive. Rooms were nice and clean I took my 6,13,and 11 year old and by the next day there were ready to go because after 1 day there isn't much to do the water park to us was very small not allot of attractions I have to say soak city is more fun. But like I said it is a nice and clean place...ohhh if you have sensitive skin beware the water park is all chlorine big time...over powering but for good reasons allot of people

AWESOME place to bring your family and friends to. We did a two-family min vacation. The food was very tasty and the selection is more than enough. The staff was very pleasant to every guest. Parents can feel "safe" to allow their kids to roam around with their friends/family members.

Summary Heading: Great place for a birthday party!
Summary: Great all-in-one family destination!  There was enough time to enjoy the water park as well as participate in other activities within the resort.  Staff members were friendly & were able to address problems when they arose.

Rooms are very comfortable & clean. Water park is a blast for kids. They didn't do anything special for my sons birthday but still a fun place to go to for a birthday or event. I wish they had a bit more to do in the water park for 1-2 year olds other than the kitty pool, still a fun experience.

Summary Heading: Great for Kids (But Not Really for Me)
Summary: My 9 year old and his cousins (11, 13 and their two friends) had a blast. They really loved it. And because they had so much fun, I give it 3 stars. But for me? Not fun, really.   Let me start by saying that I'm a hotel snob. I like very nice hotels, and Great Wolf is not my style. Here are the things I did not like about the room (a Family Suite):  - The air conditioner is a wall unit. Why no central air in a new hotel? It was VERY loud. First, the thermostat would click and buzz. Then, a few seconds later, the A/C would kick on. I would get woken up by the thermostat, and then kept awake by the A/C unit which sounded like a lawnmower. I decided that the only way to sleep would be to make the room SUPER cold, then turn the A/C off and fall asleep before it got too hot in the

Great Value and Great Experience, they really do make you feel appreciated and welcome! We are ready to go back with the entire Family again. the food, the service, the staff and the place were Amazing!! very Highly recommended to anyone who wants to have a good quality fun time.

Booked a mini vacation. Book months out and you can great discounts. We also recived a room upgrade upon request! Great stay. Comfortable beds. No complaints. Take time to eat in the hotel. Prives are reasonable and they serve up yummy food.

Safety  could be better.. hours of magi quest hunting should be enforced . Pool Aretha . Saw lot of running and falls. The rule changes per person I had a cooler with water . Not accepted I saw a cooler cooler with beer. That was accepted.  Be consistent ! Do You have a better price for seniors with grandchild ?

I took my Troop of Girl Scouts here as part of their cookie rewards. We booked directly initially and then found a better deal on groupon. There was a long line when we arrived, but it seemed to move quickly. Our room was ready when we arrived at 1:30 or so. We were offered Paw Passes for the kids for an extra fee. It got pretty expensive really fast. The recommendation would have been an extra $550 for us. We declined.   The water park was smaller than my impression from other people's photos and commercials. Not a bad thing, but just different. There is not a large outdoor area. The water park is heated to a balmy 84° so it's pretty comfy. It's very loud inside the park with all of the water rushing around and the very high ceilings. I felt like I had to yell to have a

Summary Heading: Great family fun, but a little pricey.
Summary: The kids had a blast! It was really fun with a very safe environment. All of the rides were age appropriate for the little ones and even fun for the older ones. The price was a little steep we didn't get the Wolf Den for the extra $300 I think the kids would have enjoyed it but we needed that $300 to spend inside. They had a lot to do I just wish the activities inside were a little more cost effective after paying 700 bucks for hour stay and the water park. But again the kids had a blast and I must admit so did I.

This was our second time visiting GWL. We had such a great time! First visit was in February, and as you can imagine, we practically had the water park to ourselves- no waiting in lines! This time we had to wait in lines. Granted, it is June and kids are out for summer. I would recommend going to the water park first thing in the morning, around dinner time and towards closing. Those are the least busiest hours. Overall, great experience! I recommend taking the kiddos to Nickels right around the corner from GWL. It is an arcade where all the games are only a nickel!

So we have been at great wolf for 2 days. We enter and leave park with snacks without issue. We also see people with outside snacks. On the 3rd day we walked in and was told we can't bring in our snacks. So I sat and waited for my family at the door and saw a Hispanic guy walked in with a mega size Doritos without any issue. There are certain snacks that my kids will only eat and you don't sell it. We buy food and drinks at the resort too.  We spend a big fortune staying and enjoying our time and can easily go back to our room for snacks but this is how you want to treat customers? I never had problem bring snacks in at Disneyland, Legoland, Seaworld, Wild Animal Park, Zoo.  Also during the bracelet making activity, my daughter wanted to make a necklace instead and was told that

The trip is always a surprise for my grandson. He did well in school. Promoted to the 4th Grade. It is always a birthday celebration with the family. I wish more family would attend but because of the overall cost, many cannot afford to come with us. Will you be opening another park in the County of Los Angeles? Making the park closer to commute too?

Summary Heading: Better than Disneyland in the summer!! Kids loved it!!
Summary: Summertime at Disney sucks because you spend most of your time standing in long lines, baking in the sun and trying to trudge your way through crowds like cattle in a tiny pen. We brought a 6, 9 and 11 yo and they had a blast. Said it was better than Disney which was only a few miles away. At first threw us off coz its in a fairly residential area but it's across from McDonalds and down the street from Roscoe Chicken and waffle. Everything at GWL is so easy and accessible. On check in day, you can come early and use facilities like glow golf, xd theater, arcade, magical quest game ( highly recommend). All of those have extra fees. Then at 1pm you can use the waterpark. You can preregister and they'll give you a wristband that you keep your entire stay. The wristband also doubles

Very fun environment for younger children but the older ones can partake and enjoy as well. Plenty to keep the kiddos busy. Water park is nice but the chlorine was burning my eyes. Staff was very friendly and the cabin was nicely furnished but the beds were very uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: Great place for a family vacation
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge is a wonderful place to go with your family, primarily because there is a very fun waterpark located just steps from your room, but it will cost you. There are some very great benefits of staying at the resort, like having a Dunkin Donuts, an arcade, multiple restaurants, mini bowling and a put put golf course all within a minute walk from each other. The food is reasonably priced, but if you can find a room for under $400/night then you've got a great deal. There are themed rooms available, but those will also add at least an additional $100 to your total. The basic rooms are just that, basic, but the beds are really comfortable. Overall, this is a good place to experience, but you may not return for a second visit because for the same price you can take a 10

We came here from an hour away. This hotel is super kid friendly, which I am not used to them running around everywhere especially through the room halls late at night. We would stay again, especially as our babies get older it will continue to get more fun for them. The rooms are not fancy at all but are simply a place to stay. This is close to Disneyland ( not quite walking distance) but just a few miles so we went to Downtown Disney a few times for dinner and to walk around. I love the wristbands with credit card and room key info so we dont have to carry that stuff around.

A newer hotel with indoor water park.   My 14 year old absolutely loves it.  It is warm inside and the water is pleasant also. Clean with plenty of towels and chairs. One thing - I am not usually health sensitive, but the chlorine was killing me! Eyes, lungs, headache. Be sure to bring visine and advil! The lower level has an arcade.  Our son loves the restaurants.  Yes there are some common complaints, but this is not a luxury resort. The rooms have a good size mini fridge.  BYOB. Perfect for a one night staycation!  It's all about the kids.  Water park available to you before check in and after check out.

This place is awesome. The water is warm, temperature inside the park is nice, they have an outside pool if you want to catch some sun. My 3 year old and 9 year old had a great time there is something to do for all ages. Its walking distance to many restaurants if you don't want to spend $$ in food inside the resort. They have a 24 hour arcade which is amazing after a long day at the water park. I would give 5 stars but the hamburgers inside the park were tasteless and expensive. Also the arcade games are too expensive. I bought a $20 dollar card for each of my kids and 6 games later it was gone. But besides that I will be returning to The Great Wolf lodge. I wish they had nap time are for toddlers :)

Long wait in line for check-in, no phone operators nobody answers the phone, front desk is understaffed. Ac in the room not working properly, leak on the sink. Switched room at 1am only to find out the tv in this room is not working. I am not expecting a vacation like this.

I felt like a kid having a blessing time with my family I didn't might at all about the money it was more than fair what we paid for actually it was tipper than sea word (San Diego )Disneyland (Florida ) Mountain creek ( New Jersey ) worth the trip and what happen to us about the Jack Hammer construction noise and vibration on last night of your staying was just bad management
