He had such a wonderful 2 day get away with the family. There's lots of fun  for all ages. Comfortable clean rooms. The staff there was amazing. Family fun for all ages. Very reasonable and affordable. Can't wait to go back to this indoor water park

My family had a blast playing all weekend here. The food and service was great. My 4 year old and 1 year old had so much fun with all the different activity  options. The lifeguards very diligent. Story time, and the dance party was a nice way to end each night.

Describe the service you experienced. I WILL BE BACK Tell us how you liked the room. EXCELLENT Talk about the location & amenities. VERY NICE Say what you liked best & least. this place is very cleanliness.

we stay there from Friday to Sunday, place is nice but price, you need to have lots of $$$, the Quest Game was a waste my daughter in law spent $150 the kids only used once so if your kids are not in to that do not waste your money, the reason I am giving a 3 stars is because my daughter in law reserve an indoor Cabana and they gave us one outdoors it was cold and they close the outdoors pool for more than 1 hours so we really only stay indoors so that was also a wast of money, drinks are expensive so is the food so make sure you take lots of snacks also the line for Dunnkyns is so long you better off going to Mc Donald's  I recommend you only go for 1 night and not on Sundays it got so crowded that we left the lines where to long and the pools full so...... the dance party and

My family had a great time! My kids (8yo and 2yo) ask me everyday when we can go back. It is clean, comfortable, convenient, and fun. You could easily check-in and not leave the resort for the duration of your stay because they have everything you need. They are also very close to Disney if you decide to go off property.

Went to celebrate my sons  birthday hoping they were going to like it because it was our first time there and they absolutely loved it. They went home crying becuase they didn't want to leave. They never done that for any other theme park.

Will come back but still pricey even for military discount! You have to find other means of food due to the price they have for the hotel restaurants. I recommend them having a military appreciation day or having a flat rate for veterans and federal agency jobs.

We enjoyed our stay at Great Wolf Lodge.   The. price of the food is not bad at all.  I like that we can bring our snacks for the room and they have microwave inside to re-heat our left over.  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  I have kids that like the arcade;  they played at the arcade while we waited for the food.   It is safe for kids to just go around by themselves.

We have been wanting to come here since they opened. Since it was so new, my expectations were a little high. But as soon as I entered the huge parking structure and had to park at the top floor since it was so full, I was worried. The place was crowded! Think of checking into a Las Vegas hotel on a holiday. The water park was smaller than what it seems like in photos and tv ads. This resort allows hotel guests to bring guests for a $40 fee per extra person and they allow you to enjoy the park the day of check out. I guess most people takes advantage of this which seems like a good deal but actually causes overcrowding. Save your money and go to an outdoor water park.

We had a FABULOUS time!!!! This is definitely the place to go with your family of all ages. The staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating. You must visit and see this lodge. it is worth every penny and more...

This resort has something to offer everyone. It's all inclusive and the pack members go out of their way to be sure you have a memorable experience. The best waterpark we have ever been to. We will be back!

Our family enjoyed every part of Great Wolf Lodge from the Room (Wolf Den) to the water park. We are from Hawaii and kids are asking to return. We came to Southern California and went to Legoland, Disneyland and Unviersal Studions. Our kids stated, Great Wolf Lodge was the best part of their trip.

excellent family vacation, the water park was fun for all ages in our group.  It was nice to have the food available at the water park location.  The hotel room was very nice.  The older children doing the magiquest looked like they were having a wonderful time.

Roaches in the Room dirty Room poor poor poor management service. They don't care about the customer or guest. Poop in the water park Only to just be scraped into the recycled water and having everyone taste krapp disgusting took my kids out shortly after that

Loved our stay... definitely will return and stay longer! The water park was awesome, with warm water! and lots of things to do for everyone! The hotel itself was sooo beautiful!  Entire Family loved it!

Great experience, kids loved it. We loved bowling, the theatre . Food was great. we had great steak, and restaurant was kid friendly menú. My kids loved their macaroni n cheese and special drinks. I would bringreccommend this place to all my friends n family.

Our family of 5 had a super fun time at Great Wolf Lodge. The staff were all helpful and friendly. The waterparks rides were really fun and exciting. We would definitely come back again. Thank you Great Wolf Lodge!

GWL is a fun trip for the kids and parents.  Our kids loved the resort and the water activities. The water slides were fun for all 3 of our children.  Ages 9,12 and 13 they all found slides they loved.  We went on slides as a family too.  The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful  and friendly.

Summary Heading: Fun times at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: I was one of a party of 5!! I am 72- and my daughter in law is 47 and my Grands are 16-14-12 We each really enjoyed our time at the Lodge!! I have only one complaint and that is that the sofa bed was uncomfortable- this is what my 16 yr old Grandson said! Other then that - it was a very great time!!

The hotel is average and overpriced for hotel amenities. The kids and family will enjoy the environment and waterpark. Take advantage of any discounts as this facility is 3 star at best. Family trip..

Good balance of Disneyland parks and onsite attractions. Gave us something to do when not at Disneyland. Didn't have to drive anywhere else on days we didn't go to Disney parks. Did 3 days at Disneyland and 2 full days at lodge.

A staff member should be checking on the restrooms every 30 minutes the family restroom had about 20 towels on the floor and when I went into the showers in the woman's restroom there was a lot of empty shampoo bottles on the floor

Loved the water park and bowling. My grandson and I had a great time! The beds and room were comfortable.The shampoo and conditioner, soap and hair mask were good quality. Extra blanket and pillows in the drawer. There is a small safe in the room. At the pool there are plenty of towels. There are bathrooms and showers, they had 1 swimming suit water extractor. At the end of the day the changing stalls was dirty with diapers on the floor, urine smell, and used towels everywhere. Some of the bathrooms run out of toilet paper. At the pool, the life guards looked attentive. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Family Fun At Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: This has been our 5th stay at GWL and we will continue to come back. Staff is always friendly and helpful. They let you in the waterpark early and even let you stay late after checking out so your family can still enjoy the waterpark. Staycations are the best at GwL!

We took our 11 and 17 year olds and their friends knowing it was a little kid themed resort. I was a little worried we would be too old for it. Not at all!  It was a blast!  Thrill rides galore. I'd highly recommend.

The hotel was great the service was awesome but for the price point I don't think it was worth it. Food was priced quite high the only interest I had in food and beverage was french fries the souviner cup and pizza. The pizza was not great at all. Oh and coffee everything else seemed over priced and drained the wallet staying there for about 3 days 2 night. Great food all around the lodge should really have better quatily and value and I would of stayed in like i wanted. The entire time. Driving around to find a good place to eat was not suitable and time consuming when we could of enjoyed the park more.

Summary Heading: So disappointed in staff and safety.
Summary: The quality of our experience was only adequate until it turned terrible on our last day. The resort is overpacked, with minimal staff. My 13 year old son was hurrying into the wave pool when he fell landed straight on his head screaming in pain instantly. I have never seen him in so much pain. After searching for help a lifeguard came and kind of brushed it off until I insisted that it was urgent. Quickly the aquatics manager came with his clipboard to make sure he had information but was not concerned with my son or his well being. There is no qualified medical care aside from the lifeguards which are minimally trained and immature. This is horrible and makes me scared for our children in the facility if there is something more serious that happened. We will never be returning

It was our first time and front desk didn't bother to explain what's going with the resort. No clue of the schedule. We didn't get our free ears too. My concern was we didn't feel welcomed at all, front desk just checked us in and that's it. We had to figure out what we can do .

Summary Heading: Fun for the family but saftey first
Summary: Overall great hotel. Lots of fun for the whole family. Although, Be carful in the lazy river. Water pressure is high and lots of overcrowding. Have your children wear lifevest and an adult present. Even if they can swim be safe.

If you buy through groupon, call the day before to check in.  The front desk was very accommodating and gave us an earlier check in for the use of the waterpark.  Our room was ready hours before the estimated time which we greatly appreciated.

This place was hyped up by the media. I would not return save your money and go to a real water park. Place was clean i must say.customer service was not good, not greeted, place is loud no atmosphere.

Our children love this water park.  They never want to leave.  Our youngest loves the spa and the arcade.  Our oldest loves the Magi Quest.  They both love the slides and wave pool.  The Hubby loves the outdoor bar!  Something for everyone.

Excellent ,awesome the only bad part is it was super crowded.It was very clean and members were very helpful we will definitely come back. I would really appreciate more promotions because i have a big family  ;) . Overall no complains.

Awesome fun!!! I took my grand kids and had a blast! It's a very safe environment with lots of things to do as a family or the kids can go venture on their own. There are lots of activities both water and inside the hotel. Go check it out!

This place is amazing. Only thing I would change is softer pillows...other than that - it far exceeded my expectations.  Our boys (7 & 10) have been asking to go here for a year it feels, and so we finally booked a night for our son's 10th birthday as a surprise. They freaked out! We got there about 2 pm ("check in" is at 4, but you can come at 1 to use the water park & see if your room is ready). We waited in line, were served a little cup of Mike N' Ikes and learned our room was ready early. Ran up, got settled and then checked in for our MagiQuest - seriously the coolest creation! The boys got their wands and the staff were in full character getting the boys excited and explaining the game.  This scavenger hunt lasts about 8-hours, no joke, and is this amazing game throughout

Great Wolf is an exceptional place for family fun.  Everything is very well managed and maintained, the staff is top notch, and even the smallest things are done right!  I highly recommend it for families with children of all ages.

Awesome, my kids loved it. I definitely recommend this place. My kids want to go back again. The staff are friendly. They have a lot of activities. The rooms are awesome. It's a must to experience this place.

First time here with my 9 year old, 11 year old, and 20 year old kids. Fun for every age group! Love the heated water and the wide array of things to do. Magiquest was a ton of fun also! We will surely be back!

It was very fun  : )  my children and grandchildren had a great time in the water park and all the extra activities they have. The staff was great Thank You. I would recommend this place to family and friends

Clean, safe and extreme fun! Even if outside was not a great day, the fact that all the attractions are indoor make the Great Wolf Lodge a great place anytime. We have two kids 8 and 2 yrs old and they had the chance to have the same amount of fun.

It was our first time at the lodge. The exterior and interior design was well thought out and brought a warm corest feeling. The games, activities and water park and shops made it very kid friendly for all ages ranging from laser games, golfing, and arcade. The food was good with reasonable quanitity for the price. The waterpark was clean safe and bathrooms were maintained to its quality. We enjoyed our first stay and would recommend others

Staff were very friendly.  The water park is great. Lines were not long.  Everything you need (entertainment, bowling alley, arcade, miniature gold, waterpark, children's activities, dining, et..) is at the park.  No need to go outside of the park.  The room where we stayed was a good size for a family of 4.  The room could have comfortably accommodated two more guests.

Just need to lower the price a little or include  meal coupons to restaurants at your lpcstion s but overall The great  wolf lodge gets a 8 score overall.grest place to take your family and friends . Nice vacation trip

My three boys really enjoyed our visit to the Great Wolf Lodge. Their ages range from 12-yrs-14yrs. The one day stay was more than enough time to enjoy the water park and Arcade. The rest of the activities are really geared towards a younger age group more like 3yrs to !0yrs. All of us had a great time and enjoyed our stay.

Even though we're Southern California locals, we took the opportunity to use a promo and try it out. We had an absolute BLAST! We only did the water park activities, but I was pleasantly surprised with how those activities met the needs of everyone (toddlers-adults). I also loved how there were lifeguards EVERYWHERE, so even when I didn't have eyes on my daughter every single second, I knew she was safe and having fun wherever she was. I HIGHLY recommend visiting for the water park activities. And if you have "tweens" it's a perfect place for them to be contained in a safe and fun environment, while allowing them to completely explore on their own. It's also nice that all the rooms have a refrigerator and microwave, so you can take quick breaks for snacks, if you're not wanting

Fun family overnight trip..kids had a blast, but food needs improvement and fun Wolfs Den bunkbeds were squeaky..Wish the kids free activities geared towards little older of 9-11 years old...great for 24 hours trip..

Me and my kids enjoy 😊 our family vacation in Great wolf lodge it was very nice that adults can ride the two big slides on fort Mackenzie the 🍟 were delicious 😋 the gift shop was little pricey but there was something for everyone to buy 🙂

Summary Heading: The best family vacation I've had in my life.
Summary: I brought my 4 year old daughter here for her birthday. She had the time of her life.She definitely felt like a birthday princess. I will be recommending great wolf lodge to all my friends and family.i will be returning very soon.

Great place for family vacation. Staff along with food quality was excellent. They are also super close to other theme parks and activities including Disneyland. Only issues we had is with the valet, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our car.

This was our second visit and we love it every time we go. So much to do, lots of free activity's for the kids. We ate dinner and breakfast at the Loose Moose dinner and the food was excellent. Great quality over all.

I highly recommend wolf lodge it is a Must go to resprt. So much to do. I would stay at least 2 nights next time. The wolf gang staff was awesome treated us like we were the only ones there even though there were at full capacity.

Kids enjoyed the water park. It was disappointing that our room was not ready until 6:30pm. And the person who help us checked-in that day was not friendly at all. She made it looked like that it was our fault that the room was not ready by 4pm. She just keep insisting and aguing that she texted me about our room, instead of listening to my concerns. Why would I fall in line again and wait for another 30 minutes to know about our room?

Excellent family fun allowing for activities for young and old alike.  We were able to bring 8 people and enjoy watching them all have a great time.  Best sleep ever in a hotel.  And amazing accommodations.

Fun trip for kids.  Lots of activities for all ages.  I have an 11 and 13 year old.  They enjoyed being independent and away from the adults.  The water park has lots of stuff to do.  There is a bowling alley, miniature golf, spa and arcade.  The food was terrific and reasonable.  The staff was friendly.  Fun trip for the family with children of all ages.

Really enjoyed the water park overall could have stayed an extra day....wouldn't suggest the breakfast buffet food was under cooked...late check-in and early check-out sucked....the water park was super fun but everything is expensive.

Kids had fun and it was worth the vacation. My kids and nephew n niece would like to go back again. We are even thinking of celebrating my daughter's bday here with the family again. My son and thier cousin had so much fun on all the rides.

Summary Heading: First timer at Great wolf resorts
Summary: It was not what I expected.  The wrist band was a big problem. I have 5 year old and 6 year old lost their wristbands in the pool or while playing. The resort charged me $55 each wristband. That's too much. We only stayed 1 night their and spent the same amount on wristbands as we would for Disneyland ticket.

Summary Heading: What a way to kick off summer!
Summary: Perfect start to our summer--amazing water park, delicious food, endless fun for kids. The staff was friendly and helpful. The environment was welcoming and engaging, the rooms comfortable. Our large family enjoyed every minute we stayed!

Great family atmosphere and excellent water park. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly.  It was my first time time here with my family and they all want to come back. Planning a trip to go back soon this summer

Great family vacay for a weekend. Wonderful service with people who works there and very accomodating. The kids love the water park even the adult one too! Excellent room service. You can never be wrong with the place.

Summary Heading: Love the water park the staff was friendly good amount of life guard staff, clean restrooms and rooms. Lots of activityb
Summary: The check in was no hassle easy check in so we can efficient and good prices were reasonable. I would definitely come back again when there is a special on the room prices. The parking spot was nice affordable parking fee.

Annual Summer trip with the family. 2nd time at Great Wolf. Price beats Disneyland. Smaller crowd and close accessibility to our hotel room. Parking included in price. Something for all agaves. Family friendly.

Awesome place kids loved it and will diffently be returning for more fun. Not just a watermark they have a whole lot of fun activities for kids! Price was reasonable and rooms were nice and clean. Staff was awesome!!!

Had a great time.. made such good memories with my family, I can not wait to come back and make more memories! My family enjoyed themselves and did not want to leave.. thank you for putting smiles on my kids faces!

Summary Heading: Nice but pricey for what you get
Summary: We really enjoyed the waterpark on location and that it was limited to guests. But beds were not comfortable, housekeeping service practically non-existent, and the pipes make a crazy vibrating racket.

Great time! Great staff and always a wonderful time & experience.  We have chosen to go to the GWL each year since it has opened and we have loved every second of our visit.  We had great staff and kind assistance on our last visit and wanted to see if they could top it again, they did.  We were offered wonderful and generous accommodations from the second we checked in!  So happy to receive the extra surprising gifts throughout  the stay from a late check out to a free pizza and an extra game of laser tag since my boys didn't understand the rules the first time. Each time we visit we wish it could be sooner that we get to come back.  It's something we save for now so our family gets a guaranteed awesome time!

The kids would love the waterpark. As a parent I didn't enjoy the lines for the waterslides. At around noon time there is twice as many people adults and kids in the waterpark it's uncomfortable. No seats and tables available. Many are reserved and not even occupaid.

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service and Very Attentive Lifeguards.
Summary: Great Customer Service.   Although there are some rules at the park the staff are very accommodating to needs and definitely makes you feel welcome and comfortable.  Activities for the kids are great.   Lifeguards are very attentive.

I've been to several location but this is great in size, offerings, and location.  We beat the June gloom by coming to the wolf.  Pros 1.) rooms 2.) 5 star staff  3.) characters meet and greets 4.) bedtime stories 5.) magic quest (cost extra for the game and wand) 6.) mini golf (cost extra) 7.) mini Bowling (cost extra) 8.) scoops kids salon (cost extra) 9.) the water park ride lines and towels are easy breezy  10.) this one had a Dublin' over a Starbucks. 11.) great deals via Groupon but better by calling reservations and asking for specials (such as $50 credit )  12.) gift shop 13.) rf wrist ban linked to credit card if desired   The cons 1.) parking cost (self or valet) 2.) only has a parking garage unlike other locations  3.) vibration that sounds like jack hammering in the

My teen daughter and I visited on a Thursday we loved it . She loved the water slides and the arcade . The food in the water park area is affordable and there's a microwave in the room . My god daughter who is 8 enjoyed the story time and bracelet making .  I recommend a weekday  it was relaxing and the lines where super short for the water slides .

This place is great for kids, no only for the water park but because of the many activities around the resort. Rooms are clean and comfortable but this place is very expensive. I stayed two nigths and finish paying more than $$800.

Summary Heading: Decent place for kids but bad customer service
Summary: Nice place to take kids but not a place you want to go more than once.  Service is poor and furniture is already breaking down.  Beds were lumpy and uncomfortable.  With the service we received, very likely we would of spent the money somewhere else.

We took my daughter here for her birthday and had the best time.  Everything was great including the food!  Room rates were a bit pricey so we could only stay one night but enjoyed our time.  Will definitely be returning!

We needed to find a place we're my toddler was able to have fun, do things and have a good time!!! This was the place! We loved it and are looking forward to our next getaway there soon!!! She was happy the whole time and so we're we!!!!

Great place Food is quite good in the breakfast buffet! loved the magi quest  many people were amazing to us esp the wait staff - they were very good.  wish they would do a better job with the lines for the orange, blue and yellow slides.

We've stayed at the Colorado Springs GWL and LOVED it.  Which, is why we were excited to come here to the SOCal one.  Cons: HUGE. Too big. Lines to ride the slides were close to twenty minutes. Not one line in Colorado.  Cannot bring food/coolers into the pool (Colorado you can) There are wadded up used towels everywhere...people just leaving n leave their towels. In Co, you scan out towels and have to return towels by scanning in, or you are charged for towels. Because of this it's EXTREMELY hard to find open seats. We were charged a parking fee, of $13...which as a guest, we have paid TOO much already for the room....no parking fee in CO.  There is no parental supervision of smaller kids, at ALL. Pools were closed twice before 11am for kids pooping in the pool. There is no

Took my 3 kids to Great Wolf and had my family visit as well. We had the best time ever!!!! It was such a great experience for everyone (kids ages 1-11) and even the adults had a blast. They really took the time to think about ensuring parents and kids have a good time and the environment felt super safe. Totally recommend people going and totally worth every penny.

Had a great experience for our first time being there. A little pricey but other than that had a great time . Will recommend and we will be back again. Staff so friendly and very knowledgeable. Life guards very professional.

Trip was so much fun and tiring. Loved the convenience of having everything in house.  Water park was so much fun and had something for every age group. Buffet was very good and not expensive. The hotel is very pricey, but I would come again. The adult beverages were FANTASTIC! The food overall everywhere we ate was very good and not overpriced.  Very kid friendly environment. The rooms are HUGE.

We were very lucky to spend my daughters 10th birthday at Great Wolf Lodge. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The establishment is very clean. There were lots of fun activities for people of all ages. I highly recommend checking them out if you have not been yet.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf was a great time - with a few caveats!
Summary: This was our second time at the hotel.  The first time was great.  Food was excellent and it was clean.  This time, food was terrible (scaled back on quality) and the bathrooms were gross.  Still a fun trip!

We had fun, just a little expensive and servers could be better.  But other than that my kids had a blast.  The water park was great wish they had servers walking around to take orders from us.  And the mini golf and bowling should be included or less of a charge.

The kids love this place!!!! It's super convenient with your hotel right at the water park. The only downside is if you need help from the front desk even when calling from your room you will be waiting awhile

Fun water park however, its very over priced.  The food was not that great and overly expensive.  The chlorine in the pool is very potent and it gave me a headache the whole time I was there. My kids had a great time though.

Great place to bring family... me and my children absolutely love this place ... I want to go back without my children so I can act like a big kid... with my friends lol... only thing I would suggest is lay something down on the carpet or add more chairs to story time being that people walk on the floor with there shoes... and the kids have to sit there but other than that... it's a wonderful place

Went with my kids ages 19, 10, 5 and 2 and all of them had the best time. There is something for everyone and kids can't wait to go back. We loved that it's an allergy friendly resort and there is no need to drive out of the way for anything! They thought of everything and everything you need is provided at the resort.

This was our first visit to GWL and we had a blast!  We have stayed at the nearby Disney properties several times and I can say that this resort is hands down a better experience.  Parking and check-in is easy.  The property is clean throughout.  We got the two bedroom suite and it was good size and equipped with fridge, sink and microwave,  Very convenient and suitable for larger families unlike Disney.  There are a lot of activities for the kids beyond the waterpark and all of the staff are friendly.  The Loose Moose buffet is excellent for breakfast and is priced very well.  The only thing that would make it perfect is if they add characters in the morning.  The hotel also has a Dunkin donuts, ice cream shop and two other restaurants.  You won't be left feeling hungry.  Oh

This was a surprise trip for our three kids aged 6,9,11. I like the fVt that you can use the facilities before check in and after check out. This enabled us to only stay one night, but get two days of fun

Summary Heading: Great stay for family and kids
Summary: Caught a good deal. Great place for kids and family. Very relaxing. Enough to do inside the hotel besides the pool. Need better management/guideline for changing room usage. (Boys are going in the female room with their moms, ppl using cell phone (talking on the phone) in the changing room)

location is good, Easy access to parking structure from the lodge, stuff members very helpful. what I liked the most is the kids really enjoyed all the etrateiment offered. I liked the least  is the nightstand in the room was to small.  Between the clock and phone was no place for personal items. ( meds, cell, water bottle.)

Family fun for all ages and a lot more than "just" a waterpark. Too many types of pools and fun ways to enjoy them to count. The best time to enjoy them inside would be first thing in the morning, that was the least amount of crowds.  The outdoor pool was a lot of fun and was more conducive to turning the younger kids loose - so to speak.    Besides the playing in the water we enjoyed fun things to do which may cost a little extra but are still fun. The impromptu groups of singing and dancing, storytime for the kids were great. Although the arcade and such cost a bit extra the games were not run of the mill and with it.    The refrigerator in the room was small and did not have a freezer compartment. We did enjoy yummy dinner and the staff was friendly and efficient.

We enjoyed our stay and the staff truly makes a family feel special. I appreciate the selection of healthy food choices. Unlike other theme parks where they gauge you money for healthy food items this park is reasonable. We had a fun and relaxing time as a family.

Awesome place and awesome activities however it gets crowded and no one likes standing in line for that long to ride water slides. The majority of our time was spend doing other things at the lodge because of lines.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf is great for parents & kids
Summary: This was our second visit to Great Wolf Lodge.  On this trip we were celebrating the end of the school year and 8 families from our school went (35 people).  If you are going with a large group and booking through the hotel, you should try to have one person book first.  There is a referral option, Use the link so that each of you will receive $50 resort credit for to be used on food, merchandise, or games.  Inside the waterpark, there is a wave pool, plenty of slides, an obstacle course, a flowrider body surfing area, a kiddie area, and outdoors (but we didn't try the outdoors area).  Since the park is indoors, there is no need for sunblock!  There are plenty of life jackets for the kids who are not water safe, so you do not need to bring your own.  Goggles and water shoes are

We will mos def be back!! My kids loved it!! From our arrival to our check out everything went off without a hitch. I highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge for all ages. The staff was very knowledgeable and courteous. The prices were very affordable for everything. It was definitely a safe environment for the kids.  Thank you so much for having us.

I rarely give a 5 star rating, while the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove didn't get a 5 star from me, it came darn close.  Check in was fast and friendly.  Parking was plentiful.  Although there is a posted speed limit, people were disrespectful, and drove way too fast in the parking garage.  The Lodge was clean.    Our room was a basic family suite on the 8th floor.  It was clean and comfortable.  My only issues with the room was the bedding, and thin walls.  The bedding lacked in comfort.  It felt short sheeted, and in need of a full size comforter.  Pillows reminded me of uncomfortable hospital pillows.  Our neighbors were disrespectfully loud.  They placed the security lock between the door to keep it from closing all the way, the proceeded to constantly go in/out of the

One of the few places I feel safe to let my kids play without having to fear theft or harassment. I love seeing the happy children and young families having a safe water park in southern Ca. The food is very affordable. There are plenty of serious well trained lifeguards no they are friendly.

Amazing trip from check in to check out! Room was comfortable and clean. Plenty of activities we never were bored. Wolf pass kept us very entertained. Many restaurant choices , we enjoyed not having to leave the hotel!

Awesome place for family vacation.  Magiquest game was great entertaining on top of the water rides.  Definitely want to come back.  The resort was clean & beautifully designed.  Everything was worth visiting!

They thought of everything! Great place for a family vacation!! Highly recommend this place for parents and kids over the age of 2 and up.   They have a great toddler area, wave pool, lazy river and tons of different water slides for ages 2 and up.  They have great safety measures and tons of staff.

Summary Heading: Lots of fun but has bedbugs
Summary: The youngest family member with us is 16. Everyone had fun but we were bitten by bedbugs. When I called to shorten our stay, we were told that we had a nonrefundable rate so it would be better to stay.

Great Service great attractions for the whole family. we are vegan so we had to drive out for food. Over all stay was amazing and we definitely be back in the next couple of months. We are excited upon returning.

Great experience for the whole family. We enjoyed pretty much all the amenities that was offered. Breakfast at loose moose was good. Service was excellent. We are thinking about coming back for our daughter's birthday.

Not sure where to start.. Check-in was like a Vegas hotel. There must have been 75 people in front of us in line which was crazy because my daughter and friend just wanted to get to the waterslides.  it took a good 45 minutes to get to the front desk.  Our rooms were not ready becasue we were there early which was fine and their system of contacting you via text and email works great once you have your wristband.  Our biggest issue was that both my daughter and her friend started getting stomach pain and throwing up  after 3 hours of playing.. I mentioned this to a friend and they told me that they had heard similar stories from other people.  The kids that go to GWL tend to be younger and I am sure they are doing everything and anything in the water and if your kid happens to

With the exception of the Lodge Wood Fired Grill and the Loose Moose breakfast buffet, our time spent was very enjoyable.  Unfortunate, because the last time we were here, both of these restaurants were great and I would have given it a 5 star rating for sheer enjoyment of the place.    All other places to eat were REALLY good though.  Eating in the waterpark and their pizzaria was definitely worth our while.   The Wave Pool, the SLIDES, and everything else about the waterpark, oh and the service all around, smiles everywhere...  I especially enjoyed the Howlin Tornado, scary when you're the one going backwards!  I will come again, especially since one of my boys says it's his favorite place in SoCal.

Good location hopefully they have jacuzzi or warm enough pool for seniors.. I have my mother who's with me want to swim but can't stay longer in the pool because it's not warm enough.. but it's really recommended for the kids.. we enjoy..

Took our family to the Great Wolf Lodge and had a very good time. Hope to go again another time. Water park was fun for all ages, I love the fact it's indoor no need to be out side in the hot sun was the best.

Overall good experience. Be prepared to spend lots of $$$$ a pop tart from a vending machine is $2.25  They have an arcade each game ranges from $1 to $3. Which at any other place they're .25$  Bring lots of money!!!!! Try to Get a good deal On the room.

We decided to celebrate my daughter's birthday at Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove. I included the birthday package and we stayed at the Wolf Den room. Excellent choice! Friendly staff, clean resort, and room. They offer everything inside so you don't have to drive anywhere else for food or snacks. We are going to plan our next trip there soon!

This is a great indoor water park,safety and cleaning,No bleach smells at all,that is so good 😊,They're provide Warm towels anytime,we are three family spends good time and very happy,definitely we will referral to our friends, and we will get raward again.

Overall had a great time just ac/heater was not working in the room making the night stay horrible. Have little kids a 3 year old and a infant 3 months who had to bare the cold. We told the front desk but no one came to fix it.  Park was a lot of fun for my daughter and activities were great. Plan to return for my daughters and son birthday.

We had never heard of the Great Wolf Lodge, and I'm so glad I told my husband about it. We booked our one-night stay with our 8 and 6 year old children. We LOVED it! The service was exceptional! At check-in, the employee upgraded our room to the Wolf Den (we originally had the family suite) and also gave us a free ticket for our extra guest we had to use the water park. The room were in almost perfect condition. Exceptionally clean, and the beds were comfortable to sleep in. They had a small refrigerator, and a microwave. The kids even had their own tv in their little bunk-bed room! I loved it! Love the fact that the water park is at the hotel. The water park itself was so much fun. Lots of employees to take care of you. One of my favorite things was the ease of checking in and

Summary Heading: Prepare for your eyes to burn
Summary: The hotel is nice . Rooms are great but that's where the fun ends. The indoor water park was so unenjoyable for two big reasons . Our eyes began to burn after 5 mins of being in the park . Also the humidity level was so high it felt hard to breath . This is concerning for all the family in there . We couldn't handle it . Luckily they had one outdoor pool we could hangout in . This was really a let down . If you like to be comfortable beware !

We have a great family bonding at the resort. My kids Love the water park and the water is warm and the arcade, mini golf and bowling are great. My kids love dancing till they tired. You have a lot of choices of food you like, and the food is great. The staff is very friendly. We have so much fun.

We had a great time visiting the great wolf lodge in Garden Grove  Ca . My Whole family had a great time it's not only for the kids but for Family, Grandparents . It was an awesome experienced. the room of the Hotel was very clean I am very please and satisfied.

Very family oriented and kid friendly.  Relaxing environment.  The food choices are specific to what my kids like, which is great because my daughter is very picky.  There are so many activities to do with the kids that we didn't have much time to do everything that was available.

We had a relaxing vacation. All staff are very friendly and accommodating. I can see how they talk and treat little children. They got compassion. Check in crew in the front desks are very efficient and warm and accommodating they make you feel important and most of all listen to your needs.  Frank, in particular is very knowledgeable with his job and first impression is very important.

We had a great family weekend at the resort. Lots of activities and events for kids. The rooms were pricey but overall Our stay was worth it.  Very close to Disney and other resort. We will definitely come back here again.

Everything was excellent, except my kids bed sheet has stained blood on it. The water park and games room was so fun. Check in time and CHECK out time was so convenient to my family. My family will soon coming back to the wolf pack again.

My family enjoyed this trip. The kids had a great time, my most favorite part were children were dancing til they dropped tired and exhausted 😁, great experienced for everyone and unforgettable . The fees were absolutely expensive but what matters was everybody had fun

The hotel is very clean the rooms are nice,  the location is good. The indoor waterpark needs some Fresh Air Circulating. It gets very stuffy inside. The outdoor pool is very nice. The Lifeguards are great. The restroom are clean and large. Food is great.

Summary Heading: The Caballero and Najera 2017 road trip
Summary: For having friends out for the first time at the Wolf Lodge they had an overall liking of it however my friends son was bit on the back by some sort of bug our first night there so I wish they would've had a  better  experience

I had issued with one employee there, no sympathy and very disrespectful. I would not recommend none of my friend or family members. I would not like for nobody to go threw what we went threw. Horrible experience!!
Manager Response: Isabel, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us and for bringing your concerns to our attention!  We sincerely apologize for the interaction you had with one of our pack members.  We understand you provided additional details in your post-stay survey and a member of our leadership team in Anaheim will be reaching out in the near future to discuss this in greater detail.  If you have any questions in the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Was a mad house during Memorial Day weekend. Wasn't very clean. My kids had a good time overall, but on big holidays it's just too crazy. They charge way too much for the quality of rooms during a busy holiday. I could have stayed at a Four Seasons for the same price!!! It's absolutely ridiculous!!!

This place is amazing. My 3 year old and 8 year old had the best time ever. us adults loved it too. We cant wait to go back! Make sure you plan on going early if you want to do the magiquest because it is very time consuming

We had a great time here, resort is very clean, there are tons of stuff and activities for the kids to do. My kids had so much fun at the water park and they range in ages from 2-16. They wolf den suite was incredible my kids loved sleeping in a "cave" and having their own tv in there. I got the birthday package and my son was so happy when we got to our room and saw a  birthday sign on our door and balloons and cake inside.Overall great experience for our family.

The resort was fun for all ages.  It was neat, clean, and lots of activities to keep everyone busy.  We were there for my grandkids' birthday party, and we took advantage of the Waterpark for two days, completed the Magic Quest, went to the pajama party, etc.  Good fun!!

First time visiting Great Wolf Lodge we had a blast. The hotel and water park were nicer than we ever imagined and my son loved all of the attractions. Can't wait to return! We love about 30 minutes away but we felt like we were away on vacation

Great facility! Exceptional staff members. I was pleasantly surprised with the price of the food at resort. I was expecting "Disney" prices and they were actually reasonable. I hope they can keep it that way.

Highly recommend, although on site restaurants and souvenirs are too pricey. Very fun and the children had a blast. I would definitely plan to scout out restaurants in the area to eat at but overall a great experience.

Summary Heading: Fun for middle to older kids
Summary: I went for a somewhat local getaway with kids. The off season prices were good considering the watermark was included. Kids would like to return when they are slightly older (taller) and can go on more rides

Known plumbing issue...front desk was rude..was on hold an hour for front desk..spent 2 hrs in room while making tried to fix shower...wasted my valuable vac time with my girls ...when I went to front desk the lady there ...after explaining what happened was like???? Ok ???and???

Summary Heading: Great form families with younger children
Summary: Out 2 night stay was near perfect. No reason to leave the resort and you can use the park nearly all day before your room is ready and after you check out. Showers and changing rooms are available. Microwave and short fridge in room allows you to bring your favorite beverages and snacks if you want to save some money on the F&B. Their chicken wings done different ways upstairs at the grill and downstairs by the outdoor pool were the best I have had in a long while, even though they were slightly more than I like to pay for wings.

Great place, my son and his friend enjoyed it immensely. I would definitely recommend it to any family who has young children. The waterpark was huge, the lifeguards were very attentive, the place was very clean and the rooms are spacious.

Highly recommend this resort. Fun for everyone in the family. Something for everyone to do. Resort is always clean. Staff is always friendly. Although food is pricey it's pretty good. can't wait to go back.

We took our grandsons age 11 and 9. They loved the water park and magiquest. Everyone friendly and safe place to let kids play. Never have to leave property which is easy for adults.  There were lots of choices for activities.

We were looking for hotels near Disneyland since Disneyland was our main draw.  When we started to price nearby hotels, Great Wolf Lodge was comparable and easily accessible to Disneyland. We decided to look into it (I was expecting it to be crazy expensive or not that nice since it was so affordable) and read reviews and asked friends... Everyone raved about it, so we decided to go for it.  What an amazing trip! We spent 1 day at Disneyland and 2 days paint at the hotel.  It was such fun!  There was plenty to do for a 2 year old.  The lodge really paid attention to all the little details.  Carts readily available to unload your car (everyone knows how much stuff you need to pack to travel with little kids), toddler friends food options everywhere, life guards all over the water

Not our first time at the indoor water park , last stay was much better! This time around A bug was found in the bed where my kids slept & A spider was in the shower, I tried speaking to A supervisor & was told one wasn't available, I've been calling for two day straight & still havent been lucky enough to speak with A supervisor.

The entire family had a great time, food is good, and hotel is spacious and clean. I took advantage of the gym (first time ever in any hotel) and I loved that I was able to enjoy all the great treats Nd food offered with less guilt. :) Made my heart happy to see my kids happy which makes every penny spent worth it. Plan on making this a yearly tradition.

Rooms were very dark and did not look clean at all.  Food was terrible and no good restaurants nearby.  No convenience - horrible coffee everywhere in the resort; no snacks/drinks in the room.  Gross dark couch. No healthy choices.    The was park was very crowded!
Manager Response: Raquel, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, as what you describe does not meet our expectations.  We would like to get you in touch with the leadership team in Anaheim to discuss your concerns further.  Please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and provide us with the first & last name on the reservation, confirmation number and best means to contact you.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary Heading: Fun place but watch your kids!
Summary: Do NOT assume the lifeguards are gonna save your kids.  They are there to help but you have to be vigilant in watching your little ones.  I saved my own child from the lazy river.  She almost drowned because she couldn't come up for air....she was trapped under a tube.  It was SO crowded she couldn't find a spot to surface for air and kept bumping into tubes.  She's 5 and they allow them to swim under water in the lazy river.  Thank GOD I was there to save her and saw it happening.  Be careful.  It only takes seconds.

An excellent time for the whole family. The service was amazing, the syaff male you feel important amd the kids feel special. The Kids absolutely loved the water park.  The indoor activities are pricey so we skipped those bit thwy seriously looked forward to jammie jam session and story telling every nite.

Summary Heading: A great start to the summer break
Summary: Had a blast with the kids, the rooms are clean and spacious have a fridge and microwave so can bring snacks and water. Vending machines available to close to the rooms. The pizza was amazing at the the hungry as a wolf Restaurant highly recommended I also got the spaghetti and meat balls says it's for 2 to 4 people, that's not true max for two people. So that was disappointing, next time I'll just get more Pizza. No other complaints though, had a great time with my family and friends.

Summary Heading: A very good couple of days fun.
Summary: We chose The Great Wolf Lodge after staying in the Traverse City lodge in MI. This is a new resort so is clean and tidy. It has great flume rides and a wave machine. You can also surf on the Wave Slider which is excellent. The breakfast buffet was a bit expensive so we went out for both breakfast and an evening meal, there are plentiful restaurants close by.

good staycation my seven year old son spent his birthday with the great wolf lodge I feel they should rent the magic wands out and maybe not charge so much for the magic game around the hotel. other than that is a good time a little pricey

This was our 5th trip to GWL in the past year. Needless to say, my family loves this place!  The customer service on this trip was outstanding. Our room was upgraded to a kids cabin which our 6 year old twins loved! Our bed was comfortable and everyone slept great after a fun filled day in the park. The pizza in the parlor next to the Arcade is outstanding.  It's so nice there are adult drinks available and plenty of food options to please everyone. I do agree with other reviewers that weekdays are far better if you want to ride each slide multiple times without long waits. Our family also enjoys the dry land activities. One small complaint this trip which otherwise would have made this trip 5 star was the 9 PM dance party. On previous visits our whole family enjoyed the music

I'm going to call this place great everything because everything was great and I am fully satisfied about this place the only small request I ask for is that if the water will be more warmer and also we need you guys to open a new location in the Bay Area

my kids loved their themed room and that they have their own TV! the place appears clean. though i find it small.  hope they would expand or add more fun water activities! but in total, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back!

Summary Heading: Not so great experience for the amount of money i paid
Summary: Contact director via email and no response Had a couple issues with customer service and they made me feel very unwelcomed Would not recommend family or friends after my visit. Your staff was not very friendly

From the reservation agent that helped me find a budget minded option to spend a night in Anaheim, to every single staff member that we interacted with, everyone with Great Wolf Lodge was beyond polite amd courteous. The hotel's upkeep was top notch. Everything functions off of adults wristbands. Room key, room charge, parking, afterhours access. In something you can't lose unless you cut it off. The beds were firm enough for me and soft enough for my wife. Our room had everything we needed. Even had a safe found in higher end hotels. The waterpark had all the rides you would expect in a waterpark. You dont even have to leave the waterpark for food. No shortage of seating in the waterpark. More life guards than BaBaywatch. The staff is on top off meeses that guests make....no

Everything you need in one place. A place full of family fun, for all age groups. Staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The wolf den rooms are a must if you have little ones. Entire resort is very clean.

We stayed at Great Wolf Lodge for the first time as a birthday present for our 9yrs old son. He always wanted to stay here due to tv advertisements and friends referrals .  We all enjoyed the fun time that this place can offer,mainly for the kids . The only thing is that I  was disappointed, when you make your reserv. They asked you reason of stay , which I mentioned, they asked more details about my sons bday making me think they were going to have any specials treats for him. But there was not knowledge of the reason of visit upon check in . Other than that, everything  else was fun . Beds super comfy. Room spotless. Water park very clean and organize .

The beds were a bit uncomfortable. I woke up more than once and couldn't sleep soundly through the night. Other than that, we really enjoyed our trip. My boys had a lot of fun. They really want to return.

I really enjoyed how kid friendly the resort is and how there were around the clock dryland activities to break up the monotony of the water activities.  I brought my 5 year old grand daughter along with her 3 year old cousin to GWL to as a graudation gift for my granddaughter.  Boy oh boy did she have a great time.  Her favorite piece was the Scoop Spa.  She loved the suite and asked "could we stay 3 more days?"  notice she said 3 not 1.  Keep up the good work GWL. :-)

Summary Heading: Water park is amazing beds not so much
Summary: Do you love amazing family activities but a horrible nights sleep??? Then this is for you! We had one of the best times you could have at the waterpark. The rides are top notch, the kids will never be bored, the adults will be so happy. When you go to your rooms though the beds are like concrete and the pillows like bricks!  Gift shop closes when the waterpark closes so to avoid broken hearts shop early! Food is incredible, and so well priced. I would definitely go again but would not spend the night there. None of the adults in either of our parties slept well and we were all in pain the next day.

The most convienent place I've visited with my family. The whole resort offered everything we needed and not once did we have to leave the resort. you can get a good deal if you sign up for the emails but the rooms are a little pricey. Everything besides the arcade was reasonable priced.

This was a birthday celebration.my son turned 6 and both of my kids and parents as well fell in love with the place. We needed a short break away from reality and you provided that for us. Thank you!!!

The staff is not very welcoming. Restaurants and stores close pretty early. My kids enjoyed it and the rooms are very clean and comfortable however i was trying to get housekeeping and called front desk and they wouldnt pick up so i bumped into a house cleaning lady and I requested it.

Perfect.   Great.  Funn       My family really enjoyed our action & I am hopeful that soon we will return . I love the staff & the bed was so comfy. My kids really enjoyed the water park & at one point I couldn't find my daughter & the staff was amazing

Just made it home from Great Wolf and this was our second time my daughter wanted to celebrate her birthday at Great Wolf . Last year when she turned 10 we arrived on a Saturday and this year we arrived on a Tuesday and skipped school Wenesday  . Let's just say what a world of difference both times we made great memories and had lots of laughs but honestly if you can go mid week I highly recommend it . No wait times for slides , no fighting for chairs to place your towel and honestly just a real chill vibe . Because it was so slow we got to exchange rooms and pay a fee to uprgarde last minute . I don't think I can ever return on a weekend again . Also if you haven't been you will be pleasantly surprised how yummy all the food is , not your typical amusement park food . Also

Everything was amazing! Food was delicious. They made the bday boy feel special. Waterpark wasn't too crowded (even for the weekend) and they have other things to do after waterpark shuts  down (arcade, bowling, mini golf are the ones we did).

Team members were very rude and the places need to be cleaned up throughout the day. They water is fun and there are a lot of thing to do with the kids. Overall I would of given a better review but a few employees were just plain rude

Kids and i enjoyed the water park as well as the hotel stay.  Will be returning again. Hotel was clean as well as staff was very helpful.  Loved that the arcade is open 24 hrs for kids to enjoy after water park.

Family had a great time. There was plenty of fun for my adult children as well as my younger, 6 and 7 year old children. My kids have food allergies and it was difficult to find appropriate food so we ate down the street.

It's a great waterpark.  We enjoyed the lazy river, wave pool, main tower that provides slides, kids pool.  We have two young children (one toddler and one infant), so we didn't get to try the really exciting stuff.  I like how it's indoor and everything is connected and how quickly the staff brought up the crib when we requested it.  However, our room heater was not working (room was very cold).  The check in staff didn't give us the wolf ears while everybody else got it.  The breakfast buffet's bowls were lacking (while all kids would want cereal bowls)  The amount of merchandizes being sold at the kids events are a bit too much and left a bad taste.

This place is all about the kids.  If you're looking to do something fun and close if you live in the area it's outstanding.  Something going on all day besides the water slides.  Food was good.  Very overcrowded on weekends - so if you don't like crowds, you won't appreciate it.  We had a great family stay here.

Summary Heading: Most amazing hotel I've ever stayed at. Fun, Classy, Clean and Friendly Enthusiastic Staff.
Summary: not only  is this the funnest  place for the whole family but everything about this hotel from food, rooms, activities and staff is outstanding.  We so pleasantly surprised how friendly and professional every staff member was  from check in , lifeguards , kids activities and restaurants treated us  Best Hotel ever.

It is a great place to take older children and also strong swimmers. It is not such a great place for little children or those who are not strong swimmers. Hate that you can't have outside food. It sucks you in and makes you spend money on their food. It's not convienent to go off property for food. My recommendation is to bring food before you areive. The rooms have a fridge and microwave.

if you're depending on the Disneyland Shuttle. Check their schedule before booking room. It doesn't run every day all year long.  The kids loved the Lodge. They never want to stay anywhere else. The activities are amazing.

The great wolf lodge was a great way to spend the day with the kids at the water park and a good night to relax after. It was an excellent choice in stay and fun way to spend the day getting exhausted.

Overall we had a good experience. The kids had fun. The rooms are comfortable, the service was good, but some things need to be improved.  Mainly, you must fix water park ventilation & safety. It is unbearable for me to stay inside the water park as a pregnant woman.

Summary Heading: Everything we needed under one roof
Summary: Took our 2 young kids here for 3 days, and had a great time. The waterpark felt safe, there was plenty to do for each age group, it was a short walk back to our room for naps, and it was super easy to grab food and eat right there without having to stop all the fun. The rest of the lodge has fun stuff to do before and after the waterpark, though I wish there was a bit more for REALLY young kids to do. The arcade was mostly for ages 6+, and while the activities in the lobby were great, I wish they's run things like the animatronic animal show a bit more often since little ones could watch that all day.  But overall it was a GREAT experience, just look for online coupons or Groupons and save $$$. Do some searching - We found a code that saved us $150 more than the already-good

Summary Heading: Price for the stay is expensive!
Summary: The nightly rate for the rooms and water park is very overpriced. When you compare it to going somewhere like Las Vegas Nevada and spending the day out in the pool etc. the cost of this seems ridiculous.

My 10 year old nephew loves it and I have dropped the huge amounts of money to take him for his birthday 2 years in a row.  The service was the worse this time.  I tried hard to convince him to choose Legoland or Disneyland or anything else.  I think after this years terrible service I will just say this isn't an option.

Great Wolf Lodge is a fantastic place to visit for a great family getaway. The water park is excellent with a large variety of water slides and pools. Something for people of all ages. Heart stopping slides to lazy river floats.Great time for all.

Love the variety of things to do for ALL ages. Our whole family had such a blast, it took days to recover. Great staff, can't praise them enough!  Clean, comfortable, welcoming environment. We will be back! -KS

We booked Great Wolf because of its proximity to Disneyland while also being able to enjoy their water park. As it turns out it's less than 10 minutes to drive to Downtown Disney. On the other hand there is not much to see in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.  The water park rides were a lot of fun. Oddly enough there was an ebb & flow to the lines for the tandem rides. Sometimes you would have to wait in line for 10 minutes, at other times you could walk right on the slide; not clear why that is the case. The water park could benefit from more decorations (e.g. fake palm trees), right now it looks a bit sterile which is in strong contrast to the rest of the hotel. We had booked a king suite and after finding out that it has no table or desk I asked the front desk staff if

The water as more for small park was smaller than advertised, and was geared more for small children. I would like to have seen a couple larger pools for teens and adults to swim in. Maybe expand the water   activities and let some air in the indoor water area so its not so muggy.

Summary Heading: Great time at the Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: I would recommend this resort to families with kids under 12. There are a number of activities to keep everyone busy and having a great time. We went during a busy Friday and the lines were not took. Ad at all especially considering the other water parks we have been to.

Check in is late in the afternoon and not notified when my room was ready.   Have to pay a additional fee for parking,  this should be included with staying at the hotel for the amount you pay for a room.

It was a fun experience with my family in this hotel, a lot of activities and the water park was so much fun and it was indoors so we didn't have to worry about sunburns or anything and the water was perfect

Comfortable and Safe for Kiddos.  A must visit place for all families regardless of children ages.  Two day stay is definitely needed to enjoy the majority of the park activities.  Definitely visit during the week!

Very fun time. Would do again. Food at the lodge was excellent and prices were good. Room was clean and quiet . Abundance of chairs and tubes. Never had to wait. Lifeguards were attentive. This place has a lot to offer

The water park is fun, the chlorine smell is strong, the halls and hotel are freezing cold. The beds are horrible. Super uncomfortable. Prices are reasonable compared to other parks. The staff was friendly and helpful

great experience the water park area chlorine in the air is a bit strong because its enclosed area but other than that it was fun! if your n budget its a great place to get away for a couple of days, plus its local!

Summary Heading: over priced and not worth it
Summary: Should be a lot more reasonable with prices, on top of that they pre charge you for everything. Just make sure you check your receipt for over charges. I'm glad I did!! Everything is over priced and not worth it

Summary Heading: Great fun for kids, hell for me
Summary: Pros:  Great rides, lots of lifeguards, wide variety of food, fun atmosphere  Cons: Found one unoccupied chair by the pool for five when we arrived -- dozens of dozens of tables and chairs were clearly unoccupied but  not cleaned up while we were there.  LOUD.  Hotel was disorganized.  Check in lines were like Vegas. Rooms were basic and pullout couch was terrible.  I will never go again during a busy weekend.  On a Tuesday in November, maybe.  This is a trip strictly for the kids.

Is a hot tub!  How do you have a water resort that large without a hot tub for the adults?  That seemed like a missed opportunity to pamper the adults bringing their children to enjoy the resort.  With that said, that's the only missed opportunity I saw at the resort. Great Wolf Lodge is a destination as opposed to just a place to stay while at Disney. You can check into the resort and not leave for several days and be very content. There are a lot of restaurants and activities to keep you busy!  We all loved MagiQuest. It's really a fun time with the kids.  We bought wands 5 years ago in Wisconsin and they still worked fine!  That was a pleasant surprise, to say the least.

Booked two rooms for my two kids and their families. We loved the  breakfast buffet and the variety of foods within the water park. They all enjoyed the variety of water activities for the different age groups. Staff were all nice. Very clean rooms. Overall we loved our stay and can't wait to go again!

We took our 5 sons to great wolf lodge to celebrate the end of the school year. They range in age from 12 - 2. It is tricky to find any family activity that will be enjoyable for every son at their different ages, but great wolf lodge nailed it. It was clean, safe, adorable, they got a kick out of the wolf ears :), the food was tasty and reasonably priced. My ONLY regret is that we didn't book more days to enjoy our stay!  I highly recommend it!

This was our second trip, we absolutely love Great Wolf Lodge. It's entertaining for the whole family. The younger kids LOVE the water park and the older kids love Magi Quest. We can't wait to start planning our next trip!

Great local getaway. Perfect for our kids (6 and 3). We enjoyed our time there and can't wait to go back. We spent the whole time in the water park - my kids couldn't get enough. We didn't end up doing anything since the water park and our suite was enough for them.

I will definitely bring my family in friends to visit again. We all had a great time. It's plenty of things to do. They have a little bit of everything for all age groups.  Everyone was so friendly and helpful .

Your kids will love it here but your pockets won't. Yes they haven endless activities but all come at a high price. Btw, bring your own food snacks and drinks!! Food quality not very good and quite expensive! FYI, you will get a headache and very irritated eyes as the park is indoors.... plan to take breaks in between, especially if you have an infant. On the plus side, the lines are short :)

Summary Heading: You have to experience this place!
Summary: The hotel is great with the lodge decor, the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly. There are several food options available, and the water park is awesome! Overall, Great Wolf Lodge is so much fun. It's my happy place!

Everything was great except we paid for later check out and was checked out indicatedt on my phone app prior to that time....beds for me were too soft.... but for a night I was okay  everything else was Great!  My kids loved and was clean and fun!

yes, it IS expensive but it is worth it for a fun filled overnight stay. Younger kids enjoy it best when they have a PAWS Pass.. the Older kids ride the water rides over & over. Everyone loves the Arcade, even us adults

Summary Heading: Amazing family fun in one place!!
Summary: We loved the waterpark we love the arcade he loved bowling we love the movies he loved magic quest,   We loved golf he loved Lazar frenzy.  I traveled with my two boys who are eight and 10 and they loved all the activities. I loved the convenience of everything is located in one spot. The restaurants were great the shops were great!  You're definitely going back!!

Summary Heading: Just left and ready for our next visit!
Summary: We came to the Greatwolf on a Tuesday and checked out on Wednesday. We checked in early, 1 o'clock and our room was already ready (Bonus) Headed down to the water park and enjoyed it fully. Lots of things for all our kids to do. (Ages ranging from 2-15). Played at the water park for a few hours and decided to go back to the room and eat and rest for a bit. Headed downstairs to check everything out. One of our daughter decided she wanted to play at the Arcade ($$) and the other daughter wanted to play the Magicquest ($$). The Magicquest was pretty cool. She got a wand and had different quests to go on throughout the Hotel. Kids love running around hotels so this was perfect and she actually had a purpose for going all over the hotel. While our two oldest girls 10 & 15 played

We had the best time! This is our second time coming here. I brought my 14 year old granddaughter and my 3.5 year old grandson. They both love it. We always get the Grizzly Room which is a 2 bed so it's perfect for all of us.

Great place for the kids. Good activities that are free. Some activities must be purchased and were quite expensive. Water park water was too cold for me and some of the younger kids. Overall a fun place

Summary Heading: Great amenities, over priced activities- blah staff
Summary: Ended our family vacation here. Upon check I'm there is a parking garage for $13 per day or valet for $19 with no in & out privileges.  The lady who checked us in was made aware it was our first visit and she didn't provide any maps of the property, tell us where the water park was or any information. There was no line behind us so that was pretty rude.   We got a den Wolfe suite so it came with bunk beds. Kids loved that. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The water park kept my kids entertained for 6 hours!   The food is over priced, bland and the choices are limited. The characters and other little attractions are great for toddlers -6 years old.   It seemed the restaurants on site closed earlier than advertised so we were stuck eating dunking donuts at 9PM.  The

I have a 6 and 3 year old girls, there are a variety of things to do for all ages, the swim park has mild areas to adrenaline pumping areas.  Story time and art craft events at great for the younger kids, while the wand quest is great for older.  The arcade is super expensive and they don't let you combine cards so its set up for you to spend a lot of money there.

This place is great to experience with your family.  Plan a fee months ahead to get a better discount.  The staff are very friendly and welcoming.  There are a lot of children activities to do and the water park is open late from 9am-9pm!

We went for my Granddaughters Birthday and had a ball.  She was amazed at all the choices to do and activities to keep us going.  The food, fun and atmosphere was just a blast and she has not stopped talking about it. We will return and thanks for making it so memorable.

Expensive but fun my child loved it the rooms where nice and clean but really just like a hotel room. The bunk beds where what  made it fun for my child place was nice but expensive. They can work on making it more affordable. Overall very fun And close to home would go back

Great family fun. Expensive to stay. The water is great clean and safe. No outside food allowed in park. The food is very unhealthy and expensive.  And the check in time for room 4:00 pm is so late it should be changed to earlier time. You don't get time to rst and enjoy your stay in room.

Summary Heading: Not enough bang for your buck
Summary: Every amenity fell short of expectation except service. The water park only provides child size towels. The indoor park doesn't vent well and anyone could walk into the park unnoticed. The room was ok. The food was ok.

Summary Heading: The kids had a great time! We will definitely be back next year
Summary: Was nervous to bring my two youngest kids but after experience the park discovered it would be perfect for them too. My 13yr old and my 11yr old. Niece had a ball next time I will bring the entire crew and participate in more activities such as the story time and bowling and other activities throughout the park. As an adult I had a blast and was very happy and pleased with the park and all it had to offer.

My kids had a awesome time, celebration their bdays . Thabk you so much ;) we will be back soon. Everyone was really nice. Kids loved it. Was a great experience for my kids. They can't wait to go back!!!

This is not your peaceful resort!  However, it is a great place to take your children to be entertained by loads of activities and fun while you, the adults sit back and relax.  The place is clean, safe, and has a lot of reasonably priced food and drink options.  The indoor waterpark is large and is fun for the whole family, and our 9 year old son and his friend were in there for hours and hours of nonstop rides.  Our room was clean and comfortable too.

Summary Heading: Fun & Unique Experience - Great for Young Children
Summary: Highly recommend.  They have lots of free activities for the kids, the park was clean and organized, rooms were a very good size.  And plenty for young ones to do in the water park, along with the crazier rides for teens & adults.  We had so much fun!

So much fun only bummer they ran out of donuts at 7pm and my kids really wanted a donut from Dunkin Donuts, of that was Avila le for us everything woulda been exceptional. I think the price is pretty pricey but I understand based on the experience, The fire grill restaurant was so good!

Overall, this was a wonderful family experience. We were there to celebrate a 10th birthday and we all walked away with fun new memories.   WATER PARK: The water park is good sized. There was a wide variety of things to do -- a kiddie play area, a beach with waves, water tubes, obstacle courses, flow rider. If you stood in one spot, you could literally see every activity in the large area. Over two days, we did not get bored. If we stayed a third, we would be looking for other things to do. The park felt clean. I didn't notice a strong chemical smell, though the water could sting my eyes with prolonged exposure. Since it's indoor we loved not worrying about sunblock. When you first walk into the indoor water park, you notice it's kind of hot and humid. The water was pretty warm

Awesome stay!! Can't wait to come back!! Best water park and staff hands down!! I would recommend any and everyone. My family and I can't stop raving about the Great time we had. Defiantly planning to come back soon!!

Summary Heading: Very fun for my 5yr old'sBirthday wish
Summary: My daughter talked about "Great Wolf Lodge" everyday for weeks... so I booked a night trip for her birthday.  We live about an hour and a half away. It was a great trip, got up there at about 12:30, the check in line was huge but there was a group that was handing out wristbands, so we were in.  Took some photos of the lobby and went to the waterpark.  The lines were pretty short, and could probably be even faster if the staff were a little more "on it"  but still it was great.  My daughter loved the wave pool the best.  It is such a cool concept of having a waterpark inside...no waiting in freezing lines!  We did about 4 hours the check in and 4 hours the check out day.  It was enough time.  If I were staying any longer than we would have had time for the other activities, but

The rooms are very clean and spacious, the water area is also clean and always has fresh towels, the price is great my kids loved it and we will definitely be back. I expected it to be crowded but durning the week it wasn't which is a plus !

The hotel is very clean.  My only complaint would be that they don't have roll away cribs but they do have pack and plays.   We waited over 6 hours for them to bring us one and had to call again for it, but it did arrive and it was very clean.  There is plenty of activities for the kids and they have plenty of food choices.  We will be back.

Great place to enjoy some family fun, staff could be a bit more pleasant. Maybe be a little more accesable and ready to help rooms need some maintenance , stuff did not work in the room.  Water park was amazing overall we had a great time.

Second stay. Service is subpar. Understaffed. Poorly run. Lines are crazy. Rooms are very expensive. Food is fair at best. Bottom line:  you're paying through the nose for the kids to have fun. They shut down the magic quest before we arrived without any notice when we booked. Try to explain that to the kids who come for that adventure. Won't return. I'll go to a luxury hotel for the same price.

The only thing I would recommend would be the lack of parenting. I often see kids cutting the lines and pushing each other on the wet stairs when they can fall back on someone. Overall I enjoyed this stay.

Best fun place to celebrate a birthday! Fun for every member of the family. Will definitely come back with additional family members just for fun and create memories. Highly recommend, very clean and friendly staff!!!

Awesome place to bring the family only cons to me is to much chlorine in the water burns our eyes an it's like that's all you breathing in I wonder how often do they drain they're pool all that boogie water just being recycled.

Like I said. Someone pooped in the wave pool. When this happens it should be vacated immediately!  This is why my husband made us leave the resort. We unfortunately had to leave. I was sad and so were the kids.

I'm glad I booked the weekend at wolf lodge. I was impressed with the excellent customer service I was provided. The quality of the food and munchies was great as well. My favorite was the lodge restaurant. The shrimp and lobster pasta was amazing. Very friendly environment. Satisfied with everything although the prices are a little too high I will definitely consider making future reservations. My 4 yr loved it!!!!

Good place for family to interact. We really enjoyed it  The team member that helped me check in could of been more welcoming. I felt miss under estimated. I would see all the other families getting the wolf ears for the entire family and to me he only gave me 2 he also did not explain things to me

Summary Heading: Great place for the whole family .
