Summary: My kids had a blast, you couldn't bring in your food unto the water park area but you were able to hang around the lobby. This place was worth every penny.  They also had great craft beers inside the water park area and restaurants!

We enjoyed our stay immensely. The staff is helpful,the rooms are clean. The lifeguards make the water park feel very safe. There are plenty of life guards to go around,and they are very attentive. I was able to allow my older child free run on the water park knowing that help would be there if he needed it.

Summary Heading: Great time... money well spent! Just wished we could have spent a longer time!Great time... money well spent! Just wishe
Summary: We had Great time... money well spent! Just wished we could have spent a longer time! To enjoy are room which was great, we had an upgrade which gave my husband and inprvacy :) for a short time lol. The kids had there own space to let loose. We will be back!

Great Wolf exceeded our expectations by far. I had read all the reviews, seen all the pictures and learned the activities but they all came in short. Love how there are activities for kids of all ages and for their parents as well. The water park is truly awesome, we spent hours and hours there and could not get enough of. I recommend this resort to every family who is looking for the best family experience ever!

So much fun!!  Worth the price for a great family getaway!! So many things to do within the hotel and a great family environment.  Kids everywhere having such a wonderful time! Everything was clean, food was great and a few different eating places to choose from.  My kids loved the kid friendly bowling alley and would have stayed in the water park all day, if we let them.

We had such a great time. The resort exceeded our expectations.  I loved the variety of kids activities that the resort offered, in addition to the amazing indoor water park. We would certainly come back.

Great place for family fun and bonding.  On the expensive side just to use water park. Be care when going into the water park the smell of chlorine and bleiis very powerful and will make your eyes water, irritate you nose and throat. Will take a day to return to normal.

Going to great wolf was a a very nice experience. My sons loved it. The only problem was the sheets on the sofa sleeper were soiled with something. When we called to correct the problem the maid had a little bit of attitude about the mess and asked my wife to change the sheets herself.

This place is a definite MUST-VISIT!! We had a great time. There were many different activities for the children to be a part of as well as great staff. I would definitely recommend anyone to book a weekend at Great Wolf Lodge

Overall it was a great experience. We did come across a few negatives.  We let the staff know we were celebrating my daughters birthday and it really made no difference. We were hoping for an extra birthday hat or something to make her feel special like the way Disneyland hotels do.  Another negative is we requested additional shampoo and lotion and hotel housekeeping said they were out.  Lastly we all came home with good poising from eating steak at the lodge firegrill in the lobby.

Wonderful unique experience. Although I was aware it was pricey, I would carefully look at the cost you will encounter, beyond the room and waterpark. Everything is separately price, including parking.

I never would have thought my kids (6 & 8) would be entertained in the water park for 8+ hours straight.     It was a great family vacation.  Next time we plan to come with friends or plan a family vacation because there is so much to do at this one location.

Would recommend Great Wolf to other families. We had a blast! One of the families stayed in a special cabin room.  The kids LOVED it! Water rides definitely met and exceeded our expectations. It was fun for young and old alike.

Summary Heading: I had an amazing time and so did my son and friends for his bday
Summary: I love this place and told everyone about it once I came back...even when I was snapchating about it...everyone was asking me how was it...it's amazing...I so want to come back asap but my twins party is june so I'm all out and mad my 50% off don't give me more time

Took my daughter and 3 of her friends here for her 10th birthday.  The staff is inviting, and the rooms were very big and clean.  Food was pretty good! Lots of stuff for the kids to do.   The water park is a lot of fun, but it is very loud as it is indoors.  The water was clean and the pools were well kept up.   Everyone had a blast.  Couldn't ask for more.

What a great trip! Every family should find some time in their schedule to spend at least one night at this resort. The waterpark has something for everyone no matter the age. We are a large family of 8 with 6 kids ages 11 down to 22 months. Everyone enjoyed themselves. When you visit there is so much to do in the waterpark and throughout the hotel there is really no reason to leave the resort. Rooms are set up for families which is great. Staff is welcoming and friendly. The jammie dance parties in the lobby at night are super fun. The only complaint I have is that the food is pretty outrageously priced. Hamburgers in the waterpark are 5.79 for a plain burger. Add another $1.00 for cheese and Fries are an additional $3.00 something. So you are talking $11 bucks for a hamburger

My kids love this place.  We've been four times this year!  I highly recommend for family fun vacation.  It's a beautiful hotel.  They have lots of restaurants so there's no need to leave the hotel.  It has so many fun things for kids to do.  There are even free activities so you don't have to spend a lot of money.

The experience was great and the kids had a blast! The water was a little bit to cold for us but the room temperature was great. We can't wait to go back soon. The staff was very friendly and the food was good.

Didnt get to enjoy the water park fully. Really missed out on a great time im sure. Price is steep for a single mom of 4 so prob wont be back anytime soon but def would love to go back this summer. Lots of activities and fun for the kids all ages and relief for the parents. the decor is amazing

My son loves and enjoy his stays will definitely go back great place to enjoy summer. the only thing in the hotel is the elevator not all is working we need to wait long for it.  Good to have location in Anaheim

This is the best water park I have ever been to.  There were so many different attractions.  We have kids from ages 5-13 and they all had a blast.  Their facility is amazing.  It is all indoors and it was the perfect temperature in there.

Unacceptable service from housekeeping. After tipping, she went to look for pillows, kept me waiting while taking lunch and wasnt going to return return. People answering front desh are not knowlwdgeable or helpful. Beds are most uncomfortable. Chemicals in water stain and make you sick. Overpriced for what you get.

In a nut shell, it is a nice water park for the times you want to experience a water park in the cold seasons. A little over priced for all that you get. High expectations with a low return. Might go back in the future.

We had a great trip with six other family's  swimming area was amazing food was great cleanliness was great stores to be open longer an adult area with drinks music Storytime could be a little better stores arcade was fun for the kids bowling kids had fun

From beginning to end, everything was great! Very nice staff, everybody had a smile and seemed to want to make our experience the best that they could.  Everything was clean, and well kept. The hotel was very nice and the water park was everything that we could have expected. My daughter had an amazing time, we will definitely be back!

Paid  over $450 for a standard family room that sleeps 6. Large comfortable room nothing fancy. Lots of extras to pay for and do. Our kids enjoyed the free kids activities because we had spent so much on the room.

Lots of fun! Love the Waterpark. Activities for all ages. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Nice to have fridge & microwave. Staff very friendly and helpful. Food is just so-so, better to eat off site.

This is a great place for young kids and family. Overall my kids had a great time. It's great to go to a water park and not have to worry about the weather.  Overall it is kind of pricey.  If you go during midweek or book 90 days in advance you can experience significant cost savings.  For one weekend for a family of four he can expect to spend about 1000 bucks

Tge facilities were great for a convention.  Most of our rooms were on the same floor as the convention rooms, which was just great.  Those of us that used the resort areas were well pleased with them.  I would love to return and have my grand and great granskids with us.

Great place for families to take their kids and lots of fun things to do for the kids.  A bit pricey though but we're happy we went to explore.  Would definitely recommend this place to family and friends!

Summary Heading: Great Family Staycation Option in the LA Area
Summary: Our whole family had a great time staying at the GWL.  There is a good variety of water attractions that can accommodate everyone from very small kids to older kids to adults. We were exhausted after a full half day of water play but were ready for more the next day.  We had at least one meal at the resort but ventured outside for another meal because there were many good options in the immediate area if looking for something different or more veg friendly.  We will definitely be back again, probably when our youngest is tall enough for the big slides.

Was over charged and still waiting for my refund, kids had a great time but the guy at the front desk was a joke. Horrible customer service, they said the guy was new but he seemed very inexperienced and was only trying to upscale extra items instead of making sure we had a great experience.

Did not stay in rooms but did book a Birthday party was very fun,clean and organized my granddaughter had a blast at her 11th birthday bash, was provided a nice cabana space in water park  where we had good view of the kiddo's that were all over the place and there bar was really nice too.   I would do it all over again.

Bday weekend for my children teenager and young at heart enjoyed the place it would have been more better if they have full gym equipment for grown up. And more afforable rates for our trip. Would come back to my daughter 6th bday

The overall experience was good and fun. There are a few things that I think are unsafe the toddler area slides have a drop into a 2ft water it should glide in and not drop.  Also my son fell after getting dressed in the bathroom and severely cut the inside of his mouth from biting the side of his cheek from falling. There should be rubber mats by the showers and the dressing rooms going straight to the door. People are getting dressed and the shoes are slippery in that area. Also there was no sign where my son fell. I have to say that your handicap restroom had reallly hot water (too hot for kids) while washing your hands and let a member know and he said he would take care of it right away. Also I had a male life guard was agressive with my son and I approached him and spoke

This is a great place to visit lots of things for everyone to do. The water park is really nice lots of different things for all ages. The rooms were really nice and clean. The staff was nice and very helpful.

We had a great experience. Rates are a lil pricey but at the end of the day you receive great service and you have a great experience with your family. We just left and already making plans to return! Oh and did I mention clean 😊. No nasty sitting water from the water park on the restroom floors. That's a winner alone for me!

EVERYTHING about this place was amazing.  My whole family enjoyed themselves and so did I.  Already made plans for next visit. I would choose GWL Over DL anyday. Kids had a super GREAT time even with bad weather outside.

The whole family LOVED it! No need to leave the hotel cause it has everything you need. Loved the activities throughout the day for the kids. My daughter would take small breaks from swimming to do Arts & Crafts, Face Painting, Games, Pajama Jam Dance Party and Story time. My boys (13 & 10) literally spent the whole day at the water park with breaks to eat. The restaurants were great with our favorite being the Buffett. The water park is perfect for all ages. Can't wait to come back in a few months

We have been to Great wolf Lodge in Niagara twice and in Washington 5 times. This was our first visit to the Southern California location. And this one was the best! We call GWL Las Vegas for kids but what it is really is a magical  family vacation spot. Planning a trip to Disneyland? Don't stay in an overpriced Disney hotel. So what we did and stay at Great Wolf Lodge Garden Grove. It is 7 minutes from Disneyland and there is so much more to do when you are not at the theme park. Waterslides; Magiquest is something every single age will enjoy. Including parents. Bowling, arcade, spa, and a bunch of other family friendly activities right in the heart of Orange County. And the best staff! Especially Lady Lilly at the Magiquest store. She goes out of her way to naked your stay fun.

8th and 4th birthdays for kids loved all of it. We will return again later this year with more family.  We recommend this lodge for all ages.you feel safe and comfortable. Being a wolf works too. Join the fun this year.

Enjoyable Stay, One day is not enough for all the kids' activities. All Pack Members are helpful and friendly ... Just the pool water is a little cold for my family but the whole surroundings from the water attractions, slides, food are all perfect for the vacation. We had a Blast!

Definitely a place to be at. My family had an amazing time we celebrated my son's birthday it was a surprised abs he loved it  he said lets do it again next year the staff was wonderful. Will be back soon.

My family had a great time, the waterpark is clean, & fun!! Everyone is so nice and helpful, and lots of activities for the kids. Everything about our trip was awesome! My kids had a blast. We will return someday!

There's so much to do. We only stayed one night but really enjoyed our time. The staff was attentive and helpful. There's a shuttle that can take you to Disneyland, but there's enough to do here. If you are only planning a short stay, this jotel is enough.  The water park has tons to do. Children get measured upon entry which allows them into certain rides depending on their size. The water was warm. The kids never complained of the water being cold. They have an arcade where you can collect tickets for prizes. They have a magiquest where you can purchase a wand and go through different missions. We ate at the Lodge which had a good variety for our kids. There also like Dunkin' Donuts which was located there. We traveled with a toddler and elementary school child. They enoyed

Family trip with kids. Park was great. Go outside of resort for better food and service. The buffet was good but the lodge food and service wasn't worth the price. Restaurants seemed to be understaffed each visit.

Went with several families and overall had a pretty good time.  They had many different water rides of all levels.  Temperature controlled environment was great.  Rooms were basic, but clean and dining is convenient.  A nice water park for any time of the year. I would recommend, particularly for kids!

Summary Heading: Fun for a night but room for improvement
Summary: Here today with our Girl Scout Troop of 10 little 8 year old girls and several Moms.  We stayed the night last night in 3 rooms which each slept 6.  Overall this was a great experience and the girls had a lot of fun.    Pros: - Rooms are good size, clean and comfortable.  They had the vanity area in the room which was helpful so someone could shower while another brush teeth, etc. - pricing of rooms was fair considering that you get 2 days in the water park when you stay one night. - range of water activities seemed to have something for everyone.  Daring girls loved the big slides and more timid girls had fun in the lazy river - life guards are everywhere and we felt our girls were safe and being supervised - free wolf ears at check in - fun touch Cons: - no outside food in the

Amazing experience. Water park was fun and warm. Friendly staff, comfortable  rooms, good meal prices, etc. I can't wait to come abck again. Enjoyed that most items were inclusive. Bracelet system was good.

My family and I had a great time at the resort and Water Park. All the staff that we cane in contact with was very friendly and helpful. I love the idea of an indoor water park, because it doesn't matter what the weather is outside.

This is a new hotel that caters  to children.   It is clean and well thought  out floor plan, but has a few major flaws. 1st there are no chairs in the  King suite . You have to sit on the bed to put shoes on or watch  TV. The door to restroom swings in wrong direction.   The food for breakfast is frozen pre packaged . It has no taste.  The one dinning room for lunch and dinner  has a very limited menu, and food here is all frozen ready to heat. It looks like this place caters  to the pallet  of children and they completely forgot about the adults.

I am here with my kids 10 and 14 and they are having fun. The ammenities seem to be geared to the 5-10 age group. The hotel is nice and clean and the good is good quality at reasonable prices in the restaurants. The rooms are a bit pricy but if you add up everything you get I think it's a good deal.

Summary Heading: Great stay. We will definitely go back.
Summary: Front desk agents were amazing. Gift shop attendant was amazing as well. We were upgraded to the kids cabin and my kids loved that surprise. I wish we could've stayed longer. We will definitely go back and hopefully we'll get upgraded again. Thank you. It was truly an amazing experience for my family.

We have and 11yr old, 5 yr old and 9month old and we all truly enjoyed this vacation. We discovered this place when looking to book a trip to Disneyland, and ended up deciding to just stay here and not attend Disneyland because my Husband and I wanted to relax and we weren't up for the exhaustion that comes from a Disneyland vacation. Our kids love waterparks so this ended up being a great alternative for us. It was very convenient to have a variety of activities and food choices all in one place. We never left the resort during our 3 night stay. My husband and I were able to find some time to relax and our children were entertained the entire stay.  The staff was very helpful and professional. The entire resort was well kept and very clean.

friendly, clean and safe lifeguard are focused water temperature is perfect adult wrist bands carry ur debit info and room info so it makes it very convenient.  front desk is very welcoming. out side pool is also nice

This was our first time at Great Wolfe.  From the time we checked in to check out, was satisfying.   Everyone was helpful and nice.  the only thing i have to say is, when traveling with babies and young kids, we need to take in consideration that kids are unpredictable.  They need their snacks and juices ALL DAY long.  We could not bring the snacks for them.  We were told that we weren't allowed.  If i didn't have enough money to keep buying food, we would have had to keep going in and out of the water park to our room to feed them.  Which took way too much energy from the kids because they did not want to get out of the water.  This should be kept in mind.    Overall, my family had a great time!  Thank you!

*****  5 Star Review Best place ever. 2nd to Disneyland. Our grandchildren love going to Great Wolf. And so close to Disneyland, that we can have fun at both places. The Magic Quest is a wonderful adventure for my grandson. He loves it.  We stayed in a Wolf Den room and the room was fantastic. My only negative comment is the cost for Valet.

This place was amazing. My family enjoyed all the amenities it had to offer. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Addressed all of our needs and then some. The hotel wasn't at walking distance to Disneyland but they offered a shuttle to drop off and pick us up. I recommend this place for couples and families.

something different and it was enjoyable time with my wife and granddaughter at a place I never heard before and you could upgrade so they were able to start the fun from the beginning  to the end.  I look forward for the next time

I took my 7year, 5year and 8 month old baby to Great Wolf Lodge last week. Everyone- even the grandparents who joined us- had a great time. We were told by several staff that we picked the best time to come as 5 weeks of spring break had just ended. I picked the date based on the cheapest flexible date rate. We arrived right at 1:00 and were given our room at check in.  Room was clean, and the Wolf Den was a treat for the kids. We appreciated the water bottles and snap pea crisp.  We quickly headed to the water park after check in. To be honest, our first impression when we walked in wasn't great. It seemed smaller in person and the humidity and chlorine smell seemed stifling. Not to worry though- once we got in the water and started exploring, we realized how much there was to

Summary Heading: Whats the weather like outside? Who cares!?
Summary: I came here to celebrate a birthday.  I arrived and was thinking "An indoor waterpark, how big can it be?"  It's big, well, bigger than I was expecting.  There are things to keep toddlers busy all the way up to adults.  Sometimes the lines for some rides can get a little bit long around mid day.  I found that going after dinner worked best.  Keep in mind, it's ALWAYS a balmy 84 degrees in the park.  There are plenty of other activities to keep the kids busy also like Magiquest which will have them running all over the hotel on their quests.  The staff all seemed super friendly and always more than willing to assist however they could.  I stayed in a wolf den room that has a separate area for children to sleep (2 bunk beds).  The room also has a pull out couch in addition to the

Summary Heading: Fun For All, But In Doses
Summary: The water park is a lot of fun for all ages!  We are a family of four with an 11 and 8 year old.  Our kids loved it all, I think they played in every pool but the little kiddie pool.  My wife and I really enjoyed the more thrilling rides and relaxing while the kids just kept on going.  We had to take it all in doses though. We would go for 3 hrs or so then we all needed a break.  After a while the noise, the humidity, the chlorinated air, and the crowds were just too much to take, so we would retreat to our room for a bit.  The hotel also has a fun magical scavenger hunt complete with wands, Harry Potter style.  This activity kept our 8 yr old daughter fully engaged for almost as long as the pools!    There is no real high end food choices, but decent snack bar food at the pools

I think it's a pretty cool place to go for your kids to enjoy the water without the direct sun beating down. I can just imagine the amount of chlorine they must use in the water because there are so many people there at one time.   The family had a pretty good time. It was hard to find a place to sit, and we saw people fighting over a chair. The cost of the food was pretty expensive, and everything had a price tag on it but the towels. The rooms were decent. Nothing too fancy about them.

The waterpark is for guests only so it doesn't get too crowded. Safety is a primary consideration of Great Wolf and everyone seemed to enjoy the park and the family environment. A wonderful vacation for all ages!

Summary Heading: best place to stay and only 2miles from DInsleyland!
Summary: This place is a gem! so much fun for kids and parents of all ages..we stayed with our two kids ages 2yrs and 4yrs, and went to both disney parks,super convenient but also great having an amazing hotel to stay at that had the best water park and great kids activities for when we wanted a break from disney. We stayed in a "wolf den"room and the kids loved it!! They slept great and so did we! we will definietly be back!:)

The rooms were nice and the hotel common areas are geared to families with kids.  The water park is obviously the big draw here.  When you enter the water park you are struck by the heat, humidity, and noise, and then your eyes start burning from the chlorine in the air.  But I guess that is to be expected at an indoor water park.  The kids had an awesome time and want to go back.  The water slides are fun, and there are different levels to suit different ages/thrill seeker levels.  It is very noisy inside the park because of all the slides, and it's hot and humid, so if the weather is nice out, I'd recommend finding chairs outside by the pool.  We rented a cabana (originally reserved one for inside but changed to an outside one) which is definitely the way to go if the budget

Having visited Great Wolf Lodge in Washington (Grand Mound) on many occasions, we decided to check out the Great Wolf Lodge in California during our recent vacation.  For a newly built property, I must say that the decor and ambiance of the lobby and common areas of the hotel were very disappointing compared to the craftsmanship that is apparent in the Washington location.  Despite that, the friendly staff, ease of check-in, cleanliness, room decor, food quality, and availability of fun activities for the kids were great.  The water park has a wide variety of areas for both small children and older teenagers to enjoy and a great outside pool area.  There were a few negatives that led to only a 4-star rating.  The room rates, resort fees, taxes, and parking fees were ridiculously

This was our 2nd annual trip for our son's birthday. And once again it was an amazing time! From the moment we checked in, staff went above and beyond and were so helpful. They were out of birthday ears at the front desk so we were given a coupon for free ice cream instead. One of the games in the arcade didn't give my son any tickets so the staff gave him free plays on another game. Just little things like this that go a long way. The waterpark is always a great time!

Went during spring break heavily populated and not the cleanlinest. Daily activities and indoor park are a real treat. Very family friendly with many different activities for kids of all ages. Nice to have an indoor park with different amenities and attractions that are age appropriate.

This is a great place to take the entire family since this resort caters to all ages. Never a dull moment at any point in our trip. There is lots to do here and is worth every penny. We will be coming back. Not to mention that they gave me a free upgrade to our room at no additional charge.

Ok resort for a weekend getaway but for the price they charge on the weekend, it is not worth it.  Unless you get a good price for the weekend, go for it.  The only nice about this resort is that it is an indoor water resort.  That is the main activity anyway.  The rest  fill-in activities in the resort will put you on an unexpected cash-out.  Food is ok just like in any theme park.  They also charge parking fee.  If you have other friends/family that will join you to dine-in in the resort, they will pay for the parking fee regardless.  I think it is a money-pit resort since you really don't have options when you are already inside and on your wet suit.  You end up succumbing to the convenience and pay for it.

Waterpark is awesome it's indoor! Water temperature is just right. Lifeguards are very attentive, doing their job very well. The place is clean. The staffs are friendly and awesome too. Wonderful experience for the entire family!

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge check your bed
Summary: Customer service is great but the rooms are a little bit dirty because they try to go so fast to accommodate The next family that is coming Check your bed. And make sure that your room is clean also check the restroom

Came to celebrate my grandson 9th bday the place is awesome so many thing to do we only made it to the water park it kept us busy the entire day he didn't want to leave an when we did it was ime to eat dinner an go to bed. I love how the water 💦 park has something for all ages an sizes

Summary Heading: Fun family experience, nickle and dimed.
Summary: The water park was a blast, and there werent many people, the nightly activities were great for the kids. The kids activity staff was steller.  The room was ok, clean but no clothes line and the soap dish in the front.  The resort is designed to nickle and dime you, they givr you no prices in your room, and have to walk past ice cream, arcades, bowling, a movie/game and through a store to get to the water park. Food in the water park is priced ok, beer is 10. Upsairs restaurants are overpriced relative to quality and service.  None of these are included in the resort stay.

An overall good stay, though all charges where not quite apparent when I first booked online. In addition to extra charges at check in, expect to end up  spending even more on other activities. Though is you really want to avoid spending more money, there are a lot of free activities (story time, balloon animals, crafts etc) that are available too.

I'm a single mother with 2 kids who wanted to go to Disney for their April vacation.  I chose GWL because they were down the street from Disney, but provided before and after water park access with all the safety and life guard monitoring Great Wolf Lodge is known for.  This means I could let them go play while I could read a book.  Going to Disney while staying at GWL is the best of all worlds.

I had such a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge. My wife and I took our 22 month old and he had so much fun. Prior to our stay I was concerned he was too young to enjoy the water park. Not only did he enjoy it but he didn't want to leave. They have an entire section of the park designed for toddlers. My son went down the toddler slides all day long. He even went down a couple of the slides designed for bigger kids. The breakfast buffet was delicious.

Loved my trip with family, kids 2 and 4. Fun for grown ups too. Very clean, friendly staff, and super convienent for food as your wrist band is your room key and you charge to your room food and drinks!  The water slides were super fun, can spend 2 days very easily. No need to sunscreen. Loved it. Will go back again. Book in advance and sign up for emails from them to get the best price.

The resort is great for families with children of all ages.  Our children are 12 and 7 and they both loved the Waterpark and the Magiquest game.  My 7 year old and I did the Arcade and had a blast!  My 12 year old just really enjoyed the fact that from 9 - 1 the waterpark is only open to the guests who were at the resort the previous night, so it's not super crowded.  We only waited maybe 20 minutes to get on any ride in the park!  Highly recommend!

this was a great place to take the kids. they really enjoyed themselves. I would highly recommend this place and we will definitely come back. You would need at least 2-3 days to really enjoy everything

Went for my son's 9th birthday and we all had a great time 😀 really nice resort and great location, right down the street from disney. Food is a little pricey as is the room but I'd go again. Sign up for a free membership and you'll get additional promotions and discounts.

Love this indoor park resort! Lots of fun, staff is great, it's clean here! Everything about this place is great! You don't have to worry about the sun burns! It has showers you can use after the last day of stay too! Everything is well thought out! Wonderful place!

Can't complain at all. It was really appreciative. Also, I never been to an indoor water park. It's a must to come back soon and explore more than what we did. Thanks for the great service and I will recommend to others.

cleaned, fun, organize and  towels always available. Get there early to get a table and chairs inside  the water park. Very kid friendly and adults  Fun for toddlers,  verity of food and sweets  to chose from.

Kids that love the water will find this vacation incredible! We have a 9, 7 and 4 year old and spent the entire time in the water park. I recommend going when there are discounted rates otherwise it can be very expensive.

Had a great time! The room cleanliness could be a little better. We found 2 pieces of hard candy on the floor and a clump of hair next to the trash can in the bathroom. Which is surprising because everything else was very clean.

The only problem was the handicap amenities. I am paraplegic and could not reach the shower head and the bed was to high so I was unable to get into the be by myself. we stayed in the wolf den and the cave blocks the air conditioning so my son got hot in there. That room is definitely not for teen agers. The beds are twin size so my daughter had a hard time getting comfortable. She kept kicking the wall. I wold recommend the room with 2 queen beds if you have teen agers. Other than those things the room was very clean and we had a great time. The kids can't wait to go back.

We took our family to The Great Wolfe Lodge for our sons 9th birthday. Although it was a little pricey, that's ALL he asked for was to experience the "indoor waterpark" and let me just tell you, it was WORTH EVERY penny! As parents, we were ESPECIALLY pleased by the lifeguard staff. They were doing CONSTANT inspections of the water activity center they were in charge of, which of course put our minds at ease when it comes to water safety and our children. I cant wait to go back! We have been to many Theme Parks as a family and this trip by far was our best vacation yet. The adults had just as much fun as the kids. Great experience.

There was about 6 families that all went to Great Wolf Lodge this past weekend to celebrate a couple birthdays. We had all ages in our group from kids 1year-17years old, adult from 21-65 years old. Everyone had fun, including the adults. We cant wait to come back.

The kids love the waterpark and all the activities provided within the resort.  The food was good and because of its location, there are plenty of close by eateries to choose from. Staffs were friendly and helpful.  Checking in and out was a breeze.  We will definitely visit here again

Summary Heading: Fun place to go with your family
Summary: Resort is well maintained, staff was very friendly, park was very clean.  Everything was new and my family and I had a great time.  The Magiquest was fun for the kids, although it takes about 6-8 hours to complete, which actually kept the kids off of the ipads and up and about.  It also added to my exercise routine as I climbed in excess of 100 floors doing the adventure over 3 days.

Had issues with charges and promises made at reservation time being wrong and nobody has fixed those problems yet.  The hotel and water park themselves are pretty great.  Food and activities are over priced.  Lots of food places available in the area. Employees in the water park are very friendly and helpful.

Great Wolf Lodge is a really fun place to take the family. The water park is always clean and to top it off, there are always lifeguards keeping watch of everyone. The staff was very nice and the rooms were really comfortable. I totally recommended this place.

Summary Heading: Fantastic family holiday at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at Great Wolf Lodge with our 5 and 7 year old.   The kids rated this the best location of our trip, which included Disneyland, Legoland and Universal Studios.  The main attraction for them was the Magiquest. The Magiquest is a computer game where kids go all over the hotel following clues from a computer with a magic wand that leads them to an end point in a challenge or game. It does put a bit of strain on the hotels lifts and it certainly gets the parents of young kids walking and moving, it is definitely a highlight for kids who seem to love it.  The wands for magiquest also interact with the hotel room and certain features in aaa restraunt, such as the child pointing the wand at a bear in a tea cup and the bear moving, etc. The kids loved that.  We also

Nice resort with a good sized water park. The water park is kept at about 85 degrees, a little uncomfortable for me. Very comfortable beds. Nice restaurants but they close way too early. Maybe they should have one open 24 hours. If you're on a budget, there are much more economical places to eat within walking distance. There is also a refrigerator in the room where we keep snacks and drinks to cut down on the cost of food.

Summary Heading: 11 year old twin grandsons had a blast - went on all water slides 10 times or more during 3 nights we stayed there.
Summary: A very good time in the indoor water park with lots of different water slides for various ages -- water was clean and NOT cold.  Breakfast buffet is delicious.  Staff helpful though lines at check-in were slow.  My grandsons loved the activities provided by the Wolf Pass (with Magiquest).  They want to go again.  Expect your nightly rate to be about $50 more than what's quoted (since the quoted rate doesn't include the $30 daily resort fee; the $13 overnight parking charge; and the 14.5% Transient Occupancy Tax).

Nice place to visit. It's a sham we didn't feel welcomed due to a few rude employees. The resort fees are hig. We had a nice time overall but would not go back. I wouldn't recommend it either. It was very clean

The resort is great for kid of all ages.  They have a lot of pools with slides and all sorts of water-type obstacles for children.  Life guard at very pool area, and the water was clean.  The reason for only giving them 3 stars is because of the terrible costumer service at the bar by the Buckets Incredible Craveable.  I ordered the Agave Pineapple Ginger Margarita, nowhere in their cocktail menu did it say it has jalapeno peppers.  I got my drink walked away and took a sip.  I immediately went back and told the bartender he gave me the wrong drink coz it has jalapenos.  He said the drink comes with jalapeno.  So I nicely asked him if he can please make me a new one without the jalapeno since it did not say in the menu.  His reply was "I can't give people a free drink just

The air conditioner was hard to work it would never just be off which made it hard to sleep for the person on the sleeper sofa. We were never really  lynched by staff we were not told about any of activities I guess we were just suppose to read it but with 3 kids don't have much time to sit and read all the paper work

Very Good trip.  Rickey at the front desk made our trip very special. The water park was very well planned out.  Our kids had a blast.  The air quality was poor inside the park and difficulty to handle for 2 days.  Improved outside air ventilation would be a big plus.

Had a nice time just did not love our accomodations. They need to make an improvement to the rooms.  The pillow was like a log under my head! The bed lumpy and the shooter was awful. Sorry  you want me to keep going so here goes.... Why not sell day pass? We would visit more often

We had a great time at the resort. It was a little pricey after all the extras for the kids but feel it was 100% worth it. My two children both loved it (5&10 boys). The water park was warm and very fun. The food was reasonably priced and tasty at the water park.  But the restaurant and buffet were on the pricey end, so we didn't eat there the whole time. Would highly recommend a weekend trip. I don't think we could stay a whole week without doing some of the other resorts/parks in the area. Will definitely do this again!!!

Very great experience at great wolf lodge! Water parks were super fun and kids really enjoyed it. The food at great wolf lodge was great! Wish the price was maybe a little less but overall great wolf lodge was an amazing experience!

Summary Heading: Every kid deserves to experience this water park heaven!
Summary: Every kid deserves to experience this water park heaven! Even as an adult, I enjoyed this water park! In my opinion, it's for everyone to enjoy without the sun burn and sun block and it's chemicals ;)

great family place to stay, had a good time with my kids, parking structure is very easy access, one does not need to walk a great distance. plant of restaurants for kids, love the cocktails at the water park.

It was great for the kids and we had a little fun too. I would suggest not staying on the corridor hallway of floors 4,5,6 as there are children still doing quests at 10pm and later. We were on floor 3 which should have been quiet, but there were birthday parties next door and had to call security both nights- the first one we waited until 11:30, the second 10:30- because the kids were exhausted and we really didn't want some 12 year olds to make out day hell by keeping the kids up.  Glad we went with friends before. it was a very good time, but with little sleep and lots of $$$... It is a once a year kind of place :)

Staff were friendly but there has to be a better way for park to monitor the entrance of guests, anyone not staying at the hotel can borrow bracelets and get into the park. Park should only be for guests that book a room. Chlorine smell is pretty strong.

Room was not available during arrival. It took sometime to arrange another room for us to transfer. On the 2nd day, only beds were made. The room was not cleaned. No wash cloths. The bathroom was flooding. Poor design for shower area which makes it more unsafe because of possibility of slipping on the wet floors

Their friendliness since the entrance on the hotel to the very last day  The kids enjoy the water park both days from morning to sunset . Story time and kids activities are fun to the kids. We will be back  soon For another stay

Great place to visit would recommend this place to anyone with kids are not with kids you'll have a lot of fun at great wolf lodge the staff is nice the rooms are amazing and there's a lot of fast food within a couple miles of the place

Summary Heading: Discourteous treatment by staff to Autistic Child
Summary: My grandson has autism.  We had attempted to convince him for most of the morning to ride a slide.   Reluctantly at first and then with guard  enthusiasm he agreed.  Unfortunately, he chose a small slide devised for toddlers.  Of course we had not realized this restriction since there was no appropriate signage indicating such.   At the top of the slide area the staff member, following his employer guidelines, denied my grandson access to ride the slide.  The manner in which this person spoke to my grandson caused my grandson an enormous amount of distress.  This child fully believed he was not allowed to ride ANY water slide.  No amount of  coaxing could undo his first interaction with a staff member.  When I approached a 2nd employee and asked for a Manager ... this staff

Summary Heading: Fun for Kids, not so much for adults!
Summary: My kids had a great time, but my husband and I were left feeling like we overpaid for a mediocre (at best) family trip. The water park was fine, aside from the several "code browns", and the balmy 85-90 degrees inside.The rooms lack comfort and amenities (bring your own blanket, soap, and Shampoo). The bowling alley consists on 5 tiny lanes, and the glow in the dark miniature golf looks like something my neighbors put together on Halloween (with glow in the dark paint in a tiny room). Our kids had a great time, but my husband and I, not so much. We got a decent rate on the room, but spent more than double between dinner, the arcade and miniature golf. At the end of the day, we would've been happier at a 4 star resort with a great pool.

This place is absolutely horrible!  We went for my daughters 12 birthday. Way way over priced.  Sheets were dirty, staff were rude, Waterpark was humid and the chlorine was so strong. When I advise the front desk that there was dirt/sand in the bed she looked at me so rude and said, we don't have sand here. Yea I know that I just was letting you know that at 10pm when we were getting into bed it was full of dirt/sand. Housekeeping even came and saw it and changed the sheets.  When I received the email of the itemized bill. There were so many extra charges on there that I was unaware of. The biggest waist of $800+ I've spent in years. I would not recommend this place to anyone. They also advertise as suites, it's a regular size  hotel room not a suite.

My two little girls ages 3 and 7 saw a commercial on TV and BUGGED me to take them to the Great Wolf Lodge so when i got a weekend off i decided to surprise them with a trip there and they where not disappointed nor was i we all had a great time from the start with the velet parking to when i left we all had a great time.

I gave them 4 starts because for the amount of money we paid, we expected a little more.  Our kids were so excited to come to the GWL.  When we arrived it was great, the staff at the desk was friendly and helpful.  We got to our room and it was clean and comfortable...the only thing is that there are kids running up and down the hallway.  You can't take a nap or watch TV without hearing kids running and screaming down the hallway.  Yes I know its a kids hotel, but common courtesy  is that parent's  tell their child to be mindful of those around them.   The water park has a VERY strong scent of chlorine...so strong it burned my eyes and gave us a headache.  They are suppose to have a "no outside food" allowed, but it seemed the staff may have been intimidated by some people that

Had an awesome time!!  Make sure to bring goggles and water shoes.. Friendly staff, clean rooms and bathroom. There are so many activities for the kids to do they barely had time to sleep. check in is at 4pm however you can come at 1pm to use the water park. Great idea

Rooms and stay way too overpriced.  Other guests express same sentiments at checkout.  Food, games too expensive.  Could have had longer vacation with better quality elsewhere.  Next time, 2 day max if we decide to revisit

Summary Heading: Do not waste you time or hard earned money on this place! Overpriced terrible food options ghetto clientele
Summary: No healthy food options overcrowded no seats in water park area 1 1/2 hour wait time for sit down dinner. Minimal staff not geared toads teens but maybe 2 water rides. Very noisy in waterpark area. There should be a 2 alcoholic drink maximum, but then again this is the only way to cope with this place!!

Perfect for birthdays!  Very accomodating,will definitely come back ,and would recommend with friends and family. Perfect weekend getaway. Early checkin was the best and was able to enjoy the ammenities

Summary Heading: FAMILY FUN & ALL IN ONE PLACE!
Summary: What a great concept and place to have some fun, quality family time. There is something for everyone at Great Wolf Lodge. Expect to spend a lot of money though. It is not cheap. Well worth it, as it was our son's 6th birthday and this was his special birthday surprise. He loved it and couldn't get enough of the water park. Staff is friendly and what a well organized facility. No need to carry room keys or even a wallet. The wrist band you wear has a chip in it that takes care of all that. Although we live close by, it really felt like we were on vacation far away. Cannot wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Our whole family Loved this place!
Summary: This place is so much fun.... we have been there 3 times and have already booked another visit.   The rooms are large, nice & clean.  There are a lot of food choices and if you get tired of eating onsite, you are close to many great restaurants nearby as this place is close to Disneyland.  The staff members are very friendly.

My kids love this place. When we do go my kids don't even want to visit Disneyland no more. That's how much this place is loved by my kids. The water park is awesome. Food is great. Activities are brilliant and wide variety of things to do all in 1 place.

I read cons and pros and decided it to go with the pro's if you are stingy you will feel everything expensive. But I think when you go out on vacations you do expect to pay more for everything. I really thought people were over reacting on prices of the food. Pizza was great I would buy it again. I felt very safe and my kids for the most part were in their own. At no moment felt like I was not in a secure place. JUST FYI you want seats get there super early all seats were taken by 11am lol. Plan ahead of time and you will save a lot. I would do it again.

We had eight family members in our group and there was not a dull moment, Grandparents, children and grandkids all had a great time. Food, shopping and just watching the little kids in the pool and racing down the water slides was great.

Fun family place, especially for younger kids. Designed so you never have to leave for anything. Recommend rinsing off often with fresh water when in the water park as the chemicals can irritate skin after awhile. They have lots of warm towels and showers/ locker areas.

I paid with a credit card and assumed they had on file. They didn't ask for another card and checked me in.   They didn't and called me after I was in bed that night insisting that I go to the front desk.  Room had already been paid in full but because I didn't get out of bed, they deactivated my lock and I was locked out of the room in the morning.  They were very rude and explained that it is their policy to lock guests out if they have questions about their cards.  ????  There was no problem with my card, the hotel just messed up.

The place is very nice its for family adventure. Not only the kids will enjoy even the eldrr ones will do. The staff at water park is very attentive. They are well train for the safaty of the guests. I will come back here for sure.

Family friendly for all ages. Lots of activities, food is good and reasonably priced, loved the meatballs! Very clean. Will definitely come again. Staff very attentive, obviuosly well trained especially in water safety.

Summary Heading: Good family outing with a few nit picky issues
Summary: We spent one night and two full days at the water park with another family.  The kids had a fantastic time.  Pros:  Great for families with younger kids.  We felt very safe and secure.  Because they limit the water park to hotel guests only, there were very few young adults by themselves or groups of teenagers alone. This made the environment very family friendly.  This is a newer facility, so the rooms and grounds were well maintained and clean.  Cons: First, the chlorine smell inside the main park building was necessarily extremely strong - breathing was a bit tough at times, eyes burned when entering the water, etc.  We sat near doors to the outside area to get a little fresh air. Regarding the food, while we read that we should bring in our own food and drinks, they said no

I was disappointed in the service.  We spent a lot of money hosting 15 kids for a sleepover.  Multiple rooms etc.  could not get anyone on the phone at front desk for Bell service, not enough staff at cabanas or physically at front desk.  The line at the front desk wrapped around 3x.  For that much money they should be staffed better and be more attentive.

Perfect for family time! It's all about the kids. They thought of everything to keep them entertained and happy! We did not even get to experience everything there was to offer at the lodge because they offered so much. A lot of the activities were included at no extra fee.

The waterpark was great and the kids loved it. Scoops kid spa was also great! Finding a bug on our bed was not great. Housekeeping said they didn't think it was a bed bug but took the bug and offered to change our sheets.

Great for family vacation...all in one without having to drive anywhere. Clean, fun, and convenient. Staff was friendly and did an excellent job making us feel welcomed. Wide variety of food selection...activities for the kids all day long...character appearances...water slides for everyone.  🍽🍕🍔🍟🍵🍳🍜

Horrible value for your money, not enough slides, uncomfortable inside the dome (86 degrees plus humidity), kids events/games just add to the cost, 2 days with 2 kids over $2300 - WHACK!  The only positive if your a parent, the food was excellent!  But you'll come once, and not return, unless you're from the Midwest/eastern part of the US.

After returning for a second time, we were not happy. Both of my children became ill the day after we returned home. My daughter got a skin infection from the swimmers that were provided. She was required to wear due to her height. The mats for the waterslide were not removed from the bottom of the slide which caused my nephew to fall on his head. He got a concussion, which caused him to be down for the rest of our stay. We did have a great check in, checked in at 10:30am and our room was ready. The service and food at the Lodge Wood Fire Grill were horrible. If you plan to get coffee or donuts at Dunkin Donuts in the morning be prepared to wait in a very long line. It took about 1/2 hour. The water park was not clean like out pervious visit. There are dirty people and that is

Summary Heading: Save your money - Go to Disney Grand Californian Resort
Summary: The kids thought it was pretty good and would come back but said they would prefer the Grand Californian resort.... I agree!!   The cost is so high and the return on investment is so low.   The staff isn't rude or impolite -- just indifferent and definitely not helpful.   They don't staff well enough.  If this was an affordable getaway, I would say that everything was just fine. But the cost-to-value ratio is just so off.   Valet took forever and it seemed like they had 3 people working at 11:00 a.m. checkout time.    Pizza place was turning customers away last night because they said it would take 45 minutes for a pizza.  (It didn't, by the way).   No one greeted us anywhere. No one seemed to want to be helpful in any way.   The rooms were almost spacious and the furnishings /

We had a great time. Kids played for hours. There were many things to do. Staff was very approachable and attentive. Water park was clean and fun. Didn't feel like it was over packed with people. Definitely going back.

My boys and I had a wonderful time! We live about 20 minutes away so it was a sort of staycation for us. We traveled with another family and the kids had a blast in the water park for two days. We also loved playing mini golf and visiting the bowling alley at night. The pizza place being located right ne t to the arcade is so convenient for families. We had a great vacation.

This was an excellent vacation. My son is 4 years old and there were several activities for him. We also loved the fact that me and my wife could enjoy the activities with our son. I would recommend all families visit the great wolf lodge if they have children. There are activities for all ages.

Check in time of 4pm  is not  guarenteed.. rooms still occupied and not cleaned.. they kept you waited and put on hold.. what a waste of time staying here. And checking out is you have to leave on time.

Great family fun! Food is just average. There are nearby restaurants.  There's only one outdoor area but the indoor slides are fun for all ages! Rooms are clean but on the smaller side. There's a few other acactivities to do for the kids, arcade, Magiquest, etc but all at an extra cost.

I think that was that greatest decision we made to go the great wolf lodge we are planning are second vacation with more family members to great wolf lodge it was one of the best experiences i ever had in the waters parks

It was a good stay. The staff was not helpful when we returned from The ER with ideas of things we could do not involving the water part. The spa service was nice but they were filming and it kind of ruined out treatment because they had 9 extra people in the spa. Thy were loud.  We ordering food to go it would be nice in silverwear was provided. Had to walk all the way back to get silverwear just so we could eat.

Great place for family. Checked in around 1pm to enjoy waterpark a little early & our room was already ready for check in. Stayed in the themed suite, kids loved it. Indoor waterpark was fun! Checked out at 11 am but was still able to enjoy waterpark for the rest of the day. They provided plenty of towels. The showers/restrooms at the waterpark was very useful for ppl who have already checked out & needed a place to change.

Was our 2nd visit and the place is still very clean. Was a little too crowded but we did go during our spring break. Will rerun again when it is less crowded as we did get to ride as slides as we did during our 1st visit.

We had a fun time at the hotel. However, when we were leaving, it  took 20min to get my car when it wasn't busy. People stood around. When I tipped the guy $5, he thanked me and walked away withou helping me with my bags. It was ridiculous.

Made service was requested twice, and the rooms still wasn't cleaned up so we had to return from the waterpark to a dirty room twice.  Everything else was a pretty good time, the rooms in the extras are overpriced but the kids had a good time. No Jacuzzi for the adults!

Summary Heading: Great water slide and good activities for kids and parents
Summary: we going here for spring break,we have great experience this hotel resort,parents and children are having good time together,all water slide its an awesome,kids activities all perfect,good food,all working members are friendly and helpful.I would like to come back here again for my next vacation.

Family trip for spring break. It was okay but too pricy for the rooms. Not really a suite, just two rooms that have access to eachother. Elevators where too slow, haf to take the stairs, it was faster.

We had a great experience. There were water rides for all ages. There were plenty of lifeguards and everything was clean and well kept. The room was nice and my boys loved Magiquest. We ate the restaurants-most we're good and worth the money (the breakfast wasn't worth it at the shop downstairs-only complaint).

We had a great time. Everything for the kids is well thought out. Check in could have been more efficient and I would not do the wolf passes again. Overall, the great wolf lodge does not overlook a single detail in making sure families are comfortable with kids of all ages. There was something for everyone.

Summary Heading: Great family fun if you love water parks but not sunburn
Summary: Water park was a blast for the kids. Our 4 year old and 9 year old both had fun. Lots of great kids activities put on by staff. Breakfast buffet is a great deal. Room with the kids bunks is just like the ones at LEGOLAND so they are perfect for a family of 4. Rooms are very big. Only big minus was the room AC was super noisy cheap wall unit that kept me and my wife up at night.

Everyone had a great time. Lots to do. My kids did the paw package which is expensive when you have 3 kids but in the long run probably saved us money Bc they got lots of items. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Loved the water park. I think I should've upgraded to the cub room and I will do that next time.

Fun for the whole family. Very clean and had a variety of activities.   It was a relaxing environment with numerous dining options.  There were so many activities for the kids.  The dining prices were very reasonable. Parking is included in the fees.  Can't wait to take the family down for another visit.

It is always a fun for the kids and not have to worry about over exposure under the sun. Especially when your kid's skin are sensitive and tends to breakout with skin rashes.  It is nice to see your kids had fun playing in the water all day but without the sun burn.

Summary Heading: Expensive but good times will be had
Summary: We had a great time but this resort is still knew and they are working out all the kinks.   When we where there they were at 96% capacity and not prepared.    We still had a great time but will recommend a Cabana.  The other sucky thing they have a resort fee of $29.99 per day. Their rooms cost as much as a Disneyland Hotel room.   They need to figure something out with that resort fee.   We are in Southern Ca we have many options and charging a resort fee will turn people away.

Great experience I would recommend anyone to come and visit the resort. The kids enjoyed all the activities that were available. We are definitely coming down to visit again. The staff were great and the hotel was clean.

Summary Heading: Fun place for kids of all ages!
Summary: Our family really enjoyed our 2 night stay at Great Wolf Lodge. We were there on Easter Sunday and the entire basement (L1) with the arcade and shops was turned into an Easter egg hunt! The staff is very friendly and the Wolf Pass was truly worth it since it was our first time.

Our 4th stay, and the quality and value have dropped each time. The busier this place gets the more they care less about their customers. This was our 4th stay in a year and each time it's more crowded and staff members have become less attentive to their customers needs. On a side note, the water is freezing!!!

Summary Heading: Had a good time celebrating 5th year birthday with grandson and extended family
Summary: Rooms & facilities were good.  Much fun had by 2 , 5, & 8 year-old family members.  Dining options were sufficiently varied & reasonably priced for our 4-day stay.  The focus of the place is for kids, probably aged 2 - 12, although it is OK for adults as well.  Bring sun tan lotion for outdoor pool.  Checkin process can be slow due to long lines.

My family has been to the Great Wolf lodge 3 times now and love it. Its fun for everyone from my 5 year old to our 21 year old son. The staff is friendly and the part is well staffed so feel very safe with my kids. Would highly recommend.

It was a fun experience the kids love it. Unfortunately the room that we got had problems with the air-conditioning system. It was not working properly and we had a hard time sleeping at night. But overall it was a great experience especially for the kids

Unpleasant, crowded, and overpriced. Room was very far from elevator, water temp in showers were only lukewarm, suite was actually an adjoining type room with no room for sitting in one of the bedrooms, using only the bed to sit. Needed to avoid elevators when water park closed as pool patrons crowded the elevators to return to their rooms. Upon check in and not using valet service, there were NO luggage carts available to transport luggage etc to room. Not a welcoming kind of experience.

the waterslide was fun my children loved it but overall staff and survice was horrible !  the lodge was horrible service ! food took forever to get to our table  food was cold and soggy ! our room was hot and stuffy the air condition didn't work i called front desk 4 times before they answered i requested 4 pillows it took 45 mins to get them  the bathtub was dirty i requested to speak to a manger i was told there wasn't one available today . The staff at the arcade were so rude and unprofessional  for paying $510 ffor basically just a few hours because i checked in at 8 my visit was so unwelcoming and unpleasant !  SO UNPLEASEANT AND UNPROFESSIONAL !

Summary Heading: Great stay, avoid the arcade and enjoy the park and magiquest and bowling and all the other activities
Summary: Had a great time!!! The waterpark is much bigger and has more rides than you would expect. They are faster and longer than similar rides at Raging Waters.  MagiQuest is extremely entertaining and well worth the added cost. Also a great eay for only children to quickly make fast friends.  Arcade is horrible and staff there is not customer service oriented AVOID ARCADE!!  All the other staff and activities are much more worth your time and money!!!

Overall a pretty good stay and water park activity for 3 days.  The loose moose buffet needs more choices for food and should have more desert selection like ice cream.  Drinks should be included with the buffet.

Summary Heading: must like small loud out of control children
Summary: This is for families with smaller children, be ready for the wild loud, and undisciplined child. Attendents need to try to have a little more control. Parents tend to let the kids go wild. There needs to be a water space for the adult to go to and RELAX

We had a great time. We did all we wanted. Kids played till they were tired. Ordered pizza to be delivered to our room. Enjoyed that alot. Also had the bday cake waiting for us for desert. Next day we had a late checkout which was great. Along with dunkin donuts for bfast. Had a great time.

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Our family had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We stayed in the Wolf Den, and the kids loved having their own separate area. There were plenty of things for my 3 kids (ages 9, 7, and 2) to do, and we were never bored. We really enjoyed the water slides, and my youngest loved the slides in Fort Mackenzie. The water was a bit cold for my liking, but that's really my only complaint. We will definitely be back!

A thought of dissatisfaction  The visit to the wolf lodge waterpark was not a pleasant experience.  When we arrived we were informed that our room was not yet available upon arrival. After a two hour wait we received a text alert that our room was ready. We then called the bell man to deliver our luggage, it took them an estimated 40 minutes to finally arrive, but to discover the luggage they had was not our luggage. After 20 more minutes they returned with the correct luggage. After receiving our luggage we had an interruption regarding our stay. A gentleman knocked at our door and asked for identification because there was a misunderstanding about the room reservation. He asked to see my identification and clarification about how many people are in my party. I felt insulted

We took our family to the lodge for the first time.  The kids loved the ears, plenty of options outside of the water park.  Some rides had longer lines than I would have liked but overall a great experience.

We had a howling good time!!  This was our first and unfortunately will be our last visit to GWL.  One of our daughters had an allergic reaction to the reclaimed water and broke out in major hives all over her body with a swollen face. Her breathing was fine. Benadryl and hydrocortisone cream to the rescue and GWL staff documented the incident. The girls are sad we can no longer come back, but they had a blast during our stay and created wonderful memories.

Summary Heading: Kids have fun while parents get drunk!
Summary: Kids love this place, probably because it's like a kiddy version of Las Vegas, with water. Parents, however, can be seen drinking as early as 10:30 in the morning, which should tell you something. Given the price of the drinks -- a craft beer costs $9 -- there's not much incentive for the resort to make this a bit more pleasant for the parents. Now that pot is legal in California, perhaps they'll start selling that from one of the kiosks!

Summary Heading: Family Fun at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: My children had an amazing time and the staff was wonderful.  I highly recommend the great wolf lodge. I don't have one single complaint about the resort I also highly recommend registering on their website because they do send out great offers.

Only little expensive . I like to take my family and my friends coming Back again. This is special place for my kids to enjoy. Hopefully i have a price for next time. I would like to play more there for couple nights and hope the crews more nicely .

A nice get away for the entire family. We never had to go outside of the resort for anything. I thought the kids would get bored and want to venture out for other activities but they were totally satisfied

This is a wonderful family resort. I recommend Great Wolf's to all families...great location, lots of restaurants and close to everything. My kids were free to have fun and we played the wntire day...

I booked a room for for my son's birthday 2.5 months in advance..thought the early saver promotion.  The very next day I called and wanted to cancel since I found a better deal elsewhere.  NO REFUNDS on $390 I just spent...because it was through the  ESave promo code.  Unbelievable.  Even the regular rooms are subject to 15% minimum cancellation fee regardless.....horrible business practices.  You can get a much better deal through groupon or other discounted sites.  One and only time I'll stay there.

Best overall experience! !! This was our first trip as a family and what a better way to do it. It is a kid friendly environment and everyone was so nice and pleasant. The hotel was so neat and comfortable and the water park was safe enough for our kids to swim on their own.

Summary Heading: Forget hunting for eggs, we rode the rides
Summary: This was my 2nd time and my 2nd review as well.   My boy just loves it so we come here whenever we can especially since its so close to home.  The pillows   were so comfortable I felt like I was at home.  This is a big deal for me.  The room service was great.  Pizza at 10:30pm always tastes great!  The best part about this trip is how they use technology to alert their guests that their room is ready and how you get the wrist band that can be used to charge everything to your room so you don't have to carry your wallet around.  It provides a freedom to really have fun.  If you get hungry, you can order food right in the water slide area.  Also the excellent choice of bathing suits and accessories for the water can be easily bought at the store directly.  The prices are really

Had small issues but, overall is a Good indoor Water Park for kids. My 8 year old had lots of FUN. One of the small issues is that I was not aware they charge for parking. $ 19 for valet parking. What I liked about our stay is that with the stay at the Lodge you get enjoy the Indoor Water Park.

My grandson loves this place. He doesn't want to go home! We love the location. It's very near our house. Dunkin Donuts is a family favorite. We love the water park. The food court is nice too. It's our second time and we plan to come back again next vacation

Summary Heading: Come enjoy the water park but skip the hotel rooms
Summary: We booked a 5days and 4nights stay for my children's spring break. The kids had so much fun in the water park, Magiquest and the arcade. But we had to cancel the 4th night. Because I felt extremely tired. The bad quality of the room and the noise value was killing adults.  After a long day aconmendationg the children, paresnts deserve a comfortable bed to rest. After playing in the water parks, moms need some nice shampoo and at least a bottle of conditioner to pamper themselves. After a whole day playing in the water park, we need a quiet room to recharge ourselves , but the old A/C is making huge sound and blowing smelly air into the rooms. Remember we are charged for the resort price but enjoyed a two star hotel amenity and service. Now it is the second day back home, and I

Summary Heading: Cool place, but could use work
Summary: The place was fun for little children but if they are 7 and older its not fun for anyone. Also the food was beyond terrible, it was inedible. But the rooms were nice and clean and comfortable to stay in.

Summary Heading: Great waterpark, but beware of the staff
Summary: Great indoor pools and slides, plenty of towels and great activities, BUT beware of the staff.  It starts with being understaffed, and those that do work there must be porrly paid because we had the worst hospitality all over the hotel.  too expensive for such bad experience

My children had an amazing time. Rooms were basic but clean. The kids loved their own lil bunk bed cave area (in a themed room).Fun arcade & mini bowling alley to take a break from the all day water play! We didn't do the whole magiquest game thing..even my kids thought it was insanely overpriced for what it was. The Water park was pretty clean as well as the towels provided. I myself am not fond of mass public pools & sharing of water with hundreds of strangers due to my OCD issues. (I feel like it's swimming in everyone's grimy bath water) But I managed to get past it... there were a few accidents in the pool that almost made me pack it up but the staff were quick to clean & clear out those areas. My kids & I didn't revisit those areas until the next day(my issues) but they

Kid Cabin has a fold out couch bed.  Not comfortable at all, but, otherwise a wonderful stay.  Can't wait to go back.  Food was mixed, eat outside at the grill for an excellent burger.  Don't forget to visit the outside swim area and bring your swim-shirts/sunscreen.  Great place for the kids to play while enjoying lunch and a beer.

Great value and a lot of fun for the whole family! Staff was courteous and knowledgeable. Room was very clean and because we stayed in the themed room our kids were so happy! A lot of fun for them! We will definitely go back!

If you want allday fun, this is it! It is definitely worth checking it out! Great rooms on 4th deck, great suites, accessible to foods, desserts and more. Kids activities throughout the day keeps the family busy.

Great water park, excellent rides, games, and nice food. Very good staff everywhere keeping an eye on everything. The room was nice ,comforting, and the little arcade was pretty cool too. Can't wait to go again!

Great location right at Anaheim close to everything. Right off the freeway easy to get around.  Family orientation atmosphere kids had a awesome time definitely will be back to many more years. Thank you great wolf lodge.

Adults in my group raved about how much fun it was for the adults as well as the kids, maybe even more! The kids can run around in a safe and secure environment, there's life guards everywhere, while the adults can just lounge around sipping on drinks. Just make sure your wristbands works for when you exit the parking lot. Parking is supposed to be free for overnight guests. Can't wait for the next.

Kids and family had an awesome time enjoying all the available waterpark and events throughout the Resort.  Great place to take the kids and relax all in one place! Planning on my next trip for the Summer Vacay!

We have a wonderful weekend and very relaxing. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Food is really good and service excellent. It is a really safe place and as a mother i felt really comfortable with my child knowing staff will be there in case of any incident happens Definitely we want to come back.  Thank you to all staff.

This place is such fun for everyone. We stayed here to celebrate my son's birthday and reserved a kids cabin, which was really nice. I am impressed with the quality of the rooms, the caliber of the food and the helpfulness ofcthe staff. This place is worth a visit or two!

Summary Heading: Great escape so close to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 6 stayed in a Grizzly Suite for two nights.  We arrived late after doing a full day of Disney - just two miles down the road - and woke up the next day to so much fun.  Our room had two apartments and comfortably slept our whole group.  The best part of staying there is the unlimited access to the GWL waterpark - all the water fun you can have in a day without needing sunscreen. MagiQuest was also fun, but took almost 3 hours to complete - be sure to budget enough time. The breakfast buffet was well done and reasonably priced for resort food-highly recommend the omelettes to order.  I would skip the mini-golf and arcade if you can keep your kids away... Overall a great time and place to stay for family and kids of all ages.

Love this Hotel and always have a blast. Service is great and staff are friendly.  Wish they had the Hot tub area like the one in Texas.  Like to go stay at least once a month kids are occupied the whole time and never bored.

Absolutely amazing. The initial price of our trip took us by surprise, but we were instantly impressed. The resort is worth the price. Quality and comfortable. This place is designed for families, and you can tell that a lot of thought was put into the resort (our room was very quiet - and I know  lot of little ones were running by outside). The buffet has a great selection of healthy and quality food. We are not talking about powdered eggs, people. There is an omelet bar... The Grizzly restaurant is worth the wait. Prices are great and the quality of the food is outstanding. Take your time on your first day and get to know the water park. There really isn't a wait if you consider the amount of time you would spend in line at an amusement park.  The kids activities are also

There were constant shutdowns due to feces floating in the pool.  We had to wait for over an hour for some attractions to be cleaned.  It was a gross experience my children had to see when you see a log in the pool.

Great water activities without the worry of sunburn Wonderful place for family with water activities for different skill levels Children's wading pool with mini three mini slides Wave pool Giant water slides Lazy river Basketball played in water Walking across connected log slices using rope ladder Life guards and various life jacket sizes available poolside Snack bars and restaurants Rooms available with bunk beds for kids Gift shops selling water shoes, swim wear, beanie baby wolf, jewelry, clothing, trinkets Fun arcade games ie: skeeball, whack a stump, water guns etc with ticket redemption Free parking in covered garage 6 passes to water park per room reservation, Bracelets are room keys Can check in day of reservation and use water park and also afternoon you check out

We have been to the Great Wolf Lodge on 3 occasions.  The service has consistently gone down hill since it opened, especially in the restaurant.   Hostess was extremely rude not once but twice.  We weren't served drinks until after we finished our plates (buffet style) on both occasion at the restaurant. In addition, we found another guest's wedding ring and wanted to return it but the head of security was extremely rude.  Luckily, the front desk was not and was very helpful.    Sorry but for $350 a night I expect to treated with respect not like crap from a bunch of millennial drones.

Waterpark is not impressive, but better than I expected.Food was not that great, but again better than expected. Breakfast buffet had eggs to order, fresh fruit and was good. Obviously came for waterpark which kids enjoyed. In addition to waterpark, kids loved Magiquest and 4D movie game. Overall good trip. Over $2,000 for 3 days, 2 nights was a bit pricey. Had a horrible experience with cabana that someone else trashed before we arrived. Staff didnt care and took forever to clean and didnt bother to restock all the stolen drinks. Couldnt order food from cabana...  just rangs and rangs grill and then disconnects. No service from staff. My safe was broken, took staff over an hour to repair..,  precious time wasted waiting instead of using waterpark I paid for and to top it off TV

Summary Heading: Family Spring Break Vacation  at Great Wolf Lodge.
