Summary: We are very dissatisfied with our experience and hope if we visit  again things improve for the good. The alarm clock woke us up at 6am unexpected. The water park was to stuffy and smelled bad and needs to be cleaned more periodically. The pizza from the restaurant Hungry as Wolf was delicious, had fast service, excellent customer service with a reasonable price. Again this was our first experience and not approximately $700 worth our stay.  We would've spent our time and money at another place had we known.

I'm rating this place 3 stars only because of the pricing of the rooms.  We got the rooms for a special 30% off and it was still very expensive.  on top of that there were some charges i had no idea about until checkout time which was very surprising and disappointing of how high those charges were.  For example, valet was $20 a night, ok no problem, but we chose to self park.  Well, i wasnt told that self parking was $13 a night, thinking it was free, not cool.  There were occupancy charges for the room, wtf? i thought i already paid for the room, why is there a charge for me being in the room, and those charges were per night.  And of course a resort fee, a night.  The staff were very nice, the place is very cool, i wouldnt say stay more than 2nights but it is very costly and

Summary Heading: Amazing place to spend a family vacation!
Summary: We have been to the Great Wolf before and will continue to return. It is an amazing safe and self contained property with so much great stuff to do. Besides the great water park there is so much more to do. Bowling, arcades, scavenger hunts, story time, character appearances, kids spa, etc. The restaurants are great and not really overpriced. Just an overall great welcoming place to spend spring break.

Summary Heading: Great for kids of all ages.
Summary: We all had a great time. Very safe place for family vacation. Cost is a bit high, so if you plan to go, safe up. The dinner buffet is no really kid friendly but the breakfast was good. The arcade was awesome.

Summary Heading: A great place for your family!
Summary: My family enjoyed every part of this theme park! It is a bit pricey for the games but we didn't have to leave anywhere so it made it very convenient for my family and I. Definitely a great place to go when the weather does not permit you to be outdoor much!

Spring break, last minute trip. Turned out to be great! The kids loved how close to home it was! Would definitely do it again. Great place for a one day or two day visit. Definitely would recommend a visit to great wolf lodge.

Loved the indoor water park and arcade. Silly bonus, they give free glasses of water in the water park instead of paying for water bottles. Rooms were clean, staff friendly. Hallway was a little loud at times, but it is a kid place so that was expected.

It seems like a good place but we had a bad experience. I had to repeatedly call the front desk because they hadn't placed shampoo I'm my room. Fam broke out with rashes because we were waiting all night for delivery of shampoo and soap before we showered. Clorine hurt our bodies. Then one of the rides (the drop capsule) hurt my son's neck. I would recommend to stay away from that ride. It's dangerous.

My family of four had a great time at Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim.  Everything went smoothly, the services were good, the facilities were comfortable and the water park was fun for everyone.  The hours the waterpark was open worked out great (9am-9pm), as we could visit several times during the day, and take breaks to shower and change and do other activities.  We loved getting convenient coffee and breakfast at the Duncan Donuts right next to the elevators, so we could eat before going into the waterpark.  The Magic quest game was fun for my older son, while the clubhouse game was good for my younger one.  And both loved the arcade.  We chose this for our spring break vacation since it was primarily all indoors, so we didn't have to worry about the weather, although we had a

Fun. Even on the business of spring break, there was room for everyone. I just wish the lazy river was longer and wider. Kids get rowdy at times...but kids will be kids, and everyone seemed to be having a great time.

Very safe environment to let your kids be alone without worrying. Everyone are nice. I would go here again because my kids love it and also they loved the water parks. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. I would love to go here again.

Overall, the place is great.  The only things not satisfactory were the price of the food , not being able to bring any food /chips or at least drinks to the water park area. I also noted that some guests didn't shower first before going to the pool . Maybe it's better if there are staff at the pool entrance to remind people to shower/wash first . This will help maintain the cleanliness of the facility and will ensure safety of everyone .

Summary Heading: Kids had fun, horrible manager at hotel
Summary: Jessi the "manager" is rude, luck of respect to guests, charge my card without permission on paw passes I never got.  After calling me lair 3 times- by claiming I did got them, I hang up the phone, he checked and understand I did not get them- credit my CC but never apologized.

Summary Heading: Best place for a family trip...worth every penny.
Summary: We made a last min reservation for spring break and thought it would crowded. To our surprise even though the hotel was fully booked we it felt like low season. We always have a great time here with so much to do at basically any hour.

Summary Heading: Fun times! Enjoyable but a little pricey...
Summary: Kids had a great time... perfect location to enjoy outside activities as well ... little disappointed that the arcades were 2.00 a game, and the golf, bowling and movies( 8 min long)  were 8.00 per person extra! Figured with how much we spent they wouldn't overcharge for other things in the hotel. Overall great experience! Best part was the wristbands for the park were also your room key and a way to charge items to the room... loved that convenience!!

Summary Heading: Not as impressed as I hoped to be
Summary: I felt the concepts of this hotel was slightly a bait and switch.  The amenities, although nice were somewhat understaffed and a la carte in pricing.  Staff was not very knowledgeable, many of the experiences were extra in price.  Booking a room does get you access to the water park but the children activities are additional.  The rooms themselves were very bare bones and low in quality of furnishings.For the nightly price I would have expected more.  "Fitness Center" had 2 pieces of equipment and both were out of order.  Wifi was extremely slow.  Air conditioning was like the old motels were there is a big a/c unit sticking out of the wall.  Our room felt like it was 100 yards from the elevator.  No real bellman support for families but they do offer the luggage carts that look

Great wolf lodge is a great place to go with the whole family but a little bit pricey. Rooms are nice and clean altough the beds are not the most comfortable. The pools are very clean and safe. Rides are great and you don't have to wait too long to use them.

Summary Heading: Awesome time at Great Wolf Lodge!!
Summary: We had such a great time! All was awesome... highly recommend it !!! Great for families with kids!!! We went to the Garden Grove location. Staff and place was great, nothing bad to say about it. I would go again!

Stayed at Great Wolf Lodge in April for a week.  While the place was crowded due to spring break crowds, the service was still excellent especially at the restaurants.  My kids ages 2-8 LOVED the water park. The room was clean and spacious.  My only gripes are that the elevators were a pain during "rush hour" given the crowds and the bathroom showers at the water park were gross.  However, I would happily stay here again especially if late check out was available (which it wasn't when we asked) so that I could wash up in the comforts of my room and not at the water park on my last day at the hotel.

Love this place great family fun. Have every thing you need at your finger tips no need to travel away from water park .frist time attending and me and my fanily had a blast ..we will be attendin again before summer over

Summary Heading: Great Activities for Families of all ages!!
Summary: What a great kick off for Spring Break!! We had a blast!! The staff was fun and the activities were nonstop!! The water park was secure and safe. The food was wonderful as well, especially the pizza!! We will definitely be returning!! Thanks Great Wolf Lodge!!

My family and I were only there one night.  Sunday to Monday. Overall experience was great. The family had fun at the waterpark and the grizzly room was very comfy. The resort met all of our needs during our stay.

We stayed for 2 nights and 3 days. We arrived at 11:30 ish and luckily our room was ready and so were the packages we had ordered online. The room was far from the elevator just as we had requested. My 10 year old had a blast playing the MagiQuest game. We played straight for 6 hours got knighted and called it a day. Highly recommend this game for 10+. Adults make sure the family wears sneakers as there is lots of walking. We dined at Wood Fire Grill and it was decent.  Second day - we walked to Starbucks about a mile away for coffee and breakfast. Once we got back , we hit the water park and were done by noon or so. Had lunch at the Pizza place close by. We played another game of MagiQuest until late evening.   Third Day - we played all the indoor games like mini bowling, golf,

No complementary breakfast! Staffs were not friendly, they couldn't help with anything and everyone seem like they we're not happy working there.. they mest up my reservation and charged me over the price I was suppose to pay, they had to refund me the money

This place is grossly understaffed. It is a serious waste of money unless you have several days because all the activities and water park takes time due to understaffing. Don't waste your money, go to one of LAs other entertainment locations!

Great family friendly resort. Variety of activities for all age groups. No need to worry about what the weather will be like... Indoor water park is AWESOME  It was nice not to have to leave the resort for meals, there was more than one restaurant to choose from.

Under staffed wait forever for everything front desk never picks up the water slid had two ppl using 7 slides could of went by a lot faster if they had more help!! Donut place was out of everything they gave me a half full coffee as well the computer shut off to so we had to wait ten min to pay

Summary Heading: Overrated rated save your money and stay at a Disney resort
Summary: Terrible will not recommend Great would love to anyone. Worst experience ever. Staff were rude no room service calling front dance and waiting 30 minutes before towels, shampoo and toilet accessories arrives. Brand new 2017 car damage from valet

Nice place, just very expensive. 1500 in 2 days is a bit much. As a family of 5, there are other alternatives to spend your hard earned money. Not sure why the hotel rooms are 500 a night, not even disneyland is that high. We have gone to all the parks and resorts in socal. This one is not a good value.

If only I had come when my kids were younger , such a great place, so much for the kids to do  ! However my teens and my husband and I still enjoyed the water park! There is something for every age!  Very clean , very pleasant staff . Good over all experience.

They have it right! The entire experience is amazing for families that wants a quick getaway. My kids range in ages whichis hard to find a place that has something for all. However, the water park met all of our needs, kids were happy and we were happy.

Summary Heading: Does not live up to the hype! Do not go there. Go to Legoland instead.
Summary: This was a tremendous disappointment. The staff is wonderful, the amenities for the kids are all great, but poor substitute for Legoland.  Indoor water park will make you nauseaous from the chlorine fumes that do not vent properly. One year and the resort already has the old lived in threadbare and worn slumping sofa look. Not good for the $$$$$ they charge. The sheets, towels, pillows and blankets are made for leprechaun sized people. They do not supply enough of them. The food is terrible. Expensive toys and games, especially the magic wands which are priced up, up, up.

The waterpark was terrific. My kids liked the variety of many different slides and the wolf ears. We also liked the $50 gift card included in the cost of the room. My kids liked that  they could spend it on deserts and lunch.

Summary Heading: It was ok unlike before it was really good
Summary: Water when it recently open its warm and you can enjoy for a long period of time. Recently its kinda cold my baby and elder son wasnt able to enjoy that long theyre cold. On our first visit the water was warm we can stay for more than 4 hours but now its not. The place was nice there's a lot of activities for the kids and entire family. I feel secure because everywhere safeguards are watching time to time. Our room was nice and clean. Very comfy to sleep. The location was good you can dine out too theres a lot of place to eat if u decide to eat out

Not impressed with this place.  Super-expensive for an "eh" experience.  Indoor area was so hot and humid that I found it uncomfortable.  It was also crazy-loud -- which is what I guess I should expect for the large number of kids running around.  My daughter was bored after 3 hours.  Not worth the $550 we paid!  Happy we only booked for 1 night before our Disney vacation.  As for the hotel, we were upgraded to a themed room called the wolf's den.  It was pretty generic and boring.  Breakfast buffet tip: get in line early for real eggs at the omelette station so you can avoid the eggs made from a box.  Gross :(

First time going to wolf lodge. I wanted to surprise my kids to this place because they here so much about it. But from the front desk guest service thinking we were getting the best room for an upgrade we got the worst room suite. Our bathroom flooded and I was up all. Ight cleaning the room up. It's sad that I had to do that due to I didn't want anyone coming to our room at odd hours with children sleeping.

Very fun. Check was amazing g. Very friendly and helpful staff. All ages have plenty to do including adults. Food was good but expensive. Rooms were very clean but nothing special. Definitely will go back when it's not peek season.

Great family fun and bonding. Temperature inside water park was just right. Water could be 2 or 3 degrees warmer. Overall a fun place. Good food at the Wood Fire grill and the buffet. Snack bar inside the waterpark is good too, just a limited menu.

Went with a large group of family and friends and we all had a blast, especially in the water park.  Service was great right from the beginning.  Food was good and lots to do with the kids.  The arcade was fun, my kids loved the bowling and eating ice cream!

Encountered a few problems: arrival 4/6-4/9 Check in staff member Daniel was Great, unfortunately he didn't have a cash box, so he sent me to a different agent where she finished checking me in (felt mistreated by her) did not at all appreciate a remark she made as i pulled out cash to pay remaining balance. As i checked in, i told my sister to look for cart for our bags, she asked a team member and the staff member in white shirt told her she had to look for one herself! that was out welcoming, bad.  The fallowing day i asked about my California adventure ticket, she missed informed me about the information i asked.  I requested shuttle with Daniel, he booked me in for 8:15 am and pick up at 10:15; pick up was great! no problem; however pick up was a nightmare.  I was at the

Shower plumbing had issues, shakes in the walls, and Water park had only one large kid ride. My kids vary in age from 11 yrs to 17 yrs. The park is great for kids from up to 12-13 yrs old and when I made the reservation I was told that water park was great for all ages, but when your there only the Wave and Wipe-Out pools and for large teens.

great fun for the whole family we all had lots of fun.  I would recommend it for at least 2 days, the early entry to the park is very cool, we hit the water and our room was ready on time.  the food was really good as well.

We stayed from Sat through Sunday last weekend. Our party consisted of several adults and children to celebrate my sons 8th birthday. We pulled up to the valet before our check in time and the male valet was super helpful, took our birthday cake and checked it in for us even though we self parked. Check in was very very slow (they need more staff at peak times) but the staff was friendly and our room was actually ready before noon. That was great. We were able to unload our things and they had luggage carts near the parking elevators which we used and needed. Our room was pretty clean, just some dust on head board but generally clean and bathroom clean as well. We had a lot of towels and never had to request anything. The waterpark was good, our outside cabana was perfect and

Great fun-filled family weekend.  Lots of entertainment and dining options.  The wrist band makes everything so convenient. I highly recommend GWL especially if you have younger children.  They won't be disappointed.

Our kids and my husband love this place!! We recommend to all our friends and family especially when they have specials / promotional pricing. This is a all in one getaway - resort for the kids and adults.

Great time with the family at the Great Wolf Lodge. We will defiantly come back again. The staff was fantastic and they whole resort was built around having family fun. Make sure to book your room in advance and the trip is absolute worth the price.

Kids had fun!  Good amount of slides. Wait time for the slide could be improved, add more staff. Wear sandals floor is a bit slippery.  Only downside is the price, I think it's too pricey, only 4 stars.

My family was able to visit the park again and a year later I have to say that they are a much better park now. They responded to my review and accomdated my family. Only two complaints: 1) The water was cold especially in the kid pool and slide area 2) The animatronic characters still did not work properly in the room . Thanks Jessie and GWL crew members for a great experience this time around. I look forward to returning again.

Summary Heading: Super fun place for kids and adults
Summary: Hotel was great, clean, customer friendly, super fun for the whole family. Its got a free shuttle to Disneyland, which was awesome. Entertainment, food kids activities, all there, don't even have to leave the hotel.

I stayed here with my 2 children ages 6 and 13 for Spring break 2017. The lobby is great and very inviting. The rooms are new and clean. We had a blast at the water park! The days we were there it wasn't very crowded so we had a great time. We had a room on level 5 though, which has a bunch of clues for the magiquest and it was soooo loud all day and late into the nights! Definitely will never stay on one of those levels again!

We came here for my sons 7th birthday ( took two 7 year olds, one 5 year old, 4 adults) we all had a lot of fun! The park is small but that was kind of nice because the kids got to run around and we didn't feel like we were going to lose them, the rides are fun, didn't feel like I waited too long in any line. The food is bad, pizza was disgusting even worse was the cesar salad at the pizza store. We ate out for every meal after that. Expect everything to be overpriced from the rooms, to the activities like bowling and the arcade. The water park is hot and humid, on Friday we felt the water was very warm and didn't feel cold but on Saturday we had to get out a couple times and dry out because we were so cold. I'm not sure what changed from Friday to Saturday but we ended up

We arrived early and rooms were ready so we were all happy. Convenient and easy armband access process so you don't have to carry cash around or a key card to enter the room. That was great. Food at the Lodge Grill had the best ribs I have ever had. Staff very friendly. Rooms and beds very comfortable. It was a great experience and wonderful for families. Kids will love it!

Summary Heading: Fun and safe place for family fun
Summary: I'll start out by saying my daughter is 14 years old and may have been a little old for the water park but she still enjoyed it.  I'm sure it would have been different if she was with her friends instead of her parents.  With that said, it is great for families with kids in the 6-12 year old range.  I would call this place a Las Vegas-style resort but for kids.  There's the indoor water park, arcade, several restaurants, huge lobby where part of it became a dance floor at night, shops, Dunkin' Donuts, etc.  We ended up going out for dinner but when we came back there was security checking people coming in which was good because kids were running around the lobby so it was good knowing they could roam around safely.  The price of the room is a little on the high side but when you

Our kids had the most wonderful time. They bowled, golfed, played in the water for hours and ran around acting like Magicians playing MagiQuest. We had to extend our stay by one day because the kids wanted to do much more playing and water time. Brandy at the front desk was awesome and made sure our reservation matched our bill, it was not correct at check in and we didn't realize it and she fixed it then got us our extra night stay. What an awesome time. We will definitely be going back again.

Absolute chaos. Incredibly expensive. Constantly being hit up to spend additional money. I think most of the kids were having fun, but all adults looked absolutely miserable. Spend your money elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Maximize your dollar value by booking somewhere else
Summary: To be fair this place is great for kids. There are many activities for them to do like miniature golf, the 24 hour arcade, the indoor waterpark, and the story time shows. The whole marketing premise of this is that if you book the hotel you get the waterpark passes for free. I understand that in places where its usually cold outside you can come to one of these and enjoy a heated water park experience all year round. Because this particular location is in SoCal, you can get good weather pretty much all year round.  The good:  Hotel provided wolf ears for their guests at no extra charge unlike places like Disney. Dining choices: Pizza place, Dunkin Donuts, Grill, and buffet. The buffet food quality was excellent but limited in selection. 24 hour gaming arcade. Ice cream\dessert

Great quick family trip. Make sure you take your snacks inside water park in middle of the day. You will spend at least $500 for one night  bbefore you know it. Be sure to do your math before booking this trip.

Great Wolf has it all under ONE roof, from food, drinks, games and of course the Water Park for ALL ages! The Staff is awesome from the moment you check in to the check out! We can't wait to come back again!

Our Spring Break at this resort was fun.  However, staffs at the check-in was not as pleasant as I expected.  I guess it's one of the bad day she had.  I can just overlooked at this situation and move on to having fun.

My family had an excellent time, my 8 year old daughter especially liked the Magiquest game.   The base room price was reasonable and a good value. The food prices and resort fees were high, the food was also not spectacular. Higher prices are acceptable if the food is very good.

The we were overcharged of extra valet and dining at their restaurant that we never ate.  When we fixed the issue at front desk they said it's fixed but we saw the charges on our credit card and they charged an extra $77 again.  WTF

Very safe and clean and staff was very friendly! Great place to stay!  Lots to do to keep the kids occupied. A great variety of games and food.  A very relaxing atmosphere great room to sit by the fireplace and read or just relax and enjoy a 🍹.

Very expensive to stay, room n food are way too expensive otherwise, a good get away once in a while. Lazy river is a very rowdy part of the waterpark. Maybe just needs more space. The rides are fun and ok

Although it is expensive, the resort has everything you need. There is a Targer 1/2 a mile up the street so you can stock up there and save a lot of money on swim diapers and such. The food was great, water park was a ton of fun and the staff is extremely friendly.

We had a great time! We loved that we didn't have to leave the resort. They have anything that you might need here, at the resort. They water park was nice and warm, so when you are walking around you are not cold. So many things to do! Staff is super helpful.

Overall good experience.  Very expensive to do/eat at this resort. Went off site a couple of times to eat and do last minute shopping. The resort is kept up.  Nice and clean. Kids had a blast and also enjoyed the arcade!

My friend recommanded to visit Great Wolf Lodge, It was memorable trip to my family. My kids loved to be together.we hope to visit soon with cousin and in law.they will come to my place in this summer vacation .

It's our second  visit here and once again my kids, husband  and I were fully happy and satisfied with everything. The food was delicious at every place we dine and the rooms were ready before 4 and very clean with sufficient towels.

We really enjoyed our time here. This was our 2nd trip and things were still great. My grandchildren really enjoyed the variety of stuff to do... The staff is extremely helpful and attentive..will be back again.

Our family had a great time in overall from the kids activities & all the attractions & rides. We highly recommended this place it's pricey but it's worth it! We will absolutely coming back again. I'm just hoping that the check in time could be a little bit earlier.

The kids were so happy the whole trip. I hardly saw them the whole time we were there! The beds were so comfortable. Great trip. Way too expensive at the normal rate, but if you can go with a deal like Groupon or a non peak time, it is well worth it!

The water slides need to be more organized. You have 3 separate lines on 1 stairwell. You end up waiting in a long line when sometimes you don't have too. Also the ventilation inside the water park is pretty bad, my eyes were burning for a while. Also many of the water park staff were young rude kids, one girl with tattoos on her leg was rolling her eyes at guests and when I asked where to get a raft she pointed and said "due for an eye exam". But overall it was very fun. I feel it's a little overpriced though. The worst part was that housekeeping was literally at my door at 930 asking for us to leave despite checkout was 11. Felt very awkward. So service definitely needs improvement! Probably won't be back for a while!

Had a great time and the grandsons loved it! They are already planning another visit! The staff was friendly, it was not over crowded, and the facilities are nice. Prices were reasonable and the boys loved the pizza!

Great family friendly experience.  The resort is very clean and well maintained. The staff are very friendly and helpful.  The pizza is amazing. The majority of the food at the other restaurants is over priced for the quality.

My children have 2 weeks off for Spring break, where most schools only have 1 week out. This is local family fun for us. It is just a short drive from Playa Vista, Ca and I don't have to worry about planning a day of events because there is always something to do.

We had a great time!!!! The waterpark is all indoors so it does not matter the time of year or the weather! I loved that I didn't have to worry about the kids getting sunburned or getting too hot or too cold. Everything is temperature controlled. Also the waterpark was open until 8:00.  One night stay is 2 days waterpark admission. Definitely recommend this as a family/friends vacation!

We came here for Spring Break! This place is huge! Don't let the price scare you off. Sign up for the email list. They always have a deal going on. A lot of free activities also some pay to play activities. I suggest buying the paw passes. It helped a lot. I suggest purchasing any add on online. They are higher at the resort. They have food options but they are pricey. There is McDonalds across the street. There is also Target and Rite aide to get snacks for your room. They have microwaves and refrigerators in them. Overall we all had fun! We plan on returning for the summer!!

We decided to take our grandchildren to Great Wolf Lodge over spring break.  This was not our first visit, but our fourth.  This time each child got to bring a friend, which made the experience even more fun.  The lodge continues to be clean, provide good entertainment for the children, and provides excellent supervision in the water park.  We purchased the magic quest wand on the first trip.  The children bring the wand each time and for a small activation fee, they play the game each time.  The game has multiple mini games which provide hours of entertainment.

The hotel was fun for kids. The rooms were very small and not worth the cost. We had a bunk bed suite. This is only worth it if you get a half off offer somewhere. The water park was clean and not to big or small. The kids did have a great time.

Great indoor waterpark.  The kids loved it.  We had a family suite and the kids loved the bunk beds and the wand interaction within our suite.  The food on premise is overpriced and awful.  With the exception of the ice cream and Duncan Donuts!

We had a great family time! I'm glad we spent our kids Springbreak at GWL. Place is accessible to shopping and so many things to do in and out. Restaurants are all over, love the grill restaurant in the outdoor  pool.

Everything under one roof for much relief of any parent.  They definitely have some vegan and vegetarian options at the restaurants if your watching what your eating.  You must at least once bring your children and family.

All 3 of my boys (ages 8, 9 and 11) voted to leave after only an hour and a half -- need I say more?   We booked with Groupon -- thank goodness we didn't pay full price because boy,  is it over-priced. The best part is how nice the employees are -- really,  really nice -- but the water park itself is very small,  which means crowded.  The other activities are nicely appointed but small and expensive.  The locker facilities are too small,  inadequate and expensive. The hotel is ginormous and the rooms good.  Next time we'll go to Soak City at Knott's Berry Farm or Boomers.

I was impressed how this place made me feel that I got something good for my money. My child is full of happy memories and is looking forward to coming again. Hopefully she'll be big enough next time to understand the MagiQuest activities. Nonetheless there was plenty to do. They manage to have activities for everyone from toddler to grown up.

Positives: Rooms and hotel were clean. Restaurant staff were friendly   Negatives: a lot of hidden fees. Resort tax and accom tax. Having that and the Canadian dollar exchange it was expensive. For our family, two adults and two children for two nights was $1300 That includes the wolf pass and meals. We also got a cabana for our first day, very nice if you can add the luxury   Also the showers at the water park were disgusting.   My dad boys are 5&7 and the Magiquest was very difficult for them so I wouldn't recommend that for young kids (we did not finish and found the constant up and down to the floors was tedious and caused lineups for the elevators) My youngest did like the wand in the dining room the best tho  Overall I would recommend and I don't think you can do this on a

Never disappoints! Second time going and we had just as much fun as the first time. The kids disappear at this place, I am glad they are good swimmers but impressed of how active the lifeguards are watching the kids and the water.

Summary Heading: You're kids are going to LOVE this place!!!
Summary: It's just TOO much fun! Perfect place for a kid to be a kid.  I was overly pleased with this resort. My daughter chose it for her birthday and I'm sure it will be something she'll remember forever.  I recommend at least a three night stay so you're able to participate in all the fun activities offered. Location is great! It's centered around shopping centers. So if you forget to pack something no worries. They also offer discounts on passes online when you book prior to your stay. Do it! You'll save a life ton. ENJOY!!!!

Our stay was great whole family had a great time, we enjoyed it better than place down the street,very friendly safe atmosphere, comfortable to let kids take off on their own for awhile only thing restaurants very pricey, food just ok but pizza was great

A great experience for the whole family. Would definitely recommend this place for families. This is the second year in a roll I have brought my family here and they have enjoyed themselves both times

Pros: 1. As of April 2017 the rooms and lobby still felt new and clean.  2. Great staff.  Our check in lady was kind and speedy.  Our TV was not working and maintenance came and solved the problem only 10 min after we called to notify them. 3.  No sunburn!  There is an outdoor pool, but most of the water play is indoors and we did not even bring sunblock.   4.  The waterpark was fun and open many hours.  Cons: 1. COLD.  This was our largest complaint about the waterpark.  Since you are constantly getting wet, then drying off while you wait for a slide, then getting wet, then drying off..... your body feels like you are sweating and tries to cool you down.  My kids were visibly shaking they were so cold.  HUGE disappointment.  I would think an indoor facility would have the

The resort is so clean and there are so many fun things to do for the kids. I suggest renting a cabana because it was worth it! The staff are really friendly and seem to go out of their way to help you.

Great family fun! Totally recommend! Water park, dancing, story time, magic wands, arcade, bowling, and family time all in one. I highly recommended this resort to all families. Will definitely be back.

While the concept is good, it is WAY too overpriced with hidden fees, and outrageous add on prices for any activity. They charge a resort fee AND self parking fees. It was spring break and it seemed like they were way under-staffed which created longer lines than normal.

Great value for a family vacation. The indoor water park caters to all age groups and is fun for the entire family. Nice, clean facilities. Not too crowded during our visit. Restaurants have good food options and are a good value for a family on vacation.

Overall we had a great time but had a few incedents. Great wolf lodge when all is going well is great family fun with lots to do for the kids. Rooms are nice and some are themed adding to the experience for the kids. The games and activities are creative and fun.. Just beware that there are plea NYU of kids running around with no supervision.

Super fun place for the kids...super expensive for the parents!  We saw the park advertised on Trip Advisor for $186 but that was very misleading..as that was the price without the water park (why would anyone stay here and not go to the water park????)..so it ended up being $475!!!  And they charge you for EVERYTHING on the property...although we appreciated the two free bottles of water in the room!  Kids loved the water park...boring for the adults...but we expected that!

Me and my little ones had awesome time, the staff is really nice, the water park is very clean and they provide all the towels you need. You have a variety of food to choose from, we ate the buffet and we enjoyed the variety of food they have available.

My family and I enjoyed our stay. Only thing I didn't like was they didn't let you bring outside snacks in the water park. There were numerous water slides for the kids and even a area for babies and little ones. All ages would have a great time at this place.

Everything all in one spot.  Our girls' had so much fun.  They're already asking when we get to go back.  The waterpark was amazing.  I loved that it's indoors.  There is something there for every age to do.

It was overall a good trip, I had thought the room would be roomier. The park was clean, more ventilation would be a plus considering my eyes would burn when we entered the swim park. The staff was amazing and helpful!

Fantastic lodge, fantastic staff. Loads of fun for kids and adults! We especially enjoyed the buffet breakfast and childrens activities. The indoor water park was top notch. We also added the Birthday package, a great value!

Pretty decent experience all in all.  Just not the best bang for your buck. Be very careful of where you pick to eat. Some restaurants not so good. Place is clean. Staff is friendly. One time was good for me. Don't think I'll be back any time soon.

Summary Heading: Las Vegas for Kids: Great Times At Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Cons: ------- Pricey food & drinks Pricey room rates Rooms are too small (sleeps 7 in Kids Cabin due to sofa bed, but all of the kids wanted to sleep in the cabin area which only has 3 beds (1 bunk and a single) . Not enough storage space for the allotted 7 people but we figured it out and left many items in our car.  We would like to stay forever, but can afford to :)  Pros: ------- 1. Warm inviting atmosphere and staff 2. Wonderful decor (sets the mood) 3. Safe for all ages; they have life vests for all sizes and many lifeguards 4. Tot area was supercute and a nice size 5. slides were fun (lines went quick) 5. Arcade, bowling, spa and magicquest-- too fun! (older kids can be independant and roam around) 6. Pajama dance party was fun (so many free activities)  Tips: ------

Summary Heading: Great value, very nice accommodations and extremely pleasant employees.
Summary: This  place is 15 minutes from my home but by far one of the best local family attractions in orange county. Way better than Disneyland,  Knottsberry farm, Universal Studios and even Magic Mountain. It's very clean and well managed while most important to me, not overcrowded!!!   There are indoor and outdoor accommodations so it could be a rainy day and you'd still have a ton of fun. For the adults, they serve their full bar!   For the kids, they serve a been interesting and original foundation of fun that is second to none.

I had a $10 fee but not sure what it was for and wish the prices were a little more reasonable. I loved the ease of borrowing a wheelchair and access to my vehicle from valet, and the luggage carts made the transition less stressful.

Memorable and wonderful experience.Everyone was accommodating and friendly. The consistency and efficiency was awesome!!!! Truly a family friendly environment. All 3 of my children enjoyed, my infant, Kid and teenager!!!!!!!!

We had a great time.  My daughter picked great wolf lodge to celebrate her birthday.  We brought 5 kids with us underage of 10.  Great wolf lodge provides a safe environment for kids of all ages.   We definetly return!

By far the worst overall experience ever! Poor customer service, poor staff communications, poor restaurant quality, bathrooms were disgusting, absolutely under staffed. Management nowhere to be found... there's not even enough room to document how horrible this was.

Our family had a wonderful time at this resort.  It was our second visit and we were satisfied both times.  Fun and safe for the kids, 6 years old.  Food was very good and prices were reasonable for a resort.  Lots of activities.  Staff service is exceptional.

This place is a excellent place to bring your kids. All the staff provided excellent customer service.  Life guards made you feel real safe. Rooms were very nice.  The whole place made you feel very comfortable. The only minor negative is the smell of chlorine.  You won't regret this vacation

Very pleased. Had to remind ourselves we were outside Anaheim. Feel as if you are in a nice ski lodge. Must stay if you have kids. So many activities for kids. My son is already asking when we can go back. Short drive to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Spring break for a couple small kids
Summary: This is the second time we have been to a Great Wolf lodge.  The first visit was to the one in Williamsburg a couple years ago when our son was 2. We were exited to hear that a location was opening in Southern California.  It's a nice change of pace from the large crowds of the other amusement parks in So Cal such as Disney and Knotts Berry Farm, etc.  We stayed a couple of nights and ended up going to the water park on all three days. We have a 5 yr old, 2yr old, and newborn so the park was great for them.  We could spend a couple of hours at the waterpark, go back to the room for a nap, and then take them again before dinner to really wear them out.  I thought they were still a bit too young to do the magic quest game, but we did end up purchasing one of those paw passes so

Fun weekend stay.  Lines to the slides were not too long.  Not that crowded either, which is good.  Would definitely come back again and again.  Would have hoped the quality of food/dining is a bit better.  Hope they can maintain the cleanliness of the place for years to come.

Wish there was more to do androoms were a bit bigger.gghh ghhgg bbbvnjjnvvb b hnvvb hhngv hhj ghn hjk gb hgbnjhf. Jjg jjhv bjgfdyhbgtyyvgyybddryhbgfb.  Bbbjfffhhbgggbbb bbn gghhbvgghbbffyhbvfdrtgcfthbghh vhghhhggh

If you're in town and want a kids destination where you can stay and relax, then Great Wolf Lodge is it! My child cannot stop talking about it and we're planning a return trip soon. He actually put his electronics down!

Awesome place to spend time with the family...great water park...loved the suite...excellent Life Guard staff...many activities for the children...arcade, bowling, spa day and much more...and adult drinks available for the parents....

We stayed one night here while we took our son to Disneyland which is about a 30 minute walk or 10 minute Drive. Or you can arrange a shuttle service through the hotel 24hrs in advance. This hotel is perfect for the kids. They have tons of activities for the kiddos plus they have a pretty awesome water park. I really wish we would've stayed a couple nights there just so we could spend some time at the water park and enjoy all the amenities. The Great Wolf Lodge is like a theme park all in its self and you should give yourself an extra day just to check it out. Also let them know if your celebrating a birthday or anniversary they make it really special. Everyone who checks in gets wolf ears to wear. We LOVED this hotel and will go back for sure the next time we go to Disneyland.

We stayed two nights and we had fun the whole time we were there. Great for any age. We got locked out of our room one day and they came and unlocked our room within minutes. Great service. My only problem was that where our room was there were no elevators. Would of liked it if we could of used the nearby stairs, but a staff member told us they were for emergency only.

Summary Heading: Great way to have fun with the kids
Summary: Everyone was kind smiling and welcoming. From Valet to front desk to the water park to housekeeping, everything was great.  We came as a family to try it out first before telling our friends about it and it is a great place to relax and have fun with h your loved ones.

We had a blast with our two grandsons, one celebrating his 10th birthday and his 11 year old brother. From check-in to leaving, it was perfect. Super clean, safe, exciting for ALL of us, great room, comfy beds, breakfast buffet was outstanding. Already planning our next trip.

Pretty good family mini-vacation.  Kids - ages 15, 12 and 12 had a really good time.  They loved the arcade and that it was open 24 hours/day.  I felt the overall property was in great shape although the food was pricey but that's kind of to be expected.  We recommend it for families with kids.

Summary Heading: Fun for little ones but not for the money
Summary: We spent one night at this place my wife and I and our two kids and we spent about 600 bucks everything you do is 10 times more than it should be and they even get you for 20 bucks as you're driving out of the parking lot it was fun but I just don't think it's a value

Expensive compared to other Great Wolf Lodges around the country...but, you are 10 minutes from Disneyland, and the price included the waterpark -- which is AMAZING! My 9 year old LOVED his themed room with a 'Cabin' with bunk beds! We will be back!

A unique, family friendly water park. A good variety of activies inside the water park as well as at the resort for kids to engage with family and/or other kids. Appreciate there is an educational component  about wild life by way of story time, wolf walk, and yoga tails.

Great place to take a family vacation, located near LA and other venues.  Water park was excellent, never over crowded like public water parks, which makes the time there enjoyable and relaxing.  We will definitely come back.

Summary Heading: Waterpark was great, room was not.
Summary: The room was clean but I had a problem with the bathroom light sometimes working and sometimes not.  I called housekeeping for repair.  They came and fixed the light and left the light on to show me they fixed it.  I turned it off and again when I tried to turn it back on, it did not work.    Also, when the shower was being used, there was a very loud annoying sound which could possibly be heard by other guests in other rooms.  Depending on the time of day or night, it could possibly ruin their experience.  Unacceptable.

Loved this place. Friendly staff and very welcoming atmosphere. Safe for kids to play and lots of activities to keep them busy. Definitely will be returning for future celebrations and will be referring to other friends and family as well.

The quests for the kids were great, get the wolf pass, it was worth it. The water park was a lot of fun and I'm 320 pounds, and I still got up on the water slides.  My daughter who is 6 (but a water baby) preferred it to Disney Land.  We went in  the early  spring season so the hotel wasn't that crowded, I was told at 60% capacity.  I think staying here for 2 days is plenty if you are on a budget and don't get the late checkout it really isn't needed.  You can stay at the waterpark until it closes on the day of the check out.

Overall good experience but the floor in the water park is too slippery. My kids fell so many times. The table/ stand between two beds are way too small, it is hard to place anything on it. All members are trying to provide best customer services. Lifeguards are everywhere, very safe though.

Summary Heading: They have mouse droppings in my bad
Summary: Save your money unless you want to sleep with mouse droppings . They only gave me a small discount. staff is not happy to be working there they failed to treat guest respect I am formed when I checked in that I would be paying cash so my card would have me charged I exited my cut my room to find out that I was locked out of my room I went to the lobby to find out what was going the front desk person had me and my family up to my room and back down to the lobby which was super embarrassing I'm not a criminal I'm paying $1,000 to be treated like this I don't think so I'll be taking my money somewhere

This place is fun and still feels knew but it gets expensive fast. Yes, you pay for a room and water park but there are A TON of temptations for the kids, so it will be a challenge to stay on budget.  All the water attractions were open and pretty full during our stay. We visited during the week early in spring, so I can imagine how full the resort gets on weekends and summer.   The rooms are clean and a good size with a mini fridge and microwave. So pack tons of snacks and drinks.   The family and I may return for another visit but it will depend if we get a good price.

Absolutely delightful place to be. The kids love it. There is so much to see and do besides the water park. We live nearby and visit at least once a year. It is clean and safe. Staff is friendly. Kids are happy. It is a bargain for all they offer. Rooms are good. It is close to Disneyland.

This was a surprise for us all. We were pleasantly suprised by how fun this lodge is. From the moment we walked in if felt so lively and exciting. We felt like we were somewhere else. The water park was huge and so fun!

My kids loved it ! I loved it .. Its a really clean and kid friendly to the max .. I recommend it .. The wave surf thing is awesome ..  Service is awesome . if you take your kids dont be cheap and get the kids cabin .  they will remember it for ever. Hands down ..i took just me and my 2 kids . it brought us that much closer. I didnt even know was possible . lol really cool 😎

Some of the security staff were shady and rude. Almost made me pay for my 1 year old to enter water park. After waiting for 30 min in the check in line, the lady at the front told me she was free. Someone from security also decided to pick up my phone and turn it into security. My phone was under clothes and towels and other belongings that remained. We then waited 45 min for them to return us the phone and it still was disabled for 5 min. Clearly they were  trying to enter a code and failed. Food is overpriced and not worth it at all. We spent $80 for mediocre food at the lodge. The next night we dined at Olive Garden for $40 for a family of four.

We love this place.  Kids always have a blast. As for the parents, GWL is parent friendly - bar has great selection of dinks. My personal favorite Hands off my Hurricane! This is our 4th visit, we cant wait  for our 5th!

Summary Heading: Lots of fun activities for the kids and adults
Summary: We had a lot of fun! Very clean, the location is close to restaurants like Roscoe's house of chicken and waffles and Porto's bakery and also near Disney land.  I had issues with my receipt, they charged me with late checkout, but they were able to fix it.

Definitely recommending the Great Wolf Lodge. Kids had a amazing amazing time. Memories to go down in history. This lace is very geared forwards kids and it fun enough for Adults to enjoy. We loved the water slide and never waited for more than 10 mins in line. We will be going this summer.

This place is great for families. There are so many activities for kids. From morning yoga, dance parties, bowling, mini golf, the water park, and wand quest. Lots of great choices for food and activities there is no reason to leave.

It's an awesome place to be with your kids! It's a reasonable price to pay for. Many activities to do! You can take your own food and cooler to the room if you would like. Water park opens early. You don't have to wait until check in to get in the water park. I will totally recommend this place!this place! I'm planning my next trip again!

Summary Heading: A great place for the family to have fun
Summary: The check in line was a bit long, but it was tolerable.  The room was great with the Wolf Den for the kids to stay in and have their "own" room.  The whole facility is great and very family and kid friendly.  It is probably one, if not the only, place left in the US where you can let your kid run a few feet ahead of you and not have to have fears,  A very family oriented place and everyone had a great time.

The lines moved very slow due to short staffing at the start of the slides.  They would only have one attendant operating up to 3 slides. This caused an unnecessary back up and made the attendant very overwhelmed.

Summary Heading: I love the park over all and I will return
Summary: My daughters 8th birthday and I have been to this water park plenty of times. This past weekend was the first time I had a problem . I will be returning do to the park overall experience is amazing and I know it'll be better next time

Kids had an excellent time at the water park. The bar at the water park closes early so plan to eat different food and stand in long lines at the one remaining bar that is open. Food is just average but not overly priced. Staff is very friendly.

After a bumpy opening a year ago, the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove strives to please it's guests. If you are looking for a good weekend place to go with your family, check the calendar for some special rates and pack your bags. Lots of fun for kids and adults who are still kids. Just don't forget your sandals! Sunblock not required!

This was our first trip to the Great Wolf Lodge and we loved every minute of it! We would definitely recommend this resort to everyone we know!! The waterpark was awesome and the staff were all so friendly!!

We have a family of four and stayed one night just to get out of the house with the kids. We figured we'd try great wolf as we've heard good things, all in all we found it just "ok." My 5yr old couldn't do a fair amount of the water park because of size restrictions and the magiquest was recommended 10yrs+ so he and my 8yr old missed out on that. The rooms were nice, but after there resort and "transient" fees our $340 room turned into $480 per night room. The water park was much smaller than expected, we're semi local and find wet n wild to have almost the exact same set up just out doors. Great wolf to us would be good during cold winter months being it's indoors or if you come across a smoking deal of under $200. May also be good for out of state persons who stay multiple

We love GWL! We went to the Washington location a year ago and got to come to so-cal location this passed weekend and we enjoyed ourselves so much! Clean and friendly staff. Amazing food. Expensive but worth every penny. Must get the passes for the kids! Worth the price!

Summary Heading: Little fun in the clorox water
Summary: Its a little fun for kids is you don't mind the pee water and clorox smell  but for the parents its a lame and board not counting everything is so expensive. I rater spend my family vacation elsewhere where my money is well spent nit on the track they sell it to the kids

Warm!  warm! warm!  You won't shivering waiting in line on top of the platform to slide because it's indoors.  You won't wait too long either because only hotel guests can use the water park.  Soft and safe floor throughout.  Lots of beach chairs around and tables.

Resort is overpriced.  Rafts are often flat, leaving you to wait in a line to get a raft before going to wait in another line to go down the slide.  Towels in rooms are all kid sized towels, no adult sized towels or robes.  Save your money!

Summary Heading: Fun but not sure if it's worth all the money
Summary: Beds are very hard so it was difficult to get a good sleep. This may sound silly but the toilet paper was so cheap and low quality. If you're paying over $300 a night you expect some decent toilet paper. This may not be an issue to some but little things make a big difference when you're spending a lot of money. The food is outrageously expensive. The place and experience is nice but when it comes to bang for your buck this place is lacking. Expect to spend lots of money if you don't want to leave the hotel to eat.

Summary Heading: No sunscreen required for a good time!
Summary: Had a great time!  It surpassed my expectation.  My daughter had the best time and want to have her birthday there next year!  We will be returning. The food and activities were excellent.  My daughter loves the themed rooms.  The staff went above and beyond the service expected.

Great place for family, I would recommend for all to visit.friendly staff , nice rooms, lots of entertainment for kids and adults. The water park is awesome , lots of attraction for all ages of kids and adults. Thank you for a memorable family trip!!

Great place to stay with kids. Fun all day long and night Story time for the little ones was great and meet and greet afterwards for pictures. Morning Yoga for the kids was great and the Kiddos also enjoyed dance time with bubbles.

My family and I had a great time! I've never been to a more kid-friendly hotel. The staff is very nice and friendly, and it's so nice that they let you stay and enjoy the waterpark after you check out so you get an extra day of play!

My family had a wonderful time at the Great Wolf Lodge! The water park was excellent and we enjoyed the slides, lazy river and wave pool. I'd like to also point out a special experience at the Lodge restaurant where my son got to cook with Chef Hany Ali. My son has always had an interest in cooking and often help prepare meals at home. I'd like to thank the staff and Chef Hany for making our trip a memorable experience. We look forward to our next trip!

I recommend this hotel to any family with kids. My kids had the time of their life's while we stayed here. FYI, if you book this hotel on kayak, hotels.com the price only includes the hotel and not the water Peale. We were surprised when we were told we had to pay an extra $150.00 I was not Happy about that, but for my kids it was worth it.

Just finish our weekend visit to GWL. Spent $900 for two nights. With that money, you would think you will be staying in luxury place like in Disney.  The outside of the hotel is not impressive that you will think when paying that much for two nights. it's just look like a regular hotel. Inside was a little bit more what you will expect from the hotel. The indoor water park is not something I would spend that kind of money. LEGOLAND waterpark is way more impressive than GWL. The place feel so compact and the smell of chlorine was so strong. Cleanliness can be improved. The reason I give this a 3 star is because of the crowd. I understand it is out of GWL control who comes in their facility like any other theme parks, but with the money I spent, I was very surprised the type of

Although pricey, definitely worth the trip.  They have something for all ages at the waterpark, and everything was kept incredibly clean.  Our kids loved the tube rides the best, and our littlest toddler loved the kids area.  Hopefully we will be back!  We wish the Great Wolf Lodge had rooms with small Kitchenettes in them though...  Just a thought...

This place is amazing. We came for spring break as my son had been asking me for a while to stay in one after watching one of his Nickelodeon shows. I didn't even know that there was a GWL in Cali until we planned our details. The water park is a blast and a great way to wear the kids out. The hotel offers bowling mini golf laser tag and something called Magiquest (my kiddos had no interest in that one)and a 24hr arcade  There's something for everyone!!!  We also wandered off the premises, and there are a couple of shopping centers With many dining options if you don't feel like staying on  Site.

Summary Heading: What you'd expect from a water park/hotel
Summary: This place is what you'd expect with a water park attached to a hotel. The amenities could be more varied, primary activity is of course the water park, however everything else seems like an attempt at getting your kids to spend as much of your money as possible with Chuck E. Cheese style games for tickets and a magic fantasy game requiring your kids to run around the whole hotel for some kind of story.

It was a great place to spend quality time with kids and family. The lines for rides were very short in compare with other water parks. The temperature was good. Variety of rides and new exciting rides that we had never seen at other water parks. There were good food places and also other good activities. It was a very successful trip.

First time stay thought it was kinda of pricey at first. Not at all really reasonable kids loved it. Checked of and hung out the rest of the day at the water park area,Def going back for another family trip.

My children were ecstatic to spend time at GWL.  They thoroughly enjoyed every activity.  They spent most of their time at the water park.  There is so much to do.  The great thing is that the indoor water area is heated.

Rooms were nice, kids had a blast. A little heavy on the chlorine in the waterpark but it was expected. Food at the resort was not that good. I would go back again in a heartbeat but will be eating outside of the resort for my meals.

Fun for all the family! My kids love coming! All the water fun is free. Mom's and dad's can enjoy it drink. Food isn't worth the money. Close to banks and out side food. We will be back again! You won't be sorry you stayed!

We had fun, but when I fell going into the lazy river the life guard never asked if I was ok or not! Food at the Breakfast Buffett was TERRIBLE! Do not waste your money!! Poor taste, poor quality and warm food were actually cold, yes cold! The toast I made in the ONE toaster they have for hundreds of people was warm after waiting for it in a 15 min line cause again they have one toaster for hundreds of people!

We are part time Orange County residents with children aged 3, 5 and 9. We generally stay away from theme park crowding and stick to the beach, but due to the rain found ourselves looking for indoor entertainment. This was our first experience at any Great Wolf Lodge and we were more than satisfied with our one night stay. We checked in quite late and found our kidcabin room to be much smaller than expected, but the cleanliness made up for it and the layout worked well. The bathroom was spotless and the bunks and twin bed setup for the kids were perfect. The kids settled into their 'cabin' and watched a tv movie. Note that oddly there is no movie rental system through the tv and no cartoon channels in spite of this being a kid centered hotel. I was able to pick up a pizza,

Summary Heading: Cant wait to go back to the Lodge.
Summary: We had a wonderful time, the water park was really amazing, clean, and lots of room with many options from little to big kids.  The snack bar food was a little pricey.  Check in was great, the staff was so friendly and answered our questions.  I was traveling on business and took the family, they treated me like any other hotel for business travelers.  The room was clean and comfortable and surprisingly big.  We ate at several of the restaurants and were impressed.  Parking is convenient.  Security was good.  I would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Way over priced staff is rude the chlorine unbearable
Summary: I made reservations for 6 had the print out to show and when I arrived to check in the front desk said I only made for 4 even with my reservation in hand and to add 2 kids under 5 it was an additional $480 for 3 nights yes I'm not kidding $480 to add 2 toddlers . Beware even if you print out reservations and they don't have you down for the same they don't care . $886 for 3 nights went up to $1400 almost double and parking is not free as they state on website

My 8 & 13 year old had a blast. We stayed one night and only did the waterpark while we were there.  Hotel staff was very friendly. The room has a microwave and mini refrigerator we brought lunch and breakfast items to save. We ordered a large pizza which was about $18. My kids can't wait to go again!!

This place was amazing! We had a blast. We were able to play at the water park since 1pm on the day of our check in until closing time of the day of our check out. The rooms were great with everything we needed. It was one of the best trip we have ever had.

Rooms are clean and reasonably well equipped.  Its nice to have a decent size refrigerator and a microwave. Front desk was polite and helpful.  All staff in restaurants etc were friendly and helpful. Food was reasonably priced for a resort setting and quite good quality.  The ice cream shop and the bakery were very good as was the bar café outside the pool in the lido area. The water park was large and had rides or different thrill levels from kiddy stuff to the tornado etc.  Only issue was the overpowering chlorine smell and general air... it caused eye and respiratory issues even if you took a break every couple of hours.  This was a particular problem for my son who has asthma... so be aware and be careful!!  In addition there are several excellent restaurants in walking

Service was great staff is very friendly and the Waterpark was a lot of for the entire family! There's always something to do with the kids. The free activities were fun for our 7  and almost 2 year old.

We had a great time at all of the activities. Only negative is the beds and the couch being uncomfortable. We tossed and turned all night and when ever we moved the beds made a terrible noice and the kids would get startled. So I tried sleeping on couch and that also makes a terrible noise when you sit on it or move.

Our stay at Great Wolf's Lodge was wonderful.  The resort was very kid friendly and the staff was courteous. Both kids and adult enjoyed the park.  The indoor water park was warm, compared to the cold weather outside. The water park was not as large as other water parks, which was a plus for me. Will visit again, soon.

Way way expensive. Never book a full price room here- find a coupon code, a Groupon, SOMETHING to take the sting off. Once here, EVERYTHING is extra... and I mean everything. Bring your wallet. Plan to eat off site to save money or stay for convenience.  Water park is great- they could do a better job with  line cutting.  Had some pretty bad experiences at check in, but Sydney saved the day. Thanks Sydney.  We will return!

Loved it. Rooms are very clean. Water park is amazing, well designed, well maintained and perfect for any family. Would like to see more security. Overall excellent experience. Definitely highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lidge is the best!
Summary: Wonderful staff & service.  Good was great.  Can't wait to return.  Would like to see an opportunity for adults only in the water park in the evening after closing. We did not have enough time there, next time we will stay longer.

This is one of the best family vacations we've had. There is a fun activity day and night for all ages. The  Lodge and the rooms are decorated very cleverly, and they have spread out possible activities all through the facility. The water park portion of the Lodge is laid out very well with water pools & activities for all infants through adults. One important plus is they keep everything very clean and the life guards are very well trained and take their duties very seriously. A warning though is the walkways between the different pools can become very slippery. Fortunately an earlier review had warned of being sure to have water shoes for all the kids to keep them from slipping between pools. Good advice because several of the adults in our group nearly slipped several times

This trip was a lot of fun for the kids and adults traveling with them. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly, the lifeguards are serious about their jobs and the park is run well. The park prices prohibit any more return trips this year, but hope to return next year.

Great place to make family moments! Love the fact that lifeguards are present & truly watching over everyone. The lodge provides life jackets/tubings & towels which is great! But... come prepared to spend a lot of money as everything is very PRICEY! Disclosure every night you stay, you pay for parking! ;(

Very friendly u can pack like u r going to the beach with is amazing for the kids cause they get hungry the only part that's not to likeable is that u will have to leave the food in the room n take the kids back to the room to eat but it's well worth it and one day is truly not enough time u need at least two days.

I've already submitted a complaint to the resort directly and have yet to have received a reply.  No complaints are a good thing but when someone takes time out of their day to write about their experience its usually because it was more than expected or not as expected.  Sadly, in our case it was not as expected.    The rooms and water park area were as expected.  But we had a few disappointments.  We visited the buffet and were very, very disappointed with the food, especially the following items…Tomato Bisque soup was VERY salty, so we tried the Lobster and Shrimp Bisque which turned out to be VERY grainy.  90% of the items that were sitting out were not warm at all so I went around looking for items that I knew I couldn’t get sick from and I settled on Hummus, Carrot Sticks
Manager Response: James, thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, both here and directly with the Guest Relations team.  We forwarded your concerns to our leadership team in Anaheim and understand a member of our pack reached out to you via email.  Should you have any additional questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us!

Summary: This was a birthday trip for my 13 year old.  He and his friend enjoyed the water park for many hours, but the arcade for only a total of about an hour because the games were so expensive.  The rooms were not as nice as advertised and the beds were not very comfortable.  The hotel was a very busy and somewhat chaotic environment.  It appears to be much better suited to people with children ages 3-9 or so.  It was overpriced for what it was in my opinion.

This location opened in February 2016. My parents took my boys in April 2016. They had a great time and recommended we take them. . Fast forward a year. My husband and I went with our two boys ages 8 years, 4 years and our 8 month old daughter. This place is awesome. It's full of families. From the moment we saw in front the street. We were also super excited. It's huge and there's a lot to do. There's the water park of course. It's mostly indoors but there is an outdoor pool as well. Not long lines for rides. My 8 year old loved going down he big slides and playing basketball (they have hoops and plastic balls) my 4 year old loved the wave pool. They are fully stocked with life jackets and floaties. The arcade, bowling and mini golf was my husband's favorite part. The food my

We have stayed at Great Wolf Lodge's many many times with the grandchildren.  I feel safe and there are a ton of activities for them.  It's a little costly....1 night, 4 ppl $450...but I paid it and didn't regret it.  It was just what the twins needed.

Great Wolf Lodge is an excellent place to have fun and relax with your family. From the water park to the magiquest adventure, there's a lot to do and explore.  And keep those magiquest Wanda with you, you'll never know where the magic will pop up, even in the Loose Moose!

This is a fun Waterpark. It can be pricey but I try to go when there are deals and during non peak times. My kids absolutely loved it, I enjoyed it too. I've been here twice and will continue going. They have extra activities such as Magiquest, bowling, etc but these are extra and my kids spent all day at the Waterpark anyway so they weren't really interested in doing them.

Family fun trip took  four grandkids ages 11,6,2,10 months something for all of them. dancing with bubbles, story time. good food. we lost teddy my 2 years teddy bear they found it after we left a called us in Arizona will send it to us...GREAT PLACE

Kids and adults have a great time, wish we would of arrived sooner ! The temperature of the room and wAter was perfect.  The rooms were spacious  Definitely coming back soon and recommend it to all my friends and family !

Kids and adults had such a good time. There was something for everyone. The children didn't get bored. The environment was safe. The rides were fun... The adults were able to relax. The rooms accommodated our family of 5. We all sleep well and the children are already planning our next trip back.

We went for my daughter's birthday and the service from most everyone at the lodge was phenomenal. My husband and I ate at the wood fired grill, however, and the service was slow. The mashed potatoes also taste like they came from a box. Other than that we had an overall great experience.

Summary Heading: Disappointed of cleanliness  / not satisfied, need some improve staff attitude. Need to add more activities for all aged
Summary: Need improvement on your service, cleaning of the restroom area, park need some improvement of cleanliness. Add more activities to all ages including teenager.  Staff not friendly and need attendant in changing room.

I f your kids love water slides. This would be great food is good a little pricey but good.  In door arcade and other activities. Also have outdoor pool.  Gym basically its a resort go enjoy so water fun!

Great family vacation. Would definitely come back again. Great activities for the kids other than swimming. I loved how the arcade is open 24 hours. They had a section for appropriate age levels at the water park which my kids enjoyed having freedom.

I really love this place it's really fun and family oriented the kids enjoy  every minute of it the costumer service is A+ the food was really good at the buffet room was beautiful it looked like a fairy tail I really recommend this place

Summary Heading: not enough security and healthy food
Summary: This place lacks security to watch bullies attacking small children and parents for their enjoyment. This place also lacks healthy food options. Staff does not care about your stay and it's impossible to get someone on the phone.

This was a great place to play and relax. The only issue we had was magic quest.... needs more instruction for parents with little ones. It was stressful and kind of a waste of money.other than that everything was great

Overall this is a great place to take your kids! The water park is awesome and has things to do for kids of all ages (and adults). The rooms are nice but the beds are not very comfortable. The prices for food is average but NO outside food or snacks allowed in the water park which is a bummer for picky kids or kids with food allergies. It's not cheap to stay here but it's a lot of fun!

Summary Heading: Best kid vacation a kid can ask for!
Summary: The kids did not want to leave.  They had an option of going to Disneyland for a few hours and they weren't even interested in Disney at all.  This location is nice because its new.  Water park was well ventilated so it didn't smell too much chlorine.

We had a blast, we will be back. Come ready to have fun 24/7. Waterpark is great bring water shoes not flip flops. Bring a cover up for walking through the lobby because it gets chilly. Bring water and snacks for your room

No matter what age you are you'll have a blast!  We are definitely planning a trip to the Great Wolf Lodge again, they have everything you need to entertain your family.  All the daily activities and the water park is more than enough.  It's a clean and safe environment for families too!

Summary Heading: Great place to go with your family.
Summary: Great family fun.  There is something for everyone.  Food selections were not good food and it's does not offer a variety of choices for kids, unless you eat at set times for their buffet.  We were so disappointed with the food selections and quality.  Next time we will be bringing our own food and heat it up in the rooms microwave.

Kids really had a great time and would definitely go back again in the future! I just wish there were jacuzzi's for the adultds/parents! Or at least something for the parents to do while waiting for their kids in the water park!

Fun for the family. We have three young children ages 2 to 7 who all enjoyed greatly. Good activities and entertainment.  Clean, family fun with plenty to do for everyone. Good food options on property. Reasonably priced food within the water park portion.

Me And my little one Have a Cronic illnesses LUPUS so I was happy to hear about this Indoor water park, even tho I did not get what I espclifically asked for a Room close to the Park I can't walk much And I got a room so far away Was crazy So not happy with that

A bit overpriced for families. Bring lots of cash. Food, games and merchandise is very expensive. Waterpark is fun but two days is enough. Surrounding area is okay, but don't recommend going out after dark.

Great place to take your family with kids of all ages. I have a 4,9 and 12 year old and they all enjoy themselves which is hard to find sometimes with such a large age difference. Rooms can be pricey but the water park was fun and we saw a lot of other kids playing magic quest throughout the hotel which looked fun.

Great location, fun for all ages in the family from grandparents down to months old grandchildren, and close to many more fun family activities. Indoor water park is comfortable in all seasons and has many more activities for every interest

Excellent Customer Service! The lodge is clean and plenty of activities for the children. From the water park to the interactive video games located throughout the lodge, my kids had a blast. The location is close to Disneyland so that was very nice.

It was fun for the kids and a new experience for all of us but all the food and amenities were completely over priced. The bathrooms in the waterpark were not as clean as they should be and the waterpark itself could have been cleaner and picked up.

A lot of fun. Stayed on a Sunday night and kept the kids out of school Monday to be able to afford the trip.  Lines weren't too bad. Very safe environment. Felt safe letting my kids run around by themselves. I dont like that outside food and drinks arent allowed. You are food and  forced to pay for overpriced resort food. Id would've been nice to have some water bottles and a few snacks at least. Will wait for another deal and try to go again.

The best family vacation we have ever been on! The staff was great. There was so many dinning options. Not to mention a bar for an adult beverage. The kids had the best time of their lives!! I can't wait to return!!

Summary Heading: If you want to get sick then visit here
Summary: We were checked in by the most unhappy guest service ever.  No smile on her face, didn't give us information about the resort or tips for our stay.  She even gave us rainbow colors ears for our boys while other received gray for boys and colored one for girls.  I asked to change and she said No.  Netherless to say, my eyes were burning after sitting in the waterpark for less than 1 hour.  Both of my kids got sick when we got home, most likely from the dirty, contaminated water they recycled for waterpark.  Never again that we'll visit here.  There are more places to have a family vacation that we'll rather visit than here.

Great fun, kids enjoyed the water park. Great idea to have the burger shack inside,so no need to get out. Awesome and attentive lifeguuards. Bed slightly uncomfortable and high, small bug found in room. Extra blankets brought in by housekeeping.

Great Wolf Lodge goes above and beyond in customer service in all departments. There is something for everyone. They food and drinks were delicious and at reasonable prices. Thank you so much for making our trip a great one!!

Enjoyed stay with my husband and 2 boys ages 5 and 6, they loved the water park.  Bring water shoes or your feet will get sore fast!  They wanted to play the magi quest game.
