Wands and game were expensive and wand doesn't work within the hotel unless you buy the game, which was disappointing to the kids.  Also, the game was a little hard for them to follow, so we had to do it as a family.  Prepare to spend a lot on food or run out for food nearby.

It was all great ! They had great service, the rooms were clean, and the buffet was great and we enjoyed eating out breakfast there ! Only thing i have to say about the water park is that the water was cold ! Just wish it was warmer !

Child got sick from dirty water, service and hospitality sucked!! Was denied service for no id but i had the adult bracelet and the room was booked by me. Also housekeeping was kicking us out and was very rude while ny sick child was sleeping

Children had a blast with all the different activities. Fun for us all. A bit pricey but worth it.  Room was cute staff was friendly.  Bracelets make everything easier and accessible. Will likely go again

We went to celebrate our sons 2nd Birthday. They ran out of Birthday ears. And the front desk clerk didn't bother to ask if we were celebrating anything. Front desk clerks are a major part of a guest experience. I had a not so helpful or courteous clerk.

They'll make you feel right at home here.  Family friendly and kid approved.  Parking is 13 which should be included in stay. Other than that,  very ready for a great family destination.  Dunkin donuts in the lobby is regular retail pricing which is advantageous

Summary Heading: It's a fun waterpark, but not great hotel
Summary: The water park was fun. The restaurant experience was not. The Lodge-Please don't tell me it's going to take 20 minutes for a table because they have to clean it. 20 mins to clean a table for a party of 4? And there was no one else waiting. That is not acceptable. Then when you ask to speak to a manager you get told that they will call you back. I think that is what really turned us off . We decided to leave and go to El Pollo Loco for dinner when we could've spent our money in the resort at the restaurant. However, Ezekiel at the front desk was great!!  He was friendly, helpful and made our check-in a great experience.

We stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge for spring break. The staff was very friendly, the rides were fun and the food was good. It wasn't overly crowded. The kids had a great time! They already want to go back.

During our stay my boys had so much fun. There is so much to do there. There are many places to eat and food is good.  My boys had so much fun they cryed when we had to leave.The water slides are so much fun. The wave pool was one of my boys favorite attractions.

Overall great experience. Promo codes really dropped the price. So we got a great deal! Staff was super helpful. Everything in the water park was conveinent and on hand. Towels, life jackets, food, chairs to relax while the kids play. Great time. Definitely will be going back soon!

Rooms were clean and the convenience of having all the entertainment on grounds was very enjoyable. Staff was great and the waterpark had something for everyone (kids were 2 - 11 yoa) The multiple activities on the hotel grounds kept the kids entertained for 4 days. Was a great experience.

We will be booking a room at this resort again!! Awesome experience my kids had so much to do they didn't want to leave. We really enjoyed the different activities and all of the resturaunts and the water park was amazing!

Saw a Groupon and loved the concept. We loved that the room fit 6 - we are a family of 5 plus a friend - so the room size was great. Beds were way to soft - tossed and turned all night! That being said - the waterpark was fantastic. We went mid week and mostly did not have long waits - the waterpark had stuff for all - we are a family with 5 yr old, 10 yr. old and 15 - and everyone had fun! The arcade, 4D movie were great. There is also a mini golf and bowling alley and all in all - we didn't need to leave the resort though we were in the heart of Anheim/Garden Grove Disneyland area - we loved the food at the Lodge Grill - the other places like the sweet shoppe - the food looked good but food was stale or mediocre - bagel reheated not toasted, mediocre cinnamon roll, aweful

Summary Heading: NOTHING LIKE THIS, IN ALL OF CALIFORNIA!
Summary: This Place is amazing! Water park is full of activities. It's safe, and very kid friendly, for both younger kids, and even teenagers. Very affordable considering lodging and 2 days of water park. If you only purchase one night of lodging, you can visit the water park from 1 PM the day of check in, and stay the entire next day even if you are checked out. That is really customer friendly. My kids love this place. So much to do, even outside of the water park. Location is excellent. Disneyland is a 10 minute drive. Tons of great dining, great gift shop selection, affordable, safe, and super fun!

Summary Heading: Basic hotel rooms with water park
Summary: 2 queen family suit is basic at best. Motel room style with sink by your bed. Overpriced for what you get. Water park is fun but small. All the extra things to do are nice, but all cost a lot extra. Be prepared to spend a lot of money.

If you have younger kids, this is a great place for them. It's very family oriented. Tons of happy Kid's everywhere. Rooms are great although you will be busy during the day. The rooms were just for sleeping. The magi quest is perfect for kids 7-12. The $99 paw pass was worth every penny. My 2 boys shared it and had a blast! The build a bear also has a quest which was fun for my 5 year old. The free activities are geared more towards younger kids. I am likely to go at least 1 per year until my kids grow out of it.

Summary Heading: fun filled with family at great wolf lodge
Summary: Such a amazing place to be with family and at the same time to have fun. This is our second time to be here, and every single time we are very satisfied with the services and amenities. For sure we will be back soon.

It was our first time ever to a Great Wolf property, and have been curious since seeing ads. We brought our young girls (4 and 7). We loved the idea of an indoor waterpark, but never stayed at an inclusive, themed place before. Great experience all around. To get the best value: invest in the Pup Pass for kids, take advantage of the activities offered, and explore the entire grounds before jumping in the water. If you are staying more than one night, make eye contact and interact WITH FRIENDLINESS with as much staff as you can. They'll remember and always provide solid service. The best part is that you get all the fun of any waterpark, but without the energy drain from being outdoors, worried about sunburns and dehydration. There is definitely something for everyone; there were

Overall the stay was ok. Wish it could have been better  considering the amount of money you will spend while you are here. .  The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean and spacious especially if you have a three-year-old.

I think that everything is clean and fun for the kids. I just thought that the pricing on the activities its too much. But the pricing on the stay its ok. For example a pay 21 dlls for a game of mini golffor only 9 holes. If it was a little more accecible ill return no problem

Summary Heading: Amazing time at the great wolf lodge
Summary: My family had an amazing time at the great wolf lodge. We arrived at the resort where they had lemonade, games, and snacks for the kids while they waited for me to check in. I checked ina no we received our welcome pack and beautiful springtime wolf ears. We arrived to our room but found that it wasn't wheelchair accessible so we callled the front desk and they informed us that they would actually be upgrading us to a suite as they didn't have accessible single rooms left. We were upgraded to a two bedroom, one living room suite. It was beautiful and beyond amazing. We went to the water park and then had dinner. The night was amazing in our beautifully cleaned room. We started out next morning bright and early at the nearly empty waterpark which was perfect as we had a great

I probably had more fun than my kids did.we had a blast at this place the kids had a blast the food was excellent and the water temperature was warm. Will be planning our next weekend off there for sure

Summary Heading: I called the health department the next day. Enough said.
Summary: Walking into the indoor park area, I felt like I was being hit with a cloud of hot tear gas. The air was almost unbreathable, and right away my eyes stung and my throat burned. Others in our group complained of similar irritation, but we all assumed it was just the harmless smell of chlorine. As it turns out, the air was full of something much more awful and toxic.  When urine and chlorine mix, they create toxic gases called chloramines. Chloramines are bad. Very bad. They can cause all kinds of health problems, and one is even classified as a chemical warfare agent. Ventilation, the sun, and frequent cycling of water usually prevents the gases from building up at pools. Unfortunately, the water park at Great Wolf Lodge is in a giant enclosed space with little ventilation that I

Very unsatisfied with the quality of the water and rooms. Characters were almost non existant. Room was very noisy be of water pipes. The water park water burned our eyes. The smell in the water park was so sad we couldn't wait to go outside for fresh air. The quality of food was terrible. This place has so much potential and is a great idea but the quality needs to improve before this place looses its customers

We will be back! The water park is clean, the staff is friendly, the rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. We brought 2 9 year olds and a one year old and everyone had a good time. There's a baby water park, and big slides for the big kids and adults. So fun!

Service and staff ARE AMAZING!! Couldn't be more helpful and cheerful even during sold out check in. Activities and arcade are really expensive but food quality is far better than usual them park and great cocktails for adults! Wish they had a bit more for tweens

Great place to have fun with your family at a great price.  The rides are excellent and not crowded at all on a weekday.  The rooms are clean and well kept.  The food is ok with alot of variety, if you choose not to leave the hotel for food.

Summary Heading: Fun, but question whether the fun was worth the cost
Summary: We had a good time. Overall, GWL is really expensive. Two things bugged me the most: poor quality food at the resort (especially for the price), and I couldn't go on the small water slides with my small children (My 2-year-old was reluctant to go on them by himself. I think he would have if I had been allowed to go with him a few times. Thus, I don't think we had as much fun as he/we could have)

Lots of activities for kids. Not just the water park to enjoy but addition to that there are daily activities and crafts. Variety of water slides of all types from 1 year olds to 80 year olds to enjoy. Plenty of places to eat and relax. Small bowling area as well as arcade. Just about 3 blocks from Disneyland. Liked that you do not need to carry your wallet around or any room key and that it's linked to the wristband. Wristband has a chip in it that's linked to credit card on file and activates your room door... so easy and no need to worry about your valuables sitting around while enjoying the water.

What a wonderful time we had. I love the fact that after checking out of your room, you still have access to the water park. The food was great and reasonably priced. I cannot wait until our next family vacation here.

It was at spring break kids enjoyed a lot with all the water park activities very safe friendly clean it approach all ages family rides food is good arcade open all the time room is perfect for big family

Great indoor water park for the entire family.  The room was very clean, everything was in order.  The staff was very friendly.  We had a great experience.  It's close to lots of restaurants and shopping.  They also have a huge arcade and they have other kids activities throughout the day.

the experience is nice. i think they charge for late stay is unnecessary since you can shower there etc and that is not prominitely told even after asked about. the rooms are very blagh, especially the bathrooms. they seem more like motel 6 bathrooms especially when you charge for staying later. The showers had low water pressure

A good place to spend time with family and everything is satisfactory. There is no particularly problematic facility, but the floor of the water park is slippery and dangerous. I've seen a lot of people fall around the drain..

Summary Heading: We LOVE Great Wolf Lodge! Just don't come on the weekend...
Summary: Fantastic stay... Rooms are always clean and very quiet considering it's a hotel centered around kid fun. Our 6-year old son LOVED his 4-7 hour MagiQuest. Everyone is very tolerant of kids running through the lobby and in and out of elevators to complete their scavenger hunts, a behavior that wouldn't be tolerated in an average hotel. We loved how attentive the lifeguards were at the water slides. My main complaint is that half the surfaces you walk on at the water park are incredibly slippery! We saw a number of kids take big falls and the nurse in me cringed every time because I expected them to sustain a major head injury. I definitely recommend water shoes! Our only "complaint" is that the water park is too crowded on weekends with too long of lines and not enough personal

The hotel was great.  We went on Wednesday and Thursday night and it wasn't a busy which was great.  The lineups were short in the water park.  The water park had something for every age and the waterslides were fun and different.  I liked that there was an outdoor pool too.  Good choice of restaurants on the property, loved that there was a Dunkin' Donuts for my morning coffee.

A great place to take family and friends for a really good time, the food and service is excellent, the water park is a lot of fun and there is a whole lot to do for the young and older set through out.

If you catch a really good deal, it is worth the value.  Do not go during peak season, it's not an inclusive resort, so it adds up fast.  For 4 adults & 2 seven year old girls it cost us over $1200 for one night.  A Carnival Cruise for 4 days is a better value.  We had a wolf den room.  It was small.  One adult couple slept on the queen bed and the other adult couple slept less than 3 feet away on a sofa bed that was extremely uncomfortable.  In hindsight, we would have been better to bring our own air mattress.  The kids did have fun.  Bought the Paw Pass that helped to keep them busy.  The frog & fish statues in the wolf den creeped out one of the kids, though as an adult it seems like a good decorating idea.  The whale pool was the kids favorite.

This place is great for the whole family. With 3 kids all different ages this place has something for everyone. The water park is the highlight but they have a spa, arcade, bowling alley and plenty of places to get food. The staff is really helpfull as well. We will be coming back soon.

Summary Heading: Great place for families! And food-allergy families!
Summary: My kids enjoyed this place even more than Disneyland! They had so much fun! The staff was amazing, particularly the chefs. They were so attentative and accommodating to our son with food allergies. We felt safe dining there, and they made my little guy feel so special. We'll definitely be back!

Summary Heading: First time to Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We were very happy when rooms are ready before check in time. Arrived at 1pm, and Check In is not till 4pm. However, they accommodated the room 4 hours early.   Since it was off season, water park was not crowded, enjoy the all rides without any wait lines. However, family buffet restaurant was not open since it is off season. Pro: Kids friendly, safe water park, a lot of activities for kids Con: Very pricey

This is not our families normal type of vacation, but it was a second-grade school trip and our son wanted to go, so we went.  Prior to going, i was seriously doubting the weekend, and not looking forward to it, felt being indoors at a water park made no sense in So Cal.  Anyway fast forward to our Friday arrival, and BOOM the fun started the moment we checked in.  It was great, it wasn't packed, it didn't reak of chlorine (like i feared), the facility was in great condition and fun was all around.  We all hated to leave on Sunday afternoon.  I want to make special note of this particular location, however I am sure they rest probably follow suit, I was EXTREMELY impressed with the seriousness and professionalism the lifeguards in the waterpark took their jobs.  To have a group

Kid friendly! The resort was so clean. The staff was awesome! The water park is small but great for the younger kids. My older kids loved the surf rider attraction and wave pool. They also loved the older kids water slides. Really overall a great place for all ages.

Summary Heading: Great place but a lot of miscommunication
Summary: Great place but there's a lot of confusion as to a lot of stuff that is and isn't ok here when it comes to the water park.  My daughter got turned away for a ride she was supposed to be tall enough to be able to ride and don't bother buying the late check out because staff will still bug you asking if you checked out or not yet but other than those two things great place

Summary Heading: Great Family Amenities, But Staff Service is Lacking
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge was the perfect destination for our young family. The amenities were fantastic for our two-year old. There was even more for older kids. I highly recommend checking out a Great Wolf Lodge location. The only thing that would have made the experience better would have been the staff. We had to ask for our room number at check-in. No one told us how to get to our room, nor explained where all the amenities were. Wait staff would disappear after seating us. Supervisors wouldn't listen to our questions to better understand our needs.

We love going to the great wolf, we go every 3-5 months, my family and friends love to go, my theee year old son loves all the slides and pools. So much to to do for toddlers. I highly recvindmend it.

We first went to the Great Wolf Lodge for my youngest granddaughters 5 th birthday. Her 2 older siblings have summer birthdays and they always have water slide birthday parties. Being a November birthday, this little one always misses out. When I saw it on Groupon, I knew I had to get it for her. It was a hit and we went again in January and March. I have already booked our stay for this coming November so she will always get a water park birthday party!

Great short weekend vacation.  A bit pricy but a lot of fun for a 1 - 2 day vacation.  the rooms are very roomy so if you have a large family, it's really a great place to stay.  Staff really friendly and there are a lot of other things to do in the vicinity.

An amazing time with the whole family! You can't go to this place and not have fun! Things can get pricey once they start to add up but I would say it is more important to make those memories with my kids and family. There is something to do for people of all ages. My kids keep asking when we are going back!

Really fun place overall but definitely room to improve. Comfortable rooms with access to ice machine. Plenty of food however; we preferred to go out because we could find cheaper better food out of the hotel.

Our family of six went to Great Wolf Lodge using a Groupon special. We were a group of 2 grandparents, 2 parents and a 2 and 4 year old. It was more fun than we ever imagined. There are many different water areas within the water park. It is mostly indoors but there is an outdoor area as well. There were plenty of areas for the 2 and 4 year old to enjoy. I was very impressed with the number of lifeguards and the constant attention they gave to the areas they were working. There were scheduled children's activities outside the water park throughout the day. There were a variety of eating options. Dinner for the 6 of us was about $140 at one of the restaurants. They also had a buffet which was $17 for breakfast and $25 for dinner. The food was average. The pizza was disappointing.

Great time with whole family,will definitely come again.  Nobody in the family wanted to leave. Lol the staff was incredible since we first stepped in the front door.at first we weren't sure if our kids would like it,but even our older teenage kids loved.dont know if it was cuz of the free wifi.lol kids these days?

Last minute spot they will remember forever.  Safe and clean and so much fun for a 2 and 4 year old.  We took great grandma too and she enjoyed it also.  Two days and one night was plenty of time.  They kept us busy the whole time.

Summary Heading: Absolutely mind blowing fun!!! 10 out of 10!!
Summary: So much to do here and so much fun, the staff is fantastic and the food is delicious... a little pricey, but it's worth it!!! The beds are super soft and quiet, even with all the kids running around. The water is perfect in the park. I just can't stress how much there is to do!!! Definitely plan to stay at least 2 nights!!

I loved the experience. My daughter was very excited and enjoyed the whole experience from the room to the stores to the water park.  We will be going back for the summer with family. I believe the family will enjoy themselves.

Me and my family had such an amazing time at great wolf Lodge. Such a great time we will be returning soon. Love how the water park is not crowed. My kids loved the themed rooms! Had a great time at the arcade and bowling. There's just so much to do for everyone. Making it one of my favorite places to go now! :)

Summary Heading: Three year-old contracts folliculitis from water park.
Summary: Going on this trip has put me over $100 in debt from meds and doctor visits due to the horrendous rash my son contracted. Clearly the facilities are filthy. Many of the sections were closed and lines were long due to under staffing.

We've already told several friends and family members about our experience. We've been several places with our kids, but this was our favorite family vacation so far. We were blown away by how wonderful the staff was, how clean the place was, and the selection of activities for the kids. We are already planning our next trip there!

For my daughters 3rd birthday we decided on a trip and after looking at all our options we decided to come to great wolf lodge. It was such a fun experience for my daughter they made her birthday extra special. We cannot wait to plan a summer vacation

Summary Heading: A  really Fun time with Great Customer service
Summary: We Love everything about this place. We have the next time planned before we leave there. Staff is great to us. Has a super chill vibe. Great fun with late hours and endless things for people of all ages.

Great place for families. Tips: leave valuables in car or you room. Lockers are$15. You can't bring in your own food into the water park except water. Use restrooms farthest away from the entrance. The place has a heavy smell of clorine so you may want to sit outside if weather permits. Food in hotel is average but a bit pricey. McDonald's is across the street and other fast food places are within 1 mile. For two days of water park and hotel stay it was worth it.

Great Wolf Lodge is just that...Great! We had a blast! The room had a fridge and a microwave, a sleeper sofa with extra pillows and blankets. The television remote stopped working and we called for another one and received a replacement right away. Staff overall was friendly except when we first checked in the female painting faces was rude and refused to paint our kids faces because even though she was painting a child's face and no linexceptions ,she yelled at another employee that it was half past the hour and she's done! How dare him send us over there! Good thing the room was clean and comfy and the water park was awesome! Lots of fun! We had a blast! Also took the kids to the arcade and to the bowling alley there. The balls are mini so all of them bowled, even the 2 yr

Loved that we have a lovely resort just 20 minutes from my home. It's local so it's stress free travel, yet we felt far away from Orange County for the day and night. It's new and inviting and you feel very pleasant staying there. Enjoy!

We wish the park was bigger. We likes the concept of everytjing being in one place, fun for the kids and made it comfortable for the parents as well, but overall, it was a great experience. Definitely will recommend to other friends and family.

My kids had a great time my sister even got a room we loved it clean great service very clean availability of food evrywherearcade icecream water park eveything great no.big lines to wait to go lnt je rides great and will always recomend it

Summary Heading: Best place to celebrate a birth day
Summary: Three kids!! Ages 8,10,and 13 all had a blas. There was some thing for every one to do in one safe location. There were plenty of places for mom and dad to hang out at. Over all we had a great time. Bring some snacks for the late night gaming and some  comfy shoes .

This is a great place to bring your family. They have so much to do you almost never have to leave the hotel. The staff is very friendly and the service is great. The rooms are spacious and comfortable.

I brought my son here because it was one of the only available resorts with a 2 bed room available but also because we have never been and he loves the water. It was a little pricey because I brought my parents who just wanted to spend time with us but not swims and still paid a premium for them. All and all was a great stay. We had a blast.

We trade off birthday parties and fun trips for the kids birthdays.  My son really wanted to go to the beach, but our usual haunt was booked solid.  So looking around for something else to do I stumbled upon Great Wolf Lodge.  My son really loves water parks and some friends had gone and recommended it.  The water park was awesome.  Lots to do, even for my son who didn't quite make the green wristband requirement.  There is a middle section with 5 water slides, water guns to shoot at the people on the ground and a giant bucket of water that dumps out every so often (there is a bell that rings and makes people come running!).  We felt comfortable enough to let him have the run of this area, we stood/sat by watching while he ran up and down the stars/slides.  This area also fit

Summary Heading: Bad timing for a Birthday Trip
Summary: Great Wolf Lodge is definitely the coolest and best place to have fun in and out of water. This place is definitely a child's dream and could have been my son's most memorable trip. The sad part is it's definitely our most memorable trip because their was a sad incident with an older woman in the wave pool. Besides that, my son had to deal with the disappointment of their largest slide being non-operable. Oh, and they ran out of Birthday Wolf Ears. =( Overall, the staff did try to assist in making my son's 6th birthday memorable with wolf passes that did work for a short period of time (and I did get my hands on some birthday ears by 9 pm that night). This place can definitely be pricey, but it was all worth it to play in a water park while it rains outside. Rooms do come with a

We brought a bunch of food for our room because I was afraid of the food prices at the hotel. To my surprise they had great prices at their restaurants and at the water park. They didn't have any snacks available for purchase so I am glad we brought cookies and chips but the food available was good. We heard the lines to check in were brutal so we showed up early with the hopes of just going to the water while waiting but to our surprise we were the next in line to check in. All the staff we ran into were nice and helpful. If I could say anything bad it would be the walk to get to our to our room. It was a walk due to our room being the very last one so there wasn't any going back for just one thing.

Summary Heading: Great stay for both adults and kids
Summary: Stay at hotel was great from time of check in to check out.  Waterpark felt like there was plenty to do for two days of the waterpark.  We had young kids, preteens and adults.  Plenty to do for all.  Definitely coming back for another stay soon.

My daughter almost drowned and the staff didn't do anything to help compensate for this scary situation! It was awful and scary for me and my daughter. The other thing is we were celebrating her dad and brothers birthdays and they still didn't do anything to help us out. Just gave us an extra pair of wolf ears. Really??!! Still, have not done anything. We got no special birthday treatment either. With spending that kind of money at a resort, you'd think they'd want to compensate you for something like that happening to your child.
Manager Response: David, our lifeguards are regularly tested by a leading accreditation company and have received back-to-back scores in the exceptional category.  We are deeply concerned by what you describe in your review and would like to look into this further.  Please check your inbox for a message from us.

Summary: We had already traveled down here to visit Disneyland and since this is only 10 minutes away we decided to spend our last day here. Every year we always visit great wolf lodge in Washington and couldn't wait to try this one out. Right when we pulled up there was staff opening the door. We had a fast check in. However they up graded out room and I had asked them not to. We needed 2 queen beds and they gave us a wolf den bunk beds with one queen. Good thing my friend didn't mind sleeping on the couch cause once the kids saw the wolf den they didn't wanna change rooms! The park was amazing!!! Way bigger than the one in Washington. We came on a good day cause there were no lines for anything. I hope you like climbing stairs cause that's what we did a lot of! I almost had a heart

Some staff had flat affect, dessert place gave us service with an attitude. Water can be a little more warmer and some floors are very slippery. There should be more choice for restaurants and I wish they can be a little bit less pricey.

Nice front office, definitely family oriented. I came for a beauty pageant but at night the parking garage was rowdy, little to no security in a somewhat rough neighborhood. Seams like the waterpark would be fun during a stay,but rooms were a bit expensive.

Summary Heading: A vacation for kids and for parents!
Summary: I am a mom of three amazing kids 9,7,2. In all honesty I love them SO MUCH! But they wear me out. I have been looking for a vacation that my kids will enjoy and my husband and I will enjoy as well. And most importantly, I would like to refrain from saying these words to my husband after the trip " I need another vacation.(with a tired and worn out look on my face."   I finally find that gem!!! This place is AMAZING!!!! Love love love love this place.   Tips:  1. On a budget?: An overnight is good enough( you will be able to use the park for 2 full days). 2 nights is the maximum i think. By the 3rd day - kids and I were coughing already from inhaling too much of the chlorine smell.   2. Check in early: 11 am is the earliest. Do not wait until 4 pm. You may use the water park

We very much wanted to visit a water park and to have it not only be indoor but also limited to guests of the hotel made for a really fun trip.  Hope to go again soon. Beware Tornado has quite the drop in but after that was awesome.

It was overall good, but the rooms were a little small. We barely fit in the bathroom and it was odd having the sink outside the restroom. Water park fun was great. There should be more food variety. Most foods were the same thing. Overall it is a great hotel.

We went for my 12 yr old daughters birthday.  We let her bring a friend with her and we had her 10 yr old sister.  The kids had a blast running around doing all of the activities.  There was a variety of food and entertainment onsite so we didn't have to leave the property during the stay.  I like that there is a microwave and fridge in the room.  Overall a wonderful trip.

lovely time with family plan to come back soon. outstanding customer service. I love the fact salt was water is used instead of chlorine. alot of activities for kids and adults nice cocktail bar. My family and I felt very safe.

This place is beyond Amazing!! Our entire family was treated like royalty. The staff were extremely sweet and friendly, like family they took care of all of our needs. They even shudele us back and forth to Disney in style with all black SUVs. It was nothing short of AMAZING! Thank you, and we had a Great TIME.

My wife had a conference here, so we took our two elementary age boys with us for a little work balanced with R & R.  This place is very fun and extremely kid friendly.  There are a multitude of interactive children's activities during the course of the day, but the indoor water park is the big draw.  It's amazing!  There are water slides for all ages and adventure degrees.  They keep it 83 degrees in the park year round which made it nice for being there in mid February.   There are a couple of restaurants in the resort and a couple more quick service food spots in the water park area.  They are full service including beer, wine and spirits.  Also, there is a Dunkin Donuts by the main elevators.  Beware that it is super busy in the morning.  You are better off going across the

We decided to come here for two nights before a 3 day stay at Disneyland. Can I just say that this place was a better experience BY FAR over Disney. With everything inclusive in the resort, you don't need to leave for food, donuts, or entertainment. A great family outing that we'll never forget.

Summary Heading: Fun and relaxing place for the whole family.
Summary: Excellent place to celebrate a kids birthday, for sure a memorable one.  A fun and safe environment for kids also relaxing time for the adults.  This is one stress FREE vacation I had so far.  Great place.

Great trip everywhere should have one. Kids and I love the staff and all the fun things we could do for the price of our room we will be back for sure great room and water park was rad and clean as could be

The food there was very bad. Found a tooth in my burger. My child could have cracked his tooth. And manager did nothing and did not provide me with my money back. Also there was a necklace stole out of our room.

Summary Heading: Waterpark EXCELLENT.....................just the cost of hotel is way overpriced
Summary: We truly enjooyed the waterpark - you can literally spend an entire day + there. It has something for ALL AGES. Well thought out park for sure. the only cons of this that I have is the extra fees for EVERYTHING. Nothing is free or even a great deal. the buffet is overpriced and to not give drinks with the food is unreal. I have never heard of anywhere else that you pay 25 for a buffet and not get a free drink. Or to have breakfast and not get a free coffee. Not impressed with that at all. The dance party and the story telling was a real treat for the children. I would love to come back with my son but just cannot justify $700 U.S for 2 nights. Especially if you reside in Canada, which we do.  Dunkin donuts was amazing but needs a few more employees I think since it took quite

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: This is our second time visiting the Southern California Great Wolf Lodge and we love it! The environment is safe and friendly. The whole resort is very clean. The location is great but the kids have so much fun just staying at the resort. We will go back it's a fun family experience.

The entire family had an amazing time. The entire hotel including water park is clean and everyone is friendly. There's plenty to do and for very reasonable prices. The range of food and prices is wonderful

This place is great during the cold weather because of the indoor pools. It has everything a kid could ask for. Therefore it makes it a good experience for the whole family. It is a must see if you ask me.

Groupon had the best deal including parking!children activities! Pizza and foood were all affordable, donuts in the morning and also being able to being your own food to room which is an elevator away was incredibly helpful, towels were provided as well

Lodge stay exceptional, best for families with children under 14yrs. Better if outside pool open and certain rides available. Please fix waterpark ventilation issues. I would love to stay again if outside pool available and all rides functioning. Gives a chance for older teens and young adults to enjoy more of the park.

It started when I called to book... upsale. Then I called to add my husbands name to the reservation sand they couldn't do it.. California law- BS. Then our room wasn't ready by 4. No breakfast except dunkin doughnuts (like took me 30 mins). Lastly, football game prices for all good and beverages in pool area. Just a joke.

I took my daughter here for her birthday.  She had soo much fun and would love to come back soon.  Its Kid friendly, enjoyable, relaxing.  Definetly a fun place to stay with your kids.  Sooo worth the money.  The staff were friendly and attentive.

I thought because of school day not many people will be there. Ut i was wrong.  It was packed. My son loved staying and playing at the hotel.  Wish we had stay longer. But since its close to home we will be back

We had an amazing time at the Great Wolf Lodge. Everything was so much fun super clean everyone was so friendly the waterpark was absolutely wonderful and Incredibly clean    the service was also exceptional they made sure we had everything we needed and if we called the front desk for anything they brought it right up.  The food is also terrific  with lots of choices for different budgets and different tastes  and there are tons of activities for kids

We came on a Sunday and got a discount through Groupon. Saves us $100 with family suite. Room is very spacious! Sofabed was fine but kinda tilted down on head area.   Arcade is expensive here. I have 4 kids and spent $5 on each which is 18 tokens worth. They were only able to play 2 games because most nice games require 8 tokens.   The only food we had here was Dunkin Donuts for breakfast. I already knew reataurants here would also be expensive so we just went to eat meals out. We brought our to-go food and rooms are provided qith fridge and microwave. Feed your kids before going to the waterpark! They will be all over the place in this massive place.   We got in at the park around 1pm and left 8pm. I would say  1 day would be enough for kids to have fun. They didn't wanna go

Safe place to stay with your kids,the best things is only the room guests are allowed to enter the park so is not crowded as Disneyland.Plenty of chairs,towel service.The food is delicious and very reasonable prices.You have plenty of activities to do during the day besides the water park,have nice stores and good restaurants.Scoop spa for the girls is a must!!!

Summary Heading: great vacation, for indoor facility too cold water and park area
Summary: We all loved it and enjoyed our stay. Ended up leaving early because it was soo cold we were all freezing. it was not too crowded. I wish there was a warmer area/pool to warm up when freezing. Lazy river was freezing after couple of minutes. there was a lot of dirty towels everywhere blocking chairs and they were clearly not used. Also the trash cans were overfilled around lunch time. and in the bathrooms toilet paper was missing. They need to take better care of this

Fanastic way to spend some family time! Stress free environment and fun for kids and parents! Definitely purchase a pup pass and spring for the large arcade package.   We'll definitely be visiting again and intend to stay more than one night. 🙂

Extremely family friendly with lots of activities to do for the whole family. Great, friendly and knowledgeable staff who are eager to help.  Clean and spacious rooms. Good food at the Moose buffet. Entertainment for everyone...story and dance time for the children, photos with characters, sweets, and lots of excited children everywhere.

We visited Great wolf with my family (2 kids age 9 and 18 months). The kids had so much fun. The water park was clean with enough staff and was not too crowded during our visit. My only complaint was the smell of chlorine in the water park. I may be sensitive but it gave me headache and I can't tolerate to be in the water park for a whole day. We stayed at the basic family rooms which was OK. Basic accommodation but clean which is the most important. My daughter loves the arcade although its a bit pricey as compared to other resort arcades that we've visited in the past. We did not eat on their restaurant but it is short drive to downtown disney where we had dinner. I would be coming back again since my kids love it if the price is right. They do have sales once in a while.

Just minor flaws  like checking in, water park don't  have enough space to sit down and put your stuff while waiting for the room showers were not enough for  a lot of people , the inflatables for the free flowing water not enough but overall we're satisfied thanks and see you soon!

Summary Heading: Amazing for family trips great experience
Summary: It was so amazing my kids had fun we never left the hotel there were so many activities if you did want to be at the Waterpark the room was nice I got the birthday package it wS the best we walked in cake and balloons were on the table my kids loved it the inside of the Waterpark was warnot the water was warm

Very happywith stay Will be back for sure. Everything was perfect and we love room 102. Love the 60 day advance booking deal as well. Kids and me and the wife can't wait to come back.  Thanks for the memmories.

Thank you for your kind services and helping celebrate my daughters 15th bday, and we will be returning to your resort on March 11th, 2017 for my son's 11th birthday party. thank you again. It was very kid friendly and made the adults have just as much fun!

This hotel provides good entertainment for your children while not going too extreme.  There is plenty for both children and adults to do, but i would not suggest this place for adults only.  Pricing was very reasonable considering most places want to squeeze everything they want from you.  The quality, taste and price of the buffet food at the great wolf lodge was better than normal buffet places.

Summary Heading: Great stay but the staff did not follow up on theft incident
Summary: The first day we were at the resort, my daughter got her Violet Wolf Kid from the store and went to  the lobby to do some arts & craft as well listen to story time. Her Violet kid was stolen from her chair (she left her chair for a brief moment to look at the talking grandpa bear and when she got back to the crafts table, her Violet was already gone. We reported immediately to a staff who said she would have security look at the video surveillance and get back to me. Nobody did. So the next day, I personally went to front desk to speak to security, who said they will review the video surveillance  and get back to me. Again, nobody contacted me. On the third day, I asked again and they say they will look at it, and still, nobody bothered to get back to me. This was extremely

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for the little ones!
Summary: We are local but could not resist bringing the kids to the huge water park. When everyone is tired and ready to relax, there is lots of other activities to do in the resort. Also great dining on site as well.

My children had a great time at the water park, bowling, and the arcade. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel and water park felt like a safe environment. I would return again for another stay-cation.

Summary Heading: High pricing likely not worth it
Summary: The price for a one night stay that requires you to wait til 4pm for check in and requires you to check out at 11 is to expensive. Many attractions were closed and the cost of food was outrageous. We had a better time during the opening vs a year later. Chlorine was way too strong for any of us to enjoy the water for more than an hour at a time. No accommodations for birthdays for multiple groups already staying unless you purchase their birthday package. Pricing will soon relate to Disneyland, which really is more enjoyable that GWL.

Summary Heading: Love the indoor safe environment. This was our second time visiting.
Summary: Love the indoor safe environment!   My kids love the Great Wolf Lodge.  This was our second time visiting & my kids want to make it an annual tradition!! I enjoy the cozy cabin feeling once inside the resort!! Would highly recommend this place for families!!

My family really enjoyed the resort but I think the staff should inform you of the different packages they have. And also I think they should announce when it is time for the free activities so that if you don't have the schedule you still won't miss out.

From the entrance to the rooms, the mini bowling to the water park we have the best time when we visit the GWL!!!!!  The food is okay, the staff has always been friendly and the slides have always been great.  Look around and you will find everyone wearing a smile

Summary Heading: Amazing experience for myself and the family
Summary: Tip: Valet parking service is extremely good, I wouldn't recommended on the day you are leaving.  We weren't ready to leave and to have to store items in the car was a bit of a hassle not their fault.  :)   There are no lockers in the water park, is best to bring water protection for your mobile devices and cameras so you won't leave them unattended for a long periods of time.  We didn't have any incidents, but I was always worried to leave my phone in my backpack.  Other than that, be ready to be pampered and have fun.

Needs more daily activity variation for kids,lifeguard has to be a little more proactive, the pizza place next to the arcade has a very slow service, housekeeping forgot to clean our room. Reservation online glitched, birthday not registered, ended up with no banner at the room door. Front desk did not rectify.

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: This was our second visit to Great Wolf Lodge.  We had a wonderful time!  It is a great place for a family vacation.  The water park has so many different options that there is something for everyone.  I recommend bringing a waterproof cell phone case to hang your phone around your neck if you want to take pictures.  I also strongly recommend water socks/shoes.  This will help with slipping as well as protect your feet from germs.  Enjoy your visit!!!

Summary Heading: Everything was great, except the front desk
Summary: The experience overall was wonderful, my kids had the time of their lives. But while checking in, we had problems with our reservation and the staff wasn't helpful not willing to help at all. Nwarly pushed us to the side and out of line as we tried to figure it out on our own. Then returning to the back of the line, only to do this 3 more times.

Summary Heading: Fun family time for all ages
Summary: My husband, my 17 yr old son and my 7 yr old son and I all had a fabulous time here.  We loved coming and going from the water park, the 24 hour arcade, the indoor glow in the dark mini golf, the mini bowling, the shooting game/movie, etc etc.  I cannot say enough about what a great time we had.  We will definitely be back.

This is great for kids. Great for toddlers, I believe it's from 0 depth to 2ft deep. Of course there's more pool areas that are deeper for bigger kids. I don't think anything is deeper than 4ft in the park.

We loved it here.  Our daughters birthday is in the winter and she loves summer. When me collegues told me about this place it sounded perfect for her and it was. They enjoyed the Magic Quest so much, I wish it was cheaper. The kids enjoyed the yoga and the waterpark. I was bummed that I had to pay an additionl fee for our additional person when our room already accommodated 5 people. Overall this place was outstanding. My daughter turned 9 this year, I wish this place was around when she was 4 yrs old.

Everything about this place was great! There is no need to worry about anything because everything in the resort.  This is the perfect place to celebrate a child's birthday because everyone knows how room make that child feel extra special.

My Grandkids give this place two thumbs up.  They had so many activities for both of my Grandkids.  Breakfast and lunch and dinner where right there very convenient. Was very clean and everyone was very nice. Something for the entire family to do at all times of the day.

Fun for the whole family.  We really enjoyed the water park.  My daughter wants to return for her birthday instead of legoland.  The lockers are pricey to rent.  Smallest is $15 a day biggest is $25 per day.

Met up with four other families with 6+ children from ages 9-15 to experience their indoor waterpark, which has a great variety of rides that adults can enjoy as well as their children.  Normally their rooms are too expensive, but we received a special room rate offer.  Room rates are for 4 people and they will charge additional $58 for each additional person upto 6 max per room.  They also charge a $30 resort fee plus a $13 for overnight parking.  Wristbands have a chip in it to open rooms, purchase food, and parking which is nice.  Was impressed with the variety of food/drink choices as well.  Their Bar & Grill serves an excellent cheeseburger with two patties, bacon, lettuce, tomato with fries for $12.  Was a great time but two days is more than enough time in the pools which

We had a great stay.  The staff is not overly friendly but there are a lot of activities for kids to offset the average service.  The activities are in and outside of the water park.  This will save you on the cost of entertainment.  My son preferred Great Wolf over Disneyland. The hotel is located near restaurants that you can walk to.

The kids have a blast here. The water park is great and safe for them. There was great kids activities in the lobby that were free and entertaining for young pack members. We still haven't had a chance to eat at all the restaurants and this is our second stay. Great family destination!

This is a great place to bring the kids. Great indoor water park, reasonable prices for food, Rooms are ok. Not to be confused with a luxury hotel but great fun for the entire family! February is a great time to visit. Relatively low rates and the water park did not have huge lines.

Needs a hot tub!! Kids were freezing, lines were unnecessarily long due to lack of lifeguards on slides.  They had one life guard rotating between three slides to let people slide down or monitor help people with their tube.  It took a long time and was not fun being cold and wet watching one person struggle to run three rides.  Beds were not comfortable.  Staff was extremely helpful.  Park aND hotel was very clean.  Kids had fun but waterpark portion was a bust due to being to cold even the adults.

Really had a wonderful time. One suggestion is that it was a little cool in the water park in the late afternoon. Also itbwould be nice to have hair dryers in the shower area. And designated shower gel and shampoo. I like the little machine to ring water out of bathing suit. Appreciated gluten free items on menu.

The rides were understaffed causing wait times to be much longer than necessary. They employ one staff member to man two rides...very inefficient and you end up spending double the time in lines.  No outside food is allowed in the water park area. This is done so customers are forced to purchase the resort food. It was a concern for us because my kids have food allergies.

Enjoyable one stop family option- with entertainment, waterpark, dining, and board all under one roof. The place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the rides surprisingly fun! Just be prepared to stand in line to check in- and also pay a $30 resort fee (that for some reason does not include parking).

We decided to come down on Thursday night to stay at a hotel and gonto Disneyland the next morning. We didn't arrive until 7pm and when we arrived we realized that we had made the mistake of thinking we were going to make it to Disneyland the next day. There was way too much to do! Way too much fun to be had! We can't wait to go again.

I can't say enough how much we enjoyed our visit! The resort is only a year old and feels brand new. Everything is super clean and completely family friendly, down to minor details like rounded corners on furniture which we appreciated with a toddler. We will definitely visit again. Highly recommend this place!!

The rooms were clean and decorated in a wolf theme. The employeess  were all friendly and the food was all delicious. Not cheap but have seen more expensive prices at Sea World.  Kids loved the slides and arcade. Older kids will love the sword quest that takes them on a journey and keeps them busy for hours. Many activities during the day for all ages. You get wolf ears on upon arrival. I felt very comfortable for my almost eight year olds to run around the hotel and go off by themselves at the water park and feel they would be safe. The water park is very clean for the amount of people there are. The outside air is as warm as the water so you don't feel cold. My only negative was that I stepped in poop in the wave pool but it was immediately taken care of and shut down to

Great Wolf Lodge...not so great staff. Bordering rude, bothered, not happy nor smiling. Just overall blah...geared toward 4 to 10 year olds. My 11yo boys had a great time tho, but wouldnt stay more than 1 night. Food was very reasonable, but arcade/bowling spendy. To me, its "Chuck E. Cheese meets a Waterpark". Rooms are great though, fridge, microwave and coffee maker...very family friendly.

Overall we had a great time at Great Wolf Lodge. My family is difinetly going back soon. The food prices were great and I was happy with the craft beer selection. The only problems I had was that that not all the lights were'nt working in the kid cabin and the maintenance crew did not have replacement parts.

Let's just say if you are Prepared to spend $700++ for a two day water park stay... the this is your place. Everything is just too much... breakfast for $18 per person. I think the only reasonable establishment there is the Dunkin' Donuts!

Great for kids of all ages. Both my kids had so much fun and no sunscreen to worry about! The room looked like a lodge and had practical amenities (refrigerator, microwave).  The arcade was open overtime we went! The Dunkin Donut line gets long so go early!

Pls let us know if some game is broken by the time we were booking.  The game room have a game is kind of cheating . We call a staff to complain but we were not happy with the solution.The survey is wierd. It ask me have to type more than 200 words???????? It waste my time .

Great resort, but food is extremely pricey.  Id recommend packing your own food. there are fridges in the rooms.  Rides are both single and multiple, great for little kids.  Separate play are for the really little ones.  Many parents were not close to their kids, allowing them to run all over the resort.  Keep an eye on your kids!!!!

This is very kid friendly with tons of activities. Your child will love it! Mini golf, bowling, arcade, spa, water park, XD theater, laser tag, arcade, story time, Magiquest and lots of good restaurants.

Overall we enjoyed our stay here. Kids had fun at the waterpark and many adventurous activities to keep them busy all day. I didnt enjoy the food as much. Too bland for me. Rooms were clean and most(not all) of the staff are friendly. Will visit again in near future as girls enjoyed it very much. Happy kids!

Fun had by all! We would recommend to family's with youngsters or those young at heart.  I couldn't help but compare it to the Aulani Hotel in Hawaii.  Disney's always going to be at the top of the pack.  That said, the staff were friendly and helpful.

Really had a great time with the grand kids.  Something for all of them, ages 12,8, 5, 3.  The room was big and comfortable, the food was very good, and the staff was friendly.  Lots of fun things to do.

I took five little girls there 3 10 year olds 2 12 year olds and they had the most amazing time. I didn't need to worry about their safety lifeguards wear everywhere keeping an eye on all the children I really felt safe and secure having the kids run around and play on their own.

It was a perfect 2 day 1 night stay. Water park is not to big for adults to keep on eye on all their Childern, but to Childern it was huge and perfect. Nothing like a nice shower after a few hours in the water park and waking up to get ready to jump back in the water park.

Awesome resort.  Very clean. Great friendly staff. Variety of activities for kids. Lots of fun for all ages. I will definitely return. We didn't want to leave the resort. I highly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Good conceptually.  Pricepoint a little high--  would wait for a deal (eg Groupon).  Golf amd bowling are nice for older
Summary: Groupon.  Rooms are not worth buying upgraded rooms.  Comfirtable, simple.  Clearly the draw is the waterpark and if not crowded, doesnt disappoint.  Food so-so, but cleaning amd food staff great.  Front desk staff not efficient, and dont seem happy, with long lines there.  Phone service for resrrvations is horrible, with huge wait times.  Wish they had list of other attractions to visit in the area while u visit.  We have teens, and more activities for the older kids would have been nice.  They keep waterpark thoughtfully warm which is great.

Great time at the water park.  Holiday weekend was crowded but not too crowded to have fun.  My kids enjoyed the various different water slides, wave pool, etc.  Glad we brought googles.  My only complaint it that even after waiting 45 min to be seated for dinner, we still waited about an hour for our food.

Great wolf lodge was very fun.  My teenage son enjoyed it as well as my younger kids.  There were a lot of rides in which we could go on with our kids.  Rooms were super clean and spacious.  Birthday package made my son feel extra special with the birthday banner on the door upon arrival as well as birthday cake, card and balloons waiting for him inside the room

Great place. Kids had a great time. A bit pricey since everything else fun costs more money, so it is an expensive outing, but nonetheless, kids had a great time and that's  what matters. Waterpark was awesome, especially our favorite was FLOWRIDER.

Summary Heading: Amazing! I could never have imagined this place.
Summary: An indoor water park. It is more incredible than that statement or the photos lead you to believe. They have excellent craft beer choices and the food is reasonably priced, if not that great. Plus if you are willing to leave the hotel, you can get excellent Vietnamese food in the surrounding area.

After doing a lot of research, I booked a wolf den suite from 2/15-2/17 and I have to say that it was worth it! My daughters, ages 3 & 6 had a great time and I had an opportunity to relax and enjoy the many things that this resort has to offer. We visited the water park (of course!), arcade, we had dinner at the Lodge Wood Fired Grill, had fun at the dance party, enjoyed story time, made bracelets, and got mani's at Scoops. Many other reviewers recommended to book a cabana if possible which we did... again... worth it!   All of the staff was nice and friendly. We had an excellent time at Great Wolf Lodge and can't wait to go back!

Summary Heading: It's all about the indoor water park
Summary: The price is too high but the waterpark is a hit. The individual fee for each item is frustrating. The 4 pm check in is tough. They could add another restaurant to help ease the wait time. I did like how you can check out and still enjoy the waterpark.

Great stay for our family. Rooms were clean & the waterpark was so much fun!! Lots of activities for all the kids to do. Felt safe & was not overcrowded. Prices for food was definitely pricey but there are many places to eat nearby.

We enjoyed our time at the water park.  We went on a holiday weekend, so the price was very steep and the park was crowded.  The price isn't horrible if you have enough people in your room and you aren't going on a busy weekend.  The add-ons would be very expensive for a group though.  The activities are more focused on smaller children - under 9.  There are some activities for older kids, but teens might get bored.  My child loved it and I would go again if the price was right.  It would be a fun place for a birthday party sleep-over.  Negatives - $13 parking per night - was charged twice - on bill plus on exit of garage - Don't allow face masks with nose (if you have a child who likes that - no place to store valuables except room - Extra games are expensive, but they do have

Great resort and friendly staff. Very clean and pleasant during our stay. My family from Europe enjoyed the stayfrom the moment we checked in to the moment we ended our vacation. Hope to be back in the near future.

My daughter had an awesome 8th birthday celebration at Great Wolf Lodge. Way better than planning a party at your house. Lots of activities for the kids.  Only downside is that all the activities are additional charges and can add up quickly.

Great waterpark! Rooms were just ok for the high price. Basic bathroom and air conditioner and heater did not work well at all and was very loud. Food was pretty good and activities outside the waterpark were great for the kids too.

Our family had the best time at Great Wolf Lodge! It is so much more than a water park- the entire hotel is a non-stop kids paradise! We did bowling, arcade games, MagiQuest, Dance Party, Storytime, Meet Characters, shopping and so much more! Our Sntertainment host, Angel made the entire experience magical for the kids! They loved meeting the characters. When we left I asked them if they'd rather go here or Disneyland and they chose Great Wolf Lodge!

Really excellent place for families - The slides are fun for adults also....I look forward to returning with the entire family again - the food was not bad for a water park with lot's of healthy options

It's a fun place for the kids and adults.  It has an indoor waterpark with variety of fun things to do.  They even had a surfing area which my boys loved it!  Also, it has an arcade that kids can play. My 2 boys, 10 and 8 had a blast. Overall if you want your kids to have fun this is the place!

Good for families. Safe and fun environment. Buffet has delicious and a great variety of food and friendly staff. Lots of entertainment to keep whole family busy. Close by to shopping center, food places. Prepare to pay for resort fees and parking. Other than that- totally worth it

Plenty of rides. Good fun for all ages, even my teen was happy. Loved being able to use my wrist band for room access and to pay for food and drinks. The food was reasonably priced, for the most part. We ordered sandwiches at the Sweet treats and Eats but they were both gross and over priced, waste of money. All the other food was good.

Summary Heading: surely is a howlin' great fun!
Summary: Oh what a perfect quick getaway this really is! My family spent one night here and we are really pleasantly surprised on how much fun and how much activities the place has to offer, not to mention the very efficient and friendly staff from the front desk to housekeeping. :)  We booked our accommodation on line and we got a good deal for it. We even purchased a Paw Pass that provides a package of activities and items at a cheaper price.   We were advised that checking in might be around 4 pm, but we were happy to know that as early as 11 am, the room was ready!  Hotel room access is in the cool wristband so you don't have to worry about carrying a keycard! And you can use the same wristband for any charges in the resort.   The waterpark has a lot to offer from babies to adults.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel I've ever stayed at!
Summary: From the minute we walked into the door to the time we left for the airport it was a great experience.  The staff was so nice and well trained.  They knew the answers to every question and that was just the first 5 minutes!!!  The waterpark was super fun; the kids loved it.  We originally booked at the Disneyland Hotel, but we were super happy we found the Great Wolf Lodge for a much better price and the water park can't be beat.  Highly recommend this to anyone with kids who are looking for an all in one destination.  We could have just stayed at the hotel the entire time and had a blast, but we did go to Disneyland for two days.

The place was nice and clean. But I had a very hard time justifying the 500 dollar price tag for one night.. This is a one time thing for us because of the price.. I also went during the week in Feb. To but doesn't' matter it's still 400 bucks with a 100 for taxes..Don't get me wrong it's fun .. I just wish they would have coupon days or week day discounts or something.. We would come back..  Won't be returning until prices drop or have some kind of deal ....

Summary Heading: Best hotel stay for your money
Summary: If you're planning on going to a California and a water park, you might as well save the money and stay here. With the amount of money you spend on admission passes to the park, and a hotel at somewhere not as nice you end up spending way more than if you just stay at the Great Wolf Lodge, the room rates are reasonable, and the staff is very friendly, and the rooms are exceptionally clean. I will deff return.

Summary Heading: Great mini trip for local with the family
Summary: Our 2nd trip here.  The kids loved it!  We had a late dinner at Lodge Grill (forgot exact name of restaurant), food was not great.  We were so hungry due to the wait and a party of 6.  Ribs was bery dry, I love ribs, but when they brought out my plate, new right away just by looking that it will be very dry.  My wife order pasta with shrimps and lobsters, it was very blend.  Wecould have eaten out locally but due to the storm that weekend, wasn't worth it to drive around.  Overall the resort was great.  Oh one last thing, on the day of check out amd you decide to stay back, have a credit card on hand.  I was told my wristband will still work but it didn't.

Summary Heading: Terrific place for fun weekend with the kids to escape bad weather
Summary: This was our first time at the Great Wolf Lodge and we had heard good things, but were really impressed all around. So nice to be able to be inside one location for an entire weekend - kids loved the water park and the activities - and could not believe their "wolf den" hotel room. My daughter is 2 and my son is 5 and they just did not want to leave at the end of our 2 1/2 days. If we had any quibbles they were minor: not a great wine list or food selection, so I would not really recommend as a foodie experience. But for what you normally find with young families, it was an all around great experience.

They overly contaminate the pools with chemicals.  My family and I felt so sick. The Manager can't even return my call. . Not planning on coming back.. not unless they fix this problem of there's. It's a expensive Resort but at least the water park admission is free. The donuts at the resort taste stale. The Restaurant food was plain. The thermostat in our room wasn't working properly. The temperature kept dropping at night, It got my whole family sick. I called the front desk, but it kept ringing.  I can't even get a Manager to call me and at least apologize.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and very well organized
Summary: This was our first time staying at the waterpark hotel and it was very well organized we wish we had more time to stay and play. The hotel is very accommodating with time to spend at the waterpark there are a lot of activities to keep the kids busy ..... some cost extra and some do not. When we first arrived we got some free wolf pack ears and some treats for the kids which was unexpected. We definitely had a blast and look forward to coming again.

We are local to O.C found a Groupon during low volume season that worked out perfectly for my son's Bday weekend! For the sale price we received. It was awesome! I can't imagine paying the full price during high volume season. I know for sure my opinion would change if I experienced that instead.  But my children loved every minute and I would definitely go back only during off peak season or if I found awesome room rate to have the same experience again. It also nice that is not that far Disneyland because there lots of restaurants to choose when deciding to dine out.

Too many chemicals at water park. My kids were coughing, complaining of their throats burning, and faces were red as though they had been outside. You could see the haze of chemicals. It was so bad, my kids were asking for fresh air

Summary Heading: Nice 2 day family getaway for 11th birthday
Summary: This trip to the Great Wolf Lodge was meant for our 11 year old son's birthday. We ended up bringing his cousins and were able to get rooms right next to each other. All the kids had a great time at the waterpark and really enjoyed the bowling and arcade. This is our second trip to the Great Wolf Lodge and we are now making it an annual tradition. The only issue we had is that after we left myself, my wife and my two year old came down with a stomach bug. It may just be a coincidence.

We booked this vacation based on many friends sharing their great experience here. That left our expectations very high, and from check in to check out we were never disappointed. Pack member Ezekiel got us off to a very happy start and we were impressed when he remembered our names later that evening. We left wore out and completely satisfied! We are already excited for our next trip to Great Wolf!

Great place for fun secure family trip.  Food is pricey and quality at Buckets is not great.  Most items on buffet were very tasty.  Rooms are large and nicely appointed.  Restrooms at water park are very clean!!

I chose this place because it was close to home and offered something no other hotel offers, an indoor water park. Perfect water and ambient temperature. It also has an outdoor area, which was too cold for me but my kids loved it. Beware, It has a strong chlorine order, so you have to take a fresh air break every so often. The room was clean, the beds comfy. The only thing that I noticed in the room was that the shower had low water pressure but enough to take a shower.

Summary Heading: Good for one day family get away
Summary: Great for short vacation(1-2night stay). Place is clean and no crowd. Water park have enough water activity for all ages. Water slides have short waiting period. There are mary choices to slide on. Food not so good, but, guest can go out to eat.  Overall, my young one and me had a great time.

We have 2 good days at the resorts. The waterpark is a little bit small than i'd expected, but have many great slider. My kids love it. The place is very safe with plenty of lifeguards. The room is big for 4 persons. One minus is, the handwash is outside of the bathroom, it's not convienient when you use the toilet.

Went for my daughter's 6th bday. Exceeded our expectations! I want to say it's a cross between Hurricane Harbor & Circus Circus. The water park, mini bowling, miniature golf, arcade games, restaurants, it was all amazing! Will definitely go again. Check out grouping for great deals

I stayed for my daughters birthday. We arrived Friday at 1 PM. The parking structure was empty and I parked in the first spot. Staff and check in was amazing. We got to pick the room we wanted because it was less than 50 percent full that night.   In the lobby the kids (age 8 and 10) ran over and got an animal balloon made by staff members. The lobby is huge and nice. Has huge fireplace to sit next to and a nice area to hang out.   The room - The room was on the 8th floor by choice. It was super clean and nice. Just a simple room because we didn't upgrade to a theme room. It was quiet and nice. All we needed. We packed a bunch of food and drinks in an ice chest and that helped make things easy. No outside food or ice chest allowed in the water park though.   The water park - The

It is a great getaway in Orange County. The water park and events were a big hit with our children. The food options were of different price points which we appreciated. It was nice that we didn't need to leave the property for any reason during our stay.   The water in the water park is much cooler in the morning and starts to heat up around 3:00 and stays warm for the remainder of the day.

Great place for the kids. Very clean. If I were to just rate the watermark I would say it is outstanding. The staff could be friendlier and the food to be a whole lot better.  I would recommend going at least once.

Summary Heading: Save your money and go somewhere else
Summary: Check your credit card statement, they double charged me for everything. Don't eat there food is horrible! Some of the staff have a look on their face like they hate their job. We did have a great time but for the amount of money we spent there, we are very disappointed

It was our first time visiting Great Wolf Lodge.  Kids, 11and 7 years old girls absolutely loved everything!  And so did us parents.  Only thing I wish could have been better was a better guidance of what we need to do when we arrived prior to our check in time.  Other than that, really recommend for quick family vacation!!!

Summary Heading: Too much alcohol with little kids
Summary: Everything was nice but for the price of Disneyland I'm not sure it was worth it. The water was cold, not 84 degrees like they advertised. Everyone was drinking and lots of unruly adults with little kids in the pool seems a weird combo.

We were looking for a hotel in fairly close proximity to Disneyland with an indoor water park. This was a great choice. The water park was perfect for my 6 year old daughter. With the variety of restaurants and other fun activities on site we spent a whole day there. We would definitely recommend it to anyone with kids.

Spent 2 days in this amazing place.  This was our second time with this location and everyone was pleasant.  Just one minor incident this time around with housekeeping.  Asked for room clean twice but never happened.  We needed fresh towels and toiletries which they usually restock after they clean rooms.

Great family experience!  This entertainment/water park is the perfect family getaway.  The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and well taken care of and there are plenty of activities for the young ones.

We had a great time and loved the water park. Was to be able to go up to your room to put the kids down for a nap. We would definitely be back in the future. I have recommended this resort to family and friends on social media.

Summary Heading: Fun for families with young kids
Summary: Great place to go if you have young kids.  The entire resort is set up for families with kids.  The water park is a lot of fun, but lines can sometimes be long as some slides seemed to be under-staffed.  Parking is included in your resort fee and there are a lot of other fun activities.  My 10 year-old really enjoyed the bowling.

Summary Heading: SLOW Lines due to inadequate staff
Summary: Overall the resort is nice.  However, the food quality is a bit poor (for the price you pay).  In the morning when all you want it coffee, you have to stand in a line that takes OVER 45 minutes.  The water park is fun and there are some great rides; however, it is poorly staffed.  When you finally are close to the top, you see there is one life guard working 2 slides.  How about having one life guard for EACH slide.  This will speed up the lines.  It costs a lot of money to come here, so let's use that money to hire another life guards.

If the food would have been a little better and the restrooms in the water park would have been clean  I would have gave it 5 stars the Birthday package could have used a little more creativity lol it was plain for the price

I feel like I was in a nightmare  this stay ruin my son birthday party  some strangers  had my room key bellmam lost all my bag cake  decoration  kids grab bags  the staff  was disrespecting me  over my own  things

Very clean, great staff and everything there. Didn't have to leave. We will definitely stay again. Restaurants are nut free zones, best part!  Rooms were very clean and water park is very clean and not highly chlorinated

Lodge was awesome. Clean, fun and great place for mini vacation. We will go back and highly recommend to all. Wasn't sure what to Expect and was pleasantly surprised.  Wait times for rides were short  and it was crowded but didn't affect our fun

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge is a GREAT Place for the family
Summary: It's a new hotel at the end of 'hotel row' down the street from Disneyland, so there are enough outside attractions to go to.  BUT, stay for the indoor waterpark, great for all ages, very well kept up.

We stayed here for 3 nights on a travel agent work trip back in November 2016. Wow what an amazing hotel for kids!! The hotel is very nice (I would class as 4 star). Has waterslides and loads of activitys for kids - has an arcade and a little girls day spa! along with many many more activitys. Also has a lovely a la carte restaurant where I had the most amazing meal. Not far from Disney - cost about $10 in a taxi. Worth staying here!

This was our first trip to The Great Wolf Lodge and we enjoyed the experience so much. The whole pool area is secure and it is easy to keep an eye on your kids/grandkids. The place was very clean and the staff was very friendly everywhere in the lodge. The choices for eating were good and my favorite coffee place Dunkin Donuts is in this place. I wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised and we had a wonderful time.

best hotel for family and children with allot of fun and very clean also wonderful location near to big outlet shopping market and near to some Arabic restaurant with very good staff if we go again to USA we must stay in the same hotel

The resort itself is very cool. The water park was fun but the chlorine smell gave me a headache. My son is turning 9 and brought a friend. They loved the wand adventure. It is very pricey and for what you get. The staff was so very friendly. Everyone we ran into was great. A special shout out to the wand store staff...they were super helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and we appreciated the small fridge and microwave

Great for all ages but the food and attractions were pricey. Bring your own food and go back to your room to eat it. Feels very safe. We had a blast. would definitely recommend this place to others!!!

Summary Heading: Great Resort for the Whole Family
