Summary: We spent one night at GWL while we're in Anaheim in January. We had a great time! The water park was fun for the whole family (kids aged 10 and 8). The resort is very new and was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. It made a nice break from the theme parks. We would totally recommend this resort to others!

This was our second time at the great wolf lodge and both visits were awesome.  My grandson loves everything from the slides, the bunkbeds, brinley bear, donuts, ice cream, bowling, arcade, glitter tattoos to hanging out with his mom and dad and his grammy!!!! all while under one roof !!!

Nothing better than an indoor, warm, and not overly crowded waterpark!  Add in pretty decent food options, and some drinks for the parents.  That would be enough for us, but they offer so much more, will be fun for all ages of kids!

Summary Heading: A great time for the entire family
Summary: We visited Great Wolf Lodge for my daughters 10th birthday.  It is very pricey, but the kids absolutely love it. My husband and I also had a great time.  I prepared a lot of food and that saved us money.  Each room has a refrigerator. We did eat at the buffet for breakfast and that was disappointing and expensive!

Over priced, pool deck is slippery and poorly maintained. Chlorine gas smell is overpowering.  Not a lot to howl about. The restaurants are probably the best part of the resort and there are people on staff who try their best but it looks like management is trying to cut costs wherever possible around the pool.

Summary Heading: Family trip to Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Went to Great Wolf to celebrate the kids birthdays.  Was impressed by their exceptional staff and friendliness.  My kids loved the arcade and waterpark.  The bowling, golf, and laser game were a little over rated in our opinion.  Dunking donuts was delicious and had great sandwiches too.

We stayed the night and had a great time. We were able to use the water park for two full days in our visit. The food was great. Lots of healthy options in addition to food prepared really well. Not your standard amusement park fare. Fun for kids and adults! We will definitely go back. On a side note we went during a non busy time so lines were not long it would most likely be a different experience if super crowded.

Great Wolf Lodge is a great place to spend a few days with your family.  Lots of activities on site as well as near by.  We will be coming back more often!  All the kids enjoyed it as well as the adults.  Best suited for kids that are able to walk and swim on their own.

Took my 10 year old for her birthday she had a great time my only complaint was the strong smell of chlorine in the water park but other than that it was nice.  We also has our two teenagers which did enjoy the experience but the park is mostly geared toward younger children

We had a wonderful time with our granddaughter. Highly recommended for family fun. They really have their act together for convenience for your families. Lots of staff and lifeguards are really on top of everything.

We surprised our son for his 10th bday by taking him to the Great wolf lodge in Anaheim,California. When checking in staff already made our stay special. Our room was a good size and beds very comfortable for a family of 4. Downstairs they have an arcade, lil shops, food, a small bowling alley and a glow in the dark mini golf course. But the waterpark was the main attractions. They give wristbands that you have to have while stay there so you can enjoy the park all day when you check in and even when you check out. The life guards were on it, they get a hi five for their work. The whole hotel was clean. Next day we had their buffet,it was worth it and the price was reasonable. My son said he wants to go again. I would recommend my family and friends. We loved it 💟😊👍

We purchased a Kid Cabin weekend for our friend's 11, 9, and 4 year old children. They all had the time of their lives and we're already planning a visit next year. It's truly a perfect place for the family.

We heard about this place in a t.v. commercial but the reason why we came here is to have a mini get away for our family as well as a post b-day celebration of my eldest son. The resort was exceptional and the staff very efficient and friendly. There are all sorts of activities to be done at the resort not just the water park but with my boys it's all about the water. I would come back here again 😊

Where to start. from the moment we checked in it was quick and easy. Staff was very professional and very nice. The room was clean Kids loved it. The whole water park was great, clean, and safe for all ages. The restaurants are very reasonable with prices. They have huge arcade place, bowling, and mini golf. This place was awesome

Great Wolf Lodge was fun for my lil one. Service is great...rooms are great....atmosphere is great....but the food is way too expensive for a very minimul amount and quality. It would be nice to add more slides/attractions for older kids/adults. Otherwise...we really enjoyed it.

Summary Heading: Super fun and where else can you enjoy waterslides in the winter?
Summary: My family and I had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge.  We mainly went there for an awards ceremony.  I got a room, because I got a great rate for attendees of the award ceremony.  It would have been too expensive for me, if I had to pay full price.

The resort has much to offer kids, especially ages 3-12 or so. Just like most resorts, food & beverages are expensive. I felt like the facility was safe and it was clean as well. The staff wasn't overly friendly but were knowledgeable.

Good waterpark but HORRIBLE buffet. Food is bland and stale, go to McDonalds across the street for better quality (and that's not saying much). The waterpark itself is fun with a lot of good attractions.

Excellent Hotel & Waterpark. Fabulous customer service and dining experience! Beautiful rooms provided with specialty Spa soaps from the scoops children's spa. Fabulous family activities including character interactions storytime children's dance and yoga. Worth the time and money for the entire family.

This was my second time here I just love this place.The staff is so professional and all of the  activities are so great for the children.Prices for food and  activities  aren't so bad  , see you next year!!!

Summary Heading: Great water fun in the Winter
Summary: It's been an unusually cold and wet Winter in LA (but we really need it!) and having an indoor waterpark in the area is pretty nice. My family and I stayed for a night this past Friday, Feb. 3. I got lucky and found an offer code that gave us 25% off their regular rates and also received a $50 credit to spend during our stay.  We got there 2 hours early and our room was ready for us. The rooms are nice but not spectacular. There's a fairly large TV, 2 queen beds and a sofabed. We opted for the standard non-themed room which saved us $100. We had a nice view of the city on the 7th floor.  The waterpark was really fun. There was literally something for everyone to enjoy. I have 2 boys (2 and 5 years old) and they played around the park for 3 hours straight. There were slides for

Everything was exceptional! Accomodation, Food, Water park, Service etc. Everything is still very new, and they do a good job keeping everything clean Just remind your kids not to run in the water park

We had a great time. Kids loved it. It was clean and the entertainment was awesome. Only problem was there was these bugs in the room that keep coming back. For the price, the should be no bugs. Yuck.

Great place for families that have kids of all ages. even if I did't have kids I would still love to go with my husband. They have all sorts of activities and things to do they have food that is anywhere from super easy and fast for kids to sit down and have a glass of wine and relax.

Very fun, clean and safe. Extra things to do at resort were very pricey. Bring your own snacks, drinks, and adult beverages. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. Rooms were new and clean. Overall very fun for every age.

Summary Heading: Best birthdays ever for both a 7 and a 12 year old.
Summary: We went during the end of January because both of my boys' birthdays.  They had a blast at the indoor water park and enjoyed the Magiquest immensely.  The purchase of a wand and topper is a must when visiting.  I enjoyed the Dunkin Donut off the Lobby level elevators.  If you enjoy 2-3 cups of coffee daily and decide to stay 3 days, it's worth purchasing the $9.99 refillable cup during your stay.  No need to line up every time you need a coffee fix.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf is GREAT for families
Summary: Really had a great time. Kids cannot stop talking about all of the fun things to do.  Everything was very clean and felt brand new still.  The waterpark was amazing.  The staff was professional and helpful.   Really appreciate the diversity of activities. We thought we would leave and see other nearby attractions but never did. Can't wait to go back.

Summary Heading: Super fun place for the kids.
Summary: My kids really enjoy the indoor heated waterpark. I love it myself too because it's heated. I only go there during the week and not weekend. It's a much better experience with public amusement park. Staff is very attentive and place is clean and in order. Great management!

Summary Heading: Loved it. Will go back again next year.
Summary: Everyone loved it!!!!! Park was unbelievably clean. Staff was super friendly and helpful. The lines were short and the rides were a lot of fun. Great place to get away for a few days. Some favorites were the lazy river, surfing and wave pool.

Great location close to Disney.  We actually went here when it was pouring rain and booked on the discount rate for a winter getaway.  So glad we were able to make the stop, both kids loved the waterpark and the Wolf Den. The guest services were also very accommodating!

Bought a Groupon  for  a great price ...Good place for kids .The Bar outside was great!My husband and I  enjoyed Margaritas. The kids really enjoyed the magicquest game . My only suggestion  would be that they offer better options in the buffet and a few activities  for older kids (10-13) would be good .

I recommend to all my friends to visit. I also recommend a cabana. Carlos in food in beverage was great. The management here took care of my every need. I fell very safe having my kids at the water park.

Excellent size rooms for a big family of 6.  Waterpark is not overcrowded and the lifeguard coverage made me feel comfortable.  The ease of the chip wristband made it easy for us to relax and not worry if we had our wallet etc.

We recently spent one night at the Great Wolf Lodge (Anaheim) and loved it! Our three small children had a complete blast, and we even had a great time! It's not always a "really great trip" when you vacation with little children, but we honestly agreed that this was one of our best trips. All three kids loved it - great variety of activities and the entire lodge set-up was really designed with families in mind. Would definitely recommend!

If you're looking for a fun place to take your kids and still relax this is it! The water park is so safe because of the great staff always looking out that you can practically nap while the kids swim! lol there are nice little free activities for the kids outside the water and the arcade has a good variety of games. The rooms are nice, big, and clean! The only downside is the amount of resort fees and of course the humongous price of the stay! If you can afford it or catch a coupon I would definitely recommend this place!

It was a bit pricey, but it was worth every penny that was spent at this awesome place. you get what exactly what you paid for. Staff from the reception to the housekeeping are great. Room is clean and smelled fresh when we walked in. Reception was friendly, since it was our first time the person who helped us explained everything we need to know!

Summary Heading: A nice addition to the Great Wolf lodge family
Summary: As one of the newest Great Wolf Lodge, expectations were high.  I had somewhat of an idea of what to expect, having experience the property in Niagara Falls before.  Being newer, there are many things to like about this particular property, but there were a few minor things that I felt the Niagara Falls property did a little bit better.  What I liked:  Rooms still have that "new room" smell.  Everything is well maintained and in working order.  Room assigned was convenient: close to the elevator on a low floor - which is good to access the water slides and the recreation area in the basement.  The water park itself can easily handle the volume of guests, even when the outside area is closed (due to repairs or weather). All the slides are new and this is a fun water park. Some of

Took a youth group to Great Wolf Lodge and had a great time! Accommodations were very nice, clean, and new. Facilities were well maintained. Water park was a blast! Lots of things to do. Food was only fair.

Great family fun. Especially fun for a "hands on dad" weekend. We took 4 little girls and they had so much fun. They did EVERYTHING offered. Bowling, golf, stuffed a wolf, water park, Magic Quest. I only said "no" to my husband the whole weekend.

GUY! If you have not experienced Great Wolf, GO! like now... Amazing environment, huge indoor water park with water fun and slides for all ages. Have a little little? There is an area for toddlers and cabannas for the family (that you can rent) do you have a comfy place to relax as your kids are taking a rest. There is slides/water fun for everyone of all ages from baby to Grandma. The lay river was our fave, fast slides, mat racing, even a surfing exhibit where you can take a ride on the Flow Rider. Yes it is a little pricey but worth it  We stayed in a theme suite, the kids stayed in the "Wolf Den" which is a set of bunk beds, walls painted like a wolf den, all rocked in their own little spot, they have their own TV and some interactive little animals that react to the Wand

I ordered the birthday package for like $99 and the Scoops princess package which was $89. Both were extremely overpriced i will never buy that again. Cake was too dry and old. I would stick with the free activities like the pajama party. Those were fin for the kids and the parents alike.

Very nice resort with extremely friendly, nice and accommodating staff. Checking in can be a bit difficult and takes a long time because of the number of people checking in and out.  The resort is very fun for children of all ages. Good food and lots of attractions. What stood out the most to our entire family was the amazing staf for their customer service. Congratulations to the management team!

Summary Heading: Nice water park but only good for age under 12
Summary: Nice Water park, Warm and strong Chlorine smell.  Staff working at the 4D movies and Bowling aread were rude and mean to my kids.   Not friendly and say somthing unnecessary. Room is fine.  We had the Kid cabin with 3 bund beds and queen bed.  Not worth to pay about $1700.00 for two nights with 2 audlts and 3 kids under 12. Coffee price is little too high for medium cup of coffee ( Just regular coffee) for $4.00.  Suggest to go outside to eat!   There are a lot of good resturant around the area.

Summary Heading: Great for kids 12 & under.  Extra charges for everything else other than pools
Summary: We live local and thought it would be fun to bring our 9 year old daughter and two friends.  The kids had a blast for the two days.  Several areas for them to play and there were always watch full life guards on duty at every swim/play area.  Our room was larger than many properties we have stayed at.  Had two queen beds and a double pull out sofa.  Micro & mini frig which was good to store our many drinks and snack, because they will not allow you to bring in any of your personal drinks or food into the swim area. They search every bag.  Only item you can bring in was your own H2O bottles.  Hence, you had to buy their food & drinks.  They also had an extensive arcade play are, but all game cost additional.  Parking isn't free either.  Not much for adults to do.

Summary Heading: Great value for the family experience!
Summary: Loved the Great Wolf Lodge! The waterpark was so much fun my son enjoyed the big kid water slides and the surfing area. My younger two had a blast in the kiddie pool that also had activities and water slides. The water was warm and they provide towels! The food is affordable and overall a great family experience. The rooms are big and the beds were average. The water park lacks diaper changing stations. The diaper changing area is only located in the private family/unisex bathroom. I counted only two in the entire water park. There was a long line to use this private bathroom. This was my only issue.

It was a fun vacation spot for our family. It does get pricey when you have to add up all the fees and costs as it already is expensive to book in the first place. In the end it cost us a great deal more than we anticipated it being. The kids enjoyed it though so it was a fun time.

Yes, this place is pricey, but guess what? You get what you pay for! My family of 5 had an amazing and very fun experience at this Lodge. It was our first stay, and we really enjoyed the water park, in addition to several other activities. We didn't get to everything, especially since it was a one night stay, but we took advantage of the later hours on the night of our arrival, and had a blast. The staff was super nice and helpful, the place is immaculate, the room was comfortable, and we'll be back!

We had 5 kids ages 3-13 and they all had a blast. Extremely friendly staff and the resort was very clean. The water park was amazing and the kids went from slide to slide. Their smiling faces were worth every dollar we spent!

Summary Heading: Birthday Fun! Half of the trip canceled due to injury that needed stitches.
Summary: Surprised my daughter by taking her here for her sixth birthday. We came with my best friend and her family so we decided to go big and get the most expensive room in the hotel. The 2 bedroom Grizzly Bear Suite. It was a good size room 1 king, 2 queens and a pull out bed in the living room. It was the right size for our 4 adults and 4 children. We had a blast the day we arrived with a birthday celebration in our room. The next day, we woke up ready for a full day at the water park. We paid quite a bit of money for this 1 night stay so we wanted to take full advantage of the water park and get our money worth. Got right down to the park at 9 am when it opened, got our spot and started to go on the slides. 10:30 am comes along and I am doing a last check in our room to make sure

Our whole family enjoyed everything at the resort & we are already planning a return trip for next winter. In our opinion, this place is a great for any age, including teenagers! We would recommend staying at least 2 nights.

This new Great Wolf Lodge has it all!! A Spacious and Clean Property with an outstanding water park with great slides, a wave pool, and other water activities. The kidcabin rooms are very cool. Kids will enjoy immensely. Guaranteed!! A little pricy but you clearly get your monies worth at this location!!!

I recommend this amazing resort to anyone who likes water &/or water parks . The staff is so friendly & helpful. Great family fun. You get a wrist band that you use as a room key, entrance to water park, & it's also linked to your credit card so you don't have to carry money in your swimsuit (very convient)

What a wonderful vacation! Love this place! There's something for all ages going on all the time!  The kids slept in a Wolf Den...they were So happy & excited!  We stayed in a theme room (reasonably priced).  It's like an all inclusive resort. It's so much fun!  Super friendly & welcoming staff. They go above & beyond to make guests happy! (Like Disney used to).    Move over Disney! Great Wolf Lodge is just down the street.  Seriously, just go south on Harbor Blvd.

We Went to celebrate my sons 6th birthday and great wolf lodge staff made it so special. We will be going back for more birthday celebrations. This place is so fot for kids of all ages including adults

If you have kids, this is the perfect place. I actually love it more than Disneyland. There's always something to do for fun or relax. It's comfortable and everyone is entertained. The service is excellent. And there's a good variety of restaurants so you don't feel the need to leave.

Family staycation for my sons 10th bday. This was our 5th time stay at the resort this year and like always everybody had a blast.  Even dad, exspecially with the full bar and football on the flat screens. The water park has something for everybody, the 10 year olds and dad went on the super scary slides. while I hung out with the toddlers in the baby section (which has a safety gate to trap them from roaming around) one bummer is you can not go down any slides that don't require a tube with your children, which sucks if your 3year old is a chicken and refuses to go down by himself.

we travel from PHX. AZ   grand parents.  Our family lives 2 miles away. So we meet at Wolfs lodge. an have fun. our 4 grand children, an my Daughter in law's family come also.  we have fun at water park for a day or two.

Great experience. They really cater to kids. Will definitely return to a Great Wolf Lodge! I would recommend this experience to anyone with or even without kids. Fun for adults too!! They have activities from sun up to sun down!!

Visited to celebrate a family birthday and there is plenty to do here.  Although primarily focused on the kids pleasant for adults too.  Double room has two beds plus sofa bed so roomy.  Good room darkening shades, micro, small fridge, coffee maker and separate commode/shower area and sink area.    Full activity schedule from 8 am till 10 pm with a 24 hour arcade.  Some activities cost extra, others are included.  Not at a Disney level but fun.  Several restaurants on site from Dunkin Donuts, nice Lodge Grill, buffets and poolside snack bar.  Located near main retail/lodging area so there are outside choices if desired.

Great Experience for my daughter and her friends. We enjoyed the whole stay. It was a little pricey. No doubt, we will come back.  Food was definitely pricey.  The mattresses in the bunk beds were not that comfortable.

Great time with our two young kiddos! Clean, great service, nice folks, cute rooms & lots of interactive activities for the whole family. My 7 year old wants to go back already. We enjoyed the waterpark, the room, the food, arcade, mini golf, virtual shooting game, treats and morning yoga!

Over priced.  Not a good value for family. Some of the staff were not very friendly.  Food did not have any taste at the lodge grill. Food from the water park, itself, was pricey and not worth the price

We stayed in the cheapest family suit we could afford. It was big and very nice. The staff is very friendly. We did not feel insecure at the water park. We had lots of fun! Only thing we will not do next time is eat at the loose moose Buffett. The food was just okay but the wait service was awful. That's literally my only complaint. Everything else about our stay was awesome!

We had a great time here.  I have a 4 and 7 year old and both had a blast and were entertained the whole time.  We were able to check in and go straight to the water park.  All staff were courteous and attentive.

A truly terrific family entertainment resort. Enjoyed by all ages.  The resort provides everything needed to have fun. The kids cabin suite was worth the extra cost.  The restaurants' menus were tasty and not overpriced.  Although picky eaters might have a problem.

This was a great family place! Only thing I wish was different was the water temp. It was to cold, my poor kids had to get out every 10min to warm up. I did not get to enjoy the water park because it was to cold.

We loved that we were able to upgrade our stay the day of. Kids loved running around and spending the whole day at the water park while right after spending the night at the arcade and shopping. Our room was comfortable and very clean!

Birthday gift for my son ! Very costly like Disneyland prices! Disappointed with food taste! Suite prices are very high! Games pass were were reasonable but was not provided with many games . Esquivel at the front desk gave excellent service and accommodated my requests!

We will definitely be returning. A great place for families and friends. We took my son for his 6th birthday and he loved it. The rooms were exceptionally clean and the water park was as well. You can't go wrong visiting this place!

We had a wonderful time at the resort again! It's a great place to have a little gettaway! Our kids had a really good time at the surf area. The lines were not long at all due to low season. We went during the second week of January when most kids are back to school already. I highly recommend it.

Lodge was very clean with very friendly service. Kids had a great time and so did I. We stayed Thursday thru Saturday and the place was never overwhelmed by to many people. That was a huge plus for me because like most people I don't like waiting in line for hours to do something.

We decided to take our children (Ages 3 & 6) for the weekend.  We arrived on Saturday afternoon and decided to valet park as it was only $19 versus $12 for self parking, which I thought was reasonable.  At check-in the clerk gave my daughter a special Birthday set of ears and my son a set as well which I thought was a very nice touch.  Our room was ready and we headed up.  Our room was a wolf den family suite which my kids were excited about since they get to sleep in bunkbeds and had their own TV.  The room from my perspective was disappointing.  Not what I expected for a $550 a night room.  I bet the hotel 6 down the roads rooms were nicer than this room.  But we weren't here for the rooms so I guess it is what it is.  Please lower your expectations.  We made our way down to

Great wolf lodge is very family oriented and offers many fun filled activities for all ages. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the water park was super fun and the overall experience was well worth the price. We will be back!

I brought my daughter to Great Wolf Lodge for her bday with a few of her friends and we had a blast!  The service was exceptional and they made her feel so special.  The kids couldn't stop playing in the water park and lots of activities to do here!  We will be back!

The resort made for a great family vacation.  A lot of fun activities for any age.  The souvenirs were a bit pricey but still a great overall experience.  The waterpark was absolutely excellent.  Neither of my children are good swimmers but that did not matter.  Many safe and fun options available for my entire family.

A perfect place to go to get out of "LA" and have some fun with your family without having to travel too far!  We really enjoyed the fact that we didn't have to carry our wallets or a key around and didn't have to worry about protecting our stuff.  The activities were all great and our family had a wonderful time there!

Summary Heading: Fun but expensive family get away
Summary: This is a fun place! Expensive tho! We stayed only one night and spent close to $1200 and this is without doing any of the extras. The water park is a lot of fun but the lines got a bit long because there were only 2 employees running 4 slides and had to go back and forth.  Another dissappointment was Disneyland was having a Star Wars Marathon and even though we stayed in a family suite, we were woken up at 6am by the marching band! The windows are not sound proof at all.  The kids had a great time, we had fun just getting away as a family for the night. The steakhouse is really tasty

We love great wolf lodge! Lots to do with family. Food is junk food and over priced. Water park is fun.  We have been there 6 times since it opened in feb 2016. Cant wait to take my son for his birthday next month.

This place is great. From the accommodations, water park, dining and all activities. Everything went well for us. There is something for everyone to do. I highly recommend The Great Wolf Lodge. A good place for quality family time.

Water park is fun, restaurant food is terrible.. stick with pizza or go out to eat.  DO NOT STAY on the second floor, as they have piping issues, terrible noise... ask about it before you go to your room.  But overall, your kids will love the water park.

Great Wolf Lodge was way better then we expected!! Went wanting to get away with the little one and hoping she had a great time but turned out to be so much fun for even us the adults. Highly recomment it and plan to go back soon with the rest of the family

Summary Heading: Family fun for a reasonable price
Summary: With the military discount offered this is an affordable weekend get-a-way for a family.  We brought 3 twelve year old boys.  Should have dished out the $80 a piece for a paw pass.  Ended up spending $180 at the arcade and magicquest anyway in addition to $100 birthday package.  The boys had a blast though.  The environment is safe enough for them to roam fairly independently without constant supervision which made for a more relaxing experience for my husband and I as well as more fun for them I am sure.  We bought them the refillable souvenir cups which was a great investment for us.  The buffet was smaller but had good variety of quality food.  Having a fridge and micro in room allowed for breakfast and snacks to be prepared in suite.  Pizza was good and reasonably priced for

We were looking for a place to take kids during a holiday weekend without leaving town and was referred to by a friend. It was amazing for the kids and for the adults as well. They have drinks for sell in the pool area for adults and good food.

Summary Heading: Room was blowing cold air for heat, the unit was making noise worst night sleep ever and my daughter got a cold.
Summary: Room was blowing coldair for heat, the unit was making noise worst night sleep ever and my daughter got a cold. I call for service and he wasn't able to help instead they brought 2 blankets. TERRIBLE. I expect this resort to do the right thing.

We had a great time. Something for all our kids ages 13-2 to do. We pulled the kids out of school and went during the winter and it was pretty empty so lines were very short for the water park. Plan on spending money, food, parking and other attractions add up but we had a great time and will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Eh, not bad, but not great
Summary: I took my 10 yo daughter and her two friends for an overnight. They enjoyed the water park and I felt it was a safe and fun environment. Overall, the water park was far smaller than I expected and you are completely nickel and dimed for food and all other activities beyond the water park (which is included in the room rate).

We had a total of 3 rooms, 2 family suites, and 1 wolf den, totaling 15 people. We had a great time. This trip was actually for my triplets 11th birthday party. The rooms seem to be sound proof because we played games and music and none of it could be heard in the hallways. That was a big. Plus

The best vacation evarrrr. We are going back again this week actually :) they say you can't give friends a day pass to visit you... the trick is to add them as a guest to your room for $50 each and voila they get a wristband.

great family time in safe environment at reasonable price.  We will return and make Great Wolf Lodge an annual family outing.  Great memories are made during these family outings.  We highly recommend Great Wolf Lodge as an excellent family event.

It's an all year round water park, so that's already a plus. Water temperatures are great. Pricing is very reasonable specially if booked in advance. I did last minute booking and still saved $200. To top everything their service is amazing and very family oriented. No one turned me down on any question or direction I needed help with.

Overall good experience. NOT inexpensive by any means but there are ways to avoid shelling out tons of cash. Sometimes felt they were an employee short in some areas but didnt kill overall experience. Will visit again in the future.

Awesome experience lots of fun and kids had a blast with all the activities...only thing is they weren't aware of the quest until late so we got a late start and couldn't finish the day with all the other swim time going on

Overall very happy with Great Wolf. The air in the water park is a little too warm, especially when not going in the water. The rooms can be a little pricey. Good for special occasion though. Next time hope to be able dine in another one of the restaurants.

We went off season so it was very comfortable without long lines.  The food was surprisingly very good and high quality.  You don't find Lobster Bisque just anywhere.  Ok, there was not goose liver but the bone in rib eye was delicious.

Summary Heading: Super fun for kids and adults
Summary: This is our second time staying here.  We had a blast.  The kids love the waterpark and they are big enough now to enjoy a lot more of the slides.  We really enjoy the food at the breakfast buffet.  We do wish the food and other entertainment was more affordable, but there is a ton to eat right outside the hotel that we brought in.

The whole family had a great time. It's the cleanest water park that we have visited. It's open all year long. Friendly staff and great customer service. The kids can't wait to go back. We will be back sion.

My kids love the indoor water park and the other activities  available at the resort. This is our second visit to the resort and we would visit it again in the future. Every restaurant we ate at had great food. Overall excellent experience.

Great place to take the family.  My kids had a blast. The resort has lots to do, is clean and well maintained and every single person who we encountered who worked there, was extremely friendly.  Food was great too!  We can not wait to go back...and we will...soon!!!

Summary Heading: a waste of a good family vacation time and money
Summary: We planned our vacation at the great Wolf Lodge for my daughter who has been so excited to go for her birthday only to be extremely disappointed when we got there not only did no one acknowledge her birthday but also staff were extremely rude  management were  not very educated  as to the park customer service related  issues  Or getting back to me in a timely matter

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for the kids!
Summary: Why stay at a regular hotel on your Disneyland trip, when you can come here for the relative same cost! Amazing theme hotel for the kids and the water rides are amazing.  This place does have a tendency to nickle and dime you for some mundane activities like the scavenger hunt. But your kids will love it here nonetheless.

Common areas in water park bathroom are nasty. Dont stay on second or third floor due to noise in pipes. Food is great. Price is good if you have coupon. This was our second time coming. Very family friendly.

Great activities for all ages and for large families. But its only worth the price because you can play the day of your check-in and the day of your check-out.  Otherwise the price isn't worth a just a hotel room and a few activities.

It's our first time at a Great Wolf Lodge Resort & we totally enjoyed our stay & loved everything about it!  It's a new resort so everything is still clean & in great shape. I hope they take care of it & maintain it properly so we can go back often.

We absolutely loved staying here. We spent two day just at the water park. Everyone there were so helpful. They understood my crazy kids and were fine with them being loud and active. The rooms were nice. (Wish we would've upgraded to a split room) I will stay here again. Our whole family loved it!!

January is my kids' birthday month, and since they love water and swimming, we decided to spend some time here. It was a great idea! Ilove tha this place is indoor and warm all the time. January was a perfect month since it was very lightly ocupied. My kids are not very interested in their other activities, like their MagiQuest, they just love the waterpark. My kids are 4 and 8, there was plenty enough for them to do.

Summary Heading: Just as good as we hoped!
Summary: We (me, husband and 5 year old son) stayed here for 5 days and had a great time!  In fact we wish we had more time, because it was hard to juggle wanting to go to Disneyland for a few days, and do all the activities at the hotel too.   One thing we loved about this hotel was that, at almost any time of day, you would see people wandering around in their pajamas!  Lol.  It creates a nice relaxing atmosphere!!  Location: we had a rental car and had to drive about 5-10 mins to get to Disneyland.  We didn't wander around the hotel outside at all. It looks like not much around. A few fast places across the street.    Room: not huge but not too cramped either.  It was quiet when we slept at night which surprised me, with a hotel full of lots of kids!  Waterpark: awesome!  I saw other

This was a wonderful family trip.  The Great Wolf crew was very attentive and made us feel  comfortable and safe with our six-year-old son going  even going down the waterslides.  We would love to go back when we get the chance.

This resort is amazing! From the time we checked in to the time we left, everyone was friendly and helpful. We arrived at 12:30 on our first day and our room was ready for us:-) We ordered the birthday package- so there was a big banner on our door and cake and balloons in our room. It cost an extra 99 dollars, but you get 40 dollars in food credit and 20 dollars in game tokens- so for 29 dollars we got a 1/4 sheet cake, balloons and a banner...and an unforgettable smile on my 3 year old granddaughter's face! We always bring bread and peanut butter and jelly for the hourly snacks and then we eat at the buckets place in the water park. The food is good and the prices are reasonable. My entire family loves going...I'm 52 and I love all the water slides (including the drop down

I am a local and my kids had been wanting to come to this resort for a while, so I decided to give it a try.  The water park is awesome! The temperature is awesome! At first the chlorine is a bit too strong , but then we got used to it right away.   My kids truly had a blast. The food is pricey, but  I was actually surprised that it was really good, especially the pizza. It is pricey for the rooms, wish they gave some type of discounts to locals, but Awesome mini vacation. The water park is really safe and I absolutely love that they have some many lifeguards on duty. I booked the wolf den for the kids and they loved the room. Would definitely recommend to anyone that has children. They will have a blast!

We to9j our whole family on a quick mini vacation. Plan was one day at Great Wolf Waterpark one day a Knotts. Did first day at your facility. Got rained out at Knotts. All the children didn't even hesitate, "let's go back to Great Wolf water park". Had a blast and made some great memories.

Summary Heading: my family having a good experience is not valued
Summary: I'm very irritated because despite the fact that my family visited in both August and December of 2016, Great Wolf Lodge would not honor my request for a credit of $17 when I was double billed for parking, both valet and self on the same day at the same time. Though I admittedly valet parked, I requested a credit because the mistake was clearly made by GWL, but after speaking to 3 people, I was only given the $10 that should have never been charged in the first place. No one offered to credit me $17 instead of $10 or to offer a credit in another area since apparently there has to be a parking charge. A customer has been lost and a negative review posted over $17, which says to me that my family having a good experience is not valued.

Summary Heading: Get away without going far - Great experience at newest SoCal waterpark
Summary: Waterparks and beaches can be so exhausting because of the sun exposure, the yards and yards of walking, the mess and being far from your supply base.  Great Wolf Lodge solves all of that.  I loved having my hotel room connected to the park and having only hotel guests being allowed in.  So convenient.  Park was great for all ages.  Our youngest was 2; oldest 75.  Clean, spacious.  Get there while it's new and awesome.  Programming outside of waterpark could be more exciting, but staff genuinely tries to keep kids entertained.  Best part is that even in their fine dining area, young kids were accepted and wanted vs. merely tolerated.

Summary Heading: If u want to be weaken up at 930 am and room service tell u that u need to get out bcse a family it's waiting for ur roo
Summary: Don't ever go there and think u could sleep in even after u ask for late check out. Room service will be knocking in ur room ever 15 minutes to get out and this is not even busy season wow what a bday for my grandson

Love this place have visited multiple times for quick weekend getaway only gripe I have is the food venues are not as family friendly as they could be both price, menu and wait times could use some work to make this a superior experience.

Summary Heading: Awesome and awefull at the same time!
Summary: Awesome concept and very well excecuted. It would have been the perfect place to spend the weekend but air at the indook Park  I don't think is breathable.  The chlorine is an issue.  My daughter was coughing after anhour at the park and i had headaches and dissiness at night.

We had the time of our lives. My family and I went to GWL for my daughters birthday and was not disappointed. This was a fantastic experience, full of activities and character sightings. We are looking forward to returning in March.

Was blown away by the exception customer service by the whole staff.  The front desk employees made us feel comfortable and excited to be staying there.  This was for my daughters 7th bday party and it couldn't of been a better experience.  Kudos to the whole staff.

My grandson loves the place so much, all of kids activities and the water park. Very nice service and friendly staff. Perfect location because it is close to our house. My grandson doesn't want to leave the water park

The front desk clerk that checked us in was VERY RUDE!! We were there for my dayghter's bday and asked if they can do a free upgrade or give her paw pass and she said "NO! The only thing we give out is the bday ear! HERE! (She out it in the desk in front of us) Please look at your fd camera. We also mentioned that our daughter got a cut on her finger opening the shampoo last time we were there in june 2016. She said "well you should have called the security and filed a report" i said "we didn't know no ine told us that when we went to front desk and asked for medicine and bandaid becauae she was bleeding" her rude response was "well that was not our fault you should've called security instead of going to the front desk!" She said all that infront of my kids so i asked to talk to

The place was clean and the whole family loved it - kids aged 3, 9, 12.  The slides were awesome and the baby area was perfect for my 3 year old.  I wish there were more food options, but the restaurants were actually pretty good so it worked out.

Dirty rooms and horrid check in. The pool area and slides where fun. The add one are super expensive. For almost $500 a night I expected a clean room, working refridgerator, follow through from staff and timely checkin ins

excellent! great fun for the kids! very convenient for the adults. and was great to be all inclusive so you didn't have to carry a wallet or worry about forgetting belongings at the pool because the room was so close.

great room, great staff ,great breakfast, we just had a blast...we would do it all again soon..we had a family celebration there my little girl turned four years old.....can't wait to go again...I was very pleased.

Water in park a bit cold for adult watching their children...could not bring in small snack to feed three year olds and did not want to give them what they sell at poolside like white flour pretzel with salt.  Whole place is way overpriced like charging for parking when you already paid a lot to rent a room.

This is an excellent place to have fun with family and friends.  Lots to do for kids and waterpark fun for all ages.  Nice restaurants, so you never have to leave the lodge.  Nice place to go in the winter if you want to get away from the cold.  Has an arcade, mini bowling, mini golf, and laser frenzy.  Also, has a Dunkin' Donuts on the property, which the kids loved.

Severely disappointed in our stay.  The rooms were bland and the customer service was lacking.  For the price you pay $300+ a night I will stay closer to Disneyland and enjoy their waterslides. They don't even offer a shuttle to Disney which was fine.  Lyft was a $7 trip.

This is a great place for your family for kids for a group of grown ups to go enjoy the water and rides teenagers would love it. All of my friends love this place some have came already in the lot are planning to go

Spent my son's birthday this year at the park. Got a discounted price from groupon so i feel the price is reasonable.My three kids had a blast! Starting a new family tradition and hopefully, things will stay the same at this great resort!

Spent one night there in December.  Went to the water park on a Sunday and it wasn't too crowded. Most of the times, the wait times were 5 minutes or less for a water ride. The room was clean and comfortable. They give you an electronic, water proof wristband at check in, so that everything can be charged to the room and you don't have to carry your money around. The staff were all super friendly. We got breakfast delivered to our room (there's a Dunkin Donuts in the resort that offers breakfast room service).  It's also very close to Disneyland, as we went to Downtown Disney for dinner.  The resort has a restaurant, arcade, and other things to do, but we spent most of our time at the water park, which for two adults, was still quite fun.  We'll definitely come back.

We took our 8 year old and almost 6 year old for Christmas.  They had a GREAT time and my husband and I really enjoyed it too.  The water park was by far the best part of our stay.  Next time we go I think we'd do the magiquest over the arcade.

Everything is good except for conditional in the room. They provide 2 in 1 shampoo. With price we paid, we should get a separate bottle of conditional. We are in the water all day. Paying attention to small details makes a company great.

Recent trip to wolf lodge was ok. The extra activities can get pricey. We were not informed that we needed reservations for the restaurant there were plenty of tables open and we had three starving kids that had been at the water park for hours and the hostess quoted us an hour and a half wait time. She suggested that we go to the buffet. We hate buffets and it was so expensive and no one was even at the buffet. Seemed weird that that there was such a long wait when there were plenty of tables and the resort was not that packed. So we waited at the arcade for the text from the hostess for an hour and a half and never got her text. We then went back and the restaurant was empty and she said oh I was just going to text you. So rude!

Kids enjoyed the water park most. Rooms were clean and overall the hotel and everything else too. A nice, fun local mini vacation spot. Lots of activities and different in hotel places to eat. Food was delicious in all of those places we are.

We had such a wonderful time at Great wolf! There is always something to do, even beyond the water park. Although it was busy while we were there over the holidays, the lines weren't long and everything moved smooth. Our 8 and 4 year old boys said this was our best family vacation ever!

Had a great time but even more did my kids. My 6 & 4 year old over it but my 3 year old not so much since most activities are restricted due to him being under 44".  We are locals and did not stay at out room nor eat at any of the restaurants because we decided to use our favorite restaurant on our way home but the restaurants did seem busy, so they must be good.

We are a family of four with two kids ages 11 and 8. Great Wolf Lodge was a HUGE hit for our New Year's Weekend trip. The waterpark was fun (if crowded); the magiquest game kept the kids busy for hours and gave them a huge sense of accomplishment running around the resort and solving puzzles on their own. The room was nice with the kids loving the bunk beds in "Wolf Den" suite. Staff is friendly and helpful - to a PERSON they were kind and helpful. The wristband charging to your rooms and wristband keys worked really well for our family. The only services problems were the Bear Paws Sweets & Eats was understaffed and slow, and the Hungry as a Wolf pizza place - really, you are charging me a dollar for a packet of Ranch when we just spent $50? But it really was an outstanding

Great place to go / stay if you have kids between 2 and 12 or 13.  Nice hotel with everything you need inside - restaurants, arcade, etc and of course the huge indoor waterpark.  Been there twice and both great experiences.  Friendly staff.  Can have some lines for water slides so go on a weekday if you can!

Great place for a family vacation.  THey something for everyone.  I have 3 sons (8,6,2) who all enjoyed their stay.  They have a toddler pool, lazy river, wave pool, ropes course and many other activities.

Summary Heading: A fYou can NEVER be bored!
Summary: This resort is a wonderful place to visit, especially if you have young children.  We were a family of 8 and we all had a fantastic time!  I loved everything about the resort, but my ultimate favorite was the bed and pillow.  I haven't had a great sleep in a hotel before.  This was a wonderful first!

It was a lot of fun. The kids really enjoy the water fun!  You will not be disappointed.   There is NO Starbucks :(    There should always be a Starbucks at every kid friendly place for the adults.  Great Wolf in Washington State has Starbucks!

I took my nephews and my brother and we all had a great time. The resort was clean and the staff was friendly.  Our room was available before check-in so that was a plus! The water park was clean and they had plenty of towels for people to use after a great day in the water. I did not expect to have so much fun!

Summary Heading: Family of four New Years visit
Summary: Our first experience at a Great Wolf Lodge. Two kids ages 8 and 11. They loved it. Good variety of water slides, wave pool, surf/boogie board area. Room was standard, no themed room but a decent size. Smell, yes very chlorinated but not overwhelming. Wasn't insanely busy and longest wait time was about 10 mins for a slide. Few tips, bring your own food. Food is not the best, and pricey for what it is. Hot the water park early. There are somethings like the surfing that is only offered the first hour of the day (the rest of the day it is boogie boarding) Everything in the store is expensive. There is a Target sown the street, use it. If your kiddo has sensitive skin have them shower off a few times a day and take a break from the water area during peak times. We did the prepaid

Summary Heading: Highlight of our winter break in SoCal
Summary: We stayed for 1 night at this water park & resort.  Everyone in our family had a great time.  Enjoyed water slides, wave pool, lazy river, etc.  The crowds and lines were NOT overwhelming like some of the other theme parks in the area.  This is probably due to the fact that you have to stay overnight to play at the water park so it keeps occupancy levels naturally in check.  Overall the place was very well kept(clean), the staff was very professional and customer service was exceptional.  We decided to try the couple of restaurant and food options onsite and it was actually quite decent.  Most of the food was prepared to order and not pre-made, so you may have to wait a little for your food to be ready.  Lastly, when we left the water park for the day, we can easily walk right

This place is amazing for children of any ages, we really had a great time. I wish the room were a little bigger, otherwise our overall stay experience was excellent. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend quality time with family

Had a great time with the family here. There was a lot to do at the resort. Only gripe was the price and quality of food, it was outrageous. Anyone who wants to eat i suggest they drive 3 minutes in either direction from the Lodge to go eat. Its much cheaper and better quality. But everything else about the resort was perfect

Summary Heading: I had no idea this place existed
Summary: Indoor waterslides, fun hotel - perfect combination. Everything seems to have a little sticker shock these days, but if it's in your budget... you gotta go. Safe environment, great amenities, everything is new, good service. The Howlin' Tornado waterslide still gets my hearts pumping thinking about it - the sensation of "am I going to be safe" while riding it, then "I want to do that again" when it's over. Another benefit is it's not overly crowded.

It's our first time as a family to get together cause I was station at Africa and it's nice to have fun with the kids. I would like to come back next time and get a little bit discounts on our stay since I'm recommending my friends and family to come to this place.

This was a quick winter vacation trip. We wanted something local and different and thought a water park in December would be fun. For such a small property there is a lot to do. The water park was super clean, the staff were friendly, and the lines were short. My teenager had less fun than my ten-year-old but both had a good time. I was originally going to stay two days but one afternoon and morning was plenty.

Can't wait to go back!   Exceeded our every expectation!  Every aspect of it was unbelievable. Thank you for a job well done! It was my daughters best birthday ever and none of us wanted to leave! We will be back as soon as we possibly can!

Awesome place for younger kids.  My 6 and 4 year old had a blast.  Hotel and water park were clean and the staff was excellent.  Skip the breakfast buffet though.  It's not worth the price.  The other food places were up to par.

Summary Heading: A great alternative to an overcrowded and overpriced Disneyland.
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge will replace our Disneyland days on our next vacation. There is a lot more family friendly fun without the crazy crowds. We did both on this vacation and the Great Wolf Lodge was overall a much better activity.

This resort is perfect for families.  The waterpark is amazing and the amenities are plentiful.  I think it's a great value.  The suite was very nice with a refrigerator and microwave.  I like that the waterpark is only open to hotel guests.

Summary Heading: A GREAT PLACE FOR THE FAMILY
Summary: This message ONLY applies if you Are a asthma patient, or  have kids with asthma.   The high levels of chlorine in the in door water park will trigger a asthma episode to children/adults with asthma or allergies.

Summary Heading: For $1000.00 it better be worth it For those who don't know GWL is a inside water park and hotel
Summary: I began our journey on Groupon and bought one night for a discounted price.I was celebrating 2 birthdays. I valeted because it was easier with the 4 kids. The check in process was smooth not to busy.At check in, is were you get your water passes, wolf passes and "wolfie ears"for the whole family. I suggest doing research on line about different passes.The Hotel was just Ok nothing to special. It was the water park that the kids had a'lot of fun in.There is a Dunkin Donuts, a family style type restaurant and also a steak sit down type place to eat.I dont recommend the food at the buffet as only some of it was edible. This place honestly has the worst coffee I've ever had.There is a bar outside, poolside that offers Adult type snacks. We had lunch at the hot dog place outside and

Great family fun. Better with family! Do yourself a favor and book a stay. You'll be surprised with how easy it is to get around the complex. All-in-one type of experience. You will feel at home...like a giant pool party!

We visited Great Wolf Lodge for the winter  holiday. The hotel was festive and fun. The staff was very friendly. The water park was well organized and moved people easily. We've stayed at several Great Wolf properties (Madison, WI and Poconos, PA) and appreciated the conveyor belt that carried your four person tube to the top flight of stairs and the thrill rides like the wolf tail (Drops you down a chute) and the surf pool. Our kids are 9-11 and they enjoyed Magi Quest. If they had problems solving the game the staff was clever and helped them to keep going without giving away the game. The scoops soap they put in the room that smells like cotton candy smells so good!! If you bring your cups/wands from other resorts they honor them and allow you free refills and playing the

The strangest thing about this place is you have to book a hotel in order to enter the water park.  If you think about it, it's brilliant because they basically built a Motel 6 in Garden Grove and charge 1st class rates for those rooms.  Having said that, it is a fun getaway.  Kids love it, it was warm in the dome....so no complaints.

We were looking for somewhere to go for a couple days that was close to our home and I heard about GWL from a friend. We had no idea what to expect and we were pleasantly surprised! I have two kids that are 9 years apart so it is challenging to find an activity that entertains both of them but this place definitely did. There was so much to do and when we got tired from the water park, there was an arcade, bowling, virtual reality theater and mini golf.  We had a blast! Next time, I would upgrade my room to the one with a "wolf den" because I think it would be better for the kids as our sleeping arrangements were rough with 2 small beds for a family of 4. It was a last minute decision and I am so glad we went!!!

Great place for family and kids. A little pricy but well worth it!!  Food was good and activities were fun and kept kids very entertained. Staff is wonderful. Resort is clean and well staffed. Very safe environment.

We stayed during New Year's Eve. The children activities they had that night were a little bit sad, so that was a HUGE dissapointment. They were supposed to have a bubble show and a puppet show which turned out to be a lady blowing bubbles to the audile (no show really) and the puppet show had also no rhyme or reason to it. The kids were SUPER bored with that. Good thing is that they didn't really care because they had just spent the day at their awesome waterpark, which was full, but was still doable and the lines were not very long. We had a lot of fun there! The activities that followed the kid's New Year's Eve party were fun. Live DJ, raffle prices were great! Rooms were super clean and the people that work there are very nice.

Bring bottled water....lots of it Really crowded during holidays...book early. No need to bring food from outside as food is affordable here. Nice location as other theme resort is just a few minutes away.

Great Vacation time to get out the cold weather and enjoy the indoor aquatic parks. From the smallest kid to the oldest adult everyone had a fabulous time. Wolf tail is a must try for everyone Enjoy it

Our Family went to the Great  Wolf Lodge in California for New Years Eve.  Spent a single night over New Years.  Wolf Den for that one night cost over 750.00 after all the taxes and room charges.  We had children with as much as a 10 year age gap between them.  There was something for everyone to do, some free, some not.  The Magi quest for kids starts at 20 per wand and 15 per game (there are 3 games).  We were told a single game should last a child for roughly 8 hours, my son and daughter finished their game in about 2, and most of that was elevator wait time...  Bowling, and miniature Golf are pay to play.  If you want to experience everything, and have multiple children, the costs can get out of control quickly.  The water-park was great and given that only guest are allowed

Summary Heading: Great water park but hotel needs some work
Summary: We had a good experience with the water park and the kids activities, but the hotel stay wasn't great. We stayed one night at the hotel, and were a little disappointed. First of all, we have smaller kids, so we usually go to bed early. Once we got them settled in for the night, we could hear every person that walked by the room. This usually included a few noisy teenagers and even some loud mouth adults, It was a chore to put the kids to bed under these conditions.  Finally got hem to sleep, and wouldn't you believe it, they started some construction project at 7am in the morning in the room above us!!! Drilling and pounding the floor (our ceiling). Of course, everyone was cranky with very little sleep. The next day proved to be a challenge! No warning or anything! There were

Summary Heading: Great Adventure for the enire family
Summary: SO much fun and so many memories.  Great selection of food items at the buffet, but no Gluten Free selections and service was a bit spotty.  Exec Chef helped to smooth rough spots over and we were satisfied.  There were 11 in our party, grandparents, kids and grandkids.

Endless things to do. Water park, arcade, spa, activities. great reasonable food. a paradise for my water baby. Great activities in the lobby- seemed like all the time including SNOW! I would highly recommend for family vacation.

It was nice to have everything under one roof. We ate, slept and played without having to leave the premises. Kids had a really really great memorable Christmas vacation. We would definitely consider doing this again.

Great for many age ranges. Always something for everyone to do. Hours of everything were convenient. Aside from the breakfast,  which is as good as any Dennys or IHOP, is very fast- food like. That could be improved. Staff is helpful and friendly. But don't leave anything behind, itll take forever to get a hold of security to try and get it back.

Overall great experience.   The hotel and facilities are great.   The housekeeping staff is fantastic, hard working.  The front desk, check-in process is only average.  You will get your room and use the swim parks, but felt like the sting desk would just do enough and say enough to you, but I did not feel it was 5 Star service at the front.

Parents and son were having fun . A little pricey but worthy . I already recommend to my friends, family and colleagues. One to 2 days is enough for me.. I'm sure we're coming back again.. but I will look up for promotion dates.

My family visited the resort in late December. That day it was raining so being at an indoor park was great.  Unfortunately many of the pool areas were closed for extended times. In addition the Chlorine levels were so high one of my kids could not stay in the pool areas.  Prior to arriving at the resort we stayed at another resort in La Quinta and my kids stayed in the pools.  According my kids were clearly not allergic to chlorine.

Summary Heading: Great value for a family vacation
Summary: The best thing about this place is that the prices for food and souvenirs is not inflated like other theme parks. We ate lunch and dinner there and you got a lot of food for the same price as restaurants in the area. It's not like disneyland where feeding a family of five for lunch costs you close to $100 for a small burger and fries meal. Their cafe in the water park is great for a quick bite and the prices are fair. Souvenirs are affordable. Make sure you look at their paw passes before buying anything, they are a great deal.

Highly recommend this resort for families especially during the non-summer season but great for all types of weather.  The hotel staff, especially the lifeguards, are extremely attentive to the children.  The food is great and reasonably priced.

Our family had a blast This hotel and water park was a great addition to hotels in anaheim We have stayed at the Californian at Disneyland and pay $500 a night We paid under $400 and we got the water park  And food was much cheaper  Great service

Summary Heading: Happy Family! A bit pricey but worth it!
Summary: We had a blast! It can get very expensive so plan on spending money. The bunk beds are very cool and the kids loved them! It have my husband and I time to our TV shows while the kids played in their suite! We can't wait to come back!

Great value for the money! Very safe & a lot of fun for the kids. The best feature is the waterpark. However, the water temperature was a little cold at first. Also, very convenient & close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The property is amazing but the staff isn't anywhere near the same rating
Summary: Staff needs better training on how to deal with large waves of customers and understand a smile goes a long way! People should be made to feel at home, not like they're irritating and ignorant .. anytime you ask a question, it was like the staff member was bothered that they had to do their job! Only person who treated us right was Mauricio from the pizza shop! Thank you Mauricio for saving a trip that quickly went downhill

Summary Heading: Fun place to take the whole family.
Summary: My husband and I took our seven year old son to GWL over Christmas break. We stayed for two nights and three days. We upgraded to the Wolf Den, super cute. Our son loved the themed cabin room with the bunk beds and his own tv. It was nice to have a refrigerator and a microwave in the room. The queen bed was pretty comfortable as well. The water park was fun for all ages: lazy river, small slides to more thrilling waterslides, wave pool, kids interactive play area, ride a wave and much more. All the places we ate at were really good; Grizzley Jacks Bar & Grill was near the outside pool, a little more gourmet food and mixed drinks, the shrimp tacos were delicious. We ate dinner at the Lodge Wood Fire Grill both nights, food was good and great quality.  We ate breakfast at the

The staff is not very helpful or knowledgeable in their positions and for the money half of the stuff was broken and/or out of service. The food is mediocre. Having said that, the kids did enjoy the water park. Definitely overpriced and not worth the cost for what you get.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with a fun waterpark, but there are better rates in the area
Summary: Our family of two adults, a 12-year old and 10-year old, booked using timeshare points.    We had a nice time on the first day - the room was available earlier than expected and it was clean and spacious.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Based on the type of resort, there were many kids as expected - some well-behaved, some not so much.  The waterpark was fun - it's warm and the various slides are entertaining for all ages.  After about 3 hours though, even my kids were ready to stop.  There's an arcade and a "bowling alley," but not much else interesting for older kids.    We didn't eat at the restaurant because the reviews were so poor.  Also, there are so many other great places to eat in the area, there's no need to eat at the resort.  The Wolf Den was fine for our family

The kids love spending time in the water park and other activities as well. Staffs are friendly and helpful. I recommend if the younger kids can get a great wolf lifeguard jacket instead the wolf ears or choices to pick either one. That would be more memorable tor the kids 😀

Place is well kept, rooms are clean and water park is fun but expect to pay a lot of money for all this fun.  We enjoyed our stay and had a blast but price was extremely high. For two days it cost us well over $750.00. That doesn't include ALL of the amenities the property has to offer. Glow in the dark Mini golf is extra. Arcade is extra. Bowling is extra. Interactive stations are extra. Honestly after dropping that much money I didn't really want to sink more money into these activities as well. The water park is fun but a few aspects of it aren't well thought out and lines for certain slides are long when they don't have to be. Overall, if you have a lot of disposable money to spend and want to have fun this is the place to go. If you are on a budget this isn't the place for

A little pricey, but everyone in the family had a great time. The water park was fun, room was cute (we had the Kid Cabin room), food was good. I would recommend breaking up the time in the water park though, a couple hours at a time, since the chlorine is pretty intense.

Great place to take the family.  Make sure kids bring their goggles because the chlorine in the water hurts their eyes.  Kids cannot be scared to go down water slides or it won't be as fun for them. I wish there was a better selection of food in the water park.  Make sure you bring your own water.

We spent one night at the GWL in Garden Grove between Christmas and New Year's Eve.  I have 3 teenaged children.  We have stayed previously at the GWL in WA and in Niagara in 2009 and 2012.  My kids were lukewarm about going back.  They kind of thought, "we're too old for this, mom".  Truth be told, they probably were.  But we had a great time.  The room is expensive.  We got the standard family suite.  It had 2 queen or double beds and a sofa sleeper.  A small fridge and a microwave.  There was also a small desk.  We were on the first floor just off the elevator bay and had a view of an exterior stairwell.  The GWL chain has a game called "Magic Quest" that you can play (it costs money).  The game requires you to run all over the hotel. At this location there are kiosks where

The hotel was great, with roomy suites, great food, fun waterpark, clean bed, nice stores, nice fireplace,  and it was my favorite hotel! It was very special lodge! You would really enjoy for having family/friends vacation!

We ended up here on a voucher from the Anaheim Hilton when their plumbing failed. We only stayed one night and didn't get a chance to use the property outside of our room. Just looking around was a treat. This place is amazing.  The sleep was exceptional. One of the most comfortable beds I remember sleeping in for years. The value for us was excellent, but in looking at the costs, this is a typically expensive stay. It seems that the amazing resort activities are all add-ons and the cost could take you into orbit. Watch for deals. The staff was nice. There were great options for eating, but it all was additional cost. We didn't eat there. The room was huge, quiet and excellent.  I would love to come back here and spend a few days with the 3 kids, but maybe on someone else's dime.

It's very over priced I will not be returning to this Hotel, I thought it would be more for what u are paying and everything is so expensive, we could have gotten a hotel closer to downtown Disney and paid less but what done is done u learn from the experience

We took a five and three-year-old here for two days. The hotel accommodations are just average. The whole point of this resort is the theme park and all the activities for the children. It's a madhouse, But the kids loved it.The pool is great.  We ate at the buffet, which was surprisingly good and had a very good selection of food. The price for the restaurant was moderate.  Be prepared to spend a lot of money on all the activities.Buy a pup card ahead of time online to save money.

Summary Heading: A wonderful way to spend the holidays with friends and family.
Summary: Great Wolf lodge was exactly what my 5 year old son had hoped it to be. Service was amazing, the facility was spotless, and the water park was fantastic.   Pros: 1.Water park was clean, warm, not overly chlorinated, and the crowd was manageable to where you could actually relax and have fun. There were enough fun slides for every age. 2. The entertainment was completely fun and family friendly. It was the first time I let my son play any game he wanted. 3. The service was warm & friendly.  4. The kids activities were fun for all ages.  Cons: 1. The food (especially breakfast) could be of a higher quality.  2. The location is a little surprising, even though it is down the street from Disneyland.  3. The rooms were not as nice or spacious as expected for the price. However, we

Everyone and everything was incredible. The staff was very attentive and helpful with all needs that we had. The Magiquest and stuffed animal adventures were a lot of fun for my 7-year-old. I cannot praise everyone enough. From the front desk to the lifeguards to the housekeeping staff and everyone in between.

We stayed because we wanted to have a special family trip that we have never done. We were not disappointed but it was an expensive trip. I recommend staying here if you have never tried it but because of the price we would probably never come back.

Our second visit and it's still awesome. My son told me that this was the best Christmas ever. I enjoyed it more because there were not that many people and no long lines. There were actually chairs we could sit in, they weren't covered in towels. I hate when they grab chairs but then don't ever sit in them.

My family spent Christmas Day at Great Wolf Lodge and I would say that it was one of the most memorable and fun vacations we had in a while. The hotel is so great, the rooms are amazing, and the staff are so friendly. Can't wait to go back...this time for a longer stay!

Beware. Costs a small fortune. They rack you for everything in this place. My daughter wanted her nails painted and it was $49. INSANE! Lunch was $50 for chicken nugget and fries. A cheap stuffed doll was $60 and broke in two days.

Perfect for families and kids!  Lots of variety to keep kids busy and wanting more!  The water park is excellent for all ages of youth, dining options for every taste and treat, story time, and plenty to explore!

This place amazed us and our 7 & 10 year old boys! We stayed 3 nights and had a blast the whole time. We allowed the boys some independence with wristbands that had charging capabilities and room key access. MagiQuest was a huge hit, though a slow start for our 7 year old who had to get the hang of it. They teamed up with some other kids as they went around the resort solving the adventures. Took about 5 hours! Hubby and I sat in the Lobby and enjoyed quiet time. Water park was clean and well maintained. Of course it was humid - I don't understand the people who sound surprised by this. We got a table up by the Flow Rider and found the air a little better. Attractions were appropriate and safe for our boys, with a couple that were a little thrilling. I personally thought the

Summary Heading: Not a replacement park for LegoLand
Summary: We received bad to very bad service in the buffet for dinner and breakfast both. The Dinner food is not up to par for a resort. The breakfast was better but the bad service did not make up for it. The servers stand around and talk when guest need help and our server seemed a bit put off when we wanted something from her. Other server had to help us get our drinks and at 1 point we had to get up and go to the area and ask for drinks for our kids.

My kids had a great time but they got sick after eating from one of the restaurants, and I was very disappointed with the service I received from a staff member. Other than that it was a great stay! And I love the water park.

It was a great experience for everyone. I think kids preschool and elementary ages get the most out of it, but teens seem to enjoy the waterpark. The Jammie Jamboree was fun and the kids thought it was cool that it "snowed" in the lobby and they got to visit with Santa!

Our family packed our bags and headed to the Great Wolf Lodge on Christmas Eve. The entire staff was friendly from the beginning of our stay to check out day. Don't worry about forgetting something at home because the Lodge has just about everything you might need. We never had to leave the hotel for anything throughout our stay. The hotel and water park temperature was perfect. There were so many places to dine at. Since we went during the holiday season we were able to dine in the Gingerbread House which was an amazing experience not to mention the great food. The snowland suite for our family of four looked even better in person than it did on the Internet. The decorated white christmas tree in our room added the perfect touch. The room was very clean as well as the restrooms

the catering that was given to my children during their stay was impeccable. the staff was very friendly and the friendliness and kindness shown was much more that i expected. i will return next winter.

The chlorine levels were way too high. Entire group was coughing and not feeling well within a few hours. We did not even spend the night. We left around 6pm and did not return the next day. When I called the front desk to let them know, they simply said they would check me out of the room.

Our kids had the best vacation to date! We will return there within the next 2 months! Perfect vacation for a family. The staff was excellent and we felt at home during our stay. Our teenage girls were able to go off on their own without any worries.

This was the first time my family stayed at this hotel and we really enjoyed! Room was super clean and cozy.  And the water part was exceptional, because it was exclusive for hotel guests only.  I will visit this hotel for next vacation at SoCal.

My family thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My 12 year old son absolutely loved the magic wand quest and my 9 year old daughter did not want to get out of the water. We had no issues finding chairs at the water park during the time we went. The surf ride had a long line so my kids stayed away from that, but everything else was great.  The staff was super nice and had no issues during check in. I reserved the room through their website, then later purchased a Groupon. Absulutly no issue in transferring our reservation to the groupon and obtaining a refund. All was done through their member service chat- they were friendly and knowledgeable.  The only cons of our stay was that they did not offer room service (my kids enjoy breakfast room service) and that the chlorine content of the

This was our  second trip to Great Wolf Lodge and we will definitely be back. My 3 year old is obsessed with Wiley and Violet. We were lucky to meet both of them on our both stays. We purchased their plush toys and backpacks and story book. My daughter can't wait to go back again. Everybody who works there is very friendly. They have great attractions so it impossible to get bored fir kids. And as a parent if your kid is happy you are happy. I highly recommend this place to all families with kids.

Our stay at The Great Wolf Lodge was a very fun experience. We celebrated my daughter's 11th birthday with family and friends. Eric Pham was very helpful in setting us up in two adjoining rooms for our party of 7. We all had so much fun in the water park. The slides were definitely a must for all.
