Found the deal through Groupon, still have to pay about $400 per night for family of 4. Did not get the bunk bed for my kids which is disappointing. Hotel room is average. The water park is fairly fun with decent size. They provide some free kids activity.  Most of the activities are pricy, such as $35 for scavenger hunt and $45 for kids manicure. Anyway we visited the day after Christmas and it's a nice fun experience. But visit once is enough, prefer Ranging water instead due to the expensive price.

This place was excellent for a family vacation. It's a one stop shop for entertainment, food, and lodging. It's fun for all ages. The water slides were eccellent, the eateries had great choices at reasonable prices, and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

I have a better time the first time. Second time it was ok... see if I go back. The prices are very high. But I do this for the kids. I room that I got I didn't care. For it. The pizza place was better last time I will not be eating there again

Check in was easy our room was ready at 1pm spent all day at the waterpark found out when we checked out we can still use our wristbands to use to waterpark - awesome!! Staff was attentive and friendly

Summary Heading: Perfect family vacation for all ages.
Summary: Perfect family vacation for all ages. My two year old loved it and when it was time to get out of the water, there is tons of programming she enjoyed. Our 9 and 10 year old said it was the best vacation ever.

A great family adventure for all ages..you never have to leave the resort..so many food and activity options. Rooms are very nice.. my Grandkids loved the theme room. Even after the water park closes at night there are so many other things to do from, arcade, bowling, mini golf and much more.

The staff is top notch! We felt well taken care of.  Convenience is the name of the game here and as we all know, you will pay for convenience.  When toting children & bags around, the last thing you want to have to do after arriving at your destination is travel more.  Restaurants & entertainment for the kids are all here.  You won't need to leave the resort!

Summary Heading: Great place for adults and kids. Cant wait to return
Summary: 2nd time staying here. Loved every minute of it.  Christmas theme was awesome.  Waterpark was awesome. Everything was awesome.  Cant waut to return.  Maybe in summer. I hope. Thank you for the great experience.

Overall, our experience here was great. We had 6 little girls for an overnight birthday party. We did not buy into any of the activities and just utilized the water park. They were entertained by that alone. I would suggest bringing goggles. We had lots of red eyes. Chlorine is a little strong as well as for those just hanging out in the water park room. If you are eating at Buckets and ordering fries with your meal then I would suggest 1 fry per 2 or 3 kids. I wish we were told this before hand to save money. Each girl ordered fries and we had a tray piled high that we threw away. Also check your receipt if you have a larger group ordering. We were over charged by a few items but management refunded us. The ice cream shop is great and Dunkin' Donuts for breakfast was a hit.

Recommend for families young teens and kids over 48 inches tall.  They also have a puddle park for toddlers. Had a fun time.  Rooms were spacious and nice. Bathroom could have been a bit larger. Loose Moose was solid. Waterpark was excellent. Staff was average with front desk, store and restaurant employees seemed unapproachable.

Wonderful place to bring your family - lots of activities for all the family.  Food and service was wonderful.  All the staff was great!  We had a great time in the water park, rides and activities for all ages.

Our family recently stayed at the great wolf lodge and it was a great little vacation. My kids loved the activities offered in the lodge. Their only complaint is that it is the same story for story time multiple times a day. Changing the story would have made it more enjoyable for the kids. The loose moose kitchen was very expensive and did not have a huge selection for the amount of money it costs to eat there. But overall it was a great trip.

It was great fun for the entire family. W all enjoyed the water park. However there weren't much to do other than water park without paying more money for amusement. Service was excellent! The beds were super comfy and clean. We had a blast there for an overnight stay. Probably at most could stay another night for more waterpark play.

Our kids loved the indoor water park.  Excellent service:  plenty of front desk staff to receive guests at check-in (so you don't wait in line too long), staff member in lobby offering to take pictures of your family in front of the Christmas tree, friendly store employees who are helpful answering questions, etc.  Food is good at 'Loose Moose' restaurant.  Hotel Family Suite room is large.  Whole facility is clean, clean, clean.  I saw staff cleaning the windows and even the stairs.  The hotel has so many elevators so you won't have to wait too long for one - this is a minor detail but worth mentioning - applause to the hotel architect/planner!  Be careful to not fall at the water park - one kid slip/fell in front of me.  Also, one of my kids developed a rash after being in the

My 3 kids (ages 13, 17, 21) and I had a great time at Great Wolf Garden Grove.  We loved the bowling, although it was a bit pricey at $6 a person.  We loved our room, the Wolf Den suite, and comfortable beds and bathroom.  The water park was the most fun, my girls called the lazy river "the lazy rapids" because it was rather fast paced lol.  The mini golf course wasn't worth the $$, it's cool it's glow in the dark, but really basic blah course.  My son and nephew loved the water park rides.  Everything was very well maintained, the whole hotel was nicely maintained and we loved the Christmas decorations.

My son wanted to go to Great Wolf Lodge for his birthday. The hotel was amazing. It's was beautiful. The staff was amazing and kind everywhere we went. The water park was great. The slides were all super fun (gave myself a great leg workout). It does get humid in there. I couldn't imagine going in the summer. The longest we had to wait in line was about 5 minutes.  The hotel has figured out a way to suck money from parents, but it's worth it. The MagiQuest game had us running all over the hotel. My son can't wait to go back so he can play a different quest.  It was very helpful to have our room key and credit card built into our wristbands. I never worried about carrying cash or credit cards around.  In the evening I was able to sit in the lobby in front of the beautiful

Summary Heading: One day is plenty of time.
Summary: Pros: Clean Extremely fun for all ages Decorations Friendly staff, Attentive life guards Pizza is really good ($19.99 for an all meat pizza) Feeds about 6  Cons: Bed are firm and pillows are hard. Arcade is expensive  Tips: Go mid-week it's less busy Bring snacks, there's a microwave and refrigerator in the room 2-3 year olds who don't know how to stand in line will get frustrated The lazy river is probably the most dangerous place for a kid to get hurt Check out is at 11, its express checkout, so you do not have to visit front desk. Your wristband will allow you to exit and enter the parking lot. Go on the shortest line first for rides, ride wait times shift throughout the day.   I have stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge twice this year (around Halloween and Christmas) and all the

My nine year old daughter loved it and immediately wanted to come back (11/21/16 stay) my 3 year old twins did not want to leave their section of the water park. It is a great water park for younger kids. My 9 year old absolutely loved her manicure at Scoops. She felt so special and loved the other girls looking at her sash and loot. She felt like a real princess. Now the price of the rooms are extremely expensive. They are large and comfortable rooms however the price is exorbitant.

The water park is GREAT!  So many slides of different sizes and adventure levels. We enjoyed the lazy river, the wave pool, and shooting basketballs.    The rooms are comfy and you won't want to get out of bed.  The staff us always friendly and helpful.

This was our third trip to the resort and it was just as great as the first. The holiday decor made the lodge even better! All of the activities available for the kids are worth everyone's time. The whole family will love it.

Summary Heading: A safe and fun place for kids for all ages!
Summary: I have 4 children 2nd grade to senior in high school and all were entertained. At the restaurant they play close attention to your food allergies to make sure you're safe. This was our third time staying here.

Overall it was a great first time experience. Perhaps there's a way to lower the chlorine smell in the water park. It was a bit to strong for me, the wife and the kids. We would like to visit again next year.

Perfect for our quick weekend family trip with a 10 year old. Short drive from LA, we packed a lot of water park fun into one over night stay with late check out. Dolce and Kevin at the front desk were exceptionally helpful and welcoming. We will be back!

Summary Heading: My visit to Great Wolf Lodge Garden Grove was brand-new! It was a very clean bed.
Summary: My experience was awesome and the room, the location and the amenities were special! It is in Garden Grove, CA, I went to the waterpark, because it is my special day but not my birthday. It was great!

Overall an amazing family experience. The rooms and activities were perfectly geared towards kids. We Loved that it was not overly crowded. The water park is amazing and very safe. We did not love the food quality. The food was over priced and tasted like microwaved meals.

Summary Heading: Good time for everyone in the family
Summary: Got the 2 bd. All was good except no room service. Housekeeping forgot our towels.  The towels are tiny. Didn't remember birthday instructions. After dinner at the restaurant notified the food and beverage supervisor Elias . He honestly went above and beyond and got my daughter her 6th birthday magical experience at story time. Bring the whole family there is something for everyone.  Do the last minute upgrade. Buy the paw pass. Start the magic quest early it takes hours ! Craft time and extras are fun. Bedtime story is a must. The water park was fun . Nothing fancy. Being from So. CAL. the hardest part to get over is the feeling of the sun. Lots of cloriene bring your goggles and eye drops. The temperature is pretty much always perfect. Warmer in the water park area. Bring

Summary Heading: Everyone should stay at least once
Summary: I have an almost 2 year old and 4 year old. They had a blast. The water park is so cool. There's sections that are age appropriate and there's other activities available for the kids free of charge. The food was surprisingly good and the price is pretty standard. There's an arcade, bowling and golf for a fee. Kids were not happy when it was time to come home.

Summary Heading: If in SoCal, look here first!
Summary: Look here first before Disneyland! My family and i had thr best gamily vacation and it dint break the bank. Loved every minute of it! From the safety, fun, good rooms, good food, and trust me, they have it all THOUGHT OUT!

We didn't want to go home. We had such a wonderful time. From ages 9 to 66. We all felt special, comfortable and didn't want to get out of the water. There was so much for my granddaughter to do. There are activities going on all day from 8:00 am til ??

Oh, this was a wondeful christmas family vacation! Upon check in we were greeted by Jessie who was so kind with our son who has autism!  Decked out for christmas! We had a wonderful meal in the gingerbread house for a great cause to childrens hospital! Water park was a blast! Great value for a hotel and water park for 2 days! Magic quest is a must worth the money!

Great resort.  I took my son here for his birthday and although the focus of the trip was him, I discovered that it was fun for me as well.  The resort is pricey, but enjoyable and we will most likely return.  It is a year around resort.

All the bases were covered. Our family needs were taken care of without a headache. If you have special snacks you would like bring those. But dietary needs are considered, so bring that up with staff and they will take care of you. Awesome customer service!

Summary Heading: Fantastic experience for the kids and grandkids
Summary: Who ever heard of a large indoor waterpark for kids of all ages.  This is a theme park centered around stuffed animals.  You have to stay at the hotel to use the park, but it really is a good deal.  Check-in at one, check-out at 11 the next day but you can use the facilities from one until 9 in the evening the next day (really 2 full days).  We were a group of 9 adults and 15 children.  They have lots of other children activities, but our problem was getting the kids to leave the water park area.  They were non-stop, first time I've seen them so "independent" and non pestering.    Our stay was probably considered the off season, because it wasn't crowded and we got a great deal in the rooms via groupon.  Recommend planning ahead in order to get the right price on the room.

Kids love it. I would go at least once every year. If I had a good career that pays a lot, then I would definetly go at least twice a year. I was surprised by the snow-like flakes that the resort put on for their customers, it was a very brilliant idea to give the guest a feeling of "it is snowing in here, wow."

This was our third time staying with the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove.  Excellent place to stay with so many things to do at the hotel for all ages of your family.  Will be back again definitely soon.

Summary Heading: 1st experience at the great wolf lodge
Summary: Our 1st experience at the great wolf lodge was a great one. The staff and service was exceptional. We usually travel to Disneyland this time of year but thought that we'd try something different and my kids were glad we did. The water park was a blast and since we went during the week there were no long lines to worry about and being indoors the weather was never a factor. There was plenty of arts and crafts activities for the kids to enjoy along with arcade, bowling and other attractions provides plenty to do besides the water park. The rooms were clean and my kids loved the wolf den themed rooms. The food along with the service at the wood fire grill was great. I have recommended the great wolf lodge to a number of people and a couple of them are already planning a trip. When

This is the first trip my family has taken to this place and it was exactly as we expected. My girls are 10 and 12 and they absolutely love it!!! Lots of water rides, decent snacks and food to get you through the day, cocktails for the adults and indoor and outdoor seating. Food is not cheap so having your own snacks in your room is helpful, buying the refillable cups for drinks worked well for us and coming in December has made for small crowds and very small lines. Girls got to do all the rides they wanted numerous times so they felt very satisfied.  There are lockers and showers in the water park itself and towels are available so you don't need to bring your own.

This is an excellent venue.  The food at the holiday party was good.  The staff at UCI Department of Pediatrics enjoyed the whole event.  The staff were so accommodating and helpful.  We are already planning our holiday party for December 2017.

My family and I had such an awesome, fun, exciting time at the great wolf lodge! It was definitely a mini vacation to remember and we will be back next year for sure!!! We loved every second of our stay :)

We loved staying at Great Wolf Lodge.  We only used the waterpark for entertainment and LOVED it.  Our kids did not want to leave.  The only complaint is that a big family group let their kids swim and run around the waterpark in their underwear.  We felt that was inappropriate and should not be allowed.  Food prices are expensive and they get you there because you can't bring in your own food.

excelent place for kids very friendly and clean the resort is amazing and the water park great all is  very clean and the suites very good  the personal friendly but all the resort ( shops restaurante ice cream close 8 pm too early for vacations

fun, clean, affordable, great for young kids, family vacations cant wait to come back will stay again for sure!!! looking for an amusement park in southern California that wont break your bank or pay to stay in endless lines than this is the place for you!

My second trip to this location and lets say the second time was as charming as the first.  Because there is so much going on, we were still not able to do some activities that we planned on.  Bot a problem, just have to schedule them in on our next trip.  Highly recommend a stay.

The customer service is exceptional.  From the moment we walked in until we left, each member of the Lodge team made my family feel welcome and important.  The water park and other activities were beyond fun for all members of my family, both young and old.

Enjoyed our stay there with all the children's activities besides the water park. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Enjoyed the festive decorations for Christmas with the snow in the lobby and having Santa Claus picture taking and wolf ears for everybody. The price was reasonable for the hotel stay and water park entrance. We would definitely go back again.

Summary Heading: Great Family Fun in Garden Grove!
Summary: I rarely (if ever) give five stars, but I was amazed at how well Great Wolf managed this experience.  Easy check in, and the wrist band system works for everything including room key, room charges, etc.  Even the vending machines use the wrist band, so you don't need to carry cash or cards.  Naturally, it's also waterproof, so you can enjoy the facilities without worry.    The water park is first-rate, and the design is so well done, there are hardly any lines for the attractions.  The bathrooms are the cleanest I have ever seen, and showers are for individuals (with shampoo, conditioner, soap, towels, etc. with your own privacy curtain.    The food at the snack bar is quite good, and the arcade is also fun.  Overall, Great Wolf is first class all the way, and I couldn't find a

First trip to this location and it was great.  Have stayed at GWL numerous times before, all in NC.  This GWL offers a lot of activities.  Room was upgraded for free.  Hardly no lines at the water park.  Sons had a blast at the water park and arcade.  Howling Wolf pizza place was really good.  Definitely will visit again soon.

food is reasonably priced. very clean and friendly place. the staff was great. i couldn't believe how many rides they fit into one place. the water was warmer than i expected, which made for a great day.

Great Wolf Lodge is amazing! We absolutely loved it! The staff is incredibly friendly and great with the kids. I loved all the activities they had for my daughter, she had a blast. The water park is awesome. I loved not needing to worry about sunblock!

Summary Heading: Perfect mini vacation with the family
Summary: It is a great place for families that enjoy the water! The staff is amazing and does anything to make your stay even more incredible! My family can't wait to go back! What we enjoyed the most was that we stayed for one night, but we went to the waterpark both days.

We stayed here to go to Calinfornia Adventure to see the Christmas light show, we had a fantastic time and it exceeded our expectations. The food was great, the beds were comfy, and the water park was a blast.

This is the only indoor water park we have in so cal. Kids loves this place. The bet thing about this place is the access to the water park is exclusive to hotel guests. This makes the park not as crowded and everything moves along smoothly. Kids pick GWL over Disneyland because of the fun they always have there and very short wait time!

Over all it was o good experience but i think it is a once an a life time experience for me. Due to the price, if u have tons of money it is for you. But paying for a late check out a lot of $ when they are not even all booked.

This hotel is really close to Disneyland and was a fun weekend getaway. Our kids 2yr and 1yr had fun on the water slides. Nice to be able to go back to your room for nap time ect. They have their own life jackets for the waterpark which is nice and the water was warm but once you get out you may be a little chilly but they have plenty of pool towels to warm up your kids.

Great activities for kids,  need three days to do all. Constantly on the go. Wonder what activities are when not Christmas Snow land. Fantastic Santa.  Buffet excellent. Like dunkin donuts morning delivery.

Had to attend a convention and this sounded like fun for my granddaughter.  WOW it really was.  So many things to do for all ages, in and out of the water. Our granddaughter loved the evening story time in the PJ's with characters reading the stories.

Awesome place to stay! Definitely kid oriented and friendly. It is kinda pricey thought, but ask for deals, specials etc. Non stop fun from the time we arrived to the time we left. My daughter is still suffering from separation anxiety and is begging to return. Well worth it. Quality family time for sure!

Was an excellent stay from start to finish- had my two nephews with me and they thought it was the coolest hotel they had ever seen/been to.  They lived the waterpark and it even snowed in the lobby for Christmas. Would love to go here again in future and it's very close to Disney- great break from the theme parks.

Went with my family, stayed in a standard room on the 1st floor. Room was spacious, beds comfortable, check in was a breeze only 5 minutes, staff is very friendly. The water park is fun the kids and adults had a blast. The magic quest was a blast for my 10 year old who finished his quest this morning. The quest did take close to 6 hours so it kept him busy while the younger kids listened to story time. Well worth the money when you factor the the cost of 3 adults and 2 children water park and a hotel for the night. The buffet breakfast was good many choices. I would recommend this hotel for a family vacation.

We had an Awesome time at Great Wolf, perfect getaway for families to enjoy...plenty of stuff to do besides the water park, which was a great break if your not the type to like water parks...overall will def be back!!!

+ Fun for most ages + Room was clean and spacious.  + You can fill out a card the night before (before 11 pm) and they will deliver Dunkin Donuts to your room for breakfast + Story Time & Dance Party + They sell alcohol + Valet & bell boys  - It can get pretty crowded - The kid running the laser thing on Sunday morning - Price of the room - Parking garage  - Seating can be a bit hectic - The floor can be very slippery. I know what you're thinking... "its a water park, its bound to be slippery." Nope, the rubber flooring was not slippery and easy to walk on. The cement part of the floor was slippery and I say a bunch of kids falling.   Overall, this place deserves a solid 4 stars. Not sure I personally will be back, the majority of the kids in our group had a great time.

Great service ,good people ,friendly envirement, cleanly ness, great parking space warm welcome at the hotel and stors . Asom water park and life gards at every corner for safty and great looking hottel and rooms too.

I had no idea what to expect. I'd seen the advertisements but didn't know anyone who'd been to the Garden Grove location. When we arrived, Thanksgiving week, check-in was a breeze. Kids entertained with face-painting and coloring while checking in. We got Wolf  Den-kids loved it. Clean rooms and hole the kids loved climbing through in lair. Water park-Awesome! Even for adults!!! Bar and one alcohol kiosk on way up to rides. Great! In waterpark, so much to do for everyone. Showers in bathrooms. You can check in at 1pm day of, and stay until waterpark closes following day. We stayed 1 night but utilized all our time at water park. My kids loved the wave pool. They have a flow rider too and a pool with ropes u climb acroos-super fun!!! Food buffet was great! I dont like buffets

First time here. You'll never have to leave the compound as everything is there. As an added bonus, Disneyland is literally a 5 minute drive. Lastly, GWL will bend over backwards to make sure you're stay is an awesome experience.

Great Wolf Lodge was such wonderful  surprise. The hotel and water park is very clean. The slides in the water park are AMAZING!!  Our room was spacious which is perfect when traveling with kids. The food options were great. The staff was always near by and very helpful. Once inside you are surprised by what the place offers. It a must for the family. We will definitely return.

Amazing place  we had the wolf den girls absolutely loved that they had their own space. Everyone is so welcoming and friendly.Kids had a blast. We will  definitely be returning. Friendly tip use 'more fun' coupon code and stay two nights instead of one better value.

Awesome "birthdaycation!" Water park great and clean. Restaurant was good and affordable. Service was also great. The resort staff was knowledgeable about everything. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The kids will love it.

Perfect for kids. Water and park temperature is perfect during December in Los Angeles weather. Park is very clean and well maintained. Staff are great and friendly. Easy access to everything, from hotel to water park to lobby and to parking lot.

This October was our family's second trip to Great Wolf Lodge and it far exceeded our first. The water park is perfect for our 4-year-old daughter, between the little kid's pool, the wave pool, the outdoor pool, and the lazy river. She also loves the arcade and the store where she can stuff a Great Wolf animal friend. We discovered on our first trip that she is just a bit too young for MagiQuest but that didn't stop her from wanting a wand. Tip: you can buy the wand without adding the game and then bring it back and pay for the game when she is older.  But the highlight of our trip was the special one-on-one time our daughter, Ariel, spent with the resort's Executive Chef, Hany Ali. On our first trip, Chef Hany was stopping by the tables at Lodge during dinner service and he met

Summary Heading: Great resort but NO SHUTTLE SERVICE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: Resort is amazing. Staff was great however NO SHUTTLE to and from DISNEYLAND at this time. Be careful upon stay. Resort charged me for overnight parking of $10 per night when we did not have a car. Having to contact resort when I got home, I waited for 42 minutes for customer service.

Great Wolf Lodge entertains all ages from little kids to teens to adults.  The staff was very friendly. The price was great after getting the discounted tickets and well worth it.  They allow you to play at the water park before checking in to your room and even stay at the water park after you checked out.

Overall we had a great time and we will return.  WARNING: food inside the water park is mediocre at best and there is very little variety.  You are also not allowed to bring any outside food (they check your bags).  In addition water is not that warm. But the staff is super friendly and we had a great time.

At check in they did not explain how my 2 bedroom suit will open. I thought I was given a 1 bedroom by mistake. Until really late I asked and was told how it worked. I dint enjoy my suit how I was supposed to.When I purchased a bear I was not explained we could play with it in the resort, so that was not finished. at check in, the girl was done without giving me my buffet vouchers, and my wolf and paw necklace.I had to ask for them and the girl had to recheck the computer. Other than that everything was great. I will be good for my second trip, but this first one was disappointing.

This is definitely a great choice for most families. With the water park, arcade, bowling, golf, etc there always something to do. The staff seemed great, Ezekiel checked us in, super friendly and answered all of our daughter's questions. We stayed in the Wolf Den, the little cave with bunkbeds was worth the extra money. It's a fun little den and creates a separate space for kids and adults. Definitely nothing "luxury" about the room, but it was fine. The elevators were fast, but they are only in one location and our room was very far away. We were there over Thanksgiving, the hotel was sold out and the water park was crowded. The combo of pushy people, high temp, and chlorine smell were too much for us. People in lines were pushy and they need a better system of organization

We had a very fun family stay here.  Right from the start, things went well.  We arrived early but they found us available rooms.  They made an effort to group our family rooms together.  Their wrist bands are very convenient...they serve as your room key entry into the water park, and payment method in the stores, etc.  The rooms were comfy, clean and had a/c, fridge, & microwave.  This is a large, busy  hotel but there was easy parking and there were plenty of elevators so we never waited more than a few seconds to go where we needed.  The water park was really entertaining, and they provided endless towels and very good supervision by life-guards.  There were also ongoing activities that the children enjoyed such as art projects, story time, dancing, face painting, balloons,

We stayed three nights and had a blast! Great Wolf Lodge was the most family oriented hotel I have ever stayed at!! We played at the water park, did the Magiquest, gamed at the arcade, and spent lots of time bowling!!  There's something for everyone regardless of age. Also, the food was excellent - we didn't have to leave the hotel for anything!!  I've already started planning our next trip!!

Great time fun for all ages! Wood fire Grill food Had a  big variety and out of 17 people everyone  was happy. Fast service and cooked to perfection. Highly recommended. The pool didn't seem 84 degrees but was still a good temperature.

My kids and whole family enjoyed this park and the rooms were big, had many amenities!!! The rooms have fridge, microwave, and a lot of towels which is always great. The water park has many different activities for all ages.

The water park is definitely fun for the kids; however, the free kid hotel activities are quite generic.  The hotel itself is pretty average. The food is descent.  Most of the staff were friendly and professional.  Also, there was a fire in the water park on our first day there so that was scary and our hotel room door never closed fully on its own when we exited like most hotel doors do.

Summary Heading: Great wolf lodge experience with young children
Summary: We visited here for the first time and truly had a great time. Endless amounts of things for kids to do. Get them the law passed ahead of time for sure and bring your own water shoes. The food quality was just ok but there are places to eat around there. The water park is so fun and the life guards take their jobs very seriously.

Very expensive hotel. Aside from the water park Im not sure why its do expensive. There are lots of add ons that should be included with the high price tag. We stayed because we got a discount rate but would not pay the prices they are asking. Great hotel tho. Kids loved it!

Summary Heading: Bad customer service, rude front desk
Summary: Front desk is so rude, unless a manager is watching over there shoulder they are short and rude not helpful about activities for kids throughout the day. My band broke and I went to desk to get a new one and got to see a handful of new guest checking in and they got a whole undivided check in with great customer service with a manger right behind them assuring the info Was great. Totally disappointed with the staff this time around!

Past foster children and adopted children gathering. OMG. This was perfect  every year I take as many family members I can to have fun together. So much love. So much fun. Great wolf Lodge was so great. Amazing fun, Staff was perfect and EXTREMELY helpful with all my family. I am 70 years old and NOT ONCE did I worry about any of my children.  So many great life guards watching so closely.   PERFECT. PERFECT. PERFECT ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

This place  it's good for kids to have some fun. But not for birthday package. The birthday cake was terrible, too sweet. The only place that my daughter likes was water park. We only spent there one night so we really can't tell much about it. But I would recommend to stay at least two night to make it worthwhile.

Really fun place for kids! The water park is just right- big enough, but still small enough that you can keep track of your kids and find them pretty easily. There are about 5-6 rides, a wave runner, wave pool, splash pad area and a super fun lily pad rope climb thing that I had way too much fun racing my daughter on. My only suggestion would be to add a hot tub for the parents. :-)   The only issue we had was with the bell men. We pulled up to valet and nobody greeted us although there were at least 3 men working. Two were holding the front doors open. Then my husband asked if we could get help with our bags and one man said sure and gave him a cart. We unloaded our bags ourselves and wheeled them to our room. My husband was shocked and later went to speak to a manager who just

Summary Heading: One of the best family trips
Summary: Great wolf is a really cool place. They have soany things to do to keep you entertained. The staff was very welcoming. Brandi from the service desk is awesome!!! Upon arriving I had a few personal hang ups and upon returning Brandi was very u derstamding and extra helpful... I planned this trip to celebrate my daughter's 9th birthday. She has been asking for a hotel sleepover for the longest (mainly to go swimming because its indoors and her birthday is in Dec.) So this was definitely a treat and surprise to her. We enjoyed every minute of our stay...everyone should experience for themselves at least once.

Rooms are themed, traveled with my wife. At check in they would not offer a room with king bed, staff didn't care. Horrible choices for coffee, snacks etc... breakfast buffet geared towards kids and a Dunkin Donuts serving the worst flavorless and aroma-less coffee anywhere.

Summary Heading: Loved this place! But stay 2 days if you can...
Summary: I recommend staying two days...I will be coming again with a small group of friends and sharing a room...would love to have a ladies spa available ( for facials, massages,pedicures) for us worn out mommies!

The park is relatively new and is always packed on the weekends. It has a big waterpark and a heated outdoor pool. It is a nice way to spend your weekend and have a great time anytime of the year since the waterpark is indoor and the temperature is controlled to feel like it's always summer inside. The service is impeccable and the attention to detail is great. It is best to book on the weekdays as the waterpark is not that packed unlike the weekends where the lines on the slides take 30 minutes. Safety is also taken very seriously from the doors that can only be opened by guests checked in after 10 pm and the lifeguards stationed everywhere in the waterpark and I mean everywhere. Every inch is covered so everyone will always be safe and any incident will always be attended to.

We are here at the lodge as I am writing this review. It is our 2nd time here. Check-in was was unexpectedly quick when we arrived at 1 pm. Our room was ready and was upgraded to a nicer room. Water park was always fun. Staff are very attentive. Didn't like that they are out of certain things at the snack bar and the fact that there are parents who act up after consuming too much alcohol. Also, the A/C  in our room was really loud. It's really hard to sleep when you're a light sleeper. Other than that, my kids love this place and will continue to visit. Hoping that this new resort will continue to improve at its best.

This vacation was one that the children had wanted to take for a few ears after finding it on the internet.  However, minnesota was too far to travel just to go to a water park.  California has many water parks that we could have gone to for less.  However, they really enjoyed the facility so I am very well pleased.

Excellent across the board!  My daughters were sad to leave.  The waterpark lifeguards are on top of their jobs.  Everything was reasonably priced.  Great room discounts if you book in advance.  Next trip i will plan on staying 2 nights instead of just 1.

A really special "one stop shop" vacation destination for the family.  Great for all ages, safe, clean, friendly, and SO MUCH FUN! Can't wait to come back! Thank you Great Wolf Lodge CA for the wonderful memories!

It was our first time here and definitely not the last. Young and old had a great experience. Everyone was friendly. All employees did not show wage difference in how they address us guests. Everyone looks professional and presentable even the house keepers. Everyone was knowledgeable of the lodge.

Summary Heading: Doesn't Live Up To Hype for $
Summary: This resort is great in theory and their NY location proves it can be done right.  : However you will not find that with the SoCal location. Spend your money at one of the many other SoCal resorts. Great Wolf simply hasn't got it figured out yet and it isn't worth the cost, until they do figure it out.  Pros: Nice rooms, friendly staff. Lots of on property restaurants to choose from whose menus have tons of food for both adults and kids.  The MagiQuest game is tons of fun and the variety in the water park is great.  Lots of fun activities for the kids, even thought most cost extra.    Cons  Management are not prepared for their guests even though they have reservations and should have a fairly accurate idea of the number of expected guests.  Summary:  Restaurants out of food and

Was an overall awesome experience!!! Warm and inviting atmosphere! The water park is a blast! I love how the rooms have a mini fridge and microwave. The rooms are extremely comfortable and  clean! I would highly recommend staying at Great Wolf Lodge! We will definitely be back!!!

It's a great place to take the whole family we had a great time the park is very clean and there are many activities for the kids to enjoy besides the water park. we purchased the breakfast voucher and it was worth it food was great and it's an all you can eat. I definitely recommend Great Wolf Lodge for the whole family its a "home away from Home" resort.

This was my first visit to the Great Wolf Lodge.  I was impressed with the friendly staff and overall cleanliness of the hotel.  The food in the lodge was reasonably priced for our family of five.  The hotel made it easy to enter/exit the room and make purchases using a secure wristband.  My kids loved it.  We will return again.  I have nothing bad to say about the hotel and our experience.

We took our daughter and family over Thanksgiving for 3 days to this unique hotel.  It was fantastic, it's a combination water park, Disneyland. You do need to buy a wand to do the magicquests throughout the hotel, but it was worth it. Very imaginative , also has many other games to play, and entertainment for the children.  The water park was unbelievable, can hold 3000 people! So you can imagine how big it is. Has all kinds of water activities for all ages! Even though we went over a holiday , did not feel crowded. We stayed in the hotel playing for 3 days!

my son has a december birthday and he loves water parties.  First time I could celebrate it in an indoor environment. We got the kid cabin suite and the kids loved having their own little space. Beware of the top bunk, the kids can actually flip out between the doorway and the bed.  Only thing I missed was a jacuzzi for the adults.

Great place for families. Fun for the entire family. We are a family of 5. Mom and dad are 36 and our kids are 5, 3 and 1. The wristband concept is cool. I love how easy and convenient it doubles as access to the waterpark and room. The rooms are cozy and bathroom is cozy. The Waterpark was a blast! Our children had a variety and all stayed busy and engaged the whole time. We are planning to come back and take advantage of the bunk bed suite and all activities we didn't know about.  Here are the areas where we feel could be game changers for your company!  1. Security!!!! We didn't feel secure with our children just wandering through the lobby. The doors aren't guarded or secure enough. The wristband should beep if the kids go close to the doors. The wristband should band all

Kids are safe and Grandma could relax while they played in the water park.. Good food at a reasonable price. We were so surprised to find a beautiful Christmas tree in our room and the lobby was decorated so beautifully.

Summary Heading: This place Great for kids !! My family loved this place~~
Summary: My friend family they 2 days stay suite room. It was birthday party.  We will be hear next my son birthday party. Also near from heat have a lot of Korean restaurants. It is very good for my family.  Thank you so much

We have been here twice and I've had a great time both times we have kids that are 11 five and three there's something for everyone to do it's great that they have donuts in the morning at Dunkin' Donuts and the food is actually pretty good in the water park for lunch I would not eat at the buffet again

Great place to stay with Kids lots for kids to do.  I would go back again and again.  I recommend to anyone. Kids were busy from time they walk into the door until the moment we walk out.  We had a wonderful time

Stayed for two nights in a family suite after visiting Disneyland for the day. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The kids loved the water park. Very extensive water park. Many slides for all ages. Wave pool, lazy river, obstacle course.  My kids also loves playing the magi quest game( it's like modern scavenger hunt). Lots of crafts and free activities for kids. Breakfast buffet was good but expensive. Pizza was a good value but not that great quality. Overall it was a great experience and I plan to take my kids back again.

Awesome! Kids like loved it and so did the adults. Clean, spacious and great place to enjoy a family staycation. We will definitely be back. The restaurants are a bit pricey though but all in all great experience!

My family had a wonderful time! My girl, 8 years old, was extremely exciting in there. On 1st day, we played at the waterpark for 5 hours, and 2nd day, we played 8 hours. It's amazing in Thanksgiving break!

Summary Heading: Great Waterpark, Adequate in Other Areas
Summary: We took our six grandchildren to this resort to experience the indoor waterslide and spend an overnight together. The waterpark was great, the dinning opportunities very limited and the suites were the size of normal double occupancy hotel rooms. Suite for 6-7 included only one sink, small toilet / shower area and very limited seating.

The overall atmosphere was welcoming. The cost of the some of the items for kids were a bit outrageous. My kids boy and girl age 10, had a blast and can't wait to return. We did see many children wandering around alone and I wouldn't recommend that, but to each his own.

We loved it and we will return and the staff was very nice my family had a great time  I would recommend  Great wolf lodge to anyone it's a great place for family we went in the winter time and we're going again in the summer my granddaughter had a ball she didn't want to leave but we had to go thank you very much for your hospitality with the staff they were very nice thank you

Summary Heading: Too Pricey for the LACK of Service!
Summary: If you'd like to spend LOTS of money for a room that has a horrible odor, crappy customer service, cold food and rude employees - this is the perfect place for you.  Otherwise I'd advise taking your money and going elsewhere.    Don't waste your time or money.

Thank you very much for the experience!! My kids and both my husband and I loved it very much and mostly because it was an appropriate place for a baby who also enjoyed it! We made great memories and loved every moment!

Outstanding water park design with lots of options for all ages. Outstanding staff. all around. Pizza place OK. Other restaurants pretty good. Fair value. Worth a one-night stay for locals to access water park.. Very good kids' programming in lobby. Lots of activities for older kids to teens (for a fee). In general - an experience.

Fun waterpark with comfy beds, enjoyed the water rides and not needing sunscreen, kids loved the balloons and face painting included, for the price I was expecting Disneyland quality staff which wasn't the case mostly tired teenagers checking the clock except one amazing lifeguard and check in staff, would return again for right price my 7 and 9 year old enjoyed it!

Great for families! I would recommend it for family with all age groups. Restaurants are great on location so there's no need to leave the facility. The wristbands are great for the room key and for purchases, very convenient.

Smell of chlorine was overwhelming in water park, water was cold. My son got sick after visiting this place. Food was average, nothing great. Bed was comfy but that's about it. Bathtub/shower too small. No tea, just have coffee in room. Stay was not worth it for what they charge.

The overall experience was a wonderful one .  The best part is my  my kids had a great time.  My kids literally didn't want to leave I almost had to  drag them out .😬👍🏻. This was our second family trip there and there will be many more.

Overall the experience was a good one. However, I wouldn't recommend doing just one night because there is way too much to do. In addition you don't get a full day in the room because you can't check in until 4 pm and have to be out by 11 am. (19hrs). This prevents the ability to take your children back to the room to rest if needed. I would also suggest packing a small bag for the water park not a large one it costs more to rent a locker for a day then it does to park your vehicle overnight and the lockers are small. I would definitely recommend visiting the hotel because we had a blast.

Summary Heading: Attempting to start a new Thanksgiving tradition
Summary: Instead of cooking and exhausting myself, I thought "why not really focus on quality, fun family time?"  My 11 year old had the time of his life ! My husband and I had fun, appreciated the convenience of one stop shopping everything we need was on the premises (except maybe a hot tub to soak our aching bodies after the water park workout.) however our 16 year old was a lot less impressed as the activities skewed a lot younger. The restaurants were really great and a pretty good value too!  Although as a rule, I am not a big fan of the buffet, they did not change my opinion.  I would come back, but I'd eat my Thanksgiving Dinner at the fine dining Restaurant with Chef Hany

We have 4 kids... youngest is 2 and oldest is 16.. this place is fun for the whole family... we all loved it.. the water park is awesome.. We spent one night, but we get to use the water park for two whole days... They have lots of other activities (mini-bowling, arcade, etc.) but we did not do those because of our short stay.

There are many fun things to do but they are all very expensive. There is no hot tub or warming pool for the kids and they get cold even though the water park is 84 degrees. The surface of the water park is very slippery. The wait for the slides is long. You cannot take your own snacks for your kids so plan on forking out  $100.00 for snacks because they will get hungry. The kids did have fun on the slides and in the pools but there is nothing for adults. Won't be returning.

Great place for children.  The size of the park seems smaller than the places in other states.  Rather expensive for hotel stay, but considering the stay includes park admission for the whole family, the price seems legit.

Everything but the check in was as expected. Food and entertainment inside the resort is similarly priced to other area attraction prices. If you have a large family I recommend bringing breakfast and snacks with you to the room.

Children had a blast. The slides were a lot of fun.  We did appreciate the wrist bands to pay for everything.  Front area staff could have been friendlier, very firm with the children who were excited to be there.  Took 2 days to recover from the smell of chlorine, everyone's throat and eyes were burning.

We Love coming here ...fun to be able to have a great vacation even when it's raining....we will definitely be visiting this place again.Rooms fit everyone with extra space .Great prices for food and kids had a blast.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf makes for a great family vacation!
Summary: My son and I spent Thanksgiving weekend at Great Wolf.  We couldn't have choosen a better destination. We both enjoyed the water park immensely, but also enjoyed other activities offered at the resort (mini golf,  bowling, interactive video games, etc). Additionally, most of the resort restaurants we very good (with the exception of Buckets, which was just average). While the resort may seem costly at first, it's important to note that the room cost includes admission to the water park and other activities. So it really is quite a good value. My son and I both agree that this was our favorite vacation!

Need at least 2 nights to fully enjoy. Pros:  water park excellent, free gummy bears, free ears, feels like you are on a cruise ship, cool activities for kids ages 2-13, the bunk beds in room are great with their own t.v., plenty of towels, and close to Disney.  Cons:  our room was very far away from elevator, celebrating our daughter's birthday and wished the birthday poster was complimentary for outside door but needed to buy birthday package for $100 to get it, need hot tubs for adults only, not sure if they have any because didn't go outside to outdoor pool because of rain, water park hours only till 9:00pm...at least 9:30pm.  Overall we were happy to have experienced it and will recommend to anyone with small kids.

Summary Heading: Thanks for a great few days
Summary: My girlfriend and I had 6 of ours boys all ages everyone had a blast! The best part about it was we never had to leave. There were enough restaurants to please all of them.  Waterslides were great for little ones and the bigger boys.

We reserved the grand bear suite, visited with grandparents and kids. The two rooms were divided by doors that could be locked from both sides. Worked perfectly for us. Clean and spacious rooms, wonderful water park. Really enjoyed it. Lots of places to eat close by, did not care much for on site dining. The wrist bands are a nice touch, no need to carry wallet around. One think to complain about is lack of place in bathrooms to hang wet clothes. I would have expected the park to come up with some idea for this

Great place, friendly staff, very family oriented! Lots of activities for the kids. The water park is awesome - lots to do for every age! Kids had great time, and we enjoyed ourselves with them - felt like children too  :)

There was black out when we arrived. It was quickly solved but scared my kids. The water was cold. Kids kept taking breaks just to warm up. I was cold myself. I wish it was warmer as my kids wanted to stay in water all the time.

Awesome experience for my family. Bring your wallet though  because every thing is super expensive. Every impressed with the over all cleanness of the place. Bowling and mini golf were hit activities to do at night.

Water park was fun. All extra activities are very expensive. Restaurants were also very expensive for the quality of food. We chose to leave and eat else where. It's fun for kids 3-12 to take once or twice.

Clean park, attentive lifeguards, personable Chef. We have never stayed at a place that provided activities and lodging together on-site. I enjoyed the ease and comfort that provided. Would like another breakfast option in between $18 buffet and Dunkin Donuts though for families who don't eat enough to warrant the buffet cost.

The water park definitely exceeded my expectations: the slides were excellent and there was a good variety of non-slide water features to keep things interesting (wave pool, surfing simulator, water basketball and more). The hotel has a very resort/Disney feel what with the shops, arcade. dining choices, etc. Since we stayed just one night, it was nice to be able to use the water park from the time we checked in and also as long as you want after checking out the next day. While our reservation included a discount, I'd like to see more affordable rates for an even better overall value.

This is a beautiful resort, very pricey and alot of add ons.... But a nice way to go when you have three generations.  Staff was warm and friendly.  Most of the food was sub par....Nice outdoor tables and bar by the outdoor pool.

Summary Heading: Our recent stay at great wolf
Summary: I would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. This was our fourth time here. The hotel and waterpArk provide fun for all ages. My girls are five and ten . The food is delicious . Everyone is so friendly and accommodating

Had a birthday party for son. It was okay other than the too many small problems like no acknowledged or opportunity to celebrate birthday, tv wasn't working, refrigerator wasn't working in room and the maintenance replaced after 4th try. The water park was fun, but not worth the value. I don't like complaining but there was a bunch of little stuff... so awkward to write this review.

Great wolf lodge is an absolutely perfect place to spend quality time with your family! For the price you pay for the hotel remember that includes water park passes for your family. If you tried to go to a regular water park you'd pay 50 or $60 per person plus the cost of the hotel so great wolf lodge incorporating both fits well with their pricing.  The hotel itself is decorated awesome and there are so many activities for kids it's ridiculous in a good way.  The water park itself is enough to keep anybody occupied all day and through the night but also they have so many other activities to keep you and your family engaged and having a blast!  This was our third trip since Easter to this location and we will continue to go several times a year. It has become our new favorite

We were here for 3 days and didn't leave the hotel for a minute. There is so much to do; the kids never got bored. Between the awesome waterpark and the Magiquest scavenger-hunt-like game (spread out between 6 floors of the hotel) to the 24hr arcade, mini-golf, Ten Paws bowling alley, 3D interactive thriller shooting movies (Gigamon was our personal favorite), and the Great Wolf Kids Store where your child can stuff their own animal friend and pick an outfit (much like Build-A-Bear).... the kids were never bored. I'm convinced that we could've spent an entire week there. The restaurants inside the hotel (there are at least 5...6 if you include Dunkin' Donuts) all have great food and the prices are perfect. We were allowed to bring food in, so we saved a little money by bringing

The Great Wolf Lodge is a great place for family fun. The water park is an excellent, safe, fun; clean environment. The amenities and free entertainment for the kids are great. The staff is friendly and on point. And the price is certainly reasonable for all that one gets.

Every staff member was friendly and helpful.  The water attraction was diversified - something for everyone's age and interest - lifeguards were top notch.  Plenty of towels so you always had a dry one at your disposal.  Story time and pajama dance party were informative and entertaining for the entire family

Summary Heading: Got to check this pricey resort !!!
Summary: Good family trip. A bit pricey. Clean fun! My girls enjoyed the magiquest game and the water park. Totally cool family fun. I would go again. I think the wolf den rooms should be in every room!  That would be so cool.

We have been here 3 times this year and we just LOVE it.  So much fun and just an overall amazing place to take your children.  The staff is amazing.  Everyone is friendly and profesional.  Whoever is runing this location is doing an amazing job.  Until next time!

I am glad that the water park is exclusive to those that stay at the hotel. That makes the occupancy very low on non standard days. Also makes it easy to make the most out of your water park time. You can always go back to the room for a rest or leave for a meal whenever needed. No pressure. Lots of slides and more than most places but being greedy, I would have liked more.  I am sad on how they clean the facility. Perhaps this was just a touch up clean but i was watching a person clean half heatedly and considering that I have two kids, I know ALL the nooks and crannies that my kids get into and I would have appreciated a more through cleaning from staff members.

Spent our son's 9th birthday here and we had so much fun.  The hotel room is ready as soon as we checked in at 2:30pm.  The water park is so amazing, its not too big and not too small.  It has a perfect size to enjoy all the activity the park has to over.  The lifeguards are everywhere which make me feel secure and safe for my kids if I loose sight on them.  I like the bracelet that serves as the pass (for the water park), your key to the hotel room and credit card that I don't have to bring a purse all the time.  My daughter enjoyed the hourly activity in the hotel.  My son enjoyed the magic quest game.  The food is great and reasonable price.  Overall.... it was a nice, safe, clean and enjoyable experience.  We will sure come back.

Location, amenities and friendly staff make for a great vacation. Price is a bit high so a lot of guests stay one night with two days at the water park. Sounds discouraging but trust me it's worth every penny. Better than Disney hotel.

Lovely staff.  The kids had a great time.  If your room isn't ready, there is still plenty to do while you wait - you can even go to the waterpark before you get your room, if you want to! When you check in, everyone gets wolf ears to wear. There is so much to do, for a pretty wide range of ages.  There's story time, dance party, arts and crafts, yoga, etc....The magic quest is a digital scavenger hunt, that takes kids through several floors of the resort can last 6-10 hours - totally fueled my kids imaginations.  They're still writing stories and drawing pictures inspired by magic quest.  The water park has plenty of places to lounge, but also activities ranging from tame to insane.  There are also several places for teeny tiny kids to play in the water.  The lifeguards are

This is a new experience for my kids.  My kids enjoyed the magic quest too, although the wand was not working in the room.\, & they were not able to finish it maybe because it is a short stay (3days)?  One thing that kind of bothers me was that why I was charged for the parking.  I spoke to one of my co workers who visited the place & mentioned to me that it should be included in the room rate, but not in my case.  I want to know why.

This had about a dozen slide my son, 13, did. Other slides for younger kids or not as adventurous. Also the other activities seemed to be aimed to younger children as well, like story time or Magiquest. The arcade was pretty good but that was not included with staying so that was additional funds to participate.

We spent 3 nights at the great wolf lodge and were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and at home. Travis on front desk was wonderful offering us an upgrade to a wolf den and anything we needed to know Travis knew the answers.   The great staff did not stop there.. from housekeeping, food outlet staff through to the lifeguards they all did their jobs to an exceptionally high standard. There was always an activity on for the kids and the waterpark was a huge hit with our family.  My 8yr old LOVED the Magiquest and when the water park wasn't open she was madly dashing around collecting crystals, making new friends and what not.  I would highly recommended staying here for at least 3 nights to really give everything a go.

First timer and loved great wolf, while not inexpensive thought pricing was fair for what for all you get. Very nice, clean newish rooms and fab water park. Cocktails and microbrews available at the park is a plus. Restaurants are mostly pricey but we did have pizza which was excellent and fairly priced. The on site dunkin donuts is overwhelmed in the morning replete with running out of everything and huge lines. Only wrinkle in a delightful stay at great wolf. Plan to be back a lot!

The rooms were large and the accommodations were nice. The staff was very friendly.  The lack of shuttle transportation to the Disneyland parks was frustrating, as the website said the lodge offered shuttle transportation for a small fee when I booked my reservation;  however, when I checked in they said they no longer offer the shuttle.  The dinner buffet was not worth the money and the food quality was poor. The breakfast buffet was excellent.  We did not try the other restaurant,  but my kids loved the Dunkin' Donuts on site.  The waterpark was very fun and not too crowded during our Sunday through Wednesday stay. I do wish that the wave pool was larger.  Overall this is a lovely  resort and very family-friendly.

This place was beyond words. I've worked in hospitality and have never encountered something so friendly and fun as this. Disneyland is fun but they are way too big to focus on their guests as much as this place did. They surely went above and beyond for my family and I. I definitely recommend this place! You won't regret it.

I wanted to Celebrate my Child BDay at this Resort because my child love water parks and when November comes around all the water park are close. And when I found this place and book a vacation there for us! We was Blown away by how fun it was and the activities they had also a 24hrs Arcade. This Place is so Awesome!!!

Summary Heading: Water park's water is tooo cold
Summary: Love the place but for toddlers the pools are tooo cold. We were there during the change from Summer to fall and my children never wanted to go to the pool because it's sooo cold!!!  Hope they figure that out and turn up the heater for the pools. Young kids can't handle the cold water.

Summary Heading: Great Fun for Kids, Grandparents Not So Much
Summary: The water park is terrific. The "suite" was the size of a postage stamp - furnishings reminded me of Motel 6 so don't expect to have any luxuries even at the price we paid. There are plenty of restaurants and fun zone, shops but we went outside to eat. The Tangerine Cafe is almost next door and has excellent Thai food. McDonalds is right across the street so that save some money. The water park out of necessity smelled heavily chlorinated. The various rides in the water park were really great and my grandkids (15 and 11) enjoyed it.

We're so happy that finally, there's an indoor water park in California. We first experienced this place in Canada. Now, the kids can do water activities even in the winter months. Very clean. Convenient. The restaurants are not that expensive. I just wish that they add more variety of restaurants and games/arcades for the bigger kids.

This is the best place to go on vacation I mean there's a indoor waterpark I took my kids and they loved it! I extremely recommend this place to spend some time with family and friends. Clean and safe for kids

Greatwolf is such an amazing place for a family vacation. We went with the whole family ranging from 3 yrs old to 53 yrs old and everyone had something to do and a great time. We created family memories that we will talk about for a lifetime. THANK YOU GREATWOLF!!!! See you next year.

Had 2 days with grandsons and 2 days with granddaughters .  We had so much fun and made so many memories. It was a wonderful resort for grandparents, parents and grandchildren. The water park was great , activities for young and old. The activity were fun for all of us.  The food was good . Everything you need and want in one place.

Kids had a great time ages 13, 9, and 20 months. The staff was nice everywhere except for the ice cream shop (the reason for only 4 stars). We'll definitely go again. It's smaller than I had anticipated but we went on a weekday so it wasn't packed which was great.

Summary Heading: Great place but a little pricey
Summary: We enjoyed the resort, staff were very friendly.  But the extra charges for EVERYTHING became a little ridiculous.  Other than that it was a great time and the kids enjoyed it.  Will probably return when the kids are a little older so that they can explore the water park on their own, as each child wanted to do something different (4 kids) so that got a little difficult.

I stayed at the Great Wold Lodge for my son's 8th birthday along with my 11 and 13 year old.  The kids thought it was wonderful and as the birthday boy said, 'this is the best birthday ever'!  Our stay was in November, so the place was probably half full, which was nice because it kept the lines short at the water park.  I would recommend the place to anyone and my kids can't wait to come back.

We checked in at about 12:30 pm so we can enter into the water park at 1:00 pm.  We were lucky and our room was already available.  There were about 10 people ahead of us at the check-in counter, but the wait was short because they had lots of staff.  All kids got wolf ears, and each person gets a wrist band which provides entry into the water park, parking garage, and hotel room.  The wrist bands is associated to your credit card so you can use that for charges.   We were able to designate the kids’ wrist bands to be without charging capabilities.    Our reservation was for a kidCabin Suite, which sleeps up to 7 people because 2 can be in the sofa sleeper.  The three bunk beds in the separate “Cabin” area of the room is only adequate for kids.  My kids loved that area with its

Summary Heading: One night was enough for us
Summary: We were there for one night and it really was the right amount of time. My kids, (ages 13 and 11 ) along with my niece and nephew(7 and 15) enjoyed the water slides but were ready to go back to the room after just a few hours.   My husband and I did not use the water slides but sat by and watched. Although we sat under a large fan, the chlorine smell became too much and we had to take turns getting fresh air. My son came back after two hours coughing. I asked if he had swallowed water and he said he had not. It possibly could have been the chlorine smell as well.   The room was very spacious and had a large tv, a table, kitchenette area and plenty of space for luggage.   We did not use all of the amenities but I can certainly see how a family would not have to leave. There is a

This resort will keep the family busy from the morning until night.  We spent most of our time in the water park, so we missed out on a lot of the fun activities for the little ones.  Plenty to stay busy without purchasing the extra activities.  Though we will stay longer next time to be able to do more.

What an amazing property!!!! A kids wonderland!!!! I will visit this chain of resorts at least once a year. Spacious room, SUPER CLEAN RESORT. great amenities. Would recommend them having activities open at least until 10pm on a regular basis.   Staff is amazing!

Brought the kids, and kids' kids. Three to 70 years old. Everyone had a great time. Many birthdays going on. Got special wolf ears for the birthday kid (me). Learning I can still do the most extreme water slides. How about 20 foot dead drop when the floor drops away over the slide!

In the words of my granddaughter "I don't want to ever leave!!" We enjoyed our stay! The rooms are comfortable and the den is a must for kids!! We purchased two rooms, a Wolf Pass, a Birthday pkg, and a indoor cabana at the water park. Every Extra PKG is Well Worth it!! It Enhanced our Stay a million times over, especially at the water park where normally you have theatre seating and everyone is in very close proximity, but with the cabaña we had privacy along with a patio table w/chairs, lounge chairs, mini fridge stocked with drinks at no extra charge(since it was already costly, lol), TV, ceiling fan because It could get hot, towels, safe, and storage shelves. All in all the food was good the beds were comfy and even the grownups had a great time!! We LOVED our experience,

This is a great place for families everyone is nice it is clean and not overcrowded. I felt we really got a great value for this hotel they have everything you need for fun in one location food, entertainment and a place to sleep. My son loved the waterpark but we also enjoyed the arcade, mini golf, bowling and scheduled kids activities it was hard to leave! Can't wait to return.

Stayed here for three days and the whole family had an awesome time. We will definitely be coming back.  We arrived late Friday and the check-in was quick and easy.  The dude that helped me at the front was friendly and informative. They use a wristband system so no room keys or cards here. I thought this made things easier since you don't have to pull out a card to access your room. Just a wave of your wristband opens your door. This is also used to access the hotel after hours,  paying for food and items at shops. This made things convenient, especially being at the water park. Our room was nice with some cool decor of wolves and bears.  The kids had a bunk bed and their own tv. There was also a hide-a-bed couch for extra sleeping space. The mini fridge came in handy. Our bed

We went for 1 night with 2 kids and a toddler. The kids loved the water slides and my toddler enjoyed the shallow play area for toddlers. The water was a bit cold so make sure to bring a bathrobe to warm up between slides. The water slides were first rate! Other fun activities included story time with animated animals. For food the pizza was a hit and everything reasonably priced. Lots of fun for the whole family!

CELEBRATED my Bby girls 10th Bday...All guest had a BLAST...guest wanna visit Great Wolf Lodge again...Fun...fun...fun 4 all ages...Family had an  AWESOME experience. ..so looking forward 2  planning another get away there.

Second visit to Great Wolf Lodge. I wanted to spend some time with my family before my vacation to Cancun. Great Wolf is fun for all ages!! Lots of activities for kids besides the actual waterpark. Yummy food & great cocktails... Yes...I said cocktails. Its really fun for all ages!! Cant wait to go again.

Summary Heading: A must visit in SoCal if you have kids or grandkids, or for the kid-at-heart
Summary: Where to begin... The hotel is über family friendly, with activities and a wide range of food choices that appeal to all ages. We chose a theme room with a built-in log cabin with bunk beds for the grandkids. It was more expensive, but it could accommodate all 6 of our family members comfortably.  We splurged because we were celebrating three family birthdays. The log cabin section has a built-in interactive screen that responds to a magic wand which is purchased separately. The wand is a big part of interactive displays scattered around the hotel, akin to a scavenger hunt. The wand remains active for a year if you choose to visit Great Wolf again in that timeframe. No need to buy a wand if you don't want to, because there are other activities inside the hotel from bowling, a

Love this place. This was our second visit. Fun for our entire family :) The staff is wonderful and very friendly and entertaining. We plan on visiting every year with our daughter. The water park is her favorite :)

This is one Of the Best places I have ever stayed at. I have stayed at hotels all over the Us , For pleasure and work . The rooms are on par with any other fine hotel  . But this place isnt just somewhere to stay It's a destination . The waterpark and games .where a lot of fun form y family. A block or two from disneyland if you want  to go there . We had more fuin here than if we went to D.L . but no Long Lines No rude people. My kids didn't want to leave and go to Disney . We had a blat without worrying about keeping an eye out for the kids . Ew would play and rest and play some more . We actually had time to have fun the whole family did . If your tired you can sit down and watch the kids . Or they can dare you too ride the slides . It's been a long time since I've had that

Summary Heading: Lots to complain about, but we would go back
Summary: So overall, our kids had a great time (4.5 yrs, 2.5 yrs, and 6 months). They are dying to go back. We already have reservations for a future visit but made this prior to our stay a few weeks ago. Would we go back if we didn't have reservations? Probably. I'll start at check-in; noonish we arrive and had asked for an early check in. We were told we would be texted with our room # once it was ready. Cell was confirmed. Then we preordered two paw passes but didn't receive any direction on where to go for these things. We weren't even told how to get to the waterpark. We also were NOT told about a $10/night parking fee or. $25 resort fee. This should've been addressed at check in. We park and lug the bare necessaties with us to use the water park but with 3 adults and 3 kids, we had

Summary Heading: Rooms are similar to a Motel 6
Summary: The kids will enjoy the water slides. Best to summarize this place as a Chucky Cheese with an indoor Soak City. The staff works hard to please, but not all staff are properly trained or don’t know how to treat a customer.  The water park has a lot to offer for all ages, but gets crowded mid-day. Many people bring in their own food and drinks which dirties up the place by the end of the day.  Lots of soggy crackers on the ground,

Great place to take the family for a getaway. It's a relaxing atmosphere and I love that you have everything there from arcade, shops and restaurants. These is no need to leave the park. We would definitely come back again.

Summary Heading: Wow...did I say Wow?  I meant WOW!!  This place was everything we hoped and so much more
Summary: I had high expectations for the GWL, specifically because everyone I talked to had said what a great hotel it was.  I was not remotely disappointed and my expectations were met at every turn.  The activities for children (our child is 5) was perfect.  I also saw so many other families with children of all ages (tweens, elementary school, babies, etc.) who were having a blast.  The hotel definitely caters to children and they know how to ensure there are plenty of opportunities to have fun.  The water park...woah mama!  I loved every moment.  There were so many options, and I wasn't bored.  At one point, I got chilly (I get cold easily) so I brought my Kindle, and just enjoyed the sound of the water (it's pretty loud) and relaxed.  I loved Fort MacKenzie - we spent a lot of time

My friends and I had a great stay this past weekend. I have to start this review by telling you I work for a hotel, and typically onto go out of my brand, because of price. I was a little hesitant to spend the money on our stay. We were staying at your property because we did the CHOC Walk Sunday morning and since we were not doing Disney after we thought this would be fun for the kids. OMG! This resort is just amazing. I don't know how to express how amazingredients the staff is and the value of the resort. Lisa at the front desk was just themailing sweetest and she extend our check out till noon, since we were not sure if we would make it back from the walk in time to pack up. Lisa was very sweet and has a personality with guest. The housekeeping staff is also very sweet,

My kids and I had an amazing time! We just went to the lodge not Disneyland! They had a blast! Best staff around!! They were all great with kids and went above and beyond to make sure they were having fun! The place was spotless! Our beds and even the pull out sofa bed were very comfy!!! This was by far our best hotel experience ever and a great trip to Great wolf Lodge! I can't wait for them to come to Northern CA. But they were even worth the drive through LA traffic!;)

I took my daughter to Great Wold Lodge for her 7th birthday on October 24, 2016. We will definitely be back!!! When we arrived at 2pm, we checked in and although our room was not ready, we were told we could leave our luggage with the bell desk and we would receive a text message when our room was available. Our room was ready around 3pm and we went to the room to await our luggage. When our luggage arrived, the bell hop informed me that my suitcase somehow got broken; one of the wheels fell off. I wasn't sure what to say about this, but before I could even think of a response, he told me that the resort would replace my suitcase. I spoke with Rachel and Kevin at the front desk, and they offered to purchase a comparable suitcase for me from Target and assured me that I would

The water park was very enjoyable and fun.  The restaurants had good food and service. The hotel on the other hand...well that could have been so much better.  It was very clear that corners were cut and there was not much attention to detail in the theming and decor of the hotel and the guest rooms. When the resort was designed and built, it seems, cost was more important than the guest experience.     The Hotel lobby lighting is dismal and boring.  The interior design should have done more to tell the story of a grand lodge.  The sound system used for lobby events was cheap making it difficult to hear the staff. The upgraded "wolf den" room was not worth the additional expense, there was a clear lack of planning for how the themed elements integrated with the room.  MagiQuest

Summary Heading: Nice place to go to if you have younger kids
Summary: This is surely a family place. I like that it is close to Los Angeles.  If you have younger kids, they will have lots of fun and really enjoy this place. Not so much for teenagers though. They will just like the water park. But activities are for younger kids only. I just think their price is too expensive.  To stay for 2 nights is almost $800 for a regular suite on weekends. Too much!

This property is good for families with children.  Pool hours change daily so be sure to check them or you will have sad little ones. They offer refillable drink cups for around $14 which is great- during certain hours and if soda machines are stocked.  Overall a great weekend trip for kids and water park adventures.

We had a terrific stay at GWL! We will definitely be coming back. Friendly staff, tons of activities for the kids and the awesome water park! We only stayed one night but was able to play in the water park for two days! Pretty good value when you account for that, Celebrated my sons birthday there, now my other three kids want to go there for their bday!
