We booked the room to go to a Disneyland knowing would have a fun pool and slides too. We didn't realize the hotel was a destination in and of itself. We cannot wait to come back and spend more time at the hotel! There was so much to do we did it even scratch the surface. The water park is out of this world. Ten timebetter than we imagined. Awesome rides. So much fun.  The "newness" of the hotel felt awesome too. Hope they can keep the hotel having that nice clean feeling! We can't wait to come back!

One word Amazing!! We stayed for 2 nights for our 1st time! And this resort was so amazing!! Everything we expected and more staff was kind and hotel was so easy to navigate. The waterpark is huge so much to do! We did lots of activities also went down to the 24 hr arcade and did the mini bowling. Book here you won't be disappointed!

We have been avoiding kid parties for years and been doing overnight stays at theme parks instead. This time it was for our 5 yr old. I had seen advertisements for this place on tv for the other location so I pitched it to my kid and he was immediately on board. This place is pricey but it's soooo worth it. There were daily dance parties, good food, the water park (you have to be a hotel guest), arcade, mini golf, nail salon, etc... And the water park had features for all ages. This was one of our favorite family trips. We will definitely be back each year.

Rooms: the rooms are clean and new, but rather small.  We upgraded to a "Grant Bear Suite", but it is just two connecting basic hotel rooms, not really a "suite", so that was a little disappointing.  The rooms are very loud so bring ear plugs or something to drown out the sound.  You can hear everything in the hallway and the rooms around you.  Also, a beeping garbage truck outside our window woke us up around 6am and we were on the 8th floor.    Check-in:  was smooth and fast.  We arrived at 1:30 on a Sunday and our room was ready so we were able to check in early.    Service:  all the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Four star service all around from front desk to the waterpark and restaurants.  Water Park:  Clean and new.  Overall very fun.  The slides could be organized

Amazing customer service was excellent, our 14 year old Daughter left her stuffed animal behind they went out of their way to locate and return the priceless gem that she has had for the past 12 years!  The family focused and with a PACK of little ones and a teenager it was a great experience for all of us and looking forward to going back!!

It has unforgettable rides that are like rollercoasters.  We were able to have a great time at this indoor amusement park on a rainy day in Southern California.  Bring your whole family for a fabulous vacation.

Summary Heading: Worst experience of my life!!!!! Questionable business policies which are totally discriminatory!
Summary: My grandfather asked my six your to choose any amusement park he wanted to go to for his birthday and he would pay for tickets and hotel. He chose the Great Wolf Lodge. My grandfather told us he had paid for the room Friday night thru Sunday night; check out Monday morning. So Friday after work we took a five hour train ride and arrived at around 9:50 pm. At check in they said room was paid but they needed a credit card to swipe for incidentals. It would not be charged, but a hold for $100 would be on there. They put a wrist band on my son and then asked us to wait a moment. By the time they came back it was now 10:45 at night. They informed us that the room had not been paid for (and would need the balance of $1399 before we could proceed. We gave them a different credit card
Manager Response: Sacha, we are deeply sorry for any confusion or inconvenience you encountered while staying with us. We would love to look into this for you more.  At your earliest convenience, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and provide us with the confirmation number, first & last name on the reservation and the best means to contact you.

Summary Heading: It was average. Not bad, but not wonderful either
Summary: It was about what I expected.  The rooms were clean with fridge and microwave.  The fold out couch in addition to two beds was nice.  We had a view of the parking structure and mountains in the background.  I had an Italian sub at the pizza place for around 13 dollars.  It was ok, had a lot of meat.  The wait was long though. There was only one person ahead of me. They gave me a pager and had me wait around 15 minutes for a sub and salad. I think they hope that I take my kids to the expensive arcade while I wait, which is attached to the pizza place.   I had a couple different salads , one at the snack bar and another at the pizza place.  They were 10 dollars each and the portions were so small. When you check in, they get your phone number to call when the room is ready, but

Summary Heading: Not cheap, but not crazy overpriced.
Summary: Their are so many positive things to say.  First off, The staff is wonderful.  Each member greeted us with a smile, and were very helpful.   We got the room with the bunk beds.  When your have this style, the A/C has to be left at a low temperature because the kids area has no vent of it’s own.  This place has a satellite hookup for the TV.  When we watched the TV the channels were scrambled.  They had general channels, I would hope for more kid programming since they are focused on the family.    The Pool Area:  The experience is so positive.  The lifeguards are on point watching everyone.  The environment feels so safe and organized.  I would always recommend the swim park for another visit.  One thing to take into consideration:  Upon registration they give you a wristband

Gwl needs to figure out the ventilation! I'm not an asthmatic but the chemical smell and lack of oxygen is unreal and not safe for anyone with resp hx. Did the public health dept actually test the air and approve this place? In 2 hrs my eyes were burning and needed to get air. I read reviews before and few talked about how bad it is. Property is clean there were chairs and tables but hurricane Harbor is so much better plus fresh air...I  feel sorry for employees. Will not be back unless they fix ventilation!! Wife had best idea...retractable roof. This place is a public health hazard
Manager Response: Marc, thank you for staying with us and providing us with your feedback.  We monitor air purity and quality levels throughout the day and if adjustments need to be made, they are done so in real-time.  We always recommend our guests to use their best judgment and take small breaks from the action in the water park to refresh themselves by taking quick showers in the water park to wash off chlorinated water and get some fresh air.  We hope your pack will choose to stay with us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great Place to take the kids
Summary: My kids and I had a great time here.  The water park was ALOT of fun.  Since it was October when we visited the lodge there was trick or treating in the lobby for the kids and the hotel was decorated for Halloween.  We went to the water park the afternoon we checked in, had dinner at the pizza place, went to story time and then retired to our room (which was really nice).  We got up the next morning and went back to the water park which was much less crowded.  We will definitely be going back!

Hmmm...where to begin? 2 year old loved every aspect. My 12 year old niece and 15 year old nephew enjoyed it as well. My husband and I enjoyed ourselves more than expected and decided we'd be back.  Here are some things we loved: waterpark access from 1pm the day of check in to closing on the day you check out, close enough to Disney for 1/2 the price of Disney, decorations and extra activities for the kids are thoughtful and cute, nice surprise upgrade, good food at Loose Moose, clean rooms, friendly staff, very efficient check in & check oUT procedures, chat line su per helpful. Here are some things we hated: parking is pricey, $25 pp for buffet...I can pay the same at Disney and there will be characters, the changing area at the Waterpark is crowded, flooded, smelly, and

First time visiting an indoor water park and it was a great, great experience. Lodging: We booked a family room for 2 adults, 3 kids and 2 babies (3 siblings, 2 cousins). The lodge provided a play pen so we were able to sleep relatively comfortably. The rooms are equipped with a mini fridge (no freezer so leave the ice cream at home) as well as a microwave. We brought our own drinks and snacks for the kids to cut on cost. I thought the restaurant inside the waterpark was fairly priced and affordable. We did not (have time to) eat at the other restaurants The Water Park: We visited mid-August and it was not too packed. Most of the lines, if any, were reasonable. The kids had a ton of fun. The rides cater for all age ranges. Our 4 year old poor swimmer enjoyed several activities

There was a used tampon on the side wall of the lazy river. I informed a staff member however the item stayed there and was not discarded which I found very unsanitary. In addition the showers in the guest rooms do not have rubber mats on the inside which is a huge safety hazard. My wife fell inside of the shower due to the lack of grip in the tub and sustained a minor abrasion. In addition the pools weren't to clean due to the fact my 1 1/2 year old son sustained a bacterial infection and received pink eye from playing in the pool
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing these concerns to our attention, as the safety and well-being of our guests is our number one priority.  We sincerely apologize for what you observed, as this fails to meet our expectations.  A member of the leadership team in Garden Grove will be reaching out to you in the near future to discuss this in greater detail.

Summary: This resort is definitely geared towards family fun.  The water park is huge and offers hours and hours of water play.  My grandson actually put down the electronics and got lost in all the water activities.  There are slides galore, a lazy river, a separate area for little ones, and an awesome wave pool.  The food wasn't bad either.  Besides the water park, there's a bowling alley for kids with bumpers and light-weight balls, and lots of additional kids activities, such as dance parties and an interactive spy game.  The upgraded room for 4 offers a separate sleeping area with bunk beds.  This extra area has it's own TV and great kids' decorations.  There's a nice countertop area with a small refrigerator.  The downside to this resort is that it's expensive so expect to pay for

Summary Heading: Great time!!! Best vacation for family
Summary: Best vacation every. My kids had a great time. Would definitely go back. The water park was amazing my son played on it for hours. The spa scoops was very cute and my daughter loved it. The restaurants had great food and was very family friendly.

The Great Wolf Lodge is a fabulous place to take kids.  It seems the majority of patrons there were from the greater LA area doing either a staycation or birthday party for their kids.  We had just finished a week at Disneyland and decided to spend a couple nights at the GWL.  We stayed a total of 3 days/2 nights.  Overall it was a fabulous stay.  Our 5yr old daughter liked it more than Disneyland but our 8yr old son still preferred DL.  We had some friends who stayed at the GWL and also went to DL during the day, but that's probably not taking advantage of the GWL enough and a bit expensive, although they got an AMAZING price.  There are other reviews about the place that are mostly spot on.  We didn't have any problem with the air quality in the water park area.  It was a

Summary Heading: This is our 2nd visit to this amazing hotel.
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge gave us one of our best vacations when we visited in June. We decided to save up and come back over Fall Break. I  didn't think it was possible to have more fun than we had our first trip, but I was wrong! We packed every day with more adventures and experiences.     As a parent of children with  special needs, I am extremely grateful when I find a place that is so understanding and show so much kindness towards individuals with different abilities.  My son with Down Syndrome loved hanging out with his favorite Chefs, security staff, and life guards, more then water slides (which is says a lot with this guy). The general manager Phillip even took time to meet us.   What a wonderful place this Great Wolf Lodge is.  We will be leaving here today and we are

After a grueling 5 days at the Magic Kingdom, we figured we would have further fun by booking two days here.  It turned out to be a pleasant choice but with all the activities available, probably should have stayed one more night.    This is a fairly new Great Wolf Lodge and some of our party had been to the one out in Virginia. The water park seems basically the same except that everything seems a little smaller.  We booked a Grizzly Suite a while back to accommodate our family of 7.  The suite was pretty comfy but a little skimpy as it only had an eating table for 4 but can accommodate 8.  The room was pretty pricey even with the grand opening discount and I would say similar to what you would get at the Grand California as the theme is rustic too so you don’t feel like you’re

Lots of fun things to do for the kids, not just the water park but also video/arcade games, mini golf, mini bowling.... The Executive Chef and his team were awesome in accommodating us for my son's specific and restrictive diet. We are coming back again!!

My family and I has a good time. It was really nice. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was so nice and warm. I wish the night activities stayed open longer. We felt safe and comfortable. A+

Summary Heading: Fun Time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Check in disorganized. I stood in line for 25 minutes before finding out that I could access the water park and resort early and I would get a text message when my room was available and could pick up our keys in the water park. The text message never came. The indoor water park was about the only redeeming quality. We had a great time at the water park. The room was adequate. The sofa bed was uncomfortable. The TV reception was awful. For being a new resort you would think furniture and television would be better.

This place is fantastic for kids, more than you can ever see from their website.  Every detail is thought of to make this a trip that children will not forget.  Even Dad said he would go back there.  We cant wait to get back there.  And best of all a Waterpark without sunburns.....

Went here for my daughter's bday.  Got here around 12:00, there was a short line for check in.  It wasn't a long wait, which was great.  We received 3 wolf ears for the kids to wear.  My daughter's had a bday hat on it so that the staff would know it was her bday.  She was really excited about it. The room was big enough for the 5 of us. We had two beds and a sofa bed. The water park was always set at 84 degrees so it was nice and warm.  It was pretty clean and the kids loved it.  The only thing I would say was uncomfortable were the chairs that didn't recline. Someone also stole my flip flops which was annoying. They had a 24 hour arcade.  Also, a mini bowling alley and glow in the dark mini golf. The restaurants were overpriced as usual.  The buffet had average food with a

Summary Heading: Amazing Place and what a great time!
Summary: All I can say is this place has it all! It is truly enjoyable at any age. Perfect location and great service from everyone. I stayed back in August and my daughter is still asking me when are we going back! A big thank you to Tammy Park for assisting me with my reservation and we will definitely be back soon!

Great resort for families with young children (13 and younger). Not much to do for other teenaged kids. Tons of attractions to keep your kids entertained all day and night. Resorts also service beer in the water park area. Main restaurant has a full services bar. Your given a wristband to wear which makes it very convenient to get in and out the parking structure, guest room and ordering food from all restaurants, grills, etc. Just one swipe of the wristband and it's charged to your room. The only con is that the beds are hard as a rock, both the bunk beds and the queen bed. Woke up with major lower back pain. Over I had a nice stay.

Summary Heading: Amazing Family Resort for the Water Enthusiast
Summary: If you are looking for a hotel to give you multiple options to keep the kids entertained and have them talking for weeks about it, this is the place.  We booked a mini wolf suite with bunk beds for the kids.  At about $200 per night, it includes admission to the football field sized indoors water park exclusive to hotel guests.  Water slides, wave pool and good food all within a huge indoor area attached to the hotel.   We spent 5 hours the first day in the water park, and I had to Convince my kids to go to Disneyland that night instead of staying until the water park closed.  Only 2 miles south of Disneyland and only 2/3 of the room rate of other hotels near the park made this a gem.  Shuttle rides every 30 minutes to Disneyland or a $9 Uber.  Both great options.  My 8 year old

My family and I stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge this past weekend (my husband and I, our 14 year old son, 9 year old daughter and 3 year old daughter). We had a great time. This hotel is definitely kid-friendly. The weekend we stayed they started their Halloween celebration, which added to the experience. We did have a minor hiccup at registration, but the hotel personnel were able to fix it right away. In fact, every staff member that we encountered were very friendly and helpful.  The waterpark was small, due to the fact that it is indoors I can understand that. My kids enjoyed it. The toddler area was perfect for my 3 year, she didn't need to wear her life vest, which was nice. The wave pool and other areas were entertaining enough for my other two. The only bummer is that due

Summary Heading: No working AC and clogged toilet at the new Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We loved the water park and resort minus our very. Standard room. AC never cooled below 77 degrees and toilet remained clogged even after being repaired 3 times. This is a brand new resort! Sadly, when reported upon checkout "supervisor" offered only apologies before I pressed for something more considering we paid $375 for a fitful nights sleep with the added bonus of being afraid to use the toilet! Free lunch was offered, although we had just checked out and then 20% was taken off our bill. Basically, cost of the lunch. That was it! In other resorts when a night of sleep is list typically they bend over backwards to make it up to you. Usually a night for a night.
Manager Response: Julie, thank you for staying with us this past week and for bringing your concerns to our attention.  We strive to exceed guest expectations and it appears we missed the mark in assisting your pack and for that, we are deeply sorry.  Our Director of Engineering will be reaching out to you in the near future to discuss your concerns in greater detail.

Summary: Beautiful place that started with friendly faces and warm welcomes. Tam was especially helpful at the front desk talking us through everything the place had to offer. We have kids ages 2, 5 & 6 and they all thought this is the "best place ever". We had a wolf den room which offers the cave like setting with bunk beds. Again the kids were ecstatic over it. We went mid week and overall I assume the hotel was probably at half capacity (if that) which made it a very short wait for all the slides and a very enjoyable time. There are multiple options to eat inside and just outside there are multiple fast food/diners to choose from if desired. We opted not to purchase any of the extra packages and the kids didn't skip a beat or even notice. This resort is definitely one the kids will

I have a lot of pros and cons for this excellent place to visit. The only reason I gave it very good instead of excellent was because of the fact I am handicapped, which is not really well thought out as far as I am concerned. We arrived about as early as we could which was 1pm on Sunday, and there was a long line, but the caveat was that there was someone there who could take your name and number and give you wristbands and text you when your room was ready. But I was able to go ahead because of my disability and they easily gave me a room close to the elevator, though the elevators are placed at the very end of the public areas rather than the middle, which was a walk at times. The stairs are more convenient, which are sometimes difficult for me. We checked in, brought in our

I went to the Lodge this weekend. The check in was easy. The Park was crowded although I checked in on a Sunday. I spent 2 days and one night at the park. Being in a steamy chlorinated room for 2 days is enough. The Lodge also have plenty of other activities. Since its Halloween time your kids can go trick or treating. They have several interactive games to play, bowling, miniature golf, and a 3D movie theater where you can have an inter active experience, story time, a dance party, and other things they have planned for your kids throughout the day. I bought my kids the wolf pass. We had the breakfast buffet which was good and full of alternatives. We also ate at the Fire Grill which was just okay but convenient. Over all the kids had fun.

Went there to celebrate my kids birthday, had fun at the waterpark, rooms were nice and clean. Bad experience at Loose Moose restaurant, no specific server, not a lot of choices in food, chicken was dry. Two servers said there would be cupcakes for my kids, the last server was so eager to give us the bill. When i asked for the 3rd time about the cupcake, she madenus wait for 10 mins before she told us that theres no cupcake  available. My kids were so sad but whatever, weve moved on. The next day after  ee checked out, we found out that our 3rd row seat ahs been stolen, our window got busted open, and it was right in their parking structure! It was a horrible experience!!! Never coming back again!
Manager Response: Eleanor, the safety and security of our guests is our number one priority. We understand our leadership team has been in direct contact with you and is cooperating with law enforcement to resolve this issue. We regret the impact this has had on your family. If you have any further questions or concerns please contact our management team directly, or email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com.

Summary: Every aspect of our stay here was exceptional. Stayed 5 days and 4 nights. Appearance of lobby, rooms, common and dinning areas all superior. Very clean and well maintained. Kids loved the water park, arcade and additional kid friendly events. Great location close to Disney. Every staff member was accommodating, helpful and friendly. The holloween decorations and events were spectacular.

Summary Heading: Memorable, for all the right reasons
Summary: The moment you walk into the lodge you feel welcomed. Everyone we encountered during our 3 day/2 night stay was friendly and helpful. The waterpark was thrilling for the whole family. A memorable vacation, for all the right reasons.

Summary Heading: GREAT time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We had the BEST time!  Excellent food, fun, & service!  Clean, comfortable....can't say enough!  Highly recommend adding a late check out--felt like we had an entire extra day! Will definitely go back again!  Thanks GWL for the wonderful family memories!

Learned from our mistake last time arrived earlier, and luckily our room was ready. So relaxing with less people visiting. Even made an evening trip to downtown Disney. We upgraded to the wolf den room and the kids loved it!

Summary Heading: Great for families of all ages
Summary: Everyone from 2 to 52 in our group enjoyed this. Everything is well thought out for families. My kids had an incredible vacation. Next time I will probably bring sandwiches in the room as the food and all the attractions other than the water park can get expensive. Overall an incredible experience. We have been recommending it to all our friends and are already planning the next trip.

Our family recently visited after a day at disneyland!! We were not quite sure to expect and The Great Wolf Lodge did not dissapoint!  We had so much fun from late night arcade to family yoga in the morning and getting to meet the characters. There is fun for everyone! We are already planning to book our next trip! Thank you GWL!!

My husband,our daughter and her two children (5 and 8) and myself went for just one night. We arrived at 1:30. We got into our rooms right away. We were celebrating our 5 year old granddaughter 's birthday so they had everything ready- poster,balloons,cake, cars and gift cards to be spent at the Lodge. The children had a ball on all the slides. We went bowling and played the games. There were so many things to keep them busy- they got their face painted and made balloon animals. We will definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Every other hotel in the Anaheim area will provide you with better service
Summary: I am currently sitting in my hotel room at Great Wolf Lodge on my final night writing this review. We have 3 rooms and are staying for 3 nights. One of our 3 rooms had not receive daily housekeeping service today when we returned home from Disneyland around 3:00pm. We went to the front desk to tell them and ask for this to be done as we were leaving again for a couple of hours. In our minds at this point this was not a big deal, more annoying than anything but not a deal killer. At 6:30 when we returned from the water park, the room had still not been serviced. I called the front desk and asked to speak to a supervisor. I was asked what for and I explained the situation, I was then transferred to a housekeeping manager. I thought this was weird and very unprofessional as every
Manager Response: Julie,  Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for bringing your concerns to our attention!  We are deeply sorry for our shortcomings in getting one of your rooms available on time and with attempting to speak with a Front Desk Supervisor, as this fails to meet our expectations in both regards.  We have escalated this to the leadership team at the lodge to review and they will follow-up with you directly once they have done their due diligence.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: I loved, LOVED it here. Yes, it's up their in price, but it is so worth it. The staff here is so kind. You get these cute little wolf headbands for the family, which is included. Their are tons of things for your family to do. The water park is, yes, AMAZING. The lines aren't long, it isn't burning hot because its indoors, and the water is warm. The food isn't a bad price of you keep in mind that this is a tourist place.

This is a great family place. The water park has many different fun rides and for different ages. We have three kids 4,12 and 15. All three are enjoying this place! There is so much to do and we can't wait to experience the rest of this place!

The water park was a blast, love the indoors didn't worry about my kids and the sun. That's a plus, lots of stairs to go to the slides but super worth it. It is pricey. . .so save up. . . If you can  Afford to come to Great Wolf Lodge then highly recommended.

We spent two days splashing around at the Great Wolf Lodge. We have three kids aged 9, 11, and 13 and they were on the water slides from the time they opened until closing. The supervision is incredible, and we all had a great time. Your wrist band acts as your key and allows you to purchase anything in the hotel, which is great, but can be dangerous! Two days was the perfect amount of time to spend here. Definitely family oriented, keep an eye out for specials from the hotel, we were able to book a room for $169 a night during a 48 hour sale. This included four water passes. We upgraded at check in to a Wolf Den room which was $229 a night and included five water passes.

The staff were very friendly, the pool, hotel, and everything else were very clean. The kids had an enjoyable time even us parents. We will definitely come back again next year :)! Book early because the prices vary everyday!

This indoor water park has a lots of fun ride. My boys like them. They try everything. The flow rider so adventure. And staffs very friend. They allow you early go into water park before your room is ready.  And there are lots of good restaurant around great wolf lodge.

Warning !!!With regards to waterpark------- Be careful!! The waterpark has no security cameras and minimal security!! I saw drunks playing irresponsibly next to little children- they sell alcohol!! I saw drunks stumbling and throwing up next to my kids and feared for my child's safety. The lifeguards couldn't do anything about drunks jumping into the wave pool full of children from high up. All they do is whistle.   There were 2 incidents of "accidental fecal contamination" in wave pool that closed it down for 30-45 min to clean up. But that's out of their control.   Also theives are there prowling and stole my friends iPhone 6 plus when not paying attention for just a minute. Front desk did not seem sympathetic to the loss. Don't take anything valuable and keep close watch of
Manager Response: Ben,  Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Southern California!  The safety of our guests is our number one priority and if there is ever anything a guest feels is unsafe, please bring it to our attention.  Our security team can intercede with the disruptive guests and as necessary, work with local police.  If you should have any other questions, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: excellent place for children to have fun, my kids loved it. We celebrated my son's 9th birthday, he was a little disappointed, we stayed at knots berry farm hotel for my daughter birthday and they gave us two free sundae, he was looking forward to his sundae, i felt i didn't have to pay extra, as it is room was somewhat expensive and on top of that i had to buy a birthday package, no thank you.

Great overall experience, but had some things happen that would warrant this.  1) Room had leaking toilet, 2) Had 2 random food charges on our bill, 3)Server at Buffet accidentally charged us for our infant son.  We didn't ask for any form of compensation for the leaking toilet, but kind of wished this was checked prior to us checking in.  We had to move rooms later, as maintenance had to verify in fact it was leaking.  So I had to stop our waterpark visit to move our luggage to the new room.  No form of compensation, upgrade, or voucher was offered.  #2 and #3 would have been a terrible charge if I didn't review the bills.  If I didn't spot the random charges to our room account, we would have had to pay an additional $40+ for either people charging to our room (or employees

Summary Heading: Unique Place but Prob a One and Done spot
Summary: I took my boys and some friends here a few weeks ago to see what the buzz was all about. An indoor water park sounded cool. My boys are 9 and 12 and they enjoyed it, but they are not asking to go back and I am thankful for that. On the plus side - its a novel concept - everything under one roof - lodging, food, games, water parks, etc. In reality the slides were OK and the staff seemed nice and attentive...but the place was way too jammed to have fun - all the chairs and tables were taken and barely any place to settle. There is a nice outdoor area that seemed less crowded than the indoor part. The boys enjoyed the arcade and the big kid slides, but the lines for the good slides were quite long and the stairs almost too narrow to navigate making everyone bump into one another

We had a great time, though my son was on the old side... perfect for 6-8 year olds.   Well themed, open spaces, good sized rooms. Loved the wristband for accessing your room, water park, charging purchases. Very convenient. The staff was amazing! Additional activities felt a little pricey, wish there was more for older kids.  Lines got a little long during busy times... and for the price we paid, the showers in the water park should be stocked with soap and shampoo/conditioner. I was really shocked to find the dispenser full of the pink industrial type hand soap.

Summary Heading: This place is a must to stay and play
Summary: Where do I start....our family loved this place. The large indoor water park had plenty to do for all ages. The best part about this place is everything is very convenient. They have several restaurants and places to get snacks or dessert. The rooms have a fridge and microwave, coffee maker. The give you a wrist band that does it all, it's the key to your room and allows you to charge everything to your room so it eliminates the need to bring your money and wallet. Your family never needs to leave to eat because there are plenty of choices, The food is pretty good as well. The have a large arcade/game area. They have story time, face painting, and other activities for the kids. The have a store in case you forget anything and a Dunkin donuts for you coffee donut freaks, an ice

We booked the Great Wolf lodge for our daughters 10th birthday.  We had 6 girls and two adults in the party.    Considering the check-in line was very long, the actual check-in was fast and painless.  We had ordered the birthday package and the room was decorated as expected.  The water park was an experience, an indoor water park in SoCal seemed odd to me but ok.  The minute you walk in to the water park you are hit by a wave of chlorinated humidity and stale air.  There are actually signs reminding you to go outside for fresh air!  There are huge tubes that remove stale air and pump in fresh air, and while it exceeds the CA standard for indoor air it was not enough to make the space tolerable for more than a few hours at a time.  After a while my eyes started burning.  The
Manager Response: Flor,  Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Southern California and for sharing your feedback with us!  I am sorry that the conversation you had with our management team was not to your satisfaction, as we strive to meet our guests needs when they allow us the opportunity to correct any problem that arises.  Our leadership team in Garden Grove is reviewing your particular case with fresh eyes to see what we can do better in the future.  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary Heading: Very fun but dirty water park
Summary: We arrived at 1:00 on Labor Day and as expected, the place was packed. Our room wasn't available until 4:00 so we immediately went into the water park. Our very first impression was not favorable. The place was a mess. Every table was full of dirty plates and trays, there was food spilled everywhere, soggy french fries and napkins were on the ground, as well as piles of used, wet towels. They clearly didn't have the staff to keep up with the demand and we didn't see a single housekeeping person. We went back to the water park the next morning and were glad to see that the place had been given a thorough cleaning overnight. However, by 2:00 that day, the bathrooms and changing areas were disgusting. If you're queasy about pool deck cleanliness like I am, bring water shoes. I had

Summary Heading: Great time at the Great Wolf Lodge in SoCal
Summary: The staff were all friendly and very knowledgeable about the resort and the activities. Our 6 year old had a blast. Do get the Pawpass and the breakfast buffet.  The Pawpass comes with many things for your child. The major item that it includes is the MagiQuest. Your Child chooses a wand and goes on a Quest throughout the Hotel. This Quest will last for hours, we did not finish. They say it stores your progress so the next time you come you can start where you left off. Other items you get with the Pawpass is a "build a bear" animal that also comes with a quest. Swim googles, tattoos, game card, and others. Definitely worth for you little one. The Breakfast Buffet is also a good deal. The selection and the quality is excellent. We all had a great time at the water park too,

Summary Heading: Great time and lots of fun!
Summary: I live locally and was able to get a discounted rate coming mid-week.  Our school district starts late, and most other school districts were already back in session, so the water park was empty!  No lines, no crowds, and the discount rate was the only way I could afford to go.  The best part about our one night stay is that you get both full days at the water park.  We were able to play while waiting for our room to be ready and continued to play long after we checked out.  The kids enjoyed every water slide, and I even enjoyed them as well and I'm a mom!

I went with 4 kids age 3,7,8 and 12. They all had a blast the water park has attractions for every age. Our favorite was the wave pool! They provide life vest for the kids in 3 sizes. I wouldn't bring a baby I have a 11 month old, she stayed home with dad.

Summary Heading: Good weekend getaway location for family
Summary: Love to have a big water park next to the hotel so we can walk to our room for shower. We spend the day in the water park and played the arcade game at night. Kids will never get bored because they also have story time activity or morning yoga. Plan to stay for 2 days because the guest can visit the water park in both check-in and check-out day. Highly recommend for a short family vacation.

We had an amazing time with no lines for any water park adventures by going the Tuesday after Labor Day.    I could not imagine going during summer as the water park was fabulous but with 50 % more people and lines to slide this could be miserable!  It was very warm and humid in the water park.  The lifeguards were wonderful, observant and personable and did not bark at the children like at the Disney hotel slides. I heard stories about long check in lines but we walked up at 2:30 with no line.  The front desk employees, as well as everyone else we encountered were friendly and helpful.  Lodge Woodfired Grill was good and priced as expected for a hotel.  No complaints.  Rooms were clean and basic with nice lodge-like decor.  Refrigerator and microwave were a nice addition. Lots

Summary Heading: Fun experience but way overpriced and overcrowded for what you get
Summary: Glad we went to have the experience but we were not impressed. For how much we paid we expected a much nicer hotel with some amenities. We also expected the water park to be properly staffed. The lines for each ride were really long and inefficient. Sometimes one staffer would be working two slides (going back and forth) leading to a lot of unnecessary downtime between riders and making the line way too slow. Kids like the waterpark and the magic (costs extra btw) though so glad we can check it off the list.

Beware of extra costs at this hotel. Parking fee, resort fee, arcade, mini golf, bowling, build a stuffed animal, wands....if you're not careful things add up. $50 dinner for myself and my 4 year old. Hotel not really in an area where you can walk to food except for McDonald's across the street.  Tip: wait until your child is 42", then they can almost ride all the rides  Military discount, friendly staff, clean rooms is why I gave 4 stars out of 5  Take advantage of the Free nightly activities, they'll make you feel you got your money's worth.

Great place to stay. We loved how there was plenty for our toddler to do... From story time to the dance party and all the activities in between it was a great time. Felt like you were in a cruise. The room key and your credit card were programmed into your wristband so you didn't need to worry about anything. When given the choice of Disneyland or great wolf lodge, my daughter said "great wolf lodge."  Now that has to say something b

Summary Heading: Fun and Clean Rooms - Yes, a little pricey
Summary: Just came back from a one night stay.  I read the reviews so I kind of knew what to expect.  We were there during Labor Day weekend, so I was a little worried that it was going to be too crowded.  But it wasn't!  Here's a recap:  parking was fine, had to pay for it, but it was in a structure and close to the hotel.  check-in was a breeze and they gave us each some wolf ears (nice touch).  I signed up online for a free 'membership' and got $50 credit to use (nice!).  You are able to use the waterpark on the day you check in from 1:00 pm.  We checked in at 2:00 and the room was available.  The room was spacious, 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa (very handy), good size TV, good size bathroom, mini fridge - handy for water...etc and a microwave.  The water park was a good size, not

Summary Heading: Not worth it for the price.
Summary: Spending over $1000 for two nights you'd expect decent service. Not so at the Great Wolf Lodge. Upon arrival the parking attendants were very rude and unhelpful. I got out to check us in (which there was a very long line) while my husband waited in the car with our 3 kids. Typical for a hotel right? Well according to the attendants, we weren't allowed to wait there, and that they had to "keep it clear". There were 4 lanes open, and only 3 cars including ours total. What more "open" did they need? On top of that, the service at Dunkin Donuts in the hotel was terrible. A popular place in the morning, you'd think they'd have it properly staffed. Instead the 2nd register attendant left on her break with no word to her co-workers and leaving 15+ people in her line. The television

We had a great time at The Great Wolf Lodge! One night with 2 days of water fun was perfect! It's all a blast! Every employee there is so friendly and the patrons are smiling and laughing. Great food! Highly recommend the breakfast buffet. We brought fruit, cheese and crackers for an afternoon snack but lots of yummy eating options there. Prices seem fair. Refrigerator and microwave in rooms. You can't bring your own food to water park, just enjoy it back at your room. Rooms comfortable and quiet. What a concept! Great for all ages.. Even Grandmas and Grandpas watching their families. They keep it pretty warm inside the water park so if you are wet there is no chill. Water temps refreshing. I heard comments about water shoes because slippery when wet. Just don't run and you

We had our family reunion here in sept. 2016. New place. Very nice. Great inside water park but not much outside. Guest services are nice. The restaurants are pricy but the good is good. Lots of places off site to go get food. Better and cheaper.

Summary Heading: Great fun for kids and the kid at heart!
Summary: Just returned from a stay here with my 7 and 9 year old boys. Wow, finally something that beat out Disney! We must have played the MagiQuest game for 6 hours and easily had them turning into prunes at the water park for the same amount of time.  Pros: Tons to see and do with many different ages. Newspaper for your room, great options for celebrating occasions. Can bring in food to areas other than the water park. Cons: Feeling nickel and dimed to death. There's a charge for the room, the resort fee, the typical up charge for having a Dunkin Donuts on site, wickedly expensive food, and can't see Disney fireworks.

We did a last minute end of summer trip here and it was a blast. Something for adults and kids. Major kudos to the lifeguards. Those people are so on top of it. We felt our kids were very safe with them around. Service was excellent. The Lodge restaurant had incredible food. The only thing that was a little tough is there wasn't too much direction on how the lines worked or where you're supposed to go to get rafts and such. You do figure it out quickly though. The hotel itself was very nice as well. They also have a drink kiosk for the parents at the water park too. All in all a terrific place. We will be back!!

We waited for 45 minutes to check-in.  Only 4 people working the counter for 50 guests. They need to hire more workers or put in kiosk. We'll see how other activities go. Welcome cookies are nice. It's little cold in September

This place is 10 year old child heaven! Having said that we also had 2 14 year olds who had lots of fun. Pros: rooms were basic but clean, have a fridge and microwave. We were in the kids den and the kids loved their own little space. The hotel has plenty to do especially for younger kids. The waterpark is great. Good variety of slides. Waits were not long and we were here prime time so in off times must be really great. We found  the area clean well cared for and TONS of life guards. For post pool time The interactive wand game is very fun and if you can get kids to share not crazy expensive if you figure the number of hours of fun it provides. We got a cabana for our check out day. Would highly recommend this as you essentially have a room for the day- has a safe, fridge and a

Summary Heading: Kids had a blast but be careful with slips and falls
Summary: Definitely something kids will enjoy tremendously. Lodging and food are great, though overall park and bathroom were a bit dirty especially on the busier day. Definitely wear water shoes and be careful as stairs and floors can be slippery. We saw two people carried away on stretchers on the busiest day that we were there. Recommend to go during the week to avoid the larger chaos.

Summary Heading: Your Kids Will Have a Wonderful Time
Summary: It's much more than just a water-park; as everything is geared towards the little ones.  But in the end, even the grown-ups had a great time.  From the arcade, to the interactive quest in the hallways, and the storytime characters; you will not have much quiet time.

The service here is great! I was in Anaheim for Disney. We spent three days at Disneyland. The fourth day, the people I came with took off to Legoland. Since I was told that Legoland is for younger kids. I didn't think my 11 year old son would enjoy Legoland, so we stayed behind. We decide on a waterpark. We found out that there was a great wolf lodge nearby. I looked into it. Checked out of my hotel and took an uber to great wolf. From the moment I stepped out of the car, I was made to feel welcome. There was someone with a smile to open the door. Check in was so fast and easy. Since it is the end of the tourist season and kids are going back to school, there are less guests in the hotel. Your nights stay includes waterpark passes. You can come early and use the waterpark

Not only is the indoor water park available, they have a range of activities for children of all ages!!! The main lobby area is so relaxing, welcoming and beautiful! The staff members especially a young gal named Stephanie, are super amazing and knowledgeable and very helpful! The underground arcade is open 24/7 and they have a wide selection of different games. They even have a scavenger hunt for the kids with kiosks located all around the resorts where they lead you and a fun adventure!!!! Definitely planning our next vacation already!!!! And we just left!!!!

My family and I had a great time and can't wait to go back. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. My kids loved all of the activities. Rooms were spacious and beds were comfy. Will definitely come back again before next year.

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money. Overhyped and expensive
Summary: Force you to stay the night - no need. Way overpriced. Lowest tier room $450+ doesn't offer queen beds at all.  We are small people but double sized bed sharing is ridiculous. Have to upgrade to get a larger bed. Terribly slow service at the BBQ restaurant and mgr made me feel guilty for asking for a discount because of the 1hour + wait on our food (just salads and sandwiches!).  Waterpark is underwhelming. Really great marketing team that makes it look so much bigger with so many more rides in the commercials. Realistically it's reslly only for 4-6 year olds. My 8 and 10 year olds were kinda bored. Long wait times. They told us they'd call us when our room was ready at 4pm - no call, text or email. Finally at 5pm my husband had to leave the waterpark to check on our room to see

No air circulation in the water park, kids ended up with a respatory infection and a trip to the ER.  Full size beds are way to small and hard as a rock Buffet food is terrible Resturant reservations should be made before you get there, no one told us

The Pros: Great entertainment. The water park is a blast. The lines were short and way more reasonable than Raging Waters. The park is nice and warm (but the air conditioning hits you when you leave the water park). Not too crowded. The food is good and the prices were surprisingly reasonable. They have free towels available in the park. Outside of the water park, there's plenty of activities for everyone (arcade, miniature golf, candlepin bowling, etc.). Staff was excellent. Everyone was very helpful. If you forget any swim wear or accessories, they sell them on site. Our room included a mini fridge and a microwave.   The Cons: Very pricey. Rooms are very ordinary for the price. They need to work on their birthday packages. It's not worth buying the birthday package at $75 per

Finally, a new player in OC to take on Mickey. Great Wolf lodge live up to its reputation. Great hotel, friendly service, amazing indoor water park. Our standard room was clean, spacious with fridge, microwave and wall safe for your valuable.  The kids enjoy the free activities like face painting, art, story telling, generous-ticket-giving arcades and the water park, Plenty of parking with airport trolley that you can use to haul your luggage.    Overall an amazing experience. We will definitely stay again in the future.

Summary Heading: Pricey but great fun for adults and kids alike
Summary: My son decided not to have a party but instead celebrate his bday here.  I was reading all the reviews and I have to agree, super pricey but it's a fun place for kids.  The room was simple but very clean, had everything we need and more. The water park was very humid when you come in and the smell of chlorine was strong, but I guess it's to sanitize and clean the place, after awhile the smell becomes bearable specially when the fun begins.  Super place to come and enjoy with family. Would  recommend to come and enjoy the place

We had an amazing weekend at the Great Wolf!!! The kids loved everything from their den sleeping area to the magic wands and quests they used them on. Best of all was the water park. We adults enjoyed the freedom of not having to worry about the kids and our areas!! The staff at all the restaurants and the bar areas are the best!!! Hani, Barry, Carlos and everyone else made this such a memorable weekend. I cannot say enough about the quality of the food and drinks available as well as the variety and surprisingly the value. Usually at a resort like this you pay a lot more for this kind of quality!!! Great job all around to everyone involved!!!

Summary Heading: Very fun for the whole family
Summary: Excellent stay for one night but beyond that it can get somewhat boring if not for the water park and extra things to do. Let me start off by saying the gym for those who are interested has no weights just treadmills and a place to stretch. They need sliding doors for guests brining in luggage from the garage. The lack of music in and outside the waterpark is non existent and good luck finding chairs midday for your family because towels are reserving almost all except in the kiddie park. But this is not a complaint just some pointer outs that ive noticed and should be changed. The experience is one to tell all friends and share on social media. I couldn't resist taking videos and photos throughout the park and my kids had a better time here then any beach or outdoor water park.

Loads of fun at the waterpark.  The staffs keep up with the maintenance very well.  Lines for check-in is long, but staffs at the check-in counter are very professional, polite, cheerful and helpful.  Restaurant service is great.  Food is ok, no surprise, but nothing to complain about.  Hotel room is very clean, and the noise isolation is surprisingly good for a place like this with kids running around all the time.  The mattress is too soft for my preference.  This is a great place for families to spend 2 days at.  One and a half day at the waterpark is just the right time.  Price is a little high but everyone will find it well worth it.

Summary Heading: SO FUN!  Can't wait to come back!
Summary: We, 2 adults, 3 kids (ages 5-8) came up from San Diego for 3 nights/4 days. We rented a Cabana for our stay, which I highly recommend.  Cabana rental gives you access to the water park at 9am on your arrival day!! We fully expected to leave our bags and go straight to the water park. The plan was to beat any rush at the front desk and have a family meeting place. We were incredibly lucky and a room was ready on arrival!  Yes, thank you!  We were given a first floor room which was great because we were able to bypass any wait for elevators! Not that they were always busy but it was just one less thing for us to consider. We reserved a Kid Cabin and the kids adored their room.  So excited on arrival and then later when they got their animals and wands to activate the extra

Summary Heading: Disneyland is great, but so is the Great Wolf Lodge!
Summary: My family and I visited the Great Wolf Lodge at the end of July 2016. This place is incredible! The lodge designers excelled way beyond what is expected! The tube slides and mat slides grabbed our attention. The water park was so great, we stayed for about 8 hours one day! The wave pool was great! We also checked out the cargo nets, basketball hoops, wave rider, and raft slides. Our favorite slide was the Howlin' Tornado! The drop on that slide will definitely get your attention. Also, the lodge lifeguards are definitely keeping the water park as safe as possible. The lifeguards are very friendly and focused on the guests. The magic quest seemed fun for the kids. They were traveling around the lodge to find the many different magic quest stations. The room was great for us

Stayed at Great Wolf Fri and Sat, me and my kids had a blast. The children are 8 yes old to 17yrs and there was something for all of them to do. Planning my next visit already. The resort is a little pricey, but it is worth it.

Summary Heading: Fantastic staycation for our So Cal family!
Summary: A big vacation wasn't in the budget this year, but Great Wolf Lodge was a great way to wrap up the summer. We spent three days and two nights here as a surprise for my children. Our group included two grandparents, an adult, kids ages 8 and 12, and one 70 lb. service dog. We upgraded our room to the two room suite which gave us plenty of space for everyone.  The water park had something for all of us. My daughter loved the wave pool and my older son was especially keen on the boogie boarding attraction. Of course the water slides were a hit too.  As far as the rest of the hotel, the food was tasty, dunking donuts was a hit with our family. The magi quest game was fun for my kids who were a little old for the other kid programming. What I can't say enough about is the staff here.

We took our 6 year old daughter to Great Wolf Lodge for a weekend staycation and had the best time. Our room had a little "Wolf Den" in it, that consisted of a bunk bed and TV just for her. The room also had a fridge, safe and sitting area with couch and coffee table. Everything is BRAND NEW, very nice. Not fancy, just NICE. While at the water park our daughter said "This is the best place ever! It's way better than Disneyland!" There were only two rides she could not go on, due to her height, but that still left plenty to do. They give everyone in the family a wrist band and the parent's wrist bands can be used to get into the room and to charge to the room. So you don't really need to bring anything to the water park. Asides from the park there was lots to do. Arcade, bowling,

Kids had a great time. Didn't eat in the hotel, went next door for pizza. Water slides were fun, be sure to be at the waterpark entrance at 9am to get some rides in before it gets crowded. Rooms are very spacious.

Our 2 and 4 year old, along with us had a blast! By far the best vacation spot and will return yearly. Staff super friendly, super clean and safe. The lifeguards are professional and don't mess around, there are plenty of them. I felt very safe and relaxed during our stay. The rooms are great and the food is good. Pricey, we ate a couple of meals in our room with store bought food to balance out the prices. The website doesn't do itself justice so you have to just go for it. We are already planning our next trip there!

Everything is new in this building. MagicQuest game is so much fun. You get to walk a lot (bring comfortable shoes), you get to bond with your kids, you get to play in the water a lot. neither my wife or I saw reason to leave the property during our stay. Only one minor thing. the TV reception was very poor. the picture kept buffering like we were watching a computer program. No big deal, since we were there to play and not watch tv.

We had a nice family stay. The kids enjoyed the water park and other hotel features (bowling, mini golf, arcade, movies, story time, etc).  The water park is really fun, with options for all ages.  Plenty of seating and food vendors inside.  I liked that the water park was only open to hotel guests so, everyone gets a wristband that can be used as water park entrance, room entrance and to make purchases, too.  The hotel does a great job of ensuring you do not have to leave the hotel. The restaurants are good (make reservations for dinner at prime times).  There are also budget options (pizza by the slice or whole pie), Dunkin Donuts, etc.   It was very crowded at check-in, however, as we waited about 30 minutes in line! This could use some work. The hotel is big, with themed

Summary Heading: NO GROWLING -- JUST HOWLING GOOD TIME
Summary: I took my 2 sons, their wives and my 3 grandchildren to celebrate my grandson's 8th birthday.  What a fun experience for all of us.  The rooms were ultra-clean and large.  There was an issue with the toilet, but the hotel sent someone to fix the problem within 5 minutes of calling down.  Check in was fast.  The water park is really fun for all ages with slides, a river, wave rider, etc.  We absolutely loved this place.  There were lots of other things to do, but we left early the next morning to go to Universal Studios, so we'll have to schedule a return visit to check out the other features!

This is a great place to bring kids of all ages to enjoy the indoor water park, great food, comfortable lodging, and best of all the MAGI QUEST game that challenges them for hours. You must be a registered guest of the hotel to use the waterpark; however, the lower level has activities for day use, i.e., arcade, spa, pizza restaurant, bowling.  Great fun for the family.  I would highly recommend it.

The kids had a great time at this water park.  The check process was lengthy and there was not enough staff to handle the rush at check in.  The quality of the cuisine is good, but the there was the same issue with under staffing at the outside bar.  At dinner it took a long time to receive our meals.   Bring some sunblock to enjoy the outside area.

My family recently went to the Great Wolf Lodge.  What a stay!  You can stay in your swim attire the entire trip if you wanted.  There was so much to do for everyone and all under one roof.  The rooms are built for families not your standard hotel room.  I believe you can reserve larger rooms if you have a larger family.  There was so much more than just slides.  Take a look at their website to get a full understanding of all the water adventures.   The food was good, drinks for the adults at the outside bar was greatly appreciated. This is one of the latest facilities so everything is new.

We stayed at GWL for a week and had a blast at the waterpark. It was great fun for all the kids (ages 9 - 13), hubby and myself.   Pros:  1. LOADS of activities for the kids and not just the waterpark slides. SLIDES rocked! There's the Magiquest adventure which sent the kids off in different parts of the hotel. There's bowling, arcade, 3-D adventure, and miniature golf too! Mom and daughter can enjoy an hour or so at Scoops for a mani/pedi! 2. Free shuttle to Disneyland. They are really close to the Disney parks and less hassle to take the shuttle.  3. Clean rooms with great air conditioner.  4. Get the kids a Paw or Wolf Pass. Either pass allows them to get their wands, a build your own stuffed animal that has an adventure, arcade points, etc.  5. Enough food choices within the

It's our first time to visit with our friends and family.  Everything is awesome.  Adults and kids had fun.  Kids enjoyed the grand lobby activities and MagiQuest.  Dunkin donuts and Pizza place has a reasonable price.

I came here with my wife and 3 kids and we had so much fun! It's great that they have indoor waterslides especially during a hot weather outside. Rooms were clean. Hallway weren't smelly. A lot of kids walking around because they have an activity for kids where they buy this wand and can get points in some areas of the hotel. Check in can be crazy slow during the day but i came here during night time so it wasn't a problem.   Cons: there's not a lot of great restaurant selection in the hotel. But a few good ones are just blocks away.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will be coming back!

My family and I recently stayed at the great Wolf Lodge it was a wonderful experience !!!!  We had a great quality sleep !  Comfortable beds nice clean rooms nice quiet room .  Staff was excellent we had a great time without being out in the sun .  Definitely will go again we had an awesome experience my son loved it !

Summary Heading: Traveling with 3.5 year old, 6.75 year old and my hubby
Summary: Let me start by saying that I received a discount of about half off because we booked at least 60 days in advance. Without the discount, this trip would NOT have been a good value in my opinion. However, at the end of our trip, my almost 7 year old told me she preferred GWL over Disneyland! My hubby also felt it was a decent value given what we paid. FYI, there is a resort fee of $25 (not sure if it is daily as we only stayed 1 night), and there was a shocking 14.5% fee for something called "transient occupancy tax"!   Likes: -The resort feels fun and family friendly.  -All the staff members I encountered were patient and kind. -Since our visit was from Monday to Tuesday, it was not too crowded. -we arrived around 12:30; Check-in took about 15 minutes including the wait time and

We decided on a low key vacation this year. After a Disney cruise, Hawaii, and Morro Bay we were concerned about being disappointed with a stay only one hour away. We were not disappointed at all. The staff was friendly, the grounds and rooms clean, and the water park was nothing but fun. The lines were not an issue, the water was clean without being over chlorinated, and the lifeguards were so attentive even families with young kids should feel comfortable.  The restaurant selections are limited and nothing to rave about. I would not suggest searching for food in the immediate area unless you are driving. We will definitely come to this place again. We liked it so much we even added a day at the last minute. Five thumbs up!

Summary Heading: Great fun for the kids at Great Wolf
Summary: This place a gem for families. The water park is a blast, Family Suite is large and comfy, and the food prices around the resort are extremely reasonable. There are also other food options close by if you don't mind the walk. There's also a free shuttle to Disneyland is you are planning to go there as well.

A little pricey, but we all had a blast! We spent most of our time in the water park, but there is lots to do in the resort, mostly for the kids. At first I was a little disappointed with the atmosphere of the water park as I thought it would have a more tropical feel. But it was in a big warehouse and had more of a public pool feeling. But I got past that and we had a blast. Water is not warm, so be prepared. But food everywhere was excellent!! Not just your typical theme park food. Lots of choices and all delicious! All in all we had a great time and will definitely be returning!:)

Summary Heading: Scoops spa was a bit too pricey to give it 5 stars
Summary: This is a great hotel with so many activities to keep the whole family busy for a weekend trip without ever leaving the hotel.  The water park was the best, very organized and clean.  The seating area was pretty full, but we didn't have to much trouble finding a seat.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The other activities the hotel offered were a great addition, some had additional fees, but not over priced and well worth the family fun.  The scoops spa was over priced at $75.00 for a kids pedicure only, so we didn't get to experience that, but the kids would have loved to if the prices were a bit more reasonable.  Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be returning.

Summary Heading: Hotel theme park without the theme park prices!
Summary: Great deals, tons of fun to be had, and no worries about your kids being "too" crazy indoors! This is the most family friendly hotel out there. My kids love this place. As the second location we have visited, we loved this one! Its brand new, so it is clean! Rooms are roomy and comfortable. We booked 60 days in advance and got a great discount! The waterpark is awesome! no crazy hourlong waits for one slide. Friendly staff everywhere. Overall, no issues here! Cant wait to visit again!

Summary Heading: Great Value. Not Disney World. But way fun.
Summary: We visited as part of a two week trip to California to visit family and friends. The trip culminated with a three night stay at Great Wolf Lodge.  Overall it's a great value. Kids had a blast. Lots to do, decent food, great water slides, reasonable prices. For us though, living on the east coast I wouldn't fly to CA just to visit Great Wolf since Disney World in Orlando is much closer, albeit more expensive if you take out the airfare. but overall if I were in the Southern California area again I would definitely return. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because their bar drinks were weak and the wine list at the "high-end" restaurant was frankly awful. Considering we are in California I expected a much more robust wine selection. This might not be important to some

Summary Heading: Good , fun stay at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Me and my family had a great time at Great Wolf lodge! Good service by staff and rooms are clean.My husband had an awesome time boogy boarding ... He really wants to go back to Great wolf lodge soon...My kids had an awesome time playing in the water..

I booked this trip for my daughter. When we checked in we were given wolf ears. The girls loved that. We lost them when we put them down. but the lady at the first desk was nice enough to replace them for us. ( the ears are like money. don't put them down) Asked for a room on first floor and I got that. What I loved the most was that the bracelet they give you when you check in unlocks your room door and is connected to your card you used to pay for room. So that way you can walk around the whole place without a purse cuz all you do is scan your bracelet.  The room was nice. I liked that I didn't have to find a plug. The lights all had one. And they all had bears on them. The bathroom was nice. The air was controlled by a wall mount. So i couldn't make the room more cold or

The checking in process was sooo long but Staff are friendly so okay . Room is accommodating however the tv wasn't working properly and I wasn't Abe to use the WIFI  but l my 2 year old had an amazing time! So, We'll be back very soon!

GWL is great fun for the kids. Our group of 7 (4 kids and 3 adults) stayed here in mid July. We received a requested upgrade to the Grand Bear Suite which worked out great for us. The suite was clean and spacious with comfy beds. The only downside was there was absolutely no hot or even warm water in either of our 2 bathrooms. I think the hotel has since resolved this issue. The buffet at The Loose Moose was pretty good and Dunkin Donuts hit the spot for a quick breakfast option.  The waterpark was fun with a variety of different rides. It was really stuffy and humid inside the waterpark, so it was nice to get some fresh air in the outdoor pool area.

Great Wolf Lodge was not what we expected. In their website you can see a fun clean waterpark environment. But when you actually go there and experience what we did... Omg the waterpark was packed with people and the water "for me" is not safe for kids. Sign says water is recirculated do not drink. So not safe for kids. There is not really much to do there for adults. The price is too high that you could have booked in a resort in San Diego or a five star hotel in Vegas. It was really not what you will expect. The hotel lobby is great, the Kids cabin suite was ok, the staff is professional and they have Dunkin donuts inside the building... But what they sell (waterpark) Is not what you see online. Take it from me I've been in this hotel. Thank you

Took 4 grand daughters, ages 10,11, 14 and 15. We all, my husband and myself included, had a super time! The water park , hotel and staff all exceeded our expectations. We took the Grizzley Bear Suite.....2 bedrooms, 2 baths and living room.....so comfy and very quiet. The walls must be very well insulated as no noise above or from hall. If you want a great " kids vacation" this can't be beat!

Summary Heading: Take it off your kids bucket list - One day is enough
Summary: If your kids are begging to go here, one day is enough.  I took a group of 10 kids ages from 8 - 12 years, by the second day the kids became bored with the park, due to an lack of ride variety.  The Great Wolf knows that one day is enough, that is why they temp you with BIG discounts for multiple days.  Also, we went in the middle of summer can you say green house effect. We assumed that the park would be properly ventilated as well as a comfortable temperature, WRONG.  I was found myself grasping for air and sweating after a couple of hours.

My kids had a lot of fun. It's a great place to relax and spend time with the kids they loved it. We are looking forward to going again next year for one of the kids birthday. The water was good not too cold and inside so no sun burn.

My family went here for the first time for my sons 13th birthday! EPIC!! This place has a little bit of everything. Buy your own food and snacks for the room, wear swim shoes(major slippery) it gets a little stuffy inside & the chlorine can get a little overwhelming but then you can lay by the pool outside(problem solved) oh and yes they serve drinks for grown ups(drops mic) all in all great choice for the fam.

Summary Heading: Hotel and Water park are great. Buffet terrible.
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. It was quite expensive though. The food at the buffet for breakfast and supper was awful. Hot things were cold or barely warm. All bread products were dry and hard. Eat somewhere else!  There are a lot of good restaurants in the area. The kids had a great time at the water park.

We have 2 room for our family of 13 and it's nice  that there no fee for water park nice and clean room  short driving  but not a good view form outside but overall we have fun with the water park it's a nice park

So looking forward to this trip. We heeded their advice and did not arrive until 5 PM. However, the front desk was woefully understaffed. At least 25 families were in line for the two people working the front desk while four other employees stood around. No management around to keep things moving. Forty five minutes later we were checked in. They sell these "paw passes" for kids but the glitter tattoo kiosk was horribly understaffed and the stuff your own stuffed animal selection was for very little kids. Great arcade and the water park appeared well run. The lifeguards did not put up with any shenanigans. The food in the breakfast buffet was ok and Dunkin Donuts was great.   Water park was clean enough but not a lot of staff except for lifeguards.   We were gone all day at the

Summary Heading: Water Park is very nice, shame you have to endure a poor hotel facility and Terrible food
Summary: Due to our experience. When we arrived we waited in line for 25 minutes (just to check in) The lobby was very cool (air conditioner set to high) Once at the front desk, reception was very pleasant. When we arrived at our room, the room smelled like body order and we have to prop the door open to air the room out. We visited the water park which was very nice. A major concern is the floors which are very slippery (when walking slow) After being at the water park we went to the hotel Grill and were met by a tall white male employee who had no smile nor greeted us, while we looked at the menu one of our children saw the basket of crayons, turned to us and told us "good dad they have crayons for us" at this point the employee pushed the pack of crayons back into the basket and

The Great Wolf Lodge is so much fun for all ages!  Not only are the water slides a blast but you can do other things while you are there that are super fun as well.   You should definitely take your kids here!

The water park is not big, but the best part is that it is indoor.  We played for hours without worrying about applying sun screen or getting sun burn.  Water was clean and at comfortable temperature.  Plenty of lifeguards.  Water slides were fun.  All the staff and lifeguards we interacted with were friendly.

Summary Heading: My grandkids loved this place, so much fun for them.
Summary: I found the staff to all be very friendly and happy. They were very helpful. Room was clean and there was plenty of room. I liked that it had a fridge and microwave to keep some milk and a few snacks for the kids.

Summary Heading: Good water park but everything else was below average
Summary: Rooms were like motel 6, they were clean but that's about it. They didn't provide extra toiletries other than soap, shampoo and lotion. The check in took 30 minutes and the receptionist did not double check that we had pup pass or late check out. Had to mention these to him. Maids still disturbed us 2x about what time we are going to leave, one of them walking in while I was just wearing a towel. The food was disgusting. I ate a lot of Dippin Dots because everything tasted off to me, the ahi BLT at the grill was greasy and ahi looked uncooked, they also took 5 mins for an extra plate, the pizza was ok but carbonara was tasteless and the bagel sandwich from Dunkin' was dry. Don't expect to eat any healthy foods while you are here. The water park was ok but everything else was

We stayed on the fourth floor in room 448.  We booked a Wolf Den room.  Kids loved the bunk beds and having their own tv.  Water park was CROWDED on Saturday with very long lines.  We still made the best of it.  Our kids are ages 7 and 5.  We spent 4 hours inside the park and rode on several slides.  I would recommend going right at opening to get the best bang for your buck.  On Sunday we were in line by 845am.  We had a blast with no lines and hardly any people.    We did not participate in all the activities the hotel has to offer.  We did go to Mini golf, the arcade, and the creation station.  We ate at the :Lodge Wood Fire grill for lunch.  Food was good.  For breakfast we had Dunkin donuts and did not eat on property for any other meals.  We went down the street 1.2 miles

Water park was great for young children- safe and clean. A variety of activities. Not many teens. There were many life guards who were attentive and helpful. The restaurants were very good with adequate menu selections. Activities were somewhat overpriced. The arcade needed more staff. Overall the activities were fun.

Summary Heading: Water park and kids activities awesome,  accomodations not so much.
Summary: The water park and kids activities were so much fun for the family.  Room was clean and neat but we had no hot water the entire time we were there.  The hotel was trying to take care of the issue but we had left before they were able to fix the problem.

Clean, safe enjoyable place near Disney California to spend with family. Water park was a big hit with the Grabdkids. It is centrally located to many attractions such as Knotts, Angel Stadium, also. We will return.

This was our second family trip to Great Wolf Lodge and we had another amazing experience!  We had planned to spend one day at Disney and one day at Great Wolf and the kiddos decided to spend the whole time at Great Wolf!  During our last trip there were a few kinks (line at Dunkin Donuts, etc.) that all got worked out to our satisfaction.  The staff here are great too!  One of our kids had so much fun that they set their alarm for 6am so they could get up early and start exploring the lodge again :)

Summary Heading: Great place - Just be careful in wet area!!!
Summary: This is an awesome place, lots of fun things for the kids. It is on the pricey side so be ready to spend $800 to $1,000 for a couple of days, including food. Of course this depends on what type of room & what days of the week you choose. Do be extremely careful in the wet area, my daughter who is young, very physically fit & secure on her feet fell and suffered a severe injury to her shoulder, she is still suffering a week later.

We decided to try it out for a 1 night stay. Overall, very mixed experience. First off, we arrived at 1pm and checked in, expecting our room not to be ready. After only a few minute wait, we were checked in and our room was ready. We immediately went to our room, which was very spacious and clean, and went to the water park. The water park is very family orientated without crazy thrill slides.  Fine for us and our five year old. It was hard to find a chair, but we did and enjoyed all of the slides and pools. Very clean and well run. Around 5pm, when we were done with the park is where our stay got bad.    The food here is awful. First, we were told they couldn't accommodate us at their restaurant because it was reserved all evening. Even though there were only 3 tables occupied.

The whole concept is geared toward children.Expensive for what is offered. The water area and slides is low key. There is a magic quest feature spread throughout the lodge. There is a limited choice of food venues, recommend that eat elsewhere. Several pricy gift shops on lower two floors. The parking garage fills fast with day trippers. You can bring food in. Lodge food and drinks are expensive.

We celebrated my son's birthday here with a 2 night stay, and he had a blast! Next time, I would definitely get the Birthday Bash package because we spent $100 at the arcade for about 30 min of play. Yikes!  There are so many appealing activity choices for all ages and genders (mini golf, bowling, arcade, story time, water park, etc).  We dined at the Lodge Wood Fired Grill.
