The burgers were on point and cost around $13.  The bbq chicken salad was just ok.  The food served at the outside pool area was probably the best. I ordered the shrimp tacos with sweet potato fries for $12, and  everything tasted delicious. The bartender out there makes a mean Long Island Iced Tea ($12).  The water park wasn't crowded at all compared to the other options in So Cal, and the wait for the big

Summary Heading: A fun, but expensive getaway with the kids!
Summary: We had heard about Great Wolf Lodge through a friend and it looked like a blast.  We decided to take our 14 year old daughter there for a little getaway and fun.  We did have a great time, but this little one night getaway cost us over $700! The room, two lunches, two bar drinks, dinner, and breakfast.  As long as we receive an email with discounted rates, we will definitely go back.  The slides are not Hurricane Harbor size or speed, but provide plenty of enjoyment!  We've already recommended Wolf Lodge to some friends.

Summary Heading: Amazing vacation stop for our 6, 8, and 10 year old Grandchildren
Summary: We had a blast watching our Grandchildren's excitement. The waterpark was exceptional. The log cabin room was great, the adults separated from the children meant we did not have to go to bed at 9pm because the children needed to. The food choices were good most healthy some not so much but delicious chocolaty, yummy.

Summary Heading: Nice and Clean but very expensive
Summary: I would like to start with the positive. We stayed at Great Wolf in July. The hotel was was very up to date and clean. Check in was pretty quick. We got there a little early so our room was not ready but you are able to use the water park until it is. They send you a text when the room is ready so that is nice. There is plenty to see if you are not ready to swim. There are plenty restaurants, shops and activities to do besides swim. After we got our text we went to our room. We booked the wolf den so the kids could have their own little room with bunk beds. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms very clean. The water park was fun with a lot of different activities for the whole family. They even provide towels so you don't have to worry about that. There is a restaurant

The only 2 things I didn't like were the price of the stay and the food. I recommend you go out for dinner. Overall I would go back and the staff was great. The longest wait was during check in so, get there by 1pm.

Very good for families with young children. The kids had nonstop activities and had a good night sleep after. The water park was clean. There are other activities but some cost extra. Our tween got bored faster but wifi was good throughout the whole place so she was able to pass the time.

We will be going back in a few months for my daughters birthday.  We had such a memorable time!  I highly recommend GWL to all families but especially to those who are looking for an adventure! :) Love!

Although my children had plenty of fun, the lounge area was not clean and the changing rooms were dirty. It appeared their was no cleaning staff to empty old food tables or pick up discarded towels.  Costs of arcade and other attractions was typical for a Disney property......overpriced....very expensive.  I bought the Wolf pass for each child which was expensive but a good value based on the individual pricing but many things were not up to par. Lazer Frenzy is a joke and ripoff.  They only had one flavor of Mike and Ikes (out of all other flavors except raspberry) for the cups they were supposed to get in their pass and no apologies. I could buy Mike and Ikes at the store for much less.

We visited the Great Wolf Lodge this week. We booked our room in April and was able to get our room half off. They have deals if you book 60 days in advance. There is a 25 dollar resort fee per day and they include the 10 dollar parking charge right now but will be taking that away. With a one night stay you can access the park at 1 the day you check in and all day the next. Our rate was 191 before resort fees and taxes and with 4 people it's a really good deal for an Anaheim hotel and water park admission. There's a Dunkin donut inside as well as many restaurants. You have to be careful because it is very easy to fall into the trap of add ons...miniature golf, kids salon, arcade, etc. So have a plan of what you are willing to spend ahead of time. I visited in the summer and it

Came to Great Wolf Lodge expecting the kids to have a lot fun, but the adults got in on the fun too.   Pros: 1.                  Lifeguards were highly attentive.  They seemed to be frequently training and actively involved in all aspects of the park. 2.                  Excellent selection of water activities for the whole family to keep everyone entertained for hours. 3.                  Relatively short lines for water attractions.  The longest wait for the popular tube rides was about 20 minutes during peak times.  They probably could be a bit more efficient but considering neighboring Disney where ride waits can easily attain one hour, the lines moved relatively quickly.     Cs: 1.      GWL could learn a bit about crowd management techniques from the mega resorts in Vegas.

Summary Heading: Love the indoor waterpark! Close to Disneyland!
Summary: We had a great stay here. It was busy, and check it took a bit too long. The room was very clean and big. The waterpark was really busy, but had lots of different things for all ages to do. The Dunkin Donuts and Howling Pizza were really good. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. This resort is about 3 miles directly south of Disneyland. Very convenient for visiting Disney. We will stay here again.

We recently stayed to celebrate my 8 year old's birthday.  We booked the Wolf Den room and added on the $99 birthday package, which included a poster, cake, balloons, gaming credit, and dining credit.    We arrived a little after 1 p.m. and did pre-registration, which meant our room wasn't ready but we could go use the waterpark.  They text you when your room is ready, then you line up at the towel station in the waterpark where they swap out your temporary wristbands for the official ones.  We did not get ears, and later that night went to the front desk where they happily gave us our wolf ears, including a pair with a birthday hat for the birthday girl.  The waterpark was nice - plenty of activities and the lines moved fast considering they were at full capacity.  When we

Summary Heading: Great family place for some indoor fun
Summary: We went to San Diego and were looking for a mini-getaway. After a friend recommended this place, I booked a room in the standard suite for my family of 4. Room was not huge but did include a sofa bed which was perfect for my 5 year old and very comfy. The other 2 beds were doubles and small for hubby and myself but perfect for my 7 year old. So the kids were perfectly accommodated - it's the parents that had to rough it. And for $325 for the 1 night, I would not say it was a good deal. But when you factor the 2 days of water park use, that's what makes the room worth it (sort of...we still never go to places that are that expensive). You have to wear the RFID wrist bands all the time which is a pain. Mine never worked right to exit the garage, so that was another pain...had to

The water park area is very humid and has very strong chlorine smell. It was difficult to be in there for too long. The rooms are average. Hotel and water park are too crowded long lines and bad service.

We had a wonderful time at Great Wolf Lodge.  Clean, helpful staff, and plenty of fun for the family. Water park was for all ages and plenty of seating for those who didn't want to get wet.  Had a great lunch too.

This is our third great wolf lodge.  The kids begged us to take them since it opened.  It was crowded. More crowded than the great wolf in seattle during christmas.  In comparison to other GWLs, I feel they under decorated the lobby.  It wasn't as magical.  Kids don't really want to go back. Which works for us because room (especially room taxes) isn't cheap.  We live in So Cal. For the price of a night at GWL, we can get season passes to a water park for our family of four.  If you do go, eat elsewhere.  Food is not good and pricey for the quality.

We live in San Diego and this is a great way to spend either a long or regular weekend with your family.  Our first trip was during the 4th of July and we just recently went up for a regular weekend getaway.  Our son had a great time both visits.

Summary Heading: Lots of Kids, Commotion and Fun...at a Price
Summary: First things first. Don't come here to relax or for peace and quiet. It's all about kids at Great Wolf Lodge, all the time. The water park is unique and your children will love it despite the lines and your frowning because of the cost. From the rooms to the food, I kept thinking Disneyland might even be cheaper. Really. No real gourmet offerings but...the kids did not care. They liked every meal so long as it did not take too long to eat and get back to the water park or mini-golf. Room decor is for them, too, not you. Not that a Fort isn't nice. So despite the price and add-ons like the resort fee, and limited room service/slow service, and average locale, we will probably come back. After we save up some cash.

This is my second visit this year.  Both times I have used a Family Suite which is large enough to accommodate 4 kids and 1 adult.  The room was very clean and while we were out housekeeping came by with extra blankets and bedding for the pull out couch even though I had not yet had a chance to call them.  The kids I took for both trips enjoyed all of the activities.  I do recommend the Wolf Pass (for older kids) because you will probably spend that much anyway on extras and this way they get some free things which is pretty exciting for them. My two problems with the place:  the floor is slippery.  Both trips I saw kids slip and fall numerous times.  There is not enough emphasis on kids not being allowed to run (which is the opposite of a place like Soak City).  There is no

Great Wolf Lodge was a good one-night stay for our kids.  Our room was ready by 1:00 so we were able to check-in and get to the water park immediately.  We booked on a Thursday to avoid weekend crowds.  You can use the water park starting at 1:00 pm on your check-in day and until closing of the next day.  It felt like a good amount of people, but do-able.  The lines for the most popular water slides were about 20 minutes tops.  We had no problem finding a table on either Thursday or Friday.  We did not buy the wands for Magiquest because our kids are older, and did not buy tickets for the XD ride or laser tag so probably saved money that way. The water park has enough to keep the kids busy enough.  We also booked using a 20% discount promotion.  We booked a basic room which was

Had a great time on our 1 night stay here.  All we really had time to enjoy was the water park but it was great.  Lots of activities for people of every age and level of bravery :).  Nice temperature of both the air and water, lots of towels, snack bar with really good chicken strips and fries.  Room was nice and clean with comfortable beds.  My daughter loved the PJ dance party and story time and they had free crafts too which provide a fun break from the water activities.  Check in took forever and so could the elevators.  Also there can be a very long walk to your room if you are at the end of the corridor so take that into consideration when booking your room.  Not really a place for couples but a great place for families.

Our overall experience was full of excitement and fun, it was worth every penny we spent. Our room was surprisingly clean and neat. Staff were courteous and helpful. I hope that they could consider changing their check out time 11:00am is awfully early and not enough time. Check in time is 4:00pm. In late , out early...

Summary Heading: I got skin rash after visiting this place
Summary: My sister book this hotel and invited me so i went to enjoy the waterpark. After a day, I had etching skin. After the next day, I came down with skin rash.. Specially around my legs. I'm putting hydrocortisone so I don't scratch much. I've never had skin rash before in my life and to think what was in that water concerns me. If this rash doesn't go away in day or two, I'm gonna go see my doctor.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove!  We are sorry to hear of the issues you encountered after swimming in our water park.  We always recommend guests to shower prior to entering the water so that there will be fewer particles on the body that can negatively interact with the chemicals we use to keep our water clean.  It is this negative interaction that results in dry/itchy skin.  To mitigate this, we also ask guests to shower after exiting the water to wash those exposed areas that once dry, can become irritated.  We hope you will choose to stay with us again soon!  Howling regards, Jason Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: I took my daughter here for her 11th birthday and we had the best time playing together . It was so great to be able to get away and forget about the outside world and just spend quality time together. She loved the in house video game that had her running all over the hotel and I got quite a workout at the waterpark. We laughed and made friends and really enjoyed ourselves. No sunscreen or fear of sunburn . And no seagulls stealing your food LOL  It's so special and interactive even in the rooms. So well thought out. My daughter didn't want to leave until she finished her "quest" . everything you need is there no need to leave. You  forget all about the world outside and are in this bubble of happiness..

Summary Heading: Staff DO NOT WANT TO BE THERE!
Summary: Overall it was ok. Very expensive with all the unmentioned fees, but basically the staff make or break it and they plain didn't want to be there. They didn't care that we wear waiting in line, cold. They were going to finish their conversation with their friend associate before we were going down that slide. Hickies covered the bellman's neck, which was fun explaining to children. Just the overall feel was sort of like dmv-ish. We'll get to you when we get to you and you're lucky we're even acknowledging you.

This place is by far the best water park I've visited. The atmosphere in amazing, my family and I spent 3 nights and 4 days and had a blast! There's so much to do you'll never get bored. The staff members are professional, helpful and accommodating to all your needs. The facility is impeccably clean, restaurants are a little pricy (I was purchasing for 5 people) but the foods are delicious. Overall I would highly recommend this place to family's, couples and young adults .

We took our kids and nephew there for my eldest sons birthday who has autism. It was very fun the one who had the most fun was out 3 year old he kept saying ooh mommy this is so cool. Our oldest he had a good time as well.   The park allows you to check in early if they have clean rooms which you can form there change and go to the park  you can play as long as you like  they also have an arcade and food there as well a little pricey but if you can afford it then go right on ahead  there is a McDonalds located on the corner if you wan to walk across the street we went there for breakfast and johns incredible for dinner. hey we had four kids with us  we have to make the dollars stretch where we can  they also have activities for little kids to do throughout the day   overall you

From check in when they give you your awesome wolf ears, to the amazing indoor water park to not want to leave at time of check out amazing experience for us. Our room was standard family room for 6 with more than enough space. The wrist band access made it a even more care free experience. The breakfast buffet is completely worth purchasing at time of reservation best deal. The lobby is a mad house during 1-4pm for check in so come with patience or wait till later. After check in look and the resorts map/schedule to get familiar about what is going on and what time so you don't miss out on anything. The Waterpark inside can be very humid so for sensitive eyes like mine bring drops and also to save money you can bring a cooler to your room with water to take to park with you. No

We were very disappointed with the lifeguards and how they allowed others to cut in line on the water slides. We saw this happen multiple times during the 3 days we were in the waterpark. The lines are very confusing and not ran very well when at the top is only one lifeguard for three slides (yellow, blue and orange). I also didn't care for the way the lifeguard spoke to my daughter on the slides when her mat began to slip and on the slide that you lay down on your stomach. She was very rude and my daughter was scared because of the way this one lifeguard spoke to her. The food quity and taste was very disappointing. We ate at 4 different places inside great wolf and the food was not tasty at all. I felt that the whole experience was very overrated for the quality of the water

Very good experience kids had alot of fun!! Water park was very clean and rooms were very comfortable....kids enjoyed the arcade but games were a little pricey. Would defiantly take my kids back for another trip!!

This place was everything and more that I expected!  Great customer service!  My 2 boys, 7 and 10, had so much fun!  The food was a little pricey.  Food is not allowed in the park, but the fact that you can bring your own food to eat in your room and each suite has a small fridge and microwave was great!

Excellent servive and a great place for a family and friends. Definetely be back!!! Highly recommended this Indoor and outdoor water park and also great for the kids as they also have games and archades and bowling if you dont want to swim and a lot of selections for refresfments..

First, remember you must stay here (or know someone who is) to avail of the water park.  Quite a few people in line wanted day passes, however, you must know a guest staying here to play here.    Check in was a bit chaotic from valet to the weird in line wolf guy asking you if you wanted to be sent a text.  You still must pick up your keys, and we got no wolf ears :/.  Everyone is smiling, but navigating things isn't as easy as it could be.   Even playing mini golf had us loading cards in the arcade - it's a bit confusing.  The water park is fun but again difficult to navigate with big crowds.  When no rooms are available for people to check into in the afternoon, everyone goes into the water park 😬.    Rooms are ok but a bit basic.  Ditto on all of the expensive snack and

Stayed one night in June 2016.  We arrived on Sunday and left on Monday afternoon.  There were definitely more people on Sunday than Monday.  The water park is so much fun.  The slides and wave pool were enjoyable!  The chemicals that they put in the water are strong though, as my kid's eyes were watering after a few hours.    We had a standard family room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed.  The room was pretty spacious for 4 people.  Beds were comfortable.  The sink was outside the bathroom with enough counter space.  There was also counter space above the small refrigerator.  Parking was included in the price of the room.  The wristband that they give you to get in the water park also serves to get you in and out of the parking garage.

Summary Heading: Kids LOVED it (but bring your patience for crowds)
Summary: We went for the first time to the Great Wolf Lodge that recently opened in Southern California.  It's basically a hotel and indoor water park (and a whole bunch of other activities you can add on).   We managed to escape the place for about $400, which included 2 days in the water park , overnight at the hotel, pizza and ice cream for 4.  Not a bad deal when you consider that is the price of admission alone for 4 to nearby Disneyland.  And,for the record, my kids (girls aged 9 and 11) gave it an equal "fun" score as Disneyland.  Pros: Pretty good value for the price.  Hotel night includes unlimited water park admission for 4 (at least that was what was included in our $289 + tax room) from 1:00pm day of arrival through 9:00pm day of check-out.  Fun factor is HIGH for kids (and

Wow. This venue is made for a family outing. You can choose to stay (water park including in room rate) go to just the water park or, do the Magic Quest.  It is one of the few venues catering to children that also serve alcohol and good food!   Be forewarned. It is expensive. With a capital E!!  There is a "Scoops" for the girls and the Magic Quest for all. I encourage you to read the web site. Standard rooms are very large, have fridge and microwave. It is one of the cleanest facilities we have been too. Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  All in all, if you aren't on a tight budget, go for it!

After reading so many bad reviews I was very impressed by our experience at GWL. All the employees we came across were very friendly and attentive. We had a very enjoyable time. The rooms are clean and if you ask politely housekeeping will leave extra toiletries in your room. The rooms are all equipped with a mini fridge, a microwave oven, coffee maker, ironing board, iron,  and hair dryer. Bring your own food to snack on. Go to Costo down the street and grab a case of water. Water bottles are almost $3 each at the park.There are plenty of nearby shops to eat about a mile a way. Don't forget the water shoes. Bring two swim suits. BUY THE $100 WOLF PASS AHEAD OF TIME OR AT CHECK IN AT THE BEGINNING OF YOUR STAY. We learned the hard way... Over $200 extra later at the arcade and

Summary Heading: 7 year old's birthday - two stay night
Summary: A girlfriend's son had done spring break here and liked it so much he asked that his birthday party be here.  They stayed two nights.  Their room was cute with bunk beds for the two boys had their own little "jungle hideaway", separate from the parents bed.  Their stay was nice.  The hotel was very busy and unfortunately they had water issues causing many rooms to be without water for showers.  This took most of a day to correct.     Luckily, the water park kept everyone busy and even though it was crowded, wait time to get onto some of the water rides went by pretty quickly.  There are enough staff members present to watch the kids in the water, which can help parents feel more secure.  Also, they had doors open leading to the outdoor pool, which decreased the humidity we felt

Summary Heading: Return visit even better than first!
Summary: We had gone opening weekend, and the kids had a blast, but there were definitely opening pains.  Given the long waits and problems that weekend, the lodge was kind enough to credit a gift voucher for a return room, and so we booked a second room as well for our party of 4 adults and 6 kids.  This time, everything went off without a hitch: check in super-smooth with both our rooms available before 2 pm, and my SIL and husband were able to check in at 1ish with minimal line, when I called ahead to give their names since I was still working late.  The water park was not too crowded, no stalking tables and chairs like before, with the rides now staffed well, and the lines moving. The wrist bracelets were all working as waterpark, parking, and room keys (tip: it is possible to ask to

An amazing place for families with children.  While registration could be better staffed at peak times the personnel are first rate, helpful to a fault, and eager to please.  "My pleasure" is heard often when they complete a helpful task for you. Upon arrival every guest receives their Wolf Ears...really cute! Rooms are fairly basic, but you have all you need, just don't expect to spend much time there except for a nap.  While there this week the hot water,  in a major section of the hotel, including ours, was minimal or nonexistent for several days.  As a result many compensations were enjoyed - free buffet breakfast and dinner (no matter how large the family group) and significant discounts applied to daily room fees, The wait staff, particularly Heather at  The Loose Moose

We paid extra to book a Wolf Den room that included the bunk beds. We did not expect how much this hotel has to offer. Of course there's the water park, but there are several places to eat inside, including a Dunkin Dounuts, an arcade, a salon for little girls, gift shop, and mini golf and bowling alley. My son and his friend loved the Magi Quest throughout 5 floors of the hotel.   Tips-- save some money by bringing in your own snacks and lunches. There was a mini fridge and the kids enjoyed lunchables and uncrustables, fruit and other snacks. There are also a ton of eateries outside the hotel, including a McDonald's within walking distance. You have access to the water park the entire day. Although you cannot take your own food or drinks into the water park, you can check in

liked that the majority of the park was indoor -- the week I was there temperatures in the area were over 100 degrees.  this is a popular place and can be crowded during midday.  park is less crowded at the beginning and end of the day.  overall had a great time even though there are a lot of people.  when checking in try to be there before 1:00 as lines to check in can get long -- even if your room is not ready you can get the wristbands for the waterpark at that time that being said pack the bathing suits etc and leave your main suitcase in the car. .  no big deal getting your bags from your car later - plenty of baggage carts in the parking structure --like those at an airport -- to stack all your stuff.  if you want to to eat at any of the sit down restaurants -- go

Summary Heading: Fun family weekend! Had the best time with the kiddies!! Can't think of one thing I would change about this place!!!
Summary: Everyone was so helpful and friendly!!! The wrist bands were very convenient. With all that swimming, we all slept like baby Cubs!! The breakfast buffet was so good. I was really surprised how fresh and delicious everything was, at a really fair price.

Not a good family value, you can get more going to a regular water park. Very pricy, especially the extras for the kids. The room and food was average kids food.  Water slides were confusing, no one assisting with direction.  LazY rive was small and shallow .  The park as very crowded, whatever chemicals they use burn the eyes and the floors are VERY SLIPPERY!!!!!

The place was great ,it is very family oriented. I have 3 boys, my 9 years old celebrated his birthday here and he had a blast. My teenagers also had a fantastic moment.I recommend it to the whole family.

Daughter and nephew had lots of fun. Rooms are very clean. Enough storage space for everyone. Love the way everything is charge to your room. No need to worry about your room key or cash! The arcade and other activities should stay open until maybe mid-night. So kids can have fun after the water park closes at nine.

Summary Heading: Over priced, unfriendly staff, don't waste your money!!
Summary: Over priced , unfriendly staff, don't waste your money the maid service was awful they made the bed with dirty sheets and never picked up obvious trash in the room. The hot water wasn't working on our floor and the water pressure was terrible. Supposedly we were told because everyone decided to shower at the same time.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for sharing your feedback with us!  We apologize for the difficulties your pack encountered with housekeeping and with the hot water during your stay.  We will forward your review to our team in Garden Grove to discuss and determine how we can improve for future guests.  Regarding hot water difficulties, as of this morning, that has been fixed.  This should no longer be an issue.  We hope we can host your pack again in the future!

Summary: We had a party of seven, so we opted for the Grand Bear Suite. Two adjoining rooms, king bed in one room and two queens in the other. It worked out great. The little ones had a great time at the pool area and the MagicQuest was a big hit too. The food at the inhouse venues was a little pricey but not as bad as other Southern Calif. places. The service was great and the lifeguards were on top of things.

Every employee would greet you.  Great customer service. The room was very clean indeed.  My kids had a blast.  Will definitely go back again.  The rooms were quiet you could hardly hear the people on the other side of the wall.

Our family trip was amazing. Hotel was clean, staff was great and attentive. Lots of activities for the kids. Plenty of food options.The water park itself is fun! Only recommendation I would say is to take a shower break. It is so highly chlorinated and warm inside you may feel ill after a while. Best thing is they have showers in the bathrooms to wash off.

Summary Heading: Great time at the Great Wolf
Summary: We surprised our two boys with a trip to the Great Wolf.  I highly recommend booking in advance and taking advantage of this discount.  We were able to get a family suite room for under $250 with taxes.  Great deal for the middle of the summer.  Check in lines were long, which we had expected.  The person that checked us in was very friendly and did her best to accommodate the requests of our group.  The room was clean and spacious.  Only complaint was for being a watermark, there are hardly any places to hang your wet swim suit to dry.  They need more hooks, towel bars or even a retractable clothes line in the bathroom.    Food by the pool was good and not too high priced.  Made it a more affordable family vacation.  Hope to be able to go back again someday.

Summary Heading: Great time for kids all ages!!
Summary: We stayed for one night but ONE night is ALL you need! Our kids had such a great time!! They had a pool area for each of their ages. Because the waterpark is exclusive for hotel guest the waterslide lines were not long. The food prices are not as bad as I thought; $6 burgers and $13 souvenir cups which has unlimited drink refills. I do recommend water shoes although I'm sure they make you take them off when going down the water slides. No food or drinks are allowed in the water park but the burger and pizza place kept our kids full. We will definitely be back, even in the winter!

Grandchildren loved the WaterPark. We appreciated the variety of things to do and it kept all three entertained, ages 10, 9, and 5. Restaurant choices were great, activities were great. It was a great weekend getaway.

Booked an overnite stay on a weekday, cost us $399  a nite, total of $486 with tax. Went with my hubby and  an 8 y/o daughter and 5 y/o son and they had a blast. *CHECK IN ~checked in around 3 pm and our room was ready at 4:30 pm via text or email. we just decided to go to the water park that time until 8pm. Place was crowded but we were able to get a some chairs. The crowd starts to lessen around 7pm till closing at 9pm. *CHECK OUT- We left the hotel at 0900 and packed our swim clothes and spent more time at the water park. Left out luggage at the car.  *BREAKFAST- Dunkin donuts was crowded, so my hubby just went to McDonalds just across the park and bought some breakfast for us to eat at the hotel. why not? @THE WATER PARK -outside foods are not allowed, but plastic bottled

We booked a two night stay in June for a family of 5. My husband was not sold on paying such an outrageous price for a water park. But to our surprise....we all had a great time. The three kids loved all the water slides and were able to ride their favorites multiple times. My husband loved the Flowrider especially when they changed it over to a mini-surfboard at the end of the day. My youngest daughter loved the balloon making, face painting, and button. The Magiquest was a hit - took 5 hours to complete...but they loved every moment of the game.   Room was spacious and clean. Stayed in a regular family room. There are themed rooms...but I did not want to pay extra as my kids are a little older.  Ate at the pizzeria and Lodge restaurant. Both were delicious and well priced.

We stayed here for 1 night. Family of 5! 11 year old, 3 year old and 2 month old! The rooms are really big and spacious! Beds are really comfortable. Nice sized fridge and microwave. I really liked that there was a sink available in the room itself and not in the bathroom because even if someone was using the restroom the sink was available for us to use. I had my 2 month old and washed his bottles all the time so the sink was really handy. They key to the room was in our wristband so no need to carry a key card. Great entertainment for the kids. They had bowling, arcades, kids spa. The water park is so much fun! So clean! I was expecting Disneyland prices but everything was decently priced! Well will come back here again it was so worth it!!

Our family of 5 had a great time at the Great Wolf Lodge. There is loads of fun for everyone. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Resort was clean and well kept. Temperature of water and space was super comfortable. Price is good. Food at Loose Moose is fantastic. Buckets for food was horrible.

Disappointed with how the resort handled items that were left behind by our children in a dresser drawer. After 3 days of our visit it has not been resolved. Housekeeping is supposed to check entire room for items left behind by guests and turn them in. Our boys left their wallets with money and an expensive watch and we are being told nothing has been turned in. Extremely upset.

on our first visit, a week after the opening, we did not have warm water in the room for the showers at night, we assume they were still working thru start up issues and didn't make a big deal out of it since we had lots of fun in the water park. Visit for the 2nd time this past weekend (over 3 months after opening) and the same happened, no hot water for showers. We complaint but no actions were taken to fix or even a solid explanation. We had friends on a different floor who experience the same problem, so was definitely not a one room problem only. Place is  fun but still needs lots of improvements on the infrastructure.

The "huge" water park as advertised is not HUGE. If you are after a water park, raging waters, legoland's water park are much better deals. This resort was far too overpriced. They offer extra activities which were fun, but it was too pricey, for example to bowl in their miniature kid friendly alley is $6per person, per game in other words $30 for a family of 5 for one game. $35 for their golf, their aracade area again very expensive to play. You can burn through $50 in less than 30min. The food is average for a lot of money (which is typical of most resorts). The rooms were average, had poor wall mounted motel style AC units which did not cool the "kids cabin" area.  If you do decide to give it a go, I would recommend only 1 night, which gets you two days at the water park.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for school aged kiddos! Bring water shoes!
Summary: I was impressed with GWL overall. GWL is perfectly catered for kids. Besides the water park, there are several activities on the lower level to keep them very busy.  Water shoes are a MUST! It is very slippery.   Parking is self parking and there are luggage carts available in the parking garage and on the hotel floors.  Upon check in, they issue you a wristband that is also your room key and you can charge things to your room too (like snacks or things from the gift shop). This was great not having to put a room card in a pocket or take anything down to the water park.  There is a snack bar in the water park. You can ask for a cup of water too, if you don't want to bring bottles of water to the water park. I thought the food selection was decent and reasonably priced. Don't try

I totally recommend thiz hotel for families specially with little kids. Hotel: there is nothing fancy about the room but its clean, bed is comfortable and there is a mini fridge and coffee maker in the room.   Amenities: Lots of activities for kids, everything  you see online plus more ...My kids enjoy the singing and dancing part and also there are crafts and games for kids. The most popular one is the magic quest which looks like a lot of fun.. We didnt try it but i definitely recommend buying the paw pass , it think its totally worth it.  Waterpark : clean and awesome..there is a pool for all ages.  I definitely recommend this place for an overnight fun filled experience for kids..its definitely worth it😊😊👍

We visited this hotel not long after it had its grand opening and we were very pleased. The hotel is in a somewhat strange area  - in the middle of a suburban residential neighborhood about 3-4 miles from the Disneyland area. There was nowhere really to walk of interest, and the views were of an apartment complex and houses that shared a backyard wall with the hotel. We did see that the hotel did have a shuttle to the parks (I believe for $5.00 per day per person) that departed about every 30 minutes.   Although the hotel appeared to be pretty close to full, we did not find the water park to be too crowded at all. Most of the slides had very short waits, though occasionally some would have longer waits of 15 minutes or more. It is pretty warm in the water park area, which is

Had a great time kids loved it  the down side they offer a late check for a little extra $$ they don't do it don't even tell you a reason why and room is supposed to be ready by 4 and they contact you it was 4:25 and we still weren t contacted we had to go to the front desk to get it resolved

If you are looking for a waterpark to take your family there are much better options available in Southern California.  For a brand new hotel facility I was shocked at how poorly the rooms were appointed, a terrible outdoor pool area with not even one umbrella and exceptionally poor service from the staff. The room prices are outrageous!  We could have stayed in a 4 star resort in a beautifully appointed room and taken the family to a nice outdoor waterpark. The indoor waterpark was very irritating to eyes and throat due to the strong chlorine in the air.

Summary Heading: Great way to spend family time!
Summary: It's was an amazing way for us to spend time together and experience something new as a family.  The staff was very friendly and it felt like a Las Vegas hotel with the multiple floors and all the restaurant options, bowling, 24hr arcade, mini spa, mini golf, and all within the hotel.We will be returning!

Summary Heading: Had a great time but talk about Kach$ng
Summary: Overall we had a great time.  My main complaint besides the beds not being very comfortable is the lack of ventilation in the water slide area (it really is unpleasant and seems unhealthy to breath that chlorine so directly).  And lack of outdoor pool area.  Would have been nice to have more outdoor pool areas. Something more pretty and larger. And maybe indoor outdoor water slide area.  Would be great to have part of the roof open in the main area.  I know it was nice being warm when wet but breathing is nice too.  Look for promo codes for discounts.Can always add after you make the reservation or change later.

We went to gwl to celebrate my sons birthday. We had the time of our lives, it's clean and all the staff members are very friendly. The place is not crowded so the lines are not long. The rides are perfect

We were only here as a guest of a guest.  We did enjoy all swimming facility, even my 1 yr old enjoyed the wave pool.  The restaurant prices is not over-priced so that's a good thing also.  I suggest checking in here on a slow day to get good pricing and to avoid the crowds.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money or hassle
Summary: Stayed 2 nights 3 days. The room looked okay but were we wrong. The bathroom sink wouldn't run any cold water after the hot water has been run for a while so we had to brush our teeth and wash our faces in the tub (hassle for the 6 of us to do), there was some sort of water pressure issue. After the shower had run for a while (and there were 6 of us) it started rattling loudly and the walls would shake. Then the water would only spray out in bursts with the bangig noisei magine trying to wash the kids hair with only bursts of water! Trying to get all the chlorine out was a pain like this. Then to add insult to injury our main TV wouldn't turn on the second night or the morning of our departure.  I paid for it I'd like to watch it! I complaimed to a woman who said she was a

If it weren't for the kids nagging to go here, I would have rather have gone to LEGOLAND where I know I would be having a good time at the park and the resort.  The rooms are over priced for the size.  We stayed in one of the themed rooms with bunk beds.  The kids loved the bunk beds but couldn't sleep there because it was too hot.  The area is walled off and the AC doesn't reach there.  The room says it can hold 6 people but it's very tight.  Make sure you bring your own food because the wait for the restaurants is long and the quality of the food is poor.  Overall it's not worth the money for an overpriced hotel and a crowded water park with reclaimed dirty water and lack of AC where it makes it hard to breath.  The good thing about it is that they do have an interactive game

Summary Heading: Make sure you have great medical insurance!
Summary: The concept is great, and we enjoyed the waterpark immensely. The hours go by very quickly, we didn't realize it was already 9pm after being in the park all day since it is indoors and you lose track of time easily (like you do in a casino). A great variety of slides for all ages and different levels of crazy. We never waited in a long line and we felt comfortable letting our 9 and 7 year olds go on their own for a little while because the lifeguards are amazing and there is nowhere that our kids would not be able to stand up. The entire hotel is very nice and clean and I love that they only let guests into the water park, but there are a few things they could improve on.  1. The floor in the waterpark area is dangerously slippery. We all came home with numerous bruises after

Summary Heading: Kids loved it but no value
Summary: There is no doubt about it, kids will love this place - mine did.  What's not to like?  No running away from parents slathering sunscreen; food and drink by the pool; and so many distractions in the arcade.  These, of course, cost money.  Just to stay in a themed suite, we paid nearly $700 for one night.  Stupid really.  Don't know what I was thinking, but the regular, non-themed rooms with just beds and a bathroom was nearly $550 during our stay.  What's another $150 for the kids?!  We spent another $70 for the privilege of late check out so that the kids felt like they got the full day in a lazy (not so lazy mind you) river crowded with rude, screaming kids. We felt like we needed to eek out every drop of value at the resort, so we never left after we checked in.  So, with

A great place to go and spend 2-3 days max with the kids and enjoy a holiday where everything is taken care of!! Was an awesome way to break up our time in California after Disneyland and before hitting Santa Monica!!

Summary Heading: Unable to check in to get room
Summary: I was una le to get to my room until 6pm then get my luggage brought up til 6:30 so we could change into our swimwear to go to the waterpark we ended up getting to the waterpark at 7 2 hours before it closed then had a hard time opening my room because the key was  somehow deactivated and was holding my sleeping one year old son outside of the room until someone came and helped me but took an hour to re activate the room key! This was a disaster i stayed calm because i wanted my kids to enjoy the time there but this was unacceptable

This is our second time visiting Great Wolf since it open cause we love it here so much. We already have another reservations on Dec. Very Family friendly hotel especially for toddlers and kids. We love that the Toddler/Kids pool is gated off and separated it helps kids not to wonder around the other pools. Rooms are great and clean.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf a Lodge   Garden Grove California
Summary: This was one is the best times I have had on a mini vacation. It is really a great family lodge/hotel. Many different things for the family to do. And the water park is great. Very clean and well staffed.

This was our 2nd visit- checked in after the July 4th holiday thinking it wouldn't be busy.  We were very wrong.  Check in lines were long.  We attempted to bring water in the park, but was told we couldn't.  As we entered the park we saw many people who brought in 2 liters of Soda and other things.  They need to treat everybody the same and have the same rules.  Since our first visit, they have added  Dippin Dots next to the hotel front desk so when you are waiting 1 hour to check in the kids will scream for ice cream.  In addition, they have setup alcohol stands in the pool area - poor taste and tacky.  I saw a customer standing in the wave pool with a beer in his hand.    We will not be returning.

Summary Heading: Clean and Fun, Indoor Water Park
Summary: My family and I stayed here for one night over July 4th weekend.  We were very lucky to get our room 3 hours before the official check in time (this is only if there are clean rooms ready so don't rely on early check in).  I had a great experience with the front desk representative (friendly and answered all of my questions).  My family and I had a family suite.  I got 4 tickets for entry into the water park with my room.  I paid an additional $100 to get two guests in.  Your wrist band is computerized so you use it as the room key and you may use it to make payments at the store and restaurants.  There is a safe in the room for you to lock your valuables.  There are also lockers available for $15 in the water park.  The water park was pretty clean.  There's a lot of chlorine in

Summary Heading: Great time at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Awesome rooms and awesome facility. The staff is great and the water park is really nice and well kept. Great place to take the kids. They will definitely have a good time. Even the parents will enjoy themselves.

Heard about this place through Groupon or Living Social.  These places were located unfortunately out of CA.  Imagine my surprise when I found out that they built one in CA!!  My kids and I had a blast!  No sunburns.

The good it was clean, beautiful, staff was very accommodating, lots of activities check in check out was super easy and our rooms were ready even though we were 5 hours earlier than check in time.  cons expensive most activities had extra charges want to participate in all the activities bring extra cash!!! i bought the wolf pass for my kids all activities included (like a build a bear who is interactive, a wand interactive with "magical powers",bowling,goggles,candy,4d theater glitter tattoo, leather wrist band etc. ($100)but still had to pay extra for extra rounds of bowling and interactive movies very fun. food pricey went to loose moose buffet $25 i believe for dinner, food was cold all drinks watered down i'm not even gonna mention the cheese tray (stay away). Food would

Summary Heading: "Not worth paying $439 that's with discount already a night"
Summary: Reservations line too long and they didn't ask if we preferred to stay close to the elevator.. Staff not attentive to the water park especially the surfi area . The staff is chatting and laughing to each other and my son tumbled all the way to the back hit his back to the wall and scra his elbow and arms . My other don said the water park is confusing and no sign . To humid .

Thi s was our first time staying and Great Wolf Lodge and it won't be our last.  This place was top notch on customer service and the water park which is the main attraction didn't disappoint! Our family enjoyed our stay and having Dunkin Donuts on site didn't hurt either!! The food at the Lodge Grill was amazing!!

Summary Heading: Our New Relaxing Happiest Place in Southern California
Summary: Great family vacation.  Wonderful place and relaxing stay.  Clean and new with great activities for the kids.  Didn't need to leave the resort everything you need is there!!  Definitely a vacation everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime.

My son saw the adds on the Food Network and convinced us to visit. We were not disappointed at all. There are a lot of activities for the kids, such as bowling, interactive rides, a quest that has the kids going through the hotel with an interactive wand, the very safe water park, and so much more. Safety is a priority and the life guards are everywhere and very well trained. The rest of the staff are extremely nice and go out of their way to greet you. There is food available throughout the hotel. In the evening they have a pajama party to tire out the kids that somehow have some energy left after a day of sliding. I would definitely recommend the Great Wolf Lodge for families.

Summary Heading: Such a blast!   We would love to come back!
Summary: We loved the Great Wold Lodge.   We are local and live just 15 minutes away.  We took our 10 year old daughter and 11 year old son.  We all had a blast.    Super fun water slides.   It was very kid friendly.   We stayed in a basic room.  It had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa.  The room was very clean.     We went with 2 other families.  We called ahead a few days before and they were able to reserve rooms right next to each other.     We stayed for 2 nights.   You can check in early at 1:00 pm and start using the waterpark even if your room is not available.   We arrived about 1:30 and were able to check in our room at that time.  There was a long line for checkin but it moved very quickly.  The staff is very friendly and courteous.    The lifeguards were great!   We booked a

I took my two grown children and five grandchildren on a family vacation and one of our stops was Great Wolf lodge.  The hotel was fabulous. The rooms were spacious and clean.  The hotel also has numerous restaurants and activities for the children .  We got 2 rooms that adjoined for five of us.  Each room comes equipped with a refrigerator and a safe. The hotel is just a short 10 minute drive to Disneyland. The hotel has its own shuttle and it runs every 30 minutes.  There is a fee of five dollars per adult and two dollars for children.  The water park is downstairs and is huge!  Make sure you reserve a cabana which runs a little over $100.  It makes a great meeting spot for the whole family.  The waterpark is great for children and adults of all ages.    I definitely will be

Summary Heading: Great stay at Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: Very great experience! From the time we stepped in the door we felt welcomed.  We immediately were given risk bland and away were in the water park.  It was great. The slides were great fun.  The enclosure made it easy to always keep track of the kids. I greatly recommend going, if only for a night.  You get the park the day you check in and the following day.

We were a large party, 3 families total. Of 12 kids. We all enjoyed the waterpark and the hotel was very comfortable and well designed to have access to everything. I would only like to point out that as you go into the waterpark all kids are measured and given a band according to their size which gives them access to the slides. Well the staff are not all on the same page. After waitibg in line for a ride a child can get remeasured and they can deny access to the ride stating the child doesnt meet the required height. Which makes it frustratibg and a waste of time for everyone. So administration should look into that to make sure everyone is on the same page.

We love the great wolf lodge kids have a wonderful time the only issue we had was our eyes itch cuz of the amount of bleach from the attractions but overall it was an amazing vacation kids can't stop talking about it!;)

Summary Heading: Meh. Only stay here if you don't plan on leaving hotel
Summary: We stayed here for our family Disneyland trip. Way over priced for value you get in return. I would only stay here if you are planning to not leave the hotel. Lots of fun kid activities, they get 5 stars on kid entertainment, but rooms are average at best, maids are non existent, and the water park is so crowded you'll be waiting to go on every slide and so many people swimming you can't really swim or enjoy it. Felt like an overcrowded mini water park and rooms were nothing to jump up and down about. 3/5 stars at best. Not worth the $300-375/night. Stay in a nice hotel for that.

We live about 20 miles from this hotel, mid kids were thrilled to go on a mini vaca. The water park is amazing and that is where we spent most of our time. I hope in the future they figure out check in, took way too long!!! Other then that really no complaints

This was a different experience from most hotels. There was some good and some not so good. Over all, it was an ok experience. The kids really loved the waterpark area. There is something for the little ones and big ones alike. The area is enclosed indoors and extremely humid and hot. They really need better ventilation in there. The staff is mostly very nice and helpful throughout the hotel. Like most hotels everything there is over priced. The arcade games are pricy to play but they give lots of tickets which the kids love. The arcade is a lot like Chuck E Cheese. Scoops the ice cream themed salon is pricy (they ask you to add a 20% tip to the price), but the service is cute for little girls. My little one loved it. Make sure you have a reservation because they don't

The advertisements by Great Wolf Lodge were way over exaggerated on their website! The overall environment of the lodge and the rooms were nice. However, everything else at the resort, such as activities, shops and some restaurants fell way short of the descriptions in the advertisement!

Great place to get wet playing out of the sun!  There is tons of fun for all ages and staying indoors makes everything much nicer!  Water isn't too cold and it really wasn't that crowded!  I think it is a fun family outing!  The rooms also are outstanding!

Stayed for 3 nights and it was pretty awesome! My only complaints are that wish the water park was open later and there seems to be a shortage of tubes for the tube rides and lazy river but other than that it was great! Room was clean staff was nice and the water park was awesom. Would like to visit again though I'll be sure to book several months in advance next time to get a better rate.

We decide to try this new place because we heard so much about it. We could not believe how many life guards they have around watching everything. It sure gives you a nice feeling when you children are around water and there is a chance for something to happen. The water was a comfortable temp and there was a lot of fun things to do. I do recommend wearing some sort of rubber pool shoes because the deck is very slippery.

The facility looks new as you drive up. Unless you want to valet park, go directly into the parking structure. Check in was easy and the front desk was friendly and explained things clearly with the wristbands. I asked how long they'd been open as everything looks super clean and new, only since February 2016.  The water park was clean and a bit overwhelming at first. I'd say 80% is pretty shallow, most less than the shallow end of a typical swimming pool. The "baby" area is fenced and no more than 2 feet deep.   There are safety checks where staff will check the kids' height and give them a band to indicate whether or not they need flotation devices. They do let the kids use their own as long as it's not an inflatable type.  There are a lot of courtesy life vests if you don't

Summary Heading: Not a two thumbs up when it comes to service
Summary: Don't do express checkin.. Process was very disorganized. You won't be able to get your room not until close to 5pm. They kept redirecting you to someone else.. You have to wait for the "golden text" before they gave the wristband and room number.. Not so happy for the customer service.

Great staff, nice clean rooms and excellent water park. Great Wolf Lodge offers plenty of fun for the kids and Adults. They also offer a variety of options for food and beverages.  I definitely recommend it for the day or overnight stay. Excellent customer service.

If you are going to Disneyland you have to stay in this resort. Forget the Disney Hotel. This resort will be lest expensive  and your kids will have so much fun!  A lot of activities for all the kids. The more days you stay the cheaper it will be. Book early.

Loved loved loved our stay! Everyone was soooo nice and made our family feel very welcome. The water park is very nice. There's life guards everywhere, made me feel very safe for my children. It's all about the kids, it's like Vegas for kids! The food was also very good and can't wait to come next year.

Summary Heading: Bring the family wolf pack to the Great Wolf
Summary: We spent Father's Day weekend at the Great Wolf Lodge in Anaheim with our 3 kids and it was by far the greatest experience and Father's Day I could have asked for.  The accommodations were great, food was good and water park and activities for the kids was excellent.  Plenty of staff to make me feel safe with 3 kids running around and playing in the water.  Highly recommend!!

An adventure awaits you and your family under this dome of water slides, pool, 4-hour scavenger hunt, and lots of other fun activities!  The themed rooms are very cute and definitely were a plus for my 7-yr old son having his own space and TELEVISION! I particularly appreciated not having to lather up with sunblock and simply enjoying the activities offered by the indoor waterpark! Booking our second stay this summer---fun!

Summary Heading: more fun for kids than adults
Summary: There are still opportunities for Great Wolf Lodge to work out their operational kinks in this newly opened resort.  The water park is nice and there are ample rides for children but it is extremely crowded between 1 and 9 during the days.  The rooms are below average and the customer service environment of employees is inconsistent.

We didn't like the breakfast at The Loose Moose Family Kitchen much as staff members weren't courtesy to guests. The cooks weren't too nice as they let other guests cut inline go first with their foods while other wait inline longer to receive their foods. The foods at the Lodge Wood Fired Grill Restaurant wasn't good for their price. I believe other Restaurant closed by outside the Lodge is better such as Black Angus, Red Lobster, Denny or etc.. is much better value for their tasty menu/foods.

Great fun for the whole family! My fiancé and I had a lot of fun and so did the kids! There are lots of slides and activities, which were more fun than expected. You can't go into the indoor waterpark without staying at the hotel. I think this is great to prevent it from getting overcrowded. Btw, you can pay $50 to get into the waterpark as long as someone books a room there.

This is our second trip to the Garden Grove location.  We have also been to the one in Ground Mound Washington several times and love that one too. Our first experience was 8 years ago in the Poconos Resort.  They have thought of everything for a gun and relaxing vacation for the whole family.  We love the GWL!

Summary Heading: Great family break from the sun - indoor new park
Summary: It was very quiet and so much for younger children to do.  My 8 & 6 year old really enjoyed the water park because there were so many areas to choose from, the assault course, basketball hoops in the water, surfing, wave machine, flumes, lazy river etc.  We didn't really explore the rest of the hotel too much but our room was brand new, very large and comfortable.  really pleased with our stay here.  This is the only hotel we didn't have to pay for valet parking on our trip which was a nice surprise!

Summary Heading: Not bad but not doesn't give me same magical feeling as other GWLs
Summary: What is GWL? Indoor water park, theme park, gaming center. This is located right down the street from Disneyland, about 2 miles. It's a fully contained resort which the main attraction is an indoor water park - lazy river, water slides, wave pool, wave  runner, a couple of kiddie pools, and a big water play structure that has some easy water slides and giant bucket of water that dumps every 5 mins. The other attractions are arcade, spa, various gift shops, two restaurants, a 3d virtual movie, AND this magical I'll call it scavenger hunt game.  This place is really for kids not adults. Get the $80 package for the kids, gets you food, games, etc included.   The LA location didn't give you that magical feel when you walk in the lobby . I kind of felt it was half done. No animals

Summary Heading: Fun and Affordable (IF you can book discounted rates)
Summary: Brand new. Water park was awesome! Downside? Lots of opportunities to part with your $$.  If you are on a budget, skip the themed rooms. I recommend allowing separate days for theme parks and water park.

Great indoor water park. Check in was slow but the staff was excellent. Wrist band keys worked great. Covered parking and little luggage trolleys for you bags.The pizza was very good and fed four us easily.The water park gets crowed in the afternoon.Grand kids had a great time.

My family & I visited Great Wolf Lodge on the day it first opened & it was a nightmare. I received an upgraded room, full refund and gift certificate for a future return stay. This visit was perfect!!

Summary Heading: It was okay place to stay and play.
Summary: I would not go back again unless it has 50% discount.  There weren't that many "rides" and the room was just average.  I rather take my family to Lego Land with their annual pass and stay at a local hotel there for more fun and value!

Quick stay for Father's Day weekend. Water park passes and self parking is included with room fee. You can enjoy the water park for the entire length of your stay. You will be admitted to the park early before check in and can stay in the park after you've checked out. Everyone is assigned a wristband and adult wristbands are also the room keys and give you the capability to pay for everything by charging to your room.   The water park is mainly indoors with a small pool and rentable cabanas outside. It was an unusually warm weekend during our stay. Don't know if that factored into turning the indoor water park into a sauna. It was suffocatingly humid in there. We enjoyed snacks in the park. It was the usual fare; fries, hot dogs, burgers. There are several food options in

The best vacation ever.  Kids were entertained the entire time.  I locked up all kids screen devices in the room safe and they never ask for it once the 3 days we stayed.  That says a lot about how much fun they had.  Staff were fantastic!  I could go on and on but, there is not enough room on this site.  Go Go Go!

If you have kids you need to bring them here! From the water park activities to the arcade to the Magiquest it was amazing. It's like your staying in a big video game. We always had things to do and the kids loved everything. Exceptional derive and accommodations.

First time staying at Great Wolf Lodge property.  Pleasantly surprised by what they had to offer in the location.  Nice rooms and very comfortable beds (either that or we are just very tired from spending all day at the water park).  We didn't try any of the onsite restaurants during our stay but based on the crowd, seems like everyone enjoyed the food. Prices on the menu looks reasonable as well.

What a place to stay we were booked in down the road closer to Disney land for seven nights and thought we would stay here for a night to break it up a little, and glad we did our kids 8/5 had a great time as did we the water park is busy however no sunburn is a bonus! U can use the water park from 3pm on the day of checkin and until close after u check out which is a real bonus!! However a good tip would be to sta one night there and the rest of your vacation closer to Disneyland and keep your wrist band on so u can go into the water park wolf lodge everyday of your stay! As u only have to have a band on to get in nobody has any idea if u stayed at the hotel that night or not all u need is to keep your band on as u would if u were staying for a week!!!! The food is just okay

A great indoor water park/hotel destination. It's fun for the whole family. Kids recieved Wolf Ears upon check-in. The entire family enjoyed the water park especially the slides. Definitely purchase the Wolf Pass. It allowed the kids access to have extended fun beyond the waterpark. It included: Magicquest Wand of choice & game, 20 Arcade points, Bowling, Moon Glow Golf, Glitz Glitter Tattoo, Creation Station to stuff an animal and more! The themed rooms are great the kids loved their bunk beds and the animated frogs and fish activated by their Magiquest Wands!

Summary Heading: Great Fun and the Great Wolf
Summary: I stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge with my family for 2 nights in June, and we all had a fantastic time.  The resort just opened in April 2016, and is located in Garden Grove on Harbor Blvd, and is about 3.5 miles from Disneyland.  The outside of the resort looks like a large lodge and has a statue of a giant wolf howling in the front, kind of hard to miss.  Self parking is free if you are guest in the large parking structure next to the resort, valet parking is $10 per day.  There is also a $25 per day resort fee.  When you check in they give you a waterproof wristband which is your room key, your pool pass, your parking pass, and you can charge all of your resort purchases with your wristband.  I found it very convenient.   The first thing you’ll notice when you walk in is how

Summary Heading: Way better than the "Happiest Place On Earth"1
Summary: We checked in the day school was out.  The front desk line was LONG. After that everything else was perfect.  Rooms great, we had a room with a set up bunkbeds(4 kids).  Pool and slides were warm and well kept.  The food was good and reasonably priced.  Great selection of Micro Brewed beers at every bar.  The brunch and service were incredible (Special thanks to Maria F our server).  The kid game with the electronic wands kept them busy for hours.  My eight year old cried when we had to leave.  Best value trip in a long time.  I recommend two night and 3 days to satisfy the kids, 1 night two days to satisfy me!

Summary Heading: Pretty good, but room for improvement.
Summary: My family and I spent the night here earlier this week.  At first look I was surprised at how big this place is.  The hotel is 9 floors and there is a large parking structure attached.  The lobby has huge ceilings and although there is a fair amount of theming down at eye level, up high it's pretty much blank walls.  Check in was surprisingly busy for a weekday, but we only waited about 20 min or so.  On the day you arrive you can check in at 1pm and have access to the amenities until the actual check in time of 4pm.  Our room was ready when we arrived at about 2pm.    The room was clean, decent sized, and nice decor.  The beds were comfortable.  I wasn't a fan of the sheets.  The bed linens in our room were, for lack of a better term, crispy.  Rolling over at night you'd think

Top Notch service from the bellman, to the lifeguards, the front desk agents, to wait staff in the restaurants. This family resort is incredible and should be made a blue print for all hotels and family resorts. Thank you Great Wolf for a incredible experience, we will be back very very soon.

Summary Heading: Lots of activities and very fun
Summary: This hotel was great! When you get there be prepared to not check into your room first thing and go to the water park or enjoy other attractions. The water park had so many rides for everyone. Some were bigger, like the light green one where you walk into a capsule and the the floor under you opens, and some were smaller like the dark green ride which was slower. For those who do not enjoy water slides there is also a lazy river, wave pool, and water that pushes up while you are on a board to imitate surfing. Younger kids who are not tall enough for the water slides have a play structure with smaller water slides and every 5 minutes or so the water in a bucket at the top of the structure would poor down on the kids. The room was great also. We stayed in the wolf den room. This

We went for a quick 1 night stay since we are local. My 7 year old loved it, however the 16 and 18 year old were a little bored after 2-3 hours. They do have 1 outdoor pool so the older ones went outside to lay out which helped. The rooms were comfortable and fine. No complaints. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rides were fun. The lazy river was a little on the small side and did seem to get too crowded. Overall, it would be a great time for a family with kids that are 12 and under.

Summary Heading: Lots of activities for any age but PRICEY!
Summary: Spent 2 nights, 3 days here with my nephews (age 6 and 4). Overall there were lots of activities to choose from (bowling, laser tag, "magic quest", "build a bear", ticket arcade, 4D ride, story book sessions, dancing/PJ parties, etc.) BUT with the exception of the stuff that happens in the lobby (story book and dancing parties), you have to pay more for on top of your hotel room cost.   Pros: all in one place (there's a restaurant, pizza and ice cream parlor, dunkin donuts, souvenir shop, store for all necessities for the water park)... you really don't need to leave this place for anything. The water park provides a lot of what you'd need at no additional cost: towels, floaties for the little ones, water fountains. Lots of skylights allow natural lighting to go in.  Cons: hotel

We have been three times now. I feel so welcome and safe. The experience is one of a kind. I would stay here before Disneyland by far!!!!! The staff is exceptional!!!!!  Adrianna, Michelle, Stacy, and Alex are wonderful. Thank you guys. Jenni and Madison.

Nice brand new hotel with its own water park........Great for little kids up to adults........They will let you come in ......and use the park before check-in...as early as 1:00pm and you can still use it until closing after you check out.....

Summary Heading: Resort prices but no real Resort.
Summary: We love resorts and water parks but this was a missed opportunity to me.  Rooms are not worth the prices and very small.  Food was not resort quality but definitely resort prices!  i would say leave hotel to eat and just enjoy the waterplay. Disappointed !

This is the second trip we have made to this resort. The first was on opening day. As you could imagine their were some speed bumps but the staff tried their best. However this trip was great. The resort has worked out most of the kinks and it is a great place. I can't reccommend the place enough. It is a great value and there is so much to do. If you love water parks, but can't stand sunburns, it's perfect. We will definetly go back, hopefully soon.

Summary Heading: Kids had a Blast!! But Pricey.
Summary: Our Kids really enjoyed this place which means we enjoyed it. They were in the water till almost 10pm and they loved it.  The place looked awesome and was very clean. The water slides were well maintained and clean.  The place fills up quick so go down early to get good seating.   Expect to pay for any extra things you want to do from the arcade to bowling... Our price included parking, wifi, and entrance into the water park, everything else is extra. If you ask us it was over priced.  However we will be going back again but with a discount. I suggest ordering out for food and or going out to eat a the local restaurants.

Summary Heading: Very fun for kids, so much to do!
Summary: We had a great time, the place has so much to do for kids, it's really fun. My only complaint is that the suites are small, and even in a themed suite with bunk beds for the kids (wolf den suite) there was no privacy at all from the kids.

This was our second stay here. The first time was on Grand opening day. This time, we stayed in the Grand Bear suite.  Check in took around 10-15 minutes. They have special birthday wolf ears for the birthday celebrants. There were two different entrances to our suite. It's basically a room with a king bed and another room with two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. It fit our party of 7 fine. We were able to enjoy the water park. The line for the Flow rider had the longest wait but it was fun.  They still have not fixed the floors in there. It is still VERY slippery. My daughter fell and hurt herself.  We also enjoyed the arcade room and went shopping in the gift shop. For breakfast we went to Dunkin Donuts and the line for that was outrageous. Overall this visit was better than

This hotel, containing a water park, restaurants, shops and an arcade, children's adventures created memories for 3 generations of family members. Ages 2- 71! The employees were spectacular. All young and very willing to be helpful. You can tell that they love their jobs. I would definitely recommend this adventure for families. The price was not too high. Room and there are 2 days of water park usage. The question will be...are 2 days enough?

Summary Heading: A kid's dream vacation but some adult hiccups....
Summary: We just returned from a two night stay at Southern California's Great Wolf Lodge. Overall it was good, but there are some things that can be improved upon.   Upon our arrival Friday at 4pm, we had to wait for our room for over 30 minutes (we had a Wolf Den Suite room).  When we initially checked in, they said it would just be a couple minutes but that wasn't the case.  Finally I went back to the front desk and spoke with a manager who did get us a room.  He said there were rooms available and for some reason the person that helped us didn't assign us one even though we were there and the other people with our room type hadn't checked in yet.  Once we got to our room it was nice.  There was a lot of room for the kids to play which is great but the bathroom wasn't large or

We spent 4 nights and had a great time. Everything was excellent and we will definitely we coming back soon. We never left the lodge since everything we needed was right there. The staff everywhere we went was awesome and the room was great too.

Summary Heading: We were so impressed with the food the cost of eating here. The water park is amazing! Loved our stay!
Summary: This Lodge is amazing! My kids never wanted to leave for Disneyland.  So impressed! Staff members were so kind,  food was so well priced and delicious! There are things to do from toddlers to teenagers. My 7 years old loved going on a Maji Quest. You will be working off your dessert calories here!

We stayed one night at Great Wolf Lodge since we are local to the area and had a great little break from reality. The hotel is new and we loved the outdoors theme. We stayed in a regular family suite with 2 queens and a sofa and it was plenty of room. We didn't spend much time in the room other than for sleeping. Lots of activities for the kids besides the water park. The food seemed reasonably priced. We brought snacks and food but they check bags going in to the water park so don't plan on bringing that in. The water park was great for our 8 & 5 yr old. Two days and they still wanted more slides and pool time. I loved the lifeguards and their watchful eye. They had some lifeguard training going on and they were on top of it. It does get slippery and we saw several people

Cant beat it for things to do in So Cal.  We were looking for something fun to do with the kids nothing huge just a day away to relax and enjoy as a family.  We had heard about this resort from people who had gone to it in other citys so we decided to give it a try.  And let me say we are hooked and will be going back often.  What a great place to just relax and have fun as a family.  Even with the hotel its way cheaper than a lot of other things to do in So Cal.  So when we need a break as a family we will seriously be headed back.

Summary Heading: A lot of Bang for your Buck!
Summary: Great staycation venue!  The kids loved the water park and the arcade!  If you're room isn't ready upon arrival, you can hang out at the water park.  After checkout, you can stay at the waterpark until it closes at 9 pm.  You don't really have to leave the hotel for anything;  all of the food venues were good and reasonably priced.  There is a McDonalds across the street.

Summary Heading: Dare I say better than Disneyland
Summary: I've been telling friends and family this place is far more fun and affordable than Disneyland. There's something for each age group in the family and the amenities offered for the children are incredible. We had an amazing time and will definitely return!  SO glad they opened in SoCal.

This was a great trip for a large group.  Being that the hotel and facilities are new, they were very clean, although I can see that changing rapidly the more it gets used if the staff is not diligent about upkeep.  Overall it's a bit expensive for what you get, and considering how many people are allowed in, there are not enough rides.  The lines were too long and took a lot of the fun out of it.

Excellent place to visit for family fun with small children. It isn't exactly cheap but it weeds out the ghetto people for the most part. Staff are friendly and helpful. My family reserved the wolf den room which came with bunk beds for the kids. Our room was on the top floor and faced north which allowed for unobstructed view of Disneyland firework show at 9:30 PM.   Room is fairly standard. TV did not work and called for repair but no one came. Room comes with a small coffee machine, refrigerator, and a microwave. Shower and bathroom are basic and water pressure was too low.  Several restaurants on the property and the prices weren't outrageous. Other dining options are within walking distance. Water park was decent with several attractions. If you have small children, this is

5 STARS !!!! I LOVE that it offers your hotel stay & provides entertainment for all ages . Resort feel atmosphere . You really don't need to leave the lodge. I recommend bringing a ice chest if your staying a few days

Of course the main attraction at Great Wolf Lodge is the huge indoor water park.  It is quite a sight to behold and the attractions/rides are all excellent.  If your children are old enough, you wont see them for hours. There is something for everyone and for children of all ages.  The crowd here in Southern California was quite diverse and friendly.  At between $400 and $700 a night (everyone who enters the water park must be a hotel guest), you tend to attract a different crowd than typical water parks.  There are pros and cons to an indoor water park.    Pros:  You never have to worry about the weather.  We were there on an overcast and cold Memorial weekend but inside the water park it was balmy and warm.  A quick step to the outdoor pool on a cold day makes you quickly
