The whole family enjoyed the entire weekend, on land and in the pool. The resort offers a number of activities to keep everyone busy. Best of all, the food prices are reasonable, not like many other resorts. Highly recommended for families with toddlers and elementary school aged kids.

Excellent service and value for parents with tweens and younger.  Lots of activities to keep muss busy in addition to the Waterpark.  Disneyland is right down the street if you want to extend your stay but it's good enough for its own vacation destination.

Summary Heading: Splish-Splash I was taking a bath...
Summary: Good Times and a fantastic, safe and wet adventure for families with young children or non-swimmers!  Almost entirely indoors, no need to wait on the weather to go, just go!  You'll have fun and so will all of the little ones you bring...the more the merrier!!

We had a "staycation" with another family recently at the Great Wolf Lodge - 4 kids total, ages 5-10. It was a great place to go since there is something for all age levels (even the grown-ups). The waterpark was large enough, but smaller than the one in Wisconsin. TIPS: (1) Go to the waterpark 1st thing when it opens to save seats. They go very quickly (within 30 minutes). (2) MagiQuest was a HUGE hit among the kids ($18 for the cheapest wand + $18 for the cheapest wand topper (optional) + $15 to actually play the game). It is basically a scavenger hunt that covers the lower lobby, lobby, and 4th-6th floors of the resort. Make sure if you bought a wand topper that the MagiQuest store employees actually registered it (you can check on any of the status machines). We didn't

Summary Heading: Fun for kids... disappointing for adults
Summary: Though we did not have a terrible experience, we were left a little disappointed with the overall theme and decor of the resort.  We are used to the high quality of Disney resorts and were surprised at the lack of decor in both the lobby and the room.  For the amount of money we paid for our stay, we were disappointed at what we actually received.  My children enjoyed the water park, however we thought it was small and not as relaxing of an environment as we had hoped.  In particular, the lazy river was extremely disappointing as it was small and had way too many water spouts that splashed us in the face.  We were hoping for a more relaxing lazy river, but it was far from relaxing as we had to constantly avoid the water spouts.  There was not a place for grown-ups to relax while

Summary Heading: First time stay at great wolf
Summary: I expected a lot based on feedback received from friends.  I understand I booked on Memorial Day weekend and it would be crowded upon arrival.  However, we booked the birthday package and we were not told anything as to special activities for my daughter.  Moreover, we wanted to eat at the lodge and were told that we needed a reservation and first available wasn't until 9:30pm!!!    We have spent birthday nights at he Disneyland Hotel and they have always exceeded our expectations.  Although they only have one pool with a few water slides, they made it a point to recognize my kids birthdays and it was always very easy to get in their restaurants.  Upon check in, we knew specific activities the resort is doing and it always felt stress free.  The other problem was the

The kids had a blast, but not as big as I thought it would be and 1.5 days there is plenty of time. Rooms were spacious and clean. Beds were comfortable. We had pizza there, it was ok. Prices are reasonable for food.

Staying at the Great Wolf Lodge was the most memorable experience for myself and my kids! We had an exceptional time. It's a one stop shop. No need to ever leave the resort. Plenty of activities to keep you busy for days, and also enough food options to not have to leave. To top it off the staff is exceptional. Every single staff member that crossed our path was SO helpful and polite with a smile on their face. Our trip was magical. We will surely be back! The prices were MORE than fair. We only stayed for one night but I wished we stayed for two. We got to do the water park both days and all he activities. It was amazing. Truly fun for all ages.

Amazing time! Great Park, great value! Just 5 minutes from Disney Parks! The staff was amazing and we were always greeted with a smile! Even the Lifeguards were nice, helpful, smiling and went above and beyond to make sure we were having fun! they took the extra time to teach my kids how to surf and actually got in the water with them! The slides are EPIC! The Tornado was the family favorite. I suggest booking on a weekday. We arrived Friday and we were spoiled by little wait times. Got very crowded Saturday. After the park closes  there is tons a fun to have in the hotel. I have been to other Great Wolf Lodges and this one was the BEST!

We really enjoyed our stay with our 18m son. I can honestly say we all enjoyed ourselves including my son. The wristband technology was very convenient. If you have kids, I think you will find this place a blast.

I and my family of 4 enjoyed our stay at the Lodge. We went at the beginning of the summer season and in the middle of the week. It was not too crowded, The kids loved it. I loved all the lifeguards and how attentive they are to the children. Rooms large and clean. A little pricey but the specials made it affordable. Like that no outsiders can come in. Overall a great time for our family I will return, but only on a special. We are not able to afford 450.00 a night for a room.

Super fun family vacation. New resort was very clean. Comfy beds. They issue room key bracelets that you can swim with and use for room charges.Staff is friendly and attentive. Water slides/activities for kids and adults of all ages. Will definitely return.

I live near by but felt like we were on vacation while here.  Loved everything about this resort.  Bring your water shoes because the ground can be slippery.  I will be back again! We only stayed one night to experience the water park.  There was no need for the extras for us.

This place is amazing for families. Kids are the center of attention. It's a kid's Paradise. Safe and secure environment you can call it a kid's vegas. Staff makes you fell important and welcomed. Oh yeah and the action never stops

The kids had so much fun!  Alot of restaurants nearby and walking distance.  Staff were super friendly and the front desk person were so helpful.  You get alot of exercise on the stairs, but sleep good at night. We will be back soon with friends.

Summary Heading: Visit to Great Wolf Lodge Southern California
Summary: Fun for kids and nice to stay. Nice water park; slides are closed to each other. You don't need to walk far. We  enjoyed the place and our stay. The  price include the water park use. No need to rent tubes.

Nearly everything was great. Wristbands are such a great idea being a key and credit card! We did have two charges not made by us but they were looked into and removed. My daughter who's 10 especially loved this trip - the water park and magi quest were great experiences for her! The breakfast buffet also had great variety and was reasonably priced. Another highlight was the corn by the pool bar. Delicious!

Summary Heading: Amazing Fun With The Grand Kids
Summary: Excellent place, friendly, clean.  A lot of things to do for all ages.  Staff was amazingly friendly and knowledgeable of the things to do during your stay.  They seemed very well trained and appreciative of their job.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, but still lacking in some areas
Summary: We attended the park with 2 other families and stayed for 2 nights. The park itself is a lot of fun and we did have a great time. The rooms are new, which is nice. The staff are incredibly friendly and always willing to help. The parking is easy and accessible. However, there are a few things to be aware of.  Our room was clean, but very small (Wolf Den), and not ready until 4:30 p.m. even though we were told when we arrived at 1 p.m. that it would be ready by 4 p.m. The food in the Wood Fired Grill was very inconsistent. Raw hamburgers and chicken, inexperienced servers, etc. Loose Moose had a great buffet breakfast and we would highly recommend that. There are limited options for food overall when you are in the water park. You have to subsist on burgers, fries and pizza all

All staff was super friendly and made us feel welcomed. We took our son for his 5th birthday but everyone in our party had a great time. Fun for all ages, even adults. Highly recommend this place!!! I can't wait to go back again.

The water park is fun for all ages, the additional free activities are amazing, and even the other activities that are at an additional fee are not costly. The food was also decently priced, especially for an amusement park. Already booked our next trip.

Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Fun outdoor woodsy atmosphere.  Kids are encouraged to be kids and have fun.  Water park floor can get slippery maybe wear water shoes. Will definitely go again.

Summary Heading: I was so excited i was able to book using my exclusive membership to get a great rate i was so impressed We had a ball
Summary: I was so excited when i arrived what a great way to me to spend memorial day with my family i would definately do it again with the same rate or better the food was great prices werent bad the pool area was a nice temperature at all times the closing time was perfect felt like a family

Summary Heading: Relaxing for parents & fun for the kids
Summary: I have visited 2 other Great Wolf Lodge locations & they are all great! You get full access to the water-park the day you arrive and the full day/night you check out! Totally fun for my kids, didn't have to worry about sunburns, and we all felt really safe at Great Wolf Lodge. I definitely recommend this place!

Summary Heading: Good, but needs extra personal touch.
Summary: I did mentioned it early, we stayed at the suite for kids.  I didn't expected big goodie bag,  but it would be nicer if you had a mini cookie or chocolate for kids in the room. Little bit of personal touch would be bery nice

Summary Heading: Great family resort for young children
Summary: Wonderful service in the restaurants, however food is just mediocre and pricey. Lots of activities for small children and middle school children but not so great for teens. Room was clean and nice nothing spectacular. Pillows were very uncomfortable and the air conditioner was very loud.

It was perfect for a 1 night stay with a 2 year old and a 5 year old kid.  The hotel's theme was fun,my kids enjoyed the lobby activities, and the convenience of having a waterpark within walking distance of your hotel room was awesome.  Just the waterpark alone kept them thrilled for the afternoon that we arrived and the morning before we left.  And my kids also enjoyed the PJ jamberee and the story time.

Summary Heading: Great for smaller kids, wouldn't go at a peak time
Summary: We have a 3 & 5 year old and they really enjoy going to Great Wolf Lodge. The hotel rooms feel cheap and the bed is not comfortable but the hotel isn't that expensive considering it includes the Water Park tickets. Both times we have been have been mid week while school was still in session and the wait times for slides were mostly non existent. But the park felt good with that amount of people. We will definitely go back but not on the weekend or during the summer. The rides were fun for our smaller kids but if you had to wait in line for them they would get old pretty fast.

Worth the money especially with the purchase of the Paw Pass, kids had an awesome time and so did the parents. Great value for money and better option than Disney or universal. Would definitely go again.

We went on a Thursday and saved a little bit of money over the weekend rate.  The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful!  My kids are ages 7, 9 and 12 and it was perfect for them.  The food was a bit pricey, but the quality was great.  Our room was very clean and my daughter loved the special bubble bath.

Summary Heading: wonderful vacation, great resort, lots of fun
Summary: The resort is wonderful, beautiful and lots of fun. My kid loves the wáter park and the romos are great, friendliness of the staff is also great. lots of things to do. I definitely recommend spending a day or two with your family

I was beyond impressed with the outstanding service provided by all Pack members.  It's definitely worth the price of the suites.  I was expecting to be nickel and dimed and it was the exact opposite.  The prices on all the food and beverages was fair.  Only $15 for 2 beers!  Yes, there is alcohol for the parents.

From the moment you walk in, the vibe and the beauty of this place shines through! We got here at 12pm and decided to check in and see if there a room available (trying our luck) even though check in is at 4pm. We were happy we tried because they quickly gave us our room. They also took their time to explain us everything we should expect and do while there. The water-park was amazing. I am glad I bought shoes for the kids to walk in though, it can be slippery and floors are a little dirty because of the people going in and out. I actually think it should be required to have water shoes on. Anyway, the staff is super attentive and happy! At one point we were eating and one guy noticed we didn't have lids for our cups and brought us some! Awesome right? We slept in the wolf den

Our first day went smoothly-we arrived at noon, room was ready, and we were given our water park wristbands immediately.  Park was packed but other than lack of seating, you didn't feel overly crowded and lines moved quickly. Water temp seemed to get colder as the night went on. Food and drinks at the snack bars were good but overpriced.  Second day was not as positive. Less staff working in the park so lines moved slower, issue with teens cutting in line.  When the issue was reported, the staff member treated us like idiots, made excuses for the teens and allowed them to stay at the front of the line where they had cut and told us to talk to her supervisor which we did and were told that cutting was absolutely not allowed.  After leaving the park, we stopped at one of the

This resort is perfect for all ages. My family and I hadon't a great time on the water slides and all other activities provided in the hotel. Loved the theme and the energy of the whole place. We will be returning real soon.

Had a great time! Kids did not want to leave! The water park was a lot of fun. Suitable for all ages.  Safe because only hotel guests can enter. Everyone brought family so felt comfortable enough to leave our belongings at the tables while all 6 of us went on rides.  I am telling everyone about it and hope to visit again soon!

Everything about the resort was amazing! The staff was incredible, friendly, and made us feel welcomed. The staff in the arcade and the supervisors were extremely patient and helpful. They attended to our needs and always had a smile on their faces. The water park was a lot of fun for the family and we will definitely come back again!

Fun place for the kids. However, after hotel room price, taxes, resort fees, buffet and arcade prices...it turned out to be a one expensive one night stay... Although we had a good time, we most likely will not be returning anytime soon.

My family really enjoyed our time at this resort.  It is pretty pricey but the value of what you get is good.  We stayed 1 night but I think I could have done 1 more night.  More than that would be too much.  We tried the mini golf which I thought was fun and a good price.  The dinner buffet food was delicious with a good amount of variety.  I plan to go back in about a year and stay 2 nights.

Recommended for kids 2 years and older, for sure! 42 inches is the magic height number, then you can go on most things with them. Awesome rooms and great hours to play! We will absolutely go back! Can't wait!

I took my daughter and friend for their 11th birthday celebration. They had a blast. Only stayed 1 night but had access to the waterpark both days. The staff is tremendous, the rooms are clean and comfortable. We stayed in the Wolf Den and they loved their area. Definitely going back!

My family visited with 2 small kids and we had a blast. The staff was friendly, and the room we stayed in was nice. We had the small themed cabin room. My girls loved the paintings and bunk beds. The couch bed was comfortable and the room was a great size for 4 adults and 2 kids. The water park was a lot of fun, my kids did not want to leave. We will be visiting again. We are going to do the MagiQuest next time, which is an interactive game throughout the resort with a wand you purchase. This was one of the most fun trips with my kids. The prices of the food in the resort was reasonable. We got the buffet breakfast, there was a good selection and the food was delicious.

The staff were great. We checked in before the official check-in time, and the room was available to us.  The family suite was large and spacious.  Super clean and tastefully decorated. The water park was also immaculate, water temp was perfect.  Great time overall. Kids loved it.

Great Wolf Lodge was quite fun for the kids! Very efficient and well organized during check-in and in the water park. Staying here more than 2 nights is way too much. The water park is not very big and all the other activities is not enough to keep you entertained. Great place to check out though! One tip: buy the souvenir cups.. you get free refills!😉

Young kids, teenagers and Adults will have a blast. Be prepared to go up the stairs (no joke!). Customer service is excellent. Food is decent and affordable. Like the fact that entrance is not for general public.

We were not happy with how My husband and I were not happy with the crew members standing the Waterpark door.  They demanded us to throw away my 11 months old snacks when later on we saw other adults eating other snacks from outside. Like big bags of patties chips, big bag of grapes, and ect.   How did they allow those snacks but dememnaded us to throw away my baby snacks. They didn't have those to purchase for my son at the park. I begged them to let my son keep it. They careless with a mean face toward us.  We would never come back because I don't think we were treated fairly. Especially my little 11 months old. All he had all day were milk. No snacks ! Poor kid. we were treated upon entering the water park. If you have small kids don't bother to come here unless you are

I went to the great Wolf Lodge to celebrate my 35th birthday. I had an 11-year-old 12-year-old and a one-year-old in tow. Everyone enjoyed themselves. My husband and I enjoyed the convenience of the wristbands that let you into your rooms and allowed us to purchase food without having to carry a key

Water park is awesome and very well organized. Definitely worth the money. I will definitely be visiting again. Check in was quick and effortless. Our room was ready within thirty minutes. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean and fully stocked. The Water park itself was huge and fresh towels were always ready. I cannot wait to return. My sons birthday is in November and we can FINALLY do what he's always wanted to do for his bday- go swimming!!

Although we enjoyed our overnight stay at Great Wolf, we were dismayed by the lack of seating in the water park. We wondered around the place for a good 20 minutes trying to find seats. Once we found them, we watched other people struggle all day long to find a place of their own to sit. It's not like you're going o be in the water a solid 10 hours. The arcade was $2 per game. The room was comfortable. The buffet was good. $23 for adults, $12 for kids - dinner. We may go again. And we may not. It's worth a visit though.

Waterpark was clean and comfortable.  Rooms were small but comfortable.  Price is a very high for a better room with theme.  Overall,  great time.  Parking was too expensive.  I thought it was included in my stay but I had to pay $60.00 when I pulled out

Good water park, except it's really slippyer for kids, good food, great Arcadia, great rooms, good food, check in fast and simple. I would recommend coming here again. Arcade was a bit pricey, but rooms was great and customer service was excellent

Summary Heading: Experience once, but not sure if we'll go again
Summary: It was fun for the kids. Smaller than I thought but of course for the kids it was big. Asked for housekeeping..never came, slippery water areas even with swim shoes on, food was whatever and took forever and there was only one other table there W T H? so we ended up going out to eat for dinner and breakfast. We get to our room...and it wasn't made!!! First, our keys didn't work so we had to flag down a housekeeper and thankfully she opened it and upson entering the place, sofa couch was messy, trash in bathroom, little pieces of trash...ummmm...we paying for this? Rooms were really whatever. Like a days inn or a best western. We stayed in the family suite. Bed was whatever..everything was really just whatever!

Waterpark overcrowded! Lazy river is tiny and there was no limit to how many folks entered at anytime. It was a 'bumper tube' (bumper cars) vibe. People were arguing about space. Smh! The breakfast buffet is horrible. Do not waste your money on that restaurant. The story time, you could barely hear. The sound system needs to be adjusted for that activity. It didnt seem very organized. Other than that, the staff was friendly. Very nice service. The resort is beautiful. Kids enjoyed it, so we're pleased with the trip overall.

This place was super awesome. The kids had a blast. It was clean with lots to do. The wrist bands connected to ur debit card & room, genius.  Didn't have to tote around my valuables.  It made the whole experience easier especially when I have a ton of kids. Love the showers and swim suit dryer in the bathroom.  Another convenience.  Definitely coming back next year

Summary Heading: Great for Kids but not such great healthy food options!
Summary: We chose this place to celebrate my son's 9th birthday along with our 4 other kids and they LOVED it! But there were no healthy food options and we are all vegan! We had to make do with going to the store and making food in our room (that didn't have a kitchen) but we did what we could. We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights and wow that was so long - I would recommend only 1-2 nights max. Your pay only covers the stay and water park but my kids could only handle the water park for 1 hour and 1/2 at a time then they wanted to get out. You can do everything in 1-2 hours at the water park. They have other activities but everything is VERY expensive - bowling, magiquest game, arcades, movie it's all over priced. We ended up using our disneyland passes to go there TWICE during our stay

Since I was unable to be with my son, his wife and grandchildren for Mothers Day. My husband and I thought we would check out this new resort Great Wolf Lodge, to make sure it would be a good place to take our grandchildren. We had so much fun and cannot wait to bring our grandchildren. The only thing is parents you need to watch your children to make sure they can ride some of the slides. We saw a lot of children that were being lead back done the stairs because they were to little or scared.

Summary Heading: Great place for kids but expensive.!
Summary: We spent one night here.  When we arrived on a Sunday afternoon the lobby was filled and there was a fairly long line to check in.  The line moved quickly and check in was fast and efficient.  Upon check in your party is given a head band with wolf ears and a wrist band for the waterpark.  We were in a Wolf Den room that had a queen bed, sofa sleeper, and a set of bunkbeds in a little cabin themed alcove.  There was a TV in the alcove and one in the main part of the room.  The bathroom was very simple and the sink is outside the bathroom.  There is a microwave and a little fridge that is empty to put  your food in.  Sunday afternoon the waterpark was packed and a little crazy.  Lots of safety things slid by the attendants that were caught on Monday when it was much calmer and

My daughter who turned 5 in May saw the ads for the Great Wolf Lodge on TV. As like every other kid she begged me to go. I booked our room for her birthday. I booked it for 5 days. I arrived very tired because of the 8 hour drive. When I arrived we were greeted and because I seen how tired I was they check to see if my room was available. Even though I was early they checked me in so I could rest. They also made my children feel welcomed. They told us how to get to our room and they told my children what was coming up in the day's events. Arriving to our room it was very nice and welcoming. My children were hungry so we went to the Loose Moose. Their food was absolutely amazing. They have chefs not Cooks. I've been home now for 3 days and I am already planning my next trip. The

I am glad that they opened an indoor waterpark in Orange county close to Disneyland. You have to stay in their hotel to get access to their waterpark which is think is a little pricey but worth it. Both adults and children can have fun in the water park. It is huge but it still can get crowded especially summer time coz even if we went there before summer break it is still kind of busy. Overall, its still worth to try and experience great wolf lodge in Garden Grove, CA

We first went to disney and they sold us tickets with our little kids for grad night. The busiest day of the year and huge lines of teenagers. Miserable. This place saved us. Best waterpark ever. The staff are so nice and you cant drown there. They are watching every square inch of that place and making kids wear life jackets. Staff police the pools inensely and dont stand for running or roughousing(poor parenting) like other pools. So many choices for slides from death defying lock you in a tube to entire family on a raft to body surfing the wave pool. We loved the boogie board machine. Everyone was eating the large pizza from the lobby take out hungry as a wolf and we had this for dinner and it was very good pizza. Too much cheese, awesome hand cut pepperoni, decent crust,

Summary Heading: Fun for Kids but Super Expensive!
Summary: The Resort is beautiful, service is good and food is good but Super Expensive beyond the cost to spend the night you need to add food and indoor entertainment. Things  like the arcade, bowling, magic quest which is at least $40 for one kid to play and it design for kids to see it and want it while they have you there. Be aware to come with an open wallet and

Summary Heading: Great park and fun, horrible beds and noise
Summary: I would actually rate this a 3.5.  A 4 to 5 for the fun and activities, and a 2 for the room/comfort/sleeping.  We had an overall good stay, mainly due to the fun waterpark.  But through the waking hours of the night and early morning, all I could think about was how this sleeping experience was not worth the price.  Although we had a blast at the waterpark, my daughter enjoyed her birthday, great dinner at the grill, the bed and room noise really make me hesitant to return.  I enjoyed everything except the room facilities. The adult bed is way too small for 2 adults, and was not comfortable in the least. This is a new resort and we expected an excellent new bed. The couch was also small and uncomfortable, but you don't spend much time sitting around, so this could be

We had a great time as a family we enjoyed the waterpark and all the cute little stores. This place is perfect for children under five for the storytime and the craft  activities.  The Arcade bowling and golfing  and of course the waterpark  it's fun for any age we had from four years old to 61 years old We really enjoyed yourself.

This vacation is well worth the price, particularly if you stay on a Tuesday/Wednesday.  We were able to avoid any wait on all the waterslides!  We stayed in the Grand Bear Suite with our family friends, and it was worth it.  We took turns watching each other's kids so we, too, could partake in the fun.  Be sure to try the surfing that is only available during the first and last hour that the park is open.  Every single employee we encountered was friendly and helpful.  The resort was remarkably clean and reasonably priced (food, souvenirs, etc.).  Our boys really enjoyed the MagiQuest experience during the evening after dinner and a nice bath.  After two days at the water park - we were pleasantly exhausted!

Our kids were the ideal age to enjoy the water park (5-12) so it was a low stress getaway for us. We came with the whole family (Grandpa, Grandma, Aunts, Uncles and Cousins) and had a blast! It's a great place for boys-lots of activities to wear them out. :)

The burger that I ordered was raw in the middle.  Also, how do you run out of juice at the waterpark for kids? Your website says no cooler in the water park but does not say no outside food into the waterpark.  Guests should be able to bring food into the waterpark or at least offer more of a variety in your menu.....to charge $10 for a sala without chicken is outrageous.

Brought our daughter here for her 8th birthday! Very impressed with the water park and the cleanliness of it. Beds were a little small, but comfortable. A bit overpriced on the food, but there are tons of places to walk to if you want to save some money. Overall, a great place to have a staycation!

It was just a little pricey but overall experience I love it.Rooms were very clean people was very friendly and I love that there's a lot of activities for the kids . I will go for probably one more day to enjoy to the fullest all of the activities that the hotel offers.

We're a family of 4 - kids ages 3 & 9, went here for my daughters birthday and everyone had a blast.  We're locals and found extreme value at this resort.  Food was priced very well and the food quality was great.  Water park was awesome (these guys have it down) and overall pricing was great considering you get 2 days of water park fun for 1 nights stay.  Rooms are clean but very basic (we stayed in a Standard Room) but we didn't spend very much time in the room as there's so much to do on the resort property.  Love Love Love our stay!

This is an amazing place for families . Kids are entertained the entire time . Lines for slides are reasonable, the interactive activities in the hotel are pricey but worth it  . Lifeguards are everywhere and attentive.  The only safety issues I could see is in the water park . Multiple people slipped and fell on their bottoms. They were not running , just walking . Their were multiple pregnant women elderly that could get seriously injured . They need to fix that . Other than that , this place is magical and I have referred multiple friends .

We stayed at the lodge for my son's 11 birthday it was good but not great. The staff was mostly friendly had a few members that were just not there. The room was nice, clean and on time which I enjoyed being that we arrived at about 2pm. After checking in we went to our room and then down to the park. We got the birthday package which includes a door banner, cake, 5 balloons, $40 dining credit and $40 arcade credit. The park is big lots to do for kids ranging from 6 to 15 I would say. Not so much for the little ones but there is some and they get tired quickly so it was not to bad for my daughter. I traveled with an 11 year old and a 7 month old. There were a lot of life guards everywhere but not a lot of rule following. The lazy river was a mess with kids running, jumping

This is a great place to go with family. We had young kids as well as teens in our party and a great time was had by all. I loved that the lines were never too long for anything. The water park was so much fun and it was wonderful not to have to worry about hats or sunscreen since it was indoors.

Overall very pleasant vacation, gets moneys worth and very accommodating and considerate. We got there 12pm and our room was ready. We were able to enjoy every minute of it. We will definitely go back. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Summary Heading: Pricey, but great for young kids
Summary: Rooms were great and clean.  Kids activities were good as well, could have some activities for early risers. For the cost, the buffet was terrible, food very mediocre.  Only great item was the pasta bar.  Very little for kids that are GF and dairy-free. There was not a lot of information upfront on what was available, and extra costs, or suggested timing of activities for first timers.

The front desk  member, Yeesina, is very rude. I was waiting for the Disneyland shuttle scheduled at 630pm. After waiting 20 minutes, no shuttle came.  I went to the front desk to inquire again about the shuttle schedule.  Yeesina had a very bad attitude, told me she did not know the schedule and looked at me in a very rude manner.  Front desk staff should have answers to these simple requests or direct me to someone who does.  This is a family resort, I spent a good amount of money and expect that the staff will have better customer service training.  This incident put me and my family in a very bad mood.  Customer service should be #1 priority.

I am a grandma that enjoys being a kid again and I had a blast on all the rides! It was great exercise going up the stairs. It was warm. And the lazy river was there when you needed a break. And the food was fantastic. It felt like a real vacation to me.

Be aware of the added resort fee. The majority of inside attractions outside of the water park cost extra money. Dunkin Donuts has a line a mile long in the morning and their meal prep area is small and cramped, so walk across the street to McDonald's instead. All restaurants were super slow. Water rides didn't have enough attendant's causing the lines to get backed up and the overall flow was very slow.

Quick family vacation, just a short drive from San Diego. I had been to the Wolf Lodge in Wisconsin but this one was so much better!! Took the family that had never been and according to my kids this was the Most Amazing Place!! Everyone was super friendly and helpful and the suite was clean and comfortable.  The only thing to be careful with in the room is the tub, very slippery a very smooth surface.  One last note at 6am the delivery Trucks for US foods comes in and the when it undocks the doors slam and it woke us up, and I'm a heavy sleeper. When I called the desk the agent said "well no one else has complained " I will be visiting again, I just may ask for a room on the other side. Overall Great Wolf Stay!!!

Our family 8 yr old, 5 yr old and 2 yrs old had a great time. There were activities catered to each age group. Best trip we've taken. My kids already want to go back! We plan to return at least annually

Best place for a family!  Fun for everyone.  What a great experience all around.  The waterpark was the best, food prices were reasonable, room was fun and excellent, great detail to a family experience.  Can't wait to go again!

We had a blast!  Our first Great Wolf experience was awesome, we were only 58 miles from home but we really felt that we on a mini vacation. Great wolf lodge is a great place for the whole family. the water park is amazing . we enjoyed the cabana on Saturday too. I have already recommended Great Wolf Lodge to my co-workers....thanks for the memories, we will return

It was a lot of fun for my kids. The only problem I could see was security, kids come and go and my kids are 6 & 8 and that made me nervous. There wasn't any checking of wristbands or making sure that the parents are with the kids. There should be some sort of security in place. But other than that it was very fun.

The kids had a ball. Food was pretty good and reasonably priced for the location. The slides were fantastic, accommodations were nice, parking and access were easy. It was crowded on the weekend, as expected. A Thursday night stay was lovely; few crowds. Great family fun time!

We celebrated my son's 11th birthday here on May 7th and booked a 2 Queen bed room. The property is very clean and well maintained. We booked here mainly because of their indoor water park and it did not disappoint! We had a blast from the moment we checked in till the next day at the water park. There were plenty of restaurants nearby. Parking and wifi included with the extra fees when you book your room.  Rather than writing a long review, I am attaching photos for all to look at. I love taking pictures and photos are proofs of our priceless memories...  One thing they might need to improve is the Dunkin Donuts costumer service. The lines were pretty long in the morning. I waited more than half hour just to buy donuts for breakfast. The  2 cashiers were slow. They need to add

Fun for the entire family, including smaller children.  The capacity was perfect, not too crowded. The wait time for water slides was minimal.  I was impressed with the number of lifeguards on duty and their attentiveness.

This is a great place for a family vacation. It's a bit on the pricey side but worth it. The staff is very friendly. There is a lot to do inside the water park as well as outside the park. The beds were not very comfortable and very small.

Look at the other Great Wolf Lodge Locations! They all have charm but for some reason decided to skip on this in Garden Grove. VERY Disappointed! Not only that but the cost to stay there is I am sure by far more expensive then any other location. NO Charm! Go stay at Disneyland, Legoland, or Universal Studios instead!

Great waterpark for all ages. My kids ages 9,6,3 all had a different section in water park they loved. And much to do besides water park in hotel. Water temp is perfect. Bring eye drops because on second day my childrens eyes were irrated from chlorine.

Our stay was excellent.  The staff is very kind, fun, interactive and helpful.  The resort is clean, organized and plenty of fun to be had.  The water attractions were great!  The lines were short and it was not crowded.  We look forward to going back!

One of the best family hotels you will ever stay at!! Extremely fun with lots to do and the food prices are just as cheap as local restaurants if not better!! This place is a must stay, your kids will love it and you will love it too!!!!

The hotel and waterpark are both nice.. We expect to he check in at 4:00 pm... And when we arrived about 12:30 pm we tried to checked if they have some room available and were lucky Because the room was ready for us...!

Summary Heading: Awesome indoors waterpark hotel, we love it 💘
Summary: The name just said it all , the great 🐺 wolf lodge, the best indoor waterpark place to take your family. Will totally recommend it , great reasonable  prices and plenty of options to do during your stay.

Summary Heading: They thought of everything for a family on vacation
Summary: We visited the hotel with our 2 and 4 1/2 year old. They were both entertained the whole time. Getting them to sleep was no problem as they were active all day long. Having bar service near our table was a nice touch towards the end of the day. All in all, excellent time had by all. They kids have been asking to go back ever since we left.

My family had a great time!! The food was pricey but the activities were wonderful, we'll be going back soon. Planning on taking my nieces and nephews....,... This summer will be great to come back to the great wolf lodge!

My wife and I came with our four kids. It's so convenient to have the hotel and the park in the same building. We felt totally safe letting the kids roam free at the park. Thank you for a great weekend.

Summary Heading: The best all around hotel/resort my family has stayed in
Summary: My family and I have stayed at many hotels through the years, but found Great Wolf Lodge to be the best resort we've stayed in thus far.  The location could be better, it's in Garden Grove which is not the safest city, but as long as you stay in the resort or close to the resort you should be fine.  The service we received made my kids feel really special and they are looking forward to going back.  We only stayed one night, but being able to access the waterpark both days was worth it.  We arrived around 12 noon the day of check in and were allowed to access the waterpark (their policy is to let you access as early as 1, so we already felt like we were treated special) and both my kids were given wolf ears at check-in (my oldest got a special set of wolf ears as we were

Had a terrible experienceWe had a horrible 1st experience at Great Wolf Lodge. At check-in, the staff member looked like a deer in head lights when I asked about our room being upgraded. She had no idea when I asked if we had been granted the up grade. I was able to talk with a manager and a change was made. We went to the water park for a few hours and planned to have a nice dinner that the staff had bragged about during check-in, claiming it was a 3 star buffet. We had to order terrible, soggy pizza and drinks for $70.00. After we placed our order we were informed that all the soda machines were down, no carbonation had been delivered and that we would have to purchase a 2 litter for $5.00. Our only conselation was the plan to stop by Dunkins and head back to the room to watch

The water in the water park was cold. We had a hard time enjoying it since my son was shivering and had purple lips the majority of the time. Good thing there was warm water in the public showers and towels readily available.  When we went to get pizza our first night there for my sons birthday, they were out of pizza and said it would be hours before it would be available again. My son was very unhappy. Then we ordered spaghetti but was told that the spaghetti was not cooked but we could have linguini noodles instead. My son is picky and was not too happy. We ordered it anyways. When we received it the noodles were spaghetti noodles but we're very undercooked. Thankfully I also ordered Alfredo and he tried it and liked it.

Summary Heading: Vacation could of been better if staff was trained properly.
Summary: We had a good discount for our first visit. However, I would not pay to re-visit if there was no discount. I wouldn't pay the advance booking pricing for the service we received. The concept of the resort was good. The kids had a blast but the staff can be better. Some were good, others can use some more training on customer service.

An overall great experience for the girls.  My daughter said it was the best staycation ever!  Food was horrible!  Plenty of places to eat outside of resort.  Customer service was excellent. Alcohol was consumed in arcade area, especially later in the evening...not a great idea when there are a lot of kids.

Stayed here 3 days two nights. Waterpark was great. We never left the hotel property. They have everything you need here. I loved the dunkin donuts.Staff very friendly and helpful. My kids shut down the waterpark every night and had a blast. Would definitely stay again.

Everyone had a blast! The rooms were great! Water park had a lot to offer, something for everyone. Service was very good. Dunkin Donuts!! My son also loved the quest, it takes some time but it was a lot of fun running around the hotel finding everything.

Summary Heading: A Great Family Experience for ALL Ages!!!!
Summary: We were so impressed with this location from start to finish! The amount of activities available, the affordable dining and the safety at the water park was all stellar! I highly recommend this as a vacation spot! Don't forget to pack your water shoes though! It's a bit slippery in the park itself. :)

Summary Heading: Great Place for Kids and Fun
Summary: Loved this place and the staff.  Very friendly and kind to the kiddos.  Plenty to do and there wasn't enough time to do it all.  Will definitely be back.  I have no choice, my girls (8) and (11), wouldn't have it any other way.  Bring water shoes, ground is slippery and wet, and can be a little rough on feet, but other than that, just plan on coming for a great time.  Will not lie, very pricey, but worth it.  The more money you spend, the more you did.

Had a good experience and I like the variety of activities and restaurants. Clean hotel and rooms. This is a good place for the family to getaway for a few days. Waterpark was a lot of fun. Only reason I gave it 3 stars was the cost per night just does not fit the room type and level of service. There is a a resort fee of $25, so when they tell you the waterpark usage is included with your room...not really...you're still paying for it! On top of that, there is an "occupancy fee of 14.5%; this means you're paying an additional $32+ per night. So tag on an extra $56+ per night on top of your over-priced room. Worth a stay, nice experience...just the cost.

My family and I just came back from our first stay at any GWL and we were completely impressed.  Although my wife and I were a bit skeptical when our son chose this for his 7th birthday, we went with it, and are very glad that we did. This turned into a large family trip with our son (now 7) daughter (3), as well as my wife's mother, brother, and sister-in-law (don't worry....we all get along just fine).  A big age range, and everyone still had a good time.  First off, I have to say that water shoes are a must!  The ground can be slippery in spots, but it looks like they are trying to combat that by putting on some extra texture....but that can be a bit abrasive.  Having the water shoes made walking around all day really easy.....spend the $15 and buy a cheap pair before you

We stayed here for my son's birthday and the whole family had a great time. The staff was always around and overly friendly. Value for what you get is good. Room and water park were clean. Food was good at the various restaurants.

Parts of the hotel were falling apart and in disrepair, three people from our family slipped and fell in water park causing very bad bruising in one child, and we were bothered THREE times BEFORE checkout time by employees knocking on the door asking us when we were leaving. Disneyland is cheaper, cleaner, safer, and makes you feel welcome- they don't try to bug you into checking out hours early. Also don't waste your money on a wolf den room. We did and there were no Ac vents in that area. Our kids had to sleep sweaty and move into our beds to cool down.

We took our son for his 10th birthday for two nights and it was amazing. The staff blew me away with their attentiveness and kindness. Impressed by the dining throughout- was not expecting to enjoy the food as much as I did and was happily surprised with everything. All meals were delicious. We had SUCH a great time at the water park, plus, Magiquest kept him busy and was fun to watch as he explored...  I"M THRILLED with our visit and will be coming back.  THANK YOU!!!!!!

Great Wolf Lodge was awesome! Our kids are begging to go back. Everything was great - the amenities, kids' programs, wonderful water park, food, etc. The lifeguards were incredible. Incredibly attentive and cautious and made us feel very very comfortable. Wonderful slides and huge play areas for non-swimmers which was great as well. Highly recommend!

We spent over 2000 on two horrible nights our birthday bash room we requested over 5 weeks in advance was not ready. we had to check in with a trainee employee who forgot about our breakfast and birthday booking total waste of money nothing was ready.the wave pool and surf pool where both closed on our last day would never visit again pushy staff

Fun family water park. However room was in poor shape from a cleanliness perspective, beer bottle caps between sofa cushions, dirty socks left under furniture, rotten tomatoes and olives left under air unit in room.

What a fun way to spend a weekend!  We have 2 kids, 9 & 11 years old. They had so much fun, both in & out of the water. The waterpark was well laid out with activity areas that catered to each age group. And there were so many lifeguards!  I felt very comfortable letting my kids go off on their own to have fun.  We went over Mother's Day weekend, so attendance was lower than normal. The lines for the tube rides were fairly short (5-15min). There were also a number of activities available in the hotel outside of the waterpark too. My son really enjoyed the MagiQuest game and my daughter loved her experience at the Scoops Kids Spa.  These activities were not included in the cost of the stay and a little pricy. The staff was super attentive and friendly. But the staff is still

I booked a family suite to celebrate my sons birthday. Our suite was ready at 1, well before the 4 PM check-in. We were able to enjoy the park and outside pool, despite the rainy weather. The staff was amazing, always smiling and personally offered warm towels upon our exit from the outside pool. Was a pleasant experience and we will definitely be back this summer!

Summary Heading: What an amazing time!  We will return...
Summary: We didn't stay in the hotel but we did get to visit the Water Park area and restaurants (we visited friends staying at the hotel).  The waterpark passes and parking are free as long as you are a registered guest in the hotel.  First let me say that there wasn't too much of anything to actually complain about! This place is pretty amazing! There were a couple of concerns though. There were several instances in which they had just simply ran out of stuff! Like straws for the souvenir cups, or milk, or pizza, or a certain types of cheese etc.  When we went to order something or our friends went to order something, they have to try to find a substitute or go to a different restaurant to see if they had it available.  And I know it's a newer place that just opened in February, but

Summary Heading: It's a great resort of all the attractions are open during your stay
Summary: The hotel staff was great. They were helpful and attentive. The reason I'm unsure if I would come back is because 3 of the main slides were shut down during a good portion of our stay which is really disappointing. My kids are bigger and the slides are what they were interested in most. The whole facility should be up and running when you spend that kind of money to come stay at the resort. I also had to contact the resort after our stay to dispute charges that weren't mine.  The person I spoke to was very kind and removed the charges but I think there needs to be some adjustments to the wristbands to make them more accurate. If I did come back I would choose to not link a credit card to the wrist band to avoid dealing with it.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge in Southern California
Summary: This was our 1st trip to Great Wolf Lodge. We expected a one-star hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel accommodations for the standard room were excellent, along the lines of a three-star hotel. The hotel itself was well designed and clean. There were various activities for adults and kids of all ages. We had a great time!

Summary Heading: Great Service by Marie at the a Lodge Restaurant
Summary: My family and I have dined at hundreds of restaurants and the service we received from a waitress named Marie at the Lodge Buffet was above and beyond any service we have ever received.  We ended up having a great Mother's Day weekend at the Lodge topped off by perfect service by Marie.

My two young kids (ages 1 1/2 and 3 1/2) enjoyed the water park the most. They loved the bunk beds in the wolf den and the fact that it had it's own TV. The TV was not working the second day, we had to call the front desk twice before the maintenance guy came to our suite, he said the TV got disconnected, probably from the housekeeping staff. Lots of free activities for the kids to participate in, we watched the forest friends show, colored, and made balloon animals. The arcade is very expensive, a $5 card only gets you play on about 2 games.

We stayed two nights and it was really fun.  Although it is geared towards younger children I was with 4 teenagers the oldest being 19.  They had a blast  and never complained once about the attractions.  A small complaint was that our room wasn't visited by the cleaning staff until about 4pm.  Although they did show up EARLY (before 8am) in the morning some kids were still sleeping so I asked them to come later.  4pm was too late for a revisit in my book.  It wasn't a huge deal as we are pretty tidy but kind of a bummer if you wanted to go back to a clean room and relax after your day in the water park.  The Loose Moose was not that great.  I can always find something at the buffet to eat and my kids think buffets are amazing but this place got a thumbs down from all 6 of us.

We had a blast!  The pools were great for all ages.  The snack bar had great food and prices. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and everyone that worked there were really nice. Ready to book our next stay!!

Summary Heading: They are still working on the formula
Summary: New facility from a company that has been building hotel/water parks for some time. We stayed for two nights and went from very happy to pretty disappointed over our stay.  1) Rooms are fairly small. Not California Adventure small but having six people in one is very cosy.  2) There is nothing to hang wet swimwear up on in the bathrooms so they can drip dry.  3) The Magicquest game was fun for the kids until they reach a level boss. The whole game is just waving a wand around until you get to a boss. Then, with zero explanation you are supposed to know to use icons on a tv screen in a specific way. If you don't, you spend 3-6 minutes failing then must start over. With lines we spent 30-40 minutes on a single station. All of us were very frustrated with this. Frequent trips down

For Mother's Day I really like to do something special for my 3 year old daughter. If it wasn't for her I wouldn't be able to be celebrating such a special day. I really wanted to check out the Great Wolf Lodge and I am SO glad that I did. I surprised my daughter and she was ecstatic. I didn't think she was going to want to go down all the slides on her own, but she totally did. We got the Wolf Den Suite it was so cute and so perfect for her and still privacy for my husband and I. On Sunday morning we got brunch at the Loose Moose. It was really good quality food and reasonably priced, especially for being at a resort.

The property was clean, safe, and friendly.  Our daughter (5) had a great time, as well as the adults!  The water park was a blast.  Excellent value for what you are provided.  Easily a top ten place to visit when in Orange County!

Overall our stay at the Wolf Resort was enjoyable and lots of fun.  The staff for the most part was very helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the water park staff created a safe place to swim and enjoy the water park.

Our ages were from 45-2 and we all loved it!!! We will be back! there is bar area for adults.. Its a rain or shine hotel. So the outside weather does not affect the fun inside. I loved the after hours kids party.. My kids danced for about an hour and went straight to bed.

amazing place!!! we had a great time and would recommend this to everyone. Great service and lots of fun things to do. our kids had an amazign time. The water park had something for everyone and was perfect

Summary Heading: Awesome Water park...beats every water park in CALI. Hotel is amazing!
Summary: The park is new, clean and not too crowded.  The hotel was awesome. This place is highly recommended.  The staff members are all guest service experts, they attend to every guest needs.  Visit this place and you will definitely come back. The price is amazing too.:)

This place is awesome and very kid friendly. My only advise would be to not eat meals here and either pack food/snack snacks and or eat out in town for a third of the price. The Buffet was absolutely terrible. I wish I would have walked out and spoke with a manager over how terrible and old the overpriced food was.

Summary Heading: Excellent Family V action - Well worth the money!
Summary: My kids are 8 and 10 and they had a blast here! It was a last minute decision to do a staycation and I am so glad we did!  We will definitely come back!! I can not stop raving about this place to my friends!

Worth it! This is a great place to relax  spend good quality time your family.  Food is very reasonable in pricing and worth it.  This place is not only for kids.  Adults will have a great time.  Majority of the adults were more excited than kids.

Summary Heading: Endless fun for an AWESOME price
Summary: This experience was so much fun we will definitely be coming back to this location and trying out other locations when we travel.  My grand kids are 4 and 8 and there was so much to do for each of them.  I was a bit apprehensive because neither know how to swim and the 4 yo has a fear of water.  But I felt very safe with all of the lifeguards and the appropriate depths of the attractions.  Lots to do out of the water too (if you ever get the kids out of the water).  And we all had very restful sleep, a comfortable room.

I stopped by to have dinner and check this place out as I'm a father of four young children. I was interested to see what everyone I knew was talking about (all good things).   I was fortunate enough to meet the executive Chef. Chef Hany was welcoming and I noticed that a lot of the guests were waiving and saying hi to Chef Hany. As I travel a lot, I'm likely a quick judge regarding to the food quality, and I must say, the food here is second to none.  I was thoroughly impressed. A job well done to everyone at the Great Wolf Lodge!

We chose a short Staycation for my son's 9th birthday. We were greeted and asked upon check in if we were staying for a special occasion and they made the kids feel so special with a wolf ear headband, token for a free scoop of ice cream and a little back pack plush wolf (even for my daughter who was not celebrating, so she didn't feel left out!) We enjoyed the conveniences and well thought out details of the resort, (key cards/credit card can be activated into your wristband so you don't need to carry anything around, food options are inside the resort for your convenience, etc.)  There were many activities in the lobby for the children to participate in although for 9 and 10 year olds, they felt the activities were more geared for younger kids.   We greatly enjoyed the water

Booked the Sunday of Mother's Day for my daughters birthday the next day. This place is awesome! Great water park, good food, and clean rooms. We are already thinking about when to come back! The employee's are all so nice and always had a smile.

Mother's Day trip with family of 7 .. Kids had a great time and so did I . Thanks wolf Hotel for a great Mother's Day . Rooms were great for being a standard room it was just perfect. Water park was amazing kids loved all the different slides ..

Summary Heading: Awesome place to be a big kid
Summary: I'm a big kid at heart. Come on, who isn't? I work as a pediatric researcher. This place has everything you could want as a kid all under one roof. And to top it off, I got a really good deal on my suite. Accommodations were comforting and attractions were plenty.

An all-in-one destination.  Who needs to go to the other attractions nearby when you can spend days relaxing and enjoying the water park with a year round comfort zone (84 degrees at water park).  Add to that having activities for the kids in a slower paced environment, with comfortable beds to go take a nap in when the little ones get tired!!!   Who needs to drive anywhere? Food for the kids and the adults all within easy steps of each other!  I love this place

Summary Heading: A great one stop shop for a family vacation!
Summary: The hotel and water park are convenient and fun. Easy for families with children of all ages. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. The bar and grill had an awesome burger and Cuban sandwich. And the Dunkin Donuts is a nice addition.

Very nice family fun place for kids and the parents, my son celibrated his 2nd birthday and my nephew is 6 and they both had a blast ! I would go back to the great wolf lodge, only bad thing the beds were not comfy and the pillow weren't either But other than that it was a great time i can not wait to go back!

My girls are 12 and 7 and have seen the commercials for Great Wolf Lodge on Disney Channel. When we found out that one had just been built near us, we couldn't wait to go. My best friend's daughter was having a birthday, so we made a weekend trip out of it. The hotel is beautiful. The staff is incredibly friendly too. Our girls really just wanted to be in the water. The indoor bowling, mini golf, and arcade they had no interest in. They spent the entire time playing in the water park. The water park was very clean and there were so many life guards around, you could hardly take 5 steps without running in to one. We ate in the restaurant one night and the food was fantastic. The executive chef was talking to people from table to table and even took the girls to see their kitchen.

Everything was fantastic.  I could not believe how careful the lifeguards were. I never worried about our children.  The staff was beyond accommodating and super attentive.  I would take my family and friends back in a moment..if I could.  Thank you Wolf Lodge for an amazing stay.

My family loved this place. My son had been wanting to go since he was about 3, he is now 6, and we finally took him since it's now a drive away. Both he and my 2 and a half year old daughter, loved it. We were able to enjoy the park since the moment we checked in. Our room was available at 1pm when we got there. I know some people complained that they had to wait for their room to be ready. We may have not experienced that since we arrived on a tuesday. We got the room with the Wolf Den. The kids loved it.  The best part was that i didnt have to worry about carrying a purse, towels, or any extra clothes. The resort provides you a bracelet that has a chip to give you access to your room, but food, etc. So that made everything very convenient. I see how one can spend a lot of

Really good place to come and spend time with family and friends only thing that I dislike was the fact that my TV wasn't working when I was trying to watch my show but they did send a technician to come see the problem

Fantastic!! My trybe & I have made memories too last us til our next stay! The staff were very awesome in making my son (the birthday boy) feel special everytime we did an activity! Our stay was pleasant

Summary Heading: WATCH YOUR MONEY OR MORTGAGE YOUR HOME FIRST!
Summary: This new resort has missed the mark. They do not have a hot tub for adults. They over charge and charge for additonal extras. I thought I was bringing my 3 children to a resort that included swimming, golf, bowling and movie theater. All those were extra, and I mean by a lot of money.  $24.00 for all 3 to watch a 5min. Movie. That did not include me!!! Disneyland is cheaper!  On a good note, the water park is great, but you cannot swim all day for 3 days.

The family had so much fun the water park was awesome the arcade was great the bowling alley was great everything was great at this place highly recommended! It was located only minutes away from Disneyland it was a great place for family or business!

Great Wolf Lodge was such a fun little getaway!!! We surprised our boys with 3 nights, and the whole family loved it. There is so much to do at the resort, there really was no reason for us to leave while we stayed.

Great weekend. Our son is 4 years old and he really enjoyed the waterpark. Great area for toddlers , too. I was pleased with the temperature in the waterpark area, it was comfortable. Water shoes are a must! The floor is extremely slippery! I was a little bummed there was no outdoor Jacuzzi. I strongly suggest the Pup Pass for the little ones, great deal! Overall, our family had a great time and would love to do it again.

Summary Heading: Great time by kids and adults
Summary: Overall, a great experience. The water park was lots of fun for the kids and adults. And there is definitely an advantage in being indoors - it's not hot or cold, no sunscreen, no sunglasses, enjoying the waterpark at night. Besides the waterpark, there is a lot to do - some free and some at extra costs. I ate at 4 of the eateries and overall, the quality and value was good. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the room so you could bring food if you wanted. Also, there are tons of restaurants by the hotel.  My only complaints are within the water park. These are the comments I wrote in the Hotel Survey. "The waterpark opened at 9am. Of course by 8:45am, there was a mob of people waiting to get in. No surprise. The surprise was that the staff was not prepared for the mob. If

its was a good experience and its nice that we have this in socal so we can enjoy swimming in a cold weather too. Love the bracelet key all purpose i dont have to worry about bring my whole wallet. I wish theres a professional photo for some of the slides or anyspot from the hotel

We had a wonderful stay at Great Wolf Lodge. The property is clean, very family oriented and the employees are wonderful. The Theme rooms are cool, but I think next time we'll go with a one room family suite, since we spent so much time out of the room.

Loved this place. Kids had tons of fun and so did the adults. Do not want to ever leave. Clean safe environment. Staff very attentive and friendly. It is a bit pricy, wish they would consider lowering the price but overall had a great time. Can't complain

Extremely fun family experience. Water park is great. The hotel activities were great. Purchased the Wolf Pass which gave the kids a lot activities to do. Found it a great value. Would definitely go back. Great for all young members of the family.

If you want to have a fun filled amazing time then this is the place, something for everyone. All the staff from water park ride workers, dining, retail, fast food, games and activities everyone has a smile.

Fantastic place to spend with the kiddos. We live in LA so we chose to go during the week and it was great since there were no lines for the slides. Food was good at good prices in the pool area. My daughters 8, 11 absolutely loved  it and we're already  planning another family vacation. I purchased the breakfast and it was delicious and very well priced. I would go back during the week again as I can see long lines forming during vacation or holidays. I gave it 4 stars since upon arriving the kids' bunk was missing a mattress and we didn't get it until 11pm and 3 calls later.

It's always hard for me to go to Great Wolf Lodge as it's often pricier than Disney, but the kids always have a fantastic time.  The Southern California property is beautiful - shiny and new with a staff that is eager to please.

This was our first time at a Great Wolf Lodge.  Over all the Lodge exceeded my expectations.  I had read about how over powering the chlorine smell was, how the chorine burns the skin and eyes. While the chlorine is strong - the ventilation system was fairly good inside - it was hot and yes you can smell chlorine - but the other option would be worse.  The Lodge was very clean in all areas, workers were constantly wiping, sweeping, mopping etc, in all areas of the Lodge.  The food outlets were good and reasonably priced. The staff was extremely friendly and seemed happy to be working at the Lodge.  The rooms are cute for the kids. We booked the Kids cabin. The kids cabin was decorated in the wolf theme with a set of bunk beds and a single twin.  We thought we booked a King bed,

excellent place for a short family visit.  near disneyland with lots of restaurants nearby.  pretty convenient to get to.  Was practically empty mid week so we had the place to ourselves.  overall fun time.  one to two days is all that is necessary.

What an amazing experience for my family!  We have 4 children ages 1,4,8 &10.  There was something for all ages.  My little ones had the best time in the "kiddy" pools and my 8 and 10 year olds had the the time of their lives.  We were surprised on how big the water park was.  It felt great to not worry about the kids regarding safety.  Every pool has multiple lifeguards, and the lifeguards take their jobs serious.  They are focused every minute on duty.  I would give the entire resort staff 5 stars on customer service.  From the minute we checked in to the time we left, the staff made sure that we were taken care of.  The food was fantastic and there are plenty of activities for the kids when you want to take a break from the water park.  We cannot wait to go back!

We had a great time with our two kids. There was something for everyone and we all left happy and refreshed! Everyone was very welcoming and treated our kids well. The ice cream shop was great and the arcade was super fun, albeit a bit pricy!!

Summary Heading: FUN BUT OTHER CHARGES ARE PRICEY
Summary: I like it thats its indoor and its not too big to go around the water park but the extra charges that comes with the total price are too much. Its nice to come up to your room and rest. I will give it a try again but not a lot of times....

Great Wolf Lodge was a lot of fun.  We went with our 4 year old son who loved every bit of it.  He even said it was better than Disneyland.  We stayed one night but hung out at the hotel all day on check out day, so we got two days of fun.  The water park is so much fun and there is a lot to do for young kids.  We played for hours.  There are free life vests available in multiple sizes.  The whole resort is Peanut/Tree Nut free which is great since my son is allergic to all nuts, so he was able to enjoy his vacation pretty much worry free about a reaction.  We visited the bakery a few times during our trip, it was amazing to watch him be able to pick out anything he wanted (this is a big deal because he normally can’t eat anything from a bakery due to cross contamination with

My kids absolutely loved and enjoyed themselves! We went for my sons 6th birthday, and his words "this is the bestest birthday ever" that made my entire trip worth wild! Definitely going back in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf in Ca is awesome!
Summary: Our first trip to a Great Wolf Lodge and it's a winner!  Rooms are clean and nice, activities for our children are plentiful, varied and fun, food and service are excellent.  From the moment we walked in Erik Libid and Ali'i Garcia welcomed us at the front desk with professionalism and warm hospitality rivaling five star hotels.  We were delighted to find out they both had ties to Hawaii-they certainly spread the aloha spirit all the way over to California kick starting a fabulous family vacation. We would recommend experiencing this brand new Wolf Lodge to all of our friends and family. Well done!

My girls loved their stay at the lodge (7, 5, and 4).  We were only there one night, but were able to take advantage of the waterpark both days, which was nice.  The water park was great.  It was fairly crowded on Sunday and we had to wait for all of the slides, but it wasn't very crowded on Monday and we didn't have to wait much for anything.  The only downfall of the waterpark was that my 5 year old is short and was just barely below the 42" inch mark for the bigger slides.  She really wanted to go down them, but couldn't.  There is bowling and a kids spa and arcades and such in the lodge, but they are pricey, especially when you have more than one child.  We just bought them one of the little stuffed animals for 11.99 (not the creation station animals for $35) and called it

We stayed one night to celebrate daughter's 11 bday. Fun place for kids under 13. They gave her birthday ears and free ice cream which was a nice treat. Enough slides to keep them busy. Be aware noisy and loud in the water park. Can get really expensive if you do other activities. 2 adults and 4 kids we spent $900 for room, food, and activities for just one night. I would go back if there was a good deal available. My daughter had a memorable birthday weekend.

Whole family had an amazing time. We rented a cabana and service was great. Really enjoy our time. Only disappointed with our dinner at the Fire Grill. Time of food delivery and being correct. But in time I am sure they will work that out being a new place and such.

Summary Heading: overall best hotel ever for kids!
Summary: Just stayed two nights for seven yr olds birthday. He and 8 yr old brother had a blast in water park. The place was very clean and the staff was generally very nice everywhere we went. As far as crowds, we went on a Wednesday (non Spring Break) and there was virtually no lines anywhere which was an added plus for us since we would rather do just about anything but spend our time waiting in lines. One staff member told me they were at 10% capacity which seemed a bit hard to believe. We didn't have to worry about not seeing our boys in the waterpark for any period since the lifeguards are extremely attentive to the point of being almost militant. I must add that my son spent so much time in the water that his eyes started to burn badly from the chorine. We called the desk and they

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for children but a little expensive.
Summary: The hotel staff is wonderful. Our room was big enough for my wife and three kids (ages 8 months, two and six). We didn't try any of the restaurants because we have local favorites around the area. The water park has plenty of slides to keep everyone interested for a couple days. There is stuff inside for all ages (baby to adult) including a wave pool if you just want to float in the water. We went to this hotel right after a couple days at Disneyland with very sore feet. It was relaxing and our kids had a lot of fun. I enjoyed myself also. This will be on our list of places to stay for our socal trips a couple times a year.   We only stayed one night which seems like plenty of time honestly. On the day you check in you can play at the water park starting at 1:30pm and until

We stayed at this property recently and had a great time.  We have two girls and they had a blast.  Waterpark is awesome and they had as much fun running up and down the stairs doing magic quest all night long (be prepared for a lot of walking).  Only complaint was the line at Dunkin Donuts in the morning to get some coffee... I inquired and their staff said they're in the process of opening another outlet soon.  Our kids said it was one of their favorite vacations yet!

Great family friendly place. Our little ones loved it and can't wait to comeback. We are saving our money for another stay cation.  Was so much fun watching our grand kids enjoying the fabulous water park.

Where do I start?  You were out of the Wolf ears for the kids. The towels in my room were dirty (covered in poop). The sink fixtures weren't attached properly. The shower head leaked water. I was almost hit in the parking structure by a member of food services (he was wearing a chef coat). I was charged for a beer (I don't drink) and disputed the charge, but it was never taken off of my account. When I shared all of this with Jesse, a manager at the front desk, he apologized and said he would e-mail me day passes for my family to make up for the inconvenience and he would mail us the wolf ears later that week. It's been 3 weeks and I'm still waiting for both of these items.

Great family vacation spot the water park is awesome the staff is very friendly lots of activities to keep the kids entertained great variety of food water park staff was patient and helpful with my grandchildren

Kids had a lot of fun, a bit pricey for the place with not many rides.. Kids suite was nice and roomy. Did a mid-week stay so wasn't very crowded.  I expected more, by the time you pay for room, food and games for a one night stay you are about $800 in.  The arcades are not cheap and the kids spent $300 on games, the Waterpark closes at 8 so not much to do after that.  Breakfast at the buffet I must say was horrible. $100 on breakfast and we all left hungry because everything had a weird taste to it... My husband had plastic in his juice shot and the server apologized for this to just tell us that prior to that someone had glass in their food, didn't want to eat anymore after that... I would rather get a hotel and go to a real Waterpark spending less money...

What a great time!   If you love water this is the place to take your family.  I wish I would have had the idea of an indoor water park and of course afford to build it!.  No need to worry about weather.  We found the staff to be great. The big issue is safety and that was NOT an issue.  If you don't stay at the hotel you can't use the facilities.  Life guards were really alert.  Another thing was no pressure to shop...just have fun.  The packages to purchase before arrival appeared to be a better value. Also, the food was really good and reasonably priced, especially compared to many other parks. A suggestion is to get there fairly early before 4P checkin. Otherwise, the lines are long. Yes, the rooms may be expensive but if you arrive early you actually could get 2 days at the

I took 1 1/2 year old. They have a nice set up for all ages. From 5 foot wave pool to shallow water with fountains for little ones. My whole family enjoyed this trip. Will do it again soon. Worth the trip if you have kids

We stayed there in April and were very disappointed. We had our 16 and 13 with us and they were bored in an hour. There is no pool for the adults and the food left a lot to be desired. I know it's new but I really expected more for the price we paid.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove! We are deeply sorry we did not meet your expectations for family fun. We will share your feedback with our management team as we continue to expand and improve our resorts.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Customer Service, Safe and Clean Environment!
Summary: The customer service is amazing- I am in a customer service- management role and I think your people are outstanding- you must have a great recruiting and training program!  I would even venture to say that these associates rival those of top- brands such as Ritz Carlton.  I was impressed most at the nicer restaurant (we dined there twice in 12 hours!), and with the staff that checked us in.  They anticipated our every need and were genuinely warm and friendly.  They seemed to really enjoy their jobs- I asked one of the bus boys how he liked working there and he raved about it and said the company provided wonderful training.  I have already recommended several families and am working on planning another trip this summer with a family who has not yet experienced Great Wolf

We loved everything about this place the rooms were clean, staff was very friendly, food was great, and most importantly the kids had a great time. Water park was also very clean and the lifeguards were really attentive. Great job!

This is the most fun the kids have had in one place. There is so much for them to do. Slides, arcades, puzzling adventures, and more waterpark fun.  Everyone was so helpful and friendly.  Even the patrons were all very pleasant.  We all really enjoyed ourselves, Thank you Great Wolf. Our new Friends! park fun.
