Summary Heading: What an awesome family friendly place!
Summary: Looking  for a place to take the family?  This is the place. Don't let the price deter you. The price includes the water park for 2 days! The first day you can check in and get a wristband for water park even if your room is still not available. The day of check out you can still enjoy the water park until 9 pm.  The wristband is not only for the water park,  it's the room key, it's also how you pay for EVERYTHING in the whole place! We loved the piece of mind of not having to keep money or an debit card on us. Everything was very clean and maintained very nicely. We had our 2 sons age 2 and 4 years old with us and they Loved everything here. The water park had something for all of us. The water is heated to a comfortable temperature. Even though the whole place was climate

Hands down THE BEST family vacation we have had yet!  We have an 11 year age gap between our two children and it is always a struggle to plan a vacation that caters to both of their interests.  GWL was the perfect solution!  We all had such a great time and we were very impressed by the variety of activities and accommodations for all age groups!  The waterpark is AMAZING!!!  My 4 year old wanted to leave Disneyland early to play in the wave pool!  The staff is attentive, helpful & friendly!  The resort is spotless!  We can't imagine staying anywhere else now that we have experienced Great Wolf Lodge!

I am so impressed with the whole staff.  Everyone went over and beyond to assure our stay was both enjoyable and comfortable.  I loved our stay as much as the children.  There is something for everyone. The indoor Waterpark exceeded our expectations.  The outdoor interactive pool area was an added Bonus!  One suggestion, I wish they would consider an all inclusive meal plan.  The meals are pretty costly, especially if you stay 3 days.  Overall my family and I were thoroughly impressed!  The staff were awesome.   The children were entertained.  Thank you! We will be back soon

We went to Great Wolf Lodge to celebrate my daughter’s birthday.  It was me, my wife and my three daughters (ages 3, 8, and 11).  We stayed there for 2 days.  This was our first time here.  The indoor waterpark was the main reason why we wanted to be at this hotel and we already plan to going back in the summer. We stayed in the standard family suite.  We had a wonderful and exciting time at the hotel.  The kids didn’t want to leave when it was time to leave.  Everything was amazing.  The hotel has lots to offer but not enough time to do everything.  If you go there, you should definitely try the Loose Moose restaurant.  For breakfast, they have a great made to order omelet station and for dinner they have an excellent made to order pasta.  Price is reasonable and comparable to

Summary Heading: Read lots of reviews before your stay!!!!!
Summary: This was my first time at an indoor water park. They need to work on a better ventilation system because the smell of chlorine is strong!! If you're sensible to strong smells this is not a place for you. We stayed for one night, we got there around 3pm since they send an email just a couple days prior to our stay stating the busiest hours were 1pm - 4pm. Theres not that many rides overall maybe for a 4 or 5 yr old would be a good place. When we did get to our room, a smell of humidity was present. They have to wash those carpets. I understand its a water park resort and people are going to come in their rooms wet but getting there and having that smell was not pleasant. Also I didn’t know you could get a discount with your AAA membership i asked one of the receptionist and she

We loved the slides and water fun, but the water is just too cold. My daughter is like a fish, she loves to be in the water but wanted to come out because she was freezing. I know they say it´s between 82 and 84, and that might be the case. But it just felt too cold. Especially when you climb up those stairs to the slides and you wait in line with these giant fans right above you that create wind, while you are standing there in your wet swimsuit. Everything else is great. But this is a real deal breaker for me for future stays. After 2 hours in the waterpark I couldn´t wait get under a hot shower.

Overall our families experience was good.  Good price for the value.  I thought GWL was only an indoor water park.  Their are many other activities, most with a price tag.  Which made what I thought a reasonable prices weekend stay, more pricey.   Bed sheets are extremely itchy!  Nice environment, nothing fancy.  Very kid and family friendly!

We called the front desk 3 times to complain about the noise in the rooms next to us and each time we were told security would come and they never did.  At 11:00 pm children were driving remote control cars in the hallway, they were playing soccer, and they were extremely loud.   My children normally go to sleep at 8:00pm and instead they were unable to sleep and it made it miserable for everyone.  Also, the rides were under-staffed.  The light would be "green" and ready for a rider however there was 1 staff person managing 3 slides.  Another major problem is the staff was constantly waiting on a raft to makes its way up the escalator.  The light would be green and we would be sitting around waiting for a raft to arrive.  For how much we paid I would expect every ride to have

Summary Heading: Go to an outdoor facility instead!
Summary: The chemicals of the pool are overwhelming and you will leave with a sore throat.  Go to an outdoor pool instead!  Also- our bathroom was locked in our room.  We informed the front desk and after calling twice and then waiting an hour, we picked the lock ourselves so my three year old daughter could use the restroom.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge  We love it
Summary: The Great Wolf Lodge in Southern California was amazing.  We highly recommend for anyone.  If you eat at the hungry wolf pizza, dunk in donuts, and the snack bar in the Waterpark area it was all reasonable.  I recommend getting the wolf passes we loved all the activities except maybe the Lazer frenzy.  My kids couldn't figure it out.  You should bring warmer clothes though, the lobby was kept pretty cool and my kids were shivering a bit during storytime but that is the only complaint we had.  My kids had fun, I had fun, and even my husband had fun and he doesn't like anything.  The water slide lines were pretty short too.  We were there Saturday, Sunday and monday.  The only day there was any wait really was saturday.  It was great and we hope to go again soon.

The room was clean, but very generic for the price.  I guess my family and I just expected more overall from the resort for the high price that we paid.  The food and service was mediocre at the Loose Moose Kitchen and I thought they would have a special dessert for the kids who were celebrating birthdays....not 3 sugar cookies that I could get from the grocery store down the street.  Both my daughter and my niece were shivering uncontrollably when we were in the toddler area and I mean lips turning blue shivering! We had to keep taking them out of the pool and wrapping them in towels to warm them up.  My 8 year old son and 4 year old nephew hated the Fort area since there were a bunch of punk kids who would shoot everyone in the face with a water cannon the second they tried to

Summary Heading: Fun but VERY crowded and have some kinks to work out!
Summary: We arrived at 1 pm on a Saturday afternoon.  Valet was quick, bell hop took about 5 minutes and stood in line for about 15 minutes to register. Friendly staff, I was informed that you do NOT have to check out as they do it automatically! Off to our rooms and we were stopped by Denzel, a nice, friendly young man who offered to help us put our wrist bands on. The room was nice and clean.  The water park was VERY crowed and my three 11 year old grand children grew bored quickly.  (The clock has a different time on both sides of the tower, so don't be upset with your kids if they find you 10 minutes later than you specified as you may be looking at a different side of the tower than they are....tell them which side to look at so neither party panics! )  Jacquline at the "Magic

We came for the water park experience and kept it to that. We stayed away from all the "upsell noise," so we didn't incur all the costly expenses of the arcade, etc. The kids shut down the park each night we were there, and by then it was straight to our room for showers, jammies, and sandwiches. We had a blast!

My husband and I stayed here on a Thursday night.  We LOVED it.  The kids LOVED it.  I almost hate writing a good review because I don't want this place to get busy.  My husband and I rented a cabana.  Some important tips about the cabanas: 1)  Indoor cabanas don't have doors or roofs.  Outdoor ones have roofs and door flaps that clip together for privacy.  GREAT for naps. 2) Cabanas have full size towels - not the super TINY towels available for everyone else. 3) There is a decent sized safe.  You can fit your wallets, cell phones, and giant cameras. 4) Outdoor cabanas are directly in front of a huge outdoor pool.  Indoor cabanas are in front of the 'baby' pool.  There is a large rope fence in front of the indoor cabanas so it's difficult to jump in the pool if the kids need

Summary Heading: Relaxing!!! Very clean, extremely caring staff.  Very nice place to celebrate a birthday or special event. I highly  .
Summary: Had a wonderful time. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. The water park is awesome and the kids loved it!!! The room was very comfortable and the mini-fridge was an added bonus.  Can't wait to go back.

The Great Wolf Lodge was great for a weekend gateway with the family.  We chose Great Wolf Lodge mainly for the water park, and it did not disappoint.  The water park is exclusive for those staying at the hotel, and even though we were only there for one night, we were able to use go to the water park on the day we checked in starting at 1 PM and the entire next day.  The room itself was very clean and comfortable as well.

This place was incredible!! I have a son with severe allergies to gluten/dairy. This was our first vacation in 8 years that I was able to relax! Lol. The chef's were so knowledgeable and the kitchen has designated grills/cookware for gluten free. The whole Lodge is clean and bustling with activity. The water park has something for everyone. Our kids are 5, 8 and 10. They all had so much fun!! We'll definitely be back!

Summary Heading: The Kidsplosion that turned our nice!
Summary: When you first walk in to the Great Wolf Lodge you will think, "who let the kids out?" especially if you arrive at story time. Bed down for the night wake up and you I'll enjoy one of the best breakfasts ever. Then you will realize that the place is more that a party zone for kids, it's the rare place that manages to please the kids and adults. Something that is not easy to do.  Make this your staycation place.  you won't regret it.

This was our third visit to a GWL.  We have been to the ones in Mason, OH and Kansas City for a group reunion.  We have always enjoyed the GWL and the new Southern California location did not disappoint.  Here are some tips and advice, especially after reading some others' reviews.  First of all don't come here if: 1) You believe that an indoor water park should not smell of chlorine and shouldn't be loud;  2) You are on a tight budget and already think this place is expensive.  It is.  If you are going to go around expecting everything to be perfect because you spent a lot of money, you are setting yourself up for disappointment;  3) If you expect more than 3 star accommodations.  The money you are paying for is NOT for the room itself; and 4) If you expect that there will not

This resort is funtastic. Lots of attractions, for both big and little kids. Mini golf, mini bowling, water park, arcade, just to name a few of the fun things to do. Staff was very courteous, smiles at every turn. Glad we tried this place.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite Family Vacation Spot Yet!
Summary: The website did not give too many pictures of the water park, but I am probably thankful for that because it exceeded expectations! The fact that this huge water attraction was indoors allowed us to play to our hearts content without worrying about the children being burnt to a crisp by the end of the day. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the waterpark was well maintained with lifeguards who were kind and very vigilant. I have a 10 year old and a 2 year old, and our entire family had an amazing two days! If your children love the water, this is the place to go!

All the slides were as promised and more. Kids were excited, and can't wait to come back. Plenty of activities to keep them busy. The beach was relaxing and really enjoyed the simulated waves. Rooms were very clean, and beds were comfortable.

Overall, the place was great. Kids enjoyed the waterpark. It was great that the park allows you to stay and play even after checking out! We took advantage of that and let the kids play all day. It's close enough to home and we will definitely come back!

If you have small children to middle school children.. This is a great place for only the kids to enjoy but also the parents. My daughter had the time of her life and neither did her cousins who came with us to celebrate her birthday. I love that it such a great place for small kids to enjoy themselves.

We had a great time! Only complaints were the strong smell of chlorine in the water park with the humid air was hard to deal with. Second,  The arcade we were told to most games were one dollar and they were definitely more like 5 to 8 dollars each game! Less than one hour in the arcade we spent $80. I feel the arcade is way too overpriced.  We definitely would never do the arcade again. I also thought it was kind of a rip off that once my child purchased a wand for the magiQuest it did not work in less you spend another $15 to purchase the game! The game and wand should be included with one price! It was kind of misleading.  We will definitely go again but definitely hope to take advantage of some discount pricing on the rooms and be more prepared to spend a lot of money once

Our last-minute weekend visit to the Great Wolf Lodge was packed full of fun! Initially I was bummed that we could only stay one night but it turned out to be more than enough time to enjoy the hotel's amenities. We arrived at the hotel around 2pm but our room would not be ready for 2-3 hours. Luckily management sent us an email prior to arriving recommending that we prepare to enjoy the water park before we get our room keys. This worked out great because the kids were ready for showers and dinner right about the time we were texted that the room was ready.   The onsite restaurants have good choices at reasonable prices but don't forget you are only a few miles from Disneyland so there are lots of choices within a few minutes drive.   Check-out time is strictly 11am. Before

Great getaway.  I felt like I was in a giant log cabin.  The kids never complained of being bored.  The food was reasonably priced.  However, If you're a guest using the waterpark and you notice that you have a cut, ask for a band-aid.  If you're an adult, refrain from showering with your partner in the public restroom where young eyes can see you (save that for your hotel room).  Otherwise, very clean, welcoming, and fun times.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family. Tricky charges if you add people.
Summary: After i booked my stay last March, I booked 2adults and 1 child. After reading the maximum capacity of people we can still add 2 more because the maximum capacity is 5 on that particular room. When I try adding 2 more people they told me ( first was Paige then next one was Eric) there shouldn't be no problem adding 2 more since you are at the limit and not exceeding it and they told me there shouldn't be any additional charges. However, when I was checking in they told me I have to pay for those 2 people. I didn't argue with her but I said that I spoke with Eric and Paige but she just told me that thiese charges are part of their policy.   My thing is if I book 3 or 5 people during the time I book it the charges are the same. That's just my point  because adding shouldn't be a

My husband, two kids (ages 11 and 13) and I had a lot of fun here.  I would highly recommend that you arrive early but do the bowling, glow golf, Magi Quest, arcade etc. FIRST.  You will not have to wait for these things because everyone is at the water park. Have an early dinner and then hit the water park around 6:00 pm. This is when everyone is leaving for dinner or just because they're done for the day.  We did this and did not have to wait in long lines for any of the water park rides. That was a huge plus. The kids can play Magi Quest for a couple more hours after the water park closes also. The water park lines started very early the next morning but it wasn't a big deal because we had been on everything so many times the night before.

This place is good if you want to get away for a little bit.  Its meant for the kids of course but the price tag is definitely adultish....  $1000 for two nights is a little steep if you ask me.  My suggestion is to get the Wolf Den which is the room with the bunk beds for kids so you have your space.  The rooms are very plain but it is what it is.  Save money by bringing snacks and your own drinks.  They do not prohibit that at all and if I wasn't so lazy I would have gone to the CVS next door.  So if you have one of those drink coolers that keep things cold for 24 hours imagine the possibilities!!  there is a fridge in the room so you could save a ton.  If not the wristband charges everything and also acts as a room key so you don't have to carry anything.  There is a special

We had a spectacular time. SO impressed from start to finish. From the minute we pulled up to the smiling, waving valet attendant to Sydney helping us make the best decisions at the front desk and getting our rooms close together and even early, to the lifeguards making us feel safe and welcome. They were so patient and helpful. Even the woman sweeping took a moment to smile and ask how our day was. You guys have a GREAT thing going on and we are happy to recommend you to everyone we know. Our huge Facebook following was waiting for my review and I'm happy to tell them all how great it was. Thanks GWL!!!

Summary Heading: My son says this was his best birthday ever
Summary: My family and I had the best experience in your hotel. Everyone was friendly the rooms were clean beautiful, we all slept so comfortable we all had a wonderful time. We can't wait to go again, we are.planning on going for my birthday in july.

Prices are ridiculously high but it was worth it I guess because the kids had s blast! Would recommend to family and friends! Do your research. Bring water shoes and arrive by 12pm to get your room sooner!

We went for my sons birthday and we had a great time. We have been to the organ location and like this one alot more We already want to start planning our next trip back.I love how even you check out you can still have access to the water park till it closes!!!

We had a discounted room but by the time they added the resort fees and taxes the cost was right back to the original cost.  We arrived around 4pm on Friday went to the pools, dinner which consisted of cheese burgers and fries for three was almost $50.    Later we went to the arcade, sixty dollars lasted about 30 to 45 minutes.  The next day we woke up walked across to McDonald's.  Probably could have eaten at Duncan Doughnuts for about the same price.   We went back to the water park for about 1/2 day, had another 50 dollar meal and departed.   Kids loved both the water park and the arcade,  if price went down about 1/4 we would probably go back.

Great resort! Family fun! Everything you want in one awesome water park location! Friendly staff. Clean resort. Paw passes were expectional value and fun. Lifeguards very attentive and made environment feel safe.

Came to celebrate our kids birthdays with family. Everything was excellent. I recommend this place. Kids are asking to return already! We will definitely come back. No need to leave the resort, but there are decent food choices outside of the resort too within walking distance or within blocks of resort.

Summary Heading: A little quirky, but a whole lot of fun
Summary: This place is a little quirky but there is nothing else quite like it in Southern California.  It is lots of fun and there are FAR TOO MANY activities to do to list.  Primarily focused on elementary school aged kids, but our young teens had a lot of fun as well.  Definitely something you need to check out if you have not gone.

Great Wolf Lodge is Awesome for the whole family!!!  From the water park, to the service, the restaurants, the rooms, the magic quest- you name it.  couldn't have had more fun!  I highly recommend it to everyone

Summary Heading: Great place!  The lifeguards we're awesome, the place was fun! The staff was really attentive. The Lodge restaurant was
Summary: Really great experience! My six year old granddaughter had a blast! It felt clean, staff was awesome and the life guards were always doing their job. The place was noisy because it's inside and the chlorine smell is a little much, but we will be back!

Over-all we were satisfied with our stay. There were only some problems first is we were not instructed at the check-in to use our wrist band as a key to the door. So we were outside for a while, then one of the staff pass by and told us to use the wrist band but she was laughing at us. Then when we were in our room the TV was not working, we called the front desk and they said they'll be sending someone to fix it. The maintenance said that the plug was out maybe the housekeeping who clean our room do it.

Summary Heading: The New So Cal Family Destination . . . Soon
Summary: This place was great. They've only been in operation for about two months, so they have some kinks to work out. At least a few of them are experienced Disneyland Cast Members.  Indoor water park is AWESOME? It's small, though. Which is good and bad. Good because it's easier to get from one end to the other. Bad because I imagine it will get super-crowded. We went on a Monday and it wasn't too crowded. I can't imagine weekends and breaks.  Plan to spend a LOT of money here. MagiQuest and Creation Station costs add up as you buy add-ons. The Arcade is super expensive.  My family enjoyed the food, but make sure to read the reviews for each dining spot. Dude, there's a Dunkin Donuts here.

Hotel was motel 6 quality.  The waterpark is so humid, no ventilation and the room smells like chlorine and it's almost unbearable.  Anything is So. Cal should not be indoors since the beach is so close

I loved the lodge, rooms and in lodge dining was a little pricey, but it wasn't crowded and the staff made sure you was taken care of. We will be returning, just wish it wasn't so pricey, but it is Anaheim.

Only time I was ever disappointed was when I hate checked in late at 4am. The staff didn't mention the promotions for us since I was having to pay a full day price for only 7 hours of staying in the room. I understand that they're not required to but it seems like they were more worried about taking advsntage of us not being able to check in elsewhere and having to check in at this resort. But I do have to admit that everyone had a great time and would come back regardless of what happened last time. I would've given them a 5 if they had tried to help us that first night.

If you want a truly kid specific resort, this is for you. Clean, friendly, and so acomadating. We really loved the never ending warm towels by the water park that was provided, and the super friendly, family atmosphere

My 12 year old son and his friends had a blast. Lots of activities for the kids. The rooms could use some better quality bedding and furniture.  Not very comfortable sleep. But, I would return.  Overall,  a good trip, but pricey.

We loved our weekend there. The indoor waterpark was the main reason why we wanted to be at this hôtel and we already plan to go back. We have tons of fun. The food at the Grill restaurant was really good and our server was really efficient, friendly and really nice!

Many different and fun things to do for all ages. We went for my sons 4th birthday and had a blast. The only drawl back was no room service but you are able to order from your room you just have to pick it up

My 11 yr old daughter was asleep after 6th grade camp on our way to Great Wolf Lodge. She did not know we were going. The look in her eyes when we arrived was priceless, she was so stunned and excited that she had no words. The entire stay was a constant smile on my families faces, they could not stop. The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff was beyond exceptional, the waterpark was so much fun. We left there already discussing our return trip. Kids will lose their minds there. Great experience.

The Great Wolf Lodge was great for a one time visit.  Both my boys enjoyed all the amenities it had to offer.  The indoor water park is great for my children.  The Maji Quest was a little confusing as how to use it.  The person giving the instructions was rambling it off.  Made it difficult for my 10 year old and I to play.  That was a waste of money for us.  The buffet was ridiculous and extremely overpriced.  The food was not good.  The toast and waffles were hard, oatmeal was thick and lumpy.  You could not get it off the serving spoon.  I would recommend going out of the lodge to eat.  Their are plenty of great restaurants nearby to eat for a fraction of the price.

It was our first time there and would recommend it to anyone with kids in the 2-16 yr old range.  My wife an I enjoyed the rides and we could let our kids (5 & 8) enjoy the facility with us just relaxing nearby.  The ability to use the water park the day of arrival and up to 9pm after checking out the next day, made the cost of the experience much more worth it.

We went for a Spring Break staycation and my son and his friend had a great time. I was worried it might be too young for them,-they are 11- but  they loved Magi Quest and would have loved to play all of the versions, but we only stayed one night and it takes some time to finish these games!  We got a Wolf Den Suite for the bunk beds and the separate television, but the boys were so tired out after all of the activities, they hardly noticed. The room was clean and comfortable, but certainly not worth what they charge, but you aren't there for the rooms. The activities are what you come for, and they are kid approved!. The water park was clean and not too crowded for a Friday and Saturday and it is open until 9, so you can stay late. We got the Wolf Pass, so golf, bowling,

Summary Heading: Wolfed down a lot of water and magic at the lodge
Summary: The grandkids and I had a fantastic time ... with unexpected variations.  First and foremost, plan on at least 1 paw pass.  We split ours so my granddaughter got Sammy the Squirrel and other goodies and my grandson got to play MagiQuest and other goodies and their shared some goodies.   Didn't know about magiquest before hand.  Be prepared for a lot of young ones (some with parents) rushing around with magic wands shaking them at crystals and screens (takes 6 hours to finish and creates breaks from water).  Honest, it is super fun for them, and means all those people are not in the water play area.  There is so much more than water to do.     The water play area has both the advantage and disadvantage of being all the fun in a compressed area.  The advantage is that you are not

If you are looking for a one stop shop for a family vacation, the Great Wolf Lodge Southern California is the place to go!  Our kids, ages 5 and 7 had a blast at the waterpark and loved all the other activities that the resort had to offer.  They especially had fun on the MagiQuest scavenger hunt.  The quest kept them busy when they were tired out from swimming all day!

Summary Heading: Nice place Wolf Pack needs more training with Den Mother
Summary: ISSUE 1 Friends and relatives have stayed here since opening and all got Wolf ears at check in. My son is autistic and while spending time at Wolf lodge with family staying there he would want some but we explained to him the rule so he was ok. When WE stayed he was so very excited to finally get HIS wolf ears because his friends and cousins play games with him. He didn't receive any because you were out. He was very upset because that was the rule. The Pack Member scoffed and told us to buy them at the gift store. ISSUE 2 We were given NO information about the water park. We were not told to measure our son and get a bracelet until after we were there half an hour. I told a Pack Member our situation, my son is Autistic and there is just my husband and myself with me. And then

Do not get pizza there under any circumstances!!!!  Hungry Like A Wolf has the worst pizza I've ever had. Other than that, the food and drink prices were very reasonable. We had a great time and will definitely go back!

This was our first trip to Great Wolf lodge and we will definitely be coming back.   Great atmosphere for our kids, they never wanted to leave.  They do need to add more staff to the rides in the water park so there isn't such a delay or a ride being closed due to not enough staff.

We just spent two days at this great resort. Overall, I am very happy with our stay. The waterpark is phenomenal, food is really good, the rooms are spotless, and best of all, our kids had the time of their lives. My only complaint was the customer service at the creation station. The attendants there were not helpful in providing any information on the magic quest, they just filled the animal and moved on to the next guest. They were not friendly at all and seemed annoyed to be there. We did not let this ruin our fun, but I thought it was worth to mention so maybe they will take steps in correcting this issue. Kids expect a magical creation!!!  Overall we were very happy with our stay and will definitely return!

We stayed here for one night for my son's 5th birthday. I was a little wary after reading the opening reviews but we had an excellent time. There was barely a wait to check-in, our room was ready at 3pm, and it never seemed too crowded. We had reservations for dinner and breakfast which was definitely helpful as they were turning people away who didn't have one. We had a great time and will definitely be back!

This place was beautiful food was great people were great not to expensive there were a lot of people there but the place is so big it didn't look to clutter the kids loved it they didn't want to go home.

This place is excellent, I cant say enough.  Rooms are clean, staff is Friendly & Courteous, The Food was delicious at the restaurant next to Dunkin Donuts. The prices for food, drinks or Souvenirs were NOT OVERPRICED. Lots to do Fun for the entire family from 1 to 100 years old.

If you play your cards right the trip to this hotel doesn't need to break the bank, they have microwaves and fridges in the room, coolers can be brought in so not every meal or snack needs to be purchased and the pizza's are large enough for 2 days of meals.

We weren't sure about how the hotel and water park were going to be.   But once we checked in,  our kids were eager to hit the water park.   There is so much for kids and adults to do here with the family. We will definitely be returning soon.

The Resort water park is very small, but the kids had fun.  The water in park is freezing cold & the park is muggy.  Chlorine is so strong that after an hour it burns your eyes.  They need fan or something running... My daughter got a bacterial ear infection from dirty water.

We live in Garden Grove and chose to "get away" for a couple of days. Worth the money if you spend all your time there like we did.  Our boys, aged 8 and 9, LOVED all the activities, especially the water park. I don't normally like crowds, but this was very manageable and the waits for the slides weren't too long. The room was very comfortable, but not very soundproof; we kept waking up from loud hallway noise. Everything was reasonably priced except for the arcade.

Summary Heading: Visiting NOW, having a great time!
Summary: This is our first time to a resort like Great Wolf.  I read ALL of the reviews and was worried about crowds and check in but we have had a super experience so far!  Check in was perfect.  We arrived at 2pm waited no more than 10 minutes.  Our room wasn't ready but that was o.k. because I had reserved a Cabana - a total must do if you can.  Here is the best part... There are 4 indoor cabanas - don't get them unless you have tiny kids and need this near the kiddy pool.  It is very very warm and noisy.  The front desk let us move to an outside cabana - which was so much better. We purchased a "Kids Cabin Suite"  Totally the best way to go with kids.  We were first placed in the "Accessible room" which is smaller and doesn't have a couch and only two kids beds.  AGAIN, the front

The kids had a great time!  Staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating!  Two improvements that could be made would be the flooring in the water park, seemed slippery.  Also the rooms are very expensive especially for the Wolf Den or Cabin, could be $50 cheaper.  It was unique experience for the kids but not worth the price.  I wouldn't get that type of room again.

Conveniently located near Disneyland and super family friendly hotel/atmosphere for all children.  Stay can be pricey if participate in various kid activities or upgrades.  Would definitely stay again but the taxes/resort fees are a bit ridiculous.

I had such a fun experience with my kids. My teenagers, pre teens & toddler all had an exceptional time. My recommendation is stay longer then 1 night because I didn't get to enjoy all the resort had to offer in 1 day

Summary Heading: Great place but extremely expensive rooms
Summary: This place was fantastic, Very kid friendly. I loved everything about it. Staff was very nice and the rooms were every clean and smelled amazing as soon as you open the door, love that. The only down fall is the rooms are ridiculously expensive my kids wanted to go so I booked one night in deluxe suit. (All I could afford) I spent about $268 and after check in they added 24.99 or so for fees. This place has a lot to offer so I get it but at the same time why is anything you try to do for your kids so da** expensive these days. I will say they need to work on front service desk cause during peak hours they are hard to reach, anything after 9pm there good. The water wasn't as warm as I liked, and if you like beach towels then bring your own. There towels by pool could barely wrap

Unbelievable fun, great value for the buck and exceptionally helpful staff.  The sofa bed wasn't very comfortable but served it's purpose.  Other than that we can honestly say it was a great getaway weekend.

All was great, just wish you had options for Vegas when it comes to food. My daughter and husband loved your pizza among other types of food they had, but I couldn't eat other than salad and fries (not so healthy). Please consider us vegans. Thanks.

I love that your water park tickets are included in the price. And I like that you can go play at the water park till your room is ready at 1 pm. The Arcade is way expensive i would avoid it if you can. The restaurants were not over priced I thought everything was fair priced for a theme park. I would HIGHLY recommend water shoes the waterpark floor is little slippery. My favorite place to eat was Lodge wood fire grill make sure you make a reservation for dinner it gets packed.

Summary Heading: Need to amp up their customer service skills
Summary: Check in was very poor. We came early at 1pm, put our name on a list and were told that we would get a page when our room was ready around 4pm. We went to enjoy the water park and by 5pm , after an hour of waiting, we went to the front desk . They informed us that they forgot to page us. The gentlemen at the front had no idea what additional packages we had (breakfast and birthday package) so I had to remind him after he gave our room number.  When I asked him if our birthday package was set up, he assured us it was, or to call down if it wasn't. Needless to say, it was not. So what a big dud for my son to walk in on that.   My husband called the front desk, and they said someone would be right up. I called 15 later and talked to a lady and she had me on hold and came back and
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for sharing this with us! We are deeply sorry for the frustrations your pack experienced and for any missteps we took during your stay. We will share this feedback with the appropriate teams to use as a training tool so we can improve for future guests.

Summary: Great place for family fun! There is plenty for kids of all ages to do here. You will not be bored! Most of your time will be spent at the waterpark but when you need to dry off and have some fun there is bowling, an arcade, restaurants, kids spa, free GWL activities at different times during your stay, etc. We stayed two days and did not have a chance to do it all and we will be back!

Summary Heading: Fun waterpark, Magiquest, arcade, bowling, and so much more
Summary: When we stayed at the GWL in Washington for 3 days, we left thinking we didn't have enough time to do everything. There were so many fun things to do! We booked for 4 days at the GWL in Southern California, and we said the same thing after we left. There's just so much to do and so little time. The water park was so much fun... my 2, 5, and 12 year old kids love it. My two year old went on 6 different water slides... the slide stops him at the end just in time so that he doesn't fully dunk under water. It was very age appropriate. Magiquest is a must-do. It is so addicting. Arcade, bowling, story-time, food... you'll never have to leave this resort. Everything is there. I wish they had time-share!

fun filled adventure with this indoor waterpark, kids love it, we are ready to book again, had an awesome time at the park. you dont have to leave the park everything u need is there, restaurant or food prices are so reasonable!

A very good place to enjoy with the family, we check out on a Monday and on Tuesday we were already triying to book again to go with in 2 months for my kids birthday, we had plans for a party but not no more we going to great wolf lodge.

First I need to say that ALL of the staff are fantastic! Also I want to say that this is a great place to have a fantastic time-the water park is excellent and the hotel beds are really great! The other side-you are paying a lot to stay at the hotel so why do they have to stiff you with $3.50 for a bottle of water!  You are also captive when you need to eat! A lunch for 2 adults and 2 young children will cost at leat 90 dollars and a dinner will cost at least 120 dollars!!! Also be awre that if you are Gluten free you are going to have a hard time getting food unless you want a salad or a hambuger with a gluten free bun which is available in only only place!! They also call it a water park that is indoor and outdoor. Be advised that the oudoor consists of an average size pool

Summary Heading: Very fun place, definitely worth going to!
Summary: For some background, we stayed at Great Wolf for one weeknight, specifically 30-31 March.  I am not sure how it being a weeknight instead of a weekend influences the amount of people present.  From what I could tell (plus the number of room options that were sold out on that day), the hotel was fairly full.  We were excited that Great Wolf was coming to California since we had one in Texas and other places we have lived. Some personal opinions:  First, Great Wolf is similar to LEGOLAND, there is kind of a "sweet spot" in ages which will get the most out of the place.  I think that is approximately 6-12 years old, though my 14-year-old did participate in a lot of things with her younger sister and I think enjoyed them.  Second, we went there thinking we wouldn't do a lot of the

The room was nice, the water park was fun, and the staff was friendly.  We lucked out and ended up on the 9th (top) floor in a kid's cabin suite and enjoyed it....very quiet compared to other floors.  Be prepared to spend a lot of extra money if you want to do the extra things (mini-golf, mini-bowling, arcade, etc.).  We didn't check in until 4pm to avoid lines that other reviewers mentioned and had no problems.  The water park was open until 8pm that day, so plenty of time to play.

Summary Heading: Great fun for the whole family
Summary: I loved this place! We arrived at noon, checked in and were told we would get a text when our room was ready. We were allowed to enter the waterpark and played until rooms were ready. My family had heard of the Magiquest and came prepared.... with capes, cloaks and an eagerness to slay the dragon. It was  a bit of a hassle to have 5 kids in the tiny magiquest shop getting their wands activated but once on our way they had a blast! We had some snacks and munchies along the way and I found the prices to be reasonable for a resort.  The beds were comfortable and the staff provided us with a pack and play for our youngest adventurer! We hit the water park again in the morning after a stop at Dunkin Donuts.... really the only long line we encountered!~ The restrooms had changing

Summary Heading: Good fun but the poor service of some could ruin your trip.
Summary: The staff were hot or cold.  Some gave great customer service, while others (Dunkin' Donuts and Buckets in particular) gave extremely poor service.  It was like they didn't care and hated their jobs.  The check in crew was helpful and efficient.  Very nice attitudes and very welcoming.  Equally nice were the check out staff.  The food was atrocious.  The kids weren't interested in the Steakhouse menu, so we went to Loose Moose.  The buffet food was cold or at best, room temperature.  The servers were very friendly, but I would not ever eat there again.  Buckets wasn't good either, but the servers had poor attitudes.  We asked for 4 water cups and when we asked for a tray, the response with an attitude was "For what?"  Taken aback, we said it was to carry the water cups.  She

Summary Heading: Indoor, heated water park in OC.
Summary: Pass on all the restaurants. McDonald's is across the street & shopping center w rite aid, grocery store , kfc within yards of resort. Wear slippers, it's wet & slippery in waterpark. We all took a fall. It's clean, towels everywhere, shower have soap, & their life vests are free to use too! There's something for every age. Stayed one night but got to use facility till 9pm the next day. Pass on the story time. It will put u to sleep.Definitely going to waterpark again.

Love all the entertainment for the children and the water park is fabulous.  I'm 56 and I enjoy as much as my grandchildren.  We will be back very soon.  Plan on having our granddaughter's birthday party here.

great experience all the way around!  the amenities at the hotel and the quality of the property made it to where we didn't want to leave the hotel.  We almost skipped Disneyland the next day because everyone was having so much fun on property!!  loved it and highly recommend!

We had a fun family time in here! Lobby is spacious and have plenty of sofas to sit. Dunkin donut is in the corner to entertain your sweet tooth. Hotel room is nice, clean, quite spacious. It has microwave and refrigerator so we brought our own food, heat it and had dinner in the room after hours in the water park.   Water park has areas that entertain every age kid and adult. Water slides are fun. Besides water slides, they have wave pool, water playground, lily pond pool. All are fun! Lazy river is too short and narrow. People were squeezing in there and you could not be lazy in this lazy river. It was jam pack.   It is a bit difficult to find chair(s) to put your stuff. They have plenty chairs, tho.. It's just there were too many people. Shower/Restroom/Changing room are

Summary Heading: Excellent resort for non-stop family fun! Warning: after 3 days you will be exhausted! ;)
Summary: I benefited so much from reading the reviews here before we went so wanted to reiterate a few of the more valuable tips and share a few new ones from our recent 3 day/2 night visit:  - The hotel emailed in advance to say 1 - 4 pm was their busiest check in time...so we arrived at 11:30 and were the only ones in the check-in line; room wasn't ready but the staff assured us they would text us the room # when it was and with the smart tech bracelets they gave us we would be able to gain access to the room immediately. It worked, and we had access to our room by 1 pm!  Although some have complained they never received a text message my observation is that in the water park I had no AT&T  service, but quickly connected to their open (no password) Wifi network.  -  It's a hectic place

Just spent two nights at the Great Wolf Lodge.  Overall  it was a fun family experience.  The check-in was a bit stressful.  We got to the Lodge at 1PM and did not get into a room until 4 and that was after 2 inquiries as to when the room might be ready. The Lodge is nicely appointed with the lodge theme throughout.  The room-2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper was larger than the average hotel room which accommodated our group of two adults and three kids nicely. The Great Wolf is great for families with kids.  Everything from the games, story time and dance party every night to the arcade, bowling and miniature golf are geared for kids.  Our children were too young (6 & under) for the magic wand packages, but we did get the 2 oldest "Pup Passes" and felt this was a great way to do

Had a great time.  Couldn't drag my son out of the wave pool. The air temperature and water temperature were great.  It is loud, but what do you expect being that it is indoors. Would skip the magic wand activities next time.  Too unclear and time consuming...a hassle in my mind.

We absolutely loved our stay,  very clean,  big rooms, friendly people. The water slide lines went by pretty fast. Obstacle course and wave pool was  my daughter's favorite. You should have a loyalty program for us guests who would rather stay with you than the previous hotels we have stayed at.   Fun fun fun

This is great fun for the family, all age kids will enjoy the warm atmosphere and fun activities. We really enjoyed the stay and will make it a point to come back each year. The food was reasonable price and good quality as well.

Summary Heading: Great Wolf a fun water park but NO ROOM SERVICE FOR THE ADULTS
Summary: I am a SoCal resident.  Myself and family were really excited to go to the great wolf.  I have a 5 year old.   The water park was great,  the kids activities were awesome but we were disappointed by the Great Wolf.    NO ROOM SERVICE.  I purposely reserved a family suite so my family could eat our meals at the sofa and table.   We have traveled to most all the hotels off of harbor blvd.   Hyatt, Courtyard Marriott, etc  and Disneyland hotels they all have room service.   Need to work on that!

Great for family vacation. Kids love it and had lots of fun.lots of different activities for different ages. Variety of food choices for kids and adults. We will be definitely planning our next family vacation visit again.

This place is great but pricey for sure. It is beautiful and brand new. The restaurants are really not that great for the price, you are better off going outside of the hotel for food. While the rooms are decent they echo really bad and I think it is because it is so new that the pipes make a lot of noise same with the air unit (it kept me up both nights). The activities for the kids are good story time is a real hit same with the little music time and what not. That water park is great the only bad thing about it is there is not enough chairs in the place you have to really hunt down a place to sit and if you have little ones you will stand most of the time. The life guards are great they have an eye on things for sure. We watch a parent not looking after their child all that

Kids were very happy with the water park, activities around the lodge, and the food options. I gave three stars only because we paid over $500 for a one night stay and a majority of our time was spent walking around looking for a place to sit or put our things, not enjoying the amenities. It was so overcrowded, lines were theme park long for check in and we didn't get to take advantage of the slides due to the same issue. During the day, the water park was so packed we had to take our lunch and sit on the nasty, soaked floors by the exit doors. I was concerned about the safety of the kids at times as the floors were so slick and I had watched multiple people fall. I would definitely recommend non-skid shoes for future visitors and expect most of your time to be spent in the wave

Had a great time at Great Wolf Lodge--was very warm, clean and fun. The kids were exhausted but called the trip "EPIC". I would highly recommend. Its a little pricy, but defiantly worth it. Be sure to make reservations at the restaurant as it books up fast and save time to do the quests and other games throughout the resort.

Summary Heading: We had a fun time  at great wolf but there needs to be some improvements.
Summary: The water park itself was great and my kids loved it. Thank you Greatwolf, we had a fun time during the stay in overall. Dry and warm towels were supplied at all times so it was very nice. Hope the air and water temperature in the waterpark should be more warm cause we all felt cold after water play. There was a bad smell on the sofa in our room. Also you need to build another elevator tower at the other side of the hotel. It was a long walk aisle by aisle from the elevator to our room. Wished there were another elevators at the other end. Pizza was pricey yet poor quality. They need to improve the quality of the food. Some of the shower curtains were taken off in the shower located in the waterpark.

So much fun for the entire family. God and activities are affordable. You don't have to leave the hotel. We drove 7 hours each way to get there and stayed 3 days, it's was worth it. Staff are very friendly and accommodating to your needs.

Summary Heading: Fun for all levels of excitement in your family.
Summary: The place was great and lived up to 5 years of waiting for one to be built near the SF Bay Area.  My oldest thrill seeker 9 year old daughter loved the Tornado and Tail Drop (whatever they are called).  The rest of the members found water activities that they loved.  The wave pool was real popular.  Food was good for a hotel, but pricey as expected.  Worth it to buy at the hotel to get max pool time.  Full bar is available outside and the corn on the cob was great.  TriTip in buffet was great as well.  Dunkin Donuts was the go to for breakfast sandwiches.  No negatives on food.  Sabroso Mexican featured by Guy whatshisname is near by.  Very tasty.  We ran into other families we knew and in the end we were a pack of 26!  That is why we went out to Sabroso for one dinner since

The indoor water park was a little gross. Florescent lighting, lots of dirty water on the floors. Not necessarily Great Wolf's fault but the primary reason we won't be returning. We really liked the Magiquest game but the wands were poorly made and broke almost immediately. Really frustrating for the kids. For the price, they should really build a higher quality product. The staff were all super friendly - "Disney nice" - and did a fantastic job.

My kids are 7 & 9 & are the perfect age for this. It was a blast - recommend aqua sox (water shoes) and goggles as the chemicals from the pool are very powerful. Also bring your own snacks if possible as it can get pricey buying everything. Thought it was very well organized & staff was great.

Resort is definitely for children, everything is geared for them, employees are friendly, clean hotel, good food. Parents be ready to spend...  Waterpark had some issues regarding safety, new place I'm sure they'll get it under control. Need more staff not only standing at the attraction but also walking around.

Summary Heading: They are not prepared for Southern CA
Summary: Not advised of anything at check in - except about wristbands. Waited 30 minutes in line at Dunkin Donuts to order breakfast. The resort as a whole was out of everything. They didn't even have wolf ears for the kids as described as part of the resort fee cost. Waited over an hour to be seated for dinner - only to find out that bowling and miniature golf closed at 9pm. Prices are extremely high.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge and for sharing your feedback with us! We are sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your stay. We are constantly pursuing different ways to provide our guests with as much information prior to arrival so check-in is as streamlined as possible, which is why we send several pre-arrival emails that cover several of the most frequently asked questions. If there are any questions you have that the emails do not cover, feel free to ask them at check-in as we want you to know as much as possible about your visit.

Summary: This is a new resort so the check-in took forever with long lines. The room was clean. My kids loved the indoor water park. They also had other things to entertain the kids beside the water park like Norther Lights Arcade, MagiQuest, Ten Paw Alley and Howl at the Moon Glow Golf, which was bit expensive.  Self parking is free but the valet parking is $10 per night. The park is bit over crowed but we still had a good time.  Great family resort.

Great waterpark plus more available activities. My kids enjoyed the waterpark, bowling and the arcade/games. They loved it so much they want to come back for their birthdays. The staff at great wolf lodge is genuinely friendly and welcoming.

We all had a blast here. We loved the water park (was expecting it to be bigger) but over all it was fun.  Good selection of slides and a great spot for small kids to play as well.  We got the Paw Pass that included the MagiQuest game....6.5 hours and 7 miles (according to phone) later we completed the chapter and the girls became MagiMasters???  Food is a good price and it was delicous.  We dinner at the Wood Fired Grill, good price for 4 people, service is amazing, food was awesome.  Room was new, smelled like cleaner but left the door open to air it our for a few minutes.  In reality we didnt spend that much time in the room. Bed was comfortable and the room was large.

Summary Heading: Family Spring Break Fun at the Great Wolf
Summary: Having stayed at the Great Wolf Texas property, we were very excited to find there was a Great Wolf opening in our home state. We booked a two night, three day stay and couldn't be happier. The resort being brand new was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Our room was big enough for my family (2 Queen Suite) and the waterpark was super fun!

My kids stayed at the water park from open until close.  The lines for the slides did get long in the middle of the day.  I think they should have more employees working the slides.  Great family staycation.

A must go location. Very safe and clean for all ages. 84 * water and no need for sun block or sun glasses. Very short wait lines.  Good food and the refill cup is a must for a family. Freestyle drinks satisfied entire family. Can't wait to go again.

My 4 year old loved the park!  It's like Las Vegas for kids. I appreciated the many, many activities available but man oh man, everything has a charge and it's not nominal charges.  $3-5 for arcade games?   I didn't even take my daughter into the arcade because I had heard the cost was very expensive and I didn't want to disappoint her.  Overall,  we had a great time during our 1 day stay and will likely to be back with Dad but it cost $500 for one day's stays (that was with a discount).  It's not just the cost of the room but all the additional costs at the hotel and the fees associated with the room.  A few notes on the waterpark.  The people doing the measuring are inconsistent. One day my daughter was pink and the second day she was yellow lucky she didn't know the

Summary Heading: Super fun for the whole family!
Summary: Glad we decided to stay and experience Great Wolf Lodge Southern California. We have passes to Disneyland and decided to tack on a few days at the lodge. It was the best decision! We had so much fun. My kids are 12,10 & 8.

Staff and Service • No complaints all around. From the front desk to the maintenance personnel. Pool lifeguards to Kids activities personnel. All of the staff were pretty on point, friendly, courteous, and worked with you to address any problems. • Magiquest people were fantastic. I really wish I could remember all their names, but we were there for 4 days and these people were on the ball. Answering questions, incredibly helpful, in the "role" and just overall nailed it.  Room (Standard Family Suite) PROS • Clean. They did just open though (few months) • Mini-fridge can easily hold a few 2-liter bottles of your choosing, a small to medium pizza, and a variety of other things. It's a fairly good sized "mini-fridge".  • Spacious with decent outlets. Remember, the outlets are part

Summary Heading: Great TWO TO THREE DAY STAY
Summary: STAFF is amazing!!!  Friendly and can't wait to please.  Food is overall decently priced and great tasting.  But there are tons of outside dining options.  The resort makes it easy for ins and outs. I would avoid buffets, over priced for the food selection.  Arcade games average about $2 each play!!  Bit steep!  Water Rides are awesome...it's like an indoor compacted Raging Waters...pretty good selection of rides for all sizes.  Seating is difficult, due this accommodation so get there early enough to reserve your seating. Upon reservation, I advised it was my son's birthday, because they asked...But, there was no special treatment or surprise in the room...I was kinda banking on a balloon or something...apparently it was just for their own consensus.

We went to the Lodge on a whim.  It's perfect everyone in the family.  Even though the "wheel house" is for Elementary and Pre K, my 13 yr old had a great time and even wants to bring some friends for his 14th bday.  The place is a bit pricey after you include the $74 of tax on the room.  I like the idea of the bracelet being your room key, parking, water park and credit card.  It makes it very convenient that you don't have to carry your wallet every time the kids want a drink (or you).  Beer and food selection in the waterpark area could be better.  I felt like I was in Excalibur after it 1st opened.  I just hope GWL will keep up the maintenance and look better than Excalibur.    We will go back in a few months because my 8 year old daughter said it's her favorite hotel she's

Summary Heading: Great place-too little staff at night
Summary: Loved this place and when staff was present they were on it. It was great. But practically no way to get a hold of the front desk or restaurants after 8pm. You have to walk downstairs and find someone to help. It's very hard. But the staff was fantastic during the day and everyone was great to us and our kids.

This resort is great for kids age 3 to 12. Much younger and it's a lot of work as a parent, and much older and your kid may be bored. We spent 3 days and 2 nights and it was the perfect amount of time there. Food was better and much more affordable than we expected. There are a lot of other activities offered that cost additional money (bowling, mini golf, arcade, etc) but it's all reasonably priced. We had a great time and the kids are already asking to go back.

My kids love the place so much lots of activities  for the kids. They enjoy the resort but with fear of gettin hurt because of the incident that i bumped on one of the slide. Magiquest is their next favoriteand of course the food and the sweets.

We joined two other families for an awesome time at Great Wold Lodge during spring break. The water park kept our combined 12 kids occupied for two solid days and we had to drag them out the first night at the 9pm closing! There are many rides and activities for all ages to enjoy. The resort also has other attractions to occupy time when the water park is closed like bowling, an arcade and MagiQuest.   The hotel rooms are super clean and functional for our family of 6. We had plenty of room to spread out which is rarely the case when we stay in hotels. I really want to thank GWL for considering larger families when planning the rooms!  I do wish the rooms and additional activities were a bit less expensive but I understand the cost of running a top notch resort. We can't wait to

Great Wolf Lodge really understands families of all ages. We have 4 young children 6 and under and we travelled with friends with older kids and everyone had a wonderful time. Fun water park, great amenities, great room setup, and the food was even pretty good too.

My son is two and we had the most amazing time with him. Everyone was super friendly, the resort was beautiful, and there was always something fun to do. The staff was always accommodating and it was an overall great trip.

Kids had a great time.  Very clean and secure facilities.  Appreciated the large number of lifeguards as it is difficult to keep track of kids at all times in such a large resort.  Magi-quest was a huge hit with my two elementary school children.  Workers at the resort were very helpful.

Great family resort. The indoor water park is amazing. My 5 year old was able to do most of the water attractions, his favorite was the wave pool. Get to the water park early to secure a table. Although the park does not over crowd, tables to sit can be limited. We had such a good time.  We can come here year round!

My kids and I couldn't have been happier.  It was a wonderful experience.  We stayed Sun-Thurs.  In the future I would probably shorten the stay a bit but overall it was wonderful.  I loved how they had things to do outside of the water park to entertain the kids.

Summary Heading: Great Wolfe Lodge in Garden Grove, CA
Summary: I loved this place. I took my 7 year old and my 5 year old. They had a great time.  They loved the wave pool and the pool with the basket ball hoop. I loved the lazy river.  The pizza was awesome and they have the best roasted corn at the Bar and Grill.  We will definitely return very soon.  FYI: Best rates are available if you sign up and wait for an email coupon code.

The hostess at the lodge was rude and didn't feel like seating a big party after 9pm, even though they closed at 11pm. Blatantly sat other people in smaller groups but told us quite a few excuses. Appetizers came out after the dinner. Horrible, just horrible service.

This was a great family resort that kept the kids entertained, plenty of exercise. Kids slept well at night, no whining or comparing during the day. They want to play in the water all day! We will go back

Summary Heading: A different vacation option for families for this area
Summary: The new building was nice, front desk were great, some of the staff in different areas seemed to not want to be there. Very clean. Nice varieties of places to eat. Not too expensive for the location. We had a good time, not as great as some of the other Great Wolf Lodge's though.

We had a great time. We have a 2 1/2  year old and  7 month old. There was plenty of things for them to do at the water park. I will say I had forgotten how loud an indoor pool can be. By  the end of the day we were all ready for quiet. It is so loud in there you can't even have a conversation. It was nice to be outside by the outdoor pool when we needed some down time.

My toddler absolutely loved Great Wolf.  The service was excellent, the children's activities are extensive and engaging and the prices are quite reasonable.  There are lots of thrill rides for older children, as well as plenty of options for toddlers.  My two year old was even able to bowl.  We will be back.

Summary Heading: AMAZING Fun, yet some improvement needed with staff training for medical issues
Summary: This place is amazing!  The kids loved it, the water-park is phenomenal, MagicQuest killed it (And kids loved it even more than the water-park, go figure) and Food was really good and prices reasonable for this location. Half of our stay was simply awesome.  Unfortunately, my daughter fell sick during the stay and a call to Front-Desk in the middle of the night for a doctor came back with a very non-caring "We don't have one, and we have no idea where to get one". Not what you expect from a resort hosting 100's of kids and families at once. I ended up leaving my wife and other kids alone in the room for a day whileI ended up going to the ER and wasting half of my vacation time in a hospital, but those things happen (and everyone is healthy now, which is the important thing). One

We had a great time at Great Wolf, the chain is very good and makes strong efforts to provide a great quality experience. Kids love the experience and the themed suites are amazing. The water park is well maintained and all employees are focused on safety.  Would came again Avoid the buffet for lunch or dinner though, food not worth the price and with so many restaurants around the neighbourhood you could have a better experience outside.

Awesome family destination!  Never a dull moment! The lifeguards never took their eyes off the water. They had a great scanning technique. As a former lifeguard I felt very safe with my 4 year old who is not a stellar swimmer yet. The bowling alley for kids is great too.

We had a wonderful time at GWL.  The customer service was absolutely fantastic everywhere at the resort. We stayed with 3 adults and 3 twelve year old girls.  The girls had an amazing time.  They loved the water park as well as the other activities, including miniature golf, the arcade and MagiQuest.  There were several options for food (2 restaurants (the Loose Moose Buffet seems to be the best deal as far as the restaurant options), then there are less expensive options to get pizza, sandwiches  and salads and Dunkin Donuts. We stayed in the Wolf Den Suite and the girls loved the bunk bed cave area. The rooms are not luxurious, but were very clean and served their purpose.  We spent very little time in the room since there was so much to do. We all had a great time and would

By all means this was our best family vacation ever. The staff where extremely polite. Not one rude employee which is very rare these days we felt completely welcomed. The rooms where amazing and the amount of fun that is provided is awesome. We as a family want to thank you for providing us with such an awesome experience this was for sure one for the books thanks to the awesome service. We will see you all soon. Looking foward to visiting soon.

FUN FUN FUN - Although we had been to the Wisconsin Dels and had experienced an indoor water park on a much grander scale - we had a blast!  Non of rides had long lines except for the surf/boogie board.  It was warm enough in the park area and the water seemed to be at a good temp where you weren't cold when you come out.  Staff was super nice!  It was a fun weekend.

Summary Heading: First & Definitely Not the Last Visit to Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: We loved the resort and cannot wait for our next visit!  From the time we pulled up the gentlemen at the valet was very helpful and directed us to what we needed to do since this was our first visit. They also called another team member right away to assist with our luggage. The team member patiently waited with our luggage while we checked in and was very friendly. The check in was a very smooth process and the gentlemen who assisted was very nice/friendly. You also get these awesome wolf ears at check-in. Since the resort is very large I would recommend asking for a map as to know where your room is located and if that is location you would like to be located.   We ate at all the restaurants and the food was very good. We only had one hiccup at the Lodge restaurant with the

My kids love to swim, but sometimes, when we go on a family vacation during Spring break anywhere in Southern California, the waters are still cold. So this indoor waterpark at Great Wolf Lodge was an excellent alternative if you'd like to go take a swim. Not only swimming, but they have all sorts of other activities that all ages can enjoy. We will definitely come back again!

This was a staycation for us that did not disappoint.  It is great for a family vacation with many options for the kids.  The staff was accommodating and pleasant.  The resort is definitely on the pricey side which would be the only reason I gave it a four.  The room we stayed in was clean and basic but the price for the room was a bit much.

Nice indoor water park; water temperature is great. Attentive lifeguards. Felt really safe for kids. Not enough seating for hotel guests in water park, very disappointing since it's harder to watch your kids enjoying themselves. For us, this will probably be a one time deal. Better off to spend money on yearly pass to Soak City.

Summary Heading: Mixed review 2 kids one who happens to have autism
Summary: Our daughter loved the water park and stayed all day! Our son who has autism could not deal with the water park as it was so loud with really long lines, he lasted 10 minutes and was done with the water park. The one thing our son loved magic quest!  The food was great, we had pizza/pasta and salad that was a great price. Had the breakfast buffet yummy as my kids woukd say! Spent big bucks on the room and water park so it sucks that my son and I did not get to really enjoy the water park, however my husband and daughter had a blast in the water park and want to return. As for me I would say not so autism friendly.

Summary Heading: GWL is amazing for family vacations!
Summary: It's really clean. Staff is beyond helpful and friendly.  You can go in and out without any inconvenience. Which is amazing.  Food isn't pricey.  Arcade is nice.  Kids just love it here.  They also have activities throughout the day for kids such as arts and crafts, story time, dancing, etc.

Staff and rooms were friendly, inviting and great!  Plenty for the whole family to enjoy!  They make the entire process easy.  Very fun group of people and very safe environment for the children.  Highly recommend!

My grand kids loved the water park as did the adults.  You need more chairs. when we arrived at 1pm there was not a chair to be found. Which made us come down at 8am One hour before the park opened to stand in line just to get chairs.   But my biggest complaint is the wait for tables for breakfast at moose lodge.  There were so many empty tables but they made us wait 45!!! minutes said others waiting and reservations well ok 1st day we went beck when buzzer rang  still many many empty tables. this didn't only happen to me I heard many folks complaining.  Dinner at the wolf grill was ridicules. had reservations 7pm  showed up at 6:50  was told had to wait. but again empty tables just sitting...  Then my husbands dinner finally showed up long after we were all done. of course he

Great Wolf is such an awesome place for kids and family.. Had such a wonderful time and can't wait to go back again. The rooms were great and the area pool area was fab!!! Love that there were always warm towels available..

great wolf was a great experience, friendly staff, clean place to visit, felt very safe there.. We traveled from Hanford,ca.... I just left with one sad feeling because an employee hurt my granddaughters feelings.

Summary Heading: The life guards were not nearly as safe as previous visits to your resorts. They mustr not have been traine3d by the sam
Summary: The life guards allowed adult dodge ball in the indoor basketball area with a crowded pool and many young kids in the area. Several were hit with a arrant fastball thrown across the entire pool area. I took my 6 year old out before he was seriously injured. The guards were oblivious, marching like solders, but too stupid to realize what a dangerous situation this was.

Lots of activities to do.  Slides, wave pool, flow rider, outdoor pool, indoor pool, water jungle gym and young kid jungle gym and slides. And that's just the water park.  There is an arcade, mini golf, interactive movie ride, bowling, quest games, yoga, story time, character photos, kid salon with ice cream and various activities for the kids.  Our family had a great time.    Water park:  As first time visitors we wish there was more information on the hours of the water park and the slides.  There are no descriptions on the  slides while you are in line.  We quickly figured it out and overall each slide was very fun.  The slides are color coded and you get in line and follow the paw print of the color slide.  There are two main staircases leading up to the slides.    Left side

Summary Heading: Still had some kinks to be worked out but we still plan on going back
Summary: We planned our stay last minute which meant beaucoup bucks...we could have easily stayed 2 nights for what we spent. They should add last minute rates but maybe that will come later.   Since we were only staying one night and had to leave at the crack of dawn the next day we booked a cabana which gives u access to the water park at 11 in instead of 1pm. When I called the night before to check in to see if there was an inside cabana available instead,  I was told we could go to water park upon park open. So on the off chance it was true we showed up at 9am. Our experience at check in was awesome!!!! We lucked out since they were not sold out and got our room right away and we were in our cabana by 9:30am. So grateful because it helped us make the best of the few hours we had

We went on a weekend with my family and everyone had a blast!  Check-in was a little disorganized, but all is well.  Make sure you know what packages you bought before hand as they did not have a good system yet in place.  They forgot to give us our passes, breakfast vouchers, and one of the Buckets lunch vouchers.  Had to call and ask for them, but they were very attentive and took care of it right away!   At the water park we had a hard time finding seats to set our bags and towels-- it was full!  Granted it was on one Saturday during Spring Break for many.  The next day we tried to reserve lounge chairs so we can be relaxed near the water, but all lounge chairs are gone!  Our only guess was they needed more room to set up regular beach chairs (less room), which we had a hard

Our kids had a blast and had plenty to do during our stay. The big slides were thrilling and kept the big kids (adults) entertained as well. The young kids section kept our 4 year old entertained and safe.  It was a great experience.

Summary Heading: SPRING BREAK FUN at Great Wolf Lodge!!!
Summary: My family and I had a fantastic time visiting the new Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove!!  The indoor water park was more than we expected...EXTREMELY CLEAN, not too crowded and loads of fun!!  The rides were extremely exciting and the food was surprisingly delicious!! We are already planning our next trip!!  We highly recommend this spot if you want to have a great time!!

I've already been in contact with a manager and I don't have a lot more to say.  The check-in process was a complete nightmare and is what is keeping me from wanting to go again.  Also, the seating is bad at the pool as everyone saves seats and doesn't actually sit down.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for bringing this to our attention! We are incredibly sorry to learn of the difficulties your pack encountered in the water park and at check-in, as this experience is not in line with our standards. We will share your concerns with the respective teams to discuss and review for future guests.

Summary Heading: Inhaling chlorine and ammonia makes people sick!!
Summary: I paid a lot of money to get a high on inhaling the chlorine and urinating ammonia in the pool. We are sick from exposing ourselves to the indoor park's enclosure of 84 degrees, which feels hotter with hundreds of people's body heat as well. It's supposed to be a vacation at a resort but it feels like being a sardine encased in a humid gas chamber. Warning to moms who care about the air quality of the park and the non-healthy food options. For the amount of money I spent there, it was sub-par of a resort experience. The company cuts corners everywhere to save money.

Summary Heading: Great place for a family weekend trip!
Summary: We came back for another weekend and will likely go back again in a few weeks.  Kids love it!  It is clean and safe and price gets reasonable when you consider that you get to go to park 2 days.  love that the kids can stay in the water for the whole day without worrying about the sun, although we did enjoy the outdoor pool too.

Took my family to the Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove. It was alright considering the resort is so new and so is the entire staff. This place has potential to be an amazing place, hopefully it gets there!

The resort is geared towards small children not teenagers. The rooms were okay, but I was looking for a better quality of room for the price I paid for a Grizzly Suite. The children loved the resort water park.

Definelty will be back.. Great customer service. Rooms were very clean. The water park was so fun! They had lots of great water slides and a great toddler area. The only thing is my youngest daughter wanted to go on the big slides and they gave her a wrist band for only the little kids slides. They should go off of the parents  preference when it comes to getting a wrist band for their children. Cause we've been to wet n wild and she went on all the big slides there so was a little disappointed when she couldn't go on the big ones here.

Check-in process was several hours and heinous!! However, the park was nice. My kids LOVED MagiQuest. And with a nice coupon we'd return, but the price is definitely exorbitant, unless you take a large group.

Summary Heading: Amazing, safe, clean-mother of all water parks-great family mini vacation
Summary: Convenience and family entertainment is what you'll get when staying at Great Wolf. There are tons of activities for the kids to do other than the water park included in your hotel stay-great value. Not nearly as exhausting as Disneyland! Water park lifeguards are everywhere-they've got great safety procedures to keep the little ones safe. Customer service is good-but not outstanding, they cont go over and beyond. I'd definitely come back-kids loved the park and slept solid from all the swimming.

The resort was nice and new. It's much smaller than I thought it would be. And the rides were few and far between. However, water temperature was way too cold!!! Made it impossible for us to fully enjoy the experience! Outside the cold water, the resort is meant for the younger crowd. The activities offered are geared toward the 5-7 crowd at best.
