Everything else costs $$$.

Summary Heading: Great for families, but a few shortcomings
Summary: Overall experience was good, the staff and the activities available for kids are really great. My kids had a blast with the stuffed animal adventure, we got the Pup Pass and for all the stuff that is included, it was really worth it.    However, there are several things that weren't so great: 1. The rooms were really small, I had gotten the biggest available Family room, and with 3 beds in it, there was barely room for walking between beds. For something that is $550 a night, the size is way too small and the decor is Motel 6 at best.  2. The waterpark water was too cold! All of the kids were shivering after an hour of being in the water, and most of the kids there had purple lips!!  Our kid had fever for 2 days after leaving the waterpark!!  Either the water needs to be warmer

Summary Heading: Kids were thrilled to death but we all came home sick
Summary: We stayed at GWL for 2 nights to celebrate my daughter and granddaughters birthdays.  The front desk Person who checked us in was wonderful.  We were in room 202 which had a view of the water park from the window.  Room was clean and comfortable.  My daughter and I did have issues with some pack members working with the children not being as friendly.  They need to make sure that the people that work with children WANT to work with children....you can tell.  Often when we asked staff a question they looked dumbfounded and said "I'm not sure" or "I don't know" and would forward us on to someone else.  Kinda irritating. We bought Pup Passes for the kids.....WELL worth it but kinda of annoying that when we went to redeem their points so they could play in the arcade we were told

My kids love this place- they enjoyed the water park and LOVEd the quest! worked well for my 9yr old and my 14yr old.  I enjoyed reading a book while they played. the beds were very comfortable. The kids were worn out after 1 night and 2 days

Summary Heading: Spilled coffee and sticky food at the bunkbed
Summary: We stayed at the wolf den lodge we just barely put our luggage down my son said the carpet is wet, checked and it's a spilled coffee. Called front desk and was told that they don't check in people till they know the room is ready to be used the person at the front desk said maybe it's a house keeping issue and will send house keeping to clean.  Night came my son was yelling and said there's something sticky at his bunk bed.  Came to check on it and saw there's a donut in between the bunk bed and the fitted sheet.  That room wasn't ready for use I think, maybe they didn't even removed the whole beddings for the next family to use it.

Summary Heading: Great fun for kids at Great Wold Lodge CA
Summary: Our family had an amazing time at Great Wolf Lodge over spring break.  The kids played from dawn till bed.  You get great value for your money with the many slides and other fun activities that are not water related.

Worst Check in. Check in early. Said room avail soon on 4th flr. 5.5hrs later and many complaints got room. Now on 7th flr. Looks like room was givin away. Staff lies about room readiness and avil time.

Summary Heading: First time at Great Wolf Lodge.
Summary: Being first timers my family and I had high expectations, spending $319/night for a family of four is not cheap. Check in process was a little bit long, 45 minutes, all tho we received an email prior to expect it. Water park was amazing, fun and family friendly. Everything was easily accessible and can always ask staff members for help. We snacked at Dunkin Donuts the minute we arrived, lady behind the counter was in a hurry attitude. There was no line, but she was pretty hush hush to get things done. One thing that really stuck to us like a sore thumb is the water pressure of the shower in our room. For being a water park, shower pressure by our room was so weak. Other than that we had an amazing time at the water park, bowling and arcade.

You can definitely tell that they need to work out the kinks. The line to check was so long that they had to take people's numbers down to text them when they would have rooms a aisle. I never got a text after waiting for about 2 hours and when I went up to the front desk the keys were already there. We waited over an hour for bellhop to bring up our stuff to our room and my husband ended up going downstairs himself and grabbing the our stuff himself. After we checked out I was charge for $100 breakfast that I never went to and it's been almost a week and they are still "reviewing it" and making sure it wasn't me.

Even in the land of Disney, prices were exceptional. On top of high costing rooms, we didn't feel we could purchase any  souvenirs . We had a two night stay; expected to close the park the last day, but kids ( 18 to 10) had had enough. Buffet, at $22. Was simply ghastly. Adequate choices, but poor quality. Most was Luke warm, if not frozen, like the fruit  and the carrots, and the chocolate milk. Desserts were sawdust. Breakfast one day was the same quality,quite good the other. Hamburger prices not outrageous, but they closed early.. We enjoyed the food at the grill, and while a little on the high side, was not exorbitant. One main staircase to all rides a confusing bottleneck. Lazy river small and over crowded. You will maybe enjoy it if you don't have high expectations and

Summary Heading: Dirty rooms with no one to remedy the situation.
Summary: upon arrival found the sheets dirty. Asked them to come up to the room and it took 4 calls, 1 visit in person to the front desk and 9 hours to get it done. After the kids were absolutely exhausted and I demanded either clean sheets or a new room so the kids could go to bed. they offered no solution until I became demanding. I would not go back here.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge and for sharing this with us! We are deeply saddened to learn of the difficulties your pack encountered in your guest suite, as this experience does not meet our expectations. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.   We would love to ensure you have spoken with a member of our leadership team at the property. Please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and provide us with the first & last name on the reservation and the best means to contact you.

Summary Heading: Great Fun, Great Food, Comfortable rooms but activities and food costs are pretty expensive
Summary: We waited for hours for our room to be ready which was unacceptable in our opinion.  The staff could not give us even an idea of when our room would be ready.  The lobby was far too overcrowded with TONS of people everywhere in a disarray (however it was spring break).  I thought our room would have bunk beds but just not the log theme, but I was wrong...when I called the front desk to inquire the lady was rude and said "You got what you paid for" :-(  Wow! Also, for the price of a one night stay they might want to consider adding at least one meal per family in that pricing.  The meals were pricey for a family of 5 and all of the activities are pretty pricey too!  Totally LOVED the waterpark though and the theme of the resort is sooooo cute and cozy!  I would love to go back,

Great hotel.  Close to home and I love how they give you the option to invite a guest at an additional $40.00 which is a great price.  The Buffet was wonderful and the Grill by the pool was delicious.  The only problem is finding a seating place at the water park when you get there at the 1-3 check in.  People from the night before have the option of using the water park after they check out.  This caused a bit of a problem to find somewhere to sit.  Now we did have a party of 8 but we couldn't even find 2 chairs to put our stuff on.  We eventually found some seats but it took a good 30 minutes of wondering around.  We will be back again.

Nicely appointed, reasonably priced, family fun.  Great for kids of all ages.  The water park was well organized with wait times, even during a full capacity day, being tolerable.  Rooms were nice and clean with very large TV.  Beds were comfortable

We stayed 1 night and found it to be PLENTY of time to play! The Paw Pass was a great deal and both of our kids (7 and 3) had so much fun doing Magiquest. The waterpark was clean and well watched. If you want a chair, go early and put your stuff out....they are gone by mid-morning. The line for Dunkin Donuts is long in the morning...totally worth it as it was delicious but just be prepared to wait in line 20 minutes. Our kids loved the 10-pin bowling...perfect for littler guests! The themed room was great and the kids loved having their own bunkbeds and TV. Great family fun for everyone!!

Summary Heading: bring your own goggles, shampoo and conditioner
Summary: This is a great vacation spot, esp for Southern CA residents who don't want to travel. Everything you need is within the hotel. I would bring goggles for the kids to help with the chlorine, as well as your own shampoo and conditioner.

Not the best experience. But the water park was awesome. My kids truly enjoyed themselves although we went through hell upon our arrival. Our room was not available we wait 5 hours after checkout time and still no room availability. Mind you we paid for 3 nights in advance.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the feedback from your recent visit to Great Wolf Lodge! We are genuinely sorry for our multiple missteps during your visit, as this experience fails to meet our expectations. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.

Summary: Had a fabulous time with the grandkids.  Something to do for everyone.  Staff was eager to please! Rooms were very clean and the water park was amazing.  I have already booked another vacation with the kids!

Summary Heading: Take your family! You will not be disappointed!
Summary: My family absolutely loved Great Wolf Lodge! We had such a great time we are returning in July. We have three kids ages 8, 5, & 3 and they all had a blast! There is something for everyone! The waterpark is absolutely incredible and the other activities offered are great as well! The hotel is clean and inviting and the staff are very friendly and helpful! We stayed in a kid cabin suite and the kids couldn't have been happier. My husband and I had a comfortable bed and a tv to our selves. We love Great Wolf Lodge!

Spent one night at the Great Wolf Lodge with (3) 12 year olds. The kids were highly entertained. Lots of fun stuff to do. Would not stay longer than 2 nights. Younger kids would probably have more fun and could spend longer time with them. The activities were a little pricey but for one night at a hotel and essentially 2 days at a water park it was a good deal overall. The food was tasty...seemed fresh and had a homemade style to it. Waited 40 minutes for a cup of Dunkin Donuts coffee. Get up early!!

It was not affordable as a Disney vacation, but loads of fun for 1 day/night.  Great for a local staycation.  The lifeguards were extremely visible to all the water activities.  Safety is a high priority.

WE traveled to Great Wolf with two grandchildren, ages 14 & 8 for spring break.  The check in line was very long but was shortened by attendants offering a quick way to avoid the line.  The water park was excellent although two or three of the areas were understaffed causing lines to be longer than necessary.  The park has attractions geared to children of all ages and most of the children seemed to be having a good time.  The food was mediocre at best with the exception of the breakfast buffet which was outstanding.  The checkout process was very efficient and charges made after checkout were properly assigned to my room account and billed to my credit card.  The baggage handling service was very good and the attendants were friendly and accommodating although the baggage

We had an incredible time. My kids thoroughly enjoyed themselves...and so did we. The staff and everyone were extremely courteous and helpful. We didn't leave to eat or anything, everything we needed was right there.

Great resort for family of all sizes and ages. However the resort was not read to accomadate the size of large crowds. I stood online for over an hour just to check into the hotel. Also dunkin donuts was another hour long wait the next morning. The staff needs to learn to work better with large crowds.

This was a great family vacation.  We had high expectations based on reviews from YouTube and Pinterest and it lived up to it all on our first trip to the Great Wolf Lodge.  The staff was wonderful and very accommodating.  There were a couple of quirky kinks that need to be worked out such as no chocolate ice cream at the Bear Paw and the story disappearing during storytime and Wiley showing up a bit late.  There had been a power-outage during the day and animated show didn't work either.  My son didn't care though.  He is three and had a blast.  He is looking forward to a return trip with his cousins.

Overall trip was great.  Check-in process needs to be looked at.  There were a lot of staff but the line was just way too long and room was not ready until after the check-in time specified on the website.

This is our 6th visit to a GWL, and the first to the brand new So Cal location. We are excited to have one in our local area and we will be frequent guests.  Every detail is thought of to make this a safe, friendly, family environment.  The waterpark is spectacular and the staff is great. You feel welcome from the minute you pull up to the time you walk out the door.  Food options are reasonably priced for children 11 and under, but teens and adults can be quite expensive. Breakfast options in the buffet were great, but dinner was disappointing.  Don't hesitate to book your family vacation, you will not regret it...a lifetime of memories will be created!

First experience at this resort! Convenient, exceptional facility! Will be returning annually! Everything you will need is available for water fun. Felt safe with kids entertaining themselves while the adults lounged.

It was great to be with family and having fun and excellent time together. I was able to rest and relax at he same time no stress at all. And we had a great view from our room. And the staff on the water area were helpful and fun specially on the flow rider .

Summary Heading: Not a whiner, but hoping to provide info to families looking at spending their hard-earned money!
Summary: First off, I’m not one to “whine” as another reviewer suggested or to give a bad review just to leave a review.  I try and at least list the positives.  In that spirit, I will do that here.  Note* - If I could give 2.5 stars, I would do that.   Great Wolf does a great job of catering to the kids, aged about 7 – 12.  The water park is adequate and was fun for our kids (two teens and a toddler) to a certain extent.  The teens were bored after a while because the water park is smaller than a normal park of course.  This means that the water slides that older kids will want to use are much more crowded with teens and adults.  They did enjoy it nonetheless.   Our toddler was enchanted with the area meant for little ones her age.  The downstairs entertainment area for kids was both

We spent our spring break at the Great Wolf Lodge.  It was me and my four kids (7, 9, 12, and 14).  From the moment we walked in, we loved it.  The lobby is beautifully furnished and is decorated like a mountain lodge.  There is a huge rock fireplace, and a floor to ceiling wall of windows that looks out over the watermark.  We arrived at 12:30 pm and the line to check in was very long - it took about 30 minutes for us to check in.  I purchased two "wolf passes" and divided the activities between the four kids.  The wolf passes cost $99 each but they include so much.  However, some of the included items were ones that we wouldn't have purchased if they weren't included, such as a tattoo, swim goggles, and a leather bracelet.  But the build-a-bear, magi quest wand and game,

Great family vacation!! Will definitely recommend it and go again. Staff was friendly. Plenty to do for kids. Not once did my kids ask for an electronic. This place kept them busy and entertained all day.

Wonderful time!  It is a great, fun packed place.  It is quite pricey and because the water is a bit chilly the kids did not want to stay too long in the water park (happened last time too).  Lines are SUPER long during peak times (11-5pm); though we do stay during their busy times (spring break and holiday).  Overall still a family favorite.

Good idea, indoor water park, but they need to iron out the kinks.  Place was clean, but it just opened.  Let's see how it looks in a year or two.  Food was excellent, particularly the Grill at the outdoor pool. Overall, it was a good experience.  Glad we tried it.

Summary Heading: Not worth the price, chaotic and unfriendly environment
Summary: Not sure what all the fuss was about this place- we had a bad experience and certainly don't feel it was worth the high prices!  This was our first visit to the lodge and check-in was confusing at best.  We were ushered out of the check-in line and given wrist bands for the water park by a flustered hotel clerk.  She wasn't very welcoming and didn't provide any guidance or information about the resort.  I had to ask for a map and schedule of activities as well as an explanation of the wrist bands. She seemed annoyed by my questions and like it was a big inconvenience to her to provide this information.  We were told we would receive a text when our room was ready, but not to come back before 4:00pm because no rooms would be ready before then.  We decided to head to the water
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the feedback from your recent visit to Great Wolf Lodge! We are genuinely sorry for our multiple missteps during your visit, as this experience fails to meet our expectations. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.

Summary: WORST resort and vacation EVER!! To say this resort is a disappointment, is an understatement.  While the staff was friendly, they were very robotic, with no capacity to accommodate or facilitate anything for guests.  The water park, itself, was fine.  The kids enjoyed the rides, though somewhat limited due to its small size.  (Being told that the 'outdoor water park' was also available, weather permitting, was somewhat exciting.  However, any optimism there quickly turned into a laughable joke when we found that the 'outdoor waterpark' is a pool. Period.  Beyond lame and seriously misleading.  All that aside, my issue with this "resort" is just that.  This is not a resort.  This is merely a Motel 6 with water slides and a price tag inflated five times as much.  (And, please

Summary Heading: Go elsewhere, not worth the money
Summary: I will not go back nor recommend this to anyone. The water park was enjoyed by the kids. The spa was great. I wont go into detail but the overall experience was bad. For the money I spent I expect better.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge and for sharing this with us! We are deeply saddened to learn of the difficulties your pack encountered throughout the resort, as this experience does not meet our expectations. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.

Summary: The experience was extremely overpriced and cheesy. The food was decent and waterpark was great but all the other little add-ons like the Magi Quests and Paw experience was honestly just crappy and not worth the value.

Summary Heading: Great fun place for kids. Food is reasonably priced. Remember, price quoted nudes watermark tickets!
Summary: Stay was great. Food was reasonable. Room was clean and fun. We had the wolf den. My daughter loved it. Valet deeply scraped my car and didn't tell me. I found it when I got home. Strongly suggest you check exterior of car before taking possession.  Other than the car damage.....stay was great

Summary Heading: Okay, but not a great value for the money if kids are oldet
Summary: Really geared towards a younger family.  E paid a sale price/night that just didn't make it seem worth the value.  Patk was fine, but with Raging waters nearby with a lot more attractions, the hotel experience was just ok.  Food was ok.  Other attractions were either pricey or just geared for a younger crowd.  My kids are 14 and 17, and enjoy a little of younger kid stuff (they r a "younger, more innocent" 14, 17 yo.     Given most of the attractions though would say this place best suited for <10 overall.    Also Just felt like everything cost so much and guess we expected a little more for that, which didn't happen.  38$/5 people for a motion game ride that is all of 5 mins was fun but not worth doing again.  Day trips to Raging waters and a cheaper nearby hotel would have

Ran out of soda and beer in the pizza restaurant   I think this was from being so new and lack of experience in management  the buffet had the same food each night which was very disappointing but the rest of the hotel was great.  Good family vibe and safe for the kids.  There were a lot of staff by the pool sand slides and I felt that my kids were safe.

It was a very fun expirence with lots of fun things to do! We enjoyed everything about it! Short drive over, fun at the water park, fun doing the magi quest, and had a ton of fun celebrating a birthday!

Summary Heading: One of our best family vacations ever!
Summary: Go and experience it! It's fun, safe, family oriented, & a great vacation choice! The beds were so comfortable, the waterpark had short lines, we felt really safe in the water, and the Magiquest game was like nothing we have ever done before!

Summary Heading: Do not go on spring break
Summary: NOT enough seats in waterpark, ran out of pepperoni in pizza place, ran out off all flavors of icecream except one, magi quest glithced and there were lines to fight bosses. 45 min line for dunkin donuts. Our couch in our room stunk like vomit.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the feedback from your recent visit to Great Wolf Lodge!  We are genuinely sorry for our multiple missteps during your visit, as this experience fails to meet our expectations.  We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.

Summary: This resort has everything to make a family get-away amazing for the whole family. Geared for kids 3 and up - probably too much going on for little ones to appreciate and enjoy, Resort is new and clean, staff is nice. Still working out kinks of being newly opened. We had a blast and look forward to going back; although it's not an inexpensive undertaking, it is on par with Disneyland and other similar family entertainment destinations.

My children are 5 and 7 and LOVED Great Wolf Lodge. They are ready to go back right now. They both loved the water park, but my 5 year old was crazy for the Majiquest adventure. She was determined to become a master maji and so proud of herself when she had accomplished it. Just know that at these ages, the kids need help... and sometimes the adults do too! You can ask the staff in the Majiquest shop and they do a great job with assistance. The water park has great slides and different areas to keep the kids entertained for hours! I'm not a water person and I even had fun on the slides.

Poor check in experience, very limited seating around the water features, very nice staff otherwise, be prepared to spend $$$ in the arcade, food reasonably priced, suites cute but very "motel"in quality. Kids had a good time but adults not so.

I took my 22 year old daughter and my 13 year old grandson to Great Wolf Lodge and we had a fantastic time. I'm not sure whether my grandson liked the water park or playing the magi quest the most but they were both great activities. We definitely will return.

here were two different incidents that happened with the quality of service at the dining restaurants. It seems like there was not enough food and beverages to accommodate everyone because on 2 separate days both the pizza place, buckets place and ice cream place did not have what either myself or what my children wanted. Not only that the staff was clueless on how to operate a beverage machine that only had soda in it, there was no non carbonated drinks avaliable the 2 days of our stay. Pizza place on the other had, first didn't have basic toppings to make a pizza and 2 made me wait an about 45 mins for 2 pizzas that were made incorrectly. Not only to mention was given a horrible attitude by the chef cooking the pizza while he was chatting with other employees and texting

Lots of things to do for the 2 - 12 age group.  Rooms are very nice.  Check in is a real BEAR! Try to check in before 1pm or after 3pm.  Take lots of extra money.  Food and souvenirs are very expensive.  But I would take my kids there again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and water park don't listen to the whiners
Summary: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is great. We came here for my son's 5th birthday gift. He love, love, loved it. Yes, it is geared for youner kids. Yes, it's busy but, yes, it's worth it. My 16 year old enjoyed the water park. The staff is fun and friendly and whenever there is an issue they work hard to fix it.   The lines at check in are long so, get there early, or late. Coming at the peak time just like any place leads to lines. They do have staff pass out bracelets and text you when your room is available. Don't wait for the text check back in after a while and just get your key.   We had one problem which is that we paid to have the birthday set up in the suite (which is worth the money. It could sleep 10 to 12 people easy and is larger than some apartments!) But they

It's is a very fun family friendly place. I am definitely going back soon. So is so much to do and all in one place. Good service and great food. All staff is friendly and helpful from the moment you walk in you feel welcomed.

They should have a done a 'Soft Opening' to work out the kinks - and there were quite a few.  Room was not ready until 6.  Was supposed to be notified by text that it was ready - text never came. Had to whine to get a room. Stood in Dunkin Donut Line for 30 minutes. No chairs avaliable in the water park...shouldn't be able to "hold" chairs, especially those areas with tables,  used for eating.   Crazy. Magiquest - moneysuck.... too many kids playing, lined up at the same spots, not much of an "Adventure". Cabin room - bunk beds too small for my boys (12 and 13).  They are not standard sized beds.  This should be noted on the website when making reservations.  Tried to make a dinner reservation before arriving.  Was told reservations were for parties of 8 or more - not true. We

Summary Heading: Take it from a Southern California Gal!
Summary: This is a great place for family fun.  Living in Southern California affords lots of outdoor activities.  But staying in an all-inclusive water park is an adventure for children.  The food, entertainment and resort activities are all right there.  You never have to leave.  They love it!

Summary Heading: Great venue...if they can figure out how to staff for the crowds!!
Summary: Check in wait time was over 2 hours...Lines are too long everywhere, not enough chairs in water park...bring your own folding chair if you want a seat. Brink your own drinks and snacks because lines are 45 minutes long to get a drink or snack. And you will lose your chair!! Drink machines in hotels empty...bring your own bottled water. Dunkin Donuts line 45 -60 minutes and they run out of all the good donuts...so unless you want glazed...gets there at 6 am!! Waited 40 minutes  for a bellman..recycle cans everywhere but no trash cans...go figure. Be sure your kids wear swim shirts to avoid the rough surfaces...and water shoes if you don't want sore feet by day 2!!

Summary Heading: How do you feel about lines?
Summary: I was a bit surprised by how highly rated the park is.  I think it depends on how sensitive you are to lines.  Check in was an hour.   Dinner was 45 minutes.  For breakfast if you just want a cup of coffee you can pay $16 and wait 25 minutes for buffet...or wait 45 minutes in line at dunkin donuts..those are your options.    The lines in water park are reasonable for a theme park.  20 minutes or so.  The kids had fun and that obviously was the goal!  Management mentioned they have major plans to deal with foodservice issues.  For us, it was enough of a hassle we wouldn't return.  So if you don't like lines I suggest you research whether they have improved some of their issues before going.

Arrived around 1 pm even though was emailed 1-4 pm is busiest time to check in. Waited in line 30 minutes to check in. Room wasn't ready, so we went to water park until 4 pm. Went to see if room was ready and was told the room was clean but needed to be inspected. We were told to wait for a text saying the room was ready. Was given room number and we were able to access room, luckily, since we never received the text that the room was ready until 6 pm. We had a kid cabin with a little room with bunk beds and twin bed for the kids. Double bed and sofa bed, so could sleep up to 7 people. Paid over 400 bucks for room (which included admission to water park for 5 for 2 days) and that was with a discount.   Water park was fun with areas for little kids, big kids, and families. My 4

Summary Heading: Way too cold, floor too slippery.
Summary: What is the point of an indoor water park when the air and water inside is SO cold it's warmer outside!  I loved the slides, the food was fine, but none of that matters.  The air temp and the water temp was way too cold to enjoy anything.     I won't be returning but not only that, I'm actively discouraging family neighbor's & friends not to go.  The floor is way too slippery & frankly it is dangerous. I fell, my son fell. I saw patrons of all ages toddler teenager to adult slipping & falling. These people were NOT running. Not even walking fast. I'm a triathlete and have been a lifeguard for years. I'm coordinated and this floor is way too slippery. The Great Wolf Lodge might be a hit in places like Wisconsin or PA where 1) it is freezing outside and 2) there's absolutely

Summary Heading: Spring Break Vacation at the Great Wolf Lodge
Summary: It was extremely inconsiderate of people to put their belongs on chairs in the waterpark area, when there were people that needed a place to sit/eat inside. Putting a towel on a chair to "mark" your spot should not be allowed. Seating should be listed for people who want to sit down. Also, someone picked up my shoes and walked away with them. Luckily, my family member saw the person walking off with our belongs as she was standing next to them and she was able to confront that person.  At night, the kids in the hallway were running up and down the hallways until midnight or so.  I liked that people were allowed to bring in their own water and snacks/food.

I love the fact that you do not have to drive anywhere. You only walk outside your hotel room and go down an elevator to the water park. The water park is amazing. Something for all age levels. I also like the fact that there is also an outside pool. There was a nice selection of restaurants and other activities for the kids This place is genius!

We were extremely underwhelmed by the size of the waterpark and the number of slides, pools, and other attractions. It was also overcrowded, making the lines long and seating difficult to find. There are local rec centers that cost $10/per person that have almost as many slides, pools, and other waterpark features. For $400, we expected WAY MORE. After only using the waterpark on the evening before our stay, we ended up leaving early and paying for an extra day at Disneyland instead. We had to cut our losses.  The hotel itself was very nice and clean. We had a spacious room and the staff was great. The food was a little overpriced, but nothing out of the ordinary for captive-audience eateries.

I commend the cleanliness no matter how the number of kids overwhelm the population of the adults in the hallways, the lobby, etc. Kudos to the staff.  The programs for the kids are awesome. My kids had so much fun that we felt one day here was just not enough. :) Our first night there was to celebrate my birthday and we found ourselves back there again after four days. :D

Cjose here for a vacation because we saw tv adds and heard about it from friends.  We apent 2 nights and 3 days where we didnt have to leave the hotel.  The price was very reaonable for the experience and the staff was excellent.

It's new, therefore it's still clean.  However, customer service for hotel room request is poorly! They need to do better job in training or hiring more staffs for servicing customers' requests. Indoor air quality isn't fresh enough so sometimes it feels really stuffy, and difficult breathing when it's crowded.

We live about an hour from the resort and had a wonderful experience. We have a 6 yr old and she enjoyed the water park and the extra activities when not there. However, it's a little too easy to spend money with the wristbands. Going back soon. Staff was amazing, it was clean and food was really good. Dunkin' Donuts line is ridiculous in the morning for the first couple hours.

Fun and a safe environment for all ages.  Kids can have a variety of games to choose from. All prices are good and affordable. They have great customer service in all areas and a friendly attitude also a lot of assortments for the water park basketball slides the wave pool a kids pool also the lazy river and the boogie board pool with plenty of lifeguards on duty.

Summary Heading: There is a new family hang out in town.
Summary: We tried the newly opened water park, it's indoor and doesn't need to worry about sun/uv exposure. The food in the restaurant is very reasonable and good. The hotel rooms are large and spacious and very clean.

Summary Heading: Great for kids with parents who like water parks
Summary: Great Wolf lodge has a very nice indoor water park.  The temperature is just right and it seems very clean with plenty of different choices.  The four to ten year old crowd will love it.  The rooms are fine and very cute for the kids (We had a wolf den), but not huge.    The experience is expensive and there are plenty of possible add-ons.  My eight year old loved the quests although that was an extra $100 (with the upgraded wand).  The only major negative I have is the gigantic check-in line.  Let people check-in online and have them pick up an envelope with their wrist bands, room assignments, and information at a separate counter from walk-ins. Stop letting people get their rooms early, simply program their wristbands to let them into their rooms starting at 3pm. Have another

Very fun new waterpark in So Cal. If you're not from CA, you may wonder why an indoor waterpark would be great here, but while it's nice and sunny here year-round it's not hot enough for a water park year-round. The day we were at the park, it was 60 degrees out and rained in the morning. So, an indoor park was great.   The best part of this park is that they don't have day passes. The only people who can go to the park are guests of the hotel. So, even at its busiest, it's still not as busy as an average day at Soak City or Raging Waters. They manage the lines quite efficiently compared to other parks, so even though we went during Spring Break, when you would expect huge crowds, the longest lines were maybe 15 minutes long. And, if you want no lines (or very short lines), just

Once you check in, you will have kids activities at your disposal. The resort is clean. The rooms are fun and geared towards families. The kids will enjoy the wolf's den. Best of all the water park has lots of supervision. Safety and fun are their priority.

We had a wonderful time and cannot wait to return. The staff was absolutely wonderful and the entire family had a blast. The breakfast buffet was less than desirable, so I suggest to get breakfast outside of the park.

Great family fun all in one place. No need to leave which was great for us. Bar which was great for us parents. Clean, friendly, affordable...  My only complaint was the bed and pillows.  The beds were kind of hard and the pillows were way too fluffy !  Nitpicking I know but other than that great family fun...or did I say that already?? Lol

Summary Heading: Fun family place, close to Disneyland, lots to do!
Summary: This is a fun diversion to Disneyland and love the shuttle between the two. Traveled with our 12 and 13 year olds boys and though it caters to much younger kids, we all still had a great time. Arcade, video game 4D option, and mini bowling were still enjoyed.  Recommend wearing water shoes and bringing your own towels if you plan to lay out on lounge chairs--also grab those first thing park opens.

I understand I went at spring break, but the resort was overcrowded and way too expensive. For the cost, I would expect more. Nothing was included but a bed and the water park. They nick and dime you from there. The place was clean and most of the staff were friendly. But the kids had a good time and that's all that matters.

We stayed for 2 nights and loved it.  My one area of disappointment was that the staff were overall uninformed about the resort.  They need to have the staff tour and cross-train more throughout the resort so questions about amenities and attractions are not answered with "ask the front desk."  Two nights was really great, I think a 1 night stay would leave you feeling that you couldn't do enough.

I purchased the biggest suite for about $900. It said sleeps 8 .. Which is a joke . The pull out couch was a bit bigger than an arm chair . When I called to have the sofa bed made, I was told to make the bed myself! Seriously !! ... The room looks cheap . There is not enough room for 4 adults 4 kids . The shower was laughable , the curtain was 2 feet shorter than the floor .. So water was every where. A shower curtain in a hotel ! That should have been the first clue of the cheap and shoddy asthetic sense. The towels given at water park are like hand towels .. Small thin and cheap . The food is close to being fast food

Great place in a perfect location. Kids enjoyed the water park and arcade room. Rooms are spacious with plenty amenities. Kids and I could only endure 4 hours at the water park. After a while the indoor smell of chlorine becomes too much.  The outdoor pool is perfectly heated and very enjoyable. Planning additional family activities is a plus and retreating to a waterpark is a perfect family vacation that enjoys water activities. Open long hours so easy to enjoy all times of the day.

Summary Heading: But the commercial looks so fun
Summary: Every year for spring break we take our girls on a trip.  The commercial came on everyday and my daughters were super excited for our trip. We didn't have a great experience and this is a new resort so they have some work to do.  I have several complaints...but I also have some good things to say.  The location is perfect if you are also visiting Disney land.  You can walk to Restaurants around the hotel within minutes. The hotel it self is beautiful.  My concerns....your roomkey/credit card is supposed to be convenient; but it was such a hassel.  You don't need to scan it to get in the water park...but you need it for parking..to get in your room..get ice cream..shopping...vending machines and exiting the garage.  Imagine a line full of people trying to stick their hands out of

This was a vacation where the kids had a fabulous time and the adults got to relax. We stayed for three nights, and were very happy with the condition of the hotel and waterpark. Everything is new of course, so the facilities are impeccable. It was like Vegas for the kids.  We will be back!

This was our 1st time to a great Wolf Lodge.  We had a great time specially our 8 year old daughter.  We just thought $400 a night for 2 adults and 2 kids was a bit pricey. Over all we were pretty satisfied.

Summary Heading: So bad we left early and forfeited a night
Summary: The indoor water park is much smaller than Soak City and noise is deafening. Not enough chairs.  Long lines for slides.  Smallest lazy river I have ever seen.  Fake Chuckie Cheese arcade that is smaller than Chuckie Cheese and pizza is worse.  "Add-on" package for $99 per person just to get the   things in your room to light up is a complete rip-off.  Was supposed to be our spring break trip for the kids but they were tired of it in less than 24 hours so we forfeited our room and went home.  Bunk bed too small for my son    ]

We went to Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove last week, with our 12 year old son and 9 year old daughter. We had a blast and can't wait to return. Not only is it a lot of fun, the staff are so nice and helpful and the rooms were very nice!

Summary Heading: Great Indoor Experience for Sunny California!
Summary: Considering it was an indoor waterpark in Southern California (which is a place which is sunny throughout the year), we had a blast! My kids ages range from 10, 13, & 17 and the hotel had a little bit of fun for each them. The watermark itself caters to kids of all ages wanting to have fun...adults too!!  We will be back...Thanks Great Wolf Lodge for the wonderful family experience!!

Kids and adults alike will love this place and the service is exceptional. Priced on the high end but look for coupons and other deals from.them. The waterpark itself is great but the free activities for the kids is amazing and the staff is ever so ready to help in.any way or form.

Awsome fun for kids, water park is overwhelming with the chlorine, takes some time to get used to. you smell and taste it all day after. it can use some better ventilation, make sure if you want to eat at the resort you make reservations because the waits can be up to 2 hrs. and sometime they don't take reservations because they are full... just book ahead. other than that the family had a blast. I would definitely book again.

Summary Heading: Give it a try at least once!
Summary: For the most part we enjoyed ourselves. Love the concept. And will mostly likely be back however, the sheets on my son's bunk bed were dirty and had a blood stain on them. Sheets seemed to not have been replaced prior to us arriving. Housekeeping did come and change the sheets. It took 45 minutes for housekeeping to come change the sheets, but when they arrived the woman was polite, and quick.  One of the restaurants screwed up our to go order. I understand this place just opened so hopefully over time they will have these kinks worked out.  I was most impressed with the lifeguards at the water park. The amount of lifeguards and their attentiveness was the most appreciated especially when you have kids in the water.  There was some dumb teenager acting like he was drowning and

Summary Heading: Great safe, contained family Overnight Trip
Summary: Overall a well organized and contained experience for families with young children. Fun rides for all ages, great food for value, fun arcade and great gift shop. We had a great time for one night two days. Housekeeping was very helpful.   Shampoo in room should be supplemented by conditioner. Lots of little kids with long hair require more and better product. The pillows are awful and artificial. The valet was jammed for 30 minutes upon exit.The line at Dunkin Donuts took 30 minutes. The value of the wands for the purchase price and experience is very poor.

Great Wolf Lodge Southern California is a GREAT place to stay and play! Absolutely amazing experience! The team, the property, the food ... everything was wonderful! It's enjoyable for ALL ages (grown ups too). My family had such a wonderful time. The water slides are a blast, but everything else is great too.

I really enjoy it, but the room price is little pricy and the pillow is really steep. Beside all of that, everything is good and we will come back there again to visit. I will recommend this resort to my friends and my customers . Have a nice day!!!

Summary Heading: Our family had the time of our life here!
Summary: This is an AMAZING family destination & we can't wait to go again sometime soon!!!  Having the wristband that gets you in the room & pays for stuff is ingenious & so convenient!! Thank you Great Wolf Lodge for a GREAT time had by ALL!!!!

Great place , good food but the service lacked . Easter weekend was busy and I don't think the staffed properly. The kids loved the water park but the hotel check in was a nightmare . Didn't get room until after 4 .....wished I had a difference experience

Great brand but this property needs a lot of tweaking.  Not a lot for adults to do and coffee line obnoxious. The water park itself is amazing but be prepared to spend a lot of money and wait for basic dining amenities once you're dried off

We came to Great Wolf Lodge -Garden Groove to celebrate my sons 7th birthday. My son had googled this location after a visit to ChuckECheese. We spent  an amazing 3 days and 2 nights. There was plenty for our family to do and the food was delicious and priced reasonably. My 3 boys who are 6 and 4 would be exhausted at the end of the evening. Fort Mackenzie was perfect start for my boys.  The slides where fun and especially the water cannons. My older son really enjoyed the Mountain Edge raceway. But my boys absolute favorite was the Crooked Creek. The  water  park was very clean and the staff was  very vigilant with safety.

My family had fun, liked their FB page, and commented that the water was a little on the cold side, and my baby's (3 years old) lips turned blue in one of their indoor pools. Another mom commented and agreed, and said her baby (1 year old) was shivering. The Great Wolf Lodge blocked me for just giving an honest review. I guess they don't want people knowing their kids will be cold.

Summary Heading: Didn't quite meet expectations but it's worth one visit
Summary: Overall we had a good time and so did the kids (ages 13, 9 5). The staff was all very nice, check in process was easy, although the next day we saw quite the line at check in, must have hit it at the right time. Our first impression was the room. We got the kids bunk room with the wolf den with bunk beds. The younger kids enjoyed it. Overall the room was just so small. We got used to it, but for the price (even considering water park tickets are included) it was so small and extremely basic. I'm glad we came shortly after opening. I can see how these rooms could look quite run down in the years to come but for now they are still clean.  The next impression was the water park. This was our first visit to a Great Wolf, but based on pictures of other properties we were expecting a

The hotel was nice but the power went out, and everyone had to get out of the water, then we had the Great Wolf Workout walking up 3 flights of stairs with babies and young kids, while my mom was stuck on the 1st floor in her power chair until an elevator became available. Be careful of the horse carousel in the arcade the handle came off while my grand baby was riding it...luckily he didn't fall...

Summary Heading: Great New Place in SoCal to take the family
Summary: You will have lots of fun rain or shine. There are things for kids of all ages to do, even when you're out of the water there are fun activities to keep everyone busy. Disneyland and Downtown Disney are close by and many restaurants to choose from if you don't want to eat at the resort. It is super convenient that your wristband is a key to your room and a "wallet" so you can charge things to your room without having to carry a credit card or cash.

Excellent, we appreciate taking us in earlier than the check in time. We felt safe by the pool area. Lots of staff and lifeguards. Food was a little expensive. Towels were provided even by the pool area. We love the indoor pool.

An amazing place to take the kids!  The moose lodge food is great. Good prices all around.  The water park was a blast.  Good variety of slides and activities for young and older children, as well as the adults!!

My three kids had a blast!  Great environment and experience. From the place to staff members top notch!  My two year old daughter wanted to stay longer and move close to this great place! Our 8 hour trip to this place is all worth the admission. We're already making a plan for our next visit.

Summary Heading: Fun for the price and location
Summary: This was our first time and we had a great time! Beats going to a regular outdoor water park with the sun beating down on you AND you can easily return to your room do shower and go out! It's 10 mins south of Disneyland so there's plenty of stuff to do. One night is not enough to take advantage of this.

You must offer conditioner as you're a waterpark and hair gets extremely affected by chlorine! The rooms don't have any view and are dark and the mattresses are uncomfortable. The waterpark doors should remain open to the outside as it gets incredibly hot and stuffy and chlorine odored! The elevators were too long to get on as was the line for Dunken Doughnuts and the wait to eat at the restaurant. More outside cabanas would be ideal too and we were not told the inference between indoor and outdoor cabanas and so we were given indoor and never knew those are in the baby pool section.

I have already given my review on social media, resulting in several friends booking as well as a future visit for my family. For 2 kids and 1 adult I spent $700.00 for 1 night. That only included the wands & Magic Quest as well as the suite that I ended sleeping in the bunk beds, and some burgers & snacks. As a single mom, it was a lot of money but my kids minds were blown! I only wish the specials that you are running now were available before you opened. My future booking with the passes cost me almost as much as 1 night in the suite for 2 nights!

We booked a 1 night stay at Great Wolf Lodge for our daughters 9th birthday. While the kids really enjoyed themselves I felt that it was just alright. The rooms were big and clean but quality was average. Staff at the bar wasn't friendly at all. I would have also enjoyed a place for parents to Lou he or relax while older kids are at arcade or playing magi quest game.

The resort was clean and a lot of fun. There were people constantly picking up towels left by guests which was great. The only reasons that I didn't give it 5 starts is because we rented a cabana that had cigarette butts on the ground and because the lines for riding rides was confusing and made it easy for people to cut in front of the lines. I I also never received the pack and play that was requested both in my reservation and when I called the front desk, along with the diaper pail. Otherwise our stay was great. We will most likely visit again during a non peak season when the prices are not as high. They seemed to be inflated due to being during spring break.

Summary Heading: Like a Vegas resort for kids.
Summary: When you in Vegas staying on the strip that hotel tries to make sure food, games and entertainment are convenient. Similar so does the Great Wolf Lodge for children. You will also spend like your staying at a Vegas Casino.         Our children 6 & 3 had more entertainment than they could handle in 2 days. The carni/video games are not overly hard or as impossible as some places make them, the prizes were decent.  The food was ok, wish there was also the more variety but they definitely have healthier options on the menu. Their Quest game seemed like a hit, our children were to young to get the whole game, although there are people in costumes who will help you out.         Customer service was sincere and attentive. There were more than one times when a associate saw some minor

Summary Heading: Fun for all, but be very vigilant of your kids
Summary: Stayed there for 1 night and 2 full days. It was plenty of time for us to enjoy the water park, bowling, glow golf, arcade. My kids (8,5,3) all had a fantastic time. There needs to be more restaurant choices, and/or more hours of availability. The crowds at meal times were crazy. Also, the water park can get extremely crowded and I felt there wasn't enough staff monitoring the rides. I lost my 8 year old for 15 minutes b/c he was stuck at the top of a ride and no one was there to let us at the bottom know. Security finally found him but it could've been easily prevented had there been someone up at the top watching the kids. Besides this experience, my kids can't wait to return.

Great Wolf Lodge is a fun place for all kids of all ages.  There's a variety of fun activities.   Kids had a blast on all the slides and the arcade.   The younger children enjoyed all the activities,  including,  bingo,  pj party and story time.

This place has small very small room, even if you get the suite! Also be aware that all sinks are outside of the restroom! Our children had fun, even though the toddler section was closed since a hold had used the restroom in the pool so my toddlers were limited to what they could do. Make sure when you go you don't pay more than $200/night, anything more than that is really not worth it.

Non functioning elevators, rushing to get kids out.of the water areas due to an electric surge.  I had scared kids due to the incident, and was concerned regarding the safety of a power surge happening around all the water.

The water park is fun. We did struggle to find a place to sit and leave our bags and towels. The amount of seating seems to not meet the demands of the guests. I made some kind of mistake in regards to the room I booked. My kids were disappointed but they got over it. We did have fun, especially later in the evening when the lines died down.

Place is amazing! Location is great! Has so many activities to do with your kids, but be willing to spend a little money. Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable! Ordered room service from Hungry as a Wolf Pizza and food was tasty and was delivered to the room sooner than expected. Loved the whole wristband concept especially when getting in the room. Only thing I didn't like was that my room was not ready at the check in time. We only stayed a day, so having to sit and wait for a text with 2 anxious kids until my room was ready was a big bummer. Got our room at about 4:30pm and once we got in our room and got dressed it was about 5:00. All together, we got about 3 hours at the waterpark which was fine. Other than that, had a great experience, I will definitely recommend to

A great atmosphere for the kids as well as the adults and my kids loved it cant wait to go back.  The only down fall was the electronic went out when we were on the elevator but they had everything running in no time.

Summary Heading: Amazing family time at the Great Wolf! Exceeded expectations!
Summary: We had such a great time at Great Wolf!!! It didn't feel crowded, lots of life guards, kids were totally entertained in and out of the water. More options for cabanas would be nice, and servers that come to you lounge chairs would have been especially nice and would put the resort at a 5 star. The bathtub is super slippery but our Great Bear suite was perfect! Room service would be nice too! Overall a fabulous time was had by all!

Waterpark and hotel was fantastic,  avoid the breakfast buffet buffet (items were over cooked such as the waffles,  under cooked such as the tater tots,  or did not look appetizing such as the sausage gravy.  The kids loved the Wolf den and the water park.   Will definitely come back.  Everyone working seemed to have fun and were enthusiastic.

Summary Heading: Had a blast with my grandkids
Summary: So much fun for the weekend, water park small but had all you need for kids and adults. Bring lots of dry cloth, can be a bit cold walking to access your room from water park! Rooms are clean and warm

Beautiful rooms and lots of fun activities for the kids. Strongly recommend the Paw Pass, great value for activities around hotel. My only problem was the strong chlorine odor in the water park my daughter had a had time breathing after a few hours and we had to leave.

Checking in is a mess very disorganized Water park so noisy. There's towels everywhere don't see staff trying to clean specially the bathroom / restroom No jacuzzi for adults to relax  Gym is like a gym of a motel looks old  Kids if lost there's no safety setup unlike some other great wolfs lodge all parents information is included on their wrist bands

I took my kids here for spring break and they had an amazing time and the staff was so friendly and they had so many activities to keep the kids busy during the stay. My daughter loved it so much we booked her bday there, so we will be returning in two months.

Great Resort Plenty Of Fun For ALL.... Pool Water can be a little warmer but still a great place to take the kids of all ages your sure to enjoy all the fun this resort has to offer from sun up to sun down.

My overall rating for yhe place was excellent. Staff was super friendly. We stayed during Spring break and paid $489 after taxes. My kids loved the place. There were plenty of activities until about 9:30 pm.   The room has a small refrigerator and a microwave. I recommend bringing something to eat as the restaurants can get very crowded. The waiting time to get a table was 40 minutes around 7 pm. An entree can cost you $17 a plate. Downstairs, there is a pizza place that charges reasonably. They also offer a half order of pasta which was around $7.  The only thing that I didn't like was that someone pooped in the slide are of the toddler pool. What the crew did was sprayed the area and wiped it. That was it! Usually they close down the pool , but that was not the case. There

I came here in a Thursday and Friday so I think that's why it wasn't too crowded, which I loved.   The room: Two queen beds and was a perfect size room for a family of 4. Very clean with a "lodge cabin" design. Everything was nice and clean. The pillows were very thick, so if you like thinner pillows, bring your own. The mattress was comfortable.   Restaurants/Food: The food was pretty good. At the pool, we had hamburgers which my kids loved and the hamburger bun was sooo soft. The chicken strips were good with not too much breaking. They also offer salads with grilled chicken which was also good.  We didn't make dinner reservations early enough, so when we called, they were already booked. But, we were able to order, pick it up and bring it to our room. I had the steak which

Definitely a great place for kids. Very clean. Service was kinda spotty. Some of the people there were great and very helpful. Others were not customer oriented at all. The check in process was below average. The person checking us in didn't explain much.  Others seemed to go into more detail.  Wristbands didn't always work for purchasing items but could always give room number and name to charge. Decent food options. We stayed 3 nights, but two probably would be fine.  The wolf den suite isn't necessarily worth the extra money but not a bad experience for 9 year olds.

We decided to take our two children to this resort over spring break. Our kids ages are 8 and 13 in addition to 2 adults.  We checked in on Friday around 7PM and there were only a few people in line. Check in was easy and the front desk clerk checked us in promptly and explained everything to us.   They have  self parking that is free with your hotel stay or you can choose $10 per night for Valet.  We decided to valet because we had driven in and didn't feel like taking the car to self park.  $10 for valet in California is the lowest I have ever paid.  We had reserved a Wolf Den room and it came with a set of bunk beds and 1 other bed plus a sofa that could turn into a bed.  The room was outfitted with fridge and a microwave, separate bathroom.  The bathroom was OK, I expected

Disappointed in lost and found policy.  Head of security informed us it is "too much work" to look through all the stuff in lost in found about an item that was lost the same day and that we had to fill out a form.  We were already leaving the resort and were told we would be contacted in 2 business days regarding the lost item.  If found the item could either be picked up or mailed at "our" cost. Hearing about lost and found policies from other resorts, this seemed like a substandard policy for returning lost items

My husband,  2 year old son and I stayed overnight on March 8. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and the themed room was truly a magical experience for my son. The manager was gracious as were the entire staff. Will certainly be returning.

Had a really good time with my family....very friendly staff....Eric Libid took really good care of us also made our stay was a memorable one.....we can wait for our next visit.....my kids enjoyed the water park also they loved the room setup....they had their own space with the kids cabin suite.....great all around place for family

Your stay at the hotel includes access to the water park.  This is a small scale park and most features are geared towards 12 and under.  The food at the hotel is mediocre so get in your car and travel a few miles for good food.    We stayed in room with a den which again these bunks are for smaller children 10 and under.  The food at the dinner buffet was pricey for the quality.

Great place to be at home  We love it the room staff & parking too would go back in a heartbeat  Good times had by all.give it a try You will be surprised at this place. Shuttle to park was excellent coming& going.they gave us free ears!how cool is that?

Summary Heading: Spring Break with the Boys ages 4 and 6.
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights between 03/23/16-03/25/16 in a family suite.  Check in took a while, but it was due to the staff explaining various items in detail to the guests.  Our room was ready when we checked in around 1pm.   The room was clean but very basic. There was a microwave, coffee maker and fridge that was a nice touch.  Bed were comfortable.  It got loud in the hall ways, so bring a noise generator if noise bothers you.  Also stay away from the rooms near the elevators.  There are the Magicquest game consoles outside the doors of the room. With kids congregated around the consoles from 9am to night.  One review mentioned to bring something for the kids to cover up on their way back to the water park. The Waterpark is warm, the hallways are cold.  So a robe really comes in

Had a great family trip would really recommed and definetly come back . I think its a great place to not fot the su?er but all year long. I will consider having my boys birtgday party there. I will reco.ene yo all my friends and family to experience the fun and exictment. Greaat mini vacation.

I had an amazing time at the Great Wolf Lodge! One of the best family experiences I've had. Not only was the indoor water park incredible, but the arcade and mini golf was a super smart choice. The food was amazing as well. It was super convenient to have the a food stand in the pool area so we didn't have to go inside! I was able to enjoy some amazing  sweet potato fries with a nice burger right by the pool. The indoor food was great as well. They offered lots from the menu. I ended up ordering Chicken and Waffles and it was no mistake! Amazing food and service. Props to the Chef! I plan to visit again!

My family had a great time. The kids had lots to do and the food was great. The water park is amazing and it happens to be the only indoor water park in California. The staff enjoy their work and provided great service. 8/8 would go again.

Summary Heading: Beware lodging on the first floor at Great Wolf Lodge - S. California
Summary: Although told at check-in about how wonderful it was to be given a room close to the water park, it turned out the room (105) was directly over the maintenance area in the basement.  We were awoken in the middle of night both nights we were at the Great Wolf Lodge resort by hammering.  When we complained the first night, we were told that an email would be sent to the maintenance director and the hammering would not happen again.  Not an improvement, however.  The second night, we again was awoken by hammering at 1:30 am, went to the front desk immediately, and complained again.  This was not an enjoyable experience on vacation with grandkids.  Who puts a maintenance area directly under guest rooms, and then uses it in the middle of the night?

Summary Heading: Great Wolf Lodge, a JOY for families.
Summary: I was so impressed.  The environment felt safe and warm and your staff is very attentive and genuinely seem to enjoy their work.  The lifeguards in particular were excellent.  They enforce the GWL rules, but not at the expense of fun.   At the very least, we will visit annually.  My 5 YO daughter cried when we left.

Great time.  Kids had a wonderful time!  Great room.  Lots of fun stuff to do.  Cant wait to go back with the kids!  Only bad service was wait staff at sit down dinner auctioned off food...and brought glasses to table by holding around the rim...Not Good.  If I am going to have 100.00 dinner I do now want waitstaff coming to my table and "who gets the steak?" " Who gets the salad?" Use pivot point please.  Learn to hold a glass correctly please. Park itself was great. Lots to do.

Hope management and employees improve guest relations or future prospects could be effected! Arguing with clients who have already commited their time and finances for the enjoyment of their loved ones diminishes the fun for all.

There are many things to like about GWL. The waterpark has lots of activities, is included with the price of lodging and available from 1pm on the day of arrival and all day on your departure day. Almost all other activities (arcade, bowling, MagiQuest, character scavenger hunt, kid's spa, laser frenzy, mini golf, simulated ride and all food) cost extra.   We stayed in a class of rooms called the wolf den which is a room with a partially enclosed section with bunk beds that is made to look like a cave and has its own TV. The room also has a sofa bed, queen bed, mini fridge and microwave. My boys (9 & 11) loved the wolf den.   Since we were celebrating my youngest child's birthday, we opted for birthday package ($69.99) which included 1/4 sheet cake that says "Happy Birthday"

We have 4 kids ages 10, 6, 4 and 18 months.  The great wolf lodge had so many different activities for the kids that made their experience so fun and memorable.  It was so nice to be able to be in one place and not have to drive anywhere else once we were there.  So convenient!  Our kids loved it!

Overall good for older kids to roam themselves. TOO slippery and even water shoes don't work great. Valet left my $50,000 vehicle in the valet line for 13 hours, with the windows down and did not contact me about it until 2am!! They called my room and scared the daylights out of me. Who does that!!?? Not ok!! It was damp out and that could have ruined my leather seats. They could have called over a PA system, or looked up my personalized license plate (my name spelled out clearly), or checked my registration in the car...something. The manager apologized and gave a discount but that was unacceptable. I would be afraid to come back and have my vehicle left again without anyone knowing.

My 9 year old really had fun at Great Wolf Lodge. We will definitely go again. We loved the water park. My only complaints are about the room we stayed in. The air conditioning/heating system was very loud we had a hard time falling asleep because of it. Also, our t.v. in our room didn't work.

Both the adults as well as the children enjoyed the experience.   The water park was nice & cozy, they were very well staffed, the room was nice for the value.  There's an outdoor pool.  For me personally I would have liked a jacuzzi to accompany the pool, but still all was well!!!!    Also other acticvities for an additional fee such as miniature golf, XD theater, etc.

Summary Heading: Great water adventure for the kids!
Summary: What a great experience for the family and a nice Freindly Hotel in enviroment.  The staff was great and extremely friendly. They made you feel right at home. My five-year-old daughter was in heaven as we stayed three days she got to experience so many things

Great wolf lodge- SoCal is awesome! Family and kid friendly. There is something for everybody including adults. The food is resonably priced and there is a good variety of it. From check-in until check-out all the employees were extremely friendly and willing to help with any questions, every step of the way. There are a so many lifeguards watching and tending to the children, I felt confident that nothing major would happen if I let the kids go off and explore without me. MagiQuest is a must do, gives kids the opportunity to go out on a scavenger hunt type adventure, while allowing the adults to sit back a relax for a few hours. It was a great experience we will definitely be going back!

Expensive for what you get, but the kids had a great time.  The rooms were cute (we stayed in the Wolf Den and the kids loved the bunk beds.  The waterpark is great, but with little kids it can be a little overwhelming.

The visuals as you pull up are impressive because of the size.  Check in staff were great, the rooms were outstanding is size and quality and the waterpark was awesome.  Even at 6'8" 260 lbs, I was able to get on the slides and have a great time with my kids.

We had a great experience when we stayed at the Great Wolf Lodge.  Everything was clean and comfortable and the people that work there were all friendly and helpful.  There were not too many guests when we went (mid-week) so it was really nice to be able to do everything we wanted with out long lines.  The waterpark was awesome - it's a little "steamy" feeling in the waterpark area when you first walk in, but that feeling disappears quickly once you've been in there for a few minutes.  We LOVED the wave pool. The lifeguards were very attentive and all seemed to be on their game as far as paying attention.  We will definitely be going back!

We had 6 kids from 10-16 years old and 3 adults. We all had a really good time. Safe environment for the kids to go off in groups or pairs to different activities. My favorite part was the wristbands that work for your room key and to charge to your room at any store/restaurant in the hotel. Didn't have to carry a purse, or hear "can I have $5?" a million times a day. Overall kind of pricey, but totally worth it. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. Room was nice but we didn't spend a lot of time in it cuz there were so many other fun things to do.

Summary Heading: Not exactly what we thought it would be
Summary: Resort way to over crowded. Not enough seating area in the water park. Park not really suitable for all ages. The temperature of the water is not warm enough. The atmosphere temperature is not warm enough you get cold while waiting in line. Food was not great. I would def not recommend the park for families with children 3 and younger.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for sharing this with us! We are deeply saddened to learn of the difficulties your pack encountered in the water park and while dining with us, as this experience is not typical for us. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.   We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss this with you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Plenty of parking, plenty of things to do-food is priced a little high as is the toys for the kids. Need a parking attendant 24 hrs to help is you have a problem. More seating is needed for family to watch or relax. need more fans so parent s are comfortable in water area.

One of the only places that accommodates very young kids.... my 3 and 5 year old were never once bored and for the price you pay there was SOOOO much free stuff included! The staff was very friendly and made you feel like family, each and every one of them!!  HIGH RECOMMEND!

Resort was very clean. Everything was freshly painted since it opened only a month ago. Elevators was a lil rocky and line to check in was long but other than that it was great. Kids had a blast. Can't wait to go back!

great time with the family, very clean, very safe. the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, the life guards were the most disciplined I have ever seen at a water park, very well organized and friendly :)

It was fun to stay a Great wolf lodge. My 13 year old daughter loves Magiquest  a lot.  It took almost a day to complete a mission.  Rides are fun too. My 10 year old boy enjoyed a lot .  Bucket Incredible (a hamburger restaurant) in the swimming pool was horrible though.

Kids and grandkids had a WONDERFUL time at the hotel.  They were thrilled with the "kid cabin" and "wolf den" in the rooms.  The waterpark was hard to get them out of, They also really enjoyed the magiquest and all the fun things for them to do.  Food was very good.  Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: The most expensive indoor water park ever
Summary: My daughter wanted to celebrate her 8th birthday at the new GWL in SoCal. We had never been before but I thought an indoor water park would be a great place to celebrate. The only way to access the water park is to stay at the resort which on its' surface sounds like a great plan because 1) your stuff is all right there and 2) less people at the resort. Wrong and wrong. The website said we could arrive as early as 1 pm for swim time. We arrived around 2 to check-in. We pulled up to chaos at the front door. I guess if you are valeting your car then you also can't use a bellhop. Because as soon as we told them no for the valet, they told us to go to the parking garage and then moved on to the next car. Regardless, we unloaded while about 10 other families were unloading and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for bringing this to our attention! We are incredibly sorry to read about the difficulties your pack encountered upon arrival, as this experience does not meet our standards. We will share your concerns with the respective teams to discuss and review for future guests.   We would like to dig into this for you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: The place is packed with plenty of activities for kids. You will not run out of things to do. The water park is great!!! The place is very family oriented. My son had so much fun and would like to come back again anytime soon....

Summary Heading: A fun time had by all
Summary: We stayed one night at the Great Wolf Lodge. It is a bit $$.  If all you are interested in is the water park, one night is enough.  There are other activities to take part in.  I highly suggest water shoes. It can get very slippery in the park. Walk gingerly.  The slides are fun for both kids and adults.  The chlorine smell is pretty intense and can 'burn' your eyes and if you have asthma it might affect that as well.  There are lockers in the park area for your valuables. There's a bar outside for the adults. We didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food. The resort is close to restaurants so it's nice to escape for a bit if you wish. Overall we (5 adults, 5 kids) had a great time.

I do not like that you have Magiquest as an extra activity. It's too time consuming. Time wasted that could be spent with what you came for - the amazing waterpark!  Very disappointed about it and my son didn't even get to complete quest. It's truly a shame that you have built in this activity into the resort experience. My husband and I hated it.

We had a very positive experience. The person who greeted and checked us in was very friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed the free wolf ears and welcoming us to the wolf family. The place is clean, well decorated, had friendly staff, and offers variety of family fun activities. We totally enjoyed the water park and the fact that we could use the facility all the way to closing even after we checked out.

We went here for my daughters 9th birthday!! We took 3 friends and they loved it!!us adults had a great time also!! I would recommend it to all my friends with kids to stay here!! We will be visiting again soon!!

Advise to go during the week. Weekends are too packed. Also, make sure you get the room you actually are paying for. Bring money. You need to pay for all the extra activities like bowling, mini-golf, movie (which is only a 5 minute 6D movie) and the arcade. Food is a bit pricey.

We had a great time, everyone is very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend it to anyone, lots of options! There are a lot of fun slides to go on! Everyone should go at least once!😄

Summary Heading: Great slides for kids under 48 inches in height
Summary: We have stayed at other GWL resorts.  Comparatively this resort is smaller than other GWL, so it feels like the slides & people are on top of each other.  But service was great everywhere, food is pricey for the value, but you are a captive audience so they get away with it.  And long lines for everything from restaurants to riding the slides to finding a place to sit.  We enjoyed ourselves though.

Summary Heading: My stay could have been better
Summary: our stay at great wolf lodge could have been better. My son is 43 inches tall every time we stepped in the water park they measured him the first day we were they they gave him a yellow wristband was having fun going on the slides he was allowed and then out of nowhere was approached by one of the staff and measure him again an said he was to small for that wristband. I didn't think anything of it and thought maybe it was a mistake coming in. The next day we entered the water park again was measured again given a yellow wristband rode the slides then again the same the happend it was taken away  for no reason was told he was to small at that point I was upset and my son being 5 was really upset he's the main reason we came to great wolf lodge. I went to the entrance had them

Summary Heading: If you're gonna pay the price, take advantage of the water park.
Summary: To make this trip worth it, make sure your hours are spent in the waterpark! all other activities can wait until water park is closed or your are over the waterpark. But overall great family fun. Food was reasonably priced, alcoholic drinks was a MAJOR plus. We stayed during the week and longest line for a water slide was less than 5mins.

Summary Heading: Worse stay EVER. Do NOT go to Great Wolf Lodge!!!!
Summary: slept on poo stained sheets, had broken tv.. birthday package for my child was NOT in the room... quality of pillows and beds are cheap. Horrified by our trip. COMPLETELY OVER PRICED for quality. Drinks were terrible at the grill restaurant. Food was good though. Waterpark was fun. Do NOT drop a penny at the nail spa.. $49 for a pedicure to sit on a HARD bench no spa chair and they use CHEAP nail polish.
