They say ice cream spa.. but you don't even get ice cream there they give you a voucher to the ice cream store and you have to stand around and eat your ice cream in the halls because no seating area.... my 9 year old LITTLE tiny toe nails cost me $55 dollars for a pedicure.. RIDICULOUS. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT ... you want quality stay for LESS stay at the California Adventure

it feels like paying for 1 day, but staying 2, somehow i love deals, and it was 20% off per room due to grand opening, great for locals, i will love to go back again during summer, because you don't get sunburn.

4 year old grandson had the time of his life. He seemed to like it even better than Disney. Pool area air and water temperature are perfect combo to keep kids comfortable and not chilled.  It wasn't overly crowded and there was no waiting in lines.  Room was quiet and comfortable.  We will be back. 😀

The best customer service you will ever receive and so much fun for the whole family. Food is delicious and well priced. Walking from my room to the water park at least 10 staff members greater me and asked how I was doing😃

This place has a very poor manangement and staff.  It's such a poor quality that it's so sad.  We've experienced this place and won't be going back even if they only charged $100.  They need to learn and teach how to treat guest who are paying lots of money. The staff member treats you like trash.  If your spending this kind of money look more into other places that has better quality sleep and staff.  I can't see how long this place will last.  Well waiting to complaint there was at least 10 people waiting in line for mistrement from a staff.

Summary Heading: Great local fun with the family
Summary: Great indoor waterpark park but dinning was horrible. Won't spend another 100 dollars on bad service, don't mind spending it but give me the service and respect. Over all the location is well over staffed, clean hope it can stay like this in time.

Summary Heading: Very family friendly, but be prepared to pay
Summary: Very family friendly, but be prepared to pay, worth the money.  Onsite, everything was a premium, perhaps in excess, but the staff and cleanliness outweighed the cost sand cleanliness.  Good value, but you might want to bring healthy snacks :)

Summary Heading: Nice Place to stay and fave FUN for a family with young kids!
Summary: We were here with our 2 boys (9 and 13) and their 2 (9 and 14) friends. It was a B-Day Party stay :) They had blast playing in the water park. We did not have time to play any other games in the hotel. We stayed for 1 night and 2 days, and it was enough!  Dinning experience was little disappointed at Lounge Grill:  waiting time for the reservation was 65 min instead of 25-30 min that they promised, and after that we had to wait another 20 min to get served. It was 9 pm when we got in, Kids were really hungry and tiered. Food was good. It just waiting time that disappointed us. Overall experience was really good. since its a very new location, I just hope they will keep this place clean and safe for a long time

Summary Heading: So happy we decided to visit the Great Wolf Lodge So Cal!
Summary: We had an awesome experience! So much fun for all of us! Food was great, rooms were clean and beautiful, water park was a blast! We had two family groups spending the night together in two rooms, the accommodated us in being next to each other. Our ages ranged from 3 to 46 and everyone (even the teens) had a blast! Well worth the money spent and if you get the chance to visit...go for it! Loved it!

It's all brand new, clean and fun! it's expensive but it's fair for a brand new hotel/ waterpark resort... I love the slides and this Great wolf lodge is far better than the one in washington (in my opinion)... This is great for kids. We brought our own food and drinks so we were able to save some money...

Awesome family fun!  Super fast check-in (and they let us in even earlier than advertised).  Room was nice and very clean.  We didn't leave the resort at all - everything we needed was right there.  Great lunch and dinner and of course, Dunkin Donuts for breakfast - how can you beat that?  Waterpark blew us away.  SOOOO much fun and a great way to unwind after two crazy, busy days at Disneyland.  We loved our stay at Great Wolf and can't wait to go back again.

Summary Heading: Excellent waterpark. Rooms only "okay" for the price. You are paying for the water park here, primarily.
Summary: We stayed here for one night on Friday, March 18 to celebrate our son's birthday.. First impressions were that the hotel was very clean and employees were immediately friendly and helpful. However, signage was mostly absent, leaving us to "guess" where most things were located. Signs in the elevators would have been helpful, or labels with each floor listing what could be found on each floor. The waterpark entrance was actually what looked like a giftshop selling swimwear. We walked by it several times looking for the waterpark entrance before I realized it was INSIDE the giftshop.   We stayed in a Family Suite and my impression was that the room was smaller than I expected, but it was plenty of space for our family of 4. I appreciated the sofa bed, as our boys have a hard time

Summary Heading: Strong Bonds best location for military families
Summary: We just hosted a Strong Bonds event for California Air Force families and the service at GWL was AMAZING. The staff went above & beyond our hopes. They were extremely polite and very professional. There aren't enough words to express our appreciation for GREAT WOLF LODGE SOCAL employees. The accommodations were very nice as well. The waterpark was very well received by all the family members. It is my hopes that we will continue to host our Strong Bonds here for the years to come. You guys are outstanding and we thank you for all the hard work & awesome service you all provide! Personally, I thank you for the moments my family and I made here at your waterpark. The memories of FUN we had are PRICELESS.. Bravo!!!

For starters, the staff couldn't have been  more helpful this weekend-on par with what you get on a  Disney Cruise.   Checked in @3pm. Our room was ready, but kids went straight to park and we just had bellmen deliver our luggage to room. Checkin took about 5 minutes.  We ate at the park-not too expensive, about 10 dollars per kid.  That night we let the kids do the 3D virtual reality experience. They loved it (8 girls, all  age 10.) We chose the "los Banditos" experience as it was not too scary. it is a western shootout" game, so if that is unappealing, don't waste your money. We did not do Magic Quest as we did not have time but have done it before and it is a great experience for the kids, the game itself and the freedom to move about hotel finding clues. Parking was free for

Had an amazing time at the Great Wolf Lodge with our 2 and 6 year old daughters. Will definitely be going back at some point in the future. There are so many activities to keep you busy, and places to get food at the hotel, that we never had to leave from the time we checked in until we checked out.

Great food here at the buffet with a lot of variety. There's even a carving station and salad bar for those who don't like meat. Everything is freshly made, with made to order Italian deli sandwiches. The cheese and food display looks amazing and delicious 😋 They had much more food at their ther restaurants if you don't feel like a buffet, with burgers and macaroni and bacon. I'd definitely take the family here again! I had the pleasure to meet executive chef Hany Ali and thank him for the wonderful food. All the staff were nice and polite too. Would recommend any family looking for a great vacation to check this out!  The waterpark here is very roomy and there are many lifeguard to make see everyone is safe. The staff smile and greet us when we walk by, unlike other hotels.

The Great Wolf Lodge is a great addition to SoCal family attractions.  The hotel is beautiful, the staff is attentive and kind, and the water park is fantastic.  I recommend water shoes, as the flooring in the park is rather slippery.  Fun slides and pool attractions for kids and adults of all ages.

Summary Heading: Great Family Fun and Best food of any of the Great Wolf Lodges
Summary: We had a blast there . They have multiple water slides and Magiquest and even a Flowrider wave surfer .   And the food was delicious . The head chef Hany Ali is very involved in the food throughout the property and has excellent skills and food choices and the menus are all delicious . The wood burning oven pizzas were exceptional not only in comparison to the other Great Wolf Lodges but compared to the best pizza places I've ever eaten

We had so much fun during our stay here. The water park was great. We loved the slides and variety of slides. The hotel was fun as well. The kids den in the bedroom was great. It was interactive with the magi quest wands which our son loved. The magi quest game was a lot of walking all around the hotel and somewhat confusing. But the staff was good to help out. We highly recommend it. Having said all this, it was still a little pricey which will effect our ability to stay more or for longer periods.

Summary Heading: Must stay in So Cal for kids beside the beaches
Summary: Brand spanking new, that's all I needed to say!  Not often you'll find anything in So Cal new built, conveniently located to other attractions i.e. Disneyland.  Safe environment for kids, beware of the game rooms....$$$

Summary Heading: Midweek Getaway Surprise for our kids!
Summary: We surprised our 2 daughters and they found out about this incredible place when they walked in the lobby. My 11 yr old said "this is so cool, I love this place". My 14 yr old was also thrilled when she looked out the big windows and saw the waterpark for the first time! This is the first Wolf Lodge in CA and we are excited they are here. I love the architecture and all the wood, carvings, animal pictures, etc. Plenty of things to do besides the waterpark. Enjoy the compactness of the waterpark and the lines are so much shorter than Knotts Soak City or the former Wild Rivers. From one line you can ride several different slides/tubes. They also have a big kids outdoor pool if you need some sun. No sunscreen needed since it is indoor and food, towels, etc. is all around you. We

We gave this overnight stay at Great Wolf Lodge to our Grandkids as a Christmas present.  We all loved everything about our stay...The staff, food was kid friendly,  so much to do, we were busy the entire two days...We had to check out at 11AM but stayed the entire day.  I cannot think of any negatives regarding Great Wolf..The entire family had a wonderful time..

I enjoy the great wolf lodge brand, as I've been to many other locations in Texas, Ohio, and Washington. Given that this one is brand new, I expected more - however it's quite small and still unorganized from being new. Birthday surprise is a waste of money, don't get it.

Our stay was very good. The resort is very convenient and the value is very good however there are PLENTY of opportunities to spend money while in the resort so watch out if you tend to be a impulse shopper(they make spending money very convenient). The waterpark was great. Our children are 6,4,2 and they had tons of fun but the park would have been more fun for them if they were about 4-5 years older.

Great wolf lodge is definitely a family friendly resort.  We stayed in the wolf den where the kids loved to sleep in the bunk beds. My only suggestion would be if you plan to get the magi quest wand get it before going to your room because I hear the wand works inside the room to move the characters. Every employee is wonderful but if you plan on going to the moose lodge you have to request Melanie. She was simply amazing and what made our experience there over the top!! I would recommend Great Wolf Lodge 1000 times!

Thank you for providing my grandchildren a wonderful experience. We had a little concern after some mixed opening reviews but our experience from beginning to end could not have been better. Our room was a nice size, not fancy but functional and comfortable. the bed was so comfy after a long day at the waterpark. We were very impressed with the staff EVERYWHERE. We thought the lifeguards were on top of things without being overly aggressive. We felt our grandchildren were in a safe environment. We like that there was enough variety for all ages to enjoy the park. We will definitely consider coming again in the future. We ate dinner in the wood Fired Grill and found our food to be quite delicious and at a reasonable cost. I liked the house Mai Tai and the AGL Margarita was quite

Summary Heading: Fabulous SoCal option as long as you keep a few things in mind...
Summary: I want to preface this by saying that I had no expectations whatsoever. We heard about this place on the radio and thought it was a wonderful new option for us SoCal people. I'm glad we got to check it out during the first month of it opening. I read reviews but really came with an open mind. The website I feel was pretty sparse with details (no prices, poor details with room description, etc). I want to start this review a tad differently. I wanted to list up front a few things to keep in mind... - This is not a luxury resort (ie Montage, Ritz, 4S, etc). So don't expect 5 star anything. If you keep that in mind, you will be able to appreciate it more. - When we went, capacity was approx 30-50%. I based this on the parking lot's 1st floor being only half filled and by asking

This is a great resort for kids, but expensive for parents!🙊  The parking structure is huge and so are the grounds of the resort.   Given that workers are brand new and still working out their kinks, check in was quick until later I realized the person who checked us in failed to mention a few things. She didn't mention the passes that could've saved us money since we bought some of the activities individually. She also didn't give us the free wolf ears. She also didn't mention where our room was, so we walked around looking for the elevator until another worker saw us looking confused. He resort uses a wristband for your convenience. It acts as your room key and charges to your room.   We stayed in the Wolf Den. I know the resort is new, but the room had a funky smell to it.

We had so much fun at Great Wolf Lodge. The water park is very family friendly. The room we had was very comfortable and spacious. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. We encountered a problem with the stuffed animal that we bought from one of its stores but the staff went above and beyond to fix it. The food at Lodge Wood Fired Grill was great but the food at the buffet next door was not.  We will definitely come back again!

Some of the reviews make it seem like you might have been better going somewhere else, but that was not the case for us! Grand opening hiccups were gone. Pack members were helpful and so nice!! Guests were happy and lines were short! My husband 16 year old and six year old ALL had a great time, we will definitely be back!

Had great time at this lodge with our 2 kids + 2 of their friends.  the flow rider, volcano, wolf's tale and alberta calls (orange) are the best rides.  great family atmosphere and being that we avoided the main spring break crowd, had the water park with very few lines.  the buckets and hungry as a wolf pizza place are pretty good for hotel food joints.  Lodge and loos moose family kitchen are overpriced and not that great.  dunkin donuts is good quality value for breakfast food and McD's, KFC, flame broiler, red lobster, lee's sandwiches are next door.  two down things we didnt like:  a) they closed flow rider two hours before the water park was to close for surfacing work - why not do this AFTER the park closes???? seems lame to take away the best ride in the park.  my kids

Summary Heading: fun time at the water park
Summary: We live close by, and we were waiting for the facility to be opened already. At the water park, the surfing ride should have a projector behind it on the wall, showing what to do, instead of the attendants taking so much time to explain to every single person what to do. The wait for that ride is way too long because of that. It is just a suggestion. While you are waiting, you could view on the wall what to do, just like in Disneyland while your are waiting for some rides, it explains what to do on the wall or on a TV screen. It works well.

We were guest of a 1st Birthday party from 03/11/16 to 03/13/16. The prices were high for two guest for one night $536? Because the rooms include 4 park passes but if you have 2 persons for the room i think its pricey and they should offer based on the guest in the rooms. Overall we had a very nice experience. The venue is all in doors which made the outside weather irrelevant because it rained and was overcast all weekend. The pools were clean and the life guards were very attentive. I only had the food offered inside of the water park. I did not get a chance to try the other foods the venue offered. Unlike Knotts which has a similar family package that I have made an annual event for my family, Knotts has joining rooms (less expensive that come with breakfast buffet).  The

Summary Heading: Probably great if you have kids
Summary: Check in was awful...they couldn't find me, couldn't find my prepayment, on and on.  The receptionist just laughed about it all, which, had I been in a better mood, may have been funny to me as well, but since I clearly was not, she should not have tired to joke.    Place is loud and obnoxious with screaming children, but I think that's what it's supposed to be all about.  Bed was comfortable.  Bar was grossly overpriced.

I had a great time. I went to the park for my birthday.  The kids had a great time. I would go again. It's costly, but I don't feel cheated. The rooms are cute, and the staff were very nice. The water park is kept warm, so even if it's raining outside, you can enjoy a warm day at the water park.

Great local option for family fun. Food is reasonably priced for a theme park. Do invest in water shoes as slipping is a hazard. Bring your on pillows as those in the rooms offer no support. There is so much to do, but the water park is the main attraction. Bring patience as not all parents supervised their kids or picked up after them but the hotel staff is very attentive, friendly, and helpful.

Was very pleased with the lodge, staff & water park. The towels are a  bit thin so hard to dry off with and the towels in the room leave lot's of lint on your body & hair. All in all we would come back! Be sure and bring snacks if you have kids as they get hungry and it can get pricey eating at the snack sack.

Summary Heading: Great family vacation/children's birthday party spot!
Summary: We brought 6 kids with us to the new Great Wolf Lodge in Garden Grove for my son's birthday party.  We had a great experience.  Water park was fun, staff was very nice, and my son had a great birthday experience with his buddies.    Tips - we brought our own beach towels as towels in the water park are small and you cannot take them with you back to your room.  So I would recommend bringing towels (or a robe with you) for going back and forth from room to water park.  Room has a fridge - bring water/drinks.  Food wasn't too pricey so I would just eat there vs. bringing food with you.  Alcohol served at all restaurants for parents.  The interactive movie/game experience was super fun.  Kids (11 years old) really enjoyed playing the zombie and monster game.  Arcade also had a lot

Unfortunately only hotel guests are allowed in the Water Park so we had to book a room. And for a brand new hotel, the rooms had a Motel 6 vibe to it. Shower would rattle through that "dark" bathroom when you put it on warm/hot. The A/C would also rattle through the wall after awhile of being on. Everything was oddly placed, the sink was in the hallway. And to top it all off it was such ugly decor and about a mile away from the only sets of elevators that took so long to get to our floor! So no, we will not be returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for sharing this with us! We are deeply saddened to learn of the difficulties your pack encountered in your guest suite, as this experience is not typical for us. We will alert the appropriate teams of your concerns to review.   We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss this with you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: First of all, I was very excited to come here. I was really looking forward to it, but sadly it did not met my expectations.  I went with my family for only one night and spent over $1,000 and I have to say that it was better to eat at the Dunkin Donuts than the restaurants in this place. The buffet is horrible, cold, not stocked, they really need help on whoever is handling the menu...only exception was the pizza place, which wasn't that bad, if you eat the pizza right away of course. The grill / bar on the other hand, way too salty..sodium through the roof!   Then, it's a family of five and in the room there's only one soap? one shampoo? are you serious? And I guess the worst part was that on a Sunday at 5:10AM until 5:50AM you guys are drilling on the back of my room! Are you
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for bringing your concerns to our attention! We sincerely apologize for the difficulties your pack encountered in your guest suite and while dining with us. We have already reached out to our leadership team in Garden Grove to discuss your concerns and they will follow-up with you soon.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: The hotel staff is completely unorganized and are not helpful when situations arise. The wand program hardly worked and it was an overpriced gimmick. On a better note the lifeguard staff was very attentive and we felt our children were safe at their waterpark.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for bringing this to our attention! We are incredibly sorry to read about the difficulties your pack encountered during your visit, as this experience does not meet our standards. We will share your concerns with the respective teams to discuss and review for future guests.   We would like to dig into this for you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: I went on a business trip so I didn't get a chance to use the water park. It could have been so much fun if I went on a vacation with my family. Great Staff and fun environment. very welcome and hospitable.

We live about an hour and 15 minutes away and surprised our birthday boy with a trip to Great Wolf! We are on our last day of a two night trip. We chose the basic room for my husband and I and two kids. Thanks to Cora, we were able to upgrade to a wolf den room for our last night. Both rooms were excellent. Clean and comfy. Large tv, microwave, mini fridge, and coffee maker. Kudos to Cora who walked me all the way to my room so I could get in to move our things into our new room. She was terrific! Actually, all staff are so friendly and polite. Whoever hired did a great job! Water park is so fun, we are not talking Raging Waters here-but there are quite a number of exciting fun slides! We arrived on a Sunday, and that day was the most crowded. But even then wait lines for

My husband and I took our 6-year-old son and a friend of the same age to Great Wolf Lodge last week. We spent Tuesday and Wednesday nights at the resort. I was very impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of all the employees. The bracelet that serves as your room key and credit card was ingenious and so practical. For being a resort that caters to kids, the hotel was extremely quiet and not crowded at all during the week. The food was really delicious, nothing like most food at water or amusement parks. The room was very spacious with a comfy bed, table and chairs, a pullout sofa, a microwave, and a good-sized fridge to keep drinks or leftover pizza from the yummy pizza place. Attached garage parking is free. This is the perfect place to spend a night or two with

Positive: We enjoyed our stay at great wolf lodge in California.  It's larger than the resort in Pennsylvania. It's nice that the waterpark is only accessible to resort guests.  That way the waterpark isn't overly crowded. Negative:  Expensive room charge per night (even with discount).

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a family staycation!
Summary: We're local to OC and we're looking for a fun overnight trip for my son's 6th birthday. When you factor in room price, overcrowding, and having to purchase separate resort tickets, we decided against Disneyland. Fortunately Great Wolf Lodge had just opened and it seemed like a great alternative. We spent one night there and we had the BEST time! The property is great, themed really well, and very clean. The water park is phenomenal and will appeal to kids of all ages. It's warm, clean, and not overcrowded (one of the perks from only allowing hotel guest in). The thing that really stood out was the service. EVERYONE we met was friendly, smiling and super helpful. We were very happy with our stay and I'd highly recommend it.

Our family really enjoyed our stay at Great Wolf.  We were all so excited to get to the water park that we didn't take the time to read the hotel information that was given to us at check in.  The information had the time of various activities around the hotel like kids' yoga and story time.  I would recommend you take a few minutes to read the information given to you at check in.  Otherwise, room was what was expected, service was excellent, and the water park was fun for everyone.  We were there with my sister's family and all the age ranges were 2 months to age 45-- we all equally enjoyed the resort.  The BEST part of the hotel was, of course, the water slides!  The large yellow one can be seen from outside and it is awesome!  If you have a Go Pro camera take it with you--

Great Hotel. Fun for the whole family. Great wolf morning hike is definitely geared for younger children, kindergarten and under.  A little pricey but made Great memories, and had lots of fun!! Our room did have a funny smell that we believe was coming through the water system. Safety is a priority for this resort. The only thing missing is a Starbucks!!

Overall the experience was fun and would come back as long as the amenities remain as well kept as possible. Like in all other places like this keep an eye out for your kids when inside the water park. The place is great for the younger kids to the younger teens. Unfortunately, was not able to experience any of the daily activities as much as my daughter wanted to, not enough time, even with our paid late check out the following day. I love the fixtures and furnitures inside our KidsCabin, can still be a bit bigger, with the bunk beds' mattresses a bit higher than the bed frame so as to avoid heads bumping against it while the kids are asleep. Staff can be more welcoming. On our way to the lobby from the parking lot we chanced upon two staffs, I expected them to greet us or

Great Wolf is great!  So much to do, like a child oriented cruise on land. The resort included a water park, mini golf, bowling alley, 4d rides, arcade, magical quests, story hour, child yoga, etc... So much to do, so little time!

We took our three kids, oldest is 6. They have a ton of activities for young kids as well as the water park. This is definitely a place for families with kids. We stayed one night and that was plenty.

Let me start by saying after reading reviews on here I was concerned before we went. But we were happily surprised. There are definitely areas that we did not like, but the waterpark out weights all of that.  So the waterpark, its brilliant! Fun for all ages. toddlers to adults. There is soooooo much to do. we took regular breaks to enjoy the fun. There were never any long lines for the slides, there were lots of lifeguards around.  There are plenty of seats for everyone The floor is slippery, take flip flops and remind your children to walk.   When you are done with the water park, you have the bowling, arcade, kids salon, golf to keep you busy. They they have the games, dance party and story time in the lobby in the evening amongst other things.  The kids were truly

Had a wonderful time. The indoor waterpark and waterslides are a blast. The arcade is like a kids casino. Particularly enjoyed the interactive 4-D theatre game with the Zombies. Lots of organized activities for little kids from morning until night-time. You really don't need to leave the resort. Can get up to six people in the rooms. Will definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Family time at its best, it just opened keep that in mind!
Summary: Ok so I read reviews before we went and any of the 1 star reviews were from the first week open and OF COURSE it'll be rough! We just went Thur and Fri night March 10-11 after they had been open for 3 weeks. First off we got to the hotel at 12:30 NO line at check in took only 5 min and we could use our room ASAP, which was nice I wasn't expecting to get in to the room till 3 or so. We got a family suit, I will say it was a lot smaller then I expected 2 queen beds and a couch that pulls out BUT you don't spend a lot of time in your room, also we didn't have a remote for the TV but we asked the front desk and one was brought up! Also I brought my own bottle of wine and for got a cork screw and the front desk had one sent up :) you can drink in the arcade room down Stairs And

We just got back from staying at the Great Wolf Lodge in California and we LOVED our experience so much that I felt the need to come and leave a review. We're a family of 5 and we stayed in the family suite (not themed) and it was perfect. Great size!! we all slept comfortably, it had a fridge, microwave, safe, everything that we needed. I'd recommend it for sure. Then of course we have the water park….so amazing. Plenty of seats, the slides were fantastic the staff was wonderful, towels, change rooms, lockers you name it they had it covered for all ages - no one in our party ever got bored. My one and only complaint is that we needed to use a locker on our very last day and it cost me 10.00 - TOTAL RIP OFF!!!! Wasn't happy about that at all!!!!! otheriwse it's HIGHLY

Summary Heading: Still needs to work out the kinks...
Summary: I really waffled with my rating, I would give 3.5 if I could. We just got back from a mid-week, one night first time trip. We are local, so we were looking forward to this opening for a very long time, and super super excited to stay, hoping to make it our new favorite stay-cation spot. The resort was completely, totally dead during our stay. I think I counted like 40 cars in the parking garage, and they didn't even fill up on lane of one level. I think there may have been more staff than guests on site, no joke!    First the positive: The resort is brand new, so of course very clean. We saw people cleaning everywhere, all the time, from wiping handrails to scrubbing tile floors with something the size of a toothbrush. They seem to take clean very seriously. I never once saw

Summary Heading: Fun! Wish we could stay longer. Food is ehh
Summary: I'm 7 months preggo so we wanted to take a mini trip close by and this was a perfect choice. We were upgraded (without asking!) to a suite but when we got there one room wasn't cleaned so instead we asked to get a wolf den room which was the best choice! Our 2.5 year old daughter got her own little space in the room with a TV and bunk beds.. Although she stayed on the bottom. She loved it and slept better since she wasn't in our bed and then after she fell asleep, we used the WiFi to watch movies on our laptop! The water park is obviously the main attraction! We loved it. It's a bit colder than I expected inside at times. The toddler water area was great to acclimate the little ones. Put on a life jacket and your kiddo can be pretty Independent in that area (it's gated off

Summary Heading: Pretty good... probably only a one time deal
Summary: We stayed at the new Great Wolf Lodge from Wednesday, Feb 24-26, 2016.  Since it was mid-week, it was very slow... after a jammed first weekend opening.  However, you would think the staff was dealing with a full house considering how long it took them to respond and communicate.  We were there for my daughter's birthday and got the Birthday Bash which was $99 for special birthday ears, balloons in the room, a poster on the door, $30 casino type coin credit, $40 dining credit, and a single layer 9 inch birthday cake with plates/napkins.  Not a bad deal, really.  Everyone said happy birthday to her... the staff was very nice.  However, since we arrived the day BEFORE her birthday, I asked them to surprise her with the cake the next day (birthday day)... which (eventually) they

We arrived Sunday morning. When we arrived everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was nice and ready when we checked in. The water park was fun but there was not enough chairs and tables for all guests. The cabanas are very limited. I would say  there's only about 10 available for rental. The food is a bit pricey. Sunday night around 10:30pm the hotel was evacuated due to a fire emergency. The police and firefighters arrived. We had to stand out in the cold for about 30 min or so. Without any explanations guests were instructed to return to their rooms. Monday while checking out  My husband and I addressed our concerns to the front desk. The manager did offer us a $50 discount but we asked if we can get something for the kids instead. She agreed to a pup pass which has a

GWL is the only indoor water park in SoCal, making it a unique destination for families.  We are locals and stayed here for 2 nights in March.  We wanted to wait a couple of weeks til after their opening, in case there were any kinks to work out.  We checked in on a weekday and the place was deserted!  We had the water park to ourselves, which was great. That said, the staff needs a lot of training.  Everyone is so confused here, even though we were the only ones in the check in line, it took 35 minutes (!!!) to check us in, which is absurd. He just couldn't figure out the computer system.    We also bought one of the passes that includes some of the activities, yet we were still charged on top of that because the arcade employees didn't know how to issue the points without

Summary Heading: Like a Cruise Ship on land!
Summary: Our family visited and the grandkids had the time of their life!  The lodge is one big family attraction, with the indoor waterpark the highlight.  While the water slides and other activities were plentiful and kept the kids occupied, the things we appreciated the most were the plentiful, helpful lifeguards.  They were totally attentive to their assigned areas and enabled us to relax because we knew plenty of eyes were on the kids at all times.  When the kids got tired we were able to walk to our room and let them rest!  What a luxury!  When we return again, we'll consider renting one of their enclosed, poolside cabanas, which contain a refrigerator, TV, and several chaise  lounges.  I envision a cabana as a great meeting place for everyone to return to, as well as a nice place

Summary Heading: Has potential but not good yet
Summary: My review mysteriously disappeared so I am writing again: We were so excited about this trip. Let's start with the positive. We checked in on Sunday and check in was a breeze. The gentleman who checked us in was very nice and got us set up with a Wolf Pass. The lodge itself is beautiful and the room was very spacious. My son LOVED the magic quest game and the water park was clean and well maintained. In a new property that is to be expected. That is when our stay went from bad to worse. After checking in we decided to grab something to eat at "Hungry as a Wolf" we order our family favorite Hawaiian pizza. The pizza came out burnt, and the crust was tough and flavorless, hardly any cheese. My son took 1 bite and said he didn't like it. My husband and I ate about half a piece and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for sharing this with us! We are deeply sorry for our shortcomings during your visit, as this experience is not typical for us and does not meet our expectations.   We will share your concerns with our leadership team at the lodge to review for future guests. If you would like to discuss your experience, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary Heading: Amazing stay!  Great for kids of all ages
Summary: It appears a few of the negative reviews came from opening weekend when it was very busy and the staff was still getting kinks worked out. Our stay was nothing short of fantastic.  We checked in this past Tuesday. (I'd highly recommend coming on a weekday if possible - no lines at all for rides, plenty of lounge chairs, etc). Did valet parking ($10/night) as we have 3 kids with like 10 bags, so figured it was worth it since we were staying just one night. Self parking is free. Got there around 2pm and there was no line at all, walked right up to the front desk. They had our room ready already, which was nice as it was not advertised to be ready until 4pm. They also gave all of us free wolf ears which the kids loved.  The bellman followed us up to our room and got everything

Great Wolf Lodge is a terrific place to let your "inner child" and your young children run and play. The booking process is straight-forward (and some discounts are still available), check-in is easy (no room key - hurray!) and the wrist bands make using your room and all of the many facilities very easy. This visit was a birthday present for my adult daughter and her two kids (3 & 4). The room is normal for a family hotel but the TV was huge (nice touch). The water play area (all under roof) is large, well laid-out, and kept to 84 degrees. With the humidity from the water, it felt just like the midwest. Plenty of places to play for the kids and a large number of chaise lounges/chairs for the adults. Food is readily available as is beer. Tons of lifeguards to keep everyone safe:

This place is amazing! The attendants and lifeguards are all amazing. I have children's from 2-16yrs old and everyone loved it! We celebrated my daughter's 11th bday and have had an amazing time! I can't wait to go back!!! Just make sure to wear water shoes. The floors are VERY slippery and many guests and workers can be seen slipping. They have tasty food, bowling and a little movie theatre. This place is ever more fun than Disneyland! Can't wait to go back. Hannah checked us in and made sure to give my daughter a birthday headband and wristband. Joshua O. Was also a very nice and helpful lifeguard. Can't wait to go back this summer!!!!!!!!!

First of all they put us in the wrong room, I originally booked a kids suite with 2 queens and bunk beds.  I did this specifically so my teenagers to be kids one more time. This is not the room I got so my husband went down to ask them for the right room, they moved us into a 1 queen with bunk bed, yet again not what I asked for. The staff was willing to work with us and truly genuine. However the general manager was very unprofessional and rude.  I didn't bring my family to what I thought would be a few days away from home to be treated like this. On top of that the rooms are not equipt with any USB ports. My towel also got taken along with about 10$ from the poolside. They ran out of hot dogs at 3pm and they had hardly any ice cream or brownies. I don't pay 300 plus a night to
Manager Response: Sharole,   Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge - Garden Grove and for sharing this with us! We are deeply sorry for the difficulties your pack encountered upon arrival and for the subsequent issues due to this.   We would love the chance to look into this for you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: I want to start by saying we would love to go back to The Great Wolf Lodge but I'm hoping they can work out some kinks. We are a family of five and we visited the hotel form Feb 26th to the 28th. My kids had a blast there were so many activities to do and the water park kept them busy all day long. The staff were very friendly and we were always greeted with a smile. Unfortunately during our stay we ran into problems that made me as a parent not as satisfied as my kids.   My son wanted to go on the XD Hollywood attraction but 15 secs he became afraid and we had to stop. I was told by the friendly associate that I was going to be refunded although that does not seem to be the case on my bank statement.    The next incident happened when my son's foot got caught in the door

Summary Heading: Great Family Vacation! Totally worth the money!
Summary: My family spent 4 days here last week and we had the most amazing time! Yes it's expensive but it's a resort! What do you expect? We got the Wolf Den Suite which wasn't as big as the pictures from the website portrayed, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The water park was really nice and warm. All of the water slides were safe and fun. Both of my kids got a kick out of the wave pool and the outdoor pool area. The bowling, arcade and mini golf weren't anything special. My daughter LOVED Scoops, the kids spa. She's 3 and we paid for the princess package. They gave her a crown and a robe and made her feel really special for her first manicure. She'll remember it forever! The food was outstanding! The drinks were delicious! Little know fact: Buckets serves the

I am usually not one to write reviews and I am usually a very passive person but I feel had to for this business based on the experience(s) of my family and I. I understand that the hotel/park just recently opened up and I was willing to let some issues slide, but when the problems started snowballing I started paying closer attention to them.  Initially, I was impressed by the check in process. The line was long but moved very quickly. Unfortunately, not long after that experience things started going downhill from there.   Below is a list of all the issues/observations my family experienced during our stay at the hotel/park:  -After the quick and impressive check in, my family got to our room, opened the door and there was already another family in there. This was extremely
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at Great Wolf Lodge – Garden Grove and for bringing this to our attention! We are incredibly sorry to read about the difficulties your pack encountered throughout your visit, as this experience does not meet our standards. We will share your concerns with the respective teams to discuss and review for future guests.   We would like to dig into this for you. If you are willing, please email us at guestrelations(at)greatwolf(dot)com and reference the title of your review to expedite the follow-up process.   Howling regards,  Jason  Great Wolf Guest Relations

Summary: Ignore all the 1 & 2 star reviews! They all seemed to come on opening weekend along with the rest of the universe! I on the other hand was smart enough to wait a few weeks for the staff to work out the kinks and crowds to die down before my trip. We arrived on a Wednesday around 1pm and had the resort to ourselves!!! No wait at check in, no wait at the water park, no wait at the restaurants nada! Pick your poison people and plan accordingly.  This place is heaven for kids no doubt! We had two days of fun here and it was just enough. I booked the lowest category room...the family suite. Although it wasn't close to a suite just a normal sized room in my opinion it was just fine for myself and two kids. Two queen beds were comfy but don't except any luxury. Rooms are clean but bare

My family has a yearly pass to Disneyland so we would drive by Great Wolf when it was being built.  We decided to check out the place when it first opened and we're glad we did.  My kids (ages: 9, 11, 13) had so much fun at this resort I had to physically take them out of the water just so they can take a break and eat.  This place is big and has many variety of rides/play areas.  Unlike Disneyland where you have to wait over an hour for one ride, we were able to go on every ride with a wait time of around 2-5 minutes.  I enjoyed some of the slides as much as my kids!  There were plenty of restaurants/bars inside to order food and drinks while relaxing by the pool which my wife really liked.  Overall, our family loved the experience at Great Wolf and can't wait to go there again!

We  visited on opening night and although there were "growing pains" they definitely have it together.  If you have ANY allergy to food, they really do cater to you.  The Executive Chef, Hany is beyond fabulous.  He was real empathatic to our allergy, really took his time with us and never made us feel rushed.  We then ran into him the next morning, bright and early and he was just as helpful with breakfast. The water park is big with lots to do.  It is very hot and muggy in there if you are just watching and the floors are SLIPPERY - saw at least 20 people fall.  Also, not a fan on the kids, non-alcoholic drinks called "pina colada" and "margarita" (they also have a "strawberry", but why don't you just call the others cocnut and lime?  my 9 year old asked whats a margarita????

OMG, where was Great Wolf when I was a kid? After seeing the ads, we decided to give it a try.  Awesome!  Took the wife and the three kids, 5,7 and 12.  What a blast.  Kids were entertained from morning to night and never wanted to leave the pool.  My wife and I could keep an eye on the kids all day but also sit back and relax and have a beer. Different pool sections for all different ages.  A very secure and gated shallow area for the younger kids.  Very attentive lifeguards everywhere.    While the food was basic quality, it wasn't super expensive.  Kids meals ranged from $5-$8. You can also bring your own food which can really help keep costs down.  Its been three days since our visit and I asked my kids last night, "Hey, for spring break, do you want to Disney, Magic

We arrived at 4:45pm and had to stand in line for check in. The line wrapped around all the way to the outside of the garage.  We waited for about and hour and 30 minutes before we finally got to check in at the front desk.  Our room was on the 6th floor and it was very far away from the elevators. It's quite a walk (room 644).   Our view was of the roof top of the building next door. We got the standard room with two queen beds. It has a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. It was clean and had enough room to walk around. The bed was comfortable enough. I liked the pillows.  The water park was a lot of fun.  Be careful though because the floors could get slippery. My husband bought a meatball sandwich at Hungry as a Wolf and they liked it. for dinner we tried to go to The

Summary Heading: What an amazing time with the kids!
Summary: Opening weekend is always tough, but that is the case for any location and we understood that going in.  We were so excited to have a glass of wine, dinner and play in the waterslides with our kids that we lost complete track of time!  It's not just a place that the kids have fun, my husband and I had a blast being kids again, plus enjoying the benefits of being an adult (GREAT BAR OUTSIDE BY THE WAY).   Both kids asked if they could change their birthday parties to Great Wolf instead of Disneyland and that is a no brainer for us!  So looking forward to our next trip to Great Wolf!

What an amazing experience! We had the opportunity to see this fun hotel resort.  If you're looking for a fun place to stay that's extremely kid friendly... Then this place is for you. With its fun camping theme, amazing watermark, and games throughout, you'll never be bored. The park is within earshot of Disneyland too.   If you're wondering whether friends if guests are allowed in the water park, the answer is yes. Well, at $40.00 additional per friend.

Summary Heading: Great, friendly staff despite some opening weekend bumps
Summary: The staff at this place are so nice!!   We, of course, knew that there would be some issues coming in... What kid doesn't want to be at a brand new water park on opening weekend? But what parent doesn't expect the logistics of it to be a nightmare? And, yes, indeed, we hit a few snafus.. we waited two hours in the check in line, to a room that we eventually got into six hours later, our water park passes/room key/hotel charge bracelets did not account charge properly, and at dinner they were out of both the wine I ordered and the brussel sprouts my husband ordered, BUT my, goodness, as hassled as the staff must have been from hours of dealing with frustrated guests, everyone single staff member to s person with whom I interacted was so obviously trying to make the best of a

First of all I will start this by saying it was the grand opening. That said check in was awful. I waited almost 2 hours like a lot of people. However the staff was friendly and seemed like they were trying hard.  The resort did give  a 25 dollar resort credit for the issue.  The indoor water park is incredible. Also all of the amenities for children is really unmatched. I felt like it was a las vegas for kids.  Everything stays open until 10 or 11pm. I have 3 children under 8 and they loved it.  There were some other issues with the restaurants as well. In the end the resort gave everyone a 150 dollar reduction in rate and tried their best. Highly recommended, but they have to work out some of the kinks and I hope they do.

We stayed at Great Wolf Lodge on opening night 2/19/16 in a standard room. Check-in was about a 20minute wait (as we got there early. Later in day the lines were even longer --maybe hours wait?). We had a standard room. It was clean, smelled of fresh paint. A/C was very noisy. Sink is outside of bathroom which is good for families. There was a coffee maker and small fridge, which we did not use. It was a clean, motel-quality room. We saw a mosquito this morning in room, probably from all the dampness. Does not bode well for long-term quality of this room. It was fine when brand new.  We had a late lunch at The Lodge, which serves Applebee's style food and was pretty good. That early in day, no lines and service was great.   In fact, service was great throughout the stay --

We're from Northern California and usually fly to Washington for our GWL adventures but we got a postcard advertising this new location and decided to give it a try.   Our daughters are 11 and they love GWL. They have all their Magiquest gear from our previous 4 trips and can hardly wait to continue their game.    We expected there would be bumps during their opening weekend but we are pretty shocked that it's so disorganized.  We called at 9am on opening day to find out what time we should come and they told us 1pm. The line was crazy long and it took 1.5 hours before I reached the front and got the bracelets that allow us access to our room and the water park. My husband spent that 1.5 hours with the kids trying to get their Magiquest activated. He purchased one of the three

Our check in started bad, its the grand opening day and the line was endless, but the staff made it all turn into what we have expected.  Its my daughter's 7th birthday and we dont always celebrate birthdays extravagantly since we are a family of six.  The manager/supervisor Diana was able to help us upgrade our room.  I have spent so much time calling and almost everyday I visited the website just to see if the upgrade becomes available. Diana was easy to approach and told me beforehand that it might not be possible, but she still offers to check what she can find.  I saw her diligence.  Jessie, the front desk clerk was also very helpful when i went back and asked them to reset our room access. We are so excited to stay in our upgraded room and play at the waterpark. Thanks
